hebrew_text: מָבוֹי שֶׁהוּא גָּבוֹהַּ לְמַעְלָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה — יְמַעֵט. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ.
human_translation: an alleyway height above twenty cubits, one must diminish Rabbi Yehuda says: He need not
llm_translation: The alleyway that is higher than twenty cubits - diminishes. Rabbi Yehuda says: It is not necessary.

hebrew_text: וְהָרָחָב מֵעֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת יְמַעֵט. וְאִם יֵשׁ לוֹ צוּרַת הַפֶּתַח, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהוּא רָחָב מֵעֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת אֵין צָרִיךְ לְמַעֵט.
human_translation: wider than ten cubits, one must diminish However, if has the form of a doorway, even if it is wider than ten cubits, he need not diminish
llm_translation: And the width more than ten cubits diminishes. And if it has a form of a doorway, even though it is wider than ten cubits, it does not need to be diminished.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תְּנַן הָתָם: סוּכָּה שֶׁהִיא גְּבוֹהָה לְמַעְלָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה פְּסוּלָה, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַכְשִׁיר. מַאי שְׁנָא גַּבֵּי סוּכָּה דְּתָנֵי ״פְּסוּלָה״ וְגַבֵּי מָבוֹי תָּנֵי תַּקַּנְתָּא?
human_translation: We learned there, A sukka that is more than twenty cubits high is unfit, and Rabbi Yehuda deems it fit. What is the difference with regard to a sukka teaches unfit, whereas with regard to an alleyway, it teaches rectification,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah there: A sukkah that is taller than twenty cubits is invalid, and Rabbi Yehuda deems it valid. What is the difference regarding a sukkah that it teaches "invalid," and regarding an alleyway it teaches a corrective measure?

hebrew_text: סוּכָּה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, תָּנֵי ״פְּסוּלָה״. מָבוֹי דְּרַבָּנַן, תָּנֵי תַּקַּנְתָּא.
human_translation: sukka , by Torah law, teaches unfit, an alleyway, by rabbinic law, teaches rectification,
llm_translation: Sukkah of the Torah, it teaches "pesulah." Mavoi of the Rabbis, it teaches takanta.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא נָמֵי תָּנֵי תַּקַּנְתָּא. אֶלָּא, סוּכָּה דִּנְפִישִׁין מִילֵּיהּ — פָּסֵיק וְתָנֵי ״פְּסוּלָה״. מָבוֹי דְּלָא נְפִישִׁי מִילֵּיהּ — תָּנֵי תַּקַּנְתָּא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say even by Torah law, rectification. However, sukka , whose matters are numerous, it categorically teaches unfit. an alleyway, whose matters are not numerous, teaches rectification.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: that from the Torah it is also taught as a regulation. Rather, a sukkah whose walls are higher than its roof - it is interrupted and it is taught "invalid." A courtyard whose walls are not higher than its roof - it is taught as a regulation.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: חֲכָמִים לֹא לְמָדוּהָ אֶלָּא מִפִּתְחוֹ שֶׁל הֵיכָל, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לֹא לְמָדָהּ אֶלָּא מִפִּתְחוֹ שֶׁל אוּלָם.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: The Rabbis only derived from the doorway of the Sanctuary, And Rabbi Yehuda only derived from the doorway of the Entrance Hall
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The sages learned it only from the entrance of the sanctuary, and Rabbi Yehudah learned it only from the entrance of the hall.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: פִּתְחוֹ שֶׁל הֵיכָל גׇּבְהוֹ עֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה וְרׇחְבּוֹ עֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת, וְשֶׁל אוּלָם גׇּבְהוֹ אַרְבָּעִים אַמָּה וְרׇחְבּוֹ עֶשְׂרִים אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: As we learned The doorway of the Sanctuary is twenty cubits high and ten cubits wide, and that of the Entrance Hall is forty cubits high and twenty cubits wide.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: The entrance of the Sanctuary was twenty cubits high and ten cubits wide, and the entrance of the Hall was forty cubits high and twenty cubits wide.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁנֵיהֶן מִקְרָא אֶחָד דָּרְשׁוּ: ״וּשְׁחָטוֹ פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד״, דְּרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: קְדוּשַּׁת הֵיכָל לְחוּד וּקְדוּשַּׁת אוּלָם לְחוּד. וְכִי כְּתִיב ״פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד״ — אַהֵיכָל כְּתִיב.
human_translation: Both of them, interpreted the same verse homiletically: and slaughter it at the doorway of the Tent of Meeting, As the Rabbis hold the sanctity of the Sanctuary is discrete and the sanctity of the Entrance Hall is discrete, And when speaks of the doorway of the Tent of Meeting, it is referring to the Sanctuary.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And both of them expounded one verse: "And they shall slaughter it at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting." The Rabbis hold: The sanctity of the Sanctuary is distinct, and the sanctity of the Hall is distinct. But is it written "the entrance of the Tent of Meeting"? — It is written "Tent."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: הֵיכָל וְאוּלָם קְדוּשָּׁה אַחַת הִיא. וְכִי כְּתִיב: ״פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד״ — אַתַּרְוַיְיהוּ הוּא דִּכְתִיב.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda holds the Sanctuary and the Entrance Hall are one, sanctity, and when it is written: “The doorway of the Tent of Meeting,” it is referring to both of them,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda holds: the Sanctuary and the Hall are one. Is it written: "The entrance of the Tent of Meeting" - this is its location as it is written.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה נָמֵי קְדוּשַּׁת אוּלָם לְחוּד וּקְדוּשַּׁת הֵיכָל לְחוּד. וְהָכָא הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה — דִּכְתִיב: ״אֶל פֶּתַח אוּלָם הַבַּיִת״.
human_translation: And if you wish, say even according to Rabbi Yehuda, the sanctity of the Sanctuary is discrete and the sanctity of the Entrance Hall is discrete. And here, this is the reasoning of Rabbi Yehuda: as it is written: To the doorway of the Entrance Hall of the House.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: According to Rabbi Yehuda, the sanctity of the Temple is distinct, and the sanctity of the chamber is distinct. And here is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda's opinion - as it is written: "At the entrance of the chamber of the house."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן: אִי הֲוָה כְּתִב ״אֶל פֶּתַח אוּלָם״ — כִּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ. הַשְׁתָּא דִּכְתִיב ״אֶל פֶּתַח אוּלָם הַבַּיִת״ — הַבַּיִת הַפָּתוּחַ לָאוּלָם.
human_translation: And the Rabbis Had written: “To the doorway of the Entrance Hall,” as you said. now that it is written: “To the doorway of the Entrance Hall of the House,” the House that opens into the Entrance Hall,
llm_translation: The sages said: If it had written "to the entrance of the hall" - as you said. The difference is that it is written "to the entrance of the hall of the house" - the house that is open to the hall.

hebrew_text: וְהָא כִּי כְּתִיב הַאי, בְּמִשְׁכָּן כְּתִיב!
human_translation: But when this is written: isn’t it written with regard to the Tabernacle
llm_translation: And this, for it is written this, in the Tabernacle it is written!

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן מִשְׁכָּן דְּאִיקְּרִי מִקְדָּשׁ, וּמִקְדָּשׁ דְּאִיקְּרִי מִשְׁכָּן. דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, הָא דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שְׁלָמִים שֶׁשְּׁחָטָן קוֹדֶם פְּתִיחַת דַּלְתוֹת הַהֵיכָל — פְּסוּלִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּשְׁחָטוֹ פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד״ — בִּזְמַן שֶׁפְּתוּחִין וְלֹא בִּזְמַן שֶׁהֵן נְעוּלִים, וְהָא כִּי כְתִיב הָהִיא, בְּמִשְׁכָּן כְּתִיב! אֶלָּא, אַשְׁכְּחַן מִקְדָּשׁ דְּאִיקְּרִי מִשְׁכָּן וּמִשְׁכָּן דְּאִיקְּרִי מִקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: We find that the Tabernacle is called Temple, and that the Temple is called Tabernacle; As if you do not say so, that which Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: Peace-offerings that were slaughtered prior to the opening of the doors of the Sanctuary are disqualified as it is stated: “And he shall slaughter it at the doorway [ petaḥ ] of the Tent of Meeting,” When are open [ petuḥin ], and not when they are closed. But when this is written: isn’t it written with regard to the Tabernacle? Rather, we find the Temple called Tabernacle, and the Tabernacle called Temple.
llm_translation: I found a Tabernacle that is called a Temple, and a Temple that is called a Tabernacle. For if you do not say so, this is what Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Peace offerings that they slaughter before the opening of the doors of the Sanctuary are invalid, as it is stated: "And he shall slaughter it at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting" - when the doors are open and not when they are closed. But is it not written regarding that Temple, it is written as a Tabernacle! Rather, I found a Temple that is called a Tabernacle, and a Tabernacle that is called a Temple.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא מִקְדָּשׁ דְּאִיקְּרִי מִשְׁכָּן, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְנָתַתִּי (אֶת) מִשְׁכָּנִי בְּתוֹכְכֶם״. אֶלָּא מִשְׁכָּן דְּאִיקְּרִי מִקְדָּשׁ מְנָלַן? אִילֵּימָא מִדִּכְתִיב: ״וְנָשְׂאוּ הַקְּהָתִים נוֹשְׂאֵי הַמִּקְדָּשׁ וְהֵקִימוּ אֶת הַמִּשְׁכָּן עַד בּוֹאָם״ —
human_translation: Granted, the Temple is called Tabernacle, as it is written: “And I will set My Tabernacle among you” However, the Tabernacle is called Temple, from where do we If you say from that which is written: “And the Kehatites, the bearers of the Temple, set forward, that they may set up the Tabernacle before they came”
llm_translation: In truth, the Sanctuary which is called Mishkan, as it is written: "And I will place My Mishkan among you." But from where do we derive that the Mishkan which is called Mikdash Sanctuary is derived? If you say from what is written: "And the Kohathites shall come to carry them, but they shall not touch the holy objects lest they die," —

hebrew_text: הָהוּא בְּאָרוֹן כְּתִיב. אֶלָּא מֵהָכָא: ״וְעָשׂוּ לִי מִקְדָּשׁ וְשָׁכַנְתִּי בְּתוֹכָם״.
human_translation: that is written with regard to the ark Rather, from here: “And let them make Me a Temple that I may dwell among them”
llm_translation: That one in the ark is written. Rather from here: "And let them make Me a sanctuary, that I may dwell among them."

hebrew_text: בֵּין לְרַבָּנַן וּבֵין לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לֵילְפוּ מִפֶּתַח שַׁעַר הֶחָצֵר, דִּכְתִיב: ״אוֹרֶךְ הֶחָצֵר מֵאָה בָאַמָּה וְרֹחַב חֲמִשִּׁים בַּחֲמִשִּׁים וְקוֹמָה חָמֵשׁ אַמּוֹת״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַחֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה קְלָעִים לַכָּתֵף״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְלַכָּתֵף הַשֵּׁנִית מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה לְשַׁעַר הֶחָצֵר קְלָעִים חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה״, מָה לְּהַלָּן חָמֵשׁ בְּרוֹחַב עֶשְׂרִים, אַף כָּאן חָמֵשׁ בְּרוֹחַב עֶשְׂרִים!
human_translation: Both according to the Rabbis and according to Rabbi Yehuda, let them derive from the doorway of the gate of the courtyard As it is written: “The length of the courtyard shall be one hundred cubits and the breadth fifty everywhere, and the height five cubits” And it is written: “The hangings on one side of the gate shall be fifteen cubits; And it is written: “And for the other side of the court gate, on this hand and on that hand, were hangings of fifteen cubits; just as there, five by twenty wide so too here, five by twenty wide
llm_translation: Between the sages and Rabbi Yehuda they differed regarding the entrance of the courtyard, as it is written: "The length of the courtyard shall be one hundred cubits, and the width fifty by fifty, and the height five cubits." And it is written: "And fifteen cubits of hangings for one shoulder." And it is written: "And for the second shoulder, from here and from here to the entrance of the courtyard, hangings of fifteen cubits." Just as there, the width is twenty, so too here, the width is twenty!

hebrew_text: ״פֶּתַח שַׁעַר הֶחָצֵר״ אִיקְּרִי, פֶּתַח סְתָמָא — לָא אִיקְּרִי.
human_translation: is called the doorway of the gate of the courtyard, it is not called a doorway, unmodified.
llm_translation: "The opening of the gate of the courtyard" is called, an ordinary opening - is not called.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, כִּי כְתִיב: ״קְלָעִים חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה לַכָּתֵף״ — בְּגוּבְהָה הוּא דִּכְתִיב.
human_translation: And if you wish, say when it is written: “The hangings on one side of the gate shall be fifteen cubits,” to the height
llm_translation: And if you wish, say, for it is written: "Fifteen cubits high were the pilasters for the shoulder" — for it is written in height.

hebrew_text: גּוּבְהָה?! וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״וְקוֹמָה חָמֵשׁ אַמּוֹת״! הָהוּא מִשְּׂפַת מִזְבֵּחַ וּלְמַעְלָה.
human_translation: height Isn’t it written “And the height five cubits”? from the edge of the altar and above.
llm_translation: Height?! But isn't it written: "And it shall be five cubits high"! That one is from the edge of the altar and upwards.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מִפִּתְחוֹ שֶׁל אוּלָם גָּמַר? וְהָא תְּנַן: וְהָרָחָב מֵעֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת יְמַעֵט, וְלָא פְּלִיג רַבִּי יְהוּדָה!
human_translation: Did Rabbi Yehuda derive from the doorway of the Entrance Hall? But didn’t we learn wider than ten cubits, one must diminish And Rabbi Yehuda does not dispute
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda from the entrance of the hall concluded? But didn't we learn: "And if the width is more than ten cubits, he shall diminish it," and Rabbi Yehuda does not disagree!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: פְּלִיג בְּבָרַיְיתָא, דְּתַנְיָא: וְהָרָחָב מֵעֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת יְמַעֵט, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְמַעֵט.
human_translation: Abaye said: disagrees in a baraita . As it was taught wider than ten cubits, he must diminish Rabbi Yehuda says: He need not diminish it.
llm_translation: Abaye said: He disputes in a baraita, as it was taught: "And if the width is more than ten cubits, he shall reduce it." Rabbi Yehuda says: He does not need to reduce it.

hebrew_text: וְלִיפְלוֹג בְּמַתְנִיתִין? פְּלִיג בְּגוּבְהָה, וְהוּא הַדִּין לְרֻחְבָּה.
human_translation: let him disagree in the mishna. disagrees with regard to height, but the same applies to its width.
llm_translation: To dispute in the Mishnah? He disputes in height, and the same applies to width.

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מִפִּתְחוֹ שֶׁל אוּלָם גָּמַר? וְהָתַנְיָא: מָבוֹי שֶׁהוּא גָּבוֹהַּ מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה יְמַעֵט, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַכְשִׁיר עַד אַרְבָּעִים וַחֲמִשִּׁים אַמָּה. וְתָנֵי בַּר קַפָּרָא: עַד מֵאָה.
human_translation: And still, Rabbi Yehuda derived from the doorway of the Entrance Hall? Wasn’t it taught an alleyway that is higher than twenty cubits, one must diminish and Rabbi Yehuda deems it fit up to forty and fifty cubits. And bar Kappara taught up to a hundred
llm_translation: And when, Rabbi Yehuda from the entrance of the hall concluded? And it was taught: An alleyway that is higher than twenty cubits should be diminished, and Rabbi Yehuda permits up to forty-five cubits. And Bar Kappara taught: Up to one hundred.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְבַר קַפָּרָא גּוּזְמָא. אֶלָּא לְרַב יְהוּדָה מַאי גּוּזְמָא? בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַרְבָּעִים — גָּמַר מִפִּתְחוֹ שֶׁל אוּלָם, אֶלָּא חֲמִשִּׁים מְנָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: Granted, according to bar Kappara, an exaggeration, However, according to Rav Yehuda what exaggeration Granted, forty Rabbi Yehuda derived from the doorway of the Entrance Hall. However, fifty from where does he derive
llm_translation: In truth, for Bar Kappara, a decree. Rather, for Rav Yehudah, what is the decree? In truth, for Rabbi Yehudah, forty - he completes from the opening of the hall, rather, fifty - does he assign to it?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הָא מַתְנִיתָא אַטְעִיתֵיהּ לְרַב, דְּתַנְיָא: מָבוֹי שֶׁהוּא גָּבוֹהַּ מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה, יוֹתֵר מִפִּתְחוֹ שֶׁל הֵיכָל — יְמַעֵט. הוּא סָבַר: מִדְּרַבָּנַן מִפִּתְחוֹ שֶׁל הֵיכַל גָּמְרִי, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מִפִּתְחוֹ שֶׁל אוּלָם גָּמַר. וְלָא הִיא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מִפִּתְחָא דְמַלְכִין גָּמַר.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: this baraita misled Rav As it was taught an alleyway that is higher than twenty cubits, higher than the doorway of the Sanctuary, one must diminish maintains: From that the Rabbis derived from the doorway of the Sanctuary, Rabbi Yehuda derived from the doorway of the Entrance Hall. But that is not so. Rabbi Yehuda derived from the entrance of kings,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: This Mishnah I have planted before Rav, as it was taught: An alleyway that is higher than twenty cubits, more than the entrance of the sanctuary - one must decrease it. He thought: According to the Rabbis, it is measured from the entrance of the sanctuary, but Rabbi Yehuda measures it from the entrance of the hall. And it is not so, rather Rabbi Yehuda measures it from the entrance of the palace.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, אִי מִפִּתְחוֹ שֶׁל הֵיכָל גְּמִירִי — לִיבְעוֹ דְּלָתוֹת כְּהֵיכָל, אַלְּמָה תְּנַן: הֶכְשֵׁר מָבוֹי, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: לֶחִי וְקוֹרָה, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: לֶחִי אוֹ קוֹרָה!
human_translation: And, the Rabbis, if they derived from the doorway of the Sanctuary, let them require doors just as the Sanctuary. Why did we learn rendering an alleyway fit Beit Shammai say: a side post and a beam And Beit Hillel say: a side post or a beam
llm_translation: The sages, if from the opening of the sanctuary they are learned — the heart of the doors of the sanctuary, why do we teach: the validation of an alleyway, Beit Shammai says: a beam and a crossbeam, and Beit Hillel says: either a beam or a crossbeam!

hebrew_text: דַּלְתוֹת הֵיכָל לִצְנִיעוּת בְּעָלְמָא הוּא דַּעֲבִידָן.
human_translation: The Sanctuary doors were made solely for privacy,
llm_translation: The doors of the sanctuary are for modesty, it is what they do.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, לָא תַּיהֲנֵי לֵיהּ צוּרַת הַפֶּתַח, דְּהָא הֵיכַל צוּרַת הַפֶּתַח הָוְיָא לוֹ, אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי עֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת הוּא דִּרְוִיח. אַלְּמָה תְּנַן: אִם יֵשׁ לוֹ צוּרַת הַפֶּתַח, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁרָחָב מֵעֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת — אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְמַעֵט!
human_translation: But if so, the form of a doorway, should not be effective as the Sanctuary had the form of a doorway, and even so, it was ten cubits wide. Why did we learn If has the form of a doorway, even if it is wider than ten cubits, he need not diminish
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, the form of the entrance does not benefit him, for the form of the entrance is his, even so, it is ten cubits wide. Why do we learn: If he has the form of the entrance, even though it is wider than ten cubits — he does not need to decrease!

hebrew_text: מִידֵּי הוּא טַעְמָא אֶלָּא לְרַב, הָא מַתְנֵי לֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה לְחִיָּיא בַּר רַב קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְמַעֵט. וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַתְנְיֵיהּ ״צָרִיךְ לְמַעֵט״.
human_translation: As that is the reason only according to Rav, Didn’t Rav Yehuda teach Ḥiyya bar Rav before Rav, he need not diminish it, and Rav said to him teach He must diminish it.
llm_translation: From him is the reason, but for Rav. This is what Rav Yehudah taught to Chiya bar Rav before Rav: It is not necessary to minimize. And he said to him: Teach him "it is necessary to minimize."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה
human_translation: However, if so,
llm_translation: Rather, from now on.

hebrew_text: לָא תַּיהֲנֵי לֵיהּ אֲמַלְתְּרָא, דְּהָא הֵיכָל אֲמַלְתְּרָא הַוְיָא לֵיהּ, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי — עֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה הוּא דְּגָבוֹהַּ, דִּתְנַן: חָמֵשׁ אֲמַלְתְּרָאוֹת שֶׁל מֵילָה הָיוּ עַל גַּבָּיו, זוֹ לְמַעְלָה מִזּוֹ, וְזוֹ לְמַעְלָה מִזּוֹ.
human_translation: a cornice [ amaltera ] should not be effective as the Sanctuary had a cornice, and even so twenty cubits high, As we learned Over it were five oak cornices, one above the other.
llm_translation: Do not benefit from it, for the chamber of benefit should be for it, and even so — it is twenty cubits high, as we learned: there were five chambers of circumcision on its back, one above the other, and this one above that, and that one above that.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי מַאי תְּיוּבְתָּא? דִילְמָא כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא דַּאֲמַלְתְּרָאוֹת, בָּאוּלָם תַּנְיָא?
human_translation: And, that what is the refutation? Perhaps when that with regard to cornices was taught, it was taught with regard to the Entrance Hall,
llm_translation: And this, what is the reason for it? Perhaps when it was taught that which you said, it was taught in the hall?

hebrew_text: וְהַאי מַאי קוּשְׁיָא? דִילְמָא תַּבְנִית הֵיכַל כְּתַבְנִית אוּלָם?
human_translation: And what is the difficulty that? Perhaps the design of the Sanctuary was like the design of the Entrance Hall.
llm_translation: And this, what is the question? Perhaps the structure of the Temple is like the structure of the Hall?

hebrew_text: אַלְּמָה אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא אָמַר רַב: רְחָבָה אַרְבָּעָה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינָהּ בְּרִיאָה. וְאִם יֵשׁ לָהּ אֲמַלְתְּרָא אֲפִילּוּ גְּבוֹהָה יוֹתֵר מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְמַעֵט.
human_translation: Why did Rabbi Ile’a say Rav said: width four even if it is not sturdy, And if it has a cornice, even if it is higher than twenty cubits, one need not diminish
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Why did Rabbi Ilai say that Rabbi said: A courtyard four, even though it is not a structure. And if it has a balcony, even if it is higher than twenty cubits, it does not need to be diminished.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אֲמַלְתְּרָא מַתְנִיתָא הִיא, מַאן קָתָנֵי לַהּ?
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: cornice is a baraita . Who, teaches
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: It is a contradictory Mishnah, who is the one who taught it?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: וְהָא חָמָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ קָתָנֵי לַהּ, וְתִיהְוֵי אֲמַלְתְּרָא מַתְנִיתָא וְתִיקְשֵׁי לְרַב!
human_translation: Abaye said: Isn’t it Ḥama, son of Rabba bar Avuh, who teaches it? And cornice will be a baraita , it poses a difficulty to Rav.
llm_translation: Abaye said: And behold, the son of Rabba bar Avuh recites it to him, and it should be a support for the Mishnah and a refutation for Rav!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב: דַּל אֲנָא מֵהָכָא, מַתְנְיָיתָא מִי לָא קַשְׁיָין אַהֲדָדֵי? אֶלָּא מַאי אִית לָךְ לְמֵימַר — תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, לְדִידִי נָמֵי תַּנָּאֵי הִיא.
human_translation: Rav said to you: eliminate me from here, don’t the baraitot contradict each other? Rather, what have you to say tanna’im ; so too, according to my is tanna’im .
llm_translation: He said to you, Rav: "I am poor from here, is the Mishnah not difficult for each other? Rather, what do you have to say? It is a Mishnah, it is a Mishnah for me and it is a Mishnah for you."

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: בְּלָא רַב — מַתְנְיָיתָא אַהֲדָדֵי לָא קַשְׁיָין: לְרַבָּנַן קוֹרָה טַעְמָא מַאי — מִשּׁוּם הֶיכֵּרָא, וְהַאי דְּקָתָנֵי ״יָתֵר מִפִּתְחוֹ שֶׁל הֵיכָל״ — סִימָנָא בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Without Rav, the baraitot do not contradict each other, according to the Rabbis, what is the reason a beam as a conspicuous marker And that which is taught Greater than the entrance of the Sanctuary, merely mnemonic
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Without Rav - the Mishnahs are not difficult to each other: for the Rabbis, the beam is for the purpose of recognition, and this that is taught "more than the entrance of the sanctuary" - is merely a sign.

hebrew_text: וְרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, הָנִיחָא אִי לָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ הָא דְּרַבָּה, אֶלָּא אִי סְבִירָא לֵיהּ הָא דְּרַבָּה, דְּאָמַר רַבָּה, כְּתִיב: ״לְמַעַן יֵדְעוּ דוֹרוֹתֵיכֶם כִּי בַסֻּכּוֹת הוֹשַׁבְתִּי״, עַד עֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה אָדָם יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁדָּר בַּסּוּכָּה, לְמַעְלָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה אֵין אָדָם יוֹדֵעַ, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא שָׁלְטָא בֵּיהּ עֵינָא.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak works out well if he does not hold this of Rabba; however, if he holds this of Rabba, Rabba said it is written: “In order that your generations should know that I made dwell in booths up to twenty cubits a person is aware that he is dwelling in a sukka ; above twenty cubits, a person is not aware because the eye does not discern
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak, it is possible if not he agrees with that of Rabba, but if he agrees with that of Rabba, for Rabba said, as it is written: "So that your generations may know that I made the children of Israel dwell in booths," up to twenty cubits a person knows that he dwelt in the booth, beyond twenty cubits a person does not know, because the eye does not have dominion over it.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא גַּבֵּי סוּכָּה נָמֵי בְּהֶיכֵּרָא פְּלִיגִי, אִיפְּלוֹגֵי בְּתַרְתֵּי לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: Apparently, with regard to sukka as well, disagree conspicuous. why do I disagree in two cases,
llm_translation: The matter of a sukkah is similar to the matter of a heichera; they dispute. If they dispute regarding two, why do I need it?

hebrew_text: צְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן גַּבֵּי סוּכָּה — בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה כֵּיוָן דְּלִישִׁיבָה עֲבִידָא, שָׁלְטָא בֵּיהּ עֵינָא. אֲבָל מָבוֹי, דִּלְהִילּוּךְ עֲבִיד — אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן. וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן בְּהָא — בְּהָא קָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן, אֲבָל בְּהָךְ אֵימָא מוֹדוּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: necessary as had taught us with regard to sukka , in this Rabbi Yehuda say since is designed for dwelling, the eye discerns However, an alleyway, is designed for walking, say he concedes to Rabbis And had taught us with regard to that in that the Rabbis say however, in that say they concede to Rabbi Yehuda, necessary
llm_translation: The matter is, for if we were to hear regarding a sukkah - in this case Rabbi Yehuda is saying that once it is fit for sitting, the eye controls it. But in the case of an alleyway, where walking is done - say that the Sages concede to Rabbi Yehuda. And if we were to hear in this case - in this case the Sages say, but in that case they would concede to Rabbi Yehuda. This is necessary.

hebrew_text: מַאי אֲמַלְתְּרָא? רַב חָמָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ אָמַר: קִינֵּי. כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אֲמַר, אָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא: פִּסְקֵי דְאַרְזָא.
human_translation: What an amaltera ? Rav Ḥama, son of Rabba bar Avuh, said: birds’ nests. When Rav Dimi came he said they say in the West, cedar poles.
llm_translation: What is "Amaltra"? Rav Ḥama, son of Rabba bar Avuh, said: "Kinei." When Rav Dimi came, he said, they say in the West: "Piskei d'Arza."

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר פִּסְקֵי דְאַרְזָא, כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן קִינֵּי. מַאן דְּאָמַר קִינֵּי, אֲבָל פִּסְקֵי דְאַרְזָא לָא.
human_translation: The one who said cedar poles all the more so birds’ nests, the one who said birds’ nests but not to cedar poles.
llm_translation: The one who says "Piskei d'Arza," certainly Kinnei. The one who says Kinnei, but Piskei d'Arza not.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן דְּאָמַר פִּסְקֵי דְאַרְזָא מַאי טַעְמָא — מִשּׁוּם דִּנְפִישׁ מְשָׁכֵיהּ. וְהָא סוּכָּה דִּנְפִישׁ מְשָׁכֵיהּ, וְקָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן דְּלָא!
human_translation: the one who said cedar poles. What is reason since its length is great, But isn’t the length of a sukka great and the Rabbis say that not
llm_translation: And one who says that the branches of a cedar tree, what is the reason? - Because its branches are numerous. But a sukkah, its branches are numerous, and the Rabbis say it is not!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: כֵּיוָן דְּקָא חֲשִׁיב אִית לֵיהּ קָלָא.
human_translation: Rather, Since is significant it publicity.
llm_translation: Rather: since he is considering, there is a voice to him.

hebrew_text: מִקְצָת קוֹרָה בְּתוֹךְ עֶשְׂרִים, וּמִקְצָת קוֹרָה לְמַעְלָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים, מִקְצָת סְכָךְ בְּתוֹךְ עֶשְׂרִים, וּמִקְצָת סְכָךְ לְמַעְלָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים? אָמַר רַבָּה: בְּמָבוֹי כָּשֵׁר, בְּסוּכָּה פָּסוּל.
human_translation: part of the beam within twenty and part of the beam above twenty part of the roofing within twenty and part of the roofing above twenty Rabba said: In an alleyway, it is fit; in a sukka , it is unfit.
llm_translation: Some of the roof within twenty, and some of the roof above twenty, some of the sukkah within twenty, and some of the sukkah above twenty? Rabah said: In an alleyway it is valid, in a sukkah it is invalid.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא בְּמָבוֹי דְּכָשֵׁר, דְּאָמְרִינַן קְלוֹשׁ? סוּכָּה נָמֵי לֵימָא קְלוֹשׁ!
human_translation: What is different in an alleyway that it is fit? we say: Thin sukka too, say: Thin
llm_translation: What is different in a valid alleyway, that we say "closed"? In the case of a sukkah, let us also say "closed"!

hebrew_text: אִי קָלְשַׁתְּ — הָוְיָא לַהּ חֲמָתָהּ מְרוּבָּה מִצִּילָּתָהּ.
human_translation: If you thin it will result in whose sun is more than its shade.
llm_translation: If she is light - her anger is greater than her deliverance.

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי, אִי קָלְשַׁתְּ הָוְיָא לַהּ קוֹרָה הַנִּיטֶּלֶת בָּרוּחַ. אֶלָּא עַל כׇּרְחָךְ, נַעֲשׂוּ כְּשַׁפּוּדִין שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת. הָכָא נָמֵי — עַל כׇּרְחָךְ נַעֲשֵׂית צִילָּתָהּ מְרוּבָּה מֵחַמָּתָהּ!
human_translation: Here too, if you thin it would become a beam that is removed by the wind, Rather, perforce, becomes like metal skewers [ shefudin ], Here too, perforce, becomes like whose shade is more than its sun.
llm_translation: Here it is stated: If a metal rod is placed in a windy place, it will become hot. Rather, against its will, they were made like metal rods. Here it is stated - against its will, its shade is greater than its heat!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא מִפַּרְזַקְיָא: סוּכָּה דִּלְיָחִיד הִיא לָא מִדְּכַר, מָבוֹי דִּלְרַבִּים מַדְכְּרִי אַהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: Rava from Parzakya said: A sukka , which is for an individual, he not be reminded An alleyway, which is many they remind each other
llm_translation: Rava said from Partzakya: A sukkah of an individual, it is not remembered, a mavoi of the public, they remind each other.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: סוּכָּה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — אַחְמִירוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן, מָבוֹי דְּרַבָּנַן — לָא אַחְמִירוּ בֵּיהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Ravina said With regard to a sukka , is by Torah law, the Sages were stringent. with regard to an alleyway, is by rabbinic law, the Sages were not stringent.
llm_translation: Ravina said: A sukkah of biblical origin - the Rabbis are stringent with it, an alleyway of Rabbinic origin - the Rabbis are not stringent with it.

hebrew_text: רַב אַדָּא בַּר מַתְנָה מַתְנֵי לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא דְּרַבָּה אִיפְּכָא. אָמַר רַבָּה: בְּמָבוֹי פָּסוּל, בְּסוּכָּה כְּשֵׁירָה!
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Mattana taught this halakha of Rabba opposite Rabba said: In an alleyway, it is unfit; in a sukka , it is fit.
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Matna teaches this teaching of Rabba in reverse. Rabba said: In a mavoi it is invalid, in a sukkah it is valid!

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא סוּכָּה דִּכְשֵׁירָה, דְּאָמְרִינַן קְלוֹשׁ? בְּמָבוֹי נָמֵי לֵימָא קְלוֹשׁ!
human_translation: What is different in a sukka it is fit? we say: Thin in a beam as well, let us say: Thin
llm_translation: What is the difference between a valid sukkah, for we say "klush"? In the case of an alleyway, let us also say "klush"!

hebrew_text: אִי קְלַשַׁת, הָוֵי לַהּ קוֹרָה הַנִּיטֶּלֶת בְּרוּחַ. הָכָא נָמֵי, אִי קָלְשַׁתְּ — הָוְיָא לַהּ חֲמָתָהּ מְרוּבָּה מִצִּילָּתָהּ! אֶלָּא עַל כׇּרְחֲךָ, נַעֲשֵׂית צִילָּתָהּ מְרוּבָּה מֵחַמָּתָהּ, הָכָא נָמֵי, עַל כׇּרְחָךְ נַעֲשׂוּ כְּשַׁפּוּדִין שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת!
human_translation: If you thin it will become a beam that moves in the wind. Here too, if you thin it would become whose sun is more than its shade. Rather, perforce, becomes like whose shade is more than its sun; here too, perforce, becomes like metal skewers,
llm_translation: If it is a soft vessel, let it have a flexible reed. Here, too, if it is soft — let its remedy be greater than its affliction! Rather, inevitably, its remedy is made greater than its affliction. Here, too, they were made like metal cauterizing irons!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא מִפַּרְזַקְיָא: סוּכָּה דִּלְיָחִיד הִיא רָמֵי אַנַּפְשֵׁיהּ וּמִדְּכַר, מָבוֹי דִּלְרַבִּים הִיא סָמְכִי אַהֲדָדֵי וְלָא מִדַּכְרִי, דְאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: קִדְרָא דְבֵי שׁוּתָּפֵי, לָא חַמִּימָא וְלָא קָרִירָא.
human_translation: Rava from Parzakya said: a sukka , which is for an individual, he casts upon himself and is reminded an alleyway, which is many they rely upon each other and are not reminded As people say: A pot partners is neither hot nor cold.
llm_translation: Rava said from Pardesakya: A sukkah of an individual, it elevates itself and leans, an alleyway of the public, they support each other and not lean, as people say: The pot of the people of Shutafey, neither hot nor cold.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: סוּכָּה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — לָא בָּעֵי חִיזּוּק. מָבוֹי דְּרַבָּנַן — בָּעֵי חִיזּוּק.
human_translation: Ravina said: sukka , is by Torah law, does not require reinforcement an alleyway is by rabbinic law, requires reinforcement,
llm_translation: Ravina said: A Sukkah of Torah law - does not require reinforcement. An alleyway of Rabbinic law - requires reinforcement.

hebrew_text: מַאי הָוֵי עֲלַהּ? רַבָּה בַּר רַב עוּלָּא אָמַר: זֶה וָזֶה — פָּסוּל. רָבָא אָמַר: זֶה וָזֶה כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: What was about this Rabba bar Rav Ulla said: this, and that, are unfit. Rava said: this and that are fit,
llm_translation: What is the ruling regarding it? Rabbah bar Rav Huna said: Both are invalid. Rava said: Both are valid.

hebrew_text: חֲלַל סוּכָּה תְּנַן, חֲלַל מָבוֹי תְּנַן.
human_translation: we learned space of the sukka ; we learned space of the alleyway
llm_translation: Empty Sukkah we learned, empty alleyway we learned.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְרָבָא, תַּנְיָא דִּמְסַיַּיע לָךְ: מָבוֹי שֶׁהוּא גָּבוֹהַּ מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה יוֹתֵר מִפִּתְחוֹ שֶׁל הֵיכָל יְמַעֵט. וְהֵיכָל גּוּפוֹ חֲלָלוֹ עֶשְׂרִים.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Rava: was taught that supports your an alleyway is higher than twenty cubits greater than the entrance of the Sanctuary, one must diminish its And the space of the Sanctuary itself was twenty
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to Rava, "A teaching that supports you: A gateway that is higher by twenty cubits than the entrance of the Sanctuary should be diminished. And the Sanctuary itself is twenty cubits wide."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב שִׁימִי בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי לְרַב פָּפָּא: כֵּיצַד הָיָה עוֹשֶׂה — מַנִּיחַ קוֹרָה מִשְּׂפַת עֶשְׂרִים וּלְמַטָּה!
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Rav Ashi raised an objection to Rav Pappa How would he do it? He places the beam from the edge of twenty and below.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Rav Shimi son of Rav Ashi to Rav Papa: How was he doing? - He places a beam from the edge twenty and below!

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: ״וּלְמַעְלָה״. וְהָא ״לְמַטָּה״ קָתָנֵי!
human_translation: say: and above. But isn’t it taught: below?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Eima: "ul'ma'alah." veha "le'matta" katanai! English translation: Eima: "and above." But it is taught "below"!

hebrew_text: הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דִּלְמַטָּה כִּלְמַעְלָה: מָה לְמַעְלָה חֲלָלָהּ עֶשְׂרִים, אַף לְמַטָּה חֲלָלָהּ עֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: is teaching us the following: below is like above. Just as above, space twenty so below, space ten
llm_translation: This is what we infer, perhaps below is like above: Just as above its hollow is twenty, so too below its hollow is ten.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: אַמַּת סוּכָּה וְאַמַּת מָבוֹי בְּאַמָּה בַּת חֲמִשָּׁה, אַמַּת כִּלְאַיִם בְּאַמָּה בַּת שִׁשָּׁה.
human_translation: Abaye said in the name of Rav Naḥman: The cubit of sukka and the cubit of an alleyway a cubit of five the cubit of diverse kinds a cubit of six
llm_translation: Abaye said in the name of Rav Nachman: A cubit of a sukkah and a cubit of an alleyway is a cubit of five handbreadths, a double cubit is a cubit of six handbreadths.

hebrew_text: אַמַּת מָבוֹי בְּאַמָּה בַּת חֲמִשָּׁה, לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? לְגוֹבְהוֹ וּלְפִירְצַת מָבוֹי.
human_translation: The cubit of an alleyway is a cubit of five With regard to what halakha to and to the breach of an alleyway
llm_translation: A cubit of an alleyway is a cubit of five, for what halakha? For its height and for the breach of the alleyway.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִיכָּא מֶשֶׁךְ מָבוֹי בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, דִּלְקוּלָּא!
human_translation: But isn’t there the length of an alleyway? four cubits to a leniency.
llm_translation: And there is a case where there is a protrusion in a courtyard of four cubits, which is a leniency!

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר בְּאַרְבָּעָה טְפָחִים.
human_translation: in accordance with the one who said four handbreadths.
llm_translation: As one who said in four handbreadths.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — וְרוֹב אַמּוֹת קָאָמַר.
human_translation: And if you wish, say four cubits, he is speaking of most, cubits
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: "Within four cubits — and he meant the majority of the cubits."

hebrew_text: אַמַּת סוּכָּה בְּאַמָּה בַּת חֲמִשָּׁה, לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? לְגוֹבְהָהּ וּלְדוֹפֶן עֲקוּמָּה.
human_translation: the cubit of a sukka a cubit of five With regard to what halakha to its height, and to the a curved wall.
llm_translation: A cubit of a sukkah is a cubit of five, for what halakha? For its height and for its slanted roof.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִיכָּא מֶשֶׁךְ סוּכָּה בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, דִּלְקוּלָּא! דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אוֹמֵר אֲנִי, כׇּל סוּכָּה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת עַל אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת פְּסוּלָה!
human_translation: But isn’t there the length of a sukka , four cubits that to a leniency. As it was taught Rabbi says: I say, any sukka that does not in it four cubits by four cubits is invalid.
llm_translation: And there is a case of a sukkah with a length of four cubits, it is a disgrace! As it was taught: Rabbi says: I say, any sukkah that does not have four cubits by four cubits is invalid!

hebrew_text: כְּרַבָּנַן, דְּאָמְרִי: אֲפִילּוּ אֵינָהּ מַחְזֶקֶת אֶלָּא רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ וְשׁוּלְחָנוֹ.
human_translation: in accordance with the Rabbis, who say: even if it holds only one’s head, most of his and his table.
llm_translation: As the Rabbis say: Even if it only strengthens its head, majority, and its table.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי הִיא, וְרוֹב אַמּוֹת קָאָמַר.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Actually, it is Rabbi And he is speaking of most, cubits
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: "It is always Rabbi, and he is speaking in the majority of cases."

hebrew_text: אַמַּת כִּלְאַיִם בְּאַמָּה בַּת שִׁשָּׁה, לְמַאי הִילְכְתָא? לְקָרַחַת הַכֶּרֶם וְלִמְחוֹל הַכֶּרֶם.
human_translation: the cubit of a diverse kinds is a cubit of six handbreadths. With regard to what halakha to a clearing in a vineyard and to the perimeter of a vineyard.
llm_translation: A cubit of two cubits in a cubit of six, for what practical purpose? For the vineyard's trellis and for the vineyard's ditch.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: קָרַחַת הַכֶּרֶם, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: שֵׁשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה אַמּוֹת. וּמְחוֹל הַכֶּרֶם, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: שֵׁשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה אַמּוֹת, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: As we learned a clearing in a vineyard, Beit Shammai say: twenty-four cubits, and Beit Hillel say: Sixteen cubits. the perimeter of a vineyard, Beit Shammai say: Sixteen cubits, and Beit Hillel say: Twelve cubits.
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: Regarding the thickness of the vineyard wall, Beit Shammai say: twenty-four cubits, and Beit Hillel say: sixteen cubits. And regarding the space of the vineyard, Beit Shammai say: sixteen cubits, and Beit Hillel say: twelve cubits.

hebrew_text: אֵיזוֹ הִיא קָרַחַת הַכֶּרֶם? כֶּרֶם שֶׁחָרַב אֶמְצָעִיתוֹ, אֵין שָׁם שֵׁשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה אַמּוֹת לֹא יָבִיא זֶרַע לְשָׁם. הָיוּ שָׁם שֵׁשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה — נוֹתֵן לוֹ כְּדֵי עֲבוֹדָתוֹ, וְזוֹרֵעַ אֶת הַמּוֹתָר.
human_translation: What is a clearing in a vineyard? a vineyard whose middle was laid bare there are not sixteen cubits one may not bring seeds there, there were sixteen cubits one provides its work area, and he sows the rest
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the "baldness of the vineyard"? A vineyard whose middle has been destroyed, there are not there sixteen cubits, he shall not bring seed there. If there were sixteen cubits there - he gives him enough for his work, and he sows the rest. English translation:

hebrew_text: וְאֵיזֶהוּ מְחוֹל הַכֶּרֶם — בֵּין כֶּרֶם לַגָּדֵר. אֵין שָׁם שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה, לֹא יָבִיא זֶרַע לְשָׁם. הָיוּ שָׁם שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה — נוֹתֵן לוֹ כְּדֵי עֲבוֹדָתוֹ, וְזוֹרֵעַ אֶת הַשְּׁאָר.
human_translation: What is the perimeter of a vineyard? between the vineyard and the fence there are not twelve cubits one may not bring seeds there. there were twelve cubits he provides its work area, and he sows the rest.
llm_translation: "And which is the space of the vineyard? — Between the vineyard and the fence. If there are not twelve cubits there, one should not bring seed there. If there are twelve cubits there, one should give him enough for his work, and he may sow the rest."

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִיכָּא רְצוּפִים בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, דִּלְקוּלָּא! דִּתְנַן: כֶּרֶם הַנָּטוּעַ עַל פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ כֶּרֶם. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כֶּרֶם, וְרוֹאִין אֶת הָאֶמְצָעִיִּים כְּאִילּוּ אֵינָם.
human_translation: But isn’t there consecutively, within four cubits which to a leniency? As we learned a vineyard that was planted with less than four cubits Rabbi Shimon says: it is not a vineyard, And the Rabbis say: a vineyard, and one regards the middle as if they are not
llm_translation: And there are rows within four cubits, it is a disgrace! As we learned: A vineyard planted within less than four cubits, Rabbi Shimon says: It is not a vineyard. And the Sages say: It is a vineyard, and they view the middle ones as if they are not there.

hebrew_text: כְּרַבָּנַן, דְּאָמְרִי הָוֵי כֶּרֶם. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, וְרוֹב אַמּוֹת קָאָמַר.
human_translation: in accordance with the Rabbis, who say is a vineyard. And if you wish, say Actually, it is Rabbi Shimon, he is speaking of most, cubits
llm_translation: As the Rabbanan, who say "be like a vineyard." And if you wish, say: "Rather, it is always Rabbi Shimon, and he is speaking in the majority of cases."

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: כׇּל אַמּוֹת בְּאַמָּה בַּת שִׁשָּׁה, אֶלָּא: הַלָּלוּ שׂוֹחֲקוֹת, וְהַלָּלוּ עֲצֵבוֹת.
human_translation: But Rava said in the name of Rav Naḥman: All cubits cubit of six However, these, are expansive whereas those, are compressed
llm_translation: Rava from the name of Rav Nachman said: Every cubits in a cubit daughter six, except: these laughing, and these sorrowful.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: כׇּל אַמּוֹת שֶׁאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים בְּאַמָּה בַּת שִׁשָּׁה, וּבִלְבַד
human_translation: The Gemara raises an objection All cubits that were mentioned by the Sages are cubits of six provided
llm_translation: Challenger: All cubits that the sages said are a cubit, the daughter of six, and only

hebrew_text: שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ מְכֻוּוֹנוֹת. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרָבָא — כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלִיהֶוְיָין הַלָּלוּ שׂוֹחֲקוֹת וְהַלָּלוּ עֲצֵבוֹת. אֶלָּא לְאַבָּיֵי קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: that they are not precisely Granted, according to Rava, So that these, should be expansive and those, depressed However, according to Abaye, difficult.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "That they should not be similar. According to Rava — for how could these be laughing and those be sad. But according to Abbaye, it is difficult!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ אַבָּיֵי, אֵימָא: אַמַּת כִּלְאַיִם בְּאַמָּה בַּת שִׁשָּׁה.
human_translation: Abaye said to you: say: The cubit of diverse kinds is with a cubit of six
llm_translation: Abbaye said to you: say: a cubit of two cubits in a cubit of six.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: כׇּל אַמּוֹת שֶׁאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים בְּכִלְאַיִם בְּאַמָּה בַּת שִׁשָּׁה, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ מְצוּמְצָמוֹת, מִכְּלָל דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא כׇּל אַמּוֹת קָאָמַר!
human_translation: However, from that it is taught the latter clause Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: All the cubits that the Sages mentioned with regard to diverse kinds with cubits of six provided that they are not exact by inference the first tanna is speaking of all cubits,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And this is learned in the latter part: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: All cubits that the Sages stated in cubits, a cubit is six handbreadths, provided that they are not narrow, as it is derived from the first Tanna, he said all cubits!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ אַבָּיֵי: וְלָאו מִי אִיכָּא רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל דְּקָאֵי כְּווֹתִי, אֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: Abaye said to you: Isn’t there Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who holds in accordance with my I stated in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: He said to you, Abaye: But isn't there Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel who stands like my equal, I who say like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: לְאַבָּיֵי וַדַּאי תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. לְרָבָא מִי לֵימָא תַּנָּאֵי הִיא?
human_translation: According to Abaye, is certainly tanna’im , According to Rava, must it be said this is tanna’im ?
llm_translation: To Abbaye, and certainly it is a teaching. To Rava, who should say it is a teaching?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רָבָא: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הָא אֲתָא לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן: אַמַּת כִּלְאַיִם לֹא יְצַמְצֵם.
human_translation: Rava said to you: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel came to teach us this: One not reduce the cubit of diverse kinds
llm_translation: He said to you, Rava: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel came to teach us: "A true eunuch shall not diminish."

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא: ״אַמַּת כִּלְאַיִם לֹא יְצַמְצֵם״, בְּאַמָּה בַּת שִׁשָּׁה לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי? לָאו לְמַעוֹטֵי אַמַּת סוּכָּה וְאַמַּת מָבוֹי?
human_translation: And let him say: One must not reduce the cubit of diverse kinds What does A cubit of six to exclude? Does it not to exclude the cubit of a sukka and the cubit of an alleyway,
llm_translation: And say: "A cubit of two is not to be diminished," with a cubit of six for what? Not for the diminishment of a cubit of a sukkah and a cubit of an alleyway?

hebrew_text: לָא, לְמַעוֹטֵי אַמָּה יְסוֹד וְאַמָּה סוֹבֵב,
human_translation: No, to exclude the cubit of the base and the cubit of the surrounding ledge
llm_translation: No, for the purpose of lessening an amah, the foundation and an amah surrounding.

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאֵלֶּה מִדּוֹת הַמִּזְבֵּחַ בָּאַמּוֹת אַמָּה אַמָּה וָטֹפַח וְחֵיק הָאַמָּה וְאַמָּה רֹחַב וּגְבוּלָהּ אֶל שְׂפָתָהּ סָבִיב זֶרֶת הָאֶחָד וְזֶה גַּב הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״. ״חֵיק הָאַמָּה״ — זֶה יְסוֹד, ״וְאַמָּה רֹחַב״ — זֶה סוֹבֵב, ״וּגְבוּלָהּ אֶל שְׂפָתָהּ סָבִיב״ — אֵלּוּ הַקְּרָנוֹת, ״וְזֶה גַּב הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״ — זֶה מִזְבַּח הַזָּהָב.
human_translation: As it is written: “And these are the measures of the altar by cubits; the cubit is a cubit and a handbreadth, the bottom shall be a cubit, and the breadth a cubit, and its border by its edge round about shall be a span: And this shall be the higher part of the altar” “The bottom shall be a cubit,” this is the base “and the breadth a cubit,” this is the surrounding ledge “and its border by its edge round about,” these are the horns “and this shall be the higher part of the altar,” the golden altar
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is written: "And these are the measurements of the altar in cubits: the cubit is a cubit and a handbreadth, and the bottom shall be a cubit, and the width a cubit, and its border around its edge a span, and this shall be the height of the altar." "The bottom shall be a cubit" - this is the foundation. "And the width a cubit" - this is the surrounding area. "And its border around its edge a span" - these are the horns. "And this shall be the height of the altar" - this is the golden altar.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: שִׁיעוּרִין חֲצִיצִין וּמְחִיצִין, הֲלָכָה לְמֹשֶׁה מִסִּינַי.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Ashi said Rav said: The measures interpositions partitions are halakhot to Moses from Sinai.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Ashe said, Rabbi said: Measurements, partitions, and enclosures, the halacha is according to the ruling of Moses from Sinai.

hebrew_text: שִׁיעוּרִין?! דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הוּא! דִּכְתִיב: ״אֶרֶץ חִטָּה וּשְׂעוֹרָה וְגוֹ׳״, וְאָמַר רַב חָנָן: כׇּל הַפָּסוּק הַזֶּה לְשִׁיעוּרִין נֶאֱמַר —
human_translation: measures They are in the Torah, as it is written: “A land of wheat, and barley, and Rav Ḥanan said: This entire verse was stated for measures
llm_translation: Measurements?! It is from the Torah! As it is written: "A land of wheat and barley, etc.," and Rav Hanan said: This entire verse was stated for measurements —

hebrew_text: ״חִטָּה״, לִכְדִתְנַן: הַנִּכְנָס לַבַּיִת הַמְנוּגָּע וְכֵלָיו עַל כְּתֵיפָיו, וְסַנְדָּלָיו וְטַבְּעוֹתָיו בְּיָדָיו — הוּא וְהֵם טְמֵאִין מִיָּד. הָיָה לָבוּשׁ כֵּלָיו, וְסַנְדָּלָיו בְּרַגְלָיו, וְטַבְּעוֹתָיו בְּאֶצְבְּעוֹתָיו הוּא טָמֵא מִיָּד, וְהֵן טְהוֹרִין עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁהֶא בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס — פַּת חִיטִּין וְלֹא פַּת שְׂעוֹרִין, מֵיסֵב וְאוֹכֵל בְּלִיפְתָּן.
human_translation: Wheat as that which we learned One who enters a house afflicted with leprosy and his clothes over his shoulders, and his sandals and his rings are in his hands, he and they, immediately ritually impure. he was dressed in his clothes, and his sandals were on his feet, and his rings were on his fingers, he immediately ritually impure, but they, remain pure until he stays long enough to eat half a loaf wheat bread, and not barley bread, reclining and eating with relish,
llm_translation: "Wheat," as we learned: One who enters a house afflicted with tzara'at, and his garments on his shoulders, and his sandals and rings in his hands — he and they are immediately impure. If he was wearing his garments, and his sandals on his feet, and his rings on his fingers, he is impure immediately, and they are pure until the time it takes to eat a half loaf of wheat bread and not barley bread, he sits and eats with them.

hebrew_text: ״שְׂעוֹרָה״, דִּתְנַן: עֶצֶם כִּשְׂעוֹרָה מְטַמֵּא בְּמַגָּע וּבְמַשָּׂא, וְאֵינוֹ מְטַמֵּא בְּאֹהֶל.
human_translation: Barley as we learned A bone of a barley imparts impurity through contact and by being carried, it does not impart impurity of a tent,
llm_translation: "Se'orah," as we learned: A bone like "se'orah" imparts impurity through contact and carrying, but does not impart impurity in a tent.

hebrew_text: ״גֶּפֶן״: כְּדֵי רְבִיעִית יַיִן לְנָזִיר.
human_translation: vine is the quantity of a quarter- log of wine for a nazirite.
llm_translation: "Gefen": ke'dei revi'it yayin le'nazir.

hebrew_text: ״תְּאֵנָה״: כִּגְרוֹגֶרֶת לְהוֹצָאַת שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Fig a dried fig-bulk with regard to carrying out Shabbat.
llm_translation: "Te'enah": like a dried fig for the purpose of Shabbat.

hebrew_text: ״רִמּוֹן״, כְּדִתְנַן: כׇּל כְּלֵי בַּעֲלֵי בָתִּים שִׁיעוּרָן כְּרִימּוֹנִים.
human_translation: Pomegranate as that which we learned All vessels belonging to homeowners the size of pomegranates.
llm_translation: "Pomegranate," as we learned: all vessels of householders, their measure is like pomegranates.

hebrew_text: ״אֶרֶץ זֵית שֶׁמֶן (וּדְבָשׁ)״: אֶרֶץ שֶׁכׇּל שִׁיעוּרֶיהָ כְּזֵיתִים. כׇּל שִׁיעוּרֶיהָ סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! וְהָאִיכָּא הָנֵי דַּאֲמַרַן! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: אֶרֶץ שֶׁרוֹב שִׁיעוּרֶיהָ כְּזֵיתִים.
human_translation: A land of olive oil and honey, A land, all of whose measures are olive-bulks. Does it enter your mind all of whose measures Yet aren’t there those that we mentioned Rather, say: A land, most of whose measures are olive-bulks,
llm_translation: "The land of olive oil (and honey): a land whose every measurement is like olives. All its measurements are beyond your understanding?! But what about those that we mentioned! Rather say: a land whose majority of measurements are like olives."

hebrew_text: ״דְּבַשׁ״, כְּכוֹתֶבֶת הַגַּסָּה לְיוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים.
human_translation: Honey, to Yom Kippur, a large date-bulk
llm_translation: "Honey," as it is written in the book of Esther for Yom Kippur.

hebrew_text: וְתִיסְבְּרָא שִׁיעוּרִין מִיכְתָּב כְּתִיבִי? אֶלָּא הִלְכְתָא נִינְהוּ, וְאַסְמְכִינְהוּ רַבָּנַן אַקְּרָאֵי.
human_translation: And can you hold measures are written Rather, they are halakhot and the Sages based them on verses
llm_translation: And is it to be thought that the measurements are from the written Torah? Rather, they are Halakha, and the Rabbis support them with verses.

hebrew_text: חֲצִיצִין, דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא נִינְהוּ! דִּכְתִיב: ״וְרָחַץ אֶת כָּל בְּשָׂרוֹ (בַּמַּיִם)״, שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא דָּבָר חוֹצֵץ בֵּין בְּשָׂרוֹ לַמַּיִם. ״בַּמַּיִם״ — בְּמֵי מִקְוֶה. ״כׇּל בְּשָׂרוֹ״ — מַיִם שֶׁכׇּל גּוּפוֹ עוֹלֶה בָּהֶן, וְכַמָּה הֵן — אַמָּה עַל אַמָּה בְּרוּם שָׁלֹשׁ אַמּוֹת. וְשִׁיעֲרוּ חֲכָמִים מֵי מִקְוֶה אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה.
human_translation: interpositions are in the Torah, as it is written: “And he shall bathe all his flesh in the water” that nothing should intervene between his flesh and the water. “in the water” in the water of a ritual bath, “all his flesh” water into which all of his body can enter, And how much is that? a cubit by a cubit by the height of three cubits. And the Sages calculated the waters of a ritual bath forty se’a .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Chatzitzin, de'orayta ninhu! Dichtiv: "Ve'rachat et kol basaro (bamayim)," shelo yehi davar chotetz bein basaro lamayim. "Bamayim" — b'mei mikveh. "Kol basaro" — mayim shekol gufo oleh bahen, v'kama hen — amah al amah b'rum shalosh amot. V'shi'aru chachamim mei mikveh arba'im se'ah. English translation: Separations, they are from the Torah! As it is written: "And he shall wash all his flesh (in water)," so that there shall be no barrier between his flesh and the water. "In water" — in the waters of a mikveh. "All his flesh" — water that covers his entire body, and how much is that — a cubit by a cubit in height of three cubits. And the Sages estimated the water of a mikveh to be forty se'ah.

hebrew_text: כִּי אִיצְטְרִיךְ הִילְכְתָא, לִשְׂעָרוֹ. וְכִדְרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא, דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: נִימָא אַחַת קְשׁוּרָה חוֹצֶצֶת, שָׁלֹשׁ אֵינָן חוֹצְצוֹת, שְׁתַּיִם אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ.
human_translation: halakha is needed to his hair, And this is in accordance with Rabba bar Rav Huna, as Rabba bar Rav Huna said: A single hair tied constitutes an interposition Three do not constitute an interposition, two I do not know
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "For a case of necessity, one may go out with it. And as Rabba bar Rav Huna said, for Rabba bar Rav Huna said: If one is tied with one knot, it is considered a partition; with three knots, it is not considered a partition; with two knots, I do not know."

hebrew_text: שְׂעָרוֹ נָמֵי דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הוּא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְרָחַץ אֶת כָּל בְּשָׂרוֹ״ — אֶת הַטָּפֵל לִבְשָׂרוֹ, וְזֶהוּ שֵׂעָר!
human_translation: his hair is also in the Torah, as it was taught And he shall bathe all [ et kol ] his flesh. that which is subordinate to his flesh, and that is hair.
llm_translation: His hair is considered part of the Torah, as it is taught: "And he shall wash all his flesh" - including the attached hair to his flesh, and this is the hair!

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתַאי הִילְכְתָא לְרוּבּוֹ וּלְמִיעוּטוֹ וּלְמַקְפִּיד וּלְשֶׁאֵין מַקְפִּיד, וְכִדְרַבִּי יִצְחָק.
human_translation: halakha comes with regard to its majority and its minority, and with regard to one who is particular and one who is not particular, in accordance with Rabbi Yitzḥak.
llm_translation: When it comes, it goes to the majority and the minority, to the meticulous and the non-meticulous, as Rabbi Yitzchak said.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה רוּבּוֹ וּמַקְפִּיד עָלָיו חוֹצֵץ, וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ מַקְפִּיד עָלָיו אֵינוֹ חוֹצֵץ. וְגָזְרוּ עַל רוּבּוֹ שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַקְפִּיד מִשּׁוּם רוּבּוֹ הַמַּקְפִּיד, וְעַל מִיעוּטוֹ הַמַּקְפִּיד מִשּׁוּם רוּבּוֹ הַמַּקְפִּיד.
human_translation: As Rabbi Yitzḥak said: By Torah law, the majority his and he is particular is it an interposition However, if he is not particular about it is not an interposition. issued a decree the majority one’s he is not particular, due to the majority one’s he is particular. And, the minority his one is particular, due to the majority his one is particular.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Yitzchak said: A matter of Torah, its majority and one who is meticulous about it is a barrier, and one who is not meticulous about it is not a barrier. And they decreed regarding its majority that one who is not meticulous because of its majority is like one who is meticulous, and regarding its minority that one who is meticulous because of its minority is like one who is meticulous because of its majority.

hebrew_text: וְלִיגְזוֹר נָמֵי עַל מִיעוּטוֹ שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַקְפִּיד מִשּׁוּם מִיעוּטוֹ הַמַּקְפִּיד, אִי נָמֵי מִשּׁוּם רוּבּוֹ שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַקְפִּיד!
human_translation: let us also issue a decree the minority one’s he is not particular due to the minority his one is particular, or alternatively, due to the majority his he is not particular.
llm_translation: And to decree upon him regarding his minority that he does not insist because of his minority, the one who insists, if he insists because of his majority, he does not insist!

hebrew_text: הִיא גּוּפַהּ גְּזֵירָה, וַאֲנַן נֵיקוּם וְנִיגְזוֹר גְּזֵירָה לִגְזֵירָה?!
human_translation: an interposition is itself a decree. Shall we rise up and issue decree to decree?
llm_translation: She herself is a decree, and we should take revenge and decree a decree upon a decree?!

hebrew_text: מְחִיצּוֹת, דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא נִינְהוּ!
human_translation: partitions They are in the Torah,
llm_translation: Partitions, for they are of biblical origin!

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר מָר: אָרוֹן תִּשְׁעָה וְכַפּוֹרֶת טֶפַח, הֲרֵי כָּאן עֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: As the Master said: Ark nine And the cover handbreadth, which ten.
llm_translation: Master said: The Ark is nine handbreadths and the Cover of the Ark is one handbreadth, here we have ten handbreadths.

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּאָמַר: אַמַּת בִּנְיָן בְּאַמָּה בַּת שִׁשָּׁה. אַמַּת כֵּלִים בְּאַמָּה בַּת חֲמִשָּׁה.
human_translation: is necessary only Rabbi Yehuda, who said: The cubit the building was a cubit of six the cubit vessels was a cubit of five
llm_translation: Not needed, for Rabbi Yehuda said: A cubit of building is a cubit of six handbreadths. A cubit of utensils is a cubit of five handbreadths.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי מֵאִיר דְּאָמַר: כׇּל הָאַמּוֹת הָיוּ בְּבֵינוֹנִית, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Meir, who said: All the cubits were medium what can be said?
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Meir who said: "All the nations were in moderation, what is there to say?"

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, כִּי אֲתַאי הִילְכְתָא — לְגוּד וּלְלָבוּד וּלְדוֹפֶן עֲקוּמָּה.
human_translation: According to Rabbi Meir, halakha comes extending gode ], and joining [ lavud ], and the curved wall
llm_translation: To Rabbi Meir, when the Halacha came - for Gud and for Lavud and for Dofen Akumah.

hebrew_text: הָיָה גָּבוֹהַּ מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה וּבָא לְמַעֲטוֹ, כַּמָּה מְמַעֵט? כַּמָּה מְמַעֵט?! כַּמָּה דִּצְרִיךְ לֵיהּ!
human_translation: was higher than twenty cubits and one comes to diminish its how much must he diminish How much must he diminish The amount that he needs
llm_translation: He was high from twenty cubits and came to diminish it, how much does he diminish? How much does he diminish?! How much does he need!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: רׇחְבּוֹ בְּכַמָּה? רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: טֶפַח, אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: Rather, how much the width Rav Yosef said: handbreadth. Abaye said: Four
llm_translation: Instead: How wide is it? Rav Yosef said: A handbreadth. Abbaye said: Four.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר טֶפַח, קָסָבַר: מוּתָּר לְהִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ תַּחַת הַקּוֹרָה,
human_translation: Let us say disagree about this: The one who said handbreadth holds one is permitted to utilize beneath the beam
llm_translation: Let us say in this case where they are in disagreement, as to who says a handbreadth, he holds: it is permitted to make use under the beam,

hebrew_text: וּמַאן דְּאָמַר אַרְבָּעָה, קָסָבַר: אָסוּר לְהִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ תַּחַת הַקּוֹרָה!
human_translation: And the one who said four holds to utilize beneath the beam.
llm_translation: And one who says four, holds: it is forbidden to make use under the beam!

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא קָסָבְרִי מוּתָּר לְהִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ תַּחַת הַקּוֹרָה, וּבְהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי: מָר סָבַר קוֹרָה מִשּׁוּם הֶיכֵּר, וּמָר סָבַר קוֹרָה מִשּׁוּם מְחִיצָה.
human_translation: No, everyone agrees that it is permitted to utilize beneath the beam, and they disagree with regard to this: Master, holds a beam as a conspicuous marker And Master, holds a beam as a partition,
llm_translation: Not, that all the world holds, permissible to use under the beam, and in this they dispute: one master holds the beam is for the sake of adornment, and one master holds the beam is for the sake of partition.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא קוֹרָה מִשּׁוּם הֶיכֵּר, וְהָכָא — בְּהֶיכֵּר שֶׁל מַטָּה וּבְהֶיכֵּר שֶׁל מַעְלָה קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר אָמְרִינַן הֶיכֵּר שֶׁל מַטָּה כְּהֶיכֵּר שֶׁל מַעְלָה, וּמָר סָבַר לָא אָמְרִינַן הֶיכֵּר שֶׁל מַטָּה כְּהֶיכֵּר שֶׁל מַעְלָה.
human_translation: And if you wish, say that everyone agrees a beam as a conspicuous marker, and here they disagree with regard to a conspicuous marker below, and a conspicuous marker above, Master, holds we say the conspicuous marker below is like the conspicuous marker above, And Master, holds we do not say the conspicuous marker below is like the conspicuous marker above.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: In all the world, a beam is recognized because of its mark, and here — in the mark of the lower beam and in the mark of the upper beam it is distinguished, for one Sage holds that we say the mark of the lower beam is like the mark of the upper beam, and the other Sage holds that we do not say the mark of the lower beam is like the mark of the upper beam.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אָמְרִינַן: הֶיכֵּר שֶׁל מַטָּה כְּהֶיכֵּר שֶׁל מַעְלָה, וְהָכָא בִּגְזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יִפְחוֹת קָמִיפַּלְגִי.
human_translation: And if you wish, say that everyone agrees we say the conspicuous marker below is like conspicuous marker above, But here they disagree whether decreed lest diminish
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: In all the world, we say: The recognition of the lower part is like the recognition of the upper part, and here it is by decree lest one diminish and cause a split.

hebrew_text: הָיָה פָּחוֹת מֵעֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים וְחָקַק בּוֹ לְהַשְׁלִימוֹ לַעֲשָׂרָה, כַּמָּה חוֹקֵק? כַּמָּה חוֹקֵק?! כַּמָּה דִּצְרִיךְ לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא מִשְׁכּוֹ בְּכַמָּה? רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: בְּאַרְבָּעָה, אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: was less than ten handbreadths and one hollowed out to complete to ten, how much must he hollow out? How much must he hollow out? However much is necessary for it Rather, How far must extend Rav Yosef said: Four Abaye said: Four cubits.
llm_translation: He was less than ten handbreadths and he carved in it to complete it to ten, how much does he carve? How much does he carve?! How much does he need! Rather, how much does he draw it out? Rav Yosef said: By four, Abaye said: By four cubits.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא בִּדְרַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּאִיתְּמַר: מָבוֹי שֶׁנִּפְרַץ מִצִּידּוֹ כְּלַפֵּי רֹאשׁוֹ, אִיתְּמַר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי: אִם יֵשׁ שָׁם פַּס אַרְבָּעָה — מַתִּיר בְּפִירְצָה עַד עֶשֶׂר.
human_translation: Let us say that disagree with regard to Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi. As it was stated the side wall of an alleyway was breached toward its entrance, It was stated in the name of Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi: If an board four renders it permitted a breach up to ten
llm_translation: Let us say in the name of Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi who disagree, as it was stated: A courtyard that was breached on one side opposite its entrance, it was stated in the name of Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi: If there is there a breach of four cubits — one may permit carrying within it up to ten cubits.

hebrew_text: וְאִם לָאו, פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה מַתִּיר. שְׁלֹשָׁה אֵינוֹ מַתִּיר. לְרַב יוֹסֵף אִית לֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי, לְאַבָּיֵי לֵית לֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי.
human_translation: And if no less than three renders it permitted three does not render it permitted Rav Yosef, adopts of Rabbi Ami, Abaye, does not adopt of Rabbi Ami.
llm_translation: "And if not, less than three permits. Three does not permit. According to Rav Yosef, he holds like Rabbi Amei, but according to Abaye, he does not hold like Rabbi Amei."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ אַבָּיֵי: הָתָם סוֹף מָבוֹי, הָכָא תְּחִלַּת מָבוֹי. אִי אִיכָּא אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — אִין, אִי לָא — לָא.
human_translation: Abaye said to you There, the final of an alleyway, Here, the initial of an alleyway, If there are four cubits yes, if not, no,
llm_translation: Abbaye said to you: There, the end of the alleyway; here, the beginning of the alleyway. If there are four cubits - yes; if not - no.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ — דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין מָבוֹי נִיתָּר בְּלֶחִי וְקוֹרָה עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ בָּתִּים וַחֲצֵרוֹת פְּתוּחִין לְתוֹכוֹ.
human_translation: Abaye said: From where do I say As it was taught An alleyway is permitted by means of a side post or beam only if it has houses and courtyards opening into it,
llm_translation: Abaye said: From where do I say this? As it was taught: A passageway is not considered open until there are houses and courtyards open into it.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בְּאַרְבָּעָה הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לֵיהּ!
human_translation: And if four how can you find this
llm_translation: And if with four, how do you find him?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא דְּפָתַח לֵהּ בְּדוֹפֶן הָאֶמְצָעִי, וְהָאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: נְקִיטִינַן, אֵיזֶהוּ מָבוֹי שֶׁנִּיתָּר בְּלֶחִי וְקוֹרָה כֹּל שֶׁאׇרְכּוֹ יָתֵר עַל רׇחְבּוֹ, וּבָתִּים וַחֲצֵרוֹת פְּתוּחִין לְתוֹכוֹ.
human_translation: And if you say that opens through middle wall, Didn’t Rav Naḥman say we hold Which is an alleyway that is permitted by a side post or a beam? Any whose length is greater than its width and has houses and courtyards opening into it.
llm_translation: And if you will say that he opened it with the middle post, and Rav Nachman said: We take, which alleyway is permitted with a beam and a crossbeam, all that its length exceeds its width, and houses and courtyards open into it.

hebrew_text: וְרַב יוֹסֵף: דְּפָתַח לֵיה בְּקֶרֶן זָוִית.
human_translation: And Rav Yosef, where open at its corners.
llm_translation: And Rav Yosef: that he opened to him in the corner horn.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ — דְּאָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לֶחִי הַבּוֹלֵט מִדּוֹפְנוֹ שֶׁל מָבוֹי, פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם לֶחִי, וְאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לֶחִי אַחֵר לְהַתִּירוֹ. אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם מָבוֹי וְצָרִיךְ לֶחִי אַחֵר לְהַתִּירוֹ.
human_translation: Abaye said: From where do I say As Rami bar Ḥama said Rav Huna said: a side post that protrudes from the wall of an alleyway less than four cubits, it is deemed a side post and no other side post is required to render it permitted four cubits, is deemed an alleyway, and another side post is required to render it permitted
llm_translation: Abaye said: From where do I say this? - For Ramei, son of Hama, said that Rav Huna said: If the cheek of the projecting wall of a courtyard is less than four cubits - it is judged due to the cheek, and it does not require another cheek to permit it. If it is four cubits - it is judged due to the courtyard, and it requires another cheek to permit it.

hebrew_text: וְרַב יוֹסֵף? לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִתּוֹרַת לֶחִי עַד דְּאִיכָּא אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת. לְמִיהְוֵי מָבוֹי אֲפִילּוּ בְּאַרְבָּעָה טְפָחִים נָמֵי הָוֵי מָבוֹי.
human_translation: And Rav Yosef, to removing its status as a side post, until there are four cubits in order to be an alleyway, even with four handbreadths it is also an alleyway.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef? To go out from the Torah of Lechi until there are four cubits. To be considered a Mavoi even with four handbreadths, yes, it is considered a Mavoi.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא. אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לֶחִי הַבּוֹלֵט מִדׇּפְנוֹ שֶׁל מָבוֹי
human_translation: itself: Rami bar Ḥama said Rav Huna said: a side post that protrudes from the wall of an alleyway
llm_translation: Body. Ramei son of Hama said Rav Huna: The cheek that protrudes from the side of the alleyway.

hebrew_text: פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם לֶחִי, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לֶחִי אַחֵר לְהַתִּירוֹ. אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם מָבוֹי, וְצָרִיךְ לֶחִי אַחֵר לְהַתִּירוֹ.
human_translation: less than four cubits, it is deemed a side post and no other side post is required to render it permitted. four cubits, is deemed an alleyway, and another side post is required to render it permitted to
llm_translation: Less than four cubits - judged due to a wound, and does not require another wound to permit it. Four cubits - judged due to an alleyway, and requires another wound to permit it.

hebrew_text: אוֹתוֹ לֶחִי, הֵיכָן מַעֲמִידוֹ? אִי דְּמוֹקֵי לֵיהּ בַּהֲדֵיהּ, אוֹסֹפֵי הוּא דְּקָא מוֹסִיף עֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: That side post, where does one position it If one positions it alongside he is extending
llm_translation: That lobe, where does one place it? If he places it on its base, it is considered as if he is adding to it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: דְּמוֹקֵי לֵיהּ לְאִידַּךְ גִּיסָא. רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא דְּמוֹקֵי לֵהּ בַּהֲדֵיהּ דִּמְטַפֵּי בֵּיהּ, אוֹ דִּמְבַצַּר בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: He should position it, on the other side Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Even if you say that he positions it alongside he adds to it or diminishes from it
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: They are similar to each other in one respect. Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Even if you say they are similar to each other in that it drips on it, or that it congeals on it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: לָא אֲמַרַן, אֶלָּא בְּמָבוֹי שְׁמוֹנָה. אֲבָל בְּמָבוֹי שִׁבְעָה — נִיתָּר בְּעוֹמֵד מְרוּבֶּה עַל הַפָּרוּץ.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: We stated only in an alleyway eight However, in an alleyway seven permitted standing is greater than the breached
llm_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: We did not say, except in an alleyway that is eight amot wide. But in an alleyway that is seven amot wide — it is permitted with a standing majority over the breach.

hebrew_text: וְקַל וָחוֹמֶר מֵחָצֵר: וּמָה חָצֵר שֶׁאֵינָהּ נִיתֶּרֶת בְּלֶחִי וְקוֹרָה — נִיתֶּרֶת בְּעוֹמֵד מְרוּבֶּה עַל הַפָּרוּץ, מָבוֹי שֶׁנִּיתָּר בְּלֶחִי וְקוֹרָה — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁנִּיתָּר בְּעוֹמֵד מְרוּבֶּה עַל הַפָּרוּץ?
human_translation: And an a fortiori inference from a courtyard: Just as a courtyard, which is not permitted by a side post or a beam, is permitted as the standing is greater than the breached an alleyway, as is permitted by a side post or a beam, is it not right is permitted when the standing greater than the breached
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And a fortiori from a courtyard: And just as a courtyard that is not nullified by a beam and a crossbeam — is nullified by a standing post that is predominant over the breach, a passageway that is nullified by a beam and a crossbeam — is it not logical that it is not nullified by a standing post that is predominant over the breach?

hebrew_text: מָה לֶחָצֵר שֶׁכֵּן פִּרְצָתָהּ בְּעֶשֶׂר, תֹּאמַר בְּמָבוֹי שֶׁפִּרְצָתוֹ בְּאַרְבַּע!
human_translation: what a courtyard, that its breach is ten you say of an alleyway, its breach is four
llm_translation: The courtyard whose breach is ten cubits wide, you will say it is considered in a passageway whose breach is four cubits wide!

hebrew_text: קָסָבַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: מָבוֹי נָמֵי, פִּרְצָתוֹ בְּעֶשֶׂר. לְמַאן קָאָמְרִינַן? לְרַב הוּנָא, וְהָא רַב הוּנָא פִּרְצָתוֹ בְּאַרְבַּע סְבִירָא לֵיהּ?!
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, holds the breach of an alleyway also ten in accordance with whose did we state in accordance with Rav Huna. But doesn’t Rav Huna hold that the breach four
llm_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, holds: An alleyway that is near, its breach is ten. According to whom do we say this? According to Rav Huna. But doesn't Rav Huna hold that its breach is four?!

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ טַעְמָא דְנַפְשֵׁיהּ קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, stated his own view,
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua, the reason of his soul, he said.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא בְּמָבוֹי שְׁמוֹנֶה נָמֵי לָא צְרִיךְ לֶחִי, מָה נַפְשָׁךְ: אִי עוֹמֵד נְפִישׁ נִיתָּר בְּעוֹמֵד מְרוּבֶּה עַל הַפָּרוּץ, וְאִי פָּרוּץ נְפִישׁ נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם לֶחִי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Even if you say in an alleyway eight too does not require an side post. Whichever you If standing is greater, is permitted, standing is greater than the breached and if breached is greater, deemed a side post,
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Even if you say in a mavoy that is eight cubits wide, it does not require a lechi. What is your reasoning? If the lechi stands out, it is nullified by the majority of the opening, and if it is protruding, it is judged as a lechi.

hebrew_text: מַאי אָמְרַתְּ, דְּשָׁווּ תַּרְוַיְיהוּ כִּי הֲדָדֵי — הָוֵה לֵיהּ סְפֵק דִּבְרֵיהֶן, וּסְפֵק דִּבְרֵיהֶן לְהָקֵל.
human_translation: What you say that the two are equal, This is an uncertainty rabbinic law, and an uncertainty a rabbinic law, lenient
llm_translation: What do you say, that they both agreed like Hadadei - there was for him a doubt in their words, and a doubt in their words to be lenient.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חָנִין בַּר רָבָא אָמַר רַב: מָבוֹי שֶׁנִּפְרַץ
human_translation: Rav Ḥanin bar Rava said Rav said: an alleyway that was breached,
llm_translation: Rav Hanin bar Rava said in the name of Rav: A breached alleyway.

hebrew_text: מִצִּידּוֹ — בְּעֶשֶׂר, מֵרֹאשׁוֹ — בְּאַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: from its side, ten from its front, four
llm_translation: From his side - in ten, from his head - in four.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא מִצִּידּוֹ בְּעֶשֶׂר — דְּאָמַר פִּתְחָא הוּא, מֵרֹאשׁוֹ נָמֵי נֵימָא פִּתְחָא הוּא!
human_translation: What is the difference from the side ten because say it is an entrance. in the front, let us also say it is an entrance,
llm_translation: What is different about his side in ten - for it says, "He is the beginning, the firstborn of all creation."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּפְרַץ בְּקֶרֶן זָוִית, דְּפִתְחָא בְּקֶרֶן זָוִית לָא עָבְדִי אִינָשֵׁי.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: a case where the breach is in a corner. people do not make an entrance in a corner,
llm_translation: Said Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua: For example, when one broke through a corner beam, if he did not open a corner beam, people did not do.

hebrew_text: וְרַב הוּנָא אָמַר: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה בְּאַרְבָּעָה. וְכֵן אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא לְרַב חָנָן בַּר רָבָא: לָא תִּפְלוֹג עִלַּאי דְּרַב אִיקְּלַע לְדַמְחַרְיָא וַעֲבַד עוֹבָדָא כְּווֹתִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רַב בִּקְעָה מָצָא וְגָדַר בָּהּ גָּדֵר.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: both this and that, four And so Rav Huna said to Rav Ḥanan bar Rava: Do not dispute me, as Rav arrived at Damḥarya and performed an action, in accordance with my said to him: Rav found an valley and fenced it in,
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: one this and one this in four. And so Rav Huna said to Rav Hanan bar Rava: do not divide the upper part of Rav, for he will come to the bloodletter tomorrow and do the work of a butcher. He said to him: Rav found a valley and fenced it in.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִיתְּמַר: מָבוֹי עָקוֹם — רַב אָמַר: תּוֹרָתוֹ כִּמְפוּלָּשׁ. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: תּוֹרָתוֹ כְּסָתוּם.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Rav Huna’s opinion stands to reason, as it was stated a crooked, alleyway Rav said: Its law is like open And Shmuel said: Its law is like closed
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: The measurements of Rav Huna are plausible, as it was stated: A crooked alleyway - Rav said: Its law is like a folded garment. And Shmuel said: Its law is like a sealed vessel.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בְּיוֹתֵר מֵעֶשֶׂר — בְּהָא לֵימָא שְׁמוּאֵל תּוֹרָתוֹ כְּסָתוּם?
human_translation: With what are we dealing? If you say more than ten in this would Shmuel say that its law is like closed
llm_translation: In what are we dealing? Perhaps with more than a tithe — in this case, let us say: "Shmuel's Torah is like a sealed book?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו בְּעֶשֶׂר, וְקָאָמַר רַב תּוֹרָתוֹ כִּמְפוּלָּשׁ, אַלְמָא פִּירְצַת מָבוֹי מִצִּידּוֹ בְּאַרְבָּעָה!
human_translation: Rather, are we not ten and Rav said the law is like that of open Apparently, a breach in the side of an alleyway four
llm_translation: Rather, not with ten, and Rav said his Torah is like a spread out garment, implying that the breach of an alleyway is on its side with four!

hebrew_text: וְרַב חָנָן בַּר רָבָא, שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דְּקָא בָּקְעִי בַּהּ רַבִּים.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥanan bar Rava It is different there, for many people cross through
llm_translation: And Rav Hanan son of Rava, there they differ, for he was arguing with the many.

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דְּרַב הוּנָא סָבַר אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא בָּקְעִי בַּהּ רַבִּים, מַאי שְׁנָא מִדְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי?
human_translation: inferred that Rav Huna holds even if many people not cross through What is the difference Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi
llm_translation: From the premise of Rav Huna, he holds that even though the majority do not agree with it, what is the difference between the opinion of Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi?

hebrew_text: הָתָם דְּאִיכָּא גִּידּוּדֵי, הָכָא דְּלֵיכָּא גִּידּוּדֵי.
human_translation: There, there are remnants of a wall here, there are no remnants of a wall.
llm_translation: There, where there are sinews, here where there are no sinews.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כֵּיצַד מְעָרְבִין דֶּרֶךְ רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים? עוֹשֶׂה צוּרַת הַפֶּתַח מִכָּאן, וְלֶחִי וְקוֹרָה מִכָּאן. חֲנַנְיָה אוֹמֵר: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: עוֹשֶׂה דֶּלֶת מִכָּאן וְדֶלֶת מִכָּאן וּכְשֶׁהוּא יוֹצֵא וְנִכְנָס נוֹעֵל. בֵּית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: עוֹשֶׂה דֶּלֶת מִכָּאן, וְלֶחִי וְקוֹרָה מִכָּאן.
human_translation: The Sages taught How does one render a public thoroughfare fit by an eiruv ? He constructs an form of a doorway from here, and a side post or a beam from here, Ḥananya says: Beit Shammai say: He constructs a door from here, and a door from here, and when he exits and enters, he must lock Beit Hillel say: He constructs a door from here, and a side post or a beam from here,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: How do we combine the public domain? One makes the form of the entrance from here, and the doorpost and lintel from here. Chananya says: Beit Shammai say: One makes a door from here and a door from here, and when he goes out and comes in, he closes it. Beit Hillel say: One makes a door from here, and the doorpost and lintel from here.

hebrew_text: וּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים מִי מִיעָרְבָא?! וְהָתַנְיָא: יָתֵר עַל כֵּן אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה,
human_translation: Can a public domain be rendered fit by an eiruv ? Wasn’t it taught Furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda said:
llm_translation: The public domain, who will mix it up?! And it was taught: All the more so did Rabbi Yehuda say,

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁהָיוּ לוֹ שְׁנֵי בָתִּים מִשְּׁנֵי צִידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, עוֹשֶׂה לֶחִי מִכָּאן וְלֶחִי מִכָּאן, אוֹ קוֹרָה מִכָּאן וְקוֹרָה מִכָּאן, וְנוֹשֵׂא וְנוֹתֵן בָּאֶמְצַע. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵין מְעָרְבִין רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים בְּכָךְ.
human_translation: One who has two houses on the two sides of the public domain, he may place a side post from here, and side post from here, Alternatively, a beam from here, and beam from here, and he may carry and place between said to him: One cannot render a public domain fit by an eiruv in this manner.
