llm_translation: One who had two houses on two sides of a public domain, he makes a partition here and a partition there, or a beam here and a beam there, and carries back and forth in the middle. They said to him: One may not combine a public domain in this manner.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא בְּכָךְ הוּא דְּלָא מִיעָרְבָא, הָא בִּדְלָתוֹת מִיעָרְבָא, וְהָאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: יְרוּשָׁלַיִם, אִילְמָלֵא דַּלְתוֹתֶיהָ נִנְעָלוֹת בַּלַּיְלָה — חַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים!
human_translation: And if you say in this manner, that cannot be rendered fit but by doors rendered fit for carrying. But didn’t Rabba bar bar Ḥana say Rabbi Yoḥanan Jerusalem, were it not for its doors are locked at night, one would be liable for it because as a public domain?
llm_translation: And if you will say that in this case it is not considered mingling, behold, through its doors it is considered mingling. And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Jerusalem, were it not for the fact that its doors are locked at night - one would be liable for carrying on Shabbat in its public domain!

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר עוּלָּא: הָנֵי אֲבוּלֵּי דְמָחוֹזָא אִילְמָלֵא דַּלְתוֹתֵיהֶן נִנְעָלוֹת — חַיָּיבִין עֲלֵיהֶן מִשּׁוּם רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים.
human_translation: And Ulla stated: the entrances [ abbulei ] of Meḥoza, were it not for the fact that their doors are locked, one liable for them, because a public domain.
llm_translation: And Ula said: Those residents of Mahoza, if not for their doors being locked - they are liable for the public domain.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, הָכִי קָאָמַר: כֵּיצַד מְעָרְבִין מְבוֹאוֹת הַמְפוּלָּשִׁין לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, עוֹשֶׂה צוּרַת הַפֶּתַח מִכָּאן וְלֶחִי וְקוֹרָה מִכָּאן.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: this is what it says: How does one render alleyways that open into the public domain fit by an eiruv ? He constructs an opening form of a doorway from here, and a side post or a beam from here,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said, thus he said: How do we combine the entrances of the alleys that open into the public domain? One makes the form of the doorway from here, and the sidepost and crossbeam from here.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר. רַב אָמַר: הִילְכְתָא כְּתַנָּא קַמָּא. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כַּחֲנַנְיָה.
human_translation: It was stated Rav said: halakha is in accordance with the first tanna And Shmuel says: halakha is in accordance with Ḥananya,
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav said: the halakha is in accordance with the first Tanna. And Shmuel said: the halakha is in accordance with Hananiah.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: לַחֲנַנְיָה אַלִּיבָּא דְּבֵית הִלֵּל צָרִיךְ לִנְעוֹל, אוֹ אֵין צָרִיךְ לִנְעוֹל? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לִנְעוֹל. וְכֵן אָמַר רַב מַתְנָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לִנְעוֹל. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי אָמַר רַב מַתְנָה: בְּדִידִי הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא, וְאָמַר לִי שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין צָרִיךְ לִנְעוֹל.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before to Ḥananya, in accordance with of Beit Hillel, must be locked or need it not be locked? Come hear which Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said, need not be locked. And similarly, Rav Mattana said Shmuel said: need not be locked. Some say Rav Mattana said: A case happened to me, and Shmuel said to me: need not be locked.
llm_translation: He asked them: Does the chamber of Hananiah, the son of Hillel, need to be locked, or does it not need to be locked? Come and hear, for Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: It does not need to be locked. And so said Rav Matnah in the name of Shmuel: It does not need to be locked. There are those who say that Rav Matnah said: In my case, the matter was different, and Shmuel told me: It does not need to be locked.

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב עָנָן: צָרִיךְ לִנְעוֹל אוֹ אֵין צָרִיךְ לִנְעוֹל? אֲמַר לְהוּ: תָּא חֲזִי הָנֵי אֲבוּלֵּי דִּנְהַרְדָּעָא דְּטִימָן עַד פַּלְגַיְיהוּ בְּעַפְרָא, וְעָיֵיל וְנָפֵיק מָר שְׁמוּאֵל, וְלָא אֲמַר לְהוּ וְלָא מִידֵּי.
human_translation: They raised a dilemma before Rav Anan Need be locked or need not be locked? He said to them: Come see these entrances of Neharde’a which were filled up halfway with earth, Mar Shmuel goes in and out but has never said anything to
llm_translation: He asked from Rav Anan: Does it require locking or does it not require locking? He said to them: Come and see those water channels of Timan until their estuaries in Afra, and Mar Shmuel came and did not say to them and not immediately.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: הָנָךְ מְגוּפוֹת הֲוַאי.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said: Those were blocked,
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: "Hanach megufot havai."

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: פַּנְּיוּהּ לְעַפְרַיְיהוּ. לֵימָא קָסָבַר רַב נַחְמָן: צָרִיךְ לִנְעוֹל? לָא, כֵּיוָן דִּרְאוּיוֹת לִנְעוֹל, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין נִנְעָלוֹת.
human_translation: when Rav Naḥman came he said: Clear away the earth, Let us say that Rav Naḥman holds must be locked. No, be fit to be locked, even if they are not locked.
llm_translation: When Rav Nachman came, he said: "It is facing its ashes." Let us say: Does Rav Nachman hold that it needs to be locked? No, once it is fit to be locked, even though it is not locked.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא מָבוֹי עָקוֹם דַּהֲוָה בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא, רְמֵי עֲלֵיהּ חוּמְרֵיהּ דְּרַב וְחוּמְרֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, וְאַצְרְכוּהוּ דְּלָתוֹת. חוּמְרֵיהּ דְּרַב — דְּאָמַר: תּוֹרָתוֹ כִּמְפוּלָּשׁ. וְהָאָמַר רַב הֲלָכָה כְּתַנָּא קַמָּא?!
human_translation: a certain crooked, alleyway that was in Neharde’a, upon which they imposed the stringency of Rav and the stringency of Shmuel, and required it doors. The stringency of Rav, which he said, is regarded like open But didn’t Rav say the law follows the first tanna
llm_translation: That alleyway that was crooked in Nehardea, they threw upon it the building materials of Rav and the building materials of Shmuel, and they needed doors. The building materials of Rav - for he said: his Torah is like a flowing stream. And did Rav really say that the halacha is like the first Tanna?!

hebrew_text: כִּשְׁמוּאֵל — דְּאָמַר: הֲלָכָה כַּחֲנַנְיָה. וְהָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל תּוֹרָתוֹ כְּסָתוּם! כְּרַב דְּאָמַר תּוֹרָתוֹ כִּמְפוּלָּשׁ.
human_translation: in accordance with Shmuel, who said the halakha is in accordance with Ḥananya. But didn’t Shmuel say is regarded like closed in accordance with Rav, who said is regarded like open
llm_translation: Samuel said: the halakha is like Hananiah. But didn't Samuel say: his Torah is like a sealed cistern! Like Rav who said: his Torah is like a broken cistern.

hebrew_text: וּמִי עָבְדִינַן כִּתְרֵי חוּמְרֵי? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: לְעוֹלָם הֲלָכָה כְּבֵית הִלֵּל, וְהָרוֹצֶה לַעֲשׂוֹת כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי עוֹשֶׂה, כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל עוֹשֶׂה. מִקּוּלֵּי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּמִקּוּלֵּי בֵּית הִלֵּל — רָשָׁע. מֵחוּמְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּמֵחוּמְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל — עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״הַכְּסִיל בְּחֹשֶׁךְ הוֹלֵךְ״. אֶלָּא, אִי כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי כְּקוּלֵּיהוֹן וּכְחוּמְרֵיהוֹן, אִי כְּבֵית הִלֵּל כְּקוּלֵּיהוֹן וּכְחוּמְרֵיהוֹן.
human_translation: But do we adopt the stringencies of two Wasn’t it taught halakha is always in accordance with Beit Hillel, but one who wishes to act in accordance with the opinion of Beit Shammai may do so, in accordance with the opinion of Beit Hillel may do so. the leniencies of Beit Shammai and the leniencies of Beit Hillel, a wicked person. the stringencies of Beit Shammai and the stringencies of Beit Hillel, with regard to him the verse states: “The fool walks in darkness” Rather, either in accordance with Beit Shammai, their leniencies and their stringencies, or in accordance with Beit Hillel, their leniencies and their stringencies.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who do we follow, the leniencies of Beit Shammai or the leniencies of Beit Hillel? But it was taught: Always the halakha is like Beit Hillel. And one who wishes to act according to the words of Beit Shammai may do so, and one who wishes to act according to the words of Beit Hillel may do so. One who is stringent like Beit Shammai and one who is stringent like Beit Hillel — is wicked. One who is lenient like Beit Shammai and one who is lenient like Beit Hillel — the verse applies to him: "The fool walks in darkness." Rather, whether like Beit Shammai in their stringencies and leniencies, or like Beit Hillel in their stringencies and leniencies.

hebrew_text: הָא גוּפָא קַשְׁיָא. אָמְרַתְּ: לְעוֹלָם הֲלָכָה כְּבֵית הִלֵּל, וַהֲדַר אָמְרַתְּ: הָרוֹצֶה לַעֲשׂוֹת כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי עוֹשֶׂה?!
human_translation: is itself difficult You said halakha is always in accordance with Beit Hillel, and then you reversed said one who wishes to act in accordance with the view of Beit Shammai may do so.
llm_translation: The matter is difficult. You said: Always the halakha is like Beit Hillel, and then you said: One who wants to act according to the words of Beit Shammai, may he do so?!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — קוֹדֶם בַּת קוֹל. כָּאן — לְאַחַר בַּת קוֹל.
human_translation: not difficult. Here, before the Divine Voice here, after the Divine Voice
llm_translation: Not difficult: here - before the voice. Here - after the voice.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָא וְהָא — לְאַחַר בַּת קוֹל,
human_translation: And if you wish, say this and that after the Divine Voice
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: "This and this - a Heavenly Voice after."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הִיא דְּלָא מַשְׁגַּח בְּבַת קוֹל.
human_translation: and is Rabbi Yehoshua, who does not pay attention to a Divine Voice
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua, it is that he does not pay attention to a bat kol.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: כׇּל הֵיכָא דְּמַשְׁכַּחַתְּ תְּרֵי תַּנָּאֵי וּתְרֵי אָמוֹרָאֵי דִּפְלִיגִי אַהֲדָדֵי כְּעֵין מַחֲלוֹקֶת בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל — לָא לֶיעְבַּד כִּי קוּלֵּיהּ דְּמָר וְכִי קוּלֵּיהּ דְּמָר, וְלָא כְּחוּמְרֵיהּ דְּמָר וְכִי חוּמְרֵיהּ דְּמָר. אֶלָּא, אוֹ כִּי קוּלֵּיהּ דְּמָר וּכְחוּמְרֵיהּ עָבֵיד, אוֹ כְּקוּלֵּיהּ דְּמָר וּכְחוּמְרֵיהּ עָבֵיד.
human_translation: And if you wish, say this is is saying: Wherever you find two tanna’im or two amora’im who disagree with each other in the manner of the disputes between Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel, one should not act either in accordance with the leniency of the Master and in accordance with the leniency of Master, in accordance with the stringency of Master and in accordance with the stringency of Master. Rather, one should act either in accordance with the leniencies and the stringencies of Master, or in accordance with the leniencies and the stringencies Master.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say thus: This is what he is saying: In every place where you find two Tannaim and two Amoraim who argue with each other like the dispute between Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel - one should not act leniently according to the opinion of one Master and leniently according to the opinion of the other Master, nor strictly according to the opinion of one Master and strictly according to the opinion of the other Master. Rather, either act leniently according to the opinion of one Master and strictly according to his stringencies, or act leniently according to the opinion of one Master and strictly according to his stringencies.

hebrew_text: מִכׇּל מָקוֹם קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: In any case, it is difficult
llm_translation: From every place it is difficult!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: כּוּלֵּיהּ כְּרַב עַבְדוּהּ. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה וְאֵין מוֹרִין כֵּן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: they acted entirely in accordance with Rav, which Rav Huna said Rav said: halakha ; however, a ruling is not issued to that effect
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: All of it is like Rav served it. As Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: Halacha, and we do not teach it thus.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה אָמַר רַב, דְּאָמַר: הֲלָכָה וּמוֹרִין כֵּן, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: And according to Rav Adda bar Ahava Rav said, as said halakha and a ruling is issued to that effect, what can be said?
llm_translation: And for Rav Adda bar Ahava said Rav, as he said: Halakha and we teach so, what is there to say?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁיזְבִי: כִּי לָא עָבְדִינַן כְּחוּמְרֵי דְּבֵי תְרֵי — הֵיכָא דְּסָתְרִי אַהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: Rav Sheizvi said: when we do not act in accordance with the stringencies of two where contradict one another.
llm_translation: Rav Sheizbi said: When we do not act like the people of the house of Teri - where can we find the support of each other.

hebrew_text: כְּגוֹן שִׁדְרָה וְגוּלְגּוֹלֶת. דִּתְנַן: הַשִּׁדְרָה וְהַגּוּלְגּוֹלֶת שֶׁחָסְרוּ — וְכַמָּה חֶסְרוֹן? בַּשִּׁדְרָה, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: שְׁתֵּי חוּלְיוֹת, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: חוּלְיָא אַחַת. וּבַגּוּלְגּוֹלֶת, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: כִּמְלֹא מַקְדֵּחַ, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּנָּטֵל מִן הַחַי וְיָמוּת.
human_translation: an example the spine and skull. As we learned The spine and the skull incomplete How much a deficiency in the spine Beit Shammai say: two vertebrae, and Beit Hillel say: one vertebra. And in the skull: Beit Shammai say: size of a drill hole, and Beit Hillel say: when removed from a living to die,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Such as the shidra and gulgolet. For it was taught: The shidra and the gulgolet that are lacking - and how much is the lack? In the shidra, Beit Shammai say: two spoonfuls, and Beit Hillel say: one spoonful. And in the gulgolet, Beit Shammai say: like the size of a hole, and Beit Hillel say: enough that if taken from a living creature, it will die.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: וְכֵן לְעִנְיַן טְרֵיפָה.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: likewise with respect to a tereifa ,
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: And so regarding the matter of treifah.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּלָא סָתְרִי אַהֲדָדֵי עָבְדִינַן.
human_translation: However, in a case where do not contradict one another, we may act
llm_translation: But here, where they did not conceal from each other, we do it.

hebrew_text: וְהֵיכָא דְּסָתְרִי אַהֲדָדֵי לָא עָבְדִינַן?! מֵתִיב רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא שֶׁלִּיקֵּט אֶתְרוֹג בְּאֶחָד בִּשְׁבָט, וְנָהַג בּוֹ שְׁנֵי עִישּׂוּרִין: אֶחָד כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, וְאֶחָד כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל?!
human_translation: we do not act where contradict one another? Rav Mesharshiya raised an objection an incident involving Rabbi Akiva, who gathered a citron on the first of Shevat and applied two tithes to it. one in accordance with the statement of Beit Shammai, one in accordance with the statement of Beit Hillel,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: And where is it that we do not require the testimony of both parties?! Rav Mesharshiya raises an objection: It was told of Rabbi Akiva that he took an etrog on the first of Shevat, and he treated it with two measures of tithes: one according to the words of Beit Shammai, and one according to the words of Beit Hillel?!

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא גְּמָרֵיהּ אִיסְתַּפֵּיק לֵיהּ, וְלָא יְדַע אִי בֵּית הִלֵּל בְּחַד בִּשְׁבָט אֲמוּר, אִי בַּחֲמֵיסַר בִּשְׁבָט אֲמוּר, וַעֲבַד הָכָא לְחוּמְרָא וְהָכָא לְחוּמְרָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva he was in doubt with regard to his tradition and did not know whether Beit Hillel said on the first of Shevat or on the fifteenth of Shevat, and he acted stringently here and stringently there.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva concluded his reasoning, and he did not know whether Beit Hillel stated it in the first month of the year or in the twelfth month of the year, and he did it here for stringency and he did it there for stringency.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַב יוֹסֵף קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא, וְיָתֵיב וְקָאָמַר, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מַחֲלוֹקֶת בִּסְרַטְיָא מִכָּאן וּסְרַטְיָא מִכָּאן, וּפְלַטְיָא מִכָּאן וּפְלַטְיָא מִכָּאן.
human_translation: Rav Yosef sat before Rav Huna, and he sat and said: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: The dispute to a main street [ seratya ] from here, and a main street from here, Alternatively, a plaza [ pelatya ] from here, and a plaza from here,
llm_translation: Sat Rav Yosef before Rav Huna, and sat and said, said Rav Yehudah said Rav: Dispute in Sartia from here and Sartia from here, and Plateya from here and Plateya from here.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל סְרַטְיָא מִכָּאן וּבִקְעָה מִכָּאן, אוֹ בִּקְעָה מִכָּאן וּבִקְעָה מִכָּאן — עוֹשֶׂה צוּרַת הַפֶּתַח מִכָּאן וְלֶחִי וְקוֹרָה מִכָּאן.
human_translation: But a main street from here, and a valley from here, or a valley from here, and a valley from here, one constructs form of a doorway from here, and a side post or a beam from here,
llm_translation: But Sartia from here and Bik'ah from here, or Bik'ah from here and Bik'ah from here - he makes the shape of the entrance from here, and the cheek and beam from here.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא סְרַטְיָא מִכָּאן וּבִקְעָה מִכָּאן, עוֹשֶׂה לוֹ צוּרַת הַפֶּתַח מִכָּאן וְלֶחִי וְקוֹרָה מִכָּאן — בִּקְעָה מִכָּאן וּבִקְעָה מִכָּאן מִיבַּעְיָא?!
human_translation: Now, a main street from here, and a valley from here, construct the form of a doorway from here, and a side post or a beam from here, was it necessary a valley from here, and a valley from her
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "This side is a line, and this side is a line, making the form of the entrance from here, and the cheek and beam from here - a line from here and a line from here, is it necessary?!"

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: סְרַטְיָא מִכָּאן וּבִקְעָה מִכָּאן — נַעֲשֶׂה כְּבִקְעָה מִכָּאן וּבִקְעָה מִכָּאן.
human_translation: This is he to say: a main street from here, and a valley from here, it is considered as if there were a valley from here, and a valley from here,
llm_translation: Thus he said: A sirtiya from here and a biq'ah from here - it shall be like a biq'ah from here and a biq'ah from here.

hebrew_text: וּמְסַיֵּים בַּהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה: אִם הָיָה מָבוֹי כָּלֶה לִרְחָבָה, אֵין צָרִיךְ כְּלוּם.
human_translation: And he concluded in the name Rav Yehuda If the alleyway terminated in a backyard, nothing is needed
llm_translation: And concludes in it from the name of Rav Yehudah: If there was a mavoi leading into a courtyard, nothing is needed.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: הָא דְּרַב יְהוּדָה דִּשְׁמוּאֵל הִיא.
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: This of Rav Yehuda is of Shmuel,
llm_translation: Abbaye said to Rav Yosef: "This is the case of Rav Yehudah son of Shmuel."

hebrew_text: דְּאִי דְּרַב — קַשְׁיָא דְּרַב אַדְּרַב בְּתַרְתֵּי: דְּאָמַר רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַב: מָבוֹי שֶׁנִּפְרַץ בִּמְלוֹאוֹ לֶחָצֵר, וְנִפְרְצָה חָצֵר כְּנֶגְדּוֹ — חָצֵר מוּתֶּרֶת וּמָבוֹי אָסוּר. וְאַמַּאי? לֶיהֱוֵי כְּמָבוֹי שֶׁכָּלֶה לִרְחָבָה!
human_translation: For if of Rav, of Rav of Rav a difficulty in two which Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said Rav said: an alleyway was breached along the entire into a courtyard, and the courtyard was breached opposite it permitted the courtyard, and prohibited the alleyway, Why let it be like an alleyway that terminates in a backyard,
llm_translation: If Rav said - the difficulty of Rav is resolved by Rav with two explanations: for Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said in the name of Rav: A breached alleyway that opens into a courtyard, and the courtyard opposite it is breached - the courtyard is permitted and the alleyway is prohibited. And why? It should be like an alleyway that ends in a broad space!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא לָא יָדַעְנָא, עוֹבָדָא הֲוָה בְּדוּרָא דְּרָעֲוָתָא מָבוֹי שֶׁכָּלֶה לִרְחָבָה הֲוָה, וַאֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה וְלָא אַצְרְכֵיהּ וְלָא מִידֵּי. וְאִי קַשְׁיָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב — תֶּיהְוֵי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא מִידֵּי.
human_translation: said to I do not know an incident in a shepherds’ village an alleyway terminated in a backyard, and came before Rav Yehuda and he did not require anything And if, it is difficult in the name of Rav, let it be in the name of Shmuel, and there will be no difficulty.
llm_translation: He said to him: I do not know, there was a matter in the generation of wickedness, a courtyard that was ending in a broad space, and it came before Rav Yehudah and he did not need it, nor did he accept it. And if it is difficult from the name of Rav - let it be from the name of Shmuel, and not difficult from him.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת לְרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַבָּא, וְאָמְרִי לֵיהּ לְרַב יוֹסֵף בַּר אַבָּא: אַסְבְּרָא לָךְ, כָּאן — שֶׁעֵירְבוּ, כָּאן — שֶׁלֹּא עֵירְבוּ.
human_translation: Now that Rav Sheshet said to Rav Shmuel bar Abba, and some say to Rav Yosef bar Abba: I will explain to you Here  where established an eiruv There where did not establish an eiruv
llm_translation: The question that Rav Sheshet asked Rav Shmuel bar Abba, and some say he asked Rav Yosef bar Abba: "I will explain to you, here - where they mixed, here - where they did not mix."

hebrew_text: דְּרַב אַדְּרַב נָמֵי לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — שֶׁעֵירְבוּ בְּנֵי חָצֵר עִם בְּנֵי מָבוֹי, כָּאן — שֶׁלֹּא עֵירְבוּ.
human_translation: of Rav of Rav also no difficulty. Here, where the residents of the courtyard and the residents of the alleyway established a joint eiruv , here, where did not establish a joint eiruv .
llm_translation: Rav Addarav Nami said it is not difficult: Here - where the children of the courtyard combined with the children of the alleyway, here - where they did not combine.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאי דִּסְלֵיק אַדַּעְתִּין מֵעִיקָּרָא בֵּין שֶׁעֵירְבוּ וּבֵין שֶׁלֹּא עֵירְבוּ פְּלִיגִי: בְּעֵירְבוּ בְּמַאי פְּלִיגִי, בְּשֶׁלֹּא עֵירְבוּ בְּמַאי פְּלִיגִי?
human_translation: And to what first entered our minds, disagree both where established an eiruv as well as where they did not establish an eiruv on what they disagree in where they established a eiruv , on what they disagree where they did not establish a eiruv .
llm_translation: And for what do they depart in their opinion, whether they have made an eruv or have not made an eruv? In what do they differ when they have made an eruv, and in what do they differ when they have not made an eruv?

hebrew_text: בְּשֶׁלֹּא עֵירְבוּ — פְּלִיגִי בְּנִרְאֶה מִבַּחוּץ וְשָׁוֶה מִבִּפְנִים.
human_translation: where they did not establish eiruv , disagree concerning appears from the outside. but even from the inside.
llm_translation: When they did not mix - they dispute regarding what appears from the outside and what is equal from the inside.

hebrew_text: בְּעֵירְבוּ — קָמִיפַּלְגִי בִּדְרַב יוֹסֵף. דְּאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁכָּלֶה לְאֶמְצַע רְחָבָה, אֲבָל כָּלֶה לְצִידֵּי רְחָבָה — אָסוּר.
human_translation: where they established a eiruv , they disagree about Rav Yosef. For Rav Yosef said: was only taught where terminates in the middle of the backyard, But terminates on the sides of the backyard, is prohibited.
llm_translation: In the evening - he stumbled in front of Rav Yosef. For Rav Yosef said: They only taught that it is forbidden when it reaches the middle of the width, but if it reaches the sides of the width - it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: הָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ ״לְאֶמְצַע רְחָבָה מוּתָּר״, לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא זֶה שֶׁלֹּא כְּנֶגֶד זֶה, אֲבָל זֶה כְּנֶגֶד זֶה — אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rabba said: That which you say: in the middle of the backyard, is permitted, was only stated are not opposite one another. But are opposite one another, is prohibited.
llm_translation: Rabah said: This that you said, "In the middle of its width is permitted," we only say this when it is not opposite another, but when it is opposite another, it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: הָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ ״זֶה שֶׁלֹּא כְּנֶגֶד זֶה מוּתָּר״, לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא רְחָבָה דְרַבִּים, אֲבָל רְחָבָה דְיָחִיד, זִימְנִין דְּמִימְּלַךְ עֲלַהּ וּבְנֵי לַהּ בָּתִּים, וְהָוֵי לַהּ כְּמָבוֹי שֶׁכָּלֶה לֵהּ לְצִידֵּי רְחָבָה וְאָסוּר.
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiya said: That which you say: are not opposite one another, is permitted, was only stated the backyard many But the yard a individual, he might sometime change his mind about it and build houses and will become like an alleyway that terminates on the sides of the backyard, prohibited.
llm_translation: Rav Mesharshaya said: This that you said, "This that is not opposite this is permitted," we only said this regarding a public domain, but regarding a private domain, sometimes it happens that a beam and the sons of the house are leaning on it, and it becomes like an alleyway that is finished to its sides of width, and it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: וּמְנָא תֵּימְרָא דְּשָׁנֵי לַן בֵּין רְחָבָה דְרַבִּים לִרְחָבָה דְיָחִיד — דְּאָמַר רָבִין בַּר רַב אַדָּא, אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּמָבוֹי אֶחָד שֶׁצִּידּוֹ אֶחָד כָּלֶה לַיָּם וְצִידּוֹ אֶחָד כָּלֶה לְאַשְׁפָּה, וּבָא מַעֲשֶׂה לִפְנֵי רַבִּי, וְלֹא אָמַר בָּהּ לֹא הֶיתֵּר וְלֹא אִיסּוּר.
human_translation: And from where do you say that we distinguish between a backyard many and a backyard a individual? As Ravin bar Rav Adda said that Rabbi Yitzḥak said: an incident involving a certain alleyway, one of its sides terminated in the sea and one of its sides terminated in a refuse heap, And the incident came before Rabbi and he did not say about it, neither permission nor prohibition.
llm_translation: And count you say that we between width of public domain to width of private domain — for said Ravin son of Rav Adda, said Rabbi Yitzchak: There was an incident in one alleyway that one side ended at the sea and one side ended at the garbage dump, and the case came before Rabbi, and he did not say about it neither permitted nor prohibited.

hebrew_text: אִיסּוּר לָא אֲמַר בַּהּ — דְּהָא קָיְימִי מְחִיצּוֹת. הֶיתֵּר לָא אֲמַר בַּהּ — חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא תִּינָּטֵל אַשְׁפָּה, וְיַעֲלֶה הַיָּם שִׂרְטוֹן.
human_translation: did not state a prohibition in for partitions, stand, he did not state permission in for we are concerned that perhaps the refuse heap will be removed And, the sea will raise up sand,
llm_translation: Prohibition not said in it - for it is established by partitions. Permission not said in it - we are concerned lest garbage be removed, and the sea level rise.

hebrew_text: וּמִי חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא תִּינָּטֵל אַשְׁפָּה? וְהָתְנַן: אַשְׁפָּה בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, חַלּוֹן שֶׁעַל גַּבָּהּ — זוֹרְקִין לָהּ בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Are we concerned that perhaps the refuse heap will be removed? But didn’t we learn A refuse heap in the public domain ten handbreadths high, a window above we may throw onto on Shabbat.
llm_translation: And do we concern that perhaps the refuse will be removed? And we learned in a Mishnah: Refuse in a public domain, if it is ten handbreadths high, a window on top of it - one may throw it out on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא שָׁנֵי בֵּין אַשְׁפָּה דְרַבִּים לְאַשְׁפָּה דְיָחִיד.
human_translation: Apparently, distinguish between a public refuse heap and a private refuse heap,
llm_translation: The meaning is: there is a difference between the refuse of many and the refuse of an individual.

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי, שָׁנֵי בֵּין רְחָבָה דְרַבִּים לִרְחָבָה דְיָחִיד.
human_translation: Here, too, distinguish between a backyard many and a backyard a individual,
llm_translation: Here it is taught, there is a difference between the width of a public domain and the width of a private domain.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן מַאי?
human_translation: And the Rabbis what
llm_translation: And the sages, what is it?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר אַבְדִּימִי, תָּנָא: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹסְרִין; אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר אַבְדִּימִי, תָּנָא: וַחֲכָמִים מַתִּירִין; אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: Rav Yosef bar Avdimi said: It was taught And the Rabbis prohibit Rav Naḥman said: The halakha is in accordance with the statement of Rabbis. There are some who state Rav Yosef bar Avdimi said: It was taught And the Rabbis permit Rav Naḥman said: The halakha is not in accordance with the opinion of Rabbis.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef bar Avdimi said: It was taught: "And the sages prohibit." Rav Nachman said: The halakha is in accordance with the words of the sages. There are those who say: Rav Yosef bar Avdimi said: It was taught: "And the sages permit." Rav Nachman said: The halakha is not in accordance with the words of the sages.

hebrew_text: מָרִימָר פָּסֵיק לַהּ לְסוּרָא בְּאוּזְלֵי. אָמַר: חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא יַעֲלֶה הַיָּם שִׂרְטוֹן.
human_translation: Mareimar would block off Sura, with nets He said: we are concerned that perhaps the sea will raise up sand,
llm_translation: Marimar divided for her a Surah in Uzlei. He said: We are concerned that the sea may rise a span.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא מָבוֹי עָקוֹם דַּהֲוָה בְּסוּרָא, כְּרוּךְ בּוּדְיָא אוֹתִיבוּ בֵּיהּ בְּעַקְמוּמִיתֵיהּ. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הָא לָא כְּרַב וְלָא כִּשְׁמוּאֵל. לְרַב דְּאָמַר תּוֹרָתוֹ כִּמְפוּלָּשׁ — צוּרַת הַפֶּתַח בָּעֵי. לִשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר תּוֹרָתוֹ כְּסָתוּם — הָנֵי מִילֵּי לֶחִי מְעַלְּיָא. אֲבָל הַאי, כֵּיוָן דְּנָשֵׁיב בֵּיהּ זִיקָא וְשָׁדֵי לֵיהּ — לֹא כְּלוּם הוּא.
human_translation: a certain crooked alleyway that was in Sura, rolled up a mat placed it at the turn Rav Ḥisda said: This neither in accordance with Rav nor in accordance with Shmuel. According to Rav, said the halakha of is like that of an open requires the form of a doorway. according to Shmuel, said its halakha is like that of an closed this applies only a proper side post But this once the wind blows upon it, it throws it over; it is nothing
llm_translation: That alleyway that was in Surah, was twisted, they sat a barrel in it in its crookedness. Rav Chisda said: This is not like Rav and not like Shmuel. According to Rav who said his Torah is like a spread-out mat - it requires a formed entrance. According to Shmuel who said his Torah is like a sealed cask - those words are mere idle talk. But this one, since they placed a beam in it and supported it - it is not considered a deficiency.

hebrew_text: וְאִי נָעֵיץ בֵּיהּ סִיכְּתָא וְחַבְּרֵיהּ — חַבְּרֵיהּ.
human_translation: But if a peg was inserted and attached attached
llm_translation: And if one inserted into it a peg and its companions - its companions.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַב: מָבוֹי שֶׁנִּפְרַץ בִּמְלוֹאוֹ לְחָצֵר, וְנִפְרְצָה חָצֵר כְּנֶגְדּוֹ — חָצֵר מוּתֶּרֶת, וּמָבוֹי אָסוּר.
human_translation: As to the matter itself, Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said that Rav said: An alleyway that was breached along the entire into a courtyard, and the courtyard was breached on its opposite side the courtyard is permitted and the alleyway is prohibited
llm_translation: The body, said Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said Rav: A courtyard that was breached in its fullness to another courtyard, and the other courtyard was breached opposite it - the other courtyard is permitted, and the alleyway is prohibited.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה בַּר עוּלָּא לְרַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי: רַבִּי, לֹא מִשְׁנָתֵנוּ הִיא זוֹ? ״חָצֵר קְטַנָּה שֶׁנִּפְרְצָה לִגְדוֹלָה — גְּדוֹלָה מוּתֶּרֶת וּקְטַנָּה אֲסוּרָה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא כְּפִתְחָהּ שֶׁל גְּדוֹלָה״.
human_translation: Rabba bar Ulla said to Rav Beivai bar Abaye: My Master, is this not our Mishna? A smaller courtyard that was breached into a larger larger one is permitted and the smaller one is prohibited, because is as the entrance to the larger
llm_translation: Rabah bar Ulla said to Rav Bibi bar Abbaye: Rabbi, is this not from our Mishnah? "A small courtyard that broke into a larger one - the larger one is permitted and the smaller one is forbidden, because it is like the entrance of the larger one."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי מֵהָתָם הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּלָא קָא דָרְסִי בָּהּ רַבִּים, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּקָא דָרְסִי בַּהּ רַבִּים — אֵימָא אֲפִילּוּ חָצֵר נָמֵי.
human_translation: He, said to him, If from there I would have said only applies in a place where many people do not tread. But in a place where many people tread, say even courtyard as well,
llm_translation: He said to him: If from there, I would have said: those words where not dwelling in it many, but where dwelling in it many - say even a courtyard also.

hebrew_text: וְהָא נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: חָצֵר שֶׁהָרַבִּים נִכְנָסִין לָהּ בָּזוֹ וְיוֹצְאִין לָהּ בְּזוֹ, רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים לַטּוּמְאָה, וּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד לַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: But didn’t we learn this as well, A courtyard into many people enter on this and exit on that a public domain ritual impurity, but a private domain Shabbat.
llm_translation: And here is what we learned: A courtyard into which the public enters and exits indiscriminately, the public domain is susceptible to impurity, and the private domain is designated for Sabbath.

hebrew_text: אִי מֵהָתָם הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי, זֶה שֶׁלֹּא כְּנֶגֶד זֶה.
human_translation: If there I would have said only applies not opposite one another,
llm_translation: From there, I would say: these matters, this is not corresponding to this.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל זֶה כְּנֶגֶד זֶה, אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: but are opposite one another, say not
llm_translation: But this against this, say not.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבָּה דְּאָמַר זֶה כְּנֶגֶד זֶה אָסוּר, הָא דְּרַב בְּמַאי מוֹקֵי לָהּ — בְּזֶה שֶׁלֹּא כְּנֶגֶד זֶה, תַּרְתֵּי לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: And according to Rabba, who said are one opposite another, is prohibited, how does construe Rav’s are not one opposite another, why do I two
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And according to Rabbah who said this is prohibited against this, what does Rav mean by saying to her - in this that is not against this, why do I need two?

hebrew_text: אִי מֵהָתָם הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי לִזְרוֹק, אֲבָל לְטַלְטֵל — אֵימָא לָא. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: If one from there, I would have said only applies of throwing, But carrying say no, teaches us
llm_translation: From there, I would say: those words are for throwing, but for hanging - I would say no. This is what we have heard.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: מָבוֹי הֶעָשׂוּי כְּנַדָּל, אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: עוֹשֶׂה צוּרַת הַפֶּתַח לַגָּדוֹל, וְהָנָךְ כּוּלְּהוּ מִישְׁתְּרוּ בְּלֶחִי וְקוֹרָה.
human_translation: It was stated an alleyway shaped like a centipede, Abaye said: the form of a doorway is made for the large and all the are permitted by a side post or a beam.
llm_translation: It was stated: A courtyard made like a lock, Abaye said: One should make the shape of the entrance for the larger gate, and all of them the smaller gates should be left with a beam and a crossbeam.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: כְּמַאן, כִּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר תּוֹרָתוֹ כְּסָתוּם — לְמָה לֵיהּ צוּרַת הַפֶּתַח? וְעוֹד, הָא הָהוּא מָבוֹי עָקוֹם דַּהֲוָה בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא, וְחַשּׁוּ לָהּ לִדְרַב!
human_translation: Rava said to him: According to whom Shmuel, who said the halakha of is like closed why is the form of a doorway for it? And furthermore, the crooked, alleyway in Neharde’a, didn’t they take into consideration of Rav?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: According to whom, like Shmuel who said his Torah is like a sealed letter - why does he need the form of the entrance? Furthermore, that alleyway that was crooked in Nehardea, and they were concerned about it to prohibit it!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: עוֹשֶׂה צוּרַת הַפֶּתַח לְכוּלְּהוּ לְהַאי גִּיסָא, וְאִידָּךְ גִּיסָא מִישְׁתְּרוּ בְּלֶחִי וְקוֹרָה.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: the form of a doorway is made for all of on this sides, and the other side is permitted by a side post or a beam.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: One should make the shape of the doorway for all of them for this side, and the other side should be left with a cheek and a beam.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא בַּר תַּחְלִיפָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא בַּר מַלְכִּיּוֹ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא רַבֵּיהּ דְּרַב, וְאָמְרִי לָהּ, רַב כָּהֲנָא בַּר מַלְכִּיּוֹ הַיְינוּ רַב כָּהֲנָא רַבֵּיהּ דְּרַב: מָבוֹי שֶׁצִּידּוֹ אֶחָד אָרוֹךְ וְצִידּוֹ אֶחָד קָצָר, פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת מַנִּיחַ אֶת הַקּוֹרָה בַּאֲלַכְסוֹן. אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — אֵינוֹ מַנִּיחַ אֶת הַקּוֹרָה אֶלָּא כְּנֶגֶד הַקָּצָר. רָבָא אָמַר: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה אֵינוֹ מַנִּיחַ אֶת הַקּוֹרָה אֶלָּא כְּנֶגֶד הַקָּצָר.
human_translation: Rav Kahana bar Taḥalifa said in the name of Rav Kahana bar Minyumi, in the name of Rav Kahana bar Malkiyu, in the name of Rav Kahana, the teacher of Rav; and some say Rav Kahana bar Malkiyu is Rav Kahana, the teacher of Rav: an alleyway that its one side long and its other side short, less than four cubits, the beam is placed diagonally four cubits the beam is placed across of the short Rava said: both this and that the beam is placed across of the short
llm_translation: Rav Kahana bar Tahalifa said in the name of Rav Kahana bar Minyomei in the name of Rav Kahana bar Malkiyo in the name of Rav Kahana his teacher, and some say, Rav Kahana bar Malkiyo is the same as Rav Kahana his teacher: A passageway whose one side is long and one side is short, if it is less than four cubits, one places the beam diagonally. If it is four cubits, one only places the beam opposite the shorter side. Rava said: Whether it is this way or that way, one only places the beam opposite the shorter side.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא טַעְמָא דִידִי, וְאֵימָא טַעְמָא דִידְהוּ. אֵימָא טַעְמָא דִידִי: קוֹרָה טַעְמָא מַאי — מִשּׁוּם הֶיכֵּר, וּבַאֲלַכְסוֹן לָא הָוֵי הֶיכֵּר.
human_translation: I will state my reason, and I will state their reason. I will state my reason: What is the reason for a beam? as a conspicuous marker and diagonally, is not conspicuous.
llm_translation: And why not my reasoning, and why not their reasoning. Why not my reasoning: What is the reason for this? - Because of recognition, and on a slant it is not recognition.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא טַעְמָא דִידְהוּ, קוֹרָה מִשּׁוּם מַאי — מִשּׁוּם מְחִיצָה. וּבַאֲלַכְסוֹן נָמֵי הָוֵי מְחִיצָה.
human_translation: I will state their reason What is the reason for a beam? To as a partition, even diagonally, it is a partition.
llm_translation: And why not the reason of them, a beam because of what? - because of a partition. And on a diagonal it is also considered a partition.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: הוֹאִיל וּשְׁמַעְתְּתָא דְכָהֲנֵי הִיא, אֵימָא בַּהּ מִילְּתָא. הָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ מַנִּיחַ הַקּוֹרָה בַּאֲלַכְסוֹן, לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין בַּאֲלַכְסוֹנוֹ יוֹתֵר מֵעֶשֶׂר, אֲבָל יֵשׁ בַּאֲלַכְסוֹנוֹ יוֹתֵר מֵעֶשֶׂר, דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵינוֹ מַנִּיחַ אֶלָּא כְּנֶגֶד הַקָּצָר.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said: Since this halakhot of Kahana, will say something to it: That which you said, the beam is placed diagonally was only said where the diagonal is no more than ten But if the diagonal is more than ten all agree that must be placed across the short
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: Since you have heard the tradition of the priests, say in it a matter. That which you said, "One may place the beam diagonally," we only said this when there is not more than ten handbreadths in its diagonal, but if there is more than ten in its diagonal, everyone agrees that one should only place it opposite the shorter side.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מַהוּ לְהִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ תַּחַת הַקּוֹרָה? רַב וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמְרוּ: מוּתָּר לְהִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ תַּחַת הַקּוֹרָה. שְׁמוּאֵל וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בַּר רַבִּי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ אָמְרוּ: אָסוּר לְהִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ תַּחַת הַקּוֹרָה.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised What is utilizing beneath the beam Rav, Rabbi Ḥiyya, and Rabbi Yoḥanan said: It is permitted to utilize beneath the beam. Shmuel, Rabbi Shimon bar Rabbi, and Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: It is prohibited to utilize beneath the beam.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises a dilemma: What is the ruling regarding making use beneath the beam? Rav, Rabbi Ḥiyya, and Rabbi Yoḥanan said: It is permitted to make use beneath the beam. Shmuel, Rabbi Shim'on bar Rabbi, and Rabbi Shim'on ben Lakish said: It is forbidden to make use beneath the beam.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר: קוֹרָה מִשּׁוּם הֶיכֵּר, וּמָר סָבַר: קוֹרָה מִשּׁוּם מְחִיצָה.
human_translation: Shall we say argue over the following that Master, holds: A beam serves as a conspicuous marker and Master, holds: A beam serves as a partition.
llm_translation: Let us say in this case where they disagree, for Mar holds: a beam due to recognition, and Mar holds: a beam due to partition.

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא קוֹרָה מִשּׁוּם הֶיכֵּר, וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר: הֶיכֵּירָא מִלְּגָיו, וּמָר סָבַר: הֶיכֵּירָא מִלְּבַר.
human_translation: No, everyone agree a beam serves as a conspicuous marker, but here they argue over the following: Master, holds the conspicuous marker inside and Master, holds the conspicuous marker outside
llm_translation: Not, that, all, of, the, world, a, beam, from, the, recognition, and, here, in, this, it, disputes, that, master, holds: recognition, from, his, colleague, and, master, holds: recognition, from, the, outside.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִשּׁוּם מְחִיצָה, וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר: חוּדּוֹ הַפְּנִימִי יוֹרֵד וְסוֹתֵם, וּמָר סָבַר: חוּדּוֹ הַחִיצוֹן יוֹרֵד וְסוֹתֵם.
human_translation: And if you wish, say that everyone as a partition, and here they argue over the following As Sage holds the inner edge descends and seals off and the Sage holds the beam’s outer edge descends and seals off
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: The entire world is considered a partition, and here in this case it is being divided, for one Sage holds: Its inner side descends and closes, and the other Sage holds: Its outer side descends and closes.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּבֵין לְחָיַיִם שֶׁאָסוּר.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: All concede between the side posts is prohibited,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: Everyone agrees that it is forbidden to intervene between the living.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא מֵרַב חִסְדָּא: נָעַץ שְׁתֵּי יְתֵידוֹת בִּשְׁנֵי כּוֹתְלֵי מָבוֹי מִבַּחוּץ, וְהִנִּיחַ קוֹרָה עַל גַּבֵּיהֶן, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raised a dilemma before Rav Ḥisda: What inserted two pegs in the two alleyway walls, on the outside and he placed a beam on top of
llm_translation: Requested of him Ramei son of Hama from Rav Ḥisda: He inserted two pegs in two walls of an alleyway from the outside, and placed a beam on top of them, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְדִבְרֵי הַמַּתִּיר — אָסוּר, לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹסֵר — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: said to him: According to the statement of who permits is prohibited, according to the statement of who prohibits is permitted,
llm_translation: He said to him: According to the one who permits - it is forbidden, according to the one who forbids - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹסֵר נָמֵי אָסוּר — בָּעִינַן קוֹרָה עַל גַּבֵּי מָבוֹי, וְלֵיכָּא.
human_translation: Rava, said: Even according to the opinion of who prohibits is prohibited, for we require the beam on top of the alleyway, and is not.
llm_translation: Rava said: Regarding the matter of one who forbids, it is truly forbidden - we require a beam across the entrance of the alleyway, and it is not present.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר מַתְנָה לְרָבָא: הָיְתָה קוֹרָתוֹ
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Mattana raised an objection to Rava If the beam is
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Matna raised an objection to Rava: "If his beam was"

hebrew_text: מְשׁוּכָה אוֹ תְּלוּיָה, פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה — אֵין צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא קוֹרָה אַחֶרֶת. שְׁלֹשָׁה — צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא קוֹרָה אַחֶרֶת. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבָּעָה — אֵין צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא קוֹרָה אַחֶרֶת, אַרְבָּעָה — צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא קוֹרָה אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: drawn away or suspended less than three one is not required to bring a different beam, three he is required to bring a different beam Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, says: less than four one is not required to bring a different beam; four he is required to bring a different beam.
llm_translation: Pulled or hanging, less than three - not necessary to bring another beam. Three - necessary to bring another beam. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Less than four - not necessary to bring another beam, four - necessary to bring another beam.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו — מְשׁוּכָה מִבַּחוּץ, וּתְלוּיָהּ מִבִּפְנִים!
human_translation: What, is it not drawn away on the outside And suspended, on the inside
llm_translation: What is "Lavo"? - Pulled from the outside, and hanging from the inside!

hebrew_text: לָא, אִידִי וְאִידִי מִבִּפְנִים. מְשׁוּכָה — מֵרוּחַ אַחַת, וּתְלוּיָה — מִשְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹת.
human_translation: No, this, and that, on the inside drawn away from one direction, suspended from both directions.
llm_translation: Not so, both from inside. Pulled - from one spirit, and hanging - from two spirits.

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: מֵרוּחַ אַחַת אָמְרִינַן לָבוּד, מִשְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹת — לָא אָמְרִינַן לָבוּד, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Lest you say from one direction, we say lavud from two directions, we do not say lavud teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? From one spirit we say "alone," from two spirits - we do not say "alone," it is implied to us.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: מְשׁוּכָה וְהִיא תְּלוּיָה, וְהֵיכִי דָּמֵי? כְּגוֹן שֶׁנָּעַץ שְׁתֵּי יְתֵידוֹת עֲקוּמּוֹת עַל שְׁנֵי כּוֹתְלֵי מָבוֹי, שֶׁאֵין בְּגוֹבְהָן שְׁלֹשָׁה, וְאֵין בְּעַקְמוּמִיתָן שְׁלֹשָׁה. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: אוֹ ״לָבוּד״ אָמְרִינַן, אוֹ ״חֲבוֹט״ אָמְרִינַן, לָבוּד וַחֲבוֹט לָא אָמְרִינַן. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: drawn away and suspended And what are the circumstances For example, where he inserted two bent pegs on the two alleyway walls, the height is less than three and their bend is less than three handbreadths, Lest you say we either say lavud , or we say ḥavut , we do not say lavud and ḥavut . teaches us
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Pulled and it is hanging, and how so? For example, when two crossbeams are inserted leaning on two alley walls, each not three handbreadths high, and not three handbreadths wide. Lest you say: Or we say "attached," or we say "pressed," we do not say attached or pressed. This is what he informs us.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַבִּי זַכַּאי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בֵּין לְחָיַיִם וְתַחַת הַקּוֹרָה נִידּוֹן כְּכַרְמְלִית. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פּוֹק תְּנִי לְבַרָּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Zakkai taught before Rabbi Yoḥanan: between the side posts and beneath the beam legal status karmelit , said to him: Exit teach outside,
llm_translation: It was taught by Rabbi Zakkai before Rabbi Yochanan: Between the jaws and under the beam is judged like a Carmelite. He said to him: Go out and teach it to the son of the Creator.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִילְּתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן תַּחַת הַקּוֹרָה, אֲבָל בֵּין לְחָיַיִן אָסוּר. וְרָבָא אָמַר: בֵּין לְחָיַיִם נָמֵי מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Abaye said: Rabbi Yoḥanan’s statement is reasonable beneath the beam, but between the side posts, is prohibited, And Rava said: even between the side posts is permitted.
llm_translation: Abaye said: It is logical that the matter of Rabbi Yochanan is permitted under the beam, but between the living it is forbidden. And Rava said: Even between the living it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ — דְּכִי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מָקוֹם שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ אַרְבָּעָה עַל אַרְבָּעָה, מוּתָּר לִבְנֵי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים וְלִבְנֵי רְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד לְכַתֵּף עָלָיו, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יַחֲלִיפוּ.
human_translation: Rava said: From where do I say this, For when Rav Dimi came Rabbi Yoḥanan said: A place that has less than four by four it is permitted for the people in the public domain the people in the private domain to loading onto their shoulders, so long as they do not exchange
llm_translation: Rava said: From where do I say this? — For when Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Yochanan said: In a place where there are not four by four, it is permitted for the public domain and the private domain to carry alongside it, provided they do not exchange.

hebrew_text: וְאַבָּיֵי, הָתָם בְּגָבוֹהַּ שְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: And Abaye there, is three high,
llm_translation: And Abbaye, there in that case with regard to height it is three handbreadths.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ — דְּאָמַר רַב חָמָא בַּר גּוּרְיָא אָמַר רַב: תּוֹךְ הַפֶּתַח, צָרִיךְ לֶחִי אַחֵר לְהַתִּירוֹ.
human_translation: Abaye said: From where do I say this, For Rav Ḥama bar Guria said that Rav said: within the opening, requires another side post to permit
llm_translation: Abbaye said: From where do I know this? - For Rav Ḥama bar Gurya said that Rav said: Within the doorway, one must have another cheek to permit it.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: דְּאִית בֵּיהּ אַרְבָּעָה עַל אַרְבָּעָה, וְהָאָמַר רַב חָנִין בַּר רָבָא אָמַר רַב: תּוֹךְ הַפֶּתַח, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ אַרְבָּעָה עַל אַרְבָּעָה צָרִיךְ לֶחִי אַחֵר לְהַתִּירוֹ.
human_translation: And if you say that has four by four For didn’t Rav Ḥanin bar Rava say that Rav said: within the opening even if it does not have four by four requires an additional side post to permit
llm_translation: And if you will say: that it has four by four, and Rav Hanin bar Rava said in the name of Rav: within the opening, even though it does not have four by four, one must make another opening to permit it.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא — הָתָם דְּפָתוּחַ לְכַרְמְלִית.
human_translation: And Rava There, opens to a karmelit ,
llm_translation: And Rava - there, where it is open to the vineyard.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים מַאי — שְׁרֵי? יַצִּיבָא בְּאַרְעָא וְגִיּוֹרָא בִּשְׁמֵי שְׁמַיָּא!
human_translation: But to a public domain, what permitted a permanent resident is on the ground, while a stranger is to the highest heaven,
llm_translation: But to public domain what — permitted? Yatziva in the land and Givora in the heavens of heavens!

hebrew_text: אִין, מָצָא מִין אֶת מִינוֹ וְנֵיעוֹר.
human_translation: Yes, it has found its own type and been awakened.
llm_translation: There is, he found a species its species and a youth.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְרָבָא: וְאַתְּ לָא תִּסְבְּרָא דְּבֵין לְחָיַיִן אָסוּר? וְהָאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מָבוֹי שֶׁרְצָפוֹ בִּלְחָיַיִן פָּחוֹת פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבָּעָה — בָּאנוּ לְמַחְלוֹקֶת רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Huna, the son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rava: And you do not hold between the side posts is prohibited? But didn’t Rabba bar bar Ḥana say that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: an alleyway was lined with side posts, each less than four we have arrived at the dispute Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and the Rabbis
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua said to Rava: "And do you not hold that between the cheeks is forbidden?" But didn't Rabba bar bar Ḥana say in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: "An alleyway whose entrance is less than four cubits wide – we came to the dispute of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and the Rabbis."

hebrew_text: לְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל דְּאָמַר: אָמְרִינַן לָבוּד, מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ עַד חוּדּוֹ הַפְּנִימִי שֶׁל לֶחִי הַפְּנִימִי. לְרַבָּנַן, דְּאָמְרִי: לָא אָמְרִינַן לָבוּד, מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ עַד חוּדּוֹ הַפְּנִימִי שֶׁל חִיצוֹן. אֲבָל בֵּין לְחָיַיִן דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אָסוּר!
human_translation: to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, said we say lavud He may utilize up to the inner edge of the innermost side post, the Rabbis, say we do not say lavud may utilize up to the inner edge of the outermost But between the side posts, all agree is prohibited.
llm_translation: To Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel said: We say "Labud," one may use the razor until the innermost cheekbone. But the Rabbis, who say: We do not say "Labud," one may use the razor until the outermost cheekbone. But between the two cheeks is forbidden!

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא, הָתָם נָמֵי דְּפָתוּחַ לְכַרְמְלִית.
human_translation: And Rava there too, opens to a karmelit .
llm_translation: And Rava, there, stated in the name of Pfatuch to the one who is open to the Carmelite.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים מַאי — שְׁרֵי? יַצִּיבָא בְּאַרְעָא וְגִיּוֹרָא בִּשְׁמֵי שְׁמַיָּא! אִין, מָצָא מִין אֶת מִינוֹ וְנֵיעוֹר.
human_translation: But to a public domain, what permitted? a permanent resident is on the ground, while a stranger to the highest heaven. Yes, it has found its own type and been awakened.
llm_translation: But to the public domain, what is the ruling? Yatziva in the land and Givora in the heavens! No, he found his species and fled.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁרְצָפוֹ בִּלְחָיַיִם פָּחוֹת פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבָּעָה בְּמֶשֶׁךְ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: where that one lined with side posts, each less than four for a length of four cubits.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: For example, if one plastered his cheeks less than four by four cubits with mud.

hebrew_text: לְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל דְּאָמַר: אָמְרִינַן לָבוּד — הָוֵה לֵיהּ מָבוֹי, וְצָרִיךְ לֶחִי אַחֵר לְהַתִּירוֹ. וּלְרַבָּנַן דְּאָמְרִי: לָא אָמְרִינַן לָבוּד — לֹא צָרִיךְ לֶחִי אַחֵר לְהַתִּירוֹ.
human_translation: According to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who said we say lavud it is alleyway; requires an additional side post to permit it. And according to the Rabbis, who say we do not say lavud does not require an additional side post to permit
llm_translation: To Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel who said: We say "Labud" - if there is a courtyard, and it requires another wall to permit it. And to the Rabbis who say: We do not say "Labud" - it does not require another wall to permit it.

hebrew_text: וּלְרִבֵּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, לֶהֱוֵי כְּנִרְאֶה מִבַּחוּץ וְשָׁוֶה מִבִּפְנִים!
human_translation: And according to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, Let it as visible from the outside, but even from the inside.
llm_translation: And regarding Rebbi Shimon ben Gamliel, let him be as he appears on the outside and as he is on the inside!

hebrew_text: מִידֵּי הוּא טַעְמָא אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, הָא כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: נִרְאֶה מִבַּחוּץ וְשָׁוֶה מִבִּפְנִים אֵינוֹ נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם לֶחִי.
human_translation: As reason is only according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, when Ravin came didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan said: visible from the outside, but even from the inside, is not considered of a side post?
llm_translation: From him is the reason, but for Rabbi Yochanan, when Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: It appears from the outside and is equal from the inside, it is not judged due to a blemish.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: נִרְאֶה מִבִּפְנִים וְשָׁוֶה מִבַּחוּץ — נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם לֶחִי. נִרְאֶה מִבַּחוּץ וְשָׁוֶה מִבִּפְנִים, רַבִּי חִיָּיא וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּרַבִּי, חַד אָמַר: נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם לֶחִי, וְחַד אָמַר: אֵינוֹ נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם לֶחִי.
human_translation: was stated: visible from the inside, but even from the outside, is considered a side post. visible from the outside but even from the inside, Rabbi Ḥiyya and Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi One said: It is considered of a side post. And one said: It is not considered of a side post.
llm_translation: It was stated: If it appears from the inside and is equal from the outside - it is judged due to the liver. If it appears from the outside and is equal from the inside, Rabbi Chiya and Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi, one said: it is judged due to the liver, and one said: it is not judged due to the liver.

hebrew_text: תִּסְתַּיֵּים דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא הוּא דְּאָמַר ״נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם לֶחִי״, דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: כּוֹתֶל שֶׁצִּידּוֹ אֶחָד כָּנוּס מֵחֲבֵירוֹ, בֵּין שֶׁנִּרְאֶה מִבַּחוּץ וְשָׁוֶה מִבִּפְנִים, וּבֵין שֶׁנִּרְאֶה מִבִּפְנִים וְשָׁוֶה מִבַּחוּץ נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם לֶחִי, תִּסְתַּיֵּים.
human_translation: Conclude that Rabbi Ḥiyya who said it is considered of a side post, as Rabbi Ḥiyya taught: a wall whose one side is more recessed than the other, whether is visible from outside but even from the inside, or is visible from the inside but even from the outside, is considered of a side post. conclude
llm_translation: The judgment of Rabbi Chiya is final, as he said, "Judged for the sake of the wall." For Rabbi Chiya taught: A wall that its one side is leaning towards its fellow, whether it appears from the outside and is equal from the inside, or whether it appears from the inside and is equal from the outside, is judged for the sake of the wall. It is final.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִי לָא שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ הָא?! אֶלָּא שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ וְלָא סָבַר לַהּ, רַבִּי חִיָּיא נָמֵי לָא סָבַר לַהּ!
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan, did he not hear this Rather, he heard it, but he does not hold it. Rabbi Ḥiyya also does not hold it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan: Who did not hear this?! Rather, he heard it but did not agree with it, Rabbi Chiya also did not agree with it!

hebrew_text: הַאי מַאי?! בִּשְׁלָמָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לָא סָבַר לַהּ — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי לָא תָּנֵי לַהּ. אֶלָּא רַבִּי חִיָּיא, אִי אִיתָא דְּלָא סָבַר לַהּ, לְמָה לֵיהּ לְמִיתְנָא?
human_translation: What is this Granted, Rabbi Yoḥanan does not hold that That is why he did not teach it. But Rabbi Ḥiyya, if it is that he does not hold it, why would he teach it?
llm_translation: This what?! Granted, Rabbi Yochanan does not hold this view - therefore he does not teach it. Rather, Rabbi Chiya, if there is one who does not hold this view, why should he be taught?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: נִרְאֶה מִבַּחוּץ וְשָׁוֶה מִבִּפְנִים — נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם לֶחִי. אָמַר רַבָּה, וּמוֹתְבִינַן אַשְּׁמַעְתִּין: חָצֵר קְטַנָּה שֶׁנִּפְרְצָה לִגְדוֹלָה — גְּדוֹלָה מוּתֶּרֶת וּקְטַנָּה אֲסוּרָה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא כְּפִתְחָהּ שֶׁל גְּדוֹלָה. וְאִם אִיתָא, קְטַנָּה נָמֵי תִּשְׁתְּרֵי בְּנִרְאֶה מִבַּחוּץ וְשָׁוֶה מִבִּפְנִים.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: visible from the outside, but even from the inside, it is considered of a side post. Rabba said: And we raise an objection to our halakha a small courtyard that was breached into a large the large one is permitted and the small one is prohibited because is considered an entrance of the large And if it is so, the small should also be permitted as is visible from the outside but even from the inside.
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: If it appears from the outside and is equal from within - it is judged due to the outside. Rabba said, and we understand the reasoning: A small courtyard that broke into a larger one - the larger one is permitted and the smaller one is forbidden, because it is like the entrance of the larger one. And if it comes, the smaller one will also be equal from the outside and from within.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: בְּנִכְנָסִין כּוֹתְלֵי קְטַנָּה לִגְדוֹלָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: where the walls of the small protrude into the large one,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Zeira: "When the walls of a small city enter into a larger city."

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא לָבוּד וְתִשְׁתְּרֵי!
human_translation: And let us say lavud and will be permitted
llm_translation: And why not? Let it be examined and investigated!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא דְּמַפְלְגִי טוּבָא? וְהָא תָּנֵי רַב אַדָּא בַּר אֲבִימִי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: קְטַנָּה, בְּעֶשֶׂר. גְּדוֹלָה, בְּאַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה!
human_translation: And if you say that are too separate didn’t Rav Adda bar Avimi teach before Rabbi Ḥanina: small to ten cubits large to eleven
llm_translation: And if you will say, "But perhaps they divided the good portion?" But behold, Rav Adda bar Avimi taught before Rabbi Chanina: A small one, at ten. A large one, at eleven!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: בְּמוּפְלָגִין מִכּוֹתֶל זֶה בִּשְׁנַיִם, וּמִכּוֹתֶל זֶה בְּאַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: Ravina said: where are separated from this wall by two and from this wall by four
llm_translation: Ravina said: In Muflegin, one wall is with two, and one wall is with four.

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא לָבוּד מֵרוּחַ אַחַת, וְתִשְׁתְּרֵי.
human_translation: And let us say lavud from one direction, will be permitted
llm_translation: And say it is necessary from one spirit, and two.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי הִיא, דְּאָמַר: בָּעִינַן שְׁנֵי פַּסִּין. דְּתַנְיָא: חָצֵר, נִיתֶּרֶת בְּפַס אֶחָד, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: בִּשְׁנֵי פַּסִּין.
human_translation: is Rabbi who said we require two boards, As it was taught a courtyard becomes permitted with one board Rabbi says: with two boards
llm_translation: Rabbi Hiya said: We require two partitions. As it was taught: A courtyard that was breached by one partition, Rabbi says: With two partitions.

hebrew_text: הַאי מַאי? אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא: נִרְאֶה מִבַּחוּץ וְשָׁוֶה מִבִּפְנִים — אֵינוֹ נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם לֶחִי, וְרַבִּי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וּדְרַבִּי זֵירָא וּדְרָבִינָא לֵיתָא — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי קְטַנָּה בְּעֶשֶׂר וּגְדוֹלָה בְּאַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה, מִשּׁוּם דְּרַבִּי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: What is this Granted, if you say visible from the outside but even from the inside is not considered a side post; and Rabbi holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei and that Rabbi Zeira and Ravina are not that is why small ten large one is eleven due to Rabbi holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: This what? If you say: "It appears from the outside and is equal from the inside - it is not judged because of a blemish," and Rabbi Yosei holds like this, and Rabbi Zeira and Ravina do not agree - because of this, a minor is considered at ten and an adult at eleven, because Rabbi Yosei holds like this.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ: נִרְאֶה מִבַּחוּץ וְשָׁוֶה מִבִּפְנִים — נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם לֶחִי, וּדְרַבִּי זֵירָא וּדְרָבִינָא אִיתָא, וְרַבִּי לָא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי — גְּדוֹלָה בְּאַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: However, if you say visible from the outside but even from the inside is considered a side post; and Rabbi Zeira’s and Ravina’s are Rabbi does not hold in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, why do I large eleven
llm_translation: Rather, if you say: "It appears from the outside and is equal from the inside" - it is judged due to the liver, and Rabbi Zeira and Ravina are there, and Rabbi does not agree with Rabbi Yosei - why do I need a large one at eleven?

hebrew_text: מִמָּה נַפְשָׁךְ: אִי לְמִשְׁרְיַיהּ לִגְדוֹלָה קָאָתֵי — בְּעֶשֶׂר וּשְׁנֵי טְפָחִים סַגִּיא. וְאִי לְמֵיסְרַהּ לִקְטַנָּה קָאָתֵי — לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן דְּמַפְלְגִי טוּבָא.
human_translation: Whichever way If is coming to permit the large of ten and two handbreadths suffices. And if it is coming to prohibit the small it should teach us farther removed
llm_translation: From what does your soul derive satisfaction: if to release it for greatness, it is established at ten and two cubits. And if to confine it for smallness, it is established to hear that it is a good division.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: נִרְאֶה מִבַּחוּץ וְשָׁוֶה מִבִּפְנִים — אֵינוֹ נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם לֶחִי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, can we not conclude from visible from the outside but even from the inside is not considered a side post? conclude from this.
llm_translation: Rather, no, learn from it: if it appears from the outside and is equal from the inside - it is not judged for being a blemish. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לָא שְׁמִיעַ לִי הָא שְׁמַעְתְּתָא.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: I did not hear this halakha
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: "I did not hear this that you heard."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אַתְּ אֲמַרְתְּ נִיהֲלַן, וְאַהָא אֲמַרְתְּ נִיהֲלַן — דְּאָמַר רָמֵי בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לֶחִי הַמּוֹשֵׁךְ עִם דׇּפְנוֹ שֶׁל מָבוֹי, פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם לֶחִי, וּמִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ עִם חוּדּוֹ הַפְּנִימִי. אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם מָבוֹי, וְאָסוּר לְהִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בְּכוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: You told us and with regard to this you told us. As Rami bar Abba said Rav Huna said: a side post that extends along the wall of an alleyway less than four cubits it is considered of a side post. And one may use up to the inner edge four cubits, it is considered to of an alleyway, and it is prohibited to utilize the entire
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye: You said they are considered joined, and now you say they are considered joined - for Ramei, son of Abba, said Rav Huna said: A beam that extends from the side of an alleyway less than four cubits is judged as a beam, and one may make use of its inner space. Four cubits are judged as an alleyway, and it is forbidden to make use of it entirely.

hebrew_text: וְאַתְּ אֲמַרְתְּ לַן עֲלַהּ: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תְּלָת. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: בֵּין לְחָיַיִן אָסוּר. וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: מֶשֶׁךְ מָבוֹי בְּאַרְבַּע. וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: נִרְאֶה מִבַּחוּץ וְשָׁוֶה מִבִּפְנִים נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם לֶחִי.
human_translation: And you said to us about this: Learn from this three Learn from it between the side posts it is prohibited And learn from it length of an alleyway is four And learn from it visible from the outside but even from the inside is considered of a side post.
llm_translation: You said to us: Go up. Understand from it three. Understand from it: Between the cheeks is forbidden. And understand from it: A breach in a wall is four. And understand from it: If it appears from the outside and is equal from the inside, it is judged due to the cheek.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא: נִרְאֶה מִבַּחוּץ וְשָׁוֶה מִבִּפְנִים — נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם לֶחִי. תְּיוּבְתָּא וְהִלְכְתָא?
human_translation: The halakha visible from the outside but even from the inside is considered of a side post. a conclusive refutation and the halakha ?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And the halakha: If it appears from the outside and is equal from the inside - it is judged due to the cheek. Is it a contradiction and the halakha?"

hebrew_text: אִין, מִשּׁוּם דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא כְּווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Yes, because Rabbi Ḥiyya taught in accordance with it.
llm_translation: There is not, because Rabbi Chiya teaches like his father.

hebrew_text: וְהָרָחָב מֵעֶשֶׂר יְמַעֵט. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, תָּנָא: וְהָרָחָב מֵעֶשֶׂר יְמַעֵט, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְמַעֵט. וְעַד כַּמָּה?
human_translation: wider than ten one must diminish Abaye said taught is wider than ten one must diminish Rabbi Yehuda says: He need not diminish it. Until what
llm_translation: The text reads: "And the broadening diminishes the tithe." Abaye said, a Tanna taught: "And the broadening diminishes the tithe," Rabbi Yehuda says: "It does not need to diminish." And until when?

hebrew_text: סָבַר רַב אַחַי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף לְמֵימַר: עַד שְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה וּשְׁלִישׁ. וְקַל וָחוֹמֶר מִפַּסֵּי בִירָאוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Aḥai thought to say before Rav Yosef: Up to thirteen and a third cubits. And an a fortiori from boards surrounding a well.
llm_translation: Rav Ahai thought before Rav Yosef to say: Until thirteen cubits and a third. And a fortiori from the walls of towers.

hebrew_text: וּמָה פַּסֵּי בִירָאוֹת שֶׁהִתַּרְתָּה בָּהֶן פָּרוּץ מְרוּבֶּה עַל הָעוֹמֵד — לֹא הִתַּרְתָּה בָּהֶן יוֹתֵר מִשְּׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה וּשְׁלִישׁ, מָבוֹי שֶׁלֹּא הִתַּרְתָּה בּוֹ פָּרוּץ מְרוּבֶּה עַל הָעוֹמֵד, אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא תַּתִּיר בּוֹ יוֹתֵר מִשְּׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה וּשְׁלִישׁ?
human_translation: Just as boards surrounding a well, where you permitted breached is greater than the standing you did not permit within them more than thirteen and a third cubits an alleyway, where you did not permit breached is greater than the standing is it not right that you will not permit within it more than thirteen and a third cubits
llm_translation: And what are the thresholds in courtyards that you permitted with a breach greater than the standing post - you did not permit in them more than thirteen cubits and a third. A courtyard that you did not permit with a breach greater than the standing post, is it not the law that you should not permit in it more than thirteen cubits and a third?

hebrew_text: וְהִיא הַנּוֹתֶנֶת: פַּסֵּי בִירָאוֹת שֶׁהִתַּרְתָּה בָּהֶן פָּרוּץ מְרוּבֶּה עַל הָעוֹמֵד — לֹא תַּתִּיר בָּהֶן יוֹתֵר מִשְּׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה וּשְׁלִישׁ, מָבוֹי שֶׁלֹּא הִתַּרְתָּה בּוֹ פָּרוּץ מְרוּבֶּה עַל הָעוֹמֵד — תַּתִּיר בּוֹ יוֹתֵר מִשְּׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה אַמּוֹת וּשְׁלִישׁ!
human_translation: But that provides boards surrounding a well, where you permitted within them, breached is greater than the standing you will not permit within them, more than thirteen and a third cubits; an alleyway, where you did not permit breached is greater than the standing you will permit more than thirteen and a third cubits.
llm_translation: And she who places: breaches in walls that were permitted with a protrusion greater than the standing - do not permit in them more than thirteen cubits and a third. A courtyard that was not permitted with a protrusion greater than the standing - permit in it more than thirteen cubits and a third!

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי לְאִידַּךְ גִּיסָא: פַּסֵּי בִירָאוֹת דְּאַקֵּילְתְּ בְּהוּ חַד קוּלָּא — אַקֵּיל בְּהוּ קוּלָּא אַחֲרִינָא, מָבוֹי כְּלָל כְּלָל לָא.
human_translation: Alternatively, to the contrary. boards surrounding a well, with regard to which you were lenient one leniency, be lenient and another leniency an alleyway, not at all.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "If you wish, I will give you an example: Cut off in the streets where you have lightened one voice — you have lightened another voice, the entrance is not at all."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי לֵוִי: מָבוֹי שֶׁהוּא רָחָב עֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה, נוֹעַץ קָנֶה בְּאֶמְצָעִיתוֹ, וְדַיּוֹ. הוּא תָּנֵי לַהּ וְהוּא אָמַר לַהּ: דְּאֵין הֲלָכָה כְּאוֹתָהּ מִשְׁנָה. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּלֵוִי: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּאוֹתָהּ מִשְׁנָה.
human_translation: Levi taught an alleyway is twenty cubits wide, one may stick a reed in center and sufficient He taught and he said it that the halakha is not in accordance with that teaching, Some say Shmuel said in the name of Levi: The halakha is not in accordance with that teaching.
llm_translation: Levi taught: A courtyard that is twenty cubits wide, one inserts a pole in its middle, and it suffices. He taught it to her, and he said to her: The halakha is not like that Mishnah. Some say, Samuel said in the name of Levi: The halakha is not like that Mishnah.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הֵיכִי עָבֵיד? אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּלֵוִי:
human_translation: Rather, how should one act Shmuel said in the name of Levi:
llm_translation: Rather, how does he do it? Shmuel said in the name of Levi:

hebrew_text: עוֹשֶׂה פַּס גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה בְּמֶשֶׁךְ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, וּמַעֲמִידוֹ לְאׇרְכּוֹ שֶׁל מָבוֹי.
human_translation: One prepares a board ten high with a length of four cubits and stands it lengthwise of the alleyway,
llm_translation: He makes a high threshold of ten in length by four cubits, and he sets it up for the length of the alleyway.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי כִּדְרַב יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: מָבוֹי שֶׁהוּא רָחָב חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה — מַרְחִיק שְׁתֵּי אַמּוֹת וְעוֹשֶׂה פַּס שָׁלֹשׁ אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: Alternatively, in accordance with Rav Yehuda, Rav Yehuda said: an alleyway is fifteen cubits wide, He distances two cubits and prepares a board three cubits
llm_translation: If you wish, like Rav Yehudah, for Rav Yehudah said: A courtyard that is fifteen cubits wide - he distances two cubits and makes a passageway of three cubits.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? יַעֲשֶׂה פַּס אַמָּה וּמֶחֱצָה, וְיַרְחִיק שְׁתֵּי אַמּוֹת, וְיַעֲשֶׂה פַּס אַמָּה וּמֶחֱצָה. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: עוֹמֵד מְרוּבֶּה עַל הַפָּרוּץ מִשְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹת לָא הָוֵי עוֹמֵד!
human_translation: And why One prepare a board a cubit and a half and distance two cubits, and prepare a cubit and a half conclude from this standing greater than the breached from two directions, is not considered standing
llm_translation: And why? He should make a width of an amah and a half, and distance two amot, and make a width of an amah and a half. Learn from it: If the majority is standing on the breach from two sides, it is not considered standing!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ הָוֵי עוֹמֵד, וְשָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דְּאָתֵי אַוֵּירָא דְּהַאי גִּיסָא וְאַוֵּירָא דְּהַאי גִּיסָא וּמְבַטֵּל לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Actually, I would say to you it is considered standing However, it is different here, as the air, of this side and the air, of this side come and negate it.
llm_translation: Forever say to you be standing, and differ here, that comes the argument of this side and the argument of that side and nullifies it.

hebrew_text: וְיַעֲשֶׂה פַּס אַמָּה וְיַרְחִיק אַמָּה, וְיַעֲשֶׂה פַּס אַמָּה וְיַרְחִיק אַמָּה, וְיַעֲשֶׂה פַּס אַמָּה. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ עוֹמֵד כְּפָרוּץ — אָסוּר!
human_translation: And one prepare a board cubit and distance cubit, and prepare board a cubit and distance cubit, and prepare board cubit, conclude from this standing is equal to the breached is prohibited.
llm_translation: And he shall make a pass of one cubit and distance a cubit, and he shall make a pass of one cubit and distance a cubit, and he shall make a pass of one cubit. Learn from it: If it stands like a breach - it is forbidden!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ — מוּתָּר, וְשָׁאנֵי הָכָא דְּאָתֵא אַוֵּירָא דְּהַאי גִּיסָא וּדְהַאי גִּיסָא וּמְבַטֵּל לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Actually, I would say to you is permitted But here it is different, since the air, on this side and the air, on that side come and negate
llm_translation: Forever say to you - permitted, and different here that came a wind of this side and of this side and nullifies it.

hebrew_text: וְיַרְחִיק אַמָּה וְיַעֲשֶׂה פַּס אַמָּה וּמֶחֱצָה, וְיַרְחִיק אַמָּה וְיַעֲשֶׂה פַּס אַמָּה וּמֶחֱצָה.
human_translation: And distance one cubit and prepare a board a cubit and a half, and distance cubit, and prepare board a cubit and a half.
llm_translation: And he shall distance a cubit and make a cubit and a half, and he shall distance a cubit and make a cubit and a half.

hebrew_text: אִין הָכִי נָמֵי, וְכוּלֵּי הַאי לָא אַטְרְחוּהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Yes, it is indeed so; But the Sages did not burden him this much,
llm_translation: So it is said: "And all these the sages did not pay attention to."

hebrew_text: וְלֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא שָׁבֵיק פִּיתְחָא רַבָּה, וְעָיֵיל בְּפִיתְחָא זוּטָא! אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר מַתְנָה: חֲזָקָה אֵין אָדָם מַנִּיחַ פֶּתַח גָּדוֹל וְנִכְנָס בְּפֶתַח קָטָן.
human_translation: But let us be concerned lest one abandon the larger entrance, and enter through the smaller entrance, Rav Adda bar Mattana said: presumption a person does not abandon a larger entrance and enter through a smaller entrance.
llm_translation: And perhaps he left the large entrance and entered through the small entrance! Rav Adda bar Matna said: It is assumed that a person does not leave a large entrance and enter through a small entrance.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא מִדְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי וּדְרַבֵּי אַסִּי?
human_translation: And what different of Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi,
llm_translation: And what is the difference between Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi?

hebrew_text: הָתָם קָא מְמַעֵט בְּהִילּוּכָא. הָכָא לָא קָא מְמַעֵט בְּהִילּוּכָא.
human_translation: There, reduces walking here, it does not reduce walking
llm_translation: There, it is diminishing in walking. Here, it is not diminishing in walking.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: עוֹר הָעַסְלָא וְחָלָל שֶׁלּוֹ — מִצְטָרְפִין בְּטֶפַח.
human_translation: We learned there, The leather of a stool asla and its hole join to a handbreadth
llm_translation: We learned there: The skin of the asla and its cavity - combine in a handbreadth.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״עוֹר הָעַסְלָא״? אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עוֹר כִּיסּוּי שֶׁל בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא.
human_translation: What is the leather of a stool Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rav Yoḥanan said: The leather covering of a bathroom.
llm_translation: "What is 'the skin of the asla'?" Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: The skin covering of the toilet."

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה? כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: אֶצְבָּעַיִים מִכָּאן, וְאֶצְבָּעַיִים מִכָּאן, וְאֶצְבָּעַיִים רֶיוַח בָּאֶמְצַע. כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר: אֶצְבַּע וּמֶחֱצָה מִכָּאן, וְאֶצְבַּע וּמֶחֱצָה מִכָּאן, וְאֶצְבַּע רֶיוַח בָּאֶמְצַע.
human_translation: And how large When Rav Dimi came he said: Two fingers from here, and two fingers from here, and a space of two fingers in the middle. when Ravin came he said: A finger and a half from here, and a finger and a half from here, and a space of finger in the middle.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And how much? For Rav Dimi came and said: fingers from here, and fingers from here, and fingers spacious in the middle. When Ravin came, he said: a finger and half from here, and a finger and half from here, and a finger spacious in the middle."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב דִּימִי: מִי פְּלִיגִיתוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא, הָא — בְּרַבְרְבָתָא, הָא — בְּזוּטְרָתָא, וְלָא פְּלִיגִין.
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Dimi: Do you, disagree said to him: No, this, is referring to the large this, is referring to the small and we do not disagree.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye to Rav Dimi: Who disputed? He said to him: No, this — in the case of abundance, this — in the case of scarcity, and they do not dispute.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאיֵי, פְּלִיגִיתוּ, וּבְעוֹמֵד מְרוּבֶּה עַל הַפָּרוּץ מִשְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹת פְּלִיגִיתוּ. לְדִידָךְ הָוֵי עוֹמֵד מִשְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹת, לְרָבִין מֵרוּחַ אַחַת — הָוֵי עוֹמֵד, מִשְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹת — לָא הָוֵי עוֹמֵד.
human_translation: said to him: not so la’ei You disagree, and you disagree with regard to standing greater than the breached from two directions, According to you, is considered as standing, from two directions. According to Ravin, on one side is considered as standing; from the two directions, is not considered as standing.
llm_translation: He said to him: To whom are you referring? You have disputed, and when one stands predominantly on the breach, you have disputed. According to your opinion, when one stands predominantly on the breach, for Rabbin, from one side — he stands, from two sides — he does not stand.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ לָא פְּלִיגִיתוּ, לְרָבִין הָכִי אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְמֵימַר: אֶצְבַּע וּשְׁלִישׁ מִכָּאן, וְאֶצְבַּע וּשְׁלִישׁ מִכָּאן, וְאֶצְבַּע וּשְׁלִישׁ רֶיוַח בָּאֶמְצַע.
human_translation: For if it should enter your mind you do not disagree, to Ravin should have said as follows: A finger and a third from here, and a finger and a third from here, and a finger and a third in the middle.
llm_translation: If your mind did not come to this conclusion, Ravin thus raised an objection to him, saying: "A finger and a third from here, and a finger and a third from here, and a finger and a third meet in the middle."

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מַאי — פְּלִיגִינַן? לְדִידִי, הָכִי אִיבְּעִי לִי לְמֵימַר: אֶצְבַּע וּשְׁנֵי שְׁלִישִׁים מִכָּאן, וְאֶצְבַּע וּשְׁנֵי שְׁלִישִׁים מִכָּאן, וְאֶצְבָּעַיִים וּשְׁנֵי שְׁלִישִׁים רֶיוַח בָּאֶמְצַע.
human_translation: Rather, what we disagree? to me, I should have said as follows: A finger and two thirds from here, and a finger and two thirds from here, and a space of two fingers and two thirds in the middle.
llm_translation: And rather what — do we dispute? According to me, thus I would say: A finger and two-thirds from here, and a finger and two-thirds from here, and two fingers and two-thirds meet in the middle.
