hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר דִּפְלִגִינַן — בִּפָרוּץ כְּעוֹמֵד פְּלִגִינַן.
human_translation: Rather, if there is to say that we disagree, we argue the breached is equal to the standing
llm_translation: Rather, is there a place to say that we differentiate — in the case of a breach, we differentiate as if standing we differentiate.

hebrew_text: אִם יֵשׁ לוֹ צוּרַת הַפֶּתַח, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁרָחָב מֵעֶשֶׂר — אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְמַעֵט. אַשְׁכְּחַן צוּרַת הַפֶּתַח דְּמַהְנְיָא בְּרַחְבּוֹ, וַאֲמַלְתְּרָא דְּמַהְנְיָא בְּגׇבְהוֹ.
human_translation: If has form of a doorway, even if it is wider than ten one need not diminish We find form of a doorway is effective with its width, and a cornice is effective with its height,
llm_translation: If he has the form of the entrance, even though it is wider than ten - he does not need to lessen. We find the form of the entrance that is relevant in its width, and the form that is relevant in its height.

hebrew_text: אִיפְּכָא מַאי?
human_translation: What is the opposite
llm_translation: Opposite, what is it?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע דְּתַנְיָא: מָבוֹי שֶׁהוּא גָּבוֹהַּ מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה יְמַעֵט, וְאִם יֵשׁ לוֹ צוּרַת הַפֶּתַח אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְמַעֵט.
human_translation: Come hear as it was taught an alleyway is higher than twenty cubits, one must diminish but if has an opening in the form of a doorway, he need not diminish it.
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught: A gateway that is higher than twenty cubits, one should diminish it, and if it has a lintel, there is no need to diminish it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַלְתְּרָא בְּרׇחְבּוֹ מַאי? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא: מָבוֹי שֶׁהוּא גָּבוֹהַּ מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה יְמַעֵט, וְהָרָחָב מֵעֶשֶׂר יְמַעֵט, וְאִם יֵשׁ לוֹ צוּרַת הַפֶּתַח אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְמַעֵט, וְאִם יֵשׁ לוֹ אֲמַלְתְּרָא אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְמַעֵט.
human_translation: What is a cornice with width? Come hear as it was taught an alleyway is higher than twenty cubits, one must diminish and wider than ten one must diminish However, if has an opening in the form of a doorway, he need not diminish it, and, if it has a cornice, he need not diminish it.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is "Amaltra" in its width? Come and hear, as it was taught: A passageway that is higher than twenty cubits decreases, and its width decreases from ten, and if it has a doorframe shape, it does not need to decrease, and if it has an "Amaltra," it does not need to decrease.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו אַסֵּיפָא: לָא, אַרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: What, is not to the latter No, to the first
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "Lav Asseifa"? Not in the beginning.

hebrew_text: מַתְנֵי לֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה לְחִיָּיא בַּר רַב קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְמַעֵט. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַתְנְיֵיהּ, צָרִיךְ לְמַעֵט.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda would teach Ḥiyya bar Rav before Rav he need not diminish said to him: Teach him He must diminish
llm_translation: He taught him, Rav Yehudah to Chiya bar Rav before him of Rav: He does not need to lessen. He said to him: Teach it, he needs to lessen.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מִדִּבְרֵי רַבֵּינוּ נִלְמַד: חָצֵר שֶׁרוּבָּהּ פְּתָחִים וְחַלּוֹנוֹת — אֵינָהּ נִיתֶּרֶת בְּצוּרַת הַפֶּתַח.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: From the statement of our teacher, we will learn a courtyard, which are mostly entrances and windows, it is not permitted by the form of a doorway.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: From the words of our teacher we have learned: A courtyard whose majority is doorways and windows - it is not considered closed with regard to the law of carrying within it.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא — הוֹאִיל וְיוֹתֵר מֵעֶשֶׂר אוֹסֵר בְּמָבוֹי, וּפָרוּץ מְרוּבֶּה עַל הָעוֹמֵד אוֹסֵר בֶּחָצֵר. מָה יוֹתֵר מֵעֶשֶׂר הָאוֹסֵר בְּמָבוֹי — אֵינוֹ נִיתָּר בְּצוּרַת הַפֶּתַח, אַף פָּרוּץ מְרוּבֶּה עַל הָעוֹמֵד הָאוֹסֵר בֶּחָצֵר — אֵינוֹ נִיתָּר בְּצוּרַת הַפֶּתַח.
human_translation: What is the reason? Since more than ten renders it prohibited in an alleyway, and breached is greater than its standing renders it prohibited in a courtyard, Just as, more than ten that renders it prohibited in an alleyway, is not permitted by the form of a doorway so breached is greater than its standing that renders it prohibited in a courtyard, is not permitted by the form of a doorway
llm_translation: What is the reason? - Since one who exceeds the tithe prohibits the use of the alleyway, and a breach that is mostly over the standing area prohibits the use of the courtyard. Just as one who exceeds the tithe does not nullify the status of the entrance, so too, a breach that is mostly over the standing area does not nullify the status of the entrance.

hebrew_text: מָה לְיוֹתֵר מֵעֶשֶׂר הָאוֹסֵר בְּמָבוֹי — שֶׁכֵּן לֹא הִתַּרְתָּ בּוֹ אֵצֶל פַּסֵּי בִירָאוֹת לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, תֹּאמַר בְּפָרוּץ מְרוּבֶּה עַל הָעוֹמֵד הָאוֹסֵר בֶּחָצֵר — שֶׁכֵּן הִתַּרְתָּ אֵצֶל פַּסֵּי בִירָאוֹת לְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל.
human_translation: What more than ten that renders it prohibited in an alleyway? because you did not permit with regard to boards surrounding a well, in accordance with Rabbi Meir. you say in a breached greater than the standing that renders it prohibited in a courtyard, as you permitted with regard to boards surrounding a well according to everyone.
llm_translation: What is the law regarding a wall that is higher than ten handbreadths that prohibits entry into an alleyway? So too, it was not permitted by Rabbi Meir in the case of breaches in the walls of courtyards. You will say that in the case of a breach that is mostly open towards the standing one who prohibits entry into the courtyard, it was permitted by Rabbi Meir in accordance with the view of everyone.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: דְּפָנוֹת הַלָּלוּ שֶׁרוּבָּן פְּתָחִים וְחַלּוֹנוֹת מוּתָּר, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיְּהֵא עוֹמֵד מְרוּבֶּה עַל הַפָּרוּץ.
human_translation: Let us say supports these walls that most of them entrances and windows, permitted provided that the standing are greater than the breached
llm_translation: Let us say that it assists him: These walls that have more doorways than windows are permitted, as long as the majority is over the breach.

hebrew_text: שֶׁרוּבָּן סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? — אֶלָּא אֵימָא: שֶׁרִיבָּה בָּהֶן פְּתָחִים וְחַלּוֹנוֹת, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיְּהֵא עוֹמֵד מְרוּבֶּה עַל הַפָּרוּץ.
human_translation: Can it enter your mind that where most of Rather, to which he added entrances and windows is permitted, provided that the standing are greater than the breached
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "She'ruban sakla da'atach?" - Rather say: "Sheribah bahen petachim ve'chalonot, u'vilvad she'yehi omed merubeh al haparutz." English translation: "Did your mind ascend? - Rather say: 'Let there be many openings and windows in it, provided that a standing beam is more numerous than the breach.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא — בְּפִיתְחֵי שִׁימָאֵי.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said When this was taught, with regard to broken entrances
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: When it is taught that — in the gates of Sheimaei.

hebrew_text: מַאי פִּיתְחֵי שִׁימָאֵי? פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַב רְחוּמִי וְרַב יוֹסֵף. חַד אָמַר: דְּלֵית לְהוּ שִׁקְפֵי, וְחַד אָמַר: דְּלֵית לְהוּ תִּיקְרָה.
human_translation: What are broken entrances? Rav Reḥumei and Rav Yosef disagreed One said that they do not have doorposts, and one said that they do not have lintels
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "Shimaei's opening"? They dispute it: Rav Rehumi and Rav Yosef. One says: there are no windows, and one says: there are no roofs.

hebrew_text: וְאַף רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן סָבַר לַהּ לְהָא דְּרַב. דְּאָמַר רָבִין בַּר רַב אַדָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאָדָם אֶחָד מִבִּקְעַת בֵּית חוֹרְתָן שֶׁנָּעַץ אַרְבָּעָה קוּנְדֵּיסִין בְּאַרְבַּע פִּינּוֹת הַשָּׂדֶה, וּמָתַח זְמוֹרָה עֲלֵיהֶם. וּבָא מַעֲשֶׂה לִפְנֵי חֲכָמִים, וְהִתִּירוּ לוֹ לְעִנְיַן כִּלְאַיִם.
human_translation: And even Rabbi Yoḥanan holds that of Rav, As Ravin bar Rav Adda said Rabbi Yitzḥak said: an incident involving a person from the valley of Beit Ḥortan who stuck four poles kunddeisin in the four corners of field, and stretched a vine over them, And the case came before the Sages, and they permitted him with regard to diverse kinds.
llm_translation: And even Rabbi Yochanan thought to her according to the opinion of Rav. For Ravin, son of Rav Adda, said in the name of Rabbi Yitzchak: There was an incident with a certain man from the valley of Beit Choratan who planted four kundesin in the four corners of the field, and he stretched a zemorah over them. And the matter came before the sages, and they permitted him to benefit from them as if they were not a kilayim.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁהִתִּירוּ לוֹ לְעִנְיַן כִּלְאַיִם כָּךְ הִתִּירוּ לוֹ לְעִנְיַן שַׁבָּת. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: לְכִלְאַיִם הִתִּירוּ לוֹ, לְעִנְיַן שַׁבָּת לֹא הִתִּירוּ לוֹ.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish said: Just as they permitted him with regard to diverse kinds, so they permitted him with regard to Shabbat, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: With regard to diverse kinds, they permitted him with regard to Shabbat, they did not permit him
llm_translation: And Reish Lakish said: Just as they permitted him for the matter of Kilayim, so too they permitted him for the matter of Shabbat. Rabbi Yochanan said: They permitted him for Kilayim, but they did not permit him for the matter of Shabbat.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא מִן הַצַּד, וְהָאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: צוּרַת הַפֶּתַח שֶׁעֲשָׂאָהּ מִן הַצַּד לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְלוּם.
human_translation: With what are we dealing If you say from the side, didn’t Rav Ḥisda say one constructed the form of a doorway from the side, he has done nothing?
llm_translation: In what are we dealing? If you say from the side, but Rav Ḥisdah said: The form of the doorway that he made from the side, he did not make it and it is nothing.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא עַל גַּבָּן. וּבְמַאי? אִילֵימָא בְּעֶשֶׂר — בְּהָא לֵימָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בְּשַׁבָּת לָא?!
human_translation: Rather, on top of And in what If you say of ten would Rabbi Yoḥanan say in that with regard to Shabbat, not
llm_translation: Rather, on top of the roof. And with what? If you say with ten - with that, let Rabbi Yochanan say on Shabbat?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו — בְּיָתֵר מֵעֶשֶׂר.
human_translation: Rather, isn’t where more than ten
llm_translation: Rather no - with more than tithe.

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם בְּעֶשֶׂר וּמִן הַצַּד — וּבִדְרַב חִסְדָּא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי.
human_translation: No, actually where ten and from the side. And disagree with regard to Rav Ḥisda.
llm_translation: Not, always in ten and from the side - and in Rav Ḥisda's opinion, he disputes.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִי דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אַדְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וּרְמִי דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אַדְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא:
human_translation: But raise a contradiction of Rabbi Yoḥanan and of Rabbi Yoḥanan; and raise a contradiction of Reish Lakish and of Reish Lakish. As Reish Lakish said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥanina:
llm_translation: "And a teaching of Rabbi Yochanan according to Rabbi Yochanan, and a teaching of Reish Lakish according to Reish Lakish, for Reish Lakish said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Chanina:"

hebrew_text: פֵּיאָה מוּתֶּרֶת לְעִנְיַן כִּלְאַיִם, אֲבָל לֹא לְשַׁבָּת. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: כִּמְחִיצּוֹת לְשַׁבָּת דְּלָא, כָּךְ מְחִיצּוֹת לְכִלְאַיִם דְּלֹא.
human_translation: A braid is permitted with regard to diverse kinds, but not with regard to Shabbat. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Just as not partition with regard to Shabbat, so not a partition with regard to diverse kinds.
llm_translation: Pe'ah is permitted for the purpose of boundaries, but not for Shabbat. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Just as boundaries are not permitted for Shabbat, so too boundaries are not permitted for Kilayim.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אַדְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — דִידֵיהּ, הָא — דְרַבֵּיהּ. אֶלָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אַדְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: Granted, of Reish Lakish of Reish Lakish no difficulty, as this his that of his teacher, However, of Rabbi Yoḥanan and of Rabbi Yoḥanan, a difficulty.
llm_translation: In the peace of Resh Lakish, Resh Lakish said: It is not difficult. This — of himself, this — of his master. Rather, Rabbi Yochanan is difficult to Rabbi Yochanan!

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא: הָתָם — עַל גַּבָּן, הָכָא — מִן הַצַּד, שַׁפִּיר. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי מִן הַצַּד, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: Granted, if you say there, on top of here, from the side, well. However, if you say this and that from the side, what is there to say?
llm_translation: If you say: There — on top; here — from the side, it is fine. But if you say: Both from the side, what can be said?

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם, אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי מִן הַצַּד: הָתָם — בְּעֶשֶׂר, הָכָא — בְּיוֹתֵר מֵעֶשֶׂר.
human_translation: Actually, this and that from the side. There, where ten here, where more than ten
llm_translation: Always, both this and that from the side: there — in ten, here — more than ten.

hebrew_text: וּמְנָא תֵּימְרָא דְּשָׁנֵי לַן בֵּין עֶשֶׂר לְיוֹתֵר מֵעֶשֶׂר — דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: לֹא כָּךְ הָיָה הַמַּעֲשֶׂה, שֶׁהָלַךְ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אֵצֶל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁבָּקִי בְּהִלְכוֹת כִּלְאַיִם, וּמְצָאוֹ שֶׁיּוֹשֵׁב בֵּין הָאִילָנוֹת וּמָתַח זְמוֹרָה מֵאִילָן לְאִילָן. וְאָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי, אִי גְּפָנִים כָּאן מַהוּ לִזְרוֹעַ כָּאן? אָמַר לוֹ: בְּעֶשֶׂר מוּתָּר, בְּיוֹתֵר מֵעֶשֶׂר אָסוּר.
human_translation: And from where do you say that we distinguish between ten and more than ten As Rabbi Yoḥanan said to Reish Lakish: That is not the incident As Rabbi Yehoshua went to Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri to study Torah, even though expert in the halakhot of diverse kinds and found him sitting among the trees, and stretched a vine from one tree to another and said to him: Rabbi, if there are grapevines here, what sowing here, said to him: where ten permitted; where more than ten prohibited.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: What is the law regarding the difference between ten and more than ten? For Rabbi Yochanan said to Reish Lakish: The incident did not occur in this manner, that Rabbi Yehoshua went to study Torah with Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri, even though he was proficient in the laws of forbidden mixtures, and they found him sitting among the trees and grafting a branch from one tree to another. And he said to him: Rabbi, if there are vines here, what is the law of planting here? He said to him: With ten it is permitted, with more than ten it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא עַל גַּבָּן יוֹתֵר מֵעֶשֶׂר אָסוּר — וְהָתַנְיָא: הָיוּ שָׁם קָנִין הַדּוֹקְרָנִין וְעָשָׂה לָהֶן פֵּיאָה מִלְמַעְלָה, אֲפִילּוּ בְּיוֹתֵר מֵעֶשֶׂר מוּתָּר!
human_translation: With what are we dealing If you say on top of more than ten is it prohibited? But wasn’t it taught If there were forked reeds there and he plaited a braid above them, even more than ten it is permitted?
llm_translation: With what are we dealing? Perhaps it is forbidden to place a roof over the top of the pigeons more than ten handbreadths high — and it was taught: If there were there pigeon coops that were roofed and he made for them a peak from above, even more than ten handbreadths is permitted!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו מִן הַצַּד, וְקָאֲמַר לֵיהּ בְּעֶשֶׂר מוּתָּר, יוֹתֵר מֵעֶשֶׂר אָסוּר. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, not from the side, and he is saying to him: In ten permitted; in more than ten it is prohibited? learn from it
llm_translation: Rather, not from the side, and it says to him with ten permitted, more than ten forbidden. Hear from it.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: צוּרַת הַפֶּתַח שֶׁעֲשָׂאָהּ מִן הַצַּד — לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְלוּם.
human_translation: the matter itself Rav Ḥisda said: one prepared the form of a doorway from the side, he has not done anything.
llm_translation: The body, said Rav Ḥisda: If the form of the doorway he made from the side — he did not make and did not nullify.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: צוּרַת הַפֶּתַח שֶׁאָמְרוּ, צְרִיכָה שֶׁתְּהֵא בְּרִיאָה כְּדֵי לְהַעֲמִיד בָּהּ דֶּלֶת, וַאֲפִילּוּ דֶּלֶת שֶׁל קַשִּׁין.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said: The form of a doorway of which spoke must be strong enough to mount a door in it, and even door of straw.
llm_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said: The form of the doorway that they spoke of, it requires that it be created large enough to support a door, even a door of straw.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יַנַּאי: צוּרַת הַפֶּתַח צְרִיכָה הֶיכֵּר צִיר. מַאי הֶיכֵּר צִיר? אָמַר רַב אַוְיָא: אַבְקָתָא.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said in the name of Rabbi Yannai: The form of a doorway requires a mark for hinges. What is a mark for hinges? Rav Avya said: Loops [ avkata ]
llm_translation: Said Reish Lakish in the name of Rabbi Yannai: The form of the doorway requires recognition of the beam. What is the recognition of the beam? Rav Avya said: Dust.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחִינְהוּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַוְיָא לְתַלְמִידֵי דְּרַב אָשֵׁי, אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֲמַר מָר מִידֵּי בְּצוּרַת הַפֶּתַח? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: לֹא אָמַר וְלֹא כְּלוּם.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, the son of Rav Avya, found the students of Rav Ashi said to them: Did the Master, say anything with regard to the form of a doorway? They said to him: He said nothing,
llm_translation: I found Rav Ahah, son of Rav Avya, to the students of Rav Ashi, he said to them: Did the Master say anything about the shape of the doorway? They said to him: He did not say anything.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: צוּרַת הַפֶּתַח שֶׁאָמְרוּ, קָנֶה מִכָּאן וְקָנֶה מִכָּאן וְקָנֶה עַל גַּבֵּיהֶן. צְרִיכִין לִיגַּע, אוֹ אֵין צְרִיכִין לִיגַּע? רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: אֵין צְרִיכִין לִיגַּע. וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: צְרִיכִין לִיגַּע.
human_translation: taught The form of a doorway of which they spoke a reed from here, and a reed from there, and a reed on top of them. Need to touch or do they not need to touch Rav Naḥman said: They do not need to touch and Rav Sheshet said: They need to touch
llm_translation: Mishnah: The form of the doorway that they spoke of, a reed from here and a reed from here and a reed on top of them. Do they need to touch, or do they not need to touch? Rav Nachman said: They do not need to touch. And Rav Sheshet said: They need to touch.

hebrew_text: אֲזַל רַב נַחְמָן וַעֲבַד עוֹבָדָא בֵּי רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא כִּשְׁמַעְתֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ רַב גַּדָּא: זִיל, שְׁלוֹף שְׁדִינְהוּ. אֲזַל, שְׁלַף, שְׁדִינְהוּ. אַשְׁכְּחוּהוּ דְּבֵי רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא, חַבְשׁוּהוּ. אֲזַל רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, קָם אַבָּבָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: גַּדָּא, פּוֹק תָּא! נְפַק וַאֲתָא.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman went and performed an action in the house of the Exilarch in accordance with his opinion. Rav Sheshet said to his attendant, Rav Gadda: Go, remove throw them went, removed threw them of the Exilarch’s court found him imprisoned him Rav Sheshet went stood at the door called to him: Gadda, go out come he went out and came
llm_translation: Rav Nachman went and did a task in the house of the head of the exile when he heard him. Rav Sheshet said to Rav Gadda to hear him: "Go, pull their hair." He went, pulled their hair. They found him in the house of the head of the exile, they bound him. Rav Sheshet went, the father came, said to him: "Gadda, come out!" He went out and came.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת לְרַבָּה בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תָּנֵי מָר מִידֵּי בְּצוּרַת הַפֶּתַח? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, תְּנֵינָא: כִּיפָּה, רַבִּי מֵאִיר מְחַיֵּיב בִּמְזוּזָה, וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹטְרִין. וְשָׁוִין שֶׁאִם יֵשׁ בְּרַגְלֶיהָ עֲשָׂרָה שֶׁהִיא חַיֶּיבֶת.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet found Rabba bar Shmuel said to him: Did the Master teach anything with regard to the form of a doorway? He said to him: Yes, we learned an arched gateway, Rabbi Meir deems obligated to a mezuza , and the Rabbis deem exempt. However, they agree that if its supports, are ten that requires
llm_translation: He found Rav Sheshet to Rabba bar Shmuel, he said to him: Does Mar teach regarding the form of the doorway? He said to him: No, we learned: A dome, Rabbi Meir obligates with a mezuzah, and the Sages exempt. And they are equal that if it has ten handbreadths in its legs, it is obligated.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים אִם גְּבוֹהָה עֲשָׂרָה וְאֵין בְּרַגְלֶיהָ שְׁלֹשָׁה, אִי נָמֵי: יֵשׁ בְּרַגְלֶיהָ שְׁלֹשָׁה, וְאֵין גְּבוֹהָה עֲשָׂרָה — וְלֹא כְּלוּם.
human_translation: Abaye said: Everyone agrees that if is ten high, but its supports are less than three alternatively, its supports are three is less than ten high, no at all.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Everyone agrees that if it is ten high and does not have three in its legs, or rather: if it has three in its legs and is not ten high — it is invalid.

hebrew_text: כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּיֵשׁ בְּרַגְלֶיהָ שְׁלֹשָׁה וּגְבוֹהָה עֲשָׂרָה, וְאֵין רְחָבָה אַרְבָּעָה, וְיֵשׁ בָּהּ לָחוֹק לְהַשְׁלִימָהּ לְאַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: Where they disagree is in the supports are three and ten high, is less than four wide; however, there is to carve out to complete it to four
llm_translation: When they argue about a courtyard that has three in its length and ten in its height, and its width is not four, and there is a law in it to complete it to four.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: חוֹקְקִין לְהַשְׁלִים, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: אֵין חוֹקְקִין לְהַשְׁלִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir holds one carves to complete And the Rabbis hold one does not carve out to complete
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir holds: we may carve to complete, and the Rabbis hold: we may not carve to complete.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לְהוּ — לָא תֵּימָא לְהוּ לְבֵי רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא וְלָא מִידֵּי מֵהָא מַתְנִיתָא דְכִיפָּה.
human_translation: said to If you find them, do not say to the Exilarch’s household anything with regard to this baraita of an arched gateway,
llm_translation: He said to him: If you find them - do not say to them, "Go to the head of the exile," but rather from this Mishnah of Kippah.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הֶכְשֵׁר מָבוֹי, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: לֶחִי וְקוֹרָה, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אוֹ לֶחִי אוֹ קוֹרָה. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: לְחָיַיִן.
human_translation: rendering an alleyway fit Beit Shammai say: a side post and a beam Beit Hillel say: Either a side post or a beam. Rabbi Eliezer says: side posts
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Regarding the validity of an alleyway, Beit Shammai say: It requires a beam and a crossbeam, and Beit Hillel say: It requires either a beam or a crossbeam. Rabbi Eliezer says: It requires both.

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אָמַר תַּלְמִיד אֶחָד לִפְנֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל עַל מָבוֹי שֶׁהוּא פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, שֶׁהוּא נִיתָּר אוֹ בְּלֶחִי אוֹ בְּקוֹרָה. עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ — עַל רָחָב מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת וְעַד עֶשֶׂר, שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: לֶחִי וְקוֹרָה, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אוֹ לֶחִי אוֹ קוֹרָה. אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: עַל זֶה וְעַל זֶה נֶחְלְקוּ.
human_translation: In the name of Rabbi Yishmael, one student said before Rabbi Akiva: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree about an alleyway that is less than four cubits that is rendered permitted by either a side post or a beam. With regard to what did they disagree? It is with regard to wider than four cubits, and up to ten as Beit Shammai say: a side post and a beam. And Beit Hillel say: either a side post or a beam. Rabbi Akiva said they disagree about this and about that
llm_translation: From the teaching of Rabbi Yishmael, a disciple said before Rabbi Akiva: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree regarding a passageway that is less than four cubits, whether it is resolved with a beam or with a crossbeam. What did they disagree about? They disagreed regarding a width from four cubits to ten cubits. Beit Shammai says: with a beam and a crossbeam, and Beit Hillel says: either a beam or a crossbeam. Rabbi Akiva said: They disagreed on this and on that.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ כְּמַאן? דְּלָא כַּחֲנַנְיָה וְלָא כְּתַנָּא קַמָּא.
human_translation: In accordance with whose neither in accordance with Ḥananya, nor in accordance with the first tanna
llm_translation: Gemara: Who says so? Not like Chananya, and not like the first Tanna.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, הָכִי קָאָמַר: הֶכְשֵׁר מָבוֹי סָתוּם כֵּיצַד? בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: לֶחִי וְקוֹרָה, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אוֹ לֶחִי אוֹ קוֹרָה.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said this is what is saying: How is a closed alleyway rendered fit Beit Shammai say: a side post and a beam. And Beit Hillel say: Either a side post or a beam.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said, thus he said: How does one make a valid enclosed alleyway? Beit Shammai says: A beam and a crossbeam, and Beit Hillel says: Either a beam or a crossbeam.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: לֶחִי וְקוֹרָה, לְמֵימְרָא דְּקָא סָבְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי: אַרְבַּע מְחִיצּוֹת דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: a side post and a beam. Is that to say Beit Shammai hold four partitions are by Torah law?
llm_translation: House of Shammai says: "Rib and beam," to say what House of Shammai holds: "Four partitions of biblical law."

hebrew_text: לָא, לִזְרוֹק — מִשָּׁלֹשׁ הוּא דְּמִיחַיַּיב, לְטַלְטֵל — עַד דְּאִיכָּא אַרְבַּע.
human_translation: No, to throw once three one is liable to carry until there are four
llm_translation: Not to throw - from three is one liable, to carry - until there are four.

hebrew_text: בֵּית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים אוֹ לֶחִי אוֹ קוֹרָה. לֵימָא קָא סָבְרִי בֵּית הִלֵּל שָׁלֹשׁ מְחִיצּוֹת דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא?
human_translation: Beit Hillel say: Either a side post or a beam Is that to say Beit Hillel hold that three partitions by Torah law,
llm_translation: Beit Hillel say, "Either a cheek or a beam." Shall we say that Beit Hillel holds that there are three partitions according to the Torah?

hebrew_text: לָא, לִזְרוֹק — מִשְּׁתַּיִם הוּא דְּמִיחַיַּיב, לְטַלְטֵל — עַד דְּאִיכָּא שָׁלֹשׁ.
human_translation: No to throw once two one is liable to carry until there are three
llm_translation: Not to, to throw - from two he is liable, to carry - until there are three.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר לְחָיַיִן. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְחָיַיִן וְקוֹרָה קָאָמַר, אוֹ דִילְמָא לְחָיַיִן בְּלֹא קוֹרָה קָאָמַר?
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: side posts dilemma was raised Rabbi Eliezer say side posts and a beam Or perhaps he say side posts without a beam
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says to the vintner. He asked them: Rabbi Eliezer to the vintner and a beam he said, or perhaps to the vintner without a beam he said?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר שֶׁהָלַךְ אֵצֶל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן פְּרִידָא תַּלְמִידוֹ
human_translation: Come hear an incident involving Rabbi Eliezer, who went to Rabbi Yosei ben Perida, his disciple,
llm_translation: Come and hear: an incident with Rabbi Eliezer who went to visit Rabbi Yosei ben P'rida, his student.

hebrew_text: לְאוֹבָלִין וּמְצָאוֹ שֶׁיּוֹשֵׁב בְּמָבוֹי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא לֶחִי אֶחָד. אָמַר לוֹ: בְּנִי, עֲשֵׂה לֶחִי אַחֵר. אָמַר לוֹ: וְכִי לְסוֹתְמוֹ אֲנִי צָרִיךְ? אָמַר לוֹ יִסָּתֵם, וּמָה בְּכָךְ.
human_translation: at Ovelin, and found him dwelling in an alleyway that had only one side post. He said to him: My son, set up another side post. said to him: Am I required to close it up? said to him: Let it be closed up; what does it matter?
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "L'ovālīn u'metzā'o sheyoshēv b'mavoy she'ein lo ela lechi echad. Amar lo: Beni, aseh lechi acher. Amar lo: Vechi lesotmo ani tzarich? Amar lo: Yisatem, u'mah b'kach." Translation: "L'ovālīn and they found that he was sitting in an alleyway that only has one wall. He said to him: My son, make another wall. He said to him: Do I need to close it off? He said to him: Close it off, what is the harm in that."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל עַל מָבוֹי שֶׁהוּא פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת שֶׁאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ כְּלוּם, עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ, עַל רָחָב מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת וְעַד עֶשֶׂר. שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: לֶחִי וְקוֹרָה, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אוֹ לֶחִי אוֹ קוֹרָה.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree about an alleyway is less than four cubits, that does not require anything About what did they disagree? About wider than four cubits, and up to ten as Beit Shammai say: a side post and a beam, and Beit Hillel say: either a side post or a beam.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not dispute regarding a passageway that is less than four cubits wide that does not require anything. What did they dispute about? They disputed about the width from four cubits to ten. Beit Shammai says: Either a beam or a crossbeam, and Beit Hillel says: Either a beam or a crossbeam.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי מִיהַת ״וְכִי לְסוֹתְמוֹ אֲנִי צָרִיךְ״, אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא לְחָיַיִן וְקוֹרָה — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי אָמַר ״וְכִי לְסוֹתְמוֹ אֲנִי צָרִיךְ״. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לְחָיַיִן בְּלֹא קוֹרָה — מַאי לְסוֹתְמוֹ?
human_translation: In any case, it teaches: Am I required to seal it? Granted, if you say side posts and a beam, for that said: Am I required to seal it? However, if you say side posts without a beam, what to seal it?
llm_translation: The text states: "And if you say, 'Do I need it for sealing?' If you say it is for wine and a beam - for this reason it says, 'And if I need it for sealing.' But if you say it is for wine without a beam - what is it for sealing?"

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: וְכִי לְסוֹתְמוֹ בִּלְחָיַיִן אֲנִי צָרִיךְ?
human_translation: this is what he is saying: Am I required to seal it with side posts?
llm_translation: So it is saying: And to close it with my cheeks, do I need?

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל עַל מָבוֹי שֶׁפָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת שֶׁאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ כְּלוּם. וְהָא אֲנַן תְּנַן: מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אָמַר תַּלְמִיד אֶחָד לִפְנֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל עַל מָבוֹי שֶׁהוּא פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת שֶׁהוּא נִיתָּר אוֹ בְּלֶחִי אוֹ בְּקוֹרָה!
human_translation: The Master said Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel do not disagree about an alleyway is less than four cubits, that it does not require anything But didn’t we learn A certain disciple said before Rabbi Akiva in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree about an alleyway is less than four cubits, that is permitted by either a side post or a beam.
llm_translation: Master said: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree regarding a passageway that is less than four cubits that does not require anything. But did we not learn: in the name of Rabbi Yishmael, one disciple said before Rabbi Akiva: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree regarding a passageway that is less than four cubits that is either breached or with a beam or with a crossbeam!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי, הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לֶחִי וְקוֹרָה כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי, וְלֹא לְחָיַיִן כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, אֶלָּא: אוֹ לֶחִי אוֹ קוֹרָה, כְּבֵית הִלֵּל.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: This is is saying. It neither requires a side post and a beam, in accordance with Beit Shammai, nor side posts, in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer; rather, either a side post or a beam, in accordance with Beit Hillel
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said, thus he is saying: Not needs cheek and beam like Beit Shammai, and not for wine like Rabbi Eliezer, rather: either cheek or beam, like Beit Hillel.

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה? אָמַר רַב אַחְלַי: וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב יְחִיאֵל: עַד אַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: And how Rav Aḥlei said, and some say Rav Yeḥiel Up to four
llm_translation: And how much? Rav Achlai said: And it was stated by Rav Yechiel: Until four.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַב: מוֹדִים חֲכָמִים לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּפַסֵּי חָצֵר. וְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּפַסֵּי חָצֵר.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said Rav said: The Rabbis concede to Rabbi Eliezer with regard to the boards of a courtyard. But Rav Naḥman said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer with regard to the boards of a courtyard.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said, Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said, Rav said: The sages concede to Rabbi Eliezer regarding the corners of the courtyard. And Rav Nachman said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer regarding the corners of the courtyard.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מַאן מוֹדִים? — רַבִּי. הֲלָכָה מִכְּלָל דִּפְלִיגִי, [מַאן פְּלִיג עֲלֵיהּ] — רַבָּנַן. דְּתַנְיָא: חָצֵר נִיתֶּרֶת בְּפַס אֶחָד. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: בִּשְׁנֵי פַסִּין.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Who concede Rabbi halakha by inference that dispute Who disagree with the Rabbis, as it was taught a courtyard is permitted one board Rabbi says: two boards,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman son of Yitzchak said: Who agrees? — Rabbi. The halakha is in accordance with the opinion that they dispute, who disputes it — the Rabbis. As it was taught: A courtyard that is open on one side. Rabbi says: With two doorposts.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: חָצֵר צְרִיכָה שְׁנֵי פַסִּין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא לְרַבִּי אַסִּי: מִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הָכִי? וְהָא אַתְּ הוּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: פַּסֵּי חָצֵר צְרִיכִין שֶׁיְּהֵא בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה. וְכִי תֵּימָא: אַרְבָּעָה מִכָּאן וְאַרְבָּעָה מִכָּאן —
human_translation: Rabbi Asi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: A courtyard requires two boards Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Asi: Did Rabbi Yoḥanan say that? But weren’t you the one who said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: The boards in a courtyard must be four And if you say four from here, and four from there,
llm_translation: Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A courtyard requires two entrances. Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Assi: Who said it like this, Rabbi Yochanan? But you yourself said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Courtyards require four entrances. And if you might say: Four from here and four from here—

hebrew_text: וְהָתָנֵי רַב אַדָּא בַּר אֲבִימִי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פַּפִּי: קְטַנָּה בְּעֶשֶׂר, וּגְדוֹלָה בְּאַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה!
human_translation: But didn’t Rav Adda bar Avimi teach before Rabbi Ḥanina, and some say before Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappi, small ten and the large eleven
llm_translation: And it was taught: Rav Adda bar Avimi stood before Rabbi Chanina, and some say it was before Rabbi Chanina bar Papi, and he said: "A small one at ten, and a large one at eleven!"

hebrew_text: כִּי סָלֵיק רַבִּי זֵירָא מִיַּמֵּי פָּרְשַׁהּ: בָּרוּחַ אַחַת בְּאַרְבָּעָה, מִשְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹת — מַשֶּׁהוּ לְכָאן וּמַשֶּׁהוּ לְכָאן.
human_translation: When Rabbi Zeira ascended from sea he explained in one direction, four from two directions, any amount here, and any amount there,
llm_translation: When Rabbi Zeira ascended from the days of his separation: with one wind in four, from two spirits - one goes here and one goes there.

hebrew_text: וְהָדְתָנֵי אַדָּא בַּר אֲבִימִי — רַבִּי הִיא, וְסָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: And that which Adda bar Avimi taught it is Rabbi holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: And it was taught: Adah son of Abimi said - it is Rabbi Hiya, and he holds like Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: חָצֵר נִיתֶּרֶת בְּפַס אֶחָד. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: מִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל הָכִי? וְהָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב חֲנַנְיָה בַּר שֵׁילָא: אַתְּ לָא תַּעֲבֵיד עוֹבָדָא אֶלָּא אוֹ בְּרוֹב דּוֹפֶן אוֹ בִּשְׁנֵי פַסִּין!
human_translation: Rav Yosef said that Rav Yehuda said that Shmuel said: courtyard is permitted one board Abaye said to Rav Yosef: Did Shmuel say this? But didn’t Shmuel say to Rav Ḥananya bar Sheila: You must not perform an action, unless either the majority of the wall or two boards
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said, Rav Yehudah said Shmuel: A courtyard is permitted in one side. Abaye said to Rav Yosef: Who said so, Shmuel? But didn't Shmuel say to Rav Chananya bar Sheilah: You should only perform an action either with the majority of the wall or with two sides!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וַאֲנָא לָא יָדַעְנָא, דְּעוֹבָדָא הֲוָה בְּדוּרָה דִרְעוּתָא, לְשׁוֹן יָם הַנִּכְנָס לְחָצֵר הֲוָה. וַאֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה, וְלָא אַצְרְכֵיהּ אֶלָּא פַּס אֶחָד.
human_translation: said to I do not know there was an incident in a shepherds’ village a narrow inlet of the sea that penetrated a courtyard, and came before Rav Yehuda, and he required only one board
llm_translation: He said to him: And I do not know, that the work was in the generation of the flood, the language of the sea that entered the courtyard was. And he came before Rav Yehudah, and he only needed one pass.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְשׁוֹן יָם קָאָמְרַתְּ, קַל הוּא שֶׁהֵקֵלּוּ חֲכָמִים בְּמַיִם.
human_translation: said to You speak of a narrow inlet of the sea, this is a leniency in which the Sages lessened in water.
llm_translation: He said to him: "The language of the sea you are speaking, it is light that the sages lightened in water."

hebrew_text: כְּדִבְעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי טַבְלָא מֵרַב: מְחִיצָה תְּלוּיָה, מַהוּ שֶׁתַּתִּיר בְּחוּרְבָּה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵין מְחִיצָה תְּלוּיָה מַתֶּרֶת אֶלָּא בְּמַיִם, קַל הוּא שֶׁהֵקֵלּוּ חֲכָמִים בְּמַיִם.
human_translation: dilemma Rabbi Tavla raised before Rav: Does a suspended partition permit in a ruin? said to him: A suspended partition permits only water; this is a leniency in which the Sages lessened in water.
llm_translation: As it was stated from him, Rabbi Tabla from Rav: A hanging partition, what is the ruling in a courtyard? He said to him: A hanging partition is only permitted with water, for the sages were lenient with water.

hebrew_text: מִכׇּל מָקוֹם קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: In any case, it is difficult.
llm_translation: From all place difficult.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתוֹ רַב פָּפָּא וְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ מִבֵּי רַב פֵּירְשׁוּהָ: מֵרוּחַ אַחַת — בְּאַרְבָּעָה, מִשְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹת — מַשֶּׁהוּ לְכָאן וּמַשֶּׁהוּ לְכָאן.
human_translation: When Rav Pappa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, came from the house of their teacher, they explained from one direction, of four from two directions, a bit here, and bit here,
llm_translation: When Rav Papa and Rav Huna the son of Rav Yehoshua came from the house of Rav, they explained it: "From one spirit - in four, from two spirits - some here and some there."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אִי קַשְׁיָא לִי — הָא קַשְׁיָא לִי, דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב חֲנַנְיָה בַּר שֵׁילָא: אַתְּ לָא תַּעֲבֵיד עוֹבָדָא אֶלָּא אוֹ בְּרוֹב דּוֹפֶן אוֹ בִּשְׁנֵי פַסִּין.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: If is difficult for me this is my difficulty: For Shmuel said to Rav Ḥananya bar Sheila: You must not perform an action, unless either most of the wall or two boards
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: If it is difficult for me - it is difficult for me, for Shmuel said to Rav Chananya bar Sheilah: You should not do business except with a majority of merchants or with two coins.

hebrew_text: לְמָה לִי רוֹב דּוֹפֶן? בְּפַס אַרְבָּעָה סַגִּי! וְכִי תֵּימָא מַאי בְּרוֹב דּוֹפֶן בְּדוֹפֶן שִׁבְעָה, דִּבְאַרְבְּעָה הֲוָה לֵיהּ רוֹב דּוֹפֶן, לְמָה לִי אַרְבָּעָה? בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה וּמַשֶּׁהוּ סַגִּי! דְּהָא אָמַר רַב אַחְלַי וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב יְחִיאֵל: עַד אַרְבָּעָה!
human_translation: Why do I need most of the wall? board of four should suffice. And if you say, what is most of the wall wall seven four constitutes most of the wall, why do I four Three and any amount should suffice, as Rav Aḥlei, and some say Rav Yeḥiel who said: up to four
llm_translation: "Why do I need a majority of dofen? In a space of four cubits! And if you say, what about a majority of dofen within a dofen of seven, for in a space of four there is a majority of dofen, why do I need four? In three and a bit is sufficient! For Rav Achlay said, and some say it was Rav Yechiel: Until four!"

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כָּאן — בְּחָצֵר, כָּאן — בְּמָבוֹי, וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּרַב אַחְלַי גּוּפֵיהּ תַּנָּאֵי הִיא.
human_translation: If you wish, say here, to a courtyard, There, to an alleyway. And if you wish, say Rav Aḥlei is itself tanna’im .
llm_translation: If you wish, say: Here - in a courtyard, here - in an alleyway. And if you wish, say: For Rav Achalai himself is a Mishnaic scholar.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: לְשׁוֹן יָם הַנִּכְנָס לְחָצֵר — אֵין מְמַלְּאִין הֵימֶנּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן יֵשׁ לוֹ מְחִיצָה גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — שֶׁפִּירְצָתוֹ בְּיוֹתֵר מֵעֲשָׂרָה, אֲבָל עֲשָׂרָה — אֵין צָרִיךְ כְּלוּם.
human_translation: The Sages taught a narrow inlet of the sea that enters into a courtyard, one may not fill from it on Shabbat. unless there is a partition ten handbreadths high In what is this statement said? Where the breach is more than ten but ten nothing is required.”
llm_translation: The sages taught: The language of the sea that enters a courtyard - one may not fill it with water on Shabbat unless it has a partition that is ten handbreadths high. In what case are these words said? When its breach is more than ten, but if it is ten - it is not necessary at all.

hebrew_text: מִמְלָא הוּא דְּלָא מְמַלְּאִינַן, הָא טַלְטוֹלֵי מְטַלְטְלִינַן. וְהָא נִפְרְצָה חָצֵר בִּמְלוֹאָהּ לְמָקוֹם הָאָסוּר לָהּ!
human_translation: one may not fill but one may carry. But isn’t the courtyard breached along its entirety, into a place that is prohibited to it?
llm_translation: From what is not filled, for we do not require it, these are suspended, we suspend. And this courtyard broke through its fullness to a place where it is forbidden to it!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְמַאי עָסְקִינַן — דְּאִית לֵיהּ גִּידּוּדֵי.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here where remnants of the wall
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? - that it has sinews.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: מָבוֹי שֶׁלֹּא נִשְׁתַּתְּפוּ בּוֹ, הִכְשִׁירוֹ בְּלֶחִי, הַזּוֹרֵק לְתוֹכוֹ — חַיָּיב, הִכְשִׁירוֹ בְּקוֹרָה — הַזּוֹרֵק לְתוֹכוֹ פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: an alleyway did not merge. was rendered fit by a side post one who throws into it is liable; was rendered fit by beam, one who throws into it is exempt;
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: A courtyard that was not shared by the residents, if one made it fit for use by attaching a beam, and one throws into it - he is liable. If one made it fit for use by installing a roof, and one throws into it - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: טַעְמָא דְּלֹא נִשְׁתַּתְּפוּ בּוֹ, הָא נִשְׁתַּתְּפוּ בּוֹ אֲפִילּוּ הִכְשִׁירוֹ בְּקוֹרָה נָמֵי חַיָּיב?! וְכִי כִּכָּר זוֹ עֹשָׂה אוֹתוֹ רְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד אוֹ רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים?
human_translation: Rav Sheshet strongly objects to this The reason did not merge. if they did merge, one would be liable even if was rendered fit by beam. Does this loaf, render a private domain or a public domain?
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet objects to him: The reason that they did not participate in it, is it because they did not participate in it? Even if they made it valid with a beam, is it still liable? And does this loaf make it a private domain or a public domain?

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: חֲצֵירוֹת שֶׁל רַבִּים וּמְבוֹאוֹת שֶׁאֵינָן מְפוּלָּשִׁין, בֵּין עֵירְבוּ וּבֵין לֹא עֵירְבוּ הַזּוֹרֵק לְתוֹכָן חַיָּיב!
human_translation: But wasn’t it taught Courtyards by many and alleyways that are not open whether established an eiruv or did not establish an eiruv , one who throws into them is liable.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: Courtyards of the public and alleys that are not interconnected, whether they made an Eruv or did not make an Eruv, one who throws into them is liable!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אִיתְּמַר, הָכִי אִיתְּמַר: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: מָבוֹי שֶׁאֵינוֹ רָאוּי לְשִׁיתּוּף, הִכְשִׁירוֹ בְּלֶחִי — הַזּוֹרֵק לְתוֹכוֹ חַיָּיב, הִכְשִׁירוֹ בְּקוֹרָה — הַזּוֹרֵק לְתוֹכוֹ פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rather, if it was stated, it was stated as follows. Rav Yehuda said: an alleyway that is not fit for merging, was rendered fit by a side post, one who throws into it is liable. was rendered fit by beam, one who throws into it is exempt.
llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated, it was stated thus: Rav Yehudah said: A courtyard that is not fit for partnership, if one made it fit with a board - one who throws into it is liable; if one made it fit with a beam - one who throws into it is exempt.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא קָסָבַר: לֶחִי מִשּׁוּם מְחִיצָה וְקוֹרָה מִשּׁוּם הֶיכֵּר. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבָּה: לֶחִי מִשּׁוּם מְחִיצָה וְקוֹרָה מִשּׁוּם הֶיכֵּר. וְרָבָא אָמַר: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה מִשּׁוּם הֶיכֵּר.
human_translation: Apparently, holds a side post as a partition, whereas a beam as a conspicuous marker And, so too, Rabba said: A side post as a partition, whereas beam as a conspicuous marker. But Rava said: Both this, and that, as a conspicuous marker.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: Does he hold that a beam is considered a partition and a beam is considered a roof? So too Rabba said: A beam is considered a partition and a beam is considered a roof. Rava said: Both this and this are considered a roof.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אַבָּא לְרָבָא: הַזּוֹרֵק לְמָבוֹי, יֵשׁ לוֹ לֶחִי — חַיָּיב, אֵין לוֹ לֶחִי — פָּטוּר!
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov bar Abba raised an objection to Rava One who throws into an alleyway, if has a side post, he is liable; if it does not have a side post he is exempt.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Rava: One who throws into an alleyway, if he has a wall - he is liable; if he does not have a wall - he is exempt!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ אֶלָּא לֶחִי, הַזּוֹרֵק לְתוֹכוֹ — חַיָּיב, לֶחִי וְדָבָר אַחֵר — הַזּוֹרֵק לְתוֹכוֹ פָּטוּר.
human_translation: This is what is saying: it requires only a side post one who throws into it is liable a side post and something else one who throws into it is exempt
llm_translation: So it is stated: He only needs the cheek, one who throws into its interior - liable, the cheek and another thing - one who throws into its interior is exempt.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ, יָתֵר עַל כֵּן אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ שְׁנֵי בָתִּים בִּשְׁנֵי צִידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, עוֹשֶׂה לֶחִי מִכָּאן וְלֶחִי מִכָּאן, אוֹ קוֹרָה מִכָּאן וְקוֹרָה מִכָּאן, וְנוֹשֵׂא וְנוֹתֵן בָּאֶמְצַע.
human_translation: He raised an objection Furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda said: one who has two houses on two sides of the public domain, he may place a side post from here, And, an post from here, Or, a beam from here, And, a beam from here, carry and place in between
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: Furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda said: One who has two houses on two sides of a public domain, he makes a partition from here and a partition from here, or a beam from here and a beam from here, and carries back and forth in the middle.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵין מְעָרְבִין רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים בְּכָךְ!
human_translation: said to him: One may not place an eiruv in the public domain in that
llm_translation: They said to him: "One does not combine the public domain in this manner!"

hebrew_text: הָתָם קָסָבַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: שְׁתֵּי מְחִיצּוֹת דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: there Rabbi Yehuda holds by Torah law two partitions
llm_translation: There, Rabbi Yehuda holds: Two partitions of biblical origin.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מָבוֹי שֶׁאׇרְכּוֹ כְּרׇחְבּוֹ אֵינוֹ נִיתָּר בְּלֶחִי מַשֶּׁהוּ. אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: מָבוֹי שֶׁאׇרְכּוֹ כְּרׇחְבּוֹ אֵינוֹ נִיתָּר בְּקוֹרָה טֶפַח.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said that Rav said: an alleyway whose length is equal to its width is not permitted by a side post of minimal Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi said in the name of Rav: an alleyway whose length is equal to its width is not permitted by beam of a handbreadth.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: A courtyard whose length is equal to its width is not exempt from a mezuzah. Rav Chiya bar Ashe said in the name of Rav: A courtyard whose length is equal to its width is not exempt from a beam of one handbreadth.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: כַּמָּה מְכַוְּונָן שְׁמַעְתָּא דְסָבֵי. כֵּיוָן דְּאׇרְכּוֹ כְּרׇחְבּוֹ — הָוֵה לֵיהּ חָצֵר, וְחָצֵר אֵינָהּ נִיתֶּרֶת בְּלֶחִי וְקוֹרָה, אֶלָּא בְּפַס אַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: How precise are the traditions of the Elders. Since the length is equal to its width, it is a courtyard, and a courtyard is not permitted by a side post or beam, but by an board of four
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: How much must one lengthen the Shema prayer? Once its length equals its width - it should have a courtyard, and a courtyard is not considered as such unless it is enclosed by a wall and a beam, but with a space of four cubits.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: אִי קַשְׁיָא לִי, הָא קַשְׁיָא לִי: לֶיהֱוֵי הַאי לֶחִי כְּפַס מַשֶּׁהוּ, וְנִשְׁתְּרֵי!
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: if is difficult for me this is my difficulty: Let this side post be like board of minimal and permit
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: If it is difficult for me, then it is difficult for me; let this be like the liver of Moses, and let it be resolved!

hebrew_text: אִישְׁתְּמִיטְתֵּיהּ הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: פַּסֵּי חָצֵר צְרִיכִין שֶׁיְּהֵא בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: that which Rabbi Asi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said escaped attention: The boards of a courtyard must be four
llm_translation: His wife's brother, this that Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: "Courtyards require that there be four."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: נָקְטִינַן, אֵיזֶהוּ מָבוֹי שֶׁנִּיתָּר בְּלֶחִי וְקוֹרָה — כֹּל שֶׁאׇרְכּוֹ יָתֵר עַל רׇחְבּוֹ וּבָתִּים וַחֲצֵרוֹת פְּתוּחִים לְתוֹכוֹ, וְאֵיזוֹ הִיא חָצֵר שֶׁאֵינָהּ נִיתֶּרֶת בְּלֶחִי וְקוֹרָה אֶלָּא בְּפַס אַרְבָּעָה — כֹּל שֶׁמְּרוּבַּעַת.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: We have a tradition What is the alleyway which is permitted by a side post or beam? Any whose length is greater than its width and has houses and courtyards opening into it. And what is the courtyard which is not permitted by a side post or beam, but by board of four Any that is square.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: We have learned, what is a mavoy that is breached in the side and crossbeam? Any alleyway whose length exceeds its width, and houses and courtyards open into it. And what is a courtyard that is not breached in the side and crossbeam except by a four cubit opening? All are considered as if they are squared.

hebrew_text: מְרוּבַּעַת אִין, עֲגוּלָּה לָא?! הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִי אׇרְכָּהּ יָתֵר עַל רׇחְבָּהּ — הָוֵה לֵיהּ מָבוֹי, וּמָבוֹי בְּלֶחִי וְקוֹרָה סַגִּיא, וְאִי לָא — הָוֵה לַהּ חָצֵר.
human_translation: square, yes, round, no, This is it is saying: If its length is greater than its width, it is an alleyway, and an alleyway a side post or a beam suffices; but if not it is a courtyard.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Meruba'at ein, agulah la?! Hachi ka'amar: I arkah yater al rachbah — haveh leih mavoi, u'mavoi belechi ve'kora sagiya, ve'i la — haveh la chazer." English translation: "If it is longer than it is wide — it has a courtyard, and if not — it has an alleyway."

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה? סָבַר שְׁמוּאֵל לְמֵימַר: עַד דְּאִיכָּא פִּי שְׁנַיִם בְּרׇחְבָּהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב, הָכִי אָמַר חֲבִיבִי: אֲפִילּוּ מַשֶּׁהוּ.
human_translation: And how much Shmuel thought to say: unless is double its width, Rav said to him: My uncle ḥavivi said this: Even a minimal amount,
llm_translation: And how much? Shmuel thought to say: Until there are two mouths in its width. Rav said to him, thus said my beloved: Even a little.

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אָמַר תַּלְמִיד אֶחָד כּוּ׳.
human_translation: A certain disciple said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael, etc.
llm_translation: On account of Rabbi Yishmael said: "One disciple is as..."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: עַל זֶה וְעַל זֶה נֶחְלְקוּ כּוּ׳.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said: They disagree about this, and about that,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: "On this and on this they disputed."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא! אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּרַב אַחְלַי, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב יְחִיאֵל. וְלָא מְסַיְּימִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva first tanna There is between them Rav Aḥlai, and some say Rav Yeḥiel, are not defined;
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva, that is the first Tanna! There is a dispute between Rav Achlay and it is said Rav Yechiel. And they did not conclude.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: לָא אָמַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל דָּבָר זֶה, אֶלָּא אוֹתוֹ תַּלְמִיד אָמַר דָּבָר זֶה, וַהֲלָכָה כְּאוֹתוֹ תַּלְמִיד.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Akiva said: Rabbi Yishmael did not state this matter, rather, that disciple who stated that matter and the halakha is in accordance with that disciple.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Akiva said: Rabbi Ishmael did not say this matter, rather that disciple said this matter, and the halakha is like that disciple.

hebrew_text: הָא גּוּפַהּ קַשְׁיָא: אָמְרַתְּ ״לָא אָמַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל דָּבָר זֶה״ — אַלְמָא לֵית הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ, וַהֲדַר אָמְרַתְּ: ״הֲלָכָה כְּאוֹתוֹ תַּלְמִיד״!
human_translation: This itself is difficult. You stated Rabbi Yishmael did not state this matter; apparently the halakha is not in accordance with And then you said: The halakha is in accordance with that disciple.
llm_translation: This is a difficult matter: You said, "Rabbi Yishmael did not say this." - This implies that the halakha does not follow his opinion, and then you said, "The halakha is like that student!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא אֲמָרָהּ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אֶלָּא לְחַדֵּד בָּהּ הַתַּלְמִידִים.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: Rabbi Akiva said only to sharpen his students with
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Rabbi Akiva did not say it except to sharpen the students with it.

hebrew_text: וְרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: נִרְאִין אִיתְּמַר.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said, appears was stated.
llm_translation: And Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "It appears that it was stated."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאַתָּה מוֹצֵא ״מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אָמַר תַּלְמִיד אֶחָד לִפְנֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא״ — אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ אֶת רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וְאֶת רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Anywhere that you find A certain disciple said before Rabbi Akiva in the name of Rabbi Yishmael, it is none other than Rabbi Meir, who served Rabbi Yishmael and Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: Every place that you find "in the name of Rabbi Yishmael said one disciple before Rabbi Akiva" — it is none other than Rabbi Meir, who used the teachings of Rabbi Yishmael and Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: כְּשֶׁהָיִיתִי אֵצֶל רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל הָיִיתִי מֵטִיל קַנְקַנְתּוֹם לְתוֹךְ הַדְּיוֹ, וְלֹא אָמַר לִי דָּבָר. כְּשֶׁבָּאתִי אֵצֶל רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, אֲסָרָהּ עָלַי.
human_translation: As it was taught Rabbi Meir said: When I was with Rabbi Yishmael, I used to put iron sulfate [ kankantom ] into the ink and he did not say anything to me. When I came with Rabbi Akiva, he prohibited me so.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir said: When I was with Rabbi Ishmael, I would throw his inkwell into the inkwell, and he did not say anything to me. When I came to Rabbi Akiva, he prohibited it to me.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: כְּשֶׁהָיִיתִי לוֹמֵד אֵצֶל רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הָיִיתִי מֵטִיל קַנְקַנְתּוֹם לְתוֹךְ הַדְּיוֹ, וְלֹא אָמַר לִי דָּבָר. וּכְשֶׁבָּאתִי אֵצֶל רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, אָמַר לִי: בְּנִי, מָה מְלַאכְתֶּךָ? אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: לַבְלָר אֲנִי. אָמַר לִי: בְּנִי, הֱוֵי זָהִיר בִּמְלַאכְתֶּךָ, שֶׁמְּלַאכְתְּךָ מְלֶאכֶת שָׁמַיִם הִיא, שֶׁמָּא אַתָּה מְחַסֵּר אוֹת אַחַת אוֹ מְיַיתֵּר אוֹת אַחַת — נִמְצֵאתָ מַחֲרִיב אֶת כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: Is that so? Didn’t Rav Yehuda say Shmuel said in the name of Rabbi Meir: When I studied with Rabbi Akiva I used to put iron sulfate into the ink, and he did not say anything to me. But when I came with Rabbi Yishmael, he said to me: My son, what is your vocation? I replied: I am a scribe [ lavlar ] He said to me: My son, be careful in your vocation, as your vocation is heavenly service, lest you omit a single letter or add a single letter and you will end up destroying the whole world in its entirety.
llm_translation: I?! And didn't Rav Yehudah say in the name of Shmuel in the name of Rabbi Meir: When I was learning by Rabbi Akiva, I would throw my staff into the inkwell, and he wouldn't say anything to me. But when I came to Rabbi Yishmael, he said to me: My son, what is your occupation? I said to him: I am a scribe. He said to me: My son, be careful in your occupation, for your occupation is a heavenly occupation. Perhaps if you omit one letter or add one letter, you will destroy the entire world.

hebrew_text: אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: דָּבָר אֶחָד יֵשׁ לִי וְ׳קַנְקַנְתּוֹם׳ שְׁמוֹ, שֶׁאֲנִי מֵטִיל לְתוֹךְ הַדְּיוֹ. אָמַר לִי: וְכִי מְטִילִין קַנְקַנְתּוֹם לְתוֹךְ הַדְּיוֹ? וַהֲלֹא אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: ״וְכָתַב וּמָחָה״, כְּתָב שֶׁיָּכוֹל לִמָּחוֹת.
human_translation: I said to him: I have one substance called iron sulfate, which I place into the ink, He said to me: May one place iron sulfate into the ink? Didn’t the Torah state “And shall write and he shall blot them out writing that can be blotted out.
llm_translation: I said to him: "I have one thing, and its name is 'Kankantom,' that I throw into the ink." He said to me: "Do we indeed throw 'Kankantom' into the ink? Hasn't the Torah said: 'And he shall write and erase,' indicating that he should be able to erase?"

hebrew_text: מַאי קָאֲמַר לֵיהּ, וּמַאי קָא מְהַדַּר לֵיהּ?
human_translation: What is saying to and what is he answering him?
llm_translation: What is it saying to him, and what is it honoring to him?

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא בַּחֲסֵירוֹת וּבִיתֵירוֹת [דְּלָא טָעֵינָא] — דְּבָקִי אֲנָא, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ מֵיחַשׁ לִזְבוּב נָמֵי, דִּילְמָא אָתֵי וְיָתֵיב אַתָּגֵיהּ דְּדָלֶת וּמָחֵיק לֵיהּ וּמְשַׁוֵּי לֵיהּ רֵישׁ — דָּבָר אֶחָד יֵשׁ לִי וְקַנְקַנְתּוֹם שְׁמוֹ שֶׁאֲנִי מֵטִיל לְתוֹךְ הַדְּיוֹ.
human_translation: this is is saying to There is no need defective and plene as I am an expert; however, even with regard to the concern that a fly might come and land on the crown of dalet and blot it out and render it a reish , I have a substance called iron sulfate that I place into the ink
llm_translation: Thus he said to him: It is not necessary in the case of missing items and extra items that I should be concerned — for I am careful, but even if a fly were to come, perhaps it will come and sit on the doorpost and rub its head — I have one thing and its name is a "kan'kan'tom" that I throw into the inkwell.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא שִׁימּוּשׁ אַשִּׁימּוּשׁ, קַשְׁיָא אֲסָרָהּ אַאֲסָרָהּ.
human_translation: there is a difficulty between service and service, There is a difficulty between he prohibited it and he prohibited it
llm_translation: The translation of the Talmudic text is as follows: "Kashya shimmush ashimmush, kashya asaraha aasaraha."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא שִׁימּוּשׁ אַשִּׁימּוּשׁ לָא קַשְׁיָא: מֵעִיקָּרָא אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, וּמִדְּלָא מָצֵי לְמֵיקַם אַלִּיבֵּיהּ — אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, וּגְמַר גְּמָרָא, וַהֲדַר אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, וּסְבַר סְבָרָא.
human_translation: Granted, there is no difficulty between service and service, initially came before Rabbi Akiva, and since he was unable to comprehend in accordance with his he came before Rabbi Yishmael and studied the tradition, and again came before Rabbi Akiva and studied logical
llm_translation: In truth, the handling of the matter is not difficult. Initially, he came before Rabbi Akiva, and since he did not find a resolution to establish it according to his heart, he came before Rabbi Yishmael, and he concluded the matter. Then he returned before Rabbi Akiva, and he thought a thought.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֲסָרָהּ אַאֲסָרָהּ קַשְׁיָא! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: However, the difficulty with regard to prohibited prohibited difficult. difficult;
llm_translation: Rather, he prohibited it, he prohibited it, difficult! Difficult.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר, רַבִּי מֵאִיר הָיָה אוֹמֵר: לַכֹּל מְטִילִין קַנְקַנְתּוֹם לְתוֹךְ הַדְּיוֹ, חוּץ מִפָּרָשַׁת סוֹטָה. וְרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר מִשְּׁמוֹ: חוּץ מִפָּרָשַׁת סוֹטָה שֶׁבַּמִּקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Yehuda says Rabbi Meir would say: One may place iron sulfate into the ink for all except for the passage a sota , Rabbi Ya’akov says in his name: Except for the passage a sota in the Temple
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says, Rabbi Meir used to say: For all cases, they pour the water of the bitter waters into the inkwell, except for the portion of the Sotah. And Rabbi Yaakov says in his own name: except for the portion of the Sotah in the Temple.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אָמַר רַב יִרְמְיָה: לִמְחוֹק לָהּ מִן הַתּוֹרָה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: What is between their Rav Yirmeya said: between their is to erase from a Torah
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? Rav Yirmeya said: To erase it from the Torah, there is a difference between them.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי תַנָּאֵי כִי הָנֵי תַנָּאֵי, דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין מְגִילָּתָהּ כְּשֵׁירָה לְהַשְׁקוֹת בָּהּ סוֹטָה אַחֶרֶת. רַבִּי אַחַי בַּר יֹאשִׁיָּה אָמַר: מְגִילָּתָהּ כְּשֵׁירָה לְהַשְׁקוֹת בָּהּ סוֹטָה אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: And those tanna’im as these tanna’im , as it was taught her scroll is not fit to give to another sota to drink. Rabbi Aḥai bar Yoshiya said: Her scroll is fit to give another sota to drink.
llm_translation: The Tannaim say, for the Tannaim say, as it was taught: Her scroll is not fit to be used to administer the bitter waters to another suspected adulteress. Rabbi Ahai bar Yoshiyah said: Her scroll is fit to be used to administer the bitter waters to another suspected adulteress.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: דִּילְמָא לָא הִיא. עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר תַּנָּא קַמָּא הָתָם — אֶלָּא כֵּיוָן דְּאִינְּתִיק לְשׁוּם רָחֵל תּוּ לָא הָדְרָא מִינַּתְקָא לְשׁוּם לֵאָה, אֲבָל גַּבֵּי תּוֹרָה דִּסְתָמָא מִיכַּתְבָא, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּמָחֲקִינַן.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Perhaps that is not The first tanna stated only there; since it had been designated in the name of Rachel, it cannot then be designated in the name of Leah. However, in the case of a Torah which is written with no particular too we erase
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Perhaps it is not so. Until here, it did not say, a Tanna said earlier there — rather, since it was removed for the sake of Rachel, it did not return for the sake of Leah, but regarding Torah, which is generally written, so we also erase.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, דִּילְמָא לָא הִיא: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי אַחַי בַּר יֹאשִׁיָּה הָתָם — אֶלָּא דְּאִיכְּתִיב מִיהַת לְשׁוּם סוֹטָה בָּעוֹלָם, אֲבָל גַּבֵּי תּוֹרָה, דִּלְהִתְלַמֵּד כְּתִיבָא — הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא מֵחַקְיָנָן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said Perhaps it is not so, Rabbi Aḥai bar Yoshiya stated only there because at least, it was written for a sota in the world. However, in the case of a Torah which was written for study, too we do not erase
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said, perhaps it is not so. Until here, Rabbi Achai bar Yoshiyah did not say there. Rather, it is written from there for the sake of the case of a Sotah in the world, but regarding Torah, for one to learn from the written text - so too, we do not establish.

hebrew_text: וְלֵית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אַחַי בַּר יֹאשִׁיָּה הָא דִּתְנַן: כָּתַב [גֵּט] לְגָרֵשׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ,
human_translation: And does Rabbi Aḥai bar Yoshiya not hold that which we learned If one wrote a bill of divorce to divorce his wife,
llm_translation: And there is no support for Rabbi Ahai son of Yoshiyah, as we learned: "He wrote a bill of divorce to divorce his wife,"

hebrew_text: וְנִמְלַךְ וּמְצָאוֹ בֶּן עִירוֹ וְאָמַר: שִׁמְךָ כִּשְׁמִי וְשֵׁם אִשְׁתְּךָ כְּשֵׁם אִשְׁתִּי — פָּסוּל לְגָרֵשׁ בּוֹ!
human_translation: but reconsidered and a resident of his city found him and said: Your name is as my name, and your wife’s name is as my wife’s name, is invalid to divorce with it?
llm_translation: And he shall be anointed, and they shall find him in his city, and he shall say: "Your name is like my name, and the name of your wife is like the name of my wife" — he is disqualified to divorce her!

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא? הָתָם ״וְכָתַב לָהּ״ כְּתִיב — בָּעִינַן כְּתִיבָה לִשְׁמָהּ, הָכָא ״וְעָשָׂה לָהּ״ כְּתִיב — בָּעִינַן עֲשִׂיָּיה לִשְׁמָהּ, עֲשִׂיָּיה דִידַהּ מְחִיקָה הִיא.
human_translation: How can you compare There, it is written: “And he shall write for her” we require writing in her name, here, it is written: “And he shall perform with her we require performance in her name. her performance is erasure;
llm_translation: So now? There, "and he shall write for her" is written - we require writing for her sake. Here, "and he shall do for her" is written - we require doing for her sake, doing for one's own sake is a mere erasure.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא: גָּלוּי וְיָדוּעַ לִפְנֵי מִי שֶׁאָמַר וְהָיָה הָעוֹלָם שֶׁאֵין בְּדוֹרוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי מֵאִיר כְּמוֹתוֹ, וּמִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא קָבְעוּ הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ? שֶׁלֹּא יָכְלוּ חֲבֵירָיו לַעֲמוֹד עַל סוֹף דַּעְתּוֹ. שֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר עַל טָמֵא טָהוֹר וּמַרְאֶה לוֹ פָּנִים, עַל טָהוֹר טָמֵא וּמַרְאֶה לוֹ פָּנִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina said: It is revealed and known before the One Who spoke and the world came into being that in the generation of Rabbi Meir there was no his equal. Why didn’t establish the halakha in accordance with his because his colleagues were unable to ascertain the profundity of his opinion. As he state with regard to impure pure, and display justification with regard to pure impure, and display justification
llm_translation: Rabbi Ahah bar Hanina said: It is revealed and known before the One who spoke and the world came into being, that there is no one in the generation of Rabbi Meir like him, and why did they not establish the halacha like him? Because his colleagues could not grasp the depth of his understanding. For he would say about impure that they are pure, and show them favor, and about the pure that they are impure, and show them favor.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: לֹא רַבִּי מֵאִיר שְׁמוֹ אֶלָּא רַבִּי נְהוֹרַאי שְׁמוֹ, וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ רַבִּי מֵאִיר? שֶׁהוּא מֵאִיר עֵינֵי חֲכָמִים בַּהֲלָכָה. וְלֹא נְהוֹרַאי שְׁמוֹ אֶלָּא רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה שְׁמוֹ, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲרָךְ שְׁמוֹ, וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ נְהוֹרַאי? שֶׁמַּנְהִיר עֵינֵי חֲכָמִים בַּהֲלָכָה.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Meir was not his name; rather, Rabbi Nehorai was his name. And why was he called name Rabbi Meir? because he illuminates [ meir ] the eyes of the Sages in the halakha . And Rabbi Nehorai was not the name rather, Rabbi Neḥemya was his name, and some say: Rabbi Elazar ben Arakh was his name. And why was he called name Rabbi Nehorai? because he enlightens [ manhir ] the eyes of the Sages in the halakha .
llm_translation: It was taught: Not Rabbi Meir is his name, rather Rabbi Nehorai is his name. And why was he called Rabbi Meir? Because he enlightens the eyes of the sages in halakha. And his name is not Nehorai, rather Rabbi Nechemiah is his name. And some say his name was Rabbi Elazar ben Arach. And why was he called Nehorai? Because he enlightens the eyes of the sages in halakha.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי: הַאי דִּמְחַדַּדְנָא מֵחַבְרַאי דַּחֲזִיתֵיהּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר מֵאֲחוֹרֵיהּ, וְאִילּוּ חֲזִיתֵיהּ מִקַּמֵּיהּ הֲוָה מְחַדַּדְנָא טְפֵי — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָיוּ עֵינֶיךָ רוֹאוֹת אֶת מוֹרֶיךָ״.
human_translation: Rabbi said: that I am incisive than my colleagues is that I saw Rabbi Meir from behind, Had I seen him from the front, I would be incisive, as it is written: “And your eyes shall see your teacher”
llm_translation: Rabbi said: This one who sharpens himself from my colleagues, if you had seen him in front of Rabbi Meir, he would have been sharpened more - as it is written: "And your eyes shall see your teachers."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: תַּלְמִיד הָיָה לוֹ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר וְסוֹמְכוֹס שְׁמוֹ, שֶׁהָיָה אוֹמֵר עַל כׇּל דָּבָר וְדָבָר שֶׁל טוּמְאָה אַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁמוֹנֶה טַעֲמֵי טוּמְאָה, וְעַל כׇּל דָּבָר וְדָבָר שֶׁל טׇהֳרָה אַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁמוֹנֶה טַעֲמֵי טׇהֳרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Rabbi Meir had a disciple, and his name was Sumakhus, who would state with regard to each and every matter of ritual impurity forty-eight reasons impurity, and with regard to each and every matter of ritual purity forty-eight reasons purity.
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: There was a student of Rabbi Meir, and his name was Somchus. He used to say regarding every matter of impurity forty-eight reasons of impurity, and regarding every matter of purity forty-eight reasons of purity.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: תַּלְמִיד וָתִיק הָיָה בְּיַבְנֶה שֶׁהָיָה מְטַהֵר אֶת הַשֶּׁרֶץ בְּמֵאָה וַחֲמִשִּׁים טְעָמִים.
human_translation: It was taught There was a distinguished disciple at Yavne who could purify the creeping animal, one hundred and fifty reasons
llm_translation: Mishnah: A disciple and an elder were in Yavneh, who would purify the creeping thing in one hundred and fifty tastes.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא, אֲנִי אָדוּן וַאֲטַהֲרֶנּוּ: וּמָה נָחָשׁ שֶׁמֵּמִית וּמַרְבֶּה טוּמְאָה — טָהוֹר, שֶׁרֶץ שֶׁאֵין מֵמִית וּמַרְבֶּה טוּמְאָה — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן!
human_translation: Ravina said: I will deliberate and purify it And just as a snake that kills and increases ritual impurity is ritually pure a creeping animal that does not kill and increase impurity all the more so
llm_translation: Ravina said, "I am Adon and I will purify it: And what about a snake that kills and increases impurity - it is pure, a creeping thing that does not kill and increases impurity - all the more so!"

hebrew_text: וְלָא הִיא — מַעֲשֶׂה קוֹץ בְּעָלְמָא קָעָבֵיד.
human_translation: And it is not so; is performing a mere act of a thorn.
llm_translation: And not it is — an incident of a splinter in the world is rare.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל, הַלָּלוּ אוֹמְרִים: הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתֵנוּ, וְהַלָּלוּ אוֹמְרִים: הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתֵנוּ. יָצְאָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ דִּבְרֵי אֱלֹהִים חַיִּים הֵן, וַהֲלָכָה כְּבֵית הִלֵּל.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said Shmuel said: For three years Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel disagreed. These said: The halakha is in accordance with our and these said: The halakha is in accordance with our a Divine Voice emerged and proclaimed: these and those are the words of the living God. However, the halakha is in accordance with Beit Hillel.
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said in the name of Shmuel: Three years Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel disputed, these say: the halakha is according to our opinion, and these say: the halakha is according to our opinion. A heavenly voice came forth and said: These and those are the words of the living God, but the halakha is according to Beit Hillel.

hebrew_text: וְכִי מֵאַחַר שֶׁאֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ דִּבְרֵי אֱלֹהִים חַיִּים, מִפְּנֵי מָה זָכוּ בֵּית הִלֵּל לִקְבּוֹעַ הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתָן? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנּוֹחִין וַעֲלוּבִין הָיוּ, וְשׁוֹנִין דִּבְרֵיהֶן וְדִבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁמַּקְדִּימִין דִּבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי לְדִבְרֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Since both these and those are the words of the living God, why were Beit Hillel privileged to the halakha established in accordance with their that they were agreeable and forbearing, teach their statements and the statements of Beit Shammai. Moreover, they prioritized the statements of Beit Shammai to their statements,
llm_translation: And when these and those asked, the words of the living God, why did the House of Hillel merit to establish the halakha like their opinion? Because they were submissive and humble, and would review their words and the words of the House of Shammai, and not only that, but they would give precedence to the words of the House of Shammai over their own words.

hebrew_text: כְּאוֹתָהּ שֶׁשָּׁנִינוּ: מִי שֶׁהָיָה רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ בַּסּוּכָּה וְשֻׁלְחָנוֹ בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי פּוֹסְלִין וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַכְשִׁירִין. אָמְרוּ בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי: לֹא כָּךְ הָיָה מַעֲשֶׂה, שֶׁהָלְכוּ זִקְנֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וְזִקְנֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבַקֵּר אֶת רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן הַחוֹרָנִית וּמְצָאוּהוּ יוֹשֵׁב רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ בַּסּוּכָּה וְשֻׁלְחָנוֹ בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת. אָמְרוּ לָהֶן בֵּית שַׁמַּאי: אִי מִשָּׁם רְאָיָה?! אַף הֵן אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אִם כָּךְ הָיִיתָ נוֹהֵג, לֹא קִיַּימְתָּ מִצְוַת סוּכָּה מִיָּמֶיךָ.
human_translation: As that we learned: one whose head and most of his body were in the sukka , but his table was in the house, Beit Shammai deem invalid; and Beit Hillel deem it valid. Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: Wasn’t there an incident in which the Elders of Beit Shammai and the Elders of Beit Hillel went to visit Rabbi Yoḥanan ben HaḤoranit, and they found him sitting his head and most of his body in the sukka , but his table was in the house? Beit Shammai said to them: From there a proof? too, said to him: If that was you were accustomed you have never fulfilled the mitzva of sukka in your days.
llm_translation: As we have learned: One whose head and most of his body are inside the sukkah and his table is inside the house, Beit Shammai disqualify it, and Beit Hillel deem it fit. Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: This was not the practice, for the elders of Beit Shammai and the elders of Beit Hillel went to visit Rabbi Yochanan ben HaChoranit and found him with his head and most of his body inside the sukkah and his table inside the house. Beit Shammai said to them: Is this a proper sight?! They also said to him: If this is how you conducted yourself, you did not fulfill the mitzvah of sukkah in your lifetime.

hebrew_text: לְלַמֶּדְךָ שֶׁכׇּל הַמַּשְׁפִּיל עַצְמוֹ — הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מַגְבִּיהוֹ, וְכׇל הַמַּגְבִּיהַּ עַצְמוֹ — הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מַשְׁפִּילוֹ. כׇּל הַמְחַזֵּר עַל הַגְּדוּלָּה — גְּדוּלָּה בּוֹרַחַת מִמֶּנּוּ, וְכׇל הַבּוֹרֵחַ מִן הַגְּדוּלָּה — גְּדוּלָּה מְחַזֶּרֶת אַחֲרָיו, וְכׇל הַדּוֹחֵק אֶת הַשָּׁעָה — שָׁעָה דּוֹחַקְתּוֹ, וְכׇל הַנִּדְחֶה מִפְּנֵי שָׁעָה — שָׁעָה עוֹמֶדֶת לוֹ.
human_translation: to teach you that anyone who humbles himself, the Holy One, Blessed be He, exalts him, and anyone who exalts himself, the Holy One, Blessed be He, humbles him. Anyone who seeks greatness, greatness flees from him, and, anyone who flees from greatness, greatness seeks him. And anyone who force the moment the moment forces him And anyone who yields to the moment, the moment stands his
llm_translation: To teach you that anyone who humbles himself - the Holy One, blessed be He, elevates him, and anyone who elevates himself - the Holy One, blessed be He, humbles him. Anyone who seeks greatness - greatness flees from him, and anyone who flees from greatness - greatness seeks after him. Anyone who forces the moment - the moment forces him, and anyone who is pushed away because of the moment - the moment stands for him.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים וּמֶחֱצָה נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל. הַלָּלוּ אוֹמְרִים: נוֹחַ לוֹ לְאָדָם שֶׁלֹּא נִבְרָא יוֹתֵר מִשֶּׁנִּבְרָא, וְהַלָּלוּ אוֹמְרִים: נוֹחַ לוֹ לְאָדָם שֶׁנִּבְרָא יוֹתֵר מִשֶּׁלֹּא נִבְרָא. נִמְנוּ וְגָמְרוּ: נוֹחַ לוֹ לְאָדָם שֶׁלֹּא נִבְרָא יוֹתֵר מִשֶּׁנִּבְרָא, עַכְשָׁיו שֶׁנִּבְרָא — יְפַשְׁפֵּשׁ בְּמַעֲשָׂיו. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: יְמַשְׁמֵשׁ בְּמַעֲשָׂיו.
human_translation: The Sages taught For two and a half years, Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel disagreed. These say: It would have been preferable had man not been created than to have been created. And those said: It is preferable for man to have been created than had he not been created. they were counted and concluded: It would have been preferable had man not been created than to have been created. now that he has been created, he should examine his actions And some say: He should scrutinize his actions
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel disputed for two and a half years. These say: It would have been better for man not to have been created than to have been created, and those say: It would have been better for man to have been created than not to have been created. They counted and concluded: It would have been better for man not to have been created than to have been created, but now that he has been created, let him examine his actions. And some say: Let him engage in his actions.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַקּוֹרָה שֶׁאָמְרוּ רְחָבָה כְּדֵי לְקַבֵּל אָרִיחַ. וְאָרִיחַ, חֲצִי לְבֵנָה שֶׁל שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים. דַּיָּיהּ לַקּוֹרָה שֶׁתְּהֵא רְחָבָה טֶפַח כְּדֵי לְקַבֵּל אָרִיחַ לְרׇחְבּוֹ.
human_translation: The beam, which stated wide enough to receive a small brick. And small brick half a large brick, three handbreadths, It is sufficient that the beam will be a handbreadth in width, enough to hold a small brick across its width.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The beam that they said should be wide enough to receive a roof tile. And the roof tile, half a brick of three handbreadths. Its sufficiency for the beam is that it should be a handbreadth wide in order to receive a roof tile to widen it.

hebrew_text: רְחָבָה כְּדֵי לְקַבֵּל אָרִיחַ וּבְרִיאָה כְּדֵי לְקַבֵּל אָרִיחַ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: רְחָבָה אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין בְּרִיאָה. הָיְתָה שֶׁל קַשׁ וְשֶׁל קָנִים — רוֹאִין אוֹתָהּ כְּאִילּוּ הִיא שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת.
human_translation: wide enough to hold a small brick sturdy enough to hold a small brick Rabbi Yehuda says: wide even though it is not sturdy is of straw or reeds, one considers it as though it were of metal.
llm_translation: The courtyard is made wide in order to receive fragrance, and the well is made wide in order to receive fragrance. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even a courtyard that is wide, even though it does not have a well. If it was made of straw and reeds - they view it as though it is made of metal.

hebrew_text: עֲקוּמָּה — רוֹאִין אוֹתָהּ כְּאִילּוּ הִיא פְּשׁוּטָה, עֲגוּלָּה — רוֹאִין אוֹתָהּ כְּאִילּוּ הִיא מְרוּבַּעַת. כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בְּהֶיקֵּיפוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים יֵשׁ בּוֹ רוֹחַב טֶפַח.
human_translation: curved, one considers it as though it were straight; round, one considers it as though it were square. Any with a circumference of three handbreadths is a handbreadth in width,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Akumah - ro'in otah ke'ilu hi peshutah, agulah - ro'in otah ke'ilu hi meruba'at. Kol sheyesh behekifoh shloshah tefachim yesh bo rochav tefach.
