English translation: Akumah - we see it as if it is simple, agulah - we see it as if it is square. Anything that has a circumference of three handbreadths has a width of one handbreadth.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ טֶפַח, טֶפַח וּמֶחֱצָה בָּעֵי!
human_translation: A handbreadth? A handbreadth and a half is required,
llm_translation: "Gema' tefach, tefach u'mechetzah ba'ei!"

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּרָחָב לְקַבֵּל טֶפַח, אִידַּךְ חֲצִי טֶפַח מְלַבֵּין לֵיהּ בְּטִינָא מַשֶּׁהוּ מֵהַאי גִּיסָא וּמַשֶּׁהוּ מֵהַאי גִּיסָא, וְקָיְימָא.
human_translation: Since is wide enough to receive a handbreadth, one can affix the remaining half handbreadth with plaster, amount on this side and a amount on side, and stand
llm_translation: Since the width to receive a handbreadth, alternatively half a handbreadth they whitewash it with clay, some from this side and some from that side, and it stands.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: קוֹרָה שֶׁאָמְרוּ — צְרִיכָה שֶׁתְּהֵא בְּרִיאָה כְּדֵי לְקַבֵּל אָרִיחַ, וּמַעֲמִידֵי קוֹרָה — אֵינָן צְרִיכִין שֶׁיִּהְיוּ בְּרִיאִין כְּדֵי לְקַבֵּל קוֹרָה וְאָרִיחַ. וְרַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה צְרִיכִין שֶׁיִּהְיוּ בְּרִיאִין כְּדֵי לְקַבֵּל קוֹרָה וְאָרִיחַ.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: The beam of which spoke must be sturdy enough to receive a small brick; however, the supports of the beam need not be sturdy to receive beam and a small brick. Rav Ḥisda said: Both this, and that, must be sturdy to hold beam and a small brick.
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: A beam that they said - it needs to be healthy in order to receive a roof, and the ones who are setting up the beam - they do not need to be healthy in order to receive the beam and the roof. And Rav Ḥisdah said: Both this one and that one need to be healthy in order to receive the beam and the roof.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הִנִּיחַ קוֹרָה עַל גַּבֵּי מָבוֹי, וּפָרַס עָלֶיהָ מַחְצֶלֶת וְהִגְבִּיהַּ מִן הַקַּרְקַע שְׁלֹשָׁה — קוֹרָה אֵין כָּאן מְחִיצָה אֵין כָּאן. קוֹרָה אֵין כָּאן — דְּהָא מִיכַּסְּיָא. מְחִיצָה אֵין כָּאן — דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ מְחִיצָה שֶׁהַגְּדָיִים בּוֹקְעִין בָּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: If one placed beam over of an alleyway, and draped a mat over it, and raised three from the ground, there is neither beam here, nor is there a partition here There is neither beam here, as it is obscured Nor is there a partition here, as it is a partition through which goats can pass,
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: If one placed a beam across the entrance of an alleyway, and spread a mat over it and raised it three handbreadths from the ground - there is no beam here, there is no partition here. There is no beam here - because it is covered. There is no partition here - because the goats would break through it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: קוֹרָה הַיּוֹצְאָה מִכּוֹתֶל זֶה וְאֵינָהּ נוֹגַעַת בְּכוֹתֶל זֶה, וְכֵן שְׁתֵּי קוֹרוֹת אַחַת יוֹצְאָה מִכּוֹתֶל זֶה וְאַחַת יוֹצְאָה מִכּוֹתֶל זֶה וְאֵינָן נוֹגְעוֹת זוֹ בָּזוֹ, פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה — אֵין צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא קוֹרָה אַחֶרֶת. שְׁלֹשָׁה — צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא קוֹרָה אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: Our Sages taught If beam projects from this wall but does not touch that wall and similarly, two beams, one projecting from this wall and one projecting from that wall and they do not touch one another, less than three one need not bring another beam three one must bring another beam.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A beam that extends from this wall and does not touch this wall, and similarly, two beams, one extending from this wall and one from that wall, and they do not touch each other, if less than three beams - there is no need to bring another beam. If three beams - another beam must be brought.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע — אֵין צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא קוֹרָה אַחֶרֶת, אַרְבַּע — צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא קוֹרָה אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: less than four one need not bring another beam. four he must bring another beam,
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Less than four - no need to bring another beam, four - need to bring another beam.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן שְׁתֵּי קוֹרוֹת הַמַּתְאִימוֹת, לֹא בְּזוֹ כְּדֵי לְקַבֵּל אָרִיחַ וְלֹא בָּזוֹ כְּדֵי לְקַבֵּל אָרִיחַ, אִם מְקַבְּלוֹת אָרִיחַ לְרׇחְבּוֹ טֶפַח — אֵין צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא קוֹרָה אַחֶרֶת, וְאִם לָאו — צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא קוֹרָה אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: And similarly, two matching, beams there is not in this to receive a small brick, and there is not in that if receive a small brick along its handbreadth width, one need not bring another beam but if not, one is required to bring another beam.
llm_translation: And so too, two beams that are aligned, not in this way in order to receive a beam, and not in that way in order to receive a beam, if they receive a beam to a width of a handbreadth - there is no need to bring another beam, and if not - it is necessary to bring another beam.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אִם מְקַבֶּלֶת אָרִיחַ לְאׇרְכּוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה — אֵין צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא קוֹרָה אַחֶרֶת, וְאִם לָאו — צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא קוֹרָה אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: If receive a small brick along its length, three one need not bring another beam, but if not, one must bring another beam.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: If one receives a beam of three cubits in length, there is no need to bring another beam, but if not, one must bring another beam.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ אַחַת לְמַעְלָה וְאַחַת לְמַטָּה, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: רוֹאִין אֶת הָעֶלְיוֹנָה כְּאִילּוּ הִיא לְמַטָּה, וְאֶת הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה כְּאִילּוּ הִיא לְמַעְלָה, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא עֶלְיוֹנָה לְמַעְלָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה וְתַחְתּוֹנָה לְמַטָּה מֵעֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: If are one above and one below, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: One considers the upper as though it were below, and the lower one as though it were above, provided that the upper beam is not above twenty cubits and the lower below ten
llm_translation: They were one above and one below, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: We view the upper one as if it were below, and the lower one as if it were above, provided that the upper one is not more than twenty cubits above and the lower one is not less than ten cubits below.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר לַהּ כַּאֲבוּהּ בַּחֲדָא, וּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא. סָבַר לַהּ כַּאֲבוּהּ בַּחֲדָא — דְּאִית לֵיהּ רוֹאִין.
human_translation: Abaye said: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, holds in accordance with his father with regard to one and disagrees with his with regard to one He holds in accordance with his father in one as he is One considers,
llm_translation: Abaye said: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, holds regarding her like her father in one matter, and he disagrees with her in one matter. He holds regarding her like her father in one matter - that he has the right of inspection.

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא — דְּאִילּוּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: לְמַעְלָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: בְּתוֹךְ עֶשְׂרִים אִין, לְמַעְלָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים לָא.
human_translation: And disagrees with his with regard to one While Rabbi Yehuda holds higher than twenty Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, holds: Within twenty cubits, yes, above twenty, not.
llm_translation: And they dispute about it in one matter — for Rabbi Yehuda holds: above twenty, and Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, holds: within twenty not, above twenty not.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: רְחָבָה אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינָהּ בְּרִיאָה. מַתְנֵי לֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה לְחִיָּיא בַּר רַב קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב: רְחָבָה אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינָהּ בְּרִיאָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַתְנְיֵיהּ, רְחָבָה וּבְרִיאָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: wide even though it is not sturdy Rav Yehuda taught to Ḥiyya bar Rav in the presence of Rav: wide even though it is not sturdy said to him: Teach him Wide and sturdy
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: A courtyard, even though it is not built. Rav Yehuda taught it to Hiyya bar Rav before Rav: A courtyard, even though it is not built. He said to him: Teach it, a courtyard and built.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעַאי אָמַר רַב: רְחָבָה אַרְבָּעָה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינָהּ בְּרִיאָה! רְחָבָה אַרְבָּעָה שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: Didn’t Rabbi Elai say Rav said: four wide even if it is not sturdy four handbreadths wide is different,
llm_translation: And he said, Rabbi Ilai said, Rav said: A width of four, even though it is not a structure! A width of four is different.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה שֶׁל קַשׁ כּוּ׳. מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּאָמְרִינַן רוֹאִין — הַיְינוּ הָךְ!
human_translation: if is of straw What is teaching us? that we say one considers this is the same as the
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Haita shel kash ku." Maai ka mashmaa lan, de'amrinan roin - hainu hakh!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: בְּמִינָהּ אָמְרִינַן, שֶׁלֹּא בְּמִינָהּ — לָא אָמְרִינַן. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: lest you say of its own kind we say not of its own kind we do not say teaches us
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Mah hu d'teima: b'minah amrinan, shelo b'minah - lo amrinan. Ka mashma lan." English translation: "What is the reasoning? When we say 'with its kind,' we mean 'not with its kind' - we do not say. It is implied to us."

hebrew_text: עֲקוּמָּה רוֹאִין אוֹתָהּ כְּאִילּוּ הִיא פְּשׁוּטָה. פְּשִׁיטָא! קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן כִּדְרַבִּי זֵירָא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: הִיא בְּתוֹךְ הַמָּבוֹי וְעַקְמוּמִיתָהּ חוּץ לַמָּבוֹי, הִיא בְּתוֹךְ עֶשְׂרִים וְעַקְמוּמִיתָהּ לְמַעְלָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים, הִיא לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה וְעַקְמוּמִיתָהּ לְמַטָּה מֵעֲשָׂרָה, רוֹאִין כׇּל שֶׁאִילּוּ יִנָּטֵל עַקְמוּמִיתָהּ וְאֵין בֵּין זֶה לָזֶה שְׁלֹשָׁה — אֵין צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא קוֹרָה אַחֶרֶת, וְאִם לָאו — צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא קוֹרָה אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: curved, one considers it as though it were straight. obvious. in accordance with Rabbi Zeira, as Rabbi Zeira said: is inside the alleyway, and its curved is outside the alleyway; it is within twenty and its curved is above twenty it is above ten and its curved is below ten one considers any where, were the curved removed, there would not be three between this and that one need not bring another beam. And if not, he must bring another beam.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Aqumah ro'in otah ke'ilu hi peshutah. Peshita! Qa mashma lan kid'Rabbi Zeira. D'amar Rabbi Zeira: Hi betokh ha'mavoy ve'aqemumitah chutz la'mavoy, hi betokh esrim ve'aqemumitah le'ma'alah me'esrim, hi le'ma'alah me'asarah ve'aqemumitah le'mattah me'asarah, ro'in kol she'ilu yinatel aqemumitah ve'ein bein zeh la'zeh shloshah — ein tzarikh lehaavi korah acheret, ve'im lav — tzarikh lehaavi korah acheret."

hebrew_text: הָא נָמֵי פְּשִׁיטָא! הִיא בְּתוֹךְ מָבוֹי וְעַקְמוּמִיתָהּ חוּץ לַמָּבוֹי אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לֵיחוּשׁ דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְאִמְּשׁוֹכֵי בָּתְרַהּ. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: That too is obvious, is inside the alleyway and its curved is outside the alleyway, it was necessary for him Lest you say: Let us be concerned that he come to be drawn after it teaches us
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text you provided: "This is a clear case! It is within a courtyard, and its protrusion is outside the courtyard, it requires an enclosure. What might you say? To be concerned lest one come to pull it inside. This is implied to us."

hebrew_text: עֲגוּלָּה רוֹאִין אוֹתָהּ כְּאִילּוּ הִיא מְרוּבַּעַת. הָא תּוּ לְמָה לִי? סֵיפָא אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ: כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בְּהֶיקֵּפוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים יֵשׁ בּוֹ רֹחַב טֶפַח.
human_translation: round, one considers it as though it were square. Why do I need this as well? It was necessary the last clause any with a circumference of three handbreadths is a handbreadth in diameter.
llm_translation: Round - see it as if it is square. Why do I need it? The end requires it: anything that has a circumference of three handbreadths also has a width of one handbreadth.

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וַיַּעַשׂ אֶת הַיָּם מוּצָק עֶשֶׂר בָּאַמָּה מִשְּׂפָתוֹ עַד שְׂפָתוֹ עָגֹל סָבִיב וְחָמֵשׁ בָּאַמָּה קוֹמָתוֹ וְקָו שְׁלֹשִׁים בָּאַמָּה יָסוֹב אוֹתוֹ סָבִיב״.
human_translation: From where are these matters, Rabbi Yoḥanan said the verse said “And he made a molten sea, ten cubits from the one brim to the other: It was round all about, and its height was five cubits; and a line of thirty cubits did circle it round about”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "What are these words?" Rabbi Yochanan said, the verse says: "And he made the Sea of cast metal, ten cubits from one brim to the other; it was completely round. Its height was five cubits, and a line of thirty cubits encircled it all around."

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִיכָּא שְׂפָתוֹ?!
human_translation: But isn’t there its brim
llm_translation: And is there his lip?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: שְׂפָתוֹ שְׂפַת פֶּרַח שׁוֹשָׁן כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְעׇבְיוֹ טֶפַח וּשְׂפָתוֹ כְּמַעֲשֵׂה כּוֹס פֶּרַח שׁוֹשָׁן אַלְפַּיִם בַּת יָכִיל״.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: With regard to its brim, it is written the brim the petals of a lily, “And it was a handbreadth thick; and its brim was wrought as the brim of a cup, as the petals of a lily; it contained two thousand bat ”
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: "His lips are like a rose, Lily lips are written about him, as it is written: 'And his cheeks are like a bed of spices, towers of perfumes; his lips like lilies, dropping sweet-smelling myrrh.'"

hebrew_text: וְהָאִיכָּא מַשֶּׁהוּ! כִּי קָא חָשֵׁיב — מִגַּוַּאי קָא חָשֵׁיב.
human_translation: But isn’t there amount When one calculates he calculates from the inside.
llm_translation: And there is a proof! For when it is being considered - it is being considered from the aspect of the body.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא רַבִּי חִיָּיא: יָם שֶׁעָשָׂה שְׁלֹמֹה הָיָה מַחֲזִיק מֵאָה וַחֲמִשִּׁים מִקְוֵה טׇהֳרָה. מִכְּדִי, מִקְוֶה כַּמָּה הָוֵי — אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה, כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״וְרָחַץ אֶת בְּשָׂרוֹ
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya taught The sea that Solomon fashioned contained one hundred and fifty baths of ritual purification. After all, a ritual bath, how much is forty se’a , as it was taught And he shall bathe his flesh
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Chiya said: The sea that Solomon made held one hundred and fifty Mikvehs of purity. How much was each Mikveh? Forty Seah, as it was taught: "And he shall wash his flesh."

hebrew_text: בְּמַיִם״ — בְּמֵי מִקְוֶה. ״כׇּל בְּשָׂרוֹ״ — מַיִם שֶׁכׇּל גּוּפוֹ עוֹלֶה בָּהֶן, וְכַמָּה הֵן? אַמָּה עַל אַמָּה בְּרוּם שָׁלֹשׁ אַמּוֹת. וְשִׁיעֲרוּ חֲכָמִים, מֵי מִקְוֶה אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה.
human_translation: in water in the water of a ritual bath. “all his flesh” water that his whole body can enter And how much is that? A cubit by a cubit by the height of three cubits. And the Sages calculated water a ritual bath is forty se’a .
llm_translation: "B'mayim" - in water. "Kol basaro" - water that his entire body goes up in them, and how much are they? An amah by an amah in height of three cubits. And the Sages estimated, a mikveh is forty se'ah of water.

hebrew_text: כַּמָּה הָווּ לְהוּ? חֲמֵשׁ מְאָה גַּרְמִידֵי, לִתְלָת מְאָה — מְאָה, לְמֵאָה וְחַמְשִׁין — חַמְשִׁין. בְּאַרְבַּע מְאָה וְחַמְשִׁין סַגִּיא!
human_translation: how many five hundred cubits, three hundred a hundred one hundred and fifty fifty four hundred and fifty are enough
llm_translation: How many were they? Five hundred cubits, for three hundred - one hundred, for one hundred and fifty - fifty. In four hundred and fifty it is excessive!

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּרִיבּוּעָא — יָם שֶׁעָשָׂה שְׁלֹמֹה עָגוֹל הָיָה.
human_translation: These apply to a square, sea fashioned by Solomon was round,
llm_translation: These are the words in the square — the sea that Solomon made was round.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי, כַּמָּה מְרוּבָּע יָתֵר עַל הֶעָגוֹל? רְבִיעַ. לְאַרְבַּע מְאָה — מְאָה, לְמֵאָה — עֶשְׂרִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה. הָנֵי מֵאָה וְעֶשְׂרִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה הָווּ לְהוּ!
human_translation: Now, how much larger is a square than a circle A quarter. four hundred one hundred hundred twenty-five one hundred and twenty-five
llm_translation: From where, how much is the excess of a square over a circle? A quarter. For four hundred - one hundred, for one hundred - twenty-five. Those one hundred and twenty-five were for him!

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רָמֵי בַּר יְחֶזְקֵאל: יָם שֶׁעָשָׂה שְׁלֹמֹה, שָׁלֹשׁ אַמּוֹת תַּחְתּוֹנוֹת מְרוּבָּעוֹת, וּשְׁתַּיִם עֶלְיוֹנוֹת עֲגוּלּוֹת.
human_translation: Rami bar Yeḥezkel taught sea that Solomon fashioned, three lower cubits were square and upper two were round.
llm_translation: It was taught: Ramei son of Yehezkel said: The sea that Solomon made, three cubits its lower square part, and two its upper circular part.

hebrew_text: נְהִי דְּאִיפְּכָא לָא מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ — דִּ״שְׂפָתוֹ עָגוֹל״ כְּתִיב, אֶלָּא אֵימָא חֲדָא!
human_translation: Although you cannot say the opposite, as it is written its brim was round; however, say one
llm_translation: נְהִי דְּאִיפְּכָא לָא מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ — דִּ״שְׂפָתוֹ עָגוֹל״ כְּתִיב, אֶלָּא אֵימָא חֲדָא! Be it that you did not find what you were seeking, you say — "His lips are round" is written, rather say something else!

hebrew_text: לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״אַלְפַּיִם בַּת יָכִיל״. ״בַּת״ כַּמָּה הָוְיָא — שָׁלֹשׁ סְאִין, דִּכְתִיב: ״מַעְשַׂר הַבַּת מִן הַכּוֹר״, דְּהָוֵה לְהוּ שִׁיתָּא אַלְפֵי גְּרִיוֵי.
human_translation: This cannot enter your mind, as it is written it contained two thousand bat ” How much is a bat ? Three se’a , the tenth part of a bat out of the kor , contained six thousand se’a ,
llm_translation: Your request is to translate the following Talmudic text into English word-for-word, maintaining the original style and format of Talmudic discourse. Here is the translation: Talmudic text: "La sakla da'atach, dikhtiv: 'alpayim bat yakhil'. 'Bat' kamah havya — shalosh se'in, dikhtiv: 'ma'asar habat min hakor', dehavah lehu shitta alfei gerivei." English translation: "It did not enter your mind, as it is written: 'Two thousand in a thousand'. 'Bat' how much is it — three se'ah, as it is written: 'a tenth of the daughter from the threshing floor', which amounts to six thousand geriv."

hebrew_text: וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״מַחֲזִיק בַּתִּים שְׁלֹשֶׁת אֲלָפִים״? הָהוּא לְגוּדְשָׁא.
human_translation: Isn’t it written “It received three thousand bat ” That to the heaped measure
llm_translation: And is it not written: "He holds three thousand houses"? That refers to Gudsha.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הַאי גּוּדְשָׁה, תִּלְתָּא הָוֵי. וּתְנַן נָמֵי: שִׁידָּה תֵּיבָה וּמִגְדָּל, כַּוֶּורֶת הַקַּשׁ וְכַוֶּורֶת הַקָּנִים, וּבוֹר סְפִינָה אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִית, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן שׁוּלַיִם וְהֵן מַחֲזִיקוֹת אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה בַּלַּח, שֶׁהֵן כּוֹרַיִים בַּיָּבֵשׁ — טְהוֹרִין.
human_translation: Abaye said: Learn from it the surplus is one-third We also learned A carriage, a box, and a cupboard, a round straw barrel, and a round barrel of reeds, and the cistern of an Alexandrian ship, although have bottoms, have a capacity of forty se’a liquid, which is the two kor dry ritually pure.
llm_translation: Abaye said, hear from it: this basket, three it is. And we learned: a chest, a box, and a tower, like the thickness of the reed and like the thickness of the canes, and a pit with a ladder, even though they have a base and they hold forty se'ah in the mud, which are like kor in the dry - they are pure.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ לְחָיַיִן שֶׁאָמְרוּ — גּוֹבְהָן עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, וְרׇחְבָּן וְעוֹבְיָין כׇּל שֶׁהוּא. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: רׇחְבָּן שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים.
human_translation: The side posts spoke their height ten handbreadths, and their width and thickness any amount. Rabbi Yosei says: Their width three handbreadths.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: For a winepress, their height is ten handbreadths, and their width and length can be any size. Rabbi Yosei says: Their width is three handbreadths.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לְחָיַיִן שֶׁאָמְרוּ כּוּ׳. לֵימָא תְּנַן סְתָמָא כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּאָמַר לְחָיַיִן בָּעִינַן?
human_translation: The side posts spoke etc. Shall we say the mishna taught an unattributed ruling in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, who said we require side posts?
llm_translation: Gemara: Regarding the case of Chayayin that they said thus. Let us say: Did we learn in a Mishnah simply like Rabbi Eliezer, who said that we require Chayayin?

hebrew_text: לָא, מַאי לְחָיַיִן — לְחָיַיִן דְּעָלְמָא. אִי הָכִי, קוֹרָה נָמֵי — נִיתְנֵי קוֹרוֹת, וּמַאי קוֹרוֹת: קוֹרוֹת דְּעָלְמָא!
human_translation: No; what side posts? Side posts in general, If so, let also teach beam beams, and What beams? in general.
llm_translation: Not, what for wine - for wine of the world. If so, beam also - beams are given, and what are beams: beams of the world!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: אוֹתָן לְחָיַיִן שֶׁנֶּחְלְקוּ בָּהֶן רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וַחֲכָמִים — גּוֹבְהָן עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, וְרוֹחְבָּן וְעוֹבְיָין כׇּל שֶׁהוּא. וְכַמָּה כׇּל שֶׁהוּא, תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: אֲפִילּוּ כְּחוּט הַסַּרְבָּל.
human_translation: this is what is saying: Those side posts that Rabbi Eliezer and the Sages disagreed about, their height ten handbreadths, and their width and thickness any amount. And how much is any amount? Rabbi Ḥiyya taught: Even as the string a coat.
llm_translation: So did he say: Those cheeks that Rabbi Eliezer and the Sages disputed about - their height is ten handbreadths, and their width and thickness, whatever it may be. And how much is whatever it may be? Rabbi Chiya taught: Even as thin as a hair of a horse's mane.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא עָשָׂה לֶחִי לַחֲצִי מָבוֹי אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא חֲצִי מָבוֹי. פְּשִׁיטָא! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: יֵשׁ לוֹ חֲצִי מָבוֹי. הָא נָמֵי פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לֵיחוּשׁ דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְאִישְׁתַּמּוֹשֵׁי בְּכוּלֵּיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: It was taught one who erected a side post for half an alleyway, he has only half of the alleyway, That is obvious; Rather, say: He may half of the alleyway That too is obvious. Lest you say we should be concerned that one might come to use the entire teaches
llm_translation: The text states: A Tanna made a cheek for half of a courtyard, it only has half a courtyard. It is obvious! Rather say: It has a half courtyard. This too is obvious! Lest you say: We should be concerned that perhaps one will come to carry throughout the entire courtyard, it teaches us.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: עָשָׂה לֶחִי לְמָבוֹי וְהִגְבִּיהוֹ מִן הַקַּרְקַע שְׁלֹשָׁה, אוֹ שֶׁהִפְלִיגוֹ מִן הַכּוֹתֶל שְׁלֹשָׁה — לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְלוּם. אֲפִילּוּ לְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל דְּאָמַר אָמְרִינַן לָבוּד — הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְמַעְלָה, אֲבָל לְמַטָּה, כֵּיוָן דְּהָוְיָא מְחִיצָה שֶׁהַגְּדָיִין בּוֹקְעִין בָּהּ — לָא קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Rava said: one who erected a side post in an alleyway and raised it three from the ground, or distanced it three from the wall, he has not done anything, Even according to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who said: We say connected, that applies only above, but below, since it is a partition through which goats can pass, he did not say
llm_translation: Rava said: If one made a beam for an alleyway and raised it from the ground by three handbreadths, or if he extended it from the wall by three handbreadths - he has not fulfilled the requirement. This is the case even according to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel who said that we say "lavud" - those matters are relevant above, but below, since goats can breach it, he did not say.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר רׇחְבָּן שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי לֹא בְּהֵילְמֵי וְלֹא בִּלְחָיַיִן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: The width three handbreadths. Rav Yosef said Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: The halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, not with regard to brine [ hilmei ] and not with regard to side posts.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: "Rachban is three handbreadths." Rav Yosef said, Rav Yehudah said, Shmuel said: The halakha is not like Rabbi Yosei, neither in Helmei nor in Lachayin.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בַּר חִינָּנָא: בְּהֵילְמֵי אֲמַרְתְּ לַן, בִּלְחָיַיִן לָא אֲמַרְתְּ לַן? מַאי שְׁנָא בְּהֵילְמֵי — דִּפְלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ, לְחָיַיִן נָמֵי — פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שָׁאנֵי לְחָיַיִן, מִשּׁוּם דְּקָאֵי רַבִּי כְּווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Ḥinana said to him: With regard to brine you told us with regard to side posts you did not tell us What is different about brine, the Sages disagree with side posts also the Sages disagree with him, said to him: Side posts are different, as Rabbi holds in accordance with
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Huna the son of Chinena: In regards to the lungs, you said to us, but in regards to the cheeks, you did not say to us? What is the difference in regards to the lungs - that the Rabbis disagreed about it, and in regards to the cheeks - the Rabbis also disagreed about it. He said to him: The cheeks are different, because Rabbi stands by his opinion.

hebrew_text: רַב רְחוּמִי מַתְנֵי הָכִי: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל [בַּר שִׁילַת] מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי לֹא בְּהֵילְמֵי וְלֹא בִּלְחָיַיִן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אָמַרְתְּ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: לָא. אָמַר רָבָא: הָאֱלֹהִים! אַמְרַהּ, וּגְמִירְנָא לַהּ מִינֵּיהּ. וּמַאי טַעְמָא קָא הָדַר בֵּיהּ? מִשּׁוּם דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי נִימּוּקוֹ עִמּוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Raḥumei taught this Rav Yehuda, the son of Rav Shmuel bar Sheilat, said in the name of Rav: The halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, not with regard to brine and not with regard to side posts. said to him: Did you say He said to them: No. Rava said, By God! He did say this, and I learned it from him, And what reason he retracted it? Due to Rabbi Yosei’s reasoning [ nimmuko ] is with him,
llm_translation: Rav Rechumi teaches thus: Rav Yehudah, son of Rav Shmuel Bar Shilat, said in the name of Rav: The halakha does not follow Rabbi Yosei, neither in matters of Helmei nor in matters of Lachayin. He said to him: Did you say this? He said to him: No. Rava said: By God! She said it, and we have learned it from her. And why did he change his mind? Because Rabbi Yosei was familiar with it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא בַּר רַב חָנָן לְאַבָּיֵי: הִילְכְתָא מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פּוֹק חֲזִי מַאי עַמָּא דָבַר.
human_translation: Rava bar Rav Ḥanan said to Abaye: What is the halakha He said to him: Go out what the people are doing;
llm_translation: Rava son of Rav Hanan said to Abbaye: What is the law? He said to him: Go out and see what the people are saying.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַהָא: הַשּׁוֹתֶה מַיִם לִצְמָאוֹ, אוֹמֵר: ״שֶׁהַכֹּל נִהְיָה בִּדְבָרוֹ״. רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: ״בּוֹרֵא נְפָשׁוֹת רַבּוֹת וְחֶסְרוֹנָן עַל כָּל מַה שֶּׁבָּרָאתָ״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חָנָן לְאַבָּיֵי: הִלְכְתָא מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פּוֹק חֲזִי מַאי עַמָּא דָבַר.
human_translation: there are who taught this with regard to this One who drinks water his thirst recites By Whose word all things came to be. Rabbi Tarfon says Who creates the many forms of life and their needs, for all that You have created. Rav Ḥanan said to Abaye: What is the halakha ? He said to him: Go out what the people are doing;
llm_translation: There is one who teaches about her father: one who gives water to a thirsty person, he says, "that everything is done by His word." Rabbi Tarfon says, "He who creates many souls and their deficiencies for all that you have created." Rav Hanan said to Abbaye: What is the halakha? He said to him: Go out and see what is the most important thing.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: לֶחִי הָעוֹמֵד מֵאֵלָיו, אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: הָוֵי לֶחִי, רָבָא אָמַר: לָא הָוֵי לֶחִי.
human_translation: It was stated a side post that stands by itself, Abaye said: It is a side post. Rava said: It is not a side post.
llm_translation: It was stated: The cheek of the one standing before him, Abbaye said: Let it be a cheek, Rava said: It is not a cheek.

hebrew_text: הֵיכָא דְּלָא סָמְכִינַן עֲלֵיהּ מֵאֶתְמוֹל, כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּלָא הָוֵי לֶחִי. כִּי פְּלִיגִי הֵיכָא דְּסָמְכִינַן עֲלֵיהּ מֵאֶתְמוֹל. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: הָוֵי לֶחִי, דְּהָא סָמְכִינַן עֲלֵיהּ מֵאֶתְמוֹל. רָבָא אָמַר: לָא הָוֵי לֶחִי, כֵּיוָן דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא לָאו אַדַּעְתֵּיהּ דְּהָכִי עֲבִידִי, לָא הָוֵי לֶחִי.
human_translation: where did not rely on it from yesterday, all agree that it is not a side post. Where they disagree is where they relied on it from yesterday. Abaye said: It is a side post, as they relied on it from yesterday. Rava said: It is not a side post; since it was not originally erected for this purpose, it is not a side post.
llm_translation: Here where we do not rely on it from yesterday, everyone agrees that it is not valid. When do they disagree? Here where we rely on it from yesterday. Abbaye said: It is valid, for we rely on it from yesterday. Rava said: It is not valid, since initially he did not have in mind to do so, it is not valid.

hebrew_text: קָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ כִּי הֵיכִי דִּפְלִיגִי בְּלֶחִי פְּלִיגִי נָמֵי בִּמְחִיצָה.
human_translation: enter your mind just as they disagree with regard to a side post, they also disagree with regard to a partition
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Your mind has gone out to think how they argue in the cheek, they also argue in the partition."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הָעוֹשֶׂה סוּכָּתוֹ בֵּין הָאִילָנוֹת וְאִילָנוֹת דְּפָנוֹת לָהּ — כְּשֵׁירָה. הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, שֶׁנְּטָעָן מִתְּחִילָּה לְכָךְ. אִי הָכִי פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לִיגְזוֹר דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְאִישְׁתַּמּוֹשֵׁי בְּאִילָן, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Come hear one who makes his sukka among the trees, and the trees serve as its walls, it is valid With what are we dealing here, where he planted from the outset for this If so, obvious Lest you say should issue a perhaps one will come to use the tree teaches us
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who makes his sukkah among trees, and the trees serve as its walls — it is valid. Here, what are we dealing with? That they were planted for this purpose from the beginning. If so, it is obvious! Lest you say: Let us decree, perhaps one will come to use the trees as walls, it has been taught to us.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הָיָה שָׁם אִילָן אוֹ גָּדֵר אוֹ חִיצַת הַקָּנִים — נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם דְּיוֹמָד!
human_translation: Come hear there was a tree there, or a fence, or a barrier of reeds it is judged a double post,
llm_translation: Come and hear: If there was there a tree or a fence or a thorn of reeds - it is judged because of damage!

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי, בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — שֶׁעֲשָׂאָן מִתְּחִילָּה לְכָךְ. אִי הָכִי מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? [קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן], חִיצַת הַקָּנִים קָנֶה קָנֶה פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים, כְּדִבְעָא מִינֵּיהּ אַבָּיֵי מֵרַבָּה.
human_translation: Here, too, with what are we dealing? where one constructed them from the outset for this If so, what does it teach us; It teaches us a barrier of reeds one reed and the next is less than three handbreadths, as Abaye raised dilemma to Rabba,
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? - that he made them initially for this purpose. If so, what does it imply to us? It implies to us, the width of the reeds is less than three handbreadths, as Abaye said from Rabbah.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אִילָן הַמֵּסֵיךְ עַל הָאָרֶץ, אִם אֵין נוֹפוֹ גָּבוֹהַּ מִן הָאָרֶץ שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים — מְטַלְטְלִין תַּחְתָּיו. הָכָא נָמֵי, בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — שֶׁנְּטָעוֹ מִתְּחִילָּה לְכָךְ.
human_translation: Come hear a tree hang over the ground, if its branches are not higher than three handbreadths from the ground, one may carry under it; Here, too, with what are we dealing? where he planted from the outset for this
llm_translation: Come and hear: a tree that overshadows the ground, if its canopy is not elevated three handbreadths from the ground - one may move objects underneath it. Here we are dealing with what? - that it was initially planted for this purpose.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, לִיטַלְטֵל בְּכוּלּוֹ! אַלְּמָה אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין בּוֹ אֶלָּא בֵּית סָאתַיִם.
human_translation: If so, it should carry in all of it Why, did Rav Huna, the son of Rav Yehoshua, say: One may only carry two beit se’a ,
llm_translation: So, to move it all! Why did Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, say: One may only carry it within a distance of two sa'ah.

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵי דִּירָה שֶׁתַּשְׁמִישָׁהּ לַאֲוִיר, וְכׇל דִּירָה שֶׁתַּשְׁמִישָׁהּ לַאֲוִיר, אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין בָּהּ אֶלָּא בֵּית סָאתַיִם.
human_translation: because it is a dwelling whose use is for air and any dwelling whose use is for air one may carry in it only if two beit se’a .
llm_translation: On account of it being a dwelling whose use is for the air, and any dwelling whose use is for the air, one may only carry within it up to two se'ahs.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שָׁבַת בְּתֵל שֶׁהוּא גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה וְהוּא מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת וְעַד בֵּית סָאתַיִם, וְכֵן בְּנֶקַע שֶׁהוּא עָמוֹק עֲשָׂרָה, וְהוּא מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת וְעַד בֵּית סָאתַיִם, וְקָמָה קְצוּרָה וְשִׁיבּוֹלוֹת מַקִּיפוֹת אוֹתָהּ — מְהַלֵּךְ אֶת כּוּלָּהּ וְחוּצָה לָהּ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה.
human_translation: Come hear one established his Shabbat on a mound that was ten high and from four cubits to two beit se’a ; and similarly, in a cavity that is ten deep and from four cubits to two beit se’a ; reaped grain, and stalks surround it, he may walk in the entire and outside it two thousand cubits.
llm_translation: Come and hear: A Sabbath limit in a mound that is ten high and it is from four cubits and until a Beit Se'atayim, and similarly in a pit that is deep ten, and it is from four cubits and until a Beit Se'atayim, and if a short reed and stalks surround it - one may walk its entire length and two thousand cubits outside of it.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכָא נָמֵי שֶׁעָשָׂה מִתְּחִילָּה לְכָךְ, בִּשְׁלָמָא קָמָה לְחַיֵּי, אֶלָּא תֵּל וָנֶקַע — מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: And if you say here, too, where he made it from the outset for this Granted, grain, all right; but a mound and a cavity, what can be said?
llm_translation: And if you will say here it is different because he did it initially for this purpose, it is understandable if it arose for life, but if it is hanging and torn - what can be said?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: בִּמְחִיצוֹת כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּהָוְיָא מְחִיצָה, כִּי פְּלִיגִי — בְּלֶחִי. אַבָּיֵי לְטַעְמֵיהּ דְּאָמַר: לֶחִי מִשּׁוּם מְחִיצָה, וּמְחִיצָּה הָעֲשׂוּיָה מֵאֵלֶיהָ הָוְיָא מְחִיצָה. וְרָבָא לְטַעְמֵיהּ דְּאָמַר: לֶחִי מִשּׁוּם הֶיכֵּר, אִי עֲבִידָא בְּיָדַיִם הָוְיָא הֶיכֵּר, וְאִי לָא לָא הָוֵי הֶיכֵּר.
human_translation: Rather, With regard to partitions, all agree that is a partition, Where they disagree with regard to a side post. Abaye follows his reasoning, as he said a side post as a partition, and a partition that stands by itself is a partition. And Rava follows his reasoning, as he said a side post as a conspicuous marker. if it was made with hands it is a conspicuous marker; and if not, it is not a conspicuous marker.
llm_translation: Rather: in partitions all of the world not argue that was a partition, when they argue — in the cheek. Abbaye according to his reasoning that he said: cheek because of a partition, and a partition that is made from it is considered a partition. And Rava according to his reasoning that he said: cheek because of recognition, if it is done by hand it is considered recognition, and if not, it is not considered recognition.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אַבְנֵי גָדֵר הַיּוֹצְאוֹת מִן הַגָּדֵר מוּבְדָּלוֹת זוֹ מִזּוֹ פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה, אֵין צָרִיךְ לֶחִי אַחֵר. שְׁלֹשָׁה — צָרִיךְ לֶחִי אַחֵר.
human_translation: Come hear stones of a wall that protrude from the wall separated from each other less than three there is no need for another side post three there is a need for another side post.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Stones of a fence that protrude from the fence, if they are separated from each other by less than three handbreadths, there is no need for another fence. If they are separated by three handbreadths, another fence is needed.

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי שֶׁבְּנָאָן מִתְּחִילָּה לְכָךְ. אִי הָכִי, פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא לְמֵיסַר בִּנְיָינָא הוּא דַּעֲבִידָא. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Here, too, where one built them from the outset for this If so, it is obvious Lest you say in order to connect the building he built it teaches us
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text into English: Here, it is taught that in the case of Shabbat, one begins in this manner. If so, it is obvious! What might you say, that it is to engage in construction work. This is what we hear.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: כּוֹתֶל שֶׁצִּידּוֹ אֶחָד כָּנוּס מֵחֲבֵרוֹ, בֵּין שֶׁנִּרְאֶה מִבַּחוּץ וְשָׁוֶה מִבִּפְנִים, וּבֵין שֶׁנִּרְאֶה מִבִּפְנִים וְשָׁוֶה מִבַּחוּץ — נִדּוֹן מִשּׁוּם לֶחִי.
human_translation: Come hear taught by Rabbi Ḥiyya: A wall, one side of which is more recessed than the other, whether is visible from the outside and even from the inside, or is visible from the inside and even from the outside, it is considered a side post.
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rabbi Chiya teaches: A wall that its one side is leaning towards its fellow, whether it appears from the outside and is equal from the inside, and whether it appears from the inside and is equal from the outside - it is discussed due to the principle of "Lechi."

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי שֶׁעֲשָׂאוֹ מִתְּחִילָּה לְכָךְ. אִי הָכִי, מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: נִרְאֶה מִבַּחוּץ וְשָׁוֶה מִבִּפְנִים — נִדּוֹן מִשּׁוּם לֶחִי.
human_translation: Here, too, where one fashioned it from the outset for this If so, what does it teach us? This teaches us is visible from the outside and even from the inside is considered a side post,
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text you provided: Here, it is taught that if one made it initially for this purpose. If not, what is it teaching us? It is teaching us: If it appears beautiful from the outside and is ugly from within - it is judged due to the inside.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: דְּרַב הֲוָה יָתֵיב בְּהָהוּא מְבוֹאָה, הֲוָה יָתֵיב רַב הוּנָא קַמֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ: זִיל אַיְיתִי לִי כּוּזָא דְמַיָּא. עַד דַּאֲתָא, נְפַל לֶחְיָא. אַחְוִי לֵיהּ בִּידֵיהּ קָם אַדּוּכְתֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא: לָא סָבַר לַהּ מָר לִסְמוֹךְ אַדִּיקְלָא? אָמַר: דָּמֵי הַאי מֵרַבָּנַן כְּמַאן דְּלָא פָּרְשִׁי אִינָשֵׁי שְׁמַעְתָּא, מִי סָמְכִינַן עֲלֵיהּ מֵאֶתְמוֹל?
human_translation: Come hear Rav was sitting in a certain alleyway, Rav Huna was sitting before him. He said to his attendant: Go, bring me a pitcher of water. By the time he came the side post had fallen. signaled to him with his hand stood in his place. Rav Huna said to Doesn’t the Master hold to rely on the palm tree said: This scholar, is comparable to one who does not know the teachings Did we rely on from yesterday?
llm_translation: Come and hear: For Rav was sitting in that alleyway, and Rav Huna was sitting before him. He said to him to listen: "Go bring me a cup of water." Until he came, a snake fell into his lap. He threw it off with his hand. Rav Huna said to him: "Does the Master not hold that one should not rely on a miracle?" He said: "The blood of this snake is like that of the Rabbis, for just as people do not pay attention to a rumor, do we rely on it from yesterday?"

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא — דְּלָא סָמְכִינַן, הָא סָמְכִינַן — הָוֵי לֶחִי.
human_translation: The reason because we did not rely had we relied it would be a side post,
llm_translation: Reason — that we do not rely on, if we rely on it — it is considered as a mere jest.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא בִּדְלָא סָמְכִינַן עֲלֵיהּ פְּלִיגִי, הָא סָמְכִינַן עֲלֵיהּ — הָוֵה לֶחִי. לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דְּהָהוּא בַּרְקָא דַּהֲוָה בֵּי בַּר חָבוּ דַּהֲווֹ פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא כּוּלֵּי שְׁנַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Shall we say Abaye and Rava disagree where they did not rely on it where they did rely on it, it is a side post? should not enter your mind, as there was a certain balcony [ barka ] that was in the house of Bar Ḥavu that Abaye and Rava disagreed about their entire lives.
llm_translation: Let Abaye and Rava say: When we did not rely on it, they disagree. If we rely on it - it is effective. Do not think that the son of Barak who was in the house of Bar Chavu disagrees with both Abaye and Rava.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בַּכֹּל עוֹשִׂין לְחָיַיִן אֲפִילּוּ בְּדָבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ רוּחַ חַיִּים, וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹסֵר. וּמְטַמֵּא מִשּׁוּם גּוֹלֵל,
human_translation: One may construct side posts from anything, even a living creature, and Rabbi Meir prohibits imparts ritual impurity covering of a grave.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: In all things, one may perform the ritual slaughter even with something that contains the breath of life, and Rabbi Meir prohibits. And it renders impure due to rolling.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר מְטַהֵר. וְכוֹתְבִין עָלָיו גִּיטֵּי נָשִׁים, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי פּוֹסֵל.
human_translation: But Rabbi Meir deems it pure. one may write women’s bills of divorce on But Rabbi Yosei HaGelili invalidates
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir declares pure. And they write concerning him bills of divorce of women, and Rabbi Yosei the Galilean disqualifies.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כָּל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ רוּחַ חַיִּים אֵין עוֹשִׂין אוֹתוֹ לֹא דּוֹפֶן לְסוּכָּה וְלֹא לֶחִי לְמָבוֹי, לֹא פַּסִּין לְבֵירָאוֹת וְלֹא גּוֹלֵל לְקֶבֶר. מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אָמְרוּ: אַף אֵין כּוֹתְבִין עָלָיו גִּיטֵּי נָשִׁים.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Meir says: An animate object may neither be used as a wall for a sukka , nor as a side post for an alleyway, nor as boards a well, nor as the covering of a grave. They said in the name of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili: Nor may one write women’s bills of divorce on it.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Rabbi Meir says: Anything that has a living spirit in it, one may not make it neither a door for a sukkah nor a doorpost for an alleyway, one may not chop it for firewood nor roll it to a grave. In the name of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, they also said: One may not write divorce documents on it." English translation: "Gemara: Rabbi Meir says: Anything that has a living spirit in it, one may not make it neither a door for a sukkah nor a doorpost for an alleyway, one may not chop it for firewood nor roll it to a grave. In the name of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, they also said: One may not write divorce documents on it."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, דְּתַנְיָא: ״סֵפֶר״, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא סֵפֶר. מִנַּיִין לְרַבּוֹת כָּל דָּבָר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״וְכָתַב לָהּ״, מִכׇּל מָקוֹם. אִם כֵּן מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״סֵפֶר״? לוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה סֵפֶר דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ רוּחַ חַיִּים וְאֵינוֹ אוֹכֶל, אַף כָּל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ רוּחַ חַיִּים וְאֵינוֹ אוֹכֶל.
human_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Yosei HaGelili’s As it was taught a scroll I have only a scroll From where to include all objects The Torah states: “That he write her,” in any case, If so, why does the verse state “scroll”? To tell you Just as a scroll is neither alive nor food, so too, any object that is neither alive nor food.
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Yosei the Galilean? For it was taught: "sefer," I have nothing except sefer. From where do we derive to include everything? The Torah says, "and he shall write for her," from every place. If so, why does the Torah say "sefer"? To tell you: Just as a sefer that does not have a living spirit and does not eat, so too, everything that does not have a living spirit and does not eat.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן? מִי כְּתִיב ״בְּסֵפֶר״? ״סֵפֶר״ כְּתִיב, לִסְפִירוּת דְּבָרִים בְּעָלְמָא הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, Is written: in the scroll [ basefer ],” scroll [ sefer ] is written, which comes to a mere account of the matters [ sefirot devarim ]
llm_translation: The sages? Who is it written "in the book"? "Book" is written, for the counting of words in the world it is that he came.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, הַאי ״וְכָתַב לָהּ״ מַאי דָּרְשִׁי בֵּיהּ? הָהוּא מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ: בִּכְתִיבָה מִתְגָּרֶשֶׁת, וְאֵינָהּ מִתְגָּרֶשֶׁת בְּכֶסֶף. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וְאִיתַּקַּשׁ יְצִיאָה לַהֲוָיָה — מָה הֲוָיָה בְּכֶסֶף, אַף יְצִיאָה בְּכֶסֶף. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And what do the Rabbis derive the “that he write her”? That is required is divorced by means of writing, and she is not divorced by means of money. It might have entered your mind to say: Since leaving is juxtaposed to becoming just as becoming is with money, so leaving with money. teaches us:
llm_translation: The sages asked: What is the interpretation of the phrase "and he shall write for her"? He wanted to say: In writing she is divorced, but she is not divorced with money. Do you really think I would say that? Since the exit is contingent upon existence — just as existence is with money, so too the exit is with money. This is what we have heard.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, הַאי סְבָרָא מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״סֵּפֶר כְּרִיתוּת״: סֵפֶר כּוֹרְתָהּ, וְאֵין דָּבָר אַחֵר כּוֹרְתָהּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, from where does he this reasoning, He derives it from A scroll of severance, a scroll, severs her and nothing else severs her
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, does this reasoning satisfy him? He derived it from the book of "Kritut": a book that cuts, and there is nothing else that cuts.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, הַאי ״סֵפֶר כְּרִיתוּת״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְדָבָר הַכּוֹרֵת בֵּינוֹ לְבֵינָהּ. לְכִדְתַנְיָא: הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטֵּךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁלֹּא תִּשְׁתִּי יַיִן, עַל מְנָת שֶׁלֹּא תֵּלְכִי לְבֵית אָבִיךְ לְעוֹלָם — אֵין זֶה כְּרִיתוּת. כָּל שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם — הֲרֵי זֶה כְּרִיתוּת.
human_translation: And the Rabbis this A scroll of severance, is required a matter that severs between him and her. As it was taught This is your bill of divorce, on condition that you will drink wine, on condition that you will never go to your father’s house, that is not severance; for the duration of thirty days, that is severance,
llm_translation: The sages, this "document of excision" they require for a matter that creates a separation between him and her. As it was taught: "Here is your bill of divorce on the condition that you do not drink wine, on the condition that you do not go to your father's house forever - this is not excision. Thirty days - this is excision."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״כָּרֵת״ ״כְּרִיתוּת״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei HaGelili derives from karet , keritut .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, it was derived for him from "Kareth" "Keritut."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן ״כָּרֵת״ ״כְּרִיתוּת״ לָא דָּרְשִׁי.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, they do not derive karet keritut .
llm_translation: The sages did not expound on the term "karet" or "excision."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁיָירָא שֶׁחָנְתָה בְּבִקְעָה וְהִקִּיפוּהָ כְּלֵי בְהֵמָה — מְטַלְטְלִין בְּתוֹכָהּ. וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיְּהֵא גָּדֵר גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, וְלֹא יְהוּ פִּירְצוֹת יְתֵרוֹת עַל הַבִּנְיָן.
human_translation: a caravan camped in a valley, and enclosed with animals’ equipment, one may carry inside provided that will be a fence ten handbreadths high, and there will not be breaches greater the built
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A courtyard that was situated in a valley and was surrounded by animal pens - one may carry within it. However, it must have a fence that is ten handbreadths high, and there should not be any openings beyond the structure.

hebrew_text: כָּל פִּירְצָה שֶׁהִיא כְּעֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת מוּתֶּרֶת, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא כְּפֶתַח. יָתֵר מִכָּאן — אָסוּר.
human_translation: Any breach that is approximately ten cubits is permitted because it is like an entrance. greater than it is prohibited
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Any breach that is like ten cubits is permitted, because it is like a doorway. Greater than this — is prohibited.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיתְּמַר, פָּרוּץ כְּעוֹמֵד — רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: מוּתָּר, רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אָמַר: אָסוּר.
human_translation: It is stated breached equals the standing Rav Pappa said: It is permitted Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: It is prohibited.
llm_translation: Gemara: It was stated: "A breach is like a standing wall." Rav Papa said: Permitted. Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Prohibited.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר מוּתָּר: הָכִי אַגְמְרֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לְמֹשֶׁה — לָא תִּפְרוֹץ רוּבָּה. רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אָמַר אָסוּר: הָכִי אַגְמְרֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לְמֹשֶׁה — גְּדוֹר רוּבָּה.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: It is permitted. This is what the Merciful One taught Moses: Do not breach the majority Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: It is prohibited. This is what the Merciful One taught Moses: Circumscribe the greater
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Permitted. Thus has the Merciful One concluded to Moses - "Do not break through the fence." Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Prohibited. Thus has the Merciful One concluded to Moses - "Fence in the courtyard."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: וְלֹא יְהוּ פִּירְצוֹת יְתֵרוֹת עַל הַבִּנְיָן. הָא כַּבִּנְיָן — מוּתָּר?!
human_translation: We learned And there will not be breaches greater the built if equal the built it is permitted.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: "And there shall not be excessive breaches in the building." But if it is like a building - is it permitted?!

hebrew_text: לָא תֵּימָא הָא כַּבִּנְיָן מוּתָּר, אֶלָּא אֵימָא: אִם בִּנְיָן יָתֵר עַל הַפִּירְצָה — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Do not say: equal the built it is permitted; rather, say: If the built is greater than the breach, it is permitted
llm_translation: Do not say that building is permitted, rather say: if building is more than breaching - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל כַּבִּנְיָן, מַאי — אָסוּר? אִי הָכִי לִיתְנֵי ״לֹא יְהוּ פִּירְצוֹת כַּבִּנְיָן״! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: However, equals the built what prohibited? If so, let teach breaches do not equal the built a difficulty
llm_translation: But regarding a building, what is the prohibition? If so, should it not have taught "Do not have breaches like a building"! This is difficult.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַמְקָרֶה סוּכָּתוֹ בְּשַׁפּוּדִין אוֹ בַּאֲרוּכּוֹת הַמִּטָּה, אִם יֵשׁ רֶיוַח בֵּינֵיהֶן כְּמוֹתָן — כְּשֵׁירָה!
human_translation: Come hear one who roofed his sukka with skewers or with bed posts, if there is space between them, equal to their is valid.
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who sets up his sukkah with boards or with the beams of a bed, if there is an empty space between them like their width - it is valid!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן: כְּשֶׁנִּכְנָס וְיוֹצֵא.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? where inserted and extracted
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? When he enters and exits.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אֶפְשָׁר לְצַמְצֵם?
human_translation: Isn’t it possible to be precise?
llm_translation: And is it possible to shorten?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: בְּמַעֲדִיף.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said: where one adds
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Ammi: In the preferable.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: אִם הָיוּ נְתוּנִין עֵרֶב — נוֹתְנוֹ שְׁתִי, שְׁתִי — נוֹתְנוֹ עֵרֶב.
human_translation: Rava said: if were placed crosswise he should place lengthwise, lengthwise, he should place crosswise,
llm_translation: Rava said: If they were designated for the evening - one gives two, two - one gives the evening.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שְׁיָירָא שֶׁחָנְתָה בְּבִקְעָה וְהִקִּיפוּהָ בִּגְמַלִּין, בְּאוּכָּפוֹת,
human_translation: Come hear a caravan camped in a field, and surrounded with camels with saddles,
llm_translation: Come and hear: A caravan that camped in a valley and surrounded it with camels, with bundles.

hebrew_text: בַּעֲבִיטִין, בִּשְׁלִיפִין, בְּקָנִים, בְּקוֹלָחוֹת — מְטַלְטְלִין בְּתוֹכָהּ, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא בֵּין גָּמָל לְגָמָל כִּמְלֹא גָּמָל, וּבֵין אוּכָּף לְאוּכָּף כִּמְלֹא אוּכָּף, וּבֵין עָבִיט לְעָבִיט כִּמְלֹא עָבִיט!
human_translation: with cushions [ avitin ], with wheat sheaves, with boards, with stalks [ kolaḥot ], one may carry within provided that there is no camel-length between one camel and another, or a saddle-length between one saddle and another, or a cushion-length between one cushion and another.
llm_translation: In bundles, in sheaves, in reeds, in stalks — one may shake within it, provided that there is not the measure of a camel between one bundle and another, or the measure of a yoke between one yoke and another, or the measure of a bundle between one bundle and another!

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי כְּשֶׁנִּכְנָס וְיוֹצֵא.
human_translation: Here, too, be inserted and extracted,
llm_translation: Here it is taught: "When one enters and exits."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: נִמְצֵאתָ אַתָּה אוֹמֵר, שָׁלֹשׁ מִדּוֹת בִּמְחִיצוֹת: כֹּל שֶׁהוּא פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה, צָרִיךְ שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא בֵּין זֶה לָזֶה שְׁלֹשָׁה, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִזְדַּקֵּר הַגְּדִי בְּבַת רֹאשׁ.
human_translation: Come hear Ultimately, you say that there are three measures for partitions. any less than three it is necessary that there will not be three between this and that, so that a goat would not leap headlong
llm_translation: Come and hear: You find yourself saying, three measurements in partitions: anything that is less than three, it is necessary that there should not be between this and that three, so that the goat does not pierce the head.

hebrew_text: כֹּל שֶׁהוּא שְׁלֹשָׁה, וּמִשְּׁלֹשָׁה עַד אַרְבָּעָה, צָרִיךְ שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא בֵּין זֶה לָזֶה כִּמְלוֹאוֹ, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא פָּרוּץ כְּעוֹמֵד. וְאִם הָיָה פָּרוּץ מְרוּבֶּה עַל הָעוֹמֵד — אַף כְּנֶגֶד הָעוֹמֵד אָסוּר.
human_translation: any three as well as from three to four it is necessary that there will not be the full width between one and the next, so that the breached will not equal the standing And if the breached is greater than the standing it is prohibited even opposite the standing
llm_translation: Every that is three, and from three until four, needs that not should be between this and that like its fullness, in order that not should be a breach like standing. And if it was a breach more than the standing — even opposite the standing is forbidden.

hebrew_text: כֹּל שֶׁהוּא אַרְבָּעָה, וּמֵאַרְבָּעָה עַד עֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת, צָרִיךְ שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא בֵּין זֶה לָזֶה כִּמְלוֹאוֹ, שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא פָּרוּץ כְּעוֹמֵד. וְאִם הָיָה פָּרוּץ כְּעוֹמֵד, כְּנֶגֶד הָעוֹמֵד — מוּתָּר, כְּנֶגֶד הַפָּרוּץ — אָסוּר. וְאִם הָיָה עוֹמֵד מְרוּבֶּה עַל הַפָּרוּץ — אַף כְּנֶגֶד הַפָּרוּץ מוּתָּר.
human_translation: any four as well as from four to ten cubits it is necessary that there not be the full between one and the next, so that the breached will not equal the standing And if the breached equals the standing opposite the standing it is permitted facing the breached it is prohibited. And if the standing is greater than the the breached is permitted, even opposite the breached
llm_translation: All that is four, and from four to ten cubits, it is necessary that there should not be between this and that like its fullness, that it should not be spread out like standing. And if it was spread out like standing, opposite the standing — it is permitted, opposite the spread out — it is forbidden. And if the standing is more than the spread out — even opposite the spread out it is permitted.

hebrew_text: נִפְרְצָה בְּיוֹתֵר מֵעֶשֶׂר — אָסוּר, הָיוּ שָׁם קָנִים הַדּוֹקְרָנִים וְעוֹשֶׂה לָהֶן פֵּיאָה מִלְמַעְלָה, אֲפִילּוּ בְּיוֹתֵר מֵעֶשֶׂר מוּתָּר.
human_translation: breached more than ten is prohibited, But if there were pronged stakes stuck there, and one made them a braid [ pe’a ] above even if more than ten is permitted.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "If it was pierced more than ten times - it is forbidden. If there were there reeds that were piercing and one made for them a corner from above, even if it was pierced more than ten times, it is permitted."

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי מִיהַת רֵישָׁא מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה עַד אַרְבָּעָה, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא בֵּין זֶה לָזֶה כִּמְלוֹאוֹ, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב פָּפָּא!
human_translation: In any case, the first clause teaches from three to four provided that there is not the full between one and the next. a conclusive refutation Rav Pappa,
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita from three until four, and specifically that there should not be between this and that like its fullness, the dispute of Rav Papa!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב פָּפָּא: מַאי מְלוֹאוֹ — נִכְנָס וְיוֹצֵא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to you: What the full inserted and extracted,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to you: What is its filling - it enters and exits.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי: אִם הָיָה פָּרוּץ מְרוּבֶּה עַל הָעוֹמֵד — אַף כְּנֶגֶד הָעוֹמֵד אָסוּר. הָא כְּעוֹמֵד — מוּתָּר. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: So too, it stands to reason, from teaches If the breached is greater than the standing it is prohibited even opposite the standing if equals the standing is permitted. learn from here
llm_translation: So it was taught in a Baraita: If it was protruding more than the standing wall, even opposite the standing wall is forbidden. But if it is like the standing wall, it is permitted. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתֵּיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ? אָמַר לָךְ: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: אִם הָיָה עוֹמֵד מְרוּבֶּה עַל הַפָּרוּץ, אַף כְּנֶגֶד הַפָּרוּץ מוּתָּר. הָא כַּפָּרוּץ — אָסוּר!
human_translation: Let us say that this is a conclusive refutation Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua. said to you: And according to your reasoning, say the latter clause If the sum of the standing is greater than the sum of the breached is permitted even opposite the breached equals the standing is prohibited.
llm_translation: Let us say, should the preference of Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua be? He said to you: and for your taste, let me say the conclusion: if it was standing more on the side of the breach, even opposite the breach is permitted. But like the breach - it is forbidden!

hebrew_text: סֵיפָא קַשְׁיָא לְרַב פָּפָּא, רֵישָׁא קַשְׁיָא לְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: the latter clause poses a difficulty for Rav Pappa’s the first clause poses a difficulty for Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua.
llm_translation: The latter part is difficult for Rav Papa, the former part is difficult for Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua.

hebrew_text: סֵיפָא לְרַב פָּפָּא לָא קַשְׁיָא: אַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא רֵישָׁא ״פָּרוּץ מְרוּבֶּה עַל הָעוֹמֵד״, תְּנָא סֵיפָא ״עוֹמֵד מְרוּבֶּה עַל הַפָּרוּץ״.
human_translation: The latter clause poses no difficulty to Rav Pappa. Since the first clause taught the the breached is greater than the standing the latter clause taught the standing is greater than the breached
llm_translation: The latter clause to Rav Papa is not difficult: since the first Tanna taught, "the breach is predominant over the standing," the latter Tanna teaches, "the standing is predominant over the breach."

hebrew_text: רֵישָׁא לְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לָא קַשְׁיָא: אַיְּידֵי דְבָעֵי לְמִיתְנֵי סֵיפָא ״עוֹמֵד מְרוּבֶּה עַל הַפָּרוּץ״, תְּנָא רֵישָׁא ״פָּרוּץ מְרוּבֶּה עַל הָעוֹמֵד״.
human_translation: the first clause does not pose a difficulty to Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua. Since sought to teach in latter clause: the standing is greater than the breached the first clause taught the breached is greater than the standing
llm_translation: Beginning: To Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua, it is not difficult: since he wants to teach the latter part, "standing is more significant than breaking through," the first part teaches, "breaking through is more significant than standing."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב פָּפָּא, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי לָא עָרֵיב לְהוּ וְתָנֵי לְהוּ.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rav Pappa, for that did not combine and teach them
llm_translation: In peace to Rav Papa, because of this, it did not mix for him and it taught for him.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ — לִיעָרְבִינְהוּ וְלִיתְנִנְהוּ: כׇּל שֶׁהוּא פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה, וּשְׁלֹשָׁה — צָרִיךְ שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא בֵּין זֶה לָזֶה שְׁלֹשָׁה!
human_translation: However, according to Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, should have combined and taught them Any less than three or three it is necessary that there not be three between one and another.
llm_translation: Rather, to Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua - let them mix and let them give: anything that is less than three, and three - it is necessary that there should not be between them three!

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא דָּמֵי פְּסוּלָא דְרֵישָׁא לִפְסוּלָא דְסֵיפָא. פְּסוּלָא דְרֵישָׁא — כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִזְדַּקֵּר הַגְּדִי בְּבַת אַחַת, פִּסּוּלָא דְסֵיפָא — שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא פָּרוּץ כָּעוֹמֵד.
human_translation: because the disqualification in the first clause is not similar to the disqualification in the latter clause. the disqualification in the first clause so that a goat would not to jump in one the disqualification in the latter clause, so that the breached will equal the standing
llm_translation: Because not similar disqualified of the beginning to disqualified of the end. Disqualified of the beginning - in order not to pierce the sinew in one piece, disqualified of the end - so it should not be spread out like standing.

hebrew_text: פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה מַנִּי — רַבָּנַן הִיא, דְּאָמְרִי: פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה אָמְרִינַן לָבוּד, שְׁלֹשָׁה לָא אָמְרִינַן לָבוּד.
human_translation: less than three whose the Rabbis, say: less than three we say, lavud , three we do not say lavud .
llm_translation: Less than three - it is the Rabbis, for they say: Less than three we say 'lavud', three we do not say 'lavud'.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא: כׇּל שֶׁהוּא שְׁלֹשָׁה, וּמִשְּׁלֹשָׁה וְעַד אַרְבָּעָה —
human_translation: Say the latter clause three and from three to four
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Eima seifa: kol shehu shloshah, u'mishloshah v'ad arba'ah — English translation: Say the latter clause: any that is three, and from three up to four —

hebrew_text: אֲתָאן לְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל דְּאָמַר: פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבָּעָה לָבוּד. דְּאִי רַבָּנַן: מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה וְעַד אַרְבָּעָה? שְׁלֹשָׁה וְאַרְבָּעָה חַד הוּא.
human_translation: we have arrived at Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who said: less than four lavud As had the Rabbis, from three to four three and four is one
llm_translation: The Master Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel came and said: Less than four is not considered. For if the sages say: From three to four? Three and four are one.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מִדְּרֵישָׁא רַבָּנַן, סֵיפָא נָמֵי רַבָּנַן, וּמוֹדוּ רַבָּנַן דְּכׇל לְמִישְׁרֵא כְּנֶגְדּוֹ, אִי אִיכָּא מָקוֹם אַרְבָּעָה — חֲשִׁיב, וְאִי לָא — לָא חֲשִׁיב.
human_translation: Abaye said: From that the first clause is the Rabbis, the latter clause also be the Rabbis. And the Rabbis concede that any case permits opposite if there is an area of four it is a significant and if not, it is not a significant
llm_translation: Abaye said: From the beginning, the Rabbis expound, and at the end, the Rabbis agree. And the Rabbis concede that everyone is considered straight in his own eyes. If there is room for four, it is significant; if not, it is not significant.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: מִדְּסֵיפָא רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, רֵישָׁא נָמֵי רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. וְכִי אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אָמְרִינַן לָבוּד — הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְמַעְלָה, אֲבָל לְמַטָּה, הָוֵה לֵיהּ כִּמְחִיצָה שֶׁהַגְּדָיִים בּוֹקְעִין בָּהּ — לָא אָמְרִינַן: לָבוּד.
human_translation: Rava said: From that the latter clause is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, the first clause also be Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. And when Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said we say lavud this applies above, However, below, it is like a partition through which goats can pass, we do not say lavud
llm_translation: Rava said: From the conclusion, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel; from the beginning, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. And when Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said, "We say 'lavud' for those matters above, but for those below, it is like a partition that goats pierce through," we do not say 'lavud.'

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: דְּפָנוֹת הַלָּלוּ שֶׁרוּבָּן פְּתָחִים וְחַלּוֹנוֹת מוּתָּר, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיְּהֵא עוֹמֵד מְרוּבֶּה עַל הַפָּרוּץ.
human_translation: Come hear these walls, where most of them entrance and windows, permitted provided that the standing are greater than the breached
llm_translation: "Come and hear: These doorways whose majority is open and windows are permitted, but only if one is standing more on the broken part."

hebrew_text: ״שֶׁרוּבָּן״, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא: שֶׁרִיבָּה בָּהֶן פְּתָחִים וְחַלּוֹנוֹת מוּתָּר, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיְּהֵא עוֹמֵד מְרוּבֶּה עַל הַפָּרוּץ.
human_translation: Can it enter your mind that most of Rather, to which one added entrances and windows, is permitted, provided that the standing are greater than the breached
llm_translation: "Shiruban," is it according to your opinion?! Rather: that there should be broken openings and windows in them is permitted, as long as there is a standing greater than the breach.

hebrew_text: הָא כַּפָּרוּץ אָסוּר, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב פָּפָּא תְּיוּבְתָּא. וְהִילְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא.
human_translation: If equal the breached is prohibited a conclusive refutation of Rav Pappa. a conclusive refutation. the halakha is in accordance with Rav Pappa.
llm_translation: The Gemara: "This is like the breach, it is forbidden; the argument of Rav Papa is an argument. And the halakha is in accordance with the opinion of Rav Papa."

hebrew_text: תְּיוּבְתָּא וְהִילְכְתָא?! אִין, מִשּׁוּם דְּדַיְיקָא מַתְנִיתִין כְּווֹתֵיהּ. דִּתְנַן: לֹא יִהְיוּ פְּרָצוֹת יְתֵירוֹת עַל הַבִּנְיָן. הָא כַּבִּנְיָן מוּתָּר.
human_translation: A conclusive refutation and the halakha ? Yes, because the precise reading of the mishna is in accordance with As we learned there will not be breaches greater the built equal to the built is permitted,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Tevubta vehilkhta?! Ein, mi'shum de'dayika matnitin kevoteih. Ditnan: Lo yihyu peratzot yeteirot al habinyan. Ha kabin'yan mutar." English translation: "Improvement and destruction?! No, because it specifically matches the Mishnah. For we learned: Extra breaches should not be made in the building. But like the building is permitted."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מַקִּיפִין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֲבָלִים זֶה לְמַעְלָה מִזֶּה, וָזֶה לְמַעְלָה מִזֶּה, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ בֵּין חֶבֶל לַחֲבֵירוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים.
human_translation: one surrounds three ropes, one above another, and one above other provided that there will not be three handbreadths between rope and the next.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: They surround with three ropes, this one above that one, and that one above this one, provided that there are not less than three handbreadths between one rope and its neighbor.

hebrew_text: שִׁיעוּר חֲבָלִים וְעוֹבְיָין יָתֵר עַל טֶפַח, כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא הַכֹּל עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים.
human_translation: The measure of the ropes and their thickness greater than a handbreadth, so that the entire will be ten handbreadths
llm_translation: Measurement of ropes and cords, and their thickness, more than a handbreadth, in order that everything should be ten handbreadths.

hebrew_text: מַקִּיפִין בְּקָנִים, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא בֵּין קָנֶה לַחֲבֵירוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים.
human_translation: one surround with boards provided that there will not be three handbreadths between one board and the next.
llm_translation: Surround with reeds, and there should not be between one reed and its fellow three handbreadths.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁיָירָא דִּבְּרוּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: לֹא דִּבְּרוּ בִּשְׁיָירָא, אֶלָּא בַּהוֹוֶה.
human_translation: they spoke of a caravan; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda, However, the Rabbis say: They spoke of a caravan only in the present,
llm_translation: In the remnant they spoke, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. And the sages say: They did not speak in the remnant, but in the present.

hebrew_text: כׇּל מְחִיצָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ שֶׁל שְׁתִי וְשֶׁל עֵרֶב — אֵינָהּ מְחִיצָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֶחָד מִשְּׁנֵי דְּבָרִים.
human_translation: Any partition that is not of warp and woof, is not a partition; the statement of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda. However, the Rabbis say: One of the two elements,
llm_translation: Every partition that is not of two and of evening - is not a partition, the words of Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda. And the sages say: one of two things.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא אָמַר רַב: הֲרֵי אָמְרוּ, עוֹמֵד מְרוּבֶּה עַל הַפָּרוּץ בִּשְׁתִי — הָוֵי עוֹמֵד. בָּעֵי רַב הַמְנוּנָא: בְּעֵרֶב מַאי?
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna said Rav said: said in warp, the standing is greater than the breached is standing. Rav Hamnuna raised a dilemma: What is woof,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara Amar Rav Hamnuna Amar Rav: Harei amru, omed merubeh al haparutz bishti - havei omed. Ba'i Rav Hamnuna: Be'erev mai? English translation: Gemara said, Rav Hamnuna said Rav: Behold they said, standing the majority on the breach in two - he should stand. Rav Hamnuna asked: In the evening, what?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, תָּא שְׁמַע: שִׁיעוּר חֲבָלִים וְעוֹבְיָין יָתֵר עַל טֶפַח, שֶׁיְּהוּ הַכֹּל עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים. וְאִי אִיתָא — לְמָה לִי יָתֵר עַל טֶפַח?
human_translation: Abaye said: Come hear The measure of the ropes and their thickness greater than a handbreadth, so that the entire will be ten handbreadths And if it is why do I need greater than a handbreadth?
llm_translation: Abaye said, come and hear: The measurement of ropes and cords should be more than a handbreadth, so that they are all ten handbreadths. And if you ask, why do I need more than a handbreadth?

hebrew_text: לֶיעְבֵּיד פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה וְחֶבֶל מַשֶּׁהוּ, פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה וְחֶבֶל מַשֶּׁהוּ, פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבָּעָה וְחֶבֶל מַשֶּׁהוּ.
human_translation: let one leave less than three and a rope of any size, less than three and rope of any size, less than four and a rope any size.
llm_translation: To work less than three and a rope is its measurement, less than three and a rope is its measurement, less than four and a rope is its measurement.

hebrew_text: וְתִיסְבְּרָא? הַאי פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבָּעָה הֵיכָא מוֹקֵים לֵיהּ? אִי מוֹקֵים לֵיהּ תַּתַּאי, הָוֵה לֵיהּ כִּמְחִיצָה שֶׁהַגְּדָיִים בּוֹקְעִין בָּהּ.
human_translation: And you understand Where does he position less than four If he positions it at the bottom, its is like a partition through which goats pass,
llm_translation: And it was created? This less than four, where is it established for him? If it is established for him below, it will be like a partition that the goats break through.

hebrew_text: אִי מוֹקֵים לֵיהּ עִילַּאי, אָתֵי אַוֵּירָא דְּהַאי גִּיסָא וּדְהַאי גִּיסָא וּמְבַטֵּל לֵיהּ.
human_translation: If he positions it at the top, the air on this side, above and on that side, come and negate it.
llm_translation: If one establishes it above, comes a wind of this side and of that side and nullifies it.

hebrew_text: אִי מוֹקֵים לֵיהּ בְּמִיצְעֵי, הָוֵה לֵיהּ עוֹמֵד מְרוּבֶּה עַל הַפָּרוּץ מִשְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹת. שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ עוֹמֵד מְרוּבֶּה עַל הַפָּרוּץ מִשְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹת הָוֵי עוֹמֵד!
human_translation: If he positions it in the middle, the standing is greater than the breached on the two sides conclude from it the standing is greater than the breached on the two sides standing.
llm_translation: If one establishes it in the middle, it is considered as standing predominantly on the breach from both sides. You heard from it that if it stands predominantly on the breach from both sides, it is considered as standing!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַב הַמְנוּנָא הָכִי קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ: כְּגוֹן דְּאַיְיתִי מַחְצֶלֶת דְּהָוֵי שִׁבְעָה וּמַשֶּׁהוּ, וַחֲקַק בַּהּ שְׁלֹשָׁה, וּשְׁבַק בַּהּ אַרְבָּעָה וּמַשֶּׁהוּ, וְאוֹקְמֵיהּ בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Hamnuna raised the following dilemma: where one brought a mat that is seven and any and carved in it three and left four and any and positioned less than three
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Hamnuna thus asks him: For example, if one brings a cucumber that is seven inches long and cuts off three inches, leaving it with four inches, and places it in a vessel less than three inches deep.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: מְחִיצָה תְּלוּיָה אִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ. כְּדִבְעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי טַבְלָא מֵרַב: מְחִיצָה תְּלוּיָה מַהוּ שֶׁתַּתִּיר בְּחוּרְבָּה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵין מְחִיצָה תְּלוּיָה מַתֶּרֶת אֶלָּא בַּמַּיִם, קַל הוּא שֶׁהֵקֵלּוּ חֲכָמִים בְּמַיִם.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: The dilemma he raised partition suspended similar to that which Rabbi Tavla raised a dilemma before Rav: Does a suspended partition render it permitted in a ruin? said to him: A suspended partition renders it permitted only water, a leniency by the Sages with regard to water.
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: A hanging partition is needed for it. As Rabbi Tabla heard from his teacher: What is the ruling regarding a hanging partition in a ruin? He said to him: A hanging partition is only permitted in water, for the sages were lenient with water.

hebrew_text: מַקִּיפִין בְּקָנִים וְכוּ׳. בִּשְׁיָרָא אִין, בְּיָחִיד לָא? וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל מְחִיצּוֹת שַׁבָּת לֹא הִתִּירוּ לְיָחִיד יוֹתֵר מִבֵּית סָאתַיִם.
human_translation: One surround with boards With regard to a caravan, yes, with regard to an individual, no, Wasn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda says: all partitions of Shabbat, did not permit for an individual greater than two beit se’a ?
llm_translation: Encircling with reeds, etc. In a public domain, yes, but not in a private domain? And it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: All partitions on Shabbat were not permitted for an individual more than two sa'ahs.

hebrew_text: כִּדְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי: לָא נִצְרְכָא אֶלָּא לִיתֵּן לָהֶן כׇּל צָרְכָּן, הָכָא נָמֵי לִיתֵּן לָהֶן כׇּל צָרְכָּן.
human_translation: in accordance with that which Rav Naḥman, and some say Rav Beivai bar Abaye, said was necessary only to provide all their needs. Here, too, to provide all their needs.
llm_translation: As Rav Nachman said, and some say it was Rav Bivi bar Abbaye: It was only necessary to give them all their needs. Here too, it is necessary to give them all their needs.

hebrew_text: הֵיכָא אִיתְּמַר דְּרַב נַחְמָן וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי? אַהָא דִּתְנַן: כׇּל מְחִיצָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ שֶׁל שְׁתִי וָעֵרֶב אֵינָהּ מְחִיצָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Where was of Rav Naḥman, and some say Rav Beivai bar Abaye, stated? to this Any partition that is not vertical and horizontal is not a partition; Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Here is where it was stated: Rav Nachman said, and it was stated: Rav Bibi son of Abbaye? This is as we learned: Any partition that is not of two and an eruv is not a partition, the words of Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הָכִי? וְהָתַנְיָא: אֶחָד יָחִיד וְאֶחָד שְׁיָירָא לַחֲבָלִים. וּמָה בֵּין יָחִיד לִשְׁיָירָא? יָחִיד נוֹתְנִין לוֹ בֵּית סָאתַיִם, שְׁנַיִם נוֹתְנִין לָהֶם בֵּית סָאתַיִם, שְׁלֹשָׁה נַעֲשׂוּ שְׁיָירָא וְנוֹתְנִין לָהֶן בֵּית שֵׁשׁ. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Did Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, say this? Wasn’t it taught both an individual and a caravan, ropes And what, is between an individual and a caravan? individual, provides him two beit se’a , two provides them two beit se’a . Three assume the status of a caravan, and provides them six beit the statement of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who said it? Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda said so. And it was taught: One individual and one who is cautious with ropes. And what is the difference between an individual and one who is cautious? An individual is given two se'ah, two are given four se'ah, three have become cautious and are given six se'ah. These are the words of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֶחָד יָחִיד וְאֶחָד שְׁיָירָא נוֹתְנִין לָהֶן כׇּל צָרְכָּן, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא בֵּית סָאתַיִם פָּנוּי!
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: both an individual and a caravan, one provides them all their needs, provided that there will not be an unoccupied space of two beit se’a .
llm_translation: The sages say: "One who is alone and one who is fearful, we provide for all their needs, as long as there is not an empty space of two se'ahs!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי: לָא נִצְרְכָא, אֶלָּא לִיתֵּן לָהֶן כׇּל צָרְכָּן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman, and some say Rav Beivai bar Abaye, said: was necessary only to provide them all their needs
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, and some say it was Rav Bibi bar Abbaye: It is not necessary, but to provide for all their needs.

hebrew_text: דָּרַשׁ רַב נַחְמָן מִשּׁוּם רַבֵּינוּ שְׁמוּאֵל: יָחִיד — נוֹתְנִין לוֹ בֵּית סָאתַיִם, שְׁנַיִם — נוֹתְנִין לְהוּ בֵּית סָאתַיִם, שְׁלֹשָׁה — נַעֲשׂוּ שְׁיָירָא וְנוֹתְנִין לָהֶן בֵּית שֵׁשׁ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman taught in the name of Rabbeinu Shmuel: individual, provides him two beit se’a . two provides them two beit se’a Three assume the status of a caravan, and provides them six beit
llm_translation: Rav Nachman expounded in the name of our Master Samuel: One individual — they give him two se'ahs, two — they give them four se'ahs, three — they are considered a group and they are given a six se'ah house.

hebrew_text: שָׁבַקְתְּ רַבָּנַן וְעָבְדַתְּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה?
human_translation: Did you abandon the Rabbis and act in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda?
llm_translation: The sages left and you served like Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda?

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אוֹקֵים רַב נַחְמָן אָמוֹרָא עֲלֵיהּ וּדְרַשׁ: דְּבָרִים שֶׁאָמַרְתִּי לִפְנֵיכֶם טָעוּת הֵן בְּיָדִי. בְּרַם כָּךְ אָמְרוּ: יָחִיד — נוֹתְנִין לוֹ בֵּית סָאתַיִם, שְׁנַיִם — נוֹתְנִין לָהֶן בֵּית סָאתַיִם, שְׁלֹשָׁה — נַעֲשׂוּ שְׁיָירָא וְנוֹתְנִין לָהֶן כָּל צָרְכָּן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman then placed a speaker over him, and taught: The matters that I stated before you are an error on my part. Indeed, this said: individual, provides him two beit se’a . two provides them two beit se’a Three assume the status of a caravan, and provides them all their needs.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Hadar okeim Rav Nachman amorah aleih u'darash: Devarim she'amarti lifneichem ta'ut hen b'yadi. Beram kach amru: Yachid - notnin lo beit sa'ataim, shnayim - notnin lahen beit sa'ataim, shlosha - na'asu sh'yaira v'notnin lahen kol tzorkan."

hebrew_text: רֵישָׁא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְסֵיפָא רַבָּנַן?!
human_translation: the first clause is Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, and the latter clause is the Rabbis?
llm_translation: The beginning: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda. And the end: the Rabbis?!

hebrew_text: אִין, מִשּׁוּם דְּקָאֵי אֲבוּהּ בְּשִׁיטְתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Yes, because his father, holds in accordance with his opinion
