llm_translation: There is not, because he stands with his opinion.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: שְׁלֹשָׁה בְּחָמֵשׁ — אֲסוּרִין, בְּשֶׁבַע מוּתָּרִין. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אֲמַר רַב הָכִי? אֲמַר לְהוּ: אוֹרָיְיתָא נְבִיאֵי וּכְתִיבֵי דַּאֲמַר רַב הָכִי!
human_translation: Rav Giddel said Rav said: three prohibited in five permitted in seven said to him: Did Rav say that? He said to them: the Torah, the Prophets, and the Writings, that Rav said so.
llm_translation: Rav Gidel said in the name of Rav: Three in five - prohibited, in seven - permitted. They said to him: Did Rav really say this? He said to them: The Torah, the Prophets, and the Writings say so as Rav said!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מַאי קַשְׁיָא? דִּילְמָא הָכִי קָאָמַר: הוּצְרְכוּ לְשֵׁשׁ וְהִקִּיפוּ בְּשֶׁבַע — אֲפִילּוּ בְּשֶׁבַע מוּתָּרִין. לֹא הוּצְרְכוּ אֶלָּא לְחָמֵשׁ וְהִקִּיפוּ בְּשֶׁבַע — אֲפִילּוּ בְּחָמֵשׁ אֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: What is the difficulty Perhaps this is what he is saying: they needed six and they enclosed seven, they are permitted even in seven, they needed only five and they enclosed seven, even in five is prohibited,
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: What is the difficulty? Perhaps this is what he meant to say: If they needed six and they surrounded with seven - even with seven it is permitted. They only needed five and they surrounded with seven - even with five it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּקָתָנֵי: ״וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא בֵּית סָאתַיִם פָּנוּי״ — מַאי לָאו, פָּנוּי מֵאָדָם? לָא, פָּנוּי מִכֵּלִים.
human_translation: However, that which is teaching, provided that there will not be an unoccupied space of two beit se’a , what, is it not space unoccupied by people? No, unoccupied by utensils.
llm_translation: And rather this that it teaches: "And only that there should not be two se'ahs empty" — what is the reason, not empty from a person? No, empty from vessels.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: שְׁלֹשָׁה וּמֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶן, שְׁנַיִם וְנִתּוֹסְפוּ עֲלֵיהֶן — רַב הוּנָא וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק, חַד אָמַר: שַׁבָּת גּוֹרֶמֶת, וְחַד אָמַר: דָּיוֹרִין גּוֹרְמִין.
human_translation: It is stated: three and one of them died two and were added to them Rav Huna and Rabbi Yitzḥak One said: Shabbat determines And one said the residents, determine
llm_translation: It was stated: three and one of them dies, two and they are added upon - Rav Huna and Rabbi Yitzchak, one said: Shabbat causes, and one said: dwellings cause.

hebrew_text: תִּסְתַּיֵּים דְּרַב הוּנָא הוּא דְּאָמַר שַׁבָּת גּוֹרֶמֶת. דְּאָמַר רַבָּה: בְּעַאי מֵרַב הוּנָא, וּבְעַאי מֵרַב יְהוּדָה: עֵירַב דֶּרֶךְ הַפֶּתַח וְנִסְתַּם הַפֶּתַח, דֶּרֶךְ הַחַלּוֹן וְנִסְתַּם הַחַלּוֹן, מַהוּ? וְאָמַר לִי: שַׁבָּת הוֹאִיל וְהוּתְרָה — הוּתְּרָה. תִּסְתַּיֵּים.
human_translation: Conclude that it is Rav Huna who said that Shabbat determines Rabba said: I raised a dilemma before Rav Huna, and I raised a dilemma before Rav Yehuda established an eiruv via opening and that opening was sealed via window and that window was sealed what is And he said to me: Since was permitted Shabbat, it was permitted conclude
llm_translation: The completion of Rav Huna, he said, Shabbat causes. Rabba said: He asked from Rav Huna, and he asked from Rav Yehuda: If the door bolt was placed in the path of the door and the door was closed, or if the window bolt was placed in the path of the window and the window was closed, what is the ruling? And he said to me: Since Shabbat permitted, it is permitted. The completion.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא רַב הוּנָא וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה קָמִיפַּלְגִי? דִּתְנַן: חָצֵר שֶׁנִּפְרְצָה מִשְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹתֶיהָ, וְכֵן בַּיִת שֶׁנִּפְרַץ מִשְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹתָיו, וְכֵן מָבוֹי שֶׁנִּיטְּלוּ קוֹרוֹתָיו אוֹ לְחָיָיו — מוּתָּרִין לְאוֹתָהּ שַׁבָּת וַאֲסוּרִין לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Let us say that Rav Huna and Rabbi Yitzḥak are disagreeing in the dispute of Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Yehuda. As we learned a courtyard was breached from two of its sides, or a house was breached from two of its sides, or an alleyway’s beams or side posts were removed, permitted on that Shabbat, but prohibited in the future; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Let Rav Huna and Rabbi Yitzchak say in the dispute of Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Yehuda? For it was taught: A courtyard that breached from both its sides, and similarly a house that breached from both its sides, and likewise an alleyway whose beams or walls were removed - they are permitted for that Shabbat but forbidden for the future, the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אִם מוּתָּרִין לְאוֹתָהּ שַׁבָּת — מוּתָּרִין לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא, וְאִם אֲסוּרִין לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא — אֲסוּרִין לְאוֹתָהּ שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: If permitted on that Shabbat, permitted in the future. However, if prohibited in the future, prohibited on that Shabbat.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: If they are permitted on that Shabbat - they are permitted for the future to come, and if they are forbidden for the future to come - they are forbidden on that Shabbat.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא רַב הוּנָא דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי?
human_translation: Let us say Rav Huna who stated in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, And Rabbi Yitzḥak who stated in accordance with Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: Let Rav Huna say, as Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yitzchak say, as Rabbi Yosei says?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב הוּנָא: אֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי אֲפִילּוּ לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הָתָם — אֶלָּא דְּלֵיתַנְהוּ לִמְחִיצוֹת, הָכָא — אִיתַנְהוּ לִמְחִיצוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Huna said to you: I who stated even in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Yosei stated only there, where there are no partitions here there are partitions
llm_translation: Rav Huna said to you: I, who said even to Rabbi Yosei, until here Rabbi Yosei did not say there — rather, that they did not give him to partitions, here — they gave him to partitions.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר: אֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי אֲפִילּוּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הָתָם — אֶלָּא דְּאִיתַנְהוּ לְדָיוֹרִין, הָכָא — לֵיתַנְהוּ לְדָיוֹרִין.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak said I who stated even in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yehuda stated only there, where there are residents. here, there are no residents
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: I, who said even according to Rabbi Yehuda, until here Rabbi Yehuda did not say there - rather, that he allowed for residents there, here - he allowed for residents here.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים אֶחָד מִשְּׁנֵי דְּבָרִים. הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא?
human_translation: However, the Rabbis say: One of the two elements, This is the first tanna
llm_translation: And the sages say: one of two things. Is this the first Tanna?

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ יָחִיד בַּיִּישּׁוּב.
human_translation: There is between them an individual a settlement.
llm_translation: There is a difference between them: "Yachid" in the Yishuv.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אַרְבָּעָה דְּבָרִים פָּטְרוּ בַּמַּחֲנֶה: מְבִיאִין עֵצִים מִכׇּל מָקוֹם, וּפְטוּרִין מֵרְחִיצַת יָדַיִם, וּמִדְּמַאי, וּמִלְּעָרֵב.
human_translation: exempted in camp four matters: One may bring wood from any place and one is exempt from washing hands and from doubtfully tithed produce [ demai ], and from establishing an eiruv .
llm_translation: They taught: Four things exempt one in the camp: One may bring wood from any place, and they are exempt from washing hands, from Demai, and from Erev.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַחֲנֶה הַיּוֹצֵאת לְמִלְחֶמֶת הָרְשׁוּת מוּתָּרִין בְּגֶזֶל עֵצִים יְבֵשִׁים. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן תֵּימָא אוֹמֵר: אַף חוֹנִין בְּכׇל מָקוֹם. וּבִמְקוֹם שֶׁנֶּהֶרְגוּ שָׁם נִקְבָּרִין.
human_translation: The Sages taught camp that goes out to an optional war, it is permitted to steal dry wood. Rabbi Yehuda ben Teima says: They may also encamp in any location, And in the place where they were killed, there they are buried
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A camp that goes out to a discretionary war is permitted to use stolen dry wood. Rabbi Yehuda ben Tema says: They may even camp anywhere. And in the place where they are killed, there they are buried.

hebrew_text: מוּתָּרִין בְּגֶזֶל עֵצִים יְבֵשִׁים. הַאי תַּקַּנְתָּא דִּיהוֹשֻׁעַ הֲוָה? דְּאָמַר מָר, עֲשָׂרָה תְּנָאִים הִתְנָה יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: שֶׁיְּהוּ מַרְעִין בָּחוֹרָשִׁין, וּמְלַקְּטִין עֵצִים מִשְּׂדוֹתֵיהֶן!
human_translation: They are permitted to steal dry wood? This was an ordinance by Joshua, the Master said Joshua stipulated ten conditions that may graze in woods gather wood from their fields.
llm_translation: Permitted in the theft of dry wood. Was this the enactment of Joshua? As the Master said, Joshua established ten enactments: that they may plow on Shabbat and gather wood from their fields!

hebrew_text: הָתָם — בְּהִיזְמֵי וְהִיגֵי, הָכָא — בִּשְׁאָר עֵצִים.
human_translation: There, shrubs [ hizmei ] and thorns [ higei ], here, other wood.
llm_translation: There — with arrows and spears; here — with other types of wood.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי: הָתָם — בִּמְחוּבָּרִין, הָכָא — בִּתְלוּשִׁין.
human_translation: Alternatively: There, to attached Here, to detached.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "אִי נָמֵי: הָתָם — בִּמְחוּבָּרִין, הָכָא — בִּתְלוּשִׁין." English translation: "If you say 'there' - in connected cases, here - in detached cases."

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי: הָתָם — בְּלַחִין, הָכָא — בִּיבֵשִׁים.
human_translation: Alternatively: There, to moist Here, to dry
llm_translation: If you wish: There — with liquids; here — with dry substances.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן תֵּימָא אוֹמֵר: אַף חוֹנִין בְּכׇל מָקוֹם, וּבִמְקוֹם שֶׁנֶּהֱרָגִים שָׁם נִקְבָּרִים. פְּשִׁיטָא, מֵת מִצְוָה הוּא, וּמֵת מִצְוָה קוֹנֶה מְקוֹמוֹ!
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Teima says: They may also encamp in any place, and in the place where they were killed, there they are buried. obvious, is a corpse with no one to bury it [ met mitzva ], a met mitzva acquires its place.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Tema says: Even in every place, and in a place where they are killed there they are buried. It is obvious, he is a mitzvah death, and a mitzvah death acquires his place!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, אַף עַל גַּב
human_translation: No, necessary even though
llm_translation: Not necessary, even though

hebrew_text: דְּאִית לֵיהּ קוֹבְרִין, דְּתַנְיָא: אֵיזֶהוּ מֵת מִצְוָה? כֹּל שֶׁאֵין לוֹ קוֹבְרִין. קוֹרֵא וַאֲחֵרִים עוֹנִין אוֹתוֹ — אֵין זֶה מֵת מִצְוָה.
human_translation: there are to bury it. As it was taught Which is a met mitzva ?Any that has no one to bury it. one calls out, others answer him, this is not a met mitzva .
llm_translation: If one has no one to bury him, as it was taught: Who is considered a mitzvah corpse? Anyone who has no one to bury him. If one reads and others respond after him - this is not a mitzvah corpse.

hebrew_text: וּמֵת מִצְוָה קָנָה מְקוֹמוֹ? וְהָתַנְיָא: הַמּוֹצֵא מֵת מוּטָל בִּסְרַטְיָא — מְפַנֵּיהוּ לִימִין אִסְרַטְיָא אוֹ לִשְׂמֹאל אִסְרַטְיָא.
human_translation: And does a met mitzva acquire its place? Wasn’t it taught One who finds a corpse laid out on a main street evacuates it to the right of the street or to the left of the street,
llm_translation: "And does a corpse acquire its place? And it was taught: One who finds a corpse lying in a ditch - he turns them to the right side of the ditch or to the left side of the ditch."

hebrew_text: שְׂדֵה בוּר וּשְׂדֵה נִיר — מְפַנֵּיהוּ לִשְׂדֵה בוּר. שְׂדֵה נִיר וּשְׂדֵה זֶרַע — מְפַנֵּיהוּ לִשְׂדֵה נִיר. הָיוּ שְׁתֵּיהֶן נִירוֹת, שְׁתֵּיהֶן זְרוּעוֹת, שְׁתֵּיהֶן בּוּרוֹת — מְפַנֵּהוּ לְכׇל רוּחַ שֶׁיִּרְצֶה!
human_translation: an uncultivated field or a plowed field, he evacuates it to the uncultivated field. a plowed field and a sown field, he evacuates it to the plowed field. both are plowed, both are sown, both are uncultivated, he evacuates it to any side that he wishes
llm_translation: Field of pit and field of plowed land - one faces towards the field of pit. Field of plowed land and field of seed - one faces towards the field of plowed land. If both are plowed lands, both are seeded lands, both are pits - one may face it in any direction one desires!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב בִּיבִי: הָכָא בְּמֵת מוּטָּל עַל הַמֵּיצַר עָסְקִינַן. מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁנִּיתְּנָה רְשׁוּת לְפַנּוֹתוֹ מִן הַמֵּיצַר — מְפַנֵּיהוּ לְכׇל רוּחַ שֶׁיִּרְצֶה.
human_translation: Rav Beivai said: Here we are dealing with a corpse laid out across on the side Since permission was granted to evacuate it from the side one may evacuate it to any side he wishes.
llm_translation: Rav Bevai said: Here we are dealing with a corpse lying on a bed. Since permission was granted to turn him away from the bed — one may turn him in any direction he pleases.

hebrew_text: וּפְטוּרִין מֵרְחִיצַת יָדַיִם. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא מַיִם רִאשׁוֹנִים, אֲבָל מַיִם אַחֲרוֹנִים חוֹבָה.
human_translation: one is exempt from washing hands. Abaye said: They taught only first waters, However, final waters, is an obligation
llm_translation: And exempt from washing of hands. Abaye said: They only taught regarding the first water, but the last water is obligatory.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ מַיִם אַחֲרוֹנִים חוֹבָה? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמֶּלַח סְדוֹמִית יֵשׁ, שֶׁמְּסַמֵּא אֶת הָעֵינַיִם.
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi said: For what did say that the final waters are an obligation? due to that there is the presence of Sodomite salt, which blinds the eyes
llm_translation: Rav Chiya bar Ashe said: For what reason did they say that the last waters are obligatory? Because there is Sodomite salt, which blinds the eyes.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: וּמִשְׁתַּכְחָא כְּקוּרְטָא בְּכוֹרָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: כָּיֵיל מִילְחָא, מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: [הָא] לָא מִיבַּעְיָא.
human_translation: Abaye said: And is present grain [ korta ] in an kor Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: one measured salt what He said to him: It was unnecessary this,
llm_translation: Abaye said: And it is found like a needle in a bundle of flax. Rav Ahah, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: A vessel of salt, what is it? He said to him: It is not necessary.

hebrew_text: וּמִדְּמַאי. דִּתְנַן: מַאֲכִילִין אֶת הָעֲנִיִּים דְּמַאי וְאֶת אַכְסַנְיָא דְּמַאי. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: תָּנָא, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מַאֲכִילִין אֶת הָעֲנִיִּים דְּמַאי וְאֶת אַכְסַנְיָא דְּמַאי, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מַאֲכִילִין אֶת הָעֲנִיִּים דְּמַאי וְאֶת אַכְסַנְיָא דְּמַאי.
human_translation: And from doubtfully tithed produce [ demai ]. As we learned One may feed the poor demai , and quartered soldiers [ akhsanya ] demai . Rav Huna said: taught Beit Shammai say one may neither feed the poor demai , nor quartered soldiers demai . And Beit Hillel say one may feed the poor demai , and quartered soldiers demai .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And from what is the law concerning Demai. For it was taught: One may feed the poor with produce of Demai, and provide lodging for guests with Demai. Rav Huna said: It was taught, Beit Shammai say: One may not feed the poor with produce of Demai, nor provide lodging for guests with Demai, and Beit Hillel say: One may feed the poor with produce of Demai, and provide lodging for guests with Demai."

hebrew_text: וּמִלְּעָרֵב. אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא עֵירוּבֵי חֲצֵירוֹת, אֲבָל עֵירוּבֵי תְּחוּמִין חַיָּיבִין.
human_translation: And from establishing an eiruv . the school of Rabbi Yannai said: They taught only the joining of courtyards. However, are obligated a joining of Shabbat boundaries,
llm_translation: "And from the evening. The house of Rabbi Yannai said: They only taught regarding the combining of courtyards, but regarding the combining of boundaries, one is obligated."

hebrew_text: דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: לוֹקִין עַל עֵירוּבֵי תְּחוּמִין דְּבַר תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: As Rabbi Ḥiyya taught One is flogged by Torah law for joining of Shabbat boundaries.
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita of Rabbi Hiyya: They may flog for violations of the Shabbat boundary laws as prescribed by the Torah.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: וְכִי לוֹקִין עַל לָאו שֶׁבְּ״אַל״? מַתְקֵיף רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה דִּכְתִיב: ״אַל תִּפְנוּ אֶל הָאוֹבוֹת וְאֶל הַיִּדְּעוֹנִים״, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא לָקֵי?!
human_translation: Rabbi Yonatan strongly objects: Is one flogged for a prohibition that is al , Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov strongly objects If so, that which is written: “Turn you not [ al ] unto the ghosts, nor unto familiar spirits” too that one is not flogged?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Yonatan objects to him: Do we indeed administer lashes for a negative commandment that is transgressed unintentionally? Rav Acha bar Yaakov objects: Rather, now that it is written: "Do not turn to mediums or seek out spiritists," is it not so that one is not lashed?!

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן הָכִי קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ: לָאו שֶׁנִּיתַּן לְאַזְהָרַת מִיתַת בֵּית דִּין. וְכׇל לָאו שֶׁנִּיתַּן לְאַזְהָרַת מִיתַת בֵּית דִּין — אֵין לוֹקִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: this is difficulty for Rabbi Yonatan: a prohibition that was given as a warning of court-imposed capital punishment, And Any prohibition that was given as a warning of court-imposed capital punishment one is not flogged,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yonatan the son of Kashya challenges it: "Is it not a negative commandment punishable by death penalty by the court? And any negative commandment punishable by death penalty by the court - one does not receive lashes for it."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מִי כְּתִיב ״אַל יוֹצִיא״? ״אַל יֵצֵא״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Is it written No shall carry out [ yotzi ], “No shall go out [ yetze ]” is written.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Who is it written "do not bring out"? "Do not bring out" is written.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ מָבוֹי
llm_translation: We will return to you, alleyway.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ עוֹשִׂין פַּסִּין לְבֵירָאוֹת.
human_translation: One may arrange boards [ passin ] around a well
llm_translation: They taught: they make partitions for wells.

hebrew_text: אַרְבָּעָה דְּיוֹמְדִין נִרְאִין כִּשְׁמוֹנָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: שְׁמוֹנָה נִרְאִין כִּשְׁנֵים עָשָׂר — אַרְבָּעָה דְּיוֹמְדִים וְאַרְבָּעָה פְּשׁוּטִין.
human_translation: four double posts [ deyomadin ] that look like eight the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Meir says: eight look like twelve. four double posts, four plain
llm_translation: Four who stand appear as eight, according to the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Meir says: Eight appear as twelve - four who stand and four who are spread out.

hebrew_text: גּוֹבְהָן עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, וְרוֹחְבָּן שִׁשָּׁה וְעוֹבְיָים כׇּל שֶׁהוּא. וּבֵינֵיהֶן כִּמְלֹא שְׁתֵּי רְבָקוֹת שֶׁל שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁלֹשׁ בָּקָר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: The height ten handbreadths, their width six and their thickness a minimal amount. And between them, the size of two teams [ revakot ] of three oxen each; the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Their height is ten handbreadths, and their width is six and all that it is. And between them is like the filling of two troughs of three by three cattle, the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שֶׁל אַרְבַּע, קְשׁוּרוֹת וְלֹא מוּתָּרוֹת, אַחַת נִכְנֶסֶת וְאַחַת יוֹצֵאת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: of four tied and not untied, one entering one is leaving.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: of four, tied and not untied, one enters and one exits.

hebrew_text: מוּתָּר לְהַקְרִיב לַבְּאֵר, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁתְּהֵא פָּרָה רֹאשָׁהּ וְרוּבָּהּ בִּפְנִים וְשׁוֹתָה.
human_translation: It is permitted to bring closer to the well, provided that a cow to its head and the majority of its inside it drinks.
llm_translation: It is permitted to offer sacrifices at the well, provided that its head and the majority of its body are inside, and it drinks.

hebrew_text: מוּתָּר
human_translation: It is permitted
llm_translation: Permitted

hebrew_text: לְהַרְחִיק כׇּל שֶׁהוּא, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיַּרְבֶּה בְּפַסִּין. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד בֵּית סָאתַיִם.
human_translation: to distance any amount, provided that he increases the boards Rabbi Yehuda says: up to two beit se’a ,
llm_translation: To distance all that is, and only that he will increase in Pasin. Rabbi Yehuda says: Up to two Sa'ah.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לֹא אָמְרוּ בֵּית סָאתַיִם אֶלָּא לְגִנָּה וּלְקַרְפֵּף, אֲבָל אִם הָיָה דִּיר אוֹ סַהַר אוֹ מוּקְצֶה אוֹ חָצֵר — אֲפִילּוּ בֵּית חֲמֵשֶׁת כּוֹרִין, אֲפִילּוּ בֵּית עֲשָׂרָה כּוֹרִין מוּתָּר. וּמוּתָּר לְהַרְחִיק כׇּל שֶׁהוּא, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיַּרְבֶּה בְּפַסִּין.
human_translation: said to him: They only spoke of two beit se’a with regard to a garden or an enclosure [ karpef ]. But if it was a pen [ dir ], or a stable [ sahar ], or a backyard, or a courtyard even five beit kor even ten beit kor , it is permitted. And it is permitted to distance by any amount, provided that one increases the boards
llm_translation: They said to him: They only said regarding a courtyard and a roof, but if it was a dwelling or a storehouse or a threshing floor or a courtyard—even if it was the size of five kor, even if it was the size of ten kor—it is permitted. And it is permitted to distance anything, as long as it increases in width.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כַּחֲנַנְיָא, דְּתַנְיָא: עוֹשִׂין פַּסִּין לְבוֹר וַחֲבָלִין לִשְׁיָירָא. וַחֲנַנְיָא אוֹמֵר: חֲבָלִין לְבוֹר, אֲבָל לֹא פַּסִּין.
human_translation: Let us say the mishna is not in accordance with Ḥananya, as it was taught One may arrange boards around a cistern and ropes around a caravan. Ḥananya says: ropes for a cistern, but not boards.
llm_translation: Gemara: Let us say the Mishnah is not like Chananya, as it was taught in a Baraita: They make ropes for a pit and ropes for a well. Chananya says: Ropes for a pit, but not for a well.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא חֲנַנְיָא בּוֹר לְחוּד בְּאֵר לְחוּד.
human_translation: Even if you say Ḥananya, a cistern discrete a well water discrete
llm_translation: Even say Hananiah well separately well separately.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: מִדְּלָא קָתָנֵי ״חֲנַנְיָא אוֹמֵר: עוֹשִׂין חֲבָלִין לְבוֹר וּפַסִּין לִבְאֵר״, מִכְּלָל דְּלַחֲנַנְיָא לָא שְׁנָא בּוֹר וְלָא שְׁנָא בְּאֵר — חֲבָלִין אִין, פַּסִּין לָא. לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כַּחֲנַנְיָא?
human_translation: Some say From that does not teach: Ḥananya says: One may set up ropes around cistern and boards around a well, by inference, according to Ḥananya, there is no difference between a cistern and a well. ropes indeed boards are not. Let us say the mishna is not in accordance with Ḥananya.
llm_translation: There are those who say: Since it does not teach "Chananya says: They make ropes for a pit and cords for a well," from the inference that Chananya did not differentiate between a pit and a well - there are no ropes, and there are no cords. Let us say the Mishnah is not like Chananya?

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא חֲנַנְיָא, לְמַאי דְּקָאָמַר תַּנָּא קַמָּא — קָא מַהְדַּר לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Even if you say Ḥananya, to that which the first tanna had said;
llm_translation: Even if you say it was Hananiah, what is the meaning of what the first Tanna said? He is repeating it.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא? דִּתְנַן: אֶחָד בְּאֵר הָרַבִּים וּבוֹר הָרַבִּים וּבְאֵר הַיָּחִיד עוֹשִׂין לָהֶן פַּסִּין. אֲבָל בּוֹר הַיָּחִיד — עוֹשִׂין לוֹ מְחִיצָה גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: Let us say the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Akiva. As we learned each of a public well, a public cistern, and a private well, one may arrange boards for them, but a private cistern, one must establish partition for it ten handbreadths high; the statement of Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: Let us say the Mishnah that is not like Rabbi Akiva? For we learned: One who digs in a public domain and uncovers a public pit and a private pit, they make partitions for them. But a private pit - they make for it a ten-handbreadth high partition, the words of Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: וְאִילּוּ הָכָא קָתָנֵי: לְבֵירָאוֹת. לְבֵירָאוֹת — אִין, לְבוֹרוֹת לָא.
human_translation: Whereas here it teaches: for a well, for a well, yes, for a cistern, no,
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "And here it is taught: for cisterns. For cisterns - yes, for pits - no."

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, בְּאֵר מַיִם חַיִּים דִּפְסִיקָא לֵיהּ, לָא שְׁנָא דְּרַבִּים וְלָא שְׁנָא דְּיָחִיד — קָתָנֵי. בּוֹר מְכוּנָּסִין דְּלָא פְּסִיקָא לֵיהּ — לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: Even if you say Rabbi Akiva, teaches a well of spring water, which he a distinct there is no difference the public and there is no difference to an individual, he did not teach a cistern collected which he not distinct
llm_translation: Even if you say it is Rabbi Akiva, in a well of living water that is interrupted for him, it does not matter if it is for the public or for an individual - it is taught. A cistern that is not interrupted for him - it is not taught.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא, דִּתְנַן: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵין עוֹשִׂין פַּסִּין אֶלָּא לִבְאֵר הָרַבִּים בִּלְבַד, וְאִילּוּ הָכָא קָתָנֵי לְבֵירָאוֹת — לָא שְׁנָא דְּרַבִּים וְלָא שְׁנָא דְּיָחִיד!
human_translation: Let us say the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava, as we learned Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava says: One may only arrange boards for a public well, whereas here states: For wells. there is no difference the public, and there is no difference to an individual.
llm_translation: Let us say the Mishnah that is not like Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava, as we learned: Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava says: One may only make breaches to clarify the public domain alone, but here it teaches for wells - it is no different whether for the public or for an individual!

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא, מַאי בֵּירָאוֹת — בֵּירָאוֹת דְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: Even if you say Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava, what wells? wells in general,
llm_translation: Even if you say it is Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava, what are "beiraot" - the wells of the world.

hebrew_text: מַאי דְּיוֹמְדִין? אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: דְּיוֹ עַמּוּדִין.
human_translation: What are deyomadin ? Rabbi Yirmeya ben Elazar said: Two [ deyo ] posts [ amudin ],
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "deyomdin"? Rabbi Yirmiyah ben Elazar said: "They are pillars."

hebrew_text: דְּיוֹ לִמְנוּדֶּה שֶׁבַח זוֹנִית נִתְקַלְקֵל בְּמִידָּה שְׁלֹשָׁה סִימָן.
human_translation: Two, to ostracized, praise, nourishment, ruin, attribute, three, mnemonics
llm_translation: If to a designated prostitute praise, she becomes corrupted in three ways.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כֹּל הַשִּׁיתִין פְּטוּרִין, חוּץ מִן הַדְּיוֹפְרָא. מַאי דְּיוֹפְרָא? אָמַר עוּלָּא: אִילָן הָעוֹשֶׂה דְּיוֹ פֵּירוֹת בַּשָּׁנָה.
human_translation: We learned there Rabbi Yehuda says: All inferior figs are exempt except for deyufra . What is deyufra ? Ulla said: A tree that yields two [ deyo ] of fruit [ peirot ] each year.
llm_translation: We learned there, Rabbi Yehuda says: all those who plant are exempt, except for the dyopra. What is the dyopra? Ulla said: a tree that produces fruit in the year.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: דְּיוֹ פַּרְצוּף פָּנִים הָיָה לוֹ לְאָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אָחוֹר וָקֶדֶם צַרְתָּנִי״. כְּתִיב: ״וַיִּבֶן ה׳ אֱלֹהִים אֶת הַצֵּלָע וְגוֹ׳״, רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל: חַד אָמַר פַּרְצוּף, וְחַד אָמַר זָנָב.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya ben Elazar said: Adam two [ deyo ] faces, As it is stated: “You have formed me behind and before, it is written: “And the tzela , which He made Rav and Shmuel One said: face, and one said: a tail [ zanav ],
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya ben Elazar said: The first man had a double-faced appearance, as it is stated: "Behind and before You have formed me." It is written: "And the Lord God built the rib, etc." Rav and Shmuel: one said "face," and one said "tail."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר פַּרְצוּף — הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״אָחוֹר וָקֶדֶם צַרְתָּנִי״. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר זָנָב — מַאי ״אָחוֹר וָקֶדֶם צַרְתָּנִי״?
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says face; that it is written: “You have formed me [ tzartani ] behind and before.” However, according to the one who says tail, what is “You have formed me [ tzartani ] behind and before”?
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says "parzuf" - that is as it is written, "Behind and before You have hemmed me in." But according to the one who says "zanav" - what is "Behind and before You have hemmed me in"?

hebrew_text: כִּדְרַבִּי אַמֵּי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: אָחוֹר לְמַעֲשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית, וָקֶדֶם לְפוּרְעָנוּת.
human_translation: in accordance with Rabbi Ami, as Rabbi Ami said: Behind the act of creation; and before for punishment.
llm_translation: Like Rabbi Ammi, for Rabbi Ammi said: "Back to the work of Creation, and forward to retribution."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא אָחוֹר לְמַעֲשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית — דְּלָא אִיבְּרִי עַד מַעֲלֵי שַׁבְּתָא, אֶלָּא וָקֶדֶם לְפוּרְעָנוּת מַאי הִיא? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם קְלָלָה — הָא בַּתְּחִילָּה נִתְקַלֵּל נָחָשׁ, וּלְבַסּוֹף נִתְקַלְּלָה חַוָּה, וּלְבַסּוֹף נִתְקַלֵּל אָדָם!
human_translation: Granted, behind, in the act of creation, he was not created until Shabbat eve. However, before, for punishment, what this If you say because of the curse Wasn’t the snake was cursed first, and afterward Eve was cursed, and at the end was Adam cursed?
llm_translation: In truth, regarding the incident of the beginning — for it did not come to pass until the eve of the Sabbath, but what is the reason for the punishment beforehand? If you say it is due to a curse — at first, the serpent was cursed, and in the end, Eve was cursed, and in the end, Adam was cursed!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לַמַּבּוּל, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּמַח אֶת כׇּל הַיְקוּם אֲשֶׁר עַל פְּנֵי הָאֲדָמָה מֵאָדָם וְעַד בְּהֵמָה וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rather, to Flood, as it is written: “And He blotted out every living substance which was upon the face of the ground, both man and cattle,
llm_translation: Rather, for the Flood, as it is written: "And He blotted out all existence that was upon the face of the earth, from man to beast, etc."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר פַּרְצוּף, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״וַיִּיצֶר״ תְּרֵין יוֹדִין. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר זָנָב — מַאי ״וַיִּיצֶר״?
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said a face that it is written: formed [ vayyitzer ] a double yod , However, according to the one who said a tail, what is vayyitzer
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says "parzuf," that is as it is written, "and He formed" with two yods. But according to the one who says "zanav" - what is "and He formed"?

hebrew_text: כִּדְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי: אוֹי לִי מִיִּצְרִי, אוֹי לִי מִיּוֹצְרִי.
human_translation: in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi, as Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi said: Woe unto me from my inclination [ yetzer ] and woe to me from my Maker [ Yotzri ]
llm_translation: As Rabbi Shimon ben Pazzi said, as Rabbi Shimon ben Pazzi said: Woe is me from the Yetzer Hara, woe is me from the inclination.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר פַּרְצוּף, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה בְּרָאָם״. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר זָנָב — מַאי ״זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה בְּרָאָם״?
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said a face, that it is written: “Male and female, He created them, However, according to the one who said a tail, what is “Male and female, He created them”?
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says "parzuf," that is as it is written, "male and female He created them." But according to the one who says "zanav" - what is "male and female He created them"?

hebrew_text: לְכִדְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ. דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ רָמֵי, כְּתִיב: ״זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה בְּרָאָם״, וּכְתִיב: ״(כִּי) בְּצֶלֶם אֱלֹהִים בָּרָא אוֹתוֹ״. בַּתְּחִלָּה עָלְתָה בְּמַחְשָׁבָה לִבְראוֹת שְׁנַיִם, וּלְבַסּוֹף לֹא נִבְרָא אֶלָּא אֶחָד.
human_translation: in accordance with Rabbi Abbahu, as Rabbi Abbahu raised a contradiction it is written: “Male and female, He created them,” and it is written: for in the image of God He created him” At first, the thought entered to create two, and ultimately, only one was created.
llm_translation: To Rabbi Avahu. Rabbi Avahu raises an objection: It is written, "Male and female He created them," and it is also written, "(For) in the image of God He created him." Initially, it arose in thought to create two, but in the end, only one was created.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר פַּרְצוּף, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּסְגּוֹר בָּשָׂר תַּחְתֶּנָּה״, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר זָנָב — מַאי ״וַיִּסְגּוֹר בָּשָׂר תַּחְתֶּנָּה״?
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said a face, that it is written: and closed up the flesh in its place” However, according to the one who said a tail, what is “And He closed up the flesh in its place”?
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who said "parzuf," that is as it is written: "And he closed up the flesh underneath," but according to the one who said "zanav" — what is "And he closed up the flesh underneath"?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב זְבִיד, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לִמְקוֹם חֲתָךְ.
human_translation: Rav Zevid said, and some say Rabbi Yirmeya, and some say Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak: It was necessary only with regard to the place of the incision.
llm_translation: Said Rav Zevid, and some say Rabbi Yirmeya, and some say Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak: It was only needed for a place of cutting.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר זָנָב, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּבֶן״, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר פַּרְצוּף — מַאי ״וַיִּבֶן״?
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said a tail; that it is written: “And built However, according to the one who said face what is “And He built”?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Bishlama lem'an de'amar zanav, hainu dikhtiv: 'vayiven', ela lem'an de'amar partsuf - mai 'vayiven'?" English translation: "According to the one who says 'tail,' that is what is written: 'and he built,' but according to the one who says 'face' - what is 'and he built'?"

hebrew_text: לְכִדְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן מְנַסְיָא. דְּדָרֵישׁ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן מְנַסְיָא: ״וַיִּבֶן ה׳ אֱלֹהִים אֶת הַצֵּלָע״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁקִּילְּעָהּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְחַוָּה וֶהֱבִיאָהּ לְאָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן, שֶׁכֵּן בִּכְרַכֵּי הַיָּם קוֹרִין לְקַלָּעִיתָא בַּנָּיְיתָא.
human_translation: in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya, as Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya interpreted homiletically “And the Lord God built the tzela .” teaches that the Holy One, Blessed be He, braided for Eve and brought her to Adam, as in the coastal towns, they call braiding building.
llm_translation: To Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya. Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya expounded: "And the Lord God built the rib" - this teaches that the Holy One, blessed be He, formed it for Chava and brought her to Adam the first man, for in the waves of the sea they call the pearl 'Kalla'ita' in its formation.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״וַיִּבֶן ה׳ אֱלֹהִים״, אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁבְּנָאָהּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְחַוָּה כְּבִנְיָין
human_translation: Alternatively, “And the Lord God built,” Rav Ḥisda said, and some say it is taught in a baraita : teaches that the Holy One, Blessed be He, built Eve like the structure
llm_translation: Another explanation: "And God built," Rav Ḥisdah said, and some say in a baraita: It teaches that in building her, the Holy One, blessed be He, built Eve like a structure.

hebrew_text: אוֹצָר, מָה אוֹצָר זֶה רָחָב מִלְּמַטָּה וְקָצָר מִלְמַעְלָה כְּדֵי לְקַבֵּל אֶת הַפֵּירוֹת — אַף הָאִשָּׁה רְחָבָה מִלְּמַטָּה וּקְצָרָה מִלְמַעְלָה כְּדֵי לְקַבֵּל אֶת הַוָּלָד.
human_translation: of a storehouse. Just as a storehouse is wide on the bottom and narrow on top, in order to hold produce so too a woman wide on the bottom and narrow on top, in order to hold the fetus.
llm_translation: Treasury, what is this treasury that is wide from below and narrow from above in order to receive the fruits - so too the woman is wide from below and narrow from above in order to receive the child.

hebrew_text: ״וַיְבִיאֶהָ אֶל הָאָדָם״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁעָשָׂה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שׁוֹשְׁבִינוּת לָאָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן, מִכָּאן לַגָּדוֹל שֶׁיַּעֲשֶׂה שׁוֹשְׁבִינוּת לַקָּטָן וְאַל יֵרַע לוֹ.
human_translation: “And brought her unto the man” teaches that the Holy One, Blessed be He, was Adam the first best man, From here that a greater individual should serve as a best man for a lesser individual and should not feel bad
llm_translation: "And He brought her to the man" - teaches that the Holy One, blessed be He, made a match for the first man. From here we learn that it is fitting for the elder to make a match for the younger, and it should not be detrimental to him.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר פַּרְצוּף, הֵי מִינַּיְיהוּ סָגֵי בְּרֵישָׁא? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מִסְתַּבְּרָא דְּזָכָר סָגֵי בְּרֵישָׁא, דְּתַנְיָא: לֹא יְהַלֵּךְ אָדָם אֲחוֹרֵי אִשָּׁה בַּדֶּרֶךְ, וַאֲפִילּוּ הִיא אִשְׁתּוֹ. נִזְדַּמְּנָה עַל הַגֶּשֶׁר יְסַלְּקֶנָּה לִצְדָדִין. וְכׇל הָעוֹבֵר אֲחוֹרֵי אִשָּׁה בַּנָּהָר — אֵין לוֹ חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא.
human_translation: And according to the one who says a face which one of them walked in front? Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: It is reasonable that the male walked in front, as it was taught A man should not walk behind a woman on a path, even if she is his wife. If she happens on a bridge, he should move her to side, And anyone who walks behind a woman in a river, has no share in the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: And for the one who says "Parzuf," let him differentiate between them at the outset? Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: It is reasonable that a male should go at the outset, as it was taught: A man should not walk behind a woman on the road, even if she is his wife. If they meet on a bridge, he should move her to the side. And anyone who walks behind a woman by the river - he has no portion in the World to Come.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמַּרְצֶה מָעוֹת לְאִשָּׁה מִיָּדוֹ לְיָדָהּ אוֹ מִיָּדָהּ לְיָדוֹ בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁיִּסְתַּכֵּל בָּהּ, אֲפִילּוּ דּוֹמֶה לְמֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ שֶׁקִּיבֵּל תּוֹרָה מֵהַר סִינַי — לֹא יִנָּקֶה מִדִּינָהּ שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם. וְעָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״יָד לְיָד לֹא יִנָּקֶה רָע״ — לֹא יִנָּקֶה מִדִּינָהּ שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם.
human_translation: The Sages taught: one who counts out money for a woman from his hand into her hand or from her hand into his hand, in order to look upon her, even if he is like Moses our teacher, who received the Torah from Mount Sinai, he will not be absolved from the punishment of Gehenna. The verse says about him: “Hand to hand, the evil man shall not go unpunished” he will not be absolved from the punishment of Gehenna,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who gives coins to a woman, from his hand to her hand, or from her hand to his hand, in order to gaze at her, even if he is as great as our teacher Moses who received the Torah from Mount Sinai, he will not be acquitted from the judgment of Gehenna. And regarding him the verse says: "Hand to hand, he will not go unpunished" - he will not be acquitted from the judgment of Gehenna.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מָנוֹחַ עַם הָאָרֶץ הָיָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיָּקׇם וַיֵּלֶךְ מָנוֹחַ אַחֲרֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: Manoah, was an ignoramus, as it is stated: “And Manoah arose, and went after his wife”
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Manoach was at rest, as it is stated: "And Manoach arose and went after his wife."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, גַּבֵּי אֶלְקָנָה דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֵּלֶךְ אֶלְקָנָה אַחֲרֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ״, הָכִי נָמֵי? וְגַבֵּי אֱלִישָׁע דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּקׇם וַיֵּלֶךְ אַחֲרֶיהָ״, הָכִי נָמֵי?
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak strongly objects to this: If that is so, with regard to Elkana, as it is written: “And Elkana walked after his wife.” this also And with regard to Elisha, as it is written: and he arose and followed her” this also
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak objects to her: Rather, from now on, regarding Elkanah as it is written: "And Elkanah went after his wife," is it really so? And regarding Elisha as it is written: "And he arose and went after her," is it really so?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: אַחֲרֵי דְּבָרֶיהָ וַעֲצָתָהּ, הָכָא נָמֵי — אַחֲרֵי דְּבָרֶיהָ וַעֲצָתָהּ.
human_translation: Rather, he followed her words and advice. here too, he followed words and advice.
llm_translation: Rather: after her words and her advice, here too it is stated - after her words and her advice.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: וּלְמַאי דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן מָנוֹחַ עַם הָאָרֶץ הָיָה, אֲפִילּוּ בֵּי רַב נָמֵי לָא קְרָא. דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתָּקׇם רִבְקָה וְנַעֲרוֹתֶיהָ וַתִּרְכַּבְנָה עַל הַגְּמַלִּים וַתֵּלַכְנָה אַחֲרֵי הָאִישׁ״, וְלָא לִפְנֵי הָאִישׁ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: And according to what Rav Naḥman said, Manoah was an ignoramus, he did not even read in school. As it is written: “Rebecca arose, and her damsels, and they rode upon the camels, and followed the man” not before the man.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: And for what did Rav Nachman say that an ignoramus is at ease, even the household of Rav Nami did not read. As it is written: "And Rebecca arose, and her maidens, and they rode upon the camels, and followed the man," and not before the man.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אַחֲרֵי אֲרִי וְלֹא אַחֲרֵי אִשָּׁה. אַחֲרֵי אִשָּׁה וְלֹא אַחֲרֵי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. אֲחוֹרֵי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וְלֹא אֲחוֹרֵי בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁמִּתְפַּלְּלִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: behind a lion, and not behind a woman. behind a woman and not behind idolatry. behind idolatry and not behind a synagogue at a time of prayer.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: After a lion and not after a woman. After a woman and not after foreign worship. After foreign worship and not after the synagogue at a time when they are praying.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: כָּל אוֹתָן הַשָּׁנִים שֶׁהָיָה אָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן בְּנִידּוּי, הוֹלִיד רוּחִין וְשֵׁידִין וְלִילִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְחִי אָדָם שְׁלֹשִׁים וּמְאַת שָׁנָה וַיּוֹלֶד בִּדְמוּתוֹ כְּצַלְמוֹ״, מִכְּלָל דְּעַד הָאִידָּנָא לָאו כְּצַלְמוֹ אוֹלֵיד.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya ben Elazar said: All those years during which Adam was ostracized he bore spirits, demons, and female demons, as it is stated: “And Adam lived a hundred and thirty years, and begot a son in his own likeness, after his image, By inference, until now, he did not bear after his image,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yirmeya ben Elazar said: All those years that the first man was under condemnation, he begot spirits and demons and lilin, as it is stated: "And Adam lived a hundred and thirty years, and he begot in his likeness, after his image," which implies until now he did not beget in his likeness.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן חָסִיד גָּדוֹל הָיָה, כֵּיוָן שֶׁרָאָה שֶׁנִּקְנְסָה מִיתָה עַל יָדוֹ, יָשַׁב בְּתַעֲנִית מֵאָה שְׁלֹשִׁים שָׁנָה, וּפֵירַשׁ מִן הָאִשָּׁה מֵאָה שְׁלֹשִׁים שָׁנָה, וְהֶעֱלָה זִרְזֵי תְּאֵנִים עַל בְּשָׂרוֹ מֵאָה שְׁלֹשִׁים שָׁנָה.
human_translation: an objection Rabbi Meir would say: Adam the first was very pious. When he saw that death was imposed as a punishment because of him, he observed a fast for a hundred thirty years, and he separated from wife for a hundred thirty years, and wore belts [ zarzei ] of fig on his body a hundred thirty years.
llm_translation: The question was raised: Rabbi Meir used to say, "Adam the first man was a great pious individual. Once he saw that death was decreed upon him, he sat in fasting for one hundred and thirty years, separated from his wife for one hundred and thirty years, and wore fig leaves upon his flesh for one hundred and thirty years."

hebrew_text: כִּי קָאָמְרִינַן הָהוּא, בְּשִׁכְבַת זֶרַע דַּחֲזָא לְאוּנְסֵיהּ.
human_translation: When made his statement, from the semen that accidentally emitted,
llm_translation: For we say that he, in the emission of seed, sees his oppressors.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: מִקְצָת שִׁבְחוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם אוֹמְרִים בְּפָנָיו, וְכוּלּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו. מִקְצָת שִׁבְחוֹ בְּפָנָיו, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי אוֹתְךָ רָאִיתִי צַדִּיק לְפָנַי בַּדּוֹר הַזֶּה״,
human_translation: And Rabbi Yirmeya ben Elazar said: some of a person’s praise should be said in his presence, and all of it not in his presence. some of his praise should be said in his presence, as it is written: for you have I seen righteous before Me in this generation”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yirmeya ben Elazar said: Some of a person's praise they say in his presence, and all of it they say not in his presence. Some of his praise they say in his presence, as it is written: "For I have seen you righteous before Me in this generation."

hebrew_text: כּוּלּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו, דִּכְתִיב: ״נֹחַ אִישׁ צַדִּיק תָּמִים הָיָה בְּדוֹרוֹתָיו״.
human_translation: And all of it not in his presence, as it is written: Noah was a righteous man, and perfect in his generations,
llm_translation: The entirety of him not in his presence, as it is written: "Noah was a righteous man, wholehearted in his generations."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהִנֵּה עֲלֵה זַיִת טָרָף בְּפִיהָ״ — אָמְרָה יוֹנָה לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, יִהְיוּ מְזוֹנוֹתַי מְרוֹרִין כְּזַיִת וּמְסוּרִין בְּיָדְךָ, וְאַל יִהְיוּ מְתוּקִין כִּדְבַשׁ וּתְלוּיִן בְּיַד בָּשָׂר וָדָם. כְּתִיב הָכָא ״טָרָף״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם ״הַטְרִיפֵנִי לֶחֶם חוּקִּי״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yirmeya ben Elazar said: What is which is written: and lo, in her mouth was an olive leaf, plucked off [ taraf ]; The dove said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, let my food be bitter as an olive but given into Your hand, and let it not be sweet as honey but dependent upon flesh and blood. Here it is written: Taraf . And there it is written: feed me [ hatrifeni ] my allotted portion”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yirmeya ben Elazar said, what is the meaning of what is written: "And behold, an olive leaf torn in its mouth" - the dove said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the world, may my sustenance be bitter like an olive and placed in Your hand, and may it not be sweet like honey and dependent on flesh and blood. It is written here "torn," and it is written there "break my bread."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: כׇּל בַּיִת שֶׁנִּשְׁמָעִין בּוֹ דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה בַּלַּיְלָה, שׁוּב אֵינוֹ נֶחְרָב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלֹא אָמַר אַיֵּה אֱלוֹהַּ עוֹשָׂי נוֹתֵן זְמִירוֹת בַּלָּיְלָה״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yirmeya ben Elazar said: Any house in which the words of Torah are heard at night will never be destroyed, as it is stated: “But none says: Where is God my Maker, Who gives songs in the night”
llm_translation: And said Rabbi Yirmeya ben Elazar: Every house that words of Torah are heard in it at night, it will not be destroyed, as it is stated: "And He did not say, 'Where is God my Maker, who gives songs in the night?'"

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: מִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, דַּיּוֹ לָעוֹלָם שֶׁיִּשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בִּשְׁתֵּי אוֹתִיּוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כֹּל הַנְּשָׁמָה תְּהַלֵּל יָהּ הַלְלוּיָהּ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yirmeya ben Elazar said: From the day that the Temple was destroyed, it is enough for the world to use two letters as it is stated: “Let everything that has breath praise the Lord [ Yah ]. Halleluya ”
llm_translation: And said Rabbi Yirmeya ben Elazar: From the day that the Temple was destroyed, it is enough for the world to make use of two letters, as it is said: "Let every soul praise the Lord, Hallelujah."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: נִתְקַלְּלָה בָּבֶל — נִתְקַלְּלוּ שְׁכֵינֶיהָ, נִתְקַלְּלָה שׁוֹמְרוֹן — נִתְבָּרְכוּ שְׁכֵינֶיהָ. נִתְקַלְּלָה בָּבֶל נִתְקַלְּלוּ שְׁכֵינֶיהָ — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְשַׂמְתִּיהָ לְמוֹרַשׁ קִיפּוֹד וְאַגְמֵי מָיִם״. נִתְקַלְּלָה שׁוֹמְרוֹן נִתְבָּרְכוּ שְׁכֵינֶיהָ — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְשַׂמְתִּי שׁוֹמְרוֹן לְעִי הַשָּׂדֶה
human_translation: And Rabbi Yirmeya ben Elazar said: Babylonia was cursed, its neighbors were cursed Samaria was cursed, its neighbors were blessed. Babylonia was cursed, its neighbors were cursed, as it is written: “I will also make it a possession for wild birds, and pools of water” Samaria was cursed, its neighbors were blessed, as it is written: “Therefore I will turn Samaria into a heap of rubble in the field
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yirmiyah ben Elazar said: Babylon was cursed - its ministers were cursed; Samaria was blessed - its ministers were blessed. Babylon was cursed, its ministers were cursed - as it is written: "And I will make it a possession for the hedgehog, and pools of water." Samaria was cursed, its ministers were blessed - as it is written: "And I will make Samaria a heap of ruins in the field."

hebrew_text: לְמַטָּעֵי כָרֶם״.
human_translation: for planting vines”
llm_translation: "To plant a vineyard."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: בֹּא וּרְאֵה שֶׁלֹּא כְּמִדַּת הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִדַּת בָּשָׂר וְדָם. מִדַּת בָּשָׂר וָדָם, מִתְחַיֵּיב אָדָם הֲרִיגָה לַמַּלְכוּת — מְטִילִין לוֹ חַכָּה לְתוֹךְ פִּיו כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יְקַלֵּל אֶת הַמֶּלֶךְ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yirmeya ben Elazar said: Come and see that the attribute of flesh and blood is unlike the attribute of the Holy One, Blessed be He. the attribute of flesh and blood place an hook in the mouth a person who was sentenced to death by the government, so that he should not curse the king
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yirmeya ben Elazar said: Come and see that the measure of the Holy One, blessed be He, is not like the measure of flesh and blood. The measure of flesh and blood, if a person is deserving of death by the kingdom, they place a gag in his mouth so that he does not curse the king.

hebrew_text: מִדַּת הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, אָדָם מִתְחַיֵּיב הֲרִיגָה לַמָּקוֹם — שׁוֹתֵק, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לְךָ דוּמִיָּה תְהִלָּה״, וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁמְּשַׁבֵּחַ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תְּהִלָּה״. וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁדּוֹמֶה לוֹ כְּאִילּוּ מַקְרִיב קׇרְבָּן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּלְךָ יְשׁוּלַּם נֶדֶר״.
human_translation: the attribute of the Holy One, Blessed be He one is silent is sentenced to death by the Omnipresent, as it is stated: “For You silence is praise, And what is more, he praises as it is stated: “Praise.” And what is more, it appears to him as though he were offering a sacrifice as it is stated: “And to You shall the vow be performed.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Midat HaKadosh Baruch Hu, adam mitchayev harigah laMakom - shotek, shene'emar: 'lecha dumiyah tehillah', ve'lo od ela she'meshabech, shene'emar: 'tehillah'. Ve'lo od ela she'domeh lo ke'ilu makriv korban, shene'emar: 'ulcha yeshulam neder'." English translation: "The attribute of the Holy One, blessed be He, a person is obligated to silence before the Omnipresent - he remains silent, as it is said: 'To You silence is praise,' and not only that but he praises, as it is said: 'praise.' And not only that but he resembles one who brings an offering, as it is said: 'and to You shall be paid the vow.'"

hebrew_text: הַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״עוֹבְרֵי בְּעֵמֶק הַבָּכָא מַעְיָן יְשִׁיתוּהוּ גַּם בְּרָכוֹת יַעְטֶה מוֹרֶה״.
human_translation: And this is Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: What is which is written: “Those who pass through the valley of weeping turn it into a water spring; moreover, the early rain covers it with blessings”
llm_translation: That is what Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: What is the meaning of what is written, "Those who pass through the Valley of Baca will make it a place of springs; the early rain also covers it with blessings"?

hebrew_text: ״עוֹבְרֵי״ — אֵלּוּ בְּנֵי אָדָם שֶׁעוֹבְרִין עַל רְצוֹנוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא. ״עֵמֶק״ — שֶׁמַּעֲמִיקִין לָהֶם גֵּיהִנָּם. ״הַבָּכָא״ — שֶׁבּוֹכִין וּמוֹרִידִין דְּמָעוֹת כְּמַעְיָין שֶׁל שִׁיתִין. ״גַּם בְּרָכוֹת יַעְטֶה מוֹרֶה״ — שֶׁמַּצְדִּיקִין עֲלֵיהֶם אֶת הַדִּין, וְאוֹמְרִים לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, יָפֶה דַּנְתָּ, יָפֶה זִכֵּיתָ, יָפֶה חִיַּיבְתָּ, וְיָפֶה תִּקַּנְתָּ גֵּיהִנָּם לָרְשָׁעִים גַּן עֵדֶן לַצַּדִּיקִים.
human_translation: “Those who pass through [ overei ],” these are people who transgress [ overin ] the will of the Holy One, Blessed be He. “Valley [ emek ]” Gehenna is deepened [ ma’amikin ] for them. “Of weeping [ bakha ]” they weep [ bokhin ] and make tears flow like a spring [ ma’ayan ] of the foundations [ shitin ], “Moreover, the early rain covers it with blessings,” they accept judgment, and say before Him: Master of the Universe, You have judged properly, You have acquitted properly, You have condemned properly, and it is befitting that You have prepared Gehenna for the wicked and the Garden of Eden for the righteous.
llm_translation: "Transgressors" - these are human beings who transgress the will of the Holy One, blessed be He. "Valley" - for them Gehenna is deepened. "The Weeper" - who weep and shed tears like the waters of a well. "Also with blessings he will cover the teacher" - they justify the judgment upon them, and say before Him: Master of the World, You have judged beautifully, You have acquitted beautifully, You have obligated beautifully, and You have beautifully prepared Gehenna for the wicked and Gan Eden for the righteous.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: רְשָׁעִים אֲפִילּוּ עַל פִּתְחוֹ שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם אֵינָם חוֹזְרִין בִּתְשׁוּבָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְיָצְאוּ וְרָאוּ בְּפִגְרֵי הָאֲנָשִׁים הַפּוֹשְׁעִים בִּי וְגוֹ׳״, ״שֶׁפָּשְׁעוּ״ לֹא נֶאֱמַר, אֶלָּא ״הַפּוֹשְׁעִים״ — שֶׁפּוֹשְׁעִים וְהוֹלְכִין לְעוֹלָם!
human_translation: Is that so? Didn’t Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish say: The wicked do not repent, even at the entrance to Gehenna, as it is stated: “And they shall go forth, and look upon the carcasses of the men who rebel against Me; does not say: Who rebelled, but “Who rebel,” they continue rebelling forever.
llm_translation: I?! And didn't Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish say: The wicked, even at the entrance of Gehinnom, do not repent, as it is stated: "And they shall go forth and look upon the carcasses of the men who have transgressed against Me, etc." (Isaiah 66:24) It does not say "who have transgressed," but "the transgressors" - they transgressed and go to eternity!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּפוֹשְׁעֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, הָא — בְּפוֹשְׁעֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: not difficult; here, to the sinners of the Jewish people; there, to the rebels among the nations of the world.
llm_translation: Not difficult: this - regarding the transgressions of Israel, this - regarding the transgressions of the nations of the world.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִם כֵּן קַשְׁיָא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אַדְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ. דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: פּוֹשְׁעֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֵין אוּר גֵּיהִנָּם שׁוֹלֶטֶת בָּהֶן, קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִמִּזְבַּח הַזָּהָב.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable if so, a contradiction of Reish Lakish and of Reish Lakish. As Reish Lakish said: the sinners of the Jewish people, the fire of Gehenna has no power over them, a fortiori from the golden altar.
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: For if so, the difficulty of Reish Lakish is a difficulty. For Reish Lakish said: The transgressors of Israel, Gehenna does not have dominion over them, a fortiori from the golden altar.

hebrew_text: מָה מִזְבַּח הַזָּהָב, שֶׁאֵין עָלָיו אֶלָּא כְּעוֹבִי דִּינַר זָהָב, עָמַד כַּמָּה שָׁנִים וְלֹא שָׁלְטָה בּוֹ הָאוּר. פּוֹשְׁעֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁמְּלֵיאִין מִצְוֹת כְּרִמּוֹן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כְּפֶלַח הָרִמּוֹן רַקָּתֵךְ״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״רַקָּתֵךְ״ אֶלָּא ״רֵיקָתֵיךְ״, שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ רֵיקָנִין שֶׁבָּךְ מְלֵיאִין מִצְוֹת כְּרִמּוֹן — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: If the golden altar which was only covered by the thickness of a golden dinar, stood for many years and the fire did not burn it, the sinners of the Jewish people, who are filled with good deeds like a pomegranate, as it is stated: “Your temples [ rakatekh ] are like a split pomegranate And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said Do not read: Your temples [ rakatekh ], but Your empty ones [ reikateikh ], even the sinners among you are full of mitzvot like a pomegranate; how much more so
llm_translation: The golden altar, upon which there is nothing except the weight of a dinar of gold, stood for many years and the light did not have dominion over it. The transgressors of Israel, who fulfill mitzvot like a pomegranate, as it is said: "Your temples are like a slice of pomegranate." And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Do not read it as "your temples" but as "your empty spaces," for even your empty spaces are filled with mitzvot like a pomegranate - how much more so the full ones.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דִּכְתִיב: ״עוֹבְרֵי בְּעֵמֶק הַבָּכָא״, הָהוּא דִּמְחַיְּיבִי הָהִיא שַׁעְתָּא בְּגֵיהִנָּם, וְאָתֵי אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ וּמַסֵּיק לְהוּ וּמְקַבֵּל לְהוּ. בַּר מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁבָּא עַל הַגּוֹיָה, דְּמָשְׁכָה עׇרְלָתוֹ וְלָא מְבַשְׁקַר לֵיהּ.
human_translation: However, that which is written: “Those who pass through the valley of weeping” There those who are liable at that time in Gehenna, but our father Abraham comes and raises them up and receives them. except for a Jew who had relations with a gentile woman, his foreskin is drawn, and does not recognize him
llm_translation: Rather, this that is written: "Those who pass through the Valley of Weeping," that refers to those who are obligated to spend a certain time in Gehenna, and Abraham our father comes and intercedes for them and they are forgiven. Who is the son of Israel who came upon the heathen, whose foreskin was drawn but was not examined.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב כָּהֲנָא: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ ״הַפּוֹשְׁעִים״ — דְּפָשְׁעִי וְאָזְלִי, אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה דִּכְתִיב ״הַמּוֹצִיא״ וְ״הַמַּעֲלֶה״ — דְּמַסֵּיק וּדְמַפֵּיק הוּא?! אֶלָּא דְּאַסֵּיק וְאַפֵּיק, הָכִי נָמֵי — דְּפָשְׁעִי הוּא.
human_translation: Rav Kahana strongly objected to this: Now you have said those who rebel those who go on rebelling, if so, it is written of “He Who brings out” and “He Who raises up” He Who is raising up and bringing out? Rather, He Who raised up and brought out; here too those who rebelled.
llm_translation: Challenges her Rav Kahana: The instance where you said "those who transgress" - they transgress and depart. Rather, now that it is written "the one who brings out" and "the one who brings up" - he concludes and he brings out?! Rather, he concludes and he brings out, so it is said - he is a transgressor.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה (בַּר) אֶלְעָזָר: שְׁלֹשָׁה פְּתָחִים יֵשׁ לַגֵּיהִנָּם, אֶחָד בַּמִּדְבָּר וְאֶחָד בַּיָּם וְאֶחָד בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם. בַּמִּדְבָּר, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֵּרְדוּ הֵם וְכׇל אֲשֶׁר לָהֶם חַיִּים שְׁאוֹלָה״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yirmeya ben Elazar said: There are three entrances to Gehenna, one in the wilderness, one in the sea, and one in Jerusalem. in the wilderness, as it is written “And they, and all that appertained to them, went down alive into the pit [ She’ol ],
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yirmeya (son) of Elazar said: There are three entrances to Gehinnom, one in the desert, one in the sea, and one in Jerusalem. In the desert, as it is written: "And they went down, they and all that was theirs, alive into Sheol."

hebrew_text: בַּיָּם, דִּכְתִיב: ״מִבֶּטֶן שְׁאוֹל שִׁוַּעְתִּי שָׁמַעְתָּ קוֹלִי״.
human_translation: In the sea as it is written “Out of the belly of the netherworld [ She’ol ] I cried, and You did hear my voice”
llm_translation: In the sea, as it is written: "Out of the belly of Sheol I cried, and You heard my voice."

hebrew_text: בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, דִּכְתִיב: ״נְאֻם ה׳ אֲשֶׁר אוּר לוֹ בְּצִיּוֹן וְתַנּוּר לוֹ בִּירוּשָׁלִָים״. וְתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״אֲשֶׁר אוּר לוֹ בְּצִיּוֹן״ — זוֹ גֵּיהִנָּם, ״וְתַנּוּר לוֹ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם״ — זוֹ פִּתְחָהּ שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם.
human_translation: in Jerusalem, as it is written: “Says the Lord, Whose fire is in Zion, and Whose furnace is in Jerusalem” And taught the school of Rabbi Yishmael: “Whose fire is in Zion,” this is Gehenna; and “Whose furnace is in Jerusalem,” this is an entrance to Gehenna.
llm_translation: In Jerusalem, as it is written: "The word of the Lord that has settled in Zion and His furnace in Jerusalem." And it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: "That has settled in Zion" — this is Gehinnom, "and His furnace in Jerusalem" — this is the entrance to Gehinnom.

hebrew_text: וְתוּ לֵיכָּא? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי מָרִיּוֹן אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ תָּנָא רַבָּה בַּר מָרִיּוֹן בִּדְבֵי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי: שְׁתֵּי תְמָרוֹת יֵשׁ בְּגֵי בֶּן הִנּוֹם וְעוֹלֶה עָשָׁן מִבֵּינֵיהֶן, וְזוֹ הִיא שֶׁשָּׁנִינוּ: צִינֵי הַר הַבַּרְזֶל כְּשֵׁירוֹת, וְזוֹ הִיא פִּתְחָהּ שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם! — דִּילְמָא הַיְינוּ דִּירוּשָׁלַיִם.
human_translation: Are there no more Didn’t Rabbi Maryon say in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, and some say Rabba bar Maryon taught in the school of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Zakkai: There are two date trees in the valley of ben Hinnom, and smoke rises from between them, this we learned: The palms of Har HaBarzel are fit and this is the entrance to Gehenna. perhaps this is the in Jerusalem.
llm_translation: And is there not? But Rabbi Mariyon said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, and some say it was taught by Rabba bar Mariyon in the name of Rabbi Yochanan ben Zakkai: There are two palm trees in the valley of Ben Hinom, and smoke ascends between them, and this is what we learned: The branches of the Iron Mountain are like harps, and this is its entrance to Gehinnom! — Perhaps this is Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: שִׁבְעָה שֵׁמוֹת יֵשׁ לְגֵיהִנָּם, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: שְׁאוֹל, וַאֲבַדּוֹן, וּבְאֵר שַׁחַת, וּבוֹר שָׁאוֹן, וְטִיט הַיָּוֵן, וְצַלְמָוֶת, וְאֶרֶץ הַתַּחְתִּית.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Gehenna has seven names, and they are as follows: She’ol, Avadon, Be’er Shaḥat, Bor Shaon, Tit HaYaven, Tzalmavet, and Eretz HaTaḥtit.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Seven names Gehinnom has, and they are: Sheol, Abaddon, the Pit of Destruction, the Pit of Noise, the Mire of the Pit, Shadow of Death, and the Netherworld.

hebrew_text: שְׁאוֹל, דִּכְתִיב: ״מִבֶּטֶן שְׁאוֹל שִׁוַּעְתִּי שָׁמַעְתָּ קוֹלִי״. אֲבַדּוֹן, דִּכְתִיב: ״הַיְסוּפַּר בַּקֶּבֶר חַסְדֶּךָ אֱמוּנָתְךָ בָּאֲבַדּוֹן״. בְּאֵר שַׁחַת, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי לֹא תַעֲזוֹב נַפְשִׁי לִשְׁאוֹל לֹא תִתֵּן חֲסִידְךָ לִרְאוֹת שָׁחַת״. וּבוֹר שָׁאוֹן וָטִיט הַיָּוֵן, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעֲלֵנִי מִבּוֹר שָׁאוֹן מִטִּיט הַיָּוֵן״. וְצַלְמָוֶת, דִּכְתִיב: ״יוֹשְׁבֵי חוֹשֶׁךְ וְצַלְמָוֶת״. ״וְאֶרֶץ הַתַּחְתִּית״ — גְּמָרָא הוּא.
human_translation: She’ol, as it is written: “Out of the belly of the netherworld [ she’ol ] I cried and You did hear my voice” Avadon, as it is written: “Shall Your steadfast love be reported in the grave or Your faithfulness in destruction [ avadon ]?” Be’er Shaḥat, as it is written: “For You will not abandon my soul to the netherworld; nor will You suffer Your pious one to see the pit [ shaḥat ]” And Bor Shaon and Tit HaYaven, as it is written: “He brought me up also out of the gruesome pit [ bor shaon ], out of the miry clay [ tit hayaven ]” And Tzalmavet, as it is written: “Such as sat in darkness and in the shadow of death [ tzalmavet ], And Eretz Taḥtit, it is tradition
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Sheol, as it is written: 'From the belly of Sheol I cried out, You heard my voice.' Abaddon, as it is written: 'Will Your kindness be declared in the grave, Your faithfulness in Abaddon.' Pit of destruction, as it is written: 'For You will not abandon my soul to Sheol, You will not allow Your faithful one to see the Pit.' Pit of noise and mire, as it is written: 'He brought me up from the Pit of noise, from the mire of the swamp.' And shadow of death, as it is written: 'Those who dwell in darkness and the shadow of death.' 'And the netherworld' — this is the conclusion."

hebrew_text: וְתוּ לֵיכָּא? וְהָאִיכָּא ״גֵּיהִנָּם״! — גֵּיא שֶׁעֲמוּקָּה (בְּגֵיהִנָּם), שֶׁהַכֹּל יוֹרֵד לָהּ עַל עִסְקֵי הִנָּם.
human_translation: Are there no more Isn’t there Gehenna? A valley that is as deep as the valley [ gei ] of Hinnom. Into which all descend for vain [ hinnam ] acts,
llm_translation: And is there a place? But there is "Gehinnam"! — A valley that is deep (in Gehinnam), to which everyone descends for the matters of Gehinnam.

hebrew_text: וְהָאִיכָּא ״תׇּפְתֶּה״, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי עָרוּךְ מֵאֶתְמוּל תׇּפְתֶּה״, הָהוּא שֶׁכׇּל הַמִּתְפַּתֶּה בְּיִצְרוֹ יִפּוֹל שָׁם.
human_translation: Isn’t there Tofte, as it is written: “For its hearth [ tofte ] is ordained of old” That that anyone who allows himself to be seduced [ mitpateh ] by his inclination will fall there.
llm_translation: And there is the word "tafteh," as it is written: "For he is prepared from yesterday, tafteh," that one who deceives himself with his inclination will fall there.

hebrew_text: גַּן עֵדֶן. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אִם בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל הוּא — בֵּית שְׁאָן פִּתְחוֹ, וְאִם בַּעֲרַבְיָא — בֵּית גֶּרֶם פִּתְחוֹ, וְאִם בֵּין הַנְּהָרוֹת הוּא — דּוּמַסְקְנִין פִּתְחוֹ. בְּבָבֶל — אַבָּיֵי מִשְׁתַּבַּח בְּפֵירֵי דְּמַעֲבַר יַמִּינָא, רָבָא מִשְׁתַּבַּח בְּפֵירֵי דְהַרְפַּנְיָא.
human_translation: the Garden of Eden. Reish Lakish said: If it is in Eretz Yisrael, its entrance is Beit She’an, and if in Arabia, its entrance is Beit Garem, and if between the rivers its entrance is Dumsekanin, Abaye praise the fruits of the right bank and Rava praise the fruits of Harpanya.
llm_translation: Garden of Eden. Reish Lakish said: If it is in the land of Israel — Beit She'an is its entrance, and if it is in Arabia — Beit Garem is its entrance, and if it is between the rivers — Dumasqin is its entrance. In Babylonia — Abbaye praises the fruits of the other side of the sea, Rava praises the fruits of the Euphrates.

hebrew_text: וּבֵינֵיהֶן כִּמְלוֹא שְׁתֵּי וְכוּ׳. פְּשִׁיטָא, כֵּיוָן דִּתְנָא לֵיהּ דִּקְשׁוּרוֹת הָווּ — אֲנַן יָדְעִינַן דְּלָא הָווּ מוּתָּרוֹת!
human_translation: And between them, the size of two teams obvious; since the tanna taught they are tied, we know that they are not untied.
llm_translation: And between them the space of two and so forth. It is obvious, since it was taught to him that they were tied — we know that they were not permitted!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: קְשׁוּרוֹת — כְּעֵין קְשׁוּרוֹת, אֲבָל מַמָּשׁ לָא — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן וְלֹא מוּתָּרוֹת.
human_translation: lest you say tied similar to tied, but not actually teaches us and not untied.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "What is the reasoning: 'Keshurot' - like 'ein keshurot', but not literally - it is teaching us and not permitted."

hebrew_text: אַחַת נִכְנֶסֶת וְאַחַת יוֹצֵאת. תָּנָא: רִבְקָה נִכְנֶסֶת וְרִבְקָה יוֹצֵאת. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כַּמָּה רֹאשָׁהּ וְרוּבָּהּ שֶׁל פָּרָה — שְׁתֵּי אַמּוֹת, וְכַמָּה עוֹבְיָהּ שֶׁל פָּרָה — אַמָּה וּשְׁנֵי שְׁלִישֵׁי אַמָּה.
human_translation: one can enter and another can leave. was taught one team can enter and team can leave. Our Sages taught How much is the head and most of the body of a cow? Two cubits. And how much is the thickness of a cow? A cubit and two-thirds of a cubit,
llm_translation: One enters and one exits. It was taught: Rivkah enters and Rivkah exits. The Sages taught: How long is the head and body of a cow? — Two cubits. And how wide is it? — One cubit and two-thirds of a cubit.

hebrew_text: שֶׁהֵן כְּעֶשֶׂר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כִּשְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה וּכְאַרְבַּע עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה.
human_translation: so that is approximately ten the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda said approximately thirteen cubits or approximately fourteen cubits.
llm_translation: They are like ten, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: like thirteen cubits and like fourteen cubits.

hebrew_text: ״כְּעֶשֶׂר״? הָא עֶשֶׂר הָוְיָין! מִשּׁוּם דְּבָעֵי לְמִיתְנָא סֵיפָא ״כִּשְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה״.
human_translation: Approximately ten Isn’t it ten Since he wanted to teach: Approximately thirteen, in the last clause,
llm_translation: "Like ten"? But ten are they! Because it needs to teach the latter clause "like thirteen."

hebrew_text: ״כִּשְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה״ — טְפֵי הָוְיָין? מִשּׁוּם דְּבָעֵי לְמִתְנֵי ״כְּאַרְבַּע עֶשְׂרֵה״. ״וּכְאַרְבַּע עֶשְׂרֵה״ — הָא לָא הָוְיָא? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: יְתֵירוֹת עַל שְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה, וְאֵינָן מַגִּיעוֹת לְאַרְבַּע עֶשְׂרֵה.
human_translation: Approximately thirteen, it is more? Since he wanted to teach: Approximately fourteen, But they are not approximately fourteen, Rav Pappa said: more than thirteen and not reach fourteen
llm_translation: "Regarding 'thirteen' — are they considered as 'a little'? Because they require to be taught as 'fourteen.' 'And as fourteen' — but are they not considered? Rav Papa said: Excesses over thirteen, and do not reach fourteen."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בְּבוֹר שְׁמוֹנֶה דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּלָא בָּעִינַן פְּשׁוּטִין.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: With regard to cistern eight everyone agrees, that there is no need upright
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: In a pit eight handbreadths deep, everyone agrees that we do not require a partition.

hebrew_text: בְּבוֹר שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה — דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּבָעֵינַן פְּשׁוּטִין.
human_translation: With regard to a cistern twelve everyone agrees that there is a need for upright
llm_translation: In a pit twelve — all the world does not argue that we require simple interpretations.

hebrew_text: כִּי פְּלִיגִי — מִשְּׁמוֹנֶה עַד שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה. לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר בָּעִינַן פְּשׁוּטִין. לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא בָּעִינַן פְּשׁוּטִין.
human_translation: Where they disagree between eight twelve According to Rabbi Meir, one must upright according to Rabbi Yehuda, one need not upright
llm_translation: When they dispute - from eight until twelve. According to Rabbi Meir, we require simple interpretations. According to Rabbi Yehuda, we do not require simple interpretations.

hebrew_text: וְרַב פָּפָּא מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנֵינָא?!
human_translation: And what is Rav Pappa teaching us? We learned
llm_translation: And Rav Papa, what is he teaching us? We have learned?!

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא בָּרָיְיתָא לָא שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ, וְקָא מַשְׁמַע לַן כְּבָרַיְיתָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa did not hear baraita , and he taught us as baraita .
llm_translation: Rav Papa son of Raita did not hear it, and he is inferring to us like Raita.

hebrew_text: אֲרִיךְ יוֹתֵר בְּתֵל חִיצַת חָצֵר שֶׁיָּבְשָׁה סִימָן. בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ אַבָּיֵי מֵרַבָּה: הֶאֱרִיךְ בִּדְיוֹמְדִין כְּשִׁיעוּר פְּשׁוּטִין, לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר מַהוּ?
human_translation: Extended, more, in a mound, a barrier of, a courtyard, that dried up; mnemonic Abaye raised a dilemma before Rabba: one extended the double posts, the measure of an upright what according to Rabbi Meir?
llm_translation: Lengthier more in Tel courtyard that dried sign. Asked from him Abaye from Rava: Lengthened in dried as measurement simple, to Rabbi Meir what?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: ״וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיַּרְבֶּה בְּפַסִּין״. מַאי לָאו דְּמַאֲרִיךְ בִּדְיוֹמְדִין? לָא, דְּמַפֵּישׁ וְעָבֵיד פְּשׁוּטִין.
human_translation: to him: We learned it Provided that he increases the boards. Does not that he extends the double posts, No, that he makes more upright
llm_translation: He said to him, "You should teach it: 'And only if it increases in value by a quarter.' What is the reason that one should not prolong in judgments? Not because he confuses and makes simple."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הַאי ״וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיַּרְבֶּה בְּפַסִּין״, ״עַד שֶׁיַּרְבֶּה פַּסִּין״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! תְּנִי ״עַד שֶׁיַּרְבֶּה פַּסִּין״.
human_translation: If so, this Provided that he increases the boards, it should have Provided that he increases the boards. Teach: Provided that he increases boards.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, this one "and only if it increases in value," "until it increases in value" is required! It teaches "until it increases in value." English translation:

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: ״וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיַּרְבֶּה בְּפַסִּין״. מַאי לָאו דְּמַפֵּישׁ וְעָבֵיד פְּשׁוּטִין? לָא, דְּמַאֲרִיךְ בִּדְיוֹמְדִין.
human_translation: There are who say said to We learned it: Provided that he increases the boards. Does not that he makes more upright No, that he extends the double posts,
llm_translation: There are some who say: he said to him, "You have taught it: 'And only that it should increase in fine flour.'" What is it that he does not grind and make into fine flour? Not that he grinds and makes into fine flour, but that he prolongs with kneading.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, מִדְּקָתָנֵי ״וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיַּרְבֶּה בְּפַסִּין״. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable from the fact that teaches: Provided that he increases the boards, learn from this
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: "And only if it increases in value." Learn from it.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ אַבָּיֵי מֵרַבָּה: יוֹתֵר מִשְּׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה וּשְׁלִישׁ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַהוּ? פְּשׁוּטִין עָבֵיד, אוֹ בִּדְיוֹמְדִין מַאֲרֵיךְ?
human_translation: Abaye raised dilemma before Rabba: more than thirteen and a third cubits, what according to Rabbi Yehuda? Does he bring upright or does he extend the double posts,
llm_translation: Abaye asked Rabbah: More than thirteen cubits and a third according to Rabbi Yehuda, what is the law? Does he make a partition, or does he extend the measurement?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תְּנֵיתוּהָ. כַּמָּה הֵן מְקוֹרָבִין — כְּדֵי רֹאשָׁהּ וְרוּבָּהּ שֶׁל פָּרָה. וְכַמָּה מְרוּחָקִין — אֲפִילּוּ כּוֹר וַאֲפִילּוּ כּוֹרַיִים.
human_translation: said to him: We learned How close as the head and most of a cow. And how far even a kor and even two kor ,
llm_translation: He said to him: "You should give it." How close are they considered? - The time it takes for its head and the majority of its body to be covered by the earth of the cow. And how far are they considered? - Even a pit and even two pits.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בֵּית סָאתַיִם מוּתָּר, יוֹתֵר מִבֵּית סָאתַיִם אָסוּר. אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אִי אַתָּה מוֹדֶה בְּדִיר וְסַהַר וּמוּקְצֶה וְחָצֵר, אֲפִילּוּ בַּת חֲמֵשֶׁת כּוֹרִים וַאֲפִילּוּ בַּת עֲשָׂרָה כּוֹרִים שֶׁמּוּתָּר?
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: two beit se’a , it is permitted more than two beit se’a is prohibited. said to Rabbi Yehuda: Do you not agree with regard to a pen, and stable, and a backyard, and a courtyard that even of five beit kor and even of ten beit kor is permitted
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: A Beit Sa'ataim (a measurement of area) is permitted, more than a Beit Sa'ataim is prohibited. They said to Rabbi Yehuda: If you concede regarding a Dir, Sahar, Muktzeh, and Chatzer, even for a daughter of five kor (a measurement of volume), and even for a daughter of ten kor, is it permitted?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן: זוֹ מְחִיצָה, וְאֵלּוּ פַּסִּין.
human_translation: said to them: this is a partition, whereas these are boards.
llm_translation: He said to them: This is a mechitzah, and these are pasin.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אִיתָא, זוֹ מְחִיצָה וְזוֹ הִיא מְחִיצָה מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: And if it is so he, should have This is a partition and that is a partition.
llm_translation: "And if it is stated, this is a partition and this is a partition, it requires it!"

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: זוֹ תּוֹרַת מְחִיצָה עָלֶיהָ — וּפִרְצוֹתֶיהָ בְּעֶשֶׂר, וְאֵלּוּ תּוֹרַת פַּסִּין עֲלֵיהֶן — וּפִרְצוֹתֵיהֶן בִּשְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה וּשְׁלִישׁ.
human_translation: is saying as follows: This the laws of a partition, and its breaches ten Whereas these, the laws of boards, and their breaches thirteen and a third cubits.
llm_translation: Thus he said: This is the law of a partition upon it - and its breaches are ten, and these are the laws of corners upon them - and their breaches are thirteen cubits and a third.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ אַבָּיֵי מֵרַבָּה: תֵּל הַמִּתְלַקֵּט עֲשָׂרָה מִתּוֹךְ אַרְבַּע, נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם דְּיוֹמָד אוֹ אֵינוֹ נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם דְּיוֹמָד?
human_translation: Abaye raised dilemma before Rabba: Can a mound that rises ten within four serve as a double post or can it not serve as a double post?
llm_translation: Abaye asked Rabbah: If a cluster of ten grapes is taken from within four clusters, is it considered as if it is detached from the vine or is it not considered as if it is detached?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הָיְתָה שָׁם אֶבֶן מְרוּבַּעַת רוֹאִין, כׇּל שֶׁאִילּוּ תְּחַלֵּק וְיֵשׁ בָּהּ אַמָּה לְכָאן וְאַמָּה לְכָאן נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם דְּיוֹמָד, וְאִם לָאו אֵינוֹ נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם דְּיוֹמָד.
human_translation: said to him: We learned this Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: a square stone was present, we see Wherever it can be divided there would remain a cubit here and a cubit there it can serve as a double post; but if not, it cannot serve as a double post.
llm_translation: He said to him, "You have taught it: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: If there was there a square stone, all that if it will divide and there is in it a cubit to here and a cubit to there, it is judged due to the law of yomad, and if not, it is not judged due to the law of yomad."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה אוֹמֵר: הָיְתָה שָׁם אֶבֶן עֲגוּלָּה, רוֹאִין כׇּל שֶׁאִילּוּ תֵּחָקֵק וְתֵחָלֵק וְיֵשׁ בָּהּ אַמָּה לְכָאן וְאַמָּה לְכָאן — נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם דְּיוֹמָד, וְאִם לָאו — אֵינוֹ נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם דְּיוֹמָד.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, says: a round stone was present, we see Wherever it could be chiseled and then divided there would remain a cubit here and a cubit there it can serve as a double post; but if not, it cannot serve as a double post.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Baroka, says: If there was a round stone there, one sees that if it were to be chiseled and divided, and there is in it a cubit here and a cubit there - it is judged as a yavam, and if not - it is not judged as a yavam.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: חַד רוֹאִין אָמְרִינַן, תְּרֵי רוֹאִין לָא אָמְרִינַן, וּמָר סָבַר: אֲפִילּוּ תְּרֵי רוֹאִין נָמֵי אָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? Sage, holds we say: We see, once. we do not say: We see, twice. And Sage, holds we even say: We see, twice.
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? One Master holds: We say one witness, we do not say two witnesses, and one Master holds: Even two witnesses we also say.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ אַבָּיֵי מֵרַבָּה: חִיצַת הַקָּנִים קָנֶה קָנֶה פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה, נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם דְּיוֹמָד אוֹ לָאו?
human_translation: Abaye raised dilemma before Rabba: a barrier of reeds each reed is less than three can it serve as a double post or not?
