llm_translation: Requested from him Abaye from Rabbah: The arrow of the reeds, a reed, a reed, less than three, is it considered as a support or not?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: הָיָה שָׁם אִילָן אוֹ גָּדֵר אוֹ חִיצַת הַקָּנִים נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם דְּיוֹמָד. מַאי לָאו, קָנֶה קָנֶה פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה?
human_translation: said to him: We learned this a tree, or a fence, or a barrier of reeds was present, it serves as a double post. Does not each reed is less than three
llm_translation: He said to him, "You should teach it: If there was there a tree or a fence or a hedge of reeds, it is judged due to the issue of dyeing. What is the reason? Is it not because a reed is less than three handbreadths?"

hebrew_text: לָא, גּוּדְרְיָתָא דִּקְנֵי. אִי הָכִי — הַיְינוּ אִילָן.
human_translation: No, a thicket of reeds If so, it is a tree,
llm_translation: Not, Gudreita of Kinai. If so - this is the same as a tree.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מַאי: קָנֶה קָנֶה פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה — הַיְינוּ גָּדֵר! אֶלָּא מַאי אִית לָךְ לְמֵימַר, תְּרֵי גַוְונֵי גָּדֵר? הָכָא נָמֵי — תְּרֵי גַוְונֵי אִילָן.
human_translation: What, then? each reed is less than three it is a fence. Rather, what must you say teaches two types of fence; here too, two types of tree,
llm_translation: And rather what: "a reed, a reed, less than three" - that is a fence! But what do you have to say, two types of fences? Here too - two types of trees.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: גּוּדְרְיָתָא דִּקְנֵי קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ. גּוּדְרְיָתָא דִּקְנֵי מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: הָיָה שָׁם גָּדֵר אוֹ אִילָן אוֹ חִיצַת הַקָּנִים נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם דְּיוֹמָד. מַאי לָאו, גּוּדְרְיָתָא דִּקְנֵי?
human_translation: There are who say dilemma raised before thicket of reeds said to him: We learned this a tree, or a fence, or a barrier of reeds was present, it can serve as a double post. Does not a thicket of reeds?
llm_translation: There are those who say: A fence that surrounds a field is needed for it. What is a fence that surrounds it? He said to him, "You have taught: If there was a fence or a tree or a hedge of reeds there, it is judged as a fence." What is the reason it is not a fence that surrounds it?

hebrew_text: לָא, קָנָה קָנֶה פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה. אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ גָּדֵר!
human_translation: No, each reed is less than three If so, it is a fence.
llm_translation: Not, he acquired, he acquired, less than three. If so, that is the same as a fence!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מַאי: גּוּדְרְיָתָא דִּקְנֵי — הַיְינוּ אִילָן! אֶלָּא מַאי אִית לָךְ לְמֵימַר,
human_translation: What, then? a thicket of reeds? this is a tree. Rather, what must you say
llm_translation: And rather what: a fence of reeds that it acquires — that is a tree! Rather what do you have to say,

hebrew_text: תְּרֵי גַוְונֵי אִילָן? הָכָא נָמֵי, תְּרֵי גַוְונֵי גָּדֵר.
human_translation: two types of tree; here too, two types of fence,
llm_translation: Two types of trees? Here it is stated, two types of fences.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ אַבָּיֵי מֵרַבָּה: חָצֵר שֶׁרֹאשָׁהּ נִכְנָס לְבֵין הַפַּסִּין — מַהוּ לְטַלְטֵל מִתּוֹכָהּ לְבֵין הַפַּסִּין, וּמִבֵּין הַפַּסִּין לְתוֹכָהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מוּתָּר.
human_translation: And Abaye inquired of Rabba: a courtyard, the end of which interposed between the boards what is with regard to carrying from inside to between the boards, and from between the boards into said to him: It is permitted.
llm_translation: Requested of him Abaye from Rabbah: A courtyard whose head enters between the doorposts - what about moving from within it to between the doorposts, and from between the doorposts to within it? He said to him: It is permitted.

hebrew_text: שְׁתַּיִם, מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אָסוּר.
human_translation: two what said to him It is prohibited.
llm_translation: Two, what is it? He said to him: forbidden.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: שְׁתַּיִם אֲסוּרִין, וַאֲפִילּוּ עֵירְבוּ. גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאמְרוּ ״עֵירוּב מוֹעִיל לְבֵין הַפַּסִּין״. רָבָא אָמַר: עֵירְבוּ מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: two is prohibited even if made an eiruv a decree lest they say an eiruv is effective for between the boards. Rava, said: they made an eiruv is permitted
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: Two are forbidden, even if they combined. A decree lest they say, "An eruv is effective between the corners." Rava said: Combining is permitted.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרָבָא: תַּנְיָא דִּמְסַיַּיע לָךְ — חָצֵר שֶׁרֹאשָׁהּ אֶחָד נִכְנָס לְבֵין הַפַּסִּין מוּתָּר לְטַלְטֵל מִתּוֹכָהּ לְבֵין הַפַּסִּין וּמִבֵּין הַפַּסִּין לְתוֹכָהּ, אֲבָל שְׁתַּיִם אָסוּר. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים שֶׁלֹּא עֵירְבוּ, אֲבָל עֵירְבוּ מוּתָּרִין.
human_translation: Abaye said to Rava: was taught supports your a courtyard, one end of which interposes between the boards it is permitted to carry from inside to between the boards, and from between the boards into but two this is prohibited. With regard to which case was this statement made? where did not make an eiruv but if they made an eiruv is permitted
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye to Rava: A teaching that supports you - a courtyard whose entrance is one, may carry from within it to between the partitions and from between the partitions to within it, but two are forbidden. In what case are these words said? That they did not make an eruv, but if they made an eruv, they are permitted.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב הוּנָא?! אָמַר לְךָ רַב הוּנָא: הָתָם דְּהָדְרָן וְעָרְבָן.
human_translation: Shall we say this is a refutation of Rav Huna, Rav Huna said to you: There, later became joined
llm_translation: Let it be the goodness of Rav Huna?! Rav Huna said to you: There, where they returned and mixed.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ אַבָּיֵי מֵרַבָּה: יָבְשׁוּ מַיִם בְּשַׁבָּת מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּלוּם נַעֲשֵׂית מְחִיצָה אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל מַיִם, מַיִם אֵין כָּאן מְחִיצָה אֵין כָּאן.
human_translation: Abaye asked Rabba the water dried up on Shabbat, what is said to him: are considered partition only on account of the water; there is no water here, there is no partition here.
llm_translation: Abaye asked Rabbah: "If water dried up on Shabbat, what is the ruling?" He said to him: "No partition is made except for the sake of water; if there is no water here, there is no partition here."

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָבִין: יָבְשׁוּ מַיִם בְּשַׁבָּת וּבָאוּ בְּשַׁבָּת מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: יָבְשׁוּ בְּשַׁבָּת לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ, דִּבְעַי מִינֵּיהּ דְּמָר וּפְשֵׁיט לִי דַּאֲסִיר.
human_translation: Ravin raised a dilemma: If the water dried up on Shabbat, and on Shabbat came what is Abaye said to him: dried up on Shabbat should not be a dilemma for you, for I raised this dilemma before my Master, and he resolved for me that it is prohibited to
llm_translation: Ba'ei Ravin: Yavshu mayim b'Shabbat u'vau b'Shabbat mah? Amar lei Abaye: Yavshu b'Shabbat la tibbei lakh, dibai mineih de'mar u'feshait li da'asir. Ba'ei Ravin asked: If water dried on Shabbat and then came back on Shabbat, what is the ruling? Abaye said to him: If it dried on Shabbat, you do not need to ask, for it is one of the things prohibited by the Master, and it is clear to me that it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: בָּאוּ נָמֵי לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ — דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ מְחִיצָה הָעֲשׂוּיָה בְּשַׁבָּת, וְתַנְיָא: כׇּל מְחִיצָה הָעֲשׂוּיָה בְּשַׁבָּת, בֵּין בְּשׁוֹגֵג בֵּין בְּמֵזִיד בֵּין בְּאוֹנֶס בֵּין בִּרְצוֹן — שְׁמָהּ מְחִיצָה.
human_translation: came should also not be a dilemma for you, for is a partition erected on Shabbat, and it was taught Any partition erected on Shabbat, whether unwittingly, or whether intentionally, whether by unavoidable accident, or whether willingly, it is called partition.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: If the walls were not made for you, do you not require an enclosure on Shabbat? But it was taught in a baraita: Any enclosure made on Shabbat, whether unintentionally, intentionally, by force, or willingly — its name is an enclosure.

hebrew_text: וְלָאו אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לִזְרוֹק, אֲבָל לְטַלְטֵל — לֹא.
human_translation: Was it not stated with regard Rav Naḥman said: They only taught to throw but to carry in it not
llm_translation: And not if it was said about it, said Rav Nachman: They only taught regarding throwing, but for carrying - no.

hebrew_text: כִּי אִיתְּמַר דְּרַב נַחְמָן — אַמֵּזִיד אִיתְּמַר.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman’s statement applies intentionally.
llm_translation: When it was stated: Rav Nachman said - it was stated in a different place.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הַזּוֹרֵק לְבֵין פַּסֵּי הַבֵּירָאוֹת חַיָּיב. פְּשִׁיטָא, אִי לָאו מְחִיצָה הִיא — הֵיכִי מִשְׁתְּרֵי לֵיהּ לְמַלּאוֹת?!
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: One who throws into between the boards surrounding a well is liable. obvious, were it not partition, how could he be permitted to draw
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: One who throws an object between the posts of the wells is liable. It is obvious, if it is not considered a partition, how can he drink from it to fulfill the well?

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דַּעֲבַד כְּעֵין פַּסֵּי בֵירָאוֹת בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, וְזָרַק לְתוֹכָהּ — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: is only necessary where one arrange similar to the boards surrounding a well in the public domain, and threw into it he is liable.
llm_translation: Not necessary, for he did like the manner of throwing in public domains, and he threw into it - liable.

hebrew_text: הָא נָמֵי פְּשִׁיטָא! אִי לָאו דִּבְעָלְמָא מְחִיצָה הִיא — גַּבֵּי בוֹר הֵיכִי מִשְׁתְּרֵי לֵיהּ לְטַלְטֹלֵי? לָא צְרִיכָא, אַף עַל גַּב דְּקָא בָּקְעִי בָּהּ רַבִּים.
human_translation: Isn’t this obvious as well? were it not a partition in general, how could he be permitted to carry in a cistern? It is only necessary even though many pass through it,
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text you provided: Talmudic text: "Ha namei peshita! Iy lav dib'alma mechitzah hi — gabei bor heichi mishtarei lei letaltolei? La tzericha, af al gav deka bak'i bah rabim." English translation: "This is also obvious! If it is not a regular partition — how can it serve as a support for hanging? It is not necessary, even though many people are making use of it."

hebrew_text: וּמַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן — דְּלָא אָתוּ רַבִּים וּמְבַטְּלִי מְחִיצְתָּא, הָא אֲמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר חֲדָא זִימְנָא!
human_translation: And what is he teaching us that the many does not come and negate a partition? But Rabbi Elazar stated once
llm_translation: And what is it teaching us? — that if many people come and nullify the partition, behold, Rabbi Elazar said once!

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיְתָה דֶּרֶךְ רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים מַפְסַקְתָּן — יְסַלְּקֶנָּה לִצְדָדִין, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַויְיהוּ: כָּאן הוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחָן שֶׁל מְחִיצּוֹת.
human_translation: As we learned Rabbi Yehuda says If the path of the public domain obstructs them, he divert it to the sides, And the Rabbis say: He need not Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Elazar both said: Here, informed you of the strength of partitions.
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Yehuda says: If the public domain interrupts them, one should remove it to the sides, and the Sages say: It is not necessary. Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Elazar both said: Here they informed you of the power of partitions.

hebrew_text: אִי מֵהָתָם, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא ׳כָּאן׳ — וְלָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן ׳כָּאן׳ — וּסְבִירָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: If from there I would have said here but he, does not agree He teaches us here and he agrees
llm_translation: From there, I would have said 'here' - but it does not seem to him. He is teaching us 'here' - and he deems it likely.

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא הָא, וְלָא בָּעֵי הָךְ! חֲדָא מִכְּלַל חֲבֶירְתָּהּ אִיתְּמַר.
human_translation: let say this and he would not have need to other one was stated by inference from the other.
llm_translation: And say this, and not require that! One from all her colleagues was said.

hebrew_text: מוּתָּר לְהַקְרִיב לַבְּאֵר וְכוּ׳. תְּנַן הָתָם: לֹא יַעֲמוֹד אָדָם בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים וְיִשְׁתֶּה בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד, בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד וְיִשְׁתֶּה בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן מַכְנִיס רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ לִמְקוֹם שֶׁהוּא שׁוֹתֶה.
human_translation: It is permitted to bring closer to the well, we learned there A person may not stand in a public domain and drink in the private domain, in the private domain and drink in a public domain, unless he brings his head and most of his into the place where he is drinking.
llm_translation: It is permitted to offer sacrifices to the well, etc. We learned there: A person should not stand in a public domain and drink in a private domain, in a private domain and drink in a public domain, unless he brings his head and the majority of his body into the place where he is drinking.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בַּגַּת.
human_translation: And likewise in a winepress
llm_translation: And so too in Gath.

hebrew_text: גַּבֵּי אָדָם — הָא אָמַר דְּבָעֵי רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ. גַּבֵּי פָּרָה — מִי בָּעִינַן לַהּ רֹאשָׁהּ וְרוּבָּהּ אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: With regard to a person, it was said that it is necessary his head and most of his with regard to a cow Is it necessary its head and most of its or not?
llm_translation: Regarding a person - this, he said, concerning his head and majority. Regarding a cow - do we require for it its head and majority or not?

hebrew_text: כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּקָא נָקֵיט מָנָא וְלָא נָקֵיט לַהּ — לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ דְּבָעֵי רֹאשָׁהּ וְרוּבָּהּ מִלְּגָיו. כִּי תִּבְּעֵי לָךְ — הֵיכָא דְּנָקֵיט מָנָא וְנָקֵיט לַהּ, מַאי?
human_translation: Wherever holds the bucket but does not hold should not be a dilemma for you, it is necessary its head and most of its inside, Where there should be a dilemma for you where he holds the bucket and holds What
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Kol heicha deka naket mana v'lo naket la — lo tibaei lakh debaei roshah v'rubah milgaye. Ki tibaei lakh — heicha de'naket mana v'naket la, mai?" English translation: "Wherever one takes a pledge and does not take it for her — she does not need to specify that she wants her head and most of it from its body. If she does specify — where one takes a pledge and takes it for her, what is the law?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁתְּהֵא הַפָּרָה רֹאשָׁהּ וְרוּבָּהּ מִבִּפְנִים וְשׁוֹתָה. מַאי לָאו, דְּנָקֵיט לַהּ וְנָקֵיט מָנָא? לָא, דְּנָקֵיט מָנָא וְלָא נָקֵיט לַהּ.
human_translation: He said to him: We learned provided that a cow its head and most of its inside and drink. Does this not where holds and holds the bucket? No, where he holds the bucket but does not hold
llm_translation: He said to him, "Give it to her: and only that its head and the majority of it should be from within, and she should drink." What is it not, that she should take it and not take from it? No, that she should take from it and not take it.

hebrew_text: וְכִי נָקֵיט מָנָא וְלָא נָקֵיט לַהּ, מִי שְׁרֵי? וְהָתַנְיָא: לֹא יְמַלֵּא אָדָם מַיִם וְיִתֵּן בְּשַׁבָּת לִפְנֵי בְהֶמְתּוֹ, אֲבָל מְמַלֵּא הוּא וְשׁוֹפֵךְ, וְהִיא שׁוֹתָה מֵאֵילֶיהָ!
human_translation: And where he holds the bucket but does not hold is it permitted Wasn’t it taught A person may not fill water and hold before his animal on Shabbat; but he may fill and pour out and it, drinks of its own accord?
llm_translation: And if one filled a vessel and did not fill it for it, is it permitted? And it was taught: A person should not fill water and place it before his animal on Shabbat, but if he himself fills it and pours it, and she drinks from her own accord!

hebrew_text: הָא אִתְּמַר עֲלַהּ: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, הָכָא בְּאֵבוּס הָעוֹמֵד בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים וְרוֹחַב אַרְבָּעָה, וְרֹאשׁוֹ אֶחָד נִכְנָס לְבֵין הַפַּסִּין.
human_translation: Wasn’t it stated with regard to this Abaye said: Here a manger that stands in the public domain ten handbreadths high and four wide, and one end interposes into between the boards
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: It was stated regarding it: Abaye said, here in the case of a balcony that stands in a public domain, its height is ten handbreadths and its width is four, and one of its heads enters between the partitions.

hebrew_text: גְּזֵרָה דִּילְמָא חָזֵי לֵיהּ לְאֵבוּס דִּמְקַלְקַל וְאָתֵי לְתַקּוֹנֵיהּ, וְדָרֵא לֵיהּ לְדַוְולָא בַּהֲדֵיהּ, וְקָא מַפֵּיק מֵרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים.
human_translation: decree, lest one see that the manger was damaged and go to fix it, and he might take the bucket with him, carrying from the private domain to the public domain.
llm_translation: Decree, perhaps he will see it to the father of the child who is negligent and will come to fix it, and he will dwell with him in his lawsuit, and he is taking out from private domain to public domain.

hebrew_text: וְכִי הַאי גַּוְונָא מִי מִיחַיַּיב? וְהָאָמַר רַב סָפְרָא אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַמְפַנֶּה חֲפָצָיו מִזָּוִית לְזָוִית, וְנִמְלַךְ עֲלֵיהֶן וְהוֹצִיאָן — פָּטוּר, שֶׁלֹּא הָיְתָה עֲקִירָה מִשָּׁעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה לְכָךְ.
human_translation: would he be liable in such a case? Didn’t Rav Safra say Rabbi Ami said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: one who transfers objects from corner to corner and changed his mind about them and carried them out he is exempt because the lifting at the first moment was not for that
llm_translation: And is this case who is liable? And Rav Safra said in the name of Rabbi Ammi who said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: One who transfers his belongings from corner to corner, and the earth becomes compacted upon them and he removes them - he is exempt, because there was no uprooting from the initial moment for this.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: זִמְנִין דִּמְתַקֵּן לֵיהּ וַהֲדַר מְעַיֵּיל לֵיהּ, וְקָא מְעַיֵּיל מֵרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים לִרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד.
human_translation: Rather, at times one would fix and bring back in again, carrying from the public domain into the private domain.
llm_translation: Rather: times that it is fixed for him and then brings it back for him, and he is bringing it from the public domain to a private domain.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: גַּבֵּי אָדָם הָא קָאָמְרִינַן דְּסַגִּי לֵיהּ בְּרֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ. גַּבֵּי פָרָה מִי סַגִּי לַהּ בְּרֹאשָׁהּ וְרוּבָּהּ, אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: Some say With regard to a person, we said that it is sufficient his head and most of his with regard to a cow Is it sufficient its head and most of its or not?
llm_translation: There are some who say: Regarding a person, we say that it suffices for him with his head and most of his body. Regarding a cow, does it suffice for her with her head and most of her body, or not?

hebrew_text: הֵיכָא דְּנָקֵיט מָנָא וְנָקֵיט לַהּ — לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ דְּסַגִּי לַהּ בְּרֹאשָׁהּ וְרוּבָּהּ, אֶלָּא כִּי תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ דְּנָקֵיט מָנָא וְלָא נָקֵיט לַהּ, מַאי?
human_translation: where holds the bucket and holds should not be a dilemma for you, it is enough its head and most of its Rather, where there should be a dilemma for you where he holds the bucket but does not hold What
llm_translation: Here where it is taken a portion and taken for it - it does not require for you that it is fitting for it in its beginning and its majority, rather when it is required for you that it is taken a portion and not taken for it, what?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁתְּהֵא פָּרָה רֹאשָׁהּ וְרוּבָּהּ מִבִּפְנִים וְשׁוֹתָה. מַאי לָאו דְּנָקֵיט מָנָא וְלָא נָקֵיט לַהּ: לָא, דְּנָקֵיט מָנָא וְנָקֵיט לַהּ.
human_translation: He said to him: We learned provided that a cow its head and most of its inside and drink. Doesn’t this where holds the bucket but does not hold No, where he holds the bucket and holds
llm_translation: He said to him, "Give it to her: and only that its head and the majority of it should be inside and she should drink." What is it that he took a portion and did not take it for her: No, that he took a portion and took it for her.

hebrew_text: וְהָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִי נָקֵיט מָנָא וְלָא נָקֵיט לַהּ, מִי שְׁרֵי? וְהָתַנְיָא: לֹא יְמַלֵּא אָדָם מַיִם וְיִתֵּן לִפְנֵי בְּהֶמְתּוֹ, אֲבָל מְמַלֵּא וְשׁוֹפֵךְ וְהִיא שׁוֹתָה מֵאֵילֶיהָ!
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable for if one holds the bucket but does not hold is it permitted Wasn’t it taught A person may not fill water and hold before his animal But he may fill and pour out and drinks of its own accord.
llm_translation: And thus it is fittingly reasoned, for if one takes water and does not give it to her, is it permitted? And it was taught: A person should not fill water and place it before his animal, but rather he should fill it and pour it, and she will drink from it!

hebrew_text: הָא אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָכָא בְּאֵבוּס הָעוֹמֵד בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים וְרוֹחַב אַרְבָּעָה, וְרֹאשׁוֹ נִכְנָס לְבֵין הַפַּסִּין, דְּזִמְנִין דְּחָזֵי לֵיהּ לְאֵבוּס דִּמְקַלְקַל וְאָתֵי לְתַקּוֹנֵיהּ, וְדָרֵי לֵיהּ לְדַוְולָא בַּהֲדֵיהּ, וְקָא מַפֵּיק מֵרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים.
human_translation: Wasn’t it stated with regard to this Abaye said: Here, a manger that stands in the public domain, ten handbreadths high and four wide, and one end interposes into between the boards at times one see that the manger was damaged and go to fix it and take the bucket with him, carrying from the private domain into the public domain.
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text you provided: It was stated regarding it, Abaye said: Here in the case of a beam that stands in the public domain, its height is ten handbreadths and its width is four, and its head enters between the partitions, at times when it appears to him that the beam is unstable and he comes to fix it, and he leans a ladder against it, and he is extending from the private domain to the public domain.

hebrew_text: וְכִי הַאי גַּוְונָא מִי מִיחַיַּיב? וְהָאָמַר רַב סָפְרָא אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַמְפַנֶּה חֲפָצָיו מִזָּוִית לְזָוִית וְנִמְלַךְ עֲלֵיהֶן וְהוֹצִיאָן — פָּטוּר, שֶׁלֹּא הָיְתָה עֲקִירָה מִשָּׁעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה לְכָךְ!
human_translation: But would he be liable in such a case? Didn’t Rav Safra say Rabbi Ami said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: one who transfers objects from corner to corner and changed his mind about them and took them out he is exempt because the lifting at the first moment was not for that
llm_translation: And is this case who is liable? And Rav Safra said in the name of Rabbi Ammi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: One who transfers his belongings from corner to corner and walks on them and takes them out - is exempt, because it was not uprooted from the first moment for this reason!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: זִמְנִין דִּמְתַקֵּן לֵיהּ וַהֲדַר מְעַיֵּיל לֵיהּ, וְקָא מְעַיֵּיל לֵיהּ מֵרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים לִרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד.
human_translation: Rather, at times one would fix and bring back in again, carrying from the public domain into the private domain.
llm_translation: Rather: times that it is fixed for him and then brings it back to him, and he brings it back from the public domain to a private domain.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: גָּמָל שֶׁרֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ מִבִּפְנִים אוֹבְסִין אוֹתוֹ מִבִּפְנִים, וְהָא אִיבּוּס כְּמַאן דְּנָקֵיט מָנָא וְנָקֵיט לַהּ דָּמְיָא, וְקָא בָּעִינַן רֹאשָׁהּ וְרוּבָּהּ!
human_translation: Come hear A camel whose head and most of its are inside may be force-fed from inside Now, force-feeding is like he holds the bucket and holds and we require its head and most of its
llm_translation: Come and hear: A camel whose head and majority are inside, we brand it from the inside, and this branding is like someone who takes a vessel and acquires it with a coin, and we require its head and majority!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: שָׁאנֵי גָּמָל, הוֹאִיל וְצַוָּארוֹ אָרוֹךְ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Rav Huna said Rav Sheshet said: A camel is different, as since its neck is long,
llm_translation: Rav Ahah bar Rav Huna said in the name of Rav Sheshet: A camel is different, because its neck is long.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: בְּהֵמָה שֶׁרֹאשָׁהּ וְרוּבָּהּ בִּפְנִים אוֹבְסִין אוֹתָהּ מִבִּפְנִים. וְהָא אֵבוּס כְּמַאן דְּנָקֵיט מָנָא וְנָקֵיט לַהּ, וְקָא בָּעִינַן רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ! מַאי ׳בְּהֵמָה׳ נָמֵי דְּקָתָנֵי — גָּמָל.
human_translation: Come hear An animal whose head and most of its were inside may be force-fed from inside Now, force-feeding is like he holds the bucket and holds and we require its head and most of its What is animal that is taught also a camel.
llm_translation: Come and hear: an animal whose head and the majority of its body are inside, one may push it from inside. But if it is pushed by someone who grabs it and pushes it, and we require its head and majority! What is "animal"? Also that which is taught - a camel.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא ׳בְּהֵמָה׳ וְהָתַנְיָא ׳גָּמָל׳!
human_translation: Wasn’t it taught animal and wasn’t it taught camel
llm_translation: And it was taught: "Behemah" and it was taught: "Gamal"!

hebrew_text: מִידֵּי גַּבֵּי הֲדָדֵי תַּנְיָא?! תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹסֵר בְּגָמָל, הוֹאִיל וְצַוָּארוֹ אָרוֹךְ.
human_translation: Were taught next to each other? This was also taught Rabbi Eliezer prohibits in the case of a camel, since its neck is long.
llm_translation: From the hands of the Hadadei, it was taught?! It was also taught thus: Rabbi Elazar prohibits the use of a camel, since its neck is long.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אַדָּא: לֹא הוּתְּרוּ פַּסֵּי בֵירָאוֹת אֶלָּא לְעוֹלֵי רְגָלִים בִּלְבַד. וְהָתַנְיָא: לֹא הוּתְּרוּ פַּסֵּי בֵירָאוֹת אֶלָּא לְגַבֵּי בְהֵמָה בִּלְבַד! מַאי בְּהֵמָה — בֶּהֱמַת עוֹלֵי רְגָלִים. אֲבָל אָדָם
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Adda said: boards surrounding wells were only permitted to Festival pilgrims. Wasn’t it taught boards surrounding wells were permitted only for cattle? What is cattle the cattle of festival pilgrims. However, a person
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak bar Adda said: The openings of wells were not permitted except for pilgrims alone. And it was taught: The openings of wells were not permitted except in the case of an animal alone! What is meant by "animal" - the animal of pilgrims. But a person

hebrew_text: מְטַפֵּס וְעוֹלֶה מְטַפֵּס וְיוֹרֵד.
human_translation: must climb up climb down
llm_translation: Climbing and ascending, climbing and descending.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר רַב יִצְחָק אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא הוּתְּרוּ פַּסֵּי בֵירָאוֹת אֶלָּא לִבְאֵר מַיִם חַיִּים בִּלְבַד. וְאִי לִבְהֵמָה, מָה לִי חַיִּים מָה לִי מְכוּנָּסִין? בָּעִינַן מִידֵּי דַּחֲזֵי לְאָדָם.
human_translation: Is that so? Didn’t Rav Yitzḥak say Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: boards surrounding wells were permitted only wells spring water? If for animals, what is to me spring and what is to me collected We require something that is fit for humans.
llm_translation: I? But didn't Rav Yitzchak say in the name of Rav Yehudah in the name of Shmuel: The openings of wells were only permitted in order to provide living water alone. And if for an animal, why do I need living water, why do I need prepared cisterns? We require it for the sake of human beings.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: לֹא הוּתְּרוּ פַּסֵּי בֵירָאוֹת אֶלָּא לִבְהֵמָה בִּלְבַד, אֲבָל אָדָם מְטַפֵּס וְעוֹלֶה מְטַפֵּס וְיוֹרֵד. וְאִם הָיוּ רְחָבִין, אֲפִילּוּ לְאָדָם נָמֵי. וְלֹא יְמַלֵּא אָדָם מַיִם וְיִתֵּן לִפְנֵי בְהֶמְתּוֹ, אֲבָל מְמַלֵּא הוּא וְשׁוֹפֵךְ לִפְנֵי בְּהֵמָה וְשׁוֹתָה מֵאֵילֶיהָ.
human_translation: the matter itself, boards surrounding wells were permitted only for cattle, but a person must climb up climb down But if were wide they are for a person as well. A person may not fill water and hold before his animal on Shabbat, but he may fill and pour out and drinks of its own accord.
llm_translation: Body: They did not permit vessels in the courtyard except for an animal alone, but a person may ascend and descend. And if they were wide, even for a sleeping person. And a person should not fill water and place it before his animal, but he himself should fill and pour before the animal and it should drink from it.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב עָנָן: אִם כֵּן, מָה הוֹעִילוּ פַּסֵּי בֵירָאוֹת? מָה הוֹעִילוּ?! לְמַלּאוֹת מֵהֶן!
human_translation: Rav Anan strongly objects to this If so, what purpose do the boards surrounding a well serve? what purpose do they serve? to draw from
llm_translation: Rav Anan objects to her: If so, what benefit did the Pesach offerings in Egypt have? What benefit did they have?! To fulfill from them!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: מָה הוֹעִיל רֹאשָׁהּ וְרוּבָּהּ שֶׁל פָּרָה?
human_translation: Rather, What purpose is served the cow’s head and most of its
llm_translation: Rather: What benefit is there from the head and majority of the cow?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — בְּאֵיבוּס הָעוֹמֵד בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה וְרוֹחַב אַרְבָּעָה וְרֹאשׁוֹ נִכְנָס לְבֵין הַפַּסִּין וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: Abaye said: With what are we dealing here? with a manger that stands in the public domain, ten high and four wide, and end of it interposes into between the boards
llm_translation: Abaye said: Here we are dealing with what? With an eaves that stands in the public domain, its height is ten handbreadths, its width is four handbreadths, and its head enters between the partitions, and so on.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַב: אֵין בּוּרְגָּנִין בְּבָבֶל, וְלֹא פַּסֵּי בֵירָאוֹת בְּחוּץ לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said Rav said: huts [ burganin ] does not apply in Babylonia, nor does boards surrounding a well apply outside of Eretz
llm_translation: Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said in the name of Rav: There are no burganin in Babylonia, and no pasei beiraot outside of the Land.

hebrew_text: בּוּרְגָּנִין בְּבָבֶל לָא — דִּשְׁכִיחִי בִּידְקֵי, פַּסֵּי בֵירָאוֹת בְּחוּץ לָאָרֶץ לָא — דְּלָא שְׁכִיחִי מְתִיבָתָא. אֲבָל אִיפְּכָא עָבְדִינַן.
human_translation: huts does not in Babylonia because floods are common boards surrounding a well does not outside of Eretz because yeshivot are not common But we do the opposite,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Burganin in Babylonia no — dishkichi bidekei, pasei beiraot bechutz la'aretz la — delo sh'khichi metivata. Aval ifka avdinan. English translation: Burganin in Babylonia no — found in the hands of inspectors, they close wells outside the land no — for they are not found in the registry. But the opposite we do.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַב: אֵין בּוּרְגָּנִין וּפַסֵּי בֵירָאוֹת, לֹא בְּבָבֶל וְלֹא בַּחוּץ לָאָרֶץ. בּוּרְגָּנִין בְּבָבֶל לֹא — דִּשְׁכִיחִי בִּידְקֵי, בְּחוּץ לָאָרֶץ נָמֵי לָא — דִּשְׁכִיחִי גַּנָּבֵי.
human_translation: Some say Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said Rav said: huts and boards surrounding a well neither in Babylonia nor outside of Eretz huts does not apply in Babylonia, because floods are common also does not outside of Eretz because thieves are common
llm_translation: There are those who say, Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said in the name of Rav: There are no burglars and pit-diggers in the land, neither in Babylonia nor outside the land. Burglars in Babylonia, no — because they are common in the cities, and outside the land also no — because thieves are common.

hebrew_text: פַּסֵּי בֵירָאוֹת בְּבָבֶל לָא — דִּשְׁכִיחִי מַיָּא. בְּחוּץ לָאָרֶץ נָמֵי לָא — דְּלָא שְׁכִיחִי מְתִיבָתָא.
human_translation: boards surrounding a well not in Babylonia, because water is common Outside of Eretz also does not because yeshivot are not common
llm_translation: The corners of wells in Babylonia - not considered water. Outside the land - yes considered not water, for it is not common to find a bed.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא לְמָרִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא: אָמְרִי אָתֵיתוּ מִבַּרְנִשׁ לְבֵי כְנִישְׁתָּא דְּדָנִיֵּאל דַּהֲוָה תְּלָתָא פַּרְסֵי בְּשַׁבְּתָא, אַמַּאי סָמְכִיתוּ — אַבּוּרְגָּנִין? הָא אָמַר אֲבוּהּ דַּאֲבוּהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: אֵין בּוּרְגָּנִין בְּבָבֶל!
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said to Marei, son of Rav Huna, son of Rav Yirmeya bar Abba: say you walk from Barnish to Daniel’s synagogue, which is three parasangs [ parsei ], on Shabbat. Upon what do you rely? on the huts Didn’t your father’s father say in the name of Rav: huts does not in Babylonia?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ḥisdah said to his master, the son of Rav Huna, the son of Rav Yirmeya bar Abba: They said, they came from Barnish to the synagogue of Daniel, who was three parasangs away on Shabbat. Why did they rely on it - the towers? This is what his father's father said in the name of Rav: There are no towers in Babylonia!

hebrew_text: נָפֵק וְאַחְוִי לֵיהּ הָנְהוּ מָתָווֹתָא, דְּמִבַּלְעָן בְּשִׁבְעִים אַמָּה וְשִׁירַיִים.
human_translation: went out and showed certain towns that were subsumed within seventy cubits and a remainder,
llm_translation: He went out and they brought him the following question, that from Bilan seventy cubits and two.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא, דָּרֵישׁ מָרִי בַּר מָר: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״לְכׇל תִּכְלָה רָאִיתִי קֵץ רְחָבָה מִצְוָתְךָ מְאֹד״, דָּבָר זֶה אֲמָרוֹ דָּוִד וְלֹא פֵּירְשׁוֹ, אֲמָרוֹ אִיּוֹב וְלֹא פֵּירְשׁוֹ, אֲמָרוֹ יְחֶזְקֵאל וְלֹא פֵּירְשׁוֹ, עַד שֶׁבָּא זְכַרְיָה בֶּן עִדּוֹ וּפֵירְשׁוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: Mari bar Mar interpreted homiletically: What is which is written: “I have seen a limit to every purpose; but Your commandment is exceedingly broad” This was stated by David, but he did not explain it; stated by Job, but he did not explain it; stated by Ezekiel, but he did not explain it, until Zechariah, son of Iddo, came and explained it.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said, Master Bar Mar taught: What is the meaning of what is written, "I have seen an end to every perfection; Your command is exceedingly broad"? This matter David said but did not explain, Job said but did not explain, Ezekiel said but did not explain, until Zechariah ben Iddo came and explained it.

hebrew_text: אֲמָרוֹ דָּוִד וְלֹא פֵּירְשׁוֹ, דִּכְתִיב: ״לְכׇל תִּכְלָה רָאִיתִי קֵץ רְחָבָה מִצְוָתְךָ מְאֹד״. אֲמָרוֹ אִיּוֹב וְלֹא פֵּירְשׁוֹ, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֲרוּכָּה מֵאֶרֶץ מִדָּהּ וּרְחָבָה מִנִּי יָם״.
human_translation: stated by David, but he did not explain it, as it is written: “I have seen a limit to every purpose; but Your commandment is exceedingly broad,” stated by Job, but he did not explain it, as it is written: “Its measure is longer than the earth and broader than the sea”
llm_translation: They said: David said it, and they did not explain it, as it is written: "I have seen an end to every purpose, but Your commandment is exceedingly broad." They said: Job said it, and they did not explain it, as it is written: "Its measure is longer than the earth and broader than the sea."

hebrew_text: אֲמָרוֹ יְחֶזְקֵאל וְלֹא פֵּירְשׁוֹ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּפְרֹשׂ אוֹתָהּ לְפָנַי וְהִיא כְתוּבָה פָּנִים וְאָחוֹר וְכָתוּב אֵלֶיהָ קִינִים וָהֶגֶה וָהִי״.
human_translation: stated by Ezekiel, but he did not explain it, as it is written: “And He spread it,” “before me, and it was written inside and outside; and in it was written lamentations, and melody [ hegeh ], and woe [ vahi ]”
llm_translation: They said: Ezekiel said, but did not explain, as it is written: "And He spread it out before me, and it was written on the front and back, and written on it were lamentations, mourning, and woe."

hebrew_text: ״קִינִים״ — זוֹ פּוּרְעָנוּתָן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״קִינָה הִיא וְקוֹנְנוּהָ״. ״וָהֶגֶה״ — זוֹ מַתַּן שְׂכָרָן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״עֲלֵי הִגָּיוֹן בְּכִנּוֹר״. ״וָהִי״ — זוֹ הִיא פּוּרְעָנוּתָן שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״הֹוָה עַל הֹוָה תָּבֹא״.
human_translation: “Lamentations,” this the punishment of the righteous in this world, and so it is stated: “It is a lamentation and they shall make lament with it” “And melody [ hegeh ],” this the reward of the righteous in the World-to-Come, and states: to the melody [ higayon ] of a lyre” And “woe [ vahi ],” this is the punishment of the wicked in the World-to-Come, and so it states: “Calamity [ hova ] shall follow upon calamity”
llm_translation: "Kinin" - this is the punishment of the righteous in this world, as it says: "It is jealousy and they will possess it." "Vahageh" - this is the reward of the righteous in the future, as it says: "Upon the harp with meditation." "Vahi" - this is the punishment of the wicked in the future, as it says: "Disaster upon disaster shall come."

hebrew_text: עַד שֶׁבָּא זְכַרְיָה בֶּן עִדּוֹ וּפֵירְשׁוֹ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלַי מָה אַתָּה רוֹאֶה וָאוֹמַר אֲנִי רוֹאֶה מְגִילָּה עָפָה אׇרְכָּהּ עֶשְׂרִים בָּאַמָּה וְרׇחְבָּהּ עֶשֶׂר בָּאַמָּה״. וְכִי פָּשְׁטַתְּ לַהּ, הָוְיָא לַהּ עֶשְׂרִין בְּעֶשְׂרִין. וּכְתִיב: ״הִיא כְתוּבָה פָּנִים וְאָחוֹר״, וְכִי קָלְפַתְּ לַהּ, כַּמָּה הָוְיָא לַהּ — אַרְבְּעִין בְּעֶשְׂרִין.
human_translation: until Zechariah, son of Iddo, came and explained it, as it is written: “And he said to me: What do you see? And I said: I see a flying [ afa ] scroll; the length of it is twenty cubits, and the breadth of it is ten cubits” so that when you open it, it is twenty by twenty And it is written: “And it was written inside and outside,” And when you peel them apart how much is it? amounts to forty by twenty
llm_translation: Until Zechariah son of Iddo came and interpreted it, as it is written: "And He said to me, 'What do you see?' And I said, 'I see a flying scroll, its length is twenty cubits and its width is ten cubits.'" And if you spread it out, it would be twenty by twenty. And it is written: "It is inscribed on both sides," and if you fold it, how would it be? Forty by twenty.

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב: ״מִי מָדַד בְּשׇׁעֳלוֹ מַיִם וְשָׁמַיִם בַּזֶּרֶת תִּכֵּן וְגוֹ׳״ — נִמְצָא כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ אֶחָד מִשְּׁלֹשֶׁת אֲלָפִים וּמָאתַיִם בַּתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: And it is written: “Who has measured the waters in the hollow of His hand, and meted out heaven with the span, we find the entire world is one in three thousand and two hundred of the Torah.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written: "Who has measured the waters in the hollow of His hand, and meted out heaven with the span?" (Isaiah 40:12) — It is found that the entire world altogether is one sixtieth of three hundred and two hundred in the Torah.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא, דָּרֵישׁ מָרִי בַּר מָר, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהִנֵּה שְׁנֵי דּוּדָאֵי תְאֵנִים מוּעָדִים לִפְנֵי הֵיכַל ה׳. הַדּוּד הָאֶחָד תְּאֵנִים טוֹבוֹת מְאֹד כִּתְאֵנֵי
human_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said: Mari bar Mar interpreted homiletically: What is which is written: and behold two baskets of figs were set before the temple of the Lord, One basket [ dud ] had very good figs, like the figs
llm_translation: And Rav Hisda said, Master, son of Master, expounded: What is the meaning of what is written: "And behold, two baskets of figs set before the Temple of the Lord"? One basket of very good figs, like the figs.

hebrew_text: הַבַּכּוּרוֹת וְהַדּוּד הָאֶחָד תְּאֵנִים רָעוֹת מְאֹד אֲשֶׁר לֹא תֵאָכַלְנָה מֵרוֹעַ״ —
human_translation: that are first ripe, and the other basket [ dud ] had very bad figs, so bad they could not be eaten”
llm_translation: The firstborns and the beloved, one figs very bad that not will eat from them.

hebrew_text: תְּאֵנִים הַטּוֹבוֹת — אֵלּוּ צַדִּיקִים גְּמוּרִים. תְּאֵנִים הָרָעוֹת — אֵלּוּ רְשָׁעִים גְּמוּרִים. וְשֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר אָבַד סִבְרָם וּבָטַל סִיכּוּיָם? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״הַדּוּדָאִים נָתְנוּ רֵיחַ״ — אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ עֲתִידִין שֶׁיִּתְּנוּ רֵיחַ.
human_translation: Good figs, these are full-fledged righteous bad figs, these are full-fledged wicked And lest you say that the hope is lost and their prospect is void, the verse states, “The baskets [ duda’im ] yield a fragrance” both of them, will eventually yield a fragrance.
llm_translation: Good figs - these are completely righteous individuals. Bad figs - these are completely wicked individuals. And lest you say their thoughts are lost and their chances are nullified? The Scripture says: "The mandrakes give forth fragrance" - these and these are destined to give forth fragrance.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״הַדּוּדָאִים נָתְנוּ רֵיחַ״ — אֵלּוּ בַּחוּרֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁלֹּא טָעֲמוּ טַעַם חֵטְא.
human_translation: Rava interpreted homiletically What is which is written: “The mandrakes [ duda’im ] yield a fragrance,” these are the young men of Israel who have never tasted the taste of sin.
llm_translation: Rava expounded, what is the meaning of what is written: "The mandrakes give forth fragrance" - these are the young men of Israel who have not tasted the taste of sin.

hebrew_text: ״וְעַל פְּתָחֵינוּ כׇּל מְגָדִים״ — אֵלּוּ בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁמַּגִּידוֹת פִּתְחֵיהֶן לְבַעֲלֵיהֶן. לָשׁוֹן אַחֵר: שֶׁאוֹגְדוֹת פִּתְחֵיהֶן לְבַעֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: “And at our doors [ petaḥeinu ] are all manner of choice fruits [ megadim ],” these are the daughters of Israel who inform [ maggidot ] their husbands about their passageway [ pit’ḥeihen ], Another version They bind [ ogedot ] their passageway for their husbands,
llm_translation: "and on our doorways all precious" — these are the daughters of Israel who open their doorways to their husbands. Another expression: who tie their doorways to their husbands.

hebrew_text: ״חֲדָשִׁים גַּם יְשָׁנִים דּוֹדִי צָפַנְתִּי לָךְ״ — אָמְרָה כְּנֶסֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, הַרְבֵּה גְּזֵירוֹת גָּזַרְתִּי עַל עַצְמִי יוֹתֵר מִמַּה שֶּׁגָּזַרְתָּ עָלַי, וְקִיַּימְתִּים.
human_translation: “New and old, which I have laid up for you, O my beloved,” the Congregation of Israel said before the Holy One, Blessed be He, Master of the Universe, I have decreed many decrees upon myself more than what You decreed upon me and I have fulfilled them.
llm_translation: "New ones as well as old ones, my beloved, I have hidden for you" — the congregation of Israel said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe, I have decreed upon myself more decrees than what You have decreed upon me, and I have fulfilled them.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא לְהָהוּא מִדְּרַבָּנַן דַּהֲוָה קָא מְסַדַּר אַגָּדָתָא קַמֵּיהּ: מִי שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ ״חֲדָשִׁים גַּם יְשָׁנִים״ מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵלּוּ מִצְוֹת קַלּוֹת וְאֵלּוּ מִצְוֹת חֲמוּרוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said to one of the Sages who would arrange the aggada before him: Did you hear what New and old He said to him: These, are the lenient mitzvot, and these, are the stringent mitzvot.
llm_translation: He said to him Rav Ḥisda to that Sage who was arranging an Aggadah before him: "Who taught you 'new things as well as old'?" What does this mean?" He said to him: "These are light commandments and these are severe commandments."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְכִי תּוֹרָה פְּעָמִים פְּעָמִים נִיתְּנָה? אֶלָּא — הַלָּלוּ מִדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, וְהַלָּלוּ מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים.
human_translation: said to him: for was the Torah given on two occasions, Rather, these, are from the Torah, and these, are from the Sages.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Was the Torah given multiple times? Rather - these are from the words of the Torah, and these are from the words of the Scribes."

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וְיוֹתֵר מֵהֵמָּה בְּנִי הִזָּהֵר עֲשׂוֹת סְפָרִים הַרְבֵּה וְגוֹ׳״ — בְּנִי, הִזָּהֵר בְּדִבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים יוֹתֵר מִדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה. שֶׁדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה יֵשׁ בָּהֶן עֲשֵׂה וְלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה. וְדִבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים — כׇּל הָעוֹבֵר עַל דִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים חַיָּיב מִיתָה.
human_translation: Rava expounded What is which is written: “And more than these, my son, be careful: of making many books [ sefarim ] My son, be careful the words of the Sages [ soferim ] more than the words of the Torah. For the words of the Torah include positive and negative Whereas the words of the Sages, anyone who transgresses the words of the Sages is liable to death
llm_translation: Rava expounded, what is the meaning of what is written: "And beyond these, my son, be warned: the making of many books is endless, and much study wearies the body" (Ecclesiastes 12:12) — my son, be more cautious with the words of the scribes than with the words of the Torah. For the words of the Torah include both positive and negative commandments, while the words of the scribes — anyone who transgresses the words of the scribes is liable to the death penalty.

hebrew_text: שֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר: אִם יֵשׁ בָּהֶן מַמָּשׁ, מִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא נִכְתְּבוּ?! אָמַר קְרָא: ״עֲשׂוֹת סְפָרִים הַרְבֵּה אֵין קֵץ״.
human_translation: Lest you say: If are of substance why were they not written the verse states: “Of making many books there is no end,”
llm_translation: Perhaps you will say: If they contain substance, why were they not written?! The verse says: "Of making many books there is no end."

hebrew_text: ״וְלַהַג הַרְבֵּה יְגִיעַת בָּשָׂר״ — אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַחָא בַּר אַדָּא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב אַחָא בַּר עוּלָּא: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁכׇּל הַמַּלְעִיג עַל דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים, נִידּוֹן בְּצוֹאָה רוֹתַחַת.
human_translation: “And much study [ lahag ] is a weariness of the flesh”? Rav Pappa, son of Rav Aḥa bar Adda, said in the name of Rav Aḥa bar Ulla: This teaches that whoever mocks [ malig ] the words of the Sages will be sentenced to boiling excrement,
llm_translation: "And to greatly toil in the study of Torah" — Rav Papa, son of Rav Acha bar Adda, in the name of Rav Acha bar Ulla said: It teaches that anyone who mocks the words of the Sages will be judged with boiling excrement.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבָא: מִי כְּתִיב לַעַג? ״לַהַג״ כְּתִיב! אֶלָּא: כׇּל הַהוֹגֶה בָּהֶן טוֹעֵם טַעַם בָּשָׂר.
human_translation: Rava strongly objects to this Is it written: Mock [ la’ag ]? “ Lahag ” is written. Rather, Whoever meditates [ hogeh ] upon them, experiences the taste of meat.
llm_translation: Rava objects to her: Who is it written for mockery? "Lahag" is written! Rather, anyone who studies them tastes the taste of meat.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא שֶׁהָיָה חָבוּשׁ בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִין, וְהָיָה רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הַגַּרְסִי מְשָׁרְתוֹ. בְּכׇל יוֹם וָיוֹם הָיוּ מַכְנִיסִין לוֹ מַיִם בְּמִדָּה. יוֹם אֶחָד מְצָאוֹ שׁוֹמֵר בֵּית הָאֲסוּרִין, אָמַר לוֹ: הַיּוֹם מֵימֶךָ מְרוּבִּין, שֶׁמָּא לַחְתּוֹר בֵּית הָאֲסוּרִין אַתָּה צָרִיךְ? שָׁפַךְ חֶצְיָין וְנָתַן לוֹ חֶצְיָין.
human_translation: The Sages taught It once happened that Rabbi Akiva was incarcerated in a prison, and Rabbi Yehoshua HaGarsi would attend to his Every day would bring him water in a measured One day the prison guard met said to him: your water today is more perhaps you need in order to undermine the prison. He poured out half and gave him half
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There was an incident involving Rabbi Akiva who was imprisoned in the jail, and Rabbi Yehoshua the Garsi would serve him. Every day they would bring him water in a measure. One day they found the guard of the jail, he said to him: "Today your water is abundant, perhaps you need to dig in the jail?" He poured out half and gave him half.

hebrew_text: כְּשֶׁבָּא אֵצֶל רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, אָמַר לוֹ: יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, אֵין אַתָּה יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁזָּקֵן אֲנִי וְחַיַּי תְּלוּיִין בְּחַיֶּיךָ?
human_translation: When came to Rabbi Akiva, he said to him: Yehoshua, do you not know that I am old, and my life depends on your life?
llm_translation: When he came to Rabbi Akiva, he said to him: Yehoshua, do you not know that I am old and my life depends on your life?

hebrew_text: סָח לוֹ כׇּל אוֹתוֹ הַמְאוֹרָע. אָמַר לוֹ: תֵּן לִי מַיִם שֶׁאֶטּוֹל יָדַי, אָמַר לוֹ: לִשְׁתּוֹת אֵין מַגִּיעִין, לִיטּוֹל יָדֶיךָ מַגִּיעִין?! אָמַר לוֹ: מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה שֶׁחַיָּיבִים עֲלֵיהֶן מִיתָה? מוּטָב אָמוּת מִיתַת עַצְמִי, וְלֹא אֶעֱבוֹר עַל דַּעַת חֲבֵירַי!
human_translation: related to him the entire incident, said to him: Give me water so that I may wash my hands. said to him: will not suffice for drinking; will it suffice for washing your hands? He said to him: What can I do; for one is liable to death better that I should die my own death rather than transgress the opinion of my colleagues
llm_translation: He argued with him, all that one who is warned. He said to him: Give me water that I may wash my hands. He said to him: For drinking they are not enough, for washing your hands they are enough?! He said to him: What shall I do that they are deserving of death? It is better that I die than transgress against the will of my companions!

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ: לֹא טָעַם כְּלוּם עַד שֶׁהֵבִיא לוֹ מַיִם וְנָטַל יָדָיו, כְּשֶׁשָּׁמְעוּ חֲכָמִים בַּדָּבָר, אָמְרוּ: מָה בְּזִקְנוּתוֹ כָּךְ, בְּיַלְדוּתוֹ עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה. וּמָה בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִין כָּךְ, שֶׁלֹּא בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִין עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: They said he would not taste anything until brought him water and he washed his hands. When the Sages heard about this, they said: If in his old age so how much more so in his youth. if in prison so how much more so when not in prison.
llm_translation: They said: One does not taste anything until he brings water to him and washes his hands. When the sages heard about this matter, they said: Just as in his old age, so too in his youth, how much more so. And just as in the house of the imprisoned, so too not in the house of the imprisoned, how much more so.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁתִּיקֵּן שְׁלֹמֹה עֵירוּבִין וּנְטִילַת יָדַיִם, יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: ״בְּנִי אִם חָכַם לִבֶּךָ יִשְׂמַח לִבִּי גַּם אָנִי״. וְאוֹמֵר: ״חֲכַם בְּנִי וְשַׂמַּח לִבִּי וְאָשִׁיבָה חֹרְפִי דָבָר״.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: At the time that Solomon instituted eiruv and washing hands a Divine Voice emerged and said “My son, if your heart is wise, My heart will be glad, even Mine” And it states “My son, be wise and make My heart glad, that I may respond to he who taunts Me”
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: At the time when Solomon established the laws of Eruvin and handwashing, a Bat Kol (heavenly voice) emerged and said, "My son, if your heart is wise, my heart will rejoice as well." And it also says, "My son, be wise and make my heart glad, so that I may respond to him who taunts me."

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״לְכָה דוֹדִי נֵצֵא הַשָּׂדֶה נָלִינָה בַּכְּפָרִים נַשְׁכִּימָה לַכְּרָמִים נִרְאֶה אִם פָּרְחָה הַגֶּפֶן פִּתַּח הַסְּמָדַר הֵנֵצוּ הָרִמּוֹנִים שָׁם אֶתֵּן אֶת דּוֹדַי לָךְ״.
human_translation: Rava interpreted homiletically: What is which is written: “Come, my beloved, let us go forth into the field; let us lodge in the villages. Let us get up early to the vineyards; let us see if the vine has flowered, if the grape blossoms have opened, if the pomegranates are in flower; there will I give you my loves”
llm_translation: Rava expounded: What is the meaning of that which is written, "Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away; for, lo, the winter is past, the rain is over and gone; the flowers appear on the earth; the time of singing is come, and the voice of the turtle is heard in our land; the fig tree putteth forth her green figs, and the vines in blossom give forth their fragrance. Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away."

hebrew_text: ״לְכָה דוֹדִי נֵצֵא הַשָּׂדֶה״ — אָמְרָה כְּנֶסֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, אַל תְּדִינֵנִי כְּיוֹשְׁבֵי כְרַכִּים שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן גָּזֵל וַעֲרָיוֹת וּשְׁבוּעַת שָׁוְא וּשְׁבוּעַת שֶׁקֶר, ״נֵצֵא הַשָּׂדֶה״ — בֹּא וְאַרְאֲךָ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, שֶׁעוֹסְקִין בַּתּוֹרָה מִתּוֹךְ הַדְּחָק.
human_translation: “Come, my beloved, let us go forth into the field,” the Congregation of Israel said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, do not judge me like those who reside in large cities where there is robbery and licentiousness, and vain oaths and false oaths, “Let us go forth into the field,” come and I will show You Torah scholars who engage in Torah in distress.
llm_translation: "Go forth, O beloved, to the field" — the congregation of Israel said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe, do not judge me like the inhabitants of secluded places that contain theft, forbidden relationships, false oaths, and vain oaths. "To the field" — come and I will show you, disciples of the sages, who engage in Torah study amidst hardship.

hebrew_text: ״נָלִינָה בַּכְּפָרִים״ — אַל תִּקְרֵי בַּכְּפָרִים אֶלָּא בַּכּוֹפְרִים: בֹּא וְאַרְאֲךָ אוֹתָם שֶׁהִשְׁפַּעְתָּ לָהֶן טוֹבָה וְהֵן כָּפְרוּ בְּךָ.
human_translation: “Let us lodge in the villages,” do not read In the villages [ bakefarim ], but rather By the deniers [ bakoferim ], come and I will show You whom You showered with good, but they have denied You.
llm_translation: "Let us lodge in the villages" - do not read "in the villages" but rather "in the atonements." Come and I will show you them, that you have benefited them with good and they have atoned for you.

hebrew_text: ״נַשְׁכִּימָה לַכְּרָמִים״ — אֵלּוּ בָּתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת וּבָתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת. ״נִרְאֶה אִם פָּרְחָה הַגֶּפֶן״ — אֵלּוּ בַּעֲלֵי מִקְרָא. ״פִּתַּח הַסְּמָדַר״ — אֵלּוּ בַּעֲלֵי מִשְׁנָה. ״הֵנֵצוּ הָרִמּוֹנִים״ — אֵלּוּ בַּעֲלֵי גְמָרָא. ״שָׁם אֶתֵּן אֶת דּוֹדַי לָךְ״ — אַרְאֲךָ כְּבוֹדִי וְגוֹדְלִי שֶׁבַח בָּנַי וּבְנוֹתַי.
human_translation: “Let us get up early to the vineyards,” these are the synagogues and houses of study. “Let us see if the vine has flowered,” these are the masters of Bible, “If the grape blossoms have opened,” these are the masters of Mishna. “If the pomegranates are in flower,” these are the masters of Gemara. “There will I give you my loves,” I will show You my glory and my greatness, the praise of my sons and daughters,
llm_translation: "Let us rise early to the vineyards" - These are synagogues and study halls. "If the vine has blossomed" - These are the masters of Scripture. "The pomegranates have budded" - These are the masters of Mishnah. "There will I give you my love" - I will show you my honor and the greatness of the praise of my sons and daughters.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְדַבֵּר שְׁלֹשֶׁת אֲלָפִים מָשָׁל וַיְהִי שִׁירוֹ חֲמִשָּׁה וָאָלֶף״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁאָמַר שְׁלֹמֹה עַל כׇּל דָּבָר וְדָבָר שֶׁל תּוֹרָה שְׁלֹשֶׁת אֲלָפִים מָשָׁל, עַל כׇּל דָּבָר וְדָבָר שֶׁל סוֹפְרִים חֲמִשָּׁה וְאֶלֶף טְעָמִים.
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna said: What is which is written: “And he spoke three thousand proverbs, and his poems were a thousand and five” teaches that Solomon pronounced three thousand proverbs for each and every word of the Torah, one thousand and five reasons for each and every word of the Scribes.
llm_translation: Rav Hamnuna said, what is the meaning of what is written: "And he spoke three thousand proverbs, and his songs were five and a thousand" - this teaches that Solomon said regarding every matter of Torah three thousand proverbs, and regarding every matter of the Scribes five and a thousand reasons.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וְיוֹתֵר שֶׁהָיָה קֹהֶלֶת חָכָם עוֹד לִימַּד דַּעַת אֶת הָעָם [וְ]אִיזֵּן וְחִקֵּר תִּיקֵּן מְשָׁלִים הַרְבֵּה״. ״לִימַּד דַּעַת אֶת הָעָם״ — דְּאַגְמְרַיהּ בְּסִימָנֵי טְעָמִים, וְאַסְבְּרַהּ בְּמַאי דְּדָמֵי לַיהּ.
human_translation: Rava taught: What is which is written: “And besides being wise, Koheleth also taught the people knowledge; and he weighed, and sought out, and set in order many proverbs” He taught the people knowledge, he taught it with the accentuation marks and explained by means of similar to it.
llm_translation: Rava expounded, what is the meaning of what is written: "And further, because the Preacher was wise, he still taught the people knowledge; yea, he pondered, and sought out, and set in order many proverbs." "He still taught the people knowledge" — that he completed it with signs of cantillation, and he explained it with what is similar to it.

hebrew_text: ״[וְ]אִיזֵּן וְחִקֵּר תִּיקֵּן מְשָׁלִים הַרְבֵּה״ — אָמַר עוּלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: בַּתְּחִילָּה הָיְתָה תּוֹרָה דּוֹמָה לִכְפִיפָה שֶׁאֵין לָהּ אׇזְנַיִם, עַד שֶׁבָּא שְׁלֹמֹה וְעָשָׂה לָהּ אׇזְנַיִם.
human_translation: “And he weighed [ izzen ], and sought out, and set in order many proverbs,” Ulla said Rabbi Eliezer said: At first the Torah was like a basket without handles [ oznayim ], until Solomon came and made handles for it.
llm_translation: "And balance and examine, establish many parables" — Ulla said, Rabbi Eliezer said: Initially, the Torah was likened to a rolled scroll that has no ears, until Solomon came and gave it ears.

hebrew_text: ״קְווּצּוֹתָיו תַּלְתַּלִּים״, אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר מָר עוּקְבָא: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִדְרוֹשׁ עַל כׇּל קוֹץ וָקוֹץ תִּילֵּי תִּילִּים שֶׁל הֲלָכוֹת.
human_translation: his locks [ kevutzotav ] are wavy [ taltalim ], Rav Ḥisda said Mar Ukva said: teaches that it is possible to expound from each and every stroke [ kotz ] mounds upon mounds [ tilei tilim ] of laws.
llm_translation: "His thorns are twisted," Rav Ḥisda said in the name of Mar Ukva: This teaches that one must expound on every thorn and twisted thorn of the laws.

hebrew_text: ״שְׁחוֹרוֹת כָּעוֹרֵב״: בְּמִי אַתָּה מוֹצְאָן — בְּמִי
human_translation: Black [ sheḥorot ] as a raven [ orev ] In whom do you find In him
llm_translation: "Black like a raven": In whom do you find them - in whom

hebrew_text: שֶׁמַּשְׁכִּים וּמַעֲרִיב עֲלֵיהֶן לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ. רַבָּה אָמַר: בְּמִי שֶׁמַּשְׁחִיר פָּנָיו עֲלֵיהֶן כְּעוֹרֵב.
human_translation: who, for sake, gets up early and stays late in the study hall. Rabba said: In him who, for sake, blackens his face like a raven,
llm_translation: He who rises early and recites the evening prayers in the study hall. Rabbah said: In the one whose face turns black like a raven upon them.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: בְּמִי שֶׁמֵּשִׂים עַצְמוֹ אַכְזָרִי עַל בָּנָיו וְעַל בְּנֵי בֵּיתוֹ כְּעוֹרֵב. כִּי הָא דְּרַב אַדָּא בַּר מַתְנָא הֲוָה קָאָזֵיל לְבֵי רַב, אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ דְּבֵיתְהוּ: יָנוֹקֵי דִידָךְ מַאי אֶעֱבֵיד לְהוּ? אֲמַר לַהּ: מִי שְׁלִימוּ קוּרָמֵי בְּאַגְמָא?
human_translation: Rava said: In him who makes himself cruel to his sons and members of his household like a raven was the case with Rav Adda bar Mattana, was go to the study hall his wife said to him: What shall I do for your children? He said to her: Are all the rushes [ kurmei ] in the marsh gone?
llm_translation: Rava said: In one who acts cruelly towards his children and the members of his household, it is as if he were acting like a raven. For example, when Rav Adda bar Matna was walking to the house of Rav, his wife said to him: "What shall I do with your young children?" He replied to her: "Who will feed the young crows in the marsh?"

hebrew_text: ״וּמְשַׁלֵּם לְשׂוֹנְאָיו אֶל פָּנָיו לְהַאֲבִידוֹ״, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: אִילְמָלֵא מִקְרָא כָּתוּב, אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְאוֹמְרוֹ — כִּבְיָכוֹל כְּאָדָם שֶׁנּוֹשֵׂא מַשּׂוֹי עַל פָּנָיו, וּמְבַקֵּשׁ לְהַשְׁלִיכוֹ מִמֶּנּוּ.
human_translation: “And He repays them that hate Him to His face to destroy them; Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Were the verse not written it be impossible to utter it, as it were, like a person who bears a burden on his face, and wishes to throw it off.
llm_translation: "And he repays his enemies to their face to destroy him," Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Were it not for the verse written, it would be impossible to say it - just as a person who carries a load on his face and seeks to throw it off.

hebrew_text: ״לֹא יְאַחֵר לְשׂוֹנְאוֹ״, אָמַר רַבִּי אִילָא: לְשׂוֹנְאָיו הוּא דְּלֹא יְאַחֵר, אֲבָל יְאַחֵר לַצַּדִּיקִים גְּמוּרִים.
human_translation: “He shall not be slack to him that hates Him,” Rabbi Ila said: He will not be slack to him that hates Him, but He will be slack those who are absolutely righteous,
llm_translation: "Not delay to hate," said Rabbi Ila: It is regarding his haters that he should not delay, but he may delay for completely righteous individuals."

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״אֲשֶׁר אָנֹכִי מְצַוְּךָ הַיּוֹם לַעֲשׂוֹתָם״, ״הַיּוֹם לַעֲשׂוֹתָם״ — וְלֹא לְמָחָר לַעֲשׂוֹתָם, ״הַיּוֹם לַעֲשׂוֹתָם״ — לְמָחָר לְקַבֵּל שְׂכָרָם.
human_translation: And that what Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: What is which is written: which I command you today to do them” Today to do them, and tomorrow not to do them, Today to do them, tomorrow, to receive reward for them.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And this is what Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: What is the meaning of what is written, "which I command you today to do them," "today to do them" - and not tomorrow to do them, "today to do them" - tomorrow to receive their reward. English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חַגַּי, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״אֶרֶךְ אַפַּיִם״? ״אֶרֶךְ אַף״ מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥaggai said, and some say Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani: What is which is written: long-suffering [ erekh appayim ], It should have erekh af ,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chagai, and some say Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani: What is the meaning of the verse "slow to anger"? "Slow to anger" - he requires it!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֶרֶךְ אַפַּיִם לְצַדִּיקִים, אֶרֶךְ אַפַּיִם לָרְשָׁעִים.
human_translation: long-suffering toward the righteous, long-suffering toward the wicked,
llm_translation: Rather, slow to anger is for the righteous, slow to anger is for the wicked.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר עַד בֵּית סָאתַיִם וְכוּ׳. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: בּוֹר וּפַסִּין קָאָמַר, אוֹ דִילְמָא בּוֹר וְלֹא פַּסִּין קָאָמַר?
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: up to two beit se’a , A dilemma was raised before Did he speak the cistern and the boards, Or perhaps he spoke the cistern without the boards,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says, "Up to Beit Sa'ataim, etc." They asked him: Is he referring to a pit and corners, or perhaps he is referring to a pit without corners?

hebrew_text: אָדָם נוֹתֵן עֵינָיו בְּבוֹרוֹ, וְלָא גָּזְרִינַן דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְטַלְטוֹלֵי יוֹתֵר מִבֵּית סָאתַיִם בְּקַרְפֵּף;
human_translation: fix his eyes on his cistern, and we do not decree lest he come to carry in an enclosure [ karpef ], more than two beit se’a ?
llm_translation: A person places his eyes on his pit, and we do not decree lest perhaps he will come to remove more than two se'ahs of earth.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִילְמָא, אָדָם נוֹתֵן עֵינָיו בִּמְחִיצָתוֹ, וְגָזְרִינַן דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְאִיחַלּוֹפֵי יוֹתֵר מִבֵּית סָאתַיִם בְּקַרְפֵּף.
human_translation: Or perhaps a person fixes his eyes on his partition, And we decree, lest he come to confuse with a karpef larger than two beit se’a ,
llm_translation: Perhaps, a person places his eyes on his partition, and we decree lest he come to exchange more than two se'ahs in a karpaf.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: כַּמָּה הֵן מְקוֹרָבִין — כְּדֵי רֹאשָׁהּ וְרוּבָּהּ שֶׁל פָּרָה, וְכַמָּה הֵן מְרוּחָקִין — אֲפִילּוּ כּוֹר אֲפִילּוּ כּוֹרַיִים. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בֵּית סָאתַיִם — מוּתָּר, יָתֵר מִבֵּית סָאתַיִם — אָסוּר.
human_translation: Come hear How close as the head and most of a cow. And how far may they be even a beit kor and even two beit kor , Rabbi Yehuda says: two beit se’a , it is permitted more than two beit se’a , it is prohibited.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: How close must one be to a corpse to become impure? — The size of the head and the majority of the body of a cow. And how far must one be to remain pure? — Even the size of a grave or two graves. Rabbi Yehudah says: Two Sa'ahs of a corpse — permitted, more than two Sa'ahs — forbidden."

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אִי אַתָּה מוֹדֶה בְּדִיר וְסַהַר מוּקְצֶה וְחָצֵר, אֲפִילּוּ בֵּית חֲמֵשֶׁת כּוֹרִים וּבֵית עֲשֶׂרֶת כּוֹרִים, שֶׁמּוּתָּר.
human_translation: said to Rabbi Yehuda: Do you not concede with regard to a pen, a stable, a backyard, and a courtyard, that even one of five beit kor and of ten beit kor is permitted
llm_translation: They said to Rabbi Yehuda: If you admit regarding a dir and sahar, muktzeh and chatzer, even a house of five kor and a house of ten kor, that it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם: זוֹ מְחִיצָה, וְאֵלּוּ פַּסִּין.
human_translation: said to them: this, partition, these are boards,
llm_translation: He said to them: This is a mechitzah, and these are pasin.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: בּוֹר בֵּית סָאתַיִם אַבֵּית סָאתַיִם — מוּתָּר, וְלֹא אָמְרוּ לְהַרְחִיק אֶלָּא כְּדֵי רֹאשָׁהּ וְרוּבָּהּ שֶׁל פָּרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: A cistern two beit se’a by two beit se’a is permitted, and they only said to distance as the head and most of a cow.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: A pit of two se'ahs, the pit of two se'ahs - it is permitted, and they did not say to distance it except for the head and majority of the cow.

hebrew_text: הָא מִדְּקָאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר בּוֹר וְלֹא פַּסִּין, מִכְּלָל דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בּוֹר וּפַסִּין קָאָמַר. וְלָא הִיא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בּוֹר בְּלֹא פַּסִּין קָאָמַר.
human_translation: From that Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar spoke of the cistern and not boards, infer Rabbi Yehuda spoke of the cistern and the boards. not so. Rabbi Yehuda he was, speaking of the cistern without the boards.
llm_translation: The Gemara: This is what Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: "Bor and not Pasin." Does this imply that Rabbi Yehuda holds both Bor and Pasin? No, Rabbi Yehuda only said Bor without Pasin.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר! אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ אֲרִיךְ וְקַטִּין.
human_translation: If so, that is Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar There is between them long and narrow.
llm_translation: So it is, that is to say, this is Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar! There is a difference between them, long and short.

hebrew_text: כְּלָל אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: כׇּל אֲוִיר שֶׁתַּשְׁמִישׁוֹ לְדִירָה, כְּגוֹן דִּיר וְסַהַר מוּקְצֶה וְחָצֵר, אֲפִילּוּ בֵּית חֲמֵשֶׁת כּוֹרִים וּבֵית עֲשֶׂרֶת כּוֹרִים — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar stated a principle: any space that is used as a dwelling, such as a pen, a stable, a backyard, or a courtyard, even five beit kor and ten beit kor , it is permitted
llm_translation: General, said Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar: Any space that is designated for dwelling, such as a dwelling, a courtyard, a balcony, even a house of five cubits by ten cubits — is permitted.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל דִּירָה שֶׁתַּשְׁמִישָׁהּ לַאֲוִיר, כְּגוֹן בּוּרְגָּנִין שֶׁבַּשָּׂדוֹת, בֵּית סָאתַיִם — מוּתָּר, יֶתֶר מִבֵּית סָאתַיִם — אָסוּר.
human_translation: And any dwelling that is used for the space such as field huts, two beit se’a , it is permitted more than two beit se’a , it is prohibited
llm_translation: "And all dwelling that its use is for the air, such as garden sheds in the fields, a house of two se'ahs — permitted, more than a house of two se'ahs — prohibited."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיָה דֶּרֶךְ רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים מַפְסַקְתָּן — יְסַלְּקֶנָּה לִצְדָדִין. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: If the path of the public domain passes through and obstructs it, one must divert to the sides, And the Rabbis say: One need not
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yehuda says: If the public domain interrupts them, one should remove them to the sides. And the Sages say: It is not necessary.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַויְיהוּ: כָּאן הוֹדִיעֲךָ כּוֹחָן שֶׁל מְחִיצּוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Elazar both said: Here, informed you of the strength of partitions;
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Elazar said together: Here they informed you of the power of partitions.

hebrew_text: כָּאן, וּסְבִירָא לֵיהּ? וְהָאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: יְרוּשָׁלַיִם, אִילְמָלֵא דַּלְתוֹתֶיהָ נִנְעָלוֹת בַּלַּיְלָה, חַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים.
human_translation: here and he agrees Didn’t Rabba bar bar Ḥana say Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Jerusalem, were it not for the fact that its doors are locked at night, one would be liable for it because as the public domain?
llm_translation: Here, and it seems to him? And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Jerusalem, were it not that its gates are locked at night, one would be liable for carrying on Shabbat due to the public domain.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: כָּאן — וְלָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Here, he does not agree
llm_translation: Rather: here - and not seems to him.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִי דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וּרְמִי דְּרַבָּנַן אַדְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: raised a contradiction between Rabbi Yehuda Rabbi Yehuda, and raised a contradiction the Rabbis the Rabbis.
llm_translation: "And Remi of Rabbi Yehuda to Rabbi Yehuda. And Remi of Rabbanan to Rabbanan."

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, יָתֵר עַל כֵּן אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מִי שֶׁהָיוּ לוֹ שְׁנֵי בָתִּים מִשְּׁנֵי צִידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, עוֹשֶׂה לוֹ לֶחִי מִכָּאן וְלֶחִי מִכָּאן, אוֹ קוֹרָה מִכָּאן וְקוֹרָה מִכָּאן, וְנוֹשֵׂא וְנוֹתֵן בָּאֶמְצַע. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵין מְעָרְבִין רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים בְּכָךְ.
human_translation: as it was taught Furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda said: one had two houses on the two sides of the public domain, he may place a side post from here, and side post from here, or beam from here, and beam from here, and carry and place in between them said to him: One cannot make the public domain fit by an eiruv in this manner,
llm_translation: It was taught: Furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda said: One who had two houses on two sides of a public domain, he should make a beam from here and a beam from there, or a crossbeam from here and a crossbeam from there, and carry back and forth in the middle. They said to him: One may not combine the public domain in this manner.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבָּנַן אַדְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: a contradiction between Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yehuda, a contradiction between the Rabbis and the Rabbis.
llm_translation: The difficulty of Rabbi Yehuda is like the difficulty of Rabbi Yehuda, the difficulty of the Rabbis is like the difficulty of the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָתָם — דְּאִיכָּא שְׁתֵּי מְחִיצּוֹת מְעַלְּיָיתָא. הָכָא — לֵיכָּא שְׁתֵּי מְחִיצּוֹת מְעַלְּיָיתָא,
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yehuda no contradiction, There, there are two proper partitions, here, there are not two proper partitions,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda: It is not difficult. There, because there are two partitions above. Here, because there are two partitions above.

hebrew_text: דְּרַבָּנַן אַדְּרַבָּנַן [נָמֵי] לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָכָא — אִיכָּא שֵׁם אַרְבַּע מְחִיצּוֹת, הָתָם — לֵיכָּא שֵׁם אַרְבַּע מְחִיצּוֹת.
human_translation: the Rabbis the Rabbis also no contradiction, here, there is a nominal of four partitions; there, there is not a nominal of four partitions.
llm_translation: The sages of the sages say: here - there are four partitions, there - there are not four partitions.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל אֵין חַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים. יָתֵיב רַב דִּימִי וְקָאֲמַר לֵיהּ לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב דִּימִי: מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Yosef said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Eretz Yisrael one is not liable for the public domain. Rav Dimi sat and recited this halakha . Abaye said to Rav Dimi: What is the reason
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak bar Yosef said, Rabbi Yochanan said: The Land of Israel one is not obligated upon it due to public domain. Rav Dimi was sitting and saying to him this teaching. Abaye said to Rav Dimi: What is the reason?

hebrew_text: אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דְּמַקֵּיף לַהּ סוּלְּמָא דְצוֹר מֵהָךְ גִּיסָא וּמַחְתָנָא דְגָדֵר מֵהָךְ גִּיסָא — בָּבֶל נָמֵי, מַקִּיף לֵהּ פְּרָת מֵהָךְ גִּיסָא וְדִיגְלַת מֵהַאי גִּיסָא! דְּכוּלָּא עָלְמָא נָמֵי מַקִּיף אוֹקְיָינוֹס! דִּילְמָא מַעֲלוֹת וּמוֹרָדוֹת קָאָמְרַתְּ?
human_translation: If you say because is surrounded by the Ladder of Tyre on one side and the slope of Gader on the other side, Babylonia, is also surrounded by Euphrates on one side and Tigris on the other side, the entire world is also surrounded by the ocean, perhaps you spoke of the ascents and descents
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Perhaps because he encircles her with a ladder of Tyre from one side and a fence of Gedera from the other side — in Babylonia, he encircles her with the Euphrates from one side and the Tigris from the other side! For the whole world is surrounded by Okyanus! Perhaps you are speaking of ascents and descents?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קַרְקַפְנָא, חֲזִיתֵיהּ לְרֵישָׁךְ בֵּי עַמּוּדֵי כִּי אֲמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא.
human_translation: said to him: skull, I saw your head between the pillars when Rabbi Yoḥanan taught this halakha ,
llm_translation: He said to him: "Karkefna, I saw it on your head in the house of the pillars, for Rabbi Yochanan said to that matter."

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי, כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ, אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַעֲלוֹת וּמוֹרָדוֹת שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל אֵין חַיָּיבִין עֲלֵיהֶן מִשּׁוּם רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים לְפִי שֶׁאֵינָן כְּדִגְלֵי מִדְבָּר.
human_translation: It was also stated when Ravin came said Rabbi Yoḥanan said, and some say Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: the ascents and descents of Eretz Yisrael, one is not liable for the public domain, because they are not like the banners in the desert.
llm_translation: It was stated similarly: when Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said, and some say it was said to him, Rabbi Abahu said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The ascents and descents in the land of Israel are not subject to the public domain laws because they are not like the flags of the desert.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַחֲבָה מֵרָבָא: תֵּל הַמִּתְלַקֵּט עֲשָׂרָה מִתּוֹךְ אַרְבַּע, וְרַבִּים בּוֹקְעִין בּוֹ, חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים אוֹ אֵין חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו?
human_translation: Raḥava raised a dilemma before Rava: a mound that rises to ten within four but many people traverse it, is one liable for the public domain or is one not liable?
llm_translation: He asked Rabba: If a mound is removed ten from within four, and many puncture it, are they liable on account of a public domain or are they not liable on it?

hebrew_text: אַלִּיבָּא דְרַבָּנַן לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ: הַשְׁתָּא, וּמָה הָתָם דְּנִיחָא תַּשְׁמִישְׁתֵּיהּ — אָמְרִי רַבָּנַן לָא אָתוּ רַבִּים וּמְבַטְּלִי לַהּ מְחִיצְתָּא, הָכָא, דְּלָא נִיחָא תַּשְׁמִישְׁתֵּיהּ — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן!
human_translation: According to the Rabbis, should not be a dilemma for you. Just as there, where the use is convenient, the Rabbis say the public does not come and invalidate the partition; here, where its use is inconvenient all the more so
llm_translation: In the matter of the sages' dispute, it shall not be resolved for you: Now, and what is the difference there that they leave its use - the sages said, "Many people did not come and nullify the partition for it." Here, where they do not leave its use - all the more so!

hebrew_text: כִּי תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. מַאי, הָתָם הוּא דְּנִיחָא תַּשְׁמִישְׁתֵּיהּ, הָכָא הוּא דְּלָא נִיחָא תַּשְׁמִישְׁתֵּיהּ — לָא אָתוּ רַבִּים וּמְבַטְּלִי מְחִיצְתָּא? אוֹ דִילְמָא לָא שְׁנָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חַיָּיבִין.
human_translation: Where there should be a dilemma for you according to Rabbi Yehuda. What is there, because the use is convenient, here, where its use is inconvenient, the public does not come and invalidate the partition? Or perhaps there is no difference? said to one is liable
llm_translation: When you come to the house of Rabbi Yehuda, what is the reason? There, where he leaves his utensils, it is suitable. Here, where he does not leave his utensils - will many people come and nullify the partition? Or perhaps it is not different? He said to him: They are obligated.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ עוֹלִין לוֹ בְּחֶבֶל? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין. וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּמַעֲלוֹת בֵּית מָרוֹן?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין.
human_translation: And even one must ascend it by means of a rope? He said to him: Yes. And even in the ascents of Beit Meron, He said to him: Yes.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And even if they bring him up with a rope? He said to him: No. And even on the steps of Beit Maron?! He said to him: No." English translation: "And even if they bring him up with a rope? He said to him: No. And even on the steps of Beit Maron?! He said to him: No."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: חָצֵר שֶׁהָרַבִּים נִכְנָסִין לָהּ בָּזוֹ וְיוֹצְאִין בָּזוֹ — רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים לַטּוּמְאָה, וּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד לַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: raised an objection A courtyard into which many people enter on this and exit on that the public domain ritual impurity, the private domain Shabbat.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to it: A courtyard into which the public enters and exits indiscriminately - it is considered a public domain for impurity, but a private domain for Sabbath.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי? אִילֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, הַשְׁתָּא וּמָה הָתָם — דְּנִיחָא תַּשְׁמִישְׁתֵּיהּ, אָמְרִי רַבָּנַן: לָא אָתוּ רַבִּים וּמְבַטְּלִי מְחִיצְתָּא, הָכָא — דְּלָא נִיחָא תַּשְׁמִישְׁתֵּיהּ, לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן!
human_translation: Who If you say the Rabbis, Just as there, where the use is convenient, the Rabbis say that the public does not come and invalidate the partition; here, where its use is inconvenient, all the more so
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Mani? Ileima Rabbanan, hashta u'ma hatam - d'nicha tashmishteih, amri Rabbanan: la atu rabim u'mevatlei mechitzta, hacha - d'lo nicha tashmishteih, lo kachin!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא?
human_translation: Rather, is it not Rabbi Yehuda?
llm_translation: Rather, is it not the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda?

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם רַבָּנַן, וּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים לַטּוּמְאָה אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: No; actually, the Rabbis. it was necessary for them the public domain to ritual impurity,
llm_translation: Not, always, sages, and public domain for impurity, necessary for him.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מְבוֹאוֹת הַמְפוּלָּשׁוֹת בְּבוֹרוֹת, בְּשִׁיחִין וּבִמְעָרוֹת — רְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד לְשַׁבָּת וּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים לַטּוּמְאָה.
human_translation: Come hear Alleyways that open in cisterns, ditches or caves the private domain to Shabbat and the public domain to ritual impurity.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Entrances that are exposed in pits, in bushes, and in caves - private domain for Shabbat and public domain for impurity.

hebrew_text: ״בְּבוֹרוֹת״ סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? אֶלָּא: לְבוֹרוֹת — רְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד לְשַׁבָּת וּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים לַטּוּמְאָה.
human_translation: Should it enter your mind in cisterns [ baborot ]; Rather, into cisterns [ laborot ] the private domain to Shabbat and the public domain to ritual impurity.
llm_translation: "In 'borot' did your mind ascend? Rather: for 'borot' - private domain for Shabbat and public domain for impurity."

hebrew_text: מַנִּי? אִילֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, הַשְׁתָּא וּמָה הָתָם — דְּנִיחָא תַּשְׁמִישְׁתֵּיהּ, אָמְרִי: לָא אָתוּ רַבִּים וּמְבַטְּלִי לַהּ, הָכָא — דְּלָא נִיחָא תַּשְׁמִישְׁתֵּיהּ, לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן! אֶלָּא לָאו רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא?
