human_translation: Who Now, if you say the Rabbis, Just as there, where the use is convenient, say the public does not come and invalidate here, where its use is inconvenient, all the more so Rather, isn’t it Rabbi Yehuda?
llm_translation: Who is the tanna? If you say the Rabbis, now what is the difference? There, since he leaves his utensils, they say: "Many people will come and nullify it." Here, since he does not leave his utensils, all the more so! Rather, is it not Rabbi Yehuda?

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם רַבָּנַן, וּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים לַטּוּמְאָה אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: No; actually, the Rabbis. it was necessary for them the public domain to ritual impurity.
llm_translation: Not, always sages, and public domain for impurity necessary for him.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שְׁבִילֵי בֵּית גִּילְגּוּל וְכַיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן — רְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד לַשַּׁבָּת וּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים לַטּוּמְאָה.
human_translation: Come hear The paths of Beit Gilgul, and similar ones the private domain to Shabbat, and the public domain to ritual impurity.
llm_translation: Come and hear: The paths of Beit Gilgul and similar cases - private domain for Shabbat and public domain for impurity.

hebrew_text: וְאֵיזֶהוּ שְׁבִילֵי בֵּית גִּילְגּוּל? אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין הָעֶבֶד יָכוֹל לִיטּוֹל סְאָה שֶׁל חִיטִּין וְיָרוּץ לִפְנֵי סַרְדְּיוֹט.
human_translation: And what are the paths of Beit Gilgul? The school of Rabbi Yannai say: any a slave [ eved ] is unable to take up a se’a of wheat and run before an officer [ sardeyot ],
llm_translation: And which are the paths of the house of Gilgul? The House of Rabbi Yannai said: Any path that a slave cannot take a se'ah of wheat and run before the Sardiyot.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי? אִילֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, הַשְׁתָּא וּמָה הָתָם — דְּנִיחָא תַּשְׁמִישְׁתָּא, אָמְרִי רַבָּנַן: לָא אָתוּ רַבִּים וּמְבַטְּלִי לַהּ מְחִיצְתָּא. הָכָא — דְּלָא נִיחָא תַּשְׁמִישְׁתָּא, לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן! אֶלָּא לָאו, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא?
human_translation: Who Now, if you say the Rabbis, Just as there, where the use is convenient, the Rabbis say the public does not come and invalidate the partition; here, where their use is inconvenient, all the more so Rather, is it not Rabbi Yehuda?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Mani? Ileima Rabanan, hashta u'ma ha'tam - d'nicha tashmishta, amri Rabanan: lo atu rabim u'mevatlei lah mechitzta. Hacha - d'lo nicha tashmishta, lo kach! Ella, Rabbi Yehuda hi?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁבִילֵי בֵּית גִּילְגּוּל קָאָמְרַתְּ? יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹהֵב יִשְׂרָאֵל הָיָה, עָמַד וְתִיקֵּן לָהֶם דְּרָכִים וּסְרַטְיָא, כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּנִיחָא תַּשְׁמִישְׁתָּא — מְסָרָהּ לָרַבִּים, כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּלָא נִיחָא תַּשְׁמִישְׁתָּא — מְסָרָהּ לַיָּחִיד.
human_translation: said to him: Did you say the paths of Beit Gilgul? Joshua, was a lover of Israel. He rose up and established roads and highways for them; any place that was convenient to use he handed over to the public, any place that was inconvenient to use he handed over to an individual.
llm_translation: He said to him: Are you speaking of the pathways of Beit Gilgul? Joshua, who loved Israel, stood and established for them roads and bridges; wherever it was suitable for use — he made it available to the public, wherever it was not suitable for use — he made it available to the individual.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֶחָד בּוֹר הָרַבִּים וּבְאֵר הָרַבִּים וּבְאֵר הַיָּחִיד — עוֹשִׂין לָהֶן פַּסִּין.
human_translation: a public cistern as well as a public well and a private well, one may arrange boards around them
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "One who digs a pit in a public domain, and a cistern in a public domain, and a cistern in a private domain - they make for them partitions."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לְבוֹר הַיָּחִיד — עוֹשִׂין לוֹ מְחִיצָה גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: But a private cistern, one must construct for it a partition ten handbreadths high; the statement of Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: But for a pit that is individual - they make for it a partition high ten handbreadths, the words of Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵין עוֹשִׂין פַּסִּין אֶלָּא לִבְאֵר הָרַבִּים בִּלְבַד, וְלַשְּׁאָר — עוֹשִׂין חֲגוֹרָה גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava says: One may arrange boards only for a public well. But for the others, one must set up a belt, ten handbreadths high.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava says: "They only make paths to clarify the public thoroughfare alone, and for the rest - they make a high fence of ten handbreadths."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא. וְאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא הוּתְּרוּ פַּסֵּי בֵירָאוֹת אֶלָּא לִבְאֵר מַיִם חַיִּים בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava. And Rav Yosef said Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: boards well were permitted only in a well spring water.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yosef said, Rav Yehudah said Shmuel said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yehudah ben Bava. And Rav Yosef said, Rav Yehudah said Shmuel said: The breaches in the walls were only permitted in order to provide living water.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא: דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: דְּרַבִּים — וַאֲפִילּוּ מְכוּנָּסִין,
human_translation: And it was necessary As had taught us halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava I would have said the public, even collected
llm_translation: The question arises: for if we were to hear a halakha according to Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava, I would say: a multitude — even when gathered together,

hebrew_text: וְהַאי דְּקָתָנֵי בְּאֵר הָרַבִּים — לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּלֹא הוּתְּרוּ פַּסֵּי בֵירָאוֹת אֶלָּא לִבְאֵר מַיִם חַיִּים.
human_translation: And that which was taught: a public well, to exclude of Rabbi Akiva teaches us boards well were permitted only a well of spring water.
llm_translation: This that is taught in the public domain well — to go out from Rabbi Akiva. It is heard to us that they did not permit breaches in wells except to dig living waters.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן בְּאֵר מַיִם חַיִּים, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: לָא שְׁנָא דְּרַבִּים וְלָא שְׁנָא דְּיָחִיד, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא.
human_translation: And had taught us a well spring water, I would have said there is no difference public and there is no difference private teaches us halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava,
llm_translation: And if we were to hear about a well of living water, I would say: It makes no difference whether for the public or for an individual, it is being taught to us: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yehudah ben Bava.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְעוֹד אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא: הַגִּינָּה וְהַקַּרְפֵּף שֶׁהֵן שִׁבְעִים אַמָּה וְשִׁירַיִים עַל שִׁבְעִים אַמָּה וְשִׁירַיִים הַמּוּקָּפוֹת גָּדֵר גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים — מְטַלְטְלִין בְּתוֹכָהּ, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיְּהֵא בָּהּ שׁוֹמֵירָה אוֹ בֵּית דִּירָה, אוֹ שֶׁתְּהֵא סְמוּכָה לָעִיר.
human_translation: And furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava said: a garden or a karpef , that is seventy cubits and a remainder, by seventy cubits and a remainder, and is surrounded by a wall ten handbreadths high, one may carry inside it, provided that it contains a watchman’s booth or a dwelling place, or it is near the town
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava said: A garden and a vineyard, which are seventy cubits by seventy cubits, and the surrounding walls are ten handbreadths high - one may carry objects within them on Shabbat, provided that there is a watchman in it, or a dwelling house, or that it is adjacent to a city.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ אֵין בָּהּ אֶלָּא בּוֹר וְשִׁיחַ וּמְעָרָה מְטַלְטְלִין בְּתוֹכָהּ. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ אֵין בָּהּ אַחַת מִכׇּל אֵלּוּ מְטַלְטְלִין בְּתוֹכָהּ, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיְּהֵא בָּהּ שִׁבְעִים אַמָּה וְשִׁירַיִים עַל שִׁבְעִים אַמָּה וְשִׁירַיִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: even if it contains only a cistern, an ditch, or a cave, one may carry inside it, Rabbi Akiva says: Even if it has none of these one may carry inside it, provided that it measures seventy cubits and a remainder by seventy cubits and a remainder.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even if it only contains a pit, a ditch, and a cave, one may carry within it. Rabbi Akiva says: Even if it does not contain any of these, one may carry within it, as long as it is seventy cubits by seventy cubits.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיְתָה אׇרְכָּהּ יָתֵר עַל רׇחְבָּהּ אֲפִילּוּ אַמָּה אַחַת — אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין בְּתוֹכָהּ. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ אׇרְכָּהּ פִּי שְׁנַיִם בְּרׇחְבָּהּ — מְטַלְטְלִין בְּתוֹכָהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: If its length is greater than its breadth, even by one cubit, one may not carry inside it, Rabbi Yosei says: Even if its length is double its breadth, one may carry inside it,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: If its length is greater than its width even by one cubit - one may not carry within it. Rabbi Yosei says: Even if its width is twice its length - one may carry within it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אִלְעַאי: שָׁמַעְתִּי מֵרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, וַאֲפִילּוּ הִיא כְּבֵית כּוֹר.
human_translation: Rabbi Elai said: I heard from Rabbi Eliezer even is a beit kor ,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elai said: I heard from Rabbi Elazar, and even if it is like a pit.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן שָׁמַעְתִּי מִמֶּנּוּ: אַנְשֵׁי חָצֵר שֶׁשָּׁכַח אֶחָד מֵהֶן וְלֹא עֵירַב — בֵּיתוֹ אָסוּר מִלְּהַכְנִיס וּלְהוֹצִיא לוֹ, אֲבָל לָהֶם מוּתָּר.
human_translation: And I also heard from him one of the residents of a courtyard forgot and did not join in an eiruv is prohibited for him, to bring in or take out his house however, it is permitted to them,
llm_translation: And so I heard from him: Men of the courtyard who forgot one of them and did not participate - his house is forbidden to bring in and take out for him, but for them it is permitted.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן שָׁמַעְתִּי מִמֶּנּוּ: שֶׁיּוֹצְאִין בְּעַרְקַבָּלִין בַּפֶּסַח. וְחָזַרְתִּי עַל כׇּל תַּלְמִידָיו וּבִקַּשְׁתִּי לִי חָבֵר, וְלֹא מָצָאתִי.
human_translation: And I also heard from him that one may fulfill his obligation on Passover with arkablin , I circulated among all disciples, seeking a colleague but I could not find
llm_translation: And so I heard from him: that they go out in Arqavbalin on Pesach. And I reviewed all his students and sought for myself a colleague, but I did not find.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי תַּנָּא דְּקָתָנֵי ״וְעוֹד״.
human_translation: What was taught that teaches And furthermore
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of the teaching that is stated, "and furthermore"?

hebrew_text: אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דִּתְנָא לֵיהּ חֲדָא לְחוּמְרָא וְקָתָנֵי אַחֲרִיתִי, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי קָתָנֵי ״וְעוֹד״ — וְהָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה דִּתְנָא לֵיהּ חֲדָא לְחוּמְרָא וְקָתָנֵי אַחֲרִיתִי, וְלָא קָתָנֵי ״וְעוֹד״!
human_translation: If you say because he taught one stringency and he teaches another for that reason teaches: And furthermore, Didn’t Rabbi Yehuda teach one stringency and teach another and does not teach: And furthermore
llm_translation: The text reads: "Perhaps it was taught in the name of one authority for stringency, and another authority taught for leniency; therefore it was taught 'and furthermore' — but Rabbi Yehuda taught in the name of one authority for stringency, and another authority taught for leniency, yet it was not taught 'and furthermore'!"

hebrew_text: הָתָם אַפְסְקוּהּ רַבָּנַן, הָכָא לָא אַפְסְקוּהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: There, the Rabbis interrupted Here, the Rabbis did not interrupt him,
llm_translation: There, the Rabbis interrupted it, here the Rabbis did not interrupt it.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל הֵיכָא דְּאַפְסְקוּהּ רַבָּנַן לָא קָתָנֵי ״וְעוֹד״? וְהָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר דְּסוּכָּה, דְּאַפְסְקוּהּ רַבָּנַן, וְקָתָנֵי ״וְעוֹד״?
human_translation: wherever the Rabbis interrupt does not teach: And furthermore? But Rabbi Eliezer in Sukka where the Rabbis interrupted his teaches: And furthermore.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And in every place where the Rabbis concluded the discussion, it does not state "and furthermore"? But Rabbi Eliezer of Sukkah, where the Rabbis concluded the discussion, and it states "and furthermore"?

hebrew_text: הָתָם, בְּמִילְּתֵיהּ הוּא דְּאַפְסְקוּהּ. הָכָא, בְּמִילְּתָא אַחֲרִיתִי אַפְסְקוּהּ.
human_translation: there, they interrupted with his topic; here, they interrupted an different matter.
llm_translation: There, in its words, it is that they concluded. Here, in the final word, they concluded.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ אֵין בָּהּ אֶחָד מִכׇּל אֵלּוּ מְטַלְטְלִין בְּתוֹכָהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said: Even has none of these one may carry inside it,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Even if it does not have one of all these, one may carry within it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא!
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva is the first tanna ,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva, that is, Tanah Kama!

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דָּבָר מוּעָט. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: דָּבָר מוּעָט יֵשׁ עַל שִׁבְעִים אַמָּה וְשִׁירַיִם, וְלֹא נָתְנוּ חֲכָמִים בּוֹ שִׁיעוּר.
human_translation: There is between them a tiny amount. as it was taught Rabbi Yehuda says: a tiny amount exceeds seventy cubits and a remainder, but the Sages did not give its measurement,
llm_translation: There is a small difference between them. As it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: There is a small difference of seventy cubits and two spans, and the Sages did not establish a specific measure for it.

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה שִׁיעוּר סָאתַיִם? כַּחֲצַר הַמִּשְׁכָּן.
human_translation: And what is measure two beit se’a ? as the courtyard of the Tabernacle,
llm_translation: And how much is the measurement of two se'ah? Like the courtyard of the Tabernacle.

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי?
human_translation: From where are these matters derived?
llm_translation: What are these words?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״אֹרֶךְ הֶחָצֵר מֵאָה בָאַמָּה וְרֹחַב חֲמִשִּׁים בַּחֲמִשִּׁים״. אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: טוֹל חֲמִשִּׁים, וְסַבֵּב חֲמִשִּׁים.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: the verse stated: “The length of the courtyard shall be a hundred cubits, and the breadth fifty by fifty, The Torah said: Take fifty and surround fifty
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said, as the verse states: "The length of the courtyard shall be one hundred cubits, and the width fifty by fifty." The Torah said: Take fifty, and encircle fifty.

hebrew_text: פְּשָׁטֵיהּ דִּקְרָא בְּמַאי כְּתִיב?! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַעֲמֵד מִשְׁכָּן עַל שְׂפַת חֲמִשִּׁים, כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא חֲמִשִּׁים אַמָּה לְפָנָיו וְעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה לְכׇל רוּחַ וָרוּחַ.
human_translation: to what does the plain meaning of the verse refer? Abaye said Position the Tabernacle at the edge of fifty so that there is fifty cubits in front of it, and twenty cubits in every direction,
llm_translation: The straightforward interpretation of the verse - with what is it written?! Abaye said: "Set up the Tabernacle on a fifty-cubit measure, so that there will be fifty cubits in front of it and twenty cubits on every side."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיְתָה אׇרְכָּהּ כּוּ׳. וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיְתָה אׇרְכָּהּ יָתֵר עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם בְּרׇחְבָּהּ אֲפִילּוּ אַמָּה אַחַת — אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין בְּתוֹכָהּ!
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: If its length is Wasn’t it taught Rabbi Eliezer says: If its length is more than double its breadth, even by one cubit, one may not carry inside it?
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: If its length was 20 cubits. And it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: If its length was more than two by its width, even one cubit - one may not carry within it!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי: כִּי תְּנַן נָמֵי מַתְנִיתִין — [יָתֵר עַל] פִּי שְׁנַיִם בְּרׇחְבָּהּ תְּנַן. אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי?!
human_translation: Rav Beivai bar Abaye said: When we learned in the mishna, also more than double its breadth. If so, this is Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: Rav Bibi bar Abbaye said: When we learned in the Mishnah - more than the width of two fingers we learned. If so, is this not Rabbi Yosei?!

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ רִיבּוּעָא דְּרִיבְּעוּהָ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: There is between them the square that the Sages squared it,
llm_translation: There is a difference between them, the square of the square, the Rabbis squared it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר כּוּ׳. אִיתְּמַר, אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. וְרַב בִּיבִי אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: It was stated Rav Yosef said Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. And Rav Beivai said Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: "It was stated: Rav Yosef said in the name of Rav Yehudah who said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yosei." And Rav Bibi said: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is according to Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: וְתַרְוַיְיהוּ לְקוּלָּא. וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא עַד דְּאִיכָּא שׁוֹמֵירָה אוֹ בֵּית דִּירָה. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: both are leniently, and necessary. As had taught halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, I would have said unless contains a watchman’s booth or a dwelling place, teaches us halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Akiva,
llm_translation: And their dispute is to be lenient. And it is necessary, for if we were to hear the halakha according to Rabbi Yosei, I would say until there is a Shomera or a Beis Dirah. It is heard for us the halakha according to Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא דַּאֲרִיךְ וְקַטִּין — לָא. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: And, had taught halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, I would have said long and narrow, not teaches halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: And if we were to hear a halakha according to Rabbi Akiva, I would say that if it is long and short - no. It is heard for us to follow the halakha according to Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: קַרְפֵּף שֶׁהוּא יוֹתֵר מִבֵּית סָאתַיִם שֶׁהוּקַּף לְדִירָה, נִזְרַע רוּבּוֹ הֲרֵי הוּא כְּגִינָּה, וְאָסוּר.
human_translation: a karpef that is greater than two beit se’a , which was enclosed for the purpose of residence, the greater part of it was sown it is like a garden, and it is prohibited
llm_translation: "Karpef, which is more than two Beit Sa'at, that he surrounded for a dwelling, if he planted most of it, behold it is like a garden, and it is prohibited."

hebrew_text: נָטַע רוּבּוֹ הֲרֵי הוּא כְּחָצֵר, וּמוּתָּר.
human_translation: the greater part of it was planted it is like a courtyard, and is permitted
llm_translation: Planted his majority, behold it is like a courtyard, and permitted.

hebrew_text: נִזְרַע רוּבּוֹ, אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא יוֹתֵר מִבֵּית סָאתַיִם. אֲבָל בֵּית סָאתַיִם — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: the greater part of was sown Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: We only said greater than two beit se’a , but two beit se’a , permitted.
llm_translation: Planted his majority, said Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua: We only said more than two se'ahs. But two se'ahs - permitted.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן? כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד גַּגּוֹת וְאֶחָד חֲצֵירוֹת וְאֶחָד קַרְפֵּיפוֹת רְשׁוּת אַחַת הֵן לְכֵלִים שֶׁשָּׁבְתוּ בְּתוֹכָן, וְלֹא לְכֵלִים שֶׁשָּׁבְתוּ בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, as we learned Rabbi Shimon says: Roofs, courtyards, and karpeifot are all one domain with regard to utensils that began Shabbat in them, not with regard to utensils that began Shabbat in the house
llm_translation: As whom? As Rabbi Shimon. For it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says: One regarding rooftops, and one regarding courtyards, and one regarding enclosures - they are all considered one domain for vessels that were placed within them on Shabbat, but not for vessels that were placed within the house.

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן דְּנִזְרַע רוּבּוֹ — הָוֵי הָהוּא מִעוּטָא
human_translation: Even according to Rabbi Shimon, since the greater part of is sown, the minor
llm_translation: To Rabbi Shimon Nami, since his majority is sown - that one is considered a minority.

hebrew_text: בְּטִיל לֵיהּ לְגַבַּי רוּבָּה, וְהָוֵה לֵיהּ קַרְפֵּף יוֹתֵר מִבֵּית סָאתַיִם — וְאָסוּר.
human_translation: is nullified to the greater part, And it is a karpef greater than two beit se’a , prohibited
llm_translation: He nullified it in comparison to the majority, and it had more crumbs than two se'ahs - and it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אִיתְּמַר הָכִי אִיתְּמַר: הָא מִיעוּטָא — שָׁרֵי. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא הָוֵי בֵּית סָאתַיִם, אֲבָל בֵּית סָאתַיִם — אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rather, if this was stated, this is what was stated minor permitted Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: We said only is not two beit se’a , however, two beit se’a , is prohibited
llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated thus, it was stated thus: If it is a small amount - it is permitted. Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: We only said this when it is not a Beit Sa'atayim, but if it is a Beit Sa'atayim - it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן? כְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: According to whose according to the Rabbis,
llm_translation: As whom? As the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: וְרַב יִרְמְיָה מִדִּיפְתִּי מַתְנֵי לְקוּלָּא: הָא מִיעוּטָא — שְׁרֵי, אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בֵּית סָאתַיִם, אֲבָל יוֹתֵר מִבֵּית סָאתַיִם — אָסוּר. כְּמַאן? כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: And Rav Yirmeya from Difti would teach as a leniency, minor is permitted Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua said: We only said two beit se’a , but more than two beit se’a , is prohibited According to whose according to Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: Rav Yirmeya from Difti taught for leniency: This small amount - permissible. Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua said: We only said this regarding a Beit Sa'ataim, but more than a Beit Sa'ataim - prohibited. According to whom? According to Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: נָטַע רוּבּוֹ — הֲרֵי הוּא כְּחָצֵר, וּמוּתָּר. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר אֲבִימִי: וְהוּא שֶׁעֲשׂוּיִין אִצְטַבְּלָאוֹת. וְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין עֲשׂוּיִין אִצְטַבְּלָאוֹת.
human_translation: the greater part of was planted it is like a courtyard, and permitted Rav Yehuda said Avimi said: This is were planted in rows [ itztablaot ], But Rav Naḥman said: even if they were not planted in rows,
llm_translation: Planted majority - behold it is like a courtyard, and permitted. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Avimi: And it is that they are made with dipping pools. And Rav Nachman said: Even though they are not made with dipping pools.

hebrew_text: מָר יְהוּדָה אִקְּלַע לְבֵי רַב הוּנָא בַּר יְהוּדָה. חֲזַנְהוּ לְהָנְהוּ דְּלָא עֲבִידִי אִצְטַבְּלָאוֹת, וְקָא מְטַלְטְלִי בְּגַוַּיְיהוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא סָבַר לַהּ מָר לְהָא דַּאֲבִימִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא כְּרַב נַחְמָן סְבִירָא לִי.
human_translation: Mar Yehuda happened to the house of Rav Huna bar Yehuda, he saw certain that were not planted in rows, and were carrying among them. said to Doesn’t the Master hold with this of Avimi? said to him: I hold like Rav Naḥman,
llm_translation: Mar Yehudah happened upon the house of Rav Huna, son of Yehudah. He saw them not engaging in ritual immersion, and they were moving their bodies. He said to him: Does our master not hold like the opinion of Abimi? He said to him: I hold like Rav Nachman.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: קַרְפֵּף יוֹתֵר מִבֵּית סָאתַיִם שֶׁלֹּא הוּקַּף לְדִירָה, כֵּיצַד הוּא עוֹשֶׂה? פּוֹרֵץ בּוֹ פִּירְצָה יוֹתֵר מֵעֶשֶׂר, וְגוֹדְרוֹ וּמַעֲמִידוֹ עַל עֶשֶׂר, וּמוּתָּר.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said: a karpef that is greater than two beit se’a , which was not enclosed for residence, what should one do He should make a breach larger than ten and fence it off and reduce to ten is permitted
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: A courtyard more than two se'ah that was not enclosed for a dwelling, how does one make it fit for use? He breaks through it more than ten handbreadths, and fences it and establishes it as a dwelling, and it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: פָּרַץ אַמָּה וְגָדַר אַמָּה [וּפָרַץ אַמָּה וּגְדָרָהּ], עַד שֶׁהִשְׁלִימוֹ לְיוֹתֵר מֵעֶשֶׂר, מַהוּ?
human_translation: raises a dilemma: he breached one cubit and fenced off cubit, and breached cubit and fenced it off, until he completed more than ten what is
llm_translation: He asked them: If one breached a cubit and fenced a cubit and breached a cubit and fenced it, until they completed it to be more than ten, what is the law?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, לָאו הַיְינוּ דִּתְנַן: כׇּל כְּלֵי בַּעֲלֵי בָתִּים, שִׁיעוּרָן כְּרִמּוֹנִים.
human_translation: He said to him: Is this not as we learned All utensils belonging to homeowners the size of pomegranates.
llm_translation: He said to him, "This is not what we learned: All household vessels, their measurement is like pomegranates."

hebrew_text: וּבָעֵי חִזְקִיָּה: נִיקַּב כְּמוֹצִיא זַיִת וּסְתָמוֹ, וְחָזַר וְנִיקַּב כְּמוֹצִיא זַיִת וּסְתָמוֹ, עַד שֶׁהִשְׁלִימוֹ לְמוֹצִיא רִמּוֹן מַהוּ?
human_translation: And Ḥizkiya raised a dilemma: was perforated for an olive to emerge, and he sealed it, and then it was perforated again for an olive to emerge, and he sealed it until completed a pomegranate to emerge, what
llm_translation: The text reads: "And Hezekiah inquired: If it was perforated like one who extracts an olive and its seal, and then it was restored and perforated like one who extracts an olive and its seal, until it was completed to extract a pomegranate, what is the ruling?"

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רַבִּי, שָׁנִיתָה לָנוּ: סַנְדָּל שֶׁנִּפְסְקָה אַחַת מֵאׇזְנָיו וְתִיקְּנָהּ — טָמֵא מִדְרָס.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: Master, you taught us sandal that one of its ears, broke and he repaired it, ritually impure treading [ ]
llm_translation: And he said to him, Rabbi Yochanan: Rabbi, you have taught us: a sandal that one of its straps has been detached from its ear and he fixed it - it is impure from the ground.

hebrew_text: נִפְסְקָה שְׁנִיָּה וְתִיקְּנָהּ — טָהוֹר בָּהּ מִן הַמִּדְרָס, אֲבָל טָמֵא מַגַּע מִדְרָס.
human_translation: If the ear ritually pure by means of treading. However, ritually impure contact treading,
llm_translation: The discussion was interrupted, and it was established: pure in it from the midras, but impure through contact with the midras.

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַרְתְּ עֲלַהּ: מַאי שְׁנָא רִאשׁוֹנָה — דְּהָא קָיְימָא שְׁנִיָּה? שְׁנִיָּה נָמֵי — הָא קָיְימָא רִאשׁוֹנָה?!
human_translation: And you said about this What is different the first because second intact. second first intact;
llm_translation: And you shall say about it: What is the difference, the first one - for it is established, the second one? The second one also - is it not established, the first one?!

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַרְתְּ לַן עֲלַהּ: פָּנִים חֲדָשׁוֹת בָּאוּ לְכָאן. הָכָא נָמֵי, פָּנִים חֲדָשׁוֹת בָּאוּ לְכָאן.
human_translation: And you said to us this a new entity has arrived here. Here, too, a new entity has arrived here,
llm_translation: And you said to us: "New faces have arrived here." Here too, new faces have arrived here.

hebrew_text: קָרֵי עֲלֵיהּ: לֵית דֵּין בַּר אִינָשׁ. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: כְּגוֹן דֵּין בַּר נַשׁ.
human_translation: he exclaimed about him: This is not a human being; Some say This is an human being.
llm_translation: He reads upon it: there is no judgment in a man. There are those who say: like Din bar Nash.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: רְחָבָה שֶׁאֲחוֹרֵי הַבָּתִּים — אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין בּוֹ אֶלָּא בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said: A yard behind houses, inside it, one may carry only four cubits.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: A courtyard behind the houses - one may only carry within it for a distance of four cubits.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אִם פָּתַח לוֹ פֶּתַח — מוּתָּר לְטַלְטֵל בְּכוּלּוֹ, פֶּתַח מַתִּירוֹ. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא שֶׁפָּתַח וּלְבַסּוֹף הוּקַּף, אֲבָל הוּקַּף וּלְבַסּוֹף פָּתַח — לָא.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: If one opened an entrance to it it is permitted to carry throughout the entire the entrance permits it, And we stated only where he opened and afterward fenced in but if he fenced it in and afterward opened not
llm_translation: And Rav Nachman said: If he opened for him a door - it is permitted to carry it all, the door permits it. And we only said that if he opened and in the end encircled, but if he encircled and in the end opened - no.

hebrew_text: פָּתַח וּלְבַסּוֹף הוּקַּף פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאִית בֵּיהּ בֵּי דָרֵי. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: אַדַּעְתָּא דְּבֵי דָרֵי עַבְדֵיהּ. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: opened and afterward fenced in obvious is necessary only where there is a threshing floor you might have said he made with the threshing floor in mind, He teaches us
llm_translation: He began and in the end he encircled - it is obvious! It is not necessary, for it has the House of Darai. What is the concern that you might say: The knowledge of the House of Darai did it. It is evident to us.

hebrew_text: קַרְפֵּף יוֹתֵר מִבֵּית סָאתַיִם שֶׁהוּקַּף לְדִירָה וְנִתְמַלֵּא מַיִם, סְבוּר רַבָּנַן לְמֵימַר כִּזְרָעִים דָּמוּ — וַאֲסִיר.
human_translation: a karpef more than two beit se’a , which had been enclosed for residence but became filled with water, the Rabbis thought to say is like seeds. is prohibited
llm_translation: "Karpef more than two Beit Se'atayim that surrounded for a dwelling and filled with water, the Rabbis thought to say like seeds they are — and prohibited."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב אַבָּא אֲבוּהּ דְּרַב בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: הָכִי אָמְרִינַן מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: מַיִם כִּנְטָעִים דָּמוּ, וּשְׁרֵי.
human_translation: Rav Abba, father of Rav, son of Rav Mesharshiya, said: We say in the name of Rava as follows: Water is like planted is permitted
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Abba the father of Rav Mesharshaya said thus in the name of Rava: "Planted water they are, and they flow."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: וְהוּא דְּחַזְיִין לְתַשְׁמִישְׁתָּא, אֲבָל לָא חַזְיִין לְתַשְׁמִישְׁתָּא — לָא.
human_translation: Ameimar said: This applies only if is fit for use, However, is not fit for use, not
llm_translation: Amemar said: "One who sees for the purpose of using, but does not see for the purpose of using - no."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: וּדְחַזְיִין לְתַשְׁמִישְׁתָּא נָמֵי לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין בְּעוֹמְקוֹ יוֹתֵר מִבֵּית סָאתַיִם, אֲבָל אִם יֵשׁ בְּעוֹמְקוֹ יוֹתֵר מִבֵּית סָאתַיִם — אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: And is fit for use, this applies only if is not deep greater than two beit se’a ; but if deep greater two beit se’a , is prohibited
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: And one may look at the utensils, we did not say except that there is not in its depth more than two se'ah, but if there is in its depth more than two se'ah - it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: וְלָאו מִילְּתָא הִיא, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַכַּרְיָא דְפֵירֵי.
human_translation: And it is not so, just as in a pile of fruit,
llm_translation: And it is not a matter, as it is evident from the fact that he is a merchant of fruits.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא רְחָבָה דַּהֲוַאי בְּפוּם נַהֲרָא, דְּחַד גִּיסָא הֲוָה פְּתִיחַ לְמָתָא, וְחַד גִּיסָא הֲוָה פְּתִיחַ לִשְׁבִיל שֶׁל כְּרָמִים, וּשְׁבִיל שֶׁל כְּרָמִים הֲוָה סָלֵיק לְגוּדָּא דְנַהֲרָא.
human_translation: There was a certain yard in Pum Nahara One of its sides opened to the town, and the other opened to a path between the vineyards, and vineyard path led to the bank of a river
llm_translation: That field that was by the mouth of the river, one side was open for the city, and one side was open for the vineyard path, and the vineyard path led to the bank of the river.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הֵיכִי נַעֲבֵיד? לַעֲבֵיד לֵיהּ מְחִיצָה אַגּוּדָּא דְנַהֲרָא — אֵין עוֹשִׂין מְחִיצָה עַל גַּבֵּי מְחִיצָה.
human_translation: Abaye said: What shall we do Shall we construct a partition for it on the river bank, one cannot construct an partition on top of another
llm_translation: Abaye said: How should we act? To make for it a partition of reeds of the river - we do not make a partition on top of a partition.

hebrew_text: וְלַעֲבֵיד לֵיהּ צוּרַת הַפֶּתַח אַפּוּמָּא דִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁל כְּרָמִים — אָתוּ גַּמְלֵי שָׁדְיָין לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Shall we arrange a doorframe at the mouth of the vineyard path? the camels will come and knock it over.
llm_translation: And to make for it the form of the entrance, the depth of the path of vineyards - camels of demons came to him.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֶיעְבֵּיד לֶחִי אַפִּיתְחָא דִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁל כְּרָמִים, דְּמִגּוֹ דְּמַהְנְיָא לִשְׁבִיל שֶׁל כְּרָמִים, מְהַנֵּי נָמֵי לִרְחָבָה.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said: We should arrange a side post at the opening of the vineyard path since as it is effective for the vineyard path, it is also effective for the yard,
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: To make a path in the middle of a vineyard, because when it is beneficial for the vineyard, it is also beneficial for the open space.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: יֹאמְרוּ לֶחִי מוֹעִיל לִשְׁבִיל שֶׁל כְּרָמִים דְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: Rava said to him: will say a side post is effective a vineyard path generally,
llm_translation: Rava said to him: They should say to the liver, "You are beneficial for the pathway of vineyards in the world."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: עָבְדִינַן לֵיהּ לֶחִי לְפִיתְחָא דְמָתָא, דְּמִגּוֹ דְּמַהְנֵי לֵיהּ לֶחִי לְמָתָא, מַהְנֵי נָמֵי לִרְחָבָה.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: They should arrange a side post at the opening to the town, as since the side post is effective for the town, it is also effective for the yard,
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: We should make for it a courtyard at the entrance of the city, from where they bring a courtyard to the city, they should also bring a courtyard to the broad area.

hebrew_text: הִלְכָּךְ: טַלְטוֹלֵי בְּמָתָא גּוּפַהּ — שְׁרֵי. טַלְטוֹלֵי בִּרְחָבָה גּוּפַהּ — שְׁרֵי. מִמָּתָא לִרְחָבָה וּמֵרְחָבָה לְמָתָא, פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַב אַחָא וְרָבִינָא: חַד אָסַר וְחַד שָׁרֵי.
human_translation: Therefore, it is permitted to carry within the town itself to carry within the yard itself. from the town to the yard or from the yard to the town, Rav Aḥa and Ravina disagree: One prohibits and the other permits
llm_translation: Therefore: hanging in a city its body - permitted. Hanging in an open space its body - permitted. From a city to an open space and from an open space to a city, Rav Acha and Ravina dispute it: one forbids and one permits.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּשָׁרֵי — דְּהָא לֵיכָּא דָּיוֹרִין. וּמַאן דְּאָסַר — זִימְנִין דְּהָוֵי בַּהּ דָּיוֹרִין וְאָתֵי לְטַלְטוֹלֵי.
human_translation: The who permits there are no residents, And the who prohibits sometimes there are residents in it and might come to carry
llm_translation: One who permits - for there are those who are lenient. And one who forbids - sometimes it is a matter of those who are lenient, and they come to be stringent.

hebrew_text: קַרְפֵּף יוֹתֵר מִבֵּית סָאתַיִם שֶׁלֹּא הוּקַּף לְדִירָה וּבָא לְמַעֲטוֹ, מִיעֲטוֹ בָּאִילָנוֹת — לָא הָוֵי מִיעוּט.
human_translation: a karpef more than two beit se’a that had not been fenced in for residence, and one came to reduce it he reduced it by trees it is not a reduction,
llm_translation: "Karpef more than two Beit Sa'ataim that he did not encircle for a dwelling and he came to diminish it, if he diminished it with trees - it is not considered a diminishment."

hebrew_text: בָּנָה בּוֹ עַמּוּד גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה וְרָחָב אַרְבָּעָה — הָוֵי מִיעוּט. פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה — לָא הָוֵי מִיעוּט. מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה וְעַד אַרְבָּעָה — רַבָּה אָמַר: הָוֵי מִיעוּט, וְרָבָא אָמַר: לָא הָוֵי מִיעוּט.
human_translation: if he built up a column ten high and four wide, it is an reduction, less than three it is not an reduction. between three to four Rabba said: It constitutes an reduction, and Rava said: It does not constitute an reduction.
llm_translation: He built in it a pillar tall ten and wide four — it is considered a deficiency. Less than three — it is not considered a deficiency. From three to four — Rabba said: it is considered a deficiency, and Rava said: it is not considered a deficiency.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה אָמַר: הָוֵי מִיעוּט, דְּהָא נָפֵיק לֵיהּ מִתּוֹרַת לָבוּד. רָבָא אָמַר: לָא הָוֵי מִיעוּט, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא הָוֵי מְקוֹם אַרְבָּעָה — לָא חֲשִׁיב.
human_translation: Rabba said it constitutes an reduction because to be excluded from the principle of lavud , Rava said it does not constitute a reduction because as it is not a place four it is not significant.
llm_translation: Rabba said: Be stringent, for he derives it from the Torah of Avud. Rava said: Do not be stringent, since there is no place for four - it is not considered.

hebrew_text: הִרְחִיק מִן הַכּוֹתֶל אַרְבָּעָה וְעָשָׂה מְחִיצָה — הוֹעִיל. פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה — לֹא הוֹעִיל. מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה וְעַד אַרְבָּעָה — רַבָּה אָמַר: הוֹעִיל, רָבָא אָמַר: אֵינוֹ מוֹעִיל.
human_translation: If one distanced four from the wall and erected an partition it is effective less than three it is not effective, between three to four Rabba said: It is effective, Rava said: It is not effective.
llm_translation: He distanced from the wall four cubits and made a partition - it is effective. Less than three - it is not effective. From three to four - Rabbah said: it is effective, Rava said: it is not effective.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה אָמַר: הוֹעִיל, דְּהָא נָפֵיק לֵיהּ מִתּוֹרַת לָבוּד. רָבָא אָמַר: אֵינוֹ מוֹעִיל, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא הָוֵי מְקוֹם אַרְבָּעָה, לָא חֲשִׁיב.
human_translation: Rabba said: It is effective, as it to be removed from the principle of lavud . Rava said: It is not effective, because as it is not a place of four it is not significant.
llm_translation: Rabba said: It is beneficial, for he receives it from the Torah of Levud. Rava said: It is not beneficial, since it does not have a space of four, it is not considered.

hebrew_text: רַב שִׁימִי מַתְנֵי לְקוּלָּא: טָח בּוֹ טִיט וְיָכוֹל לַעֲמוֹד בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ — הָוֵי מִיעוּט. אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לַעֲמוֹד בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ — רַבָּה אָמַר: הָוֵי מִיעוּט, רָבָא אָמַר: לָא הָוֵי מִיעוּט.
human_translation: Rav Simi would teach a lenient If one plastered with plaster, and can stand on its own, it is an reduction, cannot stand on its own, Rabba said: It is an reduction, Rava said: It is not an reduction.
llm_translation: Rav Shimi teaches leniently: If one plastered it with mud and it can stand by itself - it is considered a minority. If it cannot stand by itself - Rabbah said: it is considered a minority, Rava said: it is not considered a minority.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה אָמַר: הָוֵי מִיעוּט, הַשְׁתָּא מִיהָא קָאֵי. רָבָא אָמַר: לָא הָוֵי מִיעוּט, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא יָכוֹל לְמֵיקַם בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ, לֹא כְּלוּם הוּא.
human_translation: Rabba says: It is an reduction, now, in any case, it stands. Rava says: It is not an reduction, because as it cannot stand on its own, it is nothing,
llm_translation: Rabba said: Be humble, and the Holy One, blessed be He, will stand by you. Rava said: One should not be too humble, for since he cannot stand up for himself, he is nothing.

hebrew_text: הִרְחִיק מִן הַתֵּל אַרְבָּעָה וְעָשָׂה מְחִיצָה — הוֹעִיל.
human_translation: If one distanced four from a mound and erected a partition it is effective
llm_translation: He distanced from the mound four and made a partition - it is beneficial.

hebrew_text: פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה אוֹ עַל שְׂפַת הַתֵּל, רַב חִסְדָּא וְרַב הַמְנוּנָא, חַד אָמַר: הוֹעִיל, וְחַד אָמַר: לֹא הוֹעִיל.
human_translation: less than three or on the edge of the mound Rav Ḥisda and Rav Hamnuna. One said: It is effective, the other one said: It is not effective.
llm_translation: Less than three or on the edge of the mound, Rav Ḥisdah and Rav Hamnuna, one said: it was beneficial, and one said: it was not beneficial.

hebrew_text: תִּסְתַּיֵּים דְּרַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר הוֹעִיל, דְּאִתְּמַר: הָעוֹשֶׂה מְחִיצָה עַל גַּבֵּי מְחִיצָה, אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: בְּשַׁבָּת הוֹעִיל.
human_translation: Conclude that Rav Ḥisda said it is effective, for it was stated one erected a partition on top of an partition, Rav Ḥisda said: Shabbat, is effective.
llm_translation: The completion of Rav Ḥisda said beneficial, as it was stated: One who makes a partition on top of a partition, Rav Ḥisda said: It is beneficial on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: בְּנִכְסֵי הַגֵּר לֹא קָנָה.
human_translation: with regard to the property of a convert, he does not acquire
llm_translation: With the property of the convert, he did not acquire.

hebrew_text: וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: אַף בְּשַׁבָּת נָמֵי לֹא הוֹעִיל. תִּסְתַּיֵּים.
human_translation: And Rav Sheshet said: Even with regard to Shabbat it is not effective. conclude
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: Even on Shabbat, it is also not effective. It is concluded.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: וּמוֹדֶה לִי רַב שֵׁשֶׁת שֶׁאִם עָשָׂה מְחִיצָה עַל הַתֵּל — שֶׁהוֹעִיל.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: Rav Sheshet agrees with me that if one erected a partition on the mound, that it is effective
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: And Rav Sheshet agrees with me that if one made a partition on the mound - it is effective.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא, הוֹאִיל וּבַאֲוִיר מְחִיצוֹת הָעֶלְיוֹנוֹת הוּא דָּר.
human_translation: What is the reason Since he dwells in the space the upper partitions,
llm_translation: What is the reason? Since it is in the air of the upper partitions that he resides.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: נִבְלְעוּ מְחִיצוֹת הַתַּחְתּוֹנוֹת, וְהָעֶלְיוֹנוֹת קַיָּימוֹת, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana raised a dilemma: If the lower partitions were swallowed up, the upper stand, what is
llm_translation: Ba'ei Ravva bar Bar Chana inquired: The lower partitions were swallowed, and the upper ones remained standing, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: לְמַאי? אִי לְנִכְסֵי הַגֵּר, הַיְינוּ דְּיִרְמְיָה בִּירָאָה. דְּאָמַר יִרְמְיָה בִּירָאָה אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הַאי מַאן דִּשְׁדָא לִיפְתָּא אַפִּילָא דְּאַרְעָא דְגֵר, וַאֲתָא יִשְׂרָאֵל אַחֲרִינָא רְפַק בָּהּ פּוּרְתָּא — בָּתְרָא קָנֵי, קַמָּא לָא קָנֵי.
human_translation: With regard to what If with regard to the property of a convert, this Yirmeya Bira’a, as Yirmeya Bira’a said Rav Yehuda said: one sowed turnip in cracks in land a convert, and another Jew came plowed a little, the latter one, acquires the first one does not acquire
llm_translation: Regarding what? If for the property of a convert, that is what Jeremiah said in fear. As Jeremiah said in fear, Rav Yehudah said: One who acquires for the purpose of beautifying, even the land of a convert, and then another Israelite comes and interrupts it with a clod of earth - the latter acquires, the former does not acquire.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? בְּעִידָּנָא דִּשְׁדָא — לָא קָא שָׁבַח. כִּי קָא שָׁבְחָא — מִמֵּילָא קָא מְשַׁבְּחָא.
human_translation: What is the reason At the time that he sowed, was not improved When it did improve, it improved on its own.
llm_translation: What is the reason? In the time of peace - he did not praise. When he praised - he praised from the beginning.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן שַׁבָּת, הָוֵי מְחִיצָה הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rather, with respect to Shabbat, a partition that was made on Shabbat;
llm_translation: And rather for the matter of Shabbat, it is considered an enclosure that was made on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא: כׇּל מְחִיצָה הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בְּשַׁבָּת, בֵּין בְּשׁוֹגֵג בֵּין בְּמֵזִיד — שְׁמָהּ מְחִיצָה.
human_translation: And it was taught Any partition made on Shabbat, whether unwittingly or intentionally, is called a partition.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And it was taught: Any partition that is made on Shabbat, whether inadvertently or intentionally - its name is a partition."

hebrew_text: לָאו אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לִזְרוֹק, אֲבָל לְטַלְטֵל — אָסוּר.
human_translation: Wasn’t it stated about this Rav Naḥman said: They taught only to throw but to carry is prohibited.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: If it was said regarding it, Rav Nachman said: They only taught about throwing, but regarding carrying - it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: כִּי אִיתְּמַר דְּרַב נַחְמָן — אַמֵּזִיד אִיתְּמַר.
human_translation: When Rav Naḥman was stated, it was stated intentionally.
llm_translation: When it was stated: Rav Nachman said - it was stated in the name of Rav.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא דַּעֲבַדָה מְחִיצָה עַל גַּבֵּי מְחִיצָה בְּנִכְסֵי הַגֵּר. אֲתָא הָהוּא גַּבְרָא, רְפַק בָּהּ פּוּרְתָּא. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, אוֹקְמַהּ בִּידֵיהּ. אֲתַא[י] אִיהִי וְקָא צָוְוחָא קַמֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לַהּ: מַאי אֶיעְבֵּיד לָךְ, דְּלָא מַחְזְקַתְּ כִּדְמַחְזְקִי אִינָשֵׁי.
human_translation: A certain woman erected a partition on top of partition in the property of a convert. A certain man came plowed a little. came before Rav Naḥman, who established the in his possession. came and cried out before He said to her: What can I do for you, as did not take possession in the manner that people take possession.
llm_translation: That woman who made a partition on top of a partition in the property of a convert. That man came, removed it. He came before Rav Nachman, placed it in his hands. She came and cried before him. He said to her: What can I do for you, that you do not hold like other people hold?

hebrew_text: קַרְפֵּף בֵּית שָׁלֹשׁ וְקֵירָה בּוֹ בֵּית סְאָה. רָבָא אָמַר: אֲוִיר קֵירוּיוֹ מְיַיתְּרוֹ. וְרַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר: אֵין אֲוִיר קֵירוּיוֹ מְיַיתְּרוֹ.
human_translation: a karpef three and one roofed beit se’a it, Rava said: Its roofed space renders it in excess And Rabbi Zeira said: Its roofed space does not render it in excess
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Karpef Beit Shalosh veKeirah bo Beit Se'ah. Rava amar: Avir Keiruyav meyattro. veRabbi Zeira amar: Ein Avir Keiruyav meyattro." English translation: "A courtyard of three houses and a wall within it must be a Se'ah in size. Rava said: Its airspace adds to the measurement. And Rabbi Zeira said: Its airspace does not add to the measurement."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא רָבָא וְרַבִּי זֵירָא בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל קָא מִיפַּלְגִי. דְּאִיתְּמַר: אַכְסַדְרָה בְּבִקְעָה, רַב אָמַר: מוּתָּר לְטַלְטֵל בְּכוּלָּהּ, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין אֶלָּא בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: Let us say Rava and Rabbi Zeira dispute the dispute between Rav and Shmuel. as it was stated: an enclosed veranda [ akhsadra ], in a field Rav said: One is permitted to carry in the entire And Shmuel said: One may carry only four cubits.
llm_translation: Let Rava and Rabbi Zeira in the dispute of Rav and Shmuel be divided. For it was stated: A courtyard in a valley, Rav said: It is permitted to carry throughout it, and Shmuel said: One may only carry within four cubits.

hebrew_text: רַב אָמַר: מוּתָּר לְטַלְטֵל בְּכוּלָּהּ — אָמְרִינַן פִּי תִקְרָה יוֹרֵד וְסוֹתֵם. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין אֶלָּא בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — לָא אָמְרִינַן פִּי תִקְרָה יוֹרֵד וְסוֹתֵם.
human_translation: Rav said: One is permitted to carry in the entire we say the edge of the roof descends and closes up And Shmuel said: One may carry only four cubits, we do not say the edge of the roof descends and closes up
llm_translation: Rav said: It is permitted to carry throughout the entire courtyard - we say: the mouth of the roof descends and closes. And Shmuel said: One may only carry within four cubits - we do not say: the mouth of the roof descends and closes.

hebrew_text: אִי דַּעֲבִידָא כִּי אַכְסַדְרָה הָכִי נָמֵי. הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, דְּעַבְדַהּ כִּי אוּרְזִילָא.
human_translation: If were made like an enclosed veranda indeed, With what are we dealing here? is made like a hammock,
llm_translation: If he does it in an organized manner, it is indeed proper. Here, what are we dealing with? He did it like a cedar.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: וּמוֹדֵינָא בְּקַרְפֵּף שֶׁנִּפְרַץ בִּמְלוֹאוֹ לֶחָצֵר שֶׁאָסוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא? הוֹאִיל וַאֲוִיר חָצֵר מְיַיתְּרוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: I agree with regard to a karpef that is fully breached into a courtyard, that prohibited What is the reason Because the space of the courtyard renders it in excess
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: And we establish in a courtyard that was breached in its fullness as forbidden. What is the reason? Because the air of the courtyard is increased.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: וְכִי אֲוִיר הַמּוּתָּר לוֹ אוֹסְרוֹ?
human_translation: Rav Yosef strongly objects to this Does a space which it is permitted to render prohibited?
llm_translation: Rav Yosef objects to her: Is the air permitted to him that he forbids it?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: כְּמַאן, כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן נָמֵי, הָא אִיכָּא אֲוִיר מְקוֹם מְחִיצוֹת.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, even according to Rabbi Shimon, there is the space where the walls
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: According to whom, like Rabbi Shimon? To Rabbi Shimon also, there is a place for partitions.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: קַרְפֵּף שֶׁנִּפְרַץ בִּמְלוֹאוֹ לְחָצֵר — חָצֵר מוּתֶּרֶת וְקַרְפֵּף אָסוּר.
human_translation: as Rav Ḥisda said a karpef that is fully breached into a courtyard: the courtyard permitted and the karpef prohibited
llm_translation: The translation of the Talmudic text is as follows: Rav Hisda said: A skylight that broke in its fullness into a courtyard - the courtyard is permitted, and the skylight is prohibited.

hebrew_text: חָצֵר מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּאִית לֵיהּ גִּיפּוּפֵי? וְהָא זִמְנִין דְּמַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ אִיפְּכָא.
human_translation: courtyard, what is the reason because it has the remnants But at times you find the opposite;
llm_translation: The courtyard, what is the reason? Because it has doorposts? But the times that you find it, it is the opposite.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמְרִינַן: זֶה — אֲוִיר מְחִיצוֹת מְיַיתְּרוֹ, וְזֶה — אֵין אֲוִיר מְחִיצוֹת מְיַיתְּרוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, because we say this the space of the walls renders it in excess that the space of the walls does not render it in excess of
llm_translation: Rather, because we say: this - the airspace of partitions increases it, and this - the airspace of partitions does not increase it.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא בּוּסְתָּנָא דַּהֲוָה סְמִיךְ לְגוּדָּא דְּאַפַּדְנָא. נְפַל אֲשִׁיתָא בָּרַיְיתָא דְּאַפַּדְנָא. סָבַר רַב בִּיבִי לְמֵימַר לִיסְמוֹךְ אַגּוּדָּא גַוּוֹיָאתָא.
human_translation: A certain orchard [ bustana ] was adjacent to the wall of a mansion [ apadna ]. the outer wall of the mansion, collapsed. Rav Beivai thought to say we can rely upon the inner walls
llm_translation: That certain Bustana who was adjacent to the Guda of Apadna. A fire fell into the well of Apadna. Rav Bibi thought to say to lean the Guda of the Gentiles.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פַּפִּי: מִשּׁוּם דְּאַתּוּ מִמּוּלָאֵי אָמְרִיתוּ מִילֵּי מוּלְיָיאתָא. הָנָךְ מְחִיצוֹת, לְגַוַּאי — עֲבִידָן, לְבָרַאי — לָא עֲבִידָן.
human_translation: Rav Pappi said to him: Because you come from truncated [ mula’ei ] people, you speak truncated [ mulayata ] matters, these walls were made for the inside they were not made for the outside;
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Pappi: Because they came from the east, you said words of Aramaic. Those are partitions, for non-Jews — they make them, for Jews — they do not make them.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא אַבְּווֹרַנְקָא דַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ לְרֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא בְּבוּסְתָּנֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְרַב הוּנָא בַּר חִינָּנָא: לֶיעְבֵּיד מָר תַּקַּנְתָּא, דְּלִמְחַר נֵאכוּל נַהֲמָא הָתָם.
human_translation: The Exilarch had a pavilion [ abvarneka ] in his orchard said to Rav Huna bar Ḥinnana: Let the Master make arrangement so that tomorrow, we may eat bread there,
llm_translation: That Avvoranka who had a head of exiled in Busstanai. He said to Rav Huna son of Chinana: "Master, let us do the repair, lest tomorrow we eat Nahama there."

hebrew_text: אֲזַל עֲבַד קָנֶה קָנֶה פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה, אֲזַל רָבָא
human_translation: went and erected reeds, less than three Rava, went
llm_translation: He went, he did, reed reed less than three, he went Rava.

hebrew_text: שַׁלְפִינְהוּ. אֲזַל רַב פָּפָּא וְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, נַקְטִינְהוּ מִבָּתְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: removed Rav Pappa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, went after him and collected
llm_translation: Pull them out. Rav Papa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, went, they took them out from their place.

hebrew_text: לִמְחַר אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרָבָא: עִיר חֲדָשָׁה מוֹדְדִין לָהּ מִיְּשִׁיבָתָהּ, וִישָׁנָה מֵחוֹמָתָהּ.
human_translation: On the following day, Ravina raised an objection to Rava’s a new town, we measure from its settled and an old from its wall,
llm_translation: On the morrow, Ravina raised an objection to Rava: We measure a new city from its place of sitting, and an old one from its wall.

hebrew_text: אֵיזוֹ הִיא חֲדָשָׁה וְאֵיזוֹ הִיא יְשָׁנָה? חֲדָשָׁה, שֶׁהוּקְּפָה וּלְבַסּוֹף יָשְׁבָה. יְשָׁנָה, יָשְׁבָה וּלְבַסּוֹף הוּקְּפָה. וְהַאי נָמֵי כְּהוּקְּפָה וּלְבַסּוֹף יָשְׁבָה דָּמֵי!
human_translation: What is a new and what is an old A new that was surrounded and afterward settled, an old that was settled, and afterward surrounded And this should also be considered like that was surrounded and afterward settled,
llm_translation: Which is new and which is old? New, that it was overturned and ultimately settled. Old, settled and ultimately overturned. And this case is similar to one that was overturned and ultimately settled!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְרָבָא: וְהָאָמַר רַב אַסִּי מְחִיצוֹת אַדְרְכָלִין לָא שְׁמָהּ מְחִיצָה, אַלְמָא כֵּיוָן דְּלִצְנִיעוּתָא עֲבִידָא לַהּ — לָא הָוְיָא מְחִיצָה. הָכָא נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן דְּלִצְנִיעוּתָא עֲבִידָא — לָא הָוְיָא מְחִיצָה.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Rava: Didn’t Rav Asi say the screens architects are not deemed partitions? Apparently, since it was erected for privacy, it is not considered a partition. Here too, since it was erected for privacy, it should not be considered a partition.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Rava: But didn't Rav Assi say: "Partitions of a courtyard are not considered a partition"? This implies that since it is not for modesty, it is not considered a partition. Here too, since it is not for modesty, it is not considered a partition.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְרָבָא: וְהָאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מְחִיצָה הָעֲשׂוּיָה לְנַחַת — לֹא שְׁמָהּ מְחִיצָה!
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rava: Didn’t Rav Huna say a partition made for resting is not considered a partition?
llm_translation: And Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rava: And Rav Huna said: A partition made for resting - its name is not a partition!

hebrew_text: דְּהָא רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ מְעָרֵב לַהּ לְכוּלַּהּ מָחוֹזָא עַרְסְיָיתָא עַרְסְיָיתָא מִשּׁוּם פֵּירָא דְּבֵי תוֹרֵי. וְהָא פֵּירָא דְּבֵי תוֹרֵי כִּמְחִיצָה הָעֲשׂוּיָה לְנַחַת דָּמְיָא.
human_translation: as Rabba bar Avuh constructed an eiruv row of houses in the whole of Meḥoza, due to the ditches the cattle Shouldn’t cattle ditches be considered like a partition made for resting
llm_translation: Rabba bar Avuh would mix for her a potion of Egyptian lentils due to the efficacy of the house of Torah. And the efficacy of the house of Torah is like a partition made to stop the blood.

hebrew_text: קָרֵי עֲלַיְיהוּ רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא: ״חֲכָמִים הֵמָּה לְהָרַע וּלְהֵיטִיב לֹא יָדָעוּ״.
human_translation: the Exilarch recited verse about “They are wise to do evil, but to do good they have no knowledge”
llm_translation: He called out over them the head of exile: "They are wise to do evil, but to do good they do not know."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אִלְעַאי, שָׁמַעְתִּי מֵרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: וַאֲפִילּוּ בֵּית כּוֹר. מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כַּחֲנַנְיָה. דְּתַנְיָא, חֲנַנְיָה אוֹמֵר: וַאֲפִילּוּ הִיא אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה כְּאִסְטְרַטְיָא שֶׁל מֶלֶךְ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elai said: I heard from Rabbi Eliezer even is a beit kor , not in accordance with Ḥananya, as it was taught Ḥananya says: even if it forty beit se’a , like the court of a king.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elai said, I heard from Rabbi Eliezer: Even in a Beit Khor. Mishna that is not like Chananya. As it was taught, Chananya says: Even if it is forty se'ah like the storehouse of a king.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וּשְׁנֵיהֶם מִקְרָא אֶחָד דָּרְשׁוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי יְשַׁעְיָהוּ לֹא יָצָא אֶל חָצֵר הַתִּיכוֹנָה״. כְּתִיב ״הָעִיר״ וְקָרֵינַן ״חָצֵר״ — מִכָּאן לָאִסְטְרַטְיָא שֶׁל מֶלֶךְ שֶׁהָיוּ כַּעֲיָירוֹת בֵּינוֹנִיּוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Both derived from the same verse, as it is stated: “And it came to pass, before Isaiah was gone out into the middle courtyard, it is written: “The city [ ha’ir ],” and we read courtyard [ ḥatzer ],” From here royal courts were as intermediate- cities.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: And both of them expounded one verse, as it is said: "And Hezekiah did not go out to the middle courtyard." It is written "the city" and we read "courtyard" - from here to the middle courtyard of the king, which were like intermediate cities.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: עֲיָירוֹת בֵּינוֹנִיּוֹת הָוְיָין בֵּית כּוֹר. וּמָר סָבַר: אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה הָוְיָין.
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? Sage, maintains: Intermediate- towns are a beit kor ; and Sage, maintains: They are forty se’a .
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? Master holds: Intermediate cities are considered as a courtyard. And Master holds: There are forty se'ah.

hebrew_text: וִישַׁעְיָהוּ מַאי בָּעֵי הָתָם? אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁחָלָה חִזְקִיָּה, וְהָלַךְ יְשַׁעְיָהוּ וְהוֹשִׁיב יְשִׁיבָה עַל פִּתְחוֹ.
human_translation: What did Isaiah need there Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: This teaches that Hezekiah took ill, and Isaiah went and established a academy at his door,
llm_translation: Isaiah, what did he want there? Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: It teaches that Hezekiah became ill, and Isaiah went and placed a seat at his door.

hebrew_text: מִכָּאן לְתַלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁחָלָה, שֶׁמּוֹשִׁיבִין יְשִׁיבָה עַל פִּתְחוֹ. וְלָאו מִילְּתָא הִיא, דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְאִיגָּרוֹיֵי בֵּיהּ שָׂטָן.
human_translation: Based on this, with regard to a Torah scholar who took ill, that one establishes an academy at entrance his This, is not a course perhaps they will come to provoke Satan against him.
llm_translation: From here for a Torah scholar who became ill, that they establish a gathering at his doorstep. And this is not a matter, perhaps the Satan will come to challenge him.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן שָׁמַעְתִּי הֵימֶנּוּ: אַנְשֵׁי חָצֵר שֶׁשָּׁכַח אֶחָד וְלֹא עֵירַב — בֵּיתוֹ אָסוּר.
human_translation: And I also heard from him one of the residents of a courtyard forgot and did not join in an eiruv is prohibited his house
llm_translation: And so I have heard from him: Men of a courtyard who forgot one and did not join - his house is forbidden.

hebrew_text: וְהָתְנַן: בֵּיתוֹ אָסוּר לְהוֹצִיא וּלְהַכְנִיס לוֹ וְלָהֶן?!
human_translation: Didn’t we learn is prohibited his house and for to take out or to bring
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: His house, it is forbidden to take out and to bring in for him and for them?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: לָא קַשְׁיָא,
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said Rav Sheshet said: not difficult.
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua said, Rav Sheshet said: It is not difficult.

hebrew_text: הָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, וְהָא רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: This, Rabbi Eliezer, while that, the Rabbis.
llm_translation: This is Rabbi Eliezer, and this is the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: כְּשֶׁתִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר, לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: הַמְבַטֵּל רְשׁוּת חֲצֵירוֹ — רְשׁוּת בֵּיתוֹ בִּיטֵּל. לְרַבָּנַן: הַמְבַטֵּל רְשׁוּת חֲצֵירוֹ — רְשׁוּת בֵּיתוֹ לֹא בִּיטֵּל.
human_translation: When you examine according to the statement of Rabbi Eliezer, one who renounces authority over his courtyard renounces authority over his house. according to the Rabbis, one who renounces authority over his courtyard does not renounce authority over his house
llm_translation: When you find yourself saying, according to the words of Rabbi Eliezer: One who nullifies the ownership of his courtyard - he nullifies the ownership of his house. According to the Rabbis: One who nullifies the ownership of his courtyard - he did not nullify the ownership of his house.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא!
human_translation: obvious
llm_translation: The Talmudic text "פְּשִׁיטָא!" can be translated into English as "It is obvious!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַחֲבָה: אֲנָא וְרַב הוּנָא בַּר חִינָּנָא תַּרְגֵּימְנָא: לֹא נִצְרְכָא אֶלָּא לַחֲמִשָּׁה שֶׁשְּׁרוּיִן בְּחָצֵר אֶחָד וְשָׁכַח אֶחָד מֵהֶן וְלֹא עֵירַב.
human_translation: Raḥava said: Rav Huna bar Ḥinnana and I explained: was necessary only with regard to five who lived in the same courtyard, one of whom forgot to join in an eiruv
llm_translation: Rahava said: Anah and Rav Huna son of Hinana translated for us: It is necessary only for five who are dwelling in one courtyard and one of them forgot, and did not participate in the Eruv.

hebrew_text: לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: כְּשֶׁהוּא מְבַטֵּל רְשׁוּתוֹ, אֵין צָרִיךְ לְבַטֵּל לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד.
human_translation: According to the statement of Rabbi Eliezer, when he renounces his authority, he need not renounce it to each and every one
llm_translation: According to the words of Rabbi Eliezer: When he nullifies his ownership, he does not need to nullify for each and every individual.

hebrew_text: לְרַבָּנַן: כְּשֶׁהוּא מְבַטֵּל רְשׁוּתוֹ, צָרִיךְ לְבַטֵּל לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד.
human_translation: according to the Rabbis, when he renounces his authority, he must renounce it to each and every one,
llm_translation: To the sages: When he nullifies his ownership, he must nullify for each and every one.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: חֲמִשָּׁה שֶׁשְּׁרוּיִן בְּחָצֵר אֶחָד וְשָׁכַח אֶחָד מֵהֶן וְלֹא עֵירַב, כְּשֶׁהוּא מְבַטֵּל רְשׁוּתוֹ, אֵין צָרִיךְ לְבַטֵּל רְשׁוּת לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד. כְּמַאן? כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
human_translation: In accordance with which is that was taught five lived in the same courtyard, and one of them forgot and did not join in an eiruv when he renounces his authority, he need not renounce his authority to each and every one In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer,
llm_translation: As to where did he go? This is as it was taught: Five who are dwelling in one courtyard and one of them forgot and did not participate in the Eruv, when he nullifies his domain, he does not need to nullify the domain for each and every one. Whose opinion is this? It is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: רַב כָּהֲנָא מַתְנֵי הָכִי. רַב טַבְיוֹמֵי מַתְנֵי הָכִי: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: חֲמִשָּׁה שֶׁשְּׁרוּיִם בְּחָצֵר אֶחָד וְשָׁכַח אֶחָד מֵהֶן וְלֹא עֵירַב, כְּשֶׁהוּא מְבַטֵּל רְשׁוּתוֹ אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְבַטֵּל רְשׁוּת לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד, כְּמַאן? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: כְּמַאן? כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
human_translation: Rav Kahana taught this way, Rav Tavyomei, taught as follows, In accordance with which is that was taught five lived in the same courtyard, and one of them forgot and did not join in an eiruv when he renounces his authority, he need not renounce his authority to each and every one in accordance with whose Rav Huna bar Yehuda said Rav Sheshet said: In accordance with whom? In accordance with Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana teaches thus. Rav Tavyumei teaches thus: According to whom does this Mishnah go? The one that teaches: Five who are permitted in one courtyard and one of them forgot and did not participate in the Eruv, when he nullifies his domain, he does not need to nullify the domain for each and every one. According to whom? Rav Huna son of Yehuda said in the name of Rav Sheshet: According to whom? According to Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, אִי אָמַר: לָא מְבַטֵּילְנָא, וּלְרַבָּנַן, אִי אָמַר: מְבַטֵּילְנָא — מַאי?
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: According to Rabbi Eliezer, if one stated: I am not renouncing and according to the Rabbis, if he stated: I am renouncing what is
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: To Rabbi Eliezer, if he says we do not nullify, and to the Rabbis, if he says we nullify - what?

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מִשּׁוּם דְּקָסָבַר: הַמְבַטֵּל רְשׁוּת חֲצֵירוֹ, רְשׁוּת בֵּיתוֹ בִּיטֵּל. וְהַאי אָמַר: אֲנָא לָא מְבַטֵּילְנָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer’s reason because he maintains one who renounces authority over his renounces authority over his house, but this stated: I am not renouncing
llm_translation: The reason of Rabbi Eliezer is because he holds: One who nullifies his courtyard's domain, nullifies his house's domain. And this one said: I do not nullify.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִילְמָא, טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מִשּׁוּם דְּבַיִת בְּלָא חָצֵר לָא עֲבִידִי אִינָשֵׁי דְּדָיְירִי. וְכִי קָאָמַר לָא מְבַטֵּילְנָא — לָאו כָּל כְּמִינֵּיהּ, אַף עַל גַּב דְּאָמַר דָּיַירְנָא — לָאו כְּלוּם קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Or perhaps Rabbi Eliezer’s reason because people do not live a house without a courtyard, when he says: I am not renouncing not in his power as even though he says: I to live he has said nothing.
llm_translation: Or perhaps, the reason for Rabbi Eliezer is because people do not make their homes without a courtyard. And when he says we do not nullify it - not all like it, even though he said we make it - he is not saying nothing.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבָּנַן, אִי אָמַר: מְבַטֵּילְנָא. מַאי טַעְמָא דְרַבָּנַן? מִשּׁוּם דְּקָסָבְרִי: הַמְבַטֵּל רְשׁוּת חֲצֵירוֹ — רְשׁוּת בֵּיתוֹ לֹא בִּיטֵּל, וְהַאי אֲמַר מְבַטֵּילְנָא.
human_translation: And according to the Rabbis. If one stated: I am renouncing what the reason the Rabbis because they maintain one who renounces authority over his courtyard does not renounce authority over his house but this stated: I am renouncing
llm_translation: For the sages, if he said: we nullify. What is the reason of the sages? Because they hold: one who nullifies the domain of his courtyard - he does not nullify the domain of his house, and this one says we nullify.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִילְמָא, טַעְמָא דְרַבָּנַן מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא עֲבִיד אִינִישׁ דִּמְסַלֵּק נַפְשֵׁיהּ לִגְמָרֵי מִבַּיִת וְחָצֵר, וְהָוֵי כִּי אוֹרֵחַ לְגַבַּיְיהוּ. וְהַאי כִּי אָמַר מְבַטֵּילְנָא — לָאו כָּל כְּמִינֵּיהּ קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Or perhaps the reason the Rabbis because one does not usually remove himself entirely from a house and courtyard, making himself like a guest among And when he states: I am renouncing not in his power
llm_translation: Or perhaps, the reason of the Rabbis is because a person should not completely remove himself from the house and courtyard, and it will be as if he is passing by them. And when he says "we are nullified," he is not saying that he is like all of them.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בֵּין לְרַבָּנַן בֵּין לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, כֵּיוָן דְּגַלִּי דַּעְתֵּיהּ — גַּלִּי.
human_translation: said to Both according to the Rabbis and according to Rabbi Eliezer, once one has revealed his wishes, he has revealed
llm_translation: He said to him: Whether for the Sages or for Rabbi Eliezer, once he has revealed his opinion - he has revealed.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן שָׁמַעְתִּי מִמֶּנּוּ שֶׁיּוֹצְאִים בְּעַרְקַבָּלִין בְּפֶסַח. מַאי עַרְקַבָּלִין? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אַצְווֹתָא חָרוּזְיָאתָא.
human_translation: And I also heard from that one may fulfill his obligation on Passover with arkablin , What is arkablin ? Reish Lakish said: Atzvata ḥaruziyata ,
llm_translation: And so I heard from him that they go out with Arqavbalin on Pesach. What are Arqavbalin? Reish Lakish said: bundles of leeks.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ עוֹשִׂין פַּסִּין
llm_translation: We will return to you, we make partitions.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בַּכֹּל מְעָרְבִין וּמִשְׁתַּתְּפִין, חוּץ מִן הַמַּיִם וּמִן הַמֶּלַח.
human_translation: One may establish a joining and one may merge with all except for water and salt,
llm_translation: It was taught: In all other substances one may mix and partake together, except for water and salt.

hebrew_text: וְהַכֹּל נִיקָּח בְּכֶסֶף מַעֲשֵׂר, חוּץ מִן הַמַּיִם וּמִן הַמֶּלַח. הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַמָּזוֹן — מוּתָּר בְּמֶלַח וּבְמַיִם.
human_translation: All may be bought with tithe money, except for water and salt. one who vows that nourishment is permitted water and salt,
llm_translation: And all is acquired with money of tithe, except for water and salt. One who vows from food — permitted in salt and in water.

hebrew_text: מְעָרְבִין לַנָּזִיר בְּיַיִן וּלְיִשְׂרָאֵל בִּתְרוּמָה. סוֹמְכוֹס אוֹמֵר: בְּחוּלִּין.
human_translation: one may establish an eiruv for a nazirite with wine, And for an Israelite with teruma , Summakhos, says: with unconsecrated
llm_translation: We mix for the Nazirite with wine and for Israel with terumah. Simekos says: with common wine.

hebrew_text: וְלַכֹּהֵן בְּבֵית הַפְּרָס. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ בֵּין הַקְּבָרוֹת.
human_translation: for a priest in a beit haperas , Rabbi Yehuda says: even between the graves
llm_translation: And to the priest in the house of Persia. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even between the graves.

hebrew_text: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לָחוֹץ, וְלֵילֵךְ וְלֶאֱכוֹל.
human_translation: since he can interpose and go and eat
llm_translation: Because he is able to go out, walk, and eat.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין לְמֵידִין מִן הַכְּלָלוֹת, וַאֲפִילּוּ בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בּוֹ חוּץ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One may not learn from general statements, even in a place where it says except.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara Amar Rabbi Yochanan: Ein l'midin min ha'klalot, va'afilu bimkom she'ne'emar bo chutz. English translation: Gemara said Rabbi Yochanan: We do not learn from general principles, even in a place where it is stated except.

hebrew_text: מִדְּקָאָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בּוֹ חוּץ, מִכְּלָל דְּלָאו הָכָא קָאֵי, הֵיכָא קָאֵי?
human_translation: From said: Even in a place where it says except, by inference that he was not relating to here To which was he relating
llm_translation: From where he said: Even in a place where it is stated about it outside, from the inference that it is not standing here, where is it standing?

hebrew_text: הָתָם קָאֵי כׇּל מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָא, אֲנָשִׁים חַיָּיבִין וְנָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת. וְשֶׁלֹּא הַזְּמַן גְּרָמָא, אֶחָד נָשִׁים וְאֶחָד אֲנָשִׁים חַיָּיבִין.
human_translation: He was relating there: all time-bound, positive commandments, men are obligated and women are exempt. that are not time-bound, both women and men are obligated
llm_translation: There, standing, all positive commandments that are time-bound, men are obligated and women are exempt. And those that are not time-bound, both men and women are obligated.

hebrew_text: וּכְלָלָא הוּא דְּכׇל מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָא נָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת? הֲרֵי מַצָּה שִׂמְחָה וְהַקְהֵל, דְּמִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָא הוּא, וְנָשִׁים חַיָּיבוֹת.
human_translation: Is it principle women are exempt from all time-bound, positive commandments there is matza rejoicing assembly are time-bound, positive commandments, and women are obligated
llm_translation: It is a principle that all positive commandments that are time-bound, women are exempt? Behold, Matzah, Rejoicing, and Assembly, which are positive commandments that are time-bound, and women are obligated.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁלֹּא הַזְּמַן גְּרָמָא נָשִׁים חַיָּיבוֹת? הֲרֵי תַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה, פְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה, וּפִדְיוֹן הַבֵּן, דְּמִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁלֹּא הַזְּמַן גְּרָמָא וְנָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת. אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין לְמֵידִין מִן הַכְּלָלוֹת וַאֲפִילּוּ בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בּוֹ חוּץ.
human_translation: are women obligated in all positive commandments that are not time-bound? there is Torah study, be fruitful and multiply, redemption of the firstborn, positive commandments that are not time-bound, and women are exempt Rather, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One may not learn from general statements, even in a place where it says except,
llm_translation: And all positive commandments that are not time-bound, women are obligated? Behold the Torah, be fruitful and multiply, and redeeming the firstborn son, are positive commandments that are not time-bound and women are exempt. Rather, Rabbi Yochanan said: We do not learn from general principles, even in a case where it is stated except.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא, עוֹד כְּלָל אַחֵר אָמְרוּ: כׇּל שֶׁנִּישָּׂא עַל גַּבֵּי הַזָּב — טָמֵא, וְכֹל שֶׁהַזָּב נִישָּׂא עָלָיו — טָהוֹר, חוּץ מִן הָרָאוּי לְמִשְׁכָּב וּמוֹשָׁב, וְהָאָדָם. וְתוּ לֵיכָּא? וְהָא אִיכָּא מֶרְכָּב?!
human_translation: Abaye said, and some say Rabbi Yirmeya We, too, have also learned They stated another principle: Anything carried upon a zav is impure. And anything on which a zav is carried is pure, except for suitable for lying or sitting upon and a human being, And is there nothing else? But there is rides
llm_translation: Abaye said, and it was stated by Rabbi Yirmeya: We also learned, they said another general principle: Anyone who has seminal emission on his body is impure, and anyone on whom the semen falls is pure, except for that which is fit for lying or sitting, and a person. But is there a chariot here?!

hebrew_text: מֶרְכָּב הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּיָתֵיב עֲלֵיהּ — הַיְינוּ מוֹשָׁב. אֲנַן הָכִי קָאָמְרִינַן: הָא אִיכָּא גַּבָּא דְאוּכָּפָא, דְּתַנְיָא: הָאוּכָּף — טָמֵא מוֹשָׁב, וְהַתְּפוּס — טָמֵא מֶרְכָּב. אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אֵין לְמֵידִין מִן הַכְּלָלוֹת וַאֲפִילּוּ בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בּוֹ חוּץ.
human_translation: What are the circumstances one rides? If he sat upon it, it is a seat. We say as follows: There is the upper part of a saddle, As it was taught A saddle is impure a seat and the pommel, is impure a riding Rather, conclude from this one may not learn from general statements, even in a place where it says except.
llm_translation: Chariot how is it considered? If one sits on it - that is a seat. We thus say: Here there is a pit of a grave, as it is taught: The one who is sitting - impure as a seat, and the one who is holding - impure as a chariot. Rather, learn from it that we do not derive from generalizations even in a case where it is explicitly stated otherwise.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב נַחְמָן: אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: בַּכֹּל מְעָרְבִין וּמִשְׁתַּתְּפִין, חוּץ מִן הַמַּיִם וְהַמֶּלַח. וְתוּ לֵיכָּא? וְהָא אִיכָּא כְּמֵיהִין וּפִטְרִיּוֹת?! — אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: אֵין לְמֵידִין מִן הַכְּלָלוֹת וַאֲפִילּוּ בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בּוֹ חוּץ.
human_translation: Ravina said, and some say Rav Naḥman We, too, have also learned One may establish an eiruv and merge with all except for water and salt. And is there nothing else? But there are truffles and mushrooms, Rather, conclude from this one may not learn from general statements, even in a place where it says except.
llm_translation: Ravina said, and it was stated similarly by Rav Nachman: We also learned: With everything one may mix and partake, except for water and salt. Is there really a need for this teaching? But are there not fish and vegetables?! Rather, learn from it: One does not learn from general principles, even in a case where it is explicitly stated except.

hebrew_text: הַכֹּל נִיקָּח בְּכֶסֶף מַעֲשֵׂר כּוּ׳. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא, חַד מַתְנֵי אַעֵירוּב וְחַד מַתְנֵי אַמַּעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: All may be bought with tithe money, Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina one teaches with regard to eiruv , and one teaches with regard to tithe.
llm_translation: All can be acquired with money, except for the tithe. Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina, one teaches regarding Eruv and one teaches regarding Ma'aser.

hebrew_text: חַד מַתְנֵי אַעֵירוּב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא מַיִם בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ וּמֶלַח בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ דְּאֵין מְעָרְבִין. אֲבָל בְּמַיִם וּמֶלַח — מְעָרְבִין.
human_translation: One teaches with regard to eiruv , They only taught one may not establish an eiruv water by itself or salt by itself. But water and salt one may establish an eiruv .
llm_translation: One sage taught regarding Eruv: They only said water by itself and salt by itself are not mixed. But with water and salt — they mix.

hebrew_text: וְחַד מַתְנֵי אַמַּעֲשֵׂר: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא מַיִם בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ וּמֶלַח בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ, דְּאֵין נִיקָּחִין. אֲבָל מַיִם וּמֶלַח — נִיקָּחִין בְּכֶסֶף מַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: And one teaches with regard to tithe: They only taught may not be bought water by itself or salt by itself. But water and salt may be bought with tithe
llm_translation: And one Baraita teaches: They only taught that water must be given separately and salt must be given separately, for they are not taken together. But water and salt - they are taken together with Ma'aser money.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּמַתְנֵי אַמַּעֲשֵׂר, כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן אַעֵירוּב. וּמַאן דְּמַתְנֵי אַעֵירוּב, אֲבָל אַמַּעֲשֵׂר לָא. מַאי טַעְמָא — פֵּירָא בָּעִינַן.
human_translation: The one who teaches with regard to tithe, all the more so to an eiruv , the one who teaches with regard to an eiruv , but with regard to no, What is the reason we require produce,
llm_translation: One who establishes an Eruv, all the more so Maaser. And one who establishes Maaser, but not Eruv. What is the reason? We require a clear distinction.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַבִּי יִצְחָק, מַתְנֵי אַמַּעֲשֵׂר. מֵיתִיבִי: הֵעִיד רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן גָּדִישׁ לִפְנֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: שֶׁל בֵּית אַבָּא הָיוּ לוֹקְחִין צִיר בְּכֶסֶף מַעֲשֵׂר. אָמַר לוֹ: שֶׁמָּא לֹא שָׁמַעְתָּ אֶלָּא כְּשֶׁקִּרְבֵי דָגִים מְעוֹרָבִין בָּהֶן. וַאֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן גָּדִישׁ לָא קָאָמַר אֶלָּא בְּצִיר, דְּשׁוּמְנָא דְפֵירָא הִיא, אֲבָל מַיִם וּמֶלַח — לֹא.
human_translation: When Rabbi Yitzḥak came he taught with regard to tithe. raises an objection Rabbi Yehuda ben Gadish testified before Rabbi Eliezer: In Father’s house they would buy brine with tithe money. He said to him: Perhaps you only heard where the fish’s innards were mixed with And even Rabbi Yehuda ben Gadish only said with regard to brine, which is the fat of produce, but water and salt not
llm_translation: When Rabbi Yitzchak came, he taught a tradition.
