llm_translation: SOMCHOS says in Hullin: And if for a Nazirite with wine, he does not dispute, what is the reason? It is possible that he will become defiled in his Naziriteship.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, תְּרוּמָה נָמֵי אֶפְשָׁר דְּמִיתְּשִׁיל עִילָּוָיהּ? אִי מִתְּשִׁיל עֲלַהּ — הָדְרָא לְטִיבְלָא.
human_translation: If so, teruma as well, one can ask its If one asks will return to tevel ,
llm_translation: If so, can one separate terumah from it and then it becomes mixed with its chaff? If one separates the chaff first - it returns to being tevel.

hebrew_text: וְלַיפְרוֹשׁ עֲלַהּ מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר? לָא נֶחְשְׁדוּ חֲבֵירִים לִתְרוֹם שֶׁלֹּא מִן הַמּוּקָּף.
human_translation: Let him separate for from somewhere else Ḥaverim , are not suspected of separating not near
llm_translation: To separate a leaf from another place? Colleagues were not suspected of lifting from outside the boundary.

hebrew_text: וְלַפְרוֹשׁ עֲלַהּ מִינֵּיהּ וּבֵיהּ! דְּלֵית בַּהּ שִׁיעוּרָא.
human_translation: Let him separate from itself where, it would not contain the amount
llm_translation: And to separate the leaves from it and in it! For it does not have a specific measurement.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי פַּסְקָא? אֶלָּא, סוֹמְכוֹס סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבָּנַן דְּאָמְרִי: כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁהוּא מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת גָּזְרוּ עָלָיו בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת.
human_translation: What necessary Rather, Summakhos agrees with the Rabbis, who say: Anything that is due to a rabbinic decree [ shevut ], issued the decree during twilight.
llm_translation: And what is the conclusion? Rather, Somchos holds like the Rabbis who say: Any matter that is due to a rabbinic decree, they decreed concerning it even between the suns.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דִּתְנַן: יֵשׁ שֶׁאָמְרוּ הַכֹּל לְפִי מַה שֶּׁהוּא אָדָם. מְלֹא קוּמְצוֹ מִנְחָה, וּמְלֹא חׇפְנָיו קְטֹרֶת, וְהַשּׁוֹתֶה מְלֹא לוּגְמָיו בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, וּבִמְזוֹן שְׁתֵּי סְעוּדוֹת לְעֵירוּב. כְּמַאן? אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: סוֹמְכוֹס הִיא, דְּאָמַר: מַאי דַּחֲזֵי לֵיהּ בָּעִינַן.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that we learned There are they stated are all in accordance with the person the handful of a meal-offering, and the handfuls of incense and one who drinks a cheekful on Yom Kippur, and with regard to the two meals’ nourishment for an eiruv . In accordance with whose Rabbi Zeira said: It is Summakhos, who said: We require that which is fit for him,
llm_translation: As to where did he go, this is what we learned: There are those who say, "Everything according to what the person is." A handful of the meal offering, and a handful of the incense, and one who drinks a mouthful of lukewarm water on Yom Kippur, and with regard to food, two meals for the eruv. According to whom? Rabbi Zeira said: It is a support, as he said, "What he sees, we require."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא פְּלִיגָא אַדְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: מְעָרְבִין לְחוֹלֶה וּלְזָקֵן כְּדֵי מְזוֹנוֹ, וּלְרַעַבְתָן בִּסְעוּדָה בֵּינוֹנִית שֶׁל כׇּל אָדָם!
human_translation: Let us say disagrees with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar. As it was taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: One may establish an eiruv for an ill or elderly with food that is enough for him But for a glutton an average meal for the typical person.
llm_translation: Let us say that it is a dispute according to Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, as it was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: One may mix wine for a sick person and for an elderly person according to his sustenance, and for a hungry person with a regular meal of any person!

hebrew_text: תַּרְגּוּמָא, אַחוֹלֶה וְזָקֵן. אֲבָל רַעַבְתָן, בָּטְלָה דַּעְתּוֹ אֵצֶל כׇּל אָדָם.
human_translation: interpret an ill or elderly But a glutton, his opinion is rendered irrelevant by the opinions of all other people.
llm_translation: Targum, a young man and an elder. But if he is hungry, his mind is impaired in the eyes of all people.

hebrew_text: וְלַכֹּהֵן בְּבֵית הַפְּרָס. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מְנַפֵּחַ אָדָם בֵּית הַפְּרָס וְהוֹלֵךְ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּר אַמֵּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: בֵּית הַפְּרָס שֶׁנִּידַּשׁ — טָהוֹר.
human_translation: for a priest in a beit haperas , Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: a person may blow beit haperas and walk Rabbi Yehuda bar Ami said in the name of Rav Yehuda: A beit haperas that has been trodden is pure,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And to the priest in the house of the Persians. For Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: A person may relieve himself in the house of the Persians and walk away. Rabbi Yehudah bar Ammi in the name of Rav Yehudah said: A designated house of the Persians is pure."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף בֵּית הַקְּבָרוֹת. תָּנָא: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לָחוֹץ וְלֵילֵךְ בְּשִׁידָּה תֵּיבָה וּמִגְדָּל. קָא סָבַר: אֹהֶל זָרוּק שְׁמֵיהּ אֹהֶל.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: even a cemetery, It was taught: because can interpose and walk a carriage, a crate, or a cupboard. he holds A moving tent is called a tent,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even a cemetery. It was taught: Because he can go out and walk in a field, a box, and a tower. He thought: A tent whose name is thrown is a tent.

hebrew_text: וּבִפְלוּגְתָּא דְהָנֵי תַנָּאֵי, דְּתַנְיָא: הַנִּכְנָס לְאֶרֶץ הָעַמִּים בְּשִׁידָּה תֵּיבָה וּמִגְדָּל — רַבִּי מְטַמֵּא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מְטַהֵר.
human_translation: a dispute between the following tanna’im , as it was taught one who enters the land of the nations, in a carriage, a crate, or a cupboard, Rabbi renders impure. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, renders pure.
llm_translation: In the dispute of those Tannaim, as it was taught: One who enters the land of the nations with a chest and a tower - Rabbi declares impure, Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda declares pure.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר אֹהֶל זָרוּק לָאו שְׁמֵיהּ אֹהֶל, וּמָר סָבַר אֹהֶל זָרוּק שְׁמֵיהּ אֹהֶל.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? One Sage, holds a moving tent is not called a tent. And Sage, holds a moving tent is called a tent,
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? One Master holds that a thrown tent is not called a tent, and the other Master holds that a thrown tent is called a tent.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: And that which was taught Rabbi Yehuda says:
llm_translation: And this that was taught, Rabbi Yehuda says:

hebrew_text: מְעָרְבִין לְכֹהֵן טָהוֹר בִּתְרוּמָה טְהוֹרָה בְּקֶבֶר, הֵיכִי אָזֵיל? בְּשִׁידָּה תֵּיבָה וּמִגְדָּל.
human_translation: One may establish an eiruv for a priest who is pure with teruma that is pure on a grave, How does he go In a carriage, crate, or cupboard,
llm_translation: We mix for a pure priest with pure terumah in a pure grave, how does he go? With a linen sheet and a tower.

hebrew_text: וְהָא כֵּיוָן דְּאַחֲתָא אִיטַּמְּיָא לַהּ! בְּשֶׁלֹּא הוּכְשְׁרָה, אוֹ שֶׁנִּילּוֹשָׁה בְּמֵי פֵּירוֹת.
human_translation: Isn’t once was placed became defiled, where had not yet been rendered susceptible Or that was kneaded with fruit juice,
llm_translation: And behold, since she became a niddah! Without being fit, or that she was soaked in fruit juice.

hebrew_text: וְהֵיכִי מַיְיתֵי לַהּ? בִּפְשׁוּטֵי כְלֵי עֵץ דְּלָא מְקַבְּלִי טוּמְאָה.
human_translation: How can he bring it With flat wooden utensils do not contract impurity.
llm_translation: And how does he bring it to her? With simple wooden vessels that do not receive impurity.

hebrew_text: וְהָא קָא מַאֲהִיל?! דְּמַיְיתֵי לַהּ אֲחוֹרֵיהּ.
human_translation: Doesn’t cover He may bring it on the edge
llm_translation: And this, is he feeding it?! For it appears to him behind it.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּנַן? קָסָבְרִי: אָסוּר לִקְנוֹת בַּיִת בְּאִיסּוּרֵי הֲנָאָה.
human_translation: If so, what is the reason They hold it is prohibited to acquire a home with items from which benefit is prohibited.
llm_translation: So, what is the reason for the Rabbis' opinion? They hold: It is forbidden to purchase a house with forbidden benefits.

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר מוּתָּר? קָסָבַר: מִצְוֹת לָאו לֵיהָנוֹת נִיתְּנוּ.
human_translation: by inference that Rabbi Yehuda holds it is permitted holds mitzvot were not given for benefit.
llm_translation: From the principle of Rabbi Yehuda, does he hold that it is permitted? He holds: Commandments were not given for enjoyment.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רָבָא: מִצְוֹת לָאו לֵיהָנוֹת נִיתְּנוּ, לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי אַמְרַהּ לִשְׁמַעְתֵּיהּ?! אָמַר לָךְ רָבָא: אִי סְבִירָא לְהוּ דְּאֵין מְעָרְבִין אֶלָּא לִדְבַר מִצְוָה — דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִצְוֹת לָאו לֵיהָנוֹת נִיתְּנוּ. וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: מָר סָבַר אֵין מְעָרְבִין אֶלָּא לִדְבַר מִצְוָה, וּמָר סָבַר מְעָרְבִין אֲפִילּוּ לִדְבַר הָרְשׁוּת.
human_translation: But that which Rava said: Mitzvot were not given for benefit, let us say he stated his halakha in accordance with tanna’im . Rava said to you: If they hold that one may establish an eiruv only for the sake of a mitzva, all would agree mitzvot were not given for benefit. Here, they disagree with regard to this: One Sage, holds: One may establish an eiruv only for the sake of a mitzva. And one Sage, holds: One may establish an eiruv even for a voluntary matter.
llm_translation: Rather, this that Rava said: Commandments were not given for enjoyment, let us say according to the Tannaim she said it for its own sake?! Rava said to you: If it seems to them that we only combine for a matter of commandment - for the entire world, commandments were not given for enjoyment. And here in this case they dispute: One Master holds that we only combine for a matter of commandment, and one Master holds that we combine even for a matter of permission.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אֵין מְעָרְבִין אֶלָּא לִדְבַר מִצְוָה, לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי אַמְרַהּ לִשְׁמַעְתֵּיהּ?
human_translation: But that which Rav Yosef said One may establish an eiruv only for the sake of a mitzva, let us say he stated his halakha in accordance with tanna’im .
llm_translation: Rather, this that Rav Yosef said: We only mix ingredients for a matter of commandment, should we say that she said it to hear it?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב יוֹסֵף: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אֵין מְעָרְבִין אֶלָּא לִדְבַר מִצְוָה, וּדְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִצְוֹת לָאו לֵיהָנוֹת נִיתְּנוּ, וּבְהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: מָר סָבַר כֵּיוָן דִּקְנָה לֵיהּ עֵירוּב — לָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּמִינַּטְרָא. וּמָר סָבַר — נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּמִינַּטְרָא, דְּאִי אִיצְטְרִיךְ אָכֵיל לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said to you: all agree one may establish an eiruv only for the sake of a mitzva, and all agree mitzvot were not given for benefit, and they disagree with regard to this: One Sage, holds: Once acquired his eiruv , he is indifferent to its safeguarding, And one Sage, holds: It is pleasing to him that is safeguarded, for if he needs he can eat it.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said to you: The entire world only combines resources for a matter of commandment, and the entire world, commandments were not given for their own benefit. And in this case they disputed: One Master holds, since he acquired an Eruv - it is not good for him because of the administration. And the other Master holds - it is good for him because of the administration, for if he needs, he can eat from it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מְעָרְבִין בִּדְמַאי, וּבְמַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁנִּטְּלָה תְּרוּמָתוֹ, וּבְמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי וְהֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁנִּפְדּוּ, וְהַכֹּהֲנִים בְּחַלָּה.
human_translation: One may establish an eiruv with demai , and with first tithe whose teruma has been taken and with second tithe and consecrated articles that have been redeemed; and priests with ḥalla ,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may combine with Demai, and with the first tithe that its terumah has been separated, and with the second tithe and consecrated items that have been redeemed, and with the priests' portion in the dough offering.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לֹא בְּטֶבֶל, וְלֹא בְּמַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁלֹּא נִטְּלָה תְּרוּמָתוֹ, וְלֹא בְּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי וְהֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁלֹּא נִפְדּוּ.
human_translation: However, not with tevel , nor with first tithe whose teruma , has not been taken, nor with second tithe or consecrated articles that have not been redeemed.
llm_translation: But not in tevel, and not in the first tithe if its terumah was not taken, and not in the second tithe and consecrated items if they were not redeemed.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ דְּמַאי, הָא לָא חֲזֵי לֵיהּ? מִיגּוֹ דְּאִי בָּעֵי מַפְקַר לְהוּ לְנִכְסֵיהּ וְהָוֵי עָנִי וַחֲזוּ לֵיהּ — הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי חֲזֵי לֵיהּ. דִּתְנַן: מַאֲכִילִין אֶת הָעֲנִיִּים דְּמַאי
human_translation: demai ? Isn’t it unfit for him? Since if he wants, he could declare his property ownerless, and he would be a poor and be fit for him, now too, it is fit for him As we learned One may feed the poor demai ,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the case of "DeMai" that one does not see it? Because if he wants to exempt his property and become poor, and he will see it - now he sees it. As we learned: "They feed the poor" - DeMai.

hebrew_text: וְאֶת אַכְסַנְיָא דְּמַאי.
human_translation: and soldiers demai .
llm_translation: And the Achsanya of what?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: תָּנָא, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מַאֲכִילִין אֶת הָעֲנִיִּים דְּמַאי, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מַאֲכִילִין אֶת הָעֲנִיִּים דְּמַאי.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: It was taught Beit Shammai say: One may not feed the impoverished demai . And Beit Hillel say: One may feed the impoverished demai .
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: It was taught in a Baraita, Beit Shammai say: We do not feed the poor with Demai produce, and Beit Hillel say: We feed the poor with Demai produce.

hebrew_text: וּבְמַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁנִּטְּלָה כּוּ׳. פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא, שֶׁהִקְדִּימוֹ בְּשִׁבֳּלִין, וְנִטְּלָה מִמֶּנּוּ תְּרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר, וְלֹא נִטְּלָה מִמֶּנּוּ תְּרוּמָה גְּדוֹלָה.
human_translation: with first tithe has been taken. It is obvious It is only necessary preceded on the stalks, and the teruma of the tithes was taken from it teruma gedola was not taken from it.
llm_translation: In the first tithe that was taken, it is obvious! Not necessary, for it was preceded by Shibboleth, and from it was taken the tithe of the tithe, and not taken from it a great tithe.

hebrew_text: וְכִדְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁהִקְדִּימוֹ בְּשִׁבֳּלִין — פָּטוּר מִתְּרוּמָה גְּדוֹלָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַהֲרֵמוֹתֶם מִמֶּנּוּ תְּרוּמַת ה׳ מַעֲשֵׂר מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר״. מַעֲשֵׂר מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר אָמַרְתִּי לְךָ, וְלֹא תְּרוּמָה גְּדוֹלָה וּתְרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: And in accordance with Rabbi Abbahu Reish Lakish said, as Rabbi Abbahu said Reish Lakish said: First tithe, where preceded on the stalks, is exempt from teruma gedola , as it is stated: “And you shall set apart from it a gift for the Lord, even a tenth part of the tithe” A tenth part of the tithe, I told you, And not teruma gedola and the teruma of the tithe.
llm_translation: As Rabbi Abbahu said in the name of Reish Lakish, for Rabbi Abbahu said in the name of Reish Lakish: The first tithe that was separated in Shevi'it - exempt from the great heave offering, as it is stated: "And you shall lift from it the Lord's heave offering, a tithe of the tithe." I said to you a tithe of the tithe, not a great heave offering and a tithe of the tithe.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ הִקְדִּימוֹ בִּכְרִי נָמֵי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עָלֶיךָ אָמַר קְרָא: ״מִכֹּל מַעְשְׂרוֹתֵיכֶם תָּרִימוּ אֵת כׇּל תְּרוּמַת ה׳״.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: If so, even preceded in a pile, said to him: With regard to your the verse states: “From all that is given to you, you shall set apart that which is the Lord’s teruma ”
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: If so, even if they placed him in a pile of barley! He said to him: Upon you the verse said: "From all your tithes you shall set apart every contribution due to the Lord."

hebrew_text: וּמָה רָאִיתָ? הַאי — אִידְּגַן, וְהַאי — לָא אִידְּגַן.
human_translation: And what did you see This has become grain, and that did not become grain.
llm_translation: And what did you see? This one - it was plowed, and this one - it was not plowed.

hebrew_text: וּבְמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי וְהֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁנִּפְדּוּ. פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא, שֶׁנָּתַן אֶת הַקֶּרֶן וְלֹא נָתַן אֶת הַחוֹמֶשׁ. וְקָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאֵין הַחוֹמֶשׁ מְעַכֵּב.
human_translation: with second tithe and consecrated that have been redeemed. It is obvious was only needed where one paid the principle but did not pay the fifth And teaches us the fifth does not invalidate
llm_translation: In the case of the second tithe and consecrated items that were redeemed. It is obvious! It is not necessary, because he gave the principal but did not give the fifth. And it is implied to us that the fifth does not prevent.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לֹא בְּטֶבֶל. פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא, בְּטֶבֶל טָבוּל מִדְּרַבָּנַן, וּכְגוֹן שֶׁזְּרָעוֹ בְּעָצִיץ שֶׁאֵינוֹ נָקוּב.
human_translation: But with tevel , obvious, is only needed with regard to tevel that is considered tevel by rabbinic decree. For example, if one planted in an imperforated container,
llm_translation: But not with tevel. Obviously! It is not necessary, with tevel one is immersed according to the Rabbis, such as when one plants in a flowerpot that is not perforated.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא בְּמַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁלֹּא נִטְּלָה תְּרוּמָתוֹ. פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא, שֶׁהִקְדִּימוֹ בִּכְרִי, וְנִטְּלָה מִמֶּנּוּ תְּרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר וְלֹא נִטְּלָה מִמֶּנּוּ תְּרוּמָה גְּדוֹלָה.
human_translation: not with first tithe whose teruma has not been taken. It is obvious, is only needed preceded the pile, and teruma of the tithe was taken from it, teruma gedola was not taken from it,
llm_translation: And not in the first tithe that its terumah was not taken. It is obvious! Not necessary, because he prioritized it in his granary, and its terumah of the tithe was taken from it, and terumah gedolah was not taken from it.

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא כְּדַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן כִּדְשַׁנִּי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Lest you say as Rav Pappa said to Abaye, teaches us as responded to
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? As Rav Papa said to Abbaye. He is teaching us as he taught it to him.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא בְּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי וְהֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁלֹּא נִפְדּוּ. פְּשִׁיטָא!
human_translation: not with second tithe or consecrated that have not been redeemed. It is obvious
llm_translation: And not with second tithe and consecrated items that have not been redeemed. Obviously!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, שֶׁפְּדָאָן, וְלֹא פְּדָאָן כְּהִלְכָתָן: מַעֲשֵׂר — שֶׁפְּדָאוֹ עַל גַּב אֲסִימוֹן, וְרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר: ״וְצַרְתָּ הַכֶּסֶף״ — כֶּסֶף שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלָיו צוּרָה.
human_translation: is only needed where he redeemed them, did not redeem them properly, second tithe that was redeemed with an unminted coin [ asimon ]. And the Torah says And bind up [ vetzarta ] the money money that has a form [ tzura ] upon it;
llm_translation: Not necessary, that he redeemed, and not redeemed as their law: tithe — that he redeemed on a silver coin, and the Merciful One said: "And you shall make the silver" — silver that has a form.

hebrew_text: הֶקְדֵּשׁ — שֶׁחִילְּלוֹ עַל גַּב קַרְקַע, דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר: ״וְנָתַן הַכֶּסֶף וְקָם לוֹ״.
human_translation: consecrated property, where one redeemed it for land as the Torah states: “He will give the money and it shall become his.”
llm_translation: Sanctified — that he desecrated upon the ground, for the Merciful One said: "And he shall give the money, and he shall live."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַשּׁוֹלֵחַ עֵירוּבוֹ בְּיַד חֵרֵשׁ שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן, אוֹ בְּיַד מִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ מוֹדֶה בְּעֵירוּב — אֵינוֹ עֵירוּב. וְאִם אָמַר לְאַחֵר לְקַבְּלוֹ מִמֶּנּוּ — הֲרֵי זֶה עֵירוּב.
human_translation: one sends his eiruv in the hands of a deaf-mute, an imbecile, or a minor, or in the hands of one who does not accept eiruv , it is not eiruv . if one told another to receive it from him it is a eiruv .
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who sends his Eruv by way of a deaf-mute, imbecile, or minor, or by way of someone who does not agree to the Eruv - it is not a valid Eruv. But if he said to another person to accept it from him - this is a valid Eruv.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְקָטָן לָא? וְהָאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: קָטָן גּוֹבֶה אֶת הָעֵירוּב! לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בְּעֵירוּבֵי תְּחוּמִין, כָּאן בְּעֵירוּבֵי חֲצֵירוֹת.
human_translation: Is a minor not Didn’t Rav Huna say: A minor may collect the eiruv not difficult, here, to an eiruv of borders. There, to an eiruv of courtyards.
llm_translation: Gemara: And a minor can not establish an Eruv? But didn't Rav Huna say: A minor can establish the Eruv! It is not difficult: here we are dealing with Eruvin of boundaries, here we are dealing with Eruvin of courtyards.

hebrew_text: אוֹ בְּיַד מִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ מוֹדֶה בְּעֵירוּב. מַאן? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: כּוּתָאֵי.
human_translation: Or in the hands of one who does not accept eiruv . Who Rav Ḥisda said: A Samaritan [ Kuti ],
llm_translation: Or in the hand of one who does not agree to an eruv. Who? Rav Ḥisdah said: Kutai.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אָמַר לְאַחֵר לְקַבְּלוֹ הֵימֶנּוּ, הֲרֵי זֶה עֵירוּב. וְלֵיחוּשׁ דִּילְמָא לָא מַמְטֵי לֵיהּ? כִּדְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא בְּעוֹמֵד וְרוֹאֵהוּ, הָכָא נָמֵי — בְּעוֹמֵד וְרוֹאֵהוּ.
human_translation: And if he told another to receive from him, it is a eiruv . Let us be concerned that perhaps not bring as Rav Ḥisda said where he stands and watches him. Here, too, where stands and watches him
llm_translation: "And if he said to another to receive it on his behalf, this is considered an eruv. And should we be concerned that perhaps he will not reach him? As Rav Ḥisda said regarding one who stands and sees him, here too – one who stands and sees him."

hebrew_text: וְלֵיחוּשׁ דִּילְמָא לָא שָׁקֵיל מִינֵּיהּ? כִּדְאָמַר רַב יְחִיאֵל: חֲזָקָה שָׁלִיחַ עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ, הָכָא נָמֵי — חֲזָקָה שָׁלִיחַ עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ.
human_translation: let us be concerned that perhaps not take from as Rav Yeḥiel said presumption an agent fulfills his agency. Here, too, presumption agent fulfills his agency.
llm_translation: And perhaps he did not take from him? As Rav Yechiel said: A strong agent carries out his mission, here too - a strong agent carries out his mission.

hebrew_text: וְהֵיכָא אִיתְּמַר דְּרַב חִסְדָּא וְרַב יְחִיאֵל? אַהָא אִתְּמַר, דְּתַנְיָא: נְתָנוֹ לַפִּיל וְהוֹלִיכוֹ, לַקּוֹף וְהוֹלִיכוֹ, אֵין זֶה עֵירוּב. וְאִם אָמַר לְאַחֵר לְקַבְּלוֹ הֵימֶנּוּ — הֲרֵי זֶה עֵירוּב. וְדִילְמָא לָא מַמְטֵי לֵיהּ? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא בְּעוֹמֵד וְרוֹאֵהוּ. וְדִילְמָא לָא מְקַבֵּל לֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ? אָמַר רַב יְחִיאֵל: חֲזָקָה שָׁלִיחַ עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ.
human_translation: Where were Rav Ḥisda and Rav Yeḥiel stated? They were stated with regard to as it was taught one gave to elephant, and it brought it to a monkey, and it brought it it is not a eiruv . But if he told another to receive it from it is eiruv . But perhaps will not bring to Rav Ḥisda said: to where stands and watches it perhaps will not accept it from Rav Yeḥiel said: presumption an agent fulfills his agency.
llm_translation: And where is it stated that Rav Ḥisda and Rav Yeḥiel said? Here it is stated, as it was taught: If they gave it to an elephant and it took it, to a monkey and it took it, this is not an eruv. But if one said to another to receive it from him, behold, this is an eruv. And perhaps he does not agree to it? Rav Ḥisda said: While standing and watching him. And perhaps he does not accept it from him? Rav Yeḥiel said: The presumption is that a messenger carries out his mission.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: בְּשֶׁל תּוֹרָה — אֵין חֲזָקָה שָׁלִיחַ עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: With regard to Torah not presumption that an agent fulfills his agency;
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: In matters of Torah - there is no presumption that a messenger can appoint another messenger.

hebrew_text: בְּשֶׁל סוֹפְרִים — חֲזָקָה שָׁלִיחַ עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ. וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה — חֲזָקָה שָׁלִיחַ עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ.
human_translation: with regard to rabbinic presumption an agent fulfills his agency. And Rav Sheshet said: both this, and that, presumption an agent fulfills his agency.
llm_translation: Regarding a scribe's utensil - strong is the agency, one who acts, his agency. And Rav Sheshet said: One this and one this - strong is the agency, one who acts, his agency.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ, דִּתְנַן: מִשֶּׁקָּרַב הָעוֹמֶר, הוּתַּר הֶחָדָשׁ מִיָּד.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: From where do I say this? As we learned Once the omer has been offered, the new crop is immediately permitted.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: From where do I say this to her, as we learned: From when the Omer offering is brought close, the new grain is permitted immediately.

hebrew_text: וְהָרְחוֹקִים מוּתָּרִים מֵחֲצוֹת הַיּוֹם וְאֵילָךְ. וְהָא חָדָשׁ דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הוּא, וְקָתָנֵי: הָרְחוֹקִים מוּתָּרִין מֵחֲצוֹת הַיּוֹם וְאֵילָךְ. לָאו מִשּׁוּם חֲזָקָה שָׁלִיחַ עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ?
human_translation: And those far are permitted from midday and on, Isn’t the new a Torah law? And it was taught: And those far are permitted from midday and on. Is this not because presumption an agent fulfills his agency?
llm_translation: The distant ones are permitted from midday and onwards. And this is a new ruling from the Torah, and the Mishnah teaches: The distant ones are permitted from midday and onwards. Is it not because of the principle that a messenger can appoint another as his agent?

hebrew_text: וְרַב נַחְמָן? הָתָם כִּדְקָתָנֵי טַעְמָא — לְפִי שֶׁיּוֹדְעִין שֶׁאֵין בֵּית דִּין מִתְעַצְּלִין בּוֹ.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman, There, the reason that was taught: Because we know that the court will not be indolent
llm_translation: Rav Nachman? There, as it was taught the reason — because they know that a court does not deliberate in it.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ, דְּקָתָנֵי טַעְמָא לְפִי שֶׁיּוֹדְעִין שֶׁאֵין בֵּית דִּין מִתְעַצְּלִין בּוֹ. בֵּית דִּין הוּא דְּלָא מִתְעַצְּלִין בּוֹ — הָא שְׁלִיחַ מִתְעַצֵּל בּוֹ!
human_translation: And some say Rav Naḥman said: From where do I say this As it was taught the reason because we know that the court will not be indolent It is the court will not be indolent but agent may be indolent
llm_translation: And there are those who say, Rav Nachman said: From where do I say this to him, that it teaches a reason, because they know that the court does not delay in it. It is the court that does not delay in it - the messenger delays in it!

hebrew_text: וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר לָךְ: בֵּית דִּין עַד פַּלְגֵיהּ דְּיוֹמָא, שָׁלִיחַ כּוּלֵּי יוֹמָא.
human_translation: And Rav Sheshet said to you the court by midday, agent, the entire day.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said to you: The court until half of the day, the messenger is like the entire day.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ, דְּתַנְיָא: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלֶיהָ לֵידָה אוֹ זִיבָה, מְבִיאָה מָעוֹת וְנוֹתֶנֶת בַּשּׁוֹפָר, וְטוֹבֶלֶת וְאוֹכֶלֶת בַּקֳּדָשִׁים לָעֶרֶב. מַאי טַעְמָא — לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמְרִינַן חֲזָקָה שָׁלִיחַ עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: From where do I say As it was taught A woman who is responsible childbirth or ziva brings money and puts it in box immerses and eat sacrificial food at nightfall. What is the reason Is it not because we say presumption an agent fulfills his agency,
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: From where do I say this to her, as it was taught: A woman who has childbirth or a discharge, she brings coins and places them in the shofar, and she immerses and eats from the holy offerings in the evening. What is the reason? Not because we say a strong agent can appoint another in his place.

hebrew_text: וְרַב נַחְמָן? הָתָם כִּדְרַב שְׁמַעְיָה, דְּאָמַר רַב שְׁמַעְיָה: חֲזָקָה אֵין בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל כֹּהֲנִים עוֹמְדִים מִשָּׁם עַד שֶׁיִּכְלוּ כׇּל מָעוֹת שֶׁבַּשּׁוֹפָר.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman There, in accordance with Rav Shemaya, as Rav Shemaya said: presumption the court of priests would not leave until all the money in the box has been spent
llm_translation: Rav Nahman? There, like Rav Shemaya, for Rav Shemaya said: Strong, the court of Kohanim does not stand there until they finish all the coins in the shofar.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ, דְּתַנְיָא: הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״צֵא וְלַקֵּט לְךָ תְּאֵנִים מִתְּאֵנָתִי״ — אוֹכֵל מֵהֶן עֲרַאי וּמְעַשְּׂרָן וַדַּאי. ״מַלֵּא לְךָ כַּלְכַּלָּה זֹה תְּאֵנִים מִתְּאֵנָתִי״ — אוֹכֵל מֵהֶן עֲרַאי וּמְעַשְּׂרָן דְּמַאי.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said From where do I say this? As it was taught One who says to another Go and gather for yourself figs from my fig tree, may eat casually from them he must tithe them with certainty Fill this basket for yourself with figs from my fig tree, he may eat from them casually and he must tithe them demai ,
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: From where do I say this to her, as it was taught: One who says to his fellow, "Go out and gather figs for yourself from my fig tree" — he may eat from them temporarily and tithe them for sure. "Fill for yourself this basket with figs from my fig tree" — he may eat from them temporarily and tithe them. What is the reason?

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּעַם הָאָרֶץ, אֲבָל בְּחָבֵר — אוֹכֵל וְאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְעַשֵּׂר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּעַם הָאָרֶץ, אֲבָל בְּחָבֵר — אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל עַד שֶׁיְּעַשֵּׂר, לְפִי שֶׁלֹּא נֶחְשְׁדוּ חֲבֵרִים לִתְרוֹם שֶׁלֹּא מִן הַמּוּקָּף.
human_translation: In what is this statement said? an am ha’aretz . But a ḥaver , may eat and he need not tithe the statement of Rabbi Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, says In what is this statement said? am ha’aretz . But a ḥaver , may not eat until he tithes because ḥaverim , are not suspected of separating teruma from not adjacent
llm_translation: In what matters are these words said? In regards to an am ha'aretz (ignorant person), but in regards to a chaver (learned person) — he may eat without tithing, the words of Rabbi. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: In what matters are these words said? In regards to an am ha'aretz, but in regards to a chaver — he may not eat until he tithes, because chaverim are not suspected of tithing from untithed produce.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי: נִרְאִין דְּבָרַי מִדִּבְרֵי אַבָּא. מוּטָב שֶׁיֵּחָשְׁדוּ חֲבֵרִים לִתְרוֹם שֶׁלֹּא מִן הַמּוּקָּף, וְלֹא יַאֲכִילוּ לְעַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ טְבָלִים.
human_translation: Rabbi said: My statement appears than Father’s statement: It is better that ḥaverim should be suspected of separating from not adjacent and they should not feed amei ha’aretz tevel .
llm_translation: Rabbi said: My words appear like the words of Abba. It is preferable that one's friends suspect him of tithing produce that is not from the threshing floor, rather than feeding untithed produce to the common people.

hebrew_text: עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי אֶלָּא דְּמָר סָבַר: נֶחְשְׁדוּ, וּמָר סָבַר: לֹא נֶחְשְׁדוּ. אֲבָל כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא: חֲזָקָה שָׁלִיחַ עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ.
human_translation: disagreed only That one Sage, holds are suspected and one Sage, holds they are not suspected But all presumption an agent fulfills his agency,
llm_translation: Until here, they do not argue except that Mar holds: they were suspected, and Mar holds: they were not suspected. But everyone agrees: a person's agent is as himself.

hebrew_text: וְרַב נַחְמָן, הָתָם כִּדְרַב חֲנִינָא חוֹזָאָה, דְּאָמַר רַב חֲנִינָא חוֹזָאָה: חֲזָקָה הוּא עַל חָבֵר שֶׁאֵינוֹ מוֹצִיא דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְתוּקָּן מִתַּחַת יָדוֹ.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman There, in accordance with Rav Ḥanina Ḥoza’a, as Rav Ḥanina Ḥoza’a said: There is presumption with regard to a ḥaver that he does not release anything that is not tithed from his possession.
llm_translation: And Rav Nachman, there, like Rav Chanina Chozai, for Rav Chanina Chozai said: It is established upon a colleague that he does not bring forth a matter that is not fixed under his hand.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּעַם הָאָרֶץ, אֲבָל בְּחָבֵר — אוֹכֵל וְאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְעַשֵּׂר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי.
human_translation: The Master said: in what is this statement said? an am ha’aretz . However, a ḥaver , may eat and he need not tithe the statement of Rabbi
llm_translation: Master said: In what case are these words said? In the case of an am ha'aretz, but in the case of a scholar — he may eat without the need to tithe, the words of Rabbi.

hebrew_text: הַאי עַם הָאָרֶץ, דְּקָאֲמַר לֵיהּ לְמַאן? אִילֵימָא דְּקָאָמַר לְעַם הָאָרֶץ חַבְרֵיהּ — מְעַשְּׂרָן דְּמַאי, מִי צָיֵית? אֶלָּא בְּעַם הָאָרֶץ דְּקָאֲמַר לֵיהּ לְחָבֵר. אֵימָא סֵיפָא: נִרְאִין דְּבָרַי מִדִּבְרֵי אַבָּא, מוּטָב שֶׁיֵּחָשְׁדוּ חֲבֵרִים לִתְרוֹם שֶׁלֹּא מִן הַמּוּקָּף וְאַל יַאֲכִילוּ לְעַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ טְבָלִין. עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ מַאי בָּעֵי הָתָם?
human_translation: This am ha’aretz , to whom did he speak? If you say that he spoke to his fellow am ha’aretz , He must tithe them as demai ? Would comply Rather, to an am ha’aretz who told a ḥaver say the latter clause My statement appears than Father’s statement, It is better that ḥaverim should be suspected of separating from not adjacent and they should not feed amei ha’aretz tevel . What is the relevance of amei ha’aretz there?
llm_translation: This people of the land, who is he saying it to? If you say he is saying it to his fellow people of the land - regarding their tithes, what is the ruling? Rather, he is saying it to his fellow. Say the latter part: It appears that my words are from the words of my father, it is better that his friends suspect him of not separating from the untithed produce, and not feed the people of the land with untithed produce. What do the people of the land require there?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: רֵישָׁא — בְּעַם הָאָרֶץ שֶׁאָמַר לְחָבֵר, סֵיפָא — בְּחָבֵר שֶׁאָמַר לְעַם הָאָרֶץ, וְחָבֵר אַחֵר שׁוֹמְעוֹ. רַבִּי
human_translation: Ravina said: The first clause to an am ha’aretz who spoke to a ḥaver , the latter clause to a ḥaver who spoke to an am ha’aretz , and a different ḥaver heard him Rabbi
llm_translation: Ravina said: The beginning - regarding an am ha'aretz who said to a scholar; the end - regarding a scholar who said to an am ha'aretz, and another scholar hears. Rabbi

hebrew_text: סָבַר: אוֹתוֹ חָבֵר אוֹכֵל וְאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְעַשֵּׂר, דְּוַדַּאי עַישּׂוֹרֵי מְעַשַּׂר הָהוּא חָבֵר קַמָּא עִילָּוֵיהּ. וְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: לֹא יֹאכַל עַד שֶׁיְּעַשֵּׂר, לְפִי שֶׁלֹּא נֶחְשְׁדוּ חֲבֵרִים לִתְרוֹם שֶׁלֹּא מִן הַמּוּקָּף. וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי: מוּטָב שֶׁיֵּחָשְׁדוּ חֲבֵרִים לִתְרוֹם שֶׁלֹּא מִן הַמּוּקָּף וְאַל יַאֲכִילוּ עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ טְבָלִים.
human_translation: holds: That ḥaver , may eat and he is not required to tithe as the first ḥaver certainly separated tithes for And Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: may not eat until he has tithed for ḥaverim are not suspected of separating from not adjacent And Rabbi said to him: It is better that ḥaverim should be suspected of separating from not adjacent and they should not feed amei ha’aretz tevel .
llm_translation: He thought: that same colleague eats and does not need to tithe, for surely the tithes of that colleague precede it. And Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: he should not eat until he tithes, because colleagues were not suspected of tithing from untithed produce. And Rabbi said to him: it is better that colleagues be suspected of tithing from untithed produce and not have the common people eat untithed produce.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? רַבִּי סָבַר: נִיחָא לֵיהּ לְחָבֵר דְּלֶעֱבֵיד הוּא אִיסּוּרָא קַלִּילָא וְלָא לֶיעֱבֵד עַם הָאָרֶץ אִיסּוּרָא רַבָּה. וְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סָבַר: נִיחָא לֵיהּ לְחָבֵר דְּלֶיעֱבֵד עַם הָאָרֶץ אִיסּוּרָא רַבָּה, וְאִיהוּ אֲפִילּוּ אִיסּוּרָא קַלִּילָא לָא לֶיעֱבֵד.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? Rabbi holds: It is preferable to a ḥaver that he commit a minor transgression, an am ha’aretz will not commit major transgression And Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds: It is preferable to a ḥaver that an am ha’aretz commit a major transgression, and that he not commit even a minor transgression.
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? Rabbi holds: It is preferable for one's friend to engage in a minor prohibition rather than for an am ha'aretz to engage in a major prohibition. And Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds: It is preferable for one's friend to engage in a major prohibition rather than for an am ha'aretz to engage in a minor prohibition, and he himself would not even engage in a minor prohibition.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נְתָנוֹ בְּאִילָן, לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים — אֵין עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב, לְמַטָּה מֵעֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים — עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב. נְתָנוֹ בְּבוֹר, אֲפִילּוּ עָמוֹק מֵאָה אַמָּה — עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב.
human_translation: one placed in a tree above ten handbreadths his eiruv is not a eiruv ; below ten handbreadths, his eiruv is eiruv . he placed in a pit, even it was a hundred cubits deep, his eiruv is eiruv .
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If one placed his Eruv in a tree, above ten handbreadths - his Eruv is not an Eruv. If it is below ten handbreadths - his Eruv is an Eruv. If one placed it in a pit, even if it is deeper than a hundred cubits - his Eruv is an Eruv.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ יָתֵיב רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא וְרַבִּי אַסִּי וְרָבָא בַּר נָתָן, וְיָתֵיב רַב נַחְמָן גַּבַּיְיהוּ, וְיָתְבִי וְקָאָמְרִי: הַאי אִילָן, דְּקָאֵי הֵיכָא? אִילֵּימָא דְּקָאֵי בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד, מָה לִי לְמַעְלָה מָה לִי לְמַטָּה? רְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד עוֹלָה עַד לָרָקִיעַ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba sat, and Rabbi Asi and Rava bar Natan, and Rav Naḥman sat beside them, and they sat and said: This tree where does it stand? If you say it stands in the private domain, what to me above below The private domain ascends to the sky,
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba, Rabbi Assi, and Rava were sitting, and Rav Nachman was sitting before them. They were sitting and saying: "This tree, where is it standing? If you say it is standing in private domain, what do I gain from above, what do I gain from below? Private domain extends up to the sky."

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא דְּקָאֵי בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים. דְּמִתְכַּוֵּין לִשְׁבּוֹת הֵיכָא? אִילֵּימָא דְּנִתְכַּוֵּון לִשְׁבּוֹת לְמַעְלָה — הוּא וְעֵירוּבוֹ בִּמְקוֹם אֶחָד הוּא. אֶלָּא נִתְכַּוֵּון לִשְׁבּוֹת לְמַטָּה — וְהָא קָא מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בְּאִילָן!
human_translation: Rather, that stands in the public domain; Where intend to establish his Shabbat residence? If you say that intended to Shabbat residence above, he and his eiruv are in one place. Rather, intended to establish his Shabbat residence below; isn’t he making use of the tree
llm_translation: And rather it stands in a public domain. For where does he intend to sit? If you say he intends to sit above - he and his Eruv are in the same place. Rather, if he intends to sit below - but he is making use of a tree!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם דְּקָאֵי בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, וְנִתְכַּוֵּון לִשְׁבּוֹת לְמַטָּה. וְרַבִּי הִיא, דְּאָמַר: כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁהוּא מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת לֹא גָּזְרוּ עָלָיו בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת.
human_translation: Actually, that stands in the public domain, and that he intended to establish his Shabbat residence below, And is Rabbi who said: Anything that is due to a rabbinic decree [ shevut ], did not issue the decree during twilight,
llm_translation: Forever standing in the public domain, and intending to sit down below. And it is Rabbi, who said: Anything that is considered sitting, they did not decree upon it between the suns.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב נַחְמָן: יִשַׁר, וְכֵן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: פָּתְרִיתוּ בָּהּ כּוּלֵּי הַאי?! אִינְהוּ נָמֵי הָכִי קָא פָּתְרִי בָּהּ! [אֶלָּא הָכִי] אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: קָבְעִיתוּ לֵיהּ בִּגְמָרָא? אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִין. אִתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הָכָא בָּאִילָן הָעוֹמֵד בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים עָסְקִינַן, גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה וְרָחָב אַרְבָּעָה, וְנִתְכַּוֵּון לִשְׁבּוֹת לְמַטָּה, וְרַבִּי הִיא, דְּאָמַר: כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁהוּא מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת לֹא גָּזְרוּ עָלָיו בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to them: Well and Shmuel said similarly They said to him: Have you, gone so far in your explanation They, too, explained in this Rather, this is what they said to Have you established this as part of your study He said to them: Yes. it was also stated Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said: Here, we are dealing with a tree standing in the public domain, ten high and four wide. and intended to establish his Shabbat residence below And is Rabbi who said: Anything that is due to a rabbinic decree, did not issue the decree during twilight.
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Nachman: Straight, and so said Shmuel. They said to him: Did you solve all of this?! They also said to him: Did you establish it in the Gemara? He said to them: No. It was also stated, Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: Here we are dealing with a tree standing in a public domain, ten high and four wide, and one intends to sit below, and it is a Rabbinic decree, as he said: Anything that is due to sitting, they did not decree upon it between the suns.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּאִילָן הָעוֹמֵד חוּץ לְעִיבּוּרָהּ שֶׁל עִיר, אֲבָל אִילָן הָעוֹמֵד בְּתוֹךְ עִיבּוּרָהּ שֶׁל עִיר — אֲפִילּוּ לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה הֲרֵי זֶה עֵירוּב, דְּמָתָא כְּמַאן דְּמַלְיָא דָּמְיָא.
human_translation: Rava said They only taught with regard to a tree that stands beyond the outskirts of the city, However, a tree that stands within the outskirts of the city, even above ten it is a eiruv , as the city is considered as though it were filled in
llm_translation: Rava said: They only taught this regarding a tree standing outside the boundary of the city, but a tree standing within the boundary of the city—even if it is more than ten handbreadths high—it is considered part of the city, for it is like one who fills a vessel with its contents.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, חוּץ לְעִיבּוּרָהּ שֶׁל עִיר נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר רָבָא: הַנּוֹתֵן עֵירוּבוֹ יֵשׁ לוֹ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, הָוְיָא לַהּ רְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד — וּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד עוֹלָה עַד לָרָקִיעַ!
human_translation: If so, beyond the outskirts of the town, also Since Rava said: One who places his eiruv has four cubits a private domain; and a private domain rises to the sky.
llm_translation: So it is, outside the boundary of the city of Namei, since Rava said: One who places his Eruv has four cubits, it is considered his private domain - and a private domain extends up to the sky!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: הָכָא בָּאִילָן הַנּוֹטֶה חוּץ לְאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת עָסְקִינַן,
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak, son of Rav Mesharshiya, said: Here, we are dealing with a tree that leans out beyond four cubits
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak, son of Rav Mesharshaya, said: Here we are dealing with a tree that extends beyond four cubits.

hebrew_text: וְנִתְכַּוֵּין לִשְׁבּוֹת בְּעִיקָּרוֹ. וּמַאי ״לְמַעְלָה״ וּמַאי ״לְמַטָּה״ — דַּהֲדַר זָקֵיף.
human_translation: and he intended to establish his Shabbat residence at its base. And what above and below, it again in an upright
llm_translation: And one should intend to sit at its core. And what is "above" and what is "below" - that is immediately clear.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִי בָּעֵי מַיְיתֵי לַהּ דֶּרֶךְ עָלָיו!
human_translation: Isn’t if one wants, he can bring it by way of leaves,
llm_translation: And this, if he wants to bring it by way of him!

hebrew_text: כְּשֶׁרַבִּים מְכַתְּפִין עָלָיו, וְכִדְעוּלָּא. דְּאָמַר עוּלָּא: עַמּוּד תִּשְׁעָה בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, וְרַבִּים מְכַתְּפִין עָלָיו, וְזָרַק וְנָח עַל גַּבָּיו — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: where the masses shoulder on it, and is in accordance with Ulla, as Ulla said: a pillar nine in the public domain, and the masses shoulder and someone threw and it came to rest upon it, he is liable,
llm_translation: When many shoulder upon him, and like Ulla. For Ulla said: A pillar of nine in a public domain, and many shoulder upon him, and he threw and rested on his back - liable.

hebrew_text: מַאי רַבִּי, וּמַאי רַבָּנַן?
human_translation: What is Rabbi and what is the Rabbis?
llm_translation: What is "Rabbi," and what is "Rabbis"?

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: נְתָנוֹ בְּאִילָן, לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים — אֵין עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב, לְמַטָּה מֵעֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים — עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב, וְאָסוּר לִיטְּלוֹ. בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה — מוּתָּר לִיטְּלוֹ. נְתָנוֹ בְּכַלְכַּלָּה וּתְלָאוֹ בְּאִילָן, אֲפִילּוּ לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים — עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאָסוּר לִיטְּלוֹ — אֵין עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב.
human_translation: As it was taught If one placed in a tree above ten handbreadths his eiruv is not eiruv . below ten handbreadths, his eiruv is eiruv , but he is prohibited to take it within three he is permitted to take it one placed in a basket and hung it on a tree, even above ten handbreadths, his eiruv is eiruv ; the statement of Rabbi And the Rabbis say: any a location where it is prohibited to take his eiruv is not eiruv .
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If one placed his Eruv in a tree, above ten handbreadths - his Eruv is not an Eruv; below ten handbreadths - his Eruv is an Eruv, but it is forbidden to take it. Within three handbreadths - it is permitted to take it. If one placed his Eruv in a vessel and hung it on a tree, even if it is above ten handbreadths - his Eruv is an Eruv, according to the words of Rabbi. But the Sages say: Any place where it is forbidden to take it - his Eruv is not an Eruv.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים אַהֵיָיא? אִילֵּימָא אַסֵּיפָא — לֵימָא קָסָבְרִי רַבָּנַן, צְדָדִין אֲסוּרִין?! אֶלָּא אַרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: to which the Rabbis state If you say to the latter clause let us say that the Rabbis hold the sides is prohibited, Rather, to the first clause,
llm_translation: The sages say: Ahaiyah? Perhaps the latter part should be said: Do the Rabbis hold that sides are forbidden?! Rather, the first part.

hebrew_text: הַאי אִילָן הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ אַרְבָּעָה — מְקוֹם פְּטוּר הוּא. וְאִי דְּאִית בֵּיהּ אַרְבָּעָה, כִּי נְתָנוֹ בְּכַלְכַּלָּה מַאי הָוֵי?
human_translation: This tree, what are its circumstances? If it is not four it is an exempt domain, And if it is four when one places it in a basket, what of it?
llm_translation: This tree, how is it valued? If it does not have four handbreadths around it, it is considered an exempt space. And if it does have four handbreadths around it, when it is designated for a flowerpot, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: רֵישָׁא דְּאִית בֵּיהּ אַרְבָּעָה, סֵיפָא דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ אַרְבָּעָה וְכַלְכַּלָּה מַשְׁלִימָתוֹ לְאַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: Ravina said: The first clause where is four The latter clause, where is not four and the basket completes to four.
llm_translation: Ravina said: The beginning, which has four, the end, which does not have four, and the completion makes it four.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, וְסָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi holds in accordance with Rabbi Meir, and he holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Rabbi thought to her like Rabbi Meir, and thought to her like Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאָמַר חוֹקְקִין לְהַשְׁלִים.
human_translation: He holds in accordance with Rabbi Meir, who said carves out to complete
llm_translation: He thought like Rabbi Meir, who said "We may carve in order to complete."

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר בָּעִינַן עֵירוּב עַל גַּבֵּי מְקוֹם אַרְבָּעָה, וְלֵיכָּא.
human_translation: And he holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, who said: We require eiruv on a place four and there is not
llm_translation: And he holds like Rabbi Yehuda, who said: We require an eruv in a place of four, and there is none.

hebrew_text: מַאי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה? דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: נָעַץ קוֹרָה בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים וְהִנִּיחַ עֵירוּבוֹ עָלֶיהָ, גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה וּרְחָבָה אַרְבָּעָה — עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב, וְאִם לָאו — אֵין עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב.
human_translation: What is Rabbi Yehuda? As it was taught Rabbi Yehuda says: If one stuck a beam in the public domain and placed his eiruv upon it, ten high and four wide, his eiruv is a eiruv ; but if not, his eiruv is not a eiruv .
llm_translation: What is the ruling of Rabbi Yehuda? As it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: If one inserted a pole into a public domain and placed his Eruv upon it, its height being ten handbreadths and its width four handbreadths - his Eruv is valid. But if not - his Eruv is not valid.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה, הוּא וְעֵירוּבוֹ בִּמְקוֹם אֶחָד! אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה — צָרִיךְ שֶׁיְּהֵא בְּרֹאשָׁהּ אַרְבָּעָה, אֵין גְּבוֹהָה עֲשָׂרָה — אֵין צָרִיךְ שֶׁיְּהֵא בְּרֹאשָׁהּ אַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: On the contrary, He and his eiruv are in the same place, Rather, this is what he said: ten high, it is necessary that its top be four not ten high, it is not necessary that its top be four
llm_translation: The Great Rabbi, he and his Eruv in one place! Rather, thus he said: If its height is ten - it requires that it have four on top, if its height is not ten - it does not require that it have four on top.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן? דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: נָעַץ קָנֶה בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים וְהִנִּיחַ בְּרֹאשׁוֹ טְרַסְקָל, וְזָרַק וְנָח עַל גַּבָּיו — חַיָּיב!
human_translation: In accordance with whose It is not in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: one stuck a reed in the public domain, and placed a basket [ teraskal ] on top of it, and threw and it landed upon it, he is liable
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Like whom? That not like Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught, Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda says: If one inserted a reed into a public domain and placed a stone on its top, and he threw it and it rested on his shoulder - he is liable!

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָתָם — הָדְרָן מְחִיצָתָא. הָכָא — לָא הָדְרָן מְחִיצָתָא.
human_translation: Even if you say Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, There, partitions surround Here, partitions do not surround
llm_translation: Even if you say Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, there — the partition is restored. Here — the partition is not restored.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר: שָׁאנֵי כַּלְכַּלָּה, הוֹאִיל וְיָכוֹל לִנְטוֹתָהּ וְלַהֲבִיאָהּ לְתוֹךְ עֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said A basket is different, since one can tilt it and bring it to within ten
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: "It is different with a basket, since one can incline it and bring it within ten cubits."

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַב פָּפָּא וְקָא אָמַר לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב בַּר שַׁבָּא לְרַב פָּפָּא: כֵּיצַד הוּא עוֹשֶׂה? מוֹלִיכוֹ בָּרִאשׁוֹן וּמַחְשִׁיךְ עָלָיו, וְנוֹטְלוֹ וּבָא לוֹ. בַּשֵּׁנִי, מַחְשִׁיךְ עָלָיו וְאוֹכְלוֹ, וּבָא לוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa sat and recited this halakha . Rav bar Shabba raised an objection to Rav Pappa What does one do He brings on first and stays with it until nightfall, and he takes it and goes away, On second stays with it until nightfall, eat and go away,
llm_translation: Sitting Rav Papa and saying to that matter. Raised it Rav Bar Shaba to Rav Papa: How is he doing? Leading him first and darkening upon him, and taking him and coming to him. In the second, darkening upon him and eating him, and coming to him.

hebrew_text: אַמַּאי? נֵימָא: כֵּיוָן דְּאִי בָּעֵי אַמְטוֹיֵי מָצֵי מַמְטֵי לֵיהּ, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא אַמְטְיֵיהּ — כְּמַאן דְּאַמְטְיֵיהּ דָּמֵי!
human_translation: Why Let us say: Since if he wished to bring he could bring it, even though he did not bring it, it is considered as though he did bring it
llm_translation: "Why? Say: Since if he wants to pick it up, he can pick it up, even though he does not pick it up - it is as if he picks it up!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם יוֹם טוֹב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת אַחַר שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: a decree due to a Festival that occurs after Shabbat.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Zeira: A decree due to Yom Tov that falls after Shabbat.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: נִתְכַּוֵּון לִשְׁבּוֹת בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, וְהִנִּיחַ עֵירוּבוֹ בַּכּוֹתֶל, לְמַטָּה מֵעֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים — עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב, לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים — אֵין עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב. נִתְכַּוֵּון לִשְׁבּוֹת בְּרֹאשׁ הַשּׁוֹבָךְ אוֹ בְּרֹאשׁ הַמִּגְדָּל, לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים — עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב. לְמַטָּה מֵעֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים — אֵין עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב.
human_translation: raised objection intended to establish his Shabbat residence in the public domain and placed his eiruv in a wall below ten handbreadths his eiruv is a eiruv ; above ten handbreadths, his eiruv is not a eiruv one intended to establish his Shabbat residence on top of a dovecote or on top of cupboard, above ten handbreadths his eiruv is a eiruv below ten handbreadths, his eiruv is not a eiruv
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: If one intended to dwell in a public domain, and he placed his Eruv at the wall, below ten handbreadths - his Eruv is valid. If his Eruv is above ten handbreadths - his Eruv is not valid. If one intended to dwell at the head of the Shovakh or at the head of the tower, above ten handbreadths - his Eruv is valid. Below ten handbreadths - his Eruv is not valid.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? הָכִי נָמֵי נֵימָא: הוֹאִיל וְיָכוֹל לִנְטוֹתוֹ וְלַהֲבִיאוֹ לְתוֹךְ עֲשָׂרָה! אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: הָכָא בְּמִגְדָּל מְסוּמָּר עָסְקִינַן.
human_translation: Why Here too, let us say since one can tilt and bring it to within ten Rabbi Yirmeya said: Here, we are dealing with a cupboard that is nailed
llm_translation: And why? So it is said: Since he is able to bend it and bring it within ten! Rabbi Yirmeya said: Here we are dealing with a dark tower.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא בְּמִגְדָּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְסוּמָּר, וְהָכָא בְּמִגְדָּל אָרוֹךְ עָסְקִינַן, דְּאִי מַמְטֵי לֵיהּ פּוּרְתָּא, אָזֵיל חוּץ לְאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: Rava said: Even if you say a cupboard that is not nailed here, we are dealing with tall cupboard, that were one to tilt it a little would project beyond four cubits
llm_translation: Rava said: Even if you say in a tower that is not fortified, and here we are dealing with a tall tower, for if a brick falls from it, it goes outside of four cubits.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּאִיכָּא כַּוְּותָא וּמִתְנָא — לַיְיתֵיהּ בְּכַוְּותָא וּמִתְנָא! דְּלֵית לֵיהּ כַּוְּותָא וּמִתְנָא.
human_translation: What, are the circumstances? If where has a window, and a rope let him bring it by means of the window and rope. where it does not have a window, and a rope
llm_translation: "How are the prices determined? If there is a marketplace and a Mishnah - bring it in the marketplace and the Mishnah! If there is no marketplace and Mishnah."

hebrew_text: נְתָנוֹ בְּבוֹר אֲפִילּוּ עָמוֹק מֵאָה אַמָּה וְכוּ׳. הַאי בּוֹר דְּקָאֵי הֵיכָא? אִילֵּימָא דְּקָאֵי בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד —
human_translation: If one placed in a pit, even it is a hundred cubits deep, This pit, where is it situated? If you say that it is situated in the private domain,
llm_translation: They placed him in a pit, even if it is deeper than a hundred cubits, etc. Where is this pit situated? If you say it is situated in private domain—

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! רְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד עוֹלָה עַד לָרָקִיעַ, וְכִי הֵיכִי דְּסָלְקָא לְעֵיל, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּנָחֲתָא לְתַחַת. וְאֶלָּא דְּקָאֵי בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים.
human_translation: it is obvious, the private domain ascends to the sky, and just as it ascends upward, so it descends downward Rather, that is situated in the public domain.
llm_translation: It is obvious! The private domain extends up to the sky, and how does it descend below? Similarly, it is standing in the public domain.

hebrew_text: דְּנִתְכַּוֵּון לִשְׁבּוֹת הֵיכָא? אִי לְמַעְלָה — הוּא בְּמָקוֹם אֶחָד וְעֵירוּבוֹ בְּמָקוֹם אַחֵר הוּא. אִי לְמַטָּה, פְּשִׁיטָא — הוּא וְעֵירוּבוֹ בִּמְקוֹם אֶחָד!
human_translation: Where intend to establish his Shabbat residence? If above he is in one place and his eiruv is in another place, if below, it is obvious, he and his eiruv are in one place.
llm_translation: If one intends to sit here? If above - it is in one place and his Eruv in another place. If below, it is obvious - he and his Eruv are in one place!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּקָאֵי בְּכַרְמְלִית וְנִתְכַּוֵּון לִשְׁבּוֹת לְמַעְלָה, וְרַבִּי הִיא דְּאָמַר: כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁהוּא מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת לֹא גָּזְרוּ עָלָיו בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת.
human_translation: is necessary only where is situated in a karmelit , and he intended to establish his Shabbat residence above And Rabbi who said: anything that is due to rabbinic decree [ shevut ], they did not issue the decree during twilight.
llm_translation: Not necessary, as it stands in a Carmelite and intends to dwell above, and Rabbi Hiya said: Anything that is for the sake of dwelling, they did not decree upon it between the suns.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נְתָנוֹ בְּרֹאשׁ הַקָּנֶה אוֹ בְּרֹאשׁ הַקּוּנְדָּס, בִּזְמַן שֶׁהוּא תָּלוּשׁ וְנָעוּץ, אֲפִילּוּ גָּבוֹהַּ מֵאָה אַמָּה — הֲרֵי זֶה עֵירוּב.
human_translation: one placed on top of a reed or on top of a pole [ kundas ], when is detached and stuck even a hundred cubits high, it is a eiruv ,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If one placed it at the top of a reed or at the top of a pole, when it is suspended and inserted, even if it is higher than one hundred cubits - this is considered an Eruv.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ רָמֵי לֵיהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר מַתְנָא לְרָבָא: תָּלוּשׁ וְנָעוּץ — אִין. לֹא תָּלוּשׁ וְנָעוּץ — לָא. מַנִּי? רַבָּנַן הִיא, דְּאָמְרִי: כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁהוּא מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת גָּזְרוּ עָלָיו בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת. וְהָא אָמְרַתְּ רֵישָׁא רַבִּי! רֵישָׁא רַבִּי וְסֵיפָא רַבָּנַן?!
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Mattana raised a contradiction before Rava was detached and stuck yes, was not detached and stuck no, whose It is the Rabbis, who say: Anything that is due to rabbinic decree [ shevut ], they issued the decree during twilight. didn’t you say the first clause, Rabbi the first clause Rabbi and the latter clause the Rabbis?
llm_translation: The Gemara raises a contradiction to Rava from Rav Adda bar Matna: If it is hanging and inserted - no. If it is not hanging and inserted - yes. Who is the authority? It is the Rabbis, for they say: Anything that is due to a Rabbinic decree, they decreed upon it even between the suns. But didn't you say in the beginning, Rabbi! In the beginning Rabbi and in the end the Rabbis?!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּבָר רָמֵי לֵיהּ רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא לְרַב חִסְדָּא, וְשַׁנִּי לֵיהּ: רֵישָׁא רַבִּי, וְסֵיפָא רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: said to Rami bar Ḥama already raised this contradiction before Rav Ḥisda, and answered him: the first clause Rabbi and the latter clause
llm_translation: He said to him: As already stated, Ramai son of Hama stated in the name of Rav Hisda, and repeat to him: the beginning is Rabbi, and the end is the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: כּוּלָּהּ רַבִּי הִיא, וְסֵיפָא גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יִקְטוֹם.
human_translation: Ravina said: it is all Rabbi and the latter clause, decree lest he break off
llm_translation: Ravina said: The entire statement is attributed to Rabbi, and the latter part is a decree instituted lest one come to cut the fruit prematurely.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא פּוּלְמוּסָא דַּאֲתָא לִנְהַרְדְּעָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב נַחְמָן: פּוּקוּ עֲבִידוּ כְּבוּשֵׁי כַּבְשֵׁי בְּאַגְמָא, וּלְמָחָר נֵיזִיל וְנִיתֵּיב עִלָּוַיְהוּ.
human_translation: that army [ pulmosa ] came to Neharde’a Rav Naḥman said to Go out and create compressing in the marshes, and tomorrow, we will go and sit on them
llm_translation: That Pulmusah who came to Nahardea. Rav Nachman said to them: Go, make bundles of bundles in the marsh, and tomorrow we will go and sit on them.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא לְרַב נַחְמָן, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַב עוּקְבָא בַּר אַבָּא לְרַב נַחְמָן: תָּלוּשׁ וְנָעוּץ אִין, לֹא תָּלוּשׁ וְלֹא נָעוּץ לָא.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raised an objection to Rav Naḥman, and some say Rav Ukva bar Abba to Rav Naḥman, was detached and stuck yes; was not detached and not stuck no.
llm_translation: He raised an objection: Ramei Bar Ḥama raised an objection to Rav Naḥman, and some say that Rav Ukva Bar Abba raised an objection to Rav Naḥman: "If it is suspended and inserted, it is not suspended; if it is not suspended and not inserted, it is."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם בְּעוּזְרָדִין. וּמְנָא תֵּימְרָא דְּשָׁנֵי לַן בֵּין עוּזְרָדִין לְשֶׁאֵין עוּזְרָדִין — דְּתַנְיָא: הַקָּנִין וְהָאֲטָדִין וְהַהִגִּין — מִין אִילָן הֵן, וְאֵינָן כִּלְאַיִם בַּכֶּרֶם. וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: הַקָּנִים וְהַקִּידָן וְהָאוּרְבָּנִין — מִין יָרָק הֵן, וְהֵן כִּלְאַיִם בַּכֶּרֶם. קַשְׁיָא אַהֲדָדֵי!
human_translation: said to him: There, hard And from where do you say that we distinguish between hard and that are not hard? As it was taught Reeds, boxthorn, and thistles are species of trees, and are not food crops in a vineyard, And it was taught in another Reeds, cassia, and bulrushes are species of herbs, and they are food crops in a vineyard. contradict one another,
llm_translation: He said to him: There, in Uzardina. And how do we know to say that we differentiate between Uzardina and She'en Uzardina? For it was taught: The reeds, the myrtles, and the vines - they are of the tree species, and they are not forbidden in the vineyard. And it was taught alternatively: The reeds, the thorns, and the thistles - they are of the vegetable species, and they are forbidden in the vineyard. They contradict each other!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: כָּאן בְּעוּזְרָדִין, כָּאן בְּשֶׁאֵין עוּזְרָדִין. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, conclude from this Here, to hard there, to that are not hard. conclude from this
llm_translation: Rather, hear the conclusion: here in Uzardina, here where there is no Uzardina. Hear the conclusion.

hebrew_text: וְקִידָּה מִין יָרָק הוּא?! וְהָתְנַן: אֵין מַרְכִּיבִין פֵּגָם עַל גַּבֵּי קִידָּה לְבָנָה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא יָרָק בְּאִילָן! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: קִידָּה לְחוּד, וְקִידָּה לְבָנָה לְחוּד.
human_translation: Is cassia a type of herb? Didn’t we learn One may not graft rue to white cassia, as this herbs to a tree? Rav Pappa said: cassia is distinct and white cassia is distinct
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And a kida is a type of greenery?! But didn't we learn: One may not spread manure on top of a kida plant, because it is greenery on a tree! Rav Papa said: Kida for one purpose, and kida for white for another purpose." English translation:

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נְתָנוֹ בְּמִגְדָּל וְאָבַד הַמַּפְתֵּחַ — הֲרֵי זֶה עֵירוּב. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אִם אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁהַמַּפְתֵּחַ בִּמְקוֹמוֹ — אֵינוֹ עֵירוּב.
human_translation: If one put in a cupboard and the key was lost, it is eiruv . Rabbi Eliezer says: If he does not know that the key is in its place, it is not eiruv .
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one placed the key in a tower and it got lost - this is considered an Eruv. Rabbi Eliezer says: If one does not know that the key is in its place - it is not considered an Eruv.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְאַמַּאי? הוּא בְּמָקוֹם אֶחָד וְעֵירוּבוֹ בְּמָקוֹם אַחֵר הוּא!
human_translation: And why He is in one place and his eiruv is in a different place,
llm_translation: Gemara: And why? It is in one place and his residence is in another place!

hebrew_text: רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: הָכָא בְּמִגְדָּל שֶׁל לְבֵנִים עָסְקִינַן וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: פּוֹחֵת לְכַתְּחִילָּה וְנוֹטֵל. דִּתְנַן: בַּיִת שֶׁמִּילְּאָהוּ פֵּירוֹת, סָתוּם וְנִפְחַת — נוֹטֵל מִמְּקוֹם הַפְּחָת, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: פּוֹחֵת וְנוֹטֵל לְכַתְּחִילָּה.
human_translation: It was Rav and Shmuel who both said: Here, we are dealing with a cupboard of bricks, and is Rabbi Meir, who said: One may create a breach ab initio , and take As we learned a house filled with produce sealed and was breached, one may take out from the place of the breach. Rabbi Meir says: One may create a breach and take ab initio .
llm_translation: Rav and Shmuel both said: Here we are dealing with a tower of stones, and it is Rabbi Meir who said: One should remove the stones less than the minimum required and take them. For it was taught: If a house is filled with fruit, and it is sealed and inflated — one should take the fruit from the place of least inflation. Rabbi Meir says: One should remove the fruit less than the minimum required and take them initially.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר אַדָּא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּאַוֵּירָא דְלִיבְנֵי. הָכָא נָמֵי בַּאֲוֵירָא דְלִיבְנֵי.
human_translation: Didn’t Rav Naḥman bar Adda say that Shmuel said to layers of bricks Here too, layers of bricks.
llm_translation: And he said, Rav Nachman bar Adda said in the name of Shmuel: In the city of Libnei. Here too, in the city of Libnei.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: בְּיוֹם טוֹב אָמְרוּ, אֲבָל לֹא בְּשַׁבָּת! הָכָא נָמֵי בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: Didn’t Rabbi Zeira say: spoke with regard to a Festival, but not with regard to Shabbat? Here too, to a Festival
llm_translation: And this, Rabbi Zeira said: On a festival day they said, but not on Shabbat! Here too, on a festival day.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי עֲלַהּ, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אִם בָּעִיר אָבַד — עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב, וְאִם בַּשָּׂדֶה אָבַד — אֵין עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב. וְאִי בְּיוֹם טוֹב, מָה לִי עִיר מָה לִי שָׂדֶה?
human_translation: If so that which was taught about it Rabbi Eliezer says: If was lost in a city, his eiruv is eiruv ; and if it was lost in a field, his eiruv is not eiruv , And if to a Festival, what to me city field?
llm_translation: Thus, this is what is taught regarding the leaf: Rabbi Eliezer says: If it was lost in the city - his Eruv is an Eruv, but if it was lost in the field - his Eruv is not an Eruv. And if it was lost on a festival, what difference does it make to me whether it is a city or a field?

hebrew_text: חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: נְתָנוֹ בְּמִגְדָּל, וְנָעַל בְּפָנָיו וְאָבַד הַמַּפְתֵּחַ — הֲרֵי זֶה עֵירוּב. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים? בְּיוֹם טוֹב, אֲבָל בְּשַׁבָּת — אֵין עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב. נִמְצָא הַמַּפְתֵּחַ, בֵּין בָּעִיר בֵּין בַּשָּׂדֶה — אֵין עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: בָּעִיר — עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב, בַּשָּׂדֶה — אֵין עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב.
human_translation: is incomplete and it teaches the following: one placed in a cupboard and locked it, and the key is lost, it is eiruv . In what is this statement said? On a Festival; however, on Shabbat, his eiruv is not eiruv . the key is found, whether in a city or in a field, his eiruv is not eiruv . Rabbi Eliezer says: in a city, his eiruv is eiruv ; in a field, his eiruv is not eiruv .
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Hasorei michasra ve'hachi katanei: Netanu b'migdal, v'na'al b'fanav ve'avad hamafteach — harei zeh eiruv. Ba'meh devarim amurim? Be'yom tov, aval b'shabbat — ein eiruvo eiruv. Nimtza hamafteach, bein ba'ir bein basadeh — ein eiruvo eiruv. Rabbi Eliezer omer: Ba'ir — eiruvo eiruv, basadeh — ein eiruvo eiruv."

hebrew_text: בָּעִיר — עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב, כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּאָמַר: אֶחָד גַּגּוֹת וְאֶחָד חֲצֵירוֹת וְאֶחָד קַרְפֵּיפוֹת — רְשׁוּת אַחַת הֵן לְכֵלִים שֶׁשָּׁבְתוּ בְּתוֹכָן. בַּשָּׂדֶה אֵין עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב — כְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: in a city, his eiruv is eiruv in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, who said: Roofs, courtyards, and enclosed fields [ karpeifot ] are all one domain to utensils that began Shabbat in them. in a field, his eiruv is not a eiruv , in accordance with the Rabbis,
llm_translation: In the city - its Eruv is an Eruv, like Rabbi Shimon who said: One domain for rooftops, and one domain for courtyards, and one domain for enclosures - they are one domain for utensils that were placed within them. In the field, its Eruv is not an Eruv - like the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: הָכָא בְּמִגְדָּל שֶׁל עֵץ עָסְקִינַן, דְּמָר סָבַר: כְּלִי הוּא, וְאֵין בִּנְיָן בְּכֵלִים וְאֵין סְתִירָה בְּכֵלִים. וּמָר סָבַר: אֹהֶל הוּא.
human_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef, both said: Here, we are dealing with a wooden cupboard, The Sage, holds is a utensil, and there is no building utensils, and there is no dismantling of utensils. And Sage, holds is a tent.
llm_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef both said: Here we are dealing with a tower made of wood, for Mar holds: it is a vessel, and there is no building with vessels, and there is no contradiction with vessels. And Mar holds: it is a tent.

hebrew_text: וּבִפְלוּגְתָּא דְהָנֵי תַנָּאֵי, דִּתְנַן: הִקִּישׁ עַל גַּבֵּי שִׁידָּה תֵּיבָה וּמִגְדָּל — טְמֵאִין. רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מְטַהֲרִין.
human_translation: And the dispute between these tanna’im , as we learned knocked on a carriage, crate, or cupboard, they are impure Rabbi Neḥemya and Rabbi Shimon render pure.
llm_translation: In the dispute of those Tannaim, as we learned: If one placed upon the top of a chest or a tower - they are impure. Rabbi Nechemiah and Rabbi Shimon declare them pure.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, בְּהָא קָמִפַּלְגִי: מָר סָבַר — כְּלִי הוּא, וּמָר סָבַר — אֹהֶל הוּא.
human_translation: What, are they not disagreeing about this The Sage holds is a utensil, and the Sage, holds it is a tent,
llm_translation: What is the reason that they do not divide the spoils with this person? One Master holds — it is a vessel, and one Master holds — it is a tent.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: וְתִיסְבְּרָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: אֹהֶל וְנִיסָּט — טָמֵא, כְּלִי וְאֵינוֹ נִיסָּט — טָהוֹר. וְקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: וְאִם הָיוּ נִיסּוֹטִין — טְמֵאִים, זֶה הַכְּלָל: נִיסָּט מֵחֲמַת כֹּחוֹ — טָמֵא, מֵחֲמַת רְעָדָה — טָהוֹר!
human_translation: Abaye said And you think Wasn’t it taught tent, and it moved, it is impure; a utensil and it did not move, it is pure? it was taught in the latter clause And if they moved, they are impure, this is the principle: moved due to the force it is impure. due to vibrations, it is pure,
llm_translation: Abaye said: And is it logical? But it was taught: A tent and it was shaken — impure, a vessel and it was not shaken — pure. And the latter clause teaches: And if they were shaken — impure, this is the principle: if it was shaken due to its strength — impure, due to trembling — pure!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא הֶיסֵּט מֵחֲמַת כֹּחוֹ — טָמֵא, מֵחֲמַת רְעָדָה — טָהוֹר. וְהָכָא בִּרְעָדָה מֵחֲמַת כֹּחוֹ עָסְקִינַן, וּבְהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי: דְּמָר סָבַר — הָוֵי הֶיסֵּט, וּמָר סָבַר — לָא הָוֵי הֶיסֵּט.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said All movement due to force impure, due to vibrations it is pure. And here, we are dealing with vibrated because of force And disagree with regard to the following The Sage holds is movement; and the Sage, holds is not movement.
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: In all cases, if due to his strength he emitted semen — he is impure; if due to trembling — he is pure. And here, we are dealing with trembling due to his strength, and here they disagree: one Master holds — it is considered emission, and the other Master holds — it is not considered emission.

hebrew_text: וּמַתְנִיתִין בְּמַאי מוֹקְמִינַן לַהּ? אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: בְּמַנְעוּל וּקְטִיר בְּמִתְנָא עָסְקִינַן, וּבָעֵי סַכִּינָא לְמִיפְסְקֵיהּ.
human_translation: how is the mishna to be interpreted? Abaye and Rava both said: We are dealing with a lock tied with a leather strap, and a knife is required to cut it
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And the Mishnaic scholars, with what are we establishing it? Abbaye and Rava both said: with a lock and a key we are dealing in the Mishna, and it requires a knife to separate it."

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר: כָּל הַכֵּלִים נִיטָּלִין בְּשַׁבָּת, חוּץ מִמַּסָּר הַגָּדוֹל וְיָתֵד שֶׁל מַחֲרֵישָׁה.
human_translation: The first tanna holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, who said: All utensils may be moved on Shabbat, except for a large saw and the blade of a plow.
llm_translation: We learned in the first teaching: He holds like Rabbi Yosei, who said: All vessels may be moved on Shabbat, except for the large saw and the plowshare.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה, דְּאָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ טַלִּית אֲפִילּוּ תַּרְווֹד — אֵין נִיטָּלִין אֶלָּא לְצוֹרֶךְ תַּשְׁמִישָׁן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer holds in accordance with Rabbi Neḥemya, who said: Even a cloak, even a spoon, may be moved only for the purpose of their use.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer holds like Rabbi Nechemiah, for he said: Even a cloak, even a sandal — they are not removed except for the purpose of using them.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נִתְגַּלְגֵּל חוּץ לַתְּחוּם, נָפַל עָלָיו גַּל אוֹ נִשְׂרַף, תְּרוּמָה וְנִטְמֵאת, מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם — אֵינוֹ עֵירוּב. מִשֶּׁחָשֵׁיכָה — הֲרֵי זֶה עֵירוּב.
human_translation: rolled beyond the limit, a pile fell on it, or it was burnt, teruma and it became impure; while it was still day, it is not eiruv , after dark, it is eiruv ,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If a rolling stone rolled outside the boundary, and a stone fell on it or it was burned, the Terumah becomes impure. If this occurred before the end of the day, it is not considered an Eruv. If it happened after dark, then it is considered an Eruv.

hebrew_text: אִם סָפֵק, רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמְרִים: הֲרֵי זֶה חַמָּר גַּמָּל.
human_translation: If in doubt, Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda say: This is a donkey driver, and a camel driver,
llm_translation: If uncertain, Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda say: "This is a donkey of a camel."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: סְפֵק עֵירוּב כָּשֵׁר. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אַבְטוּלְמוֹס הֵעִיד מִשּׁוּם חֲמִשָּׁה זְקֵנִים עַל סְפֵק עֵירוּב שֶׁכָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: An eiruv in doubt is valid. Rav Yosei said: Avtolemos testified in the name of five Elders that an eiruv in doubt is valid.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: A doubtful eruv is valid. Rabbi Yosei said: Avtulmos testified in the name of five elders regarding a doubtful eruv that it is valid.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ נִתְגַּלְגֵּל חוּץ לַתְּחוּם. אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּתְגַּלְגֵּל חוּץ לְאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, אֲבָל לְתוֹךְ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — הַנּוֹתֵן עֵירוּבוֹ יֵשׁ לוֹ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: rolled beyond the limit Rava said: They only taught where rolled more than four cubits however, within four cubits one who places his eiruv has four cubits
llm_translation: Gemar Nikhtegalgel chutz la'techum. Amar Rava: Lo Shanu ela shenikhtegalgel chutz le'arba amot, aval le'toch arba amot - ha'noten eiruvo yesh lo arba amot.

hebrew_text: נָפַל עָלָיו גַּל וְכוּ׳. קָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ דְּאִי בָּעֵי מָצֵי שָׁקֵיל לֵיהּ.
human_translation: a pile fell on It enter your mind where if one wanted he could take
llm_translation: A stone fell on him, etc. Your mind should be at ease, for if he wants, he can remove it.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי, דְּאִי כְּרַבִּי, הָאָמַר: כָּל דָּבָר שֶׁהוּא מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת — לֹא גָּזְרוּ עָלָיו בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת.
human_translation: let us say that the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi As, if it is in accordance with Rabbi Didn’t he say anything prohibited due to rabbinic decree, they did not issue the decree to apply during twilight?
llm_translation: Let us say the Mishnah that is not like Rabbi, for if it were like Rabbi, he said: Anything that is due to a rabbinic decree - they did not decree upon it between the sunsets.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא כְּרַבִּי, לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּבָעֵי מָרָא וַחֲצִינָא.
human_translation: Even if you say is in accordance with Rabbi was necessary only where a hoe or a spade would be required
llm_translation: Even if you say like Rabbi, it is not necessary, as it requires a mirror and a knife.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכִי. דְּאִי תְּנָא ״נִתְגַּלְגֵּל״ — מִשּׁוּם דְּלֵיתָא גַּבֵּיהּ. אֲבָל נָפַל עָלָיו גַּל, דְּאִיתֵיהּ גַּבֵּיהּ — אֵימָא לֶיהֱוֵי עֵירוּב.
human_translation: And are necessary. As, if taught rolled because it is not near him, but a pile fell on it is near him, say that it should be eiruv ,
llm_translation: "And it is necessary. For if a Tanna says 'he rolled,' — because there is not a hill. But if a stone fell on him, which has a hill — say to him, let it be an Eruv."

hebrew_text: וְאִי תְּנָא ״נָפַל עָלָיו גַּל״ — מִשּׁוּם דְּמִיכַּסֵּי. אֲבָל נִתְגַּלְגֵּל, זִימְנִין דְּאָתֵי זִיקָא וּמַיְיתֵי לֵיהּ — אֵימָא לֶיהֱוֵי עֵירוּב צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if taught a pile fell on because it is covered, but rolled sometimes a wind comes and brings it you might say that it should be a
llm_translation: "And if it is taught 'a stone fell upon him' — because it covers. But if it rolled, sometimes it comes to a corner and kills him — say to him, let there be an eruv needed."

hebrew_text: אוֹ נִשְׂרַף, תְּרוּמָה וְנִטְמֵאת. לְמָה לִי? תְּנָא נִשְׂרַף —
human_translation: Or was burnt, teruma that became impure Why do I need taught was burnt
llm_translation: Or if it was burned, the terumah becomes impure. Why do I need it? A tanna taught: If it was burned —

hebrew_text: לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחוֹ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. תְּנָא תְּרוּמָה וְנִטְמֵאת — לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחוֹ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: to convey the far-reaching nature of Rabbi Yosei’s taught teruma that became impure to convey the far-reaching nature of Rabbi Meir’s
llm_translation: To inform you of the strength of Rabbi Yosei. It was taught: If a contribution becomes impure - to inform you of the strength of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר סְפֵיקָא לְחוּמְרָא? וְהָתְנַן: טָמֵא שֶׁיָּרַד לִטְבּוֹל, סָפֵק טָבַל סָפֵק לֹא טָבַל; וַאֲפִילּוּ טָבַל — סָפֵק טָבַל בְּאַרְבָּעִים סְאָה, סָפֵק לֹא טָבַל בְּאַרְבָּעִים סְאָה; וְכֵן שְׁנֵי מִקְווֹאוֹת — בְּאַחַת יֵשׁ בָּהּ אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה, וּבְאַחַת אֵין בָּהּ אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה; וְטָבַל בְּאַחַת מֵהֶן, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ בְּאֵיזֶה מֵהֶן טָבַל — סְפֵיקוֹ טָמֵא.
human_translation: Does Rabbi Meir hold doubt stringent? Didn’t we learn impure descended to immerse doubt immersed or he did not immerse; and even if he immersed, doubt immersed in forty se’a or he did not immerse in forty se’a ; and similarly, two ritual baths, one has forty se’a in it and one does not have forty se’a in it, and he immersed in one of them, but he does not know in which of them he immersed; one’s doubt, he impure?
llm_translation: And Rabbi Meir holds a doubt for stringency? And it was taught: If one who is impure descends to immerse, whether he immersed or did not immerse is uncertain; and even if he immersed — whether he immersed in forty se'ah or did not immerse in forty se'ah is uncertain; and similarly with two mikvaot — one of them contains forty se'ah, and one of them does not contain forty se'ah; and he immersed in one of them, and he does not know in which one he immersed — his doubt renders him impure.
