hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּטוּמְאָה חֲמוּרָה.
human_translation: In what case is this statement, said? with regard to severe impurity,
llm_translation: In what matters are these things said? — In severe impurity.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל בְּטוּמְאָה קַלָּה, כְּגוֹן שֶׁאָכַל אוֹכָלִין טְמֵאִין וְשָׁתָה מַשְׁקִין טְמֵאִין, וְהַבָּא רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ בְּמַיִם שְׁאוּבִין, אוֹ שֶׁנָּפְלוּ עַל רֹאשׁוֹ וְעַל רוּבּוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה לוּגִּין מַיִם שְׁאוּבִין, וְיָרַד לִטְבּוֹל; סָפֵק טָבַל סָפֵק לֹא טָבַל; וַאֲפִילּוּ טָבַל — סָפֵק טָבַל בְּאַרְבָּעִים סְאָה, סָפֵק לֹא טָבַל בְּאַרְבָּעִים סְאָה; וְכֵן שְׁנֵי מִקְווֹאוֹת — בְּאַחַת יֵשׁ בָּהּ אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה, וְאַחַת אֵין בָּהּ אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה; וְטָבַל בְּאַחַת מֵהֶן, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ בְּאֵיזֶה מֵהֶן טָבַל — סְפֵיקוֹ טָהוֹר.
human_translation: However, with regard to lenient impurity such as one who ate impure foods; and one who drank impure liquids; and one whose head and most of his body came under drawn water, or if three log of drawn water fell on one’s head and most of his body, and one descended to immerse doubt immersed or he did not immerse; and even if he immersed, doubt immersed in forty se’a or he did not immerse in forty se’a ; and similarly, two ritual baths, one has forty se’a in it and one does not have forty se’a in it, and he immersed in one of them, but he does not know in which of them he immersed; his doubt, he is pure.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But in light impurity, such as one who ate impure foods and drank impure liquids, and one whose head and the majority of his body entered drawn water, or if three lug of drawn water fell on his head and the majority of his body, and he descended to immerse; if it is uncertain whether he immersed or did not immerse; and even if he immersed — if it is uncertain whether he immersed in forty se'ah or did not immerse in forty se'ah; and similarly with two mikvaot — one of them contains forty se'ah, and one does not contain forty se'ah; and he immersed in one of them, and he does not know in which one he immersed — his doubt is pure.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי מְטַמֵּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei renders him impure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei metamei.

hebrew_text: קָסָבַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: תְּחוּמִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir holds limits are by Torah law,
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir holds: "Techumim are of biblical origin."

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר תְּחוּמִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא?! וְהָא תְּנַן: אִם אֵין יָכוֹל לְהַבְלִיעוֹ, בְּזוֹ אָמַר רַבִּי דּוֹסְתַּאי בַּר יַנַּאי מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: שָׁמַעְתִּי שֶׁמְּקַדְּרִין בֶּהָרִים.
human_translation: Does Rabbi Meir hold limits are by Torah law? Didn’t we learn cannot be swallowed in this Rabbi Dostai said in the name of Rabbi Meir: I heard that we pierce mountains,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Meir thought the boundaries of the Torah?! But didn't we learn: If one cannot swallow it, with this Rabbi Dostai bar Yannai said in the name of Rabbi Meir: I heard that they cook in the mountains.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ תְּחוּמִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — מִי מְקַדְּרִין? וְהָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: אֵין מְקַדְּרִין לֹא בְּעָרֵי מִקְלָט, וְלֹא בְּעֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן שֶׁל תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: And if it should enter your mind limits are by Torah law, would pierce the mountains? Didn’t Rav Naḥman say that Rabba bar Avuh said: We may not pierce when cities of refuge nor heifer whose neck is broken, because those are from the Torah;
llm_translation: And if it enters your mind, the boundaries of the Torah - who designates them? But Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh: We do not designate boundaries neither in cities of refuge, nor in the heifer whose neck is to be broken - because they are of the Torah.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דִידֵיהּ, הָא דְרַבֵּיהּ. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי: ״בְּזוֹ אָמַר רַבִּי דּוֹסְתַּאי בַּר יַנַּאי מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: שָׁמַעְתִּי שֶׁמְּקַדְּרִין בֶּהָרִים״. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: not difficult, This is his; that is his teacher’s. is also precise as we learned: In this Rabbi Dostai bar Yannai said in the name of Rabbi Meir: I have heard that we pierce mountains. conclude from this
llm_translation: Not difficult: this of his, this of his teacher. Specifically it is stated, as it is taught: "With this, Rabbi Dostai bar Yannai said in the name of Rabbi Meir: 'I heard that they launder in the mountains.'" Learn from it.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִי דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא אַדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר,
human_translation: to raise a contradiction Torah law and Torah law, according to Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: And Remi of the Torah, from the Torah to Rabbi Meir,

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: נָגַע בְּאֶחָד בַּלַּיְלָה, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ אִם חַי אִם מֵת, וּלְמָחָר הִשְׁכִּים וּמְצָאוֹ מֵת. רַבִּי מֵאִיר מְטַהֵר וַחֲכָמִים מְטַמְּאִין, שֶׁכׇּל הַטֻּמְאוֹת כִּשְׁעַת מְצִיאָתָן.
human_translation: As we learned touched one at night, and he does not know whether alive or dead, and the following day he arose and found him dead, Rabbi Meir renders him pure. And the Rabbis render him impure because all impure at the time they were discovered.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: If one touched someone at night and does not know if they are alive or dead, and the next morning they woke up and found them dead, Rabbi Meir declares them pure, while the sages declare them impure, for all impurities are determined at the time of their discovery.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: מִשְׁנָתֵנוּ שֶׁהָיָה עָלֶיהָ שֶׁרֶץ כָּל בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת. אִי הָכִי, בְּהָא לֵימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי סְפֵק עֵירוּב כָּשֵׁר?!
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: The mishna where a creeping animal was on for the entire twilight If so, in that case, would Rabbi Yosei say an eiruv in doubt is valid?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: From our Mishnah that had a creeping creature between the suns. If so, in this case, should Rabbi Yosei say, "A doubtful Eruv is valid?!"

hebrew_text: רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: הָכָא בִּשְׁתֵּי כִּיתֵּי עֵדִים עָסְקִינַן, אַחַת אוֹמֶרֶת: מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם נִטְמָאָה, וְאַחַת אוֹמֶרֶת: מִשֶּׁחָשֵׁיכָה.
human_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef who both said: Here, we are dealing with two sets of witnesses, one says: became impure while it was still day, and one says: after nightfall.
llm_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef both say: Here we are dealing with two groups of witnesses. One group says: "She became impure from the middle of the day," and the other group says: "From when it became dark."

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: הָתָם תְּרֵי חֶזְקֵי לְקוּלָּא, וְהָכָא חֲדָא חֲזָקָה לְקוּלָּא.
human_translation: Rava said: There, two presumptions leniency, here, one presumption leniency.
llm_translation: Rava said: There, two strong arguments for leniency, and here, one strong argument for leniency.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אַדְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי!
human_translation: a contradiction between Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: The difficulty of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yosei!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר חִינָּנָא: שָׁאנֵי טוּמְאָה, הוֹאִיל וְיֵשׁ לָהּ עִיקָּר מִן הַתּוֹרָה. שַׁבָּת נָמֵי דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הִיא? קָסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: תְּחוּמִין דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Ḥinnana said: impurity is different, since it has a basis in the Torah. Shabbat are also by Torah law; Rabbi Yosei holds: limits rabbinic
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Chinena said: The laws of impurity are different, since they have a basis in the Torah. Is Shabbat also from the Torah? Rabbi Yosei holds: The Sabbath limits are of Rabbinic origin.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָא דִּידֵיהּ, הָא דְּרַבֵּיהּ. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אַבְטוּלְמוֹס הֵעִיד מִשּׁוּם חֲמִשָּׁה זְקֵנִים שֶׁסְּפֵק עֵירוּב כָּשֵׁר — שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say This is his; that is his teacher’s. is also precise as we learned Rabbi Yosei said: Avtolemos testified in the name of five Elders that an eiruv in doubt is valid. conclude from this
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: This one is like his own, this one is like his teacher. It is precisely stated, as it is taught: Rabbi Yosei said: Avtulmos testified in the name of five elders that if one made an uncertain eruv, it is valid - accept it from him.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר, הָתָם הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: הַעֲמֵד טָמֵא עַל חֶזְקָתוֹ, וְאֵימָא לֹא טָבַל.
human_translation: Rava said There, this is the reason Rabbi Yosei’s Keep the impure in his presumptive state and say he did not immerse
llm_translation: Rava said, there, that is the reason of Rabbi Yosei: Establish the impure on his presumption, and say perhaps he did not immerse.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה הַעֲמֵד מִקְוֶה עַל חֶזְקָתוֹ, וְאֵימָא לֹא חָסַר! בְּמִקְוֶה שֶׁלֹּא נִמְדַּד.
human_translation: On the contrary, keep the ritual bath in its presumptive state and say that was not lacking a ritual bath that had not been measured
llm_translation: The Great Rav stood by his presumption, and say it is not lacking! In a presumption that was not measured.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא: כֵּיצַד אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי סְפֵק עֵירוּב כָּשֵׁר? עֵירַב בִּתְרוּמָה, סָפֵק מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם נִטְמֵאת סָפֵק מִשֶּׁחָשֵׁיכָה נִטְמֵאת; וְכֵן בְּפֵירוֹת, סָפֵק מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם נִתַּקְּנוּ סָפֵק מִשֶּׁחָשֵׁיכָה נִתַּקְּנוּ — זֶה הוּא סָפֵק עֵירוּב כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: It was taught In what case did Rabbi Yosei say that an eiruv in doubt is valid? one established an eiruv with teruma doubt whether it became impure while it was still day, whether it became impure after nightfall, and similarly, with produce doubt whether it was rendered fit while it was still day, whether it was rendered fit after nightfall, this is an eiruv in doubt is valid.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: How did Rabbi Yosei say that a doubtful Eruv is valid? If one made an Eruv with Terumah, whether the doubt arose before midday and it became impure, or whether the doubt arose after nightfall and it became impure; and similarly with fruits, whether the doubt arose before midday and they were designated, or whether the doubt arose after nightfall and they were designated — this is a case of a valid doubtful Eruv.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל עֵירַב בִּתְרוּמָה, סָפֵק טְהוֹרָה סָפֵק טְמֵאָה; וְכֵן בְּפֵירוֹת, סָפֵק נִתַּקְּנוּ סָפֵק לֹא נִתַּקְּנוּ — אֵין זֶה סְפֵק עֵירוּב כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: However, if one established an eiruv with teruma there was doubt whether it was pure or impure and similarly, with produce there was doubt whether it had been rendered fit whether it had not been rendered fit, this is not an eiruv in doubt is valid.
llm_translation: But if he mixed in terumah, whether it is a doubtful pure or a doubtful impure; and similarly with fruits, whether they were acquired or not acquired - this is not a valid doubtful eruv.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא תְּרוּמָה — דְּאָמַר הַעֲמֵד תְּרוּמָה עַל חֶזְקָתָהּ, וְאֵימָא טְהוֹרָה הִיא; פֵּירוֹת נָמֵי — הַעֲמֵד טֶבֶל עַל חֶזְקָתוֹ, וְאֵימָא לֹא נִתַּקְּנוּ!
human_translation: What is different teruma , which say: Keep the teruma in its presumptive state and say it was pure produce [ tevel ] also Keep the untithed produce in its presumptive state, and say that it was not rendered fit
llm_translation: What is the difference regarding Terumah? — For it was said: Establish Terumah based on its presumption, and say perhaps it is pure; regarding produce — establish Tevel based on its presumption, and say perhaps it has not been tithed!

hebrew_text: לָא תֵּימָא: סָפֵק מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם נִתַּקְּנוּ, אֶלָּא אֵימָא: סָפֵק מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם נִדְמְעוּ, סָפֵק מִשֶּׁחָשֵׁיכָה נִדְמְעוּ.
human_translation: Do not say: doubt whether it was rendered fit while it was still day, Rather, say: doubt whether became mixed while it was still day, whether it became mixed after nightfall.
llm_translation: Do not say: Perhaps they were detached while it was still day, rather say: Perhaps they were detached while it was still light, perhaps they were detached after it became dark.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק מֵרַב הוּנָא: הָיוּ לְפָנָיו שְׁתֵּי כִכָּרוֹת, אַחַת טְמֵאָה וְאַחַת טְהוֹרָה, וְאָמַר: עָירְבוּ לִי בַּטְּהוֹרָה בְּכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁהִיא, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak raised a dilemma to Rav Huna: there were two loaves of before one impure and one pure, and he said: Establish an eiruv for me with the pure wherever it is, what is
llm_translation: Requested Rabbi Shmuel son of Rav Yitzchak from Rav Huna: There were before him two loaves, one impure and one pure, and he said: "Can they combine for me in purity wherever it is?" What is the ruling?

hebrew_text: תִּיבְּעֵי לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, תִּיבְּעֵי לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. תִּיבְּעֵי לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר הָתָם — דְּלֵיכָּא טְהוֹרָה. הָכָא — הָא אִיכָּא טְהוֹרָה. אוֹ דִילְמָא: אֲפִילּוּ לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, לָא קָאָמַר אֶלָּא הָתָם, דְּאִם אִיתָא דְּהִיא טְהוֹרָה — יָדַע לַהּ. אֲבָל הָכָא, הָא לָא יָדַע לַהּ?
human_translation: be asked according to Rabbi Meir, be asked according to Rabbi Yosei. be asked according to Rabbi Meir Rabbi Meir only stated there, where there is no pure Here, there is a pure Or perhaps even according to Rabbi Yosei, he only said there, if indeed is pure, he knows it but here, he does not know it.
llm_translation: The question was asked to Rabbi Meir, the question was asked to Rabbi Yosei. The question was asked to Rabbi Meir: Until here, Rabbi Meir did not say there — because there is no purity. Here — there is purity. Or perhaps, even according to Rabbi Yosei, he only said that there, for if there is purity, he knows it. But here, does he not know it?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בֵּין לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֵּין לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר בָּעִינַן סְעוּדָה הָרְאוּיָה מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם — וְלֵיכָּא.
human_translation: said to According to both Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Meir, we require a meal that is fit while it is still day, and there is none.
llm_translation: He said to him: Whether for Rabbi Yosei or for Rabbi Meir, we require a meal fitting from before midday - and there is none.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵרַב נַחְמָן: כִּכָּר זוֹ הַיּוֹם חוֹל וּלְמָחָר קֹדֶשׁ, וְאָמַר: עָירְבוּ לִי בָּזֶה, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב.
human_translation: Rava raised dilemma to Rav Naḥman: This loaf unconsecrated today, and tomorrow consecrated, and he said: Establish an eiruv for me with this what is said to his eiruv is eiruv .
llm_translation: Rava asked a question of Rav Nachman: "This loaf today is mundane, and tomorrow it will be holy." And he said: "Can they combine for me in this?" He said to him: "His combining is combining."

hebrew_text: הַיּוֹם קֹדֶשׁ וּלְמָחָר חוֹל, וְאָמַר: עָירְבוּ לִי בָּזֶה, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵין עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב. מַאי שְׁנָא?
human_translation: consecrated today, and tomorrow unconsecrated, and he said: Establish an eiruv for me with this what is said to him: His eiruv is not eiruv . What is different
llm_translation: Today is holy and tomorrow is mundane, and he said: "They made an Eruv for me with this, what is it?" He said to him: "His Eruv is not an Eruv. What is the difference?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְכִי תֵּיכוּל עֲלֵיהּ כּוֹרָא דְמִלְחָא: הַיּוֹם חוֹל וּלְמָחָר קֹדֶשׁ — מִסְּפֵיקָא לָא נָחֲתָא לֵיהּ קְדוּשָּׁה. הַיּוֹם קֹדֶשׁ וּלְמָחָר חוֹל — מִסְּפֵיקָא לָא פָּקְעָא לֵיהּ קְדוּשְׁתֵּיהּ מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: said to After you eat a kor of salt over it, today unconsecrated, and tomorrow consecrated, not out of doubt sanctity has descended upon today consecrated, and tomorrow unconsecrated, not out of doubt sanctity has departed from it.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Go and inquire about it from the expert in salt-making: if today is a weekday and tomorrow is Shabbat - it is not sufficient for him to sanctify it. If today is Shabbat and tomorrow is a weekday - it is not sufficient for him to remove its holiness from it."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: לָגִין טְבוּל יוֹם שֶׁמִּלְּאוֹ מִן הֶחָבִית שֶׁל מַעֲשֵׂר טֶבֶל, וְאָמַר: הֲרֵי זֶה תְּרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר לִכְשֶׁתֶּחֱשַׁךְ — דְּבָרָיו קַיָּימִין.
human_translation: We learned there: one filled a flask that was immersed during the day [ tevul yom ] from a barrel of tithe tevel , and he said: Let this be teruma of the tithe when night falls, his statement takes effect.
llm_translation: We learned there: For a stalk of grain that was immersed in a mikveh on the day it was harvested from the vat of tithes, and one said: "Behold, this is terumah of the tithe when it gets dark" - his words are valid.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אָמַר: עָירְבוּ לִי בָּזֶה — לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם. אָמַר רָבָא זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת: סוֹף הַיּוֹם קוֹנֶה עֵירוּב,
human_translation: And if he said: Establish an eiruv for me with this he has not said anything, Rava said: That is to say the end of the day the eiruv acquires
llm_translation: "And if he said, 'They have combined for me with this one,' he did not say anything. Rava said: This means, 'The end of the day acquires the Eruv.'"

hebrew_text: דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ תְּחִילַּת הַיּוֹם קוֹנֶה עֵירוּב, אִי אָמַר עָירְבוּ לִי בָּזֶה, אַמַּאי לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם?
human_translation: As, if it should enter your mind an eiruv acquires the beginning of the day if he said: Establish an eiruv for me with this why hasn’t he said anything?
llm_translation: If the beginning of your intention is to acquire an Eruv, if he said, "They have made an Eruv for me in this," why did he not say anything?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא תְּחִילַּת הַיּוֹם קוֹנֶה עֵירוּב, בָּעִינַן סְעוּדָה הָרְאוּיָה מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם, וְלֵיכָּא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: even if you say an eiruv acquires the beginning of the day we require a meal that is fit while it is still day, and there is none
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Even if you say that the beginning of the day establishes the Eruv, we require a meal fitting from before the day, and not.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מַתְנֶה אָדָם עַל עֵירוּבוֹ, וְאוֹמֵר: אִם בָּאוּ גּוֹיִם מִן הַמִּזְרָח — עֵירוּבִי לַמַּעֲרָב. מִן הַמַּעֲרָב — עֵירוּבִי לַמִּזְרָח. אִם בָּאוּ לְכָאן וּלְכָאן — לִמְקוֹם שֶׁאֶרְצֶה אֵלֵךְ. לֹא בָּאוּ לֹא לְכָאן וְלֹא לְכָאן — הֲרֵינִי כִּבְנֵי עִירִי.
human_translation: A person may make a condition with regard to his eiruv and say: If gentiles come from the east, my eiruv is in the west, from the west, my eiruv is in the east. If they come from here and from there, I will go wherever I wish, if they do not come neither from here nor from there, I will be like the inhabitants of my town
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A person may establish an Eruv for his city, and he declares: If gentiles came from the east - my Eruv is towards the west. If they came from the west - my Eruv is towards the east. If they came both here and there - I will go to the place where I desire. If they did not come neither here nor there - I am like the inhabitants of my city.

hebrew_text: אִם בָּא חָכָם מִן הַמִּזְרָח — עֵירוּבִי לַמִּזְרָח. מִן הַמַּעֲרָב — עֵירוּבִי לַמַּעֲרָב. בָּא לְכָאן וּלְכָאן — לִמְקוֹם שֶׁאֶרְצֶה אֵלֵךְ. לֹא לְכָאן וְלֹא לְכָאן — הֲרֵינִי כִּבְנֵי עִירִי. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיָה אֶחָד מֵהֶן רַבּוֹ — הוֹלֵךְ אֵצֶל רַבּוֹ, וְאִם הָיוּ שְׁנֵיהֶן רַבּוֹתָיו — לִמְקוֹם שֶׁיִּרְצֶה יֵלֵךְ.
human_translation: If a Sage comes from the east my eiruv is in the east, from the west, my eiruv is in the west. comes from here, and from there, I will go wherever I wish; and neither from here nor from there, I will be like the inhabitants of my town. Rabbi Yehuda says: If one of was his teacher, he may go to his teacher, And if they were both his teachers, he may go wherever he wishes.
llm_translation: If a sage comes from the east - his Eruv is to the east. If from the west - his Eruv is to the west. If he came here and there - to the place he desires to go. Not here and not there - I am like the children of my city. Rabbi Yehuda says: If one of them is his master - he goes to his master, and if they both are his masters - he goes to the place he desires.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ כִּי אֲתָא רַבִּי יִצְחָק תָּנֵי אִיפְּכָא כּוּלָּהּ מַתְנִיתִין. קַשְׁיָא גּוֹיִם אַגּוֹיִם, קַשְׁיָא חָכָם אַחָכָם!
human_translation: when Rabbi Yitzḥak came he taught all the mishna in the opposite difficult between gentiles gentiles and between a Sage and a Sage
llm_translation: Gemara: When Rabbi Yitzchak came, he taught: "Turn it all into Mishnayot. The difficulty of nation to nation, the difficulty of sage to sage!"

hebrew_text: גּוֹיִם אַגּוֹיִם לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּפַרְהַגְבָּנָא, הָא — בְּמָרֵי דְמָתָא.
human_translation: between gentiles and gentiles not difficult: This a tax collector [ parhagabena ], that the lord of the town,
llm_translation: Nations against nations not difficult: this — in the Persian language, this — in the Aramaic language.

hebrew_text: חָכָם אַחָכָם לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּמוֹתֵיב פִּירְקֵי, הָא — בְּמַקְרֵי שְׁמַע.
human_translation: between a Sage and a Sage not difficult: This who sits lectures, that who teaches recite Shema ,
llm_translation: A wise man, a wise man, not difficult: this — in matters of interpretation, this — in matters of tradition.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר אִם הָיָה אֶחָד מֵהֶן וְכוּ׳. וְרַבָּנַן — זִימְנִין דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ בְּחַבְרֵיהּ טְפֵי מֵרַבֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: If one of was And the Rabbis sometimes prefers his colleague rather than his teacher,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says, "If one of them was etc." And the Rabbis - sometimes they leave him more than his teacher in his company.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: לֵיתָא לְמַתְנִיתִין מִדְּתָנֵי אַיּוֹ. דְּתָנֵי אַיּוֹ: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר אֵין אָדָם מַתְנֶה עַל שְׁנֵי דְבָרִים כְּאֶחָד, אֶלָּא: אִם (כֵּן) בָּא חָכָם לַמִּזְרָח — עֵירוּבוֹ לַמִּזְרָח, וְאִם בָּא חָכָם לַמַּעֲרָב — עֵירוּבוֹ לַמַּעֲרָב, אֲבָל לְכָאן וּלְכָאן — לָא.
human_translation: Rav said: the mishna not because of what Ayo taught as Ayo taught Rabbi Yehuda says: A person cannot make conditions about two things at once, Rather, if a Sage came from the east, his eiruv is in the east, and if a Sage came from the west, his eiruv is in the west. But not from here, and from there,
llm_translation: Rav said: There is a difference in the Mishnah from what it teaches in the Baraita. For it teaches in the Baraita: Rabbi Yehuda says: A person does not make an eruv on two things as one, but if a wise man comes from the east - his eruv is for the east, and if a wise man comes from the west - his eruv is for the west, but for here and for there - no.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא לְכָאן וּלְכָאן דְּלָא — דְּאֵין בְּרֵירָה, לַמִּזְרָח לַמַּעֲרָב — נָמֵי אֵין בְּרֵירָה.
human_translation: What is different from here and from there that is not there is no retroactive designation, to the east to the west also there is no retroactive designation.
llm_translation: What is the difference between here and there that there is no free choice, from east to west also there is no free choice.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וּכְבָר בָּא חָכָם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: the Sage had already come
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: "And already came a wise one."

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה, לֵיתָא לִדְאַיּוֹ מִמַּתְנִיתִין.
human_translation: On the contrary, Ayo not because of the mishna.
llm_translation: The Great Rav, there is no support for his opinion from the Mishnah.

hebrew_text: לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דְּהָא שָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּלֵית לֵיהּ בְּרֵירָה. דִּתְנַן: הַלּוֹקֵחַ יַיִן מִבֵּין הַכּוּתִים,
human_translation: It should not enter your mind as we have heard that Rabbi Yehuda does not retroactive designation. As it was taught One who buys wine from among the Samaritans [ Kutim ],
llm_translation: Not gone up your mind, for we heard it to him to Rabbi Yehuda that not to him choice. For we learned: One who buys wine from among the Kutim,

hebrew_text: אוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵי לוּגִּין שֶׁאֲנִי עָתִיד לְהַפְרִישׁ הֲרֵי הֵן תְּרוּמָה, עֲשָׂרָה מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן, תִּשְׁעָה מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי, וּמֵיחֵל וְשׁוֹתֶה מִיָּד — דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹסְרִין.
human_translation: may say: Two log which I will separate in the future, shall be teruma ten first tithe; nine second tithe. He redeems and he may immediately drink the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Yosei, and Rabbi Shimon prohibit
llm_translation: He says: "Two logs that I am destined to separate, behold they are Terumah, ten percent first tithe, nine percent second tithe, and if he waits and drinks immediately - the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Yosei, and Rabbi Shimon prohibit."

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא אָמַר: לֵיתָא לְאַיּוֹ מִמַּתְנִיתִין. וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּקָתָנֵי: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹסְרִין —
human_translation: Ulla said Ayo not because the mishna. But that which was taught Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Yosei, and Rabbi Shimon prohibit
llm_translation: Ulla said: There is no "Leita" in the Mishnah. But rather, this is what is taught: Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Yosei, and Rabbi Shimon prohibit —

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא זוּזֵי זוּזֵי קָתָנֵי: דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹסְרִין.
human_translation: Ulla taught in pairs, the statement of Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon prohibit
llm_translation: Oula zuzai zuzai katanei: Divrei Rabbi Meir veRabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Yosei veRabbi Shimon osrin.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אֵין בְּרֵירָה? וְהָתְנַן: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים שֶׁלָּקְחוּ אֶת קִינֵּיהֶן בְּעֵירוּב, אוֹ שֶׁנָּתְנוּ קִינֵּיהֶן לַכֹּהֵן — אֵיזֶהוּ שֶׁיִּרְצֶה כֹּהֵן יַקְרִיב עוֹלָה, וּלְאֵיזֶה שֶׁיִּרְצֶה יַקְרִיב חַטָּאת!
human_translation: Does Rabbi Yosei hold that there is no retroactive designation? Didn’t we learn Rabbi Yosei says: two women took their birds’ nests, jointly or they gave their birds’ nests to a priest whichever the priest wishes he may offer as a burnt-offering, and whichever he wishes he may offer as a sin-offering.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Yosei holds there is no free choice? But we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Yosei says: Two women who took their oaths with an eruv, or who gave their oaths to the priest—whichever priest wants to bring an elevation-offering may do so, and to whichever one he wants, he may bring a sin-offering!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: הָתָם — כְּשֶׁהִתְנוּ.
human_translation: Rabba said: there where stipulated
llm_translation: Rabba said: There — when they argued.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן כִּדְרַב חִסְדָּא, דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אֵין הַקִּינִּין מִתְפָּרְשׁוֹת.
human_translation: If so, what to say teaches us Rav Ḥisda, as Rav Ḥisda said: Birds’ nests become designated only
llm_translation: So, what is there to say? It is heard for us like Rav Ḥisdah said, as Rav Ḥisdah said: The laws of levirate marriage are not explained.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי בִּלְקִיחַת בְּעָלִים, אִי בַּעֲשִׂיַּית כֹּהֵן.
human_translation: when they are purchased by their owner, or through the actions of the priest
llm_translation: Rather, whether through acquisition of the owner, or through the action of a priest.

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי: סָבַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אֵין בְּרֵירָה? וְהָתַנְיָא: עַם הָאָרֶץ שֶׁאָמַר לְחָבֵר ״קַח לִי אֲגוּדָּה אַחַת שֶׁל יָרָק אוֹ גְּלוּסְקָא אַחַת״ — אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְעַשֵּׂר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: And still Rabbi Yosei hold there is no retroactive designation? Wasn’t it taught an am ha’aretz , said to a ḥaver , Buy for me a bundle of vegetables or a cake [ geluska ], does not need to tithe the statement of Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: And once: Thought Rabbi Yosei there is no choice? And it was taught: An am ha'aretz who said to his friend, "Take for me one bundle of vegetables or one head of cabbage" — he does not need to tithe, the words of Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: צָרִיךְ לְעַשֵּׂר. אֵיפוֹךְ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: He must tithe Reverse
llm_translation: The sages say: "One must tithe." The opposite.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, הָאוֹמֵר: ״מַעֲשֵׂר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בְּבֵיתִי מְחוּלָּל עַל סֶלַע שֶׁתַּעֲלֶה בְּיָדִי מִן הַכִּיס״. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מְחוּלָּל!
human_translation: Come hear one who says: tithe that I have in my house shall be redeemed upon the sela that will come up in my hand from the pouch, Rabbi Yosei says: is redeemed.
llm_translation: Listen, one who says: "I have a tithe in my house, consecrated upon a rock that will ascend into my hand from the pocket." Rabbi Yosei says: Consecrated!

hebrew_text: אֵיפוֹךְ, אֵימָא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: לֹא חִילֵּל. וּמַאי חֲזֵית דְּאָפְכַתְּ תַּרְתֵּי מִקַּמֵּי חֲדָא, אֵיפוֹךְ חֲדָא מִקַּמֵּי תַּרְתֵּי!
human_translation: Reverse say Rabbi Yosei says: He has not redeemed What did you see that you reversed two because of one, I should reverse one because of two
llm_translation: Opposite, say: Rabbi Yosei says: Not profane. And what do you see that you turn two before one, opposite one before two!

hebrew_text: הָא וַדַּאי אִיפְּכָא תַּנְיָא, דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּאוֹמֵר ״מַעֲשֵׂר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתִי יְהֵא מְחוּלָּל עַל סֶלַע חֲדָשָׁה שֶׁתַּעֲלֶה בְּיָדִי מִן הַכִּיס״ — שֶׁחִילֵּל. מִדְּקָאָמַר הָכָא שֶׁחִילֵּל, מִכְּלָל דְּהָתָם — לֹא חִילֵּל.
human_translation: This certainly taught in reverse, the latter clause states: And Rabbi Yosei concedes with regard to one who says: The tithe that I have in my house shall be redeemed with the new sela that will come up in my hand from the pouch, that he has redeemed From that it said here that he has redeemed by inference that there, he did not redeem
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text into English: "This, and certainly the opposite is taught, as it is taught in the latter part: And Rabbi Yosei concedes regarding one who says, 'If I have a tithe within my house, let it be redeemed on a new coin that will come into my possession from the purse' — he has desecrated. From the fact that it says here 'he has desecrated,' it can be inferred that there — he did not desecrate."

hebrew_text: הַאי סֶלַע חֲדָשָׁה הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִי דְּאִיכָּא תַּרְתֵּי תְּלָת, דְּיֵשׁ בְּרֵירָה — הַיְינוּ קַמַּיְיתָא? אֶלָּא דְּלֵיכָּא אֶלָּא חֲדָא — מַאי ״תַּעֲלֶה״?
human_translation: This new sela , what are its circumstances? If where there are two three and there is retroactive designation, this is the first Rather, where he has only one what Will come up?
llm_translation: This new rock, how is it considered? If there are two or three, that there is choice - is that the same as the first? Rather, if there is only one - what is "it shall ascend"?

hebrew_text: אַיְּידֵי דְּתָנֵי רֵישָׁא ״תַּעֲלֶה״, תְּנָא סֵיפָא נָמֵי ״תַּעֲלֶה״.
human_translation: Since the first clause taught Will come up, the latter clause also taught Will come up,
llm_translation: Through what means does the first Tanna teach "it shall go up," the latter Tanna teaches "it shall go up."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: מַאן הַאי תַּנָּא דַּאֲפִילּוּ בִּדְרַבָּנַן לֵית לֵיהּ בְּרֵירָה? דְּתַנְיָא: אָמַר לַחֲמִשָּׁה הֲרֵינִי מְעָרֵב עַל אֵיזֶה מִכֶּם שֶׁאֶרְצֶה, רָצִיתִי — יֵלֵךְ, לֹא רָצִיתִי — לֹא יֵלֵךְ. רָצָה מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם — עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב, מִשֶּׁחָשֵׁיכָה — אֵין עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב.
human_translation: Rava said to Rav Naḥman: Who is this tanna does not accept retroactive designation even concerning rabbinic decrees? As it was taught said to five I am hereby establishing an eiruv for whichever one of you I will choose, I have chosen will walk I have not chosen will not walk he chose while it was still day, his eiruv is eiruv ; after nightfall, his eiruv is not eiruv .
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava to Rav Nachman: Who is this Tanna that even according to the Rabbis does not hold of choice? For it was taught: If one says to five people, "I am joining with whichever of you I please," if he wanted - it is effective, if he did not want - it is not effective. If he wanted while it is still day - his joining is effective, if he wanted after dark - his joining is not effective.

hebrew_text: אִישְׁתִּיק, וְלָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ וְלָא מִידֵּי. וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ תַּנָּא דְּבֵי אַיּוֹ הוּא! לָא שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: was silent and did not say anything to And let say to him of the school of Ayo, He did not accept
llm_translation: The man remained silent, and did not respond to him, nor did he say anything. And why not say to him: Perhaps he is a student of the school of Ayu! He did not listen to him.

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: תַּנָּאֵי שָׁקְלַתְּ מֵעָלְמָא? תַּנָּאֵי הִיא! דְּתַנְיָא: הֲרֵינִי מְעָרֵב לְשַׁבָּתוֹת שֶׁל כׇּל הַשָּׁנָה, רָצִיתִי — אֵלֵךְ, לֹא רָצִיתִי — לֹא אֵלֵךְ. רָצָה מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם — עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב. מִשֶּׁחָשֵׁיכָה, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said, you removed the tanna’im from the world? is tanna’im , as it was taught I am hereby establishing an eiruv for the Shabbatot of the entire year, if I want I will walk if I do not want I will not walk. If he wanted while it was still day, his eiruv is eiruv after nightfall Rabbi Shimon says: His eiruv is eiruv ; and the Rabbis say: His eiruv is not eiruv .
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Did you learn it from the world? It is a teaching! As it was taught: "I am undertaking to make an eruv for all the Shabbats of the year, if I desire - I will go, if I do not desire - I will not go. If he desired while it is still day - his eruv is valid. Once it is dark, Rabbi Shimon says: his eruv is valid, and the sages say: his eruv is not valid.

hebrew_text: וְהָא שָׁמְעִינַן לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּלֵית לֵיהּ בְּרֵירָה, קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אַדְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן! אֶלָּא אֵיפוֹךְ.
human_translation: Didn’t we hear that Rabbi Shimon does not accept retroactive designation Rabbi Shimon and Rabbi Shimon is difficult. Rather, reverse
llm_translation: We have heard the teaching of Rabbi Shimon that there is no free will, the difficulty of Rabbi Shimon is greater than the difficulty of Rabbi Shimon! Rather, the opposite.

hebrew_text: מַאי קַשְׁיָא? דִּילְמָא כִּי לֵית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּרֵירָה — בִּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא, אֲבָל בִּדְרַבָּנַן — אִית לֵיהּ!
human_translation: What is the difficulty Perhaps it is with regard to Torah law that Rabbi Shimon does not accept retroactive designation, but with regard to rabbinic he does accept
llm_translation: What is the difficulty? Perhaps because if it is not according to Rabbi Shimon, it is by Torah law, but according to the Rabbis, it is not!

hebrew_text: קָסָבַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מַאן דְּאִית לֵיהּ בְּרֵירָה, לָא שְׁנָא בִּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא, לָא שְׁנָא בִּדְרַבָּנַן — אִית לֵיהּ. וּמַאן דְּלֵית לֵיהּ בְּרֵירָה, לָא שְׁנָא בִּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא וְלָא שְׁנָא בִּדְרַבָּנַן — לֵית לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef holds one who accepts retroactive designation accepts it there is no difference Torah law and rabbinic And one who does not accept retroactive designation does not accept it there is no difference Torah law and rabbinic
llm_translation: Rav Yosef holds: One who has free choice, it does not differ in matters of Torah law, nor does it differ in matters of rabbinic law - he has it. And one who does not have free choice, it does not differ in matters of Torah law, and it does not differ in matters of rabbinic law - he does not have it.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּבָעֵינַן ״רֵאשִׁית שֶׁשְּׁיָרֶיהָ נִיכָּרִין״.
human_translation: Rava said: there, is different, as we require the first whose remnants are recognizable.
llm_translation: Rava said: It is different there, because we require "the beginning of its wool to be recognizable."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, הָיוּ לְפָנָיו שְׁנֵי רִמּוֹנִים שֶׁל טֶבֶל, וְאָמַר: אִם יֵרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים הַיּוֹם יְהֵא זֶה תְּרוּמָה עַל זֶה, וְאִם לֹא יֵרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים הַיּוֹם יְהֵא זֶה תְּרוּמָה עַל זֶה, הָכִי נָמֵי בֵּין יָרְדוּ בֵּין לֹא יָרְדוּ דְּאֵין בִּדְבָרָיו כְּלוּם?
human_translation: Abaye said to him: But if that is so, there were two pomegranates tevel before him, and he said: If rain falls today, this shall be teruma for that and if rain does not fall today, that shall be teruma for this so too, whether fell or did not fall, there is no his statement
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Rather, from now on, there were before him two pomegranates of tevel, and he said: If rain falls today, let this be terumah for this one, and if rain does not fall today, let this be terumah for this one. Is it not so that whether rain falls or not, his words are meaningless?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכִי נָמֵי, וְהָתְנַן: תְּרוּמַת הַכְּרִי הַזֶּה וּמַעְשְׂרוֹתָיו בְּתוֹכוֹ, וּתְרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר זֶה בְּתוֹכוֹ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: קָרָא הַשֵּׁם!
human_translation: And if you say is so, Didn’t we learn The teruma of this pile and its tithes shall be inside it, and The teruma of this tithe shall be inside it, Rabbi Shimon says: He has given it a name,
llm_translation: And if you will say so, it is indeed so. And we learned: The heave-offering of this pile and its tithes within it, and the heave-offering of this tithe within it. Rabbi Shimon says: The Name has called!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם — דְּאִיכָּא סְבִיבָיו.
human_translation: There, it is different because there are around it.
llm_translation: There are differences there - for there are surroundings.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא — כִּדְקָתָנֵי טַעְמָא, אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר: אִי אַתָּה מוֹדֶה שֶׁמָּא יִבָּקַע הַנּוֹד, וְנִמְצָא זֶה שׁוֹתֶה טְבָלִים לְמַפְרֵעַ! אָמַר לָהֶן: לִכְשֶׁיִּבָּקַע!
human_translation: And if you wish, say in accordance with the reason that was taught said to Rabbi Meir: Don’t you concede perhaps the flask will burst and retroactively this drinking tevel ? said to them: When it bursts,
llm_translation: And if you wish, say - as it is taught in the reasoning, they said to Rabbi Meir: If you admit that perhaps the vow will be annulled, and this one will be found drinking in violation! He said to them: When it will be annulled!

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאי דִּסְלֵיק אַדַּעְתִּין מֵעִיקָּרָא דְּבָעֵינַן רֵאשִׁית שֶׁשְּׁיָרֶיהָ נִיכָּרִין, מַאי קָאָמְרִי לֵיהּ?
human_translation: And according to what initially entered our minds, that we require the first, whose remnants are recognizable what did say to
llm_translation: And for what purpose does our knowledge emerge from the outset that we require the beginning of its hair to be recognizable, what are they saying to him?

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמְרִי לֵיהּ: לְדִידַן — בָּעִינַן רֵאשִׁית שֶׁשְּׁיָרֶיהָ נִיכָּרִין. לְדִידָךְ —
human_translation: This is what they said to him: According to our we require the first, whose remnants are recognizable; according to your
llm_translation: So they were saying to him: According to us - we require the beginning of its wool to be recognizable. According to you -

hebrew_text: אִי אַתָּה מוֹדֶה שֶׁמָּא יִבָּקַע הַנּוֹד, וְנִמְצָא שׁוֹתֶה טְבָלִים לְמַפְרֵעַ? אָמַר לָהֶן: לִכְשֶׁיִּבָּקַע.
human_translation: don’t you concede perhaps the flask will burst, and retroactively this drinking tevel ? said to them: When it bursts,
llm_translation: "If you admit that perhaps the vessel will break, and it will be found that he is drinking from tevulim for the purpose of separating? He said to them: When it breaks."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: יוֹם טוֹב הַסָּמוּךְ לַשַּׁבָּת, בֵּין מִלְּפָנֶיהָ וּבֵין מִלְּאַחֲרֶיהָ — מְעָרֵב אָדָם שְׁנֵי עֵירוּבִין, וְאוֹמֵר: עֵירוּבִי בָּרִאשׁוֹן לַמִּזְרָח וּבַשֵּׁנִי לַמַּעֲרָב; בָּרִאשׁוֹן לַמַּעֲרָב וּבַשֵּׁנִי לַמִּזְרָח; עֵירוּבִי בָּרִאשׁוֹן, וּבַשֵּׁנִי כִּבְנֵי עִירִי; עֵירוּבִי בַּשֵּׁנִי, וּבְרִאשׁוֹן כִּבְנֵי עִירִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: a Festival adjacent to Shabbat, whether before it, or after it, a person establish two eiruvin and say My eiruv on the first to the east, and on the second to the west. On the first to the west and on the second to the east. My eiruv on the first but on the second like the inhabitants of my town, My eiruv on the second but on the first like the inhabitants of my town.
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Eliezer says: A festival that adjoins the Sabbath, whether before it or after it, a person may combine two Eruvin, and say: My Eruv is in the first direction to the east and in the second direction to the west; in the first direction to the west and in the second direction to the east; my Eruv is in the first direction, and in the second like the children of my city; my Eruv is in the second, and in the first like the children of my city.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אוֹ מְעָרֵב לְרוּחַ אַחַת, אוֹ אֵינוֹ מְעָרֵב כׇּל עִיקָּר. אוֹ מְעָרֵב לִשְׁנֵי יָמִים, אוֹ אֵינוֹ מְעָרֵב כׇּל עִיקָּר.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say he either establishes an eiruv in one direction or he establishes no eiruv at all; either he establishes an eiruv for two days, or he establishes no eiruv at all.
llm_translation: The Sages say: Either it combines with one wind, or it does not combine at all. Either it combines for two days, or it does not combine at all.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד יַעֲשֶׂה? מוֹלִיכוֹ בָּרִאשׁוֹן וּמַחְשִׁיךְ עָלָיו, וְנוֹטְלוֹ, וּבָא לוֹ. בַּשֵּׁנִי מַחְשִׁיךְ עָלָיו וְאוֹכְלוֹ וּבָא לוֹ, וְנִמְצָא מִשְׂתַּכֵּר בַּהֲלִיכָתוֹ, וּמִשְׂתַּכֵּר בְּעֵירוּבוֹ.
human_translation: What does one do He brings on the first and he stays with it until nightfall, and he takes it and goes away, On second he stays with it until nightfall, eat and go away, Consequently, he benefits walk and he benefits his eiruv .
llm_translation: How does one do it? He leads it first and darkens upon it, and takes it, and comes to him. In the second, he darkens upon it and eats it and comes to him, and is found to be rewarded in his walking, and rewarded in his dwelling.

hebrew_text: נֶאֱכַל בָּרִאשׁוֹן — עֵירוּבוֹ לָרִאשׁוֹן, וְאֵין עֵירוּבוֹ לַשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: was eaten on first his eiruv for first and his eiruv is not for the second
llm_translation: Eaten in the first - its eruv is for the first, and its eruv is not for the second.

hebrew_text: אָמַר (לָהֶן) רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: מוֹדִים אַתֶּם לִי שֶׁהֵן שְׁתֵּי קְדוּשּׁוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to them: you agree with me that constitute two sanctities,
llm_translation: Said (to them) Rabbi Eliezer: You admit to me that they are two holinesses.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ ״לְרוּחַ אַחַת״ מַאי נִיהוּ? לִשְׁנֵי יָמִים. ״לִשְׁנֵי יָמִים״ מַאי נִיהוּ? לְרוּחַ אַחַת. הַיְינוּ קַמַּיְיתָא!
human_translation: in one direction. What does this for two days. for two days. What does this in one direction. this is the first
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemar 'le-ruach achad' mai nihu? Lishnei yamim. 'Lishnei yamim' mai nihu? Le-ruach achad. Haynu kamayaita!" English translation: "What is the meaning of 'complete in one breath'? For two days. What is the meaning of 'for two days'? In one breath. That is the resolution!"

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמְרִי לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: אִי אַתָּה מוֹדֶה שֶׁאֵין מְעָרְבִין לְיוֹם אֶחָד חֶצְיוֹ לַצָּפוֹן וְחֶצְיוֹ לַדָּרוֹם? אָמַר לָהֶן: אֲבָל. כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאֵין מְעָרְבִין לְיוֹם אֶחָד, חֶצְיוֹ לַדָּרוֹם וְחֶצְיוֹ לַצָּפוֹן — כָּךְ אֵין מְעָרְבִין לִשְׁנֵי יָמִים, יוֹם אֶחָד לַמִּזְרָח וְיוֹם אֶחָד לַמַּעֲרָב.
human_translation: This is what the Rabbis said to Rabbi Eliezer: Don’t you concede that one day, one may not establish an eiruv for half to the north and half of it to the south? said to them: Indeed, Just as one may not establish an eiruv for one day, half to the north and half to the south, so too, one may not establish an eiruv for two days one day to the east and one day to the west.
llm_translation: Thus the sages said to Rabbi Eliezer: If you agree that one cannot combine for one day, half of it to the north and half of it to the south? He said to them: But just as one cannot combine for one day, half of it to the south and half of it to the north - so too, one cannot combine for two days, one day to the east and one day to the west.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר? הָתָם — קְדוּשָּׁה אַחַת. הָכָא — שְׁתֵּי קְדוּשּׁוֹת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer There, one sanctity, Here, two sanctities,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer? There — one sanctity. Here — two sanctities.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: אִי אַתֶּם מוֹדִים שֶׁאִם עֵירַב בְּרַגְלָיו בְּיוֹם רִאשׁוֹן — מְעָרֵב בְּרַגְלָיו בְּיוֹם שֵׁנִי? נֶאֱכַל עֵירוּבוֹ בְּיוֹם רִאשׁוֹן — אֵין יוֹצֵא עָלָיו בְּיוֹם שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to Don’t you concede that if one established an eiruv with his feet on the first day establish eiruv with his feet on the second day, his eiruv was eaten on the first day, he may not on it go out on the second day?
llm_translation: He said to them Rabbi Eliezer: If you agree that if one made an Eruv with his feet on the first day, he may make an Eruv with his feet on the second day? If his Eruv was eaten on the first day, he is not exempt on the second day.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֲבָל. הָא לָאיֵי שְׁתֵּי קְדוּשּׁוֹת הֵן. וְרַבָּנַן סַפּוֹקֵי מְסַפְּקָא לְהוּ, וְהָכָא לְחוּמְרָא וְהָכָא לְחוּמְרָא.
human_translation: said to him: Indeed, said to them: isn’t it they are two sanctities, And the Rabbis They are in doubt and here is stringent and here is stringent
llm_translation: They said to him: But. This is not so, for there are two sanctities. And the Rabbis are in doubt, and here for stringency and here for stringency.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: אִי אַתָּה מוֹדֶה שֶׁאֵין מְעָרְבִין בַּתְּחִילָּה מִיּוֹם טוֹב לַשַּׁבָּת? אָמַר לָהֶן: אֲבָל. הָא לָאיֵי קְדוּשָּׁה אַחַת הִיא!
human_translation: said to Rabbi Eliezer: Don’t you concede that one may not establish an eiruv initially on a Festival for Shabbat, said to them: Indeed, isn’t it one sanctity?
llm_translation: They said to Rabbi Eliezer: Do you not agree that we do not combine the Eruv at the outset from Yom Tov to Shabbat? He said to them: But, is not the sanctity one?

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: הָתָם מִשּׁוּם הֲכָנָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer there, due to preparation
llm_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer: there, because of preparation.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עֵירַב בְּרַגְלָיו בְּיוֹם רִאשׁוֹן — מְעָרֵב בְּרַגְלָיו בְּיוֹם שֵׁנִי. נֶאֱכַל עֵירוּבוֹ בְּיוֹם רִאשׁוֹן — אֵין יוֹצֵא עָלָיו בְּיוֹם שֵׁנִי, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי.
human_translation: The Sages taught If one established an eiruv with his feet on the first day he must establish eiruv with his feet on the second day. his eiruv was eaten on the first day, he may not on it go out on the second day. the statement of Rabbi
llm_translation: The sages taught: If one made an eruv with his feet on the first day - he may make an eruv with his feet on the second day. If his eruv was eaten on the first day - he is not exempt on the second day, the words of Rabbi.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says:
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says:

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי זֶה חַמָּר גַּמָּל.
human_translation: This is a donkey driver, and a camel driver,
llm_translation: Behold, this is a donkey of a camel.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה אוֹמְרִים: עֵירַב בְּרַגְלָיו בָּרִאשׁוֹן — אֵין מְעָרֵב בְּרַגְלָיו בַּשֵּׁנִי, נֶאֱכַל עֵירוּבוֹ בְּיוֹם רִאשׁוֹן — יוֹצֵא עָלָיו בַּשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, say: he established an eiruv with his feet on the first he not establish an eiruv with his feet on the second his eiruv was eaten on the first day, he may on it go out on the second
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Brokah, say: If one made an Eruv with his feet on the first day, he does not make an Eruv with his feet on the second day; if his Eruv was eaten on the first day, he fulfills his obligation on the second day.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּאַרְבָּעָה זְקֵנִים הַלָּלוּ, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר דְּאָמַר שְׁתֵּי קְדוּשּׁוֹת הֵן. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן אַרְבָּעָה זְקֵנִים: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה סְתִימְתָּאָה. וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, וּמַפֵּיק רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה סְתִימְתָּאָה.
human_translation: Rav said: halakha is in accordance with these four Elders and in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, who said: they two sanctities. And these are the four Elders: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel; Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka; Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Shimon; and Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda, the unattributed And there are who say: One of them is Rabbi Elazar, and remove Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda, the unattributed
llm_translation: Rav said: The halacha follows these four elders, and in the matter of Rabbi Eliezer who says they are two holy Torah scrolls. And these are the four elders: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and Rabbi Yishmael son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Brokah, and Rabbi Eliezer son of Rabbi Shimon, and Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda of the village of Stimita. And some say: One of them is Rabbi Elazar, and Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda of the village of Stimita disagrees.

hebrew_text: וְהָא רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בַּר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה אִיפְּכָא שָׁמְעִינַן לְהוּ! אֵיפוֹךְ.
human_translation: Didn’t we hear that Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, the opposite Reverse
llm_translation: And this, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and Rabbi Yishmael bar Rabbi Yochanan ben Broka contradicted! Contradiction.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ רַבִּי? אֵימָא: וְכֵן אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: If so, this is Rabbi Say And so too, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said
llm_translation: So is this, is this Rabbi? Say: And so said Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and so on.

hebrew_text: וְלִיחְשׁוֹב נָמֵי רַבִּי! רַבִּי תָּנֵי לַהּ וְלָא סָבַר לַהּ.
human_translation: Let us also count Rabbi Rabbi taught this and did not hold it
llm_translation: And to think, the students of Rabbi! Rabbi taught her, but he did not agree with her.

hebrew_text: רַבָּנַן נָמֵי תָּנוּ לַהּ וְלָא סָבְרִי לַהּ? רַב גְּמָרָא גְּמִיר לַהּ.
human_translation: the Rabbis, also taught and did not hold it Rav learned by tradition
llm_translation: The sages taught it to her, and they did not think about it? Rav said: "We have learned it to her."

hebrew_text: כִּי נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא, עָיֵיל רַב חִסְדָּא לְמִירְמָא דְּרַב אַדְּרַב. מִי אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּאַרְבָּעָה זְקֵנִים, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר דְּאָמַר שְׁתֵּי קְדוּשּׁוֹת הֵן?
human_translation: when Rav Huna, passed away, Rav Ḥisda entered to raise a contradiction between Rav and Rav: Did Rav say: halakha is in accordance with the four Elders and in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, who said they two sanctities?
llm_translation: When the soul of Rav Huna departed, Rav Ḥisdah went to console Rav Adda bar Rav. Who said Rav: The halakha is like the opinion of four elders, and according to the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer who said, "They are two holy things?"

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִיתְּמַר: שַׁבָּת וְיוֹם טוֹב, רַב אָמַר: נוֹלְדָה בָּזֶה אֲסוּרָה בָּזֶה!
human_translation: Wasn’t it stated Shabbat and a Festival Rav said: was laid on one is prohibited on the other,
llm_translation: And it was stated: Shabbat and Yom Tov, Rav said: If it was born on this one, it is prohibited on this one!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: הָתָם — מִשּׁוּם הֲכָנָה.
human_translation: Rabba said There, because of preparation,
llm_translation: Rabba said: There — because of preparation.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְהָיָה בַּיּוֹם הַשִּׁשִּׁי וְהֵכִינוּ״ — חוֹל מֵכִין לְשַׁבָּת וְחוֹל מֵכִין לְיוֹם טוֹב, וְאֵין יוֹם טוֹב מֵכִין לְשַׁבָּת וְאֵין שַׁבָּת מְכִינָה לְיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: As it was taught “And it shall come to pass, on the sixth day, when they shall prepare weekday one may prepare for Shabbat, and weekday one may prepare for a Festival. a Festival one may not prepare for Shabbat, and Shabbat one may not prepare for a Festival.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "And it shall be on the sixth day, and they shall prepare" — one may prepare on a weekday for Shabbat, and one may prepare on a weekday for a Festival, but one may not prepare on a Festival for Shabbat, and Shabbat does not prepare for a Festival.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי, אֶלָּא הָא דִּתְנַן: כֵּיצַד הוּא עוֹשֶׂה — מוֹלִיכוֹ בָּרִאשׁוֹן, וּמַחְשִׁיךְ עָלָיו, וְנוֹטְלוֹ וּבָא לוֹ. בַּשֵּׁנִי מַחְשִׁיךְ עָלָיו, וְאוֹכְלוֹ וּבָא לוֹ. הָא קָא מֵכִין מִיּוֹם טוֹב לְשַׁבָּת!
human_translation: Abaye said to him: But that which we learned What does he do He takes on the first and he stays with it until nightfall, and he takes it and goes away. On the second and stays with it until nightfall, and eat and go away, Isn’t he preparing on a Festival for Shabbat?
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye, rather this that we learned: How does one do it? He leads him on the first day, covers him, takes him and comes to him. On the second day, he covers him, eats him, and comes to him. This is preparing from the day of the festival to the Sabbath!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה: מִי סָבְרַתְּ סוֹף הַיּוֹם קוֹנֶה עֵירוּב? תְּחִלַּת הַיּוֹם קוֹנָה עֵירוּב, וְשַׁבָּת מְכִינָה לְעַצְמָהּ.
human_translation: Rabba said to him: Do you think that the eiruv acquires at the end of the day, The eiruv acquires at the beginning of the day, and Shabbat prepare for itself.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabba: Who holds that the end of the day acquires the Eruv? The beginning of the day acquires the Eruv, and the Sabbath prepares for itself.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה — יְעָרְבוּ בְּלָגִין?
human_translation: But if that is so, one should establish an eiruv with flasks
llm_translation: Rather from now on - they will mix with "Blagin"?

hebrew_text: בָּעִינַן סְעוּדָה הָרְאוּיָה מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם, וְלֵיכָּא.
human_translation: We require a meal that is fit while it is still day, and there is none,
llm_translation: We require a meal fitting from the middle of the day, and there is none.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: יוֹם טוֹב הַסָּמוּךְ לַשַּׁבָּת, בֵּין מִלְּפָנֶיהָ וּבֵין מִלְּאַחֲרֶיהָ, מְעָרֵב אָדָם שְׁנֵי עֵירוּבִין. הָא בָּעִינַן סְעוּדָה הָרְאוּיָה מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם, וְלֵיכָּא.
human_translation: But that which we learned Rabbi Eliezer says: a Festival is adjacent to Shabbat, whether before it or after it, a person may establish two eiruvin . Don’t we require a meal that is fit while it is still day, and there is none?
llm_translation: Rather, this that we learned: Rabbi Eliezer says: A festival day that is adjacent to the Sabbath, whether before it or after it, a person may combine two Eruvin. This is necessary for a meal that is fitting from before the day, and not otherwise.

hebrew_text: מִי סָבְרַתְּ דְּמַנַּח לֵיהּ בְּסוֹף אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה לְכָאן, וּבְסוֹף אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה לְכָאן? לָא, דְּמַנַּח לֵיהּ בְּסוֹף אֶלֶף אַמָּה לְכָאן, וּבְסוֹף אֶלֶף אַמָּה לְכָאן.
human_translation: Do you think that he placed at the end of two thousand cubits in this and at the end of two thousand cubits in that No, that he placed at the end of one thousand cubits in the this direction, and at the end of one thousand cubits in that
llm_translation: Who holds that the resting place for it is at the end of two thousand cubits here, and at the end of two thousand cubits there? No, the resting place for it is at the end of one thousand cubits here, and at the end of one thousand cubits there.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: עֵירַב בְּרַגְלָיו יוֹם רִאשׁוֹן — מְעָרֵב בְּרַגְלָיו יוֹם שֵׁנִי, עֵירַב בְּפַת בְּיוֹם רִאשׁוֹן — מְעָרֵב בְּפַת בְּיוֹם שֵׁנִי, הָא קָא מֵכִין מִיּוֹם טוֹב לַשַּׁבָּת!
human_translation: But that Rav Yehuda said: one established an eiruv with his feet first day, he may establish an eiruv with his feet second day; he established an eiruv with bread on first day, he may establish an eiruv with bread on second day? Isn’t he preparing from a Festival to Shabbat?
llm_translation: Rather, this that Rav Yehudah said: If one made an Eruv with his feet on the first day - he may make an Eruv with his feet on the second day; if one made an Eruv with bread on the first day - he may make an Eruv with bread on the second day. This is preparing from a festival day to Shabbat!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי סָבְרַתְּ דְּאָזֵיל וְאָמַר מִידֵּי? דְּאָזֵיל וְשָׁתֵיק, וְיָתֵיב.
human_translation: said to him: Do you think that one must go and say something He goes, and is silent, and sits
llm_translation: He said to him: Who thinks that I go and say of my own accord? I go and remain silent, and then I speak.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן? כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי, דְּאָמַר: חֶפְצֵי הֶפְקֵר קוֹנִין שְׁבִיתָה.
human_translation: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri, who said: ownerless property acquires a Shabbat residence
llm_translation: As whom? As Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri, who said: "Items of Hefker acquire ownership through being placed under guard."

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי אֶלָּא בְּיָשֵׁן, דְּלָא מָצֵי אָמַר. אֲבָל בְּנֵיעוֹר, דְּאִי בָּעֵי לְמֵימַר מָצֵי אָמַר — אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא אָמַר, כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Even if you say the Rabbis, the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri only with regard to a sleeping person, who cannot say However, with regard to awake, if he wanted to speak he could speak, even though he did not say he is considered as one who did say
llm_translation: Even if you say it is the opinion of the sages, up to here the sages do not argue on the matter of Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri except in the case of an old one, where it cannot be said. But in the case of a young one, where if one wants to say it can be said, even though he did not say it, it is as if he did say it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה בַּר רַב חָנִין לְאַבָּיֵי: אִי הֲוָה שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ לְמָר הָא דְּתַנְיָא: לֹא יְהַלֵּךְ אָדָם לְסוֹף שָׂדֵהוּ לֵידַע מָה הִיא צְרִיכָה; כַּיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ,
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Ḥanin said to Abaye: If the Master, had heard that which was taught A person may not walk to the end of his field to determine what it requires, Similarly,
llm_translation: Rabah bar Rav Ḥanin said to Abbaye: If Master had heard what is taught: "A person should not walk to the end of his field to know what it needs," similar to it.

hebrew_text: לֹא יְטַיֵּיל אָדָם עַל פֶּתַח מְדִינָה כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּכָּנֵס לַמֶּרְחָץ מִיָּד, הָדַר בֵּיהּ!
human_translation: a person may not stroll at the entrance to the city in order to enter a bathhouse immediately retracted his
llm_translation: A person should not stroll at the entrance of a town in order to immediately enter the bathhouse, let him return!

hebrew_text: וְלָא הִיא, שְׁמִעַ לֵיהּ וְלָא הֲדַר בֵּיהּ. הָתָם — מוֹכְחָא מִילְּתָא, הָכָא — לָאו מוֹכְחָא מִילְּתָא הִיא.
human_translation: And this is not heard this but did not retract There, it is clear here, it is not clear
llm_translation: "And not this, listen to it and not return to it. There — it is proven, here — it is not proven."

hebrew_text: אִי צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן הוּא, אָמְרִינַן: שְׁמַעְתָּא מְשַׁכְתֵּיהּ. וְאִי עַם הָאָרֶץ הוּא, אָמְרִינַן: חַמְרָא אִירְכַס לֵיהּ.
human_translation: If he is a Torah scholar [ tzurva merabbanan ], we, say: his study pulled him, And if he is an ignoramus, we say: he lost donkey
llm_translation: If he is a scholar, we say: "You have heard." And if he is an ignoramus, we say: "A donkey has kicked him."

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: עֵירַב בְּרַגְלָיו בְּיוֹם רִאשׁוֹן — מְעָרֵב בְּרַגְלָיו בְּשֵׁנִי. עֵירַב בְּפַת בְּיוֹם רִאשׁוֹן — מְעָרֵב בְּפַת בְּיוֹם שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: itself, Rav Yehuda said: one established an eiruv with his feet on first day, he may establish an eiruv with his feet on the second he established an eiruv with bread on first day, he may establish an eiruv with bread on second day
llm_translation: The body, Rab Yehuda said: If one made an Eruv with his feet on the first day, he may make an Eruv with his feet on the second day. If one made an Eruv with a loaf on the first day, he may make an Eruv with a loaf on the second day.

hebrew_text: עֵירַב בְּפַת בָּרִאשׁוֹן — מְעָרֵב בְּרַגְלָיו בַּשֵּׁנִי. עֵירַב בְּרַגְלָיו בָּרִאשׁוֹן — אֵין מְעָרֵב בְּפַת בַּשֵּׁנִי, שֶׁאֵין מְעָרְבִין בַּתְּחִלָּה בְּפַת.
human_translation: he established an eiruv with bread on the first establish an eiruv with his feet on the second he established an eiruv with his feet on the first he may not establish an eiruv with bread on the second one may not initially establish an eiruv with bread
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If one mixed with bread on the first day — he mixes with his feet on the second. If one mixed with his feet on the first day — he does not mix with bread on the second, for one does not mix initially with bread.

hebrew_text: עֵירַב בְּפַת בְּיוֹם רִאשׁוֹן מְעָרֵב בְּפַת בְּיוֹם שֵׁנִי, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: וּבְאוֹתָהּ הַפַּת. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי מַתְנִיתִין, דְּקָתָנֵי: כֵּיצַד הוּא עוֹשֶׂה? מוֹלִיכוֹ בָּרִאשׁוֹן, וּמַחְשִׁיךְ עָלָיו, וְנוֹטְלוֹ וּבָא לוֹ. בַּשֵּׁנִי, מַחְשִׁיךְ עָלָיו, וְאוֹכְלוֹ וּבָא לוֹ.
human_translation: he established an eiruv with bread on first day, he may establish an eiruv with bread on second day, Shmuel said: with the same bread. Rav Ashi said: the mishna is also precise as we learned: What does he do He brings on the first and he stays with it until nightfall, and he takes it and goes away. On the second stays with it until nightfall, and he eat and go away.
llm_translation: Mingling with bread on the first day, mingling with bread on the second day, Shmuel said: "With that bread." Rav Ashe said: "It is precisely as it is taught in the Mishnah: How does one do it? He brings it on the first day, covers it, takes it, and it becomes his. On the second day, he covers it, eats it, and it becomes his."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, דִּילְמָא הָתָם — עֵצָה טוֹבָה קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, perhaps there, teaching us good advice
llm_translation: The sages, perhaps there — good advice is being heard by us.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה שֶׁהָיָה יָרֵא שֶׁמָּא תִּתְעַבֵּר, מְעָרֵב אָדָם שְׁנֵי עֵירוּבִין, וְאוֹמֵר: עֵירוּבִי בָּרִאשׁוֹן לַמִּזְרָח, וּבַשֵּׁנִי לַמַּעֲרָב. בָּרִאשׁוֹן לַמַּעֲרָב, וּבַשֵּׁנִי לַמִּזְרָח. עֵירוּבִי בָּרִאשׁוֹן, וּבַשֵּׁנִי כִּבְנֵי עִירִי. עֵירוּבִי בַּשֵּׁנִי, וּבְרִאשׁוֹן כִּבְנֵי עִירִי. וְלֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Rosh HaShana, one feared that might be extended, person may establish two eiruvin and say: My eiruv on the first to the east and on the second to the west, On the first to the west, and on the second to the east. My eiruv on the first but on the second like the inhabitants of my town, My eiruv on the second but on the first like the inhabitants of my town. And the Rabbis did not agree with him
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Yehuda says: On Rosh Hashanah, if one was concerned that it might become forbidden to carry on Shabbat, he may combine two Eruvin, saying: My Eruv is in the first direction to the east, and in the second direction to the west; in the first direction to the west, and in the second direction to the east; my Eruv is in the first direction, and in the second direction like the children of my city; my Eruv is in the second direction, and in the first direction like the children of my city. The Sages did not acknowledge this.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַתְנֶה אָדָם עַל הַכַּלְכַּלָּה בְּיוֹם טוֹב רִאשׁוֹן, וְאוֹכְלָהּ בַּשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda said further, A person may make a condition a basket on the first day of the Festival He may eat on the second
llm_translation: And furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda said: A person may set aside a dish on Erev Yom Tov and eat it on the first day of Yom Tov.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בֵּיצָה שֶׁנּוֹלְדָה בָּרִאשׁוֹן, תֵּאָכֵל בַּשֵּׁנִי. וְלֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: And similarly, an egg that was laid on the first may be eaten on the second And the Rabbis did not agree with him
llm_translation: And so with an egg that was laid on the first day, it shall be eaten on the second. And the sages did not concede to it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי דּוֹסָא בֶּן הַרְכִּינָס אוֹמֵר: הָעוֹבֵר לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב שֶׁל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, אוֹמֵר: ״הַחְלִיצֵנוּ ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ אֶת יוֹם רֹאשׁ הַחֹדֶשׁ הַזֶּה, אִם הַיּוֹם אִם לְמָחָר״. וּלְמָחָר הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״אִם הַיּוֹם אִם אֶמֶשׁ״. וְלֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Dosa ben Harekinas says: One who passes before the ark on the festival of Rosh HaShana says: Strengthen us, O Lord our God, on this day of the New Moon, whether today or tomorrow. And on the following day he says: Whether today or yesterday. And the Rabbis did not agree with him
llm_translation: Rabbi Dosa ben Harkinas says: One who passes before the Ark on the festival of Rosh Hashanah, says, "May it be Your will, Lord our God, to deliver us this day of the new month, whether today or tomorrow." And on the next day, he says, "Whether today or yesterday." The sages did not agree with him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאן ״לֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ״? אָמַר רַב: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: מוֹדִים חֲכָמִים לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה שֶׁהָיָה יָרֵא שֶׁמָּא תִּתְעַבֵּר, מְעָרֵב אָדָם שְׁנֵי עֵירוּבִין, וְאוֹמֵר: עֵירוּבִי בָּרִאשׁוֹן לַמִּזְרָח, וּבַשֵּׁנִי לַמַּעֲרָב. בָּרִאשׁוֹן לַמַּעֲרָב, וּבַשֵּׁנִי לַמִּזְרָח. עֵירוּבִי בָּרִאשׁוֹן, וּבַשֵּׁנִי כִּבְנֵי עִירִי. עֵירוּבִי בַּשֵּׁנִי, וּבָרִאשׁוֹן כִּבְנֵי עִירִי. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹסֵר.
human_translation: Who are did not agree with Rav said: It is Rabbi Yosei, as it was taught the Rabbis concede to Rabbi Eliezer Rosh HaShana that a person feared that might be extended, he may establish two eiruvin and say: My eiruv on the first to the east, and on the second to the west, On the first to the west, and on the second to the east, My eiruv on the first but on the second like the inhabitants of my town, My eiruv on the second but on the first like the inhabitants of my town. Rabbi Yosei prohibits
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who is the one "they did not agree with"? Rav said: It is Rabbi Yosei, as it was taught: The Sages agree with Rabbi Eliezer on Rosh Hashanah, who was concerned lest it become intercalated. A person may combine two Eruvin, saying: My Eruv is in the first one to the east, and in the second one to the west. In the first one to the west, and in the second one to the east. My Eruv is in the first one, and in the second one like the children of my city. My Eruv is in the second one, and in the first one like the children of my city. Rabbi Yosei prohibits.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אִי אַתֶּם מוֹדִים שֶׁאִם בָּאוּ עֵדִים מִן הַמִּנְחָה וּלְמַעְלָה, שֶׁנּוֹהֲגִין אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם קֹדֶשׁ וּלְמָחָר קֹדֶשׁ?!
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said to Don’t you concede that if witnesses came from the minḥa and onwards we observe that day as sanctified and the following day as sanctified?
llm_translation: He said to them Rabbi Yosei: If you admit that if witnesses came from the Mincha offering and above, that it is customary to treat it as holy today and holy tomorrow?!

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, הָתָם כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לְזַלְזוֹלֵי בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis there, so that will not demean
llm_translation: And the Rabbis, there, as how not to belittle it.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said further
llm_translation: And furthermore said Rabbi Yehuda and so forth.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא. דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה — בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא קָעָבֵיד מִידֵּי. אֲבָל כַּלְכָּלָה, דְּמֶיחְזֵי כִּמְתַקֵּן טִיבְלָא — אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And it necessary As, if he had taught us Rosh HaShana, in this Rabbi Yehuda say because one does not do anything But a basket, where it appears as though one is rendering tevel fit say concedes to the Rabbis
llm_translation: And it is necessary. For if we were to hear the ruling regarding Rosh Hashanah — in this case Rabbi Yehudah is saying, because it is not considered significant. But regarding a basket, which appears as if it is being fixed — say he concedes to the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָנֵי תַּרְתֵּי — מִשּׁוּם דְּלֵיכָּא לְמִיגְזַר עֲלַיְיהוּ. אֲבָל בֵּיצָה, דְּאִיכָּא לְמִיגְזַר בָּהּ מִשּׁוּם פֵּירוֹת הַנּוֹשְׁרִין וּמִשּׁוּם מַשְׁקִין שֶׁזָּבוּ — אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And had he taught us these two because there is no to issue a decree them, But an egg where there is to issue a decree it, because of fruit that fall due to liquids that oozed say concedes to the Rabbis, necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear those two — because there is no decree upon them. But with regard to an egg, where there is a decree upon it due to the dripping juices and liquids that have flowed from it — say that the Rabbis agree, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, כֵּיצַד אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַתְנֶה אָדָם עַל הַכַּלְכָּלָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב רִאשׁוֹן וְאוֹכְלָהּ בַּשֵּׁנִי? הָיוּ לְפָנָיו שְׁתֵּי כַּלְכַּלּוֹת שֶׁל טֶבֶל, אוֹמֵר: אִם הַיּוֹם חוֹל וּלְמָחָר קֹדֶשׁ — תְּהֵא זוֹ תְּרוּמָה עַל זוֹ, וְאִם הַיּוֹם קֹדֶשׁ וּלְמָחָר חוֹל — אֵין בִּדְבָרַי כְּלוּם. וְקוֹרֵא עָלֶיהָ שֵׁם, וּמַנִּיחָהּ.
human_translation: It was taught How Rabbi Yehuda said, a person make a condition a basket on the first day of the Festival and eat on the second there were two baskets of tevel before him, he says If today is weekday and tomorrow is sanctified, let this be teruma for that and if today is sanctified and tomorrow weekday, my statement has no And he bestows upon the name and sets it aside.
llm_translation: It was taught: How did Rabbi Yehuda say a person can designate a food item on the first day of a festival and eat it on the second day? If two dishes of tevel were before him, he would say: If today is a weekday and tomorrow is holy — let this be terumah for that. But if today is holy and tomorrow is a weekday — my words have no effect. And he would recite a name over it and leave it.

hebrew_text: וּלְמָחָר הוּא אוֹמֵר: אִם הַיּוֹם חוֹל — תְּהֵא זוֹ תְּרוּמָה עַל זוֹ, וְאִם הַיּוֹם קֹדֶשׁ — אֵין בִּדְבָרַי כְּלוּם. וְקוֹרֵא עָלֶיהָ שֵׁם וְאוֹכְלָהּ. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹסֵר. וְכֵן הָיָה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹסֵר בִּשְׁנֵי יָמִים טוֹבִים שֶׁל גָּלִיּוֹת.
human_translation: And on the next day he says If today is weekday, let this be teruma for that and if today is sanctified, my statement has no And He bestows upon the name and eat Rabbi Yosei prohibits And, so too, Rabbi Yosei would prohibit on the two Festival days of the Diaspora,
llm_translation: And on the next day he says: If today is a weekday - this shall be a terumah upon this, and if today is a holy day - there is nothing in my words. And he recites a blessing over it and eats it. Rabbi Yosei prohibits. And so too Rabbi Yosei would prohibit on the two good days of the Diaspora.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא בַּר טַבְיָא דַּאֲתָא לְבֵי רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא דְּאִתְּצִיד בְּיוֹם טוֹב רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל גָּלִיּוֹת, וְאִשְׁתְּחִיט בְּיוֹם טוֹב שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: a particular young deer was brought to the house of the Exilarch. was trapped on the first day of a Festival in the Diaspora and slaughtered on the second day of the Festival.
llm_translation: That one, son of Tabia, who came to the house of the head of the exile, he hunted on the first day of the Diaspora, and he slaughtered on the second day of the Diaspora.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן וְרַב חִסְדָּא אֲכַלוּ, רַב שֵׁשֶׁת לָא אֲכַל. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מַאי אֶעֱבֵיד לֵיהּ לְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת דְּלָא אָכֵיל בִּישְׂרָא דְטַבְיָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: וְהֵיכִי אֵיכוֹל דְּתָנֵי אִיסִי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אִיסִי תָּנֵי: וְכֵן הָיָה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹסֵר שְׁנֵי יָמִים טוֹבִים שֶׁל גָּלִיּוֹת!
human_translation: Rav Naḥman and Rav Ḥisda ate Rav Sheshet did not eat Rav Naḥman said What can I do for Rav Sheshet, who does not eat deer meat? Rav Sheshet said to him: How can I eat as Isi taught, and some say Didn’t Isi teach: And, so too, Rabbi Yosei would prohibit on the two Festival days of the Diaspora?
llm_translation: Rav Nachman and Rav Chisda ate, Rav Sheshet did not eat. Rav Nachman said: What should I do for Rav Sheshet who does not eat meat of a fat tail? Rav Sheshet said to him: How can I eat when Isi teaches, and they say to him, Isi teaches: And so Rabbi Yosei would prohibit the two good days of Galyot!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וּמַאי קוּשְׁיָא? דִּילְמָא הָכִי קָאָמַר: וְכֵן הָיָה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹסֵר בִּשְׁנֵי יָמִים טוֹבִים שֶׁל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה בַּגּוֹלָה! אִי הָכִי ״שֶׁל גָּלִיּוֹת״ — ״בַּגּוֹלָה״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Rava said: What is the difficulty? Perhaps this is what he said: And, so too, Rabbi Yosei would prohibit on the two Festival days of Rosh HaShana in the Diaspora, If so, of the Diaspora It should have in the Diaspora.
llm_translation: Rava said: And what is the difficulty? Perhaps he meant to say: "And so Rabbi Yosei would also prohibit the two good days of Rosh Hashanah in the Diaspora!" If so, he requires it to be "of the exiles" - he should have said "in the Diaspora"!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: וּמַאי קוּשְׁיָא? דִּילְמָא הָכִי קָאָמַר: וְכֵן הָיָה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי עוֹשֶׂה אִיסּוּר שְׁנֵי יָמִים טוֹבִים שֶׁל גָּלִיּוֹת, כִּשְׁנֵי יָמִים טוֹבִים שֶׁל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לְרַבָּנַן דְּשָׁרוּ.
human_translation: Rav Asi said: What is the difficulty? Perhaps this is what he said: And so too, Rabbi Yosei would treat the prohibition on the two Festival days of the Diaspora as on the two Festival days of Rosh HaShana, according to the Rabbis, who permit
llm_translation: Rav Assi said: And what is the difficulty? Perhaps he meant to say: "And so did Rabbi Yosei observe the prohibition of two good days of Galyot, like the two good days of Rosh Hashanah that the Rabbis permitted."

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת לְרַבָּה בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תָּנֵי מָר מִידֵּי בִּקְדוּשּׁוֹת? אֲמַר לֵיהּ תְּנֵינָא: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בִּשְׁנֵי יָמִים טוֹבִים שֶׁל גָּלִיּוֹת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לְהוּ, לָא תֵּימָא לְהוּ וְלָא מִידֵּי.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet met Rabba bar Shmuel said to him: Has the Master learned anything with regard to sanctities said to him: We have learned Rabbi Yosei concedes with regard to the two Festival days of the Diaspora. said to him: If you meet do not tell them anything
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet found Rabba bar Shmuel, he said to him: Did Mar teach about matters of holiness? He said to him: We have learned: Rabbi Yosei concedes regarding the two good days of the festivals. He said to him: If you forget them, do not say to them and not from his words.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: לְדִידִי אֲמַר לִי אַמֵּימָר: הָהוּא בַּר טַבְיָא לָאו אִיתְּצוּדֵי אִיתְּצִיד,
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Ameimar told me that the deer was not trapped
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: According to my opinion, Amemar said to me: That son of Tabia is not a hunter, he is hunted.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִחוּץ לַתְּחוּם אֲתָא. מַאן דַּאֲכַל סָבַר: הַבָּא בִּשְׁבִיל יִשְׂרָאֵל זֶה — מוּתָּר לְיִשְׂרָאֵל אַחֵר.
human_translation: rather, came from outside the limit The one ate holds: that comes for one Jew is permitted to another Jew.
llm_translation: Rather, he comes from outside the boundary. Whoever eats, he thinks: "This one who comes for the sake of Israel - it is permitted for another Israelite."

hebrew_text: וּמַאן דְּלָא אֲכַל סָבַר: כׇּל דְּאָתֵי לְבֵי רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא — אַדַּעְתָּא דְּכוּלְּהוּ רַבָּנַן אָתֵי.
human_translation: And the one did not eat holds: Anything that comes to the house of the Exilarch comes with all the Sages in mind,
llm_translation: And one who does not eat, he holds: anyone who comes to the head of the exile - the opinion of all the Rabbis comes.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת לְרַבָּה בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ?! לֹא הָיוּ דְבָרִים מֵעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Didn’t Rav Sheshet meet Rabba bar Shmuel and say to him that never happened.
llm_translation: And he found Rav Sheshet to Rabba bar Shmuel and said to him?! They were never words.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא לִיפְתָּא דְּאָתֵי לְמָחוֹזָא, נְפַק רָבָא, חַזְיָא דִּכְמִישָׁא, שְׁרָא רָבָא לְמִיזְבַּן מִינֵּיהּ. אָמַר: הָא וַדַּאי מֵאֶיתְמוֹל נֶעֶקְרָה.
human_translation: turnip brought to Meḥoza Rava went out saw were withered, and he permitted to buy them He said: These were uprooted yesterday,
llm_translation: That one, Yifta who came to the district, Rava went out, saw that he was a sorcerer, Rava sent him away. He said: "This is certainly uprooted from yesterday."

hebrew_text: מַאי אָמְרַתְּ, מִחוּץ לַתְּחוּם אָתְיָא? הַבָּא בִּשְׁבִיל יִשְׂרָאֵל זֶה, מוּתָּר לֶאֱכוֹל לְיִשְׂרָאֵל אַחֵר, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן הַאי דְּאַדַּעְתָּא דְגוֹיִם אֲתָא.
human_translation: What you say; they came from outside the limit that comes for one Jew is permitted to be eaten by another Jew, and all the more so this which came with gentiles in mind,
llm_translation: What do you say, does one come from outside the boundary? He who comes for the sake of Israel, this one is permitted to eat for another Israelite, and certainly this one who is known to be a non-Jew comes.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזָא דְּקָא מַפְּשִׁי וּמַיְיתִי לְהוּ — אֲסַר לְהוּ.
human_translation: Once saw that bring increased he prohibited
llm_translation: When he sees that he is revealing and bringing to them - he prohibited to them.

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ בְּנֵי גְנָנָא דְּגַזּוּ לְהוּ אָסָא בְּיוֹם טוֹב שֵׁנִי, לְאוּרְתָּא שְׁרָא לְהוּ רָבִינָא לְאוֹרוֹחֵי בֵּיהּ לְאַלְתַּר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא בַּר תַּחְלִיפָא לְרָבִינָא: לֵיסַר לְהוּ מָר מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵינָן בְּנֵי תוֹרָה.
human_translation: certain canopy makers, cut myrtles on the second day of a Festival, in the evening Ravina permitted to smell them immediately Rava bar Taḥalifa said to Ravina: The Master should prohibit them as they are not knowledgeable in Torah,
llm_translation: Those are the sons of Genana who cut the head of an animal for him on the second day of a festival. Ravina permitted them to light a lamp for him immediately. Raba bar Tachlifa said to Ravina: "The master should rebuke them because they are not Torah scholars."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב שְׁמַעְיָה: טַעְמָא דְּאֵינָן בְּנֵי תוֹרָה, הָא בְּנֵי תוֹרָה שְׁרֵי?! וְהָא בָּעִינַן בִּכְדֵי שֶׁיֵּעָשׂוּ! אֲזַלוּ שַׁיְילוּהּ לְרָבָא, אֲמַר לְהוּ: בָּעִינַן בִּכְדֵי שֶׁיֵּעָשׂוּ.
human_translation: Rav Shemaya strongly objects to this: The reason that they are not knowledgeable in Torah; they were knowledgeable in Torah, would it be permitted? Don’t we require the time needed for preparation, They went and asked Rava. He said to them: We require the time needed for preparation.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Rav Shemaya objects to her: The reason that they are not sons of Torah, but sons of Torah are permitted?! But we require that they be done! They went and asked Rava, he said to them: We require that they be done.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי דּוֹסָא אוֹמֵר הָעוֹבֵר לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה כּוּ׳.
human_translation: Rabbi Dosa says: He who passes before the ark
