llm_translation: Rabbi Dosa says: "One who passes in front of the Ark, etc."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: כִּי הֲוֵינַן בֵּי רַב הוּנָא, אִיבַּעְיָא לַן: מַהוּ לְהַזְכִּיר שֶׁל רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה? כֵּיוָן דַּחֲלוּקִין בְּמוּסָפִין, אָמְרִינַן? אוֹ דִילְמָא — זִכָּרוֹן אֶחָד עוֹלֶה לְכָאן וּלְכָאן?
human_translation: Rabba said: When we were in the house of Rav Huna, we raised the dilemma: What is to mention the New Moon on Rosh HaShana? since they have separate additional offerings, we mention Or perhaps one remembrance counts for this and that?
llm_translation: Rabba said: When we were in the study hall of Rav Huna, we asked: What is the ruling regarding mentioning the new moon of Tishrei on Rosh Hashanah? Since they are divided in their counting, do we say that one mention suffices for both here and there?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לַן: תְּנֵיתוּהָ, רַבִּי דּוֹסָא אוֹמֵר: הָעוֹבֵר לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה כּוּ׳ — מַאי לָאו לְהַזְכִּיר?
human_translation: said to us: You have learned Rabbi Dosa says: He who passes before the ark What, is it not to mention
llm_translation: He said to us: You have taught it, Rabbi Dosa says: One who passes in front of the Ark, etc. — What is the reason? Is it not to mention the verse?

hebrew_text: לֹא, לְהַתְנוֹת.
human_translation: No, to make a condition.
llm_translation: Not, to argue.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, מִדְּקָתָנֵי בְּבָרַיְיתָא: וְכֵן הָיָה רַבִּי דּוֹסָא עוֹשֶׂה בְּרָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים שֶׁל כׇּל הַשָּׁנָה כּוּלָּהּ, וְלֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable from that it was taught in a baraita : And so too, Rabbi Dosa would do on the New Moons the entire year; and did not agree with him.
llm_translation: Thus it was stated in a Baraita: "And so did Rabbi Dosa do at the beginning of every month throughout the entire year, and they did not thank him."

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא לְהַתְנוֹת — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי לֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לְהַזְכִּיר — אַמַּאי לֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ?
human_translation: Granted, if you say to make a condition, that is why they did not agree with him But if you say to mention why didn’t they agree with him
llm_translation: If you say it is to establish a condition - therefore they did not acknowledge it. Rather, if you say it is to remind - why did they not acknowledge it?

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מַאי — לְהַתְנוֹת? לְמָה לִי לְאִיפְּלוֹגֵי בְּתַרְתֵּי? צְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה — הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: בְּהָא קָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן דְּלָא — מִשּׁוּם דְּאָתֵי לְזַלְזוֹלֵי בֵּיהּ, אֲבָל בְּרָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים שֶׁל כׇּל הַשָּׁנָה כּוּלָּהּ — אֵימָא מוֹדוּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי דּוֹסָא.
human_translation: Rather, what to make a condition? Why do I to disagree in two It was necessary as, if he had taught us Rosh HaShana, I might have said in this did the Rabbis say that one should not because people might come to demean But in New Moon throughout the year, say they agree with Rabbi Dosa,
llm_translation: And rather what — to dispute? Why do I need to argue in two? It is necessary, for if we were to hear Rosh Hashanah — I would say: In this case the Rabbis say not — because it leads to belittling it, but in the beginning of all months of the year — I would say they agree with Rabbi Dosa.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אִתְּמַר בְּהָא — בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי דּוֹסָא, אֲבָל בְּהָךְ — אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if had been stated in this in this did Rabbi Dosa say But in that say he agrees with the Rabbis, necessary
llm_translation: "And if it is stated in this case - in this case Rabbi Dosa said, but in that case - I would say he concedes to the Rabbis. This is necessary."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מִתְפַּלֵּל עֶשֶׂר, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מִתְפַּלֵּל תֵּשַׁע. וְאִם אִיתָא, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ?
human_translation: raises an objection Rosh HaShana that occurs on Shabbat, Beit Shammai say: One prays ten And Beit Hillel say: One prays nine And if there were it should Beit Shammai, eleven
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: A question was raised: If Rosh Hashanah falls on Shabbat, Beit Shammai say: one prays ten, and Beit Hillel say: one prays nine. And if you ask, does Beit Shammai require eleven?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: שָׁאנֵי רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ, מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁכּוֹלֵל לְשַׁחֲרִית וְעַרְבִית, כּוֹלֵל נָמֵי בְּמוּסָפִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: The New Moon is different, Since is included morning and evening it is included in the additional as well
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Zeira: The difference of Rosh Chodesh is that it includes Shacharit and Arbit, it includes Nami in Musafin.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִית לְהוּ לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי כּוֹלֵל? וְהָתַנְיָא: רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מִתְפַּלֵּל שְׁמֹנֶה, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁבַע. קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: And do Beit Shammai include Wasn’t it taught a New Moon that occurs on Shabbat, Beit Shammai say: One pray eight and Beit Hillel say: One must pray seven difficult.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And does Beit Shammai have a general principle? And it was taught: If Rosh Chodesh falls on Shabbat, Beit Shammai say: one prays eight, and Beit Hillel say: one prays seven. This is a difficulty."

hebrew_text: וְכוֹלֵל עַצְמוֹ — תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: שַׁבָּת שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ אוֹ בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד, עַרְבִית שַׁחֲרִית וּמִנְחָה מִתְפַּלֵּל כְּדַרְכּוֹ שֶׁבַע, וְאוֹמֵר מֵעֵין הַמְאוֹרָע בָּעֲבוֹדָה. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: בַּהוֹדָאָה, וְאִם לֹא אָמַר מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: include itself tanna’im , as it was taught Shabbat that occurs on a New Moon or on the intermediate days of a Festival: the evening, morning, and afternoon prayers, one prays in his manner seven and says event during Temple service. Rabbi Eliezer says during thanksgiving. And if he did not recite we require him to return
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And including the bone - it is a teaching, as it was taught: If Shabbat falls on Rosh Chodesh or on the weekday of a festival, one prays the evening, morning, and afternoon prayers as usual, and recites a portion of the incense offering in the Temple. Rabbi Eliezer says: with thanksgiving, and if one did not say it, they repeat it." English translation:

hebrew_text: וּבְמוּסָפִין מַתְחִיל בְּשֶׁל שַׁבָּת, וּמְסַיֵּים בְּשֶׁל שַׁבָּת, וְאוֹמֵר קְדוּשַּׁת הַיּוֹם בָּאֶמְצַע.
human_translation: And in the additional prayer, one begins with Shabbat, and concludes with Shabbat, and says the sanctity of the day in the middle.
llm_translation: And in Mosafin, one begins with the eve of Shabbat, and concludes with the eve of Shabbat, and says the sanctity of the day in the middle.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁזָּקוּק לְשֶׁבַע — מַתְחִיל בְּשֶׁל שַׁבָּת וּמְסַיֵּים בְּשֶׁל שַׁבָּת, וְאוֹמֵר קְדוּשַּׁת הַיּוֹם בָּאֶמְצַע.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, say: Wherever obligated seven he begins with Shabbat and concludes with Shabbat, and he says the sanctity of the day in the middle.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Brokah, say: In any place where they are accustomed to say the blessing of seven cups of wine, one begins with the blessing of Shabbat and concludes with the blessing of Shabbat, and one says the sanctity of the day in the middle.

hebrew_text: מַאי הֲוָה עֲלַהּ? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: זִכָּרוֹן אֶחָד עוֹלֶה לוֹ לְכָאן וּלְכָאן. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבָּה: זִכָּרוֹן אֶחָד עוֹלֶה לוֹ לְכָאן וּלְכָאן.
human_translation: What was about this Rav Ḥisda said: One remembrance counts for this and that. And so too, Rabba said: One remembrance counts for this and that.
llm_translation: What was it that went up? Rav Ḥisdah said: One memory ascends for him here and there. And so too Rabba said: One memory ascends for him here and there.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבָּה: כִּי הֲוֵינָא בֵּי רַב הוּנָא, אִיבַּעְיָא לַן: מַהוּ לוֹמַר זְמַן בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה וּבְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים? כֵּיוָן דְּמִזְּמַן לִזְמַן אָתֵי — אָמְרִינַן, אוֹ דִילְמָא כֵּיוָן דְּלֹא אִיקְּרוּ רְגָלִים לָא אָמְרִינַן. לָא הֲוָה בִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabba said: When I was in the house of Rav Huna, we raised the dilemma: What is to saying time, on Rosh HaShana and Yom Kippur? since come at fixed times we recite Or perhaps, since are not called pilgrim Festivals [ regalim ], we do not recite: did not have at hand.
llm_translation: And Rabba said: When I was in the house of Rav Huna, we asked: What does it mean to say "a fixed time on Rosh Hashanah and on Yom Kippur"? Once he establishes a fixed time, does he come? We say, or perhaps since he did not call the festivals "regalim," we do not say. It was not in his hands.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתַאי בֵּי רַב יְהוּדָה, אֲמַר: אֲנָא אַקָּרָא חַדְתָּא נָמֵי אָמֵינָא זְמַן. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: רְשׁוּת לָא קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לִי, כִּי קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לִי חוֹבָה מַאי? אָמַר לִי: רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַויְיהוּ: אֵין אוֹמֵר זְמַן אֶלָּא בְּשָׁלֹשׁ רְגָלִים.
human_translation: When I came to the house of Rav Yehuda, he said: I recite time on a new gourd, I said to him: I have no dilemma option the dilemma I have is obligation What said to me it was Rav and Shmuel who both said: One recites time only on the three pilgrim Festivals.
llm_translation: When the household of Rav Yehuda came, he said: I will read a new teaching, I believe it is the right time. They said to him: You do not need permission, when you need permission for an obligation, what is it? He said to me: Rav and Shmuel who both said: One does not declare a time except during the three pilgrimage festivals.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״תֶּן חֵלֶק לְשִׁבְעָה וְגַם לִשְׁמוֹנָה״, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: ״שִׁבְעָה״ — אֵלּוּ שִׁבְעָה יְמֵי בְּרֵאשִׁית, ״שְׁמוֹנָה״ — אֵלּוּ שְׁמוֹנָה יְמֵי מִילָה. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: ״שִׁבְעָה״ — אֵלּוּ שִׁבְעָה יְמֵי פֶסַח, ״שְׁמוֹנָה״ — אֵלּוּ שְׁמוֹנָה יְמֵי הַחַג. וּכְשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״וְגַם״ — לְרַבּוֹת עֲצֶרֶת וְרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: raises an objection “Give a portion to seven, and also to eight” Rabbi Eliezer says: “Seven,” these are the seven days of Creation; “eight,” these are the eight days circumcision. Rabbi Yehoshua says: “Seven,” these are the seven days of Passover; “eight,” these are the eight days of the festival And when it says: “And also,” to include; Shavuot , and Rosh HaShana, and Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: Challenger: "Give a portion to seven and also to eight." Rabbi Eliezer says: "Seven" - these are the seven days of Creation, "eight" - these are the eight days of circumcision. Rabbi Yehoshua says: "Seven" - these are the seven days of Passover, "eight" - these are the eight days of the festival. And when he says "and also" - to include Shavuot, Rosh Hashanah, and Yom Kippur.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו לִזְמַן? לֹא, לִבְרָכָה.
human_translation: What, is not to time? No, to the blessing
llm_translation: What is "lav lizman"? Not for a blessing.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ לִזְמַן — זְמַן כׇּל שִׁבְעָה מִי אִיכָּא? הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא: דְּאִי לָא מְבָרֵךְ הָאִידָּנָא — מְבָרֵךְ לִמְחַר וּלְיוֹם אוּחְרָא.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable as if it would enter your mind to time, is there time all seven This is not difficult, that if he does not recite the blessing now, he recites tomorrow or the following day,
llm_translation: Thus it was explained: for if it occurs to you to invite — is there any time during the entire week? This is not difficult: for if one did not bless now — one blesses for tomorrow and the following day.

hebrew_text: מִכׇּל מָקוֹם — בָּעִינַן כּוֹס? לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַב נַחְמָן. דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: זְמַן אוֹמְרוֹ אֲפִילּוּ בַּשּׁוּק. הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא, דְּאִיקְּלַע לֵיהּ כּוֹס.
human_translation: In any case, we require a cup Let us say supports Rav Naḥman, as Rav Naḥman said: time may be recited even in the market, This is not difficult, he happened to have a cup;
llm_translation: From every place — do we require a cup? Let us say it supports the statement of Rav Nachman. For Rav Nachman said: The time for saying it is even in the marketplace. This is not difficult, as a cup was brought to him.

hebrew_text: הָתִינַח עֲצֶרֶת וְרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים הֵיכִי עָבֵיד? אִי מְבָרֵךְ עֲלֵיהּ וְשָׁתֵי לֵיהּ — כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר זְמַן, קַבְּלֵיהּ עֲלֵיהּ וַאֲסִר לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Granted, Shavuot and Rosh HaShana; what does one do on Yom Kippur? If he should recite the blessing and drink it, Since he recited time, he accepted upon himself, and caused to be prohibited to himself
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: If one made a conditional vow on Shavuot and Rosh Hashanah, how should he act on Yom Kippur? If he recites a blessing over it and drinks it - since he specified a time, he should accept it upon himself and prohibit it to himself.

hebrew_text: דְּהָאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא לְרַב: מִי בָּדְלַתְּ? וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, בָּדֵילְנָא.
human_translation: As didn’t Rav Yirmeya bar Abba say to Rav, Have you abstain And he said to him: Yes, I have abstain
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "דְּהָאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא לְרַב: מִי בָּדְלַתְּ? וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, בָּדֵילְנָא." English translation: "For Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said to Rav: 'Did you separate?' And he said to him: 'No, we have separated.'"

hebrew_text: לִבְרוֹךְ עֲלֵיהּ וְלַנְּחֵיהּ — הַמְבָרֵךְ צָרִיךְ שֶׁיִּטְעוֹם! לִיתְּבֵיהּ לְיָנוֹקָא — לֵית הִלְכְתָא כְּרַב אַחָא, דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְמִסְרַךְ.
human_translation: he should recite the blessing over and leave it one who recites a blessing must taste that he should give it to a child, the halakha is not in accordance with Rav Aḥa, perhaps will come to be drawn after
llm_translation: "Blessed upon it and upon its owners — one who blesses needs to taste it! To sit with a child — do not walk like Rav Acha, lest you come to neglect."

hebrew_text: מַאי הָוֵי עֲלַהּ? שַׁדְּרוּהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַב יֵימַר סָבָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא בְּמַעֲלֵי יוֹמָא דְּרֵישׁ שַׁתָּא, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: זִיל חֲזִי הֵיכִי עָבֵיד עוֹבָדָא, תָּא אֵימָא לַן. כִּי חַזְיֵיהּ אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דַּלְיוּהּ לִרְטִיבָה רָפְסָא לֵיהּ בְּדוּכְתֵּיהּ. אַיְיתוֹ לֵיהּ כָּסָא דְחַמְרָא, קַדֵּישׁ וַאֲמַר זְמַן.
human_translation: What was about this The Sages sent Rav Yeimar the Elder before Rav Ḥisda on the eve of Rosh HaShana. They said to him: Go, see how he acts come tell us. When saw he said to him One who picks up a moist log, something on the spot. They brought him a cup of wine, and he recited kiddush and time.
llm_translation: What was the matter with him? The Rabbis sent to Rav Yeimar the Elder who was standing before Rav Chisda on the eve of Shabbat. They said to him: Go and see how he performs the work, come and tell us. When he saw him, he said to him: Pour water for him to wash his hands. They brought him a cup of wine, he sanctified and said the blessing.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא: אוֹמֵר זְמַן בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים. וְהִלְכְתָא: זְמַן — אוֹמְרוֹ אֲפִילּוּ בַּשּׁוּק.
human_translation: The halakha one recites time on Rosh HaShana and on Yom Kippur, the halakha one may recite time even in the market,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And the halakha: one says the time on Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippur. And the halakha: the time - one says it even in the marketplace." I hope this translation is helpful to you.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבָּה, כִּי הֲוֵינַן בֵּי רַב הוּנָא אִיבַּעְיָא לַן: בַּר בֵּי רַב דְּיָתֵיב בְּתַעֲנִיתָא בְּמַעֲלֵי שַׁבְּתָא, מַהוּ לְאַשְׁלוֹמֵי? לָא הֲוָה בִּידֵיהּ. אֲתַאי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה וְלָא הֲוָה בִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: And Rabba said: When we were in the house of Rav Huna, we raised the dilemma: A student in his master’s house who is fasting on Shabbat eve, what is to complete did not have at hand. I came before Rav Yehuda, and he did not have at hand.
llm_translation: Rabba said, "When we were in the study hall of Rav Huna, a question was posed to us: Bar, son of Rav, was sitting in a fast on the eve of Shabbat, what should he do for his repayment? It was not in his hands. He came before Rav Yehuda, and it was not in his hands."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: נֶחְזְיֵיהּ אֲנַן, דְּתַנְיָא: תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת
human_translation: Rava said: Let us look As it was taught the Ninth of Av that occurs on Shabbat,
llm_translation: Rava said: Let us see, for it was taught: The ninth of Av that falls on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן עֶרֶב תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת, אוֹכֵל וְשׁוֹתֶה כׇּל צָרְכּוֹ, וּמַעֲלֶה עַל שׁוּלְחָנוֹ אֲפִילּוּ כִּסְעוּדַת שְׁלֹמֹה בִּשְׁעָתוֹ. חָל לִהְיוֹת תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — מְבִיאִין לוֹ כְּבֵיצָה וְאוֹכֵל, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִכָּנֵס לַשַּׁבָּת כְּשֶׁהוּא מְעוּנֶּה.
human_translation: and so too, the eve of the Ninth of Av that occurs on Shabbat, he may eat and drink as much as he requires and bring to his table a meal even like that of Solomon in his time. the Ninth of Av occurs on Shabbat eve, bring him an egg-bulk and he eats so that he not enter Shabbat in a state of affliction.
llm_translation: And so, on the eve of the ninth of Av that falls on Shabbat, one may eat and drink to his full satisfaction, and he may even set his table as a feast of Solomon in its time. If the ninth of Av falls on the eve of Shabbat, one should bring him an egg to eat, so that he should not enter into Shabbat while hungry.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: פַּעַם אַחַת הָיִינוּ יוֹשְׁבִין לִפְנֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, וְתִשְׁעָה בְּאָב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת הָיָה. וְהֵבִיאוּ לוֹ בֵּיצָה מְגוּלְגֶּלֶת, וּגְמָעָהּ בְּלֹא מֶלַח. וְלֹא שֶׁהָיָה תָּאֵב לָהּ, אֶלָּא לְהַרְאוֹת לַתַּלְמִידִים הֲלָכָה.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Yehuda said: We were once sitting before Rabbi Akiva, and it was the Ninth of Av that occurs on Shabbat eve, and they brought him a slightly cooked egg, and he swallowed it without salt. And it was not that he desired it rather, to show the students halakha
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said: Once we were sitting before Rabbi Akiva, and it was the ninth of Av which fell on Erev Shabbat. They brought him a peeled egg, and he dipped it in salt. He did not desire it, but rather to show the students the halakha.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מִתְעַנֶּה וּמַשְׁלִים. אָמַר לָהֶן רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אִי אַתֶּם מוֹדִים לִי בְּתִשְׁעָה בְּאָב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּאֶחָד בַּשַּׁבָּת, שֶׁמַּפְסִיק מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֲבָל. אָמַר לָהֶם: מַה לִּי לִיכָּנֵס בָּהּ כְּשֶׁהוּא מְעוּנֶּה, מַה לִּי לָצֵאת מִמֶּנָּה כְּשֶׁהוּא מְעוּנֶּה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei says: He must fast and complete Rabbi Yosei said to Don’t you agree with me with regard to the Ninth of Av that occurs on Sunday, that one must stop while it is still day? They said to him: Indeed, said to them: What to me between entering in a state of affliction and leaving in a state of affliction?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: One should fast and complete. Rabbi Yosei said to them: If you admit to me that the ninth of Av falls on a Sunday, which interrupts the mourning period in the middle of the day, they said to him: But. He said to them: What do I have to enter it the fast when it is forbidden, what do I have to leave it when it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אִם אָמַרְתָּ לָצֵאת מִמֶּנָּה — שֶׁהֲרֵי אָכַל וְשָׁתָה כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ, תֹּאמַר לִיכָּנֵס בָּהּ כְּשֶׁהוּא מְעוּנֶּה, שֶׁלֹּא אָכַל וְשָׁתָה כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: They said to him: If you said leave because he ate and drank the entire day you say to enter in a state of affliction, he has not eaten or drunk the entire day?
llm_translation: They said to him: If you say to leave it - for he has eaten and drunk the entire day, you should say to enter it when he is fasting, for he has not eaten and drunk the entire day.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר עוּלָּא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. וּמִי עָבְדִינַן כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי? וּרְמִינְהִי: אֵין גּוֹזְרִין תַּעֲנִית עַל הַצִּיבּוּר בְּרָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים, בַּחֲנוּכָּה וּבְפוּרִים. וְאִם הִתְחִילוּ — אֵין מַפְסִיקִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אֵין מַפְסִיקִין, מוֹדֶה הָיָה שֶׁאֵין מַשְׁלִימִין, וְכֵן בְּתִשְׁעָה בְּאָב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: And Ulla said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, Do we act in accordance with Rabbi Yosei? And raises a contradiction We do not decree a fast upon the public on the New Moon, Hanukkah, or Purim, and if had begun they do not interrupt the statement of Rabban Gamliel. Rabbi Meir said: Even though Rabban Gamliel said they do not interrupt he conceded that they do not complete and so too, on the Ninth of Av that occurs on Shabbat eve
llm_translation: And Ula said: The halakha is like Rabbi Yosei. And who follows the opinion of Rabbi Yosei? And it was asked: Do we not decree a fast for the community at the beginning of the months, on Chanukah, and on Purim? And if they began, we do not interrupt, the words of Rabban Gamliel. Rabbi Meir said: Even though Rabban Gamliel said we do not interrupt, he agreed that we do not make up the fast, and so too on the ninth of Av that falls on Erev Shabbat.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא: לְאַחַר פְּטִירָתוֹ שֶׁל רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, נִכְנַס רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְהָפֵר אֶת דְּבָרָיו. עָמַד רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי עַל רַגְלָיו וְאָמַר: חָזֵי אֲנָא דְּבָתַר רֵישָׁא גּוּפָא אָזֵיל. כׇּל יָמָיו שֶׁל רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל קָבַעְנוּ הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ, עַכְשָׁיו אַתָּה מְבַקֵּשׁ לְבַטֵּל דְּבָרָיו?! יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לְךָ, שֶׁכְּבָר נִקְבְּעָה הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וְלֹא הָיָה אָדָם שֶׁעִרְעֵר בַּדָּבָר כְּלוּם.
human_translation: And it was taught Following the death of Rabban Gamliel, Rabbi Yehoshua entered to annul statement Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri stood on his feet and said: I see that the body must follow the head, All of Rabban Gamliel’s life we established the halakha in accordance with his now you seek to annul his statement? Yehoshua, we do not listen to you, as the halakha has already been established in accordance with Rabban Gamliel. And there was no one who disputed this statement in any way.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in a Baraita: After the passing of Rabban Gamliel, Rabbi Yehoshua came to annul his words. Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri stood on his feet and said: "I see that after the head has been cut off, the body goes." All the days of Rabban Gamliel, we established the halakha like him, and now you seek to annul his words?! Yehoshua, we do not listen to you, for the halakha has already been established like Rabban Gamliel, and no one has ever disagreed with it.

hebrew_text: בְּדוֹרוֹ שֶׁל רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל עֲבוּד כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, בְּדוֹרוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי עֲבוּד כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: in the generation of Rabban Gamliel they acted in accordance with Rabban Gamliel, in the generation of Rabbi Yosei they acted in accordance with Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: In the generation of Rabban Gamliel, they served like Rabban Gamliel; in the generation of Rabbi Yosei, they served like Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: וּבְדוֹרוֹ שֶׁל רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל עֲבוּד כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל? וְהָתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר (בֶּן) צָדוֹק: אֲנִי (הָיִיתִי) מִבְּנֵי סְנָאָב בֶּן בִּנְיָמִין. פַּעַם אַחַת חָל תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת, וּדְחִינוּהוּ לְאַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת, וְהִתְעַנִּינוּ בּוֹ, וְלֹא הִשְׁלַמְנוּהוּ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיּוֹם טוֹב שֶׁלָּנוּ הָיָה. טַעְמָא דְּיוֹם טוֹב, הָא עֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב — מַשְׁלִימִין!
human_translation: And in the generation of Rabban Gamliel they acted in accordance with Rabban Gamliel? Wasn’t it taught Rabbi Elazar ben Tzadok, said: I am a descendant of Sena’av ben Binyamin, One time, the Ninth of Av occurred on Shabbat, and we postponed it until after Shabbat, and we fasted on but did not complete because was our Festival. the reason a Festival but the eve of a Festival, they complete it.
llm_translation: In his generation, was Rabban Gamliel's service like Rabban Gamliel's? And it was taught: Rabbi Elazar (son of) Zadok said: I (was) from the sons of Sinaav ben Binyamin. Once, the ninth of Av fell on Shabbat, and we postponed it to after Shabbat, and we fasted on it, and we did not complete it, because it was our festival day. The reason for the festival day is that if the eve of a festival day falls on a Sabbath, we complete (the fast).

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: שָׁאנֵי יוֹם טוֹב שֶׁל דִּבְרֵיהֶם, מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁמִּתְעַנִּין בּוֹ שָׁעוֹת — מַשְׁלִימִין בּוֹ עַרְבִיּוֹת. שַׁבָּת, הוֹאִיל וְאֵין מִתְעַנִּין בָּהּ שָׁעוֹת — אֵין מַשְׁלִימִין בָּהּ עַרְבִיּוֹת.
human_translation: Ravina said A rabbinic Festival is different, Since one may fast on hours, one completes evening. Shabbat, since one may not fast on it hours, one does not complete
llm_translation: Ravina said: The difference of their festival day, because they fast during it for hours - they complete it with evenings. Shabbat, since they do not fast during it for hours - they do not complete it with evenings.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לָא שְׁמִיעַ לִי הָא שְׁמַעְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אַתְּ אֲמַרְתְּ נִיהֲלַן, וְאַהָא אֲמַרְתְּ נִיהֲלַן: אֵין גּוֹזְרִין תַּעֲנִית עַל הַצִּבּוּר בְּרָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים וְכוּ׳, וְאָמְרִינַן עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מִתְעַנֶּה וּמַשְׁלִים.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: I did not hear this ruling Abaye, said to him: You told us and with regard to this you told to us, We do not decree a fast upon the public on the New Moon, And we said with regard to Rav Yehuda said Rav said: This is the statement that Rabbi Meir said in the name of Rabban Gamliel. But the Rabbis say: One must fast and complete
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: "I did not hear this teaching." Abaye said to him: "Did you say we should fast, and now you say we should not fast? We do not decree a communal fast on Rosh Chodesh and so forth, and we say 'Alah.'" Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: "This is the opinion of Rabbi Meir, who said in the name of Rabban Gamliel, but the sages say: one should fast and complete."

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, אַכּוּלְּהוּ? לָא, אַחֲנוּכָּה וּפוּרִים.
human_translation: What? not to all No, to Hanukkah and Purim,
llm_translation: What is the reason for the custom of eating dairy foods on Shavuot? Is it because they ate the Torah on that day? No, it is because of Chanukah and Purim.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא,
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: "Hakhi namei mistabera,"

hebrew_text: דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ אַכּוּלְּהוּ — הָא בָּעֵי מִינֵּיהּ רַבָּה מֵרַב יְהוּדָה וְלָא פְּשַׁט לֵיהּ!
human_translation: as, if it should enter your mind to all Didn’t Rabba raise a dilemma before Rav Yehuda and he did not answer him?
llm_translation: If your mind is inclined to eat it - this requires a greater analysis from Rav Yehudah, and it is not resolved!

hebrew_text: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, הָא דְּדָרֵשׁ מָר זוּטְרָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא: הֲלָכָה, מִתְעַנֶּה וּמַשְׁלִים. הָא בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבָּה מֵרַב הוּנָא וְלָא פְּשַׁט לֵיהּ?!
human_translation: And according to your opinion, that Mar Zutra expounded in the name of Rav Huna: halakha one fasts and completes Didn’t Rabba raise dilemma before Rav Huna, and he did not answer him?
llm_translation: And according to your reasoning, this that Master Zutra expounded in the name of Rav Huna: Halacha, one fasts and completes. This Rabba asked Rav Huna about it, and it did not satisfy him?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: הָא — מִקַּמֵּי דְּשַׁמְעַהּ, וְהָא — לְבָתַר דְּשַׁמְעַהּ, הָכָא נָמֵי: הָא — מִקַּמֵּי דְּשַׁמְעַהּ, הָא — לְבָתַר דְּשַׁמְעַהּ.
human_translation: Rather, this before heard this, after he heard Here, too, this before heard this, after he heard it.
llm_translation: Rather: here - before she heard, and here - after she heard, here too: here - before she heard, here - after she heard.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ מָר זוּטְרָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא: הֲלָכָה, מִתְעַנִּין וּמַשְׁלִימִין.
human_translation: Mar Zutra expounded in the name of Rav Huna: halakha one fasts and completes
llm_translation: Mar Zutra in the name of Rav Huna expounded: Halacha, we fast and complete.

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ בַּכֹּל מְעָרְבִין
llm_translation: We will return to you in everything, we mix.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁהוֹצִיאוּהוּ נׇכְרִים, אוֹ רוּחַ רָעָה — אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: one whom gentiles took him out or an evil spirit has only four cubits
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: one who was taken out by gentiles, or by an evil spirit - he has only four cubits.

hebrew_text: הֶחְזִירוּהוּ — כְּאִילּוּ לֹא יָצָא.
human_translation: returned him, it is as though he had never left
llm_translation: Return it - as if it had not gone out.

hebrew_text: הוֹלִיכוּהוּ לְעִיר אַחֶרֶת, נְתָנוּהוּ בְּדִיר אוֹ בְּסַהַר, רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה אוֹמְרִים: מְהַלֵּךְ אֶת כּוּלָּהּ. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמְרִים: אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: brought him to a different city put him into a pen or a stable, Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya say: He may walk the entire Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Akiva say: He has only four cubits
llm_translation: They brought him to another city, they placed him in a chamber or in a prison, Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah say: "He walks her entirely." Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Akiva say: "He only has four cubits."

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁבָּאוּ מִפְּלַנְדַּרְסִין, וְהִפְלִיגָה סְפִינָתָם בַּיָּם. רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה הָלְכוּ אֶת כּוּלָּהּ, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לֹא זָזוּ מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, שֶׁרָצוּ לְהַחֲמִיר עַל עַצְמָן.
human_translation: an incident where were coming from Pelandarsin, and their boat set sail on the sea Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya walked the entire Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Akiva did not move beyond four cubits, as they sought to be stringent with themselves.
llm_translation: The incident that occurred with the men from P'landarsin, and their ship was in distress at sea. Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah went to the full extent to help, but Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Akiva did not move from four cubits, as they sought to be stringent upon themselves.

hebrew_text: פַּעַם אַחַת לֹא נִכְנְסוּ לַנָּמָל עַד שֶׁחָשֵׁיכָה, אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: מָה אָנוּ לֵירֵד?
human_translation: one occasion, they did not enter the port [ namel ] until after nightfall said to Rabban Gamliel: What alighting
llm_translation: Once they did not enter the chamber of the locust until it became dark, they said to Rabban Gamliel: "What are we to descend?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם: מוּתָּרִים אַתֶּם, שֶׁכְּבָר הָיִיתִי מִסְתַּכֵּל וְהָיִינוּ בְּתוֹךְ הַתְּחוּם עַד שֶׁלֹּא חָשֵׁיכָה.
human_translation: He said to them: You are permitted as I was watching, and we were within the limit before nightfall.
llm_translation: He said to them: "You are permitted, for I had already been looking and we were within the boundary until it became dark."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים מַעֲבִירִין אֶת הָאָדָם עַל דַּעְתּוֹ וְעַל דַּעַת קוֹנוֹ, אֵלּוּ הֵן: נׇכְרִים, וְרוּחַ רָעָה, וְדִקְדּוּקֵי עֲנִיּוּת.
human_translation: the Sages taught: Three matters cause a person to act against his will and the will of his Maker, they are: Gentiles, and an evil spirit, and the depths of poverty.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Three things cause a person to lose his understanding, both his own and that of his Creator. These are: foreigners, an evil spirit, and the details of poverty.

hebrew_text: לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְמִיבְעֵי רַחֲמֵי עֲלַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: What is the difference to request mercy for
llm_translation: For what does it come out from her? To bring mercy upon them.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה אֵין רוֹאִין פְּנֵי גֵיהִנָּם, אֵלּוּ הֵן: דִּקְדּוּקֵי עֲנִיּוּת, וְחוֹלֵי מֵעַיִין, וְהָרְשׁוּת. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אִשָּׁה רָעָה.
human_translation: Three do not see the face of Gehenna, they are: the depths of poverty, with intestinal disease, and creditors. And some say: Even one who has an evil wife
llm_translation: Three not see face of Gehinnom, these are: precise of poverty, and sick of intestines, and permission. And some say: also one who has a bad wife.

hebrew_text: וְאִידָּךְ? אִשָּׁה רָעָה מִצְוָה לְגָרְשָׁהּ.
human_translation: And the other it is a mitzva to divorce an evil wife.
llm_translation: And the other opinion? A bad woman, it is a commandment to divorce her.

hebrew_text: וְאִידָּךְ? זִימְנִין דִּכְתוּבָּתָהּ מְרוּבָּה. אִי נָמֵי, אִית לֵיהּ בָּנִים מִינַּהּ, וְלָא מָצֵי מְגָרֵשׁ לַהּ.
human_translation: And the other Sometimes her marriage contract is large, Alternatively, he has children from her, and cannot divorce her.
llm_translation: And the other? Sometimes its writing is more abundant. If so, it has children from her, and he cannot divorce her.

hebrew_text: לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְקַבּוֹלֵי מֵאַהֲבָה.
human_translation: What is the difference to accept with love,
llm_translation: For what does it come out? For the sake of receiving out of love.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה מֵתִין כְּשֶׁהֵן מְסַפְּרִין, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: חוֹלִי מֵעַיִין, וְחַיָּה, וְהִדְרוֹקָן.
human_translation: Three die while conversing and they are: Those with intestinal sickness, and a woman in childbirth, and edema [ hidrokan ].
llm_translation: Three who are considered as if they are telling their own status, and these are: one with a stomach ailment, a wild animal, and a porcupine.

hebrew_text: לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ: לְמַשְׁמוֹשֵׁי בְּהוּ זְוַודְתָּא.
human_translation: What is the difference to prepare shrouds for them,
llm_translation: For what does it come out? To use it for the purpose of a candle.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: יָצָא לְדַעַת — אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת. פְּשִׁיטָא, הַשְׁתָּא מִי שֶׁהוֹצִיאוּהוּ נׇכְרִים אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, יָצָא לְדַעַת מִיבַּעְיָא?!
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said: If one knowingly went out he has only four cubits obvious. Now, one whom gentiles took out he has only four cubits, one who knowingly went out, is it necessary
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: If he went out with intent - he only has four cubits. It is obvious, now, if non-Jews took him out, he only has four cubits. If he went out with intent, what is the question?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֵימָא: חָזַר לְדַעַת — אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: Rather, say he returned knowingly he has only four cubits
llm_translation: Rather say: he reconsidered — he only has four cubits.

hebrew_text: הָא נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: הֶחְזִירוּהוּ נׇכְרִים כְּאִילּוּ לֹא יָצָא. הֶחְזִירוּהוּ הוּא דִּכְאִילּוּ לֹא יָצָא, אֲבָל הוֹצִיאוּהוּ נׇכְרִים וְחָזַר לְדַעַת — אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת!
human_translation: This, too, we learned returned him it is as though he had never left it is returned him that it is as though he never left However, if gentiles took him out, and returned knowingly has only four cubits
llm_translation: The Gemara teaches: If the non-Jews returned it, it is as if it had not been taken out. If he himself returned it, it is as if it had not been taken out. But if the non-Jews took it out and he changed his mind — he only has four cubits!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֵימָא, יָצָא לְדַעַת וְהֶחְזִירוּהוּ נׇכְרִים — אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: Rather, say he knowingly went out and was returned by gentiles he has only four cubits
llm_translation: Rather say, he went out of his mind, and the gentiles restored him - he has only four cubits.

hebrew_text: הָא נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: הוֹצִיאוּהוּ וְהֶחְזִירוּהוּ כְּאִילּוּ לֹא יָצָא. הוֹצִיאוּהוּ וְהֶחְזִירוּהוּ — הוּא דִּכְאִילּוּ לֹא יָצָא, אֲבָל יָצָא לְדַעַת — לָא!
human_translation: This, too, we learned from took him out and returned him, it is as though he never left. it is took him out and returned him it is as though he never left However, if he knowingly went out, no,
llm_translation: The Gemara teaches: If they took him out and brought him back in, it is as though he had not gone out. If they took him out and brought him back in - that is as though he had not gone out, but if he went out intentionally - no!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא, לִצְדָדִין קָתָנֵי: מִי שֶׁהוֹצִיאוּהוּ נׇכְרִים וְחָזַר לְדַעַת — אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, אֲבָל יָצָא לְדַעַת וְהֶחְזִירוּהוּ נׇכְרִים — כְּאִילּוּ לֹא יָצָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: lest you say it is teaching disjunctively, One who was taken out by gentiles and returned knowingly has only four cubits But if he knowingly went out and was returned by gentiles, it is as though he had never left, teaches us
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: What is the reasoning for the opinion of the smaller group? If foreigners took him out and then he returned of his own accord - he only has four cubits. But if he went out of his own accord and then the foreigners returned him - it is as if he did not go out, this is what they are teaching us.

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַבָּה: הוּצְרַךְ לִנְקָבָיו מַהוּ? אָמַר לָהֶם: גָּדוֹל כְּבוֹד הַבְּרִיּוֹת שֶׁדּוֹחֶה אֶת לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: They raised a dilemma before Rabba: needed to relieve himself what is He said to them: great human dignity, which supersedes a negative precept of the Torah,
llm_translation: He sought from Rabah: Is it necessary to pierce his nostrils? He said to them: Great is the honor of creatures that overrides the prohibition of "you shall not do" in the Torah.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי נְהַרְדָּעֵי: אִי פִּיקֵּחַ הוּא עָיֵיל לִתְחוּמָא, וְכֵיוָן דְּעָל — עָל.
human_translation: of Neharde’a said: If is clever, he will enter and since he enter he entered,
llm_translation: The scholars of Nehardea said: If he took hold, he may walk to the boundary, and once he has ascended — he may.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: פֵּירוֹת שֶׁיָּצְאוּ חוּץ לַתְּחוּם וְחָזְרוּ, אֲפִילּוּ בְּמֵזִיד — לֹא הִפְסִידוּ אֶת מְקוֹמָן. מַאי טַעְמָא? אֲנוּסִין נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: produce that was taken out beyond the limit and was returned, even if intentionally, has not lost its place; What is the reason due to circumstances beyond its control.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Fruits that went out beyond the boundary and returned, even intentionally - they did not lose their place. What is the reason? They are considered as compelled.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר שְׁמַעְיָה לְרַב פָּפָּא: רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמְרִים: לְעוֹלָם אֲסוּרִין, עַד שֶׁיַּחְזְרוּ לִמְקוֹמָן שׁוֹגְגִין. בְּשׁוֹגֵג אִין, בְּמֵזִיד לָא!
human_translation: Rav Yosef bar Shemaya raised an objection to Rav Pappa Rabbi Neḥemya and Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov say: is actually prohibited unless it was returned to its place unwittingly. unwittingly, yes, intentionally, not.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Rav Yosef bar Shemaya against Rav Papa: Rabbi Nechemiah and Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov say: They are always forbidden until they return to their place unintentionally. If it is unintentional, it is not considered a sin, but if it is intentional, it is.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: פֵּירוֹת שֶׁיָּצְאוּ חוּץ לַתְּחוּם, בְּשׁוֹגֵג — יֵאָכֵלוּ, בְּמֵזִיד — לֹא יֵאָכֵלוּ.
human_translation: is the tanna’im , as it was taught produce that was taken out beyond the limit, unwittingly, it may be eaten; intentionally, it may not be eaten.
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: Fruits that went out beyond the boundary, if unintentional — they may be eaten, if intentional — they may not be eaten.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר: בִּמְקוֹמָן — יֵאָכֵלוּ, שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹמָן — לֹא יֵאָכֵלוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Neḥemya says: in its place, it may be eaten; not in its place, it may not be eaten.
llm_translation: Rabbi Nechemiah says: In their place - they may be eaten, not in their place - they may not be eaten.

hebrew_text: מַאי בִּמְקוֹמָן? אִילֵּימָא: בִּמְקוֹמָן — בְּמֵזִיד, וְהָא קָתָנֵי בְּהֶדְיָא, רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמְרִים: לְעוֹלָם אֲסוּרִין עַד שֶׁיַּחְזְרוּ לִמְקוֹמָן שׁוֹגְגִין. בְּשׁוֹגֵג — אִין, בְּמֵזִיד — לָא.
human_translation: What is In its place? If you say its place intentionally, as it was explicitly taught Rabbi Neḥemya and Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov say: is actually prohibited unless it was returned to its place unwittingly. unwittingly indeed intentionally, not
llm_translation: What is meant by "in their place"? If you say "in their place" — intentionally. But this is what Rabbi Neḥemyah and Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov taught: They are always forbidden until they return to their place unintentionally. If it was unintentional — no, if it was intentional — yes.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו: בִּמְקוֹמָן — בְּשׁוֹגֵג, וְחַסּוֹרֵי מְחַסְּרָא, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: פֵּירוֹת שֶׁיָּצְאוּ חוּץ לַתְּחוּם, בְּשׁוֹגֵג — יֵאָכֵלוּ, בְּמֵזִיד — לֹא יֵאָכֵלוּ.
human_translation: Rather, not to its place unwittingly, and is incomplete and it teaches the following: produce that was taken out beyond the limit, unwittingly, it may be eaten; intentionally, it may not be eaten.
llm_translation: Rather, no: in their place — unintentionally, and lacking awareness, and thus it was taught: fruits that went out beyond the boundary, unintentionally — may be eaten, intentionally — may not be eaten.

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹמָן, אֲבָל בִּמְקוֹמָן — אֲפִילּוּ בְּמֵזִיד יֵאָכֵלוּ. וַאֲתָא רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה לְמֵימַר: אֲפִילּוּ בִּמְקוֹמָן נָמֵי, בְּשׁוֹגֵג — אִין, בְּמֵזִיד — לָא.
human_translation: In what is this statement said? not in its place, But in its place, even intentionally, it may be eaten. And Rabbi Neḥemya came to say: Even in its place, unwittingly, yes, intentionally, not.
llm_translation: In what case are these words spoken? Not in their place, but in their place - even intentionally they may be eaten. And Rabbi Nechemyah came to say: Even in their place, if unintentional - no, if intentional - yes.

hebrew_text: לָא, בְּמֵזִיד בִּמְקוֹמָן — דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּאָסוּר, וְהָכָא בְּשׁוֹגֵג שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹמָן פְּלִיגִי: תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר בְּשׁוֹגֵג שְׁרֵי שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹמָן, וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה סָבַר אֲפִילּוּ שׁוֹגֵג, בִּמְקוֹמָן — אִין, שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹמָן — לָא.
human_translation: No, intentionally to its place, everyone agrees, it is forbidden. However, here they disagree with regard to unwittingly not in its place. The first tanna holds unwittingly, it is permitted not in its place. Rabbi Neḥemya holds even unwittingly, to its place, is to its place, not
llm_translation: Not, intentionally, in their place — everyone agrees it is prohibited, and here in error, not in their place they disagree: The first Tanna holds that in error is permitted not in their place, and Rabbi Nechemiah holds that even in error, in their place — no, not in their place — yes.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמְרִים: לְעוֹלָם אֲסוּרִין עַד שֶׁיַּחְזְרוּ לִמְקוֹמָן שׁוֹגְגִין, שׁוֹגֵג — אִין, בְּמֵזִיד — לָא, מִכְּלָל דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: בְּמֵזִיד נָמֵי שְׁרֵי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: However, since the latter clause teaches Rabbi Neḥemya and Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov say: Actually, is prohibited, unless it was returned to its place unwittingly, unwittingly indeed intentionally, not by inference, the first tanna holds intentionally, it is also permitted. learn from here
llm_translation: The Gemara continues: Rabbi Neḥemya and Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov say: They are always prohibited until they return to their place unintentionally. If it was unintentional — yes, if it was intentional — no. From the fact that the first tanna taught this, it is apparent that he holds: Even if it was intentional, it is permitted. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הָיָה מְהַלֵּךְ וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ תְּחוּם שַׁבָּת, מְהַלֵּךְ אַלְפַּיִם פְּסִיעוֹת בֵּינוֹנִיּוֹת, וְזוֹ הִיא תְּחוּם שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said: one was walking and does not know the Shabbat limit he may take two thousand medium strides and this is the Shabbat limit,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: If one was walking and does not know the boundary of Shabbat, he should walk two thousand medium steps, and that is the boundary of Shabbat.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שָׁבַת בְּבִקְעָה, וְהִקִּיפוּהָ נׇכְרִים מְחִיצָה בְּשַׁבָּת — מְהַלֵּךְ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה, וּמְטַלְטֵל בְּכוּלָּהּ עַל יְדֵי זְרִיקָה.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said: one established residence in a valley, and gentiles surrounded with a partition on Shabbat, he may walk two thousand cubits he may carry in the entire by means of throwing,
llm_translation: And Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: If one forgot an object in a valley on Shabbat, and non-Jews surrounded it with a partition on Shabbat - he may walk two thousand cubits, and may carry the entire object through throwing.

hebrew_text: וְרַב הוּנָא אָמַר: מְהַלֵּךְ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה, וּמְטַלְטֵל אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת. וְנִיטַּלְטֵל בְּכוּלַּהּ עַל יְדֵי זְרִיקָה?
human_translation: Rav Huna said: He may walk two thousand cubits; he may carry four cubits, And let him carry in the entire by means of throwing.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: One may walk two thousand cubits, and carry four cubits. And may one carry the entire distance through throwing?

hebrew_text: שֶׁמָּא יִמָּשֵׁךְ אַחַר חֶפְצוֹ.
human_translation: lest he be drawn after his object.
llm_translation: Perhaps he will be drawn after his desire.

hebrew_text: בְּאַלְפַּיִם מִיהַת לִיטַלְטֵל כִּי אוֹרְחֵיהּ!
human_translation: Within two thousand at any rate, let him carry in his usual manner.
llm_translation: In two thousand from the beginning to idle for its travelers!

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵי כִּמְחִיצָה שֶׁנִּפְרְצָה בִּמְלוֹאָהּ לְמָקוֹם הָאָסוּר לָהּ.
human_translation: because this is similar a partition that is breached in its entirety, to a place into which it is prohibited
llm_translation: Because it is like a partition that was breached in its fullness to a place where it is forbidden to it.

hebrew_text: חִיָּיא בַּר רַב אָמַר: מְהַלֵּךְ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה, וּמְטַלְטֵל בְּאַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה. כְּמַאן? דְּלָא כְּרַב נַחְמָן וְלָא כְּרַב הוּנָא!
human_translation: Ḥiyya bar Rav said: he may walk two thousand cubits, and he may carry within two thousand cubits. In accordance with whose neither in accordance with Rav Naḥman, nor in accordance with Rav Huna,
llm_translation: Chiya bar Rav said: Walking two thousand cubits, and carrying within two thousand cubits. According to whom? Not like Rav Nachman and not like Rav Huna!

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: מְטַלְטֵל בְּאַרְבַּע. אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ דְּרַב הוּנָא. אֵימָא: וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר רַב.
human_translation: Read He may carry four If so, this is of Rav Huna. Read And similarly, Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Rav said.
llm_translation: אֵימָא: - Mother: מְטַלְטֵל - carries בְּאַרְבַּע - four. אִי - If הָכִי, - so, הַיְינוּ - that is דְּרַב הוּנָא - Rav Huna. אֵימָא: - Mother: וְכֵן - and so אָמַר - said רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר רַב - Rabbi Hiyya bar Rav.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן לְרַב הוּנָא: לָא תִּיפְלוֹג עֲלֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּתַנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ. דְּתַנְיָא:
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to Rav Huna: Do not argue with of Shmuel as it was taught in accordance with his As it was taught
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Nachman to Rav Huna: Do not argue with Shmuel, as it is taught in accordance with his opinion. As it is taught:

hebrew_text: הָיָה מוֹדֵד וּבָא, וְכָלְתָה מִדָּתוֹ בַּחֲצִי הָעִיר — מוּתָּר לְטַלְטֵל בְּכׇל הָעִיר כּוּלָּהּ, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יַעֲבוֹר אֶת הַתְּחוּם בְּרַגְלָיו. מַאי מְטַלְטֵל, לָאו עַל יְדֵי זְרִיקָה?
human_translation: was measuring and his measuring ended in the middle of the city, he is permitted to carry throughout the city, provided that he does not overstep the limit by foot, how can he carry not by means of throwing?
llm_translation: He was measuring and came, and his measure ended in the middle of the city - he is permitted to carry throughout the entire city, as long as he does not pass beyond the boundary with his feet. What is meant by "carrying"? Is it not by way of throwing?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לָא, עַל יְדֵי מְשִׁיכָה.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: No, by means of pulling,
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: No, through pulling.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הָיָה מוֹדֵד וּבָא, וְכָלְתָה מִדָּתוֹ בַּחֲצִי חָצֵר — אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא חֲצִי חָצֵר.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: was measuring and his measuring ended in the middle of a courtyard, he has only half the courtyard
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: If one was measuring and came, and his measurement ended in the middle of the courtyard - he only has half the courtyard.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! אֵימָא: יֵשׁ לוֹ חֲצִי חָצֵר.
human_translation: obvious Read He has half a courtyard,
llm_translation: It is obvious! Say: he has half a courtyard.

hebrew_text: הַאי נָמֵי פְּשִׁיטָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא אָתֵי לְטַלְטוֹלֵי בְּכוּלַּהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: this too is obvious, Lest you say we should be concerned that he might come to carry in the entire Consequently, teaches us
llm_translation: This case is obvious? What is the reason? Perhaps one might think: let us be concerned that he may come to move it altogether, he informs us.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, מוֹדֶה לִי הוּנָא: הָיָה מוֹדֵד וּבָא וְכָלְתָה מִדָּתוֹ עַל שְׂפַת תִּקְרָה — מוּתָּר לְטַלְטֵל בְּכׇל הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: Huna agrees with me was measuring and his measuring ended at the edge of the roof he is permitted to carry throughout the house
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, Huna admits to me: If one was measuring and his measurement ended at the edge of the roof, he is permitted to carry throughout the entire house.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא — הוֹאִיל וְתִקְרַת הַבַּיִת חוֹבֶטֶת.
human_translation: What is the reason Because the roof of the house presses
llm_translation: What is the reason? - Since the destruction of the Temple is pressing.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נָתָן: כְּתַנָּאֵי. הוֹלִיכוּהוּ לְעִיר אַחֶרֶת, וּנְתָנוּהוּ בְּדִיר אוֹ בְּסַהַר, רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה אוֹמְרִים: מְהַלֵּךְ אֶת כּוּלָּהּ. וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמְרִים: אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Natan, said: parallel to tanna’im brought him to a different city or if they put him in a pen or a stable, Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya say: He may walk about the entire Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Akiva say: He has only four cubits
llm_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Natan, said: like the Tannaim. They brought him to another city, and they placed him in a chamber or in a prison. Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah say: he walks her entirely. And Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Akiva say: he has only four cubits.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה דְּאָמְרוּ: מְהַלֵּךְ אֶת כּוּלָּהּ — דְּלָא גָּזְרִי הִילּוּךְ דִּיר וְסַהַר אַטּוּ הִילּוּךְ בְּבִקְעָה;
human_translation: Is it not Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, who said: He may walk about the entire do not prohibit walking in a pen or a stable due to walking in a field
llm_translation: What is the reason? Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah said: "Walking its entirety" - that they did not decree walking in a circle of a courtyard and a field, but they decreed walking in a valley.

hebrew_text: וּמִדְּהִילּוּךְ אַטּוּ הִילּוּךְ לָא גָּזְרִי, טִלְטוּל אַטּוּ הִילּוּךְ לָא גָּזְרִי.
human_translation: And since they did not prohibit walking due to walking they would not prohibit carrying due to walking
llm_translation: And from the hiluk, they did not decree hiluk, from the tiltul, they did not decree hiluk.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּאוֹמְרִים: אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, דְּגָזְרִי הִילּוּךְ דִּיר וְסַהַר אַטּוּ הִילּוּךְ דְּבִקְעָהּ; וּמִדְּהִילּוּךְ אַטּוּ הִילּוּךְ גָּזְרִי, טִלְטוּל אַטּוּ הִילּוּךְ נָמֵי גָּזְרִי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Akiva, who say he has only four cubits, prohibit walking in a pen or a stable due to walking in a field? And since they prohibit walking due to walking they would also prohibit carrying due to walking
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Akiva say: He has only four cubits, as they decreed the walking distance of a courtyard and a market, and then they decreed the walking distance of its breach; and from the walking distance of its breach, they then decreed the walking distance of a market, and from the walking distance of a market, they then decreed the walking distance of a valley, and from the walking distance of a valley, they then decreed the walking distance of a river.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? דִּילְמָא כִּי לָא גָּזְרִי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה הִילּוּךְ סַהַר וְדִיר אַטּוּ הִילּוּךְ בִּקְעָה, הָנֵי מִילֵּי הָתָם דִּשְׁנֵי מְקוֹמוֹת הֵן.
human_translation: From what Perhaps Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya did not prohibit walking in a pen or a stable due to walking in a field, this applies there, because they are two places.
llm_translation: From where? Perhaps when Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah did not decree, they walked on the ridge, and when they decreed, they walked in the valley. Those are words there, for they are two different places.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל טִלְטוּל אַטּוּ הִילּוּךְ דְּמָקוֹם אֶחָד הוּא, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּגָזְרִי, גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יִמָּשֵׁךְ אַחֵר חֶפְצוֹ.
human_translation: However, carrying due to walking, it is one place, also that would decree as a preventive measure, lest the person be drawn after his object
llm_translation: However, carrying an item even a small distance within one domain, it is thus stated: it is a decree to prevent lest one continue carrying after his desire.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא נָמֵי, מִמַּאי דְּמִשּׁוּם דְּגָזְרִי הוּא? דִּילְמָא מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא סָבְרִי כִּי אָמְרִינַן כָּל הַבַּיִת כּוּלּוֹ כְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת דָּמֵי, הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּשָׁבַת בַּאֲוִיר מְחִיצּוֹת מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Akiva too, from what that due to a decree? Perhaps because they hold when we say that the entire house is considered like four cubits, applies only where one acquired his place of residence within the airspace of partitions while it was still day,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Akiva were sitting. From what source is it derived that it is considered a decree? Perhaps because they hold the opinion that when we say, "The entire house is like four cubits," it is as if these matters apply where the Sabbath entered while the partitions were still up.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּלֹא שָׁבַת בַּאֲוִיר מְחִיצּוֹת מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם — לָא.
human_translation: However, where he did not acquire his place of residence within the airspace of partitions while it was still day, not
llm_translation: But here where he did not return within the partitions while it was still day - no.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: הִלְכְתָא כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בְּדִיר וְסַהַר וּסְפִינָה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: הִלְכְתָא כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, בִּסְפִינָה, אֲבָל בְּדִיר וְסַהַר — לָא.
human_translation: Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Gamliel with regard to a pen, a stable, and a boat. And Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Gamliel with regard to a boat, but not with regard to a stable or a pen.
llm_translation: Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Gamliel in a boat, a ship, and a large boat. And Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Gamliel, in a ship, but not in a boat or a large boat.

hebrew_text: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִיהַת הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בִּסְפִינָה, מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: At any rate, all agree, that halakha is in accordance with Rabban Gamliel with regard to a boat. What is the reason
llm_translation: The inclusive ones of the world, from where is the halakha like Rabban Gamliel in a ship, what is the reason?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: הוֹאִיל וְשָׁבַת בַּאֲוִיר מְחִיצּוֹת מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם.
human_translation: Rabba said: since he acquired his place of residence within the partitions while it was still day,
llm_translation: Rabba said: Since he rested within partitions while it was still daytime.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר: הוֹאִיל וּסְפִינָה נוֹטַלְתּוֹ מִתְּחִילַּת אַרְבַּע וּמַנַּחְתּוֹ בְּסוֹף אַרְבַּע.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: since the boat lifting him from the beginning of four and placing him at the end of four
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: Since a ship takes it from the beginning four and places it at the end four.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ שֶׁנִּפְחֲתוּ דּוֹפְנֵי סְפִינָה. אִי נָמֵי: בְּקוֹפֵץ מִסְּפִינָה לִסְפִינָה.
human_translation: What is between There is between them the walls of the boat were breached, Alternatively, with regard to where jumped from one boat to another,
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? The difference between them is that the sides of the ship were bent. Alternatively: by jumping from ship to ship.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי זֵירָא, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַבָּה? אָמַר לָךְ: מְחִיצּוֹת,
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira, what is the reason did not state in accordance with Rabba, said to you: The sides
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira, what is the reason he did not say like Rabbah? He said to you: partitions,

hebrew_text: לְהַבְרִיחַ מַיִם עֲשׂוּיוֹת.
human_translation: they are made to keep the water out;
llm_translation: To distill waters made.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּה, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַבִּי זֵירָא? בִּמְהַלֶּכֶת — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְלִיגִי. כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּשֶׁעָמְדָה.
human_translation: Rabba, what is the reason he did not state in accordance with Rabbi Zeira? With regard to that is moving, all agree, They disagree that is stationary.
llm_translation: Rabba, what is the reason why he did not say like Rabbi Zeira? In the case of walking - everyone agrees. When they disagree is in the case of standing.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי דַּיְקָא דְּבִמְהַלֶּכֶת לָא פְּלִיגִי. מִמַּאי? מִדְּקָתָנֵי: מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁבָּאוּ מִפְּלַנְדַּרְסִין וְהִפְלִיגָה סְפִינָתָם בַּיָּם. רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה הָלְכוּ אֶת כּוּלָּהּ, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לֹא זָזוּ מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, שֶׁרָצוּ לְהַחֲמִיר עַל עַצְמָן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: The mishna is also precise that do not disagree with regard to a moving From where From that which is taught: an incident where were coming from Pelandarsin, and their boat set sail on the sea Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya walked the entire Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Akiva did not move beyond four cubits, as they sought to be stringent with themselves.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman son of Yitzchak said: The Mishnaic sages agree with the opinion of one who is walking. From where? Because it is taught: There was an incident involving sailors who made a vow, and their ship split in the sea. Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah walked the entire distance, while Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Akiva did not move more than four cubits, as they wanted to be stringent upon themselves.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא בִּמְהַלֶּכֶת לָא פְּלִיגִי — הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי ״רָצוּ״, דִּילְמָא עָמְדָה.
human_translation: Granted, if you say they do not disagree with regard to a moving that is why it is taught sought perhaps will stand,
llm_translation: If you say "in a case of walking," they do not argue - that is what is taught in the Mishnah "they wanted," perhaps she stopped.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ פְּלִיגִי, הַאי ״רָצוּ לְהַחֲמִיר״ — אִיסּוּרָא הוּא!
human_translation: But if you say they disagree this Sought to be stringent, it is an prohibition.
llm_translation: Rather, if you say they are in disagreement, this "they wanted to be stringent" - it is a prohibition!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי דַּיְקָא, דְּקָתָנֵי: סְפִינָה, דֻּומְיָא דְּדִיר וְסַהַר. מָה דִּיר וְסַהַר — דִּקְבִיעִי, אַף סְפִינָה נָמֵי דִּקְבִיעָא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: The mishna is also precise, for it teaches parallel to a pen and a stable. Just as a pen and a stable are fixed so too, a boat that is fixed
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: The Mishnah is precise, as it teaches: a ship, similar to a permanent dwelling and a storehouse. Just as a permanent dwelling and a storehouse are fixed, so too a ship is also fixed.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: הִלְכְתָא כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בִּסְפִינָה, הִלְכְתָא מִכְּלָל דִּפְלִיגִי!
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: the halakha is in accordance with Rabban Gamliel with regard to a boat, the halakha , by inference that disagreed
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ahah son of Rava said to Rav Ashi: The halakha is like Rabban Gamliel in a ship, the halakha is derived from the general principle they disputed!

hebrew_text: אִין, וְהָתַנְיָא חֲנַנְיָא (בֶּן אֲחִי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ) אוֹמֵר: כׇּל אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם יָשְׁבוּ וְדָנוּ בִּדְבַר הֲלָכָה, אֶמֶשׁ הִכְרִיעַ אֲחִי אַבָּא הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בִּסְפִינָה, וַהֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא בְּדִיר וְסַהַר.
human_translation: Yes, And it was taught Ḥananya, son of Rabbi Yehoshua’s brother, says: All that day they sat and discussed the matter of halakha ; evening my father’s brother, determined: halakha is in accordance with Rabban Gamliel with regard to a boat, And halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Akiva with regard to a pen and a stable,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ein, vehatanaya Chananya (ben Achi Rabbi Yehoshua) omer: Kol oto hayom yashvu v'danu bidvar halakha, emesh hichri'a Achi Abba halakha k'Rabban Gamliel b'shipna, v'halakha k'Rabbi Akiva b'dir v'sahar." English translation: "There is, and it was taught by Chananya (son of the brother of Rabbi Yehoshua) saying: Throughout that day they sat and deliberated in matters of halakha, until Achi Abba decided the halakha like Rabban Gamliel on a ship, and the halakha like Rabbi Akiva in a chamber and a roundhouse."

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב חֲנַנְיָא: יֵשׁ תְּחוּמִין לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה, אוֹ אֵין תְּחוּמִין לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה?
human_translation: Rav Ḥananya raised a dilemma: Does limits above ten or limits not above ten
llm_translation: Question of Rav Chananya: Are there boundaries above ten, or are there no boundaries above ten?

hebrew_text: עַמּוּד גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה וְרָחָב אַרְבָּעָה, לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ — דְּאַרְעָא סְמִיכְתָּא הִיא.
human_translation: a post ten high and four wide, should not be a dilemma for you. is solid ground,
llm_translation: A tall pillar ten and wide four, not required for you - for it is a support.

hebrew_text: כִּי תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ, בְּעַמּוּד גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה וְאֵינוֹ רָחָב אַרְבָּעָה. אִי נָמֵי, דְּקָאָזֵיל בִּקְפִיצָה.
human_translation: where should be a dilemma for you a post ten high but not four wide, Alternatively, where he advances by way of a leap
llm_translation: When you build for yourself a tall pillar of ten cubits high and it is not wide by four cubits. Indeed, it is as if it is going to fall with a leap.

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא: בִּסְפִינָה, מַאי?
human_translation: another version What is with regard to a boat
llm_translation: Another teaching: In a ship, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא, תָּא שְׁמַע: מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁבָּאוּ מִפְּלַנְדַּרְסִין וְהִפְלִיגָה סְפִינָתָם בַּיָּם וְכוּ׳, אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא יֵשׁ תְּחוּמִין — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי רָצוּ. אֶלָּא, אִי אָמְרַתְּ אֵין תְּחוּמִין — אַמַּאי רָצוּ?!
human_translation: Rav Hoshaya said: Come hear It once happened that were coming from Pelandarsin, and their boat set sail on the sea, etc. Granted, if you say limits applies this is why sought However, if you say limits why did they seek
llm_translation: Rav Hoshaya said, come and hear: The incident involving those who came from P'landarsin, and their ship veered off course in the sea, etc. If you say there are boundaries - that is why they consented. But if you say there are no boundaries, why did they consent?!

hebrew_text: כִּדְאָמַר רָבָא — בִּמְהַלֶּכֶת בִּרְקָק, הָכָא נָמֵי — בִּמְהַלֶּכֶת בִּרְקָק.
human_translation: as Rava said moving through swampy water; here, too, where was moving through swampy water,
llm_translation: As Rava said - when walking on a smooth surface, here too - when walking on a smooth surface.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: פַּעַם אַחַת לֹא נִכְנְסוּ לַנָּמָל עַד שֶׁחָשֵׁיכָה וְכוּ׳. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא יֵשׁ תְּחוּמִין — שַׁפִּיר, אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ אֵין תְּחוּמִין — כִּי לֹא הָיִינוּ בְּתוֹךְ הַתְּחוּם, מַאי הָוֵי!
human_translation: Come hear one occasion they did not enter the port until after nightfall, etc. Granted, if you say limits well However, if you say limits does not apply We were not within the limit what would it
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shma: pa'am akhat lo nikhnesu la-namal ad shechashikha vekhu. I amarta bishlama yesh techumin — shapir, ela im amarta ein techumin — ki lo hayinu betokh hat'chum, mai havei!" English translation: "Come and hear: One time they did not enter the ant until it was dark, etc. If you say there are boundaries — fine, but if you say there are no boundaries — because we were not within the boundary, what is the case!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: בִּמְהַלֶּכֶת בִּרְקָק.
human_translation: Rava said: moving through swampy water
llm_translation: Rava said: "In walking on tiles."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הָנֵי שָׁב שְׁמַעְתָּא דְּאִיתְאַמְרָן בְּצַפְרָא בְּשַׁבְּתָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא בְּסוּרָא, בַּהֲדֵי פַּנְיָא בְּשַׁבְּתָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא בְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא.
human_translation: Come hear the seven teachings that were said on Shabbat morning before Rav Ḥisda in Sura toward the conclusion of Shabbat before Rava in Pumbedita,
llm_translation: Come and hear: Those elders who said in Zafra on Shabbat stood before Rav Ḥisda in Sura, and those who stood before Rava in Pumbedita on Shabbat stood before his face.

hebrew_text: מַאן אַמְרִינְהוּ? לָאו אֵלִיָּהוּ אַמְרִינְהוּ? אַלְמָא אֵין תְּחוּמִין לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה! לָא, דִּלְמָא יוֹסֵף שֵׁידָא אַמְרִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Who said not Elijah who said them? Apparently, limits does not apply above ten no perhaps Yosef the demon, reported these
llm_translation: Who said it? Was it not Elijah who said it? But there are no boundaries above ten! No, perhaps it was Joseph of Sheida who said it.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר בַּיּוֹם שֶׁבֶּן דָּוִד בָּא — מוּתָּר לִשְׁתּוֹת יַיִן בְּשַׁבָּתוֹת וּבְיָמִים טוֹבִים,
human_translation: Come hear I will be a nazirite on the day that the son of David comes, he is permitted to drink wine on Shabbat and Festivals,
llm_translation: Come and hear: If one says, "I am a Nazirite on the day that the son of David comes," he is permitted to drink wine on Sabbaths and festivals.

hebrew_text: וְאָסוּר לִשְׁתּוֹת יַיִן כׇּל יְמוֹת הַחוֹל.
human_translation: However, he is prohibited to drink wine on all weekdays,
llm_translation: And forbidden to drink wine all the days of the week.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא יֵשׁ תְּחוּמִין — הַיְינוּ דִּבְשַׁבָּתוֹת וּבְיָמִים טוֹבִים מוּתָּר. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ אֵין תְּחוּמִין, בְּשַׁבָּתוֹת וּבְיָמִים טוֹבִים אַמַּאי מוּתָּר?
human_translation: Granted, if you say that limits applies that is on Shabbat and Festivals he is permitted But if you say that limits does not apply why is he permitted on Shabbat and Festivals?
llm_translation: If you say there are boundaries - that is, on Shabbat and festivals it is permitted. But if you say there are no boundaries, why is it permitted on Shabbat and festivals?

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״הִנֵּה אָנֹכִי שֹׁלֵחַ לָכֶם אֵת אֵלִיָּה הַנָּבִיא וְגוֹ׳״, וְהָא לָא אֲתָא אֵלִיָּהוּ מֵאֶתְמוֹל.
human_translation: It is different there, as the verse stated: “Behold I will send you Elijah the prophet, Since Elijah did not come the previous day,
llm_translation: The matter is different there, as the verse states: "Behold, I will send you Elijah the prophet, etc.," yet Elijah did not come yesterday.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, בְּחוֹל כֹּל יוֹמָא וְיוֹמָא נָמֵי לִישְׁתְּרֵי, דְּהָא לָא אֲתָא אֵלִיָּהוּ מֵאֶתְמוֹל? אֶלָּא אָמְרִינַן: לְבֵית דִּין הַגָּדוֹל אֲתָא. הָכָא נָמֵי לֵימָא: לְבֵית דִּין הַגָּדוֹל אֲתָא?
human_translation: If so, on weekdays, too, he should be permitted each and every day, as Elijah did not arrive the previous day. Rather, we say arrived at the Great Court, here too we should say arrived at the Great Court,
llm_translation: If so, on a weekday every day and day it is necessary, for Elijah did not come yesterday? Rather, we say: He came to the Great Court. Here too we should say: He came to the Great Court?

hebrew_text: כְּבָר מוּבְטָח לָהֶן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁאֵין אֵלִיָּהוּ בָּא לֹא בְּעַרְבֵי שַׁבָּתוֹת וְלֹא בְּעַרְבֵי יָמִים טוֹבִים, מִפְּנֵי הַטּוֹרַח.
human_translation: It has already been promised to the Jewish people that Elijah will not come either on the eve of Shabbat or on the eve of a Festival, due to the trouble,
llm_translation: As it is already established for the Israelites that Elijah does not come neither on Friday evenings nor on the eves of holidays, due to the inconvenience.

hebrew_text: קָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ מִדְּאֵלִיָּהוּ לָא אֲתָא, מָשִׁיחַ נָמֵי לָא אָתֵי, בְּמַעֲלֵי שַׁבְּתָא לִישְׁתְּרֵי! אֵלִיָּהוּ לָא אָתֵי, מָשִׁיחַ אָתֵי. דְּכֵיוָן דְּאָתֵי מְשִׁיחָא — הַכֹּל עֲבָדִים הֵן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: It might enter your mind since Elijah will not come Messiah will also not come on Shabbat eve he should be permitted Elijah will not arrive Messiah may arrive, once the Messiah comes, all will be subservient to the Jewish people,
llm_translation: Your mind has become settled that Elijah will not come, and the Messiah will not come either; in the twilight of the Sabbath they will come! If Elijah does not come, the Messiah will not come. But since the Messiah will come — all are slaves to the people of Israel.

hebrew_text: בְּחַד בְּשַׁבָּא לִישְׁתְּרֵי? לִפְשׁוֹט מִינַּהּ דְּאֵין תְּחוּמִין, דְּאִי יֵשׁ תְּחוּמִין — בְּחַד בְּשַׁבָּא לִישְׁתְּרֵי, דְּלָא אֲתָא אֵלִיָּהוּ בְּשַׁבָּת?!
human_translation: He should be permitted on a Sunday, Let us resolve from here limits does not apply as if limits applies on Sunday he should be permitted as Elijah cannot come on Shabbat.
llm_translation: In one Shabbat to permit? To establish its type that there are no boundaries, for if there are boundaries - in one Shabbat to permit, for Elijah does not come on Shabbat?!

hebrew_text: הַאי תַּנָּא סַפּוֹקֵי מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ אִי יֵשׁ תְּחוּמִין אוֹ אֵין תְּחוּמִין, וּלְחוּמְרָא.
human_translation: This tanna was uncertain whether there is limits or no limits. stringently
llm_translation: This Mishna is in doubt, questioning whether there is a boundary or there is no boundary, and for stringency.

hebrew_text: דְּקָאֵי אֵימַת דְּקָא נָדַר? אִילֵּימָא דְּקָאֵי בְּחוֹל — כֵּיוָן דְּחָל עֲלֵיהּ נְזִירוּת, הֵיכִי אָתְיָא שַׁבְּתָא וּמַפְקְעָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: When did arise take vow? If you say he arose on a weekday, since naziriteship took effect, how can Shabbat come and annul it?
llm_translation: The text is standing, when is it standing? If you say it is standing on a weekday - since the vow of Nazirite status has taken effect upon him, how does the Sabbath come and annul it for him?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּקָאֵי בְּשַׁבְּתָא וְקָא נָדַר, וּבְיוֹם טוֹב וְקָא נָדַר, וְהָהוּא יוֹמָא דְּשָׁרֵי לֵיהּ, מִיכָּן וְאֵילָךְ — אֲסִיר לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, he arose on Shabbat and took vow, or on a Festival and took vow, and that day that he is permitted from that day on he is prohibited
llm_translation: Rather, he is standing on Shabbat and he made a vow, and on a festival day and he made a vow, and that day was permissible for him, from here and onwards - it is forbidden for him.

hebrew_text: פַּעַם אַחַת לֹא נִכְנְסוּ לַנָּמָל וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: one occasion, they did not enter the port
llm_translation: One time they did not enter the "namal" etc.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: שְׁפוֹפֶרֶת הָיְתָה לוֹ לְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל שֶׁהָיָה מַבִּיט וְצוֹפֶה בָּהּ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה בַּיַּבָּשָׁה, וּכְנֶגְדָּהּ אַלְפַּיִם בַּיָּם.
human_translation: taught Rabban Gamliel had a tube through which he would look and see two thousand cubits on land, and a corresponding two thousand cubits at sea.
llm_translation: It was taught: Sh'pof'ret belonged to Rabban Gamliel, who would gaze and observe it two thousand cubits in the dry land, and opposite it two thousand cubits in the sea.

hebrew_text: הָרוֹצֶה לֵידַע כַּמָּה עוֹמְקוֹ שֶׁל גֵּיא, מֵבִיא שְׁפוֹפֶרֶת וּמַבִּיט בָּהּ, וְיֵדַע כַּמָּה עוֹמְקוֹ שֶׁל גַּיְא.
human_translation: one who wishes to know the depth of a valley can bring a tube and look through it, and he will know the depth of the valley.
llm_translation: One who wishes to know the depth of a valley, brings a measuring line and looks at it, and knows the depth of the valley.

hebrew_text: וְהָרוֹצֶה לֵידַע כַּמָּה גּוֹבְהוֹ שֶׁל דֶּקֶל — מוֹדֵד קוֹמָתוֹ וְצִלּוֹ, וְצֵל קוֹמָתוֹ וְיֵדַע כַּמָּה גּוֹבַהּ שֶׁל דֶּקֶל.
human_translation: One who wishes to know the height of a palm tree, can measure his height, and his shadow, and the shadow of the height and he will know the height of the palm tree.
llm_translation: One who wishes to know the height of a palm tree - measures its height and its shadow, and the shadow of its height, and thus knows the height of the palm tree.

hebrew_text: הָרוֹצֶה שֶׁלֹּא תִּשְׁרֶה חַיָּה רָעָה בְּצֵל קֶבֶר — נוֹעֵץ קָנֶה בְּאַרְבַּע שָׁעוֹת בַּיּוֹם, וְיִרְאֶה לְהֵיכָן צִלּוֹ נוֹטֶה, מְשַׁפֵּיעַ וְעוֹלֶה מְשַׁפֵּיעַ וְיוֹרֵד.
human_translation: one wishes that a wild beast should not rest in the shade of a grave, he should insert a reed at the fourth hour of the day, And observe in which direction the shadow inclines, slant upwards and downwards
llm_translation: One who does not want a wild animal to dwell in the shade of a grave - he should place a reed in four hours of the day, and he shall see where its shade inclines, it influences and rises, influences and descends.

hebrew_text: נְחֶמְיָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב חֲנִילַאי מְשַׁכְתֵּיהּ שְׁמַעְתָּא, וּנְפַק חוּץ לַתְּחוּם. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא לְרַב נַחְמָן: נְחֶמְיָה תַּלְמִידְךָ שָׁרוּי בְּצַעַר.
human_translation: Neḥemya, son of Rav Ḥanilai, was engrossed in learning he was going out beyond Rav Ḥisda said to Rav Naḥman: Your student Neḥemya is in distress,
llm_translation: Nehemiah son of Rav Hanilai was walking along the road, when he went outside the boundary. Rav Chisda said to Rav Nachman: "Your student Nehemiah is in trouble."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: עֲשֵׂה לוֹ מְחִיצָה שֶׁל בְּנֵי אָדָם, וְיִכָּנֵס.
human_translation: said to him: Establish a human partition for him, reenter
llm_translation: He said to him: Make for him a partition of human beings, and he shall enter.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אֲחוֹרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא, וְיָתֵיב רָבָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק לְרָבָא: מַאי קָא מִבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ לְרַב חִסְדָּא?
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak sat behind Rava, and Rava sat before Rav Naḥman. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said to Rava: What was Rav Ḥisda’s dilemma
llm_translation: Sitting Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak behind Rava, and sitting Rava in front of Rav Nachman. Said to him Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak to Rava: What is he asking for Rav Chisda?

hebrew_text: אִילֵּימָא בִּדְמָלוּ גַּבְרֵי עָסְקִינַן, וְקָא מִבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ: הִלְכְתָא כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל,
human_translation: If you say we are dealing with filled with people and the dilemma he raised the halakha in accordance with Rabban Gamliel
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: אִילֵּימָא בִּדְמָלוּ גַּבְרֵי עָסְקִינַן, וְקָא מִבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ: הִלְכְתָא כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, Translation: If you wish, we are dealing with prominent individuals, and he is inquiring: Is the halakha in accordance with Rabban Gamliel,

hebrew_text: אוֹ אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. אוֹ דִילְמָא, בִּדְלָא מָלוּ גַּבְרֵי עָסְקִינַן, וְקָא מִבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, אוֹ אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר?
human_translation: or is halakha not in accordance with Rabban Gamliel? Or perhaps we are dealing with not be filled with people and raised Is halakha in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, or is halakha not in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Or is the halakha like Rabban Gamliel? Or perhaps, since the men have not yet filled up, we are dealing with it, and he is asking: Is the halakha like Rabbi Eliezer, or is the halakha not like Rabbi Eliezer?

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא בִּדְלָא מָלוּ גַּבְרֵי עָסְקִינַן, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ בִּדְמָלוּ גַּבְרֵי עָסְקִינַן, מַאי תִּיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ? הָאָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בְּדִיר וְסַהַר וּסְפִינָה! אֶלָּא וַדַּאי בִּדְלָא מָלוּ גַּבְרֵי עָסְקִינַן, וּדְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר קָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: obvious that we are dealing with not be filled with people, as if it should enter your mind that we are dealing with filled with people, what is dilemma? Didn’t Rav say: halakha is in accordance with Rabban Gamliel with regard to a pen, a stable, and a boat? Rather, we dealing with not be filled with people, and he raised was of Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: The matter is when we are dealing with a case where the men did not fulfill their obligation, for if it enters your mind that the men fulfilled their obligation, what would he (the Mishnah) ask of him? This is what Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Gamliel in the matter of a dwelling, a watchtower, and a ship! Rather, certainly we are dealing with a case where the men did not fulfill their obligation, and Rabbi Eliezer raised an objection against him.

hebrew_text: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָאֲמַר לֵיהּ ״יִכָּנֵס״. מַאי ״יִכָּנֵס״ — לָאו בְּלֹא מְחִיצָה?!
human_translation: This also precise for said to let him reenter Doesn’t Let him reenter, without a partition
llm_translation: Precisely, it is stated, that he said to him "he shall enter." What is "he shall enter" - is it not without a partition?!

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק לְרָבָא: נָפַל דּוֹפְנָהּ — לֹא יַעֲמִיד בָּהּ אָדָם בְּהֵמָה וְכֵלִים. וְלֹא יִזְקוֹף אֶת הַמִּטָּה לִפְרוֹס עָלֶיהָ סָדִין, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין עוֹשִׂין אֹהֶל עֲרַאי בַּתְּחִילָּה בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר בַּשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak raised an objection to Rava If the wall fell one may not position people, animals or utensils there nor may one turn a bed upright in order to spread a sheet over it, because one may not make a temporary tent for the first on a Festival, and, needless to say, on Shabbat.
