llm_translation: He raised an objection to Rava: If its cover fell — one may not place a person, an animal, or utensils on it. And one may not tilt the bed to spread a sheet on it, because one does not make a temporary tent initially on a festival day, and needless to say on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ לִי מֵהָא, וַאֲנָא אָמֵינָא לָךְ מֵהָא: עוֹשֶׂה אָדָם אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ דּוֹפֶן כְּדֵי שֶׁיֹּאכַל וְיִשְׁתֶּה וְיִשַׁן. וְיִזְקוֹף אֶת הַמִּטָּה וְיִפְרוֹס עָלֶיהָ סָדִין כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא תִּפּוֹל חַמָּה עַל הַמֵּת וְעַל הָאוֹכָלִין.
human_translation: said to him: You state to me from this but I state to you from this A person may position his fellow as a wall, so that he may eat, drink, and sleep and turn a bed upright spread a sheet over it, so that the sun should not beat down on a corpse, or on food.
llm_translation: He said to him: You say to me from this, and I believe you from this: A person makes his friend similar to himself so that he may eat, drink, and sleep. And he should raise the bed and spread a sheet over it so that the sun will not shine on the deceased and on the food.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָין אַהֲדָדֵי! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, הָא — רַבָּנַן, דִּתְנַן: פְּקַק הַחַלּוֹן, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: בִּזְמַן שֶׁקָּשׁוּר וְתָלוּי — פּוֹקְקִין בּוֹ, וְאִם לָאו — אֵין פּוֹקְקִין בּוֹ. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ פּוֹקְקִין בּוֹ.
human_translation: contradict one another. not difficult; this Rabbi Eliezer, this the Rabbis. As we learned a window shutter Rabbi Eliezer says: If it is tied and hangs one may shut with it; but if not, one may not shut with it, But the Rabbis say: In either case, one may shut with it.
llm_translation: Difficult are the words of Ahadadei! Not difficult: Here - Rabbi Eliezer, here - the Rabbis, as we learned: If the window is blocked, Rabbi Eliezer says: If it is tied and hanging - we unblock it, but if not - we do not unblock it. And the Sages say: In either case we unblock it.

hebrew_text: וְהָא: אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים שֶׁאֵין עוֹשִׂין אֹהֶל עֲרַאי בַּתְּחִילָּה בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר בְּשַׁבָּת. לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא לְהוֹסִיף, שֶׁרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אֵין מוֹסִיפִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר בְּשַׁבָּת. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מוֹסִיפִין בְּשַׁבָּת, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר בְּיוֹם טוֹב!
human_translation: But wasn’t it stated with regard to this Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: All agree that one may not make a temporary tent for the first on a Festival, and, needless to say, on Shabbat. disagree only with regard to adding As Rabbi Eliezer says: One may not add on a Festival; and, needless to say, on Shabbat. And the Rabbis say: One may add on Shabbat, and needless to say, on a Festival.
llm_translation: And the Gemara: It was stated regarding this issue, Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Everyone agrees that one may not make a temporary tent on a festival at the outset, and needless to say on Shabbat. They only disagreed in order to add, as Rabbi Eliezer says: One may not add on a festival, and needless to say on Shabbat. And the Sages say: One may add on Shabbat, and needless to say on a festival!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, הָא — כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. דְּתַנְיָא: עֲשָׂאָהּ לִבְהֵמָה דּוֹפֶן לַסּוּכָּה, רַבִּי מֵאִיר פּוֹסֵל, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַכְשִׁיר.
human_translation: Rather, not difficult, this in accordance with Rabbi Meir, this in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. As it was taught one who positions an animal as the wall of a sukka , Rabbi Meir deems it unfit, Rabbi Yehuda deems it fit.
llm_translation: Rather, it is not difficult: this — like Rabbi Meir, this — like Rabbi Yehuda. As it was taught: If one made it for an animal similar to a booth, Rabbi Meir disqualifies it, and Rabbi Yehuda permits it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר דְּקָא פָּסֵיל הָתָם — אַלְמָא לָא מְחִיצָה הִיא, הָכָא שָׁרֵי, דְּלָאו מִידֵּי קָא עָבֵיד.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir, who deems unfit there, apparently is not a partition here, permitted he is not doing anything,
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir, who invalidates there — this proves that it is not considered a partition. Here, it is permitted, because he is not doing it directly.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּקָא מַכְשִׁיר הָתָם — אַלְמָא מְחִיצָה הִיא, הָכָא אָסַר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, who deems to be fit there, apparently is a partition; here, prohibit
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, who validates there — implying it is considered a partition, here he prohibits.

hebrew_text: וְתִיסְבְּרָא? אֵימַר דְּשָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר בְּהֵמָה. אָדָם וְכֵלִים מִי שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ?
human_translation: And you understand Say you heard that Rabbi Meir an animal did you hear a person or utensils
llm_translation: And was it created? Say that you heard it from Rabbi Meir regarding an animal. Did you hear it regarding a person and vessels?

hebrew_text: וְתוּ — רַבִּי מֵאִיר אַלִּיבָּא דְּמַאן? אִי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר — לְהוֹסִיף נָמֵי אָסַר.
human_translation: And furthermore, according to whose Rabbi Meir If according to Rabbi Eliezer, he even prohibited adding
llm_translation: "And come - Rabbi Meir in the view of whom? If in the view of Rabbi Eliezer - to add, he also prohibited."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבָּנַן, אֵימַר דְּאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן לְהוֹסִיף, לְכַתְּחִילָּה מִי אֲמוּר?
human_translation: Rather, in accordance with the Rabbis. say that the Rabbis said to add did they say that for the first time?
llm_translation: Rather, in the school of the sages, the statement that the sages say to add, initially who said?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: הָא וְהָא רַבָּנַן. וְכֵלִים אַכֵּלִים לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא — בְּדוֹפֶן שְׁלִישִׁית, הָא — בְּדוֹפֶן רְבִיעִית.
human_translation: Rather, this and that the Rabbis, utensils utensils, not difficult, this to third wall this to fourth wall
llm_translation: Rather: this and this are the Rabbis. And vessels that are eaten are not difficult. This - in the third layer, this - in the fourth layer.

hebrew_text: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי: נָפַל דּוֹפְנָהּ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: This is also precise as If its wall fell. Learn from this
llm_translation: Precisely it was stated, as it was taught: "He fell on his face." Learn from it.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָדָם אַאָדָם קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: However, a person a person, difficult,
llm_translation: Rather, a person, a person is difficult!

hebrew_text: אָדָם אַאָדָם נָמֵי לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — לְדַעַת, כָּאן — שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעַת.
human_translation: a person a person, also not difficult. Here, knowingly here, unknowingly
llm_translation: Man, man, is not difficult: here - with knowledge, here - without knowledge.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דְּרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חֲנִילַאי, לְדַעַת הֲוָה! שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעַת הֲוָה.
human_translation: However, Rabbi Neḥemya, son of Rabbi Ḥanilai, was knowingly was unknowingly
llm_translation: And this that Rabbi Nechemiah, son of Rabbi Chanilai, was not knowledgeable! He was not knowledgeable.

hebrew_text: רַב חִסְדָּא, מִיהָא לְדַעַת הֲוָה! רַב חִסְדָּא, שֶׁלֹּא מִן הַמִּנְיָן הֲוָה.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda, was in any case knowingly. Rav Ḥisda was not among the designated
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda, from her was knowledge! Rav Ḥisda, that it was not from the counting.

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ בְּנֵי גְנָנָא דְּאַעִילוּ מַיָּא בִּמְחִיצָה שֶׁל בְּנֵי אָדָם. נַגְּדִינְהוּ שְׁמוּאֵל. אֲמַר: אִם אָמְרוּ שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעַת, יֹאמְרוּ לְדַעַת?!
human_translation: these members of a wedding to bring water in through walls comprised of people Shmuel they be flogged. He said If said unknowingly, they would say knowingly
llm_translation: Behold, the sons of the gardeners who brought water into the partition of the sons of man. Opposite them was Samuel. He said: If they said it unknowingly, shall they say it knowingly?!

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ זִיקֵי דַּהֲוָה שַׁדְיָין בְּרִיסְתְּקָא דְמָחוֹזָא, בַּהֲדֵי דַּאֲתָא רָבָא מִפִּירְקֵיהּ, אַעְלִינְהוּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ. לְשַׁבְּתָא אַחֲרִיתִי בָּעֵי עַיְּילִינְהוּ, וַאֲסַר לְהוּ, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ כִּלְדַעַת — וְאָסוּר.
human_translation: were these flasks lying in the market [ ristaka ] of Meḥoza When Rava was coming from his discourse brought into his On another Shabbat they wanted to bring them in but prohibited them This is like knowingly and it is prohibited.
llm_translation: Those are the ones who were appointed as judges in the attic of Machoza. When Rava came and examined their rulings, he found them to be correct. On the following Sabbath, he wanted to appoint them, but he refrained, for it would be like a personal favor - and it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: לֵוִי, אַעִילוּ לֵיהּ תִּיבְנָא, זְעֵירִי — אַסְפַּסְתָּא, רַב שִׁימִי בַּר חִיָּיא — מַיָּא.
human_translation: Levi was brought straw Ze’eiri fodder [ aspasta ], Rav Shimi bar Ḥiyya water.
llm_translation: Levi, they brought him a brick, small - Aspasta, Rav Shimi bar Chiya - water.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁיָּצָא בִּרְשׁוּת, וְאָמְרוּ לוֹ: ״כְּבָר נַעֲשָׂה מַעֲשֶׂה״ — יֵשׁ לוֹ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה לְכׇל רוּחַ.
human_translation: one who was permitted to leave and they said to him The action has already been performed, he has two thousand cubits in each direction
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who goes out into the public domain, and they say to him, "The matter has already been done" - he has a two-thousand-cubit domain in every direction.

hebrew_text: אִם הָיָה בְּתוֹךְ הַתְּחוּם — כְּאִילּוּ לֹא יָצָא. כׇּל הַיּוֹצְאִים לְהַצִּיל — חוֹזְרִין לִמְקוֹמָן.
human_translation: If he was within limit, as if he had not left All who go out to save may return to their locations
llm_translation: If he was within the boundary - as if he did not go out. All those who go out to save - return to their place.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי ״אִם הָיָה בְּתוֹךְ הַתְּחוּם כְּאִילּוּ לֹא יָצָא״? אָמַר רַבָּה, הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִם הָיָה בְּתוֹךְ תְּחוּם שֶׁלּוֹ — כְּאִילּוּ לֹא יָצָא מִתּוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: What is If he was within limit, it is as if he had never left? Rabba said: is saying as follows: If he was within his limit, it is as if he had never left his house.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of "if it was within the boundary, it is as if he did not go out"? Rabah said, this is what he is saying: If it was within his own boundary - it is as if he did not go out from his house.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הוֹאִיל וְעָקַר — עָקַר, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious Lest you say since he moved he moved teaches us
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Peshita? Mahu d'teima: Ho'il v'akar - akar, ka mashma lan." English translation: "Is it obvious? What is the reasoning: Since he uprooted - he uprooted, it implies for us."

hebrew_text: רַב שִׁימִי בַּר חִיָּיא אָמַר, הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִם הָיוּ תְּחוּמִין שֶׁנָּתְנוּ לוֹ חֲכָמִים מוּבְלָעִין בְּתוֹךְ הַתְּחוּם שֶׁלּוֹ, כְּאִילּוּ לֹא יָצָא מִתְּחוּמוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ḥiyya said saying as follows: If the limit that the Sages granted him is subsumed within his limit, it is as if he had never left his limit,
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Chiya said, thus he said: If there were boundaries that the sages designated for him, he is enveloped within his own boundary, as if he did not leave his boundary.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר הַבְלָעַת תְּחוּמִין מִילְּתָא הִיא, וּמָר סָבַר לָאו מִילְּתָא הִיא.
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? Sage, holds the subsuming of limits, is something Sage, holds it is nothing
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? Master A thinks that the swallowing of the boundaries is a matter, and Master B thinks it is not a matter.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַבָּה: וְאַתְּ לָא תִּסְבְּרָא דְּהַבְלָעַת תְּחוּמִין מִילְּתָא הִיא? וּמָה אִילּוּ שָׁבַת בִּמְעָרָה, שֶׁבְּתוֹכָהּ אַרְבַּעַת אֲלָפִים וְעַל גַּגָּהּ פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבַּעַת אֲלָפִים אַמָּה — לֹא נִמְצָא מְהַלֵּךְ אֶת כּוּלָּהּ, וְחוּצָה לָהּ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה?
human_translation: Abaye said to Rabba: Do you not hold the subsuming of limits is something And what if he established residence in a cave on the inside is four thousand but atop its roof is less than four thousand cubits not the case that he may walk the entire and two thousand cubits outside it
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye to Rava: And you do not think that the swallowing of the boundaries is a matter? And what if one kept the Sabbath in a cave, within it four thousand cubits, and on its roof less than four thousand cubits - it is not found to encompass all of it, and outside of it two thousand cubits?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְלָא שָׁנֵי לָךְ בֵּין הֵיכָא דְּשָׁבַת בָּאֲוִיר מְחִיצּוֹת מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם, לְהֵיכָא דְּלֹא שָׁבַת בַּאֲוִיר מְחִיצּוֹת מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם?
human_translation: said to Do you not distinguish between where established residence within the airspace of partitions while it was still day, and where he did not establish residence within the airspace of partitions while it was still day,
llm_translation: He said to him: And is it not different for you between where one has carried out into the public domain through partitions from before Shabbat, to where one has not carried out into the public domain through partitions from before Shabbat?

hebrew_text: וְהֵיכָא דְּלֹא שָׁבַת, לָא?
human_translation: And where he did not acquire not
llm_translation: And where is the case that he did not return, no?

hebrew_text: וְהָתְנַן רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: שְׁתַּיִם — יִכָּנֵס, שְׁלֹשָׁה — לֹא יִכָּנֵס. מַאי לָאו, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְטַעְמֵיהּ דְּאָמַר וְהוּא בְּאֶמְצָעָן —
human_translation: Didn’t we learn Rabbi Eliezer says: two he may reenter three he may not reenter. What, not that Rabbi Eliezer follows his reasoning, in said in the middle of them,
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Eliezer says: Two - he may enter, three - he may not enter. What is the reason? Rabbi Eliezer according to his reasoning, as he said, "And He is in their midst" (Hosea 11:9)

hebrew_text: וְאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת דִּיהַבוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן כְּמַאן דְּמִיבַּלְעָן דָּמוּ, וְקָאָמַר ״יִכָּנֵס״ — אַלְמָא הַבְלָעַת תְּחוּמִין מִילְּתָא הִיא.
human_translation: the four cubits that the Sages gave are regarded as being subsumed and he said: He may reenter Apparently the subsuming of is something
llm_translation: "And four cubits they gave to him the Rabbis as one who swallows their blood, and he says 'he shall enter' - meaning, the swallowing of boundaries is a matter."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה לְאַבָּיֵי: וּמִדְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר קָמוֹתְבַתְּ לֵיהּ לְמָר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, דִּשְׁמִיעַ לִי מִינֵּיהּ דְּמָר: עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אֶלָּא לִדְבַר הָרְשׁוּת, אֲבָל לִדְבַר מִצְוָה מוֹדוּ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said to Abaye: Do you raise an objection against our Master, from Rabbi Eliezer? said to him: Yes, as I heard from our Master the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Eliezer only for a voluntary matter, but for a mitzva matter, they agree with him
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said to Abbaye: And from Rabbi Eliezer, do they write to him "Mar"? He said to him: No, for I have heard from the master: Until here, the Rabbis did not dispute with regard to Rabbi Eliezer except in matters of permission, but in matters of commandment, they concede to him.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל הַיּוֹצְאִין לְהַצִּיל חוֹזְרִין לִמְקוֹמָן. וַאֲפִילּוּ טוּבָא? וְהָא אָמְרַתְּ רֵישָׁא: ״אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה״, וְתוּ לָא!
human_translation: All who go out to save may return to their locations even more Didn’t the first clause say two thousand cubits, and no more?
llm_translation: And all those who go out to save, return to their place. Even if it is good? But didn't you say at the beginning: "Two thousand cubits," and not more!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: שֶׁחוֹזְרִין בִּכְלֵי זַיִין לִמְקוֹמָן. וּמַאי קוּשְׁיָא? דִּילְמָא לְהַצִּיל שָׁאנֵי!
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: that they may return with weapons to their locations, What is the difficulty Perhaps to save is different,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: "They return the vessels of wine to their place." And what is the difficulty? Perhaps to save the teeth!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי קַשְׁיָא, הָא קַשְׁיָא: דִּתְנַן בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה לֹא הָיוּ זָזִין מִשָּׁם כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, if there is a difficulty, this is the difficulty: As we learned at first and they would not move from there the entire day.
llm_translation: Rather, it is difficult, this is difficult: as we learned in the first clause, they did not move from there the entire day.

hebrew_text: הִתְקִין רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הַזָּקֵן שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה לְכׇל רוּחַ. וְלֹא אֵלּוּ בִּלְבַד אָמְרוּ, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ חֲכָמָה הַבָּאָה לְיַלֵּד, וְהַבָּא לְהַצִּיל מִן הַגַּיִיס וּמִן הַנָּהָר וּמִן הַמַּפּוֹלֶת וּמִן הַדְּלֵיקָה — הֲרֵי הֵן כְּאַנְשֵׁי הָעִיר, וְיֵשׁ לָהֶן אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה לְכׇל רוּחַ.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel the Elder instituted that they have two thousand cubits in each direction, And not only these said but even a midwife who comes to deliver and one who comes to rescue from troops or from a river or a collapsed building or a fire; they are like the inhabitants of the town and they have two thousand cubits in each direction.
llm_translation: The Sage Rabban Gamliel the Elder established that they have two thousand cubits for every wind. And not only did they say this, but even if a wise person comes to give birth, or to save from a siege, or from a river, or from a collapse, or from a fire - they are like the people of the city, and they have two thousand cubits for every wind.

hebrew_text: וְתוּ לָא? וְהָא אָמְרַתְּ: כׇּל הַיּוֹצְאִין לְהַצִּיל חוֹזְרִין לִמְקוֹמָן — אֲפִילּוּ טוּבָא!
human_translation: no more Didn’t it say All who go out to save may return to their locations even more
llm_translation: And is it not so? But didn't you say: "All those who go out to save others return to their place - even if it is good!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב [יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב]: שֶׁחוֹזְרִין בִּכְלֵי זַיִין לִמְקוֹמָן, כִּדְתַנְיָא: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ מַנִּיחִין כְּלֵי זֵיינָן בַּבַּיִת הַסָּמוּךְ לַחוֹמָה.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: that they may return with weapons to their locations, As it was taught At first would place their weapons in the house nearest the wall,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: They would return the vessels of wine to their place, as it was taught: Initially, they would place their vessels of wine in the house adjacent to the wall.

hebrew_text: פַּעַם אַחַת הִכִּירוּ בָּהֶן אוֹיְבִים וְרָדְפוּ אַחֲרֵיהֶם, וְנִכְנְסוּ לִיטּוֹל כְּלֵי זֵיינָן, וְנִכְנְסוּ אוֹיְבִים אַחֲרֵיהֶן. דָּחֲקוּ זֶה אֶת זֶה, וְהָרְגוּ זֶה אֶת זֶה יוֹתֵר מִמַּה שֶּׁהָרְגוּ אוֹיְבִים. בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ חוֹזְרִין לִמְקוֹמָן בִּכְלֵי זֵיינָן.
human_translation: Once, enemies noticed that they and chased after them; and entered to take up their weapons and enemies entered after them, push one another, and killed more of each other than enemies killed At that time instituted that they should return to their locations, with their weapons.
llm_translation: Once they recognized each other, enemies pursued them, and they entered to take the vessels of their olive trees, and enemies entered after them. They pressed against each other, and they killed each other more than the enemies killed. At that moment, they decreed that they should return to their place with the vessels of their olive trees.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: לָא קַשְׁיָא. כָּאן — שֶׁנִּצְּחוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם, כָּאן — שֶׁנִּצְּחוּ אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם אֶת עַצְמָן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: not difficult. Here, where the Jews defeated the nations of the world, here, where the nations of the world defeated themselves,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: It is not difficult. Here - when Israel conquered the nations of the world, here - when the nations of the world conquered themselves.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: נׇכְרִים שֶׁצָּרוּ עַל עַיְירוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל — אֵין יוֹצְאִין עֲלֵיהֶם בִּכְלֵי זֵיינָן, וְאֵין מְחַלְּלִין עֲלֵיהֶן אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda, said Rav said: gentiles who besieged Jewish towns, they may not go out against them with their weapons, nor may they desecrate Shabbat due to them,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Gentiles who besiege the cities of Israel - one may not go out against them with weapons, and one may not desecrate the Sabbath for them.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי נׇכְרִים שֶׁצָּרוּ וְכוּ׳. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים, כְּשֶׁבָּאוּ עַל עִסְקֵי מָמוֹן, אֲבָל בָּאוּ עַל עִסְקֵי נְפָשׁוֹת — יוֹצְאִין עֲלֵיהֶן בִּכְלֵי זֵיינָן, וּמְחַלְּלִין עֲלֵיהֶן אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: That was also taught gentiles who besieged, etc. In what is this said? where came with regard to monetary matters, However, if they came with regard to lives, they may go out against them with their weapons, and they may desecrate Shabbat due to them.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The following is the case with regard to gentiles who come and besiege a Jewish city, etc. In what circumstances are these matters stated? When they come for monetary matters, but if they come for matters concerning lives — we may violate the Sabbath for them.

hebrew_text: וּבָעִיר הַסְּמוּכָה לַסְּפָר, אֲפִילּוּ לֹא בָּאוּ עַל עִסְקֵי נְפָשׁוֹת אֶלָּא עַל עִסְקֵי תֶּבֶן וָקַשׁ — יוֹצְאִין עֲלֵיהֶן בִּכְלֵי זֵיינָן, וּמְחַלְּלִין עֲלֵיהֶן אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: And with regard to a town that is near the border, even if did not come with regard to lives, but with regard to matters of hay and straw, they may go out against them with their weapons, and they may desecrate Shabbat due to them,
llm_translation: In the city adjacent to the border, even if they came not for matters of life-saving but for matters of straw and stubble - they may go out with their weapons, and desecrate the Sabbath upon them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: וּבָבֶל, כָּעִיר הַסְּמוּכָה לַסְּפָר דָּמְיָא. וְתַרְגּוּמָא: נְהַרְדְּעָא.
human_translation: Rav Yosef bar Manyumi said Rav Naḥman said: And Babylonia is considered like a town near the border, And this means Neharde’a,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef bar Minyomei said in the name of Rav Nachman: "And Babylon is like a city adjacent to the Sefar Demya." And the translation is: Nehardea.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַבִּי דּוֹסְתַּאי דְּמִן בֵּירֵי: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּגִּידוּ לְדָוִד לֵאמֹר הִנֵּה פְלִשְׁתִּים נִלְחָמִים בִּקְעִילָה וְהֵמָּה שׁוֹסִים אֶת הַגֳּרָנוֹת״.
human_translation: Rabbi Dostai of Biri expounded: What is that which is written: “And they told David, saying: Behold, the Philistines are fighting against Ke’ila, and they rob the threshing floors”
llm_translation: Rabbi Dostai from Beirei expounded: What is the meaning of what is written: "And they told David, saying, 'Behold, the Philistines are fighting against Keilah, and they are robbing the threshing-floors.'"

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: קְעִילָה עִיר הַסְּמוּכָה לַסְּפָר הָיְתָה, וְהֵם לֹא בָּאוּ אֶלָּא עַל עִסְקֵי תֶּבֶן וָקַשׁ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהֵמָּה שׁוֹסִים אֶת הַגֳּרָנוֹת״. וּכְתִיב ״וַיִּשְׁאַל דָּוִד בַּה׳ לֵאמֹר הַאֵלֵךְ וְהִכֵּיתִי בַּפְּלִשְׁתִּים הָאֵלֶּה וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֶל דָּוִד לֵךְ וְהִכִּיתָ בַפְּלִשְׁתִּים וְהוֹשַׁעְתָּ אֶת קְעִילָה״.
human_translation: It was taught Ke’ila was a town near the border, came only with regard to matters of hay and straw, as it is written: “And they rob the threshing floors.” And it is written: “Therefore David inquired of the Lord, saying: Shall I go and smite these Philistines? And the Lord said to David: Go and smite the Philistines, and save Ke’ila”
llm_translation: Mishnah: Keilah was a city adjacent to the book, and they only came for matters of straw and stubble, as it is written: "And they were threshing in the winepresses." And it is written: "And David inquired of the Lord, saying, 'Shall I go and smite these Philistines?' And the Lord said to David, 'Go, and smite the Philistines, and save Keilah.'"

hebrew_text: מַאי קָמִבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ? אִילֵּימָא אִי שְׁרֵי אִי אָסוּר — הֲרֵי בֵּית דִּינוֹ שֶׁל שְׁמוּאֵל הָרָמָתִי קַיָּים.
human_translation: What is dilemma? If you say whether it was permitted or prohibited But the court of Samuel from Rama was in existence,
llm_translation: What is he asking about? If it is permitted or forbidden - the court of Shmuel the Ramatite is established.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: אִי מַצְלַח אִי לָא מַצְלַח. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״לֵךְ וְהִכִּיתָ בַפְּלִשְׁתִּים וְהוֹשַׁעְתָּ אֶת קְעִילָה״, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Will he succeed or will he not succeed This is also precise as it is written “Go and smite the Philistines, and save Ke’ila.” Learn from this,
llm_translation: Rather: whether successful or not successful. Precisely stated, as it is written: "Go and strike the Philistines and save Keilah," learn from it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁיָּשַׁב בַּדֶּרֶךְ, וְעָמַד וְרָאָה הֲרֵי (זֶה) הוּא סָמוּךְ לָעִיר, [הוֹאִיל] וְלֹא הָיְתָה כַּוּוֹנָתוֹ לְכָךְ — לֹא יִכָּנֵס. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: a person who was sitting along the road and he stood up he saw that he was near the town, since he had not intended he may not enter the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who was traveling on the road, and stopped and saw, behold, he is near the city, since it was not his intention for this — he should not enter. These are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: יִכָּנֵס. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה הָיָה וְנִכְנַס רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן בְּלֹא מִתְכַּוֵּין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: He may enter Rabbi Yehuda said: It once happened that Rabbi Tarfon entered without intention
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: He should enter. Rabbi Yehuda said: There was an incident, and Rabbi Tarfon entered without intent.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן שֶׁהָיָה מְהַלֵּךְ בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְחָשְׁכָה לוֹ, וְלָן חוּץ לָעִיר. לְשַׁחֲרִית מְצָאוּהוּ רוֹעֵי בָקָר, אָמְרוּ לוֹ: רַבִּי, הֲרֵי הָעִיר לְפָנֶיךָ, הִכָּנֵס! נִכְנַס וְיָשַׁב בְּבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ, וְדָרַשׁ כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Yehuda said: It once happened that Rabbi Tarfon was walking along the way and night fell upon him, and he spent the night outside the town. In the morning, cowherds found him said to him: Master, the town is before you; enter. He entered and sat in the study hall and taught the entire day.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A teaching was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said: There was an incident involving Rabbi Tarfon, who was walking on the road and darkness overtook him, and he lodged outside the city. In the morning, herdsmen found him, and they said to him: "Rabbi, behold the city is before you, enter!" He entered and sat in the study hall, and he expounded the entire day.

hebrew_text: (אָמְרוּ לוֹ): מִשָּׁם רְאָיָיה? שֶׁמָּא בְּלִבּוֹ הָיְתָה, אוֹ בֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ מוּבְלָע בְּתוֹךְ תְּחוּמוֹ הָיָה.
human_translation: said to proof from there? Perhaps he had it in mind or the study hall was subsumed within his limit.
llm_translation: (They said to him): From there a proof? Perhaps it was in his heart, or the study hall was within his boundary.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁיָּשַׁן בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְלָא יָדַע שֶׁחָשֵׁיכָה — יֵשׁ לוֹ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה לְכׇל רוּחַ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי.
human_translation: one who was sleeping along the road and did not know that night had fallen, he has two thousand cubits in each direction; Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who falls asleep on the road and does not know that it has become dark - he has a distance of two thousand cubits in every direction. These are the words of Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: וְהוּא בְּאֶמְצָעָן.
human_translation: But the Rabbis say: He has only four cubits, Rabbi Eliezer says: and he is in the middle of them,
llm_translation: The sages say: He has only four cubits. Rabbi Eliezer says: And that is in their midst.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לְאֵיזֶה רוּחַ שֶׁיִּרְצֶה יֵלֵךְ. וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוּדָה שֶׁאִם בֵּירַר לוֹ, שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לַחֲזוֹר בּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: He may walk in any direction he wishes. But Rabbi Yehuda agrees that if he selected for himself he cannot retract
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: To which spirit he will agree to go. And Rabbi Yehuda admits that if he clarified it for him, he cannot retract from it.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ שְׁנַיִם, מִקְצָת אַמּוֹתָיו שֶׁל זֶה בְּתוֹךְ אַמּוֹתָיו שֶׁל זֶה — מְבִיאִין וְאוֹכְלִין בָּאֶמְצַע,
human_translation: there were two part the cubits of one were subsumed within the cubits of the other, they may bring and eat in the middle,
llm_translation: If there were two, some of the cubits of this one within the cubits of that one - they bring and eat in the middle.

hebrew_text: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יוֹצִיא זֶה מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁלּוֹ לְתוֹךְ שֶׁל חֲבֵרוֹ.
human_translation: provided that the one does not carry from his into that of his fellow.
llm_translation: And only not he shall take out this from within his, to within of his fellow.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ שְׁלֹשָׁה וְהָאֶמְצָעִי מוּבְלָע בֵּינֵיהֶן — הוּא מוּתָּר עִמָּהֶן, וְהֵן מוּתָּרִין עִמּוֹ, וּשְׁנַיִם הַחִיצוֹנִים אֲסוּרִין זֶה עִם זֶה.
human_translation: were three and the middle one were subsumed within the others, he is permitted with them, and they are permitted with him; but the two outer ones are forbidden with each other,
llm_translation: Three and the middle one is interposed between them - he is permitted with them, and they are permitted with him, and the two outer ones are forbidden to each other.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה — לְשָׁלֹשׁ חֲצֵירוֹת הַפְּתוּחוֹת זוֹ לָזוֹ, וּפְתוּחוֹת לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים. עֵירְבוּ שְׁתַּיִם עִם הָאֶמְצָעִית — הִיא מוּתֶּרֶת עִמָּהֶן וְהֵם מוּתָּרוֹת עִמָּהּ, וּשְׁתַּיִם הַחִיצוֹנוֹת אֲסוּרוֹת זוֹ עִם זוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: To what is this comparable? three courtyards that open into one another, and open into a public domain. the two outer established an eiruv with the middle one, is permitted to and they are permitted to it, but the two outer are prohibited one to other,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: What is the matter comparable to? — To three courtyards open to one another, and open to a public domain. If two of them are combined with the middle one, it is permitted with them and they are permitted with it, but the two outer ones are prohibited to one another.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בָּעֵי רָבָא: מַאי קָסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי? מִסְבָּר קָא סָבַר: חֶפְצֵי הֶפְקֵר קוֹנִין שְׁבִיתָה.
human_translation: Rava raised a dilemma: What does Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri hold? he hold ownerless objects acquire residence
llm_translation: Gemara: What does Rava seek to say? What does Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri hold? He holds: One acquires ownership of ownerless objects through the act of acquisition.

hebrew_text: וּבְדִין הוּא דְּלִיפְלוֹג בְּכֵלִים. וְהָא דְּקָמִיפַּלְגִי בְּאָדָם — לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כּוֹחָן דְּרַבָּנַן, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר: הוֹאִיל וְנֵיעוֹר קָנָה, יָשֵׁן נָמֵי קָנָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּלָא.
human_translation: And should by right have disagreed about utensils And the reason that they disagreed about a person to convey the far-reaching of the Rabbis, that although there is to say: Since awake acquires he also acquires sleeping, teaches us that not
llm_translation: It is in the case of a dispute regarding utensils. And that which he disputes regarding a person — to inform you of the power of the Rabbis, even though there may be something to say: since a youth acquired, even a sleeping person acquired, it teaches us that it is not so.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִילְמָא, קָסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי בְּעָלְמָא: חֶפְצֵי הֶפְקֵר אֵין קוֹנִין שְׁבִיתָה, וְהָכָא הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא: הוֹאִיל וְנֵיעוֹר קָנָה, יָשֵׁן נָמֵי קָנָה?
human_translation: Or perhaps in general Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri holds ownerless objects do not acquire residence But here, the reason is as follows: Since awake acquires he also acquires sleeping.
llm_translation: Or perhaps, does Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri hold in general: Objects of hefker cannot acquire ownership of a Shvita, and here is the reason: Since a youth can acquire, can a sleeping person also acquire?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, תָּא שְׁמַע: גְּשָׁמִים שֶׁיָּרְדוּ מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב — יֵשׁ לָהֶן אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה לְכׇל רוּחַ. בְּיוֹם טוֹב — הֲרֵי הֵן כְּרַגְלֵי כׇּל אָדָם.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Come hear Rain that fell on the eve of a Festival has two thousand cubits in each direction, on the Festival it is like the feet of all people,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said, come and hear: Rain that falls from the evening of a festival - they have two thousand cubits for every wind. On a festival - they are like the feet of every person.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא קָסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי: ״חֶפְצֵי הֶפְקֵר קוֹנִין שְׁבִיתָה״, הָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הִיא.
human_translation: Granted, if you say that Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri holds ownerless objects acquire residence; whose this It is Rabbi Yoḥanan
llm_translation: If you say that Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri holds: "Items that are ownerless acquire ownership through being placed under a ban," then who is the authority? It is Rabbi Yochanan himself.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ: ״חֶפְצֵי הֶפְקֵר אֵין קוֹנִין שְׁבִיתָה״, הָא מַנִּי? לָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְלֹא רַבָּנַן!
human_translation: However, if you say ownerless objects do not acquire residence, whose this Neither Rabbi Yoḥanan nor the Rabbis,
llm_translation: Rather, if you say: "Items that are ownerless cannot be acquired through seizure," who is the authority? Not Rabbi Yochanan and not the Rabbis!

hebrew_text: יְתֵיב אַבָּיֵי וְקָאָמַר לַהּ לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב סָפְרָא לְאַבָּיֵי: וְדִילְמָא בִּגְשָׁמִים הַסְּמוּכִין לָעִיר עָסְקִינַן, וְאַנְשֵׁי אוֹתָהּ הָעִיר דַּעְתָּם עִילַּיְיהוּ!
human_translation: Abaye sat and recited this tradition. Rav Safra said to Abaye: Perhaps we are dealing with rain near a city, and the inhabitants of that city had it in mind,
llm_translation: Abbaye was sitting and saying to her, "Have you heard that?" Rav Safra said to Abbaye: "Perhaps we are dealing with rains close to the city, and the people of that city are knowledgeable about them!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דִּתְנַן: בּוֹר שֶׁל יָחִיד — כְּרַגְלֵי יָחִיד, וְשֶׁל אוֹתָהּ הָעִיר — כְּרַגְלֵי אוֹתָהּ הָעִיר, וְשֶׁל עוֹלֵי בָּבֶל — כְּרַגְלֵי הַמְמַלֵּא.
human_translation: said to him: It should not enter your mind as we learned A cistern that belongs to an individual, like the feet of that individual, And that belongs to a particular city, like the feet of that city, And that belongs to pilgrims from Babylonia like the feet of the one who draws
llm_translation: He said to him: Your opinion did not come out, as we learned: A pit of an individual - like the feet of an individual, and of that city - like the feet of that city, and of the residents of Babylon - like the feet of those who fill it.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא: בּוֹר שֶׁל שְׁבָטִים — יֵשׁ לָהֶן אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה לְכׇל רוּחַ. קַשְׁיָין אַהֲדָדֵי!
human_translation: And it was taught A cistern that belongs to the tribes has two thousand cubits in each direction. contradict each other,
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: A pit of rods - they have two thousand cubits for every direction. This is difficult!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הָא — רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי, הָא — רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rather, learn from here: This Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri, that the Rabbis,
llm_translation: Rather, no, learn from it: this — Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri, this — the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי קָאָמַר רַב סָפְרָא, וְהָכִי אַהְדַּרִי לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְאַמַּאי לָא תֵּימָא לֵיהּ מִגּוּפַהּ? אִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ גְּשָׁמִים הַסְּמוּכִין לָעִיר עָסְקִינַן — הַאי ״יֵשׁ לָהֶן אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה לְכׇל רוּחַ״?!
human_translation: when came before Rav Yosef, he said to him: This is what Rav Safra said, and this is what I answered him. said to him: And why did you not answer him from the itself? If it should enter your mind that we are dealing with rain near a city, that has two thousand cubits in each direction?
llm_translation: When he came before Rav Yosef, he said to him: "Thus did Rav Safra say, and thus did they respond to him." He said to him: "And why did you not say it directly from him? If it is because you were discussing matters related to the city, we are dealing with adjacent rains - does it have 'two thousand cubits for every wind'?"

hebrew_text: הָא ״כְּרַגְלֵי אַנְשֵׁי אוֹתָהּ הָעִיר״ מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ!
human_translation: should have like the feet of the inhabitants of that city.
llm_translation: This is the "like the feet of the people of that city" what is the question!

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: בְּיוֹם טוֹב — הֲרֵי הֵן כְּרַגְלֵי כׇּל אָדָם. וְאַמַּאי? לִיקְנֵי שְׁבִיתָה בְּאוֹקְיָינוֹס.
human_translation: The Master said: on the Festival it is like the feet of all people. And why should have acquired residence in the ocean [ okeyanos ],
llm_translation: Master said: On a festival day - behold they are like the feet of all people. And why? To acquire rest in the ocean.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּאִי כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר — הָא אָמַר: כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ מִמֵּי אוֹקְיָינוֹס הוּא שׁוֹתֶה!
human_translation: Let us say not in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer. Because if in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, he said: The entire world drinks from the waters of the ocean;
llm_translation: Let us say that it is not like Rabbi Eliezer, for if it were like Rabbi Eliezer - behold, he said: "The entire world is but a drop in the bucket of Akavya ben Mahalalel drinks!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: הָכָא בְּעָבִים שֶׁנִּתְקַשְּׁרוּ מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב עָסְקִינַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Here we are dealing with clouds that were formed on the eve of the Festival.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: Here in the case of clouds that became intertwined from the eve of a festival we are dealing with.

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא הָנָךְ אָזְלִי, וְהָנָךְ אַחֲרִינֵי נִינְהוּ? דְּאִית לְהוּ סִימָנָא בְּגַוַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: But perhaps those went and these are others where there is sign
llm_translation: Perhaps one of them went there, and the others are elsewhere? For there is a distinguishing mark on their bodies.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָוֵי סָפֵק דְּדִבְרֵיהֶם, וְסָפֵק דְּדִבְרֵיהֶם לְהָקֵל.
human_translation: And if you wish, say This an uncertainty a rabbinic law, an uncertainty a rabbinic law, lenient
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Be in doubt regarding their words, and be in doubt regarding their words to be lenient.

hebrew_text: וְלִיקְנִי שְׁבִיתָה בְּעָבִים! תִּיפְשׁוֹט מִינַּהּ, דְּאֵין תְּחוּמִין לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה. דְּאִי יֵשׁ תְּחוּמִין לִיקְנֵי שְׁבִיתָה בְּעָבִים!
human_translation: Let acquire residence in the clouds, resolve from here there is no limits above ten For if there is limits let acquire residence in the clouds.
llm_translation: And let him acquire a Sh'vita in the clouds! It should be removed from it, for there are no boundaries above ten. For if there are boundaries, let him acquire a Sh'vita in the clouds!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ: יֵשׁ תְּחוּמִין, וּמַיָּא בְּעֵיבָא מִיבְלָע בְּלִיעִי.
human_translation: Actually, say to you: There is limits and the water is absorbed in the clouds.
llm_translation: Forever say to you: there are boundaries, and water in the stomach is absorbed through drinking.

hebrew_text: כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן דְּהָווּ לְהוּ נוֹלָד, דַּאֲסִירִי!
human_translation: all the more so should it be came into being [ nolad ] prohibited
llm_translation: Certainly! Talmudic text: "Kol she'kein dehavu lehu nolad, da'asiri!" English translation: "All the more so if they were born to him, they are forbidden!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: מַיָּא בְּעָבִים מֵינָד נָיְידִי. הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָתֵית לְהָכִי, אוֹקְיָינוֹס נָמֵי לָא לִיקְשׁוֹ לָךְ, מַיָּא בְּאוֹקְיָינוֹס נָמֵי מֵינָד נָיְידִי, וְתַנְיָא: נְהָרוֹת הַמּוֹשְׁכִין וּמַעְיָינוֹת הַנּוֹבְעִין הֲרֵי הֵן כְּרַגְלֵי כׇּל אָדָם.
human_translation: Rather, The water in clouds in motion Now that you have arrived at this the ocean should also not be difficult for you, water in the ocean is also in motion. And it was taught Flowing rivers and streaming springs are like the feet of all people,
llm_translation: Rather: water in clouds from there flows. Now that you have come to this, the oceans are not enough for you, water in oceans from there flows, and it was taught: rivers that flow and springs that bubble are like the feet of all people.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא לְרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידִי: בְּפֵירוּשׁ שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ אוֹ מִכְּלָלָא שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּפֵירוּשׁ שְׁמִיעַ לִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri, Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi: you hear explicitly or did you understand it by inference said to him: I heard explicitly
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri. Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi: Do you have it explicitly from him or is it derived from inference? He said to him: I have it explicitly from him.

hebrew_text: מַאי כְּלָלָא? דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי הַמֵּיקֵל בְּעֵירוּב.
human_translation: what be inferred? which Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: The halakha is in accordance with the lenient with regard to an eiruv .
llm_translation: What is the principle? As Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: The halakha follows the opinion of the lenient in matters of Eruv.

hebrew_text: וְתַרְתֵּי לְמָה לִי?!
human_translation: Why do I need both?
llm_translation: And two, why do I need them?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא בֵּין לְקוּלָּא וּבֵין לְחוּמְרָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי הַמֵּיקֵל בְּעֵירוּב.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: were necessary, as had he informed us the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri, I would have said whether this is a leniency, or it is a stringency, Consequently, he teaches us the halakha is in accordance with the lenient with regard to an eiruv ,
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: I need, for if we would hear the halakha according to Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri, I would say whether for leniency or for stringency, he is teaching us the halakha according to the opinion of the one who is lenient in matters of Eruv.

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא ״הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי הַמֵּיקֵל בְּעֵירוּב״. הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: Let him state the halakha is in accordance with the lenient with regard to an eiruv . Why do I need the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri?
llm_translation: "And say, 'The halakha follows the lenient opinion in matters of Eruvin.' Why do I need the halakha to follow Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri?"

hebrew_text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי יָחִיד בִּמְקוֹם יָחִיד וְרַבִּים בִּמְקוֹם רַבִּים, אֲבָל יָחִיד בִּמְקוֹם רַבִּים — אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: was necessary it might have entered your mind to say this statement applies only a single with single or several several But a single several said not
llm_translation: It is necessary, as your mind has concluded, I say these matters: individual in a place of individual and many in a place of many, but individual in a place of many — say not.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְאַבָּיֵי: מִכְּדֵי עֵירוּבִין דְּרַבָּנַן, מָה לִי יָחִיד בִּמְקוֹם יָחִיד, וּמָה לִי יָחִיד בִּמְקוֹם רַבִּים!
human_translation: Rava said to Abaye: Now, since eiruvin are rabbinic what me a single with a single a single with several
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava to Abbaye: Since regarding the laws of eruv by the Rabbis, what do I need an individual in a private domain for, and what do I need an individual in a public domain for!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְרָבָא: וּבִדְרַבָּנַן לָא שָׁנֵי לַן בֵּין יָחִיד בִּמְקוֹם יָחִיד לְיָחִיד בִּמְקוֹם רַבִּים!
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Rava: Is there no difference with regard to rabbinic between a single with a single and a single several
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to Rava: "And regarding the Rabbis, it does not make a difference for us whether an individual is in a private domain or an individual in a public domain!"

hebrew_text: וְהָתְנַן, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל אִשָּׁה שֶׁעָבְרוּ עָלֶיהָ שָׁלֹשׁ עוֹנוֹת — דַּיָּיהּ שְׁעָתָהּ.
human_translation: Didn’t we learn Rabbi Elazar says: Any woman who passed three cycles it is enough from the time
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Elazar says: Any woman upon whom three periods have passed - her time is sufficient.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא: מַעֲשֶׂה וְעָשָׂה רַבִּי כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. לְאַחַר שֶׁנִּזְכַּר, אָמַר: כְּדַי הוּא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לִסְמוֹךְ עָלָיו בִּשְׁעַת הַדְּחָק.
human_translation: And it was taught It once happened that Rabbi ruled is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar. After he remembered he said: Rabbi Elazar is worthy to rely upon in exigent circumstances.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: The incident occurred, and Rabbi acted like Rabbi Elazar. After it was mentioned, he said: It is enough for Rabbi Elazar to rely on him in a time of distress.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״לְאַחַר שֶׁנִּזְכַּר״? אִילֵּימָא: לְאַחַר שֶׁנִּזְכַּר דְּאֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אֶלָּא כְּרַבָּנַן — בִּשְׁעַת הַדְּחָק הֵיכִי עָבֵיד כְּווֹתֵיהּ!
human_translation: What is After he remembered? If you say after he remembered the halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Elazar but in accordance with the Rabbis, how could he rule in accordance with him in exigent circumstances,
llm_translation: What is "after it was mentioned"? Perhaps: after it was mentioned that the halacha does not follow Rabbi Eliezer but rather the Rabbis - in a time of distress, what should one do with his principles!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: דְּלָא אִיתְּמַר הִלְכְתָא לָא כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְלָא כְּרַבָּנַן. ״לְאַחַר שֶׁנִּזְכַּר״ דְּלָאו יָחִיד פְּלִיג עֲלֵיהּ אֶלָּא רַבִּים פְּלִיגִי עֲלֵיהּ, אָמַר: כְּדַי הוּא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לִסְמוֹךְ עָלָיו בִּשְׁעַת הַדְּחָק.
human_translation: Rather, halakha not been stated neither in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, nor in accordance with the Rabbis. And after he remembered that it was not a single disagreed with but several disagreed with him, he said: Rabbi Elazar is worthy to rely upon in exigent circumstances.
llm_translation: Rather: that it was not stated the halakha is not like Rabbi Eliezer and not like the Rabbis. "After it was mentioned" - it is not an individual who disputes it, but many who dispute it. He said: It is sufficient for Rabbi Eliezer to rely on it in a time of distress.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא לְרָבָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק לְרָבָא: וּבִדְרַבָּנַן לָא שָׁנֵי בֵּין יָחִיד בִּמְקוֹם יָחִיד, בֵּין יָחִיד בִּמְקוֹם רַבִּים?
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiya said to Rava, and some say Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak to Rava: Is there no difference with regard to rabbinic between a single with a single and a single with several
llm_translation: Rav Mesharshaya said to Rava, and some say it was Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak who said to Rava: And regarding the Rabbanan, is there a difference between an individual in a private domain and an individual in a public domain?

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: שְׁמוּעָה קְרוֹבָה נוֹהֶגֶת שִׁבְעָה וּשְׁלֹשִׁים, רְחוֹקָה אֵינָהּ נוֹהֶגֶת אֶלָּא יוֹם אֶחָד.
human_translation: Wasn’t it was taught a proximate report he practices seven thirty a distant he practices one day
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: Shemuah the near one drives thirty-seven, the distant one drives only one day.

hebrew_text: וְאֵי זוֹ הִיא קְרוֹבָה וְאֵיזוֹ הִיא רְחוֹקָה? בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים — קְרוֹבָה, לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים — רְחוֹקָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אַחַת שְׁמוּעָה קְרוֹבָה וְאַחַת שְׁמוּעָה רְחוֹקָה נוֹהֶגֶת שִׁבְעָה וּשְׁלֹשִׁים.
human_translation: What is proximate and what is distant within thirty proximate, after thirty distant; the statement of Rabbi Akiva. But the Rabbis say: Both a proximate report and a distant report, practices seven- and thirty-
llm_translation: And which is considered close and which is considered far? Within thirty - close, after thirty - far, the words of Rabbi Akiva. And the sages say: One report heard is close and one report heard is far is practiced thirty-seven.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאַתָּה מוֹצֵא יָחִיד מֵיקֵל וְרַבִּים מֵחֲמִירִין, הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי הַמַּחְמִירִין הַמְרוּבִּים, חוּץ מִזּוֹ, שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מֵיקֵל וַחֲכָמִים מֵחֲמִירִין — הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Wherever you find a single is lenient and several are stringent, the halakha is in accordance with the words of the stringent the majority, except for here, where despite Rabbi Akiva is lenient and the Rabbis is stringent, the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: In every place where you find an individual lenient and the majority stringent, the halakha follows the view of the stringent majority, except for this case, where even though Rabbi Akiva is lenient and the Sages are stringent, the halakha follows the view of Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר לַהּ כִּשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי הַמֵּיקֵל בְּאֵבֶל.
human_translation: And holds like Shmuel, as Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with the lenient with mourning
llm_translation: And he reasoned with her like Shmuel, for Shmuel said: The halakha follows the lenient opinion in matters of mourning.

hebrew_text: בַּאֲבֵילוּת הוּא דְּאַקִּילוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן, אֲבָל בְּעָלְמָא — אֲפִילּוּ בִּדְרַבָּנַן שָׁנֵי בֵּין יָחִיד בִּמְקוֹם יָחִיד בֵּין יָחִיד בִּמְקוֹם רַבִּים.
human_translation: It is with regard to mourning that the Sages were lenient, but in general, even in the case of rabbinic there is a difference a single with a single a single with several
llm_translation: In mourning is it that the Rabbis were lenient with it, but in general — even with regard to Rabbis, there is a difference between an individual in a private place and an individual in a public place.

hebrew_text: וְרַב פָּפָּא אָמַר, אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּעֵירוּבֵי חֲצֵירוֹת, אֲבָל בְּעֵירוּבֵי תְחוּמִין — אֵימָא לָא צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said It was necessary it could have entered your mind to say this statement applies only with regard to eiruv of courtyards, But with regard to eiruv of limits, said not it was necessary
llm_translation: Rav Papa said, I will explain, the reason, the conclusion of your opinion: those matters in the laws of combining courtyards, but in the laws of boundaries — say it is not necessary.

hebrew_text: וּמְנָא תֵּימְרָא דְּשָׁנֵי לַן בֵּין עֵירוּבֵי חֲצֵירוֹת לְעֵירוּבֵי תְּחוּמִין — דִּתְנַן, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּעֵירוּבֵי תְחוּמִין, אֲבָל בְּעֵירוּבֵי חֲצֵירוֹת מְעָרְבִין בֵּין לְדַעַת וּבֵין שֶׁלֹּא לְדַעַת, שֶׁזָּכִין לְאָדָם שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו, וְאֵין חָבִין לְאָדָם אֶלָּא בְּפָנָיו.
human_translation: And from where do you say that we distinguish between an eiruv of courtyards and an eiruv of limits? As we learned Rabbi Yehuda said: In what is this statement said, with regard to an eiruv of limits, but with regard to an eiruv of courtyards, an eiruv may be established with his knowledge or without his knowledge, as one may act in a person’s interest in his absence; however, one may not act to a person’s disadvantage in his absence.
llm_translation: And who will say that we differ regarding the laws of combining courtyards for the purpose of the Sabbath boundary — as we learned, Rabbi Yehuda said: In what case are these matters stated? In the laws of the Sabbath boundary, but in the laws of combining courtyards, one can combine whether intentionally or unintentionally, for one can acquire for oneself even without one's knowledge, but one can only obligate oneself with one's knowledge.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא, הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּשִׁיּוּרֵי עֵירוּב, אֲבָל בִּתְחִילַּת עֵירוּב — אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said It is necessary it could have entered your mind to say this statement applies only with regard to the remnants of an eiruv , But with regard to an initial eiruv , said not
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: It is necessary, for I might have thought, that those matters apply to the clarification of an eruv, but at the beginning of the eruv - I would say no.

hebrew_text: וּמְנָא תֵּימְרָא דְּשָׁנֵי לַן בֵּין שִׁיּוּרֵי עֵירוּב לִתְחִילַּת עֵירוּב — דִּתְנַן, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בִּתְחִילַּת עֵירוּב, אֲבָל בְּשִׁיּוּרֵי עֵירוּב — אֲפִילּוּ כָּל שֶׁהוּא.
human_translation: And from where do you say that we distinguish between the remnants of an eiruv and an initial eiruv ? As we learned Rabbi Yosei said: In what is this statement said, with regard to an initial eiruv , however, with regard to the remnants of an eiruv , even a minimal amount
llm_translation: And who will say that we differ between the measurement of the Eruv and the beginning of the Eruv? For we learned: Rabbi Yosei said: In what case are these words said? At the beginning of the Eruv, but in the measurement of the Eruv - even a small amount.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא אָמְרוּ לְעָרֵב חֲצֵירוֹת, אֶלָּא כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא לְשַׁכֵּחַ תּוֹרַת עֵירוּב מִן הַתִּינוֹקוֹת.
human_translation: And they said to establish an eiruv for courtyards only so that the law of eiruv should not be forgotten by the children,
llm_translation: And not they said to mix courtyards, rather in order not to forget the law of Eruv from the children.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב וְרַבִּי זְרִיקָא אָמְרוּ: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ, וּכְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי מֵחֲבֵרָיו, וּכְרַבִּי מֵחֲבֵירוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov and Rabbi Zerika said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Akiva with Sage, and is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei with Sages, and the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi with Sage.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yaakov and Rabbi Zerika said: The halacha follows Rabbi Akiva from his colleagues, and like Rabbi Yosei from his colleagues, and like Rabbi from his colleague.

hebrew_text: לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר: הֲלָכָה. וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר: מַטִּין. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר: נִרְאִין.
human_translation: to what halakha Rabbi Asi said: halakha . And Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said: One is inclined And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: It appears
llm_translation: Regarding what is the halakha? Rabbi Assi said: Halakha. And Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said: Matin. And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Hanina, said: They appear.

hebrew_text: כַּלָּשׁוֹן הַזֶּה אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה — הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי — הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי — הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. הַשְׁתָּא בִּמְקוֹם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לֵיתָא, בִּמְקוֹם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי מִיבַּעְיָא?!
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda, halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda; Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yosei, halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei; and, needless to say, Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yosei, halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. now, in disputes with Rabbi Yehuda, is not need it in disputes with Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: In this manner said Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi said Rabbi Yochanan: Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda - the halacha is like Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yosei - the halacha is like Rabbi Yosei. And needless to say, Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yosei - the halacha is like Rabbi Yosei. Is there a question that in the place of Rabbi Yehuda it is preferable, but in the place of Rabbi Yosei is it necessary?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: אַף אֲנִי לוֹמֵד: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן — הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן — הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. הַשְׁתָּא בִּמְקוֹם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לֵיתָא, בִּמְקוֹם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי מִיבַּעְיָא?
human_translation: Rav Asi said: I also learn Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon, halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. As Rabbi Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon, halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. Now, where Rabbi Yehuda is not where Rabbi Yosei, is it necessary
llm_translation: Rav Assi said: I also learn: Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon - the halacha is like Rabbi Yosei, as Rabbi Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon - the halacha is like Rabbi Yehuda. Now, in a place where Rabbi Yehuda is present, is there a need for Rabbi Yosei?

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, מַאי? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: raises a dilemma: Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Shimon, what stands
llm_translation: The question was asked: Regarding Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Shimon, what is the ruling? It shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: לֵיתַנְהוּ לְהָנֵי כְּלָלֵי. מְנָא לֵיהּ לְרַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא הָא?
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiya said: These principles are not From where does Rav Mesharshiya this
llm_translation: Rav Mesharshya said: Let them give to those communities. From where does Rav Mesharshya derive this?

hebrew_text: אִילֵּימָא מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה — לְשָׁלֹשׁ חֲצֵירוֹת הַפְּתוּחוֹת זוֹ לָזוֹ וּפְתוּחוֹת לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים. עֵירְבוּ שְׁתַּיִם הַחִיצוֹנוֹת עִם הָאֶמְצָעִית — הִיא מוּתֶּרֶת עִמָּהֶן וְהֵן מוּתָּרוֹת עִמָּהּ, וּשְׁתַּיִם הַחִיצוֹנוֹת אֲסוּרוֹת זוֹ עִם זוֹ.
human_translation: If you say from that which we learned Rabbi Shimon said: To what is this comparable? three courtyards that open into one another, and open into a public domain. the two outer established an eiruv with the middle one, are permitted to and they are permitted to it, but the two outer are prohibited to one other,
llm_translation: Firstly, from what we learned: Rabbi Shimon says, "To what can this matter be compared? To three courtyards that open into one another, and their openings are to the public domain. If two outer courtyards are combined with the middle one, it is permitted with them, and they are permitted with it, but if two outer courtyards are combined with each other, they are prohibited."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חָמָא בַּר גּוּרְיָא אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. וּמַאן פְּלִיג עֲלֵיהּ — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וְהָא אָמְרַתְּ: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן — הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: לֵיתַנְהוּ?
human_translation: And Rav Ḥama bar Gurya said Rav said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon; and who disagrees with Rabbi Yehuda. Didn’t you say: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon, halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda? Rather, can we not conclude from not
llm_translation: And Rav Ḥama son of Gurya said in the name of Rav: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. And who disputes him? Rabbi Yehuda. But didn't you say: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon - the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. Rather, is it not that we do not accept it from him?

hebrew_text: וּמַאי קוּשְׁיָא, דִּילְמָא הֵיכָא דְּאִיתְּמַר — אִיתְּמַר, הֵיכָא דְּלָא אִיתְּמַר — לָא אִיתְּמַר.
human_translation: What is the difficulty Perhaps where it is stated it is stated, where it is not stated it is not stated,
llm_translation: And what is the question, perhaps where it is stated - it is stated, where it is not stated - it is not stated.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: עִיר שֶׁל יָחִיד וְנַעֲשֵׂית שֶׁל רַבִּים — מְעָרְבִין אֶת כּוּלָּהּ. שֶׁל רַבִּים וְנַעֲשֵׂית שֶׁל יָחִיד — אֵין מְעָרְבִין אֶת כּוּלָּהּ אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן עוֹשֶׂה חוּצָה לָהּ, כָּעִיר חֲדָשָׁה שֶׁבִּיהוּדָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ חֲמִשִּׁים דָּיוֹרִין — דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Rather, from that which we learned If a city that belongs to a individual becomes belongs to many one may establish an eiruv for all of it. belongs to many and it of a individual, one may not establish an eiruv for all of it, unless he excludes of the town of Ḥadasha in Judea, which contains fifty residents; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Rather, from that which we learned: A city belonging to an individual that becomes a city of many — they combine all of it. If it belongs to many and becomes a city of an individual — they do not combine all of it unless he makes a separate courtyard for it, like a new city in Judah that has fifty residents — the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says:
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says:

hebrew_text: שָׁלֹשׁ חֲצֵירוֹת שֶׁל שְׁנֵי בָתִּים. וְאָמַר רַב חָמָא בַּר גּוּרְיָא אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. וּמַאן פְּלִיג עֲלֵיהּ — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וְהָא אָמְרַתְּ: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן — הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה!
human_translation: three courtyards containing two houses And Rav Ḥama bar Gurya said Rav said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon; and who disagrees with Rabbi Yehuda. Didn’t you say: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda?
llm_translation: Three courtyards of two houses. And Rav Hama son of Gurya said in the name of Rav: The halakha is according to Rabbi Shimon. And who disputes it? Rabbi Yehuda. But didn't you say: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon - the halakha is according to Rabbi Yehuda!

hebrew_text: ומַאי קוּשְׁיָא? דִילְמָא הָכָא נָמֵי, הֵיכָא דְּאִיתְּמַר — אִיתְּמַר, הֵיכָא דְּלָא אִיתְּמַר — לָא אִיתְּמַר.
human_translation: What is the difficulty Perhaps here, too, where it is stated it is stated, where it is not stated it is not stated,
llm_translation: And what is the question? Perhaps here it is stated, where it is stated - it is stated, where it is not stated - it is not stated.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: הַמַּנִּיחַ אֶת בֵּיתוֹ וְהָלַךְ לִשְׁבּוֹת בְּעִיר אַחֶרֶת, אֶחָד נָכְרִי וְאֶחָד יִשְׂרָאֵל — אוֹסֵר לִבְנֵי חֲצֵירוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: Rather, from that which we learned one who left his house and established residence in a different town, whether a gentile or a Jew, prohibits the residents of the courtyards the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Rather, from what we learned: One who leaves his house and goes to dwell in another city, one being a non-Jew and one being a Jew - he prohibits the residents of the courtyards, the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ אוֹסֵר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: נָכְרִי — אוֹסֵר, יִשְׂרָאֵל — אֵינוֹ אוֹסֵר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵין דֶּרֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל לָבֹא בַּשַּׁבָּת. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ הִנִּיחַ אֶת בֵּיתוֹ וְהָלַךְ לִשְׁבּוֹת אֵצֶל בִּתּוֹ בְּאוֹתָהּ הָעִיר — אֵינוֹ אוֹסֵר, שֶׁכְּבָר הִסִּיחַ דַּעְתּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: His does not prohibit Rabbi Yosei says: a gentile prohibits a Jew does not prohibit as it is not the way of a Jew to return on Shabbat Rabbi Shimon says: Even if he left his house and established residence with his daughter in the same town, his does not prohibit because he has already removed it, from his mind.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: he does not forbid. Rabbi Yosei says: a non-Jew forbids, a Jew does not forbid, because it is not the way of a Jew to enter into Shabbat. Rabbi Shimon says: even if he left his house and went to spend Shabbat with his daughter in that city - he does not forbid, for he has already distracted his mind.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חָמָא בַּר גּוּרְיָא אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, וּמַאן פְּלִיג עֲלֵיהּ — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וְהָא אָמְרַתְּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה!
human_translation: And Rav Ḥama bar Gurya said Rav said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. And who disagrees with him? Rabbi Yehuda. Didn’t you say: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon, halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda?
llm_translation: And Rav Ḥama son of Gurya said in the name of Rav: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. And who disputes him? Rabbi Yehuda. But didn't you say that Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon agree that the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda!

hebrew_text: וּמַאי קוּשְׁיָא? דִּלְמָא הָכָא נָמֵי, הֵיכָא דְּאִיתְּמַר — אִיתְּמַר, הֵיכָא דְּלָא אִיתְּמַר — לָא אִיתְּמַר.
human_translation: What is the difficulty Perhaps here, too, where it is stated it is stated; where is not stated, it is not stated,
llm_translation: And what is the question? Perhaps here it is stated, where it is stated - it is stated, where it is not stated - it is not stated.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: וְזֶהוּ שֶׁאָמְרוּ הֶעָנִי מְעָרֵב בְּרַגְלָיו. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אָנוּ אֵין לָנוּ אֶלָּא עָנִי.
human_translation: Rather, from that which we learned And that is what they said: A pauper can establish an eiruv with his feet; Rabbi Meir says: We only to a pauper,
llm_translation: Rather, from what we learned: And this is what they said, "The poor person may mix with his feet." Rabbi Meir says: We have nothing but the poor person.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד עָנִי וְאֶחָד עָשִׁיר. לֹא אָמְרוּ מְעָרְבִין בְּפַת אֶלָּא לְהָקֵל עַל הֶעָשִׁיר, שֶׁלֹּא יֵצֵא וִיעָרֵב בְּרַגְלָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: both to a pauper and to a wealthy person. they said one can establish an eiruv with bread only in order to easier for a wealthy person, so that he not go out and establish an eiruv with his feet,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: One poor and one rich. They did not say to mix in bread except to lighten the burden on the rich, so that he does not go out and mix with his feet.

hebrew_text: וּמַתְנֵי לֵיהּ רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי לְחִיָּיא בַּר רַב קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב: אֶחָד עָנִי וְאֶחָד עָשִׁיר. וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב, סַיֵּים בָּהּ נָמֵי: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi taught Ḥiyya bar Rav in the presence of Rav, both to a pauper and to a wealthy person, and Rav said to him: conclude also with halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And Rav Chiya bar Ashei taught Chiya bar Rav before Rav: One poor and one rich. And Rav said to him, 'Conclude it truly: The halacha is according to Rabbi Yehuda.'"

hebrew_text: תַּרְתֵּי לְמָה לִי, וְהָא אָמְרַתְּ: רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה — הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה!
human_translation: Why do I need a second Didn’t you say: Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda, halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda?
llm_translation: Two reasons why is it necessary for me, and this is what you said: Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda — the halakha is like Rabbi Yehuda!

hebrew_text: וּמַאי קוּשְׁיָא? דִּילְמָא רַב לֵית לֵיהּ לְהָנֵי כְּלָלֵי?
human_translation: What is the difficulty Perhaps Rav does not accept these principles,
llm_translation: And what is the question? Perhaps Rav does not have those principles?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: הַיְּבָמָה לֹא תַּחֲלוֹץ וְלֹא תִּתְיַיבֵּם עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ לָהּ שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים.
human_translation: Rather, from that which we learned The woman waiting for her brother-in-law may neither participate in ḥalitza nor undergo levirate marriage until three months have passed
llm_translation: Rather, from that which we learned: The yevamah shall not perform chalitzah nor shall she undergo yibum until she has three months.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן שְׁאָר כׇּל הַנָּשִׁים לֹא יִנָּשְׂאוּ וְלֹא יִתְאָרְסוּ עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ לָהֶן שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, אֶחָד בְּתוּלוֹת וְאֶחָד בְּעוּלוֹת, אֶחָד אַלְמָנוֹת וְאֶחָד גְּרוּשׁוֹת, אֶחָד אֲרוּסוֹת וְאֶחָד נְשׂוּאוֹת.
human_translation: And similarly, all other women may not be married or betrothed until three months have passed whether virgins or non-virgins, whether widows or divorcees, whether betrothed or married.
llm_translation: And so too all other women may not be married and may not be betrothed until they have three months, one for virgins, one for those who are married, one for widows, and one for divorced women, one for engaged women, and one for married women.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: נְשׂוּאוֹת — יִתְאָרְסוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: married may be betrothed
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: "Nesuot - yit'ar'su."

hebrew_text: וַאֲרוּסוֹת — יִנָּשְׂאוּ, חוּץ מֵאֲרוּסָה שֶׁבִּיהוּדָה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלִּבּוֹ גַּס בָּהּ.
human_translation: betrothed may be married except for a betrothed woman in Judea, because heart is bold,
llm_translation: Engaged women - may be married, except for an engaged woman from the tribe of Judah, because his heart is haughty towards her.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַנָּשִׁים יִתְאָרְסוּ, חוּץ מִן הָאַלְמָנָה — מִפְּנֵי הָאִיבּוּל.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: All the women may be betrothed except for a widow, because mourning
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: All women may marry, except for the widow - due to the disgrace.

hebrew_text: וְאָמְרִינַן: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לָא עָל לְבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא. אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אַסִּי דַּהֲוָה קָאֵים. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי אֲמוּר בְּבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי אֲמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. מִכְּלָל דִּיחִידָאָה פְּלִיג עֲלֵיהּ?
human_translation: And we said Rabbi Eliezer did not come to the study hall. He met Rabbi Asi, who was standing, said to him: What did they say in the study hall? He said to him Rabbi Yoḥanan said as follows: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. By inference, a single disagrees with him?
llm_translation: We say: Rabbi Eliezer did not come to the study hall. He found Rabbi Assi who was standing. He said to him: What is being said in the study hall? He said to him, thus said Rabbi Yochanan: The halacha is according to Rabbi Yosei. From the fact that he is an individual, does he argue against him?

hebrew_text: אִין, וְהָתַנְיָא: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיְתָה רְדוּפָה לֵילֵךְ לְבֵית אָבִיהָ, אוֹ שֶׁהָיְתָה לָהּ כַּעַס עִם בַּעְלָהּ, אוֹ שֶׁהָיָה בַּעְלָהּ זָקֵן אוֹ חוֹלֶה, אוֹ שֶׁהָיְתָה הִיא חוֹלָה, עֲקָרָה, זְקֵנָה, קְטַנָּה וְאַיְילוֹנִית, וְשֶׁאֵינָהּ רְאוּיָה לֵילֵד, אוֹ שֶׁהָיָה בַּעְלָהּ חָבוּשׁ בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִין, הַמַּפֶּלֶת לְאַחַר מִיתַת בַּעְלָהּ — כּוּלָּן צְרִיכִין לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי מַתִּיר לֵיאָרֵס וְלִינָּשֵׂא מִיָּד.
human_translation: Yes, and it was taught If was eager to go to her father’s house or was angry with her husband or her husband was elderly or sick or she was sick, barren, an elderly woman, a minor, or a sexually underdeveloped woman or a woman who was unfit to give birth or her husband was imprisoned in jail, she had miscarried after the death of her husband, all must wait three months the statement of Rabbi Meir, Rabbi Yosei permits to be betrothed and to marry immediately.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ein, vehatan'ya: harei shehaytah redufah lelekh lebeit aviyah, o shehaytah lah ka'as im ba'alah, o shehayah ba'alah zaken o holeh, o shehaytah hi holeh, akarah, zekeinah, ketanah ve'ayilonit, vehesheinah reuyah leiled, o shehayah ba'alah chavush bebeit ha'asurin, hamafelet le'achar mitat ba'alah — kullam tzerikhin lehamtin shloshah chodashim, divrei Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei matir le'arays velinasei miyad." English translation: "No, and it was taught: If she was being pursued to go to her father's house, or if she had anger with her husband, or if her husband was old or sick, or if she herself was sick, barren, old, young, or a minor, and she is not fit to conceive, or if her husband was imprisoned in a house of detention, they all require waiting three months, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei permits engagement and marriage immediately."

hebrew_text: לְמָה לִי? וְהָא אָמְרַתְּ רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי — הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי!
human_translation: Why do I need Didn’t you say: Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yosei, halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: "Why do I need it? But didn't Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yosei say - the halacha follows Rabbi Yosei!"

hebrew_text: וּמַאי קוּשְׁיָא? דִּלְמָא לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר בִּגְזֵירוֹתָיו.
human_translation: What is the difficulty Perhaps comes to exclude Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Meir with respect to his decrees,
llm_translation: And what is the question? Perhaps to refute from the statement of Rav Nachman who said in the name of Shmuel, as he said: The halakha is like Rabbi Meir in his decrees.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מֵהָא דְּתַנְיָא: הוֹלְכִין לְיָרִיד שֶׁל נׇכְרִים וְלוֹקְחִים מֵהֶן בְּהֵמָה וַעֲבָדִים וּשְׁפָחוֹת, בָּתִּים שָׂדוֹת וּכְרָמִים, וְכוֹתֵב וּמַעֲלֶה בְּעַרְכָּאוֹת שֶׁלָּהֶן, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא כְּמַצִּיל מִיָּדָן.
human_translation: Rather, from that which was taught One may go to a fair of gentiles and buy animals, slaves, and maidservants from them, houses, fields, and vineyards and he may write and confirm in their courts because it is as though he were rescuing from their hands,
llm_translation: Rather, from what is taught: They go down to the market of idolaters and take from them cattle, slaves, and maidservants, houses, fields, and vineyards, and write and raise their deeds of sale, because he is like one who saves from their hands.

hebrew_text: וְאִם הָיָה כֹּהֵן — מִטַּמֵּא בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ לָדוּן וּלְעַרְעֵר עִמָּהֶן. וּכְשֵׁם שֶׁמִּטַּמֵּא בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ — כָּךְ מִטַּמֵּא בְּבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת.
human_translation: And if he is a priest, he may become ritually impure outside Eretz to litigate and to contest And just as may become ritually impure outside Eretz so may he become ritually impure into a cemetery.
llm_translation: If he was a kohen — from becoming impure outside the land to judge and to be stringent with them. And just as he becomes impure outside the land — so too he becomes impure in the cemetery.

hebrew_text: בֵּית הַקְּבָרוֹת סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! טוּמְאָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הִיא!
human_translation: Can it enter your mind a cemetery? ritually impure by Torah law.
llm_translation: The cemetery, is it according to your opinion?! It is impure by Torah law!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בְּבֵית הַפְּרָס, דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rather, an area where there is uncertainty with regard to the location of a grave or a corpse [ beit haperas ], by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Rather, in the house of Persia, of the sages.

hebrew_text: וּמִטַּמֵּא לִישָּׂא אִשָּׁה, וְלִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֵימָתַי — בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין מוֹצֵא לִלְמוֹד, אֲבָל מוֹצֵא לִלְמוֹד — לֹא יִטַּמָּא.
human_translation: And may become ritually impure to marry a woman or to study Torah Rabbi Yehuda said: When he cannot find to study But to study he may not become ritually impure
llm_translation: And from becoming impure to marry a woman, and to learn Torah. Rabbi Yehuda said: When? - When one cannot find time to learn, but if one can find time to learn - one should not become impure.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אַף בִּזְמַן שֶׁמּוֹצֵא לִלְמוֹד — נָמֵי יִטַּמָּא, לְפִי
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Even when he can find to study he may also become ritually impure, because
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Even at the time when one goes out to study, let him be silent, according to...

hebrew_text: שֶׁאֵין מִן הַכֹּל זוֹכֶה אָדָם לִלְמוֹד. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּיוֹסֵף הַכֹּהֵן שֶׁהָלַךְ אֵצֶל רַבּוֹ לְצַיְדָּן לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: a person does not merit to learn from everyone, And Rabbi Yosei reported It once happened that Yosef the priest went to his teacher in Tzeidan, to learn Torah,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "That from all not merits a person to learn. And said Rabbi Yosei: There was an incident with Yosef the priest that he went to his teacher to Tzaydan to learn Torah." English translation: "That from all not merits a person to learn. And said Rabbi Yosei: There was an incident with Yosef the priest that he went to his teacher to Tzaydan to learn Torah."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. וּלְמָה לִי? וְהָא אָמְרַתְּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי — הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי!
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. Why Didn’t you say: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yosei, the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: The halacha is like Rabbi Yosei. And why do I need it? But didn't you say Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yosei - the halacha is like Rabbi Yosei!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי — בְּמַתְנִיתִין, אֲבָל בְּבָרַיְיתָא — אֵימָא לָא. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן
human_translation: Abaye said: It was necessary it entered your mind to say this applies in the Mishna. But in a baraita , say no, is teaching us
llm_translation: Abaye said: It is necessary, for if you were to say: these matters - in the Mishnah, but in the Baraita - I would say no. This is implied to us.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: הָנֵי כְּלָלֵי לָאו דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל נִינְהוּ, דְּהָא רַב לֵית לֵיהּ הָנֵי כְּלָלֵי.
human_translation: Rather, this is saying: These principles were not accepted by all as Rav did not accept these principles,
llm_translation: Thus he said: Those general principles are not the words of everyone, for Rav does not hold by those general principles.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: חֶפְצֵי נָכְרִי אֵין קוֹנִין שְׁבִיתָה.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: Objects belonging to a gentile do not acquire residence
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The possessions of a non-Jew do not acquire ownership through seizure.

hebrew_text: לְמַאן, אִילֵּימָא לְרַבָּנַן — פְּשִׁיטָא! הַשְׁתָּא חֶפְצֵי הֶפְקֵר דְּלֵית לְהוּ בְּעָלִים, אֵין קוֹנִין שְׁבִיתָה. חֶפְצֵי הַנׇּכְרִי, דְּאִית לְהוּ בְּעָלִים, מִיבַּעְיָא?
human_translation: In accordance with whose If you say in accordance with the Rabbis, obvious. Now, unclaimed objects, which do not have owners, do not acquire residence, is it necessary a gentile’s objects, which have an owner,
llm_translation: To whom? If you say to the sages - it is obvious! Now, items that are ownerless, as they have no owners, one cannot acquire possession of them. But what about items belonging to a non-Jew, who does have an owner, is it necessary?
