hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי, וְקָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: אֵימַר דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי קוֹנִין שְׁבִיתָה — הָנֵי מִילֵּי חֶפְצֵי הֶפְקֵר, דְּלֵית לְהוּ בְּעָלִים. אֲבָל חֶפְצֵי הַנׇּכְרִי, דְּאִית לְהוּ בְּעָלִים — לָא.
human_translation: Rather, in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri, and is teaching us say Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri said acquire residence, this applies only unclaimed objects, which have no owners; but not objects to a gentile, which have owners.
llm_translation: Rather, in the teaching of Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri, and it implies to us: When Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri said that we establish a prohibition - those items that are ownerless property, as they have no owners. But items belonging to a non-Jew, as they have owners - no.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הַשּׁוֹאֵל כְּלִי מִן הַנׇּכְרִי בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְכֵן הַמַּשְׁאִיל לוֹ לַנׇּכְרִי כְּלִי מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב וְהֶחְזִירוֹ לוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְהַכֵּלִים וְהָאוֹצָרוֹת שֶׁשָּׁבְתוּ בְּתוֹךְ הַתְּחוּם — יֵשׁ לָהֶן אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה לְכׇל רוּחַ. וְנׇכְרִי שֶׁהֵבִיא לוֹ פֵּירוֹת מִחוּץ לַתְּחוּם — הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יְזִיזֵם מִמְּקוֹמָן.
human_translation: The Gemara raises an objection Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: who borrowed a utensil from a gentile on a Festival, and similarly who lent a utensil to a gentile on the eve of a Festival and returned it to him on the Festival, and utensils or bins that acquired residence within the limit, have, two thousand cubits in each direction. But if a gentile brought produce from outside limit, may not move it from its place.
llm_translation: The question was raised: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: One who borrows a vessel from a non-Jew on a festival, and likewise one who lends a vessel to a non-Jew on the eve of a festival and the non-Jew returns it to him on the festival day, and vessels and treasures that were left within the boundary on Shabbat — they have a limit of two thousand cubits in every direction. And a non-Jew who brought him fruits from outside the boundary — he may not move them from their place.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא קָסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי חֶפְצֵי נׇכְרִי קוֹנִין שְׁבִיתָה, הָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי הִיא.
human_translation: Granted if you say that Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri holds objects that belong to a gentile acquire residence, this whose It Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri,
llm_translation: If you say, "In truth, Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri holds that non-Jews can acquire ownership through shvita," then I maintain: "It is Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri himself."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ קָסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי חֶפְצֵי הַנׇּכְרִי אֵין קוֹנִין שְׁבִיתָה, הָא מַנִּי — לָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי וְלָא רַבָּנַן!
human_translation: However, if you say that Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri holds objects belonging to a gentile do not acquire residence, whose this neither Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri nor the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Rather, if you say that Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri holds that the property of a non-Jew cannot be acquired through seizure, then I say: Neither Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri nor the Rabbis!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם קָסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי חֶפְצֵי הַנׇּכְרִי קוֹנִין שְׁבִיתָה, וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר כְּרַבָּנַן, וּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ: לְרַבָּנַן פְּשִׁיטָא — מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: גְּזֵירָה בְּעָלִים דְּנׇכְרִי אַטּוּ בְּעָלִים דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Actually, Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri holds a gentile’s objects acquire residence, Shmuel, spoke in accordance with the Rabbis. And that which you said, according to the Rabbis, obvious you might have said decree gentile owners a Jewish owners is teaching us
llm_translation: Always Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri holds the view, the property of a non-Jew acquires ownership through seizure, and Samuel maintains like the Rabbis, and you have said: for the Rabbis it is obvious — what might you say: a decree against the owners of non-Jews will then be a decree against the owners of Israel, this is what he teaches us.

hebrew_text: וְרַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: חֶפְצֵי נׇכְרִי קוֹנִין שְׁבִיתָה, גְּזֵירָה בְּעָלִים דְּנׇכְרִי אַטּוּ בְּעָלִים דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin, said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Objects that belong to a gentile acquire residence, decree gentile owners due to Jewish owners.
llm_translation: And Rav Chiya bar Avin said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The property of a non-Jew acquires ownership through seizure, the decree of non-Jewish owners is more effective than that of Jewish owners.

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ דִּכְרֵי דַּאֲתוֹ לִמְבָרַכְתָּא, שְׁרָא לְהוּ רָבָא לִבְנֵי מָחוֹזָא לְמִיזְבַּן מִינַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: certain rams were brought to Mavrakhta Rava permitted the residents of Meḥoza to purchase them
llm_translation: Those who came to the banquet, Rava permitted the people of the district to purchase from them.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרָבָא: מַאי דַּעְתָּיךְ, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: חֶפְצֵי נׇכְרִי אֵין קוֹנִין שְׁבִיתָה.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rava: What is your reasoning Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: Objects belonging to a gentile do not acquire residence,
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rava: What is your opinion, that Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The possessions of a non-Jew do not acquire ownership through seizure.

hebrew_text: וְהָא שְׁמוּאֵל וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן — הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וְאָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: חֶפְצֵי נׇכְרִי קוֹנִין שְׁבִיתָה, גְּזֵירָה בְּעָלִים דְּנׇכְרִי אַטּוּ בְּעָלִים דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל?!
human_translation: Isn’t Shmuel and Rabbi Yoḥanan, the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan? And Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Objects that belong to a gentile acquire residence, a decree a gentile owner, due to a Jewish owner.
llm_translation: The text reads: "And this is the case of Shmuel and Rabbi Yochanan - the halacha follows Rabbi Yochanan. And Rav Chiya bar Avin said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The possessions of a non-Jew acquire ownership through seizure, but the decree of non-Jewish owners is more severe than the decree of Jewish owners?!"

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אָמַר רָבָא: לִיזְדַּבְּנוּ לִבְנֵי מְבָרַכְתָּא, דְּכוּלַּהּ מְבָרַכְתָּא לְדִידְהוּ כְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת דָּמְיָא.
human_translation: Rava reconsidered and said: Let be sold to the residents of Mavrakhta. all Mavrakhta is like four cubits for them.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates to: "Hadar said: Let us speak to the sons of Mevarkata, for the entire Mevarkata is considered as four cubits of blood."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: חֵרֶם שֶׁבֵּין תְּחוּמֵי שַׁבָּת — צָרִיךְ
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya taught A water-filled ditch [ ḥerem ] that between Shabbat limits requires
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita by Rabbi Chiya: A boundary restriction between the Shabbat limits - is necessary.

hebrew_text: מְחִיצָה שֶׁל בַּרְזֶל לְהַפְסִיקוֹ. מְחַיֵּיךְ עֲלֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא.
human_translation: an iron partition to divide it Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, laugh at this
llm_translation: Iron partition to divide it. Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina revives it.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא קָא מְחַיֵּיךְ? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דְּתָנֵי לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי לְחוּמְרָא, וְאִיהוּ סְבִירָא לֵיהּ כְּרַבָּנַן לְקוּלָּא. ומִשּׁוּם דְּסָבַר לְקוּלָּא, מַאן דְּתָנֵי לְחוּמְרָא מְחַיֵּיךְ עֲלֵהּ?
human_translation: Why did laugh? If you say because taught stringently, in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri, and holds leniently, in accordance with the Rabbis because he holds leniently, does he laugh at one who teaches stringently?
llm_translation: What is the reason that he sustains you? Perhaps because he teaches her according to Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri strictly, and he himself holds like the Rabbis leniently. And because he holds leniently, whoever teaches strictly sustains her upon him?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מִשּׁוּם דְּתַנְיָא: נְהָרוֹת הַמּוֹשְׁכִין וּמַעְיָינוֹת הַנּוֹבְעִין — הֲרֵי הֵן כְּרַגְלֵי כׇּל אָדָם.
human_translation: Rather, as it was taught Flowing rivers and streaming springs are like the feet of all people,
llm_translation: Rather, because it was taught: "Rivers that flow and springs that bubble - behold, they are like the feet of all people."

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא בִּמְכוּנָּסִין.
human_translation: perhaps collected
llm_translation: And perhaps in the gatherings.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מִשּׁוּם דְּקָתָנֵי: ״צָרִיךְ מְחִיצָה שֶׁל בַּרְזֶל לְהַפְסִיקוֹ״. וּמַאי שְׁנָא קָנִים דְּלָא — דְּעָיְילִי בְּהוּ מַיָּא, שֶׁל בַּרְזֶל נָמֵי — עָיְילִי בְּהוּ מַיָּא.
human_translation: Rather, because taught requires an iron partition to divide it Why is reeds different, that not because water enters it even of iron, water enters it
llm_translation: Rather, because it is taught: "One needs an iron fence to separate it." And what is the difference between reeds that do not — they absorb water, and iron ones — they also absorb water.

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא ״צָרִיךְ וְאֵין לוֹ תַּקָּנָה״ קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Perhaps is saying requires But there is no remedy,
llm_translation: And perhaps "tzarich ve'ein lo takanah" is what he is saying.

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּקַל הוּא שֶׁהֵקֵילּוּ חֲכָמִים בְּמַיִם.
human_translation: Rather, because the Sages were lenient with regard to water.
llm_translation: Due to the fact that it is light, the sages were lenient with water.

hebrew_text: כִּדְרַבִּי טַבְלָא, דִּבְעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי טַבְלָא מֵרַב: מְחִיצָה תְּלוּיָה, מַהוּ שֶׁתַּתִּיר בְּחוּרְבָּה?
human_translation: similar to Rabbi Tavla, as Rabbi Tavla asked of Rav: Does a suspended partition, permit in a ruin?
llm_translation: As Rabbi Tavla, who asked Rabbi Tavla from Rav: A hanging partition, what is the ruling with a sword?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵין מְחִיצָה תְּלוּיָה מַתֶּרֶת אֶלָּא בְּמַיִם, קַל הוּא שֶׁהֵקֵילּוּ חֲכָמִים בְּמַיִם.
human_translation: said to him: A suspended partition permits only water, the Sages were lenient with regard to water.
llm_translation: He said to him: A partition is only valid if it is suspended in water, for it is light that the sages have made light of water.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא אַרְבַּע וְכוּ׳. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא!
human_translation: And the Rabbis say he has only four cubits, Rabbi Yehuda is the first tanna ,
llm_translation: The sages say: "He has only four, etc." Rabbi Yehuda, that is the first Tanna!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שְׁמוֹנֶה עַל שְׁמוֹנֶה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: יֵשׁ לוֹ שְׁמוֹנֶה עַל שְׁמוֹנֶה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: Rava said: There is between them, eight by eight That was also taught He has eight by eight the statement of Rabbi Meir,
llm_translation: Rava said: "Eight by eight there is a difference between them." It was taught in a baraita similarly: "He has eight by eight," the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: מַחֲלוֹקֶת לְהַלֵּךְ, אֲבָל לְטַלְטֵל דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל: אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — אִין, טְפֵי — לָא.
human_translation: And Rava stated: dispute to walking, but as for carrying all agree four cubits indeed more not.
llm_translation: And Rava said: A dispute for walking, but for carrying everyone agrees: Four cubits - no, less - yes.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת הֵיכָא כְּתִיבָא?
human_translation: These four cubits where are they written
llm_translation: And these four cubits, where are they written?

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״שְׁבוּ אִישׁ תַּחְתָּיו״ — כְּתַחְתָּיו. [וְכַמָּה תַּחְתָּיו] גּוּפוֹ שָׁלֹשׁ אַמּוֹת, וְאַמָּה כְּדֵי לִפְשׁוֹט יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו — דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: גּוּפוֹ שָׁלֹשׁ אַמּוֹת, וְאַמָּה כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּטּוֹל חֵפֶץ מִתַּחַת מַרְגְּלוֹתָיו וּמַנִּיחַ תַּחַת מְרַאֲשׁוֹתָיו.
human_translation: As it was taught “Remain every man in his place; equal to his place. And how much is his place? body three cubits, and an cubit in order to spread out his hands and feet, the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: body three cubits, and an cubit in order to pick up an object from under his feet and place it under his head,
llm_translation: As it was taught: "Sit each man beneath his own vine and fig tree" - beneath his own. And how far beneath his body is three cubits, and a cubit's length to spread out his hands and feet - the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: his body is three cubits, and a cubit's length so that he may take an object from beneath his feet and place it beneath his head.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ, אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ: אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת מְצוּמְצָמוֹת.
human_translation: What is between them? There is between them exactly four cubits
llm_translation: What is the difference between them, there is a difference between them: four cubits constricted.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא לִבְרֵיהּ: כִּי עָיְילַתְּ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא, בְּעִי מִינֵּיהּ: אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת שֶׁאָמְרוּ, בְּאַמָּה דִּידֵיהּ יָהֲבִינַן לֵיהּ, אוֹ בְּאַמָּה שֶׁל קֹדֶשׁ יָהֲבִינַן לֵיהּ?
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiya said to his son: When you come before Rav Pappa, inquire of him four cubits [ ammot ] do we grant according to his own forearm [ amma ], or do we grant according to the cubit [ amma ] used for consecrated
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Mesharshaya to his son: When you go before Rav Papa, inquire of him: The four cubits that they said, should we give him our cubit, or should we give him a cubit of sanctity?

hebrew_text: אִם אָמַר לָךְ: אַמּוֹת שֶׁל קֹדֶשׁ יָהֲבִינַן לֵיהּ — עוֹג מֶלֶךְ הַבָּשָׁן מַה תְּהֵא עָלָיו? וְאִם אָמַר לָךְ בְּאַמָּה דִּידֵיהּ יָהֲבִינַן לֵיהּ, אֵימָא לֵיהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא לָא קָתָנֵי לַהּ גַּבֵּי ״יֵשׁ שֶׁאָמְרוּ הַכֹּל לְפִי מַה שֶּׁהוּא אָדָם״?
human_translation: If he said to you we provide him according to the cubit used for consecrated what will be with regard to Og, king of the Bashan, And if he said to you we provide him according to his own forearm, say to him: Why was not taught together with These are with regard to which they stated all in accordance with the person
llm_translation: If he said to you: "I will give you the cubits of the Holy," what is to be upon him? But if he said to you in his cubit, let us say to him: Why did he not teach him regarding "everything according to the measure of a man"?

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי דָּיְיקִינַן כּוּלֵּא הַאי, לָא הֲוֵי תָּנֵינַן.
human_translation: When came before Rav Pappa, said to him: Were we to be so precise, we would not to learn at all,
llm_translation: When he came before Rav Papa, he said to him: If we establish the entire matter like this, we will not teach.

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם בְּאַמָּה דִּידֵיהּ יָהֲבִינַן לֵיהּ. וּדְקָא קַשְׁיָא לָךְ: מַאי טַעְמָא לָא קָתָנֵי גַּבֵּי ״יֵשׁ שֶׁאָמְרוּ״? — דְּלָא פְּסִיקָא לֵיהּ, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא נַנָּס בְּאֵבָרָיו.
human_translation: In fact, we grant him according to his own forearm. And as for that which was difficult for you, why was not taught These are with regard to which they stated is not clear-cut. since there may be whose limbs are small
llm_translation: Always by a cubit of his own we give to him. And it is difficult for you: What is the reason it does not teach regarding "there are those who say"? — Because it does not interrupt him, since there is a miracle in his limbs.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ שְׁנַיִם מִקְצָת אַמּוֹתָיו שֶׁל זֶה וְכוּ׳. לְמָה לֵיהּ לְמֵימַר ״לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה״?
human_translation: If there were two part of the cubits of the one Why does need to say: To what may this be likened,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "הָיוּ שְׁנַיִם מִקְצָת אַמּוֹתָיו שֶׁל זֶה וְכוּ׳. לְמָה לֵיהּ לְמֵימַר ״לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה״?" English translation: "There were two of his close relatives, etc. Why did he need to say, 'What is the matter that it is similar'?"

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאֲמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְרַבָּנַן: מִכְּדִי לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה, לְשָׁלֹשׁ חֲצֵירוֹת הַפְּתוּחוֹת זוֹ לָזוֹ, וּפְתוּחוֹת לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, מַאי שְׁנָא הָתָם דִּפְלִיגִיתוּ, וּמַאי שְׁנָא הָכָא דְּלָא פְּלִיגִיתוּ?
human_translation: This is what Rabbi Shimon said to the Rabbis: After all, to what is this similar? To three courtyards that open into one another, and that open into a public domain. What is different there that you disagree and what is different here that you do not disagree
llm_translation: So said Rabbi Shimon to the sages: "Why is the matter comparable? To three courtyards open to one another, and open to the public domain. What is different there that you argue, and what is different here that you do not argue?"

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן: הָתָם אָוְושִׁי דָּיוֹרִין. הָכָא לָא אָוְושִׁי דָּיוֹרִין.
human_translation: And the Rabbis There residents are numerous, here residents are not numerous,
llm_translation: The sages: There, they are residents of the city. Here, they are not residents of the city.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁתַּיִם הַחִיצוֹנוֹת כּוּ׳. וְאַמַּאי? כֵּיוָן דְּעָרְבִי לְהוּ חִיצוֹנוֹת בַּהֲדֵי אֶמְצָעִית, הָוְיָא לְהוּ חֲדָא!
human_translation: And the two outer Why Since outer established an eiruv with middle one, they are one,
llm_translation: Two outer arrows like the middle one. And why? Since they mix with the middle one, it becomes one!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנָּתְנָה אֶמְצָעִית עֵירוּבָהּ בָּזוֹ וְעֵירוּבָהּ בָּזוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: where the middle placed its eiruv in this and its eiruv in that
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: For example, if one placed the middle of the Eruv in a despised place and the rest of his Eruv in a despised place.

hebrew_text: וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא שֶׁנָּתְנוּ עֵירוּבָן בָּאֶמְצָעִית, כְּגוֹן שֶׁנְּתָנוּהוּ
human_translation: And Rav Sheshet said: Even if you say that placed their eiruv in the middle with a case where they placed
llm_translation: And Rav Sheshet said: Even if you say that they placed their Eruv in the middle, for example, if they placed it

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁנֵי בָתִּים.
human_translation: in two houses,
llm_translation: In two houses.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן? כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי, דְּתַנְיָא: חֲמִשָּׁה שֶׁגָּבוּ אֶת עֵירוּבָן וּנְתָנוּהוּ בִּשְׁנֵי כֵלִים, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין עֵירוּבָן עֵירוּב. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: עֵירוּבָן עֵירוּב.
human_translation: In accordance with whose with Beit Shammai, as it was taught five collected their eiruv and placed it in two utensils, Beit Shammai say: Their eiruv is not a eiruv , and Beit Hillel say: Their eiruv is a eiruv
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "K'man? K'beit Shamai, d'tanya: chamishah shegavu et eiruvan u'netanuhu bishnei kelim, Beit Shamai omerim: ein eiruvan eiruv. U'beit Hillel omerim: eiruvan eiruv." English translation: "According to whom? According to Beit Shamai, as it was taught: If five people set up their eiruv and placed it in two vessels, Beit Shamai says: their eiruv is not valid. And Beit Hillel says: their eiruv is valid."

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא בֵּית הִלֵּל, עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי בֵּית הִלֵּל הָתָם — אֶלָּא בִּשְׁנֵי כֵלִים בְּבַיִת אֶחָד, אֲבָל בִּשְׁנֵי בָתִּים, לָא.
human_translation: Even if you say of Beit Hillel, Beit Hillel stated only there, with regard to two utensils in one house However, in two houses, not
llm_translation: Even if you say it is Beit Hillel, until here Beit Hillel did not say there - rather, with two vessels in one house, but with two houses, no.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַוְיָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: לְרַב יְהוּדָה קַשְׁיָא וּלְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת קַשְׁיָא. לְרַב יְהוּדָה קַשְׁיָא דְּאָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנָּתְנָה אֶמְצָעִית עֵירוּבָהּ בָּזוֹ וְעֵירוּבָהּ בָּזוֹ, וְכֵיוָן דְּעֵירְבָה אֶמְצָעִית בַּהֲדֵי חִיצוֹנָה הָוְיָא לֵיהּ חֲדָא, וְכִי הָדְרָה וְעָרְבָה בַּהֲדֵי אִידַּךְ — שְׁלִיחוּתָהּ עָבְדָה.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Avya, said to Rav Ashi: of Rav Yehuda is difficult of Rav Sheshet is difficult. Rav Yehuda is difficult, as he said about a case where the middle put its eiruv in the one and its eiruv in the other However, once the middle establishes an eiruv with outer ones, they are as one, when it later establishes an eiruv with the other it acts on behalf
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ahah son of Rav Avya said to Rav Ashi: For Rav Yehudah it is difficult, and for Rav Sheshet it is difficult. For Rav Yehudah it is difficult, for he said: For example, if one placed his Eruv Techumin in the west and his Eruv Techumin in the east, and once he established his Eruv Techumin with one of them, and then went back and established it with the other – his agency is effective.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת קַשְׁיָא: תֶּיהְוֵי כַּחֲמִשָּׁה שֶׁשְּׁרוּיִין בְּחָצֵר אַחַת, וְשָׁכַח אֶחָד מֵהֶן וְלֹא עֵירַב — דְּאָסְרִי אַהֲדָדֵי!
human_translation: And of Rav Sheshet is difficult. should be like five who lived in the same courtyard, one of whom forgot and did not join the eiruv , where they prohibit one another
llm_translation: To Rabbi Sheshet the difficulty: It should be like five that are dependent in one courtyard, and one of them forgot and did not participate in the Eruv - they prohibit each other!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: לָא לְרַב יְהוּדָה קַשְׁיָא וְלָא לְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת קַשְׁיָא. לְרַב יְהוּדָה לָא קַשְׁיָא: כֵּיוָן דְּעֵירְבָה לַהּ אֶמְצָעִית בַּהֲדֵי חִיצוֹנָה, וּשְׁתַּיִם חִיצוֹנוֹת בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי לָא עֵירְבוּ — גַּלְּיָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ דִּבְהָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ, וּבְהָא לָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to him: It is not difficult of Rav Yehuda and it is not difficult Rav Sheshet. It is not difficult Rav Yehuda, since the middle established an eiruv with the outer and the two outer did not establish an eiruv with one another. indicated that it desired with but did not desire with
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ashi: Not difficult for Rav Yehudah and not difficult for Rav Sheshet. For Rav Yehudah not difficult: since she mixed the middle one with its outer ones, and two outer ones with each other did not mix - the mind of this one is revealed, and of that one is not revealed.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת לָא קַשְׁיָא: אִם אָמְרוּ דָּיוֹרִין לְהָקֵל, יֹאמְרוּ דָּיוֹרִין לְהַחְמִיר?!
human_translation: And it is not difficult of Rav Sheshet. If they said residents as a leniency, they will say residents as a stringency,
llm_translation: And for Rav Sheshet it is not difficult: if they said to be lenient, they will say to be stringent?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: רְשׁוּת אַחַת מְשַׁמֶּשֶׁת לִשְׁתֵּי רְשׁוּיוֹת. אֲבָל לָא שְׁתֵּי רְשׁוּיוֹת מְשַׁמְּשׁוֹת לִרְשׁוּת אַחַת.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: This is the statement of, Rabbi Shimon. But the Rabbis say: One domain serves two domains. But two domains do not serve one domain,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: These are the words of Rabbi Shimon. But the sages say: One domain serves two domains. But two domains do not serve one domain.

hebrew_text: כִּי אַמְרִיתַהּ קַמֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, אֲמַר לִי:
human_translation: When I recited before Shmuel, he said to me:
llm_translation: When she said before Samuel, whose name is Samuel, he said to me:

hebrew_text: אַף זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: שְׁלָשְׁתָּן אֲסוּרוֹת.
human_translation: This also the statement of, Rabbi Shimon. But the Rabbis say: All three are prohibited,
llm_translation: This too is the statement of Rabbi Shimon, but the sages say: all three are prohibited.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה אַלִּיבָּא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה לְשָׁלֹשׁ חֲצֵירוֹת הַפְּתוּחוֹת זוֹ לָזוֹ וּפְתוּחוֹת לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, עֵירְבוּ שְׁתַּיִם עִם הָאֶמְצָעִית — זוֹ מְבִיאָה מִתּוֹךְ בֵּיתָהּ וְאוֹכֶלֶת, וְזוֹ מְבִיאָה מִתּוֹךְ בֵּיתָהּ וְאוֹכֶלֶת. זוֹ מַחְזֶרֶת מוֹתָרָהּ לְתוֹךְ בֵּיתָהּ, וְזוֹ מַחְזֶרֶת מוֹתָרָהּ לְתוֹךְ בֵּיתָהּ.
human_translation: It was taught in accordance with Rav Yehuda, in accordance with Shmuel. Rabbi Shimon said: To what is this comparable? to three courtyards that open into one another, and that open into a public domain. If the two established an eiruv with the middle may bring from a house and eat and may bring from a house and eat this may bring leftovers back into house and that resident may bring leftovers back into house
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yehudah, the son of Shmuel: Rabbi Shimon said: What is the matter comparable to three courtyards that open into one another and open into a public domain? If two of them make an eruv with the middle one, this one brings food from her house and eats, and that one brings food from her house and eats. This one may carry her food back into her house, and that one may carry her food back into her house.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: שְׁלָשְׁתָּן אֲסוּרוֹת.
human_translation: However, the Rabbis say: All three are prohibited.
llm_translation: But the sages say: the three of them are forbidden.

hebrew_text: וְאַזְדָּא שְׁמוּאֵל לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: חָצֵר שֶׁבֵּין שְׁנֵי מְבוֹאוֹת, עֵירְבָה עִם שְׁנֵיהֶם — אֲסוּרָה עִם שְׁנֵיהֶם.
human_translation: Shmuel follows his reasoning Shmuel said: a courtyard that is between two alleyways, established an eiruv with both it is prohibited with both of them.
llm_translation: And it was established according to the reasoning of Shmuel, for Shmuel said: A courtyard situated between two entrances, if it made an eruv with both of them — it is prohibited with both of them.

hebrew_text: לֹא עֵירְבָה עִם שְׁנֵיהֶם — אוֹסֶרֶת עַל שְׁנֵיהֶן.
human_translation: did not establish an eiruv with either it prohibits both of them.
llm_translation: "Not she mixed with both of them — forbids on both of them."

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה בְּאֶחָד רְגִילָה, וּבְאֶחָד אֵינָהּ רְגִילָה, זֶה שֶׁרְגִילָה בּוֹ — אָסוּר, וְזֶה שֶׁאֵינָהּ רְגִילָה בּוֹ — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: accustomed to utilizing one they not accustomed to utilizing one which accustomed to utilizing, is prohibited But which not accustomed to utilizing, is permitted
llm_translation: She was on one accustomed, and on one not accustomed, this one that accustomed in him - forbidden, and this one that not accustomed in him - permitted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: עֵירְבָה עִם שֶׁאֵינָהּ רְגִילָה בּוֹ — הוּתַּר רְגִילָה לְעַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: established an eiruv with which were not accustomed to utilizing, which were accustomed to utilizing is permitted on its own
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: If it (the Eruv) is combined with something that is not accustomed to it, it is permitted; accustomed to itself.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אִם עֵירְבָה רְגִילָה לְעַצְמוֹ, וְזֶה שֶׁאֵינָהּ רְגִילָה בּוֹ לֹא עֵירַב, וְהִיא עַצְמָהּ לֹא עֵירְבָה — דּוֹחִין אוֹתָהּ אֵצֶל שֶׁאֵינָהּ רְגִילָה בּוֹ.
human_translation: And Rabba bar Rav Huna said Shmuel said: If which were accustomed to utilizing established an eiruv on its own while which were not accustomed to utilizing did not establish an eiruv , and itself did not establish an eiruv we divert which not accustomed to utilizing.
llm_translation: And Rabba bar Rav Huna said in the name of Shmuel: If a courtyard is accustomed to carrying on its own, and this one that is not accustomed to it did not participate, and it itself did not participate - we may carry in it alongside the one that is not accustomed to it.

hebrew_text: וּכְגוֹן זֶה כּוֹפִין עַל מִדַּת סְדוֹם.
human_translation: In a case such as this, one compels characteristic of Sodom.
llm_translation: And like this, they compel according to the measure of Sodom.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַמַּקְפִּיד עַל עֵירוּבוֹ — אֵין עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב. מָה שְׁמוֹ — עֵירוּב שְׁמוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: one who is particular about his eiruv , his eiruv is not a eiruv . what is its name? Joining [ eiruv ] is its name,
llm_translation: Said Rav Yehudah said Shmuel: One who insists on his Eruv - his Eruv is not an Eruv. What is his name - Eruv is his name.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר: עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב, אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּקְרָא מֵאַנְשֵׁי וַרְדִּינָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina said: his eiruv is a eiruv , however, is called of the men of Vardina.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: His Eruv is an Eruv, except that it is called from the people of Vardina.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַחוֹלֵק אֶת עֵירוּבוֹ — אֵינוֹ עֵירוּב.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: one who divides his eiruv is not a eiruv .
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: One who divides his Eruv - it is not an Eruv.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן? כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי, דְּתַנְיָא: חֲמִשָּׁה שֶׁגָּבוּ אֶת עֵירוּבָן וּנְתָנוּהוּ בִּשְׁנֵי כֵלִים, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין זֶה עֵירוּב, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: הֲרֵי זֶה עֵירוּב!
human_translation: In accordance with whose in accordance with Beit Shammai, as it was taught five collected their eiruv and placed it in two utensils, Beit Shammai say: This is not a eiruv , whereas Beit Hillel say: This is an eiruv .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "K'man? K'beit Shamai, d'tanya: chamishah shegavu et eiruvan u'netanuhu bishnei kelim, Beit Shamai omerim: ein zeh eiruv, u'beit Hillel omerim: harei zeh eiruv!" English translation: "According to whom? According to Beit Shamai, as it was taught: If five people set up their eiruv and placed it in two vessels, Beit Shamai says: This is not an eiruv, and Beit Hillel says: Behold, this is an eiruv!"

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא בֵּית הִלֵּל: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי בֵּית הִלֵּל הָתָם אֶלָּא דְּמָלְיָין לְמָנָא וְאִיַּיתַּר, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּפַלְגֵיהּ מִיפְלָג — לָא.
human_translation: Even if you say Beit Hillel, Beit Hillel stated only there, where the utensil was filled and there was left over, But where they divided it not
llm_translation: Even if you say it according to Beit Hillel: Until here, Beit Hillel did not say there, except that they are full for counting and more, but where they split, they do not.

hebrew_text: וְתַרְתֵּי, לְמָה לִי? צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָתָם — מִשּׁוּם דְּקָפֵיד. אֲבָל הָכָא — אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: Why do I need two necessary. As, had taught us there, because is particular However here, say not
llm_translation: "And two, why do I need? I need, for if we would hear there - because of precision. But here - I might say no."

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָכָא — מִשּׁוּם דְּפַלְגֵיהּ מִיפְלָג, אֲבָל הָתָם — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And had taught us here, because he divided it up, However there, say not necessary.
llm_translation: And if we were to hear here - because he divided from the division, but there - say no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא לְרַב יְהוּדָה בְּבֵי מַעְצַרְתָּא דְּבֵי רַב זַכַּאי: מִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל ״הַחוֹלֵק אֶת עֵירוּבוֹ — אֵינוֹ עֵירוּב״? וְהָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בַּיִת שֶׁמַּנִּיחִין בּוֹ עֵירוּב — אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לִיתֵּן אֶת הַפַּת. מַאי טַעְמָא, לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמַר דְּכֵיוָן דְּמַנַּח בְּסַלָּא — כְּמַאן דְּמַנַּח הָכָא דָּמֵי? הָכִי נָמֵי: כֵּיוָן דְּמַנַּח בְּסַלָּא — כְּמַאן דְּמַנַּח הָכָא דָּמֵי!
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said to Rav Yehuda in the olive press in Rav Zakkai’s house: Did Shmuel say one who divides his eiruv , it is not a eiruv ? Didn’t Shmuel say The house in which the eiruv is placed need not contribute bread What is the reason Is it not because maintains since lying in a basket it is as if it were placed here Here too, since is placed in a basket, it is as if it were placed here
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Abba to Rav Yehuda in the study hall of Rav Zakkai: Who said that Shmuel "one who divides his Eruv - it is not considered an Eruv"? But didn't Shmuel say: a house in which one places his Eruv - he does not need to give the bread. What is the reason? Not because he said that since he is placing it in a basket - it is similar to one who places it here? Likewise: since he is placing it in a basket - it is similar to one who places it here!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם — אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין פַּת, מַאי טַעְמָא — דְּכוּלְּהוּ הָכָא דָּיְירִי.
human_translation: said to him: There although there is no bread what is the reason because all are as living here.
llm_translation: He said to him: There — even though there is no bread, what is the reason? — because all of them here are guests.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: עֵירוּב מִשּׁוּם קִנְיָן.
human_translation: Shmuel said: An eiruv due to acquisition,
llm_translation: Said Samuel: Eruv because of acquisition.

hebrew_text: וְאִם תֹּאמַר: מִפְּנֵי מָה אֵין קוֹנִין בְּמָעָה — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵינָהּ מְצוּיָה בְּעַרְבֵי שַׁבָּתוֹת.
human_translation: And if you say: Why can one not acquire through a ma’a , because is not available on Shabbat eve,
llm_translation: And if you will say: Why is it that we do not acquire with a Ma'ah? Because it is not commonly found in the Erev Shabbat markets.

hebrew_text: הֵיכָא דְּעֵירַב, מִיהוּ לִקְנֵי!
human_translation: where he established an eiruv it should nonetheless acquire,
llm_translation: Here where it is mixed, nevertheless to acquire!

hebrew_text: גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאמְרוּ מָעָה עִיקָּר, וְזִמְנִין דְּלָא שְׁכִיחַ מָעָה, וְלָא אָתֵי לְאִיעָרוֹבֵי בְּפַת, דְּאָתֵי עֵירוּב לְאִיקַלְקוֹלֵי.
human_translation: a decree lest say that a ma’a is essential, and sometimes a ma’a will not be available, and they will not come an eiruv with bread, and eiruv will be forgotten.
llm_translation: Decree lest they say "money is the main thing," and times when money is not common, and it does not come to mix in dough, for mixing comes to lighten.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה אָמַר: עֵירוּב מִשּׁוּם דִּירָה.
human_translation: Rabba said: An eiruv due to residence.
llm_translation: Rabah said: Eiruv because of Dirah.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ: כְּלִי,
human_translation: What is between these There is between them a utensil.
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them: a vessel,

hebrew_text: וּפָחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה,
human_translation: And less than the value of a peruta .
llm_translation: And less than the value of a prutah,

hebrew_text: וְקָטָן.
human_translation: And a minor
llm_translation: And a minor.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַבָּה: לְדִידָךְ קַשְׁיָא וְלִשְׁמוּאֵל קַשְׁיָא. הָא תַּנְיָא: חֲמִשָּׁה שֶׁגָּבוּ אֶת עֵירוּבָן, כְּשֶׁהֵם מוֹלִיכִין אֶת עֵירוּבָן לְמָקוֹם אַחֵר — אֶחָד מוֹלִיךְ לְכוּלָּן. הוּא נִיהוּ דְּקָא קָנֵי, וְתוּ לָא. הוּא נִיהוּ דְּקָא דָּיַיר, וְתוּ לָא!
human_translation: Abaye said to Rabba: It is difficult according to your and it is difficult according to of Shmuel As it was taught five who collected their eiruv , when they take their eiruv elsewhere, one take it for all of them. it is that person who acquires and nobody else, it is that person who gains residence, and nobody else.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye to Rabah: According to you it is difficult, and according to Shmuel it is difficult. This is what was taught: Five who contribute to their joint Eruv, when they are taking their Eruv to another place - one contributes for all of them. He is the one who acquires, and not the others. He is the one who is considered a resident, and not the others!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא לְדִידִי קַשְׁיָא, וְלָא לִשְׁמוּאֵל קַשְׁיָא, שְׁלִיחוּת דְּכוּלְּהוּ קָא עָבֵיד.
human_translation: to him: neither difficult according to my nor difficult according to Shmuel, acts as an agent, on behalf of all of them.
llm_translation: He said to him: Not for me is the difficulty, and not for Shmuel is the difficulty, for they are both acting as full-fledged messengers.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה אָמַר רַב חָמָא בַּר גּוּרְיָא אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: Rabba said Rav Ḥama bar Gurya said Rav said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon
llm_translation: Rabba said, Rav Ḥama bar Gurya said Rav: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁבָּא בְּדֶרֶךְ וְחָשְׁכָה לוֹ, וְהָיָה מַכִּיר אִילָן אוֹ גָדֵר, וְאָמַר: ״שְׁבִיתָתִי תַּחְתָּיו״ — לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם.
human_translation: one who was coming along the way and it grew dark he and he was familiar a tree or a fence and he said: My residence is beneath he has not said anything,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who is traveling on the road and darkness falls upon him, and he recognizes a tree or a fence, and he says, "I have placed my resting place beneath it" — he has not said anything.

hebrew_text: ״שְׁבִיתָתִי בְּעִיקָּרוֹ״ — מְהַלֵּךְ מִמְּקוֹם רַגְלָיו וְעַד עִיקָּרוֹ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה, וּמֵעִיקָּרוֹ וְעַד בֵּיתוֹ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה. נִמְצָא מְהַלֵּךְ מִשֶּׁחָשֵׁיכָה אַרְבַּעַת אֲלָפִים אַמָּה.
human_translation: My residence is at trunk, may walk from the place he is standing to the trunk two thousand cubits and from the trunk to his house, two thousand cubits. Consequently, he walks after nightfall four thousand cubits.
llm_translation: "His 'sitting' is at its core" — he walks from the place of his feet to his core two thousand cubits, and from his core to his house two thousand cubits. It turns out that he walks four thousand cubits from when it gets dark.

hebrew_text: אִם אֵינוֹ מַכִּיר, אוֹ שֶׁאֵינוֹ בָּקִי בַּהֲלָכָה, וְאָמַר ״שְׁבִיתָתִי בִּמְקוֹמִי״ — זָכָה לוֹ מְקוֹמוֹ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה לְכׇל רוּחַ.
human_translation: If one is not familiar or if he is not an expert in the halakha , and he said: My residence is at my location, his location acquires for him two thousand cubits in each direction.
llm_translation: If he does not recognize, or is not proficient in halacha, and he said, "I have designated my place" - his place is secured for him two thousand cubits in every direction.

hebrew_text: עֲגוּלּוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מְרוּבָּעוֹת, כְּטַבְלָא מְרוּבַּעַת, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּהְיֶה נִשְׂכָּר לַזָּוִיּוֹת.
human_translation: circularly, the statement of Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigenos. And the Rabbis say: squarely, as a square tablet, so that he gains the corners.
llm_translation: Round cakes, the words of Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus, and the sages say: square cakes, like a square tablet, so that it will be fit for the corners.

hebrew_text: וְזוֹ הִיא שֶׁאָמְרוּ: הֶעָנִי מְעָרֵב בְּרַגְלָיו. אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: אָנוּ אֵין לָנוּ אֶלָּא עָנִי. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד עָנִי וְאֶחָד עָשִׁיר, לֹא אָמְרוּ מְעָרְבִין בְּפַת אֶלָּא לְהָקֵל עַל הֶעָשִׁיר, שֶׁלֹּא יֵצֵא וִיעָרֵב בְּרַגְלָיו.
human_translation: And this is which said: The pauper establishes an eiruv with his feet, Rabbi Meir said: We have only a pauper, Rabbi Yehuda says: both a pauper and a wealthy person. said one establishes an eiruv with bread only to be lenient with the wealthy so that he not go out and establish an eiruv with his feet.
llm_translation: This is what they said: "The poor may mix with his feet." Rabbi Meir said: "We have only the poor." Rabbi Yehuda says: "One poor and one rich, they did not say to mix with bread, but to lighten the burden of the rich, so that he does not go and mix with his feet."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי ״לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם״?
human_translation: What is he has not said anything?
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of "Lo Amar Kelum"?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם כׇּל עִיקָּר, דַּאֲפִילּוּ לְתַחְתָּיו שֶׁל אִילָן לָא מָצֵי אָזֵיל.
human_translation: Rav said: He has not said anything at all, he may not even go to beneath tree.
llm_translation: Rav said: Not said nothing all essence, for even to underneath of tree not find go.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם לְבֵיתוֹ, אֲבָל לְתַחְתָּיו שֶׁל אִילָן מָצֵי אָזֵיל.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: He has not said anything to his home, however, beneath the tree, he may go
llm_translation: Samuel said: He did not say anything to his household, but he went beneath the tree.

hebrew_text: וְנַעֲשֶׂה תַּחְתָּיו שֶׁל אִילָן חַמָּר גַּמָּל.
human_translation: And beneath the tree becomes a donkey driver, and a camel driver,
llm_translation: And it shall be made beneath it of a tree, a donkey, a camel.

hebrew_text: בָּא לִמְדּוֹד מִן הַצָּפוֹן — מוֹדְדִין לוֹ מִן הַדָּרוֹם, בָּא לִמְדּוֹד מִן הַדָּרוֹם — מוֹדְדִין לוֹ מִן הַצָּפוֹן.
human_translation: he comes to measure from the north one measures for him from the south. he comes to measure from the south, one measures for him from the north.
llm_translation: He who comes to measure from the north - they measure for him from the south; he who comes to measure from the south - they measure for him from the north.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַב — מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא מְסַיַּים אַתְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabba said: What is the reason for Rav’s because the place is not defined.
llm_translation: Rabba said: What is the reason for Rav's statement? Because he does not conclude his teaching.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַבָּה: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַב — מִשּׁוּם דְּקָסָבַר: כׇּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה — אֲפִילּוּ בְּבַת אַחַת אֵינוֹ.
human_translation: And some say Rabba said: What is the reason Rav? Because he maintains: Anything that cannot sequentially, even simultaneously, cannot
llm_translation: And there are those who say, Rabba said: What is the reason for Rav's opinion? Because he holds: Anything that is not one after the other—even in one daughter, it is not.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּאָמַר: ״לִיקְנוֹ לִי בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת מִגּוֹ שְׁמוֹנֶה״.
human_translation: What is between these There is between them where he said: Let acquired for me four cubits of the eight
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them, as it says: "Acquire for me a burial site among you for a burial place."

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא מְסַיַּים אַתְרֵיהּ — הָא לָא מְסַיַּים אַתְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: the one who said because the place is not defined, the place is not defined,
llm_translation: One who says that because he does not finish his meal - behold, he does not finish his meal.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם ״כׇּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה אֲפִילּוּ בְּבַת אַחַת אֵינוֹ״ — הַאי כְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת דָּמֵי, דְּהָכָא אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת קָאָמַר.
human_translation: And the one who said because anything that cannot sequentially even simultaneously cannot this is as four cubits, as here he stated four cubits
llm_translation: The one who says in the name of "Anyone who is not in this one after the other, even in one daughter, is not" - this is like four cubits of blood, for here he is saying four cubits.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַבָּה: כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה — אֲפִילּוּ בְּבַת אַחַת אֵינוֹ, אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַבָּה: הַמַּרְבֶּה בְּמַעַשְׂרוֹת — פֵּירוֹתָיו מְתוּקָּנִין, וּמַעְשְׂרוֹתָיו מְקוּלְקָלִין.
human_translation: the matter itself. Rabba said: Anything that cannot sequentially even simultaneously cannot Abaye raised an objection to Rabba One who increases tithes, his produce is rendered however, his tithes are ruined,
llm_translation: The body, Rabah said: Anything that is not one after the other - even in one place, it is not. Abaye raised an objection to Rabah: One who increases in his tithes - his fruits are sweetened, and his tithes are spoiled.

hebrew_text: אַמַּאי? לֵימָא: כׇּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה — אֲפִילּוּ בְּבַת אַחַת אֵינוֹ!
human_translation: Why Let us say Anything that cannot sequentially; even simultaneously cannot
llm_translation: "Why? Say: anyone who is not one after the other - even in one daughter is not!"

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי מַעֲשֵׂר דְּאִיתֵיהּ לַחֲצָאִין, דְּאִי אָמַר: ״תִּקְדּוֹשׁ פַּלְגָא פַּלְגָא דְחִיטְּתָא״ — קָדְשָׁה.
human_translation: a tithe is different, as takes effect partially, As if one said: Let half of each wheat be designated it is designated.
llm_translation: The tithe that belongs to the priests, for if one says: "The holy half of the wheat," it is sanctified.

hebrew_text: מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה דְּלֵיתֵיהּ לַחֲצָאִין.
human_translation: animal tithe, which does take effect partially,
llm_translation: Tithe animal that does not have split hooves.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר (רַבָּה): יָצְאוּ שְׁנַיִם בַּעֲשִׂירִי, וּקְרָאָן עֲשִׂירִי — עֲשִׂירִי וְאַחַד עָשָׂר מְעוֹרָבִין זֶה בָּזֶה!
human_translation: And Rabba said: two emerged as the tenth, and he designated them tenth, the tenth and eleventh are intermingled with each other.
llm_translation: And said (Rabah): Two went out on the tenth, and they called it the tenth - the tenth and one, they are mixed with each other!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה דְּאִיתֵיהּ בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה בְּטָעוּת.
human_translation: animal tithe is different, as one after the other in an error.
llm_translation: The tithing of an animal that has another one after it is invalid.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: קָרָא לַתְּשִׁיעִי עֲשִׂירִי, וְלָעֲשִׂירִי תְּשִׁיעִי, וְלָאַחַד עָשָׂר עֲשִׂירִי — שְׁלָשְׁתָּן מְקוּדָּשִׁין.
human_translation: As we learned one designated the ninth as the tenth, the tenth as the ninth and the eleventh as the tenth, three are consecrated.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: He called the ninth "tenth," and the tenth "ninth," and the eleventh "tenth" - all three are sanctified.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי תּוֹדָה, דְּלֵיתַהּ בְּטָעוּת, וְלֵיתַהּ בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה, וְאִיתְּמַר: תּוֹדָה שֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטָה עַל שְׁמוֹנִים חַלּוֹת, חִזְקִיָּה אָמַר: קָדְשׁוּ עֲלַהּ אַרְבָּעִים מִתּוֹךְ שְׁמוֹנִים, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: לֹא קָדְשׁוּ עֲלַהּ אַרְבָּעִים מִתּוֹךְ שְׁמוֹנִים.
human_translation: But there is thanks-offering, which are not in error, and are not one after the other. And it is stated a thanks-offering that was slaughtered by eighty loaves, Ḥizkiya said: Forty of the eighty are consecrated, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Not forty of eighty are consecrated.
llm_translation: Behold a thanksgiving offering, which is not with error, and is not with this after that, and it was stated: a thanksgiving offering that was slaughtered for eighty loaves, Hezekiah said: sanctified forty from among the eighty, Rabbi Yochanan said: they did not sanctify forty from among the eighty.

hebrew_text: הָא אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַבִּי (זֵירָא): הַכֹּל מוֹדִים הֵיכָא דְּאָמַר ״לִיקְדְּשׁוּ אַרְבָּעִים מִתּוֹךְ שְׁמוֹנִים״ — דְּקָדְשִׁי, ״לֹא יִקְדְּשׁוּ אַרְבָּעִים אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן קָדְשׁוּ שְׁמוֹנִים״ — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּלֹא קָדְשׁוּ.
human_translation: Wasn’t it stated with regard to Rabbi Zeira said: Everyone, concedes where said: Let forty of the eighty be consecrated, that are consecrated; Let forty only be consecrated if eighty are consecrated, everyone agrees that they are not consecrated.
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: It was stated regarding this matter, Rabbi Zeira said: Everyone agrees in a case where it says, "Sanctify forty out of eighty" - that if they sanctified, "they shall not sanctify forty unless they have sanctified eighty" - the entire world does not disagree that they did not sanctify.

hebrew_text: כִּי פְּלִיגִי בִּסְתָמָא. מָר סָבַר: לְאַחְרָיוּת קָא מְכַוֵּין, וְעַל תְּנַאי אַיְיתִינְהוּ.
human_translation: When disagree without stipulation One Sage, maintains: he intends to ensure and he brought on condition
llm_translation: When they disputed in a general manner, Master holds: he intends for the future, and according to the opinion of the Tanna, they brought it.

hebrew_text: וּמָר סָבַר: לְקׇרְבָּן גָּדוֹל קָא מְכַוֵּין.
human_translation: And the other Sage, maintains: intends a large offering
llm_translation: And Mar said: for the great offering is one preparing.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּאִילָן שֶׁתַּחְתָּיו שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה, אֲבָל בְּאִילָן שֶׁאֵין שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה, הֲרֵי מִקְצָת בֵּיתוֹ נִיכָּר.
human_translation: Abaye said: They only taught with regard to a tree beneath which there are twelve cubits. However, with regard to a tree which there are not twelve cubits, as part of his residence is conspicuous.
llm_translation: Abaye said: They only taught this regarding a tree whose roots are twelve cubits deep, but for a tree whose roots are not twelve cubits deep, part of its house is recognizable.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: מִמַּאי דִּבְאַרְבְּעִי מְצִיעָתָא קָא מְסַיַּים, דִּלְמָא בְּאַרְבְּעִי דְּהַאי גִּיסָא וּבְאַרְבְּעִי דְּהַאי גִּיסָא קָמְסַיַּים!
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, strongly objects to this: From where that he designates in the four middle perhaps he designates the four on this side or the four on the other side?
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua objects to her: From where do you conclude that the fourth year produces fruit, perhaps they produce in the fourth year of this tree and in the fourth year of that tree they produce!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּאִילָן שֶׁתַּחְתָּיו שְׁמוֹנֶה אַמּוֹת, אֲבָל בְּאִילָן שֶׁתַּחְתָּיו שֶׁבַע אַמּוֹת — הֲרֵי מִקְצָת בֵּיתוֹ נִיכָּר.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: They taught only with regard to a tree that eight cubits beneath it. However, with regard to a tree that seven cubits beneath it, as part of his residence is conspicuous,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: They only taught this regarding a tree whose roots are eight cubits deep, but for a tree whose roots are seven cubits deep - part of his house is recognizable.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב, תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל.
human_translation: was taught in accordance with Rav was taught in accordance with Shmuel.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita in accordance with the opinion of Rav, it was taught in a Baraita in accordance with the opinion of Shmuel.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב: מִי שֶׁבָּא בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְחָשְׁכָה לוֹ, וְהָיָה מַכִּיר אִילָן אוֹ גָדֵר, וְאָמַר: ״שְׁבִיתָתִי תַּחְתָּיו״ — לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם. אֲבָל אִם אָמַר: ״שְׁבִיתָתִי בְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי״ — מְהַלֵּךְ עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לְאוֹתוֹ מָקוֹם. הִגִּיעַ לְאוֹתוֹ מָקוֹם — מְהַלֵּךְ אֶת כּוּלּוֹ וְחוּצָה לוֹ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה.
human_translation: was taught in accordance with Rav: one who was coming along the way and it grew dark he and he was familiar a tree or a fence and he said: My residence is beneath he has not said anything However, if he said: My residence is in such-and-such place, he walks until he reaches that place. he reached that place he walks all of it and two thousand cubits beyond it.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav: If one was traveling on the road and darkness fell upon him, and he recognized a tree or a fence, and he said, "I have made my Sabbath rest beneath it" — he has said nothing. But if he said, "I have made my Sabbath rest in such and such a place" — he walks until he reaches that place. When he reaches that place — he walks its entire perimeter, and outside of it, two thousand cubits.

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּמָקוֹם הַמְסוּיָּים, כְּגוֹן שֶׁשָּׁבַת בְּתֵל שֶׁהוּא גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, וְהוּא מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת וְעַד בֵּית סָאתַיִם.
human_translation: In what are these matters, stated? a defined, place, where he established on a mound ten handbreadths high, and its from four cubits to two beit se’a .
llm_translation: In what case are these words spoken? In a case of precarious situations, such as when one forgot Shabbat in Tel which is ten handbreadths high, and it is from four cubits to two se'ahs.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בִּקְעָה שֶׁהִיא עֲמוּקָּה עֲשָׂרָה, וְהִיא מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת וְעַד בֵּית סָאתַיִם. אֲבָל בְּמָקוֹם שֶׁאֵין מְסוּיָּים — אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: And, likewise, a plain ten deeper and its from four cubits to two beit se’a . However, a place that is not defined, he has only four cubits
llm_translation: And so in a valley that is deep ten, and it is from four cubits and until two se'ah. But in a place that is not designated - it only has four cubits.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ שְׁנַיִם, אֶחָד מַכִּיר וְאֶחָד שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַכִּיר — זֶה שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַכִּיר מוֹסֵר שְׁבִיתָתוֹ לַמַּכִּיר, וְהַמַּכִּיר אוֹמֵר: ״שְׁבִיתָתִי בְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי״.
human_translation: If two were one familiar and one not familiar the one who not familiar entrusts his to the one familiar and the one who familiar says: My residence is in such-and-such place.
llm_translation: They were two, one recognizes and one does not recognize - this one who does not recognize hands over his oath to the one who recognizes, and the one who recognizes says: "My oath is in the place of so-and-so."

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — כְּשֶׁסִּיֵּים אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת שֶׁקָּבַע. אֲבָל לֹא סִיֵּים אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת שֶׁקָּבַע — לֹא יָזוּז מִמְּקוֹמוֹ.
human_translation: In what are these matters, stated? where he defined four cubits that he establish However, he did not define four cubits that he establish he may not move from his place,
llm_translation: In what case are these words spoken? When one measures four cubits that he established. But if he did not measure four cubits that he established, he shall not be moved from his place.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל? אָמַר לָךְ שְׁמוּאֵל: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, כְּגוֹן דְּאִיכָּא מִמְּקוֹם רַגְלָיו וְעַד עִיקָּרוֹ תְּרֵי אַלְפֵי וְאַרְבַּע גַּרְמִידֵי, דְּאִי מוֹקְמֵית לֵיהּ בְּאִידַּךְ גִּיסָא דְּאִילָן — קָם לֵיהּ לְבַר מִתְּחוּמָא.
human_translation: Let us say conclusive refutation of Shmuel? Shmuel said to you: With what are we dealing here? with a case, where from the place he is standing to the trunk there is two thousand and four cubits, so that if you were to establish on the other side of the tree, it would be situated outside
llm_translation: Let us say, what is the preference of Shmuel? Shmuel said to you: Here, with what are we dealing? For example, if there is from the base of his foot to the top of his head two thousand and four cubits, if you establish for him in another place the thickness of a tree — he emerges to be outside the boundary.

hebrew_text: אִי סַיֵּים אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — מָצֵי אָזֵיל, וְאִי לָא — לָא מָצֵי אָזֵיל.
human_translation: if he designated four cubits he may go and if not, he may not go
llm_translation: If he completed four cubits - he may go, and if not - he may not go.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: טָעָה וְעֵירַב לִשְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹת, כִּמְדוּמֶּה הוּא שֶׁמְּעָרְבִין לוֹ לִשְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹת, אוֹ שֶׁאָמַר לַעֲבָדָיו ״צְאוּ וְעָרְבוּ לִי״, אֶחָד עֵירַב עָלָיו לַצָּפוֹן וְאֶחָד עֵירַב עָלָיו לַדָּרוֹם — מְהַלֵּךְ לַצָּפוֹן כְּעֵירוּבוֹ לַדָּרוֹם, וְלַדָּרוֹם כְּעֵירוּבוֹ לַצָּפוֹן.
human_translation: was taught in accordance with Shmuel. If one erred and established an eiruv in two directions he imagined that establish an eiruv in two directions, or if he said to his servants: Go out and establish an eiruv for me, one established an eiruv for him to the north, and one established an eiruv for him to the south, he may walk to the north as his eiruv to the south, to the south as his eiruv to the north.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Shmuel: If one erred and combined for two directions, it is as if he combined for him two directions, or if he said to his servants, "Go out and combine for me," one combined for him to the north and one combined for him to the south - he walks to the north as if his eruv was to the south, and to the south as if his eruv was to the north.

hebrew_text: וְאִם מִיצְּעוּ עָלָיו אֶת הַתְּחוּם — לֹא יָזוּז מִמְּקוֹמוֹ.
human_translation: And if placing him in the middle of the limit, he may not move from his location,
llm_translation: "And if they encroach upon his boundary - he shall not be moved from his place."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתֵּיהּ דְּרַב? רַב תַּנָּא הוּא וּפָלֵיג.
human_translation: Let us say conclusive refutation of Rav? Rav himself tanna disagree
llm_translation: Let it be the preference of Rav? Rav taught it and disputed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁבִיתָתִי בְּעִיקָּרוֹ — מְהַלֵּךְ מִמְּקוֹם רַגְלָיו וְעַד עִיקָּרוֹ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה, וּמֵעִיקָּרוֹ לְבֵיתוֹ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה. נִמְצָא מְהַלֵּךְ מִשֶּׁחָשֵׁיכָה אַרְבַּעַת אֲלָפִים אַמָּה.
human_translation: he said: My residence is at trunk may walk from the place that he is standing to the trunk two thousand cubits, and from the trunk to his house two thousand cubits. Ultimately, he may walk after nightfall four thousand cubits.
llm_translation: He said: The distance from where his feet are placed to its core is two thousand cubits, and from its core to his house is two thousand cubits. It turns out that he walks four thousand cubits from nightfall.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וְהוּא דְּכִי רָהֵיט לְעִיקָּרוֹ מָטֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְהָא ״חָשְׁכָה לוֹ״ קָתָנֵי!
human_translation: Rava said: only where, were he to run to the trunk he could reach it Abaye said to him: But doesn’t state: And it grew dark he
llm_translation: Rava said: And this, when he intends for its primary purpose, it is permitted. Abbaye said to him: But doesn't it teach, "it is dark to him"?

hebrew_text: ״חָשְׁכָה״ — לְבֵיתוֹ, אֲבָל לְעִיקָּרוֹ שֶׁל אִילָן מָצֵי אָזֵיל. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי אָמַר רָבָא: חָשְׁכָה לוֹ כִּי מְסַגֵּי קַלִּי קַלִּי, אֲבָל רָהֵיט — מָטֵי.
human_translation: it grew dark to his house however, he is able go to the trunk Some state Rava said: it grew dark he were he to walk very slowly however, if he runs, he can arrive
llm_translation: "Darkened" — to his house, but to the core of the tree it goes out. There are those who say, Rava said: It darkens for him when it reaches lightly, lightly, but if it is moist — it goes out.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף הֲווֹ קָא אָזְלִי בְּאוֹרְחָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה לְרַב יוֹסֵף: תְּהֵא שְׁבִיתָתֵנוּ תּוּתֵי דִּיקְלָא דְּסָבֵיל אֲחוּהּ. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: תּוּתֵי דִּיקְלָא דְּפָרֵיק מָרֵיהּ מִכְּרָגָא.
human_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef were going along the way. Rabba said to Rav Yosef: Our residence will be beneath the palm that carries its brother, And some say beneath the palm that spared its owner from the land tax [ karga ],
llm_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef were walking on the road. Rabba said to Rav Yosef: Let our Sabbath be like the palm tree that grows straight. And some say: like the palm tree that separates from its cluster.

hebrew_text: יָדַע לֵיהּ מָר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא יָדַעְנָא לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: סְמוֹךְ עֲלַי, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיוּ שְׁנַיִם, אֶחָד מַכִּיר וְאֶחָד שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַכִּיר — זֶה שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַכִּיר מוֹסֵר שְׁבִיתָתוֹ לַמַּכִּיר, זֶה שֶׁמַּכִּיר אוֹמֵר: תְּהֵא ״שְׁבִיתָתֵנוּ בְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי״.
human_translation: Does the Master know said to him: I do not know He said to him: rely on me, as it was taught Rabbi Yosei says: If two were one familiar and one not familiar the one who not familiar entrusts his to the one who familiar and the one who familiar says: My residence is in such-and-such place.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Did the Master know him? He said to him: We did not know him. He said to him: Rely on me, for it was taught, Rabbi Yosei says: If there were two, one recognizes and one does not recognize — the one who does not recognize transfers his ownership to the one who recognizes, and the one who recognizes says: Let "our ownership be in the place of so-and-so."

hebrew_text: וְלָא הִיא, לָא תְּנָא לֵיהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, אֶלָּא כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלִיקַבֵּל לַהּ מִינֵּיהּ, מִשּׁוּם דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי נִימּוּקוֹ עִמּוֹ.
human_translation: But it is not only taught it in accordance with Rabbi Yosei so that would accept it from him, due to Rabbi Yosei’s reasoning his
llm_translation: And not this, not taught to him like Rabbi Yosei, but as how to accept from him, because Rabbi Yosei was accustomed to him.

hebrew_text: אִם אֵינוֹ מַכִּיר אוֹ שֶׁאֵינוֹ בָּקִי וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: If one is not familiar or if he is not an expert
llm_translation: If he does not recognize or is not proficient, etc.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה הֵיכָן כְּתִיבָן? דְּתַנְיָא: ״שְׁבוּ אִישׁ תַּחְתָּיו״ — אֵלּוּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת. ״אַל יֵצֵא אִישׁ מִמְּקוֹמוֹ״ — אֵלּוּ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה.
human_translation: These two thousand cubits, where are written as it was taught “Remain every man in his place” these are four cubits, “Let no man go out of his place” these are two thousand cubits
llm_translation: These two thousand cubits, where are they written? For it was taught: "Each man shall remain in his place" - these are four cubits. "Let no man go out of his place" - these are two thousand cubits.

hebrew_text: מְנָא לַן? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לָמַדְנוּ ׳מָקוֹם׳ מִ׳מָּקוֹם׳, וּ׳מָקוֹם׳ מִ׳נִּיסָה׳, וְ׳נִיסָּה׳ מִ׳נִּיסָה׳, וְ׳נִיסָּה׳ מִ׳גְּבוּל׳, וּ׳גְבוּל׳ מִ׳גְּבוּל׳, וּ׳גְבוּל׳ מִ׳חוּץ׳, וְ׳חוּץ׳ מִ׳חוּץ׳. דִּכְתִיב: ״וּמַדּוֹתֶם מִחוּץ לָעִיר אֶת פְּאַת קֵדְמָה אַלְפַּיִם בָּאַמָּה וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: From where do we Rav Ḥisda said: We derive place from place and place from fleeing. And fleeing from fleeing, And fleeing from border, And border from border, border from outside. And outside from outside, as it is written “And you shall measure from outside [ miḥutz ] the city on the east side two thousand cubits,
llm_translation: We ask: Rav Hisda said: We learned 'place' from 'place', and 'place' from 'trial', and 'trial' from 'trial', and 'trial' from 'boundary', and 'boundary' from 'boundary', and 'boundary' from 'outside', and 'outside' from 'outside'. As it is written: "And you shall measure outside the city the eastern side two thousand cubits, etc."

hebrew_text: וְנֵילַף מִ״קִּיר הָעִיר וָחוּצָה אֶלֶף אַמָּה״? דָּנִין ׳חוּץ׳ מִ׳חוּץ׳, וְאֵין דָּנִין ׳חוּץ׳ מֵ׳חוּצָה׳.
human_translation: But let us derive “From the wall of the city outward [ vaḥutza ] a thousand cubits” One derives outside [ ḥutz ] from outside [ ḥutz ], but one does not derive outside from outward [ ḥutza ].
llm_translation: "And is it derived from 'the wall of the city and outside a thousand cubits' (Numbers 35:4)? We evaluate 'outside' from 'outside,' but we do not evaluate 'outside' from 'outside.'"

hebrew_text: וּמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? הָא תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״וְשָׁב הַכֹּהֵן״ ״וּבָא הַכֹּהֵן״ — זוֹ הִיא שִׁיבָה, זוֹ הִיא בִּיאָה!
human_translation: What is the difference Didn’t the school of Rabbi Yishmael teach “And the priest shall return [ veshav ]” “And the priest shall come [ uva ]” this is returning, this is coming;
llm_translation: And what is derived from it? This is what was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: "And the priest shall return" and "the priest shall come" - this is both returning and coming!

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּדָמֵי לֵיהּ, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּדָמֵי לֵיהּ — מִדָּמֵי לֵיהּ יָלְפִינַן.
human_translation: This applies when there are no terms identical to it however, where there are terms identical to it, we derive from identical to it,
llm_translation: These matters, where there is no bloodshed involved, but where there is bloodshed involved, we shall seek to exempt him from bloodshed.

hebrew_text: אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה עֲגוּלּוֹת. וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס מָה נַפְשָׁךְ: אִי אִית לֵיהּ גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה — פֵּיאוֹת כְּתִיבָן, אִי לֵית לֵיהּ גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה — אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה מְנָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: two-thousand-cubit circle Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigenos no matter what If he is of the verbal analogy sides written, if he is not of the verbal analogy, from where does he two thousand cubits?
llm_translation: Two thousand cubits. And Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus, what is your opinion: if there is a corresponding decree - "pe'ot" is written, if there is no corresponding decree - how does he derive two thousand cubits?

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם אִית לֵיהּ גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה, וְשָׁאנֵי הָכָא דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״זֶה יִהְיֶה לָהֶם מִגְרְשֵׁי הֶעָרִים״ — לָזֶה אַתָּה נוֹתֵן פֵּיאוֹת, וְאִי אַתָּה נוֹתֵן פֵּיאוֹת לְשׁוֹבְתֵי שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Actually, he is of a verbal analogy, but here, is different, as the verse says: “This shall be to them the open space of the cities” To this, you provide sides but you do not provide sides to those resting on Shabbat.
llm_translation: Forever there is to it a decree equal, and different here where it says scripture: "This shall be for them the open spaces of the cities" — to this you give corners, and if you do not give corners to those who dwell in the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן? תָּנֵי, רַב חֲנַנְיָה אוֹמֵר: כָּזֶה יְהוּ כׇּל שׁוֹבְתֵי שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: And the Rabbis it was taught Rav Ḥananya says: Like this shall be all those who rest on Shabbat,
llm_translation: The Sages? Taught, Rav Hananya says: "This is how all Shabbat boundaries should be."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: הַמַּעֲבִיר אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁמַּעֲבִיר הֵן וַאֲלַכְסוֹנָן.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: One who carries four cubits in the public domain is only liable if he carries four with their diagonal.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Ahah bar Jacob: One who carries four cubits in a public domain is not liable until he carries them and their diagonals.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא בָּדֵיק לַן רָבָא: עַמּוּד בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה וְרוֹחַב אַרְבָּעָה, צָרִיךְ הֵן וַאֲלַכְסוֹנָן אוֹ לָא? וְאָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ: לָאו הַיְינוּ דְּרַב חֲנַנְיָה? דְּתַנְיָא, רַב חֲנַנְיָה אוֹמֵר: כָּזֶה יְהוּ כׇּל שׁוֹבְתֵי שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said Rava tested us a pillar in the public domain, ten high and four wide, must be with their diagonal or not? And we said to him: Is this not Rav Ḥananya? As it was taught Rav Ḥananya says: Like this shall be all those who rest on Shabbat,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to us in the name of Rava: A pillar in a public domain, its height is ten and its width four, does it require a base and diagonal support or not? And we say to him: Is this not what Rav Chananya taught? For it was taught: Rav Chananya says: Such should be all the resting places of the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: וְזֶה הוּא שֶׁאָמְרוּ הֶעָנִי מְעָרֵב בְּרַגְלָיו. אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: אָנוּ אֵין לָנוּ אֶלָּא עָנִי וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: And this is which said: A pauper can establish an eiruv with his feet, We have only a pauper,
llm_translation: And this is what they said: "The poor person may mix with his feet." Rabbi Meir said: "We have nothing but the poor, etc."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מַחֲלוֹקֶת ״בִּמְקוֹמִי״, דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: עִיקָּר עֵירוּב בְּפַת,
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: dispute with regard to my location. As Rabbi Meir maintains: The primary of eiruv with bread.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: The dispute "in their places," for Rabbi Meir holds: The essence of an Eruv is with bread.

hebrew_text: עָנִי הוּא דְּאַקִּילוּ רַבָּנַן עִילָּוֵיהּ, אֲבָל עָשִׁיר — לָא.
human_translation: it is with regard to a pauper, that the Sages were lenient However, a wealthy person no,
llm_translation: The poor person is the one whom the Rabbis have lightened his yoke, but the rich person - no.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: עִיקַּר עֵירוּב בָּרֶגֶל, אֶחָד עָנִי וְאֶחָד עָשִׁיר. אֲבָל ״בְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי״ — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל: עָנֵי — אִין, עָשִׁיר — לָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda maintains: The primary of eiruv is by foot, both a pauper and a wealthy person. However, in such-and-such place, everyone, agrees a pauper yes, an a wealthy person, no,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda holds: The main aspect of an Eruv is by foot, whether one is poor or rich. But "in a specific place" - this is the opinion of all: for the poor - no, for the rich - yes.

hebrew_text: ״וְזוֹ הִיא שֶׁאָמְרוּ״ מַאן קָתָנֵי לַהּ — רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וְאַהֵיָיא קָאֵי — אַ״אֵינוֹ מַכִּיר אוֹ שֶׁאֵינוֹ בָּקִי בַּהֲלָכָה״. ״וְלֹא אָמְרוּ מְעָרְבִין בְּפַת אֶלָּא לְהָקֵל״ מַאן קָתָנֵי לַהּ — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: And this is what they said who, is teaching it? Rabbi Meir. And to which is it referring? not familiar or if he is not an expert in the halakha , And said one establishes an eiruv with bread only to be lenient with the wealthy who, is teaching it? Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: "And this is what they said: Who is the Tanna of this? — Rabbi Meir. And she is standing — it is either that he does not recognize her or that he is not proficient in Halacha. 'And they did not say that they mix in bread except to lighten it.' Who is the Tanna of this? — Rabbi Yehuda."

hebrew_text: וְרַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: מַחֲלוֹקֶת ״בְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי״, דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: עָנִי — אִין, עָשִׁיר — לָא, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: אֶחָד עָנִי וְאֶחָד עָשִׁיר. אֲבָל ״בִּמְקוֹמִי״, דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֶחָד עָנִי וְאֶחָד עָשִׁיר, דְּעִיקַּר עֵירוּב בָּרֶגֶל.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda, said: dispute in such-and-such place, As Rabbi Meir maintains: A pauper, yes, a wealthy person, no, And Rabbi Yehuda maintains: Both a pauper and a wealthy person However, in my location, everyone, agrees both a pauper and a wealthy person, the primary of eiruv is by foot.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: The dispute regarding "in a specific place," for Rabbi Meir holds: a poor person—no, a wealthy person—yes, and Rabbi Yehuda holds: one poor person and one wealthy person. However, regarding "in my place," everyone agrees that it is one poor person and one wealthy person, as the essence of an eruv is by foot.

hebrew_text: ״וְזוֹ הִיא שֶׁאָמְרוּ״ מַאן קָתָנֵי לַהּ — רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וְאַהֵיָיא קָאֵי — אַהָא: ״מִי שֶׁבָּא בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְחָשֵׁכָה״. ״וְלֹא אָמְרוּ מְעָרְבִין בְּפַת אֶלָּא לְהָקֵל״ מַאן קָתָנֵי לַהּ — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל.
human_translation: And this is what they said a pauper who is teaching it? Rabbi Meir. And to which is it referring? to this One who was coming along the way and it grew dark he said one establishes an eiruv with bread only to be lenient with the wealthy who is teaching it? Everyone agrees
llm_translation: "And this is what they said: Who is the Tanna of this teaching? — Rabbi Meir. And she is standing — Aha: 'One who comes on the way and it becomes dark.' 'And they did not say they mix with bread except to lighten it.' Who is the Tanna of this teaching? — The words of everyone."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: אֶחָד עָנִי וְאֶחָד עָשִׁיר מְעָרְבִין בְּפַת, וְלֹא יֵצֵא עָשִׁיר חוּץ לַתְּחוּם וְיֹאמַר: ״שְׁבִיתָתִי בִּמְקוֹמִי״ — לְפִי שֶׁלֹּא אָמְרוּ מְעָרְבִין בָּרֶגֶל אֶלָּא לְמִי שֶׁבָּא בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְחָשֵׁכָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: was taught in accordance with Rav Naḥman, Both a pauper and a wealthy person establish an eiruv with bread; however a wealthy person may not go out beyond the limit and say: My residence is in my location, because said one can establish an eiruv by foot only a person who was coming along the way and it grew dark he the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav Nachman: One poor person and one rich person may combine in an Eruv with bread, and the rich person should not go out beyond the boundary and say, "I have placed my Eruv in my place," because they only said to combine by foot for one who came on the road and it became dark, the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד עָנִי וְאֶחָד עָשִׁיר מְעָרְבִין בָּרֶגֶל, וְיֵצֵא עָשִׁיר חוּץ לַתְּחוּם: וְיֹאמַר ״תְּהֵא שְׁבִיתָתִי בִּמְקוֹמִי״, וְזֶה הוּא עִיקָּרוֹ שֶׁל עֵירוּב. וְהִתִּירוּ חֲכָמִים לְבַעַל הַבַּיִת לְשַׁלֵּחַ עֵירוּבוֹ בְּיַד עַבְדּוֹ, בְּיַד בְּנוֹ, בְּיַד שְׁלוּחוֹ בִּשְׁבִיל לְהָקֵל עָלָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Both a pauper and a wealthy person establish an eiruv by foot. And a wealthy person will go out beyond the limit and say: My residence is in my location. And this is the primary of eiruv . However, the Sages permitted a homeowner to send his eiruv in the hand of his servant, in the hand of his son, in the hand of his agent, to be lenient with him,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: One poor person and one wealthy person may combine their food for an Eruv, and the wealthy person may go out beyond the boundary. And he shall say, "Let my residence be in its place," and this is the essence of the Eruv. And the Sages permitted the homeowner to send his Eruv by the hand of his servant, by the hand of his son, or by the hand of his messenger in order to make it easier for him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאַנְשֵׁי בֵּית מֶמֶל וּבְאַנְשֵׁי בֵּית גּוּרְיוֹן בְּאָרוֹמָא שֶׁהָיוּ מְחַלְּקִין גְּרוֹגְרוֹת וְצִימּוּקִין לַעֲנִיִּים בִּשְׁנֵי בַצּוֹרֶת, וּבָאִין עֲנִיֵּי כְּפַר שִׁיחִין וַעֲנִיֵּי כְּפַר חֲנַנְיָה וּמַחְשִׁיכִין עַל הַתְּחוּם, לַמׇּחֳרָת מַשְׁכִּימִין וּבָאִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: an incident involving the members of the household of Memel and members of the household of Guryon in Aroma, who were distributing dried figs and raisins to the paupers in years of famine, and the paupers of the village of Siḥin and the paupers of the village of Ḥananya would come limit at nightfall, The following day they would rise early and go
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: There was an incident involving the people of Beit Memel and the people of Beit Gurion in Aram, who used to distribute dried figs and nuts to the poor in two baskets. The poor of Kfar Shihin and the poor of Kfar Hananya would come and wait at the boundary. The next day they would rise early and come.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי דַּיְקָא, דְּקָתָנֵי: מִי שֶׁיָּצָא לֵילֵךְ לְעִיר שֶׁמְּעָרְבִין לָהּ, וְהֶחְזִירוֹ חֲבֵרוֹ — הוּא מוּתָּר לֵילֵךְ, וְכׇל בְּנֵי הָעִיר אֲסוּרִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: The mishna is also precise, as it teaches: If one set out to go to a city for which an eiruv is established and another caused him to return he is permitted to go and all the residents of the town it is prohibited the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: The Mishnah is precise, as it teaches: "One who goes out on the eve of Shabbat to a city where they light candles for it, and his friend returns him – he is permitted to go, but all the residents of the city are forbidden," the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: וַהֲוֵינַן בַּהּ: מַאי שְׁנָא אִיהוּ וּמַאי שְׁנָא אִינְהוּ? וְאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ שְׁנֵי בָתִּים, וּשְׁנֵי תְּחוּמֵי שַׁבָּת בֵּינֵיהֶן.
human_translation: And we discussed What is different him and what is different them? And Rav Huna said: We are dealing here with where he has houses, and two Shabbat limits, between them.
llm_translation: We were engaged in it: What is the difference between him and them? And Rav Huna said: Here we are dealing with what — for example, if he has two houses, and two Shabbat boundaries between them.

hebrew_text: אִיהוּ, כֵּיוָן דְּנָפְקָא לֵיהּ לְאוֹרְחָא — הֲוָה לֵיהּ עָנִי.
human_translation: him, since he set out on his way, his is a pauper,
llm_translation: He, since he went out to the road - he was poor.

hebrew_text: וְהָנָךְ — עֲשִׁירִים נִינְהוּ. אַלְמָא כָּל ״בְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי״ — עָנִי אִין, עָשִׁיר לָא. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: And these is wealthy people, Apparently, everything in such-and-such place; a pauper, yes, a wealthy person, no, learn from this
llm_translation: "And Hanoch - they are rich. This implies that 'in a certain place' refers to a poor person, not a rich one. Learn from it."

hebrew_text: מַתְנֵי לֵיהּ רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי לְחִיָּיא בַּר רַב קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב ״אֶחָד עָנִי וְאֶחָד עָשִׁיר״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב: סַיֵּים בָּהּ נָמֵי הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi was teaching Ḥiyya bar Rav before Rav. both to a pauper and to a wealthy person. Rav said to him: Conclude also: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: He taught him: Rav Chiya bar Ashey to Chiya bar Rav before Rav, "One poor and one rich." Rav said to him: "Conclude it, yes, the halacha is like Rabbi Yehuda."

hebrew_text: רַבָּה בַּר רַב חָנָן הֲוָה רְגִיל דְּאָתֵי מֵאַרְטִיבְנָא לְפוּמְבְּדִיתָא.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Ḥanan was in the habit coming from Artibbena to Pumbedita
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Ḥanan used to come from Artivna to Pumbedita.

hebrew_text: אָמַר: ״תְּהֵא שְׁבִיתָתִי בְּצִינְתָא״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מַאי דַּעְתָּיךְ, רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה — הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מַחֲלוֹקֶת בְּ״מָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי״,
human_translation: would declare My residence is in Tzinta, Abaye said to him: What is your opinion Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda, the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, and Rav Ḥisda said: dispute in such-and-such place,
llm_translation: He said: "Let my residence be in Tzinta." Abaye said to him: What is your opinion, Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda - the halacha follows Rabbi Yehuda, and Rav Chisda said: The dispute is in a specific place.

hebrew_text: וְהָא רַב נַחְמָן, וְתַנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֲדַרִי בִּי.
human_translation: But didn’t Rav Naḥman and was taught in accordance with his said to him: I retract
llm_translation: And this, Rav Nachman, and it was taught in accordance with his opinion! He said to him: "Reconsider me."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: הֲרֵי אָמְרוּ שָׁבַת יֵשׁ לוֹ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת. הַנּוֹתֵן אֶת עֵירוּבוֹ, יֵשׁ לוֹ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama said: have said establishes has four cubits one who deposits his eiruv has four cubits or not.
llm_translation: Ramei bar Ḥama said: Behold, they said, Shabbat has four cubits. One who places his Eruv, does he have four cubits, or not?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, תָּא שְׁמַע: לֹא אָמְרוּ מְעָרְבִין בְּפַת אֶלָּא לְהָקֵל עַל הֶעָשִׁיר, שֶׁלֹּא יֵצֵא וִיעָרֵב בְּרַגְלָיו. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ אֵין לוֹ — הַאי לְהָקֵל?! לְהַחֲמִיר הוּא!
human_translation: Rava said: Come hear said one establishes an eiruv with bread only to be lenient with the wealthy so that he not go out and establish an eiruv with his feet. And if you say does not have this a leniency? It is a stringency.
llm_translation: Rava said, come and hear: They did not say to mix with bread except to lighten the burden on the poor, so that he should not go out and mix with his feet. And if you say he does not have any - is this to lighten the burden?! It is to make it more stringent!

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי נִיחָא לֵיהּ, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא נִטְרַח וְנִיפּוֹק.
human_translation: even this is preferable to him, so that he not exert himself and go out
llm_translation: Even so, it is preferable for him, so that he does not become troubled and leave.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁיָּצָא לֵילֵךְ בְּעִיר שֶׁמְּעָרְבִין בָּהּ, וְהֶחְזִירוֹ חֲבֵירוֹ — הוּא מוּתָּר לֵילֵךְ, וְכׇל בְּנֵי הָעִיר אֲסוּרִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: a person set out to go to a town for which an eiruv is established and another caused him to return he is permitted to go and all the residents of the town it is prohibited the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who goes out at night in a city where they mix in it, and his friend returns him - he is permitted to go out, and all the inhabitants of the city are forbidden, the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁהוּא יָכוֹל לְעָרֵב וְלֹא עֵירַב — הֲרֵי זֶה חַמָּר גַּמָּל.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: Anyone who can establish an eiruv , and did not establish an eiruv , is a donkey driver, and a camel driver,
