llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: Anyone who is able to mix (combine) but does not mix (combine) - behold, this is a stubborn donkey.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי שְׁנָא אִיהוּ וּמַאי שְׁנָא אִינְהוּ? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ שְׁנֵי בָתִּים, וּבֵינֵיהֶן שְׁנֵי תְּחוּמֵי שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: What is different him and what is different them? Rav Huna said: We are dealing here with where has two houses, with two Shabbat limits, between them.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the difference between "ihu" and "inhu"? Rav Huna said: Here we are dealing with what? For example, if one has two houses, and between them are two Shabbat boundaries.

hebrew_text: אִיהוּ, כֵּיוָן דִּנְפַק לֵיהּ לְאוֹרְחָא — הָוֵה לֵיהּ עָנִי. וְהָנֵי עֲשִׁירֵי נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: him, since he set out on his way, his is a pauper, And these is wealthy people,
llm_translation: He, since he went out to the road - he was poor. And those are rich.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ שְׁנֵי בָתִּים, וּבֵינֵיהֶן שְׁנֵי תְּחוּמֵי שַׁבָּת, כֵּיוָן שֶׁהֶחְזִיק בַּדֶּרֶךְ — קָנָה עֵירוּב, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: That was also taught one who has two houses, with two Shabbat limits between them, once he set out on the way, he acquired an eiruv the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: If one has two houses, and between them are two Shabbat boundaries, once he establishes a pathway - he acquires an eruv. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: יָתֵר עַל כֵּן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֲפִילּוּ מְצָאוֹ חֲבֵירוֹ וְאָמַר לוֹ: ״לִין פֹּה, עֵת חַמָּה הוּא, עֵת צִינָּה הוּא״ — לְמָחָר מַשְׁכִּים וְהוֹלֵךְ.
human_translation: Furthermore, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda said: Even if another found him and said to him: Spend the night here, it is a hot period, is a cold period on the following day he may rise early and go
llm_translation: "Moreover, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, said: Even if his friend finds him and says to him, 'Stay here, it is the time of the sun, it is the time of the shade' — the next day he gets up and goes."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: לוֹמַר — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דִּצְרִיךְ, כִּי פְּלִיגִי — לְהַחְזִיק.
human_translation: Rabba said: to saying everyone agrees is necessary, When they disagree set out
llm_translation: Rabba said: To say - all the world do not argue that it is necessary, when they do argue - to establish.

hebrew_text: וְרַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: לְהַחְזִיק — דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דִּצְרִיךְ, כִּי פְּלִיגִי — לוֹמַר.
human_translation: And Rav Yosef said: to setting out everyone agrees is necessary. Where they disagree to say
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: "To maintain - the entire world does not argue that it is necessary, if they do argue - to say."

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּאָמַר עוּלָּא: מִי שֶׁהֶחְזִיק בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְהֶחְזִירוֹ חֲבֵירוֹ — הֲרֵי הוּא מוּחְזָר וּמוּחְזָק.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is this Ulla stated? a person set out on his way, and another persuaded him to return he is returned and set out
llm_translation: As to where it goes, this is what Ulla said: "One who holds on the way and returns his fellow's lost item — behold, he is restored and strengthened."

hebrew_text: אִי מוּחְזָר, לָמָּה מוּחְזָק? וְאִי מוּחְזָק, לָמָּה מוּחְזָר?
human_translation: If he is returned, why set out And if set out why is returned?
llm_translation: If it is reversible, why is it strengthened? And if it is strengthened, why is it reversible?

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמּוּחְזָר — מוּחְזָק. כְּמַאן — כְּרַב יוֹסֵף, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: this is he is saying: Although he was returned set out In accordance with whose According to Rav Yosef, and in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: So it is stated: Even though it is being reviewed - it is established. Like whom? Like Rav Yosef, and according to the opinion of Rabbi Yosei the son of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַב יְהוּדָה בַּר אִישְׁתָּתָא אַיְיתִי לֵיהּ כַּלְכַּלָּה דְפֵירֵי לְרַב נָתָן בַּר אוֹשַׁעְיָא. כִּי הֲוָה אָזֵיל, שַׁבְקֵיהּ עַד דִּנְחֵית דַּרְגָּא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בִּית הָכָא. לִמְחַר קַדֵּים וֶאֱזִיל,
human_translation: Rav Yehuda bar Ishtata brought a basket of fruit to Rav Natan bar Oshaya When he was going, left him until he descended one step, and said to him: Lodge here On the following day rose early and went
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah bar Ishtata brought a basket of fruits to Rav Natan bar Oshaya. As he was leaving, he left it with him until he reached the next step, and said to him: "Here is your portion." The next day he came early and left.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן — כְּרַב יוֹסֵף, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה?
human_translation: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rav Yosef and in accordance with Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda
llm_translation: Like whom? Like Rav Yosef, or like the opinion of Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda?

hebrew_text: לָא, כְּרַבָּה, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: No, according to Rabba, and in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: Not like Rabba, and like Abba, son of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר כֹּל שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְעָרֵב כּוּ׳. הָא תְּנֵינָא חֲדָא זִימְנָא: סָפֵק, רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמְרִים: הֲרֵי זֶה חַמָּר גַּמָּל.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: Anyone who can establish an eiruv , Didn’t we have learned once uncertainty, Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda say: This is a donkey driver a camel driver.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says, "Anyone who is able to join (in the partnership) should do so." Now, we learned one time: in a case of doubt, Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda say, "This is a donkey of a camel."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת לָא תֵּימָא טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סָפֵק עֵירַב סָפֵק לֹא עֵירַב הוּא דְּהָוֵי חַמָּר גַּמָּל, אֲבָל וַדַּאי לֹא עֵירַב — לָא הָוֵי חַמָּר גַּמָּל.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: you will not say the reason Rabbi Meir’s uncertainty whether established an eiruv did not establish an eiruv , that he is a donkey driver a camel driver. However, certainty did not establish an eiruv he is not a donkey driver a camel driver,
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: Do not say that the reason for Rabbi Meir is that if there is a doubt whether the Eruv was made or not made, it is considered as if it was not made, for that would be a more stringent ruling. However, if it is certain that the Eruv was not made, it is not considered as if it was not made.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: אֲפִילּוּ וַדַּאי לֹא עֵירַב הָוֵי חַמָּר גַּמָּל. דְּהָא הָכָא וַדַּאי לֹא עֵירַב, וְקָא הָוֵי חַמָּר גַּמָּל.
human_translation: Rather, even certainty did not establish an eiruv a donkey driver a camel driver, as here he certainly did not establish an eiruv , and he is a donkey driver a camel driver.
llm_translation: Rather: even if definitely not mixed, it is considered a mixture of wine and oil. For here, even if definitely not mixed, it is considered a mixture of wine and oil.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁיָּצָא חוּץ לַתְּחוּם אֲפִילּוּ אַמָּה אַחַת לֹא יִכָּנֵס. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: שְׁתַּיִם — יִכָּנֵס, שָׁלֹשׁ — לֹא יִכָּנֵס.
human_translation: One who went out beyond limit, even one may not reenter. Rabbi Eliezer says: two he may reenter; three he may not reenter.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who goes out beyond the boundary, even by one cubit, may not re-enter. Rabbi Eliezer says: If it is two cubits, he may re-enter; if it is three cubits, he may not re-enter.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: רַגְלוֹ אַחַת בְּתוֹךְ הַתְּחוּם, וְרַגְלוֹ אַחַת חוּץ לַתְּחוּם — לֹא יִכָּנֵס, דִּכְתִיב: ״אִם תָּשִׁיב מִשַּׁבָּת רַגְלֶךָ״. ״רַגְלְךָ״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina said: one of his feet was within the limit, and his other foot was beyond the limit, he may not reenter, as it is written: “If you turn away your feet [ raglekha ] due to Shabbat” is written your foot
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Rabbi Chanina: One foot inside the boundary, and one foot outside the boundary - he may not enter, as it is written: "If you turn back your foot from the Sabbath." "Your foot" is written.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: רַגְלוֹ אַחַת בְּתוֹךְ הַתְּחוּם וְרַגְלוֹ אַחַת חוּץ לַתְּחוּם — יִכָּנֵס! הָא מַנִּי? אֲחֵרִים הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: לִמְקוֹם שֶׁרוּבּוֹ הוּא נִזְקָר.
human_translation: But wasn’t taught one of his feet was within the limit, and his other foot was beyond the limit, he may reenter. whose is this It is of Aḥerim , as it was taught Aḥerim say: He is attributed to the place where the majority of his body
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: If one of his feet is within the boundary and one of his feet is outside the boundary - he may enter! Is this not a contradiction? It is different, as it was taught: Others say: To the place where his majority is remembered.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: רַגְלוֹ אַחַת בְּתוֹךְ הַתְּחוּם וְרַגְלוֹ אַחַת חוּץ לַתְּחוּם — יִכָּנֵס, דִּכְתִיב: ״אִם תָּשִׁיב מִשַּׁבָּת רַגְלֶךָ״ — ״רַגְלֶיךָ״ קָרֵינַן.
human_translation: Some say Rabbi Ḥanina said: one of his feet was within the limit, and his other foot was beyond the limit, he may reenter, as it is written: “If you turn away your feet due to Shabbat” We read your feet,
llm_translation: There are some who say, Rabbi Chanina said: If one foot is within the boundary and one foot is outside the boundary - he may enter, as it is written: "If you turn back your foot from the Sabbath" - "your feet" we read.

hebrew_text: וְהַתַּנְיָא: לֹא יִכָּנֵס! הוּא דְּאָמַר כַּאֲחֵרִים, דְּתַנְיָא: לִמְקוֹם שֶׁרוּבּוֹ הוּא נִזְקָר.
human_translation: But wasn’t taught He may not reenter? stated in accordance with Aḥerim , as it was taught He is attributed to the place where the majority of his body
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And it was taught: He should not enter! This is like others said, as it was taught: To a place where his majority is remembered."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר שְׁתַּיִם יִכָּנֵס שָׁלֹשׁ לֹא יִכָּנֵס. וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אַחַת — יִכָּנֵס, שְׁתַּיִם — לֹא יִכָּנֵס. לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דַּעֲקַר חֲדָא וְקָם אַתַּרְתֵּי. הָא דַּעֲקַר תַּרְתֵּי וְקָם אַתְּלָת.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: two he may reenter; three he may not reenter. But wasn’t it taught Rabbi Eliezer says: one he may reenter; two he may not reenter. not a difficulty. This, he moved the first and is standing two however, that, he moved the second and is standing three
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: two may enter, three may not enter. And it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: one may enter, two may not enter. This is not difficult: here, one was uprooted and two remained. There, two were uprooted and three remained.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ אַמָּה אַחַת לֹא יִכָּנֵס! כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא לְמוֹדֵד, דִּתְנַן: וְלַמּוֹדֵד שֶׁאָמְרוּ נוֹתְנִין לוֹ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה — אֲפִילּוּ סוֹף מִדָּתוֹ כָּלֶה בִּמְעָרָה.
human_translation: But wasn’t it taught Rabbi Eliezer says: Even one cubit he may not enter. When that was taught one measuring As we learned And one is measuring with regard to whom said one provides him two thousand cubits, even if his measurement ended in a cave
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "And it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: Even one cubit should not enter! For it was taught in that Mishnah concerning the surveyor, as we learned: And for the surveyor, about whom they said, they give him two thousand cubits — even if the end of his measurement ends in a cave."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁהֶחֱשִׁיךְ חוּץ לַתְּחוּם אֲפִילּוּ אַמָּה אַחַת לֹא יִכָּנֵס. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה אַמּוֹת יִכָּנֵס, שֶׁאֵין הַמָּשׁוֹחוֹת מְמַצִּין אֶת הַמִּדּוֹת מִפְּנֵי הַטּוֹעִין.
human_translation: one whom it grew dark outside the limit even one cubit he may not enter Rabbi Shimon says: Even fifteen cubits he may enter because the surveyors do not precisely demarcate the measures; due to those who err.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who darkened outside the boundary, even by one cubit, may not enter. Rabbi Shimon says: Even if it is fifteen cubits, he may enter, for the anointed ones do not establish measurements due to errors.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: מִפְּנֵי טוֹעֵי הַמִּדָּה.
human_translation: taught Due to those who err in their measurement.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara Tanah: mipnei toei ha'middah. English translation: A Tannaitic teaching: because of those who err in measurement.

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ מִי שֶׁהוֹצִיאוּהוּ
llm_translation: We will return to you, O one who has brought it out.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כֵּיצַד מְעַבְּרִין אֶת הֶעָרִים? בַּיִת נִכְנָס בַּיִת יוֹצֵא, פִּגּוּם נִכְנָס פִּגּוּם יוֹצֵא, הָיוּ שָׁם גְּדוּדִיּוֹת גְּבוֹהוֹת עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים,
human_translation: How does one extend cities a house is recessed and house protrudes, a turret [ pagum ] is recessed and turret protrudes there were remnants ten handbreadths high,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: How do they transfer the cities? A house enters, a house exits; a breach enters, a breach exits. If there were there high battlements of ten handbreadths.

hebrew_text: וּגְשָׁרִים וּנְפָשׁוֹת שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן בֵּית דִּירָה — מוֹצִיאִין אֶת הַמִּדָּה כְּנֶגְדָּן. וְעוֹשִׂין אוֹתָהּ כְּמִין טַבְלָא מְרוּבַּעַת, כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא נִשְׂכָּר אֶת הַזָּוִיּוֹת.
human_translation: and bridges and monuments in which there is a residence, one extends the measure opposite them And one renders like a square tablet so that it gains the corners,
llm_translation: "and gesharim and nefashot that have a house - they take out the measuring line opposite them. And they make it like a square tablet, so that the corners may be measured."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל: חַד תָּנֵי ״מְעַבְּרִין״ וְחַד תָּנֵי ״מְאַבְּרִין״.
human_translation: Rav and Shmuel One taught me’abberin , and one taught me’abberin ,
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav and Shmuel: One teaches "me'abrin" and one teaches "me'abrin."

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּתָנֵי ״מְאַבְּרִין״ — אֵבֶר אֵבֶר, וּמַאן דְּתָנֵי ״מְעַבְּרִין״ — כְּאִשָּׁה עוּבָּרָהּ.
human_translation: The one who taught me’abberin limb ever limb. And the one who taught me’abberin a pregnant woman ubbera
llm_translation: One who teaches "me'abrin" - limb by limb, and one who teaches "me'abrin" - like a pregnant woman.

hebrew_text: מְעָרַת הַמַּכְפֵּלָה, רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל, חַד אָמַר: שְׁנֵי בָתִּים זֶה לִפְנִים מִזֶּה, וְחַד אָמַר: בַּיִת וַעֲלִיָּיה עַל גַּבָּיו.
human_translation: the Machpelah Cave, Rav and Shmuel One said: two rooms, one in the other. And one said: a room and story above it.
llm_translation: The Cave of Machpelah, Rav and Shmuel, one said: "Two houses, this one in front of that one," and one said: "A house and an upper story on top of it."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר זֶה עַל גַּב זֶה — הַיְינוּ ״מַכְפֵּלָה״. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שְׁנֵי בָתִּים זֶה לִפְנִים מִזֶּה, מַאי ״מַכְפֵּלָה״?
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said one above the other, that is Machpelah, double. However, according to the one who said two rooms, one in the other, what Machpelah?
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says "this on top of this" — that is "makhpelah." But according to the one who says "two houses, this one in front of this," what is "makhpelah"?

hebrew_text: שֶׁכְּפוּלָה בְּזוּגוֹת. ״מַמְרֵא קִרְיַת אַרְבַּע״, אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק, קִרְיַת הָאַרְבַּע זוּגוֹת: אָדָם וְחַוָּה, אַבְרָהָם וְשָׂרָה, יִצְחָק וְרִבְקָה, יַעֲקֹב וְלֵאָה.
human_translation: that it is doubled with in pairs. “Mamre Kiryat Ha’Arba, Rabbi Yitzḥak said: the city of the four couples Adam and Eve, Abraham and Sarah, Isaac and Rebecca, Jacob and Leah.
llm_translation: The text reads: "That she was doubled in pairs. 'The bitterness of the city of Arba,' Rabbi Yitzchak said, the city of the four pairs: Adam and Eve, Abraham and Sarah, Isaac and Rebekah, Jacob and Leah."

hebrew_text: ״וַיְהִי בִּימֵי אַמְרָפֶל״, רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל, חַד אָמַר: נִמְרוֹד שְׁמוֹ. וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ אַמְרָפֶל? שֶׁאָמַר וְהִפִּיל לְאַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ בְּתוֹךְ כִּבְשַׁן הָאֵשׁ, וְחַד אָמַר: אַמְרָפֶל שְׁמוֹ, וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ נִמְרוֹד? שֶׁהִמְרִיד אֶת כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ עָלָיו בְּמַלְכוּתוֹ.
human_translation: “And it came to pass in the days of Amraphel” Rav and Shmuel one said: Nimrod was his name. And why was his name called Amraphel? As he said [ amar ] and cast [ hippil ] our father Abraham into the fiery furnace, And one said: Amraphel was his name. And why was his name called Nimrod? Because he caused the entire world to rebel [ himrid ] God during his reign.
llm_translation: "And it came to pass in the days of Amraphel," Rav and Shmuel, one said: his name is Nimrod. And why was his name called Amraphel? Because he said, "And he cast Abraham our father into the midst of the fiery furnace." And one said: his name is Amraphel, and why was his name called Nimrod? Because he rebelled against the entire world and ruled over them all in his kingdom."

hebrew_text: ״וַיָּקׇם מֶלֶךְ חָדָשׁ עַל מִצְרָיִם״, רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל, חַד אָמַר: חָדָשׁ מַמָּשׁ, וְחַד אָמַר: שֶׁנִּתְחַדְּשׁוּ גְּזֵירוֹתָיו.
human_translation: “There arose a new king over Egypt, Rav and Shmuel One said: actually new and one said: his decrees were new.
llm_translation: "And a new king arose over Egypt," Rav and Shmuel, one said: literally new, and one said: that his decrees were renewed.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר חָדָשׁ מַמָּשׁ — דִּכְתִיב ״חָדָשׁ״, וּמַאן דְּאָמַר שֶׁנִּתְחַדְּשׁוּ גְּזֵירוֹתָיו — מִדְּלָא כְּתִיב ״וַיָּמׇת וַיִּמְלוֹךְ״.
human_translation: The one who said actually new that it is written new. And the one who said that his decrees were new from that it is not written: And died, and reigned,
llm_translation: One who says "completely new" - as it is written "new", and one who says "that his decrees were renewed" - because it is not written "and he died and he reigned."

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר שֶׁנִּתְחַדְּשׁוּ גְּזֵירוֹתָיו, הָא כְתִיב ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא יָדַע אֶת יוֹסֵף״? מַאי ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא יָדַע אֶת יוֹסֵף״ — דַּהֲוָה דָּמֵי כְּמַאן דְּלָא יָדַע לֵיהּ לְיוֹסֵף כְּלָל.
human_translation: And according to the one who said that his decrees were new, isn’t it written: “Who knew not Joseph”? What is “Who knew not Joseph”? that he like one who did not know Joseph at all.
llm_translation: And for the one who says that his decrees were renewed, behold it is written, "who did not know Joseph"? What is "who did not know Joseph" - it is as if he did not know Joseph at all.

hebrew_text: (סִימָן: שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה וּשְׁנֵים עָשָׂר לָמַדְנוּ בְּדָוִד וַיִּבֶן.)
human_translation: mnemonic Eighteen and twelve we studied, with regard to David, and he will understand.
llm_translation: Tractate: (Siman: Shemoneh Esreh u'Shneim Asar Lamadnu be'David va'Yiven) Translation: (Chapter: Eighteen and Twelve We Learned in David and He Built)

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שְׁמוֹנָה עָשָׂר יָמִים גִּידַּלְתִּי אֵצֶל רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא בְּרִיבִּי וְלֹא לָמַדְתִּי מִמֶּנּוּ אֶלָּא דָּבָר אֶחָד בְּמִשְׁנָתֵינוּ: כֵּיצַד מְאַבְּרִין אֶת הֶעָרִים — בְּאָלֶף.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: I spent eighteen days with Rabbi Oshaya the Distinguished [ Beribbi ], and I learned from him only one matter in our Mishna. How does one extend cities, with an alef .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "I spent eighteen days with Rabbi Oshaya son of Ribbi, and I did not learn from him except one thing in our Mishnah: How do we declare cities as walled? - With a thousand."

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר תַּלְמִידִים הָיוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא בְּרִיבִּי, וּשְׁמוֹנָה עָשָׂר יָמִים גִּידַּלְתִּי בֵּינֵיהֶן, וְלָמַדְתִּי לֵב כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד, וְחׇכְמַת כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד?
human_translation: Is this so? Didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: Rabbi Oshaya the Distinguished had twelve students, and I spent eighteen days among them, and I learned the heart of each and every one, and the wisdom of each and every one?
llm_translation: I?! And did not Rabbi Yochanan say: Rabbi Oshaya Ribbi had twelve disciples, and for eighteen days I distinguished between them, and I learned the heart of each one, and the wisdom of each one?

hebrew_text: לֵב כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד וְחׇכְמַת כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד גְּמַר, גְּמָרָא — לָא גְּמַר. אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מִנַּיְיהוּ דִּידְהוּ — גְּמַר, מִינֵּיהּ דִּידֵיהּ — לָא גְּמַר. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דָּבָר אֶחָד בְּמִשְׁנָתֵינוּ קָאָמַר.
human_translation: he learned the heart of each and every one and the wisdom of each and every one, he did not learn tradition. if you wish, say From themselves he learned from himself he did not learn And if you wish, say say in our Mishna
llm_translation: The heart of each and every one and the wisdom of each and every one is complete, Gemara - not complete. If you wish, say: From their own perspective - complete, from the perspective of others - not complete. And if you wish, say: One matter he is speaking of in our Mishnah.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּשֶׁהָיִינוּ לוֹמְדִין תּוֹרָה אֵצֶל רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא, הָיִינוּ יוֹשְׁבִין אַרְבָּעָה אַרְבָּעָה בְּאַמָּה. אָמַר רַבִּי: כְּשֶׁהָיִינוּ לוֹמְדִין תּוֹרָה אֵצֶל רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן שַׁמּוּעַ, הָיִינוּ יוֹשְׁבִין שִׁשָּׁה שִׁשָּׁה בְּאַמָּה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said When we were studying Torah with Rabbi Oshaya, we would sit four in each cubit. Rabbi said: When we were studying Torah with Rabbi Elazar ben Shamua, we would sit six in each cubit.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: When we were learning Torah by Rabbi Oshaya, we would sit four by four cubits. Rabbi said: When we were learning Torah by Rabbi Elazar ben Shamua, we would sit six by six cubits.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא בְּרִיבִּי בְּדוֹרוֹ כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר בְּדוֹרוֹ, מָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר בְּדוֹרוֹ לֹא יָכְלוּ חֲבֵרָיו לַעֲמוֹד עַל סוֹף דַּעְתּוֹ — אַף רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא לֹא יָכְלוּ חֲבֵרָיו לַעֲמוֹד עַל סוֹף דַּעְתּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said Rabbi Oshaya the Distinguished in his generation as Rabbi Meir in his generation: Just as Rabbi Meir, in his generation his colleagues were unable to fully grasp his thinking so Rabbi Oshaya; his colleagues were unable to fully grasp his thinking.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: Rabbi Oshaya son of Ribi in his generation was like Rabbi Meir in his generation, just as Rabbi Meir in his generation his colleagues could not stand at the end of his understanding — so too Rabbi Oshaya, his colleagues could not stand at the end of his understanding.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לִבָּן שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹנִים כְּפִתְחוֹ שֶׁל אוּלָם, וְשֶׁל אַחֲרוֹנִים כְּפִתְחוֹ שֶׁל הֵיכָל, וְאָנוּ — כִּמְלֹא נֶקֶב מַחַט סִידְקִית.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The hearts, of early like the doorway to the Entrance Hall and of later were like the doorway to the Sanctuary, And we, are like eye of a fine needle.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: The white of the first Temple is like the opening of a hall, and that of the last Temple is like the opening of a palace, and we are like the filling of a needle's eye.

hebrew_text: רִאשׁוֹנִים — רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, אַחֲרוֹנִים — רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן שַׁמּוּעַ. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: רִאשׁוֹנִים — רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן שַׁמּוּעַ, אַחֲרוֹנִים — רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא בְּרִיבִּי. וְאָנוּ כִּמְלֹא נֶקֶב מַחַט סִידְקִית.
human_translation: early Rabbi Akiva, later Rabbi Elazar ben Shamua. Some say early Rabbi Elazar ben Shamua later Rabbi Oshaya the Distinguished. And we are like eye of a fine needle.
llm_translation: The early authorities - Rabbi Akiva, the later authorities - Rabbi Elazar ben Shamua. Some say: the early authorities - Rabbi Elazar ben Shamua, the later authorities - Rabbi Oshaya beribbi. And we are like a needle's eye.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: וַאֲנַן, כִּי סִיכְּתָא בְּגוּדָּא לִגְמָרָא. אָמַר רָבָא: וַאֲנַן, כִּי אֶצְבַּעְתָּא בְּקִירָא לִסְבָרָא. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אֲנַן, כִּי אֶצְבַּעְתָּא בְּבֵירָא לְשִׁכְחָה.
human_translation: Abaye said: And we, are like a peg in the wall with regard to study. Rava said: And we are like a finger in wax [ kira ] with regard to logical reasoning. Rav Ashi said: We are like a finger in a pit with regard to forgetfulness.
llm_translation: Abaye said: And we, when we place a peg in the wall, it is for finality. Rava said: And we, when we place a finger in a pot, it is for inspection. Rav Ashi said: We, when we place a finger in a cistern, it is to forget.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: בְּנֵי יְהוּדָה שֶׁהִקְפִּידוּ עַל לְשׁוֹנָם, נִתְקַיְּימָה תּוֹרָתָם בְּיָדָם. בְּנֵי גָלִיל שֶׁלֹּא הִקְפִּידוּ עַל לְשׁוֹנָם, לֹא נִתְקַיְּימָה תּוֹרָתָם בְּיָדָם.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said that Rav said: the people of Judea, who were particular in their speech their Torah endured for them; the people of the Galilee, who were not particular in their speech, their Torah did not endure for them.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The children of Judah who were meticulous with their language, their Torah was upheld in their hands. The children of Galilee who were not meticulous with their language, their Torah was not upheld in their hands.

hebrew_text: מִידֵּי בִּקְפֵידָא תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא? אֶלָּא: בְּנֵי יְהוּדָה דְּדָיְיקִי לִישָּׁנָא, וּמַתְנְחִי לְהוּ סִימָנָא, נִתְקַיְּימָה תּוֹרָתָן בְּיָדָן. בְּנֵי גָלִיל דְּלָא דָּיְיקִי לִישָּׁנָא, וְלָא מַתְנְחִי לְהוּ סִימָנָא, לֹא נִתְקַיְּימָה תּוֹרָתָן בְּיָדָם.
human_translation: Is matter at all dependent on particular Rather, the people of Judea, who were precise in their language and would formulate mnemonics their Torah endured for them; the people of the Galilee, who were not precise in their language and would not formulate mnemonics, their Torah did not endure for them.
llm_translation: From the meticulousness of the matter? Rather: the sons of Judah who are precise in reviewing, and establish for themselves a sign, their Torah is upheld in their hands. The sons of Galilee who are not precise in reviewing, and do not establish for themselves a sign, their Torah is not upheld in their hands.

hebrew_text: בְּנֵי יְהוּדָה גְּמַרוּ מֵחַד רַבָּה, נִתְקַיְּימָה תּוֹרָתָן בְּיָדָם. בְּנֵי גָלִיל דְּלָא גָּמְרִי מֵחַד רַבָּה, לֹא נִתְקַיְּימָה תּוֹרָתָן בְּיָדָם.
human_translation: the people of Judea, studied from one teacher, their Torah endured for them, the people of the Galilee, who did not study from one teacher, their Torah did not endure for them,
llm_translation: Sons of Judah completed from one Rabah, their Torah was established in their hands. Sons of Galil who did not complete from one Rabah, their Torah was not established in their hands.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: בְּנֵי יְהוּדָה דְּגַלּוֹ מַסֶּכְתָּא, נִתְקַיְּימָה תּוֹרָתָן בְּיָדָם. בְּנֵי גָלִיל דְּלָא גַּלּוֹ מַסֶּכְתָּא, לֹא נִתְקַיְּימָה תּוֹרָתָן בְּיָדָם.
human_translation: Ravina said: the people of Judea, who would disclose the tractate their Torah endured for them; the people of the Galilee, who would not disclose the tractate their Torah did not endure for them.
llm_translation: Ravina said: The sons of Judah who revealed their learning, their Torah was established in their hands. The sons of Galilee who did not reveal their learning, their Torah was not established in their hands.

hebrew_text: דָּוִד גַּלִּי מַסֶּכְתָּא, שָׁאוּל לָא גַּלִּי מַסֶּכְתָּא. דָּוִד דְּגַלִּי מַסֶּכְתָּא, כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ: ״יְרֵאֶיךָ יִרְאוּנִי וְיִשְׂמָחוּ״. שָׁאוּל דְּלָא גַּלִּי מַסֶּכְתָּא, כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ: ״(אֶל כׇּל) אֲשֶׁר יִפְנֶה
human_translation: David would disclose the tractate Saul would not disclose the tractate With regard to David, who would disclose the tractate, it is written: “Those who fear You will see me and be glad” With regard to Saul, who would not disclose the tractate it is written: “And wherever he turned himself
llm_translation: David revealed a tractate, while Saul did not reveal a tractate. David, who revealed a tractate, it is written about him: "Those who fear You will see me and rejoice." Saul, who did not reveal a tractate, it is written about him: "(To all) who turn away."

hebrew_text: יַרְשִׁיעַ״.
human_translation: he did them mischief”
llm_translation: The Talmudic text "yarshi'a."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִנַּיִין שֶׁמָּחַל לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא עַל אוֹתוֹ עָוֹן — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מָחָר אַתָּה וּבָנֶיךָ עִמִּי״. עִמִּי — בִּמְחִיצָתִי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: From where that the Holy One, Blessed be He, forgave him for that sin, As it is stated and tomorrow shall you and your sons be with me” “with me” within my partition
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: From where do we derive that the Holy One, blessed be He, forgave him for that sin? As it is stated: "Tomorrow you and your sons will be with me." With me - within my partition.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא: אִי אִיכָּא דִּמְשַׁאֵיל לְהוּ לִבְנֵי יְהוּדָה דְּדָיְיקִי לִשָּׁנֵי — מְאַבְּרִין תְּנַן אוֹ מְעַבְּרִין תְּנַן, אַכּוּזוֹ תְּנַן אוֹ עַכּוּזוֹ תְּנַן, יָדְעִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said: If there is anyone who can ask the people of Judea, who are precise in their language, we learned me’abberin or me’abberin was we learned akkuzo or did we learn akkuzo They would know.
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said: If there are those among the children of Judah who are meticulous in their language, we teach them "m'abrin t'nan" or "m'abrin t'nan," "akuzo t'nan" or "akuzo t'nan," they will understand.

hebrew_text: שְׁאֵילִינְהוּ וְאָמְרִי לֵיהּ: אִיכָּא דְּתָנֵי מְאַבְּרִין, וְאִיכָּא דְּתָנֵי מְעַבְּרִין. אִיכָּא דְּתָנֵי אַכּוּזוֹ וְאִיכָּא דְּתָנֵי עַכּוּזוֹ.
human_translation: One asked and they said to him: Some teach me’abberin and some teach me’abberin Some teach akkuzo and some teach akkuzo
llm_translation: They asked him and said to him: Is there one who teaches "me'abrin" and is there one who teaches "me'abrin"? Is there one who teaches "akuzo" and is there one who teaches "akuzo"?

hebrew_text: בְּנֵי יְהוּדָה דָּיְיקִי לִישָּׁנָא מַאי הִיא? דְּהָהוּא בַּר יְהוּדָה דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ: טַלִּית יֵשׁ לִי לִמְכּוֹר. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מַאי גּווֹן טַלִּיתְךָ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: כִּתְרָדִין עֲלֵי אֲדָמָה.
human_translation: the people of Judea are precise in their speech, What is As a certain person from Judea who said to those I have a cloak to sell. They said to him: What color is your cloak? He said to them: Like beets on the ground,
llm_translation: Sons of Judah, Daiqi, to change what is it? For that son of Judah who said to them: "A cloak I have to sell." They said to him: "What color is your cloak?" He said to them: "Like the roses of the field."

hebrew_text: בְּנֵי גָלִיל דְּלָא דָּיְיקִי לִישָּׁנָא מַאי הִיא? (דְּתַנְיָא) דְּהָהוּא בַּר גָּלִילָא [דַּהֲוָה קָאָזֵיל] וַאֲמַר לְהוּ: ״אֲמַר לְמַאן, אֲמַר לְמַאן?״ אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: גָּלִילָאָה שׁוֹטֶה, חֲמַר לְמִירְכַּב אוֹ חֲמַר לְמִישְׁתֵּי? עֲמַר לְמִילְבַּשׁ אוֹ אִימַּר לְאִיתְכַּסָּאָה?
human_translation: the people of the Galilee, who are not precise in their speech. What is As it was taught that a certain person from the Galilee who would walk and say Who has amar ? Who has amar ? They said to him: Foolish Galilean, a donkey [ ḥamor ] to ride, or wine [ ḥamar ] to drink, wool [ amar ] to wear, or a lamb [ imar ] to slaughter.
llm_translation: Sons of Galil who do not pay attention to learning, what is it? (For it was taught) that that son of Galil who was walking and said to them: "He said to whom, he said to whom?" They said to him: "Is Galil foolish, is it for riding a donkey or is it for drinking wine? Is it for wearing clothes or is it for covering oneself?"

hebrew_text: הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא דְּבָעֲיָא לְמֵימַר לַחֲבֶרְתַּהּ: ״תָּאִי דְּאוֹכְלִיךְ חֲלָבָא״, אֲמַרָה לַהּ: ״שְׁלוּכָתִי, תּוֹכְלִיךָ לָבִיא״.
human_translation: a certain woman who wanted to say to her friend: come and I will feed you milk [ ta’i de’okhlikh ḥelba ]; she said to her: My neighbor, lioness eat you [ tokhlikh lavya ].
llm_translation: That woman who wanted to say to her friend: "Come, eat milk," she said to her: "I am a Nazirite, you may eat meat."

hebrew_text: הַהִיא אִתְּתָא דְּאָתְיָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּדַיָּינָא, אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: ״מָרִי כִּירִי, תַּפְלָא הֲוָית לִי וְגַנְבוּךְ מִין. וְכַדּוּ הֲווֹת, דְּכַד שָׁדְרוּ לָךְ עִילָּוַיהּ — לָא מָטֵי כַּרְעָיךְ אַאַרְעָא״.
human_translation: a certain woman who came before a judge she said to him: Master, servant [ Mari kiri , I had a beam and they stole you from me tafla havet li ugenavukh min And it was so that when they would hang you upon it, your feet would not reach the ground.
llm_translation: The woman who came before the judge said to him: "My master, my husband, a wonder happened to me and they stole from me. And when they sent you a summons, you did not bend your knees to the ground."

hebrew_text: אַמְהֲתָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי כִּי הֲוָה מִשְׁתַּעְיָא בִּלְשׁוֹן חׇכְמָה, אָמְרָה הָכִי: עֶלֶת נְקַפַת בְּכַד, יִדְאוֹן נִישְׁרַיָּא לְקִינֵּיהוֹן.
human_translation: The maidservant in the house of Rabbi when she would speak enigmatically, she would say as follows: The ladle is knocking against the jug, Let the eagles fly to their nests,
llm_translation: The maid of the house of Rabbi, when she erred in the language of wisdom, said thus: "A basket of figs in a jar, the handles are suitable for their nests."

hebrew_text: וְכַד הֲוָה בָּעֵי דְּלִיתְּבוּן, הֲוָה אָמְרָה לְהוּ: יִעְדֵּי בָּתַר חֲבֶרְתַּהּ מִינַּהּ, וְתִתְקְפֵי עֶלֶת בְּכַד, כְּאִילְפָא דְּאָזְלָא בְּיַמָּא.
human_translation: And when wanted them to sit, she would say to them: Let us remove from another and let the ladle in the jug like a ship sailing in the sea.
llm_translation: And when it was that they were in need, she said to them: "Go after her friend, and take a pitcher of water, like the antelope that goes out to the sea."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר אָסְיָין כִּי הֲוָה מִשְׁתַּעֵי בִּלְשׁוֹן חׇכְמָה, אֲמַר: עֲשׂוּ לִי שׁוֹר בְּמִשְׁפָּט בְּטוּר מִסְכֵּן.
human_translation: when Rabbi Yosei bar Asyan would speak enigmatically, he would say: Prepare for me an ox in judgment on a poor mountain.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Asiyin, when he was engaged in the language of wisdom, said: "Make for me an ox in judgment, in the form of a poor man."

hebrew_text: וְכַד הֲוָה שָׁאֵיל בְּאוּשְׁפִּיזָא, אָמַר הָכִי: גְּבַר פּוּם דֵּין חַי, מַה זּוֹ טוֹבָה יֵשׁ?
human_translation: And when he would inquire about an inn, he would say as follows: This man here is raw; what is this good that there is?
llm_translation: And when he was in Oushpiza, he said thus: "A man whose judgment is alive, what goodness is there?"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ כִּי הֲוָה מִשְׁתַּעֵי בִּלְשׁוֹן חׇכְמָה, הֲוָה אָמַר הָכִי: אַתְרִיגוּ לְפֶחָמִין, אַרְקִיעוּ לִזְהָבִין, וַעֲשׂוּ לִי שְׁנֵי מַגִּידֵי בַּעֲלָטָה. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: וְיַעֲשׂוּ לִי בָּהֶן שְׁנֵי מַגִּידֵי בַּעֲלָטָה.
human_translation: When Rabbi Abbahu would speak enigmatically, he would say as follows: Make the coals the color of an etrog ; beat the golden ones, and make me two speakers-in-the-dark, Some say And they shall make me in them, two speakers-in-the-dark.
llm_translation: Rabbi Abbahu, when he would engage in the language of wisdom, would say thus: "Weave for me coals, spread out for me gold, and make for me two storytellers of the palace." Some say: "And make for me with them two storytellers of the palace."

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: הַצְפִּינֵנוּ הֵיכָן רַבִּי אִלְעַאי צָפוּן. אָמַר לָהֶן: עָלַץ בְּנַעֲרָה אַהֲרוֹנִית אַחֲרוֹנִית עֵירָנִית וְהִנְעִירַתּוּ.
human_translation: the Sages said to Rabbi Abbahu: Show us [ hatzpinenu ] where Rabbi Elai is hiding [ tzafun ], He said to them: He rejoiced with the latter [ aḥaronit ] Aharonic [ Aharonit ] girl; she is lively [ eiranit ] and kept him awake [ vehiniratu ].
llm_translation: The sages said to Rabbi Avahu: "Where did Rabbi Elai hide us?" He said to them: "He delighted in a young, last, and watchful woman, and he aroused her."

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לַהּ אִשָּׁה.
human_translation: Some say a woman,
llm_translation: They said to her, "Woman."

hebrew_text: וְאָמְרִי לַהּ מַסֶּכְתָּא.
human_translation: And some say a tractate.
llm_translation: And they said to her, "You are a tractate."

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אִלְעַאי: הַצְפִּינֵנוּ הֵיכָן רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ [צָפוּן]. אָמַר לָהֶן: נִתְיָיעֵץ בַּמַּכְתִּיר וְהִנְגִּיב לִמְפִיבֹשֶׁת.
human_translation: They said to Rabbi Elai: Show us where Rabbi Abbahu is hiding, He said to them: He has taken counsel with the one who crowns, and has gone south hingiv to Mephibosheth,
llm_translation: They said to Rabbi Ilai: "Where have we hidden Rabbi Abahu?" He said to them: "He consulted with the King and responded to Mephibosheth."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן חֲנַנְיָה: מִיָּמַי לֹא נִצְּחַנִי אָדָם חוּץ מֵאִשָּׁה תִּינוֹק וְתִינוֹקֶת. אִשָּׁה מַאי הִיא? פַּעַם אַחַת נִתְאָרַחְתִּי אֵצֶל אַכְסַנְיָא אַחַת, עָשְׂתָה לִי פּוֹלִין בְּיוֹם רִאשׁוֹן — אֲכַלְתִּים וְלֹא שִׁיַּירְתִּי מֵהֶן כְּלוּם. שְׁנִיָּיה, וְלֹא שִׁיַּירְתִּי מֵהֶן כְּלוּם. בְּיוֹם שְׁלִישִׁי הִקְדִּיחָתַן בְּמֶלַח, כֵּיוָן שֶׁטָּעַמְתִּי — מָשַׁכְתִּי יָדַי מֵהֶן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya said In my days, no person defeated me except for a woman, a young boy, and a young girl. What is a woman One time I was staying at a certain inn prepared me beans. On the first day I ate them and left nothing over, second and left nothing over. she over-salted them As soon as I tasted I withdrew my hands from them.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Chananiah said: "Throughout my life, no one has ever outsmarted me except for a woman, a child, and a female child. What is a woman? Once I was a guest at an inn, and the hostess made lentils for me on Sunday. I ate them and did not leave any over. She made them again on Monday, and I did not leave any over. On Tuesday, she seasoned them with salt, and as soon as I tasted them, I withdrew my hand from them."

hebrew_text: אָמְרָה לִי: רַבִּי, מִפְּנֵי מָה אֵינְךָ סוֹעֵד? אָמַרְתִּי לָהּ: כְּבָר סָעַדְתִּי מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם. אָמְרָה לִי: הָיָה לְךָ לִמְשׁוֹךְ יָדֶיךָ מִן הַפַּת!
human_translation: She said to me: My Rabbi, why aren’t you eating I said to her: I have already eaten during the daytime. She said to me: You should have withdrawn your hand from bread
llm_translation: She said to me: Rabbi, why are you not eating? I said to her: I have already eaten earlier today. She said to me: You should have refrained from the bread!

hebrew_text: אָמְרָה לִי: רַבִּי, שֶׁמָּא לֹא הִנַּחְתָּ פֵּאָה בָּרִאשׁוֹנִים? וְלֹא כָּךְ אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: אֵין מְשַׁיְּירִין פֵּאָה בָּאִלְפָּס, אֲבָל מְשַׁיְּירִין פֵּאָה בַּקְּעָרָה.
human_translation: She said to me: My Rabbi, perhaps you did not leave a remainder on the first Isn’t this what the Sages said: One need not leave a remainder in the pot [ ilpas ], but one must leave a remainder on the plate
llm_translation: She said to me: Rabbi, perhaps you did not leave the corner of the field in the first harvest? But the sages did not say so: We do not leave the corner of the field in the thousands, but we leave the corner of the field in the basket.

hebrew_text: תִּינוֹקֶת מַאי הִיא? פַּעַם אַחַת הָיִיתִי מְהַלֵּךְ בַּדֶּרֶךְ, וְהָיְתָה דֶּרֶךְ עוֹבֶרֶת בַּשָּׂדֶה, וְהָיִיתִי מְהַלֵּךְ בָּהּ. אָמְרָה לִי תִּינוֹקֶת אַחַת: רַבִּי, לֹא שָׂדֶה הִיא זוֹ? אָמַרְתִּי לָהּ: לֹא, דֶּרֶךְ כְּבוּשָׁה הִיא. אָמְרָה לִי: לִיסְטִים כְּמוֹתְךָ כְּבָשׁוּהָ.
human_translation: What is a young girl? One time I was walking along the path, and the path passed through a field, and I was walking on it. A certain young girl said to me: My Rabbi, isn’t this a field? I said to her: Isn’t it a well-trodden path She said to me: Robbers like you have trodden it.
llm_translation: Infant, what is it? Once I was walking on the road, and the road was passing through a field, and I was walking on it. An infant said to me: Rabbi, is this a field? I said to her: No, it is a paved road. She said to me: fools like you have paved it.

hebrew_text: תִּינוֹק מַאי הִיא? פַּעַם אַחַת הָיִיתִי מְהַלֵּךְ בַּדֶּרֶךְ, וְרָאִיתִי תִּינוֹק יוֹשֵׁב עַל פָּרָשַׁת דְּרָכִים. וְאָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: בְּאֵיזֶה דֶּרֶךְ נֵלֵךְ לָעִיר? אָמַר לִי: זוֹ קְצָרָה וַאֲרוּכָּה, וְזוֹ אֲרוּכָּה וּקְצָרָה. וְהָלַכְתִּי בִּקְצָרָה וַאֲרוּכָּה, כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגַּעְתִּי לָעִיר מָצָאתִי שֶׁמַּקִּיפִין אוֹתָהּ גַּנּוֹת וּפַרְדֵּיסִין.
human_translation: What is a young boy? One time I was walking along the path, and I saw a young boy sitting at the crossroads. And I said to him: On which path shall we walk to the city? He said to me: This is short and long, and that is long and short. I walked on the short and long. When I approached the city I found that gardens and orchards surrounded it,
llm_translation: Child, what is it? Once I was walking on the road, and I saw a child sitting on the crossroads. And I said to him: In which way shall we go to the city? He said to me: This is short and long, and this is long and short. And I went in the short and long way, and when I arrived at the city, I found that they surrounded it with gardens and orchards.

hebrew_text: חָזַרְתִּי לַאֲחוֹרַי. אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: בְּנִי, הֲלֹא אָמַרְתָּ לִי קְצָרָה? אָמַר לִי: וְלֹא אָמַרְתִּי לְךָ אֲרוּכָּה? נְשַׁקְתִּיו עַל רֹאשׁוֹ, וְאָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: אַשְׁרֵיכֶם יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁכּוּלְּכֶם חֲכָמִים גְּדוֹלִים אַתֶּם, מִגְּדוֹלְכֶם וְעַד קְטַנְּכֶם.
human_translation: I went back said to him: My son, didn’t you tell me short? He said to me: And didn’t I tell you long? I kissed him on his head and said to him: Happy are you, O Israel, for you are all exceedingly wise, from your old to your young.
llm_translation: I turned back. I said to him: My son, did you not say to me a short one? He said to me: And did I not say to you a long one? I kissed him on his head, and said to him: Blessed are you, Israel, that all of you are great sages, from your greatest to your smallest.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי הֲוָה קָא אָזֵיל בְּאוֹרְחָא, אַשְׁכְּחַהּ לִבְרוּרְיָה אֲמַר לַהּ: בְּאֵיזוֹ דֶּרֶךְ נֵלֵךְ לְלוֹד? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: גָּלִילִי שׁוֹטֶה, לֹא כָּךְ אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: אַל תַּרְבֶּה שִׂיחָה עִם הָאִשָּׁה?! הָיָה לְךָ לוֹמַר: ״בְּאֵיזֶה לְלוֹד״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei HaGelili was walking along the way, met Berurya. He said to her: On which path shall we walk to Lod? She said to him: Foolish Galilean, didn’t the Sages say: Do not talk much with women? You should have said Which to Lod?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean was walking on the road, he found Berurya, he said to her: "In which way shall we go to Lod?" She said to him: "Galilean fool, did the sages not say: 'Do not engage in excessive conversation with a woman'?! You should have said: 'In which way to Lod'."

hebrew_text: בְּרוּרְיָה אַשְׁכַּחְתֵּיהּ לְהַהוּא תַּלְמִידָא דַּהֲוָה קָא גָרֵיס בִּלְחִישָׁה.
human_translation: Berurya came across a certain student who was whispering his studies
llm_translation: In clarity, I found him, to that certain student who was engaging in whispering.

hebrew_text: בְּטַשָׁה בֵּיהּ, אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: לֹא כָּךְ כָּתוּב ״עֲרוּכָה בַכֹּל וּשְׁמוּרָה״, אִם עֲרוּכָה בִּרְמַ״ח אֵבָרִים שֶׁלְּךָ — מִשְׁתַּמֶּרֶת, וְאִם לָאו — אֵינָהּ מִשְׁתַּמֶּרֶת. תָּנָא: תַּלְמִיד אֶחָד הָיָה לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר שֶׁהָיָה שׁוֹנֶה בְּלַחַשׁ, לְאַחַר שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים שָׁכַח תַּלְמוּדוֹ.
human_translation: She kicked him said to him: Isn’t it written as follows: “Ordered in all things and secure” if is ordered in your 248 limbs, it will be secure, and if not, it will not be secure. it was taught Rabbi Eliezer had a student who would study quietly, after three years he forgot his studies.
llm_translation: In his sleep, she said to him: "It is not written thus, 'Arrange in all and guard.' If your 248 limbs are arranged — she is guarded, and if not — she is not guarded." It was taught: There was one student to Rabbi Eliezer who used to review quietly, after three years he forgot his learning.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא, תַּלְמִיד אֶחָד הָיָה לוֹ לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר שֶׁנִּתְחַיֵּיב בִּשְׂרֵיפָה לַמָּקוֹם. אָמְרוּ: הַנִּיחוּ לוֹ אָדָם גָּדוֹל שִׁמֵּשׁ.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Eliezer had a student who was liable for burning, against God, said: Let him he served a great person.
llm_translation: It was taught: There was one student to Rabbi Eliezer who was liable to be burned in a certain place. They said: Let a great man serve him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב יְהוּדָה: שִׁינָּנָא, פְּתַח פּוּמָּיךְ קְרִי, פְּתַח פּוּמָּיךְ תְּנִי, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּתִתְקַיַּים בָּיךְ וְתוֹרִיךְ חַיֵּי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי חַיִּים הֵם לְמֹצְאֵיהֶם וּלְכׇל בְּשָׂרוֹ מַרְפֵּא״, אַל תִּקְרֵי ״לְמֹצְאֵיהֶם״ אֶלָּא ״לְמוֹצִיאֵיהֶם בַּפֶּה״.
human_translation: Shmuel said to Rav Yehuda: Keen scholar [ shinnana ], open your mouth and read open your mouth and study in order that should endure in you and you should live a long life, as it is stated: “For they are life to those who find them, and health to all their flesh” Do not read: “To those who find them [ lemotzeihem ],” but “to those who express them [ lemotzi’eihem ],” with mouth.
llm_translation: Shmuel said to Rav Yehudah: "Shinana, open your mouth and read, open your mouth and teach, so that your teachings and your Torah may be established in you and your life, as it is said: 'For they are life to those who find them, and healing to all their flesh.' Do not read 'to those who find them,' but rather 'to those who bring them out in speech.'"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב יְהוּדָה: שִׁינָּנָא, חֲטוֹף וֶאֱכוֹל חֲטוֹף וְאִישְׁתִּי, דְּעָלְמָא דְּאָזְלִינַן מִינֵּיהּ כְּהִלּוּלָא דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Shmuel said to Rav Yehuda, Keen scholar, grab and eat, grab and drink, as the world from which we are departing is like a wedding feast,
llm_translation: Shmuel said to Rav Yehudah: Shinana, grab and eat, grab and drink, for in the world from which we depart, it is like the worth of a locust.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב לְרַב הַמְנוּנָא: בְּנִי אִם יֵשׁ לָךְ — הֵיטֵב לָךְ, שֶׁאֵין בַּשְּׁאוֹל תַּעֲנוּג, וְאֵין לַמָּוֶת הִתְמַהְמֵהַּ. וְאִם תֹּאמַר אַנִּיחַ לְבָנַי — חוֹק בַּשְּׁאוֹל מִי יַגִּיד לָךְ: בְּנֵי הָאָדָם דּוֹמִים לְעִשְׂבֵי הַשָּׂדֶה הַלָּלוּ נוֹצְצִין וְהַלָּלוּ נוֹבְלִין.
human_translation: Rav said to Rav Hamnuna: My son, if you have do well for yourself. as there is no pleasure in the netherworld, and death does not tarry. And if you say: I will leave for my children, who told you the law of the netherworld, People are similar to grass of the field, these blossom, and these wither
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav to Rav Hamnuna: "My son, if you have - good for you, for there is no pleasure in Sheol, and death does not delay. And if you say, 'I will leave it for my children' - who will inform you of the decree in Sheol: The sons of men are like the grasses of the field, these flourish and those wither."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הַמְהַלֵּךְ בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְאֵין עִמּוֹ לְוָיָיה — יַעֲסוֹק בַּתּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי לִוְיַת חֵן הֵם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One who is walking along the way without a companion should engage in Torah as it is stated “For they shall be a graceful wreath [ livyat ḥen ]
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One who walks on the road and has no companionship with him - let him engage in Torah study, as it is said: "For they are a graceful wreath for your head."

hebrew_text: חָשׁ בְּרֹאשׁוֹ — יַעֲסוֹק בְּתוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי לִוְיַת חֵן הֵם לְרֹאשֶׁךָ״. חָשׁ בִּגְרוֹנוֹ — יַעֲסוֹק בַּתּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַעֲנָקִים לְגַרְגְּרוֹתֶיךָ״. חָשׁ בְּמֵעָיו — יַעֲסוֹק בַּתּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״רִפְאוּת תְּהִי לְשָׁרֶּךָ״. חָשׁ בְּעַצְמוֹתָיו — יַעֲסוֹק בַּתּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְשִׁקּוּי לְעַצְמוֹתֶיךָ״. חָשׁ בְּכׇל גּוּפוֹ — יַעֲסוֹק בַּתּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּלְכׇל בְּשָׂרוֹ מַרְפֵּא״.
human_translation: One who feels in his head should engage in Torah as it is stated: “For they shall be a graceful wreath for your head.” One who feels in his throat should engage in Torah as it is stated: “And chains about your neck.” One who feels in his intestines should engage in Torah as it is stated: “It shall be health to your navel” One who feels in his bones should engage in Torah as it is stated: “And marrow to your bones” One who feels in his entire body should engage in Torah as it is stated: “And health to all their flesh”
llm_translation: He who has grace on his head - let him engage in Torah, as it is said: "For they are a graceful wreath for your head." He who has grace in his throat - let him engage in Torah, as it is said: "And chains for your neck." He who has grace in his bowels - let him engage in Torah, as it is said: "It shall be healing to your navel." He who has grace in his bones - let him engage in Torah, as it is said: "And marrow to your bones." He who has grace in his entire body - let him engage in Torah, as it is said: "And healing to all his flesh."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה בְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא: בֹּא וּרְאֵה, שֶׁלֹּא כְּמִדַּת הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִדַּת בָּשָׂר וְדָם. מִדַּת בָּשָׂר וָדָם: אָדָם נוֹתֵן סַם לַחֲבֵירוֹ — לָזֶה יָפֶה, וְלָזֶה קָשֶׁה. אֲבָל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אֵינוֹ כֵּן: נָתַן תּוֹרָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל — סַם חַיִּים לְכׇל גּוּפוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּלְכׇל בְּשָׂרוֹ מַרְפֵּא״.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, said: Come and see that the attribute of flesh and blood is unlike the attribute of the Holy One, Blessed be He. The attribute of flesh and blood a person gives a drug to his fellow, it is good for this and it is harmful to that But the Holy One, Blessed be He, is not so; He gave the Torah to the Jewish people, it is a drug of life for one’s entire body, as it is stated: “And health to all their flesh.”
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah, son of Rabbi Chiyya, said: Come and see, that the measure of the Holy One, blessed be He, is not like the measure of flesh and blood. The measure of flesh and blood: a person gives a potion to his fellow - this one benefits, and that one is harmed. But the Holy One, blessed be He, is not so: He gave the Torah to Israel - a potion of life for all his body, as it is said: "And healing for all his flesh."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַמֵּי: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״כִּי נָעִים כִּי תִשְׁמְרֵם בְּבִטְנֶךָ יִכּוֹנוּ יַחְדָּיו עַל שְׂפָתֶיךָ״, אֵימָתַי דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה נְעִימִים — בִּזְמַן שֶׁתִּשְׁמְרֵם בְּבִטְנֶךָ, וְאֵימָתַי תִּשְׁמְרֵם בְּבִטְנֶךָ — בִּזְמַן שֶׁיִּכּוֹנוּ יַחְדָּו עַל שְׂפָתֶיךָ.
human_translation: Rav Ami said: What is that which is written: “For it is a pleasant thing if you keep them within you; let them be firmly attached together to your lips” When are words of Torah pleasant? When you keep them within you And when will you keep them within you? When they will be attached together to your lips,
llm_translation: Rav Ammi said: What is the meaning of what is written, "For they are pleasant when you keep them in your belly, they shall be fitted together on your lips"? When are the words of Torah pleasant? When you keep them in your belly. And when do you keep them in your belly? When they are fitted together on your lips.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״שִׂמְחָה לָאִישׁ בְּמַעֲנֵה פִיו וְדָבָר בְּעִתּוֹ מַה טּוֹב״, אֵימָתַי שִׂמְחָה לָאִישׁ — בִּזְמַן שֶׁמַּעֲנֶה בְּפִיו. לָשׁוֹן אַחֵר: אֵימָתַי שִׂמְחָה לָאִישׁ בְּמַעֲנֵה פִיו — בִּזְמַן שֶׁדָּבָר בְּעִתּוֹ מַה טּוֹב.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said from here: “A man has joy in the answer of his mouth; and a word in due season, how good it is” When does a man have joy? When an answer is in his mouth. Another version: When does a man have joy in the answer of his mouth? When A word in due season, how good it is,
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said from here: "Joy to a man in the answer of his mouth, and a word in its time, how good." When is joy to a man? - When he answers with his mouth. Another expression: When is joy to a man in the answer of his mouth? - When he speaks in its time, how good.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״כִּי קָרוֹב אֵלֶיךָ הַדָּבָר מְאֹד בְּפִיךָ וּבִלְבָבְךָ לַעֲשׂוֹתוֹ״, אֵימָתַי קָרוֹב אֵלֶיךָ — בִּזְמַן שֶׁבְּפִיךָ וּבִלְבָבְךָ לַעֲשׂוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said from here: “But the matter is very near to you, in your mouth and in your heart, that you may do it” When very near to you? When it is in your mouth and in your heart, that you may do it,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said from here: "For this commandment which I command you today is not too hard for you, neither is it far off. It is not in heaven, that you should say, 'Who will go up for us to heaven, and bring it to us, that we may hear it and do it?'" (Deuteronomy 30:11-12). When is it close to you? When it is in your mouth and in your heart to do it.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״תַּאֲוַת לִבּוֹ נָתַתָּה לּוֹ וַאֲרֶשֶׁת שְׂפָתָיו בַּל מָנַעְתָּ סֶּלָה״, אֵימָתַי תַּאֲוַת לִבּוֹ נָתַתָּה לּוֹ — בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֲרֶשֶׁת שְׂפָתָיו בַּל מָנַעְתָּ סֶּלָה.
human_translation: Rava said from here: “You have given him his heart’s desire, and have not withheld the request of his lips, Selah” When have You given him his heart’s desire? When You have not withheld the request of his lips, Selah,
llm_translation: Rava said from here: "You have given him the desire of his heart and have not withheld the request of his lips. Selah." When have you given him the desire of his heart? - When you have not withheld the request of his lips.

hebrew_text: רָבָא רָמֵי: כְּתִיב ״תַּאֲוַת לִבּוֹ נָתַתָּה לּוֹ״. וּכְתִיב ״וַאֲרֶשֶׁת שְׂפָתָיו בַּל מָנַעְתָּ סֶּלָה״. זָכָה — תַּאֲוַת לִבּוֹ נָתַתָּה לוֹ. לֹא זָכָה — וַאֲרֶשֶׁת שְׂפָתָיו בַּל מָנַעְתָּ סֶּלָה.
human_translation: Rava raised an contradiction it is written: “You have given him his heart’s desire,” it is written: “And You have not withheld the request of his lips, Selah,” is fortunate, “You have given him his heart’s desire,” is not fortunate, “You have not withheld the request of his lips, Selah.”
llm_translation: Rava raises a contradiction: It is written, "You have given him the desire of his heart." And it is written, "You did not withhold the request of his lips. Selah." If he merited it - "You have given him the desire of his heart." If he did not merit it - "You did not withhold the request of his lips. Selah."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״נֶצַח״ ״סֶלָה״ ״וָעֶד״ — אֵין לוֹ הֶפְסֵק עוֹלָמִית. נֶצַח, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי לֹא לְעוֹלָם אָרִיב וְלֹא לָנֶצַח אֶקְּצוֹף״.
human_translation: of the school of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov taught Wherever it states netzaḥ Selah, va’ed will never cease. Netzaḥ , as it is written: “For I will not contend forever; neither will I be eternally [ lanetzaḥ ] angry”
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Eliezer ben Jacob: Any place where it is stated "netzach," "selah," "va'ed" — it has no eternal cessation. Netzach, as it is written: "For I will not contend forever, nor will I be angry for eternity."

hebrew_text: סֶלָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״כַּאֲשֶׁר שָׁמַעְנוּ כֵּן רָאִינוּ בְּעִיר ה׳ צְבָאוֹת בְּעִיר אֱלֹהֵינוּ אֱלֹהִים יְכוֹנְנֶהָ עַד עוֹלָם סֶלָה״. וָעֶד, דִּכְתִיב: ״ה׳ יִמְלוֹךְ לְעוֹלָם וָעֶד״.
human_translation: Selah, as it is written: “As we have heard, so have we seen in the city of the Lord of Hosts, in the city of our God; may God establish it forever, Selah” Va’ed , as it is written: “The Lord shall reign forever and ever [ va’ed ]”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Selah, dikhtiv: "Ka'asher sham'anu kein ra'inu be'ir Hashem Tzeva'ot, be'ir Eloheinu Elohim yekhoneneha ad olam selah." Va'ed, dikhtiv: "Hashem yimlokh le'olam va'ed." English translation: Selah, as it is written: "As we have heard, so have we seen in the city of the Lord of hosts, in the city of our God; God will establish it forever. Selah." And further, as it is written: "The Lord shall reign forever and ever."

hebrew_text: (סִימָן: ״עֲנָקִים״ ״לְחָיָיו״ ״לוּחוֹת״ ״חָרוּת״). אָמַר רַבִּי (אֱלִיעֶזֶר): מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״וַעֲנָקִים לְגַרְגְּרוֹתֶיךָ״, אִם מֵשִׂים אָדָם עַצְמוֹ כַּעֲנָק זֶה שֶׁרָף עַל הַצַּוָּאר וְנִרְאֶה וְאֵינוֹ נִרְאֶה — תַּלְמוּדוֹ מִתְקַיֵּים בְּיָדוֹ. וְאִם לָאו — אֵין תַּלְמוּדוֹ מִתְקַיֵּים בְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: mnemonic: Chains, cheeks, tablets, engraved. Rabbi Eliezer said: What is that which is written: “And chains about your neck” If a person makes himself like a chain that hangs loosely on the neck, and seen but not seen, his study will endure. But if not, his study will not endure.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: (סִימָן: ״עֲנָקִים״ ״לְחָיָיו״ ״לוּחוֹת״ ״חָרוּת״). אָמַר רַבִּי (אֱלִיעֶזֶר): מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״וַעֲנָקִים לְגַרְגְּרוֹתֶיךָ״, אִם מֵשִׂים אָדָם עַצְמוֹ כַּעֲנָק זֶה שֶׁרָף עַל הַצַּוָּר וְנִרְאֶה וְאֵינוֹ נִרְאֶה — תַּלְמוּדוֹ מִתְקַיֵּים בְּיָדוֹ. וְאִם לָאו — אֵין תַּלְמוּדוֹ מִתְקַיֵּים בְּיָדוֹ. English translation: (Chapter: "Anakim" "Lechayav" "Luhot" "Charut"). Rabbi Eliezer said: What is the meaning of the verse "And anklets for your neck"? If a person makes himself like this anklet that is placed on the neck and is seen but not seen - his learning is established in his hand. But if not - his learning is not established in his hand.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״לְחָיָו כַּעֲרוּגַת הַבּוֹשֶׂם״, אִם מֵשִׂים אָדָם עַצְמוֹ כַּעֲרוּגָה זוֹ שֶׁהַכֹּל דָּשִׁין בָּהּ, וּכְבוֹשֶׂם זֶה שֶׁהַכֹּל מִתְבַּשְּׂמִין בָּהּ — תַּלְמוּדוֹ מִתְקַיֵּים, וְאִם לָאו — אֵין תַּלְמוּדוֹ מִתְקַיֵּים.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer said: What is that which is written: “His cheeks are like a bed of spices” If a person makes himself like this bed upon which everyone treads, and like this spice with which everyone perfumes himself, his study will endure. But if not, his study will not endure.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer said: What is the meaning of what is written, "His cheeks are as a bed of spices"? If a person makes himself like this bed of spices, that everyone tramples upon it, and like this balsam, that everyone becomes perfumed by it - his learning is established. But if not, his learning is not established.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי (אֱלִיעֶזֶר): מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״לוּחוֹת אֶבֶן״, אִם אָדָם מֵשִׂים עַצְמוֹ אֶת לְחָיָיו כְּאֶבֶן זוֹ שֶׁאֵינָהּ נִמְחֵית — תַּלְמוּדוֹ מִתְקַיֵּים בְּיָדוֹ, וְאִם לָאו — אֵין תַּלְמוּדוֹ מִתְקַיֵּים בְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer said: What is that which is written: “Tablets [ luḥot ] of stone” If a person makes his cheeks [ leḥayav ] like this stone that does not wear away, his study will endure. But if not, his study will not endure.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer said: What is the meaning of the verse "tablets of stone"? If a person makes himself like this stone that does not wear away, his learning will be established in his hand, but if not, his learning will not be established in his hand.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי (אֱלִיעֶזֶר): מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״חָרוּת עַל הַלּוּחוֹת״, אִלְמָלֵי לֹא נִשְׁתַּבְּרוּ לוּחוֹת הָרִאשׁוֹנוֹת — לֹא נִשְׁתַּכְּחָה תּוֹרָה מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: And, Rabbi Eliezer said: What is that which is written: engraved upon the tablets” had the first tablets, not been broken, the Torah would never have been forgotten from the Jewish people,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer said: What is the meaning of what is written, "engraved on the tablets"? If the first tablets had not been broken, the Torah would not have been forgotten from Israel.

hebrew_text: רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אָמַר: אֵין כׇּל אוּמָּה וְלָשׁוֹן שׁוֹלֶטֶת בָּהֶן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חָרוּת״ — אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״חָרוּת״, אֶלָּא חֵירוּת.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: no nation or tongue would have ruled over them, as it is stated: “Engraved do not read engraved ḥarut] but freedom [ ḥeirut ].
llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: No nation and language has dominion over them, as it is stated: "חָרוּת" - do not read it as "חָרוּת" but as "חֵירוּת."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מַתְנָה: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״וּמִמִּדְבָּר מַתָּנָה״, אִם מֵשִׂים אָדָם עַצְמוֹ כְּמִדְבָּר זֶה שֶׁהַכֹּל דָּשִׁין בּוֹ — תַּלְמוּדוֹ מִתְקַיֵּים בְּיָדוֹ. וְאִם לָאו — אֵין תַּלְמוּדוֹ מִתְקַיֵּים בְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Mattana said: What is that which is written: And from the wilderness they went to Mattanah” If a person makes himself like this wilderness, upon which everyone treads, his study will endure And if not, his study will not endure.
llm_translation: Rav Matna said: What is the meaning of the verse "and from the desert Matanah"? If a person makes himself like this desert, in which everyone tramples upon it, his learning will be established in his hand. But if not, his learning will not be established in his hand.

hebrew_text: רָבָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף בַּר חָמָא הֲוָה לֵיהּ מִלְּתָא לְרַב יוֹסֵף בַּהֲדֵיהּ, כִּי מְטָא מַעֲלֵי יוֹמָא דְכִיפּוּרֵי אֲמַר: אֵיזִיל וַאֲפַיְּיסֵיהּ. אֲזַל, אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ דְּקָא מָזֵיג לֵיהּ כָּסָא. אֲמַר: הַב לִי וְאֶימְזְגֵיהּ אֲנָא. יְהַב לֵיהּ, מַזְגֵיהּ. כִּדְטַעְמֵיהּ אָמַר: דָּמֵי הַאי מְזִיגָא לִמְזִיגָא דְּרָבָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף בַּר חָמָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא הוּא.
human_translation: Rav Yosef had a grievance against Rava, son of Rav Yosef bar Ḥama, When the eve of Yom Kippur arrived, said: I will go and appease him. He went and found attendant mixing him a cup He said to Give to me, and I will mix He gave it to mixed it. when he tasted he said: This mixture is similar to the mixture Rava, son of Rav Yosef bar Ḥama, said to him: It is I.
llm_translation: Rava son of Rav Yosef bar Hama had a matter to Rav Yosef in his hand, when the eve of Yom Kippur arrived, he said: "I will go and appease him." He went, found him sitting and pouring a cup for him. He said: "Give it to me, and I will pour it." He gave it to him, and he poured it. According to his taste, he said: "The value of this pouring is like the pouring of Rava son of Rav Yosef bar Hama." He said to him: "I am he."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא תִּתֵּיב אַכַּרְעָיךָ עַד דִּמְפָרְשַׁתְּ לִי הָנֵי קְרָאֵי. מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וּמִמִּדְבָּר מַתָּנָה וּמִמַּתָּנָה נַחֲלִיאֵל וּמִנַּחֲלִיאֵל בָּמוֹת וּמִבָּמוֹת הַגַּיְא״?
human_translation: said to him: Do not sit on your knees until you have explained these verses to me: What is that which is written: “And from the wilderness to Mattanah; and from Mattanah to Nahaliel; and from Nahaliel to Bamoth; and from Bamoth to the valley
llm_translation: He said to him: Do not sit down until you explain to me these verses. What is written: "And from the wilderness, Mattanah, and from Mattanah, Nachaliel, and from Nachaliel, Bamoth, and from Bamoth, the valley."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִם אָדָם מֵשִׂים עַצְמוֹ כְּמִדְבָּר זֶה שֶׁהַכֹּל דָּשִׁין בּוֹ — תּוֹרָה נִיתְּנָה לוֹ בְּמַתָּנָה. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁנִּיתְּנָה לוֹ בְּמַתָּנָה — נְחָלוֹ אֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמִמַּתָּנָה נַחֲלִיאֵל״. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁנְּחָלוֹ אֵל — עוֹלֶה לִגְדוּלָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמִנַּחֲלִיאֵל בָּמוֹת״.
human_translation: said to him: If a person makes himself like this wilderness, upon which everyone treads, the Torah will be given to him as a gift [ mattana ]. And once it is given to him as a gift, he inherits it [ neḥalo ] God [ El ] as it is stated: “And from Mattanah to Nahaliel.” And once God has made it His inheritance, he rises to greatness, as it is stated: “And from Nahaliel to Bamoth,”
llm_translation: He said to him: If a person makes himself like this wilderness, in which all are trampled upon - the Torah is given to him as a gift. And once it is given to him as a gift - he inherits El Nahal, as it is said: "And from the gift, Nahaliel." And once he inherits El Nahal - he ascends to greatness, as it is said: "And from Nahaliel to Bamoth."

hebrew_text: וְאִם מֵגֵיס לִבּוֹ — הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מַשְׁפִּילוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמִבָּמוֹת הַגַּיְא״. וְאִם חוֹזֵר בּוֹ — הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מַגְבִּיהוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כׇּל גֶּיא יִנָּשֵׂא״.
human_translation: And if he becomes haughty, the Holy One, Blessed be He, lowers him, as it is stated: “And from Bamoth to the valley.” And if he repents, the Holy One, Blessed be He, raises him up, as it is stated: “Every valley shall be exalted”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And if he hardens his heart - the Holy One, blessed be He, lowers him, as it is said: "And from the heights of the gorge." And if he repents - the Holy One, blessed be He, raises him, as it is said: "Every valley shall be lifted up."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״חַיָּתְךָ יָשְׁבוּ בָהּ תָּכִין בְּטוֹבָתְךָ לֶעָנִי אֱלֹהִים״, אִם אָדָם מֵשִׂים עַצְמוֹ כְּחַיָּה זוֹ שֶׁדּוֹרֶסֶת וְאוֹכֶלֶת, וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי שֶׁמַּסְרַחַת וְאוֹכֶלֶת — תַּלְמוּדוֹ מִתְקַיֵּים בְּיָדוֹ. וְאִם לָאו — אֵין תַּלְמוּדוֹ מִתְקַיֵּים בְּיָדוֹ. וְאִם עוֹשֶׂה כֵּן — הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא עוֹשֶׂה לוֹ סְעוּדָה בְּעַצְמוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תָּכִין בְּטוֹבָתְךָ לֶעָנִי אֱלֹהִים״.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: What is that which is written: “Your flock found a dwelling in it; You, O God, prepare of Your goodness for the poor” If a person makes himself like an animal that tramples and eats and some say, that soils and eats, his study will endure. And if not, his study will not endure. And if he does so, the Holy One, Blessed be He, will Himself prepare him a feast, as it is stated: “You, O God, prepare of Your goodness for the poor,”
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: What is the meaning of the verse, "Your creatures shall dwell therein; You will establish it in Your goodness for the poor, O God" (Psalms 68:11)? If a person makes himself like this animal that threshes and eats, and there are those who say that it tramples and eats, his learning is established in his hand. But if not, his learning is not established in his hand. And if he does so, the Holy One, blessed be He, Himself prepares a feast for him, as it is said: "You will establish it in Your goodness for the poor, O God."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״נוֹצֵר תְּאֵנָה יֹאכַל פִּרְיָהּ״, לָמָּה נִמְשְׁלוּ דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה כִּתְאֵנָה, מָה תְּאֵנָה זוֹ
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: What is that which is written: “He who guards the fig tree shall eat its fruit” Why were matters of Torah compared to a fig tree? Just as this fig tree,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: What is the meaning of what is written, "One who guards a fig tree will eat its fruit"? Why are the words of Torah compared to a fig tree? Just as this fig tree...

hebrew_text: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁאָדָם מְמַשְׁמֵשׁ בָּהּ — מוֹצֵא בָּהּ תְּאֵנִים. אַף דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁאָדָם הוֹגֶה בָּהֶן — מוֹצֵא בָּהֶן טַעַם.
human_translation: whenever a person searches it he finds figs in it, so matters of Torah. Whenever a person meditates upon them, he finds in them meaning.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "All the time that a person engages in it - he finds figs in it. Also, the words of Torah, all the time that a person meditates on them - he finds taste in them." English translation: "As long as a person engages in it - he finds figs in it. Also, the words of Torah, as long as a person meditates on them - he finds taste in them."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״אַיֶּלֶת אֲהָבִים וְיַעֲלַת חֵן וְגוֹ׳״, לָמָּה נִמְשְׁלוּ דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה לְאַיֶּלֶת? לוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה אַיָּלָה רַחְמָהּ צַר, וַחֲבִיבָה עַל בּוֹעֲלָהּ כׇּל שָׁעָה וְשָׁעָה כְּשָׁעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה — אַף דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה חֲבִיבִין עַל לוֹמְדֵיהֶן כׇּל שָׁעָה וְשָׁעָה כְּשָׁעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said: What is that which is written: “A loving hind and a graceful roe, Why were matters of Torah compared to a hind? To tell you just as a hind, its womb is narrow and it is cherished by its mate each and every hour like the first hour, so matters of Torah are cherished by those who study them each and every hour like the first hour.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: What is the meaning of the verse, "A lovely deer, a graceful doe"? Why are the words of Torah compared to a deer? To tell you: Just as a doe is narrow in her womb and beloved to her mate every moment, like the first moment, so too the words of Torah are beloved to their learners every moment, like the first moment.

hebrew_text: ״וְיַעֲלַת חֵן״ — שֶׁמַּעֲלָת חֵן עַל לוֹמְדֶיהָ. ״דַּדֶּיהָ יְרַוֻּךָ בְכׇל עֵת״ — לָמָּה נִמְשְׁלוּ דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה כְּדַד? מָה דַּד זֶה כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁהַתִּינוֹק מְמַשְׁמֵשׁ בּוֹ — מוֹצֵא בּוֹ חָלָב, אַף דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁאָדָם הוֹגֶה בָּהֶן — מוֹצֵא בָּהֶן טַעַם.
human_translation: “And a graceful roe” That bestows grace upon those who study it. “Let her breasts satisfy you at all times”; why were matters of Torah compared to a breast? Just as a breast, whenever a baby searches it he finds milk in it, so matters of Torah. Whenever a person meditates upon them, he finds meaning in them.
llm_translation: "and 'she shall be lifted up with grace' — that grace is lifted up upon its learners. 'her breasts will satisfy you at all times' — why are the words of Torah compared to a breast? Just as this breast, as long as the infant nurses from it, he finds milk in it, so too the words of Torah, as long as a person meditates on them, he finds taste in them."

hebrew_text: ״בְּאַהֲבָתָהּ תִּשְׁגֶּה תָּמִיד״ — כְּגוֹן רַבִּי (אֱלִיעֶזֶר) בֶּן פְּדָת. אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל רַבִּי (אֱלִיעֶזֶר) שֶׁהָיָה יוֹשֵׁב וְעוֹסֵק בַּתּוֹרָה בַּשּׁוּק הַתַּחְתּוֹן שֶׁל צִיפּוֹרִי, וּסְדִינוֹ מוּטָל בַּשּׁוּק הָעֶלְיוֹן שֶׁל צִיפּוֹרִי. (תַּנְיָא) אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: פַּעַם אַחַת בָּא אָדָם לִיטְּלוֹ, וּמָצָא בּוֹ שָׂרָף.
human_translation: “And be you ravished always with her love”; as was Rabbi Elazar ben Pedat. They said of him, of Rabbi Elazar, that he would sit and engage in Torah in the lower marketplace of Tzippori, and his cloak was lying in the upper marketplace of Tzippori. it was taught Rabbi Yitzḥak ben Elazar said: One time a person came to take and found a serpent on it
llm_translation: "In her love you shall be enraptured always" - such as Rabbi (Eliezer) ben Pedat. They said about Rabbi (Eliezer) that he would sit and engage in Torah study in the lower market of Tzipori, while his garment was hanging in the upper market of Tzipori. It was taught: Rabbi Yitzchak ben Elazar said: Once a man came to relieve himself, and he found a serpent in it.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַב עָנָן: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״רוֹכְבֵי אֲתוֹנוֹת צְחוֹרוֹת יוֹשְׁבֵי עַל מִדִּין [וְהוֹלְכֵי עַל דֶּרֶךְ שִׂיחוּ]״, ״רוֹכְבַי אֲתוֹנוֹת״ — אֵלּוּ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, שֶׁמְּהַלְּכִין מֵעִיר לְעִיר וּמִמְּדִינָה לִמְדִינָה לִלְמוֹד (בּוֹ) תּוֹרָה. ״צְחוֹרוֹת״ — שֶׁעוֹשִׂין אוֹתָהּ כְּצָהֳרַיִם. ״יֹשְׁבֵי עַל מִדִּין״ — שֶׁדָּנִין דִּין אֱמֶת לַאֲמִיתּוֹ. ״וְהוֹלְכֵי״ — אֵלּוּ בַּעֲלֵי מִקְרָא. ״עַל דֶּרֶךְ״ — אֵלּוּ בַּעֲלֵי מִשְׁנָה. ״שִׂיחוּ״ — אֵלּוּ בַּעֲלֵי תַלְמוּד, שֶׁכׇּל שִׂיחָתָן דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה.
human_translation: of the school of Rav Anan taught: What is that which is written: “You that ride on white donkeys, you that sit on rich cloths, and you that walk by the way, tell of it” “You that ride on white donkeys”; these are Torah scholars, who travel from city to city and from province to province to study Torah. “White [ tzeḥorot ]” who make it as noon tzahorayim “You that sit on couches [ midin ]” who judge [ danin ] an absolutely true judgment. “And you that walk”; these are the masters of Bible, “By the way”; these are the masters of Mishna. “Tell of it”; these are the masters of Talmud, as all their conversation is matters of Torah.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav Anan: What is the meaning of the verse, "Riders of white donkeys, sitting on saddlecloths, and those who walk on the road, speak up"? "Riders of donkeys" - these are the Torah scholars who travel from city to city and from province to province to study Torah. "White" - who make it as bright as noon. "Sitting on saddlecloths" - who judge true judgment. "And those who walk" - these are the experts in Scripture. "On the road" - these are the experts in Mishnah. "Speak up" - these are the experts in Talmud, whose every conversation is words of Torah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁיזְבִי מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״לֹא יַחֲרוֹךְ רְמִיָּה צֵידוֹ״ — לֹא יִחְיֶה וְלֹא יַאֲרִיךְ יָמִים צַיָּיד הָרַמַּאי.
human_translation: Rav Sheizvi said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya: What is that which is written: “The slothful man [ remiyya ] will not roast [ yaḥarokh ] his catch” The deceitful [ rammai ] hunter will not live [ yiḥyeh ] a long life [ ya’arikh ].
llm_translation: Said Rav Sheizbi in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah: What is the meaning of what is written, "Let not the archer bend his bow"? — He shall not live, and his days shall not be prolonged, the archer of the Ramathites.

hebrew_text: רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: צַיָּיד הָרַמַּאי יַחֲרוֹךְ?
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: a deceitful hunter roast?
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: Does the hunter from Ramah trap?

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: מָשָׁל לְצַיָּיד שֶׁצָּד צִפֳּרִים, אִם רִאשׁוֹן רִאשׁוֹן מְשַׁבֵּר כְּנָפָיו — מִשְׁתַּמֵּר, וְאִם לָאו — אֵין מִשְׁתַּמֵּר.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said: This is comparable to a hunter who is hunting birds; if he breaks wings one by one will be secured, and if not, will not be secured.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: A parable to a hunter who hunts birds, if he breaks their wings one by one - he is careful, but if not - he is not careful.

hebrew_text: אָמַר (רַבָּה) אָמַר רַב סְחוֹרָה אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״הוֹן מֵהֶבֶל יִמְעָט וְקוֹבֵץ עַל יָד יַרְבֶּה״, אִם עוֹשֶׂה אָדָם תּוֹרָתוֹ חֲבִילוֹת חֲבִילוֹת, — מִתְמַעֵט, וְאִם לָאו — קוֹבֵץ עַל יָד יַרְבֶּה.
human_translation: Rabba said that Rav Seḥora said that Rav Huna said: What is that which is written: “Wealth gotten through vanity hevel shall be diminished; but he that gathers little by little shall increase” If a person turns his Torah into bundles ḥavilot , will diminish. And if not, he that gathers little by little shall increase.
llm_translation: Rabah said, Rav Sechora said, Rav Huna said: What is the meaning of the verse, "Wealth from vanity will decrease, but one who gathers by labor will increase"? If a person studies his Torah diligently, bundle by bundle, it will decrease; but if not, he will gather it in abundance.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: יָדְעִי רַבָּנַן לְהָא מִלְּתָא, וְעָבְרִי עֲלַהּ. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אֲנָא עֲבַדְתַּהּ, וְאִיקַּיַּים בִּידַאי.
human_translation: Rabba said: The Sages know this, but transgress it, Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: I did this, and has endured.
llm_translation: Rabba said: The sages knew the matter, but they passed over it. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: I have done it, and it is established in my hands.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, כֵּיצַד סֵדֶר מִשְׁנָה: מֹשֶׁה לָמַד מִפִּי הַגְּבוּרָה. נִכְנַס אַהֲרֹן, וְשָׁנָה לוֹ מֹשֶׁה פִּירְקוֹ, נִסְתַּלֵּק אַהֲרֹן וְיָשַׁב לִשְׂמֹאל מֹשֶׁה. נִכְנְסוּ בָּנָיו, וְשָׁנָה לָהֶן מֹשֶׁה פִּירְקָן. נִסְתַּלְּקוּ בָּנָיו, אֶלְעָזָר יָשַׁב לִימִין מֹשֶׁה, וְאִיתָמָר לִשְׂמֹאל אַהֲרֹן. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם אַהֲרֹן לִימִין מֹשֶׁה חוֹזֵר. נִכְנְסוּ זְקֵנִים וְשָׁנָה לָהֶן מֹשֶׁה פִּירְקָן. נִסְתַּלְּקוּ זְקֵנִים, נִכְנְסוּ כׇּל הָעָם וְשָׁנָה לָהֶן מֹשֶׁה פִּירְקָן. נִמְצְאוּ בְּיַד אַהֲרֹן אַרְבָּעָה, בְּיַד בָּנָיו שְׁלֹשָׁה, וּבְיַד הַזְּקֵנִים שְׁנַיִם, וּבְיַד כׇּל הָעָם אֶחָד.
human_translation: The Sages taught What was the order of teaching Moses learned from the mouth of the Almighty. Aaron entered and Moses taught him his lesson Aaron moved and sat to the left of Moses. sons entered, and Moses taught them their lesson sons moved Elazar sat to the right of Moses and Itamar to the left of Aaron. Rabbi Yehuda said: Actually, Aaron would return to the right of Moses. The elders entered and Moses taught them their lesson. The elders moved the entire nation entered and Moses taught them their lesson. Therefore, Aaron had four times, his sons three the elders twice, and the entire nation once.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: How was the order of the Mishnah arranged? Moses learned from the mouth of the Almighty. Aaron entered, and Moses repeated to him his teaching. Aaron then departed and sat to the left of Moses. His sons entered, and Moses repeated to them his teaching. His sons then departed, Eleazar sat to the right of Moses, and Ithamar to the left of Aaron. Rabbi Judah says: Aaron always returns to the right of Moses. Elders entered, and Moses repeated to them his teaching. The elders departed, the entire congregation entered, and Moses repeated to them his teaching. Four were found in the hand of Aaron, three in the hand of his sons, two in the hand of the elders, and one in the hand of the entire congregation.

hebrew_text: נִסְתַּלֵּק מֹשֶׁה וְשָׁנָה לָהֶן אַהֲרֹן פִּירְקוֹ. נִסְתַּלֵּק אַהֲרֹן שָׁנוּ לָהֶן בָּנָיו פִּירְקָן. נִסְתַּלְּקוּ בָּנָיו, שָׁנוּ לָהֶן זְקֵנִים פִּירְקָן. נִמְצָא בְּיַד הַכֹּל אַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: Moses departed and Aaron taught his lesson Aaron departed his sons taught their lesson. His sons departed the elders taught their lesson. Hence everyone, four times.
llm_translation: Moses departed, and Aaron took over for them. Aaron departed, and his sons took over for them. His sons departed, and the elders took over for them. It turns out that four are in charge.

hebrew_text: מִכָּאן אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: חַיָּיב אָדָם לִשְׁנוֹת לְתַלְמִידוֹ אַרְבָּעָה פְּעָמִים. וְקַל וָחוֹמֶר, וּמָה אַהֲרֹן שֶׁלָּמַד מִפִּי מֹשֶׁה, וּמֹשֶׁה מִפִּי הַגְּבוּרָה — כָּךְ, הֶדְיוֹט מִפִּי הֶדְיוֹט — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: From here Rabbi Eliezer said: A person is obligated to teach his student four times. And an a fortiori inference: If Aaron, who learned from Moses and Moses from the mouth of the Almighty, this an ordinary from the mouth of an ordinary how much more so
llm_translation: From here Rabbi Eliezer said: A person is obligated to repeat to his student four times. And a fortiori, just as Aaron learned from the mouth of Moses, and Moses from the mouth of the Almighty — so, a layman from the mouth of a layman — all the more so.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן שֶׁחַיָּיב אָדָם לִשְׁנוֹת לְתַלְמִידוֹ עַד שֶׁיִּלְמָדֶנּוּ — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלַמְּדָהּ אֶת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״, וּמִנַּיִן עַד שֶׁתְּהֵא סְדוּרָה בְּפִיהֶם — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שִׂימָהּ בְּפִיהֶם״,
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: From where that a person is obligated to teach his student until he learns As it is stated: and teach it to the children of Israel; And from where until is organized in their mouths? As it is stated: “Put it in their mouths,”
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: From where is it obligatory for a person to repeat teach to his student until he learns it? - As it is said: "And teach it to the children of Israel." And from where is it obligatory until it is arranged in their mouths? - As it is said: "Put it in their mouths."

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִין שֶׁחַיָּיב לְהַרְאוֹת לוֹ פָּנִים — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאֵלֶּה הַמִּשְׁפָּטִים אֲשֶׁר תָּשִׂים לִפְנֵיהֶם״.
human_translation: And from where that must show the reasons As it is stated: “Now these are the judgments which you shall set before them”
