llm_translation: And from where do we derive that one is obligated to show him his face - as it is stated: "And these are the ordinances that you shall set before them."

hebrew_text: וְלִיגְמְרוּ כּוּלְּהוּ מִמֹּשֶׁה! כְּדֵי לַחֲלוֹק כָּבוֹד לְאַהֲרֹן וּבָנָיו, וְכָבוֹד לַזְּקֵנִים.
human_translation: They should all have studied from Moses in order to give honor to Aaron and his sons, and honor to the elders.
llm_translation: And they shall finish all from Moses! In order to give honor to Aaron and his sons, and honor to the elders.

hebrew_text: וְנֵיעוּל אַהֲרֹן וְנִיגְמַר מִמֹּשֶׁה, וְלִיעַיְילוּ בָּנָיו וְלִיגְמְרוּ מֵאַהֲרֹן, וְלִיעַיְילוּ זְקֵנִים וְלֵילְפוּ מִבָּנָיו, וְלֵיזְלוּ וְלַיגְמְרִינְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל! כֵּיוָן דְּמֹשֶׁה מִפִּי הַגְּבוּרָה גָּמַר, מִסְתַּיְּיעָא מִלְּתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Aaron should have entered and studied from Moses; his sons should have entered and studied from Aaron; the elders should have entered and studied from sons; and they should have gone and taught all of the Jewish people. Since Moses had studied from the mouth of the Almighty, it would be effective
llm_translation: And Aharon was locked, and it was completed from Moshe, and his sons were brought up and completed from Aharon, and the elders were brought up and they were completed from his sons, and they went and they completed them all, Israel! Since Moshe completed from the mouth of the Almighty, his words were supported.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם אַהֲרֹן לִימִין מֹשֶׁה חוֹזֵר. כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: שְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁהָיוּ מְהַלְּכִין בַּדֶּרֶךְ — הָרַב בָּאֶמְצַע, וְגָדוֹל בִּימִינוֹ, וְקָטָן בִּשְׂמֹאלוֹ. לֵימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא וְלָא רַבָּנַן?
human_translation: The Master said Rabbi Yehuda says: Actually, Aaron would return to the right of Moses, In accordance with whose was it taught three were walking along the way, the teacher in the middle and the greater to his right and the lesser to his left? Shall we say it is Rabbi Yehuda and not the Sages?
llm_translation: The Master said, Rabbi Yehuda says: Always Aaron to the right of Moses returns. Like whom did he go? This one that it was taught: Three who were walking on the road - the elder in the middle, the greater on his right, and the younger on his left. Let Rabbi Yehuda say, is it not the Rabbis?

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, מִשּׁוּם טִירְחָא דְאַהֲרֹן.
human_translation: even say the Sages, due to the trouble to Aaron
llm_translation: Even if you say it is the opinion of the Rabbis, due to the toil of Aharon.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי פְּרִידָא הֲוָה לֵיהּ הָהוּא תַּלְמִידָא דַּהֲוָה תָּנֵי לֵיהּ אַרְבַּע מְאָה זִימְנֵי וְגָמַר. יוֹמָא חַד בַּעְיוּהּ לְמִלְּתָא דְמִצְוָה. תְּנָא לֵיהּ וְלָא גְּמַר.
human_translation: Rabbi Perida had a certain student whom he would teach four hundred times, and learn One day they requested for a mitzva matter taught but did not learn
llm_translation: Rabbi Prida had a certain student who repeated to him four hundred times and completed. One day he needed him for a matter of a commandment. He taught him, but did not complete.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָאִידָּנָא מַאי שְׁנָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִדְּהָהִיא שַׁעְתָּא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ לְמָר אִיכָּא מִילְּתָא דְּמִצְוָה — אַסְּחַאי לְדַעְתַּאי, וְכׇל שַׁעְתָּא אָמֵינָא: הַשְׁתָּא קָאֵי מָר, הַשְׁתָּא קָאֵי מָר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַב דַּעְתָּיךְ וְאַתְנֵי לִיךְ. הֲדַר תְּנָא לֵיהּ אַרְבַּע מְאָה זִימְנֵי [אַחֲרִינֵי].
human_translation: said to him: What is different now He said to him: From the time that they said to the Master there is a mitzva matter my mind was distracted and every moment I said: Now the Master will get up, now the Master will get up said to him: Pay attention and I will teach you, He taught him again an additional four hundred times.
llm_translation: He said to him: What is different now? He said to him: Since that moment that he said to the master, "Is there a matter of commandment?" - I was silent in my opinion, and every time I would say: "Now the master is standing, now the master is standing." He said to him: "Have your opinion and give it to yourself." He then taught him four hundred other times.

hebrew_text: נְפַקָא בַּת קָלָא וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: נִיחָא לָיךְ דְּלִיסְפּוֹ לָךְ אַרְבַּע מְאָה שְׁנֵי, אוֹ דְּתִיזְכּוֹ אַתְּ וְדָרָךְ לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי? אָמַר: דְּנִיזְכּוֹ אֲנָא וְדָרַיי לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי. אָמַר לָהֶן הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: תְּנוּ לוֹ זוֹ וָזוֹ.
human_translation: a Divine Voice emerged and said to him: preferable to you that four hundred years be added or that you and your generation merit the World-to-Come? He said: that I and my generation merit the World-to-Come. The Holy One, Blessed be He, said Give him both;
llm_translation: A daughter of a voice emerged and said to him: Is it preferable for you that four hundred years be deducted for you, or that you merit and live in the world to come? He said: Let me merit and live in the world to come. The Holy One, blessed be He, said to them: Give him this and that.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אֵין תּוֹרָה נִקְנֵית אֶלָּא בְּסִימָנִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שִׂימָהּ בְּפִיהֶם״, אַל תִּקְרֵי ׳שִׂימָהּ׳, אֶלָּא ׳סַיְּמֶנָּהּ׳.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: The Torah can be acquired only with signs as it is stated: “Put it in their mouths.” Do not read Put it [ simah ], but Its sign [ simanah ],
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisdah said: The Torah is acquired only through mnemonic devices, as it is stated: "Put it in their mouths" (Deuteronomy 31:19). Do not read it as "put it," rather as "cause them to place it."

hebrew_text: שַׁמְעַהּ רַב תַּחְלִיפָא מִמַּעְרְבָא, אֲזַל אַמְרַהּ קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, אֲמַר: אַתּוּן מֵהָתָם מַתְנִיתוּ לַהּ, אֲנַן מֵהָכָא מַתְנִינַן לַהּ: ״הַצִּיבִי לָךְ צִיּוּנִים שִׂימִי לָךְ וְגוֹ׳״ — עֲשׂוּ צִיּוּנִים לַתּוֹרָה. וּמַאי מַשְׁמַע דְּהַאי צִיּוּן לִישָּׁנָא דְסִימָנָא הוּא? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְרָאָה עֶצֶם אָדָם וּבָנָה אֶצְלוֹ צִיּוּן״.
human_translation: Rav Taḥalifa of the West, heard this went said it before Rabbi Abbahu, said: You learn this from there; we learn it from here, “Set up signposts [ tziyyunim ] for yourself; establish you Establish signs for the Torah. And from where that this tziyyun denotes a sign? As it is written and any sees a human bone, he shall set up a sign tziyyun by it”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Shamma Rav Tahalifa from Ma'arva, azal amra kamaih d'Rabbi Avahu, amar: atun mehata matnitu la, anan mehaka matninam la: "hatsivi lakh tziyunim simi lakh ve'go" — asu tziyunim laTorah. Umai mashma dehai tziyun lishna d'simana hu? Dichtiv: "vera'ah etzem adam uvanah etzlo tziyun." English translation: Shamma Rav Tahalifa from Ma'arva went and said before Rabbi Avahu, saying: "You come from there with a teaching for her, and we come from here with a teaching for her: 'Set up signposts for yourself' — make signposts for the Torah. And what is implied by this signpost as a sign of a mark? As it is written: 'And a man shall see a bone and build a signpost beside it.'"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אָמַר, מֵהָכָא: ״אֱמוֹר לַחׇכְמָה אֲחוֹתִי אָתְּ וּמוֹדָע לַבִּינָה תִקְרָא״ — עֲשֵׂה מוֹדָעִים לַתּוֹרָה. רָבָא אָמַר: עֲשֵׂה מוֹעֲדִים לַתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said from here: “Say to wisdom, you are my sister, and call understanding, your kinswoman [ moda ]” Establish signs [ moda’im ] the Torah. Rava said Set appointed times [ mo’adim ] for Torah
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said, from here: "Say to wisdom, 'You are my sister,' and call understanding your relative" — Make acquaintances for the Torah. Rava said: Make appointed times for the Torah.

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר אַבְדִּימִי בַּר חָמָא בַּר דּוֹסָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא בַשָּׁמַיִם הִיא וְלֹא מֵעֵבֶר לַיָּם הִיא״. ״לָא בַּשָּׁמַיִם הִיא״, שֶׁאִם בַּשָּׁמַיִם הִיא — אַתָּה צָרִיךְ לַעֲלוֹת אַחֲרֶיהָ, וְאִם מֵעֵבֶר לַיָּם הִיא — אַתָּה צָרִיךְ לַעֲבוֹר אַחֲרֶיהָ.
human_translation: And this is what Avdimi bar Ḥama bar Dosa said: What is that which is written: “It is not in heaven…nor is it beyond the sea” “It is not in heaven” that if it were in heaven, you would have to ascend after it, and if it were beyond the sea, you would have to cross after it,
llm_translation: And this is what Avdimi son of Hama son of Dosa said, what is the meaning of what is written: "It is not in the heavens, that you should say, 'Who will go up for us to the heavens and get it for us and make us hear it, that we may do it?'" "It is not in the heavens," meaning, if it is in the heavens, you must go after it, and if it is beyond the sea, you must pass over after it.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: ״לֹא בַשָּׁמַיִם הִיא״ — לֹא תִּמָּצֵא בְּמִי שֶׁמַּגְבִּיהַּ דַּעְתּוֹ עָלֶיהָ כַּשָּׁמַיִם, וְלֹא תִּמָּצֵא בְּמִי שֶׁמַּרְחִיב דַּעְתּוֹ עָלֶיהָ כַּיָּם.
human_translation: Rava said: “It is not in heaven” is not to be found in someone who raises his mind over it, like the heavens, nor is it to be found in someone who expands his mind over it, like the sea,
llm_translation: Rava said: "It is not in the heavens" - it will not be found in one who elevates his mind upon it like the heavens, and it will not be found in one who expands his mind upon it like the sea.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: ״לֹא בַּשָּׁמַיִם הִיא״ — לֹא תִּמָּצֵא בְּגַסַּי רוּחַ, ״וְלֹא מֵעֵבֶר לַיָּם הִיא״ — לֹא תִּמָּצֵא לֹא בְּסַחְרָנִים וְלֹא בְּתַגָּרִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: “It is not in heaven” is not to be found in the haughty, “Nor is it beyond the sea” it is not to be found among merchants or traders
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "It is not in the heavens" — you will not find it among the arrogant; "nor is it beyond the sea" — you will not find it neither among merchants nor among sailors.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כֵּיצַד מְעַבְּרִין אֶת הֶעָרִים? אֲרוּכָּה — כְּמוֹת שֶׁהִיא. עֲגוּלָּה — עוֹשִׂין לָהּ זָוִיּוֹת. מְרוּבַּעַת — אֵין עוֹשִׂין לָהּ זָוִיּוֹת. הָיְתָה רְחָבָה מִצַּד אֶחָד וּקְצָרָה מִצַּד אַחֵר — רוֹאִין אוֹתָהּ כְּאִילּוּ הִיא שָׁוָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught How does one extend cities? long, as it is. round, one creates corners for it, square, one does not create corners for it. was wide on one side and narrow on the other side, one regards it as though were equal
llm_translation: The sages taught: How do they pass through the cities? A long one - as it is. A round one - they make it corners. A square one - they do not make it corners. If it was wide on one side and narrow on the other side - they view it as if it is equal.

hebrew_text: הָיָה בַּיִת אֶחָד יוֹצֵא כְּמִין פִּגּוּם, אוֹ שְׁנֵי בָתִּים יוֹצְאִין כְּמִין שְׁנֵי פִגּוּמִין — רוֹאִין אוֹתָן כְּאִילּוּ חוּט מָתוּחַ עֲלֵיהֶן, וּמוֹדֵד מִמֶּנּוּ וּלְהַלָּן אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה. הָיְתָה עֲשׂוּיָה כְּמִין קֶשֶׁת אוֹ כְּמִין גַּאם — רוֹאִין אוֹתָהּ כְּאִילּוּ הִיא מְלֵאָה בָּתִּים וַחֲצֵירוֹת, וּמוֹדֵד מִמֶּנּוּ וּלְהַלָּן אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה.
human_translation: one house was protruding like a turret, or two houses protruding like two turrets, one regards them as though a cord is stretched over their and one measures two thousand cubits from there. was shaped like a bow or like gamma , one regards it as though full of houses and courtyards, and one measures two thousand cubits from there.
llm_translation: There was a house that protruded like a kind of pegum, or two houses that protruded like two pegumim - they are seen as if a thread is stretched over them, and one measures from it and beyond two thousand cubits. If it was made like a bow or like a gaim - it is seen as if it is filled with houses and courtyards, and one measures from it and beyond two thousand cubits.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אֲרוּכָּה כְּמוֹת שֶׁהִיא. פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא, דַּאֲרִיכָא וְקַטִּינָא, מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לִיתֵּן לַהּ פּוּתְיָא אַאוּרְכַּהּ. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: The Master said: long, as it is. obvious. It was necessary only where long and narrow. Lest you say: Let us give its breadth of its length it teaches us
llm_translation: Master said: A bandage as it is. Obviously! It is not necessary, because it is long and short, what would you say: to give it a wide or narrow bandage. It is evident to us.

hebrew_text: מְרוּבַּעַת אֵין עוֹשִׂין לָהּ זָוִיּוֹת. פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא, דִּמְרַבְּעָא, וְלָא מְרַבְּעָא בְּרִיבּוּעַ עוֹלָם. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לִירַבְּעָא בְּרִיבּוּעַ עוֹלָם. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: square, one does not create corners for it. obvious. It was necessary only where is square but square is not four of the world, Lest you say: Let us square with the four world, it teaches us
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Meruba'at ein osin lah zaviyot. Peshita! La tzericha, dimraba'a, velo mraba'a beribua olam. Mahu dteima: liraba'a beribua olam. Ka mashma lan." English translation: "A square does not require corners. Obviously! It is not necessary, because it is square, and not square in the world's square. What if you say: to make it square in the world's square. It is implied to us."

hebrew_text: הָיָה בַּיִת אֶחָד יוֹצֵא כְּמִין פִּגּוּם אוֹ שְׁנֵי בָתִּים יוֹצְאִין כְּמִין שְׁנֵי פִגּוּמִין. הַשְׁתָּא בַּיִת אֶחָד אָמְרַתְּ, שְׁנֵי בָתִּים מִיבַּעְיָא?!
human_translation: one house was protruding like a turret, or two houses protruding like two turrets, Now, one house, you said two houses, is it necessary
llm_translation: One house goes out like a type of blemish, or two houses go out like two blemishes. Now, one house said, "Do we need two houses?!"

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, מִשְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹת. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: מֵרוּחַ אַחַת אָמְרִינַן, מִשְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹת לָא אָמְרִינַן. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: It was necessary only on two sides Lest you say: from one side, we say from two sides we do not say it teaches us
llm_translation: Not necessary, from two spirits. What might you say: from one spirit we say, not from two spirits. It is evident to us.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה עֲשׂוּיָה כְּמִין קֶשֶׁת אוֹ כְּמִין גַּאם, רוֹאִין אוֹתָהּ כְּאִילּוּ הִיא מְלֵאָה בָתִּים וַחֲצֵירוֹת, וּמוֹדֵד מִמֶּנָּה וּלְהַלָּן אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: עִיר הָעֲשׂוּיָה כְּקֶשֶׁת, אִם יֵשׁ בֵּין שְׁנֵי רָאשֶׁיהָ פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבַּעַת אֲלָפִים אַמָּה — מוֹדְדִין לָהּ מִן הַיֶּתֶר, וְאִם לָאו — מוֹדְדִין לָהּ מִן הַקֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: was shaped like a bow or like gamma , one regards it as if full of houses and courtyards, and one measures two thousand cubits from there. Rav Huna said: a city that is shaped like a bow, If there are less than four thousand cubits between two ends one measures from the bowstring But if not one measures from the bow
llm_translation: She was made like a bow or like a reed, they see it as if it is filled with houses and courtyards, and measures from it and beyond two thousand cubits. Rav Huna said: A city made like a bow, if there is less than four thousand cubits between its two ends - they measure for it from the rest, and if not - they measure for it from the bow.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַב הוּנָא הָכִי, וְהָאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: חוֹמַת הָעִיר שֶׁנִּפְרְצָה — בְּמֵאָה וְאַרְבָּעִים וְאַחַת וּשְׁלִישׁ?
human_translation: Did Rav Huna say Didn’t Rav Huna say: the wall of a city that was breached, 141⅓
llm_translation: And who said Rav Huna thus, and did Rav Huna say: "The wall of the city that was breached - with one hundred and forty-one and a third?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר עוּלָּא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — בְּרוּחַ אַחַת, כָּאן — מִשְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹת.
human_translation: Rabba bar Ulla said: not difficult. Here, on one side, there, from two sides,
llm_translation: Rabba bar Ulla said, it is not difficult: here - with one spirit, here - with two spirits.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? דְּנוֹתְנִין קַרְפֵּף לָזוֹ וְקַרְפֵּף לָזוֹ? הָא אַמְרַהּ רַב הוּנָא חֲדָא זִימְנָא, דִּתְנַן:
human_translation: what is teaching us one allocates a karpef , to this and a karpef to that Didn’t Rav Huna say on one occasion? As we learned
llm_translation: And what does it teach us? That we place a "kerpef" for this one and a "kerpef" for that one? This is what Rav Huna said one time, as we learned:

hebrew_text: נוֹתְנִין קַרְפֵּף לָעִיר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: לֹא אָמְרוּ קַרְפֵּף אֶלָּא בֵּין שְׁתֵּי עֲיָירוֹת.
human_translation: One allocates a karpef to city, the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: They spoke of a karpef only between two cities,
llm_translation: We place a ledge for the city, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: They only said a ledge between two cities.

hebrew_text: וְאִיתְּמַר, רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: קַרְפֵּף לָזוֹ וְקַרְפֵּף לָזוֹ. וְחִיָּיא בַּר רַב אָמַר: אֵין נוֹתְנִין אֶלָּא קַרְפֵּף אֶחָד לִשְׁנֵיהֶם!
human_translation: And it was stated Rav Huna said: A karpef to this and karpef to that And Ḥiyya bar Rav said: One allocates only one karpef to the two of them.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: Rav Huna said: A kerpef for this one and a kerpef for this one. And Hiyya bar Rav said: Only one kerpef is given to both of them!

hebrew_text: צְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָכָא — מִשּׁוּם דַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ צַד הֶיתֵּר מֵעִיקָּרָא. אֲבָל הָתָם, אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: It is necessary as, had he taught it to us here, because it had an aspect of permissibility from the outset, But there, say not the case
llm_translation: The matter is, for if we were to hear here — because there was for him an additional side from the beginning. But there, say no.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָתָם — מִשּׁוּם דִּדְחִיקָא תַּשְׁמִישְׁתַּיְיהוּ, אֲבָל הָכָא דְּלָא דְּחִיקָא תַּשְׁמִישְׁתַּיְיהוּ — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And had he taught it us there, because cramped for the use But here, where would not be cramped for the use of say not it was necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear there - because it is a pressing need for them, but here, where there is no pressing need for them - say no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה הָוֵי בֵּין יֶתֶר לַקֶּשֶׁת? רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה, רָבָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ יָתֵר מֵאַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה.
human_translation: And how much between bowstring and bow Rabba bar Rav Huna said: Two thousand cubits. Rava, son of Rabba bar Rav Huna, said: Even more than two thousand cubits.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "And how much is the difference between Yeter and the rainbow? Rabbah bar Rav Huna said: Two thousand cubits, Rava, son of Rabbah bar Rav Huna said: Even more than two thousand cubits."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרָבָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִי בָּעֵי הָדַר אָתֵי דֶּרֶךְ בָּתִּים.
human_translation: Abaye said: It stands to reason in accordance with Rava, son of Rabba bar Rav Huna, as if one wants, he can return and go by way of the houses.
llm_translation: Abaye said: The character of Rava, the son of Rabba bar Rav Huna, is evident, for if he wants, he can come by way of houses.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ שָׁם גְּדוּדִיּוֹת גְּבוֹהוֹת עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים כּוּ׳. מַאי גְּדוּדִיּוֹת? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: שָׁלֹשׁ מְחִיצּוֹת שֶׁאֵין עֲלֵיהֶן תִּקְרָה.
human_translation: there were remnants ten handbreadths high What are remnants? Rav Yehuda said: Three partitions that do not have a roof over them,
llm_translation: There were there battlements high ten cubits. What are battlements? Rav Yehudah said: Three partitions that do not have a roof.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: שְׁתֵּי מְחִיצּוֹת וְיֵשׁ עֲלֵיהֶן תִּקְרָה, מַהוּ? תָּא שְׁמַע, אֵלּוּ שֶׁמִּתְעַבְּרִין עִמָּהּ: נֶפֶשׁ שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת עַל אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, וְהַגֶּשֶׁר וְהַקֶּבֶר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן בֵּית דִּירָה, וּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ בֵּית דִּירָה לַחַזָּן, וּבֵית עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ בֵּית דִּירָה לַכּוֹמָרִים, וְהָאוּרְווֹת וְהָאוֹצָרוֹת שֶׁבַּשָּׂדוֹת וְיֵשׁ בָּהֶן בֵּית דִּירָה, וְהַבּוּרְגָּנִין שֶׁבְּתוֹכָהּ, וְהַבַּיִת שֶׁבַּיָּם — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מִתְעַבְּרִין עִמָּהּ.
human_translation: The dilemma was raised before two partitions have a roof over them, what is Come hear These that are included in extension: A monument [ nefesh ] that is four cubits by four cubits; and a bridge or a grave in which there is a residence; and a synagogue in which there is a residence for the sexton and an idolatrous temple in which there is a residence for the priests; and stables and storehouses in the fields in which there is a residence; and watchtowers in and a house on the sea these are included in the
llm_translation: He asked them: Two partitions and there is a roof over them, what is the law? Come and hear: These are the ones that are combined with it: a soul that has within it four cubits by four cubits, and a bridge and a grave that have a dwelling place, and a synagogue that has a dwelling place for the cantor, and a foreign place of worship that has a dwelling place for the priests, and the plowed fields and the treasuries that are in them have a dwelling place, and the towers within it, and the house in the sea - these are the ones that are combined with it.

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ שֶׁאֵין מִתְעַבְּרִין עִמָּהּ: נֶפֶשׁ שֶׁנִּפְרְצָה מִשְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹתֶיהָ אֵילָךְ וְאֵילָךְ, וְהַגֶּשֶׁר וְהַקֶּבֶר שֶׁאֵין לָהֶן בֵּית דִּירָה, וּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת שֶׁאֵין לָהּ בֵּית דִּירָה לַחַזָּן, וּבֵית עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה שֶׁאֵין לָהּ בֵּית דִּירָה לַכּוֹמָרִים, וְהָאוּרְווֹת וְהָאוֹצָרוֹת שֶׁבַּשָּׂדוֹת שֶׁאֵין לָהֶן בֵּית דִּירָה, וּבוֹר וְשִׁיחַ וּמְעָרָה וְגָדֵר וְשׁוֹבָךְ שֶׁבְּתוֹכָהּ, וְהַבַּיִת שֶׁבַּסְּפִינָה — אֵין אֵלּוּ מִתְעַבְּרִין עִמָּהּ.
human_translation: And these are not included in A tomb that was breached on both sides, here there, and a bridge and a grave that do not have a residence; and a synagogue that does not have a residence for the sexton; and an idolatrous temple that does not have a residence for the priests; and stables and storehouses in fields that do not have a residence, and a cistern, and an ditch, and a cave, and a wall, and a dovecote in and a house on a boat these are not included in the
llm_translation: And these are the things that do not become ritually impure with it: a soul that has been split into two spirits, here and there, and a bridge and a grave that do not have a dwelling place, and a synagogue that does not have a dwelling place for the cantor, and a foreign place of worship that does not have a dwelling place for the priests, and the plowed furrows and the treasuries in the fields that do not have a dwelling place, and a pit, and a ditch, and a cave, and a fence, and a thornbush within it, and a house in a ship - these do not become ritually impure with it.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי מִיהַת: נֶפֶשׁ שֶׁנִּפְרְצָה מִשְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹתֶיהָ אֵילָךְ וְאֵילָךְ. מַאי לָאו דְּאִיכָּא תִּקְרָה! לָא — דְּלֵיכָּא תִּקְרָה.
human_translation: In any case, it was taught a tomb that was breached on both sides, here there, What, not there is a roof No, where there is no roof
llm_translation: The text states: It was taught in one place: A soul that departed from its two spirits goes here and there. What is meant by "is there not a ceiling"? Not that there is no ceiling.

hebrew_text: בַּיִת שֶׁבַּיָּם. לְמַאי חֲזֵי? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בַּיִת שֶׁעָשׂוּי לְפַנּוֹת בּוֹ כֵּלִים שֶׁבַּסְּפִינָה.
human_translation: A house on the sea, what is suitable for Rav Pappa said: a house used to move a ship’s utensils
llm_translation: House in the sea. What is seen? Rav Papa said: A house made to face in it vessels of the ship.

hebrew_text: וּמְעָרָה אֵין מִתְעַבֶּרֶת עִמָּהּ, וְהָתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: מְעָרָה מִתְעַבֶּרֶת עִמָּהּ! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּשֶׁיֵּשׁ בִּנְיָן עַל פִּיהָ.
human_translation: And is a cave not included in its extension? Didn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya teach A cave is included in its extension? Abaye said: when there is a structure at its entrance,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And a cave does not pass with her, and Rabbi Chiya taught: A cave does pass with her! Abaye said: When there is a structure on its mouth." English translation:

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם בִּנְיָן גּוּפֵיהּ! לָא צְרִיכָא, לְהַשְׁלִים.
human_translation: Let him derive because of the structure itself. No, it is necessary to complete
llm_translation: And let it emerge from the aspect of its own structure! It is not necessary, to complete.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: יוֹשְׁבֵי צְרִיפִין, אֵין מוֹדְדִין לָהֶן אֶלָּא מִפֶּתַח בָּתֵּיהֶן.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: Those who dwell in huts, one measures for them only from the entrance to their homes;
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: The residents of Tzrifin, we only measure for them from the entrance of their houses.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב חִסְדָּא: ״וַיַּחֲנוּ עַל הַיַּרְדֵּן מִבֵּית הַיְשִׁימוֹת״, וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה (אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן): לְדִידִי חֲזֵי לִי הָהוּא אַתְרָא, וְהָוֵי תְּלָתָא פַּרְסֵי עַל תְּלָתָא פַּרְסֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda raised an objection: “And they pitched by the Jordan, from Beit-HaYeshimot and Rabba bar bar Ḥana said that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: I myself saw that place, and it is three parasangs [ parsa ], by three parasangs.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: "And they camped by the Jordan from Beth-jeshimoth," and Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: According to my opinion, I see that place, and it is three parasangs by three parasangs.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא: כְּשֶׁהֵן נִפְנִין — אֵין נִפְנִין לֹא לִפְנֵיהֶם, וְלֹא לְצִדֵּיהֶן, אֶלָּא לְאַחֲרֵיהֶן?
human_translation: And it was taught When they would defecate they would not defecate in front of themselves, and not to their sides, rather, behind
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ve-tanya: k'shehen nifnin - ein nifnin lo lifneihem, ve-lo l'tzideihem, ela l'achareihen?" English translation: "And it was taught: When they turn - they do not turn towards their front, nor towards their sides, but towards their back?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: דִּגְלֵי מִדְבָּר קָאָמְרַתְּ? כֵּיוָן דִּכְתִיב בְּהוּ: ״עַל פִּי ה׳ יַחֲנוּ וְעַל פִּי ה׳ יִסָּעוּ״ — כְּמַאן דִּקְבִיעַ לְהוּ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rava said to him: The banners of the desert, you say? Since it is written with regard to them: “According to the commandment of the Lord they remained encamped, and according to the commandment of the Lord they journeyed” it was considered as though it were a permanent for them.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: Are you speaking of the flags of the desert? Since it is written about them: "By the word of the Lord they encamped, and by the word of the Lord they journeyed" — like someone who establishes their value.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִינָּנָא בַּר רַב כָּהֲנָא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אִם יֵשׁ שָׁם שָׁלֹשׁ חֲצֵירוֹת שֶׁל שְׁנֵי בָתִּים — הוּקְבְּעוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥinnana bar Rav Kahana said that Rav Ashi said: If there are three courtyards of two houses they have been established
llm_translation: Rav Chinana son of Rav Kahana said, Rav Ashe said: If there are there three courtyards belonging to two houses - they are combined.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: יוֹשְׁבֵי צְרִיפִין וְהוֹלְכֵי מִדְבָּרוֹת — חַיֵּיהֶן אֵינָן חַיִּים, וּנְשֵׁיהֶן וּבְנֵיהֶן אֵינָן שֶׁלָּהֶן.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said that Rav said: Those who dwell in huts, and desert travelers, their lives are not lives, and their wives and children are not their
llm_translation: Said Rav Yehudah said Rav: Residents of Tsarifin and travelers of the wilderness - their lives are not lives, and their wives and children are not theirs.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, אֱלִיעֶזֶר אִישׁ בִּירְיָא אוֹמֵר: יוֹשְׁבֵי צְרִיפִין כְּיוֹשְׁבֵי קְבָרִים. וְעַל בְּנוֹתֵיהֶם הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״אָרוּר שׁוֹכֵב עִם כׇּל בְּהֵמָה״.
human_translation: That was also taught Eliezer of Biriyya says: Those who dwell in huts are like those who dwell in graves. And with regard to their daughters, says: “Cursed be he who sleeps with any manner of beast”
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: Namai the Elder, thus said: Eliezer Ish Biryah says: The inhabitants of Tzrifin are like the inhabitants of graves. And regarding their daughters, he says: "Cursed is one who lies with any beast."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? עוּלָּא אָמַר: שֶׁאֵין לָהֶן מֶרְחֲצָאוֹת. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּרְגִּישִׁין זֶה לָזֶה בִּטְבִילָה.
human_translation: What is the reason Ulla said: They do not have bathhouses, And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Because they sense when one another immerses.
llm_translation: What is the reason? Ulah said: because they do not have baths. And Rabbi Yochanan said: because they feel each other in immersion.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ נַהֲרָא דִּסְמִיךְ לְבֵיתָא.
human_translation: What is the between There is between them a river that is adjacent to the house,
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them - a river that is close to a house.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: כׇּל עִיר שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ יָרָק — אֵין תַּלְמִיד חָכָם רַשַּׁאי לָדוּר בָּהּ. לְמֵימְרָא דְּיָרָק מְעַלְּיָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: שְׁלֹשָׁה מַרְבִּין אֶת הַזֶּבֶל, וְכוֹפְפִין אֶת הַקּוֹמָה, וְנוֹטְלִין אֶחָד מֵחֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת מִמְּאוֹר עֵינָיו שֶׁל אָדָם, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן:
human_translation: Rav Huna said: Any city that does not have vegetables, a Torah scholar is not permitted to dwell there Is that to say that vegetables are beneficial Wasn’t it taught Three increase one’s waste, bend stature, and remove one five-hundredth of the light of a person’s eyes; and they are
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: Any city that does not have vegetables - a Torah scholar is not permitted to reside in it. Is it to be inferred that vegetables are superior? But it was taught: Three things increase waste, bend the spine, and take away one five-hundredth of a person's eyesight, and they are:

hebrew_text: פַּת קִיבָּר וְשֵׁכָר חָדָשׁ וְיָרָק. לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּתוּמֵי וְכַרָּתֵי, הָא — בִּשְׁאָר יַרְקֵי. כִּדְתַנְיָא: שׁוּם — יָרָק, כְּרֵישִׁין — חֲצִי יָרָק, נִרְאֶה צְנוֹן — נִרְאֶה סַם חַיִּים.
human_translation: coarse bread, new beer, and vegetables. not difficult. This to garlic and leeks, that to other vegetables, As it was taught Garlic is vegetable; leeks a half-vegetable, radish has been seen, an elixir of life has been seen,
llm_translation: Bread, liver, and fresh beer, and vegetables. It is not difficult: this — with dates and leeks, that — with other vegetables. As it was taught: garlic is a vegetable, leeks are half a vegetable, if it looks like an onion, it looks like a life-saving drug.

hebrew_text: וְהָא תַנְיָא: נִרְאֶה צְנוֹן — נִרְאֶה סַם הַמָּוֶת! לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — בֶּעָלִין, כָּאן — בָּאִמָּהוֹת. כָּאן — בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה, כָּאן — בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים.
human_translation: Wasn’t it taught radish has been seen, a lethal drug has been seen? not difficult. Here, to leaves; there, to the roots. here to the summer, there, to the winter,
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: If the tail appears - it appears as the poison of death! It is not difficult: here - in the mountains, here - in the valleys. Here - in the days of the sun, here - in the days of rain.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: כׇּל עִיר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ מַעֲלוֹת וּמוֹרָדוֹת, אָדָם וּבְהֵמָה שֶׁבָּהּ מֵתִים בַּחֲצִי יְמֵיהֶן. מֵתִים סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: מַזְקִינִים בַּחֲצִי יְמֵיהֶן. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: הָנֵי מוּלְיָיתָא דְּבֵי בֵירֵי וּדְבֵי נָרֶשׁ אַזְקְנוּן.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said that Rav said: any city that has ascents and descents, people and animals die at half their days, Can it enter your mind die Rather, say: They grow old at half their days, Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: The ascents between Beit Biri and Beit Neresh, made me grow old
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Any city that has ascents and descents, people and animals in it die in the middle of their days. Do you think they die? Rather say: They age in the middle of their days. Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Those of the city of Bei Berei and Bei Nares aged prematurely.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בָּא לְרַבְּעָהּ — מְרַבְּעָהּ בְּרִיבּוּעַ עוֹלָם, נוֹתֵן צְפוֹנָהּ לִצְפוֹן עוֹלָם וּדְרוֹמָהּ לִדְרוֹם עוֹלָם, וְסִימָנָיךְ: עֲגָלָה בַּצָּפוֹן, וְעַקְרָב בַּדָּרוֹם.
human_translation: the Sages taught one comes to square he squares it with the four of the world. He sets the northern to the north of the world, and its southern to the south of the world. And your sign Ursa Major is in the north and Scorpio is in the south.
llm_translation: The sages taught: If one comes to his quarter - his quarter in the world is a quarter of the world, he places its north to the north of the world and its south to the south of the world. And your signs are: a calf in the north, and a scorpion in the south.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אִם אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ לְרַבְּעָהּ בְּרִיבּוּעַ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, — מְרַבְּעָהּ כְּמִין הַתְּקוּפָה. כֵּיצַד? חַמָּה יוֹצְאָה בְּיוֹם אָרוֹךְ וְשׁוֹקַעַת בְּיוֹם אָרוֹךְ — זֶה הוּא פְּנֵי צָפוֹן. חַמָּה יוֹצְאָה בְּיוֹם קָצָר וְשׁוֹקַעַת בְּיוֹם קָצָר — זֶה הוּא פְּנֵי דָרוֹם. תְּקוּפַת נִיסָן וּתְקוּפַת תִּשְׁרֵי — חַמָּה יוֹצְאָה בַּחֲצִי מִזְרָח וְשׁוֹקַעַת בַּחֲצִי מַעֲרָב,
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: If one does not know how to square with the four of the world he should square it based upon the seasons, How so? the sun rises and sets on the longest day this is the face of the north. the sun rises and sets on the shortest day this is the face of the south. the vernal equinox and the autumnal equinox, the sun rises in the middle of the east and sets in the middle of the west.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: If one does not know to quarter it in the quadrant of the world, he quarters it like the equinox. How so? If the sun rises on a long day and sets on a long day - this is the face of the north. If the sun rises on a short day and sets on a short day - this is the face of the south. The equinox of Nisan and the equinox of Tishrei - the sun rises in the half of the east and sets in the half of the west.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הוֹלֵךְ אֶל דָּרוֹם וְסוֹבֵב אֶל צָפוֹן״, הוֹלֵךְ אֶל דָּרוֹם — בַּיּוֹם, וְסוֹבֵב אֶל צָפוֹן — בַּלַּיְלָה. ״סוֹבֵב סוֹבֵב הוֹלֵךְ הָרוּחַ״ — אֵלּוּ פְּנֵי מִזְרָח וּפְנֵי מַעֲרָב, פְּעָמִים מְהַלַּכְתָּן וּפְעָמִים מְסַבַּבְתָּן.
human_translation: As it is stated: It goes toward the south, and turns about to the north; “It goes toward the south” during the day; “and turns about to the north,” at night. “Round and round goes the wind [ ruaḥ ];” these are the face of the east and the face of the west; sometimes traverses them and sometimes it turns about them
llm_translation: As it is stated: "He who goes to the south and turns around to the north," - "he who goes to the south" - during the day, "and turns around to the north" - at night. "Turning, turning goes the wind" - these are the faces of east and west, sometimes you walk them and sometimes you go around them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: לֵיתַנְהוּ לְהָנֵי כְּלָלֵי, דְּתַנְיָא: לֹא יָצְאָה חַמָּה מֵעוֹלָם מִקֶּרֶן מִזְרָחִית צְפוֹנִית וְשָׁקְעָה בְּקֶרֶן מַעֲרָבִית צְפוֹנִית, וְלֹא יָצְאָה חַמָּה מִקֶּרֶן מִזְרָחִית דְּרוֹמִית וְשָׁקְעָה בְּקֶרֶן מַעֲרָבִית דְּרוֹמִית.
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiya said: There is no rules as it was taught The sun has never risen, at the northeastern corner and set in the northwestern corner, nor has the sun risen, at the southeastern corner and set in the southwestern corner.
llm_translation: Rav Mesharshaya said: Let them give to those principles, as it was taught: The sun has never departed from its place in the eastern northern corner and set in the western northern corner, and the sun has never departed from its place in the eastern southern corner and set in the western southern corner.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין תְּקוּפַת נִיסָן נוֹפֶלֶת אֶלָּא בְּאַרְבָּעָה רִבְעֵי הַיּוֹם, אוֹ בִּתְחִלַּת הַיּוֹם אוֹ בִּתְחִלַּת הַלַּיְלָה, אוֹ בַּחֲצִי הַיּוֹם אוֹ בַּחֲצִי הַלַּיְלָה.
human_translation: Shmuel said: The vernal equinox occurs only at the four quarters of a day: Either at the beginning of the day, or at the beginning of the night, or at midday, or at midnight.
llm_translation: Samuel said: The equinox of Nisan falls only on four quarters of the day, or at the beginning of the day or at the beginning of the night, or at midday or at midnight.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין תְּקוּפַת תַּמּוּז נוֹפֶלֶת אֶלָּא אוֹ בְּאַחַת וּמֶחֱצָה, אוֹ בְּשֶׁבַע וּמֶחֱצָה, בֵּין בַּיּוֹם וּבֵין בַּלַּיְלָה. וְאֵין תְּקוּפַת תִּשְׁרֵי נוֹפֶלֶת אֶלָּא אוֹ בְּשָׁלֹשׁ שָׁעוֹת אוֹ בְּתֵשַׁע שָׁעוֹת, בֵּין בַּיּוֹם וּבֵין בַּלַּיְלָה. וְאֵין תְּקוּפַת טֵבֵת נוֹפֶלֶת אֶלָּא אוֹ בְּאַרְבַּע וּמֶחֱצָה אוֹ בְּעֶשֶׂר וּמֶחֱצָה, בֵּין בַּיּוֹם וּבֵין בַּלַּיְלָה.
human_translation: the summer solstice occurs only Either at one and a half or seven and a half of the day or night. And the autumnal equinox occurs only Either at three hours or nine hours of the day or night. And the winter solstice occurs only Either at four and a half or ten and a half of the day or night.
llm_translation: The equinox of Tamuz falls only either in one and a half, or in seven and a half hours, whether by day or by night. And the equinox of Tevet falls only either in four and a half, or in nine and a half hours, whether by day or by night. And the equinox of Tevet falls only either in four and a half, or in nine and a half hours, whether by day or by night.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין בֵּין תְּקוּפָה לִתְקוּפָה אֶלָּא תִּשְׁעִים וְאֶחָד יוֹם וְשֶׁבַע שָׁעוֹת וּמֶחֱצָה. וְאֵין תְּקוּפָה מוֹשֶׁכֶת מֵחֲבֶרְתָּהּ אֶלָּא חֲצִי שָׁעָה.
human_translation: And there are only ninety-one days and seven and a half hours between one season and the next, And season one-half hour past the previous season. the previous
llm_translation: And there is no difference between one equinox and another except ninety-one days and seven hours and a half. And one equinox does not delay from its companion except half an hour.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין לְךָ תְּקוּפַת נִיסָן שֶׁנּוֹפֶלֶת בְּצֶדֶק, שֶׁאֵינָהּ מְשַׁבֶּרֶת אֶת הָאִילָנוֹת. וְאֵין לְךָ תְּקוּפַת טֵבֵת שֶׁנּוֹפֶלֶת בְּצֶדֶק, שֶׁאֵינָהּ מְיַיבֶּשֶׁת אֶת הַזְּרָעִים. וְהוּא, דְּאִיתְיְלִיד לְבָנָה אוֹ בִּלְבָנָה אוֹ בְּצֶדֶק.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: There is no vernal equinox occurs in Jupiter it does not break the trees and there is no the winter solstice occurs in Jupiter it does not dry up the seeds. And this where the new moon appeared either at Moon or at Jupiter.
llm_translation: And Samuel said: You do not have a Nisan equinox that falls in righteousness, which does not break the trees. And you do not have a Tevet equinox that falls in righteousness, which does not dry up the seeds. And he, whether he is born in white or in white or in righteousness.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמְרַבֵּעַ אֶת הָעִיר, עוֹשֶׂה אוֹתָהּ כְּמִין טַבְלָא מְרוּבַּעַת. וְחוֹזֵר וּמְרַבֵּעַ אֶת הַתְּחוּמִין, וְעוֹשֶׂה אוֹתָן כְּמִין טַבְלָא מְרוּבַּעַת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One who squares a city renders it like a square tablet, and then squares the boundaries and renders them like a square tablet.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One who squares the city, makes it like a square garment. And he goes back and squares the boundaries, and makes them like a square garment.

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁהוּא מוֹדֵד, לֹא יִמְדּוֹד מֵאֶמְצַע הַקֶּרֶן אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא מַפְסִיד אֶת הַזָּוִיּוֹת. אֶלָּא מֵבִיא טַבְלָא מְרוּבַּעַת שֶׁהִיא אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה עַל אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה, וּמַנִּיחָהּ בְּקֶרֶן בַּאֲלַכְסוֹנָהּ.
human_translation: And when he measures he should not measure two thousand cubits from the middle of corner because he would lose the corners, Rather, he brought a square tablet that is two thousand cubits by two thousand cubits, and places it at corner at its diagonal.
llm_translation: When he measures, he should not measure from the middle of the horn two thousand cubits, because he would be causing a loss to the corners. Rather, he should bring a square tablet that is two thousand cubits by two thousand cubits, and place it on the horn diagonally.

hebrew_text: נִמְצֵאתָ הָעִיר מִשְׂתַּכֶּרֶת אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת אַמּוֹת לְכָאן וְאַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת אַמּוֹת לְכָאן. נִמְצְאוּ תְּחוּמִין מִשְׂתַּכְּרִין שְׁמוֹנֶה מֵאוֹת אַמּוֹת לְכָאן וּשְׁמוֹנֶה מֵאוֹת לְכָאן. נִמְצְאוּ הָעִיר וּתְחוּמִין מִשְׂתַּכְּרִין אֶלֶף וּמָאתַיִם לְכָאן וְאֶלֶף וּמָאתַיִם לְכָאן.
human_translation: it will be found the city gains four hundred cubits in this and four hundred cubits in the it is found boundaries gain eight hundred cubits in this and eight hundred cubits in the it is found the city and the boundaries gain 1,200 in this and 1,200 in the
llm_translation: The city was found to be four hundred cubits square here and four hundred cubits square there. The boundaries were found to be eight hundred cubits here and eight hundred cubits there. The city and the boundaries were found to be one thousand and two hundred cubits here and one thousand and two hundred cubits there.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: וּמַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ בְּמָתָא דְּהָוְיָא תְּרֵי אַלְפֵי אַתְּרֵי אַלְפֵי.
human_translation: Abaye said: And you find this in city that is two thousand by two thousand
llm_translation: Abaye said: And you find her in the city of Havaia, which had two thousand streets.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: תְּחוּם עָרֵי לְוִיִּם אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה. צֵא מֵהֶן אֶלֶף אַמָּה מִגְרָשׁ — נִמְצָא מִגְרָשׁ רְבִיעַ, וְהַשְּׁאָר שָׂדוֹת וּכְרָמִים.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: The boundary of the cities of the Levites two thousand cubits Remove from them a thousand cubits of open space Consequently, the open space is one quarter and the rest is fields and vineyards.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: The boundary of the Levitical cities is two thousand cubits. If one measures out a thousand cubits from them as a boundary - it is found to be a quarter of a boundary, and the rest are fields and vineyards.

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רָבָא: דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״מִקִּיר הָעִיר וָחוּצָה אֶלֶף אַמָּה סָבִיב״, אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: סַבֵּב אֶת הָעִיר בְּאֶלֶף, נִמְצָא מִגְרָשׁ רְבִיעַ.
human_translation: From where are these matters? Rava said: As the verse states: shall be from the wall of the city and outward a thousand cubits round about” The Torah states: Surround the city with a thousand Consequently, the open space is one quarter
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "What are these words?" Rava said: As the verse states: "From the wall of the city and outward a thousand cubits all around," the Torah said: Surround the city with a thousand, and you will find a quarter of a mile.

hebrew_text: רְבִיעַ?! פַּלְגָא הָוֵי! אָמַר רָבָא: בַּר אַדָּא מָשׁוֹחָאָה אַסְבְּרַהּ לִי — מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ בְּמָתָא דְּהָוְיָא תְּרֵי אַלְפֵי אַתְּרֵי אַלְפֵי. תְּחוּם כַּמָּה הָוְיָא? שִׁיתְּסַר. קְרָנוֹת כַּמָּה הָוְיָין? שִׁיתְּסַר. דַּל תְּמָנְיָא דִתְחוּמִין וְאַרְבְּעָה דִקְרָנוֹת, כַּמָּה הָוֵי? תְּרֵיסַר.
human_translation: one quarter? It is one half. Rava said: Bar Adda the surveyor explained to me: You will find in a city that is two thousand by two thousand How many boundary Sixteen How many are the corners? Sixteen Subtract eight from the boundary And four from the corners, How much is Twelve
llm_translation: Fourth?! It should be half! Rava said: Bar Adda the anointer reasoned to me - you forget about it in a city that has two thousand courtyards. How much is the boundary? Twelve. How many horns are there? Twelve. The poor of the boundaries and the four of the horns, how much is it? Thirteen.

hebrew_text: נִמְצָא מִגְרָשׁ רְבִיעַ? טְפֵי מִתִּלְתָּא נִינְהוּ!
human_translation: the open space found one quarter It is more than one-third.
llm_translation: Found a courtyard of a quarter? They are considered as secondary to the third.

hebrew_text: אַיְיתִי אַרְבְּעָה דְמָתָא, שְׁדִי עֲלַיְיהוּ. אַכַּתִּי תִּילְתָּא הָוֵי!
human_translation: Bring the four of the city add them is still one-third,
llm_translation: I brought four witnesses, throw the burden on them. The third one should be silent!

hebrew_text: מִי סָבְרַתְּ בְּרִיבּוּעָא קָאָמַר? בְּעִיגּוּלָא קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Do you think was stated to a square It was stated to a round
llm_translation: Who holds in the case of a square? He holds in the case of a circle.

hebrew_text: כַּמָּה מְרוּבָּע יָתֵר עַל הֶעָגוֹל? רְבִיעַ, דַּל רְבִיעַ מִינַּיְיהוּ — פָּשׁוּ לְהוּ תִּשְׁעָה. וְתִשְׁעָה מִתְּלָתִין וְשִׁיתָּא, רִיבְעָא הָוֵי.
human_translation: How much larger is a square than the circle? One quarter. Subtract one quarter from nine are left; and nine is one quarter of thirty-six.
llm_translation: How much is the square greater than the circle? A quarter, because a quarter is taken from them - it is evident to them nine. And nine from thirty and six, a quarter is left.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ נָמֵי בְּמָתָא דְּהָוְיָא אַלְפָא בְּאַלְפָא. תְּחוּמִין כַּמָּה הָווּ? תְּמָנְיָא. קְרָנוֹת כַּמָּה הָוֵי? שִׁיתְּסַר.
human_translation: Abaye said: You will also find in a city that is a thousand by a thousand How many is the boundary eight How many are the corners? sixteen
llm_translation: Abaye said: She would find herself in the town of Havaya, which was a thousand by a thousand. How much were the boundaries? Eighty. How many horns were there? Twelve.

hebrew_text: דַּל אַרְבַּע דִּתְחוּמִין וְאַרְבַּע דִּקְרָנוֹת. כַּמָּה הָוֵי? תְּמָנְיָא.
human_translation: Subtract four of the boundary and four from the corners, How much is eight
llm_translation: Needy four of boundaries and four of corners. How much is it? Eight.

hebrew_text: תִּילְתָּא הָווּ! מִי סָבְרַתְּ בְּרִבּוּעָא קָאָמַר? בְּעִיגּוּלָא קָאָמַר. כַּמָּה מְרוּבָּע יָתֵר עַל הֶעָגוֹל — רְבִיעַ, דַּל רְבִיעַ — פָּשׁוּ לַהּ שִׁיתָּא. וְשִׁיתָּא מֵעֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע, רִיבְעָא הָוֵי.
human_translation: are one-third Do you think was stated with regard to a square It was stated with regard to a round How much larger is a square than a circle? one quarter Subtract one quarter from six are left; and six is one quarter of twenty-four.
llm_translation: The third! Who holds that it refers to a square? It refers to a circle. How much more is a square than a circle? A quarter. Subtract a quarter, it becomes six. And six out of twenty-four is a quarter.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: מַאי רְבִיעַ, רְבִיעַ דִּתְחוּמִין.
human_translation: Ravina said: What is one quarter? one quarter the boundary.
llm_translation: Ravina said: What is a revi'it? A revi'it of techumin.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: מַאי רְבִיעַ, רְבִיעַ דִּקְרָנוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said What is one quarter One quarter of the corners.
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: What is "revi'a"? A revi'a of horns.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וְהָא ״סָבִיב״ כְּתִיב!
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Isn’t it written around”
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: "But it is written 'around'!"

hebrew_text: מַאי ״סָבִיב״ — סָבִיב דִּקְרָנוֹת, דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, גַּבֵּי עוֹלָה דִּכְתִיב: ״וְזָרְקוּ (בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן) אֶת הַדָּם עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ סָבִיב״, הָכִי נָמֵי סָבִיב מַמָּשׁ?! אֶלָּא מַאי ״סָבִיב״ — סָבִיב דִּקְרָנוֹת, הָכִי נָמֵי: מַאי ״סָבִיב״ — סָבִיב דִּקְרָנוֹת.
human_translation: What is around? Around at the corners, As, if you do not say so, with regard to burnt-offering, as it is written: “And they shall sprinkle the blood around upon the altar” here, too, literally “around” Rather, what is around? Around the corners, Here too, what is around? Around the corners.
llm_translation: What is "around" - around the horns, for if you do not say so, in relation to the burnt offering it is written: "And the sons of Aaron shall throw the blood against the altar around," is it really around literally? Rather, what is "around" - around the horns, it is thus: what is "around" - around the horns.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חֲבִיבִי מָחוֹזְנָאָה לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וְהָא אִיכָּא מוּרְשָׁא דְקַרְנָתָא!
human_translation: Rav Ḥavivi from Meḥoza said to Rav Ashi: But aren’t there the protrusions of the corners?
llm_translation: Rav Chavivi said to Rav Ashi: But there is the inheritance of the horn!

hebrew_text: בְּמָתָא עִיגּוּלְתָּא. וְהָא רַיבְּעוּהָ? אֵימוֹר דְּאָמְרִינַן חֲזֵינַן כְּמַאן דִּמְרַבְּעָא. רַבּוֹעֵי וַדַּאי מִי מְרַבַּעְנָא?!
human_translation: with a circular city. But haven’t they squared Say that we say We view as if it were squared. Do we actually square it?
llm_translation: In the city of Igulta. But was it square? Say that we say: We see it as if it were square. Are we really squaring it off?!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חֲנִילַאי מָחוֹזְנָאָה לְרַב אָשֵׁי: מִכְּדִי כַּמָּה מְרוּבָּע יָתֵר עַל הֶעָגוֹל — רְבִיעַ, הָנֵי תַּמְנֵי מְאָה? שֵׁית מְאָה וְשִׁיתִּין וּשְׁבַע נָכֵי תִּילְתָּא הָוֵי!
human_translation: Rav Ḥanilai from Meḥoza said to Rav Ashi: Now, how much larger is a square than a circle? One quarter. these eight hundred is 667 minus one-third
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Chanilai the merchant, to Rav Ashi: Since how much is a square more than a circle? A quarter. Those eight hundred? Six hundred and sixty-seven and a third is the answer!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּעִיגּוּלָא מִגּוֹ רִבּוּעַ. אֲבָל בַּאֲלַכְסוֹנָא — בָּעֵינָא טְפֵי. דְּאָמַר מָר, כׇּל אַמְּתָא בְּרִיבּוּעַ — אַמְּתָא וּתְרֵי חוּמְּשֵׁי בַּאֲלַכְסוֹנָא.
human_translation: said to him: This applies only to a circle within a square, However, with regard to the diagonal [ alakhsona ] more is required. As the Master said: Every cubit of a square is one and two-fifths cubits in its diagonal.
llm_translation: He said to him: those words in a circle are a square. But in a diagonal - I need more. As the Master said, every cubit in a square - a cubit and two fifths in a diagonal.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נוֹתְנִין קַרְפֵּף לָעִיר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: לֹא אָמְרוּ קַרְפֵּף אֶלָּא בֵּין שְׁתֵּי עֲיָירוֹת, אִם יֵשׁ לָזוֹ שִׁבְעִים אַמָּה וְשִׁירַיִים וּלָזוֹ שִׁבְעִים אַמָּה וְשִׁירַיִים — עוֹשֶׂה קַרְפֵּף אֶת שְׁתֵּיהֶן לִהְיוֹת אֶחָד.
human_translation: One allocates a karpef to city, this is the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: They spoke of a karpef only between two cities. If this has seventy cubits and a remainder and that has seventy cubits and a remainder the karpef combines the two into one.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may establish an alleyway for a city, according to the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: They only said to establish an alleyway between two cities, if one has seventy cubits and two-thirds, and the other has seventy cubits and two-thirds - one may make an alleyway for both to be considered as one.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן שְׁלֹשָׁה כְּפָרִים הַמְשׁוּלָּשִׁין, אִם יֵשׁ בֵּין שְׁנַיִם חִיצוֹנִים מֵאָה וְאַרְבָּעִים וְאַחַת וּשְׁלִישׁ — עָשָׂה אֶמְצָעִי אֶת שְׁלָשְׁתָּן לִהְיוֹת אֶחָד.
human_translation: And likewise, three villages that are a triangle, if there are 141⅓ between the two outer middle combines the three into one.
llm_translation: And similarly, three villages that are arranged in a triangle, if there is between two of them one hundred and forty-one and two-thirds cubits — he made a middle one to be one village.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רָבָא: דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״מִקִּיר הָעִיר וָחוּצָה״. אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: תֵּן חוּצָה, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מְדוֹד.
human_translation: From where are these matters, Rava said: As the verse states: from the wall of the city and outward The Torah says: Provide outside and afterward measure
llm_translation: Gemara: What are these words? Rava said: As the verse states: "From the wall of the city and outward." The Torah said: Give outward, and then measure.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים לֹא אָמְרוּ וְכוּ׳. אִיתְּמַר, רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: נוֹתְנִין קַרְפֵּף לָזוֹ וְקַרְפֵּף לָזוֹ. חִיָּיא בַּר רַב אָמַר: קַרְפֵּף [אֶחָד] לִשְׁתֵּיהֶן.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: They spoke only It was stated Rav Huna said: One allocates a karpef to this and a karpef to that Ḥiyya bar Rav said: one karpef to the two of them.
llm_translation: The sages say, "They did not say, etc." It was stated: Rav Huna said, "One places a kerchief for this one and a kerchief for that one." Hiyya bar Rav said, "One kerchief for both of them."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: לֹא אָמְרוּ קַרְפֵּף אֶלָּא בֵּין שְׁתֵּי עֲיָירוֹת, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְרַב הוּנָא!
human_translation: We learned And the Rabbis say: They spoke a karpef only with regard to between two cities. a conclusive refutation of Rav Huna,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah, and the sages say: They only said "kerpef" between two cities, the Tivuta of Rav Huna!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב הוּנָא: מַאי קַרְפֵּף, תּוֹרַת קַרְפֵּף, וּלְעוֹלָם קַרְפֵּף לָזוֹ וְקַרְפֵּף לָזוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Huna said to you What is a karpef ? the principle of a karpef . In actuality, a karpef to this and a karpef to that
llm_translation: Rav Huna said to you: What is "karpef"? The law of karpef, and forever karpef for this one and karpef for that one.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אִם יֵשׁ לָזוֹ שִׁבְעִים אַמָּה וְשִׁירַיִים וְלָזוֹ שִׁבְעִים אַמָּה וְשִׁירַיִים — עוֹשֶׂה קַרְפֵּף לִשְׁתֵּיהֶן לִהְיוֹת אֶחָד. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: So, too, it is reasonable From that it teaches the latter clause: If this has seventy cubits and a remainder and that has seventy cubits and a remainder the karpef combines the two into one. learn from this
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: it is inferred from the latter clause: if one has seventy cubits and two, and another has seventy cubits and two - he makes a canopy for both to be as one. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתֵּיהּ דְּחִיָּיא בַּר רַב! אָמַר לְךָ חִיָּיא בַּר רַב:
human_translation: Let us say this is a conclusive refutation of Ḥiyya bar Rav, Ḥiyya bar Rav said to you:
llm_translation: Let it be the goodness of Hyya son of Rav! Hyya son of Rav said to you:

hebrew_text: הָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא.
human_translation: whose this It is Rabbi Meir,
llm_translation: This is a question: Rabbi Meir it is.

hebrew_text: אִי רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, הָא תָּנֵי לֵיהּ רֵישָׁא: נוֹתְנִין קַרְפֵּף לָעִיר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר?
human_translation: If it is Rabbi Meir, didn’t we learn in the first clause: One allocates a karpef to city; the statement of Rabbi Meir?
llm_translation: If it is according to Rabbi Meir, then why does the beginning teach: "One may establish an Eruv for the city," are these the words of Rabbi Meir?

hebrew_text: צְרִיכָא, דְּאִי מֵהַהִיא, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: חַד לַחֲדָא, וְחַד לְתַרְתֵּי. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דִּלְתַרְתֵּי תְּרֵי יָהֲבִינַן לְהוּ.
human_translation: It was necessary as, if from that I might have said one for one and one for two teaches us that for two one allocates two
llm_translation: The matter is, for if from that, I would say: one to one, and one to two. It is implied to us that to two, two were given to them.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָכָא, מִשּׁוּם דִּדְחִיקָא תַּשְׁמִישְׁתַּיְיהוּ, אֲבָל הָתָם דְּלָא דְּחִיקָא תַּשְׁמִישְׁתַּיְיהוּ, אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if taught us here, because crowded for the use But there, where is not crowded for the use of say not necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear here, because it is pressed, their use, but there, where their use is not pressed, say no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: וְכֵן שְׁלֹשָׁה כְּפָרִים הַמְשׁוּלָּשִׁין, אִם יֵשׁ בֵּין שְׁנַיִם הַחִיצוֹנִים מֵאָה וְאַרְבָּעִים וְאַחַת אַמָּה וּשְׁלִישׁ — עוֹשֶׂה אֶמְצָעִי אֶת שְׁלָשְׁתָּן לִהְיוֹת אֶחָד. טַעְמָא דְּאִיכָּא אֶמְצָעִי, הָא לֵיכָּא אֶמְצָעִי — לֹא. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְרַב הוּנָא!
human_translation: we learned: And likewise, three villages that are aligned if there is 141⅓ between the two outer ones, middle combines the three into one. The reason is there is a middle but were there no middle not a conclusive refutation of Rav Huna.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: And similarly, three villages that are arranged in a triangle, if there is a distance of one hundred and forty-one and two-thirds cubits between the two outer ones - one should make a middle one to be one. The reason that there is a middle one, if there is a middle one - yes. The dispute of Rav Huna!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב הוּנָא: הָא אִתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַבָּה אָמַר רַב אִידִי אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לֹא מְשׁוּלָּשִׁין מַמָּשׁ, אֶלָּא רוֹאִין כׇּל שֶׁאִילּוּ מֵטִיל אֶמְצָעִי בֵּינֵיהֶן וְיִהְיוּ מְשׁוּלָּשִׁין, וְאֵין בֵּין זֶה לָזֶה אֶלָּא מֵאָה וְאַרְבָּעִים אַמָּה וְאַחַת וּשְׁלִישׁ — עָשָׂה אֶמְצָעִי אֶת שְׁלָשְׁתָּן לִהְיוֹת אֶחָד.
human_translation: Rav Huna said to you: Wasn’t it stated with regard to Rabba said Rav Idi said Rabbi Ḥanina said: not actually aligned three Rather, we see Any where, if the middle were placed between so that they were three aligned there would be only 141⅓ cubits between one and the other, middle turns the three into one.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said to you: This was said about it, Rabba said in the name of Rabbi Idi who said in the name of Rabbi Chanina: Not truly intertwined, but they see as if one were to place a middle one between them and they would be truly intertwined, and there is no space between this and that except for a hundred and forty-one cubits and a third - he made a middle one to be with the three of them to be one.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְאַבָּיֵי: כַּמָּה יְהֵא בֵּין חִיצוֹן לָאֶמְצָעִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה.
human_translation: Rava said to Abaye: How much there be between an outer and the middle one, said to him: Two thousand cubits.
llm_translation: Rava said to Abbaye: How much should be the distance between the outer wall and the middle wall? He said to him: Two thousand cubits.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אַתְּ הוּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ: כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרָבָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאָמַר: יוֹתֵר מֵאַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה!
human_translation: Wasn’t it you who said: It is reasonable in accordance with Rava, son of Rabba bar Rav Huna, who said: more than two thousand cubits.
llm_translation: And behold, you are the one who said: The strength of Rava, son of Rabba, son of Rav Huna, is evident, as he said: More than two thousand cubits!

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא? הָתָם, אִיכָּא בָּתִּים. הָכָא, לֵיכָּא בָּתִּים.
human_translation: How can you compare? There, there are houses here, there are no houses
llm_translation: So now? There, there are houses. Here, there are no houses.

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְאַבָּיֵי: כַּמָּה יְהֵא בֵּין חִיצוֹן לְחִיצוֹן? כַּמָּה יְהֵא?! מַאי נָפְקָא לָךְ מִינַּהּ? כׇּל שֶׁאִילּוּ מַכְנִיס אֶמְצָעִי בֵּינֵיהֶן וְאֵין בֵּין זֶה לָזֶה אֶלָּא מֵאָה וְאַרְבָּעִים וְאַחַת וּשְׁלִישׁ.
human_translation: And Rava said to Abaye: How much there be between outer and outer How much there be What is the difference to you? Any where, if the middle were placed between them, there would be only 141⅓ between one and the other,
llm_translation: And Rava said to Abbaye: How much should be between one courtyard and another? How much should be?! What difference does it make to you? As long as one can insert a beam between them, and there is only a distance of one hundred and forty-one and a third between them.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ אַרְבַּעַת אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין. וְהָאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: עִיר הָעֲשׂוּיָה כְּקֶשֶׁת, אִם יֵשׁ בֵּין שְׁנֵי רָאשֶׁיהָ פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבַּעַת אֲלָפִים אַמָּה מוֹדְדִין לָהּ מִן הַיֶּתֶר, וְאִם לָאו מוֹדְדִין לָהּ מִן הַקֶּשֶׁת!
human_translation: even four thousand cubits? said to him: Yes. Didn’t Rav Huna say a city shaped like a bow: If between its two ends is less than four thousand cubits, one measures from the bowstring and if not, one measures from the bow
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And even if it is four thousand cubits?" He said to him: No. But didn't Rav Huna say: A city shaped like a bow, if the distance between its two ends is less than four thousand cubits, we measure it from the rest, and if not, we measure it from the bow!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם לֵיכָּא לְמֵימַר ״מַלֵּי״. הָכָא אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר ״מַלֵּי״.
human_translation: said to him: There, there is no to say: Fill here, there is to say: Fill
llm_translation: He said to him: There it is not necessary to say "malei." Here it is necessary to say "malei."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב סָפְרָא לְרָבָא: הֲרֵי בְּנֵי אֲקִיסְטְפוֹן, דְּמָשְׁחִינַן לְהוּ תְּחוּמָא מֵהַאי גִּיסָא דְּאַרְדָּשִׁיר, וּבְנֵי תְּחוּמָא דְאַרְדָּשִׁיר מָשְׁחִינַן לְהוּ תְּחוּמָא מֵהַאי גִּיסָא דַּאֲקִיסְטְפוֹן. הָא אִיכָּא דִּגְלַת דְּמַפְסְקָא יָתֵר מִמֵּאָה וְאַרְבָּעִים וְאַחַת וּשְׁלִישׁ?
human_translation: Rav Safra said to Rava: the people of Akistefon, for whom we measure the limit from the end of Ardeshir, and the people of Ardeshir, for whom we measure the limit from the end of Akistefon, isn’t there the Tigris which separates them by more than 141⅓
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Safra to Rava: Behold, the sons of Akishton, whom we anoint for them a boundary from this side of Ardashire, and the sons of the boundary of Ardashire we anoint for them a boundary from this side of Akishton. Is there a case of a skull that extends more than one hundred and forty-one and a third?

hebrew_text: נְפַק, אַחְוִי לֵיהּ הָנָךְ אַטְמָהָתָא דְשׁוּרָא, דְּמִבַּלְעִי בְּדִגְלַת בְּשִׁבְעִים אַמָּה וְשִׁירַיִים.
human_translation: went out showed the foundations of a wall which were submerged in the Tigris at seventy cubits and a remainder
llm_translation: He went out, he found it, the nest of a bull, which swallows with a flag in seventy cubits and two.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין מוֹדְדִין אֶלָּא בְּחֶבֶל שֶׁל חֲמִשִּׁים אַמָּה, לֹא פָּחוֹת וְלֹא יוֹתֵר. וְלֹא יִמְדּוֹד אֶלָּא כְּנֶגֶד לִבּוֹ.
human_translation: One may measure only with a rope fifty cubits no less and no more, And one may measure only at the level of one’s heart,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may only measure with a measuring line of fifty cubits, neither less nor more. And one should only measure opposite his heart.

hebrew_text: הָיָה מוֹדֵד וְהִגִּיעַ לְגַיְא אוֹ לְגָדֵר, מַבְלִיעוֹ, וְחוֹזֵר לְמִדָּתוֹ. הִגִּיעַ לְהַר, מַבְלִיעוֹ וְחוֹזֵר לְמִדָּתוֹ.
human_translation: one was measuring and he reached a canyon or a fence, he spans it and resumes his measurement. one reached a hill, he spans and resumes his measurement,
llm_translation: He was measuring and reached a valley or a fence, he swallows it, and returns to his measure. He reached a mountain, he swallows it and returns to his measure.

hebrew_text: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יֵצֵא חוּץ לַתְּחוּם.
human_translation: provided he does not go out beyond the limit,
llm_translation: And only not he shall go out outside the boundary.

hebrew_text: אִם אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהַבְלִיעוֹ — בְּזוֹ אָמַר רַבִּי דּוֹסְתַּאי בַּר יַנַּאי מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: שָׁמַעְתִּי שֶׁמְּקַדְּרִין בֶּהָרִים.
human_translation: If, he cannot span it, with regard to this Rabbi Dostai bar Yannai said in the name of Rabbi Meir: I heard that one may pierce hills.
llm_translation: If he cannot swallow it - with this Rabbi Dostai bar Yannai said in the name of Rabbi Meir: I heard that they would boil it in the mountains.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״אֹרֶךְ הֶחָצֵר מֵאָה בָאַמָּה וְרוֹחַב חֲמִשִּׁים בַּחֲמִשִּׁים״, אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: בְּחֶבֶל שֶׁל חֲמִשִּׁים אַמָּה מְדוֹד.
human_translation: From where are these matters, Rav Yehuda said Rav said: that the verse states: “The length of the courtyard shall be one hundred cubits, and the breadth fifty by fifty” The Torah states: Measure with a rope of fifty cubits,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemar mena hanei milei? Amar Rav Yehudah amar Rav: De'amar kra "orech hechatzer me'ah ba'amah ve'rochav chamishim bachamishim", amra Torah: Bechevel shel chamishim amah medod. English translation: What is the conclusion regarding these matters? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: As the verse states, "The length of the courtyard shall be one hundred cubits and the width fifty by fifty," the Torah said: With a rope of fifty cubits in circumference.

hebrew_text: הַאי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לִיטּוֹל חֲמִשִּׁים וּלְסַבֵּב חֲמִשִּׁים.
human_translation: This is necessary Take fifty and surround fifty
llm_translation: This one wants to take fifty and encircle fifty.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן לֵימָא קְרָא: ״חֲמִשִּׁים חֲמִשִּׁים״, מַאי ״חֲמִשִּׁים בַּחֲמִשִּׁים״? שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: If so, let the verse state: Fifty, fifty, What is Fifty by fifty? Conclude from this two
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, let us say a verse: "Fifty fifty," what is "fifty in fifty"? You learn from it two.

hebrew_text: לֹא פָּחוֹת וְלֹא יוֹתֵר. תָּנָא: לֹא פָּחוֹת — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּרְבֶּה, וְלֹא יוֹתֵר — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמְּמַעֵט.
human_translation: not less and not more. It was taught No less, because increases And no more, because reduces
llm_translation: Not less and not more. It was taught: Not less - because it increases, and not more - because it diminishes.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי: אֵין מוֹדְדִין אֶלָּא בְּחֶבֶל שֶׁל אַפְסְקִימָא. מַאי אַפְסְקִימָא? אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא: נַרְגִּילָא. מַאי נַרְגִּילָא? אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב: דִּיקְלָא דְּחַד נְבָרָא. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: מַאי אַפְסְקִימָא? רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר: נַרְגִּילָא, רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אָמַר: דִּיקְלָא דְּחַד נְבָרָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Asi said: One may measure only with a rope of afsakima . What is afsakima ? Rabbi Abba said: nargila What is nargila ? Rabbi Ya’akov said: A palm tree one fibrous vine Some say What is afsakima ? Rabbi Abba said: nargila Rabbi Ya’akov said: a palm tree one fibrous vine.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Assi: One measures only with the rope of Afsikima. What is Afsikima? Said Rabbi Abba: A reed. What is a reed? Said Rabbi Yaakov: A palm tree of one shoot. Some say: What is Afsikima? Rabbi Abba said: A reed, Rabbi Yaakov said: A palm tree of one shoot.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן חֲנַנְיָא: אֵין לְךָ שֶׁיָּפֶה לִמְדִידָה יוֹתֵר מִשַּׁלְשְׁלָאוֹת שֶׁל בַּרְזֶל, אֲבָל מַה נַּעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהֲרֵי אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: ״וּבְיָדוֹ חֶבֶל מִדָּה״.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya said: You have nothing better for measuring than iron chains, But what shall we do, as the Torah states: with a measuring rope in his hand”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Chananiah said: You do not have a more effective method of learning than iron chains, but what can be done since the Torah said: "And in His hand is a measuring line."

hebrew_text: וְהָכְתִיב: ״וּבְיַד הָאִישׁ קְנֵה הַמִּדָּה״? הָהוּא, לְתַרְעֵי.
human_translation: Isn’t it written: “And in the man’s hand a measuring reed That is for gates,
llm_translation: And it is written: "And by the hand of the man, buy the measure"? That one, for Tar'ei.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף, שְׁלֹשָׁה חֲבָלִים הֵם: שֶׁל מָגָג, שֶׁל נֵצֶר, וְשֶׁל פִּשְׁתָּן.
human_translation: Rav Yosef taught there are three rope, of magag , of netzer , and of flax.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita by Rav Yosef: Three ropes they are: the rope of Magag, the rope of Netzer, and the rope of Pishtan.

hebrew_text: שֶׁל מָגָג לְפָרָה, דִּתְנַן: כְּפָתוּהָ בְּחֶבֶל הַמָּגָג וּנְתָנוּהָ עַל גַּב מַעֲרַכְתָּהּ. שֶׁל נְצָרִים לְסוֹטָה, דִּתְנַן: וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵבִיא חֶבֶל הַמִּצְרִי וְקוֹשְׁרוֹ לְמַעְלָה מִדַּדֶּיהָ. שֶׁל פִּשְׁתָּן לִמְדִידָה.
human_translation: of magag for the heifer, as we learned They would bind with a rope of magag and place it on its woodpile, of netzer for a sota , as we learned And after that brings a mitzri rope, and binds it above her breasts, of flax for measuring.
llm_translation: Of Magag for Parah, as we learned: They would tie it with the rope of the Magag and place it on top of its arrangement. Of Natzarim for Sotah, as we learned: And afterwards he brings the rope of the Egyptian and ties it above her breasts. Of Pishtan for Mididah.

hebrew_text: הָיָה מוֹדֵד וְהִגִּיעַ. מִדְּתָנֵי: ״חוֹזֵר לְמִידָּתוֹ״, מִכְּלָל דְּאִם אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהַבְלִיעוֹ — הוֹלֵךְ לְמָקוֹם שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְהַבְלִיעוֹ, וּמַבְלִיעוֹ, וְצוֹפֶה כְּנֶגֶד מִידָּתוֹ, וְחוֹזֵר.
human_translation: he was measuring and he reached From it taught he resumes his measurement, by inference that if he cannot span it he goes to a place where he can span it. And he spans it, and he looks aligned with his measurement, and he resumes
llm_translation: He was measuring and reached. From what is taught: "He returns to his measure," from the inference that if he cannot swallow it - he goes to a place where he can swallow it, and swallows it, and looks opposite his measure, and returns.

hebrew_text: תְּנֵינָא לְהָא, דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָיָה מוֹדֵד וְהִגִּיעַ הַמִּידָּה לְגַיְא, אִם יָכוֹל לְהַבְלִיעוֹ בְּחֶבֶל שֶׁל חֲמִשִּׁים אַמָּה — מַבְלִיעוֹ. וְאִם לָאו — הוֹלֵךְ לִמְקוֹם שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְהַבְלִיעוֹ, וּמַבְלִיעוֹ, וְצוֹפֶה וְחוֹזֵר לְמִידָּתוֹ.
human_translation: we have learned this, as the Sages taught one who was measuring and the measurement reached a canyon, if he can span with a rope of fifty cubits, he spans it. And if not, he goes to a place where he can span it, and he spans it, and he looks and he resumes his measurement
llm_translation: We have learned in this matter, as the Rabbis taught: If one was measuring and the measuring line reached the valley, if he can swallow it with a rope of fifty cubits - he swallows it. And if not - he goes to a place where he can swallow it, and swallows it, and measures and returns to his original measurement.

hebrew_text: אִם הָיָה גֵּיא מְעוּקָּם — מַקְדִּיר וְעוֹלֶה, מַקְדִּיר וְיוֹרֵד. הִגִּיעַ לְכוֹתֶל — אֵין אוֹמְרִים יִקּוֹב הַכּוֹתֶל, אֶלָּא אוֹמְדוֹ וְהוֹלֵךְ לוֹ.
human_translation: If the canyon was curved he pierces and ascends, pierces and descends, he reached a wall, we do not say that he should pierce the wall rather, he estimates and leaves
llm_translation: If there was a valley that was deep - one digs and ascends, one digs and descends. If one reached a wall - they do not say, "Let the wall be pierced," rather they measure and walk around it.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אֲנַן תְּנַן: מַבְלִיעוֹ וְחוֹזֵר לְמִידָּתוֹ? הָתָם, נִיחָא תַּשְׁמִישְׁתָּא. הָכָא, לָא נִיחָא תַּשְׁמִישְׁתָּא.
human_translation: Didn’t we learn he spans it and resumes his measurement? There, use is convenient, here, use is not convenient.
llm_translation: And here we learned: he swallows it and it returns to its original state? There, it is suitable for its designated purpose. Here, it is not suitable for its designated purpose.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין חוּט הַמִּשְׁקוֹלֶת יוֹרֵד כְּנֶגְדּוֹ,
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: They taught only where a plumb line does not drop straight down,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: They taught not except that the thread of the spindle does not descend opposite it.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל חוּט הַמִּשְׁקוֹלֶת יוֹרֵד כְּנֶגְדּוֹ — מוֹדְדוֹ מְדִידָה יָפָה.
human_translation: However, a plumb line drops straight down, he measures properly
llm_translation: But the thread of the plumb-line descends opposite it - measure it with a fine measure.

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה עוֹמְקוֹ שֶׁל גֵּיא? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אַלְפַּיִם.
human_translation: And what is the depth of a canyon Rav Yosef said: two thousand
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "And how deep is the depth of the valley? Rav Yosef said: Two thousand."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: עָמוֹק מֵאָה וְרוֹחַב חֲמִשִּׁים — מַבְלִיעוֹ. וְאִם לָאו — אֵין מַבְלִיעוֹ? הוּא דְּאָמַר כַּאֲחֵרִים, דְּתַנְיָא, אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: אֲפִילּוּ עָמוֹק אַלְפַּיִם וְרוֹחַב חֲמִשִּׁים — מַבְלִיעוֹ.
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection one hundred deep and fifty wide, one may span it; and if not, one may not span it. He stated in accordance with Aḥerim ; as it was taught Aḥerim say: Even two thousand deep and fifty wide, one may span it.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: Abaye: "If it is deep a hundred and wide fifty - it swallows it up. And if not - does it not swallow it up? This is what others say, as it was taught, others say: Even if it is deep two thousand and wide fifty - it swallows it up."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אֲפִילּוּ יָתֵר מֵאַלְפַּיִם. כְּמַאן? דְּלָא כְּתַנָּא קַמָּא וְלָא כַּאֲחֵרִים!
human_translation: Some say Rav Yosef said: Even more than two thousand In accordance with whose not in accordance with the first tanna , and not in accordance with the Aḥerim .
llm_translation: There is one who says, Rav Yosef said: Even more than two thousand. According to whom? Not like the first Tanna and not like the others!

hebrew_text: הָתָם — שֶׁאֵין חוּט הַמִּשְׁקוֹלֶת יוֹרֵד כְּנֶגְדּוֹ. הָכָא — בְּחוּט הַמִּשְׁקוֹלֶת יוֹרֵד כְּנֶגְדּוֹ.
human_translation: There, a plumb line does not drop straight down Here, a plumb line drops straight down.
llm_translation: There — that the thread of the plummet does not descend opposite it. Here — with the thread of the plummet descending opposite it.

hebrew_text: וְכִי אֵין חוּט הַמִּשְׁקוֹלֶת יוֹרֵד כְּנֶגְדּוֹ, עַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר אֲבִימִי: אַרְבַּע. וְכֵן תָּנֵי רָמֵי בַּר יְחֶזְקֵאל: אַרְבַּע.
human_translation: And where a plumb line does not drop straight down, how much Avimi said: Four And similarly, Rami bar Ezekiel taught, four
llm_translation: And when the thread of the plummet does not descend opposite it, until when? Abimi said: Four. And so it was taught by Ramei bar Yehezkel: Four.

hebrew_text: הִגִּיעַ לְהַר, מַבְלִיעוֹ וְחוֹזֵר לְמִידָּתוֹ. אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּהַר הַמִּתְלַקֵּט עֲשָׂרָה מִתּוֹךְ אַרְבַּע, אֲבָל בְּהַר הַמִּתְלַקֵּט עֲשָׂרָה מִתּוֹךְ חָמֵשׁ — מוֹדְדוֹ מְדִידָה יָפָה.
human_translation: he reached a hill, he spans and resumes his measurement. Rava said: They taught only with regard to a hill that has an incline of ten within four However, with regard to hill, that has an incline of ten within five one must measure properly,
llm_translation: He reached the mountain, swallows it and returns to its measure. Rava said: They only taught this regarding a mountain that diminishes ten from four, but regarding a mountain that diminishes ten from five - measure it with a fine measure.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נָתָן מַתְנֵי לְקוּלָּא. אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּהַר הַמִּתְלַקֵּט עֲשָׂרָה מִתּוֹךְ חָמֵשׁ, אֲבָל בְּהַר הַמִּתְלַקֵּט עֲשָׂרָה מִתּוֹךְ אַרְבַּע — אוֹמְדוֹ וְהוֹלֵךְ לוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Natan, teaches a lenient Rava said they only taught with regard to a hill that has an incline of ten within five However, with regard to hill that has an incline of ten within four he estimates and leaves
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Rav Natan teaches leniently. Rava said: They only taught this regarding a hill that diminishes ten from five, but regarding a hill that diminishes ten from four - one may stand and walk.

hebrew_text: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יֵצֵא חוּץ לַתְּחוּם. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאמְרוּ מִדַּת תְּחוּמִין בָּאָה לְכָאן.
human_translation: provided that one does not go out beyond the limit. What is the reason Rav Kahana said: a decree, lest say: The measurement of the limit comes to here.
llm_translation: And only not he shall go out outside the boundary. What reason? Said Rav Kahana: A decree lest they say the measure of boundaries has come here.

hebrew_text: אִם אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהַבְלִיעוֹ. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כֵּיצַד מְקַדְּרִין, תַּחְתּוֹן כְּנֶגֶד לִבּוֹ, עֶלְיוֹן כְּנֶגֶד מַרְגְּלוֹתָיו. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: נְקִיטִינַן אֵין מְקַדְּרִין אֶלָּא בְּחֶבֶל שֶׁל אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: If, one cannot span it, The Sages taught How does one pierce lower at the level of his heart higher at the level of his feet, Abaye said: we hold one may pierce only with a rope of four cubits.
llm_translation: If he cannot swallow it. The Rabbis taught: How do we tie it? The lower one opposite his heart, the upper one opposite his ankles. Abaye said: We tie it only with a rope of four cubits.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: (נְקִיטִינַן) אֵין מְקַדְּרִין לֹא בְּעֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה וְלֹא בְּעָרֵי מִקְלָט — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן שֶׁל תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said that Rabba bar Avuh said: we hold one may not pierce beheaded heifer. one may not cities of refuge, Because are from the Torah,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: (We have learned) We do not establish neither with a decapitated calf nor with cities of refuge - because they are of the Torah.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין מוֹדְדִין אֶלָּא מִן הַמּוּמְחֶה. רִיבָּה לְמָקוֹם אֶחָד, וּמִיעֵט לְמָקוֹם אַחֵר — שׁוֹמְעִין לִמְקוֹם שֶׁרִיבָּה. רִיבָּה לְאֶחָד וּמִיעֵט לְאֶחָד — שׁוֹמְעִין לַמְרוּבֶּה.
human_translation: may measure only with an expert extended in one place and reduced it in another place, one accepts the place where he extended extended for one and reduced for another, one accepts the extended
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may only measure from the larger area. If one expands in one place and contracts in another - we consider the expanded area. If one expands in one and contracts in one - we consider the majority.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ עֶבֶד אֲפִילּוּ שִׁפְחָה נֶאֱמָנִין לוֹמַר עַד כָּאן תְּחוּם שַׁבָּת, שֶׁלֹּא אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים אֶת הַדָּבָר לְהַחֲמִיר, אֶלָּא לְהָקֵל.
human_translation: And even slave even maidservant, are trustworthy to say: The Shabbat limit until here; as the Sages did not state the matter, to be stringent, but to be lenient.
llm_translation: And even a slave, even a maidservant, are trusted to say until here is the Shabbat boundary, for the sages did not say this matter to be stringent, but to be lenient.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לִמְקוֹם שֶׁרִיבָּה אִין, לִמְקוֹם שֶׁמִּיעֵט לָא? אֵימָא: אַף לִמְקוֹם שֶׁרִיבָּה.
human_translation: a place where he extended yes, a place where he reduced no, Say even a place where he extended
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: To a place where there is no strife, to a place where there is no diminution? Say: Even to a place where there is strife."

hebrew_text: רִיבָּה לְאֶחָד וּמִיעֵט לְאֶחָד כּוּ׳. הָא תּוּ לְמָה לִי? הַיְינוּ הָךְ! הָכִי קָאָמַר: רִיבָּה אֶחָד וּמִיעֵט אֶחָד — שׁוֹמְעִין לְזֶה שֶׁרִיבָּה.
human_translation: extended for one and reduced for another, Why do I need this as well? This is the same as that this is what said: one extended and one reduced one accepts the who extended
llm_translation: Dispute to one and diminish to one, thus. Ha, why to me? That is it! Thus he said: Dispute one and diminish one - we listen to this that is a dispute.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יַרְבֶּה יוֹתֵר מִמִּדַּת הָעִיר בַּאֲלַכְסוֹנָא.
human_translation: Abaye said: as long as he does not extend more than the measure of the city as a diagonal
llm_translation: Abaye said: And only that it should not exceed more than the measure of the city in the diagonal.

hebrew_text: שֶׁלֹּא אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים אֶת הַדָּבָר לְהַחֲמִיר אֶלָּא לְהָקֵל. וְהָתַנְיָא: לֹא אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים אֶת הַדָּבָר לְהָקֵל אֶלָּא לְהַחֲמִיר?
human_translation: As the Sages did not state the matter, to be stringent, but to be lenient. Wasn’t taught The Sages did not state the matter, to be lenient but to be stringent?
llm_translation: The Sages did not say the matter to be stringent, but to be lenient. And it was taught: Did the Sages not say the matter to be lenient, but to be stringent?
