hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: לֹא לְהָקֵל עַל דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, אֶלָּא לְהַחְמִיר עַל דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, וּתְחוּמִין דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Ravina said not to be lenient Torah law, rather to be stringent Torah law. Shabbat limits are rabbinic law,
llm_translation: Ravina said: Not to be lenient with matters of Torah, but to be stringent with matters of Torah, and the boundaries of the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ עִיר שֶׁל יָחִיד, וְנַעֲשֵׂית שֶׁל רַבִּים — מְעָרְבִין אֶת כּוּלָּהּ.
human_translation: a private city, becomes public one may establish a joining of the courtyards for all of it,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Mishnah: A city belonging to an individual, and it becomes a city of many — they combine all of it.

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁל רַבִּים וְנַעֲשֵׂית שֶׁל יָחִיד — אֵין מְעָרְבִין אֶת כּוּלָּהּ אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן עָשָׂה חוּצָה לָהּ. כָּעִיר חֲדָשָׁה שֶׁבִּיהוּדָה, שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ חֲמִשִּׁים דָּיוֹרִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: שָׁלֹשׁ חֲצֵירוֹת שֶׁל שְׁנֵי בָתִּים.
human_translation: And a public becomes a private one may not establish an eiruv for all of it unless one maintains outside like the city of Ḥadasha in Judea, which has fifty residents. the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Shimon says: three courtyards two houses
llm_translation: And of the public, and it becomes the property of an individual - one may not combine it all unless he made an alleyway for it. Like a new city in Judah, which has fifty residents, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Shimon says: Three courtyards of two houses.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הֵיכִי דָּמֵי עִיר שֶׁל יָחִיד וְנַעֲשֵׂית שֶׁל רַבִּים? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: כְּגוֹן דִּאיסְקַרְתָּא דְּרֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא.
human_translation: What are the circumstances a private city becomes a public Rav Yehuda said: For example, the Exilarch’s village [ de’iskarta ]
llm_translation: Gemara: How is the case of the blood of an individual's city treated as if it were the blood of a community? Rav Yehudah said: For example, like the city of Reish Galuta.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן: מַאי טַעְמָא? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דִּשְׁכִיחִי גַּבֵּי הַרְמָנָא, מַדְכְּרִי אַהֲדָדֵי — כּוּלְּהוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל נָמֵי בְּצַפְרָא דְּשַׁבְּתָא שְׁכִיחִי גַּבֵּי הֲדָדֵי. אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: כְּגוֹן דִּיסְקַרְתָּא דְנַתְּזוּאִי.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to him: What is the reason If you say because are to be found at the governor [ harmana ] they remind each other the entire Jewish people are also found together on Shabbat morning Rather, Rav Naḥman said: For example, the village of Natzu’i
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Nachman: What is the reason? If you say because it is common for the pomegranate to be found, and the people of Israel are all meticulous in the observance of the Sabbath — they are all found in the town of Hadadei. Rather, Rav Nachman said: Like the courtyard of Natzua'i.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עִיר שֶׁל יָחִיד וְנַעֲשֵׂית שֶׁל רַבִּים וּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים עוֹבֶרֶת בְּתוֹכָהּ, כֵּיצַד מְעָרְבִין אוֹתָהּ? עוֹשֶׂה לֶחִי מִכָּאן וְלֶחִי מִכָּאן, אוֹ קוֹרָה מִכָּאן וְקוֹרָה מִכָּאן, וְנוֹשֵׂא וְנוֹתֵן בָּאֶמְצַע. וְאֵין מְעָרְבִין אוֹתָהּ לַחֲצָאִין, אֶלָּא אוֹ כּוּלָּהּ, אוֹ מָבוֹי מָבוֹי בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught a private city becomes public, and public domain passes through it, how does one establish an eiruv for it? He places a side post from here, and side post from there, or, beam from here, and beam from there, He may carry and place between And one may not establish an eiruv for half rather, either all of it or each alleyway separately
llm_translation: The sages taught: If a city belongs to an individual and it becomes a city of many, and the public domain passes through it, how is it combined? One makes a wall from here and a wall from here, or a beam from here and a beam from here, and carries and places it in the middle. And one does not combine it for separate entities, but either all of it, or an alleyway by itself.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה שֶׁל רַבִּים, וַהֲרֵי הִיא שֶׁל רַבִּים
human_translation: it was a public and it a public
llm_translation: It was of the many, and behold it is of the many.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין לָהּ אֶלָּא פֶּתַח אֶחָד — מְעָרְבִין אֶת כּוּלָּהּ.
human_translation: and it has only one entrance, one may establish an eiruv for all of it.
llm_translation: And it has only one entrance - we mix all of it.

hebrew_text: מַאן תַּנָּא דְּמִיעָרְבָא רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: יָתֵר עַל כֵּן אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ שְׁנֵי בָּתִּים בִּשְׁנֵי צִידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — עוֹשֶׂה לֶחִי מִכָּאן וְלֶחִי מִכָּאן, אוֹ קוֹרָה מִכָּאן וְקוֹרָה מִכָּאן, וְנוֹשֵׂא וְנוֹתֵן בָּאֶמְצַע. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵין מְעָרְבִין רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים בְּכָךְ.
human_translation: Who is the tanna that an eiruv may be established for a public domain Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: It is Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught Furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda said: One who has two houses on two sides of the public domain, he may place post from here, and post from there, Or, a beam from here, and a beam from there, carry and place in between said to him: One may not establish an eiruv in the public domain in that
llm_translation: Who is the Tanna that permits the public domain to be combined? Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: It is Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught: Therefore Rabbi Yehuda said: One who has two houses on two sides of the public domain - he makes a beam from here and a beam from there, or a crossbeam from here and a crossbeam from there, and carries back and forth in the middle. They said to him: One may not combine the public domain in this manner.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: וְאֵין מְעָרְבִין אוֹתָהּ לַחֲצָאִין. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא לְאׇרְכָּהּ, אֲבָל לְרׇחְבָּהּ — מְעָרְבִין.
human_translation: The Master said And one may not establish an eiruv for half Rav Pappa said: They said only according to its length. But according to its width, he may establish an eiruv
llm_translation: Master said: And we do not mix it for the half-measures. Rav Papa said: They only said this for its length, but for its width - we mix.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן — דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. דְּאִי כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, הָא אָמַר: רֶגֶל הַמּוּתֶּרֶת בִּמְקוֹמָהּ — אוֹסֶרֶת אֲפִילּוּ שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹמָהּ.
human_translation: In accordance with whose not in accordance with Rabbi Akiva. As, if in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, didn’t he say that a foot that is permitted in its place prohibits even in a place that is not its own?
llm_translation: As one who is not like Rabbi Akiva. For if he were like Rabbi Akiva, he would say: "The permitted foot in its place - prohibits even not in its place."

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הָתָם אֶלָּא בִּשְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת זוֹ לְפָנִים מִזּוֹ, דִּפְנִימִית לֵית לַהּ פִּיתְחָא אַחֲרִינָא. אֲבָל הָכָא, הָנֵי נָפְקִי בְּהַאי פִּיתְחָא, וְהָנֵי נָפְקִי בְּהַאי פִּיתְחָא.
human_translation: Even if you say Rabbi Akiva, Rabbi Akiva stated there only in two courtyards, one inside the other, as the inner has no other entrance. But here, these may go out through this entrance and these may go out through this entrance
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Even if you say it is Rabbi Akiva: until here not said Rabbi Akiva there but in two courtyards this in front of this, for the inner one does not have another entrance. But here, these go out through this entrance, and these go out through that entrance.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לָא תֵּימָא לְאׇרְכָּהּ הוּא דְּלָא מְעָרְבִין, אֲבָל לְרׇחְבָּהּ מְעָרְבִין, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ לְרׇחְבָּהּ נָמֵי לָא מְעָרְבִין.
human_translation: Some say Rav Pappa said: Do not say that it is according to its length that one may not establish an eiruv but according to its width, one may establish eiruv Rather, even according to its width, one may not establish an eiruv
llm_translation: There are some who say, Rav Papa said: Do not say it is because of its length that they do not mix, but rather it is because of its width that they do mix, but even for its width they do not mix.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן, כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא! אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן הָתָם אֶלָּא בִּשְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת זוֹ לִפְנִים מִזּוֹ, דִּפְנִימִית אָחֲדָא לְדַשָּׁא וּמִשְׁתַּמְּשָׁא. אֲבָל הָכָא, מִי מָצוּ מְסַלְּקִי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים מֵהָכָא?!
human_translation: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Akiva. Even if you say the Rabbis, the Rabbis stated there only in two courtyards, one inside the other, as the inner can close the door and use But here, are they able to move the public domain from here?
llm_translation: As whose opinion? As Rabbi Akiva! Even if you say the Rabbis, until here the Rabbis did not say there, except in two courtyards, this one in front of that one, for the inner one to thresh and make use. But here, who has permitted removing the public domain from here?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אוֹ כּוּלָּהּ, אוֹ מָבוֹי מָבוֹי בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ. מַאי שְׁנָא דְּלַחֲצָאִין דְּלָא — דְּאָסְרִי אַהֲדָדֵי, מָבוֹי מָבוֹי נָמֵי אָסְרִי אַהֲדָדֵי?!
human_translation: The Master said either for all of it or each alleyway separately. What is different for half which is not prohibit other each alleyway, prohibit other
llm_translation: Master said: Either entirely, or an alleyway is an alleyway by itself. What is the difference if they are not? - that they prohibit one another, an alleyway is an alleyway, they also prohibit one another?!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, כְּגוֹן דַּעֲבוּד דַּקָּה. וְכִי הָא דְּאָמַר רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אֶחָד מִבְּנֵי מָבוֹי שֶׁעָשָׂה דַּקָּה לְפִתְחוֹ — אֵינוֹ אוֹסֵר עַל בְּנֵי מָבוֹי.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? where erected a partition And like that Rav Idi bar Avin said Rav Ḥisda said: One of the residents of an alleyway, who made a partition for his entrance does not prohibit the residents of the alleyway
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? For example, like the service of a thin beam. And is this that Rav Idi bar Avin said in the name of Rav Ḥisda: One of the sons of a courtyard who made a beam for its entrance - he does not prohibit the sons of the courtyard.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה שֶׁל רַבִּים וַהֲרֵי הִיא כּוּ׳. רַבִּי זֵירָא עָרְבַהּ לְמָתָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא, וְלָא שְׁבַק לַהּ שִׁיּוּר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מַאי טַעְמָא עֲבַד מָר הָכִי?
human_translation: it was a public and it is a public Rabbi Zeira established an eiruv for Rabbi Ḥiyya’s city and did not leave any section out Abaye said to him: What is the reason that the Master acted in this
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It was of the public, yet it is like so. Rabbi Zeira sold it to the people of the house of Rabbi Chiya, and did not leave for it a remnant. Abaye said to him: What is the reason that the master did so? English translation:

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, סָבֵי דִּידַהּ אָמְרִי לִי: רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אַסִּי מְעָרֵב כּוּלַּהּ. וְאָמֵינָא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ עִיר שֶׁל יָחִיד וְנַעֲשֵׂית שֶׁל רַבִּים הִיא.
human_translation: said to The Elders told me Rav Ḥiyya bar Asi establish an eiruv entire and I said learn from this a private city and becomes a public one.
llm_translation: He said to him, the elders of his city said to me: Rav Chiya bar Assi would mix the entire mixture. And I said: Learn from it that a city belonging to an individual can become a city of many.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, לְדִידִי אֲמַרוּ לִי הָנְהוּ סָבֵי: הַהִיא אַשְׁפָּה הֲוָה לַהּ מֵחַד גִּיסָא. וְהַשְׁתָּא דְּאִיפַּנְיָא לַהּ אַשְׁפָּה, הָוֵה לַהּ כִּשְׁנֵי פְּתָחִים וַאֲסִיר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו אַדַּעְתַּאי.
human_translation: said to him: Those Elders told me There was a particular garbage on one side now that the garbage has been cleared away, it has two entrances, and is prohibited said to him: It was not on my mind,
llm_translation: He said to him, "According to my opinion, those elders told me: that woman had one husband. And now that she turned to another husband, she has two openings and is forbidden." He said to him: "I do not know."

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי מִינֵּיהּ רַב אַמֵּי בַּר אַדָּא הַרְפַּנָּאָה מֵרַבָּה: סוּלָּם מִכָּאן וּפֶתַח מִכָּאן, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר רַב: סוּלָּם תּוֹרַת פֶּתַח עָלָיו.
human_translation: Rav Ami bar Adda from Harpanya raised a dilemma before Rabba: a ladder on one side, and an entrance on the other side, what is said to him Rav said as follows: A ladder has the status of an entrance,
llm_translation: Inquired of him Rav Amei bar Adda the Harpana'ah from Rabba: "Ladder from here and opening from here, what is it?" He said to him, "Thus said Rav: 'Ladder, Torah of opening upon it.'"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב נַחְמָן: לָא תְּצִיתוּ לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר רַב אַדָּא אָמַר רַב: סוּלָּם תּוֹרַת פֶּתַח עָלָיו, וְתוֹרַת מְחִיצָה עָלָיו. תּוֹרַת מְחִיצָה עָלָיו, כְּדַאֲמַרַן. תּוֹרַת פֶּתַח עָלָיו, בְּסוּלָּם שֶׁבֵּין שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת, רָצוּ — אֶחָד מְעָרֵב, רָצוּ — שְׁנַיִם מְעָרְבִין.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to them: Do not listen to him. Rav Adda said Rav said as follows: A ladder has the status of an entrance and it has the status of a partition It has the status of a partition we mentioned, It has the status of an entrance in a ladder between two courtyards. wish, establish one eiruv ; they wish, two establish eiruv .
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Nachman: Do not extinguish it, thus said Rav Adda said Rav: A ladder of Torah is placed upon it, and a Torah of partition is placed upon it. A Torah of partition is placed upon it, as we said. A Torah of a doorway is placed upon it, in a ladder between two courtyards, if one wants to join, if two want to join, they may join.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אַנְשֵׁי חָצֵר וְאַנְשֵׁי מִרְפֶּסֶת שֶׁשָּׁכְחוּ
human_translation: Did Rav Naḥman say this? Didn’t Rav Naḥman say Shmuel said: residents of a courtyard and residents of a balcony, who forgot
llm_translation: And who said it, Rav Nachman like this? But didn't Rav Nachman say that Shmuel said: "The men of the courtyard and the men of the balcony forgot."

hebrew_text: וְלֹא עֵירְבוּ, אִם יֵשׁ לִפְנֵיהֶם דַּקָּה אַרְבָּעָה — אֵינָהּ אוֹסֶרֶת, וְאִם לָאו — אוֹסֶרֶת.
human_translation: and did not establish eiruv , if there is a partition four in front of does not prohibit And if not, prohibits
llm_translation: "And they did not mix, if there is before them a thin one of four - it does not prohibit, and if not - it prohibits."

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, בִּדְלֹא גְּבוֹהָ מִרְפֶּסֶת עֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? With the balcony is not ten high
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? With something that is not higher than ten handbreadths.

hebrew_text: וְאִי לֹא גְּבוֹהָ מִרְפֶּסֶת עֲשָׂרָה, כִּי קָא עָבֵיד דַּקָּה, מַאי הָוֵי? בִּמְגוּפֶּפֶת עַד עֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת, דְּכֵיוָן דְּעָבֵיד דַּקָּה — אִיסְתַּלּוֹקֵי אִיסְתַּלּוּק לֵיהּ מֵהָכָא.
human_translation: If the balcony is not ten high when one places a partition, what of it? with fenced off up to ten cubits since place a partition they remove themselves from
llm_translation: If it is not higher than ten handbreadths from the ground, for he is making a thin wall, what is the ruling? In a space of less than ten cubits, since he is making a thin wall - it is considered as if it is detached from here.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כּוֹתֶל שֶׁרְצָפָהּ בְּסוּלָּמוֹת, אֲפִילּוּ בְּיָתֵר מֵעֶשֶׂר — תּוֹרַת מְחִיצָה עָלָיו.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: a wall that one lined with ladders, even more than ten it the status of a partition.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: A wall that is plastered with ladders, even more than ten ladders - the law of partition applies to it.

hebrew_text: רָמֵי לֵיהּ רַב בְּרוֹנָא לְרַב יְהוּדָה בְּמַעְצַרְתָּא דְּבֵי רַב חֲנִינָא: מִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל תּוֹרַת מְחִיצָה עָלָיו? וְהָאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אַנְשֵׁי מִרְפֶּסֶת וְאַנְשֵׁי חָצֵר שֶׁשָּׁכְחוּ וְלֹא עֵירְבוּ, אִם יֵשׁ לְפָנֶיהָ דַּקָּה אַרְבָּעָה אֵינָהּ אוֹסֶרֶת, וְאִם לָאו — אוֹסֶרֶת.
human_translation: Rav Beruna raised a contradiction to Rav Yehuda in the winepress at Rav Ḥanina’s house: Did Shmuel say has the status of a partition? Didn’t Rav Naḥman say Shmuel said: the residents of a balcony and the residents of a courtyard who forgot and did not establish eiruv , if there is a partition in front does not prohibit and if not, it prohibits
llm_translation: Rav Barona threw a question at Rav Yehuda in Ma'atzarta of the house of Rav Chanina: Did Shmuel say that the law of a partition applies to it? But didn't Rav Nachman say that Shmuel said: The men of the balcony and the men of the courtyard who forgot and did not make an eruv, if there is a thin partition in front of it, four cubits do not prohibit it, but if not, it does prohibit it.

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, דְּלֹא גְּבוֹהָ מִרְפֶּסֶת עֲשָׂרָה. וְאִי לֹא גְּבוֹהָ מִרְפֶּסֶת עֲשָׂרָה, כִּי עָבֵיד דַּקָּה מַאי הָוֵי? בִּמְגוּפֶּפֶת עַד עֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת, דְּכֵיוָן דְּעָבֵיד דַּקָּה — אִיסְתַּלּוֹקֵי אִיסְתַּלַּק מֵהָכָא.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? with the balcony is not ten high, If the balcony is not ten high, when he places a partition, what of it? with fenced off up to ten cubits since place a partition they remove themselves from
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? That it is not higher than a balcony of ten. And if it is not higher than a balcony of ten, what is the law of a thin one? In a protrusion up to ten cubits, for since it is a thin one - it is detached from here.

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ בְּנֵי קָקוּנָאֵי דְּאָתֵי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: הַב לַן גַּבְרָא דְּלִיעָרֵב לַן מָאתִין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְאַבָּיֵי: זִיל עָרֵב לְהוּ, וַחֲזִי דְּלָא מְצַוְוחַתְּ עֲלַהּ בְּבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא. אֲזַל, חֲזָא לְהָנְהוּ בָּתֵּי דִּפְתִיחִי לְנַהֲרָא. אָמַר: הָנֵי לֶהֱוֵי שִׁיּוּר לְמָתָא.
human_translation: certain residents of Kakunya came before Rav Yosef said to him: Provide us with someone who will establish an eiruv for our city. said to Abaye: Go, establish an eiruv for them, and see that there is no outcry against it in the study hall, He went saw certain houses opened to the river He said: Let these the section excluded for the city.
llm_translation: Those are the students of Kakuna'i who came before Rav Yosef, they said to him: "Give us a man who can interpret for us." He said to Abbaye: "Go interpret for them, and see that they do not shout at him in the study hall." He went, and saw those houses of opening to the river. He said: "These should be a dwelling for people."

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אָמַר: ״אֵין מְעָרְבִין אֶת כּוּלָּהּ״ תְּנַן, [מִכְּלָל] דְּאִי בָּעֵי לְעָירוֹבֵי, מָצֵי מְעָרְבִי. אֶלָּא אֶיעְבֵּיד לְהוּ כַּוֵּוי, דְּאִי בָּעוּ לְעָירוֹבֵי דֶּרֶךְ חַלּוֹנוֹת מָצוּ מְעָרְבִי.
human_translation: retracted said: we learned One may not establish an eiruv for all of it; by inference, if they wanted to establish an eiruv they would have been able to establish an eiruv , Rather, I will create windows for them so that if they want to establish an eiruv by way of the windows, they can establish an eiruv ,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Hadr amar: "ein m'arvin et kullaha" tenan, miklal de'i ba'i l'arovei, matzei m'arvi. Ella eibed l'hu kavvei, de'i bau l'arovei derech challonot matzu m'arvi. English translation: Hadr said: "One does not combine the entire area." We learned, from this that if one wants to make an eruv, he can combine. Rather, I will establish it as a principle, that if they want to make an eruv through windows, they can combine.

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אָמַר: לָא בָּעֵי, דְּהָא רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ מְעָרֵב לַהּ לְכוּלַּהּ מָחוֹזָא עַרְסְיָיתָא עַרְסְיָיתָא מִשּׁוּם פֵּירָא דְּבֵי תוֹרֵי, דְּכׇל חַד וְחַד הָוֵי שִׁיּוּר לְחַבְרֵיהּ. וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּאִי בָּעוּ לְעָרוֹבֵי בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי, לָא מָצוּ מְעָרְבִי.
human_translation: He retracted said: is not necessary, as Rabba bar Avuh established an eiruv for the entire Meḥoza, neighborhood by neighborhood, due to the ditches the cattle as each one was an excluded section for the other. And although would not have been able to establish an eiruv if they wanted
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Hadr amar: la ba'ei, deha Rabbah bar Avuh me'arev la lekulla mahuza arseiyata arseiyata mishum peira debei toray, dekhol chad ve'chad havei shiyur lechavrei. Ve'af al gav de'i bau le'arovei bahadei hadadei, la matzu me'arvi.

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אָמַר: לָא דָּמֵי. הָתָם, אִי בָּעֵי — לְעָרוֹבֵי דֶּרֶךְ גַּגּוֹת, וְהָנֵי לָא מְעָרְבִי, הִילְכָּךְ נַעְבְּדַן כַּוֵּוי.
human_translation: He retracted said: are not comparable. There, if they wanted, established eiruv by way of the roofs; these cannot establish an eiruv therefore we must create windows
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Hadar said: Not similar. There, if he wants — for the purpose of combining rooftops, and these do not combine, therefore we act as prescribed."

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אָמַר: כַּוֵּוי נָמֵי לָא בָּעֵי, דְּהָהוּא בֵּי תִיבְנָא דַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמָר בַּר פּוֹפִידְתָּא מִפּוּמְבְּדִיתָא, וְשַׁוְּיַהּ שִׁיּוּר לְפוּמְבְּדִיתָא.
human_translation: He retracted said: Windows are also not necessary. As, that storehouse of straw which belonged to Mar bar Pofidata from Pumbedita was designated as the section excluded from Pumbedita,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates to: "Hadar said: It is not necessary to establish, for that house of learning that belonged to Mar bar Pofidta from Pumbedita, and he placed a gate for Pumbedita."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר, הַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר לִי מָר: ״חֲזִי דְּלָא מְצַוְוחַתְּ עֲלַהּ בְּבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא״.
human_translation: said This is what the Master said to me: See that there is no outcry against it in the study hall.
llm_translation: He said, this is what my teacher said to me: "See that you do not raise your voice in the study hall."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן עָשָׂה חוּצָה לָהּ כָּעִיר חֲדָשָׁה. תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: עִיר אַחַת הָיְתָה בִּיהוּדָה וַחֲדָשָׁה שְׁמָהּ, וְהָיוּ בָּהּ חֲמִשִּׁים דָּיוֹרִים אֲנָשִׁים וְנָשִׁים וָטַף, וּבָהּ הָיוּ מְשַׁעֲרִים חֲכָמִים, וְהִיא הָיְתָה שִׁיּוּר.
human_translation: unless he maintains outside like the city of Ḥadasha It was taught Rabbi Yehuda said: There was a certain city in Judea and its name was Ḥadasha, and it had fifty residents men, women, and children. And the Sages would use it to measure and it the excluded section
llm_translation: Rather, if so, she made a courtyard for herself like a new city. It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said: There was one city in Judea, and its name was Hadashah, and there were in it fifty dwellings of men, women, and children, and in it there were wise gatekeepers, and it was a remnant.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: חֲדָשָׁה מַהוּ? חֲדָשָׁה, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּאִיהִי הָוְיָא שִׁיּוּר לִגְדוֹלָה — גְּדוֹלָה נָמֵי הָוְיָא שִׁיּוּר לִקְטַנָּה.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before Ḥadasha, what is Ḥadasha, just as it was the excluded section of the larger the larger was also the excluded section of the smaller
llm_translation: He asked them: What is Chadashah? Chadashah, as it is that it should be a measure for greatness - for greatness indeed it should be a measure for smallness.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כְּעֵין חֲדָשָׁה, מַהוּ? רַב הוּנָא וְרַב יְהוּדָה, חַד אָמַר: בָּעֲיָא שִׁיּוּר, וְחַד אָמַר: לָא בָּעֲיָא שִׁיּוּר.
human_translation: Rather, like Ḥadasha What is Rav Huna and Rav Yehuda One said: It requires an excluded section; and one said: It does not require an excluded section.
llm_translation: Rather like a new vessel, what is it? Rav Huna and Rav Yehudah, one said: requires rinsing, and one said: does not require rinsing.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר שָׁלֹשׁ חֲצֵירוֹת וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב חָמָא בַּר גּוּרְיָא אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ בַּיִת אֶחָד וְחָצֵר אַחַת. חָצֵר אַחַת סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: בַּיִת אֶחָד בְּחָצֵר אַחַת.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: three courtyards Rav Ḥama bar Gurya said Rav said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Even one house and one courtyard Can it enter your mind one courtyard Rather, say One house in one courtyard.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "Three courtyards, etc." Rav Hama son of Gurya said in the name of Rav: The halakha is according to Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Yitzchak said: Even with one house and one courtyard. One courtyard alone, is that your opinion?! Rather say: One house in one courtyard.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: הָא דְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק, גְּמָרָא אוֹ סְבָרָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי נָפְקָא לַן מִינַּהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: גְּמָרָא גְּמוֹר, זְמוֹרְתָּא תְּהֵא?!
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: Is that of Rabbi Yitzḥak tradition or logic? said to him: What difference to us? said to him, study Talmud is it a song?;
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye to Rav Yosef: This of Rabbi Yitzchak, Gemara or Sevara? He said to him: What difference does it make to us? He said to him: It should be a complete Gemara, should it not be clear?!

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁהָיָה בַּמִּזְרָח וְאָמַר לִבְנוֹ: ״עָרֵב לִי בַּמַּעֲרָב״, בַּמַּעֲרָב וַאֲמַר לִבְנוֹ: ״עָרֵב לִי בַּמִּזְרָח״, אִם יֵשׁ הֵימֶנּוּ וּלְבֵיתוֹ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה, וּלְעֵירוּבוֹ יוֹתֵר מִכָּאן — מוּתָּר לְבֵיתוֹ, וְאָסוּר לְעֵירוּבוֹ.
human_translation: One who was to the east and he had said to his son Establish an eiruv for me to the west; to the west and he had said to his son: Establish an eiruv for me to the east, If there is two thousand cubits from his to his house, and to his eiruv is greater than this, he is permitted to his house, but it is prohibited to his eiruv .
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who was in the east and said to his son, "Prepare for me an Eruv in the west," and he was in the west and said to his son, "Prepare for me an Eruv in the east," if there are from him and to his house two thousand cubits, and for his Eruv more than this - it is permitted for his house, and it is forbidden for his Eruv.

hebrew_text: לְעֵירוּבוֹ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה, וּלְבֵיתוֹ יָתֵר מִכָּאן — אָסוּר לְבֵיתוֹ, וּמוּתָּר לְעֵירוּבוֹ.
human_translation: to his eiruv is two thousand cubits, to his house is greater than this, he is prohibited and he is permitted to his eiruv ,
llm_translation: For his city, two thousand cubits, and for his house more than this - it is forbidden for his house, and permitted for his city.

hebrew_text: הַנּוֹתֵן אֶת עֵירוּבוֹ בְּעִיבּוּרָהּ שֶׁל עִיר, לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְלוּם.
human_translation: One who places his eiruv in the outskirts of the city, he has not done anything.
llm_translation: The one who places his Eruv within the boundary of the city, he has not made it and it is not valid.

hebrew_text: נְתָנוֹ חוּץ לַתְּחוּם, אֲפִילּוּ אַמָּה אַחַת —
human_translation: he placed outside the boundary, even one cubit
llm_translation: They placed him outside the boundary, even one cubit —

hebrew_text: מַה שֶּׁנִּשְׂכַּר הוּא מַפְסִיד.
human_translation: what he gains he loses
llm_translation: What that he hired he loses.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ קָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ: ״לַמִּזְרָח״, לְמִזְרַח בֵּיתוֹ. ״לַמַּעֲרָב״, לְמַעֲרַב בֵּיתוֹ.
human_translation: It enter your mind to the east, to the east of his house to the west, to the west of his house
llm_translation: The text of the Talmud: "Gemara, your thought has gone out: 'to the east,' to the east of his house. 'To the west,' to the west of his house."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא ״הֵימֶנּוּ וּלְבֵיתוֹ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה וּלְעֵירוּבוֹ יָתֵר מִכָּאן״ — מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ, דְּמָטֵי לְבֵיתֵיהּ וְלָא מָטֵי לְעֵירוּבוֹ, אֶלָּא ״הֵימֶנּוּ וּלְעֵירוּבוֹ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה וּלְבֵיתוֹ יָתֵר מִכָּאן״ — הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?
human_translation: Granted, two thousand cubits from his to his house, and to his eiruv is greater than this, you can find, as that he can reach his house and he cannot reach his eiruv . But where do you find two thousand cubits between him and his eiruv , and to his house is greater than this?
llm_translation: In truth, "From him and to his house two thousand cubits, and to his city more than this" - she forgets, for it reached his house but did not reach his city, rather "From him and to his city two thousand cubits, and to his house more than this" - how does she forget?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מִי סָבְרַתְּ ״לַמִּזְרָח״ — לְמִזְרַח בֵּיתוֹ, ״לַמַּעֲרָב״ — לְמַעֲרַב בֵּיתוֹ?! לֹא, ״לַמִּזְרָח״ — לְמִזְרַח בְּנוֹ, ״לַמַּעֲרָב״ — לְמַעֲרַב בְּנוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Do you think to the east to the east of his house, and to the west to the west of his house? No, to the east to the east of his son, to the west means to the west of his son.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: Who thinks "to the east" — to the east of his house, "to the west" — to the west of his house?! No, "to the east" — to the east of his son, "to the west" — to the west of his son.

hebrew_text: רָבָא בַּר רַב שֵׁילָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא ״לַמִּזְרָח״ — לְמִזְרַח בֵּיתוֹ, וְ״לַמַּעֲרָב״ — לְמַעֲרַב בֵּיתוֹ, כְּגוֹן דְּקָאֵי בֵּיתֵיהּ בַּאֲלַכְסוֹנָא.
human_translation: Rava bar Rav Sheila said: Even you say to the east to the east of his house and to the west to the west of his house, a case where his house stood a diagonal
llm_translation: Rava bar Rav Sheilah said: Even if you say "to the east" - to the east of his house, and "to the west" - to the west of his house, for example, when his house is situated on a diagonal.

hebrew_text: הַנּוֹתֵן עֵירוּבוֹ בְּתוֹךְ עִיבּוּרָהּ וְכוּ׳. חוּץ לַתְּחוּם סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: חוּץ לְעִיבּוּרָהּ.
human_translation: One who places his eiruv within the outskirts Can it enter your mind outside the limit? Rather, say outside outskirts,
llm_translation: The one who places his Eruv within its mixture, etc. "Outside the boundary, is it not your intention?" Rather say: "Outside its mixture."

hebrew_text: מַה שֶּׁנִּשְׂכַּר הוּא מַפְסִיד. מָה שֶּׁנִּשְׂכַּר וְתוּ לָא?! וְהָתַנְיָא: הַנּוֹתֵן אֶת עֵירוּבוֹ בְּתוֹךְ עִיבּוּרָהּ שֶׁל עִיר, לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְלוּם. נְתָנוֹ חוּץ לְעִיבּוּרָהּ שֶׁל עִיר אֲפִילּוּ אַמָּה אַחַת, מִשְׂתַּכֵּר אוֹתָהּ אַמָּה וּמַפְסִיד אֶת כָּל הָעִיר כּוּלָּהּ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמִּדַּת הָעִיר עוֹלָה לוֹ בְּמִדַּת הַתְּחוּם!
human_translation: That which he gains he loses that which he gains and no more? Wasn’t it taught one who places his eiruv within the outskirts of the city, he has not done anything; he placed it outside the outskirts of the city, even one cubit he gains that cubit and loses the entire city because the measure of the city is included in the measure of his limit?
llm_translation: The one who receives his Eruv loses. What does it mean that he receives and still loses?! And it was taught: One who places his Eruv within the boundary of the city, he has not done anything wrong. If he placed it outside the boundary of the city even by just one cubit, he receives that cubit and causes the entire city to lose, because the city's measure is evaluated based on the measure of its boundary!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן שֶׁכָּלְתָה מִדָּתוֹ בַּחֲצִי הָעִיר, כָּאן שֶׁכָּלְתָה מִדָּתוֹ בְּסוֹף הָעִיר.
human_translation: not difficult. Here where his measure terminated in the middle of the city; there where his measure terminated at the end of the city.
llm_translation: Not difficult: here where his measure ended in the middle of the city, here where his measure ended at the end of the city.

hebrew_text: וְכִדְרַבִּי אִידִי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אִידִי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הָיָה מוֹדֵד וּבָא וְכָלְתָה מִדָּתוֹ בַּחֲצִי הָעִיר — אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא חֲצִי הָעִיר. כָּלְתָה מִדָּתוֹ בְּסוֹף הָעִיר — נַעֲשֵׂית לוֹ הָעִיר כּוּלָּהּ כְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, וּמַשְׁלִימִין לוֹ אֶת הַשְּׁאָר.
human_translation: And in accordance with Rabbi Idi, as Rabbi Idi said that Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: was measuring and his measure terminated in the middle of the city, he has only half the city, his measure terminated at the end of the city, the entire city is regarded as four cubits, and he completes the rest
llm_translation: As Rabbi Idi said, for Rabbi Idi said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: If one measures and comes and his measurement ends in the middle of the city - he only has half the city. If his measurement ends at the edge of the city - the entire city is made for him as four cubits, and they add the rest for him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אִידִי: אֵין אֵלּוּ אֶלָּא דִּבְרֵי נְבִיאוּת. מָה לִי כָּלְתָה בַּחֲצִי הָעִיר, מָה לִי כָּלְתָה בְּסוֹף הָעִיר?
human_translation: Rabbi Idi said: These are nothing more than words of prophecy, What to me terminated in the middle of the city, or terminated at the end of the city?
llm_translation: Rabbi Idi said: These are nothing but words of prophecy. What do I need a bride in the middle of the city for? What do I need a bride at the end of the city for?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, תַּרְוַיְיהוּ תְּנַנְהִי: אַנְשֵׁי עִיר גְּדוֹלָה מְהַלְּכִין אֶת כׇּל עִיר קְטַנָּה.
human_translation: Rava said: both were taught The residents of a large city may walk through an entire small city
llm_translation: Rava said, both of them taught: The people of a large city walk through every small city.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין אַנְשֵׁי עִיר קְטַנָּה מְהַלְּכִין אֶת כׇּל עִיר גְּדוֹלָה.
human_translation: And the residents of a small city may not walk through an entire large city.
llm_translation: And there are not men of a small city walking the entire great city.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא — לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּהָנֵי כָּלְתָה מִדָּתָן בַּחֲצִי הָעִיר, וְהָנֵי כָּלְתָה מִדָּתָן בְּסוֹף הָעִיר.
human_translation: What is the reason Is it not because these, their measure terminated in the middle of the city, and these, their measure terminated at the end of the city,
llm_translation: "What is the reason? — Not because these are the daughters of their mothers-in-law in the middle of the city, and those are the daughters of their mothers-in-law at the end of the city."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אִידִי, ״אַנְשֵׁי אַנְשֵׁי״ תָּנֵי, וּמוֹקֵים לָהּ בְּנוֹתֵן. אֲבָל מוֹדֵד לָא תְּנַן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Idi, teaches The residents of The residents of And he establishes to one who placed But we did not learn one who was measuring
llm_translation: Rabbi Idi taught: "Men of men" it was taught, and they establish it for her. But measuring, we did not learn.

hebrew_text: וְלָא?! וְהָתְנַן: וְלַמּוֹדֵד שֶׁאָמְרוּ נוֹתְנִין לוֹ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה, שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ סוֹף מִדָּתוֹ כָּלֶה בִּמְעָרָה!
human_translation: And not Didn’t we learn And as for one who is measuring with regard to whom said one gives him two thousand cubits, even if the end of his measurement terminates in a cave?
llm_translation: And not?! And we learned: For the surveyor, they said to give him two thousand cubits, for even if the end of his measurement is in a cave!

hebrew_text: סוֹף הָעִיר אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, דְּלָא תְּנַן.
human_translation: it was necessary for the end of the city, as we did not learn
llm_translation: End of the city, it requires for him, that not we teach.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מַאן דְּתָנֵי ״אַנְשֵׁי״ לָא מִשְׁתַּבַּשׁ, וּמַאן דְּתָנֵי ״אֵין אַנְשֵׁי״ לָא מִשְׁתַּבַּשׁ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: One who teaches The residents of does not err And one who teaches: The residents may not does not err.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: One who teaches "anshei" does not become confused, and one who teaches "ein anshei" does not become confused.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּתָנֵי ״אַנְשֵׁי״ לָא מִשְׁתַּבַּשׁ — דְּמוֹקֵים לַהּ בְּנוֹתֵן. וּמַאן דְּתָנֵי ״אֵין אַנְשֵׁי״ לָא מִשְׁתַּבַּשׁ — דְּמוֹקֵים לַהּ בְּמוֹדֵד.
human_translation: One who teaches: The residents of does not err, as he establishes to one who places And one who teaches: The residents of may not does not err, as he establishes to one who measures
llm_translation: One who teaches "men" - does not mix with her daughters. And one who teaches "not men" - mixes with her in measuring.

hebrew_text: וְחַסּוֹרֵי מְחַסְּרָא, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: אַנְשֵׁי עִיר גְּדוֹלָה מְהַלְּכִין אֶת כׇּל עִיר קְטַנָּה, וְאֵין אַנְשֵׁי עִיר קְטַנָּה מְהַלְּכִין אֶת כׇּל עִיר גְּדוֹלָה. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים, בְּמוֹדֵד. אֲבָל מִי שֶׁהָיָה בְּעִיר גְּדוֹלָה וְהִנִּיחַ אֶת עֵירוּבוֹ בְּעִיר קְטַנָּה, הָיָה בְּעִיר קְטַנָּה וְהִנִּיחַ אֶת עֵירוּבוֹ בְּעִיר גְּדוֹלָה — מְהַלֵּךְ אֶת כּוּלָּהּ וְחוּצָה לָהּ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה.
human_translation: And is incomplete and it teaches the following: The residents of a large city may walk an entire small city, but the residents of a small city may not walk an entire large city. In what is this statement said? with regard to one who was measuring But one who was in the large city and placed his eiruv in the small city, one who was in the small city and placed his eiruv in the large city, he may walk the entire and beyond it two thousand cubits.
llm_translation: The lacking ones are lacking, and thus it was taught: The people of a large city may traverse through an entire small city, but the people of a small city may not traverse through an entire large city. In what case are these matters said? In the case of measuring. However, one who was in a large city and placed his Eruv in a small city, or was in a small city and placed his Eruv in a large city — he may walk throughout it and two thousand cubits beyond it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: עִיר שֶׁיּוֹשֶׁבֶת עַל שְׂפַת הַנַּחַל, אִם יֵשׁ לְפָנֶיהָ דַּקָּה אַרְבָּעָה — מוֹדְדִים לָהּ מִשְּׂפַת הַנַּחַל. וְאִם לָאו — אֵין מוֹדְדִין לָהּ אֶלָּא מִפֶּתַח בֵּיתוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said that Rami bar Abba said that Rav Huna said: a city located on the edge of a ravine, if there is a barrier four in front of it, one measures its from the edge of the ravine, And if is not is measured from the entrance of house,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said, Ramei bar Abba said, Rav Huna said: A city that sits on the bank of a river, if it has a thin wall in front of it, four cubits - they measure for it from the bank of the river. And if not - they only measure for it from the entrance of its house.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: דַּקָּה אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת אֲמַרְתְּ לַן עֲלַהּ. מַאי שְׁנָא מִכׇּל דַּקֵּי דְעָלְמָא דְּאַרְבְּעָה?
human_translation: Abaye said to him: You told us with regard to barrier four cubits What is different than all other barriers, four
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Thin four cubits you said to us about it. What is different from all thin of the world of four?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם, לָא בְּעִיתָא תַּשְׁמִישְׁתָּא. הָכָא, בְּעִיתָא תַּשְׁמִישְׁתָּא.
human_translation: He said to him: There, use is not frightening; here, use is frightening.
llm_translation: He said to him: There, you did not desire marital relations. Here, you desire marital relations.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ? דְּתַנְיָא: הִתִּיר רַבִּי שֶׁיְּהוּ בְּנֵי גָדֵר יוֹרְדִין לְחַמָּתָן, וְאֵין בְּנֵי חַמָּתָן עוֹלִין לְגָדֵר. מַאי טַעְמָא, לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּהָנֵי עֲבוּד דַּקָּה, וְהָנֵי לָא עֲבוּד דַּקָּה?!
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: From where do I say this As it was taught Rabbi permitted the residents of Geder, to descend to Ḥamtan, the residents of Ḥamtan may not ascend to Geder. What is the reason? Is it not because these, constructed a barrier and these, did not construct a barrier
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: From where do I say this to her? For it was taught: Rabbi permitted that the people of Gader may descend to their vineyard, but the people of their vineyard may not ascend to Gader. What is the reason? Is it not because those vineyards are of fine quality, and these vineyards are not of fine quality?!

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר: טַטְרוֹגֵי מְטַטְרְגִי לְהוּ בְּנֵי גָדֵר לִבְנֵי חַמָּתָן, וּמַאי ״הִתִּיר״ — הִתְקִין.
human_translation: when Rav Dimi came he said: the residents of Geder would assault [ metatreg ] the residents of Ḥamtan. And what permitted He instituted
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: The Targumist would translate for the people of Geder to the people of Hamatan, and what is "he permitted" - he established.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא שַׁבָּת, דִּשְׁכִיחָא בָּהּ שִׁכְרוּת.
human_translation: What is different Shabbat Drunkenness is common on
llm_translation: And what is different about Shabbat, that it is mentioned in it drunkenness.

hebrew_text: כִּי אָזְלִי לְהָתָם, נָמֵי מְטַטְרְגִי לְהוּ? כַּלְבָּא בְּלָא מָתֵיהּ, שַׁב שְׁנִין לָא נָבַח.
human_translation: When go to they will assault A dog not in its place will not bark for seven years.
llm_translation: When they went there, did Metatron accompany them? A dog without its master, it did not bark for two years.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי מְטַטְרְגִי בְּנֵי חַמָּתָן לִבְנֵי גָדֵר! כּוּלֵּי הַאי לָא כָּיְיפִי לְהוּ.
human_translation: now too, the residents of Ḥamtan, will assault the residents of Geder. would not be submissive to such an extent.
llm_translation: At that time, Metatron spoke before the sons of Hamatan to the sons of Gader! All of them did not accept it.

hebrew_text: רַב סָפְרָא אָמַר: עִיר הָעֲשׂוּיָה כְּקֶשֶׁת הֲוַאי.
human_translation: Rav Safra said: was a city shaped like a bow,
llm_translation: Rav Safra said: A city that is made like a bow.

hebrew_text: רַב דִּימִי בַּר חִינָּנָא אָמַר: אַנְשֵׁי עִיר גְּדוֹלָה וְאַנְשֵׁי עִיר קְטַנָּה הֲוַאי.
human_translation: Rav Dimi bar Ḥinana said: residents of a large city, and residents of a small city.
llm_translation: Rav Dimi bar Hinana said: The people of a large city and the people of a small city are the same.

hebrew_text: רַב כָּהֲנָא מַתְנֵי הָכִי. רַב טַבְיוֹמֵי מַתְנֵי הָכִי: רַב סָפְרָא וְרַב דִּימִי בַּר חִינָּנָא, חַד אָמַר: עִיר הָעֲשׂוּיָה כְּקֶשֶׁת הֲוַאי, וְחַד אָמַר: אַנְשֵׁי עִיר קְטַנָּה וְאַנְשֵׁי עִיר גְּדוֹלָה הֲוַאי.
human_translation: Rav Kahana taught it that way, Rav Tavyomi taught it this way: Rav Safra and Rav Dimi bar Ḥinana One said: was a city shaped like a bow; and one said: were residents of a small city and were residents of a large city.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana teaches thus. Rav Tabiomi teaches thus: Rav Safra and Rav Dimi bar Hinana, one said: a city made like a bow, and one said: the people of a small city and the people of a large city.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אַנְשֵׁי עִיר גְּדוֹלָה מְהַלְּכִין אֶת כׇּל עִיר קְטַנָּה, וְאַנְשֵׁי עִיר קְטַנָּה מְהַלְּכִין אֶת כׇּל עִיר גְּדוֹלָה. כֵּיצַד? מִי שֶׁהָיָה בְּעִיר גְּדוֹלָה וְנָתַן אֶת עֵירוּבוֹ בְּעִיר קְטַנָּה, בְּעִיר קְטַנָּה וְנָתַן אֶת עֵירוּבוֹ בְּעִיר גְּדוֹלָה — מְהַלֵּךְ אֶת כּוּלָּהּ, וְחוּצָה לָהּ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה.
human_translation: The residents of a large city may walk through an entire small city, and the residents of a small city may walk through an entire large city, How so? One who was in a large city and placed his eiruv in a small city, in a small city and placed his eiruv in a large city, may walk the entire and two thousand cubits beyond it,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The residents of a large city may traverse the entire area of a small city, and the residents of a small city may traverse the entire area of a large city. How so? If one was in a large city and placed his Eruv in a small city, or in a small city and placed his Eruv in a large city, he may traverse the entire area of the city where his Eruv is placed, as well as two thousand cubits beyond it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא מִמְּקוֹם עֵירוּבוֹ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה. אָמַר לָהֶן רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: אִי אַתֶּם מוֹדִים לִי בְּנוֹתֵן עֵירוּבוֹ בִּמְעָרָה, שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא מִמְּקוֹם עֵירוּבוֹ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה?
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: He has only two thousand cubits from the place of his eiruv , Rabbi Akiva said to you not concede to me one who places his eiruv in a cave has only two thousand cubits from the place of his eiruv ,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: He has only from his place of his Eruv two thousand cubits. Rabbi Akiva said to them: If you agree with me that one may place his Eruv in a cave, for he has only from his place of his Eruv two thousand cubits?

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵימָתַי — בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ דָּיוֹרִין, אֲבָל יֵשׁ בָּהּ דָּיוֹרִין — מְהַלֵּךְ אֶת כּוּלָּהּ וְחוּצָה לָהּ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה. נִמְצָא, קַל תּוֹכָהּ מֵעַל גַּבָּהּ.
human_translation: said to him: When When has no residents. But it has residents, one may walk all of it and two thousand cubits beyond it. Consequently, inside is more lenient than above
llm_translation: They said to him: When? - When it does not have da'yorin, but if it has da'yorin - he walks its entire length and outside of it two thousand cubits. It turns out, its interior is lighter than its exterior.

hebrew_text: וְלַמּוֹדֵד שֶׁאָמְרוּ נוֹתְנִין אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה — שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ סוֹף מִדָּתוֹ כָּלֶה בִּמְעָרָה.
human_translation: And as for one who is measuring said one gives him two thousand cubits, even if the end of his measurement terminates in a cave.
llm_translation: And for the measurer that they said, "One should place two thousand cubits" - that even if the end of his measure ends in a cave.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שָׁבַת בְּעִיר חֲרֵיבָה, לְרַבָּנַן מְהַלֵּךְ אֶת כּוּלָּהּ וְחוּצָה לָהּ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה. הִנִּיחַ אֶת עֵירוּבוֹ בְּעִיר חֲרֵיבָה — אֵין לוֹ מִמְּקוֹם עֵירוּבוֹ אֶלָּא אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד שָׁבַת וְאֶחָד הִנִּיחַ — מְהַלֵּךְ אֶת כּוּלָּהּ וְחוּצָה לָהּ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said that Shmuel said: one established his Shabbat residence in a desolate city according to the Rabbis he may walk through all of it and two thousand cubits beyond it. he placed his eiruv in a desolate city, he has only two thousand cubits from the place of his eiruv . Rabbi Elazar says: Whether he established his Shabbat residence or he placed his eiruv he may walk through all of it and two thousand cubits beyond it.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: If one spent Shabbat in a destroyed city, the Sages permit him to walk the entire city and two thousand cubits outside of it. If he placed his Eruv in the destroyed city, he only has two thousand cubits from the place of his Eruv. Rabbi Elazar says: Whether he spent Shabbat there or placed his Eruv there, he may walk the entire city and two thousand cubits outside of it.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, אָמַר לָהֶן רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: אִי אַתֶּם מוֹדִים לִי בְּנוֹתֵן אֶת עֵירוּבוֹ בִּמְעָרָה, שֶׁאֵין לוֹ מִמְּקוֹם עֵירוּבוֹ אֶלָּא אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵימָתַי, בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ דָּיוֹרִין. הָא בְּאֵין בָּהּ דָּיוֹרִין מוֹדוּ לֵיהּ?!
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi Akiva said to you not concede to me one who places his eiruv in a cave has only two thousand cubits from the place of his eiruv ? They said to him: When When has no residents. when it has no residents concede to
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: A question was raised: Rabbi Akiva said to them, "If you agree with me that one may place his Eruv in a cave, where his Eruv has only a space of two thousand cubits, they said to him: When is this so? When there are no residents in it. But when there are residents in it, do they agree with him?

hebrew_text: מַאי ״אֵין בָּהּ דָּיוֹרִין״ — אֵינָהּ רְאוּיָה לְדִירָה.
human_translation: What is has no residents? is not fit for residence.
llm_translation: What is "it does not have enough residents"? - It is not suitable for dwelling.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שָׁבַת בְּעִיר, אֲפִילּוּ הִיא גְּדוֹלָה כְּאַנְטִיּוֹכְיָא, בִּמְעָרָה, אֲפִילּוּ הִיא כִּמְעָרַת צִדְקִיָּהוּ מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה — מְהַלֵּךְ אֶת כּוּלָּהּ וְחוּצָה לָהּ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה. קָתָנֵי עִיר דּוּמְיָא דִמְעָרָה, מָה מְעָרָה חֲרֵיבָה, אַף עִיר חֲרֵיבָה. וְשָׁבַת אִין, אֲבָל הִנִּיחַ לָא.
human_translation: Come hear one established his Shabbat residence in a city, even it is as large as Antioch, in a cave, even it is like the Cave of Zedekiah, king of Judah, he may walk through all of it and two thousand cubits beyond it. teaches a city similar to a cave: Just as a cave is desolate, so too the city is desolate. And he established his Shabbat residence yes, but placed no,
llm_translation: Come and hear: If Shabbat arrives in a city, even if it is as great as Antioch, in a cave, even if it is like the cave of Zedekiah the king of Judah - one may walk its entire length and breadth, two thousand cubits outside of it. The Mishna teaches: A city that resembles a cave, just as a cave is destroyed, so too a city that is destroyed. And Shabbat is not observed, but one may leave it.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי, אִילֵימָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, מַאי אִירְיָא חֲרֵיבָה? אֲפִילּוּ יְשִׁיבָה נָמֵי! אֶלָּא לָאו רַבָּנַן, וְטַעְמָא דְּשָׁבַת אִין, אֲבָל הִנִּיחַ — לָא!
human_translation: whose If you say Rabbi Akiva, why specifically desolate Even inhabited, also Rather, is it not the Rabbis? And the reason is that one established his Shabbat residence yes, But placed not
llm_translation: Mani, if we say Rabbi Akiva, what is the meaning of "charivah"? Even if it is a sitting place! Rather, it is not the Rabbis, and the reason is because of Shabbat, but if he left it - no!

hebrew_text: לָא תֵּימָא עִיר דּוּמְיָא דִמְעָרָה, אֶלָּא אֵימָא מְעָרָה דּוּמְיָא דְעִיר. מָה עִיר יְשִׁיבָה, אַף מְעָרָה יְשִׁיבָה. וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אֵין לוֹ מִמְּקוֹם עֵירוּבוֹ אֶלָּא אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה, וּבְשָׁבַת מוֹדֵי.
human_translation: Do not say a city similar to a cave. Rather, say a cave similar to a city: Just as the city is inhabited, so too the cave inhabited. Rabbi Akiva, who said he has only two thousand cubits from the place of his eiruv . one established his Shabbat residence concedes
llm_translation: Do not say a city that is similar to a cave, rather say a cave that is similar to a city. Just as a city establishes residency, so too a cave establishes residency. And it is Rabbi Akiva who said: He does not have a place for his Eruv except two thousand cubits, and on Shabbat he concedes.

hebrew_text: וְהָא כִּמְעָרַת צִדְקִיָּהוּ קָתָנֵי! כִּמְעָרַת צִדְקִיָּהוּ, וְלֹא כִּמְעָרַת צִדְקִיָּהוּ. כִּמְעָרַת צִדְקִיָּהוּ — גְּדוֹלָה. וְלֹא כִּמְעָרַת צִדְקִיָּהוּ — דְּאִילּוּ הָתָם חֲרֵיבָה, וְהָכָא יְשִׁיבָה.
human_translation: Doesn’t the teach like the Cave of Zedekiah, like the Cave of Zedekiah and not like the Cave of Zedekiah like the Cave of Zedekiah large And not like the Cave of Zedekiah, as there, desolate, and here inhabited.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: Is it like the cave of Zedekiah the king? Like the cave of Zedekiah the king, and not like the cave of Zedekiah the king. Like the cave of Zedekiah the king - it is large. And not like the cave of Zedekiah the king - for if there it was destroyed, here it is inhabited.

hebrew_text: מָר יְהוּדָה אַשְׁכְּחִינְהוּ לִבְנֵי מְבָרַכְתָּא דְּקָא מוֹתְבִי עֵירוּבַיְיהוּ בְּבֵי כְּנִישְׁתָּא דְּבֵי אַגּוֹבָר, אֲמַר לְהוּ: גַּוּוֹ בֵּיהּ טְפֵי, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלִישְׁתְּרֵי לְכוּ טְפֵי.
human_translation: Mar Yehuda found the residents of Mavrakhta placing their eiruvin in the synagogue of Beit Agovar. He said to them: Place farther so that more will be permitted to you,
llm_translation: Master Yehudah found the sons of Mevarkata who were sitting and making their eruv in the synagogue of the house of Aggobar. He said to them: "Strengthen it with branches, so that the branches may remain for you."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: פָּלְגָאָה, בְּעֵירוּבִין לֵית דְּחַשׁ לְהָא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: Rava said to him: Argumentative one! With regard to eiruv , nobody is concerned about this Rabbi Akiva,
llm_translation: Rava said to him: "Palga'ah, in matters of Eruvin, there is no concern for what Rabbi Akiva said."

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ כֵּיצַד מְעַבְּרִין
llm_translation: We shall return to you. How do we perform the crossing?

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַדָּר עִם הַנׇּכְרִי בֶּחָצֵר, אוֹ עִם מִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ מוֹדֶה בָּעֵירוּב — הֲרֵי זֶה אוֹסֵר עָלָיו.
human_translation: One who resides with a gentile in courtyard, or with one who does not accept eiruv , this renders it prohibited for him
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who resides with a non-Jew in the courtyard, or with one who does not participate in the communal food joining — this one prohibits upon him.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם אֵינוֹ אוֹסֵר עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ שְׁנֵי יִשְׂרְאֵלִים אוֹסְרִין זֶה עַל זֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: Actually, does not render it prohibited unless there are two Jews prohibit one another
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: Always not he forbids until they are two Israelites forbidding one upon the other.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּצַדּוּקִי אֶחָד שֶׁהָיָה דָּר עִמָּנוּ בְּמָבוֹי בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, וְאָמַר לָנוּ אַבָּא: מַהֲרוּ וְהוֹצִיאוּ אֶת הַכֵּלִים לַמָּבוֹי, עַד שֶׁלֹּא יוֹצִיא וְיֶאֱסֹר עֲלֵיכֶם.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel said: an incident involving a certain Sadducee who lived with us in alleyway in Jerusalem, And Father said to us: Hurry and take out utensils to the alleyway before he takes out he would render it prohibited for you to
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel said: There was an incident with a certain Sadducee who lived among us in a courtyard in Jerusalem, and he said to us, "Hurry and bring out the vessels to the courtyard, before he goes out and prohibits you."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּלָשׁוֹן אַחֵר — מַהֲרוּ וַעֲשׂוּ צׇרְכֵיכֶם בַּמָּבוֹי, עַד שֶׁלֹּא יוֹצִיא וְיֶאֱסֹר עֲלֵיכֶם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: with a different formulation, Hurry and do you must do in the alleyway before he takes out and renders it prohibited for you to
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: In another language - Hurry and do your needs in the alleyway, before he goes out and forbids you.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ יָתֵיב אַבָּיֵי בַּר אָבִין וְרַב חִינָּנָא בַּר אָבִין, וְיָתֵיב אַבָּיֵי גַּבַּיְיהוּ, וְיָתְבִי וְקָאָמְרִי: בִּשְׁלָמָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר קָסָבַר דִּירַת גּוֹי שְׁמָהּ דִּירָה, וְלָא שְׁנָא חַד וְלָא שְׁנָא תְּרֵי.
human_translation: Abaye bar Avin and Rav Ḥinana bar Avin were sitting, and Abaye was sitting beside them, and they sat and said: Granted, Rabbi Meir, he holds the residence of a gentile is considered a residence. one no different two
llm_translation: Gemara: Abaye son of Avin and Rav Chinana son of Avin were sitting. Abaye sat between them, and they were sitting and saying: "It is understandable that Rabbi Meir holds that the residence of a gentile is considered a residence, and it makes no difference whether it is one gentile or two."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב מַאי קָסָבַר? אִי קָסָבַר דִּירַת גּוֹי שְׁמָהּ דִּירָה — אֲפִילּוּ חַד נָמֵי נִיתְּסַר! וְאִי לָא שְׁמָהּ דִּירָה — אֲפִילּוּ תְּרֵי נָמֵי לָא נִיתְּסַר!
human_translation: But Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, what does he hold? If he holds the residence of a gentile is considered a residence, he should prohibit even one And if it is not considered a residence, he should not prohibit even two
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, what does he hold? If he holds that the residence of a gentile is considered a residence - even if one hairbreadth is removed! But if he does not hold that it is considered a residence - even if two hairsbreadths are not removed!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ אַבָּיֵי: וְסָבַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר דִּירַת גּוֹי שְׁמָהּ דִּירָה? וְהָתַנְיָא: חֲצֵירוֹ שֶׁל נׇכְרִי — הֲרֵי הוּא כְּדִיר שֶׁל בְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: Abaye said to them: Does Rabbi Meir hold the residence of a gentile is considered a residence? Wasn’t it taught The courtyard of a gentile is like the pen of an animal,
llm_translation: He said to them, Abaye: And does Rabbi Meir hold that the dwelling of a gentile is considered a dwelling? But it was taught: The courtyard of a gentile - it is like the dwelling of an animal.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא דִּירַת גּוֹי לֹא שְׁמָהּ דִּירָה, וְהָכָא בִּגְזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יִלְמַד מִמַּעֲשָׂיו קָא מִיפַּלְגִי.
human_translation: Rather, Everyone agrees the residence of gentile is not considered a residence, and here they disagree about a decree lest learn from ways.
llm_translation: Rather: the entire world, the dwelling of a gentile is not considered a dwelling, and here, in the decree lest one learn from his actions, he is arguing.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דְּגוֹי חָשׁוּד אַשְּׁפִיכוּת דָּמִים, תְּרֵי דִּשְׁכִיחִי דְּדָיְירִי — גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ, חַד לָא שְׁכִיחַ — לָא גְּזַרוּ בֵּיהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov holds since a gentile is suspected of bloodshed, two who commonly live issued a decree one it is not common the Sages did not issue a decree
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov holds: Since the non-Jews are suspected of shedding blood, two common witnesses - they decreed concerning them, one common witness - the Rabbis did not decree concerning him.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: זִמְנִין דְּמִקְּרֵי וְדָיֵיר. וַאֲמַרוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין עֵירוּב מוֹעִיל בִּמְקוֹם גּוֹי, וְאֵין בִּיטּוּל רְשׁוּת מוֹעִיל בִּמְקוֹם גּוֹי, עַד שֶׁיַּשְׂכִּיר. וְגוֹי לָא מוֹגַר.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir holds sometimes it happens that lives Therefore, the Sages said: An eiruv is not effective in a place a gentile nor is the renunciation of rights effective in a place a gentile unless rents And a gentile not to rent
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir holds: sometimes they are considered residents and sometimes they are considered non-residents. And the Rabbis said: An eruv does not help in a non-Jewish area, and relinquishing ownership does not help in a non-Jewish area until one rents the property. And a non-Jew is not considered a resident.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דְּסָבַר: דִּלְמָא אָתֵי לְאַחְזוֹקֵי בִּרְשׁוּתוֹ, הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: שְׂכִירוּת בְּרִיאָה בָּעִינַן.
human_translation: What is the reason If you say because thinks perhaps they will come to take possession of his property this works out well according to the one who said we require a full-fledged rental,
llm_translation: What is the reason? Perhaps because he holds the opinion that maybe he will come to grasp the object in his domain, so he leaves it for the one who says: We require a valid rental.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: שְׂכִירוּת רְעוּעָה בָּעִינַן, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? דְּאִתְּמַר, רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: שְׂכִירוּת בְּרִיאָה. וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: שְׂכִירוּת רְעוּעָה.
human_translation: However, according to the one who said we require a flawed, rental, what is there to say? As it was stated Rav Ḥisda said full-fledged rental, and Rav Sheshet said: A flawed, rental
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says: we require valid rental, what can be said? As it was stated, Rav Ḥisda said: valid rental of a healthy animal. And Rav Sheshet said: valid rental of a blemished animal.

hebrew_text: מַאי רְעוּעָה, מַאי בְּרִיאָה? אִילֵּימָא: בְּרִיאָה — בִּפְרוּטָה, רְעוּעָה — פָּחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה. מִי אִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִגּוֹי בְּפָחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה לָא? וְהָא שָׁלַח רַבִּי יִצְחָק בְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר גִּיּוֹרֵי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲווֹ יוֹדְעִין שֶׁשּׂוֹכְרִין מִן הַגּוֹי אֲפִילּוּ בְּפָחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה.
human_translation: What is flawed what is full-fledged If you say full-fledged a peruta flawed less than the value of a peruta , Is there anyone who said from a gentile for less than the value of a peruta not Didn’t Rabbi Yitzḥak, son of Rabbi Ya’akov bar Giyorei, send in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: You should know that one rent from a gentile even for less than the value of a peruta ?
llm_translation: What is "re'ua," what is "bri'ah"? If you say "bri'ah" - specifically, "re'ua" - less than the value of "bri'ah." Is there anyone who says that from a non-Jew, even for less than the value of "bri'ah," it is not permissible? But Rabbi Yitzchak, son of Rabbi Yaakov bar Giyorei sent in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Be aware that it is permitted to rent from a non-Jew even for less than the value of "bri'ah."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בֶּן נֹחַ נֶהֱרָג עַל פָּחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה, וְלֹא נִיתָּן לְהִשָּׁבוֹן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: A Noahide, is executed less than the value of a peruta . And is not returnable,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A Noachide is put to death for theft of an amount less than a perutah, and he is not subject to restitution.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: בְּרִיאָה — בְּמוּהְרְקֵי וָאבוּרְגָנֵי, רְעוּעָה — בְּלָא מוּהְרְקֵי וָאבוּרְגָנֵי. הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: שְׂכִירוּת בְּרִיאָה בָּעִינַן.
human_translation: Rather, A full-fledged to by legal documents [ moharkei ] officials [ aburganei ]; a flawed not by legal documents and officials, This works out well according to the one who said we require a full-fledged rental,
llm_translation: Rather: in creation - in haste and with deliberation, in evil inclination - without haste and with deliberation. It is preferable according to the one who says: we require a hired laborer in creation.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: שְׂכִירוּת רְעוּעָה בָּעִינַן, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי חָשֵׁישׁ גּוֹי לִכְשָׁפִים, וְלָא מוֹגַר.
human_translation: But according to the one who said we require a flawed rental, what is there to say Even so, the gentile is concerned witchcraft, and does not rent out
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says: we require valid rental, what can be said? Even so, a non-Jew is suspected of sorcery, and is not trusted.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: חֲצֵירוֹ שֶׁל גּוֹי הֲרֵי הוּא כְּדִיר שֶׁל בְּהֵמָה, וּמוּתָּר לְהַכְנִיס וּלְהוֹצִיא מִן חָצֵר לַבָּתִּים וּמִן בָּתִּים לֶחָצֵר.
human_translation: the matter itself: The courtyard of a gentile is like the pen of an animal, and it is permitted to carry in and carry out from the courtyard to the houses and from the houses to the courtyard,
llm_translation: Body: The grass of a gentile is like the manger of an animal, and it is permitted to bring in and take out from the courtyard to the houses and from the houses to the courtyard.

hebrew_text: וְאִם יֵשׁ שָׁם יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶחָד — אוֹסֵר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: But if there is one Jew there renders it prohibited the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: And if there is there an Israelite one — he prohibits, the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם אֵינוֹ אוֹסֵר עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ שְׁנֵי יִשְׂרְאֵלִים אוֹסְרִים זֶה עַל זֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: Actually, does not render it prohibited unless there are two Jews prohibit one another
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: Always not he forbids until they are two Israelites forbidding this upon this.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: חֲצֵירוֹ שֶׁל גּוֹי הֲרֵי הוּא כְּדִיר שֶׁל בְּהֵמָה. וְהָא אֲנַן תְּנַן: הַדָּר עִם הַנׇּכְרִי בֶּחָצֵר הֲרֵי זֶה אוֹסֵר עָלָיו!
human_translation: The Master said The courtyard of a gentile is like the pen of an animal, But didn’t we learn One who resides with a gentile in courtyard this prohibits him
llm_translation: Master said: The grass of a gentile is like the stall of an animal. But didn't we learn: One who dwells with a gentile in a courtyard, this one prohibits upon him!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — דְּאִיתֵיהּ. הָא — דְּלֵיתֵיהּ.
human_translation: That not difficult. This where is present, that where he is not present,
llm_translation: Not difficult: this - that it exists. This - that it does not exist.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי קָסָבַר? אִי קָסָבַר דִּירָה בְּלֹא בְּעָלִים שְׁמָהּ דִּירָה — אֲפִילּוּ גּוֹי נָמֵי נִיתְּסַר. וְאִי קָסָבַר דִּירָה בְּלֹא בְּעָלִים לֹא שְׁמָהּ דִּירָה — אֲפִילּוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל נָמֵי לָא נִיתְּסַר!
human_translation: What does hold? If he holds a residence without owners is considered a residence, even a gentile should likewise render it prohibited And if he holds a residence without owners is not considered a residence, even a Jew should also not render it prohibited
llm_translation: And what does he hold? If he holds that a dwelling without owners, its name is a dwelling - even a non-Jew also acquires it. And if he holds that a dwelling without owners, its name is not a dwelling - even an Israelite also does not acquire it!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם קָסָבַר דִּירָה בְּלֹא בְּעָלִים — לֹא שְׁמָהּ דִּירָה. וְיִשְׂרָאֵל, דְּכִי אִיתֵיהּ אָסַר, כִּי לֵיתֵיהּ — גְּזַרוּ בֵּיהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Actually, he holds a residence without owners is not considered a residence, but a Jew, who renders it prohibited when present the Sages decreed with regard to him when he is not present,
llm_translation: Always he holds that a house without owners - not its name is a house. And Israel, when it is there, he forbids; when it is not there - the Rabbis decreed upon it.

hebrew_text: גּוֹי, דְּכִי אִיתֵיהּ — גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יִלְמַד מִמַּעֲשָׂיו. כִּי אִיתֵיהּ — אָסַר, כִּי לֵיתֵיהּ — לָא אָסַר.
human_translation: a gentile, when he is present a rabbinic decree lest learn from ways, when he is present, renders it prohibited to when he is not present, he does not render it prohibited to
llm_translation: Goy, deki itei - gezirah shema yilmad mimasaiv. Ki itei - asar, ki leitei - lo asar.

hebrew_text: וְכִי לֵיתֵיהּ, לָא אָסַר? וְהָתְנַן: הַמַּנִּיחַ אֶת בֵּיתוֹ וְהָלַךְ לוֹ לִשְׁבּוֹת בְּעִיר אַחֶרֶת, אֶחָד נׇכְרִי וְאֶחָד יִשְׂרָאֵל אוֹסֵר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: And when is not present, does he not render it prohibited Didn’t we learn one who left his house and went to spend Shabbat in a different town, whether a gentile or a Jew, he renders it prohibited the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And if he did not come, did he not prohibit? And we learned in a Mishnah: One who leaves his house and goes to dwell in another city, whether a Gentile or an Israelite, he prohibits, the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: הָתָם דְּאָתֵי בְּיוֹמֵיהּ.
human_translation: There, where return on that day,
llm_translation: There, that he came in his days.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב. וְרַב הוּנָא אָמַר: מִנְהָג כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: נָהֲגוּ הָעָם כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov. And Rav Huna said: the custom is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The people are accustomed in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov.
llm_translation: Said Rav Yehudah said Shmuel: The halakha is like Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov. And Rav Huna said: The custom is like Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov. And Rabbi Yochanan said: The people have practiced according to Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: קַיְימָא לַן מִשְׁנַת רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב קַב וְנָקִי, וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב.
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef, We maintain the teaching of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov a kav, but is clean, Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov,
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye to Rav Yosef: We hold according to the teaching of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, pure and clean, and Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is according to Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov.

hebrew_text: מַהוּ לְאוֹרוֹיֵי בִּמְקוֹם רַבּוֹ?
human_translation: what is may issue a ruling in his teacher’s place
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "le'oroyei bimkom rabbo"?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲפִילּוּ בֵּיעֲתָא בְּכוּתָּחָא בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב חִסְדָּא כׇּל שְׁנֵי דְּרַב הוּנָא, וְלָא אוֹרִי.
human_translation: said to Even Rav Ḥisda was asked an egg in kutaḥ , throughout the years of Rav Huna’s he refused to issue a ruling.
llm_translation: He said to him: Even in the middle of the market, if Rav Hisda's donkey dies, all the teeth of Rav Huna's donkey will not shine.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אַבָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: כְּגוֹן מְגִלַּת תַּעֲנִית דִּכְתִיבָא וּמַנְּחָא. מַהוּ לְאוֹרוֹיֵי בְּאַתְרֵיהּ דְּרַבֵּיהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אֲפִילּוּ בֵּיעֲתָא בְּכוּתָּחָא בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב חִסְדָּא כׇּל שְׁנֵי דְּרַב הוּנָא, וְלָא אוֹרִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov bar Abba said to Abaye: such as Megillat Ta’anit , which written and laid what is may rule in his teacher’s place said to him: Rav Yosef said as follows: Even Rav Ḥisda was asked about an egg in kutaḥ throughout the years of Rav Huna’s he refused to issue a ruling.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yaakov bar Abba to Abbaye: For example, the Scroll of Fasting, as it is written, "and offerings." What about showing it to his teachers? He said to him, so said Rav Yosef: Even in the middle of the marketplace, if Rav Chisda's two sons come, do not show it.

hebrew_text: רַב חִסְדָּא אוֹרִי בְּכַפְרִי בִּשְׁנֵי דְּרַב הוּנָא.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda issued rulings in Kafri during the years of Rav Huna’s
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda lights up in the village of Shinai by the two of Rav Huna.

hebrew_text: רַב הַמְנוּנָא אוֹרִי בְּחַרְתָּא דְאַרְגֵּז בִּשְׁנֵי דְּרַב חִסְדָּא.
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna issued rulings in Ḥarta De’argez during the years of Rav Ḥisda’s
llm_translation: Rav Hamnuna said in the courtyard of Argaz, in the name of Rav Ḥisda.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא סָר סַכִּינָא בְּבָבֶל. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: מַאי טַעְמָא עֲבַד מָר הָכִי?
human_translation: Ravina examined knife in Babylonia Rav Ashi said to him: What is the reason Master acted in this manner?
llm_translation: Ravina served as a judge in Babylonia. Rav Ashe said to him: "What is the reason that Master did so?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְהָא רַב הַמְנוּנָא אוֹרִי בְּחַרְתָּא דְאַרְגֵּז בִּשְׁנֵי דְּרַב חִסְדָּא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״לָאו אוֹרִי״ אִתְּמַר.
human_translation: said to him: Didn’t Rav Hamnuna issue rulings in Ḥarta De’argez during the years of Rav Ḥisda’s said to It was stated did not issue rulings
llm_translation: He said to him: But didn't Rav Hamnuna light up in the village of Argaz in the presence of Rav Ḥisda? He said to him: "It was not lit."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִתְּמַר ״אוֹרִי״, וְאִתְּמַר ״לָא אוֹרִי״, בִּשְׁנֵי דְּרַב הוּנָא רַבֵּיהּ הוּא דְּלָא אוֹרִי, וְאוֹרִי בִּשְׁנֵי דְּרַב חִסְדָּא, דְּתַלְמִיד חָבֵר דִּילֵיהּ הֲוָה. וַאֲנָא נָמֵי תַּלְמִיד חָבֵר דְּמָר אֲנָא.
human_translation: said to it was stated issued rulings, and it was did not issue rulings, During the years of Rav Huna, teacher, did not issue rulings but he did issue rulings during the years of Rav Ḥisda’s for was disciple colleague. And I, too, am the Master’s disciple and colleague,
llm_translation: He said to him: It was said "Ori," and it was said "Lo Ori," in the two cases of Rav Huna, his teacher, it was that it is not Ori, and Ori in the two cases of Rav Ḥisda, for he was a student colleague of his. And I too am a student colleague of Mar.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן חָזֵי לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ. רָבִינָא אִיקְּלַע לְמָחוֹזָא, אַיְיתִי אוּשְׁפִּיזְכָנֵיהּ סַכִּינָא וְקָא מַחְוֵי לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל אַמְטְיֵיהּ לְרָבָא.
human_translation: Rava said: A Torah scholar may examine for himself Ravina happened to Meḥoza, His host brought a knife and showed to him. He said to him: Go, bring it to Rava,
llm_translation: Rava said: A student is seen by his teacher. Ravina entered a certain district, brought his knife and it was taken from him. He said to him: Go, bring it to Rava.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא סָבַר מָר הָא דְּאָמַר רָבָא צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן חָזֵי לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא מִיזְבָּן זָבֵינָא.
human_translation: said to him: Doesn’t the Master hold that Rava said: A Torah scholar may examine for himself? said to him: I buying from you,
llm_translation: He said to him: The master does not hold like what Rava said, "A student of the sages should look out for himself." He said to him: I am a merchant and I buy and sell.

hebrew_text: (סִימָן: זִילָא לְהַנְיָא, מַחְלִיף, אִיקָא, וְיַעֲקֹב).
human_translation: Zila Lehanya : Maḥlif : Ika : and Ya’akov :
llm_translation: Section: Zila to Hanya, Machlif, Ika, and Yaakov.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מֵהַגְרוֹנְיָא וְרַב אַבָּא בַּר תַּחְלִיפָא אִיקְּלַעוּ לְבֵי רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא, בְּאַתְרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב. בָּעֵי רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא לְמִיעְבַּד לְהוּ עִיגְלָא תִּילְתָּא, אַיְיתִי סַכִּינָא וְקָא מַחְוֵי לְהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar from Hagronya and Rav Abba bar Taḥalifa happened to the house Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, in the place of Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov. Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, wanted to prepare for them a third-born calf, He brought knife and showed to them.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar from Hagronya and Rav Abba bar Tachlifa came to the house of Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika, in the place of Rav Acha bar Yaakov. Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika, wanted to slaughter for them a third-grown calf, he brought a knife and was about to slaughter for them.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב אַחָא בַּר תַּחְלִיפָא: לָא לֵיחוּשׁ לֵיהּ לְסָבָא? אֲמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מֵהַגְרוֹנְיָא: הָכִי אָמַר רָבָא, צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן חָזֵי לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ. חֲזִי, וְאִיעֲנִישׁ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מֵהַגְרוֹנְיָא.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Taḥalifa said to them: Should we not be concerned with the Elder, Rabbi Elazar from Hagronya said to them: Rava said as follows: A Torah scholar may examine for himself. Rabbi Elazar from Hagronya inspected but he was punished
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Ahah bar Tahalifa: Should he not be concerned about the elder? Rabbi Elazar from Hagronya said to them: Thus said Rava, a student who is greater than his teacher sees to his own soul. See, and Rabbi Elazar from Hagronya was punished.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן חָזֵי לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ! שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דְּאַתְחִילוּ בִּכְבוֹדוֹ.
human_translation: Didn’t Rava say: A Torah scholar may examine for himself? It was different there, as they had begun of the honor
llm_translation: And Rava said: "A student of the sages, see to his own soul!" This is different there, for they began with his honor.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: שָׁאנֵי רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב דְּמוּפְלָג.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov is different, as he was illustrious
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: The opinion of Rav Acha bar Yaakov is different, as it is stated.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וּלְאַפְרוֹשֵׁי מֵאִיסּוּרָא — אֲפִילּוּ בְּפָנָיו שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי. רָבִינָא הֲוָה יָתֵיב קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי, חַזְיֵיהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּקָא אָסַר לֵיהּ לְחַמְרֵיהּ בְּצִינְתָא בְּשַׁבְּתָא. רְמָא בֵּיהּ קָלָא, וְלָא אַשְׁגַּח בֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לֶיהֱוֵי הַאי גַּבְרָא בְּשַׁמְתָּא.
human_translation: Rava said: in order to separate from a prohibition even in presence it seems well, Ravina was sitting before Rav Ashi he saw a certain man tying his donkey to a palm tree on Shabbat, He raised his voice to him but paid him no attention. said to Let this man be in excommunication
llm_translation: Rava said: And for those who are meticulous about prohibitions - even in his presence, it is praiseworthy. Ravina was sitting before Rav Ashi, he saw that certain man who was prohibiting his donkey in the shade on Shabbat. He raised his voice at him, but he did not pay attention to him. He said to him: Let this man be in the name of Heaven.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כִּי הַאי גַּוְונָא, מִי מִתְחֲזֵא כְּאַפְקֵרוּתָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״אֵין חׇכְמָה וְאֵין תְּבוּנָה וְאֵין עֵצָה לְנֶגֶד ה׳״, כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ חִילּוּל הַשֵּׁם — אֵין חוֹלְקִין כָּבוֹד לָרַב.
human_translation: said to such as this, does appear like irreverent said to him: “There is no wisdom or understanding or council against the Lord” Wherever a desecration of name is involved, no respect is paid to a teacher,
llm_translation: He said to him: "With this quality, who can be considered as a guarantor?" He said to him: "There is no wisdom, no understanding, and no counsel against the Lord," wherever there is desecration of the Name - honor is not divided for the teacher.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: בְּפָנָיו — אָסוּר, וְחַיָּיב מִיתָה. שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו — אָסוּר, וְאֵין חַיָּיב מִיתָה.
human_translation: Rava said: In presence, is prohibited and is liable death not in his presence, is prohibited but he is not liable death
llm_translation: Rava said: In his presence - forbidden, and liable to death. Not in his presence - forbidden, and not liable to death.

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו לָא? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: לֹא מֵתוּ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן עַד שֶׁהוֹרוּ הֲלָכָה בִּפְנֵי מֹשֶׁה רַבָּן. מַאי דְּרוּשׁ: ״וְנָתְנוּ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן הַכֹּהֵן אֵשׁ עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״, אָמְרוּ: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהָאֵשׁ יוֹרֶדֶת מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם, מִצְוָה לְהָבִיא מִן הַהֶדְיוֹט.
human_translation: not not in presence? But wasn’t taught Rabbi Eliezer says: The sons of Aaron died only because they issued a halakhic ruling before Moses, their teacher? What did they expound “And the sons of Aaron the priest shall put fire on the altar, them say: Although fire descends from Heaven, a mitzva to bring ordinary
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And not in his presence? But it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: The sons of Aaron did not die until they issued a halakhah in front of their teacher Moses. What is the interpretation: 'And the sons of Aaron, the priests, shall put fire upon the altar,' they said: Even though the fire descends from heaven, it is a commandment to bring from the common people."

hebrew_text: וְתַלְמִיד אֶחָד הָיָה לוֹ לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, שֶׁהוֹרָה הֲלָכָה בְּפָנָיו. אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְאִימָּא שָׁלוֹם אִשְׁתּוֹ: תָּמֵיהַּ אֲנִי אִם יוֹצִיא זֶה שְׁנָתוֹ. וְלֹא הוֹצִיא שְׁנָתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer had a certain disciple who issued a ruling in his presence. Rabbi Eliezer said to his wife, Imma Shalom: I will be surprised if this one completes his year, And he did not complete his year.
llm_translation: A single student was to Rabbi Eliezer, who ruled halacha in his presence. Rabbi Eliezer said to his wife: "I am amazed if this one will live out his year." And he did not live out his year.

hebrew_text: אָמְרָה לוֹ: נָבִיא אַתָּה? אָמַר לָהּ: לֹא נָבִיא אָנֹכִי וְלֹא בֶּן נָבִיא אָנֹכִי, אֶלָּא כָּךְ מְקּוּבְּלַנִי: כׇּל הַמּוֹרֶה הֲלָכָה בִּפְנֵי רַבּוֹ חַיָּיב מִיתָה.
human_translation: said to him: Are you a prophet? said to her: I am not a prophet, nor the son of a prophet, but I have received the following Anyone who issues a halakhic ruling in his teacher’s presence is liable death
llm_translation: She said to him: "Are you a prophet?" He said to her: "I am not a prophet, nor am I a son of a prophet. Rather, this is how it was received by me: Anyone who teaches halacha in the presence of his teacher is liable to receive the death penalty."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אוֹתוֹ תַּלְמִיד יְהוּדָה בֶּן גּוּרְיָא שְׁמוֹ, וְהָיָה רָחוֹק מִמֶּנּוּ שָׁלֹשׁ פַּרְסָאוֹת?!
human_translation: And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: That disciple was named Yehuda ben Gurya, and he was three parasangs away from
