llm_translation: And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: That student, Yehudah ben Guria was his name, and he was distant from him by three parasangs?!

hebrew_text: בְּפָנָיו הֲוָה. וְהָא רָחוֹק מִמֶּנּוּ שָׁלֹשׁ פַּרְסָאוֹת קָאָמַר! וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ: שְׁמוֹ וְשֵׁם אָבִיו לָמָּה? אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא תֹּאמַר מָשָׁל הָיָה.
human_translation: took place in presence But didn’t say that he was three parasangs away from And, according to your reasoning, why his name and his father’s name? Rather, that you should not say it was a parable.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: In his presence he was. But isn't it three parsecs away from him! And to taste: His name and his father's name, why? Rather, do not say it was a parable.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הַמּוֹרֶה הֲלָכָה בִּפְנֵי רַבּוֹ, רָאוּי לְהַכִּישׁוֹ נָחָשׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּעַן אֱלִיהוּא בֶן בַּרַכְאֵל הַבּוּזִי וַיֹּאמַר צָעִיר אֲנִי לְיָמִים וְגוֹ׳ עַל כֵּן זָחַלְתִּי״. וּכְתִיב: ״עִם חֲמַת זוֹחֲלֵי עָפָר״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Whoever issues a halakhic ruling in his teacher’s presence is deserving of being bitten by a snake, as it is stated: “And Elihu, son of Barachel the Buzite answered and said, I am young, therefore I held back zaḥalti and it is written: “With the venom of the crawling things of zoḥalei the dust”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: Anyone who teaches halacha in front of his teacher, it is fitting to strike him with a snake, as it is said: "And Elisha son of Barachel the Buzite answered and said, 'I am young in days, etc.' Therefore I crawled." And it is written: "With the fury of crawling serpents."

hebrew_text: זְעֵירִי אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: נִקְרָא חוֹטֵא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּלִבִּי צָפַנְתִּי אִמְרָתֶךָ לְמַעַן לֹא אֶחֱטָא לָךְ״.
human_translation: Ze’eiri Rabbi Ḥanina said: is called a sinner, as it is stated: “Your word have I hidden in my heart, that I might not sin against You”
llm_translation: Zei'iri said, Rabbi Chanina said: It is called "chotei" (sinner), as it is stated: "In my heart I have hidden Your word, so that I will not sin against You."

hebrew_text: רַב הַמְנוּנָא רָמֵי: כְּתִיב ״בְּלִבִּי צָפַנְתִּי אִמְרָתֶךָ״, וּכְתִיב ״בִּשַּׂרְתִּי צֶדֶק בְּקָהָל רַב״! לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — בִּזְמַן שֶׁעִירָא הַיָּאִירִי קַיָּים, כָּאן — בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין עִירָא הַיָּאִירִי קַיָּים.
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna raised a contradiction It is written: “Your word have I hidden in my heart,” it is written: “I have preached righteousness in the great congregation” not difficult. Here, to the period when Ira HaYa’iri, was alive; there, to the period when Ira HaYa’iri was no alive.
llm_translation: Rav Hamnuna raises a contradiction: It is written, "In my heart I have hidden Your word," and it is written, "I have proclaimed righteousness in the great congregation"! This is not difficult: here — when the moon is shining, it is fulfilled, here — when the moon is not shining, it is fulfilled.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר זַבְדָּא: כׇּל הַנּוֹתֵן מַתְּנוֹתָיו לְכֹהֵן אֶחָד, מֵבִיא רָעָב לְעוֹלָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״עִירָא הַיָּאִירִי הָיָה כֹהֵן לְדָוִד״. לְדָוִד הוּא דַּהֲוָה כֹּהֵן, לְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא?! אֶלָּא שֶׁהָיָה מְשַׁגֵּר לוֹ מַתְּנוֹתָיו, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״וַיְהִי רָעָב בִּימֵי דָוִד״.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Zavda said: Whoever gives his gifts to one priest brings famine into the world As it is stated: Ira HaYa’iri was a priest for David” Was he a priest for David not for anyone else? Rather, that would send his gifts to him And it is written afterward: “And there was a famine in the days of David,
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Zavda said: Anyone who gives his gifts to one priest, brings hunger to the world, as it is said, "Ira the Jairite was a priest to David." Was David the only one in the world? Rather, he used to send him his gifts, and it is written afterward, "And there was hunger in the days of David."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מוֹרִידִין אוֹתוֹ מִגְּדוּלָּתוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר אֶלְעָזָר הַכֹּהֵן אֶל אַנְשֵׁי הַצָּבָא וְגוֹ׳״. אַף עַל גַּב דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ: לַאֲחִי אַבָּא צִוָּה, וְאוֹתִי לֹא צִוָּה — אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי, אִיעֲנַשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: is lowered from his greatness, as it is stated: “And Elazar the priest said to the men of war Although said to to father’s brother, while to me He did not command even so he was punished
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: We lower him from his greatness, as it is stated: "And Eleazar the priest said to the men of the army, etc." Even though he said to them: "My grandfather commanded, but he did not command me" — even so, he is punished.

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלִפְנֵי אֶלְעָזָר הַכֹּהֵן יַעֲמֹד״, וְלָא אַשְׁכְּחַן דְּאִיצְטְרִיךְ לֵיהּ יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: As it is written “And he shall stand before Elazar the priest, But we do not find that Joshua had need of him.
llm_translation: It is written: "And before Eleazar the priest he shall stand," and we did not find that Joshua was needed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: כׇּל דְּמוֹתֵיב מִלָּה קַמֵּיהּ רַבֵּיהּ — אָזֵיל לִשְׁאוֹל בְּלֹא וָלָד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּעַן יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן מְשָׁרֵת מֹשֶׁה מִבְּחוּרָיו וַיֹּאמַר אֲדוֹנִי מֹשֶׁה כְּלָאֵם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Levi said: Whoever answers a word in the presence of his teacher will go down to the netherworld childless, as it is stated: “And Joshua bin Nun, the minister of Moses from his youth, answered and said: My lord Moses, shut them in”
llm_translation: Rabbi Levi said: Anyone who disputes a matter before his teacher is as if he descends to the grave without offspring, as it is stated: "And Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of Moses, one of his chosen men, answered and said, 'My lord Moses, restrain them!'"

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב: ״נוֹן בְּנוֹ יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בְּנוֹ״.
human_translation: And it is written “Non his son, Joshua his son”
llm_translation: And it is written: "Nun his son, Joshua his son."

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר פָּפָּא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר פָּפָּא: לֹא נֶעֱנַשׁ יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁבִּיטֵּל אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל לַיְלָה אַחַת מִפְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה.
human_translation: And this differs from Rabbi Abba bar Pappa, for Rabbi Abba bar Pappa said: Joshua was punished only because he had prevented the Jewish people from being fruitful and multiplying for one night.
llm_translation: Dispute of Rabbi Abba bar Papa, for Rabbi Abba bar Papa said: Joshua was punished only because he delayed Israel one night from being fruitful and multiplying.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי בִּהְיוֹת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּירִיחוֹ וַיִּשָּׂא עֵינָיו וַיַּרְא וְגוֹ׳״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר (לוֹ) כִּי אֲנִי שַׂר צְבָא ה׳ עַתָּה בָאתִי וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: As it is stated: “And it came to pass when Joshua was by Jericho that he lifted up his eyes and looked, and it is written “And he said: No, but I am captain of the host of the Lord, I am now come”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated: "And it came to pass, when Joshua was by Jericho, that he lifted up his eyes and saw, etc." And it is written: "And he said (to him), 'As the captain of the host of the Lord I have now come, etc.'" English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: אֶמֶשׁ בִּיטַּלְתֶּם תָּמִיד שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם, וְעַכְשָׁיו בִּיטַּלְתֶּם תַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה. עַל אֵיזֶה מֵהֶן בָּאתָ? אָמַר לוֹ: ״עַתָּה בָּאתִי״.
human_translation: said to him: Last night, you neglected the daily evening offering, and now, you are neglecting Torah study. For which of have you come said to him: “I am now come,”
llm_translation: He said to him: "Last night you nullified the Tamid offering of the evening, and now you have nullified the study of Torah. For which of them did you come?" He said to him: "Now I have come."

hebrew_text: מִיָּד: ״וַיֵּלֶךְ יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בַּלַּיְלָה הַהוּא בְּתוֹךְ הָעֵמֶק״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָלַךְ בְּעוֹמְקָהּ שֶׁל הֲלָכָה.
human_translation: immediately “And Joshua walked that night in the midst of the valley [ ha’emek ]” And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: teaches that he walked in the depth [ be’omeka ] of halakha ,
llm_translation: Immediately: "And Joshua went that night into the midst of the valley," and Rabbi Yochanan said: It teaches that he walked in the depth of the law.

hebrew_text: וּגְמִירִי דְּכׇל זְמַן שֶׁאָרוֹן וּשְׁכִינָה שְׁרוּיִין שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹמָן אֲסוּרִין בְּתַשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה.
human_translation: And they learned any time that the Ark and the Divine Presence are not resting in their places, are prohibited in marital relations.
llm_translation: And it was learned that as long as the Ark and the Divine Presence are not in their place, they are prohibited for common use.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אִינְיָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: גָּדוֹל תַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה יוֹתֵר מֵהַקְרָבַת תְּמִידִין, דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״עַתָּה בָּאתִי״.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Inya said in the name of Rav: Torah study is greater than the offering of daily said to “I am now come,”
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Inya said in the name of Rav: "Great is Torah study more than the offering of the daily sacrifices," as it says to him: "Now I have come."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב בְּרוֹנָא אָמַר רַב: כׇּל הַיָּשֵׁן בְּקִילְעָא שֶׁאִישׁ וְאִשְׁתּוֹ שְׁרוּיִין בָּהּ, — עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״נְשֵׁי עַמִּי תְּגָרְשׁוּן מִבֵּית תַּעֲנוּגֶיהָ״.
human_translation: Rav Beruna said Rav said: Whoever sleeps in a chamber in which a husband and wife are resting, the verse says about him: “The women of my people you cast out from their pleasant houses”
llm_translation: Rav Barona said in the name of Rav: Anyone who sleeps in a garment that belongs to both him and his wife, the verse applies to him, saying, "The women of My people you drive out from their pleasant houses."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אֲפִילּוּ בְּאִשְׁתּוֹ נִדָּה.
human_translation: And Rav Yosef said: even in whose wife is menstruating,
llm_translation: And said Rav Yosef: Even in his wife is a menstruant.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: אִם אִשְׁתּוֹ נִדָּה הִיא — תָּבֹא עָלָיו בְּרָכָה. וְלָא הִיא, דְּעַד הָאִידָּנָא מַאן נַטְרֵיהּ?
human_translation: Rava said: If his wife is menstruating, may a blessing come upon But that is not so, for who protected until now?
llm_translation: Rava said: If his wife is a menstruant, blessing will come upon him. And if not, who has been taking care of him until now?

hebrew_text: הָהוּא מְבוֹאָה דַּהֲוָה דָּיַיר בָּהּ לַחְמָן בַּר רִיסְתַּק. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אוֹגַר לַן רְשׁוּתָךְ, לָא אוֹגַר לְהוּ.
human_translation: there was a certain alleyway in which Laḥman bar Ristak, lived. said to him: Rent us your domain, He would not rent to them,
llm_translation: That entranceway in which Dair lived in it, Lachman son of Ristak. They said to him: "Store your property with us, do not store with them."

hebrew_text: אֲתוֹ אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְאַבָּיֵי. אֲמַר לְהוּ: זִילוּ בַּטִּילוּ רְשׁוּתַיְיכוּ לְגַבֵּי חַד, הָוֵה לֵיהּ יָחִיד בִּמְקוֹם גּוֹי, וְיָחִיד בִּמְקוֹם גּוֹי לָא אָסַר.
human_translation: came spoke to Abaye, said to them: Go, renounce your domains, in favor of one it is one individual in the place as a gentile. And one individual in the place as a gentile, does not render it prohibited
llm_translation: They came and said to Abbaye. He said to them: Go and place your domains together with one, it will be considered a private domain in a public domain, and a private domain in a public domain does not prohibit.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מִידֵּי הוּא טַעְמָא אֶלָּא דְּלָא שְׁכִיחַ דְּדָיְירִי, וְהָכָא הָא קָדָיְירִי!
human_translation: They said to him: But isn’t the reason only that it is not common for to live But here, are living
llm_translation: They said to him: It is a reason from itself, but not common among residents, and here it is common among residents!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: כׇּל בַּטּוֹלֵי רְשׁוּתַיְיהוּ גַּבֵּי חַד, מִילְּתָא דְלָא שְׁכִיחָא הִיא, וּמִילְּתָא דְלָא שְׁכִיחָא, לָא גְּזַרוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: said to them: Any renunciation of the domains in favor of a individual is an uncommon occurrence. an uncommon occurrence, the Sages did not issue a decree
llm_translation: He said to them: All those who nullify their ownership in favor of one, a matter that is not common, and a matter that is not common, the Rabbis did not decree upon it.

hebrew_text: אֲזַל רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אַמְרַהּ לִשְׁמַעְתָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ:
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, went reported this halakha before Rava, said to him:
llm_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, went. She said to him to hear before Rava. He said to him:

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, בִּיטַּלְתָּ תּוֹרַת עֵירוּב מֵאוֹתוֹ מָבוֹי!
human_translation: If so, you have abolished category of eiruv from that alleyway.
llm_translation: If so, you nullified the law of the Eruv from that alleyway!

hebrew_text: דִּמְעָרְבִי. יֹאמְרוּ עֵירוּב מוֹעִיל בִּמְקוֹם גּוֹי?! דְּמַכְרְזִינַן.
human_translation: that they establish an eiruv say an eiruv is effective in the place of a gentile, We make an announcement
llm_translation: "Dime'arvi. Yomru eiruv mo'il bimkom goy?! Demachrezinan." "Dime'arvi. They say, does an eiruv help in a place of non-Jews?! We announce."

hebrew_text: אַכְרָזְתָּא לְדַרְדְּקֵי?!
human_translation: an announcement for the children?
llm_translation: Proclamation to the millstones?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: לֵיזִיל חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ, לִיקְרַב לֵיהּ, וְלִשְׁאוֹל מִינֵּיהּ דּוּכְתָּא וְלַינַּח בֵּיהּ מִידֵּי, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ כִּשְׂכִירוֹ וּלְקִיטוֹ, וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֲפִילּוּ שְׂכִירוֹ וַאֲפִילּוּ לְקִיטוֹ — נוֹתֵן עֵירוּבוֹ וְדַיּוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said Let one of them go and become friendly with and ask him a place and set something down there, thus becoming like hired laborer or harvester. And Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: even his hired laborer, and even his harvester, may contribute to the eiruv and this is enough.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: Let him go one of the two ways, to approach it, and to inquire of its condition, and to take from it immediately, for it will be like his hired worker and his agent. And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Even if it is his hired worker or even his agent - he may place his Eruv and be sufficient.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: הָיוּ שָׁם חֲמִשָּׁה שְׂכִירוֹ וַחֲמִשָּׁה לְקִיטוֹ מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִם אָמְרוּ שְׂכִירוֹ וּלְקִיטוֹ לְהָקֵל, יֹאמְרוּ שְׂכִירוֹ וּלְקִיטוֹ לְהַחֲמִיר?
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: If there were five hired laborers or five harvesters there, what is said to him: If said hired laborer or harvester as a leniency, would they say that his hired laborer or harvester as a stringency?
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye to Rav Yosef: Were there five hired laborers and five gatherers there, what is the law? He said to him: If they said hired laborers and gatherers to be lenient, would they say hired laborers and gatherers to be stringent?

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֲפִילּוּ שְׂכִירוֹ וַאֲפִילּוּ לְקִיטוֹ, נוֹתֵן עֵירוּבוֹ וְדַיּוֹ. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: כַּמָּה מְעַלְּיָא הָא שְׁמַעְתָּא.
human_translation: the matter itself, Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: Even hired laborer, and even his harvester, may contribute to the eiruv and this is enough. Rav Naḥman said: How excellent is this halakha .
llm_translation: The body, said Rav Yehudah said Shmuel: Even his hired worker and even his collector, he gives his Eruv and is sufficient. Rav Nachman said: How excellent is this teaching.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שָׁתָה רְבִיעִית יַיִן — אַל יוֹרֶה. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: לָא מְעַלְּיָא הָא שְׁמַעְתָּא, דְּהָא אֲנָא כֹּל כַּמָּה דְּלָא שָׁתֵינָא רְבִיעֵתָא דְּחַמְרָא — לָא צִילָא דַּעְתַּאי.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: If one drank a quarter- of wine, he may not issue a ruling, Rav Naḥman said: This halakha is not excellent, as myself, as long as I have not drunk a quarter- of wine, my mind is not clear.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: If one drinks a revi'it of wine - he should not teach. Rav Nachman said: The matter you heard is not of concern, for as long as I have not drunk a revi'it of wine - my mind is clear.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: מַאי טַעְמָא אָמַר מָר הָכִי? הָאָמַר רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״וְרוֹעֶה זוֹנוֹת יְאַבֶּד הוֹן״ — כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר שְׁמוּעָה זוֹ נָאָה, וְזוֹ אֵינָהּ נָאָה — מְאַבֵּד הוֹנָה שֶׁל תּוֹרָה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֲדַרִי בִּי.
human_translation: Rava said to What is the reason the Master said this, Didn’t Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina say: What is which is written: “But he who keeps company with prostitutes zonot wastes his fortune” Anyone who says: This teaching is pleasant zo na’a but this is not pleasant, loses the fortune of Torah. said to him: I retract,
llm_translation: He said to him Rava: What is the reason that Master said thus? For Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina said: What is the meaning of what is written, "And one who feeds his harlots is squandering wealth" (Proverbs 29:3) — anyone who says this woman is beautiful, when she is not beautiful, is squandering the wealth of Torah! He said to him: You have restored my confidence.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: שָׁתוּי אַל יִתְפַּלֵּל, וְאִם הִתְפַּלֵּל — תְּפִלָּתוֹ תְּפִלָּה. שִׁיכּוֹר אַל יִתְפַּלֵּל, וְאִם הִתְפַּלֵּל — תְּפִלָּתוֹ תּוֹעֵבָה.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: One who has drunk must not pray, but if he prayed, his prayer is a prayer, one who is intoxicated must not pray, and if he prayed, his prayer is an abomination.
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: One who is drunk should not pray, and if he prayed - his prayer is a prayer. One who is intoxicated should not pray, and if he prayed - his prayer is an abomination.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי שָׁתוּי, וְהֵיכִי דָּמֵי שִׁיכּוֹר? כִּי הָא דְּרַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר שׁוּמְנִי וְרַב מְנַשְּׁיָא בַּר יִרְמְיָה מִגִּיפְתִּי הֲווֹ קָא מִפַּטְרִי מֵהֲדָדֵי אַמַּעְבָּרָא דִּנְהַר יוֹפְטִי. אֲמַרוּ: כׇּל חַד מִינַּן לֵימָא מִילְּתָא דְּלָא שְׁמִיעַ לְחַבְרֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר מָרִי בַּר רַב הוּנָא: לָא יִפָּטֵר אָדָם מֵחֲבֵירוֹ אֶלָּא מִתּוֹךְ דְּבַר הֲלָכָה, שֶׁמִּתּוֹךְ כָּךְ זוֹכְרוֹ.
human_translation: What are the circumstances one who has drunk and what are the circumstances one who is intoxicated the following As Rabbi Abba bar Shumni and Rav Menashya bar Yirmeya from Gifti were taking leave of each other at the ford of the Yofti River, they said: Let each one of us say something that his fellow has not heard, for Mari bar Rav Huna said: A person must take leave of his fellow only in the midst of a matter of halakha , as due to this he will remember him.
llm_translation: "How are the appearances of one who has drunk, and how are the appearances of one who is drunk? For this is like that which Rabbi Abba bar Shumni and Rav Menashya bar Yirmeya of Gipatya were walking along the bank of the river Yofti. They said: Let each of us say a matter that his companions have not heard, for Master Bar Rav Huna said: A person should only be exempt from his fellow through a matter of halakha, for through this his memory is preserved."

hebrew_text: פְּתַח חַד וַאֲמַר: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי שָׁתוּי, וְהֵיכִי דָּמֵי שִׁיכּוֹר? שָׁתוּי — כֹּל שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְדַבֵּר לִפְנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ. שִׁיכּוֹר — כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְדַבֵּר לִפְנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ.
human_translation: One opened and said: What are the circumstances one who has drunk and what are the circumstances one who is intoxicated One who has drunk anyone that he is able to talk in the presence of a king. One who is intoxicated anyone that he is not able to talk in the presence of a king.
llm_translation: He opened with one example and said: How do we determine the blood of one who drank wine, and how do we determine the blood of one who is drunk? Regarding one who drank wine - anyone who is able to speak before the king. Regarding one who is drunk - anyone who is unable to speak before the king.

hebrew_text: פְּתַח אִידַּךְ וַאֲמַר: הַמַּחֲזִיק בְּנִכְסֵי הַגֵּר, מַה יַּעֲשֶׂה וְיִתְקַיְּימוּ בְּיָדוֹ? יִקַּח בָּהֶן סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה. אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: אֲפִילּוּ
human_translation: The other one opened and said: one who took possession of a convert’s property, what should he do so that it remains in his hands? should buy a Torah scroll with Rav Sheshet said: Even
llm_translation: The text opens and says: One who holds the property of a convert, what should he do to uphold them in his possession? He should take with them a Torah scroll. Rav Sheshet said: Even

hebrew_text: בַּעַל בְּנִכְסֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: a husband to his wife’s property
llm_translation: Husband of the property of his wife.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ עֲבַד עִיסְקָא וּרְוַוח. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ מָצָא מְצִיאָה. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אֲפִילּוּ כְּתַב בְּהוּ תְּפִילִּין.
human_translation: Rava said: Even if he entered into a business venture and made a profit, Rav Pappa said: Even if he found a lost article, Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: even if wrote phylacteries with it,
llm_translation: Rava said: Even if he did business and profited. Rav Papa said: Even if he found a lost object. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Even if he wrote in them the phylacteries.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חָנִין, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מַאי קְרָאָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּדַּר יִשְׂרָאֵל נֶדֶר וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rav Ḥanin said, and some say Rabbi Ḥanina What is the verse As it is written: “And Israel vowed a vow
llm_translation: And Rav Hanin said, and some say Rabbi Hanina: What is the verse that is written: "And Israel made a vow..."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר אַבָּא: דֶּרֶךְ מִיל, וְשֵׁינָה כׇּל שֶׁהוּא — מְפִיגִין אֶת הַיַּיִן. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁשָּׁתָה כְּדֵי רְבִיעִית, אֲבָל שָׁתָה יוֹתֵר מֵרְבִיעִית — כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן שֶׁדֶּרֶךְ טוֹרַדְתּוֹ וְשֵׁינָה מְשַׁכַּרְתּוֹ.
human_translation: Rami bar Abba said: path of a mil , and sleeping a minimal amount, dispel the wine Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: They only taught who has drunk a quarter- but one who has drunk more than a quarter- path will preoccupy him all the more, and of sleep will intoxicate him.
llm_translation: Ramai bar Abba said: The way of salt, and sleep, whatever it is - dilutes the wine. Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh: They only said this when he drank a revi'it, but if he drank more than a revi'it - all the more so if he is accustomed to it and sleep intoxicates him.

hebrew_text: וְדֶרֶךְ מִיל מְפִיגָה הַיַּיִן?! וְהָתַנְיָא: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל שֶׁהָיָה רוֹכֵב עַל הַחֲמוֹר וְהָיָה מְהַלֵּךְ מֵעַכּוֹ לִכְזִיב, וְהָיָה רַבִּי אִילְעַאי מְהַלֵּךְ אַחֲרָיו. מָצָא גְּלוּסְקִין בַּדֶּרֶךְ, אָמַר לוֹ: אִילְעַאי, טוֹל גְּלוּסְקִין מִן הַדֶּרֶךְ. מָצָא גּוֹי אֶחָד, אָמַר לוֹ: מַבְגַּאי, טוֹל גְּלוּסְקִין הַלָּלוּ מֵאִילְעַאי.
human_translation: Does a path of a mil dispel the wine? Wasn’t taught There was an incident involving Rabban Gamliel, who was riding a donkey and traveling from Akko to Keziv, and Rabbi Elai was walking behind him. found fine loaves on the road, and he said to Elai, take the loaves from the road. encountered a certain gentile said to him: Mavgai, take these loaves from Elai.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And the way of cutting off wine is by diluting it?! And it was taught in a Baraita: It once happened with Rabban Gamliel that he was riding on a donkey and was traveling from Akko to Ziv, and Rabbi Ilai was walking behind him. He found glass shards on the road, and he said to him: Ilai, remove these glass shards from the road. He found a non-Jew, and he said to him: Mavga'i, remove these glass shards from Ilai." English translation:

hebrew_text: נִיטַּפֵּל לוֹ רַבִּי אִילְעַאי, אָמַר לוֹ: מֵהֵיכָן אַתָּה? אָמַר לוֹ: מֵעֲיָירוֹת שֶׁל בּוּרְגָּנִין. וּמָה שִׁמְךָ? מַבְגַּאי שְׁמֵנִי. כְּלוּם הִיכִּירְךָ רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מֵעוֹלָם? אָמַר לוֹ: לָאו.
human_translation: Elai joined and said to him: Where are you from? said to him: From the towns of guardsmen. And what is your name? My name is Mavgai. Has Rabban Gamliel ever met you before, said to him: No.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Ilai encountered him, he said to him: From where are you? He said to him: From the towns of Burganin. And what is your name? Mavga'i Shemeni. Has Rabban Gamliel ever recognized you? He said to him: No.

hebrew_text: בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה לָמַדְנוּ שֶׁכִּוֵּון רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בְּרוּחַ הַקּוֹדֶשׁ. וּשְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים לָמַדְנוּ בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה: לָמַדְנוּ שֶׁאֵין מַעֲבִירִין עַל הָאוֹכָלִין.
human_translation: At that time we learned that Rabban Gamliel divined by way of divine inspiration And at that time we learned three matters We learned that one may not pass by food,
llm_translation: At that moment we learned that Rabban Gamliel intended with the Holy Spirit. And three things we learned at that moment: we learned that one does not pass over the food.

hebrew_text: וְלָמַדְנוּ שֶׁהוֹלְכִין אַחֲרֵי רוֹב עוֹבְרֵי דְּרָכִים. וְלָמַדְנוּ שֶׁחֲמֵצוֹ שֶׁל גּוֹי אַחַר הַפֶּסַח מוּתָּר בַּהֲנָאָה.
human_translation: We learned that we follow the majority of travelers. we learned that leavened bread belonging to a gentile, it is permitted benefit after Passover.
llm_translation: And we have learned that we follow the majority of travelers. And we have learned that the leaven of a gentile after Passover is permitted for benefit.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לִכְזִיב, בָּא אֶחָד לִישָּׁאֵל עַל נִדְרוֹ. אָמַר לָזֶה שֶׁעִמּוֹ: כְּלוּם שָׁתִינוּ רְבִיעִית יַיִן הָאִיטַלְקִי? אָמַר לוֹ: הֵן. אִם כֵּן, יְטַיֵּיל אַחֲרֵינוּ עַד שֶׁיָּפִיג יֵינֵינוּ.
human_translation: When arrived in Keziv, a came to request his vow. said to the one who was with him, Did we drink a quarter- of Italian wine said to him: Yes. If so, let him journey after us until our wine is dispelled,
llm_translation: When he reached Kziv, one came to Yishaiel regarding his vow. He said to the one with him: Have we not drunk a quarter of Italian wine? He said to him: Yes. If so, let him wait for us until our wine is exhausted.

hebrew_text: וְטִיֵּיל אַחֲרֵיהֶן שְׁלֹשָׁה מִילִין, עַד שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לְסוּלָּמָא שֶׁל צוּר. כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לְסוּלָּמָא דְצוֹר, יָרַד רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מִן הַחֲמוֹר, וְנִתְעַטֵּף, וְיָשַׁב, וְהִתִּיר לוֹ נִדְרוֹ.
human_translation: And journeyed after them three mil , until arrived at the Ladder of Tyre. When he arrived at the Ladder of Tyre, Rabban Gamliel alighted from his donkey and wrapped himself and he sat and dissolved his vow.
llm_translation: And he walked after them three mil, until he reached the ladder of Tyre. Once he reached the ladder of Tyre, Rabban Gamliel descended from the donkey, wrapped himself, sat, and released his vow.

hebrew_text: וְהַרְבֵּה דְּבָרִים לָמַדְנוּ בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה. לָמַדְנוּ שֶׁרְבִיעִית יַיִן הָאִיטַלְקִי מְשַׁכֵּר, וְלָמַדְנוּ שִׁיכּוֹר אַל יוֹרֶה, וְלָמַדְנוּ שֶׁדֶּרֶךְ מְפִיגָה אֶת הַיַּיִן, וְלָמַדְנוּ שֶׁאֵין מְפִירִין נְדָרִים לֹא רָכוּב וְלֹא מְהַלֵּךְ וְלֹא עוֹמֵד, אֶלָּא יוֹשֵׁב.
human_translation: At that time we learned many matters We learned that a quarter- of Italian wine intoxicates, and we learned one who is intoxicated may not issue a ruling, and we learned that a path dispels of wine, and we learned that one may not annul vows either mounted or walking, or standing, but sitting.
llm_translation: We have learned many things at that time. We have learned that a quarter of Italian wine intoxicates, and we have learned that a drunkard does not recite the Shema, and we have learned that it is the way of one who dilutes the wine, and we have learned that one does not annul vows while lying down, walking, or standing, but while sitting.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי מִיהַת שְׁלֹשָׁה מִילִין! שָׁאנֵי יַיִן הָאִיטַלְקִי דִּמְשַׁכַּר טְפֵי.
human_translation: In any event, is teaching three mil Italian wine is different it is more intoxicating,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "From what quantity of wine does one recite the blessing? It is different with Italian wine, for it intoxicates even in small quantities."

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁשָּׁתָה רְבִיעִית, אֲבָל שָׁתָה יוֹתֵר מֵרְבִיעִית, כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן דֶּרֶךְ טוֹרַדְתּוֹ וְשֵׁינָה מְשַׁכַּרְתּוֹ!
human_translation: But didn’t Rav Naḥman say Rabba bar Avuh said: They taught only who has drunk a quarter- but one who has drunk more than a quarter- walking will preoccupy him all the more, and sleep will intoxicate him?
llm_translation: And he said, Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh: They only taught that if one drinks a quarter of wine, but if he drinks more than a quarter, all the more so, since it is his habit and it intoxicates him!

hebrew_text: רָכוּב שָׁאנֵי. הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָתֵית לְהָכִי, לְרָמִי בַּר אַבָּא נָמֵי לָא קַשְׁיָא: רָכוּב שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: mounted is different Now that you have arrived at this according to Rami bar Abba, it is also not difficult, riding is different
llm_translation: Ride on two years. Now that you have come to this, to raise a difficulty, Bar Abba said: It is not difficult: Ride on two years.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מְפִירִין נְדָרִים בֵּין מְהַלֵּךְ בֵּין עוֹמֵד וּבֵין רָכוּב!
human_translation: Is that so, But didn’t Rav Naḥman say: One may annul vows walking, standing, or mounted?
llm_translation: I?! And didn't Rav Nachman say: We annul vows whether walking, standing, or riding!

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּאִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: פּוֹתְחִין בַּחֲרָטָה.
human_translation: This is tanna’im , as there is who says one open by means of regret
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita. For there is one who says: We begin with a knife.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: אֵין פּוֹתְחִין בַּחֲרָטָה.
human_translation: And there is who says one not open by means of regret
llm_translation: And there is a support for the one who says: "We do not open with a sharp implement."

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַאי פָּתַח לֵיהּ רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא: ״יֵשׁ בּוֹטֶה כְּמַדְקְרוֹת חָרֶב וּלְשׁוֹן חֲכָמִים מַרְפֵּא״ — כֹּל הַבּוֹטֶה רָאוּי לְדוֹקְרוֹ בְּחֶרֶב, אֶלָּא שֶׁלְּשׁוֹן חֲכָמִים מַרְפֵּא.
human_translation: As Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: what did Rabban Gamliel open for that man, “There is one who utters like the piercings of a sword; but the tongue of the wise is health” Whoever utters deserves to be pierced by a sword, Rather, it is the tongue of the wise that heals,
llm_translation: Rabah bar bar Ḥanah said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: What did Rabban Gamliel see in that man? "There is a goad like the goads of a sword, but the tongue of the wise is healing" (Ecclesiastes 12:11) — Everyone who has a goad is fit to be pierced with a sword, except that the tongue of the wise is healing.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: וְאֵין מַעֲבִירִין עַל הָאוֹכָלִין. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּדוֹרוֹת הָרִאשׁוֹנִים, שֶׁאֵין בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל פְּרוּצוֹת בִּכְשָׁפִים. אֲבָל בְּדוֹרוֹת הָאַחֲרוֹנִים, שֶׁבְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל פְּרוּצוֹת בִּכְשָׁפִים — מַעֲבִירִין.
human_translation: The Master said one may not pass by food; Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon bar Yoḥai: They taught only in the early generations, when Jewish women were not accustomed to using witchcraft. However, in the later generations, when Jewish women are accustomed to using witchcraft, one may pass by
llm_translation: Master said: And we do not pass over the eaters. Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: They only did not teach this except in the earlier generations, for the daughters of Israel were not promiscuous with sorcery. But in the later generations, since the daughters of Israel are promiscuous with sorcery - we pass over.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: שְׁלֵימִין מַעֲבִירִין, פְּתִיתִין אֵין מַעֲבִירִין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַסִּי לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וְאַפְּתִיתִין לָא עָבְדָן? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַתְּחַלֶּלְנָה אוֹתִי אֶל עַמִּי בְּשַׁעֲלֵי שְׂעוֹרִים וּבִפְתוֹתֵי לֶחֶם״! דְּשָׁקְלִי בְּאַגְרַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: taught: whole, one pass by, pieces, one not pass by, Rav Asi said to Rav Ashi: they not perform pieces Isn’t it written “And you have profaned Me among My people for handfuls of barley and for pieces of bread” they took as their wages.
llm_translation: The Tanna taught: Whole loaves may be passed over the altar, broken loaves may not be passed. Rav Assi said to Rav Ashe: And broken loaves, did they not pass over the altar? But it is written: "And they have defiled Me among My people for handfuls of barley and for pieces of bread"! They took it in their wallets.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה:
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya:
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah:

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל אֲנִי לִפְטוֹר אֶת כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ מִן הַדִּין מִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ וְעַד עַכְשָׁיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לָכֵן שִׁמְעִי נָא זֹאת עֲנִיָּיהּ וּשְׁכוּרַת וְלֹא מִיָּיִן״.
human_translation: I can exempts the entire world from judgment, from the day that the Temple was destroyed until now. As it is stated: “Therefore, hear now this, you afflicted and drunken, but not from wine”
llm_translation: I am able to exempt the entire world from judgment since the destruction of the Temple until now, as it is stated: "Therefore hear this, you afflicted and drunk, but not with wine."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: שִׁיכּוֹר מִקָּחוֹ מִקָּח, וּמִמְכָּרוֹ מִמְכָּר. עָבַר עֲבֵירָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ מִיתָה — מְמִיתִין אוֹתוֹ, מַלְקוֹת — מַלְקִין אוֹתוֹ. כְּלָלוֹ שֶׁל דָּבָר: הֲרֵי הוּא כְּפִיקֵּחַ לְכׇל דְּבָרָיו, אֶלָּא שֶׁפָּטוּר מִן הַתְּפִלָּה.
human_translation: raises an objection intoxicated, his acquisition is a acquisition; and his sale is a sale. if he committed a transgression for which death he is executed; lashes, he is flogged. The principle is he is like a sober person in all matters, except that he is exempt from prayer.
llm_translation: Challenger: Drunkenness, his acquisition is an acquisition, and his sale is a sale. He committed a sin punishable by death — they put him to death, if the sin is punishable by lashes — they administer lashes to him. The general principle of the matter: he is like a competent person in all his matters, except that he is exempt from prayer.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״יָכוֹלְנִי לִפְטוֹר״ דְּקָאָמַר נָמֵי — מִדִּין תְּפִלָּה.
human_translation: what is his statement: I can exempt? too, from the judgment of prayer,
llm_translation: What is "yacholni liftor" that he is saying "namei" - from the law of prayer.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ לְשִׁכְרוּתוֹ שֶׁל לוֹט, אֲבָל הִגִּיעַ לְשִׁכְרוּתוֹ שֶׁל לוֹט — פָּטוּר מִכּוּלָּם.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina said: They taught only he did not reach the intoxication of Lot; however, if he reached the intoxication of Lot, he is exempt from all
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: They only taught that one is exempt if he did not reach the measure of Lot's wife, but if he reached the measure of Lot's wife, he is exempt from all of them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: כׇּל הַמֵּפִיק מָגֵן בִּשְׁעַת גַּאֲוָה, סוֹגְרִין וְחוֹתְמִין צָרוֹת בַּעֲדוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״גַּאֲוָה אֲפִיקֵי מָגִנִּים סָגוּר חוֹתָם צָר״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina said: Whoever passes a shield at a time of arrogance, troubles will be closed and sealed from him, as it is stated: “The channels of [ afikei ] his scales are his pride, closed together as with a tight [ tzar ] seal”
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: Anyone who removes a shield in a time of arrogance, they close and seal troubles against him, as it is stated: "Arrogance opens up shields, but a seal of trouble."

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע דְּהַאי ״אָפִיק״ לִישָּׁנָא דְעַבּוֹרֵי הוּא? דִּכְתִיב: ״אַחַי בָּגְדוּ כְמוֹ נָחַל כַּאֲפִיק נְחָלִים יַעֲבוֹרוּ״.
human_translation: From where may it be inferred that this afik is a formulation passing [ aborei ]? As it is written: “My brothers have dealt deceitfully like a wadi, like the channel [ afik ] of brooks that pass by [ ya’avoru ]”
llm_translation: What is the implication that this "afik" is a channel of transgressors? As it is written: "My brothers have acted deceitfully like a wadi, like a channel of rivers they pass."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: ״כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מֵפִיק״ אִתְּמַר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: it was stated whoever does not draws out [ mapik ]
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "Kol she'eino mafik" itmar.

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע דְּהַאי ״מֵפִיק״ לִישָּׁנָא דְגַלּוֹיֵי הוּא? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֵּרָאוּ אֲפִיקֵי מַיִם וַיִּגָּלוּ מוֹסְדוֹת תֵּבֵל״.
human_translation: From where may it be inferred that this mapik is a formulation revealing? As it is written: “The channels of [ afikei ] waters were seen, and the foundations of the world were laid bare”
llm_translation: What is the implication that this "meifik" is a revealing of uncovered things? As it is written: "The depths of the waters were seen, and the foundations of the world were uncovered."

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי, קְרָאֵי מַשְׁמַע בֵּין לְמָר וּבֵין לְמָר, מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת. דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת מָסַר שִׁינְתֵּיהּ לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ. מָר אִית לֵיהּ דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת, וּמָר לֵית לֵיהּ דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת.
human_translation: Now, since the verses may be interpreted both in accordance with of Master and in accordance with Master, what is between them? The between them is Rav Sheshet, as Rav Sheshet gave his sleep to his attendant, Sage, is of Rav Sheshet And one Sage, is not of Rav Sheshet
llm_translation: From where is it derived that the verses imply a distinction between one Master and another Master, what is the difference between them? There is a difference between them regarding Rav Sheshet. Rav Sheshet entrusted his teeth to his servant. One Master has Rav Sheshet, and the other Master does not have Rav Sheshet.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין דַּעְתּוֹ מְיוּשֶּׁבֶת עָלָיו אַל יִתְפַּלֵּל, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּצָר אַל יוֹרֶה״. רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בְּיוֹמָא דְּרָתַח לָא מְצַלֵּי, אָמַר: ״בְּצָר אַל יוֹרֶה״ כְּתִיב. מָר עוּקְבָא בְּיוֹמָא דְשׁוּתָא לָא הֲוָה נָפֵיק לְבֵי דִינָא.
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi said Rav said: Anyone whose mind is unsettled should not pray, as it is stated: When distressed, one should not issue decisions. Rabbi Ḥanina, on a day that he was angry, not pray, he said that it is written: When distressed, one should not issue decisions. Mar Ukva, on a day of a south wind, would not venture out to the court,
llm_translation: Rav Chiya bar Ashe said in the name of Rav: Anyone whose mind is not settled should not pray, as it is stated: "In distress, do not teach." Rabbi Chanina on a day of strong wind did not go out, he said: "In distress, do not teach" is written. Mar Ukva on a day of rain did not go to the court.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: הִלְכְתָא בָּעֲיָא צִילּוּתָא כְּיוֹמָא דְאִסְתָּנָא. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אִי אָמְרָה לִי אֵם קָרֵיב כּוּתָּחָא — לָא תְּנַאי.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: halakha requires clarity, as a day a north wind Abaye said if my stepmother says to me: Bring kutaḥ , I can no study
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: The halacha requires the protection like the day it was given. Abaye said: If the mother said to me, "Bring the knife," do not argue.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אִי קְרַצְתַּן כִּינָּה לָא תְּנַאי. מָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבִינָא עֲבַדָה לֵיהּ אִמֵּיהּ שִׁבְעָה מָנֵי לְשִׁבְעָה יוֹמֵי.
human_translation: Rava said: If I am bitten by a louse, I can no learn the mother of Mar, son of Ravina, would prepare seven garments for him for the seven days
llm_translation: Rava said: If you have made a nest, do not remove it. Mar, son of Ravina, did it for his mother seven nests for seven days.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: לָא אִיבְּרִי לֵילְיָא אֶלָּא לְשִׁינְתָּא. אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: לָא אִיבְּרִי סֵיהֲרָא אֶלָּא לְגִירְסָא. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי זֵירָא: מְחַדְּדָן שְׁמַעְתָּךְ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: דִּימָמֵי נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: Night was created only for sleep. Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: The moon was created only for study said to Rabbi Zeira: Your teachings are sharp, he said to them: They were during the daytime
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: I did not interpret the night except for the tooth. Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: I did not interpret the moon except for the reading. They said to Rabbi Zeira: You have sharpened your hearing. He said to them: They are like blood.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ בַּרְתֵּיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא לְרַב חִסְדָּא: לָא בָּעֵי מָר מֵינַם פּוּרְתָּא? אֲמַר לַהּ: הַשְׁתָּא אָתוּ יוֹמֵי דַּאֲרִיכֵי וְקַטִּינֵי, וְנֵינוּם טוּבָא.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda’s daughter said to Rav Ḥisda, Doesn’t the Master wish to sleep a little? said to her: Days that are long but short will soon arrive, and we will sleep a lot.
llm_translation: She said to the son of Rav Ḥisda to Rav Ḥisda: Does the Master not want some beans? He said to her: Now the days are long and the nights are short, and they are good.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אֲנַן פּוֹעֲלֵי דִּימָמֵי אֲנַן. רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב יָזֵיף וּפָרַע.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: We, are day workers, Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov borrow and repay,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: We are workers of the south, we are. Rav Acha bar Yaakov will add and explain.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הַבָּא מִן הַדֶּרֶךְ, אַל יִתְפַּלֵּל שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וָאֶקְבְּצֵם אֶל הַנָּהָר הַבָּא אֶל אַחֲוָא וַנַּחֲנֶה שָׁם יָמִים שְׁלֹשָׁה וָאָבִינָה בָּעָם וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: One who returns from a journey should not pray for three days as it is stated: “And I gathered them together at the river that runs to Aḥava, and we encamped there for three days, and I inspected the people”
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: One who comes from the road, should not pray three days, as it is stated: "And I gathered them by the river that runs to Ahava, and we camped there for three days, and I observed the people."

hebrew_text: אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, כִּי אָתֵי בְּאוֹרְחָא, לָא מְצַלֵּי תְּלָתָא יוֹמֵי. שְׁמוּאֵל לָא מְצַלֵּי בְּבֵיתָא דְּאִית בֵּיהּ שִׁיכְרָא. רַב פָּפָּא לָא מְצַלֵּי בְּבֵיתָא דְּאִית בֵּיהּ הַרְסָנָא.
human_translation: Shmuel’s father, when he would return from his journey, would not pray three days, Shmuel would not pray in a house that contained an alcoholic beverage, Rav Pappa would not pray in a house that contained small fish,
llm_translation: Father of Shmuel, when he would come on the road, would not stay three days. Shmuel would not stay in a house that had beer. Rav Papa would not stay in a house that had straw.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: כׇּל הַמִּתְפַּתֶּה בְּיֵינוֹ — יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִדַּעַת קוֹנוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיָּרַח ה׳ אֶת רֵיחַ הַנִּיחוֹחַ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina said: Whoever is appeased by his wine, has in him the mind-set of his Creator, as it is stated: “And the Lord smelled the sweet savor,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: Anyone who indulges in wine - has in it knowledge of its Creator, as it is said: "And the Lord smelled the pleasing aroma, etc."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא: כׇּל הַמִּתְיַישֵּׁב בְּיֵינוֹ — יֵשׁ בּוֹ דַּעַת שִׁבְעִים זְקֵנִים. ״יַיִן״ נִיתַּן בְּשִׁבְעִים אוֹתִיּוֹת, וְ״סוֹד״ נִיתַּן בְּשִׁבְעִים אוֹתִיּוֹת. נִכְנַס יַיִן — יָצָא סוֹד.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya said: Anyone who remains settled after wine, has the mind-set of seventy Elders. Wine [ yayin was given in seventy letters, secret [ sod was given in seventy letters, wine entered a secret emerged.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya said: Anyone who indulges in wine - he has in him the understanding of seventy elders. "Wine" is given with seventy letters, and "secret" is given with seventy letters. When wine enters, the secret departs.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָנִין: לֹא נִבְרָא יַיִן אֶלָּא לְנַחֵם אֲבֵלִים וּלְשַׁלֵּם שָׂכָר לָרְשָׁעִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תְּנוּ שֵׁכָר לְאוֹבֵד וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanin said: Wine was created only in order to comfort mourners and to reward the wicked as it is stated: “Give strong drink to him that is ready to perish,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanin said: Wine was created only to comfort mourners and to reward the wicked, as it is stated: "Give strong drink to him that is ready to perish, and so on."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָנִין בַּר פָּפָּא: כׇּל שֶׁאֵין יַיִן נִשְׁפָּךְ בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ כַּמַּיִם — אֵינוֹ בִּכְלַל בְּרָכָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבֵרַךְ אֶת לַחְמְךָ וְאֶת מֵימֶיךָ״. מָה לֶחֶם שֶׁנִּיקָּח בְּכֶסֶף מַעֲשֵׂר — אַף מַיִם שֶׁנִּיקָּח בְּכֶסֶף מַעֲשֵׂר, וּמַאי נִיהוּ — יַיִן, וְקָא קָרֵי לֵיהּ מַיִם.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanin bar Pappa said: Anyone in whose house wine does not flow like water is not included blessing, as it is stated: “And He shall bless your bread and your water” Just as bread that may be purchased with tithe money, so water that may be purchased with tithe money. And what is that? wine, and calls it “water.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanin bar Papa said: Anywhere that wine does not spill within one's house like water - it is not included in the blessing, as it is stated: "And you shall bless your bread and your water." Just as bread that is purchased with silver from the tithe - so too water that is purchased with silver from the tithe. And what is the difference? - wine, and it is called water.

hebrew_text: אִי נִשְׁפָּךְ בְּבֵיתוֹ כַּמַּיִם — אִיכָּא בְּרָכָה, וְאִי לָא — לָא.
human_translation: if flows in house like water, there is a blessing, but if not, no
llm_translation: If it spilled in his house like water - there is a blessing, and if not - there is not.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעַאי, בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים אָדָם נִיכָּר: בְּכוֹסוֹ, וּבְכִיסוֹ וּבְכַעְסוֹ. וְאָמְרִי לֵיהּ אַף בְּשַׂחֲקוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elai said: In three matters a person’s ascertained; in his cup, in his pocket, and in his anger. And some say: also in his laughter.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ilai said, "In three things a person is recognized: by his cup, and by his pocket, and by his anger." And some say, "Also by his laughter."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגוֹי בַּפְּנִימִית, וְיִשְׂרָאֵל בַּחִיצוֹנָה. בָּא מַעֲשֶׂה לִפְנֵי רַבִּי, וְאָסַר, וְלִפְנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא, וְאָסַר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: a Jew and a gentile inner while Jew in the outer one. case came before Rabbi and he prohibited Rabbi Ḥiyya, and he prohibited
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Israel and a gentile in the inner chamber, and Israel in the outer chamber. A case came before Rabbi, and he prohibited it, and before Rabbi Chiya, and he prohibited it.

hebrew_text: יְתוּב רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף בְּשִׁילְהֵי פִּירְקֵיהּ דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת, וְיָתֵיב רַב שֵׁשֶׁת וְקָאָמַר: כְּמַאן אַמְרַהּ רַב לִשְׁמַעְתֵּיהּ, כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר. כַּרְכֵּישׁ רַבָּה רֵישֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef were sitting at the end of Rav Sheshet’s lecture, and Rav Sheshet sat and said: In accordance with whose did Rav say ruling of his, in accordance with Rabbi Meir, Rabba nodded his head
llm_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef were sitting in the study hall of Rav Sheshet, and Rav Sheshet was sitting and saying: "In whose name did Rav state this halakha? In the name of Rabbi Meir." Rabba nodded his head.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: תְּרֵי גַּבְרֵי רַבְרְבֵי כְּרַבָּנַן לִיטְעוֹ בְּהַאי מִילְּתָא? אִי כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, לְמָה לִי יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּחִיצוֹנָה?
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Would two great men like Sages, err in such a matter? If in accordance with Rabbi Meir, why do I a Jew in the outer
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Two men, Rabrabei, like Rabbanan, planted in this matter? If like Rabbi Meir, why do I need Israel on the outside?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא, מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה כָּךְ הָיָה, וְהָא בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב: פְּנִימִי בִּמְקוֹמוֹ מַהוּ? וְאָמַר לָהֶן: מוּתָּר.
human_translation: And if you say the incident that took place, took place in this way, Wasn’t a dilemma raised before Rav What is the inner with regard to his place? And he said to them: It is permitted
llm_translation: And if you will say, a case that was like this was like this, and this in it from Rav: "What is the inside in its place?" And he said to them: "Permitted."

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מַאי, כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב? הָאָמַר: עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ שְׁנֵי יִשְׂרְאֵלִים אוֹסְרִין זֶה עַל זֶה!
human_translation: Rather, what in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov? Didn’t say: unless there are two Jews prohibited for one another
llm_translation: And rather what, like Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov? He said: Until two Israelites prohibit one another!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּאָמַר: רֶגֶל הַמּוּתֶּרֶת בִּמְקוֹמָהּ — אוֹסֶרֶת שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹמָהּ.
human_translation: Rather, in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, who said: foot who is permitted in his place renders it prohibited not in its place.
llm_translation: Rather like Rabbi Akiva, who said: "A permitted foot in its place - prohibits even not in its place."

hebrew_text: לְמָה לִי גּוֹי? אֲפִילּוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל נָמֵי!
human_translation: why do I a gentile The Jew would also
llm_translation: "Why do I need a non-Jew? Even an Israelite is also sufficient!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: לְעוֹלָם כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב, וּכְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? כְּגוֹן שֶׁעֵירְבוּ, וְטַעְמָא דְּאִיכָּא גּוֹי דַּאֲסִיר, אֲבָל לֵיכָּא גּוֹי לָא אֲסִיר.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said Actually, in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov and in accordance with Rabbi Akiva And with what we are dealing here? where established an eiruv And the reason that there is a gentile who renders it prohibited but there is no gentile, it is not prohibited,
llm_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Always follow the opinions of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov and Rabbi Akiva. And here, what are we dealing with? For example, a case where they mixed wine, and the reason for the prohibition is because there is a non-Jew who is prohibited, but if there is no non-Jew, it is not prohibited.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מֵרַב: יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגוֹי בַּחִיצוֹנָה וְיִשְׂרָאֵל בַּפְּנִימִית מַהוּ? הָתָם טַעְמָא מִשּׁוּם דִּשְׁכִיחַ דְּדָיַיר, דְּמִירְתַת גּוֹי, וְסָבַר: הַשְׁתָּא אָתֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאָמַר לִי: יִשְׂרָאֵל דַּהֲוָה גַּבָּךְ הֵיכָא?
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer raised a dilemma before Rav a Jew and a gentile in the outer and a Jew in the inner one, what is There, the reason because it is common to live that gentile would be afraid as thinks Now, Jew might come and say to me: Jew who used to by you, where is
llm_translation: Requested of him Rabbi Eliezer from Rabbi: Israel and non-Jew in the outer, and Israel in the inner, what is it? There, the reason is because it is common for a tenant to be beneath a non-Jew, and he thought: now Israel will come and say to me, "Where was your back when Israel was here?"

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הָכָא, אָמֵינָא לֵיהּ: נְפַק אֲזַל לֵיהּ.
human_translation: However, here, I will say to him: He went out went his
llm_translation: But here, I say to him: "Go out and meet him."

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִילְמָא, הָכָא נָמֵי מִירְתַת, דְּסָבַר: הַשְׁתָּא אָתֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְחָזֵי לִי.
human_translation: Or perhaps here, too, would be afraid as he thinks Now, the Jew might come and see me
llm_translation: Or perhaps, here it is different, for he holds: "Now Israel comes and sees me."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״תֵּן לְחָכָם וְיֶחְכַּם עוֹד״.
human_translation: said to “Give to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser”
llm_translation: He said to him: "Give to a wise person, and he will become even wiser."

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ וְתַלְמִידֵי דְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אִיקְּלַעוּ לְהָהוּא פּוּנְדָּק, וְלָא הֲוָה שׂוֹכֵר, וַהֲוָה מַשְׂכִּיר.
human_translation: Reish Lakish and the students of Rabbi Ḥanina happened to a certain inn the tenant was not landlord was
llm_translation: Reish Lakish and the disciples of Rabbi Chanina arrived at that inn, and there was no innkeeper, so they rented it out.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ: מַהוּ לְמֵיגַר מִינֵּיהּ? כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּלָא מָצֵי מְסַלֵּיק לֵיהּ — לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ דְּלָא אָגְרִינָא. כִּי תִּיבְּעֵי — הֵיכָא דְּמָצֵי מְסַלֵּיק לֵיהּ.
human_translation: They said: What is to renting from him? Anywhere that cannot remove you not raise the dilemma, for they cannot rent Where you raise the dilemma where he can remove him.
llm_translation: They said: What is the law regarding removing something from its kind? Wherever it is not readily removed, one should not ask you to remove it. When one asks you to remove it, where it is readily removed.

hebrew_text: מַאי? כֵּיוָן דְּמָצֵי מְסַלֵּיק — אָגְרִינָא. אוֹ דִילְמָא, הַשְׁתָּא מִיהָא הָא לָא סַלְּקֵיהּ?
human_translation: What is since can remove they can rent Or perhaps now, in any case he has not removed him,
llm_translation: What? Since he found it slippery - he removes it. Or perhaps, now it is not slippery?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: נִשְׂכּוֹר, וְלִכְשֶׁנַּגִּיעַ אֵצֶל רַבּוֹתֵינוּ שֶׁבַּדָּרוֹם, נִשְׁאַל לָהֶן. אֲתוֹ שַׁיַּילּוּ לְרַבִּי אַפָּס, אָמַר לָהֶן: יָפֶה עֲשִׂיתֶם שֶׁשְּׂכַרְתֶּם.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said to them: Let us rent and when we arrive at our Sages in the South we shall ask them they came and asked Rabbi Afes, said to them: You acted well when you rented
llm_translation: He said to them Reish Lakish: "He rented, and when he arrived at our masters in the South, he was asked. He came and asked Rabbi Aḥa, he said to them: 'You did well that you rented.'"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר יוֹסֵף וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא וְרַבִּי אַסִּי אִיקְּלַעוּ לְהָהוּא פּוּנְדָּק דַּאֲתָא גּוֹי מָרֵי דְפוּנְדָּק בְּשַׁבְּתָא. אֲמַרוּ: מַהוּ לְמֵיגַר מִינֵּיהּ? שׂוֹכֵר כִּמְעָרֵב דָּמֵי — מָה מְעָרֵב מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם, אַף שׂוֹכֵר מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina bar Yosef and Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba and Rabbi Asi happened to a certain inn, and the gentile innkeeper, came on Shabbat. They said: What is to renting from him Is renting like making an eiruv ? just as one who establishes an eiruv while it is still day, so one who rents while it is still day.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina bar Yosef, Rabbi Chiya bar Abba, and Rabbi Assi happened upon that inn where a non-Jew, the innkeeper of the inn, had arrived on Shabbat. They said: What is the law regarding withdrawing from him? One may rent a room from him with evening payment - just as evening time is from the middle of the day, so too one may rent from him from the middle of the day.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִילְמָא שׂוֹכֵר כִּמְבַטֵּל רְשׁוּת דָּמֵי, מָה מְבַטֵּל רְשׁוּת וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת, אַף שׂוֹכֵר וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת?
human_translation: Or perhaps one who rents is like one who renounces domain; just as one who renounces domain even on Shabbat so one who rents even on Shabbat.
llm_translation: Perhaps one might say that a renter, like one who annuls a vow, nullifies the ownership of the money. Just as one nullifies ownership even on Shabbat, so too a renter, even on Shabbat?

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר יוֹסֵף אָמַר: נִשְׂכּוֹר, וְרַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר: לֹא נִשְׂכּוֹר, אֲמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: נִסְמוֹךְ עַל דִּבְרֵי זָקֵן וְנִשְׂכּוֹר. אֲתוֹ שַׁיַּילוּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אָמַר לָהֶן:
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina bar Yosef said: Let us rent, Rabbi Asi said: Let us not rent. Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said to them: Let us rely on the words of Elder, and rent. they came and asked Rabbi Yoḥanan he said to them:
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina bar Yosef said: "Niskor." And Rabbi Assi said: "Lo niskor." Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said to them: "Nismoch al divrei zaken ve niskor." They brought it before Rabbi Yochanan, and he said to them:

hebrew_text: יָפֶה עֲשִׂיתֶם שֶׁשְּׂכַרְתֶּם. תָּהוּ בָּהּ נְהַרְדָּעֵי: וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שׂוֹכֵר כִּמְעָרֵב דָּמֵי. מַאי לָאו: מָה מְעָרֵב מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם, אַף שׂוֹכֵר מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם!
human_translation: You acted well when you rented. of Neharde’a wondered Did Rabbi Yoḥanan say this? Didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say Renting is like establishing an eiruv ? What, is not Just as one establishes an eiruv while it is still day, so one rents while it is still day?
llm_translation: Beautifully you have made, for you have hired. Confusion in it, the Nehardea scholars. And who said so, Rabbi Yochanan? But didn't Rabbi Yochanan say: "One who hires is like one who buys with money." What is the reason? Just as buying is from the middle of the day, so too hiring is from the middle of the day!

hebrew_text: לָא, מָה מְעָרֵב וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּפָחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה, אַף שׂוֹכֵר בְּפָחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה. וּמָה מְעָרֵב אֲפִילּוּ שְׂכִירוֹ וּלְקִיטוֹ, אַף שׂוֹכֵר אֲפִילּוּ שְׂכִירוֹ וּלְקִיטוֹ.
human_translation: No, Just as one who establishes an eiruv even with less than the value of a peruta , so one who rents less than the value of a peruta . And just as one who establishes an eiruv even his hired laborer or harvester so one who rents but even his hired laborer or harvester
llm_translation: Not, what mixes even in less than the value of a prutah, also a renter in less than the value of a prutah. And what mixes even his hired worker and his gatherer, also a renter even his hired worker and his gatherer.

hebrew_text: וּמָה מְעָרֵב חֲמִשָּׁה שֶׁשְּׁרוּיִן בְּחָצֵר אַחַת — אֶחָד מְעָרֵב עַל יְדֵי כּוּלָּן, שׂוֹכֵר נָמֵי, חֲמִשָּׁה שֶׁשְּׁרוּיִן בְּחָצֵר אַחַת — אֶחָד שׂוֹכֵר עַל יְדֵי כּוּלָּן.
human_translation: And just as one who establishes an eiruv , five live in the same courtyard, one establish an eiruv on behalf of them all, so one who rents five live in the same courtyard one rent on behalf of them all.
llm_translation: And what is the case of five who are partners in one courtyard? One of them partners with all of them, renting half. Five who are partners in one courtyard? One rents on behalf of all of them.

hebrew_text: תָּהֵי בַּהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: מַאי תִּהְיָיא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר? אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: גַּבְרָא רַבָּה כְּרַבִּי זֵירָא לָא יָדַע מַאי תִּהְיָיא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר? קָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל רַבֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar wondered Rabbi Zeira said: What Rabbi Elazar’s wonder? Rav Sheshet said: such a great person as Rabbi Zeira did not know what of Rabbi Elazar’s wonder? He had difficulty with of his teacher, Shmuel.
llm_translation: Let it be in it, Rabbi Elazar. Rabbi Zeira said: What is the matter with Rabbi Elazar? Rav Sheshet said: A great man like Rabbi Zeira did not know what is the matter with Rabbi Elazar? It is difficult for him because of his teacher, Samuel.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאוֹסְרִין וּמְעָרְבִין — מְבַטְּלִין. מְעָרְבִין וְאֵין אוֹסְרִין, אוֹסְרִין וְאֵין מְעָרְבִין — אֵין מְבַטְּלִין.
human_translation: As Shmuel said: any place where render it prohibited for but they establish a eiruv renounce where establish an eiruv but they do not render it prohibited they render it prohibited for but they not establish an eiruv they not renounce
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "D'amar Shmuel: Kol makom she'osrin u'me'arvin - mevatlin. Me'arvin ve'ein osrin, osrin ve'ein me'arvin - ein mevatlin." English translation: "For Shmuel said: In every place where they forbid and mix - they nullify. They mix and do not forbid, they forbid and do not mix - they do not nullify."

hebrew_text: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאוֹסְרִין וּמְעָרְבִין — מְבַטְּלִין, כְּגוֹן שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת זוֹ לִפְנִים מִזּוֹ.
human_translation: any place where prohibited but they establish an eiruv , they may renounce such as two courtyards, one within the other.
llm_translation: Every place that they forbid and mix - nullify, such as two courtyards, one inside the other.

hebrew_text: מְעָרְבִין וְאֵין אוֹסְרִין — אֵין מְבַטְּלִין, כְּגוֹן שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת וּפֶתַח אֶחָד בֵּינֵיהֶן.
human_translation: where establish an eiruv but they do not render prohibited they not renounce where two courtyards that have a single opening between them.
llm_translation: We mix, but do not prohibit - we do not nullify, for example, two courtyards and one entrance between them.

hebrew_text: אוֹסְרִין וְאֵין מְעָרְבִין — אֵין מְבַטְּלִין. לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי, לָאו לְאֵתוֹיֵי גּוֹי?
human_translation: where they render prohibited but they not establish an eiruv what to include? Wasn’t it include a gentile
llm_translation: We prohibit and do not combine - we do not nullify. To what is this coming to teach us? Is it not coming to teach us about a non-Jew?

hebrew_text: וְאִי דַּאֲתָא מֵאֶתְמוֹל — לוֹגַר מֵאֶתְמוֹל!
human_translation: Now, if where arrived on the previous day, let him rent on the previous day.
llm_translation: And if he comes from yesterday - a Logar from yesterday!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו, דַּאֲתָא בְּשַׁבְּתָא, וְקָתָנֵי: אוֹסְרִין וְאֵין מְעָרְבִין, אֵין מְבַטְּלִין. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, is it not arrived on Shabbat, and is teaching: where they render prohibited but they not establish an eiruv together, they not renounce learn from this
llm_translation: Rather, no, that it comes on Shabbat, and it teaches: they prohibit and do not mix, they do not nullify. Hear from it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לָא שְׁמִיעַ לִי הָא שְׁמַעְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אַתְּ אֲמַרְתְּ נִיהֲלַן, וְאַהָא אֲמַרְתְּ נִיהֲלַן, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין בִּיטּוּל רְשׁוּת מֵחָצֵר לְחָצֵר.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: I have not heard this halakha Abaye said to him: You told to us. And it was with regard to this you told to us. As Shmuel said: There is no renunciation of rights from one courtyard to another.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: "I did not hear this teaching." Abaye said to him: "You said they are permitted, and now you say they are permitted, for Shmuel said: 'There is no nullification of domain from courtyard to courtyard.'"

hebrew_text: וְאֵין בִּיטּוּל רְשׁוּת בְּחוּרְבָּה.
human_translation: there is no renunciation of rights in a ruin.
llm_translation: And there is no nullification of ownership in a ruin.

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַרְתְּ לַן עֲלַהּ: כִּי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל אֵין בִּיטּוּל רְשׁוּת מֵחָצֵר לְחָצֵר, לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת וּפֶתַח אֶחָד בֵּינֵיהֶן. אֲבָל זוֹ לִפְנִים מִזּוֹ, מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁאוֹסְרִין זֶה עַל זֶה — מְבַטְּלִין.
human_translation: And you said to us with regard to When Shmuel said that there is no renouncing of rights from one courtyard to another, we said only two courtyards, that have a single opening between them. However, one within the other, since render each other prohibited they may renounce
llm_translation: And you said to us: Go up, for Shmuel said, "There is no nullification of domain from courtyard to courtyard," we only said this regarding two courtyards and one entrance between them. But this one inside of this one, since they prohibit one another - they nullify.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא אָמֵינָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין לָנוּ בְּעֵירוּבִין אֶלָּא כִּלְשׁוֹן מִשְׁנָתֵנוּ — ״אַנְשֵׁי חָצֵר״, וְלֹא אַנְשֵׁי חֲצֵירוֹת!
human_translation: said to I said that in the name of Shmuel? Didn’t Shmuel say: We may eiruvin only in accordance with the wording of the mishna, residents of a courtyard, but not the residents of courtyards
llm_translation: He said to him: Do I believe from the name of Shmuel the following? But Shmuel said: We only have Eruvin in our Mishnah language - "the men of the courtyard," not "the men of the courtyards!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כִּי אֲמַרְתְּ לַן אֵין לָנוּ בְּעֵירוּבִין אֶלָּא כִּלְשׁוֹן מִשְׁנָתֵנוּ — אַהָא אֲמַרְתְּ לַן: שֶׁהַמָּבוֹי לַחֲצֵירוֹת כֶּחָצֵר לַבָּתִּים.
human_translation: said to him: When you told us we may eiruvin only in accordance with the mishna, you said it to us with regard to the following That an alleyway in relation to courtyards is like a courtyard in relation to houses.
llm_translation: He said to him: When you said to us, "We only have Eruvin in the language of our Mishnah" — ah, you said to us: that an alleyway is like courtyards to houses.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין בִּיטּוּל רְשׁוּת מֵחָצֵר לְחָצֵר, וְאֵין בִּיטּוּל רְשׁוּת בְּחוּרְבָּה. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: יֵשׁ בִּיטּוּל רְשׁוּת מֵחָצֵר לְחָצֵר, וְיֵשׁ בִּיטּוּל רְשׁוּת בְּחוּרְבָּה.
human_translation: the matter itself, Shmuel said: There is no renunciation of rights from one courtyard to another, and there is no renunciation of rights in a ruin. But Rabbi Yoḥanan said: There is renunciation of rights from one courtyard to another, and there is renunciation of rights in a ruin.
llm_translation: The body, said Shmuel: there is no nullification of domain from courtyard to courtyard, and there is no nullification of domain in a ruin. And Rabbi Yochanan said: there is nullification of domain from courtyard to courtyard, and there is nullification of domain in a ruin.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן מֵחָצֵר לְחָצֵר, בְּהָא קָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, מִשּׁוּם דְּהָא תַּשְׁמִישְׁתָּא לְחוּד וְהָא תַּשְׁמִישְׁתָּא לְחוּד. אֲבָל חוּרְבָּה, דְּתַשְׁמִישְׁתָּא חֲדָא לְתַרְוַויְיהוּ. אֵימָא: מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן.
human_translation: necessary As, if it had taught from one courtyard to another, with regard to this Shmuel said because the use alone and the use alone. However, a ruin, where there is one use for both I say concedes to Rabbi Yoḥanan.
llm_translation: The matter is, for if we were to hear from courtyard to courtyard, in this case Shmuel is saying, because this service is separate and that service is separate. But a ruin, since its service is for both together. Say: Let Rabbi Yochanan agree with him.

hebrew_text: וְכִי אִתְּמַר בְּהָא, בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אֲבָל בְּהָךְ מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לִשְׁמוּאֵל, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if it was stated with regard to with regard to this Rabbi Yoḥanan stated but with regard to the other he concedes to Shmuel. necessary
llm_translation: And when it was stated in this case, in this case Rabbi Yochanan said, but in that case they agree with Shmuel, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָא דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל אֵין בִּיטּוּל רְשׁוּת מֵחָצֵר לְחָצֵר, לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בִּשְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת וּפֶתַח אֶחָד בֵּינֵיהֶן, אֲבָל שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת זוֹ לִפְנִים מִזּוֹ, מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁאוֹסְרִין — מְבַטְּלִין.
human_translation: Abaye said: that which Shmuel said, there is no renunciation of rights from one courtyard to another, we said only to two courtyards, that have a single opening between them. However, two courtyards, one within the other, since render prohibited they may renounce
llm_translation: Abaye said: This that Shmuel said, "There is no nullification of domain from courtyard to courtyard," we only said this regarding two courtyards with one entrance between them. But two courtyards, one inside the other, since they restrict - they nullify.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת זוֹ לִפְנִים מִזּוֹ, פְּעָמִים מְבַטְּלִין וּפְעָמִים אֵין מְבַטְּלִין. כֵּיצַד? נָתְנוּ עֵירוּבָן בַּחִיצוֹנָה וְשָׁכַח אֶחָד, בֵּין מִן הַפְּנִימִית וּבֵין מִן הַחִיצוֹנָה, וְלֹא עֵירַב — שְׁתֵּיהֶן אֲסוּרוֹת.
human_translation: Rava said: Even two courtyards, one within the other, sometimes renounce and sometimes they not renounce How placed their eiruv in the outer and one forgot whether of the inner or of the outer and did not establish an eiruv prohibited both
llm_translation: Rava said: Even if two courtyards, one within the other, sometimes nullify and sometimes do not nullify. How so? If they placed their Eruv in the outer one and forgot one, whether from the inner one or from the outer one, and did not make an Eruv - both are prohibited.

hebrew_text: נָתְנוּ עֵירוּבָן בַּפְּנִימִית, וְשָׁכַח אֶחָד מִן הַפְּנִימִית וְלֹא עֵירַב — שְׁתֵּיהֶן אֲסוּרוֹת.
human_translation: placed their eiruv in the inner If of the inner forgot and did not establish an eiruv , both prohibited.
llm_translation: They placed their Eruv in the inner courtyard, and one of them forgot to participate in the inner courtyard and did not participate - both of them are prohibited.

hebrew_text: שָׁכַח אֶחָד מִן הַחִיצוֹנָה וְלֹא עֵירַב — פְּנִימִית מוּתֶּרֶת וְחִיצוֹנָה אֲסוּרָה.
human_translation: if a of the outer forgot and did not establish an eiruv , permitted the inner and prohibited the outer
llm_translation: One forgot from the outer and did not combine - the inner is permitted and the outer is forbidden.

hebrew_text: נָתְנוּ עֵירוּבָן בַּחִיצוֹנָה וְשָׁכַח אֶחָד, בֵּין מִן הַפְּנִימִית וּבֵין מִן הַחִיצוֹנָה, וְלֹא עֵירַב — שְׁתֵּיהֶן אֲסוּרוֹת. הַאי בַּר פְּנִימִית, לְמַאן נִיבַטֵּיל? לִיבַטֵּיל לִבְנֵי פְנִימִית — לֵיתָא לְעֵרוּבַיְיהוּ גַּבַּיְיהוּ. לִיבַטֵּיל לִבְנֵי חִיצוֹנָה — אֵין בִּטּוּל רְשׁוּת מֵחָצֵר לְחָצֵר!
human_translation: placed their eiruv in the outer and one forgot whether of the inner or of the outer and did not establish an eiruv prohibited both That resident of the inner in favor of whom can he renounce Let him renounce in favor of the residents of the inner their eiruv is not with them Let him renounce in favor of the residents of the outer there is no renunciation of rights from one courtyard to another.
llm_translation: They placed their Eruv in the outer courtyard, and one of them forgot, whether from the inner or from the outer, and did not make an Eruv - both are prohibited. This one in the inner courtyard, for whom should he nullify? If he nullifies for the residents of the inner courtyard, he nullifies for his own benefit. If he nullifies for the residents of the outer courtyard, the domain is not nullified from courtyard to courtyard!

hebrew_text: הַאי בַּר חִיצוֹנָה לְמַאן נְבַטֵּיל, לִיבַטֵּיל לִבְנֵי חִיצוֹנָה — אִיכָּא פְּנִימִית דְּאָסְרָה עֲלַיְיהוּ. לִיבַטֵּיל לִבְנֵי פְּנִימִית — אֵין בִּיטּוּל רְשׁוּת מֵחָצֵר לְחָצֵר.
human_translation: that resident of the outer in favor of whom can he renounce Let him renounce in favor of the residents of the outer there is the inner that renders them prohibited Let him renounce in favor of the residents of the inner there is no renunciation of rights from one courtyard to another.
llm_translation: This outer courtyard, for whom do we nullify it? To nullify it for the residents of the outer courtyard - there is an inner courtyard that prohibits carrying for them. To nullify it for the residents of the inner courtyard - there is no nullification of the domain from courtyard to courtyard.

hebrew_text: נָתְנוּ עֵירוּבָן בַּפְּנִימִית, וְשָׁכַח אֶחָד מִן הַפְּנִימִית וְלֹא עֵירַב — שְׁתֵּיהֶן אֲסוּרוֹת. הַאי בַּר פְּנִימִית לְמַאן נְבַטֵּיל? לִיבַטֵּיל לִבְנֵי הַפְּנִימִית — אִיכָּא חִיצוֹנָה דְּאָסְרָה עֲלַיְיהוּ. לִיבַטֵּיל לִבְנֵי חִיצוֹנָה — אֵין בִּיטּוּל רְשׁוּת מֵחָצֵר לְחָצֵר.
human_translation: placed their eiruv in the inner and a of the inner forgot and did not establish an eiruv , prohibited both That resident of the inner in favor of whom can he renounce Let him renounce in favor of the residents of the inner there is the outer that renders them prohibited Let him renounce in favor of the residents of the outer there is no renunciation of rights from one courtyard to another.
llm_translation: They placed their Eruv in the inner courtyard, and one of them forgot to participate in the inner courtyard and did not participate - both courtyards are prohibited. This inner courtyard, to whom does it belong? To the residents of the inner courtyard - there is an external courtyard that prohibits them. To the residents of the external courtyard - there is no nullification of domain from courtyard to courtyard.

hebrew_text: שָׁכַח אֶחָד מִן הַחִיצוֹנָה וְלֹא עֵירַב — וַדַּאי פְּנִימִית מוּתֶּרֶת, דְּאָחֲדָא דַּשָּׁא, וּמִשְׁתַּמְּשָׁא, וְחִיצוֹנָה אֲסוּרָה.
human_translation: if of the outer forgot and did not establish an eiruv , certainly permitted inner as can close the door and use However, prohibited the outer
llm_translation: He forgot one of the inner courtyards and did not combine it with an eruv - certainly the inner courtyard is permitted, for it is like one domain, and they can carry items and the outer courtyard is prohibited.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְרָבָא: וְכִי שָׁכַח אֶחָד מִן הַפְּנִימִית וְלֹא עֵירַב אַמַּאי שְׁתֵּיהֶן אֲסוּרוֹת, לְבַטֵּיל בַּר פְּנִימִית לִבְנֵי פְּנִימִית, וְתֵיתֵי חִיצוֹנָה וְתִשְׁתְּרֵי בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ!
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rava: And if a of the inner forgot and did not establish an eiruv , why prohibited both Let the resident of the inner renounce in favor of the residents of the inner courtyard, and let the outer come and be permitted with them.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua to Rava: If one forgot one of the inner loaves and did not mix the dough, why are both of them forbidden? Nullify the inner loaf for the inner loaves, and bring the outer loaf and they will be permitted together!

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּאָמַר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְבַטֵּל רְשׁוּת לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד? כִּי קָאָמֵינָא לְרַבָּנַן, דְּאָמְרִי: צָרִיךְ לְבַטֵּל לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד!
human_translation: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, who said: It is not necessary to renounce rights in favor of each and every when I spoke, in accordance with the the Rabbis, who say: It is necessary to renounce in favor of each and every
llm_translation: As whose — as Rabbi Eliezer, who said: Does one not need to annul permission for each and every one? For I am saying to the Rabbis, who say: One must annul for each and every one!

hebrew_text: רַב חִסְדָּא וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת כִּי פָּגְעִי בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי — רַב חִסְדָּא מִרַתְעָן שִׂיפְווֹתֵיהּ מִמַּתְנְיָיתָא דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת, וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת מִרְתַע כּוּלֵּיהּ גּוּפֵיהּ מִפִּלְפּוּלֵיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא.
human_translation: when Rav Ḥisda and Rav Sheshet would meet each other, Rav Ḥisda’s lips would tremble from the teachings of Rav Sheshet. Rav Sheshet’s entire body would shake from Rav Ḥisda’s sharpness,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda and Rav Sheshet, when they met in the presence of Haddad, Rav Ḥisda covered his hands with the cloak of Rav Sheshet, and Rav Sheshet covered his entire body with the cloak of Rav Ḥisda.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: שְׁנֵי בָתִּים מִשְּׁנֵי צִידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים וּבָאוּ גּוֹיִם וְהִקִּיפוּם מְחִיצָה בְּשַׁבָּת, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda raised a dilemma before Rav Sheshet: two houses on two sides of a public domain, and gentiles came and enclosed them a partition on Shabbat, what is
llm_translation: Requested of him Rav Ḥisdah from Rav Sheshet: Two houses from two sides of the public domain, and gentiles came and surrounded them with a partition on Shabbat, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: אַלִּיבָּא דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין בִּיטּוּל רְשׁוּת מֵחָצֵר לְחָצֵר, לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ. הַשְׁתָּא דְּאִי בָּעוּ לְעָרוֹבֵי מֵאֶתְמוֹל מָצוּ מְעָרְבִי — אָמְרַתְּ ״אֵין בִּיטּוּל רְשׁוּת מֵחָצֵר לְחָצֵר״, הָכָא דְּאִי בָּעוּ לְעָרוֹבֵי מֵאֶתְמוֹל לָא מָצוּ מְעָרְבִי — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?!
human_translation: In accordance with the one who said there is no renouncing of rights from one courtyard to another, you have no dilemma, Now, if where had they wanted to establish an eiruv yesterday they could have established an eiruv , you say there is no renouncing of rights from one courtyard to another, here, where had they wanted to establish an eiruv yesterday they could not have established an eiruv , all the more so not
llm_translation: In the matter of one who says there is no nullification of domain from courtyard to courtyard, do not accept it. Now, if they came to make an eruv from yesterday, they found an eruv - you say "there is no nullification of domain from courtyard to courtyard," but here, if they came to make an eruv from yesterday and did not find an eruv - all the more so?!

hebrew_text: כִּי תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ אַלִּיבָּא דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר ״יֵשׁ בִּיטּוּל רְשׁוּת מֵחָצֵר לְחָצֵר״. הָתָם, דְּאִי בָּעוּ לְעָרוֹבֵי מֵאֶתְמוֹל מָצוּ מְעָרְבִי — בַּטּוֹלֵי נָמֵי מָצֵי מְבַטֵּל — אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּלָא מָצוּ מְעָרְבִי מֵאֶתְמוֹל — בַּטּוֹלֵי נָמֵי לָא מָצֵי מְבַטֵּל.
human_translation: Where you have a dilemma is in accordance with the one who said there is renouncing of rights from one courtyard to another, there, where had they wanted to establish an eiruv yesterday they could have established an eiruv they can also renounce But here, where they could not have established an eiruv yesterday one not renounce rights either.
llm_translation: When you want to argue with someone who says, "There is annulment of domain from courtyard to courtyard," the case there is, if they wanted to make an eruv from yesterday, they found an eruv - the one who says annulment is effective, annuls it. But here, since they did not find an eruv from yesterday, the one who says annulment is not effective, cannot annul it.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִילְמָא לָא שְׁנָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵין מְבַטְּלִין.
human_translation: Or perhaps no difference said to one not renounce
llm_translation: Perhaps it is not different. He said to him: We do not nullify.

hebrew_text: מֵת גּוֹי בְּשַׁבָּת מַהוּ?
human_translation: and the gentile died on Shabbat, what is
llm_translation: Deceased gentile on Shabbat, what is the law?

hebrew_text: אַלִּיבָּא דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר שׂוֹכְרִין — לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ: הַשְׁתָּא תַּרְתֵּי עָבְדִינַן, חֲדָא מִיבַּעְיָא!
human_translation: In accordance with the one who said one rent you have no dilemma. Now we perform two is necessary one
llm_translation: In the matter of who says "we rent" - do not ask: now we have two servants, one is enough!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כִּי תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ אַלִּיבָּא דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין שׂוֹכְרִין. תַּרְתֵּי הוּא דְּלָא עָבְדִינַן, הָא חֲדָא — עָבְדִינַן, אוֹ דִילְמָא לָא שְׁנָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנִי אוֹמֵר מְבַטְּלִין, וְהַמְנוּנָא אָמַר אֵין מְבַטְּלִין.
human_translation: Rather, there is a dilemma in accordance with the one who said they not rent it is two that we not perform, however, one we perform; or perhaps no difference said to I say one renounc while Hamnuna said one not renounce
llm_translation: Rather, when you are asked, according to whose opinion do we not rent? There are two that we do not rent, this one we do rent, or perhaps it is not different. He said to him: I say we nullify, and the count said we do not nullify.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: גּוֹי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ פֶּתַח אַרְבָּעָה עַל אַרְבָּעָה פָּתוּחַ לְבִקְעָה, אֲפִילּוּ מַכְנִיס וּמוֹצִיא גְּמַלִּים וּקְרוֹנוֹת כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ דֶּרֶךְ מָבוֹי, אֵין אוֹסֵר עַל בְּנֵי מָבוֹי.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: a gentile who has entrance four by four opens into a valley, even if all day he brings camels and wagons in and out by way of the alleyway, he does not render it prohibited for the residents of the alleyway
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: A non-Jew who has a doorway measuring four by four cubits opening into a courtyard, even if he brings in and takes out camels and wagons all day long, it is not considered a prohibition for the residents of the courtyard.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? בְּפִיתְחָא דִּמְיַחַד לֵיהּ, בְּהָהוּא נִיחָא לֵיהּ.
