If the two outer established an eiruv with the middle one, it is permitted with and it is permitted with However, it is prohibited the two outer with each other,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Shimon said: What is the matter comparable to? To three courtyards that are open one to another and open to the public domain. If the two outer courtyards made an eruv with the middle one, it is permitted with them, and they are permitted with it, but if the two outer courtyards made an eruv with each other, they are prohibited with each other.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם קָתָנֵי: שְׁתַּיִם הַחִיצוֹנוֹת אֲסוּרוֹת, הָכָא קָתָנֵי: אֵין צְרִיכִין לְעָרֵב כְּלָל!
human_translation: Abaye said to him: Are comparable? There it teaches: It is prohibited the two outer here it teaches: They need not establish an eiruv ,
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye: Who is similar? There it teaches: The two outer ones are forbidden, here it teaches: We do not need to mix at all!

hebrew_text: מַאי ״אֵין צְרִיכִין לְעָרֵב״ — שְׁכֵנִים בַּהֲדֵי בַּעַל הַבַּיִת, אֲבָל שְׁכֵנִים בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי — צְרִיכִין לְעָרֵב.
human_translation: What is they need not establish an eiruv ? neighbors together with the homeowner, But the neighbors with each other, they must establish an eiruv
llm_translation: "What is the meaning of 'neighbors do not need to make an Eruv'? — Neighbors in the presence of the homeowner, but neighbors who are independent of each other — need to make an Eruv."

hebrew_text: וְרַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְרַבָּנַן בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי וְרַבָּנַן קָא מִיפַּלְגִי. דִּתְנַן: שֶׁמֶן שֶׁצָּף עַל גַּבֵּי יַיִן, וְנָגַע טְבוּל יוֹם בְּשֶׁמֶן — לֹא פָּסַל אֶלָּא שֶׁמֶן בִּלְבַד, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי אוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵיהֶן חִיבּוּרִין זֶה לָזֶה.
human_translation: And Rav Yosef said: Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis disagree about the dispute between Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri and the Rabbis. As we learned oil was floating on the surface of wine, and one who immersed during the day, touched the oil, he disqualified only the oil alone. And Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri says: They are both connected to each other
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis are in a dispute regarding the case of Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri, and the Rabbis are divided. For it was taught: If oil floated on top of wine, and a tevul yom touched it with oil - it only disqualifies the oil alone. And Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri says: Both are considered mixed with each other.

hebrew_text: רַבָּנַן — כְּרַבָּנַן, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן — כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי.
human_translation: The Rabbis is in accordance with the Rabbis and Rabbi Shimon is in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri,
llm_translation: The Sages — like the Sages, and Rabbi Shimon — like Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן תַּדַּאי אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה צְרִיכִין לְעָרֵב. וַאֲפִילּוּ לָזֶה בְּיַיִן וְלָזֶה בְּיַיִן?
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Eliezer ben Taddai says: both this and that they must establish an eiruv . even with this one in wine and with the one in wine?
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer ben Taddai says: Both this one and this one need to participate in the Eruv. Even if this one with wine and this one with wine?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: זֶה בָּא בִּלְגִינוֹ וְשָׁפַךְ, וָזֶה בָּא בִּלְגִינוֹ וְשָׁפַךְ — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּהָוֵי עֵירוּב.
human_translation: Rabba said: this one came with his jug and poured and the one came with his jug and poured everyone agrees that it is a eiruv ,
llm_translation: Rabba said: This one comes with his Eruv and pours, and this one comes with his Eruv and pours - everyone agrees that it is considered an Eruv.

hebrew_text: כִּי פְּלִיגִי כְּגוֹן שֶׁלָּקְחוּ חָבִית שֶׁל יַיִן בְּשׁוּתָּפוּת, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן תַּדַּאי סָבַר: אֵין בְּרֵירָה, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: יֵשׁ בְּרֵירָה.
human_translation: Where they disagree where they bought a barrel of wine in partnership. Rabbi Eliezer ben Taddai holds: There is no retroactive clarification, But the Rabbis hold that there is retroactive clarification,
llm_translation: When they disputed, such as when they took a barrel of wine in partnership, Rabbi Eliezer ben Taddai holds: there is no choice, and the Rabbis hold: there is a choice.

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן תַּדַּאי וְרַבָּנַן בְּסוֹמְכִין עַל שִׁיתּוּף בִּמְקוֹם עֵירוּב קָמִיפַּלְגִי.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said Rabbi Eliezer ben Taddai and the Rabbis disagree about rely on a merging instead of an eiruv ,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Rabbi Eliezer ben Taddai and the Rabbis disagree regarding reliance on a partnership in the place of an eruv.

hebrew_text: דְּמָר סָבַר: אֵין סוֹמְכִין, וּמָר סָבַר: סוֹמְכִין.
human_translation: As Sage, holds may not rely And Sage, maintains may rely
llm_translation: Mar believes: we do not rely, and Mar believes: we rely.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר. וְאָמַר רַב בְּרוֹנָא אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן תַּדַּאי. מַאי טַעְמָא, לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּחַד טַעְמָא הוּא?
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: From where do I say this, As Rav Yehuda said Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Meir, And Rav Beruna said Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Taddai, What is the reason Is it not because the rationale one
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: From where do I know to say to her, as Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The halakha is like Rabbi Meir. And Rav Barona said in the name of Rav: The halakha is like Rabbi Eliezer ben Dadai. What is the reason, is it not because it is one reason?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְאִי חַד טַעְמָא, תַּרְתֵּי הִילְכְתָא לְמָה לִי?! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּלָא עָבְדִינַן כִּתְרֵי חוּמְרֵי בְּעֵירוּבִין.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: But if it is one reason, why do I two rulings? this teach us that we do not act in accordance with two stringencies in eiruv .
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: And if one reason, two conclusions, why do I need them?! Here it is evident to us that we do not make two measures of dough for Eruvin.

hebrew_text: מַאי רַבִּי מֵאִיר וּמַאי רַבָּנַן? דְּתַנְיָא: מְעָרְבִין בַּחֲצֵירוֹת בְּפַת, וְאִם רָצוּ לְעָרֵב בְּיַיִן — אֵין מְעָרְבִין. מִשְׁתַּתְּפִין בְּמָבוֹי בְּיַיִן, וְאִם רָצוּ לְהִשְׁתַּתֵּף בְּפַת — מִשְׁתַּתְּפִין.
human_translation: What Rabbi Meir, and what the Rabbis? As it was taught One establish an eiruv with bread between courtyards but if one wanted to establish an eiruv with wine, one not establish an eiruv One merge into an alleyway with wine, and if one wanted to establish a merging with bread, one merge
llm_translation: What is the opinion of Rabbi Meir and what is the opinion of the Rabbis? For it was taught: One may combine food in courtyards with bread, but if they wished to combine with wine - they may not combine. They may participate in an alleyway with wine, and if they wished to participate with bread - they may participate.

hebrew_text: מְעָרְבִין בַּחֲצֵירוֹת וּמִשְׁתַּתְּפִין בְּמָבוֹי שֶׁלֹּא לְשַׁכֵּחַ תּוֹרַת עֵירוּב מִן הַתִּינוֹקוֹת, שֶׁיֹּאמְרוּ: אֲבוֹתֵינוּ לֹא עֵירְבוּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אוֹ מְעָרְבִין אוֹ מִשְׁתַּתְּפִין.
human_translation: does establish an eiruv between courtyards and merge into an alleyway? as not to cause the category of eiruv to be forgotten by the children, as say: Our fathers never established an eiruv . the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: either establish an eiruv or merge
llm_translation: We combine in courtyards and participate in alleys so as not to forget the law of the Eruv from the children, that they may say: "Our fathers did not make an Eruv," the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: Either combine or participate.

hebrew_text: פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי נְחוּמִי וְרַבָּה, חַד אָמַר: בְּפַת דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּבַחֲדָא סַגִּי, כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּיַיִן.
human_translation: Rabbi Naḥumi and Rabba disagreed about One said: of bread, everyone agrees that one, is enough. When they disagree of wine,
llm_translation: They disputed it, Rabbi Neḥumi and Rabba. One said: In the case of a loaf of bread, they do not dispute, for it is a sufficient quantity, but they dispute in the case of wine.

hebrew_text: וְחַד אָמַר: בְּיַיִן דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּבָעֵינַן תַּרְתֵּי, כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּפַת.
human_translation: And one said: of wine, everyone agrees that two are required, When they disagree with bread:
llm_translation: And one said: In wine, which is universally accepted, they do not argue, for we require two, as they argue in bread.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים אוֹ מְעָרְבִין אוֹ מִשְׁתַּתְּפִין. מַאי לָאו: אוֹ מְעָרְבִין בְּחָצֵר בְּפַת, אוֹ מִשְׁתַּתְּפִין בְּמָבוֹי בְּיַיִן.
human_translation: raises an objection And the Rabbis say: either establish an eiruv or a merging What, not either establishes an eiruv in the courtyard with bread or a merging in the alleyway with wine,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: A question was raised: And the sages say, "or they combine or they participate." What is the reason that it is not sufficient to say: "or they combine in a courtyard with bread, or they participate in an alleyway with wine."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב, הָכִי קָאָמַר: אוֹ מְעָרְבִין בְּחָצֵר בְּפַת — וּמוּתָּרִין כָּאן וְכָאן, אוֹ מִשְׁתַּתְּפִין בְּמָבוֹי בְּפַת — וּמוּתָּרִין כָּאן וְכָאן.
human_translation: Rav Giddel said that Rav said saying as follows: either establish an eiruv in the courtyard with bread, and be permitted here, and there, or establish a merging in the alleyway with bread, and be permitted here, and there,
llm_translation: Rav Giddel said in the name of Rav: Thus he said: Whether they join together in a courtyard with bread - and they are permitted both here and there, or they participate in an alleyway with bread - and they are permitted both here and there.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר. וְרַב הוּנָא אָמַר: מִנְהָג כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: נָהֲגוּ הָעָם כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said that Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Meir. And Rav Huna said: the custom is in accordance with Rabbi Meir. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: the people were accustomed in accordance with Rabbi Meir,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The halacha is according to Rabbi Meir. And Rav Huna said: The custom is according to Rabbi Meir. And Rabbi Yochanan said: The people have practiced according to Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חֲמִשָּׁה חֲבוּרוֹת שֶׁשָּׁבְתוּ בִּטְרַקְלִין אֶחָד, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: עֵירוּב לְכׇל חֲבוּרָה וַחֲבוּרָה, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: עֵירוּב אֶחָד לְכוּלָּן.
human_translation: five groups who spent Shabbat in one hall [ teraklin ] Beit Shammai say: An eiruv for each and every group, And Beit Hillel say: One eiruv for all of them,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Five groups that resided in one courtyard with one entrance, Beit Shammai says: Each group must make an eruv separately, and Beit Hillel says: One eruv is sufficient for all of them.

hebrew_text: וּמוֹדִים בִּזְמַן שֶׁמִּקְצָתָן שְׁרוּיִין בַּחֲדָרִים אוֹ בַּעֲלִיּוֹת, שֶׁהֵן צְרִיכִין עֵירוּב לְכׇל חֲבוּרָה וַחֲבוּרָה.
human_translation: And concede when some of them occupy rooms or upper stories, they require eiruv for each and every group,
llm_translation: And they agree in a case where some of them are residing in rooms or in courtyards, that they require an eruv for each group and group.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מַחְלוֹקֶת בִּמְסִיפָס, אֲבָל בִּמְחִיצָה עֲשָׂרָה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל עֵירוּב לְכׇל חֲבוּרָה וַחֲבוּרָה. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אַף בִּמְסִיפָס מַחְלוֹקֶת.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: dispute with a partition of pegs [ mesifas ]. However, with partition ten all agree eiruv for each and every group, Some say Rav Naḥman said Even with a partition of pegs, dispute
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Rav Nachman: Dispute in M'sifas, but in Mechitzah ten — words of all Eiruv to all group and group. Some say, said Rav Nachman: Also in M'sifas dispute.

hebrew_text: פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּרַבִּי. חַד אָמַר: מַחְלוֹקֶת בִּמְחִיצוֹת הַמַּגִּיעוֹת לַתִּקְרָה, אֲבָל מְחִיצוֹת שֶׁאֵין מַגִּיעוֹת לַתִּקְרָה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל עֵירוּב אֶחָד לְכוּלָּן. וְחַד אָמַר: מַחְלוֹקֶת בִּמְחִיצוֹת שֶׁאֵין מַגִּיעוֹת לַתִּקְרָה, אֲבָל מְחִיצוֹת הַמַּגִּיעוֹת לַתִּקְרָה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל צְרִיכִין עֵירוּב לְכׇל חֲבוּרָה וַחֲבוּרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya and Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi disagreed about One said: dispute is with regard to partitions that reach the ceiling, but partitions that do not reach the ceiling, all agree one eiruv for all of them, And one said: dispute is with regard to partitions that do not reach the ceiling, but partitions that reach the ceiling, all agree they require eiruv for each and every group.
llm_translation: Dispute in it Rabbi Chiya and Rabbi Shimon the son of Rabbi. One said: Dispute in partitions that reach the ceiling, but partitions that do not reach the ceiling - all agree that one eruv is effective for all of them. And one said: Dispute in partitions that do not reach the ceiling, but partitions that reach the ceiling - all agree that an eruv is needed for each group and group.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַסַּבָּר: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל עַל מְחִיצוֹת הַמַּגִּיעוֹת לַתִּקְרָה שֶׁצְּרִיכִין עֵירוּב לְכׇל חֲבוּרָה וַחֲבוּרָה. עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ — עַל מְחִיצוֹת שֶׁאֵין מַגִּיעוֹת לַתִּקְרָה, שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: עֵירוּב לְכׇל חֲבוּרָה וַחֲבוּרָה, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: עֵירוּב אֶחָד לְכוּלָּן.
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi Yehuda the Keen hasabbar said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree about partitions that reach the ceiling, as they require eiruv for each and every group. With regard to what did they disagree? partitions that do not reach the ceiling, as Beit Shammai say: eiruv for each and every group, and Beit Hillel say: One eiruv for all of them.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: A question was raised: Rabbi Yehuda HaSavar said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel do not disagree regarding partitions that reach the ceiling, for which an eruv is needed for each group and group. What do they disagree about? They disagree about partitions that do not reach the ceiling. Beit Shammai says: An eruv for each group and group, and Beit Hillel says: One eruv for all of them.

hebrew_text: לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בִּמְחִיצוֹת הַמַּגִּיעוֹת לַתִּקְרָה מַחְלוֹקֶת — תְּיוּבְתָּא, וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר בִּמְחִיצוֹת שֶׁאֵין מַגִּיעוֹת לַתִּקְרָה מַחְלוֹקֶת — סִיַּיעְתָּא. לְהַךְ לִישָּׁנָא דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מַחְלוֹקֶת בִּמְסִיפָס — תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: According to the one who said partitions that reach the ceiling dispute, conclusive refutation. And according to the one who said partitions that do not reach the ceiling dispute, support. to that version Rav Naḥman said: dispute with a mesifas , a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: Regarding one who says that in partitions that reach the ceiling there is a dispute - it is a stronger argument, and regarding one who says that in partitions that do not reach the ceiling there is a dispute - it is a weaker argument. This supports what Rav Nachman said: a dispute in a balcony - it is a stronger argument.

hebrew_text: לְהַךְ לִישָּׁנָא דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אַף בִּמְסִיפָס מַחְלוֹקֶת, לֵימָא תִּהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא?
human_translation: to that version Rav Naḥman said: dispute even with a mesifas , shall we say is a refutation?
llm_translation: To strike to the other side that said Rav Nachman: Even in Mispas Machloket, should we say it is a contradiction?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב נַחְמָן: פְּלִיגִי בִּמְחִיצָה, וְהוּא הַדִּין בִּמְסִיפָס. וְהַאי דְּקָא מִיפַּלְגִי בִּמְחִיצָה — לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחָן דְּבֵית הִלֵּל.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to you: They disagreed about a partition, and the same is true of a partition of pegs. And that they disagree with regard to a partition to convey to you the far-reaching nature of Beit Hillel.
llm_translation: He said to you, Rav Nachman: Dispute in a partition, and it is the same in a threshold. And this one who disputes in a partition - to inform you of the strength of the House of Hillel.

hebrew_text: וְלִיפְלְגִי בִּמְסִיפָס לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחָן דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי! כֹּחַ דְּהֶיתֵּרָא עָדִיף.
human_translation: let them disagree about a mesifas , inform you of the strength of Beit Shammai. preferable the strength of a permissive
llm_translation: To split in M'sifas to inform you the strength of the House of Shammai! The strength of the more lenient is preferable.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַסַּבָּר.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said that Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda the Keen,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said in the name of Rav: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda HaSavar.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי דַּיְקָא, דְּקָתָנֵי: וּמוֹדִים בִּזְמַן שֶׁמִּקְצָתָן שְׁרוּיִין בַּחֲדָרִים וּבַעֲלִיּוֹת, שֶׁצְּרִיכִין עֵירוּב לְכׇל חֲבוּרָה וַחֲבוּרָה. מַאי חֲדָרִים, וּמַאי עֲלִיּוֹת? אִילֵּימָא חֲדָרִים — חֲדָרִים מַמָּשׁ, וַעֲלִיּוֹת — עֲלִיּוֹת מַמָּשׁ, פְּשִׁיטָא. אֶלָּא לָאו: כְּעֵין חֲדָרִים, כְּעֵין עֲלִיּוֹת. וּמַאי נִיהוּ — מְחִיצוֹת הַמַּגִּיעוֹת לַתִּקְרָה. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: The mishna is also precise as it teaches: And concede when some of them occupy rooms or upper stories, they require a eiruv for each and every group. What rooms, and what upper stories? If you say rooms actual rooms and upper stories actual upper stories, obvious, Rather, doesn’t it similar to rooms and similar to upper stories? And what these partitions that reach the ceiling; learn from this
llm_translation: Rav Nahman son of Yitzhak said: The Mishnah is precise, as it teaches: And they agree at a time when some of them are residing in courtyards and upper chambers, that they require an eruv for each group and group. What are courtyards, and what are upper chambers? If you say courtyards - actual courtyards, and upper chambers - actual upper chambers, it is obvious. Rather, no: Like courtyards, like upper chambers. And what is the difference? Partitions that reach the ceiling. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים, כְּשֶׁמּוֹלִיכִין אֶת עֵירוּבָן לְמָקוֹם אַחֵר. אֲבָל אִם הָיָה עֵירוּבָן בָּא אֶצְלָן — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל עֵירוּב אֶחָד לְכוּלָּן.
human_translation: It was taught In what this statement, said? where bring their eiruv elsewhere But if their eiruv was coming to them, all agree one eiruv for all of them.
llm_translation: It was taught: In what case are these matters said? When they are bringing their Eruv to another place. But if their Eruv came to them — everyone agrees, one Eruv for all of them.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: חֲמִשָּׁה שֶׁגָּבוּ אֶת עֵירוּבָן, כְּשֶׁמּוֹלִיכִין אֶת עֵירוּבָן לְמָקוֹם אַחֵר — עֵירוּב אֶחָד לְכוּלָּן. כְּמַאן, כְּבֵית הִלֵּל.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that was taught five who collected their eiruv , when they take their eiruv elsewhere one eiruv for all of them. In accordance with whose In accordance with Beit Hillel.
llm_translation: As to where this goes, this is what was taught: Five who contribute to their joint Eruv, when they take their Eruv to another place - one Eruv for all of them. As to where, like Beit Hillel.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים, כְּשֶׁהָיָה עֵירוּב בָּא אֶצְלָן. אֲבָל אִם הָיוּ מוֹלִיכִין אֶת עֵירוּבָן לְמָקוֹם אַחֵר — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל צְרִיכִין עֵירוּב לְכׇל חֲבוּרָה וַחֲבוּרָה.
human_translation: And some say In what this statement, said? where the eiruv was coming to them. But if were bringing their eiruv elsewhere all agree eiruv is required for each and every one of them.
llm_translation: And there are those who say: In what case are these words said? When the eruv came to them. But if they were taking their eruv to another place - everyone agrees that an eruv is needed for each group and group.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: חֲמִשָּׁה שֶׁגָּבוּ אֶת עֵירוּבָן, כְּשֶׁמּוֹלִיכִין אֶת עֵירוּבָן לְמָקוֹם אַחֵר — עֵירוּב אֶחָד לְכוּלָּן, כְּמַאן? דְּלָא כְּחַד.
human_translation: in accordance with whose is that was taught five who collected their eiruv , when they take their eiruv elsewhere one eiruv for all of them. In accordance with whose not in accordance with one
llm_translation: As to where did he go, this is what was taught: Five who contribute to their joint Eruv, when they take their Eruv to another place - one Eruv for all of them, as whose? Not as one.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאַחִין שֶׁהָיוּ אוֹכְלִין עַל שֻׁלְחָן אֲבִיהֶם וִישֵׁנִים בְּבָתֵּיהֶם — צְרִיכִין עֵירוּב לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד. לְפִיכָךְ, אִם שָׁכַח אֶחָד מֵהֶם וְלֹא עֵירַב — מְבַטֵּל אֶת רְשׁוּתוֹ.
human_translation: brothers who were eating at their father’s table and sleeping in their houses eiruv is required for each and every one Therefore, if one of them forgot and did not eiruv , he renounce his rights
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Brothers who would eat at their father's table and sleep in their own homes - each one requires an eruv. Therefore, if one of them forgot and did not make an eruv - he nullifies his permission."

hebrew_text: אֵימָתַי, בִּזְמַן שֶׁמּוֹלִיכִין עֵירוּבָן בִּמְקוֹם אַחֵר. אֲבָל אִם הָיָה עֵירוּב בָּא אֶצְלָן, אוֹ שֶׁאֵין עִמָּהֶן דָּיוֹרִין בֶּחָצֵר — אֵינָן צְרִיכִין לְעָרֵב.
human_translation: When when they take their eiruv elsewhere But if the eiruv was coming to them, or if there are no residents with in the courtyard, they are not required to establish an eiruv ,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "When, at the time that they are bringing their Eruv to another place. But if the Eruv came to them, or if there are non-residents with them in the courtyard, they do not need to make an Eruv." English translation:

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מְקוֹם לִינָה גּוֹרֵם. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: בִּמְקַבְּלֵי פְרָס שָׁנוּ.
human_translation: Learn from it place of sleep determines Rav Yehuda said that Rav said: They taught with regard to receive a portion
llm_translation: Gemara: "G'ma Sh'ma Minah M'kom Linah Goreim." Amar Rav Yehudah Amar Rav: "Bimkablei Pras Shanu."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ בֵּית שַׁעַר, אַכְסַדְרָה, וּמִרְפֶּסֶת בַּחֲצַר חֲבֵירוֹ — הֲרֵי זֶה אֵין אוֹסֵר עָלָיו. (אֶת) בֵּית הַתֶּבֶן (וְאֶת) בֵּית הַבָּקָר בֵּית הָעֵצִים וּבֵית הָאוֹצָרוֹת — הֲרֵי זֶה אוֹסֵר עָלָיו. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ אוֹסֵר אֶלָּא מְקוֹם דִּירָה בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: The Sages taught One who has a gatehouse, porch, balcony in his friend’s courtyard does not render prohibited storeroom of straw, a cattle shed, a woodshed, or a storehouse he renders it prohibited Rabbi Yehuda says: Only a place of dwelling renders prohibited,
llm_translation: The sages taught: One who has a gatehouse, a balcony, and a porch in the courtyard of his neighbor—this one does not restrict him. (Regarding) the house of straw, the house of cattle, the house of wood, and the storeroom—this one restricts him. Rabbi Yehuda says: He only restricts (him) in a place of residence alone.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּבֶן נַפָּחָא שֶׁהָיוּ לוֹ חָמֵשׁ חֲצֵרוֹת בְּאוּשָׁא, וּבָא מַעֲשֶׂה לִפְנֵי חֲכָמִים, וְאָמְרוּ: אֵינוֹ אוֹסֵר אֶלָּא בֵּית דִּירָה בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: There was an incident with ben Nappaḥa, who had five courtyards in Usha, And the case came before the Sages and they said: Only a house of residence renders prohibited.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: There was an incident involving Ben Napahha who had five courtyards in Usha, and the matter came before the sages, and they said: He only prohibits a residential house alone.

hebrew_text: בֵּית דִּירָה סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: מְקוֹם דִּירָה.
human_translation: Does it enter your mind a house of residence? Rather, say: A place of residence,
llm_translation: House of dwelling, what is the conclusion of your opinion? Rather say: a place of dwelling.

hebrew_text: מַאי מְקוֹם דִּירָה? רַב אָמַר:
human_translation: What is place of residence? Rav said:
llm_translation: What is the place of a residence? Rav said:

hebrew_text: מְקוֹם פִּיתָּא, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: מְקוֹם לִינָה.
human_translation: The place bread, and Shmuel said: place sleep.
llm_translation: Place of bread, and Shmuel said: place of lodging.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הָרוֹעִים, וְהַקַּיָּיצִין וְהַבּוּרְגָּנִין וְשׁוֹמְרֵי פֵירוֹת, בִּזְמַן שֶׁדַּרְכָּן לָלִין בָּעִיר — הֲרֵי הֵן כְּאַנְשֵׁי הָעִיר. בִּזְמַן שֶׁדַּרְכָּן לָלִין בַּשָּׂדֶה — יֵשׁ לָהֶם אַלְפַּיִם לְכׇל רוּחַ!
human_translation: raises an objection shepherds; fig watchmen, guardsmen and produce watchmen; when they customarily sleep in the city they are like the residents of the city when they customarily sleep in the field, they have two thousand in each direction
llm_translation: Challenger: Shepherds, and those who gather figs, and winepressers, and fruit guards, when their way is to lodge in the city - behold, they are like the people of the city. When their way is to lodge in the field - they have two thousand cubits in every direction!

hebrew_text: הָתָם אֲנַן סָהֲדִי דְּאִי מַמְטוּ לְהוּ רִיפְתָּא הָתָם, טְפֵי נִיחָא לְהוּ.
human_translation: There, we are witnesses, that if bring them bread there, it would be more convenient for them.
llm_translation: There, we are witnesses that if they bring a refutation there, it is more pleasing to them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לָא שְׁמִיעַ לִי הָא שְׁמַעְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אַתְּ אֲמַרְתְּ נִיהֲלַן, וְאַהָא אֲמַרְתְּ נִיהֲלַן: הָאַחִין שֶׁהָיוּ אוֹכְלִין עַל שֻׁלְחַן אֲבִיהֶן, וִישֵׁנִים בְּבָתֵּיהֶן — צְרִיכִין עֵירוּב לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד. וְאָמְרִינַן לָךְ: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מְקוֹם לִינָה גּוֹרֵם. וַאֲמַרְתְּ לַן עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: בִּמְקַבְּלֵי פְרָס שָׁנוּ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: I have not heard this halakha Abaye, said to him: You said it to us, and it was with regard to this that you said it to us: brothers who were eating at their father’s table and sleeping in their houses eiruv is required for each and every one And we said to you: learn from place of sleep determines And you said to us in this regard Rav Yehuda said that Rav said: They taught with regard to who receive a portion
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: "I did not hear this teaching." Abaye said to him: "You said they are considered as residents, and now you say they are considered as residents? The brothers who would eat at their father's table and sleep in their own homes - each one needs an eruv. And we say to you: The place of lodging causes it. And you said to us: Go up, Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: With those who accept the division of the estate, they differ."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ חָמֵשׁ נָשִׁים מְקַבְּלוֹת פְּרָס מִבַּעֲלֵיהֶן, וַחֲמִשָּׁה עֲבָדִים מְקַבְּלִין פְּרָס מֵרַבֵּיהֶן — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה מַתִּיר בַּנָּשִׁים, וְאוֹסֵר בָּעֲבָדִים.
human_translation: The Sages taught one who has five wives receive a portion from their husband and five slaves receive a portion from their master Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira permits in the wives, And he prohibits in the slaves,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who has five wives receive a portion from their husbands, and five slaves receive a portion from their masters - Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera permits it for the women, and prohibits it for the slaves.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא מַתִּיר בָּעֲבָדִים, וְאוֹסֵר בַּנָּשִׁים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava permits in the slaves, and he prohibits in the wives,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava permits with regard to slaves, and prohibits with regard to women.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְדָנִיֵּאל בִּתְרַע מַלְכָּא״.
human_translation: Rav said: What is the rationale of Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava? As it is written: “But Daniel was in the gate of the king”
llm_translation: Rav said: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava, as it is written: "And Daniel was in the king's gate."

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא, בֵּן אֵצֶל אָבִיו, כְּדַאֲמַרַן. אִשָּׁה אֵצֶל בַּעְלָהּ וְעֶבֶד אֵצֶל רַבּוֹ, פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא. תַּלְמִיד אֵצֶל רַבּוֹ, מַאי?
human_translation: obvious a son with his father, as we stated A wife with her husband and a slave with his master dispute Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira and Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava. a student with his master what
llm_translation: The straightforward ruling, a son with his father, as we have said. A woman with her husband, and a slave with his master, the dispute of Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira and Rabbi Yehuda ben Baba. A student with his teacher, what is the law?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּרַב בֵּי רַבִּי חִיָּיא אָמַר: אֵין אָנוּ צְרִיכִין לְעָרֵב, שֶׁהֲרֵי אָנוּ סוֹמְכִין עַל שׁוּלְחָנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי חִיָּיא. וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא בֵּי רַבִּי אָמַר: אֵין אָנוּ צְרִיכִין לְעָרֵב, שֶׁהֲרֵי אָנוּ סוֹמְכִין עַל שׁוּלְחָנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי.
human_translation: Come hear As Rav, in the school of Rabbi Ḥiyya, said: We do not need to establish an eiruv , as we are dependent upon the table of Rabbi Ḥiyya. And Rabbi Ḥiyya in the school of Rabbi said: We do not need to establish an eiruv , as we are dependent upon the table of Rabbi
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rav, the son of Rabbi Chiya, said: "We do not need to make an Eruv, for we rely on the table of Rabbi Chiya." And Rabbi Chiya, the son of Rabbi, said: "We do not need to make an Eruv, for we rely on the table of Rabbi."

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ אַבָּיֵי מֵרַבָּה: חֲמִשָּׁה שֶׁגָּבוּ אֶת עֵירוּבָן, כְּשֶׁמּוֹלִיכִין אֶת עֵירוּבָן לְמָקוֹם אַחֵר, עֵירוּב אֶחָד לְכוּלָּן, אוֹ צְרִיכִין עֵירוּב לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עֵירוּב אֶחָד לְכוּלָּן.
human_translation: Abaye raised a dilemma before Rabba: five who collected their eiruv , when they take their eiruv elsewhere one eiruv for all of them, or do they need eiruv for each and every one said to him: One eiruv for all of them.
llm_translation: Abaye asked Rabba: Five who contributed to their joint Eruv, when they bring their Eruv to another place, is one Eruv sufficient for all of them, or does each individual require a separate Eruv? He said to him: One Eruv is sufficient for all of them.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אַחִין, דְּכִי גָּבוּ דָּמוּ, וְקָתָנֵי: צְרִיכִין עֵירוּב לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן דְּאִיכָּא דָּיוֹרִין בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ. דְּמִגּוֹ דְּהָנֵי אָסְרִי, הָנֵי נָמֵי אָסְרִי.
human_translation: But brothers, who are comparable who collected teaches: They require a eiruv for each and every one With what are we dealing here? where there are residents, with them. since these render prohibited those also render it prohibited
llm_translation: And this, the brothers, when they collected his blood, and it is taught: they require an eruv for each and every one! Here, what are we dealing with — for example, where there are enough to be valid together. For if these are forbidden, those are also forbidden.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּקָתָנֵי: אֵימָתַי? בִּזְמַן שֶׁמּוֹלִיכִין אֶת עֵירוּבָן בְּמָקוֹם אַחֵר, אֲבָל אִם הָיָה עֵירוּבָן בָּא אֶצְלָם, אוֹ שֶׁאֵין דָּיוֹרִין עִמָּהֶן בֶּחָצֵר — אֵין צְרִיכִין לְעָרֵב, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable as teaches: When When they bring their eiruv elsewhere But if their eiruv was coming to them, or if there are no residents with them in the courtyard, they do not need to establish an eiruv , Learn from this
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: for it was taught: When? When they are bringing their Eruv to another place, but if their Eruv came to them, or if they do not reside with them in the courtyard - there is no need to make an Eruv, learn from it.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: בְּנֵי בֵי רַב, דְּאָכְלִי נַהֲמָא בְּבָאגָא, וְאָתוּ וּבָיְיתִי בְּבֵי רַב, כִּי מָשְׁחִינַן לְהוּ תְּחוּמָא, מִבֵּי רַב מָשְׁחִינַן לְהוּ אוֹ מִבָּאגָא מָשְׁחִינַן לְהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מָשְׁחִינַן מִבֵּי רַב.
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin raised a dilemma before Rav Sheshet: students in their master’s house who eat bread in in the field [ baga ] and come and sleep in master’s house, when we measure limit for them, do we measure for them from master’s house, or do we measure for them from the field, He said to him: We measure from master’s house.
llm_translation: Requested from him Rav Chiya bar Avin from Rav Sheshet: The sons of the house of Rav, who ate bread in Bagda, and they came and entered the house of Rav, when we anoint for them a boundary, do we anoint for them from the house of Rav or do we anoint for them from Bagda? He said to him: We anoint for them from the house of Rav.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי נוֹתֵן אֶת עֵירוּבוֹ בְּתוֹךְ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה, וְאָתֵי וּבָיֵית בְּבֵיתֵיהּ, דְּמָשְׁחִינַן לֵיהּ תְּחוּמָא מֵעֵירוּבֵיהּ!
human_translation: But one who deposits his eiruv , within two thousand cubits, and goes and sleeps in his house, we measure his limit from his eiruv .
llm_translation: And behold, one places his Eruv within two thousand cubits, and Atai and Bayeit in their houses, we measure for him the boundary from his Eruv!

hebrew_text: בְּהָהוּא — אֲנַן סָהֲדִי, וּבְהָדָא — אֲנַן סָהֲדִי. בְּהָהוּא אֲנַן סָהֲדִי — דְּאִי מִיתְּדַר לֵיהּ הָתָם נִיחָא לֵיהּ, וּבַהֲדָא אֲנַן סָהֲדִי — דְּאִי מַיְיתוּ לְהוּ רִיפְתָּא לְבֵי רַב, נִיחָא לְהוּ טְפֵי.
human_translation: In that we are witnesses, and in this we are witnesses, In that we are witnesses that if he reside there, it would be better for him, And in this we are witnesses that if would bring them bread in their master’s house, it would be better for them.
llm_translation: In that case - we are witnesses, and in this case - we are witnesses. In that case we are witnesses - for if he is acquitted there, it is beneficial for him, and in this case we are witnesses - for if they bring a dish of food to the house of the Rabbi, it is more beneficial for them.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא מֵרַב חִסְדָּא: אָב וּבְנוֹ, הָרַב וְתַלְמִידוֹ, כְּרַבִּים דָּמוּ אוֹ כִּיחִידִים דָּמוּ? צְרִיכִין עֵירוּב, אוֹ אֵין צְרִיכִין עֵירוּב? מָבוֹי שֶׁלָּהֶן נִיתָּר בְּלֶחִי וְקוֹרָה, אוֹ אֵין נִיתָּר בְּלֶחִי וְקוֹרָה?
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raised a dilemma before Rav Ḥisda: a father and his son, a master and his student, are they considered as many or as individuals? require an eiruv or do they not require an eiruv , their alleyway permitted through a side post and beam, or is it not permitted through a side post and beam?
llm_translation: Ba'ei Ramei bar Ḥama from Rav Ḥisda asked: A father and his son, a teacher and his student, are they considered as two individuals or as one unit? Do they require an eruv, or do they not require an eruv? If their alleyway was breached with a beam or a crossbeam, is it considered breached or not breached?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: אָב וּבְנוֹ, הָרַב וְתַלְמִידוֹ, בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין עִמָּהֶן דָּיוֹרִין הֲרֵי הֵן כִּיחִידִים, וְאֵין צְרִיכִין לְעָרֵב, וּמָבוֹי שֶׁלָּהֶן נִיתָּר בְּלֶחִי וְקוֹרָה.
human_translation: said to him: You have learned this a father and his son a master and his student, when there are no residents with them, they are like individuals, and they do not need to establish an eiruv , and their alleyway permitted through a side post and beam
llm_translation: He said to him, "You should teach it: a father and his son, a teacher and his student, when they are not dwelling together, they are considered like individuals, and they do not need to join in an eruv, and their alleyway is exempt from the obligation of a beam and a crossbeam."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חָמֵשׁ חֲצֵירוֹת פְּתוּחוֹת זוֹ לָזוֹ וּפְתוּחוֹת לְמָבוֹי, עֵירְבוּ בַּחֲצֵירוֹת וְלֹא נִשְׁתַּתְּפוּ בַּמָּבוֹי — מוּתָּרִין בַּחֲצֵירוֹת וַאֲסוּרִין בְּמָבוֹי.
human_translation: five courtyards open into one another and open into an alleyway, established an eiruv in the courtyards and did not merge the alleyway, they are permitted in the courtyards and they are prohibited in the alleyway.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Five courtyards open into one another and open into a mavoy, if they made an eruv in the courtyards but did not combine in the mavoy - they are permitted in the courtyards and prohibited in the mavoy.

hebrew_text: וְאִם נִשְׁתַּתְּפוּ בַּמָּבוֹי — מוּתָּרִין כָּאן וְכָאן.
human_translation: And if they merged the alleyway, they are permitted here, there,
llm_translation: And if they share in the alleyway - they are permitted here and there.

hebrew_text: עֵירְבוּ בַּחֲצֵירוֹת וְנִשְׁתַּתְּפוּ בַּמָּבוֹי, וְשָׁכַח אֶחָד מִבְּנֵי חָצֵר וְלֹא עֵירַב — מוּתָּרִין כָּאן וְכָאן.
human_translation: they established an eiruv in the courtyards merged the alleyway, and one of the residents of the courtyard forgot and did not eiruv they are permitted here and there,
llm_translation: They combined in the courtyards and joined together in the alleyway, and one of the residents of the courtyard forgot to participate in the Eruv - they are permitted both here and there.

hebrew_text: מִבְּנֵי מָבוֹי וְלֹא נִשְׁתַּתֵּף — מוּתָּרִין בַּחֲצֵירוֹת וַאֲסוּרִין בַּמָּבוֹי, שֶׁהַמָּבוֹי לַחֲצֵירוֹת כֶּחָצֵר לַבָּתִּים.
human_translation: of the residents of the alleyway and did not merging they are permitted in the courtyards and prohibited in the alleyway, as An alleyway is to courtyards as a courtyard is to houses.
llm_translation: From the sons of a courtyard and not participated — permitted in the courtyards and forbidden in the alleyway, for the alleyway to the courtyards is like a courtyard to houses.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַנִּי? רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: בָּעִינַן עֵירוּב וּבָעִינַן שִׁיתּוּף.
human_translation: whose It is Rabbi Meir, who said: We require an eiruv and we require a merging
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of "Gema"? It is Rabbi Meir, as he said: We require an Eruv and we require partnership.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא מְצִיעֲתָא: ״וְאִם נִשְׁתַּתְּפוּ בַּמָּבוֹי מוּתָּרִין כָּאן וְכָאן״, אֲתָאן לְרַבָּנַן דְּאָמְרִי בַּחֲדָא סַגִּיא!
human_translation: say middle clause And if they merged in the alleyway, they are permitted here and there. We have arrived at the Rabbis, who say one is enough,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima metzitata: 've'im nishtatefu ba'mavoi mutarin kan ve'kan", atan le'rabanan de'amri bachada sagia! English translation: Mother suggests: "And if they joined in the alley they are permitted here and there", they came to the Rabbis who say in one significant matter!

hebrew_text: הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא: וְאִם נִשְׁתַּתְּפוּ נָמֵי קָאָמַר.
human_translation: That is not difficult, stated And if they also merged
llm_translation: This is not difficult: "And if the pagans have become insolent, he said."

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא: עֵירְבוּ בַּחֲצֵירוֹת וְנִשְׁתַּתְּפוּ בַּמָּבוֹי, וְשָׁכַח אֶחָד מִבְּנֵי חָצֵר וְלֹא עֵירַב — מוּתָּרִים כָּאן וְכָאן. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּלָא בַּטֵּיל, אַמַּאי מוּתָּרִים? אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא דְּבַטֵּיל. אֵימָא סֵיפָא: שָׁכַח אֶחָד מִבְּנֵי מָבוֹי וְלֹא נִשְׁתַּתְּפוּ — מוּתָּרִין בַּחֲצֵירוֹת וַאֲסוּרִין בַּמָּבוֹי, וְאִי דְּבַטֵּיל — אַמַּאי אֲסוּרִין בַּמָּבוֹי?
human_translation: Say the latter clause they established an eiruv in the courtyards and merged in the alleyway, and one of the residents of the courtyard forgot and did not eiruv they are permitted here and there. What are the circumstances? If did not renounce why are they permitted Rather, obvious that he did renounce say the last clause one of the members of the alleyway forgot and did not merging they are permitted in the courtyards and prohibited in the alleyway. But if he renounced why are they prohibited in the alleyway?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima seifa: eirvu bachatzeirot v'nishtatfu bamavoi, v'shachach echad mibnei chatzer v'lo eirav — mutarim kan v'kan. Heichi damei? Iy d'lo batel, amai mutarim? Ella peshita d'batel. Eima seifa: shachach echad mibnei mavoi v'lo nishtatfu — mutarin bachatzeirot va'asurin bamavoi, v'iy d'batel — amai asurin bamavoi?" English translation: "Say the latter case: if they combined in the courtyards and mingled in the alleyway, and one of the residents of the courtyard forgot to join in the eruv — they are permitted both here and there. How so? If it is not annulled, why are they permitted? Rather, it is obvious that it is annulled. Say the latter case: if one of the residents of the alleyway forgot and they did not combine — they are permitted in the courtyards and prohibited in the alleyway, and if it is annulled — why are they prohibited in the alleyway?"

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא קָסָבַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר אֵין בִּיטּוּל רְשׁוּת בְּמָבוֹי. וְהָא תַּנְיָא: שֶׁהֲרֵי בִּיטֵּל לָכֶם רְשׁוּתוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: And if you say Rabbi Meir holds renunciation of rights is not in an alleyway, Wasn’t it taught As he renounced his rights in your favor; the statement of Rabbi Meir?
llm_translation: And if you say, perhaps Rabbi Meir holds that there is no nullification of ownership in a courtyard. But behold, it was taught: "For he has nullified his ownership for you," the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא דְּלָא בַּטֵּיל. וּמִדְּסֵיפָא דְּלָא בַּטֵּיל — רֵישָׁא נָמֵי דְּלָא בַּטֵּיל. רֵישָׁא וְסֵיפָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, מְצִיעֲתָא רַבָּנַן!
human_translation: Rather, obvious did not renounce And from the the last clause where he did not renounce the first clause also where he did not renounce first and last clauses Rabbi Meir, middle clause the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Rather, it is obvious that it is not nullified. And from the conclusion that it is not nullified - the beginning is also that it is not nullified. The beginning and the conclusion are according to Rabbi Meir, the Rabbis object!

hebrew_text: כּוּלַּהּ רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, וְטַעְמָא מַאי אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר בָּעִינַן עֵירוּב וּבָעִינַן שִׁיתּוּף? שֶׁלֹּא לְשַׁכֵּחַ תּוֹרַת עֵירוּב מִן הַתִּינוֹקוֹת, וְהָכָא, כֵּיוָן דְּרוּבַּהּ עֵירְבוּ — לָא מִשְׁתַּכְחָא.
human_translation: it is all Rabbi Meir. And what is the reason Rabbi Meir said we require an eiruv and we require a merging as not to cause the category of eiruv to be forgotten by the children. And here, since most of established an eiruv will not be forgotten.
llm_translation: The entirety is Rabbi Meir, and the reason what did Rabbi Meir say? We require an eruv and we require partnership? Not to forget the law of eruv from the children, and here, since the majority have made an eruv - it does not become nullified.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: רַב לָא תָּנֵי ״פְּתוּחוֹת זוֹ לָזוֹ״. וְכֵן אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: רַב לָא תָּנֵי ״פְּתוּחוֹת זוֹ לָזוֹ״. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, רַב כָּהֲנָא גּוּפֵיהּ לָא תָּנֵי ״פְּתוּחוֹת זוֹ לָזוֹ״.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: Rav did not teach open into one another, And so too, Rav Kahana said: Rav did not teach open into one another. Some say Rav Kahana himself did not teach open into one another.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: Rav does not teach "openings, this to that." And so said Rav Kahana: Rav does not teach "openings, this to that." Some say, Rav Kahana himself does not teach "openings, this to that."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּלָא תָּנֵי פְּתוּחוֹת זוֹ לָזוֹ. קָסָבַר כׇּל שִׁיתּוּף שֶׁאֵין מַכְנִיסוֹ וּמוֹצִיאוֹ דֶּרֶךְ פְּתָחִים בַּמָּבוֹי — לָאו שְׁמֵיהּ שִׁיתּוּף.
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: What is the reason he did not teach open into one another? he holds any merging that is not brought in and taken out by way of the entrances into the alleyway, is not considered merging
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye to Rav Yosef: What is the reason that it does not teach "openings this to that"? He holds that any partnership that does not bring it in and take it out through doorways in the alleyway - its name is not a partnership.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: בַּעַל הַבַּיִת שֶׁהָיָה שׁוּתָּף לִשְׁכֵנָיו, לָזֶה בְּיַיִן וְלָזֶה בְּיַיִן, אֵין צְרִיכִין לְעָרֵב. הָתָם, דְּאַפְּקֵיהּ וְעַיְּילֵיהּ.
human_translation: He raised an objection to him A homeowner who was a partner of his neighbors, with this one in wine and with that one in wine, they do not need to establish an eiruv . There, where they took out brought it in
llm_translation: He raised an objection: If the homeowner was a partner with his neighbors, this one with wine and that one with wine, they do not need to make an eruv. There, because he can take it and bring it.

hebrew_text: (אֵיתִיבֵיהּ:) כֵּיצַד מִשְׁתַּתְּפִין בַּמָּבוֹי וְכוּ׳. הָתָם נָמֵי: דְּאַפְּקֵיהּ וְעַיְּילֵיהּ.
human_translation: He raised objection to him How does one merge into alleyways? There too, where they took out and brought it into
llm_translation: He raised an objection: How do they participate in the alleyway, etc.? There, they said: He opens it and brings it in.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבָּה בַּר חָנָן: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, הִקְנָה לוֹ פַּת בְּסַלּוֹ הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא הָוֵי שִׁיתּוּף?! וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָכִי נָמֵי, וְהָא אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: בְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה שֶׁהָיוּ מְסוּבִּין וְקִדֵּשׁ עֲלֵיהֶן הַיּוֹם — הַפַּת שֶׁעַל שֻׁלְחָן סוֹמְכִים עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם עֵירוּב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ מִשּׁוּם שִׁיתּוּף.
human_translation: Rabba bar Ḥanan strongly objects to this: However, if is so, he transferred ownership of bread in his basket to so too, it would not be merging. And if you say this is so, didn’t Rav Yehuda say that Rav said: members of a group who were dining and the day became sanctified for them, they may rely upon the bread on the table as an eiruv and some say, as a merging
llm_translation: Rabah bar Hanan objects to him: Rather, from now on, if he acquires bread in his basket, is it not so that there will not be a partnership?! And if you say: it is so, but did not Rav Yehudah say in the name of Rav: Members of a group that were gathered and sanctified upon them that day - the bread that is on the table they rely on it for the sake of an eruv, and some say for the sake of partnership.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבָּה, לָא פְּלִיגִי: כָּאן בִּמְסוּבִּין בַּבַּיִת, כָּאן בַּמְסוּבִּין בֶּחָצֵר.
human_translation: And Rabba said: do not disagree Here, where they were dining in a house, There, where they were dining in a courtyard,
llm_translation: And Rabba said, they do not disagree: here it refers to those reclining in the house, here it refers to those reclining in the courtyard.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא טַעְמָא דְּרַב, דְּקָא סָבַר: אֵין מָבוֹי נִיתָּר בְּלֶחִי וְקוֹרָה עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ בָּתִּים וַחֲצֵירוֹת פְּתוּחִים לְתוֹכוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, the reason Rav that he holds an alleyway cannot rendered permitted through a side post and beam unless there are houses and courtyards opening into it.
llm_translation: Rather, the reason of Rav, for he holds: A courtyard is not considered open to a side street unless there are houses and courtyards open into it.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַב: אֵין מָבוֹי נִיתָּר בְּלֶחִי וְקוֹרָה
human_translation: the matter itself Rav said: An alleyway cannot permitted through a side post and beam,
llm_translation: The body, Rav said: A passageway is not nullified by a cheek and a beam.

hebrew_text: עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ בָּתִּים וַחֲצֵירוֹת פְּתוּחִין לְתוֹכוֹ. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ בַּיִת אֶחָד וְחָצֵר אַחַת. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ חוּרְבָּה.
human_translation: unless there are houses and courtyards opening into it. And Shmuel said: Even one house and one courtyard And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Even a ruin
llm_translation: Until there are houses and courtyards open within it. And Shmuel said: Even with one house and one courtyard. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Even a ruin.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁל כְּרָמִים? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אֶלָּא בְּחוּרְבָּה, דַּחֲזֵי לְדִירָה. אֲבָל שְׁבִיל שֶׁל כְּרָמִים, דְּלָא חֲזֵי לְדִירָה — לָא.
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: Rabbi Yoḥanan say even a vineyard path He said to him: Rabbi Yoḥanan said only a ruin, which is fit as a residence. However, a vineyard path, which is not fit as a residence, not
llm_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: Rabbi Yochanan said, even for the sake of a vineyard? He said to him: Rabbi Yochanan did not say this except for a ruin, which is fit for a dwelling. But for the sake of a vineyard, which is not fit for a dwelling - no.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר חִינָּנָא: וְאַזְדָּא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דִּתְנַן (אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן): אֶחָד גַּגּוֹת וְאֶחָד קַרְפֵּיפוֹת וְאֶחָד חֲצֵרוֹת — רְשׁוּת אַחַת הֵן לְכֵלִים שֶׁשָּׁבְתוּ לְתוֹכָן, וְלֹא לְכֵלִים שֶׁשָּׁבְתוּ בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Ḥinnana said: And Rabbi Yoḥanan followed his reasoning as we learned Rabbi Shimon said: Roofs, enclosures, and courtyards are all one domain with regard to vessels that rested inside them not with regard to vessels that rested inside the house
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Chinena said: And Rabbi Yochanan agreed with his reasoning, as we learned (Rabbi Shimon said): One is for rooftops, one is for balconies, and one is for courtyards - they are all considered one domain for vessels that were placed within them on Shabbat, but not for vessels that were placed inside the house.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, וְהוּא שֶׁלֹּא עֵירְבוּ. אֲבָל עֵירְבוּ, גָּזְרִינַן דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְאַפּוֹקֵי מָאנֵי דְבָתִּים לְחָצֵר.
human_translation: And Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. And this is where did not establish an eiruv However, if they established an eiruv we decree lest they come to take out objects houses to the courtyard.
llm_translation: And Rav said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Shimon, even though they did not make an eruv. But if they made an eruv, we decree lest one come to carry from house to courtyard.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: בֵּין עֵירְבוּ וּבֵין לֹא עֵירְבוּ. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, בֵּין עֵירְבוּ וּבֵין לֹא עֵירְבוּ. אַלְמָא: לָא גָּזְרִינַן דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְאַפּוֹקֵי מָאנֵי דְבָתִּים לְחָצֵר, הָכָא נָמֵי לָא גָּזְרִינַן דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְאַפּוֹקֵי מָאנֵי דְחָצֵר לְחוּרְבָּה.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: whether established an eiruv or whether they did not establish an eiruv And so too, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, whether they established an eiruv or whether they did not establish an eiruv Apparently, we do not decree lest they come to take out objects from houses to the courtyard. Here too, we do not decree lest they come to take out objects from the courtyard to the ruin
llm_translation: Samuel said: Between Eiruvu and not Eiruvu. And so said Rabbi Yochanan: The halakha is according to Rabbi Shimon, between Eiruvu and not Eiruvu. This implies: We do not decree lest one come to carry from houses to a courtyard, so here too we do not decree lest one come to carry from a courtyard to a ruin.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַב בְּרוֹנָא וְקָאָמַר לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר בֵּי רַב: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל הָכִי?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַחְוִי לִי אוּשְׁפִּיזֵיהּ, אַחְוִי לֵיהּ. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲמַר מָר הָכִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין.
human_translation: Rav Beruna sat and recited this halakha Rabbi Elazar, a student of a Torah academy, said to him: Did Shmuel say this? said to him: Yes, He said to him: Show me his lodging he showed him. came before Shmuel said to him: the Master say this? said to him: Yes,
llm_translation: Rav sat in front and said to him: Have you heard? Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Bei Rav said: Did Shmuel say so?! He said to him: No, he said to him: Confirm it for me, confirm it for him. He came before Shmuel, he said to him: Did the master say so? He said to him: No.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מָר הוּא דְּאָמַר: אֵין לָנוּ בְּעֵירוּבִין אֶלָּא כִּלְשׁוֹן מִשְׁנָתֵינוּ, שֶׁהַמָּבוֹי לַחֲצֵירוֹת כֶּחָצֵר לַבָּתִּים. אִישְׁתִּיק.
human_translation: Wasn’t it the Master said With regard to eiruv , we have only the wording of our mishna. that an alleyway is to courtyards like a courtyard is to houses, was silent
llm_translation: The master said: We only have Eruvin in the language of our Mishnah, for the alleyway to courtyards is like a courtyard to houses. He remained silent.

hebrew_text: קַבְּלַהּ מִינֵּיהּ, אוֹ לָא קַבְּלַהּ מִינֵּיהּ? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּהָהוּא מְבוֹאָה דַּהֲוָה דָּיַיר בֵּיהּ אַיְבוּת בַּר אִיהִי, עֲבַד לֵיהּ לִחְיָיא, וּשְׁרָא לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל,
human_translation: accepted or did he not accept it from him? Come hear: a certain alleyway that Ivut bar Ihi lived in, He erected a side post for it, and Shmuel permitted him
llm_translation: Received it from him, or did he not receive it from him? Come and hear: In that alley where the son of Ihi lived, a snake was causing trouble. He brought it to life, and he named it Samuel.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא רַב עָנָן שַׁדְיֵהּ. אָמַר: מְבוֹאָה דְּדָיַירְנָא בֵּיהּ וְאָתֵינָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּמָר שְׁמוּאֵל, נֵיתֵי רַב עָנָן בַּר רַב נִישְׁדְּיֵיהּ מִן?! שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לָא קַיבְּלַהּ מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Anan came and threw said The alleyway in which I have been living and walking in the name of Master Shmuel, shall Rav Anan bar Rav come throw from Learn from did not accept
llm_translation: Rav Anan Shadye came. He said: "The entrance of the house of the tenant is in it, and I came from the name of Mar Shmuel." Rav Anan, son of Rav Nishdei, came from where?! Learn from it that she did not accept from him.

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ קַיבְּלַהּ מִינֵּהּ, וְהָכָא חַזָּנָא הוּא דַּהֲוָה אָכֵיל נַהֲמָא בְּבֵיתֵיהּ וְאָתֵי בָּיֵית בְּבֵי כְנִישְׁתָּא.
human_translation: Actually, you can say accepted and here there was attendant [ ḥazzana ] who would eat bread in his house but come and sleep in the synagogue,
llm_translation: Forever say to you received from her, and here cantor he that was eating bread in his house and came to the synagogue.

hebrew_text: וְאַיְבוּת בַּר אִיהִי סָבַר: מְקוֹם פִּיתָּא גָּרֵים. וּשְׁמוּאֵל לְטַעְמֵיהּ דְּאָמַר: מָקוֹם לִינָה גָּרֵים.
human_translation: And Ivut bar Ihi holds the place bread determines Shmuel followed his reasoning, as he said: The place sleeps determines
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Aibut bar Ahihi holds: In a place of bread, converts reside. And Samuel, according to his reasoning, said: In a place of lodging, converts reside.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מָבוֹי שֶׁצִּידּוֹ אֶחָד גּוֹי וְצִידּוֹ אֶחָד יִשְׂרָאֵל — אֵין מְעָרְבִין אוֹתוֹ דֶּרֶךְ חַלּוֹנוֹת לְהַתִּירוֹ דֶּרֶךְ פְּתָחִים לַמָּבוֹי.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said that Rav said: an alleyway, one side of which a gentile and one side of which a Jew, may not establish an eiruv through the windows to render permitted through the doors to the alleyway.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: If a courtyard has one side belonging to a gentile and one side belonging to a Jew, they do not combine to permit carrying within the courtyard through the windows, nor do they combine to permit carrying through the entrances to the courtyard.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: אָמַר רַב אֲפִילּוּ בְּחָצֵר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, דְּאִי לָא אָמַר מַאי?
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: Rav say even with regard to a courtyard, He said to him: Yes, as if he did not say what
llm_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: Rav said even in the courtyard? He said to him: No, for if he did not say what?

hebrew_text: הֲוָה אָמֵינָא טַעְמָא דְּרַב מִשּׁוּם דְּקָסָבַר: אֵין מָבוֹי נִיתָּר בְּלֶחִי וְקוֹרָה עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ בָּתִּים וַחֲצֵירוֹת פְּתוּחִין לְתוֹכוֹ.
human_translation: I would have said the rationale for Rav is because he holds an alleyway cannot be rendered permitted with a side post and beam unless there are houses and courtyards opening into it.
llm_translation: I would say the reason for Rav's opinion is because he holds: A mavoy is not nullified by a lechi or korah until there are houses and courtyards open into it.

hebrew_text: וְתַרְתֵּי לְמָה לִי! צְרִיכָא, דְּאִי מֵהַהִיא —
human_translation: why I need two necessary. As, if from that
llm_translation: And two, why do I need them! It is necessary, for if from that—

hebrew_text: הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: דִּירַת גּוֹי שְׁמָהּ דִּירָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּדִירַת גּוֹי לֹא שְׁמָהּ דִּירָה. וְאִי מֵהָכָא — הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: לָא יָדַעְנָא בָּתִּים כַּמָּה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן בָּתִּים תְּרֵין.
human_translation: I would have said the residence of a gentile is considered a residence teaches us that the status of the residence of a gentile is not considered a residence And if from here, I would have said I do not know how many houses there teaches us two houses
llm_translation: I would say: the dwelling of a non-Jew, its name is a dwelling, it is heard to us that the dwelling of a non-Jew is not called a dwelling. And if from here - I would say: we do not know how many houses, it is heard to us two houses.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמַר רַב אֲפִילּוּ חָצֵר, טַעְמָא דְּרַב דְּקָא סָבַר אָסוּר לַעֲשׂוֹת יָחִיד בִּמְקוֹם גּוֹי.
human_translation: Now that Rav said even a courtyard, the reason for Rav is that he holds: It is prohibited for an individual to establish in the place a gentile
llm_translation: The question that Rav raised, even a courtyard, the reasoning of Rav who holds that it is forbidden to perform an individual act in a public domain.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אִי הָכִי הַיְינוּ דִּשְׁמַעְנָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי טַבְלָא דְּאָמַר: ״גּוֹי גּוֹי״ תְּרֵי זִימְנֵי, וְלָא יָדַעְנָא מַאי אָמַר.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: If so, this is I heard Rabbi Tavla say: A gentile, a gentile, two times I did not understand what he say.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: If so, this is what we heard from Rabbi Tavla who said: "Goy Goy" two times, and we do not know what he meant.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת זוֹ לִפְנִים מִזּוֹ, עֵירְבָה הַפְּנִימִית וְלֹא עֵירְבָה הַחִיצוֹנָה — הַפְּנִימִית מוּתֶּרֶת וְהַחִיצוֹנָה אֲסוּרָה.
human_translation: two courtyards, one within the other, the inner established an eiruv and the outer did not establish an eiruv , the inner one is permitted and the outer one is prohibited.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Two courtyards, one inside the other, if the inner one made an eruv and the outer one did not make an eruv - the inner one is permitted, and the outer one is prohibited."

hebrew_text: הַחִיצוֹנָה וְלֹא הַפְּנִימִית — שְׁתֵּיהֶן אֲסוּרוֹת. עֵירְבָה זוֹ לְעַצְמָהּ וְזוֹ לְעַצְמָהּ — זוֹ מוּתֶּרֶת בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ וְזוֹ מוּתֶּרֶת בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ.
human_translation: the outer and the inner not, both prohibited, this established an eiruv for itself, and that established an eiruv for itself, this one is permitted by itself, and that one is permitted by itself,
llm_translation: Outer and not inner - both are prohibited. If one eruv is for itself and the other is for itself - this one is permitted by itself and that one is permitted by itself.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹסֵר הַחִיצוֹנָה, שֶׁדְּרִיסַת הָרֶגֶל אוֹסַרְתָּהּ. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין דְּרִיסַת הָרֶגֶל אוֹסַרְתָּהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva prohibits the outer one as the entry renders it prohibited. And the Rabbis say: entry does not render it prohibited.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva prohibits the outer one, for the trampling of the foot prohibits it. And the Sages say: The trampling of the foot does not prohibit it.

hebrew_text: שָׁכַח אֶחָד מִן הַחִיצוֹנָה וְלֹא עֵירַב — הַפְּנִימִית מוּתֶּרֶת וְהַחִיצוֹנָה אֲסוּרָה. מִן הַפְּנִימִית וְלֹא עֵירַב — שְׁתֵּיהֶן אֲסוּרוֹת.
human_translation: one of the outer forgot and did not eiruv , the inner is permitted and the outer one is prohibited. of the inner forgot and did not eiruv , they are both prohibited,
llm_translation: One forgot from the inner one and did not combine - the inner one is permitted and the outer one is forbidden. From the inner one and did not combine - both are forbidden.

hebrew_text: נָתְנוּ עֵירוּבָן בְּמָקוֹם אֶחָד וְשָׁכַח אֶחָד, בֵּין מִן הַפְּנִימִית בֵּין מִן הַחִיצוֹנָה, וְלֹא עֵירַב — שְׁתֵּיהֶן אֲסוּרוֹת. וְאִם הָיוּ שֶׁל יְחִידִים — אֵינָן צְרִיכִין לְעָרֵב.
human_translation: put their eiruv in one place, and one whether from the inner or from the outer one, forgot and did not eiruv , they are both prohibited And if to individuals, they are not required to establish an eiruv ,
llm_translation: They placed their Eruv in one place and one forgot, whether from the inner courtyard or from the outer courtyard, and did not make an Eruv - both are prohibited. But if they belong to individuals - they do not need to make an Eruv.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּאָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ רֶגֶל הַמּוּתֶּרֶת בִּמְקוֹמָהּ — אוֹסֶרֶת שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹמָהּ. אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁרֶגֶל הַמּוּתֶּרֶת אֵינָהּ אוֹסֶרֶת — כָּךְ רֶגֶל הָאֲסוּרָה אֵינָהּ אוֹסֶרֶת.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said Rabbi Yannai: This the statement of Rabbi Akiva, who said: Even foot who is permitted in its place, renders prohibited when not in its place. However, the Rabbis say: Just as foot who is permitted does not render prohibited so foot who is prohibited does not render prohibited
llm_translation: Gemara: When Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Yannai said: These are the words of Rabbi Akiva, who said: Even if the foot of the permitted animal is in its place, it prohibits the mixture not in its place. But the Sages say: Just as the foot of the permitted animal does not prohibit the mixture, so too the foot of the forbidden animal does not prohibit the mixture.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: עֵירְבָה חִיצוֹנָה וְלֹא פְּנִימִית שְׁתֵּיהֶן אֲסוּרוֹת. מַנִּי? אִילֵימָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, מַאי אִירְיָא רֶגֶל אֲסוּרָה? אֲפִילּוּ רֶגֶל מוּתֶּרֶת נָמֵי. אֶלָּא לָאו רַבָּנַן!
human_translation: We learned the outer established an eiruv and the inner not, they are both prohibited. Whose If you say Rabbi Akiva, why particularly a foot that is prohibited, even a foot that is permitted also Rather, is it not the Rabbis?
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: If the outer courtyard is combined but not the inner one, both are prohibited. What is the reason? If you say it is according to Rabbi Akiva, what is the meaning of a prohibited foot? Even a permitted foot is also prohibited. Rather, it is not according to the Rabbis!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, וְלֹא זוֹ אַף זוֹ קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: Actually, Rabbi Akiva, he teaches Not this also that.
llm_translation: Forever Rabbi Akiva, and not this one nor that one is insignificant.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: עֵירְבָה זוֹ לְעַצְמָהּ וְזוֹ לְעַצְמָהּ — זוֹ מוּתֶּרֶת בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ וְזוֹ מוּתֶּרֶת בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ. טַעְמָא דְּעֵירְבָה, הָא לֹא עֵירְבָה — שְׁתֵּיהֶן אֲסוּרוֹת,
human_translation: We learned this established an eiruv for itself, and that established an eiruv for itself, this one is permitted by itself, and that one is permitted by itself, The reason established an eiruv . did not establish an eiruv both would be prohibited.
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: If one eruv is designated for itself and another eruv is designated for itself - this one is permitted for itself, and that one is permitted for itself. The reason for the eruv is that if it is not an eruv - both of them are prohibited.

hebrew_text: וְהָא הַאי תַּנָּא דְּאָמַר: רֶגֶל הַמּוּתֶּרֶת אֵינָהּ אוֹסֶרֶת רֶגֶל הָאֲסוּרָה אוֹסֶרֶת, מַנִּי הָא? אִילֵּימָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא — אֲפִילּוּ רֶגֶל הַמּוּתֶּרֶת נָמֵי, אֶלָּא לָאו, רַבָּנַן הִיא. וְעוֹד: מִדְּסֵיפָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, רֵישָׁא לָאו רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: But this tanna , who said foot who is permitted does not prohibited foot who is prohibited does prohibited who is this If you say Rabbi Akiva, even foot who is permitted also Rather, is it not the Rabbis, And furthermore, from the fact that the latter clause Rabbi Akiva, the first clause, is not Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "And this, this Tanna who said: A permitted foot does not forbid, a forbidden foot forbids, who is he? If you say it is Rabbi Akiva — even a permitted foot also, rather, it is not so, it is the Rabbis. And furthermore, from the end, Rabbi Akiva, the beginning is not Rabbi Akiva."

hebrew_text: כּוּלַּהּ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא, וְחַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: עֵירְבָה זוֹ לְעַצְמָהּ וְזוֹ לְעַצְמָהּ — זוֹ מוּתֶּרֶת בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ וְזוֹ מוּתֶּרֶת בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — שֶׁעָשְׂתָה דַּקָּה, אֲבָל לֹא עָשְׂתָה דַּקָּה — חִיצוֹנָה אֲסוּרָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, שֶׁרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹסֵר אֶת הַחִיצוֹנָה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁדְּרִיסַת הָרֶגֶל אוֹסֶרֶת. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין דְּרִיסַת הָרֶגֶל אוֹסֶרֶת.
human_translation: entire Rabbi Akiva, and it is incomplete and teaches the following: this established an eiruv for itself, and that established an eiruv for itself, this one is permitted by itself, and that one is permitted by itself, In what is this statement said? where constructed a partition However, it did not construct a partition, the outer is prohibited. the statement of Rabbi Akiva, as Rabbi Akiva prohibits the outer because the entry renders prohibited And the Rabbis say: The entry does not render prohibited
llm_translation: The entirety is Rabbi Akiva, and lacking from lacking, and thus it was taught: If one eruv for itself and one eruv for itself - this one is permitted for itself and this one is permitted for itself. In what case are these words said? - that she made it thin, but if she did not make it thin - its outer part is forbidden, the words of Rabbi Akiva, for Rabbi Akiva forbids the outer part, because the trampling of the foot forbids. And the sages say: The trampling of the foot does not forbid.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי: וְאִם הָיוּ שֶׁל יְחִידִים אֵין צְרִיכִין לְעָרֵב. הָא שֶׁל רַבִּים צְרִיכִין לְעָרֵב, אַלְמָא רֶגֶל הַמּוּתֶּרֶת בִּמְקוֹמָהּ — אֵינָהּ אוֹסֶרֶת, רֶגֶל הָאֲסוּרָה — אוֹסֶרֶת!
human_translation: Rav Beivai bar Abaye raised an objection And if to individuals, they are not required to establish an eiruv . Doesn’t to many they need to establish an eiruv ? Apparently, foot who is permitted in his place does not render prohibited, foot who is prohibited render prohibited.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Bibi bar Abbaye asks: "And if they belong to individuals, there is no need for an Eruv." This implies that if they belong to the public, an Eruv is necessary. This teaches us that a permitted foot does not prohibit in its place, but a prohibited foot does prohibit!

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד מֵתִיב רָבִינָא: שָׁכַח אֶחָד מִן הַחִיצוֹנָה וְלֹא עֵירַב — הַפְּנִימִית מוּתֶּרֶת וְחִיצוֹנָה אֲסוּרָה. שָׁכַח אֶחָד מִן הַפְּנִימִית וְלֹא עֵירַב — שְׁתֵּיהֶן אֲסוּרוֹת. טַעְמָא דְּשֶׁכַח, הָא לָא שָׁכַח — שְׁתֵּיהֶן מוּתָּרוֹת. אַלְמָא רֶגֶל הַמּוּתֶּרֶת — אֵינָהּ אוֹסֶרֶת, רֶגֶל הָאֲסוּרָה — אוֹסֶרֶת.
human_translation: And Ravina raised a further objection one of the outer forgot and did not eiruv , the inner is permitted and the outer one is prohibited. one of the inner forgot and did not eiruv , both are prohibited, The reason is that forgot But he did not forget, both of them permitted. Apparently, foot who is permitted in his place does not render prohibited foot who is prohibited render prohibited
llm_translation: And furthermore, Rabinah raises an objection: If one forgot one of the inner Eruvin and did not combine it with the others, the inner Eruv is permitted and the outer Eruv is prohibited. If one forgot one of the inner Eruvin and did not combine it with the others, both are prohibited. The reason for the forgetfulness is that if one forgot, but if one did not forget, both are permitted. This implies that the foot of the permitted Eruv does not prohibit, while the foot of the prohibited Eruv does prohibit.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: שָׁלֹשׁ מַחְלוֹקוֹת בַּדָּבָר: תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: רֶגֶל הַמּוּתֶּרֶת — אֵינָהּ אוֹסֶרֶת, רֶגֶל הָאֲסוּרָה — אוֹסֶרֶת. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: אֲפִילּוּ רֶגֶל הַמּוּתֶּרֶת אוֹסֶרֶת. וְרַבָּנַן בָּתְרָאֵי סָבְרִי: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁרֶגֶל מוּתֶּרֶת אֵינָהּ אוֹסֶרֶת — כָּךְ רֶגֶל הָאֲסוּרָה אֵינָהּ אוֹסֶרֶת.
human_translation: Rather, when Ravin came Rabbi Yannai said: There are three disputes with regard to matter. The first tanna holds foot who is permitted in his place does not render prohibited foot who is prohibited render prohibited Rabbi Akiva holds even foot who is permitted renders prohibited And the latter Rabbis hold just as foot who is permitted in his place does not render prohibited so foot who is prohibited does not render prohibited
llm_translation: Rather, when Ravin came, Rabbi Yannai said: Three disputes in the matter: The first Tanna holds: A permitted foot does not prohibit, a prohibited foot does prohibit. Rabbi Akiva holds: Even a permitted foot prohibits. And the Rabbis in the latter view hold: Just as a permitted foot does not prohibit, so too a prohibited foot does not prohibit.

hebrew_text: נָתְנוּ עֵירוּבָן בְּמָקוֹם אֶחָד וְשָׁכַח אֶחָד בֵּין מִן הַפְּנִימִית וְכוּ׳. מַאי מָקוֹם אֶחָד?
human_translation: put their eiruv in one place, and one whether from the inner forgot What is one place?
llm_translation: They placed their Eruv in one place and one person forgot to participate from the inner group, etc. What is the meaning of "one place"?

hebrew_text: (סִימָן חִיצוֹנָה עַצְמָהּ בְּבֵית יְחִידָאָה רָבִינָא דְּלָא מְשַׁכַּח בִּפְנִים)
human_translation: a mnemonic Outer; for itself; in the house of an individual; Ravina; where the inner one did not forget.
llm_translation: Outer sign itself in private house Rabina that not forget inside

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: חִיצוֹנָה, וּמַאי קָרוּ לָהּ ״מָקוֹם אֶחָד״ — מָקוֹם הַמְיוּחָד לִשְׁתֵּיהֶן.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said that Rav said: the outer And why did they call it one eḥad place? designated meyuḥad for both
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Its outer part, and what is the reason it is called "one place" - a place designated for both.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: נָתְנוּ עֵירוּבָן בַּחִיצוֹנָה, וְשָׁכַח אֶחָד, בֵּין מִן הַחִיצוֹנָה וּבֵין מִן הַפְּנִימִית, וְלֹא עֵירַב — שְׁתֵּיהֶן אֲסוּרוֹת, נָתְנוּ עֵירוּבָן בַּפְּנִימִית, וְשָׁכַח אֶחָד מִן הַפְּנִימִית וְלֹא עֵירַב — שְׁתֵּיהֶן אֲסוּרוֹת. מִן הַחִיצוֹנָה וְלֹא עֵירַב — שְׁתֵּיהֶן אֲסוּרוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בָּזוֹ, פְּנִימִית מוּתֶּרֶת וְחִיצוֹנָה אֲסוּרָה.
human_translation: That was also taught they placed their eiruv in the outer and one forgot eiruv , whether he is of the outer or of the inner they are both prohibited. they put their eiruv in the inner and one of the inner forgot eiruv , they are both prohibited. of the outer did not eiruv , they are both prohibited. the statement of Rabbi Akiva. And the Rabbis say: In this inner is permitted and the outer one is prohibited.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: If they placed their eruv in the outer courtyard, and one forgot, whether from the outer or inner courtyard, and did not make an eruv - both are prohibited. If they placed their eruv in the inner courtyard, and one forgot from the inner courtyard and did not make an eruv - both are prohibited. If one forgot from the outer courtyard and did not make an eruv - both are prohibited. These are the words of Rabbi Akiva. But the Sages say: The inner one is permitted, and the outer one is prohibited.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה בַּר חָנָן לְאַבָּיֵי: מַאי שְׁנָא לְרַבָּנַן דְּאָמְרִי פְּנִימִית מוּתֶּרֶת — מִשּׁוּם דְּאָחֲדָא דַּשָּׁא וּמִשְׁתַּמְּשָׁא, לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא נָמֵי: תֵּיחַד דַּשָּׁא וּתְשַׁמֵּשׁ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עֵירוּב מַרְגִּילָהּ.
human_translation: Rabba bar Ḥanan said to Abaye: What is different according to the Rabbis, who say inner is permitted? because shut the door and use according to Rabbi Akiva as well, let shut the door and use said to him: the eiruv accustoms
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabba bar Hanan to Abbaye: What is the difference for the Rabbis who say an inner one is permitted - because it is one that is smooth and can be used, to Rabbi Akiva also: Smooth and use! He said to him: An eruv makes it habitual.

hebrew_text: לְרַבָּנַן נָמֵי עֵירוּב מַרְגִּילָהּ! דְּאָמְרָה: לְתַקּוֹנֵי שַׁיתַּפְתִּיךְ, וְלָא לְעַוּוֹתֵי.
human_translation: according to the Rabbis as well eiruv accustoms that say We joined with you to benefit, and not to detriment.
llm_translation: To the Rabbis, she said: "Make the Eruv a regular practice!" For she said: "I have joined you for the purpose of rectification, not to cause harm."

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא נָמֵי תֵּימָא: לְתַקּוֹנֵי שַׁיתַּפְתִּיךְ וְלָא לְעַוּוֹתֵי? דְּאָמְרָה לַהּ: מְבַטְּלִינַן לָךְ רְשׁוּתִי. וְרַבָּנַן, אֵין בִּיטּוּל רְשׁוּת מֵחָצֵר לְחָצֵר.
human_translation: According to Rabbi Akiva as well, let say We joined with you to benefit and not to detriment. that said We renounce our rights in your favor, And the Rabbis there is no renunciation of rights from courtyard to courtyard.
llm_translation: To Rabbi Akiva, also known as Tema: "Did I partner with you for the purpose of rectification, and not for distortion?" For she said to him: "I am annulling my authority for you." And the Rabbis hold that there is no annulment of authority from courtyard to courtyard.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא שְׁמוּאֵל וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבָּנַן וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי. דִּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר כְּרַבָּנַן, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא?
human_translation: Let us say Shmuel and Rabbi Yoḥanan, disagree about the disagreement between the Rabbis and Rabbi Akiva. As Shmuel said in accordance with the Rabbis, and Rabbi Yoḥanan said in accordance with Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: Let us say, Shmuel and Rabbi Yochanan in the dispute of the Rabbis, and Rabbi Akiva is arguing. For Shmuel said like the Rabbis, and Rabbi Yochanan said like Rabbi Akiva?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ שְׁמוּאֵל: אֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי אֲפִילּוּ לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הָכָא, אֶלָּא בִּשְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת זוֹ לִפְנִים מִזּוֹ, דְּאָסְרָן אַהֲדָדֵי, אֲבָל הָתָם, מִי קָא אָסְרָן אַהֲדָדֵי?
human_translation: Shmuel said to you: What I said is even in accordance with Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Akiva stated only here, with regard to two courtyards, one within the other, which render each other prohibited. However, there, do render each other prohibited?
llm_translation: He said to you, Samuel: I, who say even to Rabbi Akiva. Until here, Rabbi Akiva did not say here, but in two courtyards, this one in front of that one, where they prohibited each other, but there, who prohibited each other?

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי אֲפִילּוּ לְרַבָּנַן. עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן הָכָא, אֶלָּא דְּאָמְרָה לַהּ: אַדִּמְבַטְּלַתְּ לִי, קָא אָסְרַתְּ עִלַּאי. אֲבָל הָתָם, מִי קָאָסְרָה עֲלַהּ?
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: What I said is even in accordance with the Rabbis. The Rabbis stated only here, as said to Until you renounce in our favor, you render prohibited us But there, does prohibit
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "I, who say even to the Rabbis. Until here, they did not say the Rabbis here, but rather she said to it: 'You have nullified me, you have forbidden me upon myself.' But there, who forbade her?"

hebrew_text: וְאִם הָיוּ שֶׁל יְחִידִים וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, תָּנֵי רַבִּי: הָיוּ שְׁלֹשָׁה — אֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: And if to individuals, Rav Yosef said: Rabbi teaches there were three they are prohibited
llm_translation: "And if they belonged to individuals, etc." Rav Yosef said, Rabbi taught: "If there were three - they are forbidden."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב בִּיבִי: לָא תְּצִיתוּ לֵיהּ, אֲנָא אַמְרִיתַהּ נִיהֲלֵהּ, וּמִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה אַמְרִיתַהּ נִיהֲלֵהּ, הוֹאִיל וַאֲנִי קוֹרֵא בָּהֶן רַבִּים בַּחִיצוֹנָה. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מָרֵיהּ דְּאַבְרָהָם! ״רַבִּים״ בְּ״רַבִּי״ אִיחַלַּף לִי.
human_translation: Rav Beivai said to Do not listen to him, I told it to him, and I told it to him in the name of Rav Adda bar Ahava, since I call them many in the outer Rav Yosef said Master of Abraham! I mistook Rabbi for many [ rabbim ].
llm_translation: Rav Bevai said to them: Do not extinguish it for him, I said to him to let it go out, and in the name of Rav Adda bar Ahava I said to let it go out, since I read in them many rulings on the outside. Rav Yosef said: The master of Avraham! "Ravim" in "Rabi" should be switched for me.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם מוּתָּרוֹת, עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ שְׁנַיִם בַּפְּנִימִית וְאֶחָד בַּחִיצוֹנָה.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: Actually, they are permitted, unless there are two in the inner and one in the outer one.
llm_translation: Samuel said: Always permitted, until there are two in the inner and one in the outer.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: וְגוֹי הֲרֵי הוּא כְּרַבִּים. מַאי שְׁנָא יִשְׂרָאֵל דְּלָא אָסַר, דְּמַאן דְּיָדַע — יָדַע, וּמַאן דְּלָא יָדַע סָבַר: עָירוֹבֵי עָירֵב, גּוֹי נָמֵי, אָמְרִינַן: דְּיָדַע — יָדַע, דְּלָא יָדַע סָבַר: אֲגִירֵי אוֹגַר!
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: And a gentile is like many, What is different an Jew he does not prohibit Because one who knows knows and one who does not know thinks an eiruv has been established. a gentile also, we say that who knows knows, who does not know thinks rented
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: "And a non-Jew, behold, he is like a raven." What is the difference between Israel, who did not prohibit the use of their items, for one who knows - knows, and one who does not know thinks: "He will mix the items, a non-Jew, however, we say: if he knows - he knows, if he does not know, he thinks: 'He will steal the items!'"

hebrew_text: סְתָם גּוֹי, אִי אִיתָא דְּאוֹגַר — מִיפְעָא פָּעֵי.
human_translation: a typical gentile, if he rented he would chatter
llm_translation: A non-Jew, if there is one who stores — his actions are effective.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: עֲשָׂרָה בָּתִּים זֶה לִפְנִים מִזֶּה, פְּנִימִי נוֹתֵן אֶת עֵירוּבוֹ, וְדַיּוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: ten houses, one within the other, the innermost one contributes to the eiruv and it is enough.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Ten houses, one inside the other, the inner one places his Eruv, and it suffices.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ חִיצוֹן. חִיצוֹן בֵּית שַׁעַר הוּא? חִיצוֹן שֶׁל פְּנִימִי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Even outer one outer is a gatehouse outer of innermost one.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Even the outer. Is the outer the outer gate? It is the outer of the inner.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: בֵּית שַׁעַר דְּיָחִיד שְׁמֵיהּ בֵּית שַׁעַר. וּמָר סָבַר: לָא שְׁמֵיהּ בֵּית שַׁעַר.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? One Sage, holds the gatehouse of an individual is considered a gatehouse, and one Sage, holds is not considered a gatehouse,
