llm_translation: With what do they disagree? Master holds: the gate of an individual is called "beit sha'ar." And Master holds: it is not called "beit sha'ar."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ אָמַר רַב: שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת וּשְׁלֹשָׁה בָּתִּים בֵּינֵיהֶן, זֶה בָּא דֶּרֶךְ זֶה, וְנוֹתֵן עֵירוּבוֹ בָּזֶה. וְזֶה בָּא דֶּרֶךְ זֶה, וְנוֹתֵן עֵירוּבוֹ בָּזֶה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said Rav said: two courtyards three houses between them, this comes through this and places his eiruv in that and this comes through this and places his eiruv in that
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said, Rav said: Two courtyards and three houses between them, this one comes from this direction, and places his Eruv in this one. And this one comes from this direction, and places his Eruv in this one.

hebrew_text: זֶה נַעֲשֶׂה בֵּית שַׁעַר לָזֶה, וְזֶה נַעֲשֶׂה בֵּית שַׁעַר לָזֶה. אֶמְצָעִי הָוֵה לֵיהּ בַּיִת שֶׁמַּנִּיחִין בּוֹ עֵירוּב, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לִיתֵּן אֶת הַפַּת.
human_translation: this becomes a gatehouse to this and that becomes a gatehouse to that The middle is the house in which the eiruv is placed, need not contribute bread
llm_translation: This was made a gatehouse for Zeh, and this was made a gatehouse for Zeh. In the middle was for him a house where they place an Eruv, and there is no need to provide the bread.

hebrew_text: בָּדֵיק לְהוּ רַחֲבָה לְרַבָּנַן: שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵרוֹת וּשְׁנֵי בָתִּים בֵּינֵיהֶם, זֶה בָּא דֶּרֶךְ זֶה וְנָתַן עֵירוּבוֹ בָּזֶה, וָזֶה בָּא דֶּרֶךְ זֶה וְנָתַן עֵירוּבוֹ בָּזֶה, קָנוּ עֵירוּב אוֹ לָא? מִי מְשַׁוֵּית לְהוּ לְגַבֵּי דְּהַאי בַּיִת, וּלְגַבֵּי דְּהַאי בֵּית שַׁעַר [וּלְגַבֵּי דְּהַאי בֵּית שַׁעַר, וּלְגַבֵּי דְּהַאי בַּיִת]?
human_translation: Raḥava tested the Sages: two courtyards and two houses between them, this came through this and placed his eiruv in that and this came through this and placed his eiruv in that they acquire the eiruv or not, Do you render it a house with regard to this and a gatehouse with regard to that And a gatehouse with regard to this and a house with regard to that
llm_translation: Examine for them the width for the sages: Two courtyards and two houses between them, this one comes by this way and places his Eruv in this one, and that one comes by this way and places his Eruv in that one, have they acquired the Eruv or not? Who is considered as dwelling in this house, and as dwelling in that gatehouse and as dwelling in that gatehouse, and as dwelling in that house?

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: שְׁנֵיהֶן לֹא קָנוּ עֵירוּב, מָה נַפְשָׁךְ: אִי בֵּית שַׁעַר מְשַׁוֵּית לֵיהּ, הַנּוֹתֵן אֶת עֵירוּבוֹ בְּבֵית שַׁעַר אַכְסַדְרָה וּמִרְפֶּסֶת — אֵינוֹ עֵירוּב. אִי בַּיִת מְשַׁוֵּית לֵיהּ — קָא מְטַלְטֵל לְבַיִת דְּלָא מְעָרֵב לֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to Neither has acquired eiruv . Whichever way you If you consider a gatehouse, one who places his eiruv in a gatehouse, a porch, or a balcony, it is not a eiruv . if you consider a house, he would be carrying into a house for which he is not establishing an eiruv .
llm_translation: They said to him: Both of them did not acquire an eruv, what is your opinion? If the entrance of the gate is designated for him, one who places his eruv in the gatehouse, balcony, or porch - it is not considered an eruv. If the house is designated for him - he is moving from one house to another that is not joined to it.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא מִדְּרָבָא? דְּאָמַר רָבָא: אָמְרוּ לוֹ שְׁנַיִם צֵא וְעָרֵב עָלֵינוּ. לְאֶחָד עֵירַב עָלָיו מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם, וּלְאֶחָד עֵירַב עָלָיו בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת. זֶה שֶׁעֵירַב עָלָיו מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם נֶאֱכַל עֵירוּבוֹ בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת, וְזֶה שֶׁעֵירַב עָלָיו בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת נֶאֱכַל עֵירוּבוֹ מִשֶּׁתֶּחְשַׁךְ — שְׁנֵיהֶם קָנוּ עֵירוּב!
human_translation: What different from Rava? As Rava said: two said to Go and establish an eiruv for us, he established an eiruv for one while it was still day, and he established an eiruv for one during twilight, the eiruv of the one for whom he established an eiruv while it was still day was eaten during twilight, and the eiruv of the one for whom he established an eiruv during twilight was eaten after nightfall, both of them have acquired their eiruv .
llm_translation: And what is the difference from Rava? For Rava said: They told him, "Go out and make an Eruv for us." One made an Eruv for him from before daytime, and one made an Eruv for him between the suns. This one whose Eruv was made for him from before daytime, his Eruv is consumed between the suns, and this one whose Eruv was made for him between the suns, his Eruv is consumed from when it gets dark - both of them acquired their Eruv!

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם סָפֵק יְמָמָא סָפֵק לֵילְיָא לָא מִינַּכְרָא מִילְּתָא, אֲבָל הָכָא, אִי דִּלְגַבֵּי דְּהַאי בַּיִת, לְגַבֵּי דְּהַאי בַּיִת. אִי לְגַבֵּי דְּהַאי בֵּית שַׁעַר, לְגַבֵּי דְּהַאי נָמֵי בֵּית שַׁעַר.
human_translation: How can be compared? There, uncertainty day uncertainty night, the matter is not noticeable, But here, if with regard to this a house, with regard to that a house. if, with regard to this a gatehouse, with regard to that also a gatehouse.
llm_translation: So is it possible?! There, when there is doubt whether it is day or night, the matter is not recognizable, but here, if it is regarding this house, it is regarding this house. If it is regarding this gatehouse, it is regarding this gatehouse.

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ הַדָּר
llm_translation: We will return to you, Dara.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חַלּוֹן שֶׁבֵּין שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת אַרְבָּעָה עַל אַרְבָּעָה, בְּתוֹךְ עֲשָׂרָה — מְעָרְבִין שְׁנַיִם. וְאִם רָצוּ — מְעָרְבִין אֶחָד.
human_translation: a window between two courtyards, four by four within ten establish two eiruvin , And if they desire, they establish one eiruv ,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A window between two courtyards, four by four handbreadths in the midst of ten handbreadths - the two courtyards may join together. And if they wish - they may join together as one.

hebrew_text: פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבָּעָה עַל אַרְבָּעָה אוֹ לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה מְעָרְבִין שְׁנַיִם, וְאֵין מְעָרְבִין אֶחָד.
human_translation: less than four by four above ten establish two eiruvin , but they not establish one eiruv .
llm_translation: Less than four on four or above ten combine two, and do not combine one.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לֵימָא תְּנַן סְתָמָא כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, דְּאָמַר: כׇּל פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבָּעָה כְּלָבוּד דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Let us say we learned unattributed in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who said: Any less than four is considered lavud ,
llm_translation: Gemara: Let us say that we learned in a Mishnah in the name of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who said: Any amount less than four is considered as the spilling of blood.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא כְּרַבָּנַן, עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן לְבוּדִין, אֲבָל לְעִנְיַן פִּתְחָא אֲפִילּוּ רַבָּנַן מוֹדוּ דְּאִי אִיכָּא אַרְבָּעָה עַל אַרְבָּעָה — חֲשִׁיב, וְאִי לָא — לָא חֲשִׁיב.
human_translation: Even if you say in accordance with the Rabbis the Rabbis disagreed with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel only with regard to lavud , But with regard to an opening, even the Rabbis agree that if there is four by four significant, and if not, it is not significant.
llm_translation: Even if you say like the Rabbis, until here the Rabbis do not argue regarding the matter of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, but regarding the matter of Budin, but regarding the matter of the opening, even the Rabbis agree that if there are four by four - it is considered, and if not - it is not considered.

hebrew_text: פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבָּעָה וְכוּ׳. פְּשִׁיטָא, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר אַרְבָּעָה עַל אַרְבָּעָה בְּתוֹךְ עֲשָׂרָה — מִמֵּילָא אֲנָא יָדַעְנָא דְּפָחוֹת מֵאַרְבָּעָה וּלְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה לָא!
human_translation: less than four This obvious. Since stated four by four within ten from itself I know less than four or above ten not
llm_translation: Less than four and so on. Obviously, since he said four on four within ten - from the outset I knew that less than four and above ten not!

hebrew_text: הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן טַעְמָא דְּכוּלֵּיהּ לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה, אֲבָל מִקְצָתוֹ בְּתוֹךְ עֲשָׂרָה — מְעָרְבִין שְׁנַיִם, וְאִם רָצוּ — מְעָרְבִין אֶחָד.
human_translation: teaches us this The reason the entire above ten however, part of it is within ten they establish two eiruvin , and if they desire, they establish one eiruv .
llm_translation: This is what teaches to us the reason of the whole above ten, but part of it within ten — mix two, and if they want — mix one.

hebrew_text: תְּנֵינָא לְהָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: כּוּלּוֹ לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה וּמִקְצָתוֹ בְּתוֹךְ עֲשָׂרָה, כּוּלּוֹ בְּתוֹךְ עֲשָׂרָה וּמִקְצָתוֹ לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה — מְעָרְבִין שְׁנַיִם, וְאִם רָצוּ — מְעָרְבִין אֶחָד.
human_translation: we learned that the Sages taught all of is above ten and part of it is within ten all of it is within ten and part of it is above ten they establish two eiruvin , and if they desire, they establish one eiruv .
llm_translation: We have learned in the Mishnah that the Sages taught: If all of it is above ten cubits and some of it is within ten cubits, or if all of it is within ten cubits and some of it is above ten cubits, one may combine two eruvs, and if they wish, they may combine one eruv.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא כּוּלּוֹ לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה וּמִקְצָתוֹ בְּתוֹךְ עֲשָׂרָה אָמְרַתְּ ״מְעָרְבִין שְׁנַיִם וְאִם רָצוּ מְעָרְבִין אֶחָד״, כּוּלּוֹ בְּתוֹךְ עֲשָׂרָה וּמִקְצָתוֹ לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה מִיבַּעְיָא?
human_translation: Now, all of it is above ten and part of it is within ten you said they establish two eiruvin , and if they desire, they establish one eiruv , is it necessary all of it is within ten and part of it is above ten?
llm_translation: The question was asked: If the entirety is above ten and part of it is within ten, do we say "combine two, and if they wish, combine one," or is the entirety within ten and part of it above ten a matter of inquiry?

hebrew_text: ״זוֹ וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר זוֹ״ קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: teaches This, and it is unnecessary to say that,
llm_translation: "This and not need to say this," it teaches.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: חַלּוֹן עָגוֹל צָרִיךְ שֶׁיְּהֵא בְּהֶיקֵּפוֹ עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה טְפָחִים, וּשְׁנַיִם וּמַשֶּׁהוּ מֵהֶן בְּתוֹךְ עֲשָׂרָה, שֶׁאִם יְרַבְּעֶנּוּ, נִמְצָא מַשֶּׁהוּ בְּתוֹךְ עֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: A circular window must have a circumference of twenty-four handbreadths, with two and a bit of them within ten so that when he squares a bit is then within ten
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: A round window needs to have a circumference of twenty-four handbreadths, with two and a half of them within ten, so that if one enlarges it, the half will still be within ten.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדִי, כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בְּהֶיקֵּפוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים — יֵשׁ בּוֹ בְּרוֹחְבּוֹ טֶפַח, בִּתְרֵיסַר סַגִּיא.
human_translation: Now, since any with a circumference of three handbreadths is one handbreadth in diameter, of twelve sufficient
llm_translation: From where, all that has in its circumference three handbreadths - has in its width a handbreadth, in thirteen large.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּעִיגּוּלָא, אֲבָל בְּרִיבּוּעָא בָּעִינַן טְפֵי.
human_translation: This applies to a circle but with regard to a square we require larger
llm_translation: These matters in a circle, but in a square we require a corner.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי, כַּמָּה מְרוּבָּע יָתֵר עַל הֶעָגוֹל — רְבִיעַ, בְּשִׁיתְסַר סַגִּיא!
human_translation: Now, how much larger is a square than a circle? one quarter. with sixteen suffice.
llm_translation: From that, how much is a square more than a circle? A quarter, in sixteen is large!

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי עִיגּוּלָא דְּנָפֵיק מִגּוֹ רִיבּוּעָא. אֲבָל רִיבּוּעָא דְּנָפֵיק מִגּוֹ עִיגּוּלָא, בָּעִינַן טְפֵי. מַאי טַעְמָא? מִשּׁוּם מוּרְשָׁא דְקַרְנָתָא.
human_translation: This applies to a circle circumscribed by a square, but a square circumscribed by a circle, we require more, What is the reason due to the projection of the corners
llm_translation: These are the matters of the round cake that comes out of the oven. But the round cake that comes out of the pot, we require it to be small. What is the reason? Because of the inheritance of the horn.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי, כׇּל אַמְּתָא בְּרִיבּוּעַ — אַמְּתָא וּתְרֵי חוּמְּשֵׁי בַּאֲלַכְסוֹנָא, בְּשֵׁיבְסַר נְכֵי חוּמְשָׁא סַגִּיא.
human_translation: Since every cubit in a square a cubit and two-fifths in the diagonal, seventeen handbreadths minus a fifth is sufficient
llm_translation: From there, every cubit in a square - a cubit and two fifths in a diagonal, in the measure of fifteen cubits.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר כִּי דַּיָּינֵי דְקֵיסָרִי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ כְּרַבָּנַן דְקֵיסָרִי, דְּאָמְרִי: עִיגּוּלָא מִגּוֹ רִיבּוּעָא — רִיבְעָא, רִיבּוּעָא מִגּוֹ עִיגּוּלָא — פַּלְגָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan spoke in accordance with the judges of Caesarea, and some say in accordance with the Sages of Caesarea, who say: A circle within a square one quarter; a square within a circle, half
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: When the wine of the Caesar suffices, and they say to him like the sages of the Caesar, for they say: A circle from a square - a square, a square from a circle - half.

hebrew_text: פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבָּעָה עַל אַרְבָּעָה וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא חַלּוֹן שֶׁבֵּין שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת, אֲבָל חַלּוֹן שֶׁבֵּין שְׁנֵי בָתִּים אֲפִילּוּ לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה נָמֵי, אִם רָצוּ לְעָרֵב — מְעָרְבִין אֶחָד. מַאי טַעְמָא? בֵּיתָא כְּמַאן דִּמְלֵי דָּמֵי.
human_translation: less than four by four Rav Naḥman said: They taught only a window between two courtyards. But a window between two houses, even above ten as well, if they wish to establish an eiruv , they establish one eiruv . What is the reason a house is considered as though it filled,
llm_translation: Less than four on four etc. Rav Nahman said: They only taught regarding a window between two courtyards, but a window between two houses, even if it is higher than ten handbreadths, if they want to join the courtyards - they may join them. What is the reason? A house is like one who fills, it is as if it is filled.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: אֶחָד לִי חַלּוֹן שֶׁבֵּין שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת, וְאֶחָד לִי חַלּוֹן שֶׁבֵּין שְׁנֵי בָתִּים, וְאֶחָד לִי חַלּוֹן שֶׁבֵּין שְׁתֵּי עֲלִיּוֹת, וְאֶחָד לִי חַלּוֹן שֶׁבֵּין שְׁנֵי גַגִּין, וְאֶחָד לִי חַלּוֹן שֶׁבֵּין שְׁנֵי חֲדָרִים — כּוּלָּן אַרְבָּעָה עַל אַרְבָּעָה בְּתוֹךְ עֲשָׂרָה!
human_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Naḥman A window between two courtyards, and a window between two houses, and a window between two attics, and a window between two roofs, and a window between two rooms are all one and the same to me; they all four by four within ten
llm_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Nachman: "I have one window between two courtyards, and I have one window between two houses, and I have one window between two upper stories, and I have one window between two roofs, and I have one window between two rooms - all of them are four by four within ten!"

hebrew_text: תַּרְגּוּמָא אַחֲצֵירוֹת. וְהָא ״אֶחָד לִי״ קָתָנֵי! תַּרְגּוּמָא אַאַרְבָּעָה עַל אַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: Explain courtyards. Doesn’t teach: Are all one and the same to me, explain four by four
llm_translation: The interpretation is "achatzayrot." But isn't it written, "One for me"?! The interpretation is four by four.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא מֵרַב נַחְמָן: לוּל הַפָּתוּחַ מִן בַּיִת לַעֲלִיָּיה, צָרִיךְ סוּלָּם קָבוּעַ לְהַתִּירוֹ אוֹ אֵין צָרִיךְ סוּלָּם קָבוּעַ לְהַתִּירוֹ?
human_translation: Rabbi Abba raised a dilemma before Rav Naḥman: an aperture that opens from a house to an attic must a permanent ladder to render permitted Or, is a permanent ladder not necessary to render it permitted?
llm_translation: Requested from him Rabbi Abba from Rav Nachman: If the window is open from the house to the alleyway, does it require a fixed ladder to permit it, or does it not require a fixed ladder to permit it?

hebrew_text: כִּי אָמְרִינַן בֵּיתָא כְּמַאן דִּמְלֵי דָּמֵי — הָנֵי מִילֵּי מִן הַצַּד, אֲבָל בָּאֶמְצַע — לָא, אוֹ דִילְמָא לָא שְׁנָא?
human_translation: When we say a house is considered as though it filled, this apply on the side, but not in the middle? Or perhaps there is no difference,
llm_translation: We say in the house, like whose opinion are the words - these words from the side, but in the middle - no, or perhaps it is not different?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ. סְבוּר מִינָּה: סוּלָּם קָבוּעַ הוּא דְּאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ, הָא סוּלָּם עֲרַאי — צָרִיךְ. אִיתְּמַר, אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אֶחָד סוּלָּם קָבוּעַ וְאֶחָד סוּלָּם עֲרַאי — אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ.
human_translation: said to him: It is not necessary. understood from a permanent ladder is not required, but a temporary ladder is required. it is stated Rav Yosef bar Manyumi said Rav Naḥman said: Neither a permanent ladder nor a temporary ladder is required,
llm_translation: He said to him: It is not necessary. He thought from it: A fixed ladder is not necessary, but a temporary ladder is necessary. It was stated, Rav Yosef son of Minyomi said in the name of Rav Nachman: Whether a fixed ladder or a temporary ladder - it is not necessary.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כּוֹתֶל שֶׁבֵּין שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת, גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה וְרוֹחַב אַרְבָּעָה — מְעָרְבִין שְׁנַיִם, וְאֵין מְעָרְבִין אֶחָד.
human_translation: a wall between two courtyards is ten high and four wide, establish two eiruvin , but they not establish one eiruv .
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A wall between two courtyards, its height is ten and its width four cubits - two may combine to carry within both courtyards, but one may not combine to carry within both courtyards.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ בְּרֹאשׁוֹ פֵּירוֹת — אֵלּוּ עוֹלִין מִכָּאן וְאוֹכְלִין, וְאֵלּוּ עוֹלִין מִכָּאן וְאוֹכְלִין, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יוֹרִידוּ לְמַטָּן.
human_translation: If there was produce on top these may ascend from this side and eat and those may ascend from that side and eat provided that they do not lower down
llm_translation: They were at the top of the tree - these may be brought up from here and eaten, and these may be brought up from here and eaten, provided that they are not brought down below.

hebrew_text: נִפְרְצָה הַכּוֹתֶל, עַד עֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת — מְעָרְבִין שְׁנַיִם, וְאִם רָצוּ מְעָרְבִין אֶחָד, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא כְּפֶתַח. יוֹתֵר מִכָּאן — מְעָרְבִין אֶחָד וְאֵין מְעָרְבִין שְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: If the wall was breached, up to ten cubits they establish two eiruvin , and if they desire, they establish one eiruv , as it is similar to an entrance, more than this, they establish one eiruv , and they not establish two,
llm_translation: The wall broke, up to ten cubits - they combine two, and if they want, they combine one, because it is like an entrance. More than this - they combine one and do not combine two.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אֵין בּוֹ אַרְבָּעָה מַאי? אָמַר רַב: אֲוִיר שְׁתֵּי רְשׁוּיוֹת שׁוֹלֶטֶת בּוֹ, לֹא יָזִיז בּוֹ אֲפִילּוּ מְלֹא נִימָא.
human_translation: is not four what Rav said: the air of two domains controls it. one may not move on even a hair’s breadth.
llm_translation: Gemara: It does not have four handbreadths. What is the reason? Rav said: If a beam of two handbreadths is resting on it, one may not move it even a little bit.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֵלּוּ מַעֲלִין מִכָּאן וְאוֹכְלִין, וְאֵלּוּ מַעֲלִין מִכָּאן וְאוֹכְלִין.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: These may raise from and eat and those may raise from and eat
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: These ascend from here and eat, and these ascend from here and eat.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: אֵלּוּ עוֹלִין מִכָּאן וְאוֹכְלִין, וְאֵלּוּ עוֹלִין מִכָּאן וְאוֹכְלִין. עוֹלִין — אִין, מַעֲלִין — לָא.
human_translation: We learned these may ascend from this side and eat and those may ascend from that side and eat ascend, yes, raise no,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: These may ascend from here and eat, and these may ascend from here and eat. Ascend - yes, bring up - no.

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: יֵשׁ בּוֹ אַרְבָּעָה עַל אַרְבָּעָה, עוֹלִין — אִין, מַעֲלִין — לָא. אֵין בּוֹ אַרְבָּעָה עַל אַרְבָּעָה — מַעֲלִין נָמֵי.
human_translation: this is what is saying: is four by four ascend, yes, raise no, it is not four by four they may raise as well.
llm_translation: Thus he said: If it has four upon four, they ascend - yes, they ascend; they do not ascend - no. If it does not have four upon four - they still ascend.

hebrew_text: וְאַזְדָּא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּכִי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מָקוֹם שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ אַרְבָּעָה עַל אַרְבָּעָה — מוּתָּר לִבְנֵי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים וְלִבְנֵי רְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד לְכַתֵּף עָלָיו, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יַחֲלִיפוּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan followed his reasoning as when Rav Dimi came Rabbi Yoḥanan said: a place that does not have four by four it is permissible for the people in the public domain and for the people in the private domain to shoulders upon it, provided they do not exchange
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan was pleased with his reasoning, for when Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Yochanan said: In a place where there are not four by four - it is permitted for the public domain and the private domain to carry alongside it, as long as they do not exchange.

hebrew_text: וְרַב לֵית לֵיהּ דְּרַב דִּימִי? אִי בִּרְשׁוּיוֹת דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — הָכִי נָמֵי.
human_translation: And Rav, not accept of Rav Dimi If to domains by Torah law, so too,
llm_translation: And Rav does not have a son named Rav Dimi? If in the permissions of the Torah - so it is said.

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — בִּרְשׁוּיוֹת דְּרַבָּנַן. וַחֲכָמִים עָשׂוּ חִיזּוּק לְדִבְרֵיהֶם יוֹתֵר מִשֶּׁל תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: with what are we dealing here, with domains by rabbinic law, and the Sages reinforced their statements more than those of the Torah.
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? — With the permissions of the Rabbis. And the sages made their words more stringent than those of the Torah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה (אָמַר) רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: כּוֹתֶל שֶׁבֵּין שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת, צִידּוֹ אֶחָד גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים וְצִידּוֹ אֶחָד שָׁוֶה לָאָרֶץ — נוֹתְנִין אוֹתוֹ לָזֶה שֶׁשָּׁוֶה לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: Rabba said Rav Huna said Rav Naḥman said: a wall that is between two courtyards, one side ten handbreadths high, and the other side is level with the ground grant to the level with the ground.
llm_translation: Rabba said, Rav Huna said, Rav Nachman said: A wall between two courtyards, one side of it is ten handbreadths high and the other side is level with the ground - it is given to the one that is level with the ground.

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה לָזֶה תַּשְׁמִישׁוֹ בְּנַחַת וְלָזֶה תַּשְׁמִישׁוֹ בְּקָשֶׁה. וְכׇל לָזֶה בְּנַחַת וְלָזֶה בְּקָשֶׁה — נוֹתְנִין אוֹתוֹ לָזֶה שֶׁתַּשְׁמִישׁוֹ בְּנַחַת.
human_translation: because the use of is convenient for one but difficult for the other And any convenient for one and difficult for another, grant it to the one for whom its use is convenient.
llm_translation: Because it is for this one his use with ease and for this one his use with difficulty. And all for this one with ease and for this one with difficulty — we give it to this one that his use be with ease.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁיזְבִי אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: חָרִיץ שֶׁבֵּין שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת, צִידּוֹ אֶחָד עָמוֹק עֲשָׂרָה וְצִידּוֹ אֶחָד שָׁוֶה לָאָרֶץ — נוֹתְנִין אוֹתוֹ לָזֶה שֶׁשָּׁוֶה לָאָרֶץ, מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ לָזֶה תַּשְׁמִישׁוֹ בְּנַחַת וְלָזֶה תַּשְׁמִישׁוֹ בְּקָשֶׁה וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: Rav Sheizvi said Rav Naḥman said: a ditch between two courtyards, one side of which is ten deep, and the other side of which is level with the ground grant to the level with the ground. because it is the use of is convenient for one and difficult for the other,
llm_translation: Rav Sheizbi said in the name of Rav Nachman: A ditch between two fields, one side of it is deep ten handbreadths and the other side is level with the ground - it is given to the one whose side is level with the ground, because one will have easy use of it and the other will have difficult use of it, and so on.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכִי. דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן כּוֹתֶל, מִשּׁוּם דִּבְגוּבְהָא מִשְׁתַּמְּשִׁי אִינָשֵׁי. אֲבָל חָרִיץ, בְּעוּמְקָא לָא מִשְׁתַּמְּשִׁי אִינָשֵׁי — אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: And necessary since, had taught us with regard to a wall, because people use an elevated However, a ditch, people do not use a deep say not
llm_translation: And it is necessary. For if we were to say a wall, because people make use of its height. But a pit, in a depth people do not make use — we might say no.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן בְּחָרִיץ, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא בְּעִיתָא תַּשְׁמִישְׁתָּא. אֲבָל כּוֹתֶל דִּבְעִיתָא תַּשְׁמִישְׁתָּא — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And had he taught us with regard to a ditch, because its use does not cause worry, However, a wall, the use of which causes worry say not necessary
llm_translation: "And if we were to hear regarding a shard, because you did not intend for its use. But a wall, because you intended for its use - I might say no, it is necessary."

hebrew_text: בָּא לְמַעֲטוֹ, אִם יֵשׁ בְּמִיעוּטוֹ אַרְבָּעָה — מוּתָּר לְהִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בְּכׇל הַכּוֹתֶל כּוּלּוֹ. וְאִם לָאו — אֵין מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ אֶלָּא כְּנֶגֶד הַמִּיעוּט.
human_translation: one comes to diminish If the diminished is four handbreadths it is permitted to use the entire wall. However, if not one use only the opposite diminished
llm_translation: He came to his minimal amount, if there are four in his minimal amount — it is permitted to make use of the entire wall. And if not — one may only make use opposite the minimal amount.

hebrew_text: מָה נַפְשָׁךְ? אִי אַהֲנִי מִעוּטָא — בְּכוּלֵּיהּ כּוֹתֶל לִישְׁתַּמֵּשׁ. אִי לָא אַהֲנִי — אֲפִילּוּ כְּנֶגֶד הַמִּיעוּט נָמֵי לָא. אָמַר רָבִינָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁעָקַר חוּלְיָא מֵרֹאשׁוֹ.
human_translation: Whichever way you If the diminishing was effective, although let him use wall; if was not effective, even corresponding to the diminished also not Ravina said: where one removed a segment from the top
llm_translation: "What is your soul? If it is beneficial — it is a wall to lean upon. If it is not beneficial — even opposite the narrow side it is not. Ravina said: For example, when one uproots a sandal from his head."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְחִיאֵל: כָּפָה סֵפֶל — מְמַעֵט.
human_translation: Rav Yeḥiel said: one overturned a basin it diminishes
llm_translation: Said Rav Yechiel: "Kafah sefel - mema'et."

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? דָּבָר הַנִּיטָּל בְּשַׁבָּת הוּא, וְדָבָר הַנִּיטָּל בְּשַׁבָּת אֵינוֹ מְמַעֵט. לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּחַבְּרֵיהּ בְּאַרְעָא.
human_translation: And why an item that may be moved on Shabbat, And an item that may be moved on Shabbat does not diminish No, it is necessary; where he attached to the ground
llm_translation: And why? A matter that was taken on Shabbat, it is, and a matter that was taken on Shabbat does not diminish. It is not necessary, for he buried it in the ground.

hebrew_text: וְכִי חַבְּרֵיהּ בְּאַרְעָא, מַאי הָוֵי? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: פַּגָּה שֶׁהִטְמִינָהּ בְּתֶבֶן, וַחֲרָרָה שֶׁהִטְמִינָהּ בְּגֶחָלִים, אִם מְגוּלָּה מִקְצָתָהּ — נִטֶּלֶת בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: And if one attached to the ground, what of it? Wasn’t it taught an unripe that one buried in straw or a cake that one buried in coals if part of is visible, it may be moved on Shabbat.
llm_translation: And if his friends in the city, what is the ruling? And it was taught: A jug that was hidden in straw, and a pot that was hidden in coals, if some of it is exposed - it may be moved on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, דְּאִית לֵיהּ אוֹגְנַיִים.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? with has a rim
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? That it has organs.

hebrew_text: וְכִי אִית לֵיהּ אוֹגְנַיִים, מַאי הָוֵי? וְהָתְנַן: הַטּוֹמֵן לֶפֶת וּצְנוֹן תַּחַת הַגֶּפֶן, בִּזְמַן
human_translation: And if has a rim, what of it? Didn’t we learn one who buries a turnip or a radish beneath a vine when
llm_translation: And if he has ognayim, what is the ruling? And we learned in a Mishnah: One who stores bread and radish under the vine, at the time...

hebrew_text: שֶׁמִּקְצָת עָלִין מְגוּלִּין אֵינוֹ חוֹשֵׁשׁ לֹא מִשּׁוּם כִּלְאַיִם, וְלֹא מִשּׁוּם מַעֲשֵׂר, וְלֹא מִשּׁוּם שְׁבִיעִית, וְנִיטָּלִין בַּשַּׁבָּת!
human_translation: some of the leaves are showing, he need not be concerned due to diverse kinds, nor due to tithes, nor due to the Sabbatical Year, And may be taken on Shabbat.
llm_translation: Some of the leaves that are detached are not subject neither to the laws of kilayim, nor to the laws of tithes, nor to the laws of the Sabbatical year, and they may be removed on the Sabbath!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּבָעֵי מָרָא וַחֲצִינָא.
human_translation: No, is necessary that one would need a hoe [ mara ] or a spade
llm_translation: Not necessary, for Marah and Chatzina require.

hebrew_text: סוּלָּם הַמִּצְרִי אֵינוֹ מְמַעֵט וְהַצּוֹרִי מְמַעֵט. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי סוּלָּם הַמִּצְרִי? אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אַרְבָּעָה חֲווֹקִים.
human_translation: An Egyptian ladder, does not diminish a Tyrian diminishes What are the circumstances Egyptian ladder; The school of Rabbi Yannai said: Any that does not have four rungs.
llm_translation: The ladder of the Egyptian does not diminish, and the ladder of the Tyrian does not diminish. What is the value of the ladder of the Egyptian? The House of Rabbi Yannai said: Any ladder that does not have four rungs.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּסוּלָּם הַמִּצְרִי דְּלָא מְמַעֵט? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ הָא דְּאָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר אַדָּא אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא אָמַר רַב: מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ דָּבָר שֶׁנִּיטָּל בְּשַׁבָּת, וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁנִּיטָּל בְּשַׁבָּת — אֵינוֹ מְמַעֵט.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: What is the reason an Egyptian ladder does not diminish said to him: Did you not hear Rav Aḥa bar Adda said Rav Hamnuna said Rav said: because it is an object that may be moved on Shabbat, and any object that may be moved on Shabbat does not diminish
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ahah son of Rava said to Rav Ashi: What is the reason that a ladder of an Egyptian construction does not diminish the ritual impurity of a house? He said to him: Did you not hear what Rav Ahah son of Adda said in the name of Rav Hamnuna who said in the name of Rav: Because it is an object that is carried on Shabbat, and any object that is carried on Shabbat does not diminish the ritual impurity.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ צוֹרִי נָמֵי! הָתָם כּוֹבְדוֹ קוֹבְעוֹ.
human_translation: If so, even a Tyrian as well, There, its heaviness establishes it
llm_translation: If so, even a Tyrian ship is also included! There, its weight establishes it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כּוֹתֶל שֶׁבֵּין שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, וְהִנִּיחַ סוּלָּם רָחָב אַרְבָּעָה מִכָּאן וְסוּלַּם רָחָב אַרְבָּעָה מִכָּאן, וְאֵין בֵּין זֶה לָזֶה שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים — מְמַעֵט. שְׁלֹשָׁה — אֵינוֹ מְמַעֵט.
human_translation: Abaye said: a wall between two courtyards ten handbreadths high, and one placed a ladder four wide on one side, and ladder four wide on the other side, and there are less than three handbreadths between them, diminishes three does not diminish
llm_translation: Abaye said: A wall between two courtyards that is ten handbreadths high, and a ladder is placed with a width of four handbreadths from here and a ladder with a width of four handbreadths from here, and there are not three handbreadths between this one and that one - it is considered diminished. Three - it is not considered diminished.

hebrew_text: וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא הָוֵי כּוֹתֶל אַרְבָּעָה, אֲבָל הָוֵי כּוֹתֶל אַרְבָּעָה — אֲפִילּוּ מוּפְלָג טוּבָא, נָמֵי.
human_translation: And we only said wall was less than four if wall was four even greatly distanced likewise
llm_translation: And we did not say except that it is not considered a wall unless it is four handbreadths wide, but if it is considered a wall even if it is split in half, yes.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי: בָּנָה אִיצְטְבָא עַל גַּב אִיצְטְבָא, אִם יֵשׁ בָּאִיצְטְבָא הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה אַרְבָּעָה — מְמַעֵט. אִי נָמֵי אֵין בַּתַּחְתּוֹנָה אַרְבָּעָה, וְיֵשׁ בָּעֶלְיוֹנָה אַרְבָּעָה, וְאֵין בֵּין זֶה לָזֶה שְׁלֹשָׁה — מְמַעֵט.
human_translation: Rav Beivai bar Abaye said: If one built a platform above platform, if the lower platform is four it diminishes Alternatively, the lower is not four but the upper is four and there is less than three between them, it diminishes
llm_translation: Rav Bevai Bar Abbaye said: If one builds a balcony on top of another balcony, if the lower one has four handbreadths, it diminishes the space. Alternatively, if the lower one does not have four handbreadths, and the upper one has four handbreadths, and there is not a gap of three handbreadths between them, it diminishes the space.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: סוּלָּם שֶׁשְּׁלִיבוֹתָיו פּוֹרְחוֹת, אִם יֵשׁ בַּשְּׁלִיבָה הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה אַרְבָּעָה — מְמַעֵט. אִי נָמֵי אֵין בַּשְּׁלִיבָה הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה אַרְבָּעָה וְיֵשׁ בַּשְּׁלִיבָה הָעֶלְיוֹנָה אַרְבָּעָה, וְאֵין בֵּין זֶה לָזֶה שְׁלֹשָׁה — מְמַעֵט.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: a ladder whose rungs are disconnected, if the bottom rung is four it diminishes Alternatively, the bottom rung is not four but the upper rung is four and there is less than three between them, it diminishes
llm_translation: And Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh: A ladder whose rungs are spread out, if the lower section has four rungs - it diminishes. Alternatively, if the lower section does not have four rungs and the upper section has four rungs, and there are not three rungs between them - it diminishes.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ:
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman said that Rabba bar Avuh said:
llm_translation: And Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said:

hebrew_text: זִיז הַיּוֹצֵא מִן הַכּוֹתֶל אַרְבָּעָה עַל אַרְבָּעָה, וְהִנִּיחַ עָלָיו סוּלָּם כׇּל שֶׁהוּא — מִיעֲטוֹ.
human_translation: a projection four by four extends from a wall, and one placed a ladder of any against it, he has diminished
llm_translation: Ziz that goes out from the wall four by four, and he placed upon it a ladder, any that it is - diminish it.

hebrew_text: וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּאוֹתְבֵיהּ עֲלֵיהּ, אֲבָל אוֹתְבֵיהּ בַּהֲדֵיהּ אַרְווֹחֵי אַרְוְחֵיהּ.
human_translation: And we said only where one placed against However, if he placed it adjacent to he has widened
llm_translation: We did not say, but rather that he placed it on it, but he placed it on its side, its length on its length.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: כּוֹתֶל תִּשְׁעָה עָשָׂר — צָרִיךְ זִיז אֶחָד לְהַתִּירוֹ.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman said that Rabba bar Avuh said: a wall nineteen it requires one projection to permitted.
llm_translation: And Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: "A wall of nineteen amot - requires one additional beam to permit it."

hebrew_text: כּוֹתֶל עֶשְׂרִים — צָרִיךְ שְׁנֵי זִיזִים לְהַתִּירוֹ. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: וְהוּא שֶׁהֶעֱמִידָן זֶה שֶׁלֹּא כְּנֶגֶד זֶה.
human_translation: the wall twenty requires two projections to permitted, Rav Ḥisda said: And this where he positioned not one above the other,
llm_translation: The wall is twenty — requires two projections to permit it. Rav Ḥisdah said: And this is when he placed this one not opposite that one.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: עַמּוּד בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה וְרָחָב אַרְבָּעָה, וְנָעַץ בּוֹ יָתֵד כׇּל שֶׁהוּא — מִיעֲטוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: a pillar in the public domain ten high and four wide, and one drove a stake of any into it, he has diminished its
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: A pillar in a public domain, its height is ten and its width four, and if a peg is inserted into it, it diminishes it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: וּבְגָבוֹהַּ שְׁלֹשָׁה. אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין גָּבוֹהַּ שְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: three high. Abaye and Rava, who both say: Even if not three high,
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: "And in its height three." Abbaye and Rava both said: "Even though there is no height of three."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא: לָא מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: What is the reason is no longer used,
llm_translation: What is the reason: he did not use it.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ שֶׁגָּבוֹהַּ שְׁלֹשָׁה, מַאי טַעְמָא: אֶפְשָׁר דְּתָלֵי בֵּיהּ מִידֵּי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Even a stake three high What is the reason it is possible to hang an item on it. Although
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Even if it is three handbreadths high, what is the reason? It is possible that one leans on it immediately.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: מִלְּאוֹ כּוּלּוֹ בִּיתֵדוֹת מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: he filled it entirely with stakes, what is
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ahah son of Rava said to Rav Ashi: "If one filled his entire house with bundles, what is the law?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בּוֹר וְחוּלְיָיתָהּ מִצְטָרֵף לַעֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: said to him: Did you not hear that Rabbi Yoḥanan said? a pit and its embankment join ten
llm_translation: He said to him: "Did you not hear what Rabbi Yochanan said: A pit and its cavity combine to make ten."

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי, הָא לָא מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ לֵיהּ? אֶלָּא מַאי אִית לָךְ לְמֵימַר — דְּמַנַּח מִידֵּי וּמִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ, הָכָא נָמֵי דְּמַנַּח מִידֵּי וּמִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ.
human_translation: But why? He cannot use Rather, what have you to say, that he places an item, and use Here, too, he places an item and use
llm_translation: And why does he not use it? Rather, what do you have to say? — That when one puts it aside and uses it, here too, when one puts it aside and uses it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כּוֹתֶל עֲשָׂרָה — צָרִיךְ סוּלָּם אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר לְהַתִּירוֹ. רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ שְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר וּמַשֶּׁהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: a wall ten it requires a ladder fourteen permitted. Rav Yosef said: Even thirteen and a bit
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: A wall of ten - requires a ladder of fourteen to permit it. Rav Yosef said: Even thirteen and a half.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ אַחַד עָשָׂר וּמַשֶּׁהוּ.
human_translation: Abaye said: Even eleven and a bit
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Even one and eleven of them.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ שִׁבְעָה וּמַשֶּׁהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Even seven and a bit
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua said: Even seven and delay.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: סוּלָּם זָקוּף — מְמַעֵט. גְּמָרָא, וְלָא יָדַעְנָא מַאי טַעְמָא.
human_translation: Rav said: An upright ladder diminishes a tradition, but I do not know what the reason is,
llm_translation: Rav said: A leaning ladder - less. The Gemara, and we do not know the reason.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: וְלָא יָדַע אַבָּא טַעְמָא דְּהָא מִלְּתָא?! מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַאִיצְטְבָא עַל גַּבֵּי אִיצְטְבָא.
human_translation: Shmuel said: Does Abba, not know the reason for this matter? just as it is a platform above platform.
llm_translation: Samuel said: "And Abba did not know the reason for this matter?!" Since he was sitting on a stool.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא: דְּקָלִים שֶׁבְּבָבֶל — אֵינָן צְרִיכִין קֶבַע. מַאי טַעְמָא: כְּבֵידָן קוֹבַעְתָּן.
human_translation: Rabba said Rabbi Ḥiyya said: palm trees in Babylonia do not need to be established What is the reason their heaviness establishes them
llm_translation: Rabba said, Rabbi Ḥiyya said: Palm trees in Babylonia - do not require irrigation. What is the reason? Their weight sustains them.

hebrew_text: וְרַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: סוּלָּמוֹת שֶׁבְּבָבֶל — אֵינָן צְרִיכִין קֶבַע. מַאי טַעְמָא: כְּבֵידָן קוֹבַעְתָּן.
human_translation: And Rav Yosef Rabbi Oshaya said: Ladders in Babylonia do not need established What is the reason their heaviness establishes them,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said, Rabbi Oshaya: The ladders in Babylon - do not require a fixed position. What is the reason? Their weight establishes them.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר סוּלָּמוֹת, כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן דְּקָלִים. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר דְּקָלִים, אֲבָל סוּלָּמוֹת לָא.
human_translation: the one who said ladders all the more so palm trees, the one who said palm trees However, ladders, no,
llm_translation: The one who says "ladders," certainly palm branches. And the one who says palm branches, but not ladders.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף מֵרַבָּה: סוּלָּם מִכָּאן וְסוּלָּם מִכָּאן וְקַשִּׁין בָּאֶמְצַע, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rav Yosef raised a dilemma before Rabba: ladder on one and a ladder on the other and straw in the middle what is
llm_translation: Requested by Rav Yosef from Rabbah: A ladder from here and a ladder from there, and they meet in the middle, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵין כַּף הָרֶגֶל עוֹלָה בָּהֶן.
human_translation: said to him: The sole of the foot cannot upon them.
llm_translation: He said to him: "The sole of the foot does not ascend with them."

hebrew_text: קַשִּׁין מִכָּאן וְקַשִּׁין מִכָּאן וְסוּלָּם בָּאֶמְצַע, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֲרֵי כַּף הָרֶגֶל עוֹלָה בָּהֶן.
human_translation: straw on one and straw on the other and a ladder in the middle, What is said to him: The sole of the foot can upon them,
llm_translation: Difficult from here and difficult from here and a ladder in the middle, what? He said to him: Behold, the sole of the foot ascends with them.

hebrew_text: חָקַק לְהַשְׁלִים בַּכּוֹתֶל, בְּכַמָּה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בַּעֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: one dug out in the wall to complete how said to him: ten
llm_translation: He engraved to complete in the wall, in how many? He said to him: in ten.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲקָקוֹ כּוּלּוֹ בַּכּוֹתֶל, בְּכַמָּה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מְלֹא קוֹמָתוֹ. וּמַאי שְׁנָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם מִסְתַּלֵּק לֵיהּ, הָכָא לָא מִסְתַּלֵּק לֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to him: one dug out the entire in the wall, how much said to him: the full height of And what is the difference said to him: There, it is easy to climb here, it is not easy to climb.
llm_translation: He said to him: They engraved him entirely on the wall, how? He said to him: His full height. And what is the difference? He said to him: There he departs from it, here he does not depart from it.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף מֵרַבָּה: עֲשָׂאוֹ לָאִילָן סוּלָּם, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rav Yosef raised a dilemma before Rabba: If one designated a tree as a ladder, what is
llm_translation: Requested from him Rav Yosef from Rabbah: He made for the tree a ladder, what?

hebrew_text: תִּיבְּעֵי לְרַבִּי, תִּיבְּעֵי לְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Let the dilemma be raised to Rabbi let the dilemma be raised to the Rabbis,
llm_translation: It is asked of Rabbi, it is asked of the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: תִּיבְּעֵי לְרַבִּי: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי הָתָם כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁהוּא מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת לֹא גָּזְרוּ עָלָיו — הָנֵי מִילֵּי בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת, אֲבָל כּוּלֵּי יוֹמָא — לָא.
human_translation: Let the dilemma be raised to Rabbi Rabbi only stated there anything that is due to a rabbinic decree [ shevut ], did not prohibit this applies only during the twilight period. However, the entire day, not
llm_translation: The student asked Rabbi: Until here not said Rabbi there all thing that is because of dwelling not decreed upon it — those words between the suns, but all day — no.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִילְמָא אֲפִילּוּ לְרַבָּנַן: פִּיתְחָא הוּא, וְאַרְיָא הוּא דִּרְבִיעַ עֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: Or perhaps even according to the Rabbis, is a entrance, but a lion crouches upon it.
llm_translation: Perhaps even according to the Rabbis: it is the beginning, and it is the lion that roars over it.

hebrew_text: עֲשָׂאוֹ לַאֲשֵׁירָה סוּלָּם, מַהוּ? תִּיבְּעֵי לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, תִּיבְּעֵי לְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: If one designated a tree worshipped as part of idolatrous rites [ asheira ], as a ladder, what is let the dilemma be raised to Rabbi Yehuda, let the dilemma be raised to the Rabbis.
llm_translation: They made for the Asherah a ladder, what is it? It is required for Rabbi Yehudah, it is required for the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: תִּיבְּעֵי לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הָתָם דְּמוּתָּר לִקְנוֹת בַּיִת בְּאִיסּוּרֵי הֲנָאָה, אֶלָּא הָתָם, דְּבָתַר דִּקְנָה לֵיהּ עֵירוּב לָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּלִינְּטַר.
human_translation: Let the dilemma be raised to Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yehuda only stated there it is permitted to acquire, a house items prohibited to benefit, there, since after the eiruv has acquired for him, it is not important to him that it is guarded.
llm_translation: The question was raised to Rabbi Yehuda: Until here, Rabbi Yehuda did not say that it is permitted to buy a house with forbidden benefits, but there, since he acquired an Eruv, it is not pleasing to him because it does not benefit him.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִילְמָא אֲפִילּוּ לְרַבָּנַן: פִּיתְחָא הוּא, וְאַרְיָא דִּרְבִיעַ עֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: Or perhaps even to the Rabbis is an opening, but a lion crouches upon it,
llm_translation: Or perhaps even according to the Rabbis: it is the beginning, and the lion of the fourth is upon it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִילָן מוּתָּר, וַאֲשֵׁירָה אֲסוּרָה. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב חִסְדָּא: אַדְּרַבָּה, אִילָן שֶׁאִיסּוּר שַׁבָּת גּוֹרֵם לוֹ — נִיתְּסַר.
human_translation: said to him: A tree is permitted but an asheira is prohibited. Rav Ḥisda strongly objects to this: On the contrary, a tree, which a Shabbat prohibition causes it should be prohibited,
llm_translation: He said to him: A tree is permitted, and an Asherah is forbidden. Rav Ḥisdah strongly objected to him: But a large tree, if its prohibition of Shabbat causes it to be cut down — it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: אֲשֵׁירָה שֶׁאִיסּוּר דָּבָר אַחֵר גּוֹרֵם לוֹ — לָא נִיתְּסַר.
human_translation: An asheira , which something else, causes it should not be prohibited.
llm_translation: A tree that its prohibition another matter causes it - not prohibited.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי, כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כֹּל שֶׁאִיסּוּר שַׁבָּת גָּרַם לוֹ — אָסוּר, כֹּל שֶׁאִיסּוּר דָּבָר אַחֵר גָּרַם לוֹ — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: it was also stated: When Ravin came Rabbi Elazar said, and some say Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Anything which a prohibition of Shabbat causes it is prohibited; anything which something else causes it is permitted.
llm_translation: It was stated: When Ravin came, Rabbi Elazar said, and some say he said in the name of Rabbi Avahu who said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Anything that the prohibition of Shabbat caused - is forbidden; anything that the prohibition of something else caused - is permitted.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק מַתְנֵי הָכִי: אִילָן — פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי וְרַבָּנַן. אֲשֵׁירָה — פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak taught as follows: a tree is a dispute Rabbi and the Rabbis; an asheira is a dispute Rabbi Yehuda, and the Rabbis,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak teaches thus: "Ilah" - a dispute between Rabbi and the Rabbis. "Ashira" - a dispute between Rabbi Yehuda and the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חָרִיץ שֶׁבֵּין שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת, עָמוֹק עֲשָׂרָה וְרוֹחַב אַרְבָּעָה — מְעָרְבִין שְׁנַיִם, וְאֵין מְעָרְבִין אֶחָד. אֲפִילּוּ מָלֵא קַשׁ אוֹ תֶּבֶן. מָלֵא עָפָר אוֹ צְרוֹרוֹת — מְעָרְבִין אֶחָד, וְאֵין מְעָרְבִין שְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: a ditch between courtyards ten deep and four wide, establish two eiruvin , but they not establish one eiruv . Even filled straw or hay, filled with dirt or pebbles, establish one eiruv , but they not establish two eiruvin ,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A trench between two courtyards, if it is ten handbreadths deep and four handbreadths wide - two may join together in carrying within it, but one may not join in carrying within it. Even if it is filled with straw or stones. If it is filled with dirt or pebbles - one may join, but two may not join.

hebrew_text: נָתַן עָלָיו נֶסֶר שֶׁרָחָב אַרְבָּעָה טְפָחִים, וְכֵן שְׁתֵּי גְזוּזְטְרָאוֹת זוֹ כְּנֶגֶד זוֹ — מְעָרְבִין שְׁנַיִם, וְאִם רָצוּ מְעָרְבִין אֶחָד. פָּחוֹת מִכָּאן — מְעָרְבִין שְׁנַיִם, וְאֵין מְעָרְבִין אֶחָד.
human_translation: one placed a board four handbreadths wide across and similarly, two balconies [ gezuztraot ] opposite one another, establish two eiruvin , and if they desire, they establish one, less than establish two eiruvin , but they not establish one eiruv .
llm_translation: He placed upon it a beam that is four handbreadths wide, and likewise two crossbeams, one opposite the other - they combine two Eruvs, and if they wish, they combine one. Closer than this - they combine two, and they do not combine one.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְתֶבֶן לָא חָיֵיץ? וְהָא אֲנַן תְּנַן: מַתְבֵּן שֶׁבֵּין שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים — מְעָרְבִין שְׁנַיִם וְאֵין מְעָרְבִין אֶחָד!
human_translation: hay not a filling Didn’t we learn a haystack ten handbreadths high between two courtyards, establish two eiruvin , but they not establish one eiruv .
llm_translation: Gemar and straw is not considered a binding agent? But we learned: If there is straw between two courtyards, ten handbreadths high, two may combine in carrying and one may not combine!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לְעִנְיַן מְחִיצָה — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּהָוְיָא מְחִיצָה, אֲבָל לְעִנְיַן חֲצִיצָה, אִי בַּטְּלֵיהּ — חָיֵיץ, וְאִי לָא בַּטְּלֵיהּ — לָא חָיֵיץ.
human_translation: Abaye said With regard to a partition, everyone agrees that is a partition But with regard to filling If one nullified it fills however, if he did not nullify it it does not fill
llm_translation: Abaye said: Regarding the matter of a partition - everyone agrees that it is considered a partition, but regarding the matter of a breach, if one annuls it - it is considered a partition, and if one does not annul it - it is not considered a partition.

hebrew_text: מָלֵא עָפָר. וַאֲפִילּוּ בִּסְתָמָא? וְהָתְנַן: בַּיִת שֶׁמִּילְּאָהוּ תֶּבֶן אוֹ צְרוֹרוֹת וּבִיטְּלוֹ — בָּטֵל.
human_translation: filled with dirt even if one did not specify Didn’t we learn a house that one filled with hay or pebbles, and he nullified is nullified
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "malé afar. va'afilu bis'tama? ve'hatnan: bayit she'mil'ahú teven o tz'rorot u'vitteló — batél." English translation: "Full of dust. Even in a concealed manner? And we learned in a Mishnah: If a house was filled with straw or bundles of grain and they were removed — it is nullified."

hebrew_text: בִּיטְּלוֹ — אִין,
human_translation: If he nullified yes,
llm_translation: They nullified it - no.

hebrew_text: לֹא בִּיטְּלוֹ — לָא. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מַאן תָּנָא אֹהָלוֹת — רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הִיא.
human_translation: he did not nullify it, no, Rav Huna said: Who taught Oholot ? It is Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: They did not nullify it - no. Rav Huna said: Who is the Tanna of the Mishnah regarding tents? It is Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: אִי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אִיפְּכָא שָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: תֶּבֶן וְאֵין עָתִיד לְפַנּוֹתוֹ — הֲרֵי הוּא כִּסְתַם עָפָר, וּבָטֵל. עָפָר וְעָתִיד לְפַנּוֹתוֹ — הֲרֵי הוּא כִּסְתַם תֶּבֶן, וְלֹא בָּטֵיל.
human_translation: If Rabbi Yosei, we heard him the opposite, as it was taught Rabbi Yosei says: hay and does not intend to remove, it is considered as though indeterminate dirt, and it is nullified. dirt he intends to remove, it is considered as though indeterminate hay, and it is not nullified.
llm_translation: We heard a contradiction in the words of Rabbi Yosei. For it was taught: Rabbi Yosei says, "If there is straw but it is not destined to be turned into ash, it is like mere dust and is nullified. If there is ash and it is destined to be turned into ash, it is like mere straw and is not nullified."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: מַאן תְּנָא עֵירוּבִין — רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הִיא.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Asi said: Who taught It is Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Assi said: Who is the Tanna of Eiruvin? It is Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אָמַר: טוּמְאָה אַשַּׁבָּת קָרָמֵית?! הַנַּח אִיסּוּר שַׁבָּת, דַּאֲפִילּוּ אַרְנְקִי נָמֵי מְבַטֵּל אִינִישׁ.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Are you raising a contradiction impurity Shabbat? Leave prohibition of Shabbat. a person nullifies even a pouch
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua said: "Is a vineyard considered impure on Shabbat?! Leave the prohibition of Shabbat, for even a wallet also nullifies the impurity."

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: בַּיִת אַחָרִיץ קָא רָמֵית?! בִּשְׁלָמָא חָרִיץ לְמִיטְיְימֵיהּ קָאֵי. אֶלָּא בַּיִת, לְמִיטְיְימֵיהּ קָאֵי?
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: And are you raising a contradiction a house a ditch? Granted a ditch, stands to be filled. However, a house stand to be filled?
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: "A broken house you have exalted?!" Granted, if it is a broken vessel, it can be understood. But a house, can it be understood as a broken vessel?

hebrew_text: נָתַן עָלָיו נֶסֶר שֶׁרוֹחַב אַרְבָּעָה. אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁנָּתַן לְרׇחְבּוֹ, אֲבָל לְאׇרְכּוֹ — אֲפִילּוּ כָּל שֶׁהוּא נָמֵי, שֶׁהֲרֵי מִיעֲטוֹ מֵאַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: one placed a plank that is four wide Rava said: They taught only where one placed along the width But along its length, even minimum also as he reduced to less than four
llm_translation: He placed upon it a plank that is four handbreadths wide. Rava said: They only taught that it must be placed in its width, but in its length—even if it is only a little bit, for it diminishes from the four handbreadths.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן שְׁתֵּי גְזוּזְטְרָאוֹת זוֹ כְּנֶגֶד זוֹ. אָמַר רָבָא: הָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ זוֹ כְּנֶגֶד זוֹ — אִין, זוֹ שֶׁלֹּא כְּנֶגֶד זוֹ — לֹא, וְזוֹ לְמַעְלָה מִזּוֹ נָמֵי, לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא שֶׁיֵּשׁ בֵּין זֶה לָזֶה שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים, אֲבָל אֵין בֵּין זֶה לָזֶה שְׁלֹשָׁה — גְּזוּזְטְרָא עֲקוּמָּה הִיא.
human_translation: And similarly, two balconies opposite each other, Rava said: That which you said: opposite each other, yes, not opposite each other, no, and one is above the other as well, We said only where there is three between this that However, there is less than three between this that it crooked balcony.
llm_translation: And so too, two partitions, this opposite that. Rava said: This that you said, this opposite that - yes; this not opposite that - no. And this above that, we do not say, except that there are three handbreadths between this and that. But there are not three handbreadths between this and that - it is an upright partition.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מַתְבֵּן שֶׁבֵּין שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים — מְעָרְבִין שְׁנַיִם, וְאֵין מְעָרְבִין אֶחָד. אֵלּוּ מַאֲכִילִין מִכָּאן, וְאֵלּוּ מַאֲכִילִין מִכָּאן. נִתְמַעֵט הַתֶּבֶן מֵעֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, — מְעָרְבִין אֶחָד, וְאֵין מְעָרְבִין שְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: a haystack that is between two courtyards ten handbreadths high, and establish two eiruvin , and they not establish one eiruv . These, feed from here, and those, feed from there, the hay was reduced than ten handbreadths establish one eiruv , and they do not establish two eiruvin .
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A brick that is situated between two courtyards, ten handbreadths high - two may combine (for an eruv), but one may not combine. These (residents) eat from here, and those (residents) eat from there. If the brick diminishes to less than ten handbreadths - one may combine, but two may not combine.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִתֵּן לְתוֹךְ קוּפָּתוֹ וְיַאֲכִיל.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: And provided that one does not put into his basket and feed
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Huna said: And only that he should not put it into his pouch and eat.

hebrew_text: וּלְאוֹקֹמֵי שְׁרֵי? וְהָאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מַעֲמִיד אָדָם אֶת בְּהֶמְתּוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי עֲשָׂבִים בְּשַׁבָּת. וְאֵין מַעֲמִיד אָדָם אֶת בְּהֶמְתּוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי מוּקְצֶה בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: And permitted to stand Didn’t Rav Huna say Rabbi Ḥanina said: A person may stand his animal on grass on Shabbat, a person may not stand his animal on set-aside on Shabbat.
llm_translation: To the ones who establish oxen? And it was said, Rav Huna said in the name of Rabbi Chanina: One may place his animal on grass on Shabbat. But one may not place his animal on a bundle of cut stalks on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: דְּקָאֵים לַהּ בְּאַפַּהּ וְאָזְלָה וְאָכְלָה.
human_translation: where one stands in front of and it goes and eats
llm_translation: She is standing in the oven and going out and eating.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא יִתֵּן לְתוֹךְ קוּפָּתוֹ תֶּבֶן? וְהָתַנְיָא: בַּיִת שֶׁבֵּין שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת וּמִילְּאָהוּ תֶּבֶן — מְעָרְבִין שְׁנַיִם וְאֵין מְעָרְבִין אֶחָד. זֶה נוֹתֵן לְתוֹךְ קוּפָּתוֹ וְיַאֲכִיל, וְזֶה נוֹתֵן לְתוֹךְ קוּפָּתוֹ וְיַאֲכִיל. נִתְמַעֵט הַתֶּבֶן מֵעֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים — שְׁנֵיהֶם אֲסוּרִים.
human_translation: And may one not put hay into his basket Wasn’t it taught a house that is between two courtyards and filled it with hay, establish two eiruvin , but do not establish one eiruv , this puts into his basket and feeds and that puts into his basket and feeds If the hay was reduced than ten handbreadths, prohibited both
llm_translation: And not give into his basket stone? And it was taught: a house between two courtyards and filled it with stone - they may combine two and may not combine one. This one puts into his basket and feeds, and this one puts into his basket and feeds. If the stone diminishes from ten handbreadths - both are forbidden.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד הוּא עוֹשֶׂה? נוֹעֵל אֶת בֵּיתוֹ וּמְבַטֵּל אֶת רְשׁוּתוֹ, הוּא אָסוּר וַחֲבֵירוֹ מוּתָּר.
human_translation: How, does act locks his house and renounces his right it is prohibited and it is permitted the other
llm_translation: How does he do it? He locks his house and annuls his ownership, he is forbidden and his friend is permitted.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בְּגוֹב שֶׁל תֶּבֶן שֶׁבֵּין שְׁנֵי תְּחוּמֵי שַׁבָּת. קָתָנֵי מִיהַת: זֶה נוֹתֵן לְתוֹךְ קוּפָּתוֹ וְיַאֲכִיל, וְזֶה נוֹתֵן לְתוֹךְ קוּפָּתוֹ וְיַאֲכִיל.
human_translation: And you say likewise with regard to a pit [ gov ] of hay that between two Shabbat limits. In any case, teaches: this puts into his basket and feeds and that puts into his basket and feeds
llm_translation: And so you say in a heap of straw that is between two Shabbat boundaries. The Mishnah teaches from there: This one places into his basket and may eat, and this one places into his basket and may eat.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: בַּיִת, כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא (מְחִיצּוֹת וְ)תִּקְרָה, כִּי מִיפְּחִית — מִינַּכְרָא לֵיהּ מִלְּתָא. הָכָא — לָא מִינַּכְרָא לֵיהּ מִלְּתָא.
human_translation: We say a house, since it has walls and a ceiling, when is reduced the matter is conspicuous. Here, is not conspicuous.
llm_translation: They said: A house, since there are partitions and a ceiling, when it is diminished — the matter is recognizable. Here — the matter is not recognizable.

hebrew_text: נִתְמַעֵט הַתֶּבֶן מֵעֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים שְׁנֵיהֶן אֲסוּרִין. הָא עֲשָׂרָה — שְׁרֵי, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּמִידַּלְיָא תִּקְרָה טוּבָא. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: מְחִיצּוֹת שֶׁאֵין מַגִּיעוֹת לַתִּקְרָה — שְׁמָן מְחִיצּוֹת.
human_translation: If the hay was reduced than ten handbreadths prohibited both ten permitted ceiling is much higher Conclude from it status of partitions that do not reach the ceiling is that of partitions,
llm_translation: The brick diminished from ten handbreadths, two of them are forbidden. But if it is ten handbreadths - they are permitted, even though it reaches the ceiling. Learn from it: partitions that do not reach the ceiling - their oil is considered partitions.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָכָא בְּבַיִת שְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר חָסֵר מַשֶּׁהוּ עָסְקִינַן, וְתֶבֶן עֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: Abaye said: Here, we are dealing with house slightly less than thirteen and the hay ten
llm_translation: Abaye said: Here we are dealing with a case where there are thirteen people in the house, lacking one for a minyan, and ten people are occupied with prayer, and the missing person is a child.

hebrew_text: וְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא בְּבֵית עֲשָׂרָה
human_translation: And Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Even you say with a house ten
llm_translation: And Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua said: Even if you say in the house of ten.

hebrew_text: וְתֶבֶן שִׁבְעָה וּמַשֶּׁהוּ, דְּכׇל פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה כְּלָבוּד דָּמֵי.
human_translation: and hay slightly more than seven any less than three are considered joined,
llm_translation: "And straw seven and it is considered, as long as less than three like blood."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְאַבָּיֵי, הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי ״מֵעֲשָׂרָה״, אֶלָּא לְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ מַאי ״מֵעֲשָׂרָה״?
human_translation: Granted, according to Abaye, that is why teaches: than ten However, according to Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, what is than ten?
llm_translation: In truth, according to Abbaye, that which is taught "from ten," but according to Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, what is "from ten"?

hebrew_text: מִתּוֹרַת עֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: than the law of ten
llm_translation: From the Torah of ten.

hebrew_text: שְׁנֵיהֶן אֲסוּרִין. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ דָּיוֹרִין הַבָּאִין בְּשַׁבָּת אֲסוּרִין?
human_translation: prohibited both. learn from this residents who arrive on Shabbat prohibit
llm_translation: Both of them are prohibited. Can we infer from this that those who come on Shabbat are prohibited?

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא דְּאִימְּעַט מֵאֶתְמוֹל.
human_translation: Perhaps where was reduced on the previous day,
llm_translation: Perhaps he will retract from yesterday.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד הוּא עוֹשֶׂה? נוֹעֵל אֶת בֵּיתוֹ וּמְבַטֵּל רְשׁוּתוֹ. תַּרְתֵּי?! הָכִי קָאָמַר: אוֹ נוֹעֵל אֶת בֵּיתוֹ אוֹ מְבַטֵּל אֶת רְשׁוּתוֹ.
human_translation: How, does act locks his house and renounces his right two This is what is saying: Either he locks his house or he renounces his right
llm_translation: How does he do it? He locks his house and annuls his permission. Two?! This is what he is saying: Either he locks his house or annuls his permission.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם תַּרְתֵּי, כֵּיוָן דְּדָשׁ בֵּיהּ — אָתֵי לְטַלְטוֹלֵי.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Actually, both Since he is accustomed to he will come to carry.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Always two, since it is threshed in it - it comes to be sifted.

hebrew_text: הוּא אָסוּר וַחֲבֵירוֹ מוּתָּר. פְּשִׁיטָא? לָא צְרִיכָא, דַּהֲדַר אִידַּךְ וּבַטֵּיל לֵיהּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ, וְהָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: דְּאֵין מְבַטְּלִין וְחוֹזְרִין וּמְבַטְּלִין.
human_translation: it is prohibited and it is permitted the other obvious? It was necessary only where the other then renounced of the first And teaches us that may not renounce and then renounce
llm_translation: He is forbidden and his friend is permitted. Obvious? Not necessary, because the other one will retract and annul it for his friend, and this is what we hear: that one does not annul and then retract and annul.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בְּגוֹב שֶׁל תֶּבֶן שֶׁבֵּין שְׁנֵי תְּחוּמֵי שַׁבָּת. פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּאָמַר: תְּחוּמִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לִיגְזוֹר דִּלְמָא אָתֵי לְאִיחַלּוֹפֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And you say likewise with regard to a pit of hay that between two Shabbat limits. obvious? It was necessary according to Rabbi Akiva, who said boundaries by Torah law. Lest you say let us issue a decree lest come to exchange teaches us
llm_translation: And so you say in a pile of wood that is between two Shabbat boundaries. It is obvious! It is not necessary according to Rabbi Akiva who said: Shabbat boundaries are from the Torah, lest you say: let us cut the wood in case it comes to be exchanged, it is clear to us.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כֵּיצַד מִשְׁתַּתְּפִין בְּמָבוֹי? מַנִּיחַ אֶת הֶחָבִית, וְאוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי זוֹ לְכׇל בְּנֵי מָבוֹי, וּמְזַכֶּה לָהֶן עַל יְדֵי בְּנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ הַגְּדוֹלִים, וְעַל יְדֵי עַבְדּוֹ וְשִׁפְחָתוֹ הָעִבְרִים, וְעַל יְדֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: How does one merge into the alleyway, He places a barrel and says: This is for all the residents of the alleyway. and he confer possession to them by means of his adult son or daughter, and by means of his Hebrew slave or maidservant, and by means of his wife.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: How do they participate in an alleyway? One places the barrel and says: "This is for all the residents of the alleyway, and it benefits them through the agency of his adult son and daughter, and through the agency of his Hebrew slave and maidservant, and through the agency of his wife."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אֵינוֹ מְזַכֶּה לֹא עַל יְדֵי בְּנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ הַקְּטַנִּים, וְלֹא עַל יְדֵי עַבְדּוֹ וְשִׁפְחָתוֹ הַכְּנַעֲנִים, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּדָן כְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: However, he not confer possession by means of his minor son or daughter, nor by means of his Canaanite slave or maidservant, because their possession is as his possession.
llm_translation: But he does not acquire neither through his minor son and daughter, nor through his Canaanite slave and maidservant, because their hand is like his hand.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: חָבִית שֶׁל שִׁיתּוּפֵי מְבוֹאוֹת צָרִיךְ לְהַגְבִּיהַּ מִן הַקַּרְקַע טֶפַח.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: a barrel for the merging of alleyways, must raise a handbreadth from the ground,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Rav Yehudah: Chavit shel shitufei mevo'ot tzarich lehagbiha min ha'karka tefach. English translation: The Gemara said, Rav Yehudah: A barrel of joint ownership of alleyways needs to be lifted from the ground a handbreadth.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הָנֵי תַּרְתֵּי מִילֵּי, סָבֵי דְפוּמְבְּדִיתָא אַמְרִינְהוּ: חֲדָא — הָא. אִידַּךְ — הַמְקַדֵּשׁ, אִם טָעַם מְלֹא לוּגְמָיו — יָצָא, וְאִם לָאו — לֹא יָצָא.
human_translation: Rava said: The elders of Pumbedita, stated these two matters. One this the other one who recites kiddush if he tasted a mouthful he fulfilled however, if not he did not fulfill
llm_translation: Rava said: These two matters, the elders of Pumbedita stated: one — this. The other — one who sanctifies, if he tasted the size of a dried fig, he has fulfilled his obligation, and if not, he has not fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חֲבִיבָא: הָא נָמֵי סָבֵי דְפוּמְבְּדִיתָא אַמְרִינְהוּ, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: עוֹשִׂין מְדוּרָה לַחַיָּה בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rav Ḥaviva said: the elders of Pumbedita stated this too, as Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: One builds a fire for a woman in childbirth on Shabbat.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥaviva said: The elders of Pumbedita said, as Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: One may make a dwelling place for an animal on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: סְבוּר מִינָּה: לְחַיָּה — אִין, לְחוֹלֶה — לָא. בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים — אִין, בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה — לָא.
human_translation: thought from here: For a woman in childbirth, yes, for a sick person, no, in the rainy season, yes, in the summer, no,
llm_translation: The opinion is: for a living animal — no, for a sick one — yes. In rainy days — no, in sunny days — yes.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הִקִּיז דָּם וְנִצְטַנֵּן — עוֹשִׂין לוֹ מְדוּרָה בְּשַׁבָּת, וַאֲפִילּוּ בִּתְקוּפַת תַּמּוּז.
human_translation: was stated: Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin said Shmuel said: let blood and caught cold, one builds a fire for him on Shabbat, even during the season of Tammuz,
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin said in the name of Shmuel: If one vomited blood and then fainted - they make for him a fire on Shabbat, even during the summer solstice.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: הָא נָמֵי סָבֵי דְפוּמְבְּדִיתָא אַמְרִינְהוּ, דְּאִיתְּמַר: אֵיזוֹ הִיא אֲשֵׁירָה סְתָם?
human_translation: Ameimar said: This too was stated by the elders of Pumbedita, as it was stated which is presumed a tree designated for idolatry [ asheira ],
llm_translation: אָמַר - said אַמֵּימָר - Amemar (name of Talmudic sage) הָא - this נָמֵי - certain סָבֵי - elders דְפוּמְבְּדִיתָא - of Pumbedita (city in Babylonia) אַמְרִינְהוּ - said to them דְּאִיתְּמַר - it was said אֵיזוֹ - which הִיא - is אֲשֵׁירָה - the song סְתָם - plain, simple

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: כׇּל שֶׁכּוֹמָרִין שׁוֹמְרִין אוֹתָהּ
human_translation: Rav said: It is any that priests guard.
llm_translation: Rav said: "Kol she'komarin shomerin otah."

hebrew_text: וְאֵין טוֹעֲמִין מִפֵּירוֹתֶיהָ.
human_translation: and whose fruit they do not taste.
llm_translation: And we do not taste from its fruits.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: כְּגוֹן דְּאָמְרִי ״הָנֵי תַּמְרֵי לְשִׁיכְרָא דְּבֵי נִצְרְפֵי דְּשָׁתוּ לֵיהּ בְּיוֹם חַגָּם״. (אָמַר אַמֵּימָר:) וַאֲמַרוּ לִי סָבֵי דְפוּמְבְּדִיתָא: הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: For example, if they say: These dates are for the beer of the temple of Nitzrefei, which they drink on the day of their festival, Ameimar said: And the elders of Pumbedita said to me halakha is in accordance with Shmuel.
llm_translation: Samuel said: For example, as they say, "Those dates for the festival of the house of Nitzrefei, they drank it on their holiday." (Ammar Amemar:) And the elders of Pumbedita told me: The halakha is in accordance with the opinion of Samuel.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: כֵּיצַד מִשְׁתַּתְּפִין בְּמָבוֹי — מְבִיאִים חָבִית שֶׁל יַיִן וְשֶׁל שֶׁמֶן וְשֶׁל תְּמָרִים וְשֶׁל גְּרוֹגְרוֹת וְשֶׁל שְׁאָר מִינֵי פֵּירוֹת.
human_translation: raises an objection How does one merge an alleyway? One brings a barrel of wine, or oil, or dates, or dried figs, or any other type of produce
llm_translation: Challenger: How do they participate in a shared courtyard? — They bring a barrel of wine, and of oil, and of dates, and of figs, and of various other fruits.

hebrew_text: אִם מִשֶּׁלּוֹ — צָרִיךְ לְזַכּוֹת. וְאִם מִשֶּׁלָּהֶן — צָרִיךְ לְהוֹדִיעַ. וּמַגְבִּיהַּ מִן הַקַּרְקַע מַשֶּׁהוּ! מַאי ״מַשֶּׁהוּ״ נָמֵי דְּקָאָמַר? טֶפַח.
human_translation: If of his own, he must confer possession And if is theirs, he must inform And raises a minimal amount from the ground. too, what is minimal amount of which spoke? a handbreadth,
llm_translation: If from his own — he needs to acquit. And if from theirs — he needs to inform. And one who lifts from the ground, what is "something"? A handbreadth.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: שִׁיתּוּפֵי מְבוֹאוֹת, רַב אָמַר: אֵין צָרִיךְ לְזַכּוֹת, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: צָרִיךְ לְזַכּוֹת. עֵירוּבֵי תְחוּמִין, רַב אָמַר: צָרִיךְ לְזַכּוֹת, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵין צָרִיךְ לְזַכּוֹת.
human_translation: It is stated merging of alleyways. Rav said: It is not necessary to confer possession and Shmuel said: It is necessary to confer possession joining of boundaries, Rav said: It is necessary to confer possession and Shmuel said: It is not necessary to confer possession
llm_translation: It was stated: Partnerships of entrances, Rav said: not necessary to establish, and Shmuel said: necessary to establish. Eruvin of boundaries, Rav said: necessary to establish, and Shmuel said: not necessary to establish.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לִשְׁמוּאֵל — הָכָא תְּנַן, וְהָכָא לָא תְּנַן. אֶלָּא לְרַב מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: Granted, according to Shmuel, here, we learned whereas there, we did not learn However, according to Rav, what is the reason
llm_translation: In Shmuel's opinion - here we learned, and here we did not learn. Rather, what is the reason for Rav?

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּכַלָּתוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא שֶׁהָלְכָה לְבֵית הַמֶּרְחָץ, וְחָשְׁכָה לָהּ, וְעֵירְבָה לָהּ חֲמוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: This is the tanna’im , as Rav Yehuda said Rav said: an incident involving daughter-in-law of Rabbi Oshaya, who went to the bathhouse, and it grew dark she and her mother-in-law established a joining
llm_translation: It is taught: for Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: There was an incident with the bride of Rabbi Oshaya, that she went to the bathhouse, and it became dark for her, and her mother-in-law arranged for her.

hebrew_text: וּבָא מַעֲשֶׂה לִפְנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא — וְאָסַר. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: בַּבְלַאי, כׇּל כָּךְ אַתָּה מַחְמִיר בְּעֵירוּבִין?! כָּךְ אָמַר אַבָּא: כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ לְךָ לְהָקֵל בְּעֵירוּבִין — הָקֵל.
human_translation: And the incident came before Rabbi Ḥiyya and he prohibited Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said to him: Babylonian, are you so stringent with regard to an eiruv ? This father said: Any where you have to be lenient with regard to an eiruv , be lenient.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And there was an incident before Rabbi Chiya - and he prohibited it. Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said to him: "Bavlai, all this you are stringent in regards to Eruvin?!" So said Abba: "Anything that you have the ability to be lenient in Eruvin - be lenient."

hebrew_text: וְאִבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מִשֶּׁל חֲמוֹתָהּ עֵירְבָה לָהּ, וּמִשּׁוּם דְּלֹא זִיכְּתָה לָהּ. אוֹ דִילְמָא: מִשֶּׁלָּהּ עֵירְבָה לָהּ, וּמִשּׁוּם דְּשֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתָּהּ?
human_translation: And a dilemma was raised establish the eiruv for with the mother-in-law’s because she did not confer possession to her, Or perhaps she established the eiruv for her with the own because without her knowledge?
llm_translation: And Abbaye said to them: From the gift of her mother-in-law she made an eruv for herself, and perhaps because she did not merit it. Or perhaps: From her own gift she made an eruv for herself, and perhaps because it was not with her knowledge?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן הַהוּא מֵרַבָּנַן, וְרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב שְׁמֵיהּ: לְדִידִי מִיפָּרְשָׁא לַהּ מִינֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן — מִשֶּׁל חֲמוֹתָהּ עֵירְבָה, וּמִשּׁוּם דְּלֹא זִיכְּתָה לָהּ.
human_translation: One of the Sages, named Rabbi Ya’akov, said to them: It was explained to me by Rabbi Yoḥanan established the eiruv for her with the mother-in-law’s and because she did not confer possession to her.
llm_translation: He said to them that one from the sages, and Rabbi Yaakov is his name: According to my understanding, it can be explained from the teaching of Rabbi Yochanan - from the fact that her mother-in-law made an eruv, and because she did not prepare it for her.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא לְרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב (בְּרֵיהּ) דְּבַת יַעֲקֹב: כִּי מָטֵית הָתָם, אַקֵּיף וְזִיל לְסוּלָּמָא דְצוֹר, וּבַעְיָא מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Ya’akov, son of the daughter of Ya’akov: When you go there, take a roundabout and go to the Ladder of Tyre and raise dilemma before Rav Ya’akov bar Idi.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Zeira to Rabbi Yaakov (son of Yaakov): When you go there, turn and go to the ladder of Tyre, and ask from him about Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ: מִשֶּׁל חֲמוֹתָהּ עֵירְבָה, וּמִשּׁוּם דְּלֹא זִיכְּתָה לָהּ, אוֹ דִּלְמָא: מִשֶּׁלָּהּ עֵירְבָה, וּמִשּׁוּם דְּשֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתָּהּ?
human_translation: raised a dilemma before him: establish the eiruv for from the mother-in-law’s and because she did not confer possession to her? Or perhaps she established the eiruv for her with own because without her knowledge?
llm_translation: He asked of him: From the gift of her mother-in-law she made an eruv, and is it because she did not consent to it, or perhaps: From her own gift she made an eruv, and is it because she did not do so intentionally?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִשֶּׁל חֲמוֹתָהּ עֵירְבָה לָהּ, וּמִשּׁוּם דְּלֹא זִיכְּתָה לָהּ.
human_translation: said to him: established the eiruv for her with the mother-in-law’s because she did not confer possession to her.
llm_translation: He said to him: from the parable of her mother-in-law she learned, and because she did not merit for herself.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: נָקְטִינַן, אֶחָד עֵירוּבֵי תְחוּמִין, וְאֶחָד עֵירוּבֵי חֲצֵירוֹת, אֶחָד שִׁיתּוּפֵי מְבוֹאוֹת צָרִיךְ לְזַכּוֹת. בָּעֵי רַב נַחְמָן: עֵירוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין צָרִיךְ לְזַכּוֹת, אוֹ אֵין צָרִיךְ לְזַכּוֹת?
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: We hold based on tradition that all joining of boundaries, joining of courtyards, and merging of alleyways, it is necessary to confer possession. Rav Naḥman raised a dilemma a joining of cooked foods eiruv tavshilin ], is it necessary to confer possession, or is it not necessary to confer possession?
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: We have learned, whether it be an Eruv of boundaries, or an Eruv of courtyards, or a joint Eruv of alleyways, one must establish it. Rav Nachman asked: Is it necessary to establish an Eruv of cooked foods, or is it not necessary to establish it?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: וּמַאי תִּיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ? לָא שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ הָא דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר רַב אַדָּא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: עֵירוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין צָרִיךְ לְזַכּוֹת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: פְּשִׁיטָא דְּלָא שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ. דְּאִי שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ, מַאי תִּיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ?
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: What is his dilemma? he not hear that which Rav Naḥman bar Rav Adda said Shmuel said: a joining of cooked foods, it is necessary to confer possession? Abaye said to obvious that he did not hear as had he heard it, why would he have raised this dilemma?
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: And what does he need it for? He should not listen to him, as Rav Nachman bar Rav Adda said in the name of Shmuel: The mixture of cooked foods requires intention. Abbaye said to him: It is obvious that he should not listen to him. For if he were to listen to him, what does he need it for?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַטּוּ עֵירוּבֵי תְחוּמִין מִי לָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין צָרִיךְ לְזַכּוֹת, וְאָמַר אִיהוּ: צָרִיךְ לְזַכּוֹת.
human_translation: said to him: Didn’t Shmuel say, joining of boundaries, it is not necessary to confer possession, and said it is necessary to confer possession?
llm_translation: He said to him: "Did Shmuel not say: 'There is no need to establish an Eruv for the boundaries'?" And he said: "One must establish an Eruv for the boundaries."

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! בִּשְׁלָמָא הָתָם פְּלִיגִי רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל, וְקָא מַשְׁמַע לַן כְּחוּמְרִין דְּמָר וְכִי חוּמְרִין דְּמָר, אֲבָל הָכָא, אִי אִיתָא דִּשְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ מִי אִיכָּא דְּמַאן דִּפְלִיג?
human_translation: How can you compare Granted, there, Rav and Shmuel disagree, and teaches us with the stringency of master and the stringency of master, However, here, if it is so, he heard is there anyone who disputes
llm_translation: So now?! Granted there, Rav and Shmuel argue, and it is heard for us like the stringencies of Mar. But the stringencies of Mar, here, if it comes that it is heard to him, who is there that argues?
