hebrew_text: הָהוּא טוּרְזִינָא דַּהֲוָה בְּשִׁיבָבוּתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אוֹגַיר לַן רְשׁוּתָךְ, לָא אוֹגַיר לְהוּ. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מַהוּ, לְמֵיגַר מִדְּבֵיתְהוּ?
human_translation: A certain superintendent [ turzina ] lived in Rabbi Zeira’s neighborhood. said to him: Rent your domain to us he would not rent to them. They came before Rabbi Zeira and asked him: What is to rent from his wife
llm_translation: That Turzina who was in the neighborhood of Rabbi Zeira, they said to him: "Lock your door, do not lock theirs." They came before Rabbi Zeira and said to him: "What about locking from their side?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָכִי אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּגַבְרָא רַבָּה, וּמַנּוּ רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם מְעָרֶבֶת שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתּוֹ.
human_translation: said to them: Reish Lakish said as follows in the name of a great man, and who is Rabbi Ḥanina. A man’s wife may establish an eiruv without his knowledge.
llm_translation: He said to them: So said Reish Lakish in the name of the great man, and Rabbi Chanina counted: A man's wife mixes without his knowledge.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא טוּרְזִינָא דַּהֲוָה בְּשִׁיבָבוּתֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה בַּר אוֹשַׁעְיָא, אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: אוֹגַר לַן רְשׁוּתָךְ, לָא אוֹגַר לְהוּ. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה בַּר אוֹשַׁעְיָא, אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: מַהוּ לְמֵיגַר מִדְּבֵיתְהוּ, לָא הֲוָה בִּידֵיהּ. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב מַתְנָה, לָא הֲוָה בִּידֵיהּ. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה, אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָכִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם מְעָרֶבֶת שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתּוֹ.
human_translation: A certain superintendent lived in the neighborhood of Rav Yehuda bar Oshaya. said to him: Rent your domain to us he would not rent to them. They came before Rav Yehuda bar Oshaya said to him: What is to rent from his wife? He did not have at hand. They came before Rav Mattana, he did not have at hand. They came before Rav Yehuda, said to them Shmuel said as follows: A man’s wife may establish an eiruv without his knowledge,
llm_translation: That Turzinah who was in the neighborhood of Rav Yehudah bar Oshaya, they said to him: "You are storing your property for us, but you are not storing it for them." They came before Rav Yehudah bar Oshaya, they said to him: "When one wants to remove from his house, it is not in his possession." They came before Rav Matnah, it was not in his possession. They came before Rav Yehudah, he said to them: "So said Shmuel: A man's wife mixes without his knowledge."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: נָשִׁים שֶׁעֵירְבוּ וְנִשְׁתַּתְּפוּ שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעַת בַּעֲלֵיהֶן, אֵין עֵירוּבָן עֵירוּב, וְאֵין שִׁיתּוּפָן שִׁיתּוּף!
human_translation: raises an objection Women who joined or merged the alleyways without the knowledge of their husbands, their eiruv is not a eiruv , and their merging is not a merging.
llm_translation: Challenger: Women who made an eruv and participated without the knowledge of their husbands, their eruv is not an eruv, and their partnership is not a partnership!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — דְּאָסַר, הָא — דְּלָא אָסַר.
human_translation: not difficult. this would prohibit that he would not prohibit
llm_translation: Not difficult: this - that prohibited, this - that did not prohibit.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִם כֵּן קַשְׁיָא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל אַדִּשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֶחָד מִבְּנֵי מָבוֹי שֶׁרָגִיל לְהִשְׁתַּתֵּף עִם בְּנֵי מָבוֹי, וְלֹא נִשְׁתַּתֵּף — בְּנֵי הַמָּבוֹי נִכְנָסִין לְתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ וְנוֹטְלִין שִׁיתּוּפָן מִמֶּנּוּ בְּעַל כׇּרְחוֹ.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable as if this, a contradiction between of Shmuel and of Shmuel. As Shmuel said: one of the residents of an alleyway who was accustomed to join in a merging of alleyways with the residents of alleyway, but he did not join in a merging of alleyways the residents of the alleyway enter his house and take their merging of alleyways from him against his will.
llm_translation: Thus it was explained: for if so, the difficulty of Shmuel is a difficulty, for Shmuel said: One of the residents of a mavoy who is accustomed to participate with the residents of the mavoy, and does not participate - the residents of the mavoy enter into his house and take their portion from him by force.

hebrew_text: רָגִיל אִין, שֶׁאֵין רָגִיל לָא. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: accustomed yes, not accustomed no, conclude from it
llm_translation: Regular is not, that not regular is. Hear from it.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ לַעֲשׂוֹת לֶחִי וְקוֹרָה לַמָּבוֹי.
human_translation: Let us say supports him. compel to erect a side post and a beam for the alleyway.
llm_translation: Let us say, it helps him: they force him to make a wall and a beam for the alleyway.

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דְּלֵיכָּא מְחִיצוֹת.
human_translation: It is different there, as there are no partitions.
llm_translation: The difference there is that there are no partitions.

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא, מְצָד שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: Another version From the side it is different,
llm_translation: Another opinion, from the perspective of a different source.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר, רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר: עוֹשִׂין לֶחִי אֲשֵׁירָה. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ אָמַר: עוֹשִׂין קוֹרָה אֲשֵׁירָה.
human_translation: It is stated Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi said: One build a side post an asheira . And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: One build a beam an asheira .
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav Chiya bar Ashe said: They make a cheek of Asherah. And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: They make a beam of Asherah.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר קוֹרָה — כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן לֶחִי, וּמַאן דְּאָמַר לֶחִי — אֲבָל קוֹרָה לָא. כַּתּוֹתֵי מְכַתַּת שִׁיעוּרֵיהּ.
human_translation: the one who said a beam all the more so a side post And the one who said side post but a beam, no, its size has been crushed.
llm_translation: The one who says "beam" - certainly a beam, and the one who says a beam - but not a beam. The measurements of its width.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נִתְמַעֵט הָאוֹכֶל — מוֹסִיף וּמְזַכֶּה, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לְהוֹדִיעַ. נִתּוֹסְפוּ עֲלֵיהֶן — מוֹסִיף וּמְזַכֶּה, וְצָרִיךְ לְהוֹדִיעַ.
human_translation: If the food diminished one add and confer possession and he need not inform were added to he may add and confer possession and he must inform
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If the eater became diminished - he adds and benefits, and there is no need to inform. If others were added to them - he adds and benefits, and he must inform.

hebrew_text: כַּמָּה הוּא שִׁיעוּרָן? בִּזְמַן שֶׁהֵן מְרוּבִּין — מְזוֹן שְׁתֵּי סְעוּדוֹת לְכוּלָּם. בִּזְמַן שֶׁהֵן מוּעָטִין — כִּגְרוֹגֶרֶת לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד.
human_translation: What is the measure When are numerous, food for two meals for all of them; when they are few, a dried fig-bulk for each and every one of them
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "How much is their measure? When they are many - sustenance for two meals for all. When they are few - like a dried fig for each and every one."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בִּתְחִילַּת עֵירוּב, אֲבָל בִּשְׁיָרֵי עֵירוּב — כׇּל שֶׁהוּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: In what is this statement said? with regard to the beginning of an eiruv , However, with regard to the remnants of an eiruv , any amount
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: In what context are these matters spoken of? At the beginning of the Eruv, but in the remnants of the Eruv - anything goes.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא אָמְרוּ לְעָרֵב בַּחֲצֵירוֹת אֶלָּא כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא לְשַׁכֵּחַ אֶת הַתִּינוֹקוֹת.
human_translation: And they said to join the courtyards, only so that will not be forgotten by the children,
llm_translation: And not they said to mix in the courtyards except in order not to forget the infants.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בְּמִין אֶחָד, מַאי אִירְיָא נִתְמַעֵט? אֲפִילּוּ כָּלָה נָמֵי!
human_translation: With what are we dealing If you say the same type why specify decreased Even if was finished, likewise
llm_translation: We are dealing with what? If you say with one species, what is the issue of mixing? Even a bride agrees!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בִּשְׁנֵי מִינִין, אֲפִילּוּ נִתְמַעֵט נָמֵי לָא! דְּתַנְיָא: כָּלָה הָאוֹכֶל, מִמִּין אֶחָד — אֵין צָרִיךְ לְהוֹדִיעַ, מִשְּׁנֵי מִינִים — צָרִיךְ לְהוֹדִיעַ!
human_translation: Rather, to two types even if it decreased no, also As it was taught If the food was finished, the same type he need not inform from two types he must inform
llm_translation: Rather, in two species, even if it is diminished, no! As it was taught: A bride who eats, from one species — there is no need to inform, from two species — there is a need to inform!

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מִמִּין אֶחָד, וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מִשְּׁנֵי מִינִין. אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מִמִּין אֶחָד, מַאי נִתְמַעֵט — נִתְמַטְמֵט.
human_translation: If you wish, say from the same kind and if you wish, say from two kinds. If you wish, say from the same kind what decreased? crumbled away,
llm_translation: If you ask: from one species, and if you ask: from two species. If you ask: from one species, what is the ruling? - It is ruled out.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מִשְּׁנֵי מִינִין, כָּלָה שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: And if you wish, say from two kinds was finished, is different.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: From two species, the law differs.

hebrew_text: נִיתּוֹסְפוּ עֲלֵיהֶן מוֹסִיף וּמְזַכֶּה וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב שֵׁיזְבִי אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת חֲלוּקִין עָלָיו חֲבֵירָיו עַל רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: were added to he may add and confer possession Rav Sheizvi said Rav Ḥisda said: That is to say, Rabbi Yehuda’s colleagues disagree with him.
llm_translation: They were added upon, one who adds and benefits, etc. Rav Sheizbi said in the name of Rav Chisda: This means his colleagues divide upon him regarding Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּעֵירוּבֵי תְחוּמִין, אֲבָל בְּעֵירוּבֵי חֲצֵירוֹת — מְעָרְבִין בֵּין לְדַעַת וּבֵין שֶׁלֹּא לְדַעַת. פְּשִׁיטָא דַּחֲלוּקִין!
human_translation: As we learned Rabbi Yehuda said: In what is this statement, said? with regard to a joining of boundaries; however, with regard to a joining of courtyards, one establish an eiruv with his knowledge or without his knowledge. It is obvious they disagree;
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Yehuda said: In what case are these words said? In the case of Eiruvei Techumin, but in the case of Eiruvei Chatzeirot, one may make an Eruv whether intentionally or unintentionally. It is obvious that they are different!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּחָצֵר שֶׁבֵּין שְׁנֵי מְבוֹאוֹת, אֲבָל חָצֵר שֶׁל מָבוֹי אֶחָד, אֵימָא לָא. קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: lest you say this applies only to a courtyard that is between two alleyways, However, a courtyard one alleyway, say no, teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? These matters in a courtyard between two entrances, but a courtyard of one alleyway, say no. It is established for us.

hebrew_text: כַּמָּה הוּא שִׁיעוּרוֹ וְכוּ׳. כַּמָּה הוּא מְרוּבִּין? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה בְּנֵי אָדָם. שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה, וְתוּ לָא: אֵימָא מִשְּׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה וְאֵילָךְ.
human_translation: What is the measure How many are numerous, Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: Eighteen people Eighteen and no more? Say: From eighteen upward.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the measure, etc. How many are the majority? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Eighteen. Eighteen, and if not, say: From eighteen and onward. English translation: What is the measure, etc. How many are the majority? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Eighteen. Eighteen, and if not, say: From eighteen and onward.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה דְּנָקֵט? אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה: לְדִידִי מִיפָּרְשָׁא לִי מִנֵּיהּ דְּאַבָּא: כׇּל שֶׁאִילּוּ מְחַלְּקוֹ לִמְזוֹן שְׁתֵּי סְעוּדוֹת בֵּינֵיהֶן וְאֵין מַגַּעַת גְּרוֹגֶרֶת לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד — הֵן הֵן מְרוּבִּין, וְסַגִּי בִּמְזוֹן שְׁתֵּי סְעוּדוֹת. וְאִי לָא — (הֵן הֵן) מוּעָטִין נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: And what is eighteen he cited? Rav Yitzḥak, son of Rav Yehuda, said: It was explained to me by my father, Any if divide two meals between them and it does not amount to a dried fig for each and every one of them, these are the very ones numerous, and food for two meals suffices And if not, these are the very ones few,
llm_translation: "What is the significance of the number eighteen that is mentioned? Rav Yitzchak, son of Rav Yehuda, said: According to my father's explanation, whenever one divides his meal into two separate meals and does not touch a dried fig's worth of food in between them, they are indeed considered as two meals. Otherwise, they are considered as one meal."

hebrew_text: וְאַגַּב אוֹרְחֵיהּ קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דִּשְׁתֵּי סְעוּדוֹת הָוְיָין שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה גְּרוֹגְרוֹת.
human_translation: incidentally teaches us that two meals consists of eighteen dried figs.
llm_translation: And in the path, it is heard for us that two meals are considered eighteen kav.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בַּכֹּל מְעָרְבִין וּמִשְׁתַּתְּפִין, חוּץ מִן הַמַּיִם וּמִן הַמֶּלַח, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: כִּכָּר הוּא עֵירוּב, אֲפִילּוּ מַאֲפֶה סְאָה, וְהוּא פְּרוּסָה — אֵין מְעָרְבִין בָּהּ. כִּכָּר כְּאִיסָּר וְהוּא שָׁלֵם — מְעָרְבִין בּוֹ.
human_translation: One join and merge with all except for water and salt, the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. Rabbi Yehoshua says loaf an eiruv . a baked of a se’a , if it pieces, one not join with it. a loaf, an issar , if it is whole, one join with it.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: In all places one may combine eruvin and participate in them, except for water and salt, the words of Rabbi Eliezer. Rabbi Yehoshua says: A loaf of bread is its own eruv, even if one bakes a se'ah of bread, and it is divided — one may not combine an eruv with it. A loaf of bread the size of an issar, and it is whole — one may combine an eruv with it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תְּנֵינָא חֲדָא זִימְנָא: בַּכֹּל מְעָרְבִין וּמִשְׁתַּתְּפִין, חוּץ מִן הַמַּיִם וְהַמֶּלַח!
human_translation: learned once One establish an eiruv and a merging of alleyways with all except for water and salt.
llm_translation: Gemara: We learned in one place: In all matters we may mix and participate, except for water and salt!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, דְּאָמַר: כִּכָּר — אִין, מִידֵּי אַחֲרִינָא — לָא, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן ״בַּכֹּל״.
human_translation: Rabba said: to exclude Rabbi Yehoshua said a loaf, yes, anything else, no, teaches us with all
llm_translation: Rabah said: To go out from the study hall of Rabbi Yehoshua, who said: "A loaf" — no, from another source — yes, it is derived for us "in everything."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: בַּכֹּל מְעָרְבִין עֵירוּבֵי חֲצֵירוֹת וּבַכֹּל מִשְׁתַּתְּפִין שִׁיתּוּפֵי מְבוֹאוֹת, וְלֹא אָמְרוּ לְעָרֵב בְּפַת אֶלָּא בֶּחָצֵר בִּלְבַד. מַאן שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ דְּאָמַר פַּת — אִין, מִידֵּי אַחֲרִינָא — לָא, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, וְקָתָנֵי ״בַּכֹּל״!
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection One establish a joining of courtyards with all and one may establish a merging of alleyways with all They said one establish an eiruv with bread only with regard to a courtyard. Who did you hear that said bread, yes, anything else, no, Rabbi Yehoshua, and teaches: With all
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Abaye: In all cases they may combine their Eruvin of courtyards, and in all cases they may share in the partnership of alleys, and they did not say to combine with bread, but only in the courtyard. Who heard him say bread? No, it is from another source - no, Rabbi Yehoshua, and it is taught "in all"!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, דְּאָמַר שְׁלֵימָה — אִין, פְּרוּסָה — לָא, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן ״בַּכֹּל״.
human_translation: Rather, Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: to exclude Rabbi Yehoshua, as said: A whole yes, a broken no, teaches us with all
llm_translation: Rather, Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: To go out from the teaching of Rabbi Yehoshua, who said "whole" - no, "spread out" - yes, it is evident to us from "in all."

hebrew_text: וּפְרוּסָה מַאי טַעְמָא לָא? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן שָׁאוּל אָמַר רַבִּי: מִשּׁוּם אֵיבָה.
human_translation: And broken what is the reason not Rabbi Yosei ben Shaul said Rabbi said: due to enmity
llm_translation: "And a horse's hoof, what is the reason it is not permitted? Rabbi Yosei ben Shaul said in the name of Rabbi: Because of enmity."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: עֵירְבוּ כּוּלָּן בִּפְרוּסוֹת מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שֶׁמָּא יַחְזוֹר דָּבָר לְקִלְקוּלוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: they all established eiruv with broken what is said to him: lest the problem recur,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ahah son of Rava said to Rav Ashi: "If they all made an Eruv with their own portions, what is the law?" He said to him: "Perhaps the matter will revert to its detriment."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן שָׁאוּל: נִיטְּלָה הֵימֶנָּה כְּדֵי חַלָּתָהּ וּכְדֵי דִימּוּעָהּ — מְעָרְבִין לוֹ בָּהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Shaul said: If one removed from as much as its ḥalla , or as much as from a mixture he establish an eiruv with
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan ben Sha'ul said: If she removed it for the sake of her illness or for the sake of her mourning, we may mix it for him in it.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: כְּדֵי דִימּוּעָהּ — מְעָרְבִין לוֹ בָּהּ, כְּדֵי חַלָּתָהּ — אֵין מְעָרְבִין לוֹ בָּהּ!
human_translation: Wasn’t it was taught as much as from a mixture one may establish an eiruv with it, as much as its ḥalla , one may not establish an eiruv with it?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And it was taught: 'As long as its taste remains' — one may mix it in, 'as long as its form remains' — one may not mix it in!"

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּחַלַּת נַחְתּוֹם, הָא — בְּחַלַּת בַּעַל הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: not difficult, this to a baker’s ḥalla , that to an homeowner’s ḥalla .
llm_translation: Not difficult: this - in the case of a seal ring, this - in the case of a homeowner's ring.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: שִׁיעוּר חַלָּה אֶחָד מֵעֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה. הָעוֹשֶׂה עִיסָּה לְעַצְמוֹ וְעִיסָּה לְמִשְׁתֵּה בְנוֹ, אֶחָד מֵעֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה. נַחְתּוֹם שֶׁהוּא עוֹשֶׂה לִמְכּוֹר בַּשּׁוּק, וְכֵן הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁעָשְׁתָה לִמְכּוֹר בַּשּׁוּק — אֶחָד מֵאַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁמוֹנָה.
human_translation: as we learned The measure of ḥalla one twenty-fourth one who prepares dough for himself or dough for his son’s feast, one twenty-fourth. a baker who prepares for sale in the market, and likewise a woman who prepares for sale in the market, one forty-eighth
llm_translation: We have learned: The measurement of a challah is one out of twenty-four. One who makes dough for himself and dough for his son's feast, one out of twenty-four. A seal that one makes to sell in the market, and similarly a woman who made to sell in the market - one out of forty-eight.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: תְּפָרָהּ בְּקֵיסָם מְעָרְבִין לוֹ בָּהּ. וְהָא תַּנְיָא אֵין מְעָרְבִין לוֹ בָּהּ! לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא — דִּידִיעַ תִּיפְרָהּ, הָא — דְּלָא יְדִיעַ תִּיפְרָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: one who connected with a chip, one establish an eiruv with it, But wasn’t it taught one not establish an eiruv with it? not difficult, this where the seam is conspicuous; that where the seam is not conspicuous.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: If one sewed it with flax, we may mix it with it. But isn't it taught: We may not mix it with it? It is not difficult: this one — where it is known that it was sewn, and this one — where it is not known that it was sewn.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מְעָרְבִין בְּפַת אוֹרֶז וּבְפַת דּוֹחַן. אָמַר מָר עוּקְבָא: לְדִידִי מִיפָּרְשָׁא לִי מִינֵּיהּ דְּמָר שְׁמוּאֵל, בְּפַת אוֹרֶז — מְעָרְבִין, וּבְפַת דּוֹחַן — אֵין מְעָרְבִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said Shmuel said: One establish an eiruv with rice bread or with millet bread. Mar Ukva said: was explained to me by Mar Shmuel With rice bread one establish an eiruv , but with millet bread one not establish an eiruv ,
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Shmuel: One may use a piece of cedarwood for an Eruv, but not a piece of palm-wood. Mar Ukva said: According to my understanding of the words of Mar Shmuel, with a piece of cedarwood one may establish an Eruv, but with a piece of palm-wood one may not establish an Eruv.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַב: מְעָרְבִין בְּפַת עֲדָשִׁים. אִינִי?! וְהָא הָהִיא דַּהֲוַאי בִּשְׁנֵי דְּמָר שְׁמוּאֵל, וְשַׁדְיַיהּ לְכַלְבֵּיהּ וְלָא אַכְלַהּ!
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin said Rav said: One establish an eiruv with lentil bread. Is that so? But there was that in the days of Mar Shmuel, which he threw to his dog, and it would not eat it.
llm_translation: Rav Chiya bar Avin said in the name of Rav: One may mix dough with lentils. Is it not so?! But that case was with two Mar Shmuel, and he threw it to the dogs and it did not eat it!

hebrew_text: הָהִיא דִּשְׁאָר מִינִים הָוְיָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאַתָּה קַח לְךָ חִטִּין וּשְׂעוֹרִים וּפוֹל וַעֲדָשִׁים וְדוֹחַן וְכוּסְּמִים וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: That was various types “Take you for yourself wheat, and barley, and beans, and lentils, and millet, and spelt,
llm_translation: That one of other species was, as it is written: "And you shall take for yourself wheat and barley and beans and lentils and millet and spelt and so forth."

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: הָהִיא צְלוּיָה בְּצוֹאַת הָאָדָם הֲוַאי, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהִיא בְּגֶלְלֵי צֵאַת הָאָדָם תְּעֻגֶנָה לְעֵינֵיהֶם״.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: That was roasted in human excrement, as it is written: and you shall bake it with human excrement, in their sight”
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: That woman is considered like the excrement of a person, as it is written: "And she shall be trodden down under foot in the dung of men" (Isaiah 25:10).

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְעוּגַת שְׂעֹרִים תֹּאכְלֶנָּה״? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לְשִׁיעוּרִים. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: עֲרִיבָתָהּ כַּעֲרִיבַת שְׂעוֹרִים, וְלֹא כַּעֲרִיבַת חִטִּים.
human_translation: What is “And you shall eat it as barley [ seorim ] cakes”? Rav Ḥisda said: in measures [ leshiurim ], Rav Pappa said: Its preparation like the preparation of barley and not like the preparation of wheat
llm_translation: What is "and barley cakes you shall eat"? Rav Ḥisdah said: For measurements. Rav Pappa said: Its mixture is like the mixture of barley, and not like the mixture of wheat.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נוֹתֵן אָדָם מָעָה לַחֶנְוָנִי וְלַנַּחְתּוֹם כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּזַכֶּה לוֹ עֵירוּב, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
human_translation: A person give a ma’a to a grocer or a baker, so that will confer upon him possession for an eiruv , the statement of Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A person may give a ma'ah to the Chenvani and to the Nachtom, in order that he may acquire an Eruv. These are the words of Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: לֹא זָכוּ לוֹ מְעוֹתָיו.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: His money did not confer possession on him,
llm_translation: And the sages say: "His coins did not merit for him."

hebrew_text: וּמוֹדִים בִּשְׁאָר כׇּל הָאָדָם, שֶׁזָּכוּ לוֹ מְעוֹתָיו. שֶׁאֵין מְעָרְבִין לָאָדָם אֶלָּא מִדַּעְתּוֹ.
human_translation: And concede with regard to all people, that his money confers possession upon him, as one establish an eiruv for a person only with his knowledge
llm_translation: And they agree in all other cases, that a person's money is considered his. For one does not become a guarantor for a person except with his knowledge.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים בְּעֵירוּבֵי תְחוּמִין, אֲבָל בְּעֵירוּבֵי חֲצֵירוֹת — מְעָרְבִין לְדַעְתּוֹ וְשֶׁלֹּא לְדַעְתּוֹ, לְפִי שֶׁזָּכִין לָאָדָם שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו, וְאֵין חָבִין לָאָדָם שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: In what case is this statement said? with regard to a joining of boundaries, but with regard to a joining of courtyards, one establish an eiruv with his knowledge or without his knowledge. because one may act for a person’s benefit in his absence, but one may not act to a person’s disadvantage in his absence.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: In what are these matters said in regards to the Eruv of boundaries, but in regards to the Eruv of courtyards - one may make an Eruv with or without his knowledge, because we acquire on behalf of a person even without his presence, but we do not acquire on behalf of a person without his presence.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר? הָא לֹא מָשַׁךְ!
human_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Eliezer’s he did not pulling
llm_translation: "Gema, what is the reason for Rabbi Eliezer? This is not drawn out!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבָהוּ: עֲשָׂאוֹ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר כְּאַרְבָּעָה פְּרָקִים בַּשָּׁנָה, דִּתְנַן: בְּאַרְבָּעָה פְּרָקִים אֵלּוּ מַשְׁחִיטִין אֶת הַטַּבָּח בְּעַל כׇּרְחוֹ. אֲפִילּוּ שׁוֹר שָׁוֶה אֶלֶף דִּינָר וְאֵין לַלּוֹקֵחַ אֶלָּא דִּינָר אֶחָד — כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ לִשְׁחוֹט.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Abbahu said: Rabbi Eliezer established like the four times during the year as we learned On these four times force the butcher to slaughter Even ox worth a thousand dinar, and the customer has only one dinar’s force to slaughter
llm_translation: Rav Nahman said, Rabba bar Avahu said: Rabbi Eliezer made it the requirement to slaughter the animal like four chapters in a year, as we learned: In these four chapters, one may slaughter the animal against the will of the owner. Even if an ox worth a thousand dinars, and the buyer has only one dinar, we force him to slaughter it.

hebrew_text: לְפִיכָךְ אִם מֵת, מֵת לַלּוֹקֵחַ. מֵת לַלּוֹקֵחַ? הָא לֹא מָשַׁךְ! אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: בְּשֶׁמָּשַׁךְ.
human_translation: Therefore, if died, it died at the buyer’s did not pull Rav Huna said: where he did pull
llm_translation: Therefore, if he dies, he dies to the buyer. Dies to the buyer? But he did not pull! Rav Huna said: Because he pulled.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: בִּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה אֵינוֹ כֵּן. לְפִיכָךְ אִם מֵת, מֵת לַמּוֹכֵר. אַמַּאי? הָא מָשַׁךְ!
human_translation: If so, say the latter clause the rest of the days of the year, it is not so. Therefore, if died, it died at the seller’s why pulled
llm_translation: If so, say the conclusion: during the rest of the days of the year it is not so. Therefore, if he dies, he dies to the buyer. Why? Because he delayed!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יִצְחָק: לְעוֹלָם בְּשֶׁלֹּא מָשַׁךְ, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן בְּשֶׁזִּיכָּה לוֹ עַל יְדֵי אַחֵר.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Yitzḥak said: Actually, where did not pull With what are we dealing here? with where conferred possession upon by means of another
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Yitzchak said: Always, if he did not delay, here with what are we dealing with that she was designated for him by another.

hebrew_text: בְּאַרְבָּעָה פְּרָקִים אֵלּוּ דִּזְכוּת הוּא לוֹ — זָכִין לוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו. בִּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה, דְּחוֹב הוּא לוֹ — אֵין חָבִין לוֹ אֶלָּא בְּפָנָיו.
human_translation: at these four times, when it is for his benefit, one may act for his benefit in his absence, the rest of the days of the year, when it is to his disadvantage, one may act to his disadvantage only in his presence.
llm_translation: In four chapters, these are the merits that are his - they acquire for him without his presence. In the rest of the days of the year, when he has an obligation - they only acquire for him in his presence.

hebrew_text: וְרַב אִילָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּאַרְבָּעָה פְּרָקִים אֵלּוּ הֶעֱמִידוּ חֲכָמִים דִּבְרֵיהֶן עַל דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה, מָעוֹת קוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: And Rav Ila said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: At these four times, the Sages based their statement on Torah law, As Rabbi Yoḥanan said: By Torah law, money acquires
llm_translation: Rav Ila said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: In these four chapters, the sages established their words on matters of Torah. As Rabbi Yochanan said: "A matter of Torah, money acquires."

hebrew_text: וּמִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ מְשִׁיכָה קוֹנָה — גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאמַר לוֹ: נִשְׂרְפוּ חִיטֶּיךָ בָּעֲלִיָּיה.
human_translation: And why, did say pulling, acquires a decree lest say to Your wheat was burned in the upper story
llm_translation: "And because of what did they say 'acquisition through pulling'? - A decree, lest one say to him: 'Your wheat burned in the barn.'"

hebrew_text: וּמוֹדִים בִּשְׁאָר כׇּל הָאָדָם כּוּ׳. מַאן שְׁאָר כׇּל אָדָם? אָמַר רַב: בַּעַל הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: concede with regard to all people Who is all people? Rav said: an homeowner,
llm_translation: And they agree in all other matters like him. Who is "all other people"? Rav said: The homeowner.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בַּעַל הַבַּיִת. דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא נַחְתּוֹם, אֲבָל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת — קוֹנֶה. וְאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא מָעָה, אֲבָל כְּלִי — קוֹנֶה.
human_translation: And likewise, Shmuel said: an homeowner. As Shmuel said: They taught only a baker, but an homeowner acquire And Shmuel said: They taught only a ma’a , but a utensil, he acquires
llm_translation: And so said Shmuel: Baal Habayit. For Shmuel said: They only specified a seal, but a homeowner - acquires. And Shmuel said: They only specified money, but a vessel - acquires.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא דְּאָמַר לוֹ ״זְכֵה לִי״, אֲבָל אָמַר ״עָרֵב לִי״, שָׁלִיחַ שַׁוְּיֵהּ, וְקָנֵי.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: They taught only where he said to Confer possession upon me; but if he said Establish an eiruv on my behalf, appoint him agent and is acquired
llm_translation: And Samuel said: They only taught that if one said to him, "Acquire for me," but if he said, "Be a surety for me," the agent is appointed, and he acquires.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁשָּׁנָה רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּעֵירוּבִין הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: In what is this statement, said? Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda and not only that, but any place where Rabbi Yehuda taught with regard to eiruvin , halakha is in accordance with his
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehuda: In what case are these matters said, etc. Rabbi Yehuda said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yehuda, and not only that, but in every place where Rabbi Yehuda changed his mind in Eruvin, the halakha is like him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חָנָא בַּגְדָּתָאָה לְרַב יְהוּדָה: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל אֲפִילּוּ בְּמָבוֹי שֶׁנִּיטְּלוּ קוֹרוֹתָיו אוֹ לְחָיָיו?
human_translation: Rav Ḥana from Baghdad said to Rav Yehuda: Shmuel state even with regard to an alleyway whose beam or side post was removed
llm_translation: He said to him Rav Ḥanina Bagdata to Rav Yehuda: Samuel said even in an alleyway whose beams or walls were removed?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּעֵירוּבִין אָמַרְתִּי לְךָ, וְלֹא בִּמְחִיצוֹת.
human_translation: He said to him: I spoke to you with regard to eiruvin , and not with regard to partitions.
llm_translation: He said to him: "I spoke to you about Eruvin, and not about partitions."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: ״הֲלָכָה״, מִכְּלָל דִּפְלִיגִי. וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה ״אֵימָתַי״ וּ״בַמֶּה״ בְּמִשְׁנָתֵנוּ — אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא לְפָרֵשׁ דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים!
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: halakha by inference that there is a dispute But didn’t Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi say: Any place where Rabbi Yehuda says when, or in what in the Mishna, only to explain the statement of the Rabbis,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ahah son of Rava said to Rav Ashi: "Halakhah," from the inference that he disagrees. And didn't Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi say: Any place where Rabbi Yehudah said "When" and "With what" in our Mishnah - it is only to explain the words of the Sages!

hebrew_text: וְלָא פְּלִיגִי? וְהָא אֲנַן תְּנַן: נִתּוֹסְפוּ עֲלֵיהֶן — מוֹסִיף וּמְזַכֶּה, וְצָרִיךְ לְהוֹדִיעַ!
human_translation: And not dispute Didn’t we learn were added to he may add and confer possession and he must inform
llm_translation: And did they not dispute? But we learned: If additions were made to them - one adds and benefits, and it is necessary to inform!

hebrew_text: הָתָם בְּחָצֵר שֶׁבֵּין שְׁנֵי מְבוֹאוֹת.
human_translation: There, to a courtyard between two alleyways,
llm_translation: There, in the courtyard between two entrances.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַב שֵׁיזְבִי אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת חֲלוּקִין עָלָיו חֲבֵירָיו עַל רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Didn’t Rav Sheizvi say Rav Ḥisda said That is to say Rabbi Yehuda’s colleagues disagree with him
llm_translation: And he said, Rav Sheizbi said, Rav Chisda said: This means his colleagues divided concerning him, regarding Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא:
human_translation: Rather,
llm_translation: Rather:

hebrew_text: גַּבְרָא אַגַּבְרָא קָא רָמֵית?! מָר סָבַר פְּלִיגִי, וּמָר סָבַר לָא פְּלִיגִי.
human_translation: Are you raising a contradiction between one person and another? One Sage, maintains disagree, and one Sage, maintains do not disagree.
llm_translation: A man against a man are you raising?! One Master thought they are disagreeing, and one Master thought they are not disagreeing.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה ״אֵימָתַי״ וּ״בַמֶּה״ בְּמִשְׁנָתֵינוּ — אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא לְפָרֵשׁ דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: ״אֵימָתַי״ לְפָרֵשׁ, וּ״בַמֶּה״ לַחֲלוֹק.
human_translation: the matter itself: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said any place where Rabbi Yehuda says when, or in what are these, in the Mishna, he only to explain the statement of the Rabbis, And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: when to explain, in what to disagree.
llm_translation: The body, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: In every place where Rabbi Yehuda said "when" and "with what" in our Mishnah - it is only to explain the words of the Sages. And Rabbi Yochanan said: "When" is to explain, and "with what" is to differentiate.

hebrew_text: וְ״אֵימָתַי״ לְפָרֵשׁ הוּא? וְהָא תְּנַן: וְאֵלּוּ הֵן הַפְּסוּלִים: הַמְשַׂחֵק בְּקוּבְיָא, וּמַלְוֶה בְּרִיבִּית, וּמַפְרִיחֵי יוֹנִים, וְסוֹחֲרֵי שְׁבִיעִית.
human_translation: Is when to explain? Didn’t we learn The following are disqualified One who plays with dice [ kubiyya ] and one who lends at interest, and those who fly pigeons, merchants of the Sabbatical Year,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And 'when' to separate he is? And this we learned: And these are the disqualified: one who plays with a kubiya, and lends with interest, and pigeon flyers, and traders of shemittah." I hope this translation is helpful to you.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֵימָתַי — בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אוּמָּנוּת אֶלָּא הִיא, אֲבָל יֵשׁ לוֹ אוּמָּנוּת שֶׁלֹּא הִיא — הֲרֵי זֶה כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: When When he has no occupation other than this but if he has a occupation other than this, this is qualified
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehuda: When? - At a time when he has no skill except for her, but if he has a skill that is not her - this is valid.

hebrew_text: וְתָנֵי עֲלַהּ בְּבָרַיְיתָא, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בֵּין שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אוּמָּנוּת אֶלָּא הִיא, וּבֵין שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אוּמָּנוּת שֶׁלֹּא הִיא — הֲרֵי זֶה פָּסוּל.
human_translation: a baraita was taught about And the Rabbis say: Whether he has no occupation other than this or whether he has a occupation other than this, this is disqualified
llm_translation: And it was taught in a baraita, and the sages say: whether he has only her as a skill, or whether he has a skill other than her - this one is disqualified.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן הִיא.
human_translation: That it is of Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Tarfon said
llm_translation: That which Rabbi Yehuda said, Rabbi Tarfon said it.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן: לְעוֹלָם אֵין אֶחָד מֵהֶן נָזִיר, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין נְזִירוּת אֶלָּא לְהַפְלָאָה.
human_translation: As it was taught Rabbi Yehuda said in the name of Rabbi Tarfon: neither one can possibly be a nazirite, as there is no naziriteship without pronunciation.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said in the name of Rabbi Tarfon: Always none of them is a Nazir, for Naziriteship is only for wonderment.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא כֵּיוָן דִּמְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ אִי נָזִיר אִי לָא נָזִיר הוּא — לָא מְשַׁעְבֵּיד נַפְשֵׁיהּ. הָכָא נָמֵי: כֵּיוָן דְּלָא יָדַע אִי קָנֵי אִי לָא קָנֵי — לָא גָּמַר וּמַקְנֵה.
human_translation: Consequently, since he is in doubt whether he is a nazirite or he is not a nazirite, he does not submit himself Here, too, Since does not know whether he will acquire or whether he will not acquire he does not fully transfer ownership
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: Since he is in doubt whether he is a Nazirite or not a Nazirite, he does not impose restrictions upon himself. Here too, it is stated: Since he does not know whether he acquired or did not acquire, he does not complete the transaction and acquire.

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ חַלּוֹן
llm_translation: We will return to you, window.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כֵּיצַד מִשְׁתַּתְּפִין בִּתְחוּמִין? מַנִּיחַ אֶת הֶחָבִית, וְאוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי זֶה לְכׇל בְּנֵי עִירִי, לְכׇל מִי שֶׁיֵּלֵךְ לְבֵית הָאֵבֶל אוֹ לְבֵית הַמִּשְׁתֶּה. וְכׇל שֶׁקִּיבֵּל עָלָיו מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם — מוּתָּר, מִשֶּׁתֶּחְשַׁךְ — אָסוּר. שֶׁאֵין מְעָרְבִין מִשֶּׁתֶּחְשַׁךְ.
human_translation: How does one participate in boundaries? places a barrel and says: This is for all the residents of my town, for anyone who go to a house of mourning or to a house of feast Anyone who accepted upon himself while it was still day, is permitted after nightfall, prohibited one may not establish an eiruv after nightfall.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: How do we participate in the boundaries? One places the barrel and says: "This is for all the residents of my city, for anyone who will go to the house of mourning or to the house of feasting." And anyone who accepted it from before the day is permitted, once it becomes dark, it is prohibited. For we do not combine boundaries once it becomes dark.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אֵין מְעָרְבִין אֶלָּא לִדְבַר מִצְוָה. מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנֵינָא: לְכׇל מִי שֶׁיֵּלֵךְ לְבֵית הָאֵבֶל אוֹ לְבֵית הַמִּשְׁתֶּה!
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: One may establish a joining only for the purpose of a mitzva, What is he teaching us We learned For anyone who go to a house of mourning or to a house of a feast.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yosef said: We only combine people for a matter of commandment. What does this imply to us? It was taught: For anyone who goes to a house of mourning or to a house of feasting!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: אוֹרְחָא דְמִלְּתָא קָתָנֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: lest you say teaches the usual case. teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning: the way of the matter is small, it is teaching us.

hebrew_text: וְכֹל שֶׁקִּיבֵּל עָלָיו מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם. שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ אֵין בְּרֵירָה, דְּאִי יֵשׁ בְּרֵירָה — תִּיגַּלֵּי מִילְּתָא לְמַפְרֵעַ דְּמִבְּעוֹד יוֹם הֲוָה נִיחָא לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Anyone who accepted upon himself while it was still day learn from here there is no clarification. if there is clarification, it is retroactively revealed that he wanted while it was still day.
llm_translation: And all that he accepted upon himself from the middle of the day. You heard from her, there is no choice, for if there is choice - the matter will be revealed to the one who accepted it from the middle of the day, it was pleasing to him!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: ״הוֹדִיעוּהוּ״ וְ״לֹא הוֹדִיעוּהוּ״ קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said teaches: they informed him or they did not inform him
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: "Hodi'uhu" and "Lo hodi'uhu" are taught.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: קָטָן בֶּן שֵׁשׁ יוֹצֵא בְּעֵירוּב אִמּוֹ. מֵיתִיבִי: קָטָן שֶׁצָּרִיךְ לְאִמּוֹ — יוֹצֵא בְּעֵירוּב אִמּוֹ, וְשֶׁאֵין צָרִיךְ לְאִמּוֹ — אֵין יוֹצֵא בְּעֵירוּב אִמּוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Asi said: A six-year-old child may go out by his mother’s eiruv . The Gemara raises an objection A child who needs his mother may go out by his mother’s eiruv , but one who does not need his mother may not go out by his mother’s eiruv .
llm_translation: Rav Assi said: A minor who is six years old may participate in the Eruv with his mother. The question was raised: If a minor requires his mother - he may participate in the Eruv with his mother, but if he does not require his mother - he may not participate in the Eruv with his mother.

hebrew_text: וּתְנַן נָמֵי גַּבֵּי סוּכָּה כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא: קָטָן שֶׁאֵין צָרִיךְ לְאִמּוֹ — חַיָּיב בְּסוּכָּה.
human_translation: And we also learned a similar with regard to a sukka : A child who does not need his mother is obligated in sukka
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah regarding the case of a Sukkah when this is the circumstance: a minor who does not need his mother - is obligated in a Sukkah.

hebrew_text: וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: וְאֵיזֶהוּ קָטָן שֶׁאֵין צָרִיךְ לְאִמּוֹ? אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: כׇּל שֶׁנִּפְנֶה וְאֵין אִמּוֹ מְקַנַּחְתּוֹ.
human_translation: And we discussed But who is child who does not need his mother? The school of Rabbi Yannai said: any who defecates and his mother does not wipe him.
llm_translation: We were learning in it: And who is a minor that does not need his mother? The House of Rabbi Yannai said: Anyone who turns away and his mother does not rebuke him.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ אָמַר: כׇּל שֶׁנֵּיעוֹר וְאֵינוֹ קוֹרֵא ״אִימָּא״. ״אִימָּא״ סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? גְּדוֹלִים, נָמֵי קָרוּ. אֶלָּא אֵימָא: כָּל שֶׁנֵּיעוֹר מִשְּׁנָתוֹ וְאֵינוֹ קוֹרֵא ״אִימָּא, אִימָּא״.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Any who wakens and does not call: Mother, Can it enter your mind Mother older also call Rather, say any who wakens from sleep and does not call: Mother, Mother.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Anyone who becomes angry and does not recite "Ima." "Ima" is it your opinion? The great ones also recite. Rather say: Anyone who becomes angry from his sleep and does not recite "Ima, Ima."

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה? כְּבַר אַרְבַּע, כְּבַר חָמֵשׁ.
human_translation: And what one about four old about five old,
llm_translation: And how much? Like a bar four, like a bar five.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: כִּי קָאָמַר רַב אַסִּי — כְּגוֹן שֶׁעֵירַב עָלָיו אָבִיו לַצָּפוֹן וְאִמּוֹ לַדָּרוֹם, דַּאֲפִילּוּ בַּר שֵׁשׁ נָמֵי בְּצַוְותָּא דְאִמֵּיהּ נִיחָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehoshua, son of Rav Idi, said When Rav Asi said where his father established an eiruv on his behalf to the north, and his mother to the south, as even a six-year-old prefers the company of his mother
llm_translation: Rav Yehoshua, son of Rav Idi, said: When Rav Assi said — for example, if his father arranged for him to marry a woman from the north and his mother from the south, even if the son of Shesh was in agreement with his mother's command, it is pleasing to him.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: קָטָן שֶׁצָּרִיךְ לְאִמּוֹ יוֹצֵא בְּעֵירוּב אִמּוֹ — עַד בֶּן שֵׁשׁ. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בַּר רַב אִידִי תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: The Gemara raises an objection A child who needs his mother may go out by his mother’s eiruv up to the age of six. is a conclusive refutation of Rav Yehoshua bar Rav Idi, a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: Challenger: A minor who needs his mother, he may establish an Eruv with his mother - until the age of six. The contradiction of Rav Yehoshua son of Rav Idi is a contradiction.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתֵּיהּ דְּרַב אַסִּי! אָמַר לְךָ רַב אַסִּי: ״עַד״, וְעַד בַּכְּלָל.
human_translation: Let us say is a refutation of Rav Asi, Rav Asi say to you Up to up to and including
llm_translation: Let it be the goodness of Rav Assi! Rav Assi said to you: "Until," and until in general.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יַנַּאי וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ! לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא — דְּאִיתֵיהּ אֲבוּהִי בְּמָתָא, הָא — דְּלָא אִיתֵיהּ אֲבוּהִי בְּמָתָא.
human_translation: Let us say is a refutation of Rabbi Yannai and Reish Lakish, not difficult. Here when father is in town. there when his father is not in town.
llm_translation: Let it be the preference of Rabbi Yannai and Reish Lakish! It is not difficult, this - for he has his father in the city, that - for he does not have his father in the city.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מְעָרֵב אָדָם עַל יְדֵי בְּנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ הַקְּטַנִּים, עַל יְדֵי עַבְדּוֹ וְשִׁפְחָתוֹ הַכְּנַעֲנִים, בֵּין לְדַעְתָּן בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא לְדַעְתָּן. אֲבָל אֵינוֹ מְעָרֵב לֹא עַל יְדֵי עַבְדּוֹ וְשִׁפְחָתוֹ הָעִבְרִים, [וְלֹא] עַל יְדֵי בְּנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ הַגְּדוֹלִים, וְלֹא עַל יְדֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ אֶלָּא מִדַּעְתָּם.
human_translation: Our Sages taught A person may establish an eiruv on behalf of his minor son or daughter, on behalf of his Canaanite servant or maidservant, either with their knowledge or without their knowledge. However, he may not establish an eiruv , neither on behalf of his Hebrew servant or maidservant, nor on behalf of his adult son or daughter, nor on behalf of his wife, except with their knowledge.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A person can effect an eruv on behalf of his minor son and daughter, on behalf of his Canaanite slave and maidservant, whether with their knowledge or without their knowledge. However, he cannot effect an eruv on behalf of his Hebrew slave and maidservant, nor on behalf of his adult son and daughter, nor on behalf of his wife, except with their knowledge.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: לֹא יְעָרֵב אָדָם עַל יְדֵי בְּנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ הַגְּדוֹלִים, וְעַל יְדֵי עַבְדּוֹ וְשִׁפְחָתוֹ הָעִבְרִים, וְלֹא עַל יְדֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ אֶלָּא מִדַּעְתָּן. אֲבָל מְעָרֵב הוּא עַל יְדֵי עַבְדּוֹ וְשִׁפְחָתוֹ הַכְּנַעֲנִים, וְעַל יְדֵי בְּנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ הַקְּטַנִּים, בֵּין לְדַעְתָּן וּבֵין שֶׁלֹּא לְדַעְתָּן — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּדָן כְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: It was taught in another A person may establish an eiruv on behalf of his adult son or daughter, and on behalf of his Hebrew servant or maidservant, and on behalf of his wife, only with their knowledge. However, he may establish an eiruv on behalf of his Canaanite servant or maidservant, and on behalf of his minor son or daughter, either with their knowledge or without their knowledge, as their hand is like his hand,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: A person may not become a surety on behalf of his adult son or daughter, nor on behalf of his Hebrew slave or maidservant, but he may become a surety on behalf of his Canaanite slave or maidservant, and on behalf of his minor son or daughter, whether with their knowledge or without their knowledge — because their hand is like his hand.

hebrew_text: וְכוּלָּן שֶׁעֵירְבוּ וְעֵירַב עֲלֵיהֶם רַבָּן — יוֹצְאִין בְּשֶׁל רַבָּן, חוּץ מִן הָאִשָּׁה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיְּכוֹלָה לִמְחוֹת.
human_translation: And all of these who established an eiruv and their master established an eiruv for them they may go out their master’s except for a wife, because she can object
llm_translation: And all of them that became mixed and Rabban mixed upon them - they go out in the name of Rabban, except for the woman, because she is able to erase.

hebrew_text: אִשָּׁה מַאי שְׁנָא? אָמַר רַבָּה: אִשָּׁה וְכׇל דְּדָמֵי לַהּ.
human_translation: A wife, what is different Rabba said: a wife and all who are similar to her
llm_translation: A woman, what is different? Rabah said: A woman and all similar to her.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: חוּץ מִן הָאִשָּׁה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיְּכוֹלָה לִמְחוֹת. טַעְמָא דְּמַחַי, הָא סְתָמָא — נָפְקָא בִּדְבַעְלַהּ. הָא קָתָנֵי רֵישָׁא ״אֶלָּא מִדַּעְתָּם״. מַאי לָאו, דְּאָמְרִי: ״אִין״!
human_translation: The Master said except for a wife, because she can object. The reason is due to that she objected, but did not specify she may go out by her husband’s Doesn’t the first clause state only with their knowledge? What, not they said yes?
llm_translation: Master said: Outside of the woman, because she can erase. The reason that she lives, this is a presumption — it comes out in her husband. This is what the first part teaches, "except from their knowledge." What is the reason that they did not say, "no"!

hebrew_text: לָא: מַאי ״אֶלָּא מִדַּעְתָּם״ — דְּאִשְׁתִּיקוּ. לְאַפּוֹקֵי הֵיכָא דְּאָמְרִי: ״לָא״.
human_translation: No; what is Only with their knowledge? that they were silent to exclude where they said no.
llm_translation: Not: What "but from their knowledge" - that they were silent. To go out to where they say: "No."

hebrew_text: הָא: וְכוּלָּן שֶׁעֵירְבוּ וְעֵירַב עֲלֵיהֶן רַבָּן — יוֹצְאִין בְּשֶׁל רַבָּן, וּסְתָמָא הוּא, וְקָתָנֵי: חוּץ מִן הָאִשָּׁה דְּלָא נָפְקִי!
human_translation: Wasn’t And all of these who established an eiruv and their master established an eiruv for them they may go out by their master’s And that is did not specify and states: Except for a wife, who may not go out
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: הָא: וְכוּלָּן שֶׁעֵירְבוּ וְעֵירַב עֲלֵיהֶן רַבָּן — יוֹצְאִין בְּשֶׁל רַבָּן, וּסְתָמָא הוּא, וְקָתָנֵי: חוּץ מִן הָאִשָּׁה דְּלָא נָפְקִי! Translation: Here: And all of them that have been mixed and the master has mixed with them - they go out under the master's ownership, and it is a presumption, and the Mishnah teaches: Except for the woman, for she does not go out!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: כֵּיוָן שֶׁעֵירְבוּ, אֵין לְךָ מִיחוּי גָּדוֹל מִזֶּה.
human_translation: Rava said: Since they established an eiruv you have no protest greater than this.
llm_translation: Rava said: Once they have multiplied, you have no greater proof than this.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כַּמָּה הוּא שִׁיעוּרוֹ? מְזוֹן שְׁתֵּי סְעוּדוֹת לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד. מְזוֹנוֹ לַחוֹל וְלֹא לַשַּׁבָּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לַשַּׁבָּת וְלֹא לַחוֹל, וְזֶה וָזֶה מִתְכַּוְּונִים לְהָקֵל.
human_translation: What is the measure food two meals for each and every one one’s food on a weekday and not on Shabbat; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: on Shabbat and not on a weekday. And this and that intended to be lenient,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: What is the measure of his sustenance? Food for two meals for each and every person. His sustenance for weekdays but not for Shabbat, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: For Shabbat but not for weekdays, and both opinions are intended to be lenient.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה אוֹמֵר: מִכִּכָּר בְּפוּנְדְּיוֹן, מֵאַרְבַּע סְאִין בְּסֶלַע. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: שְׁתֵּי יָדוֹת לַכִּכָּר מִשָּׁלֹשׁ לַקַּב.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka says: of a loaf with a pundeyon , when four se’a for a sela . Rabbi Shimon says: two parts of a loaf, when three from a kav
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka says: From a kikar in Pundei'on, four se'ah in a sela. Rabbi Shimon says: Two handfuls for a kikar, from three for a kab.

hebrew_text: חֶצְיָיהּ, לַבַּיִת הַמְנוּגָּע. וַחֲצִי חֶצְיָיהּ, לִפְסוֹל אֶת הַגְּוִיָּיה.
human_translation: half for a leprous house. And half of its half, disqualifies the body.
llm_translation: Its half, to the afflicted house. And half of its half, to disqualify its compartments.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְכַמָּה מְזוֹן שְׁתֵּי סְעוּדוֹת? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: תַּרְתֵּי רִיפָתָא אִיכָּרְיָיתָא. רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה אָמַר: תַּרְתֵּי רִיפָתָא נְהַר פַּפָּיָתָא.
human_translation: And how much food for two meals Rav Yehuda said Rav said: Two farmers’ ikaryata loaves of bread. Rav Adda bar Ahava said: Two loaves of bread the Pappa River.
llm_translation: Gemara: And how much is the sustenance of two meals? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Two meals' worth. Rav Adda bar Ahava said: Two meals' worth of bread.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף לְרַב יוֹסֵף בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: אֲבוּךְ כְּמַאן סְבִירָא לֵיהּ? כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סְבִירָא לֵיהּ. אֲנָא נָמֵי כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סְבִירָא לֵיהּ. דְּאִי כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, קַשְׁיָא הָא דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: רַוְוחָא לִבְסִימָא שְׁכִיחַ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said to Rav Yosef, son of Rava: Your father, in accordance with whose does he hold, He holds in accordance with Rabbi Meir. I too agree with Rabbi Meir, because if in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, a difficulty from the popular saying: There is room for sweets.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yosef said to Rav Yosef his son of Rava: "Who does your father hold like?" "He holds like Rabbi Meir." "I also hold like Rabbi Meir." For if he held like Rabbi Yehuda, the difficulty of what people say would be frequent.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה אוֹמֵר. תָּנָא: וּקְרוֹבִים דִּבְרֵיהֶן לִהְיוֹת שָׁוִין. מִי דָּמֵי?! דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אַרְבַּע סְעוֹדָתָא לְקַבָּא, דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן תֵּשַׁע סְעוֹדָתָא לְקַבָּא!
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka says taught And their statements are close to being identical. Are they identical? of Rabbi Yoḥanan four meals to a kav . of Rabbi Shimon, nine meals to a kav .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka says: It was taught: And their words are close to being equal. Who is similar to whom?! For Rabbi Yochanan had four meals to a kav, while Rabbi Shimon had nine meals to a kav!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: צֵא מֵהֶן שְׁלִישׁ לַחֶנְוָנִי.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said Deduct one-third for the grocer’s
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: Go out from them a third to the Henvani.

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי לְמָר תִּשְׁעָה. וּלְמָר שֵׁית!
human_translation: remains according to Sage, nine whereas according to Sage, six
llm_translation: And once to the master nine. And to the master six!

hebrew_text: [אֶלָּא כְּאִידַּךְ] דְּרַב חִסְדָּא, דְּאָמַר: צֵא מֵהֶן מֶחֱצָה לַחֶנְוָנִי.
human_translation: Rather, in accordance with other Rav Ḥisda, as he said: Deduct one half for the grocer’s
llm_translation: Rather like the opinion of Rav Ḥisdah, who said: "Go out from them halfway to Chenwani."

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי: לְמָר תֵּשַׁע, וּלְמָר תַּמְנֵי! — הַיְינוּ דְּקָאָמַר ״וּקְרוֹבִים דִּבְרֵיהֶם לִהְיוֹת שָׁוִין״.
human_translation: But remains according to Sage, nine according to Sage, eight This is that which was stated And their rulings are close to being identical.
llm_translation: And once: to the master nine, and to the master eight! — That is what he said, "And their words are close to being equal."

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא דְּרַב חִסְדָּא אַדְּרַב חִסְדָּא! לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא — דְּקָא יָהֵיב בַּעַל הַבַּיִת צִיבֵי. הָא — דְּלָא יָהֵיב בַּעַל הַבַּיִת צִיבֵי.
human_translation: a contradiction between Rav Ḥisda and Rav Ḥisda not difficult, this the homeowner provides the wood that the homeowner does not provide the wood;
llm_translation: The difficulty of Rav Ḥisda is a difficulty of Rav Ḥisda! It is not a difficulty, for this one - who gives the homeowner a gift. It is not a difficulty, for this one - who does not give the homeowner a gift.

hebrew_text: חֶצְיָיהּ לַבַּיִת הַמְנוּגָּע, וַחֲצִי חֶצְיָיהּ לִפְסוֹל אֶת הַגְּוִיָּיה.
human_translation: half for a leprous house half of its half, disqualifies the body
llm_translation: Half of it towards the house that is afflicted, and half of it to disqualify its produce.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: וַחֲצִי חֲצִי חֶצְיָהּ לְטַמֵּא טוּמְאַת אוֹכָלִין. וְתַנָּא דִּידַן מַאי טַעְמָא לָא תָּנֵי טוּמְאַת אוֹכָלִין? מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא שָׁווּ שִׁיעוּרַיְיהוּ לַהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: taught And half of one half of its half, contracts the impurity of foods. And our tanna , what reason he did not teach the impurity of foods? because their measures are not identical.
llm_translation: Mishna: And half, half of its half, to render the impurity of foods impure. And our Mishna, why does it not teach the impurity of foods? Because their measurements are not equal to each other.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: כַּמָּה שִׁיעוּר חֲצִי פְרָס? שְׁתֵּי בֵיצִים חָסֵר קִימְעָא, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: שְׁתֵּי בֵיצִים שׂוֹחֲקוֹת. שִׁיעֵר רַבִּי, שְׁתֵּי בֵיצִים וָעוֹד. כַּמָּה וָעוֹד? אֶחָד מֵעֶשְׂרִים בַּבֵּיצָה.
human_translation: As it was taught How much is half a peras ? Two eggs minus a little; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: Two large eggs, Rabbi measured a little more than two eggs. How much little more? One-twentieth of an egg.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: How much is the measure of half a Parsah? Two eggs minus a Kimea, according to the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: Two laughing eggs. Rabbi Shi'ur, two eggs and more. How much is "and more"? One out of twenty in the egg.

hebrew_text: וְאִילּוּ גַּבֵּי טוּמְאַת אוֹכָלִין תַּנְיָא: רַבִּי נָתָן וְרַבִּי דּוֹסָא אָמְרוּ: כְּבֵיצָה שֶׁאָמְרוּ כָּמוֹהָ וְכִקְלִיפָּתָהּ, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כָּמוֹהָ בְּלֹא קְלִיפָּתָהּ.
human_translation: In contrast, concerning the impurity of foods, it was taught Rabbi Natan and Rabbi Dosa said an egg-bulk, which said equivalent to it, and its shell. And the Rabbis say: equivalent to it without its shell.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And regarding the laws of impurity of foods it was taught: Rabbi Natan and Rabbi Dosa said: Like its egg and its peel, and the sages say: Like it without its peel.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַפְרָם בַּר פָּפָּא אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כְּבֵיצָה וּמֶחֱצָה שׂוֹחֲקוֹת. וּמַאן חֲכָמִים — רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה.
human_translation: Rafram bar Pappa said Rav Ḥisda said: This the statements of Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yosei, But the Rabbis say: One and one half large egg-bulks. And who are Rabbis? Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka.
llm_translation: Rafhram son of Papa said, Rav Hisda said: These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yosei. But the sages say: like an egg and half its shell. And who are the sages? Rabbi Yochanan ben Baroka.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! שׂוֹחֲקוֹת אֲתָא לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן.
human_translation: obvious, he came to teach us large eggs.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Peshita! Sochakot ata le'ashmo'inan." English translation: "It is obvious! Laughter comes to hear us."

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: שִׁיגֵּר בּוֹנְיוֹס לְרַבִּי מוֹדְיָא דְקוֹנְדֵּיס דְּמִן נְאוּסָא, וְשִׁיעֵר רַבִּי מָאתַן וּשְׁבַע עֶשְׂרֵה בֵּיעִין.
human_translation: when Rav Dimi came he said: Bonyos sent Rabbi a measure [ ] of a se’a from Na’usa, And Rabbi measured 217 eggs.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: "The builders sent to Rabbi Modai of Kondes from Neusa, and Rabbi Matan measured and found seventeen cubits."

hebrew_text: הָא סְאָה דְּהֵיכָא? אִי דְּמִדְבָּרִית, מֵאָה אַרְבָּעִים וְאַרְבַּע הָוְיָא!
human_translation: This se’a , from where If the wilderness is 144
llm_translation: This se'ah, where is it from? If it is from the desert, it is one hundred and forty-four!

hebrew_text: וְאִי דִּירוּשַׁלְמִית, מֵאָה שִׁבְעִים וְשָׁלֹשׁ הָוְיָא!
human_translation: And if the Jerusalem is 173
llm_translation: And if it is from Jerusalem, it is one hundred seventy-three!

hebrew_text: וְאִי דְּצִיפּוֹרִית, מָאתַיִם וְשֶׁבַע הָוְיָין!
human_translation: And if of Tzippori, is 207
llm_translation: And if it is of the species of a tzipporit, two hundred and seven it shall be!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם דְּצִיפּוֹרִית, אַיְיתִי חַלְּתָא שְׁדִי עֲלַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Actually, on the of Tzippori, bring the ḥalla and add it to them.
llm_translation: "Forever of bird, I brought a cake demon upon them."

hebrew_text: חַלְּתָא כַּמָּה הָוְיָין? תַּמְנֵי, אַכַּתִּי בָּצַר לֵיהּ!
human_translation: ḥalla , how many is it? eight it remains less
llm_translation: The bread, how much should it be? Eight, for it is difficult for him!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אַיְיתִי וְעוֹדוֹת דְּרַבִּי שְׁדִי עֲלַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rather, bring excess Rabbi and add to them.
llm_translation: Rather, I have brought additional testimonies of Rabbi Shedi regarding them.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הָוֵי לֵיהּ טְפֵי! כֵּיוָן דְּלָא הָוֵי כְּבֵיצָה, לָא חָשֵׁיב לֵיהּ.
human_translation: If so, it is more Since it is not a egg, he did not count it.
llm_translation: If so, it should be considered a secondary source. Since it is not like an egg, it is not considered significant.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן סְאָה יְרוּשַׁלְמִית יְתֵירָה עַל מִדְבָּרִית שְׁתוּת. וְשֶׁל צִיפּוֹרִית יְתֵירָה עַל יְרוּשַׁלְמִית שְׁתוּת. נִמְצֵאת שֶׁל צִיפּוֹרִית יְתֵירָה עַל מִדְבָּרִית שְׁלִישׁ.
human_translation: The Sages taught A Jerusalem se’a is larger than a wilderness by one-sixth, and that of Tzippori is larger than a Jerusalem by one-sixth. Consequently, of Tzippori is larger than a wilderness by one-third.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A Jerusalemite se'ah is more than a Midbarit shetut. And a Tziporit se'ah is more than a Jerusalemite shetut. It is found that a Tziporit se'ah is more than a Midbarit shlish.

hebrew_text: שְׁלִישׁ דְּמַאן? אִילֵּימָא שְׁלִישׁ דְּמִדְבָּרִית, מִכְּדִי שְׁלִישׁ דְּמִדְבָּרִית כַּמָּה הָוֵי — אַרְבְּעִין וּתְמָנְיָא, וְאִילּוּ עוּדְפָּא, שִׁיתִּין וּתְלָת.
human_translation: One-third of which If you say one-third of a wilderness now One-third of a wilderness how much is it? Forty-eight yet the difference sixty-three
llm_translation: Third of whom? Perhaps the third of the desert, for since the third of the desert is how much? Forty-two. And if there is an excess, sixty-three.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא שְׁלִישׁ דִּירוּשַׁלְמִית: שְׁלִישׁ דִּידַהּ כַּמָּה הָוֵי — חַמְשִׁין וּתְמָנְיָא נְכֵי תִּילְתָּא, וְאִילּוּ עוּדְפָּא, שִׁתִּין וּתְלָת. וְאֶלָּא דְּצִיפּוֹרִי: שְׁלִישׁ דִּידַהּ כַּמָּה הָוֵי — שִׁבְעִין נְכֵי חֲדָא, וְאִילּוּ עוּדְפָּא, שִׁשִּׁים וְשָׁלֹשׁ.
human_translation: But rather, one-third of a Jerusalem One-third of that how much is it? Fifty-eight less one-third, yet the difference sixty-three. Rather, Tzippori One-third of that how much is it? Seventy less one-third, yet the difference sixty-three
llm_translation: Third of Jerusalem: A third of its area, how much is it? - Fifty-eight and two-thirds of a mil. And if there is an excess, sixty-three. Rather, of Tsipori: A third of its area, how much is it? - Seventy-one thirds of one mil. And if there is an excess, sixty-three and one-third.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה, הָכִי קָאָמַר: נִמְצֵאת סְאָה שֶׁל צִיפּוֹרִי יְתֵירָה עַל מִדְבָּרִית קָרוֹב לִשְׁלִישׁ שֶׁלָּהּ. וּשְׁלִישׁ שֶׁלָּהּ קָרוֹב לְמֶחֱצָה דְּמִדְבָּרִית.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yirmeya said this is is saying: Consequently, a se’a of Tzippori is larger than a wilderness se’a close to one-third of And one-third of it, is close to half of a wilderness
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yirmeya said, thus he said: If a se'ah of bird's feed is found to be in excess of its usual amount, it is close to one-third of it. And one-third of it is close to half of its usual amount.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבִינָא: מִידֵּי ״קָרוֹב״ ״קָרוֹב״ קָתָנֵי? אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבִינָא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: נִמְצֵאת שְׁלִישׁ שֶׁל צִיפּוֹרִי בִּוְעוֹדָיוֹת שֶׁל רַבִּי יְתֵירָה עַל מֶחֱצָה שֶׁל מִדְבָּרִית שְׁלִישׁ בֵּיצָה.
human_translation: Ravina raised an objection Does state Close Close Rather, Ravina said this is is saying: Consequently, one-third of a Tzippori with the excess of Rabbi is greater than half a wilderness one-third of an egg.
llm_translation: Ravina objects to her: From the words "close," "close," does the Mishnah teach? Rather, Ravina said, this is what he meant to say: A third of a bird was found in the intestines of Rabbi Yeteira on the half of a desert bird's egg.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״רֵאשִׁית עֲרִיסוֹתֵיכֶם״,
human_translation: Our Sages taught the first of your dough
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "The first of your dough,"

hebrew_text: כְּדֵי עִיסּוֹתֵיכֶם, וְכַמָּה עִיסּוֹתֵיכֶם? כְּדֵי עִיסַּת הַמִּדְבָּר. וְכַמָּה עִיסַּת הַמִּדְבָּר?
human_translation: The amount of “your dough.” And how much is “your dough”? as the amount of the dough of the wilderness. And how much is the dough of the wilderness?
llm_translation: As much as your doughs, and how many are your doughs? As much as the dough of the wilderness. And how many are the dough of the wilderness?

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָעוֹמֶר עֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה הוּא״. מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ, שִׁבְעָה רְבָעִים קֶמַח וָעוֹד חַיֶּיבֶת בְּחַלָּה, שֶׁהֵן שִׁשָּׁה שֶׁל יְרוּשַׁלְמִית, שֶׁהֵן חֲמִשָּׁה שֶׁל צִיפּוֹרִי.
human_translation: as it is written: “And an omer is the tenth part of an eifa ” From here, said seven quarters flour and more is obligated in ḥalla . This is equal to six Jerusalem which is five Tzippori
llm_translation: It is written: "And the omer is a tenth of an ephah." From here they said, seven quarters of flour and still obligated in challah, which are six of Jerusalemite flour, which are five of bird flour.

hebrew_text: מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ: הָאוֹכֵל כְּמִדָּה זוֹ — הֲרֵי זֶה בָּרִיא וּמְבוֹרָךְ. יָתֵר עַל כֵּן — רַעַבְתָן. פָּחוֹת מִכָּאן — מְקוּלְקָל בְּמֵעָיו.
human_translation: From here said: One who eats roughly this amount is healthy, and blessed, more than this a glutton, less than this has damaged bowels
llm_translation: From here they said: One who eats according to this measure - behold, he is healthy and blessed. More than this - he is gluttonous. Less than this - he is malnourished in his stomach.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אַנְשֵׁי חָצֵר וְאַנְשֵׁי מִרְפֶּסֶת שֶׁשָּׁכְחוּ וְלֹא עֵירְבוּ, כׇּל שֶׁגָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים — לְמִרְפֶּסֶת. פָּחוֹת מִכָּאן — לֶחָצֵר.
human_translation: the residents of a courtyard and the residents of a balcony forgot and did not establish an eiruv anything that is ten handbreadths high, of the balcony. lower than this of the courtyard.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The residents of a courtyard and the residents of a balcony who forgot to make an Eruv, if the height is ten handbreadths or more - it belongs to the balcony. If it is less than this - it belongs to the courtyard.

hebrew_text: חוּלְיַית הַבּוֹר וְהַסֶּלַע, גְּבוֹהִים עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים — לַמִּרְפֶּסֶת, פָּחוֹת מִכָּאן — לֶחָצֵר.
human_translation: an embankment a cistern or a rock: ten handbreadths high, to the balcony; lower than this, by the courtyard.
llm_translation: The pit and the rock chamber, their height is ten handbreadths - to the ledge, less than from here - to the courtyard.

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בִּסְמוּכָה, אֲבָל בְּמוּפְלֶגֶת — אֲפִילּוּ גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים — לֶחָצֵר. וְאֵיזוֹ הִיא סְמוּכָה — כׇּל שֶׁאֵינָהּ רְחוֹקָה אַרְבָּעָה טְפָחִים.
human_translation: In what are these matters, stated? near But in distant even ten handbreadths high, to the courtyard. And what is near? Anything that is not four handbreadths removed
llm_translation: In what matters are these words spoken? — In a case of adjacency, but in a case of separation — even if it is ten handbreadths high — it is considered connected. And what is considered adjacency? — Anything that is not distant by four handbreadths.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ פְּשִׁיטָא, לָזֶה בְּפֶתַח וְלָזֶה בְּפֶתַח — הַיְינוּ חַלּוֹן שֶׁבֵּין שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת.
human_translation: obvious this through an entrance, and that through entrance, this is a window between two courtyards.
llm_translation: Gemara: "Gemara peshita, laze b'petaḥ v'laze b'petaḥ - hainu chalon shebein shte chatzeirot."

hebrew_text: לָזֶה בִּזְרִיקָה וְלָזֶה בִּזְרִיקָה — הַיְינוּ כּוֹתֶל שֶׁבֵּין שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת. לָזֶה בְּשִׁלְשׁוּל וְלָזֶה בְּשִׁלְשׁוּל — הַיְינוּ חָרִיץ שֶׁבֵּין שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת.
human_translation: of this by throwing and of that by throwing, this is a wall between two courtyards. of this by lowering and of that by lowering, this is a ditch between two courtyards,
llm_translation: To this by throwing and to this by throwing — that is like a wall between two courtyards. To this by drawing and to this by drawing — that is a trench between two courtyards.

hebrew_text: לָזֶה בְּפֶתַח וְלָזֶה בִּזְרִיקָה — הַיְינוּ דְּרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן. לָזֶה בְּפֶתַח וְלָזֶה בְּשִׁלְשׁוּל — הַיְינוּ דְּרַב שֵׁיזְבִי אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן.
human_translation: of this through an entrance but that by throwing this is of Rabba bar Rav Huna, Rav Naḥman said: of this through an entrance but of that by lowering this is of Rav Sheizvi, that Rav Naḥman said:
llm_translation: "To this one at the entrance and to this one at the throwing — that is what Rabba bar Rav Huna said in the name of Rav Nachman. To this one at the entrance and to this one at the drawing — that is what Rav Sheizbi said in the name of Rav Nachman."

hebrew_text: לָזֶה בְּשִׁלְשׁוּל וְלָזֶה בִּזְרִיקָה, מַאי?
human_translation: What of this by lowering and by of that by throwing
llm_translation: To this in shilshul and to this in zriqah, what?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: שְׁנֵיהֶן אֲסוּרִין. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: נוֹתְנִין אוֹתוֹ לָזֶה שֶׁבְּשִׁלְשׁוּל. שֶׁלָּזֶה תַּשְׁמִישׁוֹ בְּנַחַת, וְלָזֶה תַּשְׁמִישׁוֹ בְּקָשֶׁה, וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁתַּשְׁמִישׁוֹ לָזֶה בְּנַחַת וְלָזֶה בְּקָשֶׁה — נוֹתְנִים אוֹתוֹ לָזֶה שֶׁתַּשְׁמִישׁוֹ בְּנַחַת.
human_translation: Rav said: prohibited both And Shmuel said: is granted to those who by lowering, as for them its use is convenient; for the others, its use is demanding. And Anything whose use is convenient for one and demanding for another one provides it to that whose use is convenient.
llm_translation: Rav said: Both are forbidden. And Shmuel said: One may give it to the weaker one. For the weaker one will use it gently, and the stronger one will use it roughly. And anything that the weaker one will use gently and the stronger one will use roughly - one may give it to the weaker one to use gently.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: אַנְשֵׁי חָצֵר וְאַנְשֵׁי מִרְפֶּסֶת שֶׁשָּׁכְחוּ וְלֹא עֵירְבוּ, כָּל שֶׁגָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים — לַמִּרְפֶּסֶת, פָּחוֹת מִכָּאן — לֶחָצֵר.
human_translation: the residents of a courtyard and the residents of a balcony forgot and did not establish an eiruv anything that is ten handbreadths high to the balcony, less than this to the courtyard.
llm_translation: We learned: The people of the courtyard and the people of the balcony who forgot and did not make an eruv, anyone whose height is ten handbreadths - belongs to the balcony, less than this - belongs to the courtyard.

hebrew_text: קָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, מַאי מִרְפֶּסֶת —
human_translation: It might have entered your mind What is balcony
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Ka sakla da'atach, mai mirpeset —"

hebrew_text: בְּנֵי עֲלִיָּיה. וּמַאי קָרוּ לַהּ מִרְפֶּסֶת? דְּקָסָלְקִי בְּמִרְפֶּסֶת, אַלְמָא: כָּל לָזֶה בְּשִׁלְשׁוּל וְלָזֶה בִּזְרִיקָה — נוֹתְנִין אוֹתוֹ לָזֶה שֶׁבְּשִׁלְשׁוּל!
human_translation: the residents of an upper story and why do we call a balcony? ascend by the balcony. From here any that by one by lowering and by another by throwing we grant it to those who by lowering,
llm_translation: Sons of Aliyah. And what is the reason they called her "from the balcony"? Because she was hanging on the balcony, implying: "One part in boiling and one part in roasting - we give it to the part that is in boiling!"

hebrew_text: כִּדְאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לְאוֹתָן הַדָּרִים בַּמִּרְפֶּסֶת. הָכִי נָמֵי: לְאוֹתָן הַדָּרִין בַּמִּרְפֶּסֶת.
human_translation: As Rav Huna said to those who live in the balcony here too, of those who live in the balcony.
llm_translation: As Rav Huna said: for those who reside on the balcony. Thus it was stated: for those who reside on the balcony.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: פָּחוֹת מִכָּאן — לֶחָצֵר. אַמַּאי? לָזֶה בְּפֶתַח וְלָזֶה בְּפֶתַח הוּא!
human_translation: If so, say the next clause lower than this, to the courtyard. why of this through entrance, and of that through entrance.
llm_translation: Thus, if so, say the latter part: less than this - to the courtyard. Why? For this one at the entrance and that one at the entrance it is!

hebrew_text: מַאי ״לֶחָצֵר״? אַף לֶחָצֵר. וּשְׁנֵיהֶן אֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: What is to the courtyard? also to the courtyard. and both are prohibited.
llm_translation: What is "lechatzer"? Also lechatzer. And both of them are forbidden.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים בִּסְמוּכָה. אֲבָל בְּמוּפְלֶגֶת, אֲפִילּוּ גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים — לֶחָצֵר. מַאי ״לֶחָצֵר״? אִילֵּימָא: לֶחָצֵר וּשְׁרֵי, אַמַּאי? רְשׁוּתָא דְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ הוּא!
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable as it was taught in the latter clause In what case is this statement said? When near but in distant even ten handbreadths high, to the courtyard. What, is to the courtyard If you say to the courtyard, and is permitted why It is the domain of both
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: from the end of the Mishnah, in what case are these matters said in proximity? But in a case of separation, even if it is ten handbreadths high — it is considered a courtyard. What is meant by "courtyard"? If you say, "courtyard and street," why? Because it is a shared domain for both!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי ״לֶחָצֵר״ — אַף לֶחָצֵר, וּשְׁנֵיהֶן אֲסוּרִין. הָכִי נָמֵי: מַאי ״לֶחָצֵר״ — אַף לֶחָצֵר, וּשְׁנֵיהֶן אֲסוּרִין. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, what is to the courtyard? also to the courtyard. And, both are prohibited Here too, what is to the courtyard? also to the courtyard, and both prohibited learn from this
llm_translation: Rather, what is the meaning of "to the courtyard"? — Also to the courtyard, and both are prohibited. This is what was said: What is the meaning of "to the courtyard"? — Also to the courtyard, and both are prohibited. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: חוּלְיַית הַבּוֹר וְהַסֶּלַע שֶׁהֵן גְּבוֹהִין עֲשָׂרָה — לַמִּרְפֶּסֶת, פָּחוֹת מִכָּאן — לֶחָצֵר. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לְאוֹתָן הַדָּרִים בַּמִּרְפֶּסֶת.
human_translation: We learned The embankments a cistern or a rock that are ten handbreadths high by the balcony; lower than that to the courtyard. Rav Huna said to those who live in the balcony.
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: A pit and a rock that are ten handbreadths high - from the ledge, less than this - to the courtyard. Rav Huna said: For those residents on the ledge.

hebrew_text: תִּינַח סֶלַע. בּוֹר מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: Granted, a rock, a cistern, what can be said?
llm_translation: "Give me a rock. A pit, what is there to say?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה: הָכָא בְּבוֹר מְלֵאָה מַיִם עָסְקִינַן. וְהָא חָסְרָא!
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak, son of Rav Yehuda, said: We are dealing here with a cistern full of water, But doesn’t lose
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak, son of Rav Yehuda, said: Here we are dealing with a pit full of water. But it is lacking!

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּכִי מַלְיָא שַׁרְיָא — כִּי חָסְרָא נָמֵי שַׁרְיָא. אַדְּרַבָּה, כֵּיוָן דְּכִי חָסְרָא אֲסִירָא — כִּי מַלְיָא נָמֵי אֲסִירָא.
human_translation: Since is permitted when full, it is likewise permitted when it is lacking. On the contrary, since is prohibited when it is lacking, it should likewise be prohibited when it is full.
llm_translation: Since when the stomach is full - when the wine is lacking, the head is clear. On the contrary, since when the wine is lacking - when the stomach is full.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָכָא בְּבוֹר מְלֵיאָה פֵּירוֹת עָסְקִינַן. וְהָא חָסְרִי.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said: Here we are dealing with a cistern full of produce, But doesn’t diminish,
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: Here we are dealing with a pit full of fruit. And there is a deficiency.

hebrew_text: בְּטִיבְלָא.
human_translation: to untithed produce,
llm_translation: In the immersion pool.

hebrew_text: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי דְּקָתָנֵי דּוּמְיָא דְּסֶלַע. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: is also precise, as it teaches together with a rock. learn from this
llm_translation: Precisely, it is stated that it is similar to the height of a rock. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: וּלְמָה לִי לְמִיתְנֵא בּוֹר וּלְמָה לִי לְמִיתְנֵא סֶלַע? צְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן סֶלַע — דְּלֵיכָּא לְמִיגְזַר, אֲבָל בּוֹר — לִיגְזוֹר זִמְנִין דְּמַלְיָא פֵּירוֹת מְתוּקָּנִין, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: But why do I need to state a cistern, and why do I need to state a rock It was necessary As had taught us a rock, as there is no to decree But a cistern, we should decree at times it might be filled with tithed produce, necessary
llm_translation: And why do I need to teach about a pit, and why do I need to teach about a rock? It is necessary, for if we were to learn about a rock - it is not subject to being uprooted, but a pit - at times it is subject to being filled with sweet fruits, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אַנְשֵׁי חָצֵר וְאַנְשֵׁי עֲלִיָּיה שֶׁשָּׁכְחוּ וְלֹא עֵירְבוּ — אַנְשֵׁי חָצֵר מִשְׁתַּמְּשִׁין בָּעֲשָׂרָה הַתַּחְתּוֹנִים, וְאַנְשֵׁי עֲלִיָּיה מִשְׁתַּמְּשִׁין בָּעֲשָׂרָה הָעֶלְיוֹנִים. כֵּיצַד? זִיז יוֹצֵא מִן הַכּוֹתֶל לְמַטָּה מֵעֲשָׂרָה — לֶחָצֵר, לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה — לָעֲלִיָּיה.
human_translation: Come hear If the residents of a courtyard and the residents of an upper story forgot and did not establish eiruv the residents of the courtyard may use the lower ten and the residents of the upper story may use the upper ten How so? a ledge protrudes from the wall below ten for of the courtyard; above ten for of the upper story.
llm_translation: Come and hear: The people of the courtyard and the people of the upper story who forgot and did not make an eruv - the people of the courtyard make use of the lower ten handbreadths, and the people of the upper story make use of the upper ten handbreadths. How so? A projecting beam that extends from the wall downwards ten handbreadths - is considered for the courtyard, upwards ten handbreadths - for the upper story.

hebrew_text: הָא דְּבֵינֵי בֵּינֵי — אָסוּר!
human_translation: Consequently, between and between is prohibited.
llm_translation: This that is between between — forbidden!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הָכָא בְּכוֹתֶל תִּשְׁעָה עָשָׂר עָסְקִינַן, וְזִיז יוֹצֵא מִמֶּנּוּ. לְמַטָּה מֵעֲשָׂרָה — לָזֶה בְּפֶתַח, וְלָזֶה בְּשִׁלְשׁוּל. לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה — לָזֶה בְּפֶתַח, וְלָזֶה בִּזְרִיקָה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: here we are dealing with a wall of nineteen that has a protruding ledge. below ten for this as an entrance, and for that by lowering. above ten for this as an entrance, and for that by throwing.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Here we are dealing with a wall of nineteen cubits, and a protrusion comes out of it. Below ten - one on the side, and one on the corner. Above ten - one on the side, and one in the projection.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שְׁתֵּי גְזוּזְטְרָאוֹת זוֹ לְמַעְלָה מִזּוֹ. עָשׂוּ לָעֶלְיוֹנָה, וְלֹא עָשׂוּ לַתַּחְתּוֹנָה — שְׁתֵּיהֶן אֲסוּרוֹת עַד שֶׁיְּעָרְבוּ!
human_translation: Come hear two balconies one above the other, they erected for the upper but they did not erect for the lower one, they are both prohibited unless they establish an eiruv
llm_translation: Come and hear: Two balconies, one above the other. They made for the upper one, but did not make for the lower one - both are forbidden until they are combined!
