hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: בְּבָאִין בְּנֵי תַחְתּוֹנָה דֶּרֶךְ עֶלְיוֹנָה לְמַלּאוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: where the residents lower go to the upper to draw
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: When the children of the lower world come, the way of the upper world is to be filled.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: כְּגוֹן דְּקַיָּימִין בְּתוֹךְ עֲשָׂרָה דַּהֲדָדֵי, וְלָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא עָשׂוּ לַתַּחְתּוֹנָה וְלֹא עָשׂוּ לָעֶלְיוֹנָה — דַּאֲסִירִי, דְּכֵיוָן דִּבְגוֹ עֲשָׂרָה דַּהֲדָדֵי קַיָּימִין — אָסְרָן אַהֲדָדֵי,
human_translation: Abaye said: where are situated within ten of each other, and was speaking There is no need. There is no need they erect for the lower but they did not erect for the upper one, they are prohibited that since they are positioned within ten of each other, they prohibited for one another
llm_translation: Abaye said: For example, if they are standing within ten cubits of each other, and he did not say: "He did not make for the lower one and he made for the upper one" - they are forbidden, because since they are standing within ten cubits of each other, the others have forbidden them.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ עָשׂוּ לָעֶלְיוֹנָה וְלֹא עָשׂוּ לַתַּחְתּוֹנָה, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: כֵּיוָן דְּלָזֶה בְּנַחַת וְלָזֶה בְּקָשֶׁה — לִיתְּבֵיהּ לָזֶה שֶׁתַּשְׁמִישׁוֹ בְּנַחַת, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: כֵּיוָן דִּבְגוֹ עֲשָׂרָה קַיָּימִין — אָסְרָן אַהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: Rather, even they established upper and they did not establish for the lower it might have entered your mind to say Since for this, is convenient, while for that is demanding, should be granted to the one whose use is convenient. teaches us since are located within ten prohibited for one another.
llm_translation: Rather, even if they made it for the upper one and did not make it for the lower one, it is logical to say: since this one is smooth and this one is rough — this one that is used gently, it is evident to us: since it has ten cubits — Ahadadei prohibited them.

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: גַּג הַסָּמוּךְ לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — צָרִיךְ סוּלָּם קָבוּעַ לְהַתִּירוֹ. סוּלָּם קָבוּעַ אִין, סוּלָּם עֲרַאי לָא. מַאי טַעְמָא? לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּכֵיוָן דִּבְתוֹךְ עֲשָׂרָה דַּהֲדָדֵי קָיְימִי — אָסְרָן אַהֲדָדֵי!
human_translation: similar to that Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said: a roof that is adjacent to a public domain, there must be a fixed ladder to permit a fixed ladder, yes, a temporary ladder, no, What is the reason not are situated within ten of each other, prohibited for one another,
llm_translation: The one that Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: A rooftop adjacent to a public domain - requires a fixed ladder to permit it. If there is no fixed ladder, a temporary ladder does not suffice. What is the reason? Not because since within ten handbreadths they are standing next to each other - one ladder forbids the other!

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב פָּפָּא: וְדִילְמָא כְּשֶׁרַבִּים מְכַתְּפִין עָלָיו, בְּכוּמְתָּא וְסוּדָרָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa objected to this But perhaps many people place their hats [ kumta ] and shawls
llm_translation: Rav Papa objects to her: Perhaps when many people are leaning on it, it will tilt and fall.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל:
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said:
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said, Shmuel said:

hebrew_text: בּוֹר שֶׁבֵּין שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת, מוּפְלֶגֶת מִכּוֹתֶל זֶה אַרְבָּעָה וּמִכּוֹתֶל זֶה אַרְבָּעָה — זֶה מוֹצִיא זִיז כׇּל שֶׁהוּא וּמְמַלֵּא, וְזֶה מוֹצִיא זִיז כׇּל שֶׁהוּא וּמְמַלֵּא. וְרַב יְהוּדָה דִּידֵיהּ אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ קַנְיָא.
human_translation: a cistern between two courtyards is separated four from the wall and four from the wall this may extend a ledge of minimal size and he may draw And the other may extend a ledge of minimal size and draw And Rav Yehuda himself said: even a reed.
llm_translation: A pit between two courtyards, divided by this wall four cubits and by this wall four cubits - this one removes any amount of protrusion and fills the pit, and this one removes any amount of protrusion and fills the pit. And Rav Yehudah said in his name: even a reed.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: הָא דְּרַב יְהוּדָה דִּשְׁמוּאֵל הִיא, דְּאִי דְּרַב, הָא אָמַר: אֵין אָדָם אוֹסֵר עַל חֲבֵירוֹ דֶּרֶךְ אֲוִיר.
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: This of Rav Yehuda, is Shmuel. Since if of Rav, as didn’t say: One person does not render it prohibited for another person by way of the air,
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye to Rav Yosef: This of Rav Yehudah the son of Shmuel is, for if of Rav, this said: "No man may prohibit upon his fellow the way of the air."

hebrew_text: וְדִשְׁמוּאֵל מֵהֵיכָא? אִילֵּימָא מֵהָא דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: גַּג הַסָּמוּךְ לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — צָרִיךְ סוּלָּם קָבוּעַ לְהַתִּירוֹ. דִּילְמָא כִּדְרַב פָּפָּא!
human_translation: And from where of Shmuel? If you say from that which Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said: roof adjacent to a public domain, there must be a fixed ladder to permit Perhaps, in accordance with the opinion of Rav Pappa:
llm_translation: And from where did Shmuel derive this law? If you say from that which Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: A roof adjacent to a public domain requires a fixed ladder to permit it. Perhaps this is not the case as Rav Papa said!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵהָא: זֶה מוֹצִיא זִיז כׇּל שֶׁהוּא וּמְמַלֵּא, וְזֶה מוֹצִיא זִיז כׇּל שֶׁהוּא וּמְמַלֵּא. טַעְמָא דְּאַפֵּיק, הָא לָא אַפֵּיק — אָמְרִינַן: אָדָם אוֹסֵר עַל חֲבֵירוֹ דֶּרֶךְ אֲוִיר.
human_translation: Rather, from this This may extend a ledge of minimal size and draw and the other may extend a ledge of minimal size and draw The reason is that one extended but he did not extend we say one person renders it prohibited for another person by way of the air.
llm_translation: Rather, from this: this one extracting a hair, any that it is, and filling, and this one extracting a hair, any that it is, and filling. The reason for taking out, if he did not take out — we say: a person restrains his fellow in a way of air.

hebrew_text: וּדְרַב מֵהֵיכָא? אִילֵּימָא מֵהָא: שְׁתֵּי גְזוּזְטְרָאוֹת זוֹ לְמַעְלָה מִזּוֹ, עָשׂוּ מְחִיצָה לָעֶלְיוֹנָה וְלֹא עָשׂוּ מְחִיצָה לַתַּחְתּוֹנָה — שְׁתֵּיהֶן אֲסוּרוֹת עַד שֶׁיַּעַרְבוּ.
human_translation: And from where of Rav If you say from that two balconies one above the other, erected a partition for the upper but they did not erect a partition for the lower one, both are prohibited unless they established an eiruv
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And according to Rav, from where? If you say from here: two balconies, one above the other, they made a partition for the upper one but did not make a partition for the lower one - both of them are forbidden until they combine.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּסְמוּכָה, אֲבָל בְּמוּפְלֶגֶת אַרְבָּעָה — עֶלְיוֹנָה מוּתֶּרֶת וְתַחְתּוֹנָה אֲסוּרָה.
human_translation: And Rav Huna said Rav said: They taught only when is near But four removed the upper is permitted while the lower one is prohibited
llm_translation: And Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: They only taught this regarding a leaning wall, but in the case of a divided wall of four cubits, the upper part is permitted and the lower part is forbidden.

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא שָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דְּכֵיוָן דְּלָזֶה בִּזְרִיקָה וְשִׁלְשׁוּל, וְלָזֶה בְּשִׁלְשׁוּל לְחוֹדֵיהּ — כְּלָזֶה בִּזְרִיקָה וְלָזֶה בְּפֶתַח דָּמֵי.
human_translation: perhaps it is different here, since for the this by hoisting and lowering. whereas for the other one, by lowering alone. is similar to one by throwing and another as an entrance.
llm_translation: Perhaps it is different here, for since this one is involved in sprinkling and pouring, and this one is involved in pouring separately - just as this one is involved in sprinkling and this one is involved in pouring, their blood is considered as one.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵהָא דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ אָמַר רַב: שְׁנֵי בָתִּים וְשָׁלֹשׁ חוֹרָבוֹת בֵּינֵיהֶם. זֶה מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בַּסָּמוּךְ שֶׁלּוֹ עַל יְדֵי זְרִיקָה, וָזֶה מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בַּסָּמוּךְ שֶׁלּוֹ עַל יְדֵי זְרִיקָה,
human_translation: Rather, from that which Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said Rav said: two houses with three ruins between them, this may use adjacent to him by means of throwing and the other may use adjacent to him by means of throwing
llm_translation: Rather, from what Rav Nachman said, as Rabba bar Avuh said in the name of Rav: Two houses and three pits between them. This one uses the adjacent pit through irrigation, and this one uses the adjacent pit through irrigation.

hebrew_text: וְהָאֶמְצָעִי — אָסוּר.
human_translation: and the middle is prohibited
llm_translation: And the middle one - forbidden.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַב בְּרוֹנָא וְקָאָמַר לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בַּר בֵּי רַב: אָמַר רַב הָכִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין. אַחְוִי לִי אוּשְׁפִּיזֵיהּ. אַחְוִי לֵיהּ. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲמַר מָר הָכִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין.
human_translation: Rav Beruna sat and stated this halakha Rabbi Elazar, a student of the Torah academy, said to him: Did Rav say this? said to him: Yes, Show me his lodging, He showed him came before Rav said to him: the Master say this? He said to him: Yes,
llm_translation: Rav sat in Barona and said to that report. Rabbi Eliezer son of Rav said to him: Did Rav say so? He said to him: No. I will go and check it. He went and checked it. He came before Rav, said to him: Did the Master say so? He said to him: No.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, וְהָא מָר הוּא דְּאָמַר: לָזֶה בְּשִׁלְשׁוּל וְלָזֶה בִּזְרִיקָה — שְׁנֵיהֶן אֲסוּרִין!
human_translation: said to But wasn’t it the Master said: the one by lowering and another by throwing both are prohibited
llm_translation: He said to him, "But isn't it the Master who said: for this one with roasting and for this one with sprinkling - both are forbidden!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי סָבְרַתְּ דְּקָיְימִי כְּשׁוּרָה? לָא — דְּקָיְימִי כַּחֲצוּבָה.
human_translation: said to him: Do you think that positioned in line? No. They are of a tripod
llm_translation: He said to him: Who holds that it is established like a line? No - it is established like a pit.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְרָבָא: לֵימָא שְׁמוּאֵל לֵית לֵיהּ דְּרַב דִּימִי. דְּכִי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מָקוֹם שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ אַרְבַּע עַל אַרְבַּע — מוּתָּר לִבְנֵי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים וְלִבְנֵי רְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד לְכַתֵּף עָלָיו, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יַחֲלִיפוּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Rava: Let us say Shmuel, does not agree with of Rav Dimi. When Rav Dimi came Rabbi Yoḥanan said: A place less than four by four it is permitted for the people in the public domain and the people in the private domain to adjust on their shoulders in it, as long as they do not exchange
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Rava: Let us say that Shmuel is not of the opinion of Rav Dimi. For when Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Yochanan said: A place that does not have four by four - it is permitted for the public domain and for the private domain to lean on it, as long as they do not switch.

hebrew_text: הָתָם — רְשׁוּיוֹת דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, הָכָא — רְשׁוּיוֹת דְּרַבָּנַן. וַחֲכָמִים עָשׂוּ חִיזּוּק לְדִבְרֵיהֶם יוֹתֵר מִשֶּׁל תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: There, with domains by Torah law. here, with domains by rabbinic law, and the Sages reinforced their statements more than those of the Torah;
llm_translation: There — permissions of the Torah, here — permissions of the Rabbis. And the Sages made their words more stringent than those of the Torah.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרָבָא: מִי אָמַר רַב הָכִי? וְהָא אִיתְּמַר: שְׁנֵי בָתִּים מִשְּׁנֵי צִידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: אָסוּר לִזְרוֹק מִזֶּה לָזֶה, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: מוּתָּר לִזְרוֹק מִזֶּה לָזֶה!
human_translation: Ravina said to Rava: But did Rav say this, But wasn’t it stated two houses on two sides of a public domain. Rabba bar Rav Huna Rav said: prohibited to throw from one to the other; and Shmuel said permitted to throw from one to the other.
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rava: Who said it thus? But it was stated: "Two houses from two sides of a public domain," Rabba bar Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: It is forbidden to throw from this to that, and Shmuel said: It is permitted to throw from this to that!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו מִי אוֹקֵימְנָא דְּמִדְּלֵי חַד וּמִתַּתֵּי חַד, זִימְנִין דְּמִגַּנְדַּר וְנָפֵיל, וְאָתֵי לְאֵיתוֹיֵי.
human_translation: said to him: Wasn’t it established that one higher and the one lower might sometimes roll and fall and come to pick it up
llm_translation: He said to him: "No, are we not establishing that from one side and from the other side, sometimes it protects and falls, and comes to fulfill."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַנּוֹתֵן אֶת עֵירוּבוֹ בְּבֵית שַׁעַר, אַכְסַדְרָה וּמִרְפֶּסֶת — אֵינוֹ עֵירוּב. וְהַדָּר שָׁם — אֵינוֹ אוֹסֵר עָלָיו.
human_translation: one who placed his eiruv in a gatehouse a portico, or a balcony, is not a eiruv . And one who resides there, does not render it prohibited
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who places his Eruv in the gatehouse, the balcony, or the porch - it is not considered his Eruv. But if he resides there, he does not prohibit others from passing through.

hebrew_text: בֵּית הַתֶּבֶן וּבֵית הַבָּקָר וּבֵית הָעֵצִים וּבֵית הָאוֹצָרוֹת — הֲרֵי זֶה עֵירוּב, וְהַדָּר שָׁם — אוֹסֵר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם יֵשׁ שָׁם תְּפִיסַת יָד שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת — אֵינוֹ אוֹסֵר.
human_translation: a hay shed or a cowshed or a woodshed or a storehouse, this is eiruv , And one who resides there renders it prohibited Rabbi Yehuda says: If the homeowner has there, a right of usage, does not render it prohibited
llm_translation: House of straw and house of cattle and house of wood and house of treasures — this is an eruv, and one may reside there — it is prohibited. Rabbi Yehuda says: If there is there a handbreadth of the homeowner's possession — it does not prohibit.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר שִׁילַת: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאָמְרוּ הַדָּר שָׁם אֵינוֹ אוֹסֵר — הַנּוֹתֵן אֶת עֵירוּבוֹ אֵינוֹ עֵירוּב, חוּץ מִבֵּית שַׁעַר דְּיָחִיד. וְכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים אֵין מַנִּיחִין בּוֹ עֵירוּב — מַנִּיחִין בּוֹ שִׁיתּוּף, חוּץ מֵאֲוִיר מָבוֹי.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda, son of Rav Shmuel bar Sheilat, said: Any place which said one who resides there does not render it prohibited one who places his eiruv is not a eiruv , except for a gatehouse to an individual. And any place which the Sages said a joining may not be placed there, a merging may be placed there, except for airspace alleyway,
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah, son of Rav Shmuel, son of Shilat, said: In any place where they said the resident prohibits, there the one who places his Eruv does not establish an Eruv, except for a private courtyard. And in any place where the sages said one may not place an Eruv, one may place a partnership Eruv, except for an alleyway entrance.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנֵינָא: הַנּוֹתֵן אֶת עֵירוּבוֹ בְּבֵית שַׁעַר אַכְסַדְרָה וּמִרְפֶּסֶת — אֵינוֹ עֵירוּב. עֵירוּב הוּא דְּלָא הָוֵי, הָא שִׁיתּוּף הָוֵי?
human_translation: What is he teaching us We have learned one who placed his eiruv in a gatehouse a portico a balcony, it is not a eiruv . an eiruv , it is not, a merging is.
llm_translation: What is it teaching us? We learned: One who places his Eruv in a gatehouse, a balcony, or a porch - it is not considered an Eruv. It is not an Eruv because it is not a proper Eruv, but isn't it considered a partnership?

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁעַר דְּיָחִיד וַאֲוִיר דְּמָבוֹי אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, דְּלָא תְּנַן. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הַנּוֹתֵן אֶת עֵירוּבוֹ בְּבֵית שַׁעַר אַכְסַדְרָה וּמִרְפֶּסֶת וּבְחָצֵר וּבְמָבוֹי — הֲרֵי זֶה עֵירוּב. וְהָתְנַן: אֵין זֶה עֵירוּב! אֵימָא: הֲרֵי זֶה שִׁיתּוּף.
human_translation: It was necessary for him a gatehouse to an individual and the airspace an alleyway, which we did not learn This was also taught One who placed his eiruv in a gatehouse, a portico, or a balcony, or in a courtyard, or in an alleyway, this is eiruv . But didn’t we learn is not an eiruv ? say This is merging
llm_translation: House of a single individual and the airspace of an alleyway require it, as we do not teach. It was also taught likewise: One who places his Eruv in a doorway, a balcony, a courtyard, or an alleyway — this is considered his Eruv. And we learned: This is not considered an Eruv! Say: This is a partnership.

hebrew_text: שִׁיתּוּף בְּמָבוֹי לָא מִינְּטַר? אֵימָא: בְּחָצֵר שֶׁבְּמָבוֹי.
human_translation: merging in the alleyway not guarded, say in a courtyard in the alleyway,
llm_translation: Partnership in an alleyway is not necessary? Say: In the courtyard that is in the alleyway.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה שֶׁהָיוּ מְסוּבִּין וְקִדֵּשׁ עֲלֵיהֶן הַיּוֹם, פַּת שֶׁעַל הַשֻּׁלְחָן סוֹמְכִין עֲלֵיהֶן מִשּׁוּם עֵירוּב. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: מִשּׁוּם שִׁיתּוּף.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: a group who were dining and the day became sanctified for them, they may rely upon the bread on the table for an eiruv And some say for a merging
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The members of a group who were eating together and sanctified the day, a loaf of bread on the table supports them for the sake of an eruv. And some say: For the sake of partnership.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה, וְלָא פְּלִיגִי: כָּאן — בִּמְסוּבִּין בַּבַּיִת, כָּאן — בִּמְסוּבִּין בֶּחָצֵר.
human_translation: Rabba said: do not disagree here, where dining in the house, there where dining in the courtyard,
llm_translation: Rabba said, and they did not dispute: here — reclining indoors, here — reclining outdoors.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַבָּה: תַּנְיָא דִּמְסַיַּיע לָךְ: עֵירוּבֵי חֲצֵירוֹת בֶּחָצֵר, וְשִׁיתּוּפֵי מְבוֹאוֹת בַּמָּבוֹי. וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ, עֵירוּבֵי חֲצֵירוֹת בֶּחָצֵר? וְהָתְנַן: הַנּוֹתֵן אֶת עֵירוּבוֹ בְּבֵית שַׁעַר אַכְסַדְרָה וּמִרְפֶּסֶת אֵינוֹ עֵירוּב! אֵימָא: עֵירוּבֵי חֲצֵירוֹת — בַּבַּיִת שֶׁבֶּחָצֵר, שִׁיתּוּפֵי מְבוֹאוֹת — בֶּחָצֵר שֶׁבַּמָּבוֹי.
human_translation: Abaye said to Rabba: was taught that supports you. Joinings of courtyards in a courtyard, and mergings of alleyways in an alleyway. And we discussed eiruvin of courtyards in a courtyard? But didn’t we learn one deposited his eiruv in a gatehouse, a portico, or a balcony it is not a eiruv ? say Eiruvin of a courtyard in a house in courtyard; mergings of alleyways in a courtyard into alleyway.
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye to Rava: A teaching that supports you: The combining of courtyards in the courtyard, and the partnership of entrances in the alleyway. And we are in it, the combining of courtyards in the courtyard? But didn't we learn: One who places his Eruv in a gatehouse, a balcony, it is not a valid Eruv! Say: The combining of courtyards - in the house within the courtyard, the partnership of entrances - in the courtyard within the alleyway.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם יֵשׁ שָׁם תְּפִיסַת יָד וְכוּ׳. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי תְּפִיסַת יָד? כְּגוֹן חֲצֵירוֹ שֶׁל בּוֹנְיָיס.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: If has there, a right of usage, What are the circumstances of a right of usage? For example, the courtyard of Bonyas,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: If there is there a "t'fisat yad" and so forth. How is the value of "t'fisat yad" estimated? For example, like the courtyard of the builders.

hebrew_text: בֶּן בּוֹנְיָיס אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי, אֲמַר לְהוּ: פַּנּוּ מָקוֹם לְבֶן מֵאָה מָנֶה. אֲתָא אִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא, אֲמַר לְהוּ:
human_translation: son of Bonyas came before Rabbi said to Make way for one one hundred maneh , another person came said to them:
llm_translation: Son of Bonayisa came before Rabbi, he said to them: "Prepare a place for Ben Me'ah Maneh." Another person came, he said to them:

hebrew_text: פַּנּוּ מָקוֹם לְבֶן מָאתַיִם מָנֶה. אָמַר לְפָנָיו רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: רַבִּי, אָבִיו שֶׁל זֶה יֵשׁ לוֹ אֶלֶף סְפִינוֹת בַּיָּם, וּכְנֶגְדָּן אֶלֶף עֲיָירוֹת בַּיַּבָּשָׁה. אָמַר לוֹ: לִכְשֶׁתַּגִּיעַ אֵצֶל אָבִיו אֱמוֹר לוֹ: אַל תְּשַׁגְּרֵהוּ בַּכֵּלִים הַלָּלוּ לְפָנַי.
human_translation: Make way for one two hundred maneh . Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said before him: My teacher, father of this has a thousand ships out at sea and, corresponding to them, a thousand towns on land. said to him: When you reach father, tell him: Do not send him to me in these garments.
llm_translation: He made a place for Ben Ma'atai, two hundred mana. Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said before him: Rabbi, this one's father has a thousand ships at sea, and corresponding to them a thousand cities on land. He said to him: When you reach his father, say to him: Do not provoke him with these vessels before me.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מְכַבֵּד עֲשִׁירִים. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מְכַבֵּד עֲשִׁירִים. כִּדְדָרֵשׁ רָבָא בַּר מָרִי: ״יֵשֵׁב עוֹלָם לִפְנֵי אֱלֹהִים חֶסֶד וֶאֱמֶת מַן יִנְצְרֻהוּ״ — אֵימָתַי יֵשֵׁב עוֹלָם לִפְנֵי אֱלֹהִים? בִּזְמַן שֶׁחֶסֶד וֶאֱמֶת מַן יִנְצְרֻהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi honor the wealthy, Rabbi Akiva would honor the wealthy, in accordance with Rava bar Mari’s interpretation “May he be enthroned before God forever; appoint mercy and truth, that they may preserve him” When may he be enthroned before God forever? When he appoints man mercy and truth that they may preserve him.
llm_translation: Rabbi honors the wealthy. Rabbi Akiva honors the wealthy. As Rava bar Mari expounded: "The world is sustained by kindness and truth; from when are they preserved before God?" - When is the world sustained before God? When kindness and truth are preserved.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר: כְּגוֹן יָתֵד שֶׁל מַחֲרֵישָׁה.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: For example, the pin of a plough
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: Like the peg of a plow.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, תָּנָא דְּבֵי שְׁמוּאֵל: דָּבָר הַנִּיטָּל בְּשַׁבָּת — אוֹסֵר. דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ נִיטָּל בְּשַׁבָּת — אֵינוֹ אוֹסֵר.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: of the school of Shmuel taught an object that can be moved on Shabbat renders prohibited object that cannot be moved on Shabbat, does not render it prohibited for
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, a Tanna of the school of Shmuel: A matter that is removed on Shabbat - prohibits. A matter that is not removed on Shabbat - does not prohibit.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: יֵשׁ לוֹ טֶבֶל, יֵשׁ לוֹ עֲשָׁשִׁית, וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ נִיטָּל בְּשַׁבָּת — אֵינוֹ אוֹסֵר.
human_translation: So too, it was taught has untithed produce he has lumps or anything that may not be moved on Shabbat does not render it prohibited for
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If one has a tevel, if one has a fifth, and anything that is not subject to removal on Shabbat - does not render the mixture forbidden.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּנִּיחַ בֵּיתוֹ וְהָלַךְ לִשְׁבּוֹת בְּעִיר אַחֶרֶת, אֶחָד נׇכְרִי וְאֶחָד יִשְׂרָאֵל — הֲרֵי זֶה אוֹסֵר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ אוֹסֵר.
human_translation: One who leaves his house, and goes to spend Shabbat in a different town, whether a gentile or a Jew, he renders it prohibited the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: He does not render it prohibited for
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who leaves his house and goes to spend Shabbat in another city, one being a non-Jew and one being a Jew - this one prohibits, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: He does not prohibit.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: נׇכְרִי — אוֹסֵר, יִשְׂרָאֵל — אֵינוֹ אוֹסֵר, שֶׁאֵין דֶּרֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל לָבֹא בַּשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: A gentile renders it prohibited a Jew does not render it prohibited, it is not the manner of a Jew to come on Shabbat.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: A Gentile prohibits, an Israelite does not prohibit, for it is not the way of Israel to enter into the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ הִנִּיחַ בֵּיתוֹ וְהָלַךְ לִשְׁבּוֹת אֵצֶל בִּתּוֹ בְּאוֹתָהּ הָעִיר — אֵינוֹ אוֹסֵר, שֶׁכְּבָר הִסִּיעַ מִלִּבּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Even left his house and went to spend Shabbat with his daughter in the same town, he does not render it prohibited. that he has already removed from his mind
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Even if he left his house and went to dwell with his daughter in that same city - he does not forbid, for he has already removed from his heart.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. וְדַוְקָא בִּתּוֹ, אֲבָל בְּנוֹ — לָא. דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: נְבַח בָּךְ כַּלְבָּא — עוּל, נְבַח בָּךְ גּוּרַיְיתָא — פּוֹק.
human_translation: Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. And only his daughter’s but his son’s no, As people say: If a dog barks at you, enter; if a female dog barks at you, leave.
llm_translation: Gemara said Rav: Halacha like Rabbi Shimon. And specifically with his daughter, but with his son — no. As people say: "Bark at you like a dog — unjust, bark at you like a lioness — get out."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בּוֹר שֶׁבֵּין שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת — אֵין מְמַלְּאִין מִמֶּנּוּ בַּשַּׁבָּת, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן עָשׂוּ לוֹ מְחִיצָה גְּבוֹהָ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, בֵּין מִלְּמַטָּה, בֵּין מִתּוֹךְ אוֹגְנוֹ.
human_translation: a cistern that is between two courtyards, one may not draw from it on Shabbat, unless a partition ten handbreadths high was erected for it whether below, or whether it is within the rim,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A pit situated between two courtyards - one may not fill it on Shabbat, unless they made for it a partition ten handbreadths high, whether from below, or from within its rim.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים מִלְּמַטָּה, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים מִלְּמַעְלָה. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: לֹא תְּהֵא מְחִיצָה גְּדוֹלָה מִן הַכּוֹתֶל שֶׁבֵּינֵיהֶם.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: Beit Shammai said below; and Beit Hillel said above. Rabbi Yehuda said: A partition is no better than the wall between them.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Beit Shammai say from below, and Beit Hillel say from above. Rabbi Yehuda said: There should not be a large partition from the wall between them.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לְמַטָּה — לְמַטָּה מַמָּשׁ, לְמַעְלָה — לְמַעְלָה מַמָּשׁ, וְזֶה וָזֶה בְּבוֹר. וְרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: לְמַטָּה — לְמַטָּה מִן הַמַּיִם, לְמַעְלָה — לְמַעְלָה מִן הַמַּיִם.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: below, actually below, above, actually above, And both of these cistern. And Rav Yehuda said: Below below the water, above above the water,
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Huna said: "Below - below literally, above - above literally, and this and this in a pit." And Rav Yehudah said: "Below - below from the water, above - above from the water."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה בַּר רַב חָנָן לְאַבָּיֵי: הָא דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה ״לְמַטָּה — לְמַטָּה מִן הַמַּיִם״, מַאי שְׁנָא לְמַטָּה מַמָּשׁ דְּלָא? דַּעֲרִיבִי מַיָּא. לְמַטָּה מִן הַמַּיִם נָמֵי, הָא עֲרִיבִי מַיָּא?!
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Ḥanan said to Abaye: that Rav Yehuda said: Below below the water, what is different actually below, not because the water become intermingled below the water, as well, won’t the water become intermingled
llm_translation: Rabah bar Rav Hanan said to Abbaye: This that Rav Yehudah said, "Below - below from the water," what is different about below specifically that it is not considered actual water? Because it is mixed with water. Below from the water is also considered water, so why is it considered different because it is mixed with water?!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ הָא דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, וּמָטוּ בָּהּ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי חִיָּיא: צָרִיךְ שֶׁיֵּרָאוּ רֹאשָׁן שֶׁל קָנִים לְמַעְלָה מִן הַמַּיִם טֶפַח.
human_translation: said to him: Didn’t you hear that which Rav Yehuda said Rav said, and some arrived at in the name of Rabbi Ḥiyya: The tops of the reeds must be visible a handbreadth above the water?
llm_translation: He said to him: "Do not you hear what Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, and they agreed upon it in the name of Rabbi Chiya: The top of the reeds must be seen above the water by a handbreadth."

hebrew_text: וְתוּ, הָא דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: ״לְמַעְלָה — לְמַעְלָה מִן הַמַּיִם״. מַאי שְׁנָא לְמַעְלָה מַמָּשׁ דְּלָא? דַּעֲרִיבִי מַיָּא. לְמַעְלָה מִן הַמַּיִם נָמֵי, הָא עֲרִיבִי מַיָּא?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ הָא דְּתָנֵי יַעֲקֹב קַרְחִינָאָה: צָרִיךְ שֶׁיְּשַׁקַּע רָאשֵׁי קָנִים בַּמַּיִם טֶפַח.
human_translation: And further that Rav Yehuda said: Above above the water, What is different actually above, not because the water become intermingled above the water the water also become intermingled said to him: Haven’t you heard that which Ya’akov from Karḥina taught: The ends of the reeds must be immersed a handbreadth water,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And come, this that Rav Yehudah said: "Above — above the water." What is different above really that not? Evening water. Above the water also, this evening water?! He said to him: Do not you hear this that Yaakov taught: "It is necessary that the tops of the reeds be submerged in the water by a handbreadth." English translation: And come, this that Rav Yehudah said: "Above — above the water." What is different above really that not? Evening water. Above the water also, this evening water?! He said to him: Do not you hear this that Yaakov taught: "It is necessary that the tops of the reeds be submerged in the water by a handbreadth."

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: קוֹרָה אַרְבַּע מַתֶּרֶת בְּחוּרְבָּה, וְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ:
human_translation: But Rav Yehuda said: beam of four permits in a ruin. And Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said:
llm_translation: And rather this that said Rav Yehudah: a beam four cubits in a sword, and Rav Nachman said Rabba bar Avuh.

hebrew_text: קוֹרָה אַרְבָּעָה מַתֶּרֶת בְּמַיִם.
human_translation: beam of four permits water
llm_translation: "A beam, four cubits, in water."

hebrew_text: הָא קָא אָזֵיל דְּלִי לְאִידַּךְ גִּיסָא, וּמַיְיתֵי? קִים לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן דְּאֵין דְּלִי מְהַלֵּךְ יוֹתֵר מֵאַרְבָּעָה טְפָחִים.
human_translation: bucket might drift beam to the other side and bring The Sages have established that a bucket does not drift more than four handbreadths
llm_translation: This one goes to bring for you a log of wood, and he brings it? It stands for the Rabbis who hold that one may not carry more than four cubits.

hebrew_text: תַּחַת קוֹרָה מִיהָא הָא עֲרִיבִי מַיָּא! אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּקַל הוּא שֶׁהֵקֵילּוּ חֲכָמִים בְּמַיִם. כְּדִבְעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי טַבְלָא מֵרַב: מְחִיצָה תְּלוּיָה, מַהוּ שֶׁתַּתִּיר בְּחוּרְבָּה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵין מְחִיצָה תְּלוּיָה מַתֶּרֶת אֶלָּא בְּמַיִם, קַל הוּא שֶׁהֵקֵילּוּ חֲכָמִים בַּמַּיִם.
human_translation: Nonetheless, the water becomes intermingled under the beam, Rather, because the Sages were lenient with regard to water. As Rav Tavla asked of Rav: a suspended partition, does it permit in a ruin? said to him: A suspended partition permits only of water, the Sages were lenient with regard to water.
llm_translation: Under a beam, from where does the water come? Rather, because it is light, the sages were lenient with water. As it was taught in a Baraita from Rabbi Tabla: A hanging partition, what is the ruling with a sword? He said to him: A hanging partition is only permitted with water, because the sages were lenient with water.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, לֹא תְּהֵא מְחִיצָה. אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּשִׁיטַת רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אֲמָרָהּ, דְּאָמַר: מְחִיצָה תְּלוּיָה מַתֶּרֶת אֲפִילּוּ בַּיַּבָּשָׁה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: a partition is no Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Rabbi Yehuda stated this in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yosei, who said: A suspended partition permits even on land,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehuda, there shall not be a partition. Said Rabba bar bar Ḥana in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Rabbi Yehuda, according to the opinion of Rabbi Yosei, said it, as he said: A partition suspended is permitted even in a dry area.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: הַמְשַׁלְשֵׁל דְּפָנוֹת מִלְּמַעְלָה לְמַטָּה, בִּזְמַן שֶׁגְּבוֹהוֹת מִן הָאָרֶץ שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים — פְּסוּלָה. מִמַּטָּה לְמַעְלָה, אִם גְּבוֹהוֹת עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים — כְּשֵׁירָה.
human_translation: As we learned One who lowers walls from above downward, when are three handbreadths higher than the ground, is invalid, from below upward, if they are ten handbreadths high is valid,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: One who makes a balcony projecting from above downward, when its height from the ground is three handbreadths - it is invalid. From below upward, if its height is ten handbreadths - it is valid.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמִּלְּמַטָּה לְמַעְלָה עֲשָׂרָה, כָּךְ מִלְּמַעְלָה לְמַטָּה עֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, says: Just as from below upward, ten so from above downward, ten
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Just as from below to above is ten, so too from above to below is ten.

hebrew_text: וְלָא הִיא, לָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְלָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: But this is not so, neither Rabbi Yehuda holds with Rabbi Yosei, nor does Rabbi Yosei hold with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: And not so, not Rabbi Yehuda holds like Rabbi Yosei, and not Rabbi Yosei holds like Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אֶלָּא בְּעֵירוּבֵי חֲצֵירוֹת דְּרַבָּנַן, אֲבָל סוּכָּה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — לָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda does not hold with Rabbi Yosei, Rabbi Yehuda stated only with regard to the joining of courtyards, by rabbinic law, but a sukka , which by Torah law, no,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda did not agree with Rabbi Yosei: Until here, Rabbi Yehuda did not say except in the case of the joint courtyards of the Rabbis, but regarding a Sukkah of biblical origin - no.

hebrew_text: וְלָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אֶלָּא בְּסוּכָּה דְּאִיסּוּר עֲשֵׂה הוּא, אֲבָל שַׁבָּת דְּאִיסּוּר סְקִילָה הוּא — לֹא אָמַר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei does not hold with Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Yosei stated only with regard to a sukka , is a prohibition from a positive commandment. But Shabbat, a prohibition by stoning, did not state
llm_translation: And not Rabbi Yosei holds like Rabbi Yehuda: Until here did not say Rabbi Yosei except in a sukkah of a prohibition of a positive commandment it is, but Shabbat of a prohibition of stoning it is - he did not say.

hebrew_text: וְאִם תֹּאמַר: אוֹתוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁנַּעֲשָׂה בְּצִיפּוֹרִי, עַל פִּי מִי נַעֲשָׂה? לֹא עַל פִּי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, אֶלָּא עַל פִּי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי נַעֲשָׂה.
human_translation: And if you ask: That incident, which occurred in Tzippori, on whose authority was it performed? not on the authority of Rabbi Yosei, but it was performed on the authority of Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: And if you will say: that same deed that was done in Tzipori, by whose authority was it done? Not by the authority of Rabbi Yosei, but by the authority of Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei it was done.

hebrew_text: דְּכִי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: פַּעַם אַחַת שָׁכְחוּ וְלֹא הֵבִיאוּ סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם. לְמָחָר פָּרְסוּ סָדִין עַל הָעַמּוּדִים, וְהֵבִיאוּ סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה וְקָרְאוּ בּוֹ.
human_translation: As when Rav Dimi came he said: once forgot and did not bring a Torah scroll while it was still day, On the following day, they spread a sheet over the pillars And they brought the Torah scroll and read from it.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: "Once they forgot and did not bring the Torah scroll during the day. The next day they spread a sheet on the pillars, and they brought the Torah scroll and read from it."

hebrew_text: פָּרְסוּ?! לְכַתְּחִילָּה מִי שְׁרֵי? וְהָא הַכֹּל מוֹדִים שֶׁאֵין עוֹשִׂין אֹהֶל עֲרַאי בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: spread Is it permitted ab initio ? But doesn’t everyone agree that one may not erect a temporary tent on Shabbat
llm_translation: They spread out?! Initially, who permits? And this, all agree that one may not make a temporary tent on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: מָצְאוּ סְדִינִין פְּרוּסִין עַל הָעַמּוּדִים, וְהֵבִיאוּ סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה וְקָרְאוּ בּוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, they found sheets spread over the pillars, and they brought the Torah scroll and read from it.
llm_translation: Rather: found sheets spread out on the pillars, and brought a Torah scroll and read from it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא אָמְרוּ דָּבָר אֶחָד. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא, (דִּתְנַן) רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא אוֹמֵר: גְּזוּזְטְרָא שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת עַל אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת
human_translation: Rabba said: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Ḥananya ben Akavya said the same thing. Rabbi Yehuda is that which we said, Rabbi Ḥananya ben Akavya is as we learned: Rabbi Ḥananya ben Akavya says: a balcony that contains four cubits by four cubits,
llm_translation: Rabba said: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Chananya ben Akavya said one thing. Rabbi Yehuda, as we said. Rabbi Chananya ben Akavya, as we learned: Rabbi Chananya ben Akavya says: A courtyard that has four cubits by four cubits.

hebrew_text: חוֹקֵק בָּהּ אַרְבַּע עַל אַרְבַּע וּמְמַלֵּא.
human_translation: one may carve in it four by four and draw
llm_translation: Engraving in it four by four and filling.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְדִילְמָא לָא הִיא, עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הָתָם, אֶלָּא דְּאָמַר: ״גּוּד אַחֵית מְחִיצְתָּא״, אֲבָל ״כּוֹף וְגוּד״ — לָא.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: But perhaps that is not so, Rabbi Yehuda stated only there, as he said extend and lower the partition. But bend and extend no,
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: And perhaps it is not so, until here Rabbi Yehuda did not say there, but rather he said: "A wall of a courtyard," but "a beam and a wall" - no.

hebrew_text: וְעַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא הָתָם, אֶלָּא בְּיַמָּהּ שֶׁל טְבֶרְיָא, הוֹאִיל וְיֵשׁ לָהּ אוֹגָנִים, וַעֲיָירוֹת וְקַרְפֵּיפוֹת מַקִּיפוֹת אוֹתָהּ, אֲבָל בִּשְׁאָר מֵימוֹת — לֹא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥananya ben Akavya stated only there, with regard to the Sea of Tiberias, since it has banks and towns and enclosures surround it However, with regard to other waters, no,
llm_translation: And until here not said Rabbi Hananiah ben Akavya there, rather in the sea of Tiberias, since it has organs, and cities and villages surround it, but in other days - no.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: וּלְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא, הָיְתָה סְמוּכָה לַכּוֹתֶל בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים — צָרִיךְ שֶׁיְּהֵא אוֹרְכָּהּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, וְרוֹחְבָּהּ אַחַד עָשָׂר וּמַשֶּׁהוּ.
human_translation: Abaye said: And according to the statement of Rabbi Ḥananya ben Akavya, was less than three handbreadths from the wall, Its length must be four cubits, and its width eleven and amount.
llm_translation: Abaye said: According to the words of Rabbi Hananiah ben Akavya, if it was adjacent to the wall by less than three handbreadths - it requires that its length be four cubits, and its width eleven and a fraction.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה זְקוּפָה — צָרִיךְ שֶׁיְּהֵא גּוֹבְהָהּ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, וְרוֹחְבָּהּ שִׁשָּׁה טְפָחִים וּשְׁנֵי מַשֶּׁהוּיִין.
human_translation: was upright, the height must be ten handbreadths, and the width six handbreadths and two amounts.
llm_translation: It was upright - needs that it should be its height ten handbreadths, and its width six handbreadths and two spans.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: הָיְתָה עוֹמֶדֶת בְּקֶרֶן זָוִית — צָרִיךְ שֶׁיְּהֵא גּוֹבְהָהּ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, וְרוֹחְבָּהּ שְׁנֵי טְפָחִים וּשְׁנֵי מַשֶּׁהוּיִין.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: was positioned in a corner the height must be ten handbreadths, and the width two handbreadths and two amounts.
llm_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: If it was standing in a corner - it must be ten handbreadths high, and its width two handbreadths and two handbreadths.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא אוֹמֵר: גְּזוּזְטְרָא שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת עַל אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — חוֹקֵק בָּהּ אַרְבָּעָה עַל אַרְבָּעָה וּמְמַלֵּא, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?
human_translation: However, that which is taught Rabbi Ḥananya ben Akavya said: a balcony has four cubits by four cubits one carves in it four by four and draws what circumstances be found?
llm_translation: And rather this that it was taught, Rabbi Hananiah ben Akavya says: A garden plot that has within it four cubits by four cubits - one may measure out within it four by four and plant, how does one forget about it?

hebrew_text: דַּעֲבִידָא כִּי אֲסִיתָא.
human_translation: that is built in the shape of a mortar,
llm_translation: The matter stands as follows: when it happened.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אַמַּת הַמַּיִם שֶׁהִיא עוֹבֶרֶת בֶּחָצֵר — אֵין מְמַלְּאִין הֵימֶנָּה בְּשַׁבָּת, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן עָשׂוּ לָהּ מְחִיצָה גְּבוֹהָ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים בִּכְנִיסָה וּבִיצִיאָה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כּוֹתֶל שֶׁעַל גַּבָּהּ תִּידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם מְחִיצָה.
human_translation: a water channel that passes through a courtyard, may not draw from it on Shabbat, unless they erected for it a partition ten handbreadths high at the entrance and at the exit Rabbi Yehuda says: wall that on top of it, is considered as a partition.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A stream of water that flows through a courtyard - one may not draw water from it on Shabbat unless they have made for it a partition that is ten handbreadths high at its entrance and exit. Rabbi Yehuda says: A wall that is on its height is considered a partition.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאַמָּה שֶׁל אָבֵל, שֶׁהָיוּ מְמַלְּאִין מִמֶּנָּה עַל פִּי זְקֵנִים בְּשַׁבָּת! אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בָּהּ כַּשִּׁיעוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: an incident involving a channel of Avel, which would draw from it on Shabbat by the authority of the Elders, They said to him: due to was not of the size
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: There was an incident with the widow's cubit, that they would fill it based on the word of the elders on Shabbat! They said to him: Because it did not have the proper measure.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עָשׂוּ לָהּ בִּכְנִיסָה וְלֹא עָשׂוּ לָהּ בִּיצִיאָה, עָשׂוּ לָהּ בִּיצִיאָה וְלֹא עָשׂוּ לָהּ בִּכְנִיסָה — אֵין מְמַלְּאִין הֵימֶנָּה בְּשַׁבָּת, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן עָשׂוּ לָהּ מְחִיצָה עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים בִּיצִיאָה וּבִכְנִיסָה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כּוֹתֶל שֶׁעַל גַּבָּהּ תִּידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם מְחִיצָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught they erected for at the entrance but they did not erect for it at the exit, they erected for it at the exit but they did not erect for it at the entrance, one may not draw from it on Shabbat, unless they erected for it a partition ten handbreadths at the exit and at the entrance. Rabbi Yehuda says: The wall on top of it, is considered as a partition.
llm_translation: The sages taught: If they made for it an entrance but did not make for it an exit, or if they made for it an exit but did not make for it an entrance — one may not fill it with water on Shabbat unless they made for it a partition of ten handbreadths at the exit and at the entrance. Rabbi Yehuda says: A wall that is on top of it is considered a partition.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאַמַּת הַמַּיִם שֶׁהָיְתָה בָּאָה מֵאָבֵל לְצִפּוֹרִי, וְהָיוּ מְמַלְּאִין הֵימֶנָּה בְּשַׁבָּת עַל פִּי הַזְּקֵנִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: an incident involving the water channel that went from Avel to Tzippori, and would draw from it on Shabbat by the authority of the Elders,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: There was an incident with a water channel that used to come from Abel to Tzipori, and they used to fill it on Shabbat according to the elders' instructions.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִשָּׁם רְאָיָיה?! מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלֹּא הָיְתָה עֲמוּקָּה עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים וְרוֹחְבָּהּ אַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: They said to him: a proof from there? due to was not ten handbreadths deep or four wide.
llm_translation: They said to him: From there a proof?! Because it was not deep ten handbreadths and its width four.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: אַמַּת הַמַּיִם הָעוֹבֶרֶת בֵּין הַחַלּוֹנוֹת, פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה — מְשַׁלְשֵׁל דְּלִי וּמְמַלֵּא. שְׁלֹשָׁה — אֵין מְשַׁלְשֵׁל דְּלִי וּמְמַלֵּא. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבָּעָה — מְשַׁלְשֵׁל דְּלִי וּמְמַלֵּא, אַרְבָּעָה — אֵין מְשַׁלְשֵׁל דְּלִי וּמְמַלֵּא.
human_translation: It was taught in another a water channel that passes between the windows less than three one may lower a bucket and draw three one may not lower a bucket and draw Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: less than four one may lower a bucket and draw four one may not lower a bucket and draw
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Another opinion: A cubit of water passing between the windows, less than three cubits - one may rinse a jug and fill it. Three cubits - one may not rinse a jug and fill it. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Less than four cubits - one may rinse a jug and fill it, four cubits - one may not rinse a jug and fill it.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא: בְּאַמַּת הַמַּיִם גּוּפַהּ, וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּכִי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין כַּרְמְלִית פְּחוּתָה מֵאַרְבָּעָה —
human_translation: With what are we dealing If you say to the water channel itself, for when Rav Dimi came Rabbi Yoḥanan said: A karmelit cannot be less than four
llm_translation: With what are we dealing? If you say: with a cubit of water itself, but rather this that Rav Dimi came and said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A Carmelite is not less than four cubits —

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי אַמְרַהּ לִשְׁמַעְתֵּיהּ?
human_translation: Let us say, the teaching that cited, tanna’im
llm_translation: Let us say, as the Tannaim stated, did she say it to be heard?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בַּאֲגַפֶּיהָ, וּלְהַחְלִיף.
human_translation: Rather, to the banks and with regard to exchange.
llm_translation: Rather, in its wings, and to exchange.

hebrew_text: וְהָא כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מָקוֹם שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ אַרְבָּעָה עַל אַרְבָּעָה — מוּתָּר לִבְנֵי רְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד וְלִבְנֵי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים לְכַתֵּף עָלָיו, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יַחְלִיפוּ.
human_translation: But when Rav Dimi came he said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: A place that does not have four by four exempt domain. it is permitted for the people of the private domain and for the people of the public domain to shoulders on it, provided they do not exchange
llm_translation: And this, when Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Yochanan said: A place that does not have four by four - it is permitted for the residents of the private domain and the residents of the public domain to shoulder it, provided that they do not switch.

hebrew_text: הָתָם רְשׁוּיוֹת דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא,
human_translation: There, domains by Torah law,
llm_translation: There, permissions of the Torah,

hebrew_text: הָכָא רְשׁוּיוֹת דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: here, domains by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Here are the permissions of the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: וְהָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בָּרְשׁוּיוֹת דְּרַבָּנַן נָמֵי אָמַר, (דְּתַנְיָא): כּוֹתֶל שֶׁבֵּין שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת, גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים וְרוֹחַב אַרְבָּעָה — מְעָרְבִין שְׁנַיִם, וְאֵין מְעָרְבִין אֶחָד.
human_translation: But Rabbi Yoḥanan said even in domains by rabbinic law. As we learned a wall that is between two courtyards, ten handbreadths high and four wide, establish two eiruvin , but they do not establish one eiruv .
llm_translation: And this, Rabbi Yochanan bar Resh Lakish of the Sages of Nehardea said, as it was taught: A wall between two courtyards, its height is ten handbreadths and its width is four - two may combine, but one may not combine.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ בְּרֹאשׁוֹ פֵּירוֹת — אֵלּוּ עוֹלִין מִכָּאן וְאוֹכְלִין, וְאֵלּוּ עוֹלִין מִכָּאן וְאוֹכְלִין.
human_translation: If there was produce on top these, may ascend from this and eat and those, may ascend from the other and eat
llm_translation: They were at the top fruits - these ascend from here and are eaten, and these ascend from here and are eaten.

hebrew_text: נִפְרַץ הַכּוֹתֶל, עַד עֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת — מְעָרְבִין שְׁנַיִם, וְאִם רָצוּ מְעָרְבִין אֶחָד, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא כְּפֶתַח. יוֹתֵר מִכָּאן — מְעָרְבִין אֶחָד וְאֵין מְעָרְבִין שְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: the wall is breached, up to ten cubits they may establish two eiruvin , and if they wish, they may establish one eiruv , for it is like an entrance. more than this, they may establish one eiruv , but they may not establish two eiruvin .
llm_translation: The wall broke, up to ten cubits - they combine two, and if they wish, they combine one, because it is like an entrance. More than this - they combine one and do not combine two.

hebrew_text: וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: אֵין בּוֹ אַרְבָּעָה מַאי? אָמַר רַב: אֲוִיר שְׁתֵּי רְשׁוּיוֹת שׁוֹלֶטֶת בּוֹ, וְלֹא יָזִיז בּוֹ מְלֹא נִימָא.
human_translation: And we discussed this is not four what is Rav said: the air of two domains controls it. one may not move on a hairsbreadth.
llm_translation: We were in it: it does not have four, what is it? Rav said: a beam with two permitted sides dominates it, and one should not move a full reed in it.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֵלּוּ מַעֲלִין מִכָּאן וְאוֹכְלִין, וְאֵלּוּ מַעֲלִין מִכָּאן וְאוֹכְלִין.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: These, may carry up from and eat and those, may carry up from and eat
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: These ascend from here and eat, and these ascend from here and eat.

hebrew_text: וְאַזְדָּא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּכִי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מָקוֹם שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ אַרְבָּעָה עַל אַרְבָּעָה — מוּתָּר לִבְנֵי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים וְלִבְנֵי רְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד לְכַתֵּף עָלָיו, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יַחֲלִיפוּ!
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan follows his argument for when Rav Dimi came he said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: A place that contains less than four by four it is permitted for the people of the private domain and for the people of the public domain to load onto their shoulders in it, as long as they do not exchange
llm_translation: And it was established according to the reasoning of Rabbi Yochanan, for when Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Yochanan said: In a place where there are not four by four - it is permitted for the public domain and for the private domain to carry alongside it, as long as they do not exchange.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא זְעֵירִי אַמְרַהּ. וְלִזְעֵירִי קַשְׁיָא הָא!
human_translation: That Ze’eiri stated it this is difficult according to Ze’eiri.
llm_translation: That small one said. And to the small one, a question: What is this?

hebrew_text: זְעֵירִי מוֹקֵים לַהּ בְּאַמַּת הַמַּיִם גּוּפַהּ. וְרַב דִּימִי תַּנָּאֵי הִיא.
human_translation: explains to the water channel itself. And Rav Dimi, is tanna’im .
llm_translation: Z'eiri establishes for her with a cubit of water her body. And Rav Dimi taught: it is a Mishnah.

hebrew_text: וְתִיהְוֵי כִּי חוֹרֵי כַּרְמְלִית!
human_translation: And let be like the cavities of a karmelit ,
llm_translation: And it should be as the hole of the Carmelite!

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי בַּר אָבִין וְרַב חֲנִינָא בַּר אָבִין דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: אֵין חוֹרִין לְכַרְמְלִית.
human_translation: Abaye bar Avin and Rav Ḥanina bar Avin both said: There is no cavities for a karmelit .
llm_translation: Abaye son of Avin and Rav Chanina son of Avin both said: "One may not make a hole in a Carmelite."

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא יֵשׁ חוֹרִין לְכַרְמְלִית — הָנֵי מִילֵּי בִּסְמוּכָה. הָכָא, בְּמוּפְלֶגֶת.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: You even say there are holes for a karmelit , this applies only to adjacent Here, however, that is removed
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Even if you say there are holes in the vineyard fence - those words are in proximity. Here, in a case of a split vineyard.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: כְּגוֹן דַּעֲבַד לַהּ נִיפְקֵי אַפּוּמַּהּ.
human_translation: Ravina said where one fashioned outlets for at its ends,
llm_translation: Ravina said: For example, he did to her, "Nifkei Apumah."

hebrew_text: וְאָזְדוּ רַבָּנַן לְטַעְמַיְיהוּ, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לְטַעְמֵיהּ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis follow their argument, And Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel follows his argument,
llm_translation: The scholars went to their reasons, and Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel to his reasons.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ גְּזוּזְטְרָא שֶׁהִיא לְמַעְלָה מִן הַמַּיִם אֵין מְמַלְּאִין הֵימֶנָּה בְּשַׁבָּת אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן עָשׂוּ לָהּ מְחִיצָה גְּבוֹהָה עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, בֵּין מִלְּמַעְלָה, בֵּין מִלְּמַטָּה.
human_translation: a balcony that over water, may not draw from it on Shabbat, unless they erected for it a partition ten handbreadths high whether above or below
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A balcony that is above the water, one may not fill it with water on Shabbat unless they made for it a high partition of ten handbreadths, whether above or below.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן שְׁתֵּי גְזוּזְטְרָאוֹת זוֹ לְמַעְלָה מִזּוֹ, עָשׂוּ לְעֶלְיוֹנָה וְלֹא עָשׂוּ לְתַחְתּוֹנָה — שְׁתֵּיהֶן אֲסוּרוֹת עַד שֶׁיְּעָרְבוּ.
human_translation: And likewise, two balconies, one above the other, they erected for the upper balcony but they did not erect for the lower one, are both prohibited unless they establish an eiruv
llm_translation: And so too, two gizuztrahot, this one above this one, they made for the upper one and did not make for the lower one - both of them are forbidden until they are mixed.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כַּחֲנַנְיָא בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא. דְּתַנְיָא, חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא אוֹמֵר: גְּזוּזְטְרָא שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ אַרְבַּע עַל אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת חוֹקֵק בָּהּ אַרְבָּעָה עַל אַרְבָּעָה, וּמְמַלֵּא.
human_translation: The mishna not in accordance with Ḥananya ben Akavya, as it was taught Ḥananya ben Akavya says: a balcony that contains four by four cubits one may carve out four by four in it and draw
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara matnitin d'lo kachananya ben Akavya. D'tanya, kachananya ben Akavya omer: Gezuztra sheyesh bah arba al arba amot chokkek bah arba'ah al arba'ah, u'memalei. English translation: Gemara of the Mishnah that is not like Chananya ben Akavya. For it was taught: Chananya ben Akavya says: A partition that has within it four by four cubits, one must carve within it four by four cubits, and fill it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן זִימְרָא: לֹא הִתִּיר רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא אֶלָּא בְּיַמָּהּ שֶׁל טְבֶרְיָא, הוֹאִיל וְיֵשׁ לָהּ אוֹגָנִים, וַעֲיָירוֹת וְקַרְפֵּיפוֹת מַקִּיפוֹת אוֹתָהּ, אֲבָל בִּשְׁאָר מֵימוֹת — לֹא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Yosei ben Zimra: Rabbi Ḥananya ben Akavya permitted only in the Sea of Tiberias, as it has banks and towns and enclosures surround it. But with regard to other waters, no,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Yosei ben Zimra: Rabbi Chananya ben Akavya only permitted it in the sea of Tveria, since it has ovens, and cities and villages surround it, but in other days — no.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים הִתִּיר רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא לְאַנְשֵׁי טְבֶרְיָא: מְמַלְּאִין מַיִם מִגְּזוּזְטְרָא בַּשַּׁבָּת, וְטוֹמְנִין בְּעֵצָה, וּמִסְתַּפְּגִין בַּאֲלוּנְטִית.
human_translation: Our Sages taught Rabbi Ḥananya ben Akavya permitted three activities to the inhabitants of Tiberias: They may draw water through a balcony on Shabbat, and they may insulate in the pods and they may dry themselves with a towel [ aluntit ].
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Three things Rabbi Hananiah ben Akavya permitted to the people of Teverya: Filling water from a gutter on Shabbat, covering with a board, and smearing with an ointment.

hebrew_text: מְמַלְּאִין מַיִם מִגְּזוּזְטְרָא בַּשַּׁבָּת: הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. וְטוֹמְנִין בְּעֵצָה מַאי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: הִשְׁכִּים לְהָבִיא פְּסוֹלֶת, אִם בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלָיו טַל — הֲרֵי הוּא בְּ״כִי יוּתַּן״,
human_translation: They may draw water through a balcony on Shabbat that we stated And they may insulate in the pods what is As it was taught rose early to bring residue If because has dew on it, this is considered If be put.
llm_translation: Filling water from a gutter on Shabbat: This that we said. And concealing with advice what is it? As it was taught: If one arose early to bring fine flour, if it is because there is dew upon it — behold it is considered as "Kiyor" (a ritual washing basin).

hebrew_text: וְאִם בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁלֹּא יִבָּטֵל מִמְּלַאכְתּוֹ — אֵינוֹ בְּ״כִי יוּתַּן״. וּסְתָם
human_translation: And if in order not to neglect his work, is not considered if it be put, And normally,
llm_translation: "And if because he will not cease from his work - he is not considered 'like Yutan.' And a general rule..."

hebrew_text: אַנְשֵׁי טְבֶרְיָא כְּמִי שֶׁלֹּא יִבְטַל מִמְּלַאכְתּוֹ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: the inhabitants of Tiberias like one not to neglect his work.
llm_translation: The people of Tiberias are like those who do not cease from their work.

hebrew_text: וּמִסְתַּפְּגִין בַּאֲלוּנְטִית מַאי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: מִסְתַּפֵּג אָדָם בַּאֲלוּנְטִית, וּמַנִּיחָהּ בַּחַלּוֹן. וְלֹא יִמְסְרֶנָּה לָאוֹלְיָירִין מִפְּנֵי שֶׁחֲשׁוּדִין עַל אוֹתוֹ דָּבָר. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אַף מְבִיאָהּ בְּיָדוֹ לְתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ.
human_translation: And they may dry themselves with a towel. What is As it was taught A person may dry himself with a towel and place it on a window, And he may not give to the bathhouse attendants [ olayerin ] because they are suspected with regard to that matter, Rabbi Shimon said: He may even bring in his hand to his house,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And one may smear with alum, what is it? As it was taught: One may smear with alum and place it by the window. And one should not hand it over to the non-Jews because they are suspected regarding that matter. Rabbi Shimon says: One may even bring it in his hand into his house.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לְמַלּאוֹת, אֲבָל לִשְׁפּוֹךְ — אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna: They taught only to drawing but to pour prohibited.
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: They only taught regarding filling, but regarding pouring out - it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב שֵׁיזְבִי: וְכִי מָה בֵּין זֶה לְעוּקָה?
human_translation: Rav Sheizvi raised an objection against this And what is between this and a pit [ uka ]
llm_translation: Rav Sheizbi objects to her: And what is the difference between this and a pit?

hebrew_text: הָנֵי תָּיְימִי, וְהָנֵי לָא תָּיְימִי.
human_translation: These are absorbed But these, will not be absorbed.
llm_translation: These are Taimi, and these are not Taimi.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: לָא תֵּימָא לְמַלּאוֹת הוּא דִּשְׁרֵי, לִשְׁפּוֹךְ אָסוּר, אֶלָּא לִשְׁפּוֹךְ נָמֵי שְׁרֵי. אָמַר רַב שֵׁיזְבִי: פְּשִׁיטָא — הַיְינוּ עוּקָה! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָנֵי תָּיְימִי וְהָנֵי לָא תָּיְימִי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Some say Rabba bar Rav Huna said: You should not say that it is drawing that is permitted, pouring is prohibited; rather, pouring is also permitted. Rav Sheizvi said: obvious, this is pit lest you say these, are absorbed whereas these, will not be absorbed. teaches us
llm_translation: There is one who says, Rabba bar Rav Huna said: Do not say that it is permitted to fill it up, but it is forbidden to pour out; rather, it is permitted to pour out what is already permitted. Rav Sheizbi said: It is obvious - that is the pit! Lest you say: These are suitable and these are not suitable, it is teaching us.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן שְׁתֵּי גְזוּזְטְרָאוֹת זוֹ וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּסְמוּכָה, אֲבָל בְּמוּפְלֶגֶת — עֶלְיוֹנָה מוּתֶּרֶת.
human_translation: And likewise, two balconies, one Rav Huna said Rav said: They taught only where is near But separated the upper are permitted
llm_translation: And so too, two Gazuztrot, this and so forth. Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: They only taught this in a case of adjacent properties, but in a case of separate properties - the upper one is permitted.

hebrew_text: וְרַב לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דַּאֲמַר רַב: אֵין אָדָם אוֹסֵר עַל חֲבֵירוֹ דֶּרֶךְ אֲוִיר.
human_translation: And Rav his argument as Rav said: One person does not impose restrictions upon another person by way of the air.
llm_translation: And Rav according to his reasoning, for Rav said: A person does not prevent his fellow in a manner of air.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא, וְרַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: יֵשׁ גָּזֵל בְּשַׁבָּת. וְחוּרְבָּה מַחֲזִיר לַבְּעָלִים.
human_translation: Rabba said Rabbi Ḥiyya said, and Rav Yosef said Rabbi Oshaya said: stealing applies to Shabbat and a ruin must be returned to its owner.
llm_translation: Rabba said, Rabbi Ḥiyya said, and Rav Yosef said Rabbi Oshaya: There is theft on Shabbat. And a sword returns to its owners.

hebrew_text: הָא גוּפָא קַשְׁיָא: אָמְרַתְּ ״יֵשׁ גָּזֵל בְּשַׁבָּת״ — אַלְמָא קָנְיָא, ״וְחוּרְבָּה מַחֲזִיר לִבְעָלִים״ — אַלְמָא לָא קָנְיָא!
human_translation: This itself is difficult, You said stealing applies to Shabbat From here is acquired a ruin must be returned to its owner, from here is not acquired
llm_translation: The matter is difficult: You said, "There is theft on Shabbat" - this implies acquisition. "And a sword returns to its owners" - this implies no acquisition!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: יֵשׁ דִּין גָּזֵל בְּשַׁבָּת, כֵּיצַד — דְּחוּרְבָּה מַחֲזִיר לַבְּעָלִים.
human_translation: this is are saying: The halakha of stolen applies to Shabbat How so? that a ruin must be returned to its owner.
llm_translation: So it is stated: There is a law of theft on Shabbat, how so - a sword returns to its owners.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה, וּמוֹתְבִינַן אַשְּׁמַעְתִּין: וְכֵן שְׁתֵּי גְזוּזְטְרָאוֹת זוֹ לְמַעְלָה מִזּוֹ וְכוּ׳. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ יֵשׁ דִּין גָּזֵל בְּשַׁבָּת, אַמַּאי אֲסוּרוֹת?
human_translation: Rabba said: And we raised an objection our teaching, And likewise, two balconies, one above the other, But if you say the halakha stealing applies on Shabbat, why prohibited
llm_translation: Rabba said, and we understand it: And similarly, two beams, this one above that one, etc. And if you say there is a law of robbery on Shabbat, why are they forbidden?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, כְּגוֹן שֶׁעָשׂוּ מְחִיצָה בְּשׁוּתָּפוּת.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: We are dealing here with where, for example, jointly erected a partition
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: Here, with what are we dealing? For example, when they made a partition in partnership.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, כִּי עָשׂוּ לַתַּחְתּוֹנָה נָמֵי!
human_translation: If so, where they erected for the lower likewise
llm_translation: If so, when they did for the lower ones, they also did for the upper ones!

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּעָשׂוּ לַתַּחְתּוֹנָה — גַּלּוֹיֵי גַּלִּי דַּעְתַּהּ דַּאֲנָא בַּהֲדָךְ לָא נִיחָא לִי.
human_translation: Since they erected for the lower they revealed their intention that: It is not my wish to be with you.
llm_translation: Since they did to the lower one - revealed revealed her mind that I in your presence not pleasing to me.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חָצֵר שֶׁהִיא פְּחוּתָה מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — אֵין שׁוֹפְכִין בְּתוֹכָהּ מַיִם בְּשַׁבָּת, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן עָשׂוּ לָהּ עוּקָה מַחְזֶקֶת סָאתַיִם מִן הַנֶּקֶב וּלְמַטָּה.
human_translation: a courtyard that is less than four cubits one may not pour water into it on Shabbat, unless a pit was fashioned holds two se’a from its edge below.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A courtyard that is less than four cubits - one may not pour water inside it on Shabbat, unless they made for it a pit that holds two se'ahs from the hole and downwards.

hebrew_text: בֵּין מִבַּחוּץ, בֵּין מִבִּפְנִים. אֶלָּא שֶׁמִּבַּחוּץ — צָרִיךְ לִקְמוֹר, מִבִּפְנִים — אֵין צָרִיךְ לִקְמוֹר.
human_translation: whether outside or inside only If outside it is necessary to arch over inside it is not necessary to arch over
llm_translation: From the outside, from the inside. Rather, from the outside - one must read, from the inside - one does not need to read.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: בִּיב שֶׁהוּא קָמוּר אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — שׁוֹפְכִים לְתוֹכוֹ מַיִם בַּשַּׁבָּת. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֲפִילּוּ גַּג אוֹ חָצֵר מֵאָה אַמָּה — לֹא יִשְׁפּוֹךְ עַל פִּי הַבִּיב, אֲבָל שׁוֹפֵךְ הוּא לַגַּג, וְהַמַּיִם יוֹרְדִין לַבִּיב.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: ditch whose four cubits are arched over in the public domain, one may pour water into it on Shabbat. And the Rabbis say: Even a roof or a courtyard a hundred cubits one may not pour onto the mouth of the ditch. However, he may pour upon the roof, the water spills into the drain
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: In a pit that is four cubits in the public domain - one may pour water into it on Shabbat. And the sages say: Even a roof or a courtyard of one hundred cubits - one may not pour onto the mouth of the pit, but rather one pours onto the roof, and the water descends into the pit.

hebrew_text: הֶחָצֵר וְהָאַכְסַדְרָה מִצְטָרְפִין לְאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת. וְכֵן שְׁתֵּי דְיוֹטָאוֹת זוֹ כְּנֶגֶד זוֹ, מִקְצָתָן עָשׂוּ עוּקָה וּמִקְצָתָן לֹא עָשׂוּ עוּקָה, אֶת שֶׁעָשׂוּ עוּקָה — מוּתָּרִין, אֶת שֶׁלֹּא עָשׂוּ עוּקָה — אֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: A courtyard and a portico, combine for the four cubits And likewise, two upper stories [ deyotaot ], one opposite the other one fashioned a pit and the other did not fashion a pit, those who fashioned a pit are permitted those who did not fashion a pit are prohibited
llm_translation: The courtyard and the colonnade combine to form four cubits. Similarly, two courtyards facing each other, some of them made an enclosure and some of them did not make an enclosure, those that made an enclosure - are permitted, those that did not make an enclosure - are forbidden.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַבָּה: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאָדָם עָשׂוּי לְהִסְתַּפֵּק סָאתַיִם מַיִם בְּכׇל יוֹם, בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — אָדָם רוֹצֶה לְזַלְּפָן,
human_translation: What is the reason Rabba said: Because a person ordinarily uses two se’a of water a day, of four cubits a person wants to sprinkle
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason? Rabah said: Because a person is accustomed to drink two se'ah of water every day, within four cubits — a person wants to relieve himself.

hebrew_text: פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע — שׁוֹפְכָן. אִי דַּעֲבִיד עוּקָה — שְׁרֵי, אִי לָא — אָסוּר.
human_translation: less than four cubits one pours if one fashioned a pit, it is permitted not, it is prohibited
llm_translation: Less than four - they are poured out. If he made a pit - it is permitted, if not - it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר: אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — תָּיְימִי, פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — לָא תָּיְימִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: four cubits absorbed less than four cubits will not be absorbed
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: Four cubits - valid, less than four cubits - not valid.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אֲרִיךְ וְקַטִּין אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: What is difference between Abaye said: There is between them long and narrow
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? Abaye said: There is a difference in length and shortness between them.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: חָצֵר וְאַכְסַדְרָה מִצְטָרְפִין לְאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי זֵירָא נִיחָא, אֶלָּא לְרַבָּה קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: We learned A courtyard and a portico combine for the four cubits, Granted, according to Rabbi Zeira, works out well, However, according to Rabba it is difficult,
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: A courtyard and a covered area combine to form an area of four cubits. According to Rabbi Zeira, this is understandable, but according to Rabba, it is difficult!

hebrew_text: תַּרְגְּמָא רַבִּי זֵירָא אַלִּיבָּא דְרַבָּה בְּאַכְסַדְרָה מְהַלֶּכֶת עַל פְּנֵי כָּל הֶחָצֵר כּוּלָּהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira explained in accordance with Rabba, to a portico that extends along the entire courtyard,
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira translated in the presence of Rabba in an orderly manner, walking around the entire courtyard.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: חָצֵר שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת עַל אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — אֵין שׁוֹפְכִין לְתוֹכָהּ מַיִם בַּשַּׁבָּת. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבָּה נִיחָא, אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי זֵירָא קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: Come hear a courtyard that is not four cubits by four cubits one may not pour water into it on Shabbat. Granted, according to Rabba, works out well, However, according to Rabbi Zeira, difficult.
llm_translation: Come and hear: A courtyard that does not have four cubits by four cubits - one may not pour water into it on Shabbat. It is understandable according to Rabba, but according to Rabbi Zeira it is difficult!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רַבִּי זֵירָא: הָא מַנִּי רַבָּנַן הִיא, וּמַתְנִיתִין רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב הִיא.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira say to you: whose this It the Rabbis whereas our mishna is Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov,
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to you: "This is a Rabbinic teaching, and the Mishnah is from Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov."

hebrew_text: וּמַאי דּוּחְקֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא לְאוֹקֹמַהּ לְמַתְנִיתִין כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב? אָמַר רָבָא: מַתְנִיתִין קְשִׁיתֵיהּ, מַאי אִירְיָא דְּתָנֵי ״חָצֵר שֶׁהִיא פְּחוּתָה״, לִיתְנֵי: ״חָצֵר שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת עַל אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת״!
human_translation: And what forced Rabbi Zeira to establish the mishna in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov? Rava said: The mishna was difficult for him. Why specifically teach a courtyard that is less Let teach: A courtyard that is not four cubits by four cubits,
llm_translation: And what was the difficulty that Rabbi Zeira had in establishing it in the Mishnah like Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov? Rava said: The Mishnah contradicts him, for what is the meaning of teaching "a courtyard that is less"? It should teach: "a courtyard that does not have four cubits by four cubits!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב הִיא. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, shouldn’t one conclude from this of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov? conclude from this
llm_translation: Rather, it is not a valid deduction, for it is in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov. A valid deduction.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מִדְּסֵיפָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב, רֵישָׁא לָאו רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב!
human_translation: But from a latter clause Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, the first clause not Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov.
llm_translation: And this, from the latter part: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov. The beginning is not Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov!

hebrew_text: כּוּלַּהּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב הִיא, וְחַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: חָצֵר שֶׁהִיא פְּחוּתָה מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — אֵין שׁוֹפְכִין לְתוֹכָהּ מַיִם בְּשַׁבָּת, הָא אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — שׁוֹפְכִין, שֶׁרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: בִּיב הַקָּמוּר אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — שׁוֹפְכִין לְתוֹכוֹ מַיִם בַּשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: the entire Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, and is incomplete and it teaches the following: a courtyard that is less than four cubits one may not pour water into it on Shabbat. Consequently, four cubits one may pour as Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: four cubits of a ditch were arched over in the public domain, one may pour water into it on Shabbat.
llm_translation: The entirety of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov it is, and lacking from the lacking, and thus it was taught: A courtyard that is less than four cubits - one may not pour water into it on Shabbat, but if it is four cubits - one may pour. For Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: A pit that is four cubits in the public domain - one may pour water into it on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: בִּיב הַקָּמוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: ditch were arched over
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: "Bib haKamur."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כַּחֲנַנְיָא. דְּתַנְיָא, חֲנַנְיָא אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ גַּג מֵאָה אַמָּה — לֹא יִשְׁפּוֹךְ, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין הַגָּג עָשׂוּי לִבְלוֹעַ, אֶלָּא לְקַלֵּחַ.
human_translation: The mishna not in accordance with Ḥananya. For it was taught Ḥananya says: Even a roof one hundred cubits one may not pour because a roof is not apt to absorb Rather, it to run off.
llm_translation: Mishnah that is not like Chananya. For it was taught: Chananya says: Even a roof of one hundred cubits - one should not pour, because the roof is not made for swallowing, but for plastering.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה, אֲבָל בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים — שׁוֹפֵךְ וְשׁוֹנֶה וְאֵינוֹ נִמְנָע. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רָבָא: אָדָם רוֹצֶה שֶׁיִּבָּלְעוּ מַיִם בִּמְקוֹמָן.
human_translation: taught: In what is this statement, said? In the summer, but in the rainy season, one may pour and repeat, and not hold back. What is the reason? Rava said: A person is willing for the water to be absorbed on the spot,
llm_translation: Mishnah: In what case are these matters said? — In the days of the sun, but in the days of rain — he pours and drinks and is not withheld. What is the reason? Rava said: A person prefers that the water be absorbed in its place.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וַהֲרֵי שׁוֹפְכִין, דְּאָדָם רוֹצֶה שֶׁיִּבָּלְעוּ, וְקָתָנֵי ״לֹא יִשְׁפּוֹךְ״!
human_translation: Abaye said to him: waste that a person wants it to be absorbed and teaches one may not pour
llm_translation: Abaye said to him: And behold, regarding menstrual blood, for a person prefers that they be swallowed, and it is taught: "Do not pour it out"!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם לְמַאי נֵיחוּשׁ לַהּ, אִי מִשּׁוּם קִלְקוּל חֲצֵירוֹ — הָא מִיקַּלְקְלָא וְקָיְימָא. וְאִי מִשּׁוּם גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאמְרוּ ״צִנּוֹרוֹ שֶׁל פְּלוֹנִי מְקַלֵּחַ מַיִם״ — סְתָם צִנּוֹרוֹת מְקַלְּחִים הֵם.
human_translation: said to him: There, with regard to what need we be concerned? If because spoiling his courtyard, already spoiled And if due to a decree lest say so-and-so’s gutter is flowing with water gutters ordinarily flow
llm_translation: He said to him: There, for what purpose is it placed there? If it is due to the neglect of his courtyard - behold, it is neglected and remains. And if it is due to a decree lest people say, "So-and-so's pipe is drawing water" - ordinary pipes draw water.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים, עוּקָה מַחֲזִיק סָאתַיִם — נוֹתְנִין לוֹ סָאתַיִם, מַחֲזִיק סְאָה — נוֹתְנִין לוֹ סְאָה. בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה, מַחֲזִיק סָאתַיִם — נוֹתְנִין לוֹ סָאתַיִם, סְאָה — אֵין נוֹתְנִין לוֹ כָּל עִיקָּר.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: In the rainy season, a pit that holds two se’a , we grant him two se’a holds one se’a , we grant him one se’a . in the summer, two se’a , we grant him two se’a ; one se’a , we do not grant him at all.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: In the days of rain, if one holds two kav - we give him two kav, if one holds a se'ah - we give him a se'ah. In the days of the sun, if one holds two kav - we give him two kav, if one holds a se'ah - we do not give him anything at all.

hebrew_text: בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה נָמֵי, מַחֲזִיק סְאָה נִיתֵּיב לֵיהּ סְאָה! גְּזֵרָה דִּלְמָא אָתֵי לִיתֵּן לֵיהּ סָאתַיִם. אִי הָכִי בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים נָמֵי לִיגְזוֹר!
human_translation: In the hot season as well, holds one se’a , let us grant him one se’a , a decree lest he come to put two se’a into it. If so, in the rainy season let us also apply the preventive measure.
llm_translation: In the days of the sun's heat, he holds a se'ah, he should add to it a se'ah! It is a decree lest he come to give him two se'ahs. If so, in the days of rain, let him decree!

hebrew_text: הָתָם מַאי נֵיחוּשׁ לַהּ? אִי מִשּׁוּם קִילְקוּל — הָא מִיקַּלְקְלָא וְקָיְימָא. אִי מִשּׁוּם גְּזֵירָה ״שֶׁמָּא יֹאמְרוּ צִנּוֹרוֹ שֶׁל פְּלוֹנִי מְקַלֵּחַ מַיִם״ — סְתָם צִנּוֹרוֹת מְקַלְּחִין הֵן.
human_translation: There, about what need we be concerned? If because spoiling it is already spoiled If a decree lest say so-and-so’s gutter is flowing with water gutters ordinarily gush
llm_translation: There, what is the concern for her? If due to negligence - this is negligence and it remains. If due to a decree "lest people say that so-and-so's pipe is drawing water" - ordinary pipes draw water.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הִילְכָּךְ, אֲפִילּוּ כּוֹר וַאֲפִילּוּ כּוֹרַיִים.
human_translation: Abaye said: Therefore, even a kor and even two kor
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Therefore, even a kor and even korayim.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן שְׁתֵּי דְיוֹטָאוֹת זוֹ כְּנֶגֶד זוֹ. אָמַר רָבָא: אֲפִילּוּ עֵירְבוּ.
human_translation: And likewise, two upper stories, one opposite the other Rava said: even if established an eiruv
llm_translation: And so too, two inkwells, this opposite that. Rava said: Even if they mixed.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר (לֵיהּ) אַבָּיֵי: מַאי טַעְמָא? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם נְפִישָׁא דְמַיָּא, וְהָתַנְיָא: אַחַת לִי עוּקָה, וְאַחַת לִי גִּיסְטְרָא בְּרֵיכָה וַעֲרֵיבָה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנִּתְמַלְּאוּ מַיִם מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — שׁוֹפְכִין לְתוֹכָן מַיִם בַּשַּׁבָּת!
human_translation: Abaye said to him: What is the reason If you say due to the increase of water, wasn’t it taught The same a pit, and the same a cracked vessel pond, or a basin: Even though they were filled with water on Shabbat eve, one may pour water into them on Shabbat.
llm_translation: He (Abbaye) said to him: What is the reason? If you say it is because of the abundance of water, but it was taught: "One for me is a pit, and one for me is a cistern in a courtyard or a well, even though they were filled with water from Friday evening - one may pour water into them on Shabbat!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אִי אִיתְּמַר, הָכִי אִיתְּמַר: אָמַר רָבָא
human_translation: Rather, if it was stated it was stated as follows. Rava said:
llm_translation: Rather, if it is stated, it is stated thus: Rava said.

hebrew_text: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא עֵירְבוּ, אֲבָל עֵירְבוּ — מוּתָּרִין.
human_translation: They taught only where did not establish an eiruv but if they established a eiruv , they are permitted
llm_translation: They did not teach except that if they did not mix, but if they mixed - they are permitted.

hebrew_text: וְכִי לֹא עֵירְבוּ, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: גְּזֵירָה דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִמָּאנֵי דְבָתִּים לְהָתָם.
human_translation: And where they did not establish an eiruv , what is the reason not Rav Ashi said: a decree, lest come to take out vessels from houses into
llm_translation: And if they did not perform Eiruv, what is the reason why not? Rav Ashi said: It is a decree lest one come to carry from private domains to there.

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ כֵּיצַד מִשְׁתַּתְּפִין
