llm_translation: We shall return to you: How do they participate?

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כָּל גַּגּוֹת הָעִיר רְשׁוּת אַחַת, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא גַּג גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה אוֹ נָמוּךְ עֲשָׂרָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כָּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד רְשׁוּת בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: All the roofs of the city one domain. provided that roof is neither ten higher nor ten lower the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: Each and every one a domain in and of itself.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: All the rooftops of the city are considered one domain, provided that the roof is not elevated ten handbreadths or lowered ten handbreadths, according to the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: Each and every one is considered a separate domain unto itself.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד גַּגּוֹת וְאֶחָד חֲצֵירוֹת וְאֶחָד קַרְפֵּיפוֹת — רְשׁוּת אַחַת הֵן לְכֵלִים שֶׁשָּׁבְתוּ לְתוֹכָן, וְלֹא לְכֵלִים שֶׁשָּׁבְתוּ בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Roofs, courtyards, and enclosures are all one domain with regard to vessels that were inside them Shabbat not with regard to vessels that were inside the house Shabbat
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: One regarding rooftops, and one regarding courtyards, and one regarding enclosures - they are one domain for vessels that have rested within them, but not for vessels that have rested within the house.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ יָתֵיב אַבָּיֵי בַּר אָבִין וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר אָבִין, וְיָתֵיב אַבָּיֵי גַּבַּיְיהוּ, וְיָתְבִי וְקָאָמְרִי: בִּשְׁלָמָא רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי כְּשֵׁם שֶׁדִּיּוּרִין חֲלוּקִין לְמַטָּה, כָּךְ דִּיּוּרִין חֲלוּקִין לְמַעְלָה.
human_translation: Abaye bar Avin and Rabbi Ḥanina bar Avin were sitting, and Abaye was sitting beside them, and they sat and said: Granted, the Rabbis maintain: Just as residents are divided below, so are residents divided above,
llm_translation: Gemara: Abaye son of Avin and Rabbi Chanina son of Avin were sitting, and Abaye was sitting between them. They were sitting and saying: The Rabbis hold that just as the dwellings are divided below, so too the dwellings are divided above.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַבִּי מֵאִיר מַאי קָסָבַר? אִי קָסָבַר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁדִּיּוּרִין חֲלוּקִין לְמַטָּה, כָּךְ דִּיּוּרִין חֲלוּקִין לְמַעְלָה, אַמַּאי רְשׁוּת אַחַת הֵן? וְאִי קָסָבַר אֵין חֲלוּקִין, דְּכׇל לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה רְשׁוּת אַחַת הִיא — אֲפִילּוּ גַּג גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה וְנָמוּךְ עֲשָׂרָה, נָמֵי!
human_translation: However, Rabbi Meir, what does he maintain; If he maintains just as residents are divided below, so are residents divided above, why, are they one domain? And if he maintains they are not divided as any above ten is one domain, even roof ten higher or ten lower likewise
llm_translation: Rather, what does Rabbi Meir hold? If he holds: Just as dwellings are divided downwards, so too dwellings are divided upwards, why are they considered one domain? And if he holds they are not divided, for anything above ten is considered one domain - even a high roof of ten and a low one of ten, it is still considered one domain!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ אַבָּיֵי: לָא שְׁמִיעַ לְכוּ הָא דְּאָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר אַבְדִּימִי, אוֹמֵר הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר: כָּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאַתָּה מוֹצֵא שְׁתֵּי רְשׁוּיוֹת וְהֵן רְשׁוּת אַחַת, כְּגוֹן עַמּוּד בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה וְרָחָב אַרְבָּעָה — אָסוּר לְכַתֵּף עָלָיו, גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם תֵּל בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים. הָכִי נָמֵי, גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם תֵּל בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים.
human_translation: Abaye said to them: you not heard that which Rav Yitzḥak bar Avdimi said Rabbi Meir would say: Any place that you find two domains, and they are one domain, for example, a pillar ten high and four wide in a private domain, prohibited to adjust shoulders upon it, decree, due to a mound in the public domain. Here too, decree, due to a mound in a public domain.
llm_translation: He said to them, Abaye: Do not listen to what Rav Yitzchak bar Avdimi said, that Rabbi Meir said: Any place where you find two domains and they are one domain, such as a pillar in the private domain, ten high and four wide - it is forbidden to lean on it, a decree due to carrying in the public domain. So too, it is a decree due to carrying in the public domain.

hebrew_text: סְבוּר מִינָּה אֲפִילּוּ מַכְתֶּשֶׁת וַאֲפִילּוּ גִּיגִית.
human_translation: understood from this even a mortar and even a vat
llm_translation: He thinks, perhaps even a millstone and even a nut.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ אַבָּיֵי, הָכִי אָמַר מָר: לֹא אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר אֶלָּא עַמּוּד וְאַמַּת הָרֵיחַיִם, הוֹאִיל וְאָדָם קוֹבֵעַ לָהֶן מָקוֹם.
human_translation: Abaye said to them: The Master, said as follows: Rabbi Meir spoke only a pillar or the base of a millstone. Since a person fixes a place for them
llm_translation: He said to them Abaye, thus said the Master: Rabbi Meir only said regarding the pillar and the cubit of the fragrant herbs, since a person designates a place for them.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי כּוֹתֶל שֶׁבֵּין שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת, דְּקָבוּעַ, וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: כְּשֶׁתִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר, לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר: גַּגִּין רְשׁוּת לְעַצְמָן, חֲצֵירוֹת רְשׁוּת לְעַצְמָן, קַרְפֵּיפוֹת רְשׁוּת לְעַצְמָן.
human_translation: a wall that is between two courtyards, which fixed, and Rav Yehuda said: When you will find according to Rabbi Meir roofs domain in and of themselves, courtyards domain in and of themselves, enclosures domain in and of themselves.
llm_translation: Behold, a wall between two courtyards, fixed, and Rav Yehudah said: When you come to say, according to the words of Rabbi Meir: Roofs are a separate domain, courtyards are a separate domain, and enclosed areas are a separate domain.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, דִּשְׁרֵי לְטַלְטוֹלֵי דֶּרֶךְ כּוֹתֶל!
human_translation: What, is it not that it is permitted to move via a wall,
llm_translation: What is the reason that it is permitted to hang objects on the side of a wall?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: לָא, לְהַכְנִיס וּלְהוֹצִיא דֶּרֶךְ פְּתָחִים.
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Yehuda said Rav Sheshet said: No, to carry in and carry out via openings
llm_translation: Rav Huna, son of Yehuda, said in the name of Rav Sheshet: No, to bring in and to take out through doorways.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים כָּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד רְשׁוּת בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ. אִיתְּמַר, רַב אָמַר: אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין בּוֹ אֶלָּא בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: מוּתָּר לְטַלְטֵל בְּכוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say each and every one is a domain in and of itself. It was stated Rav said: one may move only within four cubits. And Shmuel said: It is permitted to move entire
llm_translation: The sages say: "Each and every one has his own domain." It was stated: Rav said: "One may only carry it (an object) within four cubits," and Shmuel said: "It is permitted to carry it in its entirety."

hebrew_text: בִּמְחִיצוֹת הַנִּיכָּרוֹת — דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי. כִּי פְּלִיגִי — בִּמְחִיצוֹת שֶׁאֵינָן נִיכָּרוֹת.
human_translation: With regard to partitions that are conspicuous, everyone agrees Where they disagree with regard to partitions that are not conspicuous,
llm_translation: In the partitions that are recognizable - everyone agrees. When they disagree - in partitions that are not recognizable.

hebrew_text: רַב אָמַר: אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין בּוֹ אֶלָּא בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — לָא אָמַר: ״גּוּד אַסֵּיק מְחִיצְתָּא״. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: מוּתָּר לְטַלְטֵל בְּכוּלּוֹ — דְּאָמַר: ״גּוּד אַסֵּיק מְחִיצְתָּא״.
human_translation: Rav said: One may carry only within four cubits. does not state Extend and raise the partitions And Shmuel said: permitted to carry throughout entire as he states Extend and raise the partitions.
llm_translation: Rav said: One may only carry it within four cubits - did he not say: "Gud Asik Mechitzata"? And Shmuel said: It is permitted to carry it in its entirety - for he said: "Gud Asik Mechitzata."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כָּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד
human_translation: we learned the Rabbis say each and every one
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah, and the Sages say: "Each and every one."

hebrew_text: רְשׁוּת לְעַצְמוֹ. בִּשְׁלָמָא לִשְׁמוּאֵל נִיחָא, אֶלָּא לְרַב קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: a domain in and of itself. Granted according to Shmuel, well, but according to Rav, difficult.
llm_translation: Permission for himself. Granted to Shmuel is fitting, but to Rav Kashya.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי בֵּי רַב מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: שֶׁלֹּא יְטַלְטֵל שְׁתֵּי אַמּוֹת בְּגַג זֶה, וּשְׁתֵּי אַמּוֹת בְּגַג זֶה.
human_translation: school of Rav said in the name of Rav: that one may not move two cubits on this roof and two cubits on that roof.
llm_translation: The House of Rav said in the name of Rav: One should not carry two cubits on this roof, and two cubits on that roof.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כִּי הֲוֵינַן בְּבָבֶל הֲוָה אָמְרִינַן: בֵּי רַב מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב אָמְרוּ: אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין בּוֹ אֶלָּא בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, וְהָנֵי דְּבֵי שְׁמוּאֵל תָּנוּ: אֵין לָהֶן אֶלָּא גַּגָּן.
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Elazar say: When we were in Babylonia we say the school of Rav said in the name of Rav: One may move on only within four cubits, and those the school of Shmuel taught They have only their roof.
llm_translation: And this, Rabbi Elazar said: When we were in Babylon, we would say: In the school of Rav, they said: One may only carry within four cubits, and the school of Shmuel taught: They only have a roof.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״אֵין לָהֶן אֶלָּא גַּגָּן״, לָאו דִּשְׁרוּ לְטַלְטוֹלֵי בְּכוּלֵּיהּ? וּמִי אַלִּימָא מִמַּתְנִיתִין, דְּאוֹקֵימְנָא שֶׁלֹּא יְטַלְטֵל שְׁתֵּי אַמּוֹת בְּגַג זֶה וּשְׁתֵּי אַמּוֹת בְּגַג זֶה?! הָכִי נָמֵי, שְׁתֵּי אַמּוֹת בְּגַג זֶה וּשְׁתֵּי אַמּוֹת בְּגַג זֶה.
human_translation: What is They have only their roof? not that they are permitted to move throughout entire And is stronger than our mishna, which we established that one may not move two cubits on this roof and two cubits on that roof? So too, two cubits on this roof and two cubits on that roof.
llm_translation: What is meant by "they only have a roof," is it not that they are permitted to carry throughout it? And should we say according to the Mishnah, which we establish that one should not carry two cubits on this roof and two cubits on that roof?! So too, two cubits on this roof and two cubits on that roof.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לָא שְׁמִיעַ לִי הָא שְׁמַעְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אַתְּ אֲמַרְתְּ נִיהֲלַן, וְאַהָא אֲמַרְתְּ נִיהֲלַן: גַּג גָּדוֹל הַסָּמוּךְ לְקָטָן — הַגָּדוֹל מוּתָּר, וְהַקָּטָן אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said, I have not heard this halakha Abaye said to him: You said it to us, and it was about this you said it to us: a large roof that is adjacent to a small one, the large is permitted, and the small one is prohibited,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: "I did not hear this teaching." Abaye said to him: "Did you say they are connected, and now you say they are connected: a large roof adjacent to a small one - the large one is permitted, and the small one is forbidden."

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַרְתְּ לַן עֲלַהּ: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁיֵּשׁ דִּיּוּרִין עַל זֶה וְדִיּוּרִין עַל זֶה, דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ הָא דְּקָטָן מְחִיצָה נִדְרֶסֶת.
human_translation: And you said to us about it: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: They only taught where there are residents on this and residents on that as of the small a trampled partition.
llm_translation: And you said to us: Go up. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: They only taught that there should be partitions on this side and partitions on that side, for it would be like this - the small one's partition would be pushed aside.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אֵין דִּיּוּרִין עַל זֶה וְעַל זֶה — שְׁנֵיהֶן מוּתָּרִין.
human_translation: However, there are no residents on this and on that both permitted.
llm_translation: But dwelling on this and on this - both are permitted.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא הָכִי אֲמַרִי לְכוּ: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁיֵּשׁ מְחִיצָה עַל זֶה וּמְחִיצָה עַל זֶה, דְּגָדוֹל מִישְׁתְּרֵי בְּגִיפּוּפֵי, וְקָטָן נִפְרָץ בִּמְלוֹאוֹ. אֲבָל אֵין מְחִיצָה לֹא עַל זֶה וְלֹא עַל זֶה — שְׁנֵיהֶן אֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: said to him: I said to you as follows: They taught only where there was an partition on this and an partition on that that the large is permitted by the remnants and small is fully breached However, if there is no partition, neither on this nor on that both of them is prohibited.
llm_translation: He said to him: I thus say to you: They only taught that there must be a partition on this side and a partition on that side, for if one is larger, it is permitted to combine them, but if one is smaller, it is considered breached when it is filled. However, if there is no partition on either side — both are prohibited.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דִּיּוּרִין אֲמַרְתְּ לַן! אִי אֲמַרִי לְכוּ דִּיּוּרִין, הָכִי אֲמַרִי לְכוּ: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁיֵּשׁ מְחִיצָה רְאוּיָה לְדִירָה עַל זֶה וּמְחִיצָה רְאוּיָה לְדִירָה עַל זֶה, דְּגָדוֹל מִישְׁתְּרֵי בְּגִיפּוּפֵי וְקָטָן נִפְרָץ בִּמְלוֹאוֹ.
human_translation: But didn’t you speak to us residents? If I spoke to you residents, this I said to you: They taught only where there is an partition fit for residence on this and an partition for residence on that the large is permitted by the remnants and small is fully breached
llm_translation: The one who dwells said to us! If they say to you who dwell, thus they say to you: They only taught that there must be a suitable partition for a dwelling on this side and a suitable partition for a dwelling on that side, for a large opening is permitted with a small partition and a small opening is breached with its fullness.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל יֵשׁ מְחִיצָה רְאוּיָה לְדִירָה עַל הַגָּדוֹל, וְאֵין רְאוּיָה לְדִירָה עַל הַקָּטָן — אֲפִילּוּ קָטָן שְׁרֵי לִבְנֵי גָדוֹל. מַאי טַעְמָא? כֵּיוָן דְּלָא עֲבוּד מְחִיצָה, סַלּוֹקֵי סַלִּיקוּ נַפְשַׁיְיהוּ מֵהָכָא.
human_translation: However, there is a partition for a residence on the large but no a residence on the small even the small is permitted for the residents of the large What is the reason Since did not erect a partition they removed themselves from here
llm_translation: But there is a partition suitable for a large dwelling, and not suitable for a small dwelling - even a small one is permitted for the sons of the large. What is the reason? Since it is not serving as a partition, they remove themselves from here.

hebrew_text: כְּהָא דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: עָשָׂה סוּלָּם קָבוּעַ לְגַגּוֹ — הוּתַּר בְּכׇל הַגַּגִּין כּוּלָּן.
human_translation: in accordance with that which Rav Naḥman said: affixed a permanent ladder to his roof, is permitted for him to all the roofs.
llm_translation: Like this that Rav Nachman said: "If one made a fixed ladder for his roof - it is permitted for all the roofs."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בָּנָה עֲלִיָּיה עַל גַּבֵּי בֵּיתוֹ וְעָשָׂה לְפָנֶיהָ דַּקָּה אַרְבַּע — הוּתַּר בְּכׇל הַגַּגִּין כּוּלָּן.
human_translation: Abaye said: built an upper story atop his house, and erected before its a small partition [ dakka ] four it is permitted to all the roofs.
llm_translation: Abaye said: If one builds a balcony on top of his house and constructs a thin wall in front of it, four cubits - he is permitted in all the roofs, all of them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: פְּעָמִים שֶׁהַדַּקָּה לְאִיסּוּר, הֵיכִי דָּמֵי — דַּעֲבִידָא לַהֲדֵי תַּרְבִּיצָא דְבֵיתֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר
human_translation: Rava said: Sometimes the small partition to prohibition. What are the circumstances where was erected toward the garden of his house that he said
llm_translation: Rava said: Sometimes when the grinding is for prohibition, what is the case - that she does it for the purpose of the household needs, as it says:

hebrew_text: לְנַטּוֹרֵי תַּרְבִּיצָא הוּא דַּעֲבִידָא.
human_translation: that he built to protect the garden [ tarbitza ],
llm_translation: To the guardians of the treasury it is the matter that he does.

hebrew_text: בְּעַי רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: שְׁתֵּי אַמּוֹת בְּגַג וּשְׁתֵּי אַמּוֹת בְּעַמּוּד מַהוּ? אָמַר רַבָּה: מַאי קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ, כַּרְמְלִית וּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raised a dilemma: two cubits on a roof and two cubits on a pillar what is Rabba said: what is he raising a dilemma? a karmelit and a private domain he is raising a dilemma?
llm_translation: Inquires Ramei bar Ḥama: "Two cubits on the roof and two cubits on the pillar, what is the law?" Rabbah said: "What is he inquiring about? He is inquiring about a Carmelit and a private domain."

hebrew_text: וְרָמֵי בַּר חָמָא אַגַּב חוּרְפֵּיהּ לָא עַיֵּין בַּהּ, אֶלָּא הָכִי קָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ: שְׁתֵּי אַמּוֹת בְּגַג וּשְׁתֵּי אַמּוֹת בְּאַכְסַדְרָה, מַהוּ?
human_translation: and Rami bar Ḥama, due to his keen did not analyze Rather, this is dilemma he is raising: two cubits on the roof and two cubits on a portico, what is
llm_translation: Ramei bar Ḥama, because of his shame, did not look at her, but he said to her: "Two cubits on the roof and two cubits on the balcony, what is the ruling?"

hebrew_text: מִי אָמְרִינַן: כֵּיוָן דְּלָא הַאי חֲזֵי לְדִירָה וְלָא הַאי חֲזֵי לְדִירָה — חֲדָא רְשׁוּתָא הִיא. אוֹ דִילְמָא: כֵּיוָן דְּמִגַּג לְגַג אֲסִיר, מִגַּג לְאַכְסַדְרָה נָמֵי אֲסִיר.
human_translation: Do we say since neither this is fit for residence, nor is this fit for residence, it is one domain, Or perhaps since from a roof to roof is prohibited, from a roof to a portico is likewise prohibited,
llm_translation: We say: Since this one does not see to the dwelling and this one does not see to the dwelling - it is one domain. Or perhaps: Since from roof to roof is prohibited, from roof to balcony is also prohibited.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי: שְׁתֵּי אַמּוֹת בְּגַג וּשְׁתֵּי אַמּוֹת בְּחוּרְבָּה, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rav Beivai bar Abaye raised a dilemma: two cubits on the roof and two cubits of a ruin what is
llm_translation: Ba'ei Rav Bibi bar Abbayei: "Two cubits on the roof and two cubits in the courtyard, what is the ruling?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: לָאו הַיְינוּ דְּרָמֵי בַּר חָמָא?! אָמַר רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי: וְכִי מֵאַחֵר אֲתַאי וּנְצַאי? אַכְסַדְרָה לָא חַזְיָא לְדִירָה, וְחוּרְבָּה חַזְיָא לְדִירָה.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said: Is that not by Rami bar Ḥama Rav Beivai bar Abaye said: And did I come late me’aḥer to quarrel, A portico is not fit for residence, while a ruin is fit for residence.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: Is this not the same as what Ramei bar Ḥama said?! Rav Bivi bar Abbaye said: And since when did he come and go out? He does not see a wall for a dwelling, but he sees a ruin for a dwelling.

hebrew_text: וְכִי מֵאַחַר דְּחַזְיָא לְדִירָה מַאי קָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ! ״אִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר״ קָאָמַר: אִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר אַכְסַדְרָה לָא חַזְיָא לְדִירָה — חוּרְבָּה חַזְיָא לְדִירָה? אוֹ דִילְמָא: הַשְׁתָּא מִיהָא לֵית בַּהּ דָּיוֹרִין. תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: And now that it is fit for residence, what dilemma is he raising? he states If you say. If you say a portico is not fit for residence, a ruin is fit for residence, Or perhaps now in any event there are no residents in stand
llm_translation: And when he saw a dira, what is he asking for? "If you say" he is saying: If you say a proper dwelling, he does not see a dira - a ruin he sees as a dira? Or perhaps: now there are no residents in it. Let it stand.

hebrew_text: גַּגִּין הַשָּׁוִין לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, וְגַג יְחִידִי לְרַבָּנַן, רַב אָמַר: מוּתָּר לְטַלְטֵל בְּכוּלּוֹ, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין בּוֹ אֶלָּא בְּאַרְבַּע.
human_translation: roofs that are level, according to Rabbi Meir, or an isolated roof according to the Rabbis, Rav said: It is permitted to move throughout the entire and Shmuel said: One may move in it only within four
llm_translation: Rooftops that are equal to Rabbi Meir, and a private rooftop to the Rabbis, Rav said: It is permitted to carry throughout it, and Shmuel said: One may only carry within it up to four cubits.

hebrew_text: רַב אָמַר: מוּתָּר לְטַלְטֵל בְּכוּלּוֹ, קַשְׁיָא דְּרַב אַדְּרַב! הָתָם לָא מִינַּכְרָא מְחִיצְתָּא. הָכָא מִינַּכְרָא מְחִיצְתָּא.
human_translation: Rav said it is permitted to move throughout the entire difficult, of Rav and of Rav. There, the partitions are not conspicuous, Here, the partitions are conspicuous,
llm_translation: Rav said: It is permitted to carry it all, the question of Rav Adda bar Rav! There, the partition is not recognizable. Here, the partition is recognizable.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין בּוֹ אֶלָּא בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, קַשְׁיָא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל אַדִּשְׁמוּאֵל! הָתָם, לָא הָוֵי יוֹתֵר מִבֵּית סָאתַיִם. הָכָא, הָוֵי יוֹתֵר מִבֵּית סָאתַיִם, וְהָנֵי מְחִיצוֹת לְמַטָּה עֲבִידָן, לְמַעְלָה לָא עֲבִידָן, וְהָוֵה כְּקַרְפֵּף יָתֵר מִבֵּית סָאתַיִם שֶׁלֹּא הוּקַּף לְדִירָה, וְכׇל קַרְפֵּף יוֹתֵר מִבֵּית סָאתַיִם שֶׁלֹּא הוּקַּף לְדִירָה — אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין בּוֹ אֶלָּא בְּאַרְבַּע.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: One may carry only within four difficult, of Shmuel and of Shmuel, There, is no greater than two beit se’a ; here, is greater than two beit se’a . And these partitions were erected below they were not erected to above. like an enclosure greater than two beit se’a that was not enclosed residence; and any enclosure greater than two beit se’a that was not enclosed for residence, one may move in it only within four cubits.
llm_translation: Samuel said: One may only carry within it (the area) up to four cubits. The difficulty of Samuel to Samuel! There (in the Mishnah), it is not more than two sa'ahs. Here, it is more than two sa'ahs, and these partitions are made below, not above, and it is like a threshold more than two sa'ahs that was not made for a dwelling, and any threshold more than two sa'ahs that was not made for a dwelling - one may only carry within it up to four cubits.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, סְפִינָה. רַב אָמַר: מוּתָּר לְטַלְטֵל בְּכוּלָּהּ, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין בָּהּ אֶלָּא בְּאַרְבַּע. רַב אָמַר: מוּתָּר לְטַלְטֵל בְּכוּלָּהּ —
human_translation: It was stated a ship. Rav said: It is permitted to move throughout and Shmuel said: One may move in it only within four Rav said: It is permitted to move throughout
llm_translation: It was stated: a ship. Rav said: it is permitted to move it entirely, and Shmuel said: one may only move it in four. Rav said: it is permitted to move it entirely—

hebrew_text: דְּהָא אִיכָּא מְחִיצָתָא. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין בָּהּ אֶלָּא בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — מְחִיצוֹת לְהַבְרִיחַ מַיִם עֲשׂוּיוֹת.
human_translation: as there are partitions. And Shmuel said: One may move in it only within four cubits, the partitions are erected to keep water out,
llm_translation: There is a partition. And Samuel said: One may only move it within four cubits - partitions made to let water flow.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף לִשְׁמוּאֵל: הִילְכְתָא כְּווֹתָךְ אוֹ הִילְכְתָא כְּרַב? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הִילְכְתָא כְּרַב.
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Yosef said to Shmuel: the halakha in accordance with your or the halakha in accordance with Rav? said to him: The halakha is in accordance with Rav,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ḥiyya bar Yosef said to Shmuel: Did you go in accordance with your own opinion, or did you go in accordance with Rav's opinion? He said to him: I went in accordance with Rav's opinion.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף: וּמוֹדֶה רַב שֶׁאִם כְּפָאָהּ עַל פִּיהָ, שֶׁאֵין מְטַלְטְלִין בָּהּ אֶלָּא בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת. כְּפָאָהּ, לְמַאי? אִילֵימָא לָדוּר תַּחְתֶּיהָ, מַאי שְׁנָא מִגַּג יְחִידִי?
human_translation: Rav Giddel said Rav Ḥiyya bar Yosef said: And Rav concedes that if one overturned onto its mouth, that one may move on it only within four cubits. For what was overturned? If you say that reside beneath it, what is the difference an isolated roof?
llm_translation: Rav Giddel said, Rav Hiyya bar Yosef said: And Rav concedes that if she places it on her mouth, one may only carry it within four cubits. On her mouth, for what? If you say to live beneath it, what is the difference from a private roof?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא שֶׁכְּפָאָהּ לְזוֹפְתָהּ.
human_translation: Rather, that he overturned it to tar it,
llm_translation: Rather, that her forehead is for her adornment.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי מַתְנֵי לַהּ אַסְּפִינָה, וְרַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא מַתְנֵי לַהּ אַאַכְסַדְרָא. דְּאִיתְּמַר, אַכְסַדְרָה בְּבִקְעָה. רַב אָמַר: מוּתָּר לְטַלְטֵל בְּכוּלָּהּ, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין בָּהּ אֶלָּא בְּאַרְבַּע.
human_translation: Rav Ashi teaches to a ship, and Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, teaches it to a portico, as it was stated a portico in a field. Rav said: It is permitted to move throughout the entire And Shmuel said: One may move in it only within four
llm_translation: Rav Ashi teaches her to gather, and Rav Acha, son of Rava, teaches her to arrange. It was said: arrange in a valley. Rav said: it is permitted to move it entirely, and Shmuel said: one may only move it in four.

hebrew_text: רַב אָמַר: מוּתָּר לְטַלְטֵל בְּכוּלָּהּ — אָמְרִינַן פִּי תִקְרָה יוֹרֵד וְסוֹתֵם. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין בָּהּ אֶלָּא בְּאַרְבַּע — לָא אָמְרִינַן פִּי תִקְרָה יוֹרֵד וְסוֹתֵם.
human_translation: Rav said: It is permitted to move throughout the entire we say: The edge of the roof descends and seals And Shmuel said: One may move in it only within four we do not say: The edge of the roof descends and seals
llm_translation: Rav said: It is permitted to move it entirely - we say, "the mouth of the ceiling descends and closes." And Shmuel said: One may only move it in four - we do not say, "the mouth of the ceiling descends and closes."

hebrew_text: וְרַב אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, לִיטַּלְטְלֵי מִגַּג לְחָצֵר?! גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם דְּרַב יִצְחָק בַּר אַבְדִּימִי.
human_translation: But Rav’s in accordance with of Rabbi Meir to carry from a roof to a courtyard. a decree, due to of Rav Yitzḥak bar Avdimi.
llm_translation: And Rav Aliba, the student of Rabbi Meir, to carry from the roof to the courtyard?! A decree because of Rav Yitzchak bar Avdimi.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אַלִּיבָּא דְרַבָּנַן, נִיטַּלְטֵל מִגַּג לְקַרְפֵּף. אָמַר רָבָא בַּר עוּלָּא: גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יִפָּחֵת הַגָּג.
human_translation: And Shmuel’s in accordance with of the Rabbis to move from roof to an enclosure Rava bar Ulla said: a decree lest the roof diminish
llm_translation: Samuel the son of Rabbanan, he removed from the roof to the courtyard. Rava bar Ulla said: A decree lest the roof collapse.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מִקַּרְפֵּף לְקַרְפֵּף נָמֵי לָא יְטַלְטֵל, דִּילְמָא מִיפְּחִית וְאָתֵי לְטַלְטוֹלֵי? הָתָם, אִי מִיפְּחִית מִינַּכְרָא לֵיהּ מִילְּתָא. הָכָא, אִי מִיפְּחִית לָא מִינַּכְרָא מִילְּתָא.
human_translation: If so, one should also not move from one enclosure to enclosure, perhaps diminish and he come move There, if is diminished, the matter is conspicuous, Here, if is diminished, the matter is not conspicuous,
llm_translation: If so, from beam to beam, the animal should not move, perhaps it will shake and come to move? There, if it shakes, it will recognize the matter. Here, if it shakes, it will not recognize the matter.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: כְּשֶׁתִּמְצָא לוֹמַר, לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר גַּגִּין רְשׁוּת לְעַצְמָן, חֲצֵירוֹת רְשׁוּת לְעַצְמָן,
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: you will find say according to the statement of Rabbi Meir, roofs are a domain in and of themselves, courtyards are a domain in and of themselves,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: When you find to say, according to the words of Rabbi Meir, roofs are a private domain for themselves, courtyards are a private domain for themselves.

hebrew_text: קַרְפֵּיפוֹת רְשׁוּת לְעַצְמָן. לְדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים: גַּגִּין וַחֲצֵירוֹת רְשׁוּת אַחַת, קַרְפֵּיפוֹת רְשׁוּת אַחַת הֵן. לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: כּוּלָּן רְשׁוּת אַחַת הֵן.
human_translation: enclosures are a domain in and of themselves, According to the statement of the Rabbis, roofs and courtyards one domain, enclosures are one domain. According to the statement of Rabbi Shimon, all of them, are one domain,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Karpeifot reshut le'atzman. Le'divrei chachamim: Gagin vachatzeirot reshut achad, karpeifot reshut achad hen. Le'divrei Rabbi Shimon: Kulam reshut achad hen. English translation: Karpeifot are a separate domain. According to the Sages: rooftops and courtyards are considered one domain, karpeifot are considered one domain. According to Rabbi Shimon: all of them are considered one domain.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב, תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה. תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב: כׇּל גַּגּוֹת הָעִיר רְשׁוּת אַחַת הֵן, וְאָסוּר לְהַעֲלוֹת וּלְהוֹרִיד מִן הַגַּגִּין לֶחָצֵר וּמִן הֶחָצֵר לְגַגִּין. וְכֵלִים שֶׁשָּׁבְתוּ בֶּחָצֵר — מוּתָּר לְטַלְטְלָן בֶּחָצֵר, בַּגַּגִּין — מוּתָּר לְטַלְטְלָן בַּגַּגִּין, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא גַּג גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה אוֹ נָמוּךְ עֲשָׂרָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד רְשׁוּת לְעַצְמוֹ, וְאֵין מְטַלְטְלִין בּוֹ אֶלָּא בְּאַרְבַּע.
human_translation: was taught in accordance with Rav, was taught in accordance with Rav Yehuda. was taught in accordance with Rav, All the roofs of a city are one domain, and it is prohibited to carry up or carry down, from the roofs to the courtyard or from the courtyard to the roofs. And vessels that were inside a courtyard Shabbat it is permitted to carry them in the courtyard on the roofs Shabbat it is permitted to carry them on the roofs, provided that one roof is neither ten higher nor ten lower the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: Each and every one of is a domain in and of itself, and one may move on only within four
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita in accordance with the opinion of Rav, it was taught in a Baraita in accordance with the opinion of Rav Yehudah. It was taught in a Baraita in accordance with the opinion of Rav: All the rooftops of the city are considered one domain, and it is prohibited to bring up or bring down from the rooftops to the courtyard and from the courtyard to the rooftops. And vessels that were left in the courtyard - it is permitted to move them within the courtyard, on the rooftops - it is permitted to move them on the rooftops, as long as the rooftop is not ten handbreadths high or ten handbreadths low, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: Each and every one is considered a separate domain, and one may only move within it up to four cubits.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה: אָמַר רַבִּי, כְּשֶׁהָיִינוּ לוֹמְדִים תּוֹרָה אֵצֶל רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בִּתְקוֹעַ, הָיִינוּ מַעֲלִין שֶׁמֶן וַאֲלוּנְטִית מִגַּג לְגַג, וּמִגַּג לְחָצֵר, וּמֵחָצֵר לְחָצֵר, וּמֵחָצֵר לְקַרְפֵּף, וּמִקַּרְפֵּף לְקַרְפֵּף אַחֵר, עַד שֶׁהָיִינוּ מַגִּיעִין אֵצֶל הַמַּעְיָין שֶׁהָיִינוּ רוֹחֲצִין בּוֹ.
human_translation: was taught in accordance with Rav Yehuda’s Rabbi said: When we were studying Torah with Rabbi Shimon in Tekoa, we would carry oil and a towel from roof to roof, and from roof to courtyard, and from courtyard to courtyard, and from courtyard to enclosure, and from enclosure to enclosure, until we reached the spring in which we would bathe.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yehudah: Rabbi said, when we were studying Torah at the side of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai, we would ascend oil and ointment from roof to roof, and from roof to courtyard, and from courtyard to courtyard, and from courtyard to balcony, and from one balcony to another, until we reached the spring in which we would bathe.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה בִּשְׁעַת הַסַּכָּנָה וְהָיִינוּ מַעֲלִין תּוֹרָה מֵחָצֵר לְגַג, וּמִגַּג לְחָצֵר, וּמֵחָצֵר לְקַרְפֵּף לִקְרוֹת בּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: an incident during a time of danger, and we would carry a Torah scroll from courtyard to roof, and from roof to courtyard, and from courtyard to enclosure, to read from it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: There was an incident at the time of danger, and we would bring the Torah from the courtyard to the roof, and from the roof to the courtyard, and from the courtyard to the balcony to read from it.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵין שְׁעַת הַסַּכָּנָה רְאָיָה.
human_translation: said to him: a time of danger is no proof.
llm_translation: They said to him: "The hour of danger is not a time for seeing."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד גַּגִּין וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Roofs, all
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "One roofs and so forth."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, וְהוּא שֶׁלֹּא עֵירְבוּ. אֲבָל עֵירְבוּ — לָא, דְּגָזְרִינַן דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְאַפּוֹקֵי מָאנֵי דְבָתִּים לֶחָצֵר.
human_translation: Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, provided that did not establish a eiruv However, if they established eiruv no, as we issue a decree lest one come to take out vessels of houses to the courtyard,
llm_translation: Rav said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Shimon, even when they did not make an eruv. But if they made an eruv - no, for we decree lest one come to carry from houses to the courtyard.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: בֵּין עֵירְבוּ בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא עֵירְבוּ. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִי לְחָשְׁךָ, בֵּין עֵירְבוּ וּבֵין שֶׁלֹּא עֵירְבוּ?
human_translation: And Shmuel said: whether they established an eiruv or whether they did not establish an eiruv . And similarly, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Who whispered to you, whether they established an eiruv or whether they did not establish an eiruv ?
llm_translation: Samuel said: Whether they made an Eruv or did not make an Eruv. And so said Rabbi Yochanan: Who darkened your mind, whether they made an Eruv or did not make an Eruv?

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב חִסְדָּא: לִשְׁמוּאֵל וּלְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, יֹאמְרוּ: שְׁנֵי כֵלִים בְּחָצֵר אַחַת, זֶה מוּתָּר וְזֶה אָסוּר!
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda strongly objects to this According to Shmuel and according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, will say two vessels in the same courtyard, this permitted, while that one, prohibited.
llm_translation: Challenged him Rav Ḥisdah: To Shmuel and to Rabbi Yoḥanan, they say: Two vessels in one courtyard, this one permitted and this one forbidden!

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּלָא גָּזַר. דִּתְנַן, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה, לְשָׁלֹשׁ חֲצֵירוֹת הַפְּתוּחוֹת זוֹ לָזוֹ וּפְתוּחוֹת לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, וְעֵירְבוּ שְׁתֵּי הַחִיצוֹנוֹת עִם הָאֶמְצָעִית — הִיא מוּתֶּרֶת עִמָּהֶן, וְהֵן מוּתָּרוֹת עִמָּהּ, וּשְׁתֵּי הַחִיצוֹנוֹת אֲסוּרִין זוֹ עִם זוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon to his reasoning, as he did not issue a decree As we learned Rabbi Shimon said: To what is this matter comparable? to three courtyards that are open into each other, and that are open into a public domain. the two outer established an eiruv with the middle one, permitted into and they, are permitted into it, but the two outer prohibited into each other,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon according to his reasoning, that he did not decree. For it was taught: Rabbi Shimon said: What is the matter comparable to? To three courtyards open one to another and open to a public domain, and they made an eruv with the two outer ones along with the middle one - it is permitted with them, and they are permitted with it, but the two outer ones are forbidden to each other.

hebrew_text: וְלָא גָּזַר דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְאַפּוֹקֵי מָאנֵי דְּהָא חָצֵר לְהָא חָצֵר, הָכִי נָמֵי לָא גָּזְרִינַן דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְאַפּוֹקֵי מָאנֵי דְבָתִּים לְחָצֵר.
human_translation: And did not issue a decree lest one come to take out vessels from this courtyard to that courtyard, Here too, we do not issue a decree lest one come to take out utensils of the houses to the courtyard,
llm_translation: And not decreed lest perhaps will come to go out vessels of this courtyard to that courtyard, thus also we do not decree lest perhaps will come to go out vessels of houses to the courtyard.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר, אֶחָד גַּגּוֹת אֶחָד חֲצֵירוֹת וְאֶחָד קַרְפֵּיפוֹת רְשׁוּת אַחַת הֵן לְכֵלִים שֶׁשָּׁבְתוּ בְּתוֹכָן, וְלֹא לְכֵלִים שֶׁשָּׁבְתוּ בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא דְּעֵירְבוּ — הַיְינוּ דְּמַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ מָאנֵי דְבָתִּים בְּחָצֵר.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet raised an objection. Rabbi Shimon says: Roofs, courtyards, and enclosures are all one domain with regard to vessels that were inside them Shabbat But not with regard to vessels that were inside the house Shabbat Granted, if you say established an eiruv , that is how you find vessels from the house in the courtyard.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Sheshet raised an objection: Rabbi Shimon says, "Whether it is one roof, one courtyard, or one balcony, they are considered one domain for utensils that were placed within them on Shabbat, but not for utensils that were placed within the house. If you say this is in a case where they made an Eruv, that means you forget the case of houses in a courtyard."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ בְּשֶׁלֹּא עֵירְבוּ — הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ מָאנֵי דְבָתִּים בְּחָצֵר? הוּא מוֹתֵיב לַהּ וְהוּא מְפָרֵק לַהּ: בְּכוּמְתָּא וְסוּדָרָא.
human_translation: However, if you say where they did not establish an eiruv , what vessels from the house in the courtyard raised the objection, and he resolved it: to a hat or a shawl,
llm_translation: Rather, if you say that without an eruv - how does she find the owners of the houses in the courtyard? He sets it up for her and he arranges it for her: with a wall and a partition.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אַנְשֵׁי חָצֵר וְאַנְשֵׁי מִרְפֶּסֶת שֶׁשָּׁכְחוּ וְלֹא עֵירְבוּ, כׇּל שֶׁגָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים — לַמִּרְפֶּסֶת. פָּחוֹת מִכָּאן — לֶחָצֵר. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — שֶׁהָיוּ אֵלּוּ שֶׁל רַבִּים וְאֵלּוּ שֶׁל רַבִּים, וְעֵירְבוּ אֵלּוּ לְעַצְמָן וְאֵלּוּ לְעַצְמָן. אוֹ שֶׁל יְחִידִים שֶׁאֵין צְרִיכִין לְעָרֵב.
human_translation: Come hear the residents of a courtyard and the residents of a balcony who forgot and did not establish an eiruv anything ten handbreadths high to the balcony lower than that to the courtyard. In what is this statement, stated? where were many, and many, and these established an eiruv for themselves, and those established an eiruv for themselves; or individuals who need not establish an eiruv
llm_translation: Come and hear: The people of the courtyard and the people of the balcony who forgot and did not make an eruv, any that are higher than ten handbreadths - belong to the balcony. Less than this - belong to the courtyard. In what case are these words said? - When these belong to the public and these belong to the public, and these made an eruv for themselves and these made an eruv for themselves. Or in the case of individuals who do not need to make an eruv.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הָיוּ שֶׁל רַבִּים, וְשָׁכְחוּ וְלֹא עֵירְבוּ — גַּג וְחָצֵר וְאַכְסַדְרָה וּמִרְפֶּסֶת כּוּלָּן רְשׁוּת אַחַת הֵן.
human_translation: However, were many, and they forgot and did not establish an eiruv roof, and courtyard, and portico, and balcony are all one domain,
llm_translation: But they were of the public, and they forgot and did not combine - roof and courtyard and balcony and porch, all of them are considered one domain.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּלֹא עֵירְבוּ, הָא עֵירְבוּ לָא! הָא מַנִּי — רַבָּנַן הִיא.
human_translation: The reason that they did not establish eiruv ; they established eiruv , no, Whose this It is the Rabbis,
llm_translation: Reason for not they mixed, this mixed not! This is a teaching — it is the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּלָא קָתָנֵי קַרְפֵּף וּמָבוֹי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: is also precise, as it is not teaching an enclosure and an alleyway, learn from here
llm_translation: Precisely, that it does not teach about a courtyard or an alleyway. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: חָמֵשׁ חֲצֵירוֹת הַפְּתוּחוֹת זוֹ לָזוֹ וּפְתוּחוֹת לְמָבוֹי, וְשָׁכְחוּ כּוּלָּם וְלֹא עֵירְבוּ — אָסוּר לְהַכְנִיס וּלְהוֹצִיא מֵחָצֵר לַמָּבוֹי וּמִן הַמָּבוֹי לֶחָצֵר. וְכֵלִים שֶׁשָּׁבְתוּ בֶּחָצֵר — מוּתָּר לְטַלְטְלָן בֶּחָצֵר, וּבַמָּבוֹי אָסוּר.
human_translation: Come hear five courtyards that are open to each other and are open to an alleyway, and all forgot and did not establish an eiruv , it is prohibited to carry in or carry out, from a courtyard to the alleyway or from the alleyway to a courtyard. And vessels that were in the courtyard Shabbat it is permitted to carry them in the courtyard, but in the alleyway it is prohibited
llm_translation: Come and hear: Five courtyards that are open to one another and open to a mavoy, and they all forgot and did not make an eruv - it is forbidden to carry from one courtyard to the mavoy and from the mavoy to the courtyard. And vessels that were left in the courtyard - it is permitted to move them within the courtyard, but in the mavoy it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַתִּיר. שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁהֵן שֶׁל רַבִּים, וְשָׁכְחוּ וְלֹא עֵירְבוּ, גַּג וְחָצֵר וְאַכְסַדְרָה וּמִרְפֶּסֶת וְקַרְפֵּף וּמָבוֹי — כּוּלָּן רְשׁוּת אַחַת הֵן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon permits as Rabbi Shimon would say: Whenever are of many and they forgot and did not establish an eiruv , roof, and courtyard, and portico, and balcony, and enclosure, and alleyway are all one domain.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon permits. For Rabbi Shimon used to say: As long as they belong to the public, and they forgot and did not combine their Eruv, a roof, courtyard, balcony, terrace, gallery, and alleyway - all of them are considered one domain.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּלֹא עֵירְבוּ, הָא עֵירְבוּ — לָא. מַאי ״לֹא עֵירְבוּ״: לֹא עֵירְבוּ חֲצֵירוֹת בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי, הָא חָצֵר וּבָתִּים — עֵירְבוּ.
human_translation: The reason that they did not establish eiruv ; they established eiruv , no, What is They did not establish an eiruv ? courtyards did not establish an eiruv with each other; however, the courtyard established an eiruv the houses
llm_translation: Reason for not mixed, this mixed — no. What "not mixed": not mixed courtyards with each other, but courtyard and houses — mixed.

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״לֹא עֵירְבוּ״ קָתָנֵי! מַאי ״לֹא עֵירְבוּ״: לֹא נִשְׁתַּתְּפוּ.
human_translation: But doesn’t state: They did not establish an eiruv , What They did not establish an eiruv ? they did not merge
llm_translation: And this, "they did not mix," it teaches! What is "they did not mix": they did not participate.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְדִבְרֵיהֶם דְּרַבָּנַן קָאֲמַר לְהוּ: לְדִידִי לָא שְׁנָא עֵירְבוּ, וְלָא שְׁנָא לָא עֵירְבוּ. אֶלָּא לְדִידְכוּ, אוֹדוֹ לִי מִיהַת דְּהֵיכָא דְּלֹא עֵירְבוּ רְשׁוּת אַחַת הִיא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Rabbi Shimon is speaking to the Rabbis in accordance with their opinion, According to my own there is no difference they established an eiruv and there is no difference they did not establish an eiruv . However, according to your agree with me at least that where they did not establish an eiruv it is one domain.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Rabbi Shimon, according to their words, is saying to them: According to my opinion, whether they did not make an eruv or they did make an eruv, it does not matter. Rather, according to your opinion, admit to me from the place where it is not an eruv, it is one domain.

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן: לָא — שְׁתֵּי רְשׁוּיוֹת הֵן.
human_translation: And the Rabbis said to him: No, they are two domains
llm_translation: And the sages said to him: No - they are two permissions.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: וּבַמָּבוֹי אָסוּר. לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַב, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַב: מָבוֹי שֶׁלֹּא נִשְׁתַּתְּפוּ בּוֹ — אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין אֶלָּא בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת. אֵימָא: וּלְמָבוֹי — אָסוּר.
human_translation: The Master said but in the alleyway it is prohibited. Let us say supports that Rabbi Zeira said Rav said, as Rabbi Zeira said Rav said: an alleyway in which they did not merge one may carry only within four cubits. Say But to an alleyway it is prohibited,
llm_translation: Master said: And in a mavoy it is forbidden. Let us say that it supports the opinion of Rabbi Zeira, as Rav said, for Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rav: A mavoy that has not been enclosed - one may only carry within four cubits. Let us say: And for a mavoy - it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: הַיְינוּ רֵישָׁא! מִשְׁנָה יַתִּירָא אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: כִּי פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּעֵירְבוּ, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּלָא עֵירְבוּ — מוֹדוּ לֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: that is the first clause The superfluous teaching was necessary, lest you say: When the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Shimon, it is only where they established an eiruv , but where they did not establish an eiruv , concede to teaches us
llm_translation: This is the beginning! Mishnah Yatira requires it, what might you say: when the Rabbis argue with regard to Rabbi Shimon in those matters where they require an Eruv, but in those matters where they do not require an Eruv — they concede to him, this is evident to us.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי:
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi:
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi:

hebrew_text: מִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הָכִי? וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כִּסְתַם מִשְׁנָה. וּתְנַן: כּוֹתֶל שֶׁבֵּין שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת, גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה וְרוֹחַב אַרְבָּעָה — מְעָרְבִין שְׁנַיִם, וְאֵין מְעָרְבִין אֶחָד. הָיוּ בְּרֹאשׁוֹ פֵּירוֹת — אֵלּוּ עוֹלִין מִכָּאן וְאוֹכְלִים, וְאֵלּוּ עוֹלִין מִכָּאן וְאוֹכְלִים, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יוֹרִידוּ לְמַטָּה?
human_translation: Did Rabbi Yoḥanan say this, But didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say the halakha is in accordance with an unattributed mishna, and we learned: a wall between two courtyards, ten high and four wide, they establish two eiruvin , but they do not establish one eiruv . there was fruit atop these, may ascend from here and eat and those, may ascend from there and eat provided that they do not take down
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who said thus, Rabbi Yochanan? But didn't Rabbi Yochanan say: The halacha follows the anonymous Mishnah. And we learned: A wall between two courtyards, ten high and four wide - two may combine, but one may not. If there were fruits on its top - these may ascend from here and eat, and these may ascend from here and eat, as long as they do not descend below?

hebrew_text: מַאי ״לְמַטָּה״ — לְמַטָּה לַבָּתִּים. וְהָא תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא זֶה עוֹמֵד בִּמְקוֹמוֹ וְאוֹכֵל, וְזֶה עוֹמֵד בִּמְקוֹמוֹ וְאוֹכֵל!
human_translation: What is down down to the houses; But didn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya teach Provided that neither will this stand in his place and eat, nor that stand in his place and eat?
llm_translation: "What is 'below' - below the houses. And it was taught by Rabbi Chiya: And only that this one should not stand in his place and eat, and this one should stand in his place and eat!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְכִי רַבִּי לֹא שְׁנָאָהּ, רַבִּי חִיָּיא מִנַּיִן לוֹ?
human_translation: said to If Rabbi did not teach it from where does Rabbi Ḥiyya
llm_translation: He said to him: "Did Rabbi not teach it differently? From where does Rabbi Chiya derive it?"

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר: שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת וְחוּרְבָּה אַחַת בֵּינֵיהֶם, אַחַת עֵירְבָה וְאַחַת לֹא עֵירְבָה, אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: נוֹתְנִין אוֹתָהּ לָזוֹ שֶׁלֹּא עֵירְבָה, אֲבָל לְשֶׁעֵירְבָה — לָא. דִילְמָא אָתֵי לְאַפּוֹקֵי מָאנֵי דְבָתִּים לְחוּרְבָּה.
human_translation: It was stated two courtyards and one ruin between them, one established an eiruv the other did not establish an eiruv Rav Huna said: confer to that that did not establish an eiruv ; however, to that established an eiruv , no, lest people come to take out vessels of the houses to the ruin,
llm_translation: It was stated: Two courtyards and one ruin between them, one was combined and one was not combined, Rav Huna said: We give it to the one that was not combined, but to the one that was combined - no. Perhaps they will come to carry from the houses to the ruin.

hebrew_text: וְחִיָּיא בַּר רַב אָמַר: אַף לְשֶׁעֵירְבָה, וּשְׁתֵּיהֶן אֲסוּרוֹת. וְאִם תֹּאמַר שְׁתֵּיהֶן מוּתָּרוֹת, מִפְּנֵי מָה אֵין נוֹתְנִין חָצֵר שֶׁלֹּא עֵירְבָה לְחָצֵר שֶׁעֵירְבָה?
human_translation: And Ḥiyya bar Rav said: to that established an eiruv , prohibited both And if you say permitted both for what not confer the courtyard that did not establish an eiruv , to the courtyard that established an eiruv ?
llm_translation: And Ḥiyya son of Rav said: Even for a goat, and both of them are forbidden. And if you say both of them are permitted, why don't we establish an eruv for a courtyard that did not make an eruv to a courtyard that made an eruv?

hebrew_text: הָתָם, כֵּיוָן דְּמִנַּטְרִי מָאנֵי דְבָתִּים בְּחָצֵר, אָתֵי לְאַפּוֹקֵי. הָכָא בְּחוּרְבָּה, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא מִנַּטְרִי מָאנֵי דְחָצֵר בְּחוּרְבָּה, לָא אָתֵי לְאַפּוֹקֵי.
human_translation: There, since the vessels from the houses are protected in the courtyard come to take them out Here, in a ruin, since the vessels from the courtyard are not protected in the ruin, no come to take out
llm_translation: There, since they guard the houses in the courtyard, he comes to redeem. Here, in the sword, since they do not guard the houses in the courtyard in the sword, he does not come to redeem.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, חִיָּיא בַּר רַב אָמַר: אַף לְשֶׁעֵירְבָה, וּשְׁתֵּיהֶן מוּתָּרוֹת. וְאִם תֹּאמַר: שְׁתֵּיהֶן אֲסוּרוֹת — לְפִי שֶׁאֵין נוֹתְנִים חָצֵר שֶׁלֹּא עֵירְבָה לְחָצֵר שֶׁעֵירְבָה. הָתָם, כֵּיוָן דְּמִנַּטְרִי מָאנֵי דְבָתִּים בְּחָצֵר — לָא שָׁרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן, דְּאָתֵי לְאַפּוֹקֵי. אֲבָל בְּחוּרְבָּה לָא מִנַּטְרִי.
human_translation: Some say Ḥiyya bar Rav said: even to that established an eiruv , and permitted both And if you say both prohibited that do not confer the courtyard that did not establish an eiruv to the courtyard that established an eiruv , There, since the vessels from the houses are protected in the courtyard, the Sages did not permit them, lest come to take them out However, in a ruin, are not protected
llm_translation: There are those who say, Hiyya bar Rav said: Even for a courtyard that was mixed, both are permitted. And if you say: Both are forbidden - because one does not establish an eruv for a courtyard that was not mixed with a courtyard that was mixed. There, since the owners of the houses in the courtyard are careful, the Rabbis did not prohibit them, for they come to inspect. But for a ruin, they are not careful.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ גַּג גָּדוֹל סָמוּךְ לְקָטָן — הַגָּדוֹל מוּתָּר, וְהַקָּטָן אָסוּר. חָצֵר גְּדוֹלָה שֶׁנִּפְרְצָה לִקְטַנָּה — גְּדוֹלָה מוּתֶּרֶת וּקְטַנָּה אֲסוּרָה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא כְּפִתְחָהּ שֶׁל גְּדוֹלָה.
human_translation: a large roof adjacent to a small roof, the large one is permitted, and the small one is prohibited. a large courtyard that was breached into a small permitted the large but prohibited the small one because is like the entrance of the large
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: A large roof adjacent to a small one - the large one is permitted, and the small one is forbidden. A large courtyard that broke open to a small one - the large one is permitted, and the small one is forbidden, because it is like the entrance of the large one.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לְמָה לֵיהּ לְמִיתְנֵי תַּרְתֵּי?
human_translation: Why does teach twice?
llm_translation: Gemara: Why did he need to teach two?

hebrew_text: לְרַב, קָתָנֵי גַּג דּוּמְיָא דְחָצֵר: מָה חָצֵר מִנַּכְרָא מְחִיצְתָּא, אַף גַּג נָמֵי מִנַּכְרָא מְחִיצְתָּא.
human_translation: According to Rav, teach a roof similar to a courtyard: Just as a courtyard, its partitions are conspicuous, so too a roof, its partitions, conspicuous
llm_translation: To Rav, it was taught: The roof is similar to the partition of the courtyard. Just as the courtyard requires a partition, so too the roof requires a partition.

hebrew_text: וְלִשְׁמוּאֵל, גַּג דּוּמְיָא דְחָצֵר: מָה חָצֵר דְּקָא דָרְסִי לַהּ רַבִּים, אַף גַּג נָמֵי דְּקָא דָרְסִי לֵיהּ רַבִּים.
human_translation: according to Shmuel, a roof similar to a courtyard: Just as a courtyard where multitudes tread, so too, the roof where multitudes tread.
llm_translation: To Samuel, the roof of the courtyard is like the courtyard itself: just as the courtyard that is trampled by many, so too the upper roof that is trampled by many.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַבָּה וְרַבִּי זֵירָא וְרַבָּה בַּר רַב חָנָן, וְיָתֵיב אַבָּיֵי גַּבַּיְיהוּ, וְיָתְבִי וְקָאָמְרִי: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מִמַּתְנִיתִין דָּיוֹרֵי גְדוֹלָה בַּקְּטַנָּה, וְאֵין דָּיוֹרֵי קְטַנָּה בַּגְּדוֹלָה.
human_translation: Rabba, Rabbi Zeira, and Rabba bar Rav Ḥanan were sitting, and Abaye was sitting beside them, and they sat and said: Learn from the mishna the residents of the large into the small one, but the residents of the small not into the large one.
llm_translation: Rabba and Rabbi Zeira were sitting, and Rabba bar Rav Hanan was sitting with them. Abbaye was sitting opposite them, and they were saying: Learn from it (a teaching) from the Mishnah, that the large (vessels) purify the small (vessels), but the small do not purify the large.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד? גְּפָנִים בַּגְּדוֹלָה — אָסוּר לִזְרוֹעַ אֶת הַקְּטַנָּה. וְאִם זָרַע — זְרָעִין אֲסוּרִין,
human_translation: How so? vines in the large it is prohibited to sow in the small one, And if he sowed the seeds are prohibited.
llm_translation: How so? Grapevines in a large field - it is forbidden to sow the small ones. And if one sows - the seeds are forbidden.

hebrew_text: גְּפָנִים מוּתָּרִין. גְּפָנִים בַּקְּטַנָּה — מוּתָּר לִזְרוֹעַ אֶת הַגְּדוֹלָה.
human_translation: The vines, are permitted, vines in the small it is permitted to sow in the large one
llm_translation: "Gefanim mutarin. Gefanim baketanah — mutar lizroa et hagedolah." "Grapevines are permitted. Grapevines in a small pot — it is permitted to plant the large vine."

hebrew_text: אִשָּׁה בַּגְּדוֹלָה וָגֵט בַּקְּטַנָּה — מִתְגָּרֶשֶׁת. אִשָּׁה בַּקְּטַנָּה וְגֵט בַּגְּדוֹלָה — אֵינָהּ מִתְגָּרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: a wife, in the large and a bill of divorce the small she is divorced. the wife was in the small and the bill of divorce the large one, she is not divorced.
llm_translation: A woman in the elder status and a bill of divorce in the minor status — she divorces. A woman in the minor status and a bill of divorce in the elder status — she does not divorce.

hebrew_text: צִבּוּר בַּגְּדוֹלָה וּשְׁלִיחַ צִבּוּר בַּקְּטַנָּה — יוֹצְאִין יְדֵי חוֹבָתָן. צִיבּוּר בַּקְּטַנָּה וּשְׁלִיחַ צִבּוּר בַּגְּדוֹלָה — אֵין יוֹצְאִין יְדֵי חוֹבָתָן.
human_translation: congregation in the large and the prayer leader in the small one, they fulfill their obligation the congregation in the small and the prayer leader in the large one, they do not fulfill their obligation.
llm_translation: The community in the larger city and the emissary of the community in the smaller city — they fulfill their obligation. The community in the smaller city and the emissary of the community in the larger city — they do not fulfill their obligation.

hebrew_text: תִּשְׁעָה בַּגְּדוֹלָה וְיָחִיד בַּקְּטַנָּה — מִצְטָרְפִין. תִּשְׁעָה בַּקְּטַנָּה וְאֶחָד בַּגְּדוֹלָה — אֵין מִצְטָרְפִין.
human_translation: nine in the large and one in the small one, they join nine in the small and one in the large one, they do not join
llm_translation: Nine in the larger and one in the smaller - they combine. Nine in the smaller and one in the larger - they do not combine.

hebrew_text: צוֹאָה בַּגְּדוֹלָה — אָסוּר לִקְרוֹת קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע בַּקְּטַנָּה. צוֹאָה בַּקְּטַנָּה — מוּתָּר לִקְרוֹת קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע בַּגְּדוֹלָה.
human_translation: excrement in the large it is prohibited to recite Shema in the small one, excrement in the small it is permitted to recite Shema in the large one.
llm_translation: A shout in the large - forbidden to recite the Shema in the small. A shout in the small - permitted to recite the Shema in the large.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ אַבָּיֵי: אִם כֵּן, מָצִינוּ מְחִיצָה לְאִיסּוּר. שֶׁאִילְמָלֵי אֵין מְחִיצָה, מַרְחִיק אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת וְזוֹרֵעַ, וְאִילּוּ הַשְׁתָּא אֲסוּרָה!
human_translation: Abaye said to them: If so, we have found a partition that prohibition. As, were there no partition distance four cubits and sow whereas now it is prohibited
llm_translation: He said to them, Abaye: If so, we find a partition for prohibition. For if not for a partition, one must distance four cubits and sow, whereas here it is a different prohibition!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא לְאַבָּיֵי: וְלֹא מָצִינוּ מְחִיצָה לְאִיסּוּר?! וְהָא תְּנַן: חָצֵר גְּדוֹלָה שֶׁנִּפְרְצָה לִקְטַנָּה — גְּדוֹלָה מוּתֶּרֶת וּקְטַנָּה אֲסוּרָה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא כְּפִתְחָהּ שֶׁל גְּדוֹלָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to Abaye: And didn’t we find a partition that prohibition? But didn’t we learn a large courtyard that was breached into a small permitted the large but prohibited the small one because is like the entrance of the large
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Zeira to Abbaye: "And we did not find a partition for prohibition?!" But didn't we learn: "A large courtyard that broke into a small one - the large one is permitted and the small one is prohibited, because it is like the entrance of the large one."

hebrew_text: וְאִילּוּ הִשְׁוָה אֶת גִּיפּוּפֶיהָ גְּדוֹלָה נָמֵי אֲסוּרָה!
human_translation: And if he were to even its protrusions the large also be prohibited,
llm_translation: And if he made her nose larger, it is still considered forbidden!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָתָם סִילּוּק מְחִיצּוֹת הוּא.
human_translation: said to there, it is the removal of partitions.
llm_translation: He said to him, there the removal of partitions it is.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְאַבָּיֵי: וְלֹא מָצִינוּ מְחִיצָה לְאִיסּוּר? וְהָא אִתְּמַר:
human_translation: Rava said to Abaye: And didn’t we find a partition that prohibition? But wasn’t it stated:
llm_translation: Rava said to Abbaye: "And we did not find a partition for prohibition?" But it was stated:

hebrew_text: סִיכֵּךְ עַל גַּבֵּי אַכְסַדְרָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ פַּצִּימִין — כְּשֵׁירָה. וְאִילּוּ הִשְׁוָה פַּצִּימֶיהָ — פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: placed roofing on top of a portico that has doorposts, valid if he evened the doorposts invalid.
llm_translation: Place on top of the ledge that has bolts - it is valid. But if its bolts were equal - it is invalid.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: לְדִידִי כְּשֵׁירָה, לְדִידָךְ סִילּוּק מְחִיצּוֹת הִיא.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: In my opinion, valid. according to your opinion, is the removal of partitions.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: According to me it is valid, according to you it is a removal of partitions.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה בַּר רַב חָנָן לְאַבָּיֵי: וְלֹא מָצִינוּ מְחִיצָה לְאִיסּוּר? וְהָתַנְיָא: בַּיִת שֶׁחֶצְיוֹ מְקוֹרֶה וְחֶצְיוֹ אֵינוֹ מְקוֹרֶה, גְּפָנִים כָּאן — מוּתָּר לִזְרוֹעַ כָּאן.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Ḥanan said to Abaye: And didn’t we find a partition prohibition? But wasn’t it taught a house, half of which is roofed and half unroofed, vines here, it is permitted to sow there,
llm_translation: Rabah bar Rav Ḥanan said to Abbaye: "And we did not find a partition for prohibition?" And it was taught: "A house whose half is roofed and half is not roofed, vines here — it is permitted to plant, here."

hebrew_text: וְאִילּוּ הִשְׁוָה אֶת קֵרוּיוֹ — אָסוּר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם סִילּוּק מְחִיצּוֹת הוּא.
human_translation: And if he evened its roofing, prohibited said to him: There it is the removal of partitions.
llm_translation: And if he equalized his call - forbidden. He said to him: There, it is removal from partitions.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח לֵיהּ רָבָא לְאַבָּיֵי בְּיַד רַב שְׁמַעְיָה בַּר זְעֵירָא: וְלֹא מָצִינוּ מְחִיצָה לְאִיסּוּר? וְהָתַנְיָא: יֵשׁ בִּמְחִיצוֹת הַכֶּרֶם לְהָקֵל וּלְהַחֲמִיר, כֵּיצַד? כֶּרֶם הַנָּטוּעַ עַד עִיקַּר מְחִיצָה — זוֹרֵעַ מֵעִיקַּר מְחִיצָה וְאֵילָךְ. שֶׁאִילּוּ אֵין שָׁם מְחִיצָה מַרְחִיק אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת וְזוֹרֵעַ, וְזֶה הוּא מְחִיצּוֹת הַכֶּרֶם לְהָקֵל.
human_translation: Rava sent Abaye by means of Rav Shemaya bar Ze’eira, And didn’t we find a partition prohibition? But wasn’t it taught There is in the partitions of a vineyard leniency and stringency. How so? a vineyard that is planted until the base of a partition, one sows from the base of the partition onward. as were there no partition there, distance four cubits and sow And this is partitions of a vineyard leniency.
llm_translation: Rava sent to Abbaye by the hand of Rav Shemaya bar Zeira: "And we did not find a partition for prohibition?" And it was taught: "There are partitions in vineyards for leniency and for stringency, how so? A vineyard that is planted up to the edge of the partition - one sows from the edge of the partition and onwards. Since there is no partition there, one distances four cubits and sows, and this is the partitions of the vineyard for leniency."

hebrew_text: וּלְהַחֲמִיר כֵּיצַד? הָיָה מָשׁוּךְ מִן הַכּוֹתֶל אַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה — לֹא יָבִיא זֶרַע לְשָׁם, שֶׁאִילְמָלֵי אֵין מְחִיצָה מַרְחִיק אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת וְזוֹרֵעַ, וְזוֹהִי מְחִיצוֹת הַכֶּרֶם לְהַחְמִיר.
human_translation: And stringency, how so? was distanced eleven cubits from a wall, one may not bring seeds there, as were there no partition, distance four cubits and sow This is partitions in a vineyard stringency,
llm_translation: And to be stringent, how so? If he was drawing from the wall eleven cubits - he should not bring seed there, for if not, there is no partition distancing four cubits and he is sowing, and this is the partitions of the vineyard to be stringent.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, אוֹתְבַן מִמַּתְנִיתִין, דִּתְנַן: קָרַחַת הַכֶּרֶם, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: שֵׁשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה. מְחוֹל הַכֶּרֶם, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: שֵׁשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה.
human_translation: said to him: And according to your reasoning raise an objection against our from a mishna, as we learned a clearing in a vineyard, Beit Shammai say: twenty-four cubits, and Beit Hillel say: Sixteen cubits. the perimeter of a vineyard, Beit Shammai say: Sixteen cubits, and Beit Hillel say: Twelve cubits.
llm_translation: He said to him: And for your planting, we learn in a Mishnah, as it is taught: The distance for uprooting a vineyard, Beit Shammai say: twenty-four cubits, and Beit Hillel say: sixteen cubits. The distance for plowing a vineyard, Beit Shammai say: sixteen cubits, and Beit Hillel say: twelve cubits.

hebrew_text: וְאֵיזוֹ הִיא קָרַחַת הַכֶּרֶם? כֶּרֶם שֶׁחָרַב אֶמְצָעִיתוֹ. אִם אֵין שָׁם שֵׁשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה — לֹא יָבִיא זֶרַע לְשָׁם, הָיוּ שָׁם שֵׁשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה — נוֹתֵן לוֹ כְּדֵי עֲבוֹדָתוֹ, וְזוֹרֵעַ אֶת הַמּוֹתָר.
human_translation: And what is a clearing in a vineyard? a vineyard whose middle was laid bare there are not sixteen cubits one may not bring seeds there, there were sixteen cubits one provides its work area, and he sows the rest
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And what is the baldness of the vineyard? A vineyard whose middle has been destroyed. If there are not sixteen cubits there - one should not bring seed there. If there were sixteen cubits there - one gives him enough for his work, and he sows the rest.

hebrew_text: אֵי זוֹ הִיא מְחוֹל הַכֶּרֶם? בֵּין הַכֶּרֶם לַגָּדֵר. שֶׁאִם אֵין שָׁם שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה — לֹא יָבִיא זֶרַע לְשָׁם, הָיוּ שָׁם שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה — נוֹתֵן לוֹ כְּדֵי עֲבוֹדָתוֹ, וְזוֹרֵעַ אֶת הַמּוֹתָר.
human_translation: What is the perimeter of a vineyard? between the vineyard and the fence there are not twelve cubits one may not bring seeds there. there are twelve cubits he provides its work area, and he sows the rest.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the space of the vineyard? Between the vineyard and the fence. If there are not there twelve cubits - one should not bring seed there, if there are there twelve cubits - one gives him for his work, and he sows the rest.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא — הָתָם לָאו הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא, דְּכֹל אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת לְגַבֵּי כֶרֶם עֲבוֹדַת הַכֶּרֶם. לְגַבֵּי גָדֵר, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא מִזְדַּרְעָן — אַפְקוֹרֵי מַפְקַר לְהוּ. דְּבֵינֵי בֵּינֵי, אִי אִיכָּא אַרְבַּע — חֲשִׁיבָן, וְאִי לָא — לָא חֲשִׁיבָן.
human_translation: Rather, there, isn’t this the reason because the entire four cubits alongside a vineyard is the vineyard’s work area, alongside the fence since they cannot be sown he renounces ownership over in between, if it is four it is significant and if not, it is not significant
llm_translation: Rather — there, it is not the same reason, for within four cubits of a vineyard is considered part of the vineyard. In the case of a fence, once they are not sown — they are considered ownerless. In the middle, if there are four cubits — they are significant, but if not — they are not significant.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: שְׁלֹשָׁה קַרְפֵּיפוֹת זֶה בְּצַד זֶה, וּשְׁנַיִם הַחִיצוֹנִים מְגוּפָּפִים, וְהָאֶמְצָעִי אֵינוֹ מְגוּפָּף, וְיָחִיד בָּזֶה וְיָחִיד בָּזֶה — נַעֲשֶׂה כִּשְׁיָירָא, וְנוֹתְנִין לָהֶן כׇּל צוֹרְכָּן וַדַּאי.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: three enclosures alongside one another, and the two outer protrude, and the middle one does not protrude, and there is one in this and one in that becomes like a caravan, and one provides them all that they require.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: Three doorways, one next to the other, and the two outer ones are enclosed, while the middle one is not enclosed. If there is an individual on this side and an individual on that side, it is considered like a private domain, and one may carry within them all their needs for sure.

hebrew_text: אֶמְצָעִי מְגוּפָּף וּשְׁנַיִם הַחִיצוֹנִים אֵינָן מְגוּפָּפִין, וְיָחִיד בָּזֶה וְיָחִיד זֶה [וְיָחִיד בָּזֶה] — אֵין נוֹתְנִין לָהֶם אֶלָּא בֵּית שֵׁשׁ.
human_translation: middle protruded, and the two outer ones did not protrude, and there is one in this and one in that one provides them only six beit se’a ,
llm_translation: Middle one is solid and two outer ones are not solid, and individual in this and individual in that and individual in this — they are given only a six-handbreadth house.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: אֶחָד בָּזֶה וְאֶחָד בָּזֶה וּשְׁנַיִם בָּאֶמְצָעִי, מַהוּ? אִי לְהָכָא נָפְקִי — תְּלָתָא הָווּ, וְאִי לְהָכָא נָפְקִי — תְּלָתָא הָווּ.
human_translation: a dilemma was raised before one in this and one person in the other and two in the middle what is if exit to here, they are three and if they exit to there, they are three
llm_translation: He asked them: One on this side and one on that side, and two in the middle, what is the law? If they came here — there are three, and if they came here — there are three.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִילְמָא: חַד לְהָכָא נָפֵיק, וְחַד לְהָכָא נָפֵיק.
human_translation: Or perhaps, one may exit to here and the other may exit to there,
llm_translation: Or perhaps: one for here goes out, and one for here goes out.

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר חַד לְהָכָא נָפֵיק וְחַד לְהָכָא נָפֵיק, שְׁנַיִם בָּזֶה וּשְׁנַיִם בָּזֶה וְאֶחָד בְּאֶמְצָעִי מַהוּ? הָכָא וַדַּאי, אִי לְהָכָא נָפֵיק — תְּלָתָא הָווּ, וְאִי לְהָכָא נָפֵיק — תְּלָתָא הָווּ, אוֹ דִילְמָא: אֵימַר לְהָכָא נָפֵיק, וְאֵימַר לְהָכָא נָפֵיק.
human_translation: And if you say one may exit to here and one may exit to there, two in this and two in that and one in the middle what here, certainly, if he exits to here they are three, and if he exits to there they are three, Or perhaps, say he exit to here, and say he exit to there.
llm_translation: And if you will say, one comes out for here and one comes out for here, two on this side and two on this side, and one in the middle, what is the law? Here it is certain, if one comes out for here — there are three, and if one comes out for here — there are three, or perhaps one might say: one comes out for here, and one comes out for here.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא בַּעְיַין לְקוּלָּא.
human_translation: but halakha is these dilemmas leniently, and
llm_translation: And the halakha follows the lenient opinion.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא:
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said:
llm_translation: Rav Hisda said:

hebrew_text: גִּידּוּד חֲמִשָּׁה וּמְחִיצָה חֲמִשָּׁה — אֵין מִצְטָרְפִין עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא אוֹ כּוּלּוֹ בְּגִידּוּד אוֹ כּוּלּוֹ בִּמְחִיצָה.
human_translation: An embankment, of five and partition of five do not join only if is entirely of the embankment or if it is entirely of a partition.
llm_translation: The sinew of five and the partition of five - do not combine until it is either all in the sinew or all in the partition.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת זוֹ לְמַעְלָה מִזּוֹ וְעֶלְיוֹנָה גְּבוֹהָה מִן הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, אוֹ שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ גִּידּוּד חֲמִשָּׁה וּמְחִיצָה חֲמִשָּׁה — מְעָרְבִין שְׁנַיִם, וְאֵין מְעָרְבִין אֶחָד. פָּחוֹת מִכָּאן מְעָרְבִין אֶחָד, וְאֵין מְעָרְבִין שְׁנַיִם!
human_translation: The Gemara raises an objection two courtyards, one above the other, and upper one was ten handbreadths higher than the lower one, or if it had an embankment of five and a partition five and they establish two eiruvin , and they do not establish one eiruv . less than they establish one eiruv and they do not establish two eiruvin .
llm_translation: Challenger: Two courtyards, one above the other, and the upper one is ten handbreadths higher than the lower one, or if it has a breach of five handbreadths and a partition of five handbreadths - they may combine two courtyards, but they may not combine one. Less than this, they may combine one, but they may not combine two!

hebrew_text: אָמַר (רַב): מוֹדֶה רַב חִסְדָּא בַּתַּחְתּוֹנָה, הוֹאִיל וְרוֹאֶה פְּנֵי עֲשָׂרָה. אִי הָכִי: תַּחְתּוֹנָה — תְּעָרֵב שְׁנַיִם וְלֹא תְּעָרֵב אֶחָד, עֶלְיוֹנָה — לֹא תְּעָרֵב לֹא אֶחָד וְלֹא שְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: Rav said: Rav Ḥisda concedes with regard to the lower since it faces a wall of ten, If so, lower establish two eiruvin , and do not establish one eiruv the upper establish neither one eiruv nor two.
llm_translation: Rav said: Rav Ḥisdah concedes regarding the lower one, since he sees the faces of ten. If so, regarding the lower one — mix two and do not mix one; regarding the upper one — do not mix either one or two.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר עוּלָּא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיְתָה עֶלְיוֹנָה מְגוּפֶּפֶת עַד עֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: Rabba bar Ulla said: where upper protruded up to ten cubits.
llm_translation: Rabba bar Ulla said: For example, if the upper part was thick from the body until ten cubits.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: פָּחוֹת מִכָּאן — מְעָרְבִין אֶחָד וְאֵין מְעָרְבִין שְׁנַיִם, אִי בָּעֲיָא — חַד תְּעָרֵב, אִי בָּעֲיָא — תְּרֵי תְּעָרֵב!
human_translation: If so, say the latter clause less than they establish one eiruv , but they do not establish two eiruvin . if they wish, they establish one eiruv , if they wish, they establish two eiruvin .
llm_translation: If so, say the latter part: Less than this - one may combine, but not two may combine. If you wish - combine one, if you wish - combine two!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּפְרְצָה הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה בִּמְלוֹאָהּ לָעֶלְיוֹנָה.
human_translation: Rabba, son of Rava, said: where the lower was fully breached into the upper one,
llm_translation: Rabba, son of Rava, said: For example, when the lower one was breached in its fullness to the upper one.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, תַּחְתּוֹנָה חַד תְּעָרֵב, תְּרֵי לָא תְּעָרֵב. עֶלְיוֹנָה, אִי בָּעֲיָא — תְּרֵי תְּעָרֵב, אִי בָּעֲיָא — חַד תְּעָרֵב.
human_translation: If so, lower establish one eiruv do not establish two eiruvin , the upper one, if wish, establish one eiruv if wish, establish two eiruvin .
llm_translation: If so, one below will mix, two will not mix. If one above wants - two will mix, if one above wants - one will mix.

hebrew_text: אִין הָכִי נָמֵי. וְכִי קָתָנֵי ״פָּחוֹת מִכָּאן מְעָרְבִין אֶחָד וְאֵין מְעָרְבִין שְׁנַיִם״, אַתַּחְתּוֹנָה.
human_translation: Yes, it is indeed so; And when teaches: less than establish one eiruv , but they do not establish two eiruvin , to the lower
llm_translation: The text reads: "Een hachi namei. Ve'chi katanay 'pachot mikkan mearvin echad ve'ein mearvin shnayim', atachtona." Translation: "Is it not so? And when it teaches 'less than this, one may join together, but not two', it is the conclusion."

hebrew_text: דְּרַשׁ מָרִימָר: גִּידּוּד חֲמִשָּׁה וּמְחִיצָה חֲמִשָּׁה — מִצְטָרְפִין. אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תָּנֵי מָר מִידֵּי בִּמְחִיצָה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא. וְהִלְכְתָא: גִּידּוּד חֲמִשָּׁה וּמְחִיצָה חֲמִשָּׁה מִצְטָרְפִין.
human_translation: Mareimar taught: An embankment of five and an partition of five combine Ravina met Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to him: the Master taught anything with regard to partition, He said to him: No. halakha an embankment of five and a partition of five combine
llm_translation: Marimar expounded: A sinew of five and a partition of five - combine. Ravina found it before Rav Acha, son of Rava, and said to him: Did Mar teach immediately about a partition? He said to him: No. And the halakha is: A sinew of five and a partition of five combine.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא: דָּיוֹרִין הַבָּאִין בְּשַׁבָּת, מַהוּ שֶׁיֵּאָסְרוּ?
human_translation: Rav Hoshaya raised a dilemma: residents who arrive on Shabbat, Do render it prohibited
llm_translation: Inquiries of Rav Hoshaya: Dairies that arrive on Shabbat, what is the ruling that they should be prohibited?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא, תָּא שְׁמַע: חָצֵר גְּדוֹלָה שֶׁנִּפְרְצָה לִקְטַנָּה — הַגְּדוֹלָה מוּתֶּרֶת וְהַקְּטַנָּה אֲסוּרָה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא כְּפִתְחָהּ שֶׁל גְּדוֹלָה. אָמַר רַבָּה: אֵימַר מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם נִפְרְצָה.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: Come hear a large courtyard that was breached into a small permitted the large prohibited the small because is like the entrance of the large Rabba said: Say it was breached while it was still day,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said, come and hear: a large courtyard that broke open to a small one — the large one is permitted and the small one is forbidden, because it is like the entrance of the large one. Rabbah said: one might say it broke open during the day.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: לָא תֵּימָא מָר ״אֵימַר״, אֶלָּא וַדַּאי מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם נִפְרְצָה. דְּהָא מָר הוּא דְּאָמַר, בְּעַי מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב הוּנָא וּבְעַי מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב יְהוּדָה: עֵירַב דֶּרֶךְ הַפֶּתַח וְנִסְתַּם הַפֶּתַח, עֵירַב דֶּרֶךְ חַלּוֹן וְנִסְתַּם הַחַלּוֹן, מַהוּ? וְאָמַר לִי: שַׁבָּת, כֵּיוָן שֶׁהוּתְּרָה הוּתְּרָה.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: The Master should not state: Say, Rather, certainly was breached while it was still day. As Master, are the one who said: I raised a dilemma before Rav Huna, and I raised a dilemma before Rav Yehuda: established an eiruv via opening, and that opening was sealed via window, and that window was sealed what is And he said to me: Once was permitted Shabbat, it was permitted
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye: Do not say "Master said," but rather certainly it burst forth in the middle of the day. For it was Master who said, he requires it from Rav Huna and he requires it from Rav Yehuda: If the city eruv was made by way of the door and the door was closed, or if the city eruv was made by way of the window and the window was closed, what is the law? And he said to me: Shabbat, once it was permitted, it was permitted.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר, כּוֹתֶל שֶׁבֵּין שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת שֶׁנָּפַל, רַב אָמַר: אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין בּוֹ אֶלָּא בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: It is stated a wall between two courtyards, that collapsed Rav said: One may carry in only within four cubits,
llm_translation: It was stated: a wall between two courtyards that fell, Rav said: one may only carry within it for four cubits.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר:
human_translation: And Shmuel said:
llm_translation: And Shmuel said:

hebrew_text: זֶה מְטַלְטֵל עַד עִיקַּר מְחִיצָה, וְזֶה מְטַלְטֵל עַד עִיקַּר מְחִיצָה.
human_translation: This may carry to the base of the partition, and that may carry to the base of the partition,
llm_translation: This is movable until the essence of the partition, and this is movable until the essence of the partition.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דְּרַב לָאו בְּפֵירוּשׁ אִתְּמַר, אֶלָּא מִכְּלָלָא אִתְּמַר. דְּרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל הֲווֹ יָתְבִי בְּהָהוּא חָצֵר, נְפַל גּוּדָּא דְּבֵינֵי בֵּינֵי, אֲמַר לְהוּ שְׁמוּאֵל: שְׁקוּלוּ גְּלִימָא, נְגִידוּ בַּהּ.
human_translation: And this of Rav was not stated explicitly; rather, it was stated by inference; Rav and Shmuel were sitting in a certain courtyard the wall between fell. Shmuel said to Take a cloak suspend it on
llm_translation: The matter of Rav was not explicitly stated, rather it was implied. Rav and Shmuel were sitting in that courtyard, a wall between them collapsed. Shmuel said to them: "Take a cloak, cover yourselves with it."

hebrew_text: אַהְדְּרִינְהוּ רַב לְאַפֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ שְׁמוּאֵל: אִי קָפֵיד אַבָּא, שְׁקוּלוּ הֶמְיָינֵיהּ וּקְטַרוּ בָּהּ.
human_translation: Rav turned his face away, Shmuel said to them If Abba, is particular, take his belt tie it
llm_translation: He returned Rav to his place. Samuel said to them: If Abba is strict, check his wine and burn it.

hebrew_text: וְלִשְׁמוּאֵל לְמָה לִי הָא? הָא אָמַר: זֶה מְטַלְטֵל עַד עִיקַּר מְחִיצָה וְזֶה מְטַלְטֵל עַד עִיקַּר מְחִיצָה!
human_translation: And according to Shmuel, why was it necessary said: this may carry to the base of the partition, and that may carry to the base of the partition.
llm_translation: And to Shmuel, why do I need this? This one said: This is moving until the essence of the partition, and this is moving until the essence of the partition!

hebrew_text: שְׁמוּאֵל עָבֵיד לִצְנִיעוּתָא בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: Shmuel do merely for privacy,
llm_translation: Shmuel made for modesty in the world.

hebrew_text: וְרַב, אִי סְבִירָא לֵיהּ דַּאֲסִיר — לֵימָא לֵיהּ! אַתְרֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל הֲוָה.
human_translation: And Rav, if he maintains that prohibited, he should have said to him It was Shmuel’s place.
llm_translation: And Rav, if he thinks it is prohibited - let him say to him! The place of Shmuel was there.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי טַעְמָא אַהְדְּרִינְהוּ לְאַפֵּיהּ? דְּלָא נֵימְרוּ כִּשְׁמוּאֵל סְבִירָא לֵיהּ (וַהֲדַר בֵּיהּ מִשְּׁמַעְתֵּיהּ).
human_translation: If so, why did he turn his face away? that not say he holds in accordance with Shmuel, and he retracted his halakha .
llm_translation: Thus, what is the reason that they should turn it over to its face? Because they should not say, "Samuel is likely to him" (and he will retract from his opinion).

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חָצֵר שֶׁנִּפְרְצָה לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — הַמַּכְנִיס מִתּוֹכָהּ לִרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד, אוֹ מֵרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד לְתוֹכָהּ — חַיָּיב, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
human_translation: a courtyard that was breached into the public domain, one who carries from inside into the private domain, or from the private domain into it, is liable, the statement of Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Mishnah: A courtyard that was breached to the public domain— one who carries from within it to the private domain, or from the private domain to within it—is liable. These are the words of Rabbi Eliezer.
