hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מִתּוֹכָהּ לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים אוֹ מֵרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים לְתוֹכָהּ — פָּטוּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא כְּכַרְמְלִית.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: from inside into the public domain, or from the public domain into it, is exempt, because its is like a karmelit .
llm_translation: The sages say: from within it to the public domain or from the public domain into it — exempt, because it is like a Carmelit.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, מִשּׁוּם דְּנִפְרְצָה לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים הָוְיָא לַהּ רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים?! אִין, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְטַעְמֵיהּ,
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer, due to was breached into the public domain, it become the public domain? Yes, Rabbi Eliezer to his reasoning.
llm_translation: Gemara: And Rabbi Eliezer, because it broke into the public domain, should it be considered as part of the public domain?! No, Rabbi Eliezer maintains his reasoning,

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: רַבִּים שֶׁבֵּרְרוּ דֶּרֶךְ לְעַצְמָן, מַה שֶּׁבֵּרְרוּ בֵּרְרוּ.
human_translation: As it was taught Rabbi Yehuda said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: multitudes selected a path for themselves that they selected, they selected,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: Many who have scrutinized a path for themselves, what they have scrutinized, they have scrutinized.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָאָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: וְהוּא שֶׁאָבְדָה לָהֶן דֶּרֶךְ בְּאוֹתוֹ שָׂדֶה.
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rav Giddel say Rav said: And this if they had misplaced a path in that field.
llm_translation: I?! And didn't Rav Gidel say in the name of Rav: "And this is when they lost their way in that field."

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָכָא נָמֵי כְּגוֹן שֶׁאָבְדָה לָהֶן דֶּרֶךְ בְּאוֹתָהּ חָצֵר, וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: עַד מְקוֹם מְחִיצָה מַחֲלוֹקֶת.
human_translation: And if you say: Here too, where misplaced a path in that courtyard. But didn’t Rabbi Ḥanina say: dispute to [ad] the place of partition,
llm_translation: And if you will say: Here it is similar to a case where the path was lost to them in that courtyard, and Rabbi Chanina said: Until the place of the disputed partition.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: עַל מְקוֹם מְחִיצָה מַחֲלוֹקֶת.
human_translation: Say disagree over [ al ] the place of partition,
llm_translation: Mother: regarding the place of a partition there is a dispute.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, בְּצִידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר: צִידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — כִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים דָּמוּ, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי צִידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — לָאו כִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים דָּמוּ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say disagree with regard to the sides of a public domain. As Rabbi Eliezer maintains the sides of a public domain are considered like a public domain, And the Rabbis maintain the sides of a public domain are not considered like a public domain.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: In the side of the public domain he stumbled, for Rabbi Eliezer holds: The side of the public domain is like the public domain itself, and the Rabbis hold: The side of the public domain is not like the public domain itself.

hebrew_text: וְלִיפְלוֹג בְּצִידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים בְּעָלְמָא? אִי אִיפְּלִיגוּ בְּצִידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים בְּעָלְמָא, הֲוָה אָמְרִינַן: כִּי פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר — הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא חִיפּוּפֵי, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא חִיפּוּפֵי — אֵימָא מוֹדוּ לֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: let them disagree with regard to the sides of a public domain in general; Had they disagreed with regard to the sides of a public domain in general, we would have said: When do the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Eliezer? This applies only where there are stakes However, where there are no stakes, say they concede to him teaching us
llm_translation: To dispute in the side of the public domain in general? If they disputed in the side of the public domain in general, we would say: When the Rabbis disputed with Rabbi Eliezer — those matters where there is room for compromise, but where there is no room for compromise — say they concede to him, for it is evident to us.

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״מִתּוֹכָהּ״ קָאָמַר!
human_translation: But didn’t say from inside
llm_translation: And this, "from within it," he said!

hebrew_text: אַיְּידֵי דַּאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן ״מִתּוֹכָהּ״, אָמַר אִיהוּ נָמֵי ״מִתּוֹכָהּ״.
human_translation: As the Rabbis said: From inside also said: From inside
llm_translation: Through what the Rabbis said "from within it," he also said "from within it."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר צִידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, וּמַהְדְּרוּ לֵיהּ אִינְהוּ ״מִתּוֹכָהּ״!
human_translation: But, the Rabbis Rabbi Eliezer said the sides of the public domain and they replied to him From inside
llm_translation: The sages said, Rabbi Eliezer: hunting in a public domain, and they responded to him, "from within it"!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמְרִי לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: מִי לָא קָא מוֹדֵית לַן הֵיכָא דְּטִילְטֵל מִתּוֹכָהּ לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, וּמֵרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים לְתוֹכָהּ — דְּפָטוּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא כַּרְמְלִית? צִידֵּי נָמֵי לָא שְׁנָא.
human_translation: This is what the Rabbis are saying to Rabbi Eliezer: Don’t you concede to us where he carried from inside to the public domain, or from the public domain to that exempt, because is like a karmelit ? The sides no different, as well.
llm_translation: Thus were the Sages saying to Rabbi Eliezer: "Who does not agree with us here, where one throws an object from within it to the public domain, and from the public domain to within it — he is exempt, because it is like a Carmelite? The sides are not different."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, הָתָם לָא קָא דָרְסִי לַהּ רַבִּים, הָכָא קָא דָרְסִי לַהּ רַבִּים.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer There, the public does not tread on here, public treads on
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer, there he did not press the matter before the public, here he is pressing the matter before the public.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חָצֵר שֶׁנִּפְרְצָה לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים מִשְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹתֶיהָ, וְכֵן בַּיִת שֶׁנִּפְרַץ מִשְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹתָיו, וְכֵן מָבוֹי שֶׁנִּטְּלוּ קוֹרוֹתָיו אוֹ לְחָיָיו — מוּתָּרִים בְּאוֹתוֹ שַׁבָּת, וַאֲסוּרִים לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: a courtyard that was breached into a public domain from two its sides, and likewise a house that was breached from two its sides, and likewise an alleyway whose beams or side posts were removed are permitted on that Shabbat, but are prohibited in the future. the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Mishnah: A courtyard that was breached into the public domain from two of its sides, and similarly a house that was breached from two of its sides, and likewise an alleyway whose beams or walls were removed - they are permitted on that Sabbath, but forbidden in the future. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אִם מוּתָּרִין לְאוֹתוֹ שַׁבָּת — מוּתָּרִין לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא, וְאִם אֲסוּרִין לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא — אֲסוּרִין לְאוֹתוֹ שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: if they are permitted on that Shabbat, they are permitted in the future, and if they are prohibited in the future, they are prohibited on that Shabbat.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: If they are permitted on that Sabbath, they are permitted for the future to come, and if they are forbidden for the future to come, they are forbidden on that Sabbath.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בְּעֶשֶׂר, מַאי שְׁנָא מֵרוּחַ אַחַת דְּאָמַר פִּיתְחָא הוּא, מִשְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹת נָמֵי פִּיתְחָא הוּא! אֶלָּא בְּיָתֵר מֵעֶשֶׂר, אִי הָכִי — אֲפִילּוּ מֵרוּחַ אַחַת נָמֵי!
human_translation: With what are we dealing? If you say where ten what is on one side different? that we say: It is an entrance on two sides as well, It is an entrance, Rather, with greater than ten If so, even on one side,
llm_translation: We are dealing with what? If you say with ten, what difference is there from one spirit that it says "opening" - it is also from two spirits that it says "opening"! Rather, with more than ten. If so - even from one spirit also!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: לְעוֹלָם בְּעֶשֶׂר,
human_translation: Rav said: Actually, with ten
llm_translation: Rav said: Always with ten,

hebrew_text: וּכְגוֹן שֶׁנִּפְרְצָה בְּקֶרֶן זָוִית. דְּפִיתְחָא בְּקֶרֶן זָוִית לָא עָבְדִי אִינָשֵׁי.
human_translation: and where was breached in a corner, as people do not build an entrance in a corner.
llm_translation: "And for example, if it broke at a corner horn. For at the opening of a corner horn, people did not perform."

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בַּיִת שֶׁנִּפְרַץ מִשְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹתָיו. מַאי שְׁנָא מֵרוּחַ אַחַת, דְּאָמְרִינַן: פִּי תִקְרָה יוֹרֵד וְסוֹתֵם. מִשְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹת נָמֵי לֵימָא: פִּי תִקְרָה יוֹרֵד וְסוֹתֵם!
human_translation: And likewise, a house that was breached from two of its sides what is on one side different? that we say: The edge of the roof descends and seals So too, on two sides, let us say: The edge of the roof descends and seals.
llm_translation: And so too a house that was breached from two of its sides. What is the difference from one side? For we say: "The mouth that calls out descends and seals." If breached from two sides, let us also say: "The mouth that calls out descends and seals!"

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַב מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּפְרַץ בְּקֶרֶן זָוִית וְקֵירוּיוֹ בַּאֲלַכְסוֹן, דְּלֵיכָּא לְמֵימַר פִּי תִקְרָה יוֹרֵד וְסוֹתֵם.
human_translation: The school of Rav said in the name of Rav: where was breached in a corner, and its roofing was inclined, as one cannot say: The edge of the roof descends and seals,
llm_translation: The House of Rav said in the name of Rav: For example, if one broke through the corner of a beam and its plaster is on a slant, there is no need to say that the mouth of the ceiling descends and seals it.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ בְּיָתֵר מֵעֶשֶׂר. אִי הָכִי, מֵרוּחַ אַחַת נָמֵי!
human_translation: And Shmuel said: even wider than ten If so, even from one side.
llm_translation: And Shmuel said: Even with more than a tithe. If so, from one spirit indeed!

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם בַּיִת.
human_translation: due to a house.
llm_translation: Because of a house.

hebrew_text: וּבַיִת גּוּפֵיהּ תִּקְשֵׁי: מַאי שְׁנָא מֵרוּחַ אַחַת, דְּאָמְרִינַן פִּי תִקְרָה יוֹרֵד וְסוֹתֵם, מִשְּׁתֵּי רוּחוֹת נָמֵי נֵימָא: פִּי תִקְרָה יוֹרֵד וְסוֹתֵם!
human_translation: But a house itself should pose a difficulty what is on one side different? that we say: The edge of the roof descends and seals So too, on two sides, let us say: The edge of the roof descends and seals.
llm_translation: The text is difficult in its essence: What is the difference between one spirit, as we say, "The mouth of the roof descends and seals," and two spirits, it is properly stated: "The mouth of the roof descends and seals!"

hebrew_text: וְתוּ: מִי אִית לֵיהּ לִשְׁמוּאֵל פִּי תִקְרָה יוֹרֵד וְסוֹתֵם? וְהָא אִתְּמַר: אַכְסַדְרָה בְּבִקְעָה, רַב אָמַר: מוּתָּר לְטַלְטֵל בְּכוּלָּהּ, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין בָּהּ אֶלָּא בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת!
human_translation: And furthermore: Is Shmuel of The edge of a roof descends and seals? But wasn’t it stated portico in a valley, Rav said: is permitted to carry in the entire And Shmuel said: One may carry only within four cubits.
llm_translation: And come: who has to Shmuel a mouth of a roof descending and sealing? And this it was said: a balcony in a valley, Rav said: permitted to move in its entirety, and Shmuel said: one may only move within it four cubits!

hebrew_text: הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא: כִּי לֵית לֵיהּ — בְּאַרְבַּע, אֲבָל בְּשָׁלֹשׁ — אִית לֵיהּ.
human_translation: This not a difficulty. Where is not of with regard to four However, with regard to three he is of
llm_translation: This is not difficult: if it does not have - in four, but in three - it has.

hebrew_text: מִכׇּל מָקוֹם קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: In any case, difficult.
llm_translation: From every place it is difficult!

hebrew_text: כִּדְאָמְרִי בֵּי רַב מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּפְרַץ בְּקֶרֶן זָוִית וְקֵירוּיוֹ בַּאֲלַכְסוֹן, הָכָא נָמֵי, כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּפְרַץ בְּקֶרֶן זָוִית וְקֵירוּיוֹ בְּאַרְבַּע.
human_translation: as the school of Rav said in the name of Rav: where was breached in a corner, and its roofing was inclined, Here too, where was breached in a corner, and its roof is of four
llm_translation: As the House of Rav said in the name of Rav: For example, if it broke through a corner horn and its covering diagonally, here it is stated, for example, if it broke through a corner horn and its covering in four.

hebrew_text: שְׁמוּאֵל לֹא אָמַר כְּרַב, אֲלַכְסוֹן לָא קָתָנֵי. וְרַב לָא אָמַר כִּשְׁמוּאֵל, אִם כֵּן הָוְיָא לֵיהּ אַכְסַדְרָה, וְרַב לְטַעְמֵיהּ דְּאָמַר: אַכְסַדְרָה מוּתָּר לְטַלְטֵל בְּכוּלָּהּ.
human_translation: Shmuel did not say in accordance with Rav, as does not teach slanted, And Rav did not say in accordance with Shmuel, if so, its a portico, and Rav to his reasoning, as he said: a portico, it is permitted to carry throughout the entire
llm_translation: Samuel did not say like Rav, Alexandrian is not a small measure. And Rav did not say like Samuel, if so, it would be appropriate for him to arrange it, and Rav according to his reasoning that he said: arranging it is permitted to move it entirely.

hebrew_text: דְּאִיתְּמַר, אַכְסַדְרָה בְּבִקְעָה. רַב אָמַר: מוּתָּר לְטַלְטֵל בְּכוּלָּהּ. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין בָּהּ אֶלָּא בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: As it was stated Rav said: is permitted to carry in the entire And Shmuel said: One may carry only within four cubits.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If it is arranged in a row in a valley. Rav said: It is permitted to move it entirely. And Shmuel said: One may only move it within four cubits.

hebrew_text: רַב אָמַר: מוּתָּר לְטַלְטֵל בְּכוּלָּהּ, אָמְרִינַן פִּי תִקְרָה יוֹרֵד וְסוֹתֵם. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין בָּהּ אֶלָּא בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, לָא אָמְרִינַן פִּי תִקְרָה יוֹרֵד וְסוֹתֵם.
human_translation: Rav said: It is permitted to carry in the entire we say: The edge of the roof descends and seals And Shmuel said: One may carry only within four cubits, we do not say: The edge of the ceiling descends and seals.
llm_translation: Rav said: It is permitted to carry throughout it, we say: the mouth of the roof descends and closes. And Shmuel said: One may only carry within it for four cubits, we do not say: the mouth of the roof descends and closes.

hebrew_text: בְּעֶשֶׂר — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי. כִּי פְּלִיגִי — בְּיָתֵר מֵעֶשֶׂר.
human_translation: ten everyone agrees They disagree where more than ten
llm_translation: In ten - all the world does not argue. When they argue - in more than ten.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, בְּיָתֵר — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי. כִּי פְּלִיגִי — בְּעֶשֶׂר.
human_translation: And some say: more everyone agrees They disagree where ten
llm_translation: And there are those who say, in Yatir - everyone does not argue. When they do argue - it is about ten.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה:
human_translation: And that which Rav Yehuda said:
llm_translation: And this that Rav Yehudah said:

hebrew_text: קוֹרָה אַרְבָּעָה מַתִּיר בְּחוּרְבָּה, וְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: קוֹרָה אַרְבָּעָה מַתִּיר בְּמַיִם, מַנִּי?
human_translation: A beam four renders in a ruin permitted, And Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: A beam four renders in water permitted whose
llm_translation: The board (korah) of four permits in a sword, and Rav Nachman said Rabba bar Avuh: The board of four permits in water, wherefrom?

hebrew_text: לְהַךְ לִישָּׁנָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ בְּעֶשֶׂר לָא פְּלִיגִי: בְּעֶשֶׂר, וְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל. לְהַךְ לִישָּׁנָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ בְּעֶשֶׂר פְּלִיגִי: כְּרַב.
human_translation: According to this version that you stated, agree with regard to ten to ten and everyone, agrees According to that version that you stated, they disagree with regard to ten in accordance with Rav
llm_translation: To strike the earlier statement that they do not argue on ten: on ten, and the words of everyone. To strike the earlier statement that they argue on ten: like Rav.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּאִיתְּמַר: סִיכֵּךְ עַל גַּבֵּי אַכְסַדְרָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ פַּצִּימִין — כְּשֵׁירָה, אֵין לָהּ פַּצִּימִין, אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: כְּשֵׁירָה, וְרָבָא אָמַר: פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: Let us say Abaye and Rava are disagreeing with regard to the dispute between Rav and Shmuel. As it was stated: placed roofing on top of a portico that has doorposts, it is a valid sukka . has no doorposts, Abaye said: It is a valid sukka . And Rava said: It is invalid.
llm_translation: Let Abaye and Rava argue in the dispute of Rav and Shmuel, for it was stated: If a bed has crossbars, if it has pegs - it is valid; if it does not have pegs - Abaye said: it is valid, and Rava said: it is invalid.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר כְּשֵׁירָה, אָמַר פִּי תִקְרָה יוֹרֵד וְסוֹתֵם. וְרָבָא אָמַר פְּסוּלָה, לָא אָמַר פִּי תִקְרָה יוֹרֵד וְסוֹתֵם. לֵימָא אַבָּיֵי כְּרַב, וְרָבָא כִּשְׁמוּאֵל?
human_translation: Abaye said: It is valid. he said: The edge of a roof descends and seals. And Rava said: It is invalid, he did not say: The edge of a roof descends and seals. Let us say Abaye in accordance with Rav, and Rava in accordance with Shmuel?
llm_translation: Abaye said: When it is kosher, the mouth of the roof descends and seals. And Rava said: When it is pasul, he did not say the mouth of the roof descends and seals. Let us say, Abaye is like Rav, and Rava is like Shmuel?

hebrew_text: אַלִּיבָּא דִשְׁמוּאֵל כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְלִיגִי. כִּי פְּלִיגִי אַלִּיבָּא דְרַב: אַבָּיֵי כְּרַב. וְרָבָא — עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַב הָתָם, אֶלָּא דְּהָנֵי מְחִיצוֹת לְאַכְסַדְרָה עֲבִידִי. אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּהָנֵי מְחִיצוֹת לָאו לְסוּכָּה עֲבִידִי — לָא.
human_translation: According to Shmuel, everyone, agrees Where they disagree according to Rav. Abaye in accordance with Rav And Rava Rav stated only there, where those partitions were built for the portico, However, here, where these partitions were not built for sukka , no,
llm_translation: In the matter of Shmuel, everyone does not disagree. For they disagree in the matter of Rav: Abbaye is like Rav. And Rava—up to here Rav did not say there, rather, those partitions are made for a permanent structure. But here, where those partitions are not made for a sukkah, they are not made.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אִם מוּתָּרִין. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לֶאֱסוֹר, אוֹ לְהַתִּיר?
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: If they are permitted A dilemma was raised before Rabbi Yosei to prohibit or to permit
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: If permitted. Rabbi Yosei asked them: Should I forbid or permit?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: לֶאֱסוֹר. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לֶאֱסוֹר. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאֲסוּרִין לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא, כָּךְ אֲסוּרִין לְאוֹתוֹ שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: to prohibit And similarly, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: to prohibit This was also taught Rabbi Yosei said: Just as they are prohibited in the future, so are they prohibited on that Shabbat.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: to prohibit. And so said Rabbi Yochanan: to prohibit. It was also taught similarly: Rabbi Yosei said: Just as they are prohibited in the future, so too they are prohibited on that Shabbat.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, רַב חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: It was stated: Rav Ḥiyya bar Yosef said halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, while Shmuel said halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav Chiya bar Yosef said: The halacha is according to Rabbi Yosei, and Shmuel said: The halacha is according to Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל הָכִי?! וְהָתְנַן, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים, בְּעֵירוּבֵי תְחוּמִין. אֲבָל בְּעֵירוּבֵי חֲצֵירוֹת — מְעָרְבִין בֵּין לְדַעַת בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא לְדַעַת, לְפִי שֶׁזָּכִין לְאָדָם שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו, וְאֵין חָבִין שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו.
human_translation: But did Shmuel say this? Didn’t we learn Rabbi Yehuda said: In what are these matters, stated? with regard to a joining of boundaries, but with regard to a joining of courtyards, one may establish an eiruv both with his knowledge and without his knowledge, because one may act in a person’s interest not in his presence, but one may act to disadvantage only in his presence.
llm_translation: And who said thus, Samuel?! And it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said: In what case are these words said? In the case of combining the limits. But in the case of combining the courtyards, one may combine whether intentionally or unintentionally, because we can acquire on behalf of a person not in his presence, and we can combine on behalf of a person not in his presence.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁשָּׁנָה רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּעֵירוּבִין — הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. And furthermore, anyplace where Rabbi Yehuda taught with regard to eiruv , the halakha is in accordance with his
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yehudah. Moreover, in every place that Rabbi Yehudah changed in the laws of Eruvin - the halakha is like him.

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חָנָא בַּגְדָּתָאָה לְרַב יְהוּדָה: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל אֲפִילּוּ בְּמָבוֹי שֶׁנִּיטַּל קוֹרָתוֹ אוֹ לְחָיָיו? וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּעֵירוּבִין אָמַרְתִּי לְךָ, וְלֹא בִּמְחִיצוֹת.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥana of Baghdad said to Rav Yehuda: Shmuel state even with regard to an alleyway whose beam or side post was removed And said to him: I spoke to you with regard to an eiruv , and not with regard to partitions.
llm_translation: And he said to him, Rav Ḥanina said to Rav Yehuda: Shmuel said, even in an alleyway whose beam or walls were removed? And he said to him: I spoke to you about eruvim, not about partitions.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב עָנָן: לְדִידִי מִיפָּרְשָׁא לִי מִינֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: כָּאן שֶׁנִּפְרְצָה לְכַרְמְלִית, כָּאן שֶׁנִּפְרְצָה לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים.
human_translation: Rav Anan said: was explained to me by Shmuel Here, where was breached into a karmelit . There, where was breached into a public domain,
llm_translation: Rav Anan said: According to my understanding of the words of Shmuel: Here where it broke into the Carmelite domain, here where it broke into the public domain.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַבּוֹנֶה עֲלִיָּיה עַל גַּבֵּי שְׁנֵי בָתִּים, וְכֵן גְּשָׁרִים הַמְפוּלָּשִׁים — מְטַלְטְלִין תַּחְתֵּיהֶן בַּשַּׁבָּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹסְרִין.
human_translation: one who builds an upper story atop two houses and likewise bridges with a thoroughfare one carry beneath on Shabbat. the statement of Rabbi Yehuda, And the Rabbis prohibit
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who constructs an upper story above two houses, and likewise suspended bridges - one may carry underneath them on Shabbat, according to the words of Rabbi Yehuda. But the Sages prohibit it.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מְעָרְבִין לְמָבוֹי הַמְפוּלָּשׁ. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹסְרִין.
human_translation: And furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda said: One establish an eiruv for an alleyway that is open and the Rabbis prohibit
llm_translation: And furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda said: One may combine the eruv for a mavo that is breached. But the sages prohibit doing so.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבָּה: לָא תֵּימָא הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא סָבַר שְׁתֵּי מְחִיצוֹת דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא. אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּקָסָבַר: פִּי תִקְרָה יוֹרֵד וְסוֹתֵם.
human_translation: Rabba said: Do not say this is Rabbi Yehuda’s reason; that he maintains by Torah law two partitions because he maintains the edge of a roof descends and seals.
llm_translation: Gemara said Rabba: Do not say this is the reason of Rabbi Yehuda because he holds that there are two biblical partitions. Rather, because he holds: the mouth of the roof descends and closes.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: יָתֵר עַל כֵּן אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ שְׁנֵי בָתִּים מִשְּׁנֵי צִידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, עוֹשֶׂה לֶחִי מִכָּאן וְלֶחִי מִכָּאן, אוֹ קוֹרָה מִכָּאן וְקוֹרָה מִכָּאן, וְנוֹשֵׂא וְנוֹתֵן בָּאֶמְצַע. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵין מְעָרְבִין רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים בְּכָךְ!
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to Furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda said: one who has two houses on two sides of a public domain he places a side post from here, and side post from there, or a beam from here and beam from there, and he may carry and place in the middle said to him: One cannot establish an eiruv public domain in this manner.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Abaye: Furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda said: One who has two houses on two sides of a public domain, he makes an alleyway from here and an alleyway from here, or a beam from here and a beam from here, and carries back and forth in the middle. They said to him: One may not combine a public domain in this way!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מֵהַהִיא — אִין, מֵהָא — לֵיכָּא לְמִשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: said to him: From that yes, from this, nothing can be learned from this
llm_translation: He said to him: From there - no, from here - you can infer it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי דַּיְקָא, מִדְּקָתָנֵי: וְעוֹד אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מְעָרְבִין בְּמָבוֹי הַמְפוּלָּשׁ, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹסְרִין.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: The mishna is also precise As teaches: And furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda said: One establish an eiruv for an alleyway that is open and the Rabbis prohibit
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: The Mishnah also supports this, as it teaches: "And furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda said: One may combine the courtyards in a breached alleyway, but the Sages prohibit doing so."

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא סָבַר פִּי תִקְרָה יוֹרֵד וְסוֹתֵם — הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי ״וְעוֹד״.
human_translation: Granted, if you say that he maintains the edge of a roof descends and seals, that is states: And furthermore,
llm_translation: If you say, "It is understandable because he holds that the mouthpiece descends and seals," that is what is taught in the word "and furthermore."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא סָבַר שְׁתֵּי מְחִיצוֹת דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — מַאי ״וְעוֹד״?! שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: However, if you say because he maintains by Torah law two partitions what And furthermore? learn from here
llm_translation: Rather, if you say that he holds that two partitions of biblical origin - what is the meaning of "and furthermore"? Learn from it.

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ כׇּל גַּגּוֹת
llm_translation: We will return to you, all rooftops.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמּוֹצֵא תְּפִילִּין — מַכְנִיסָן זוּג זוּג. רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: שְׁנַיִם שְׁנַיִם. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בִּישָׁנוֹת, אֲבָל בַּחֲדָשׁוֹת — פָּטוּר.
human_translation: One who finds phylacteries brings them in pair pair Rabban Gamliel says: two two In what is this statement said? with regard to old However, with regard to new exempt
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who finds phylacteries - he should bring them in pairs. Rabban Gamliel says: Two by two. In what case are these words said? In regard to old ones, but in regard to new ones - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: מְצָאָן צְבָתִים אוֹ כְרִיכוֹת — מַחְשִׁיךְ עֲלֵיהֶן וּמְבִיאָן.
human_translation: one finds tied in bundles or in wrapped piles, he waits with them until dark, and brings them in
llm_translation: Found eggs or chicks - cover them and bring them.

hebrew_text: וּבַסַּכָּנָה — מְכַסָּן וְהוֹלֵךְ לוֹ.
human_translation: And in danger, he covers and proceeds on his
llm_translation: "And in the Sukkah - he covers and walks to it."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: נוֹתְנָן לַחֲבֵירוֹ, וַחֲבֵירוֹ לַחֲבֵירוֹ, עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לֶחָצֵר הַחִיצוֹנָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says One gives them to another and the other to another, until reach the outermost courtyard
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: One gives to his fellow, and his fellow to his fellow, until it reaches the outer courtyard.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בְּנוֹ — נוֹתְנוֹ לַחֲבֵירוֹ, וַחֲבֵירוֹ לַחֲבֵירוֹ, אֲפִילּוּ מֵאָה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: נוֹתֵן אָדָם חָבִית לַחֲבֵירוֹ, וַחֲבֵירוֹ לַחֲבֵירוֹ, אֲפִילּוּ חוּץ לַתְּחוּם. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לֹא תְּהַלֵּךְ זוֹ יוֹתֵר מֵרַגְלֵי בְעָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: And similarly, one’s son One gives him to another, and the other to another, even a hundred Rabbi Yehuda says: A person give a barrel to another, and the other to another, even beyond the limit, They said to him: This not go a greater than the feet of its owner,
llm_translation: And so with his son — he gives to his friend, and his friend to his friend, even a hundred. Rabbi Yehuda says: A person gives a barrel to his friend, and his friend to his friend, even outside the boundary. They said to him: Do not walk this more than the feet of its owner.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ זוּג אֶחָד אִין, טְפֵי — לָא. לֵימָא תְּנַן סְתָמָא דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר?
human_translation: one pair, yes, more no, Let us say we learned the unattributed not in accordance with Rabbi Meir,
llm_translation: Gemara: "G'ma ẓug e ḥad ein, t'fei - la. Leima tenan setama d'la keRabbi Meir?"

hebrew_text: דְּאִי כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, הָאָמַר: לוֹבֵשׁ כׇּל מַה שֶּׁיָּכוֹל לִלְבּוֹשׁ, וְעוֹטֵף כׇּל מַה שֶּׁיָּכוֹל לַעֲטוֹף. דִּתְנַן: וּלְשָׁם מוֹצִיא כׇּל כְּלֵי תַשְׁמִישׁוֹ, וְלוֹבֵשׁ כׇּל מַה שֶּׁיָּכוֹל לִלְבּוֹשׁ, וְעוֹטֵף כׇּל מַה שֶּׁיָּכוֹל לַעֲטוֹף.
human_translation: As, if in accordance with Rabbi Meir, didn’t say: he dons all that he can wear, and wraps in all which he can wrap As we learned And one removes all the utensils to and dons all that he can wear, and wraps all which he can wrap
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If like Rabbi Meir, who said: One should wear all that he can wear, and wrap himself in all that he can wrap. As we learned in a Mishnah: And to there he brings out all his utensils, and wears all that he can wear, and wraps himself in all that he can wrap.

hebrew_text: וְהַהִיא סְתָמָא, מִמַּאי דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא? דְּקָתָנֵי עֲלַהּ: לוֹבֵשׁ וּמוֹצִיא וּפוֹשֵׁט, וְלוֹבֵשׁ וּמוֹצִיא וּפוֹשֵׁט, אֲפִילּוּ כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: And from where this unattributed is Rabbi Meir? As it teaches with regard to dons takes out and removes and returns and dons and takes out and removes And even all day long; the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: And that anonymous Mishnah, from where is it according to Rabbi Meir? For it teaches regarding it: He may dress, remove, and dress, and even the entire day, all of it, are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, הָתָם דֶּרֶךְ מַלְבּוּשׁוֹ — כְּחוֹל שַׁוְויֻהּ רַבָּנַן, וְהָכָא דֶּרֶךְ מַלְבּוּשׁוֹ — כְּחוֹל שַׁוְויֻהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rava said: Even if you say Rabbi Meir, There, the manner that he wears them, the Sages rendered like week And here, the manner that he dons them, the Sages rendered like week.
llm_translation: Rava said: Even if you say it is Rabbi Meir, there, the way his garment is - like a sand equal to the Sages, and here, the way his garment is - like a sand equal to the Sages.

hebrew_text: הָתָם דִּבְחוֹל כַּמָּה דְּבָעֵי לָבֵישׁ, לְעִנְיַן הַצָּלָה נָמֵי שָׁרוּ לֵיה רַבָּנַן. הָכָא דִּבְחוֹל נָמֵי זוּג אֶחָד — אִין, טְפֵי — לָא, לְעִנְיַן הַצָּלָה נָמֵי זוּג אֶחָד — אִין, טְפֵי — לָא.
human_translation: there, where during the week he wear as many as he wishes, with regard to rescue the Sages likewise permitted him here, even during the week, one pair, yes, more no, with regard to rescue as well, one pair, yes, more no,
llm_translation: There, in the case of weekday garments, as much as the Sages require for the purpose of protection, they permitted. Here, in the case of weekday garments, even one pair - no, two pairs - no, for the purpose of protection, even one pair - no, two pairs - no.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: שְׁנַיִם שְׁנַיִם. מַאי קָסָבַר? אִי קָסָבַר שַׁבָּת זְמַן תְּפִילִּין הוּא, זוּג אֶחָד — אִין, טְפֵי — לָא.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: two by two What does he hold? If he holds Shabbat is a time for phylacteries, one pair, yes, more, no,
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: "Two by two." What does he hold? If he holds that Shabbat is the time for Tefillin, one pair is yes, one pair is no.

hebrew_text: וְאִי קָסָבַר שַׁבָּת לָאו זְמַן תְּפִילִּין הוּא, וּמִשּׁוּם הַצָּלָה דֶּרֶךְ מַלְבּוּשׁ שָׁרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן, אֲפִילּוּ טְפֵי נָמֵי!
human_translation: And if he holds Shabbat is not a time for phylacteries, and due to rescue manner clothing the Sages permitted him likewise even more
llm_translation: And if he holds that Shabbat is not a time for Tefillin, and due to the concern for danger, the Sages permitted him to wear it as a garment, even more so!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם קָסָבַר שַׁבָּת לָאו זְמַן תְּפִילִּין הוּא, וְכִי שְׁרוֹ רַבָּנַן לְעִנְיַן הַצָּלָה — דֶּרֶךְ מַלְבּוּשׁ בִּמְקוֹם תְּפִילִּין.
human_translation: Actually, he holds Shabbat is not a time for phylacteries, and when the Sages permitted for the purpose of rescue, manner clothing, place phylacteries.
llm_translation: Always he holds that Shabbat is not a time for Tefillin, and when did the Rabbis permit it for the purpose of protection? It is in the manner of wearing in a place of Tefillin.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי זוּג אֶחָד נָמֵי — אֵין, טְפֵי — לָא! אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק: מָקוֹם יֵשׁ בָּרֹאשׁ לְהַנִּיחַ בּוֹ שְׁתֵּי תְפִילִּין.
human_translation: If so, one pair, yes, more, no, Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak said: There is room on head to place two phylacteries.
llm_translation: So it is, one pair is equivalent - no, two pairs! Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzchak said: There is a place on the head to place two Tefillin.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא דְּרֹאשׁ, דְּיָד מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: It works out well of the head, of the arm, what is there to say?
llm_translation: The resting place of the head, what is there to say about the hand?

hebrew_text: כִּדְרַב הוּנָא, דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: פְּעָמִים שֶׁאָדָם בָּא מִן הַשָּׂדֶה וַחֲבִילָתוֹ עַל רֹאשׁוֹ, וּמְסַלְּקָן מֵרֹאשׁוֹ וְקוֹשְׁרָן בִּזְרוֹעוֹ.
human_translation: in accordance with Rav Huna. As Rav Huna said: Sometimes a person comes from the field with his bundle on his head, removes them from his head and binds them on his arm.
llm_translation: Like Rav Huna, for Rav Huna said: Sometimes a person comes from the field and his bundle is on his head, and he removes it from his head and ties it on his arm.

hebrew_text: אֵימַר דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא, שֶׁלֹּא יִנְהַג בָּהֶן דֶּרֶךְ בִּזָּיוֹן. רָאוּי מִי אָמַר?
human_translation: Say that Rav Huna said so that he will not treat in a degrading manner did he say fit
llm_translation: Statement: As said Rav Huna, that one should not conduct themselves with them in a disrespectful manner. Who is fit to say?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כִּדְאָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק: מָקוֹם יֵשׁ בָּרֹאשׁ שֶׁרָאוּי לְהַנִּיחַ בּוֹ שְׁתֵּי תְפִילִּין. הָכָא נָמֵי, מָקוֹם יֵשׁ בַּיָּד שֶׁרָאוּי לְהַנִּיחַ בּוֹ שְׁתֵּי תְפִילִּין.
human_translation: Rather, in accordance with Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak said: There is room on head to place two phylacteries. Here, too, there is room on the arm to place two phylacteries.
llm_translation: Rather, as Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzchak said: There is a place on the head that is fitting to place two Tefillin. Here too, there is a place on the arm that is fitting to place two Tefillin.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא דְבֵי מְנַשֶּׁה: ״עַל יָדְךָ״ — זוֹ קִיבּוֹרֶת, ״בֵּין עֵינֶיךָ״ — זוֹ קׇדְקֹד. הֵיכָא? אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: מְקוֹם שֶׁמּוֹחוֹ שֶׁל תִּינוֹק רוֹפֵס.
human_translation: The school of Menashe taught “On your arm,” this is the biceps “between your eyes,” this is the crown Where The school of Rabbi Yannai say: the spot where a baby’s head is soft
llm_translation: Tana d'bei Menashe: "Al yadecha" - this is burial, "bein einecha" - this is the skull. Where? The House of Rabbi Yannai said: the soft spot of an infant's skull.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא בִּדְרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא לֵית לֵיהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק, וְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אִית לֵיהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק?
human_translation: Let us say that disagree about Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak, that the first tanna is not Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak while Rabban Gamliel is of Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak,
llm_translation: Let us say in the name of Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzchak Kampilgi, as it was taught: In the first instance, there is no Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzchak, and does Rabban Gamliel have a Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzchak?

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אִית לְהוּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק, וְהָכָא בְּשַׁבָּת זְמַן תְּפִילִּין קָמִיפַּלְגִי. דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: שַׁבָּת זְמַן תְּפִילִּין הוּא.
human_translation: No, everyone is Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak, and here they disagree with regard to Shabbat is a time for phylacteries. The first tanna holds Shabbat is a time for phylacteries.
llm_translation: Not, for all the world, there is to him Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzchak, and here on Shabbat, the time of Tefillin he argues. For it was taught: In the first clause, he holds: Shabbat is the time for Tefillin.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סָבַר: שַׁבָּת לָאו זְמַן תְּפִילִּין הוּא.
human_translation: And Rabban Gamliel holds Shabbat is not a time for phylacteries.
llm_translation: And Rabban Gamliel holds: Shabbat is not a time for Tefillin.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא שַׁבָּת זְמַן תְּפִילִּין הוּא, וְהָכָא בְּמִצְוֹת צְרִיכוֹת כַּוּוֹנָה קָמִיפַּלְגִי. תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: לָצֵאת בָּעֵי כַּוּוֹנָה.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Everyone agrees that Shabbat is a time for phylacteries, and here they disagree with regard to mitzvot requires intent. The first tanna holds: To fulfill needs intent.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: The entire world is Shabbat, a time for Tefillin, and here in matters of Mitzvot, intention is required. The first Tanna holds: For the fulfillment of the Mitzvah, intention is necessary.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סָבַר: לָא בָּעֵי כַּוּוֹנָה.
human_translation: And Rabban Gamliel holds: one does not need intent.
llm_translation: And Rabban Gamliel holds: "It does not require intention."

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָצֵאת לָא בָּעֵי כַּוּוֹנָה, וְהָכָא לַעֲבוֹר מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תּוֹסִיף״ קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: לַעֲבוֹר מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תּוֹסִיף״ לָא בָּעֵי כַּוּוֹנָה. וְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סָבַר: לַעֲבוֹר מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תּוֹסִיף״ בָּעֵי כַּוּוֹנָה.
human_translation: And if you wish, say everyone agrees to fulfill one does not need intent, and here they disagree with regard to to violate Do not add As the first tanna holds one does not need intent to violate Do not add And Rabban Gamliel holds to violate Do not add one needs intent
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: In all the world, to go out does not require intent, and here, to pass through due to "do not add" he disputes, for the first Tanna holds: to pass through due to "do not add" does not require intent. And Rabban Gamliel holds: to pass through due to "do not add" does require intent.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: אִי דִּסְבִירָא לַן דְּשַׁבָּת זְמַן תְּפִילִּין — דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא לַעֲבוֹר בָּעֵי כַּוּוֹנָה וְלָא לָצֵאת בָּעֵי כַּוּוֹנָה.
human_translation: And if you wish, say If we were to maintain Shabbat is time for phylacteries, everyone agree one does not need intent to violate nor does one need intent to fulfill
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: If it seems to us that Shabbat is the time for Tefillin - the entire world does not require intent to fulfill and does not require intent to exempt.

hebrew_text: וְהָכָא בְּ״לַעֲבוֹר שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנּוֹ״ קָמִיפַּלְגִי. תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: לָא בָּעֵי כַּוּוֹנָה. וְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סָבַר: לַעֲבוֹר שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנּוֹ בָּעֵי כַּוּוֹנָה.
human_translation: However, here, they disagree with regard to violating not in its time, The first tanna holds one does not need intent; And Rabban Gamliel holds that to violate not in its time, one needs intent
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "And here, regarding 'to pass over not in its proper time,' they disagree. The first Tanna holds: it does not require intent. And Rabban Gamliel holds: 'to pass over not in its proper time' requires intent."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר זוּג אֶחָד נָמֵי לָא.
human_translation: If so, according to Rabbi Meir not even one pair
llm_translation: If so, to Rabbi Meir, one pair is not considered two.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד: הַיָּשֵׁן בַּשְּׁמִינִי בְּסוּכָּה יִלְקֶה! אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא כִדְשַׁנִּינַן מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: And furthermore, one who sleeps in a sukka on the Eighth Day should be flogged Rather, it is clear as we originally answered,
llm_translation: And furthermore: one who sleeps on the eighth night in a sukkah is exempt! Rather, it must be understood as we have explained initially.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ שַׁבָּת זְמַן תְּפִילִּין? רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְשָׁמַרְתָּ אֶת הַחֻקָּה הַזֹּאת לְמוֹעֲדָהּ מִיָּמִים יָמִימָה״. ״יָמִים״ — וְלֹא לֵילוֹת. ״מִיָּמִים״ — וְלֹא כׇּל יָמִים, פְּרָט לְשַׁבָּתוֹת וְיָמִים טוֹבִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי.
human_translation: Whom did you hear Shabbat is time for phylacteries? Rabbi Akiva, as it was taught “And you shall observe this ordinance in its season from year [ miyamim ] to year” days yamim and not nights. “from year” [ miyamim ] But not all days; excludes Shabbat and Festivals, the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who heard from him that Shabbat is the time for Tefillin? Rabbi Akiva. As it was taught: 'And you shall observe this statute at its appointed time, from days to days.' 'Days' - but not nights. 'From days' - but not every day, excluding Sabbaths and festivals." These are the words of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: לֹא נֶאֱמַר חוּקָּה זוֹ אֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן פֶּסַח בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: This ordinance is stated only with regard to the Paschal
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: It was not stated "this statute" except for the matter of Passover alone.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָא דִּתְנַן: הַפֶּסַח וְהַמִּילָה מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה — לֵימָא דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּאִי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא — כֵּיוָן דְּמוֹקֵי לָהּ בְּפֶסַח, לָאו נָמֵי אִיכָּא, כִּדְרַבִּי אָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעַאי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעַאי: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״הִשָּׁמֶר״ ״פֶּן״ וְ״אַל״ — אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בְּלֹא תַּעֲשֶׂה!
human_translation: But that we learned the Paschal and circumcision are positive mitzvot, let us say that not in accordance with Rabbi Akiva. that if Rabbi Akiva, since he establishes to the Paschal is also a negative in accordance with that Rabbi Avin Rabbi Elai said. As Rabbi Avin said Rabbi Elai said: Any place it is stated: Observe, lest, or do not, nothing other than a negative
llm_translation: And rather this that we learned: The Pesach and circumcision are positive commandments — let us say that it is not like Rabbi Akiva, for if it were like Rabbi Akiva — since he establishes it with Pesach, it is not so, as Rabbi Avin said Rabbi Ilai. For Rabbi Avin said Rabbi Ilai: Any place where it says "beware," "lest," and "do not" — it is only a negative commandment!

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, ״הִשָּׁמֶר״ דְּלָאו — לָאו, ״הִשָּׁמֶר״ דַּעֲשֵׂה — עֲשֵׂה.
human_translation: Even if you say Rabbi Akiva observe with regard to a negative negative observe a positive a positive
llm_translation: Even if you say it is Rabbi Akiva, "Hishamer" of negative commandments - no, "Hishamer" of positive commandments - yes.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא שַׁבָּת זְמַן תְּפִילִּין הוּא?! וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: יָכוֹל יַנִּיחַ אָדָם תְּפִילִּין בְּשַׁבָּתוֹת וְיָמִים טוֹבִים, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהָיָה לְךָ לְאוֹת עַל יָדְךָ״, מִי שֶׁצְּרִיכִין אוֹת, יָצְאוּ אֵלּוּ — שֶׁהֵן גּוּפָן אוֹת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva hold that Shabbat is a time for phylacteries? Wasn’t it taught Rabbi Akiva says: might a person should don phylacteries on Shabbatot and Festivals. the verse states: “And it shall be for a sign for you on your arm, require a sign excluding as they are themselves signs
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Akiva thought, is Shabbat a time for Tefillin?! And it was taught, Rabbi Akiva says: Can a person put on Tefillin on Shabbatot and Yomim Tovim, Scripture states: "And it shall be for you a sign upon your hand," those that require a sign, these are the Tefillin themselves.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הַאי תַּנָּא הוּא דְּתַנְיָא: הַנֵּיעוֹר בַּלַּיְלָה, רָצָה — חוֹלֵץ, רָצָה — מַנִּיחַ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי נָתָן. יוֹנָתָן הַקִּיטוֹנִי אוֹמֵר: אֵין מַנִּיחִין תְּפִילִּין בַּלַּיְלָה. מִדְּלַיְלָה לְתַנָּא קַמָּא זְמַן תְּפִילִּין — שַׁבָּת נָמֵי זְמַן תְּפִילִּין.
human_translation: Rather, it is this tanna , as it was taught one who is awake at night, if he wishes he remove if he wishes he don the statement of Rabbi Natan. Yonatan HaKitoni says: One not don phylacteries at night. From that according to the first tanna , night is time for phylacteries, Shabbat, too, is a time for phylacteries,
llm_translation: Rather, this Mishna is the one that was taught: "If one was moving about at night and he wants to put on tefillin, he may remove them, he may put them on, these are the words of Rabbi Nathan. Yonatan the Kitoni says: We do not put on tefillin at night." Since from nightfall until the time for tefillin is also considered Shabbat, the time for tefillin.

hebrew_text: דִּילְמָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ לַיְלָה זְמַן תְּפִילִּין הוּא, שַׁבָּת לָאו זְמַן תְּפִילִּין הוּא. דְּהָא שָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּאָמַר: לַיְלָה זְמַן תְּפִילִּין הוּא, שַׁבָּת לָאו זְמַן תְּפִילִּין הוּא!
human_translation: perhaps he holds night is time for phylacteries, Shabbat is not time for phylacteries. As we heard that Rabbi Akiva said night is a time for phylacteries, Shabbat is not a time for phylacteries,
llm_translation: Perhaps he thinks that night is the time for Tefillin, but Shabbat is not the time for Tefillin. For we have heard him, Rabbi Akiva, say: "Night is the time for Tefillin, but Shabbat is not the time for Tefillin!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הַאי תַּנָּא הוּא דְּתַנְיָא: מִיכַל בַּת כּוּשִׁי הָיְתָה מַנַּחַת תְּפִילִּין וְלֹא מִיחוּ בָּהּ חֲכָמִים, וְאִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁל יוֹנָה הָיְתָה עוֹלָה לָרֶגֶל וְלֹא מִיחוּ בָּהּ חֲכָמִים. מִדְּלֹא מִיחוּ בָּהּ חֲכָמִים — אַלְמָא קָסָבְרִי מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁלֹּא הַזְּמַן גְּרָמָא הִיא.
human_translation: Rather, it is this tanna as it was taught Michal, daughter of Kushi, would don phylacteries, and the Sages did not protest against her And Jonah’s wife would undertake the Festival pilgrimage and the Sages did not protest against her From that the Sages did not protest against it is apparent that these hold is a positive mitzva not bound by time,
llm_translation: Rather, this is the Tanna who teaches: Michal, the daughter of Kushite, used to put on Tefillin, and the Sages did not protest against her. And the wife of Yonah used to go up for the pilgrimage festival as an Olah offering, and the Sages did not protest against her. Since the Sages did not protest against them - it implies that they hold that a positive commandment that is not time-bound is effective.

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא סָבַר לַהּ
human_translation: But perhaps holds
llm_translation: And perhaps he thought to her.

hebrew_text: כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר: נָשִׁים סוֹמְכוֹת רְשׁוּת.
human_translation: in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, who said: optional women place
llm_translation: Like Rabbi Yosei, who said: "Women rely on permission."

hebrew_text: דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁל יוֹנָה הָיְתָה עוֹלָה לָרֶגֶל וְלֹא מִיחוּ בָּהּ, מִי אִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר רֶגֶל לָאו מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָא הוּא? אֶלָּא קָסָבַר רְשׁוּת, הָכָא נָמֵי רְשׁוּת.
human_translation: As, if you do not say so, Jonah’s wife would ascend the Festival pilgrimage and did not reprimand her. Is there anyone who says Festival is not a time-bound positive mitzva Rather, he holds optional; here, too, optional.
llm_translation: If you don't say so, the wife of Yonah would go up for the pilgrimage and he did not protest against her, who can it be according to the one who says that pilgrimage is not a positive commandment dependent on a specific time? Rather, he holds it is optional, here too it is optional.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הַאי תַּנָּא הִיא דְּתַנְיָא: הַמּוֹצֵא תְּפִילִּין, מַכְנִיסָן זוּג זוּג. אֶחָד הָאִישׁ וְאֶחָד הָאִשָּׁה, אֶחָד חֲדָשׁוֹת וְאֶחָד יְשָׁנוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹסֵר בַּחֲדָשׁוֹת, וּמַתִּיר בִּישָׁנוֹת.
human_translation: Rather, It is this tanna as it was taught One who finds phylacteries brings them in pair pair, whether a man or whether a woman, whether new or whether old. the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda prohibits new but permits old
llm_translation: Rather, this is what the Mishnah teaches: One who finds phylacteries, should insert them pair by pair. One for a man and one for a woman, one new and one old, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda prohibits the new ones and permits the old ones.

hebrew_text: עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי אֶלָּא בַּחֲדָשׁוֹת וִישָׁנוֹת, אֲבָל בְּאִשָּׁה לָא פְּלִיגִי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁלֹּא הַזְּמַן גְּרָמָא הוּא, וְכׇל מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁאֵין הַזְּמַן גְּרָמָא נָשִׁים חַיָּיבוֹת.
human_translation: disagree only with regard to new and old ones; however, with regard to a woman they do not disagree Learn from it is a positive mitzva not bound by time, and women are obligated in every positive mitzva not bound by time,
llm_translation: Until here, they only argue regarding new and old items, but they do not argue regarding a woman. Learn from it that a positive commandment that is not time-bound is the cause, and all positive commandments that are not time-bound, women are obligated to fulfill.

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר: נָשִׁים סוֹמְכוֹת רְשׁוּת? לָא סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ דְּלָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וְלָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי
human_translation: But perhaps holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, who said: optional women place This cannot enter your mind, as neither Rabbi Meir holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, nor does Rabbi Yehuda hold in accordance with Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: Perhaps she thinks like Rabbi Yosei, who said: "Do women establish ownership?" It is not according to your opinion that Rabbi Meir does not think like Rabbi Yosei, and not Rabbi Yehuda thinks like Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: לָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דִּתְנַן: אֵין מְעַכְּבִין אֶת הַתִּינוֹקוֹת מִלִּתְקוֹעַ. הָא נָשִׁים מְעַכְּבִין — וּסְתָם מַתְנִיתִין רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: Neither Rabbi Meir holds in accordance Rabbi Yosei, as we learned One not prevent children from sounding one must prevent women And an unattributed mishna Rabbi Meir,
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir does not hold like Rabbi Yosei, as we learned: One may not prevent children from blowing the shofar. But women may prevent them - and the anonymous Mishnah is in accordance with Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וְלָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּתַנְיָא: ״דַּבֵּר אֶל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל ... וְסָמַךְ״, בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל סוֹמְכִין וְאֵין בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל סוֹמְכוֹת. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: נָשִׁים סוֹמְכוֹת רְשׁוּת.
human_translation: Nor does Rabbi Yehuda hold in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, as it was taught “Speak to the sons of Israel…and he shall place the sons of Israel place but the daughters of Israel do not place Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: optional women place
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: And not Rabbi Yehuda holds like Rabbi Yosei, as it was taught: "Speak to the children of Israel ... and lean," the children of Israel lean and the daughters of Israel do not lean. Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: Women may lean voluntarily.

hebrew_text: וּסְתָם סִיפְרָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: And who is an unattributed Sifra ? Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: And a closed book who is it? - Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הַמּוֹצֵא תְּכֵלֶת בַּשּׁוּק, לְשׁוֹנוֹת — פְּסוּלוֹת, חוּטִין — כְּשֵׁרִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: one who one finds sky blue in the marketplace, strips they are unfit threads, they are fit
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: One who finds tekhelet in the marketplace, its tongues are invalid, but its threads are valid.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא לְשׁוֹנוֹת, דְּאָמַר: אַדַּעְתָּא דִגְלִימָא צַבְעִינְהוּ? חוּטִין נָמֵי, נֵימָא: אַדַּעְתָּא דִגְלִימָא טְוִינְהוּ! בִּשְׁזוּרִים.
human_translation: What is different strips said: One dyed with the intent for a cloak. threads as well, let us say: One spun them with the intent for a cloak. twisted,
llm_translation: What is different about their tongues, for it is said: "Do you know the time when the mountain goats give birth?" (Job 39:1) Some say: "Do you know the time when the deer give birth?" In the weaving.

hebrew_text: שְׁזוּרִים נָמֵי, נֵימָא: אַדַּעְתָּא דְשִׂיפְתָּא דִגְלִימָא עַיְיפִינְהוּ! בְּמוּפְסָקִין, דְּכוּלֵּי הַאי וַדַּאי לָא טָרְחִי אִינָשֵׁי.
human_translation: twisted as well, let us say one twisted them with the intent the hem of a cloak that were cut as people certainly do not exert
llm_translation: Interwoven are the reeds, it was stated: "The knowledge of the lips of the reed is weary!" In bundles, for all this, surely people do not exert themselves.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וְכִי אָדָם טוֹרֵחַ לַעֲשׂוֹת קָמֵיעַ כְּמִין תְּפִילִּין? דִּתְנַן: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים, בִּישָׁנוֹת. אֲבָל בַּחֲדָשׁוֹת — פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rava said: as does a person exert to fashion an amulet in the form of phylacteries? As we learned In what is this statement said? with regard to old However, with regard to new he is exempt
llm_translation: Rava said: Is a person obligated to make a handle like the form of Tefillin? As we learned in a Mishnah: With what are these things said? With old ones. But with new ones - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא לְאַהֲבָה בְּרֵיהּ: פּוֹק תְּנִי לְהוּ: הַמּוֹצֵא תְּכֵלֶת בַּשּׁוּק, לְשׁוֹנוֹת — פְּסוּלִין, חוּטִין מוּפְסָקִין — כְּשֵׁירִין, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין אָדָם טוֹרֵחַ.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to his son Ahava: Go out and teach to one who finds sky blue in the marketplace, strips, they are unfit threads cut they are fit because a person does not exert
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to Ahava his son: Go, teach them: One who finds tekhelet in the market, its tongues are invalid, its threads are severed — they are valid, because no one exerts effort.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וּמִשּׁוּם דְּתָנֵי לַהּ אַהֲבָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא כֵּיפֵי תְּלָא לַהּ?! וְהָתְנַן: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בִּישָׁנוֹת, אֲבָל בַּחֲדָשׁוֹת — פָּטוּר!
human_translation: Rava said: And because Ahava, son of Rabbi Zeira, taught has he hung rings on as we learned: In what is this statement said? with regard to old However, with regard to new he is exempt.
llm_translation: Rava said: And because he teaches her love for the son of Rabbi Zeira, should he be punished with lashes for her?! And we learned in a Mishnah: In what case are these words said? — In regards to old clothes, but in regards to new clothes — one is exempt!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: טָרַח וְלָא טָרַח — תַּנָּאֵי הִיא.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: exerts or does not exert is tanna’im .
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: "Whether he exerted effort or did not exert effort - it is a dispute of the Tannaim."

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: הַמּוֹצֵא תְּפִילִּין — מַכְנִיסָן זוּג זוּג, אֶחָד הָאִישׁ וְאֶחָד הָאִשָּׁה,
human_translation: As it was taught One who finds phylacteries brings them in pair pair, whether a man or a woman,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who finds Tefillin - he brings them in pairs, one for the man and one for the woman.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד חֲדָשׁוֹת וְאֶחָד יְשָׁנוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹסֵר בַּחֲדָשׁוֹת וּמַתִּיר בִּישָׁנוֹת. אַלְמָא מָר סָבַר טָרַח אִינִישׁ, וּמָר סָבַר לָא טָרַח אִינִישׁ.
human_translation: whether new or old; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda prohibits new but permits old ones. Apparently, Sage, holds a person exerts and Sage, holds a person does not exert
llm_translation: One new and one old, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda prohibits the new and permits the old. The Master holds that one has exerted effort, and the Master holds that one has not exerted effort.

hebrew_text: (שיצ״י עצב״י סִימָן.) וְהַשְׁתָּא דְּתָנֵי אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק: אֵלּוּ הֵן יְשָׁנוֹת — כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן רְצוּעוֹת וּמְקוּשָּׁרוֹת, חֲדָשׁוֹת — יֵשׁ בָּהֶן רְצוּעוֹת וְלֹא מְקוּשָּׁרוֹת. דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא טָרַח אִינִישׁ.
human_translation: Shin , yod , tzadi , yod , ayin , tzadi , beit , yod mnemonic And now that the father of Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak has taught these are old Any that have straps that tied new that have straps that are not tied, that everyone agrees a person does not exert
llm_translation: Talmudic text: (Shitzi Atzbi Siman.) Ve'hashta de'tanei abuh dishmuel bar rav Yitzchak: Elu hen yeshanot — kol sheyesh bahen retzuot u'mekusharot, chadashot — yesh bahen retzuot v'lo mekusharot. De'chulei olma la tarach inish. English translation: And now, as it was taught by the father of Shmuel, son of Rav Yitzchak: These are the old ones — all that have loops and are tied, the new ones — have loops but are not tied. For everyone does not exert himself unnecessarily.

hebrew_text: וְלִיעְנְבִינְהוּ מִיעְנָב! אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת, עֲנִיבָה פְּסוּלָה בִּתְפִילִּין.
human_translation: Let him tie a bow, Rav Ḥisda said: That is to say a bow is invalid for phylacteries,
llm_translation: And to answer them from Yainav! Rav Ḥisda said: This means, a twisted strap is invalid in tefillin.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: עֲנִיבָה קְשִׁירָה מְעַלַּיְיתָא הִיא.
human_translation: Abaye said: Rabbi Yehuda his reasoning, as he said: A bow is a full-fledged knot,
llm_translation: Abaye said: Rabbi Yehuda according to his reasoning, as he said: "Aniva is a tight knot above."

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דַּעֲנִיבָה קְשִׁירָה מְעַלַּיְיתָא הִיא, הָא לָאו הָכִי — עָנֵיב לְהוּ, וְהָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר שִׁילַת מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: קֶשֶׁר שֶׁל תְּפִילִּין הֲלָכָה לְמֹשֶׁה מִסִּינַי הוּא, וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: וְנוֹיֵיהֶן לְבַר!
human_translation: The reason that a bow is a full-fledged knot. that were not so, tie with a bow. But didn’t Rav Yehuda, son of Rav Shmuel bar Sheilat, say in the name of Rav: knot of phylacteries is a halakha transmitted to Moses from Sinai; and Rav Naḥman said: And their decorative outward.
llm_translation: Reason of Aniva is a strong binding, it is superior, this is not so - he bound them, and Rav Yehuda son of Rav Shmuel bar Shilat said in the name of Rav: The knot of the Tefillin is a Halacha given to Moses at Sinai, and Rav Nachman said: And their beauty is for the son!

hebrew_text: דְּעָנֵיב לְהוּ כְּעֵין קְשִׁירָה דִידְהוּ.
human_translation: where one tied a bow similar to a knot,
llm_translation: He answered them like a harp of his own.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רַב: הַלּוֹקֵחַ תְּפִילִּין מִמִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ מוּמְחֶה — בּוֹדֵק שְׁתַּיִם שֶׁל יָד וְאַחַת שֶׁל רֹאשׁ, אוֹ שְׁתַּיִם שֶׁל רֹאשׁ וְאַחַת שֶׁל יָד.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said Rav said: One who purchases phylacteries from one who is not an expert, examines two of the arm and one of the head, or two of the head and one of the arm,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisdah said in the name of Rav: One who acquires phylacteries from one who is not an expert should inspect two of the hand and one of the head, or two of the head and one of the hand.

hebrew_text: מָה נַפְשָׁךְ: אִי מֵחַד גַּבְרָא קָא זָבֵין, לִבְדּוֹק אוֹ שָׁלֹשׁ שֶׁל יָד אוֹ שָׁלֹשׁ שֶׁל רֹאשׁ.
human_translation: Whichever way you look at it, If purchased from one person, let him examine three of the arm or three of the head,
llm_translation: "What is your opinion: Is one man buying, to check or three of the hand or three of the head."

hebrew_text: אִי מִתְּרֵי תְּלָתָא גַּבְרֵי זָבֵין, כׇּל חַד וְחַד לִיבְעֵי בְּדִיקָה. לְעוֹלָם מֵחַד גַּבְרָא זָבֵין, וּבָעֵינַן דְּמִיתְמַחֵי בְּשֶׁל יָד וּבְשֶׁל רֹאשׁ.
human_translation: If he purchased from two three people, each and every one should require examination. Actually, bought from one person, and we require to be an expert with regard to of the arm and of the head.
llm_translation: If from two of three men are experiencing a seminal emission, each one must undergo an examination. It is always preferable for one man to experience a seminal emission, and we require that it be discharged from both the hand and the head.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָא תָּנֵי רַבָּה בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל: בִּתְפִילִּין בּוֹדֵק שָׁלֹשׁ שֶׁל יָד וְשֶׁל רֹאשׁ, מַאי לָאו אוֹ שָׁלֹשׁ שֶׁל יָד אוֹ שָׁלֹשׁ שֶׁל רֹאשׁ! לָא: שָׁלֹשׁ, מֵהֶן שֶׁל יָד מֵהֶן שֶׁל רֹאשׁ.
human_translation: Is that so? Didn’t Rabba bar Shmuel teach with phylacteries one examines three of the arm and of the head? What, is it not either three of the arm or three of the head? No, three among them of the arm and among them of the head,
llm_translation: I?! But didn't Rabba bar Shmuel teach: In tefillin one inspects three of the hand and three of the head, what does it mean, not three of the hand or three of the head! No, three, of them, three of the hand and three of the head.

hebrew_text: וְהָתָנֵי רַב כָּהֲנָא: בִּתְפִילִּין בּוֹדֵק שְׁתַּיִם שֶׁל יָד וְשֶׁל רֹאשׁ! הָא מַנִּי רַבִּי הִיא, דְּאָמַר: בִּתְרֵי זִימְנֵי הָוֵי חֲזָקָה.
human_translation: But didn’t Rav Kahana teach with phylacteries one examines two of the arm and of the head? whose is this It is Rabbi who said: Presumptive status is by two times.
llm_translation: And it was taught by Rav Kahana: In tefillin, one inspects two of the hand and two of the head! This is the teaching of Rabbi Hiyya, as he said: "With two times, it is considered established."

hebrew_text: אִי רַבִּי, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: וְכֵן בַּצֶּבֶת הַשֵּׁנִי, וְכֵן בַּצֶּבֶת הַשְּׁלִישִׁי. וְאִי רַבִּי — שְׁלִישִׁי מִי אִית לֵיהּ?
human_translation: If Rabbi say the latter clause And likewise the second bundle and likewise the third bundle. And if it is Rabbi is he of a third
llm_translation: If it is Rabbi, say the latter part: And so too in the second turtle-dove, and so too in the third turtle-dove. And if it is Rabbi - who has a third turtle-dove?

hebrew_text: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי בִּצְבָתִים, דְּמִתְּרֵי תְּלָתָא גַּבְרֵי זָבֵין. אִי הָכִי אֲפִילּוּ רְבִיעִי נָמֵי, וַאֲפִילּוּ חֲמִישִׁי נָמֵי!
human_translation: Rabbi concedes with regard to bundles, as one buys from two three people. If so, even fourth as well, and even fifth as well.
llm_translation: Rabbi concedes regarding beetles, that two of them are equivalent to three men who emit semen. If so, even a fourth one also, and even a fifth one also!

hebrew_text: אִין הָכִי נָמֵי. וְהַאי דְּקָתָנֵי שְׁלִישִׁי לְאַפּוֹקֵי מֵחֶזְקֵיהּ, וּלְעוֹלָם אֲפִילּוּ רְבִיעִי וַחֲמִישִׁי נָמֵי.
human_translation: Yes, it is indeed so; And that teaches three to exclude from its presumptive status. And actually, even fourth and fifth as well.
llm_translation: Thus it is said. And this that is taught, the third to exempt from his obligation, and always even the fourth and fifth, it is said.

hebrew_text: מְצָאָן צְבָתִים אוֹ כְרִיכוֹת וְכוּ׳. מַאי צְבָתִים וּמַאי כְּרִיכוֹת? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הֵן הֵן צְבָתִים, הֵן הֵן כְּרִיכוֹת. צְבָתִים — זָוֵוי זָוֵוי, כְּרִיכוֹת — דִּכְרִיכָן טוּבָא.
human_translation: one finds tied in bundles or in wrapped piles, What is bundles and what is wrapped piles? Rav Yehuda said Rav said: are bundles, and they are wrapped piles, Bundles in pairs [ zuvei ] wrapped piles that many are wrapped together
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If one finds tzvatim or kerikhot, etc. What are tzvatim and what are kerikhot? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: They are tzvatim, they are kerikhot. Tzvatim - intertwined, kerikhot - well woven.

hebrew_text: מַחְשִׁיךְ עֲלֵיהֶן וּמְבִיאָן. וְאַמַּאי? לְעַיְּילִינְהוּ זוּג זוּג! אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה: לְדִידִי מִיפָּרְשָׁא לֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ דְּאַבָּא, כׇּל שֶׁאִילּוּ מַכְנִיסָן זוּג זוּג וְכָלוֹת קוֹדֶם שְׁקִיעַת הַחַמָּה, מַכְנִיסָן זוּג זוּג. וְאִי לָא, מַחְשִׁיךְ עֲלֵיהֶן וּמְבִיאָן.
human_translation: waits with them until dark and brings them And why Let him bring them in pair pair. Rav Yitzḥak, son of Rav Yehuda, said: was explained to me by father Any that were he to bring them in pair pair he would finish before sunset, he brings them pair pair. But if not, he waits with them until dark and brings them
llm_translation: Darkens upon them and brings them. And why? To elevate them in pairs! Rav Yitzchak, son of Rav Yehuda, said: According to my understanding from the teachings of my father, as long as one brings them in pairs and the brides enter before sunset, one should bring them in pairs. Otherwise, darkens upon them and brings them.

hebrew_text: וּבַסַּכָּנָה מְכַסָּן וְהוֹלֵךְ. וְהָתַנְיָא: וּבַסַּכָּנָה מוֹלִיכָן פָּחוֹת פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת! אָמַר רַב: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּסַכָּנַת גּוֹיִם, הָא — בְּסַכָּנַת לִסְטִים.
human_translation: in danger one covers and proceeds on his Wasn’t it taught And in danger he carries them less than four cubits Rav said: not difficult. this to the danger by gentiles, that with the danger by bandits [ listim ].
llm_translation: In the market, one may cover and walk. And it was taught: In the market, one may lead them less than four cubits! Rav said: It is not difficult: here - in a non-Jewish market, here - in a market of thieves.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: בְּמַאי אוֹקֵימְתָּא לְמַתְנִיתִין, בְּסַכָּנַת גּוֹיִם? אֵימָא סֵיפָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: נוֹתְנָן לַחֲבֵירוֹ, וַחֲבֵירוֹ לַחֲבֵירוֹ. כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן דְּאָוְושָׁא מִילְּתָא!
human_translation: Abaye said to him: In what did you establish our mishna with the danger by gentiles? Say the latter clause Rabbi Shimon says one gives them to another and the other to another. all the more so the matter be conspicuous,
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: With what are you establishing the Mishnah, in the danger of gentiles? Say the latter part, Rabbi Shimon says: One gives to his friend, and his friend to his friend. All the more so with a matter that is urgent!

hebrew_text: חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּסַכָּנַת גּוֹיִם, אֲבָל בְּסַכָּנַת לִיסְטִים — מוֹלִיכָן פָּחוֹת פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: is incomplete and is teaching the following: In what case is this statement said? danger gentiles. However, danger bandits, one carries them less than four cubits at a time.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Hasorei michasra, vehachi katanei: Bameh devarim amurim — besakanat goyim, aval besakanat listim — molichan pachot pachot me'arba amot." Translation: "Those who are lacking are lacking, and thus it is taught: In what circumstances are these words said? — In a danger from gentiles, but in a danger from bandits — one may lead them less than four cubits."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: נוֹתְנָן לַחֲבֵירוֹ וְכוּ׳. בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת עָדִיף, דְּאִי אָמְרַתְּ נוֹתְנָן לַחֲבֵירוֹ וַחֲבֵירוֹ לַחֲבֵירוֹ — אָוְושָׁא מִלְּתָא דְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: One gives them to another With regard to what they disagree? Sage, holds less than four cubits is preferable, as if you say gives them to another, and other to another, Shabbat will be noticeable,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "One gives to his fellow, etc." With what is he disagreeing? Master holds: Less than four cubits is preferable, for if you say, "One gives to his fellow, and his fellow to his fellow," it is a matter of Shabbat.

hebrew_text: וּמָר סָבַר: נוֹתְנָן לַחֲבֵירוֹ עָדִיף, דְּאִי אָמְרַתְּ מוֹלִיכָן פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — זִימְנִין דְּלָאו אַדַּעְתֵּיהּ, וְאָתֵי לְאֵתוֹיִינְהוּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים.
human_translation: And Sage, holds one gives to another is preferable, as if you say carries them less than four cubits sometimes it is not in his thoughts and come to carry four cubits in the public domain.
llm_translation: Mar Savar: Giving to his friend is preferable, for if you say, "I will bring them less than four cubits," sometimes without his knowledge, and he comes to bring them four cubits in the public domain.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בְּנוֹ. בְּנוֹ מַאי בָּעֵי הָתָם? דְּבֵי מְנַשֶּׁה תָּנָא: בְּשֶׁיְּלָדַתּוּ אִמּוֹ בַּשָּׂדֶה.
human_translation: And the same one’s son. What is his son doing there The school of Menashe taught: where his mother gave birth to him in a field,
llm_translation: And so with his son. What does his son require there? The school of Menashe taught: When his mother gave birth to him in the field.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי אֲפִילּוּ הֵן מֵאָה? דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּקַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ יְדָא, אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי, הָא עֲדִיפָא.
human_translation: And what even a hundred that although it is difficult for hand even so, this is preferable
llm_translation: And what even if they are one hundred? For even though his hand is hard upon him, even so, this is preferable.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: נוֹתֵן אָדָם חָבִית. וְלֵית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הָא דִּתְנַן הַבְּהֵמָה וְהַכֵּלִים כְּרַגְלֵי הַבְּעָלִים!
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: A person gives a barrel to another, And is Rabbi Yehuda not of the opinion which we learned an animal and vessels is like the feet of the owners
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: A person gives a barrel. And Rabbi Yehuda does not hold like the Mishnah that teaches: "The animal and the vessels are like the feet of the owner!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מִשּׁוּם לֵוִי סָבָא: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן בִּמְעָרָן מֵחָבִית לְחָבִית. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: מַיִם אֵין בָּהֶם מַמָּשׁ.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said in the name of Levi the Elder: With what are we dealing here? with one pours from one barrel to barrel And Rabbi Yehuda his reasoning, as he said: Water has no substance,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said in the name of Levi the Elder: Here, with what are we dealing? With a cave from barrel to barrel. And Rabbi Yehuda according to his reasoning, for he said: Water that does not have any substance.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה פּוֹטֵר בְּמַיִם מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן מַמָּשׁ.
human_translation: As we learned Rabbi Yehuda exempts water due to it has no substance.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Yehuda exempts water because it does not have substance.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי לֹא תְּהַלֵּךְ זוֹ — לֹא יְהַלֵּךְ מַה שֶּׁבְּזוֹ יוֹתֵר מֵרַגְלֵי הַבְּעָלִים.
human_translation: And what, This not go That which is in this not go farther than the feet of the owners
llm_translation: And what is meant by "do not walk this"? - One should not walk more than the owner's feet.

hebrew_text: אֵימַר דְּשָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הֵיכָא דִּבְלִיעָן בְּעִיסָּה, הֵיכָא דְּאִיתַנְהוּ בְּעֵינַיְיהוּ מִי שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ? הַשְׁתָּא בִּקְדֵירָה אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא בָּטְלִי, בְּעֵינַיְיהוּ בָּטְלִי?! דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מַיִם וּמֶלַח בְּטֵלִין בָּעִיסָּה. וְאֵין בְּטֵלִין בַּקְּדֵירָה, מִפְּנֵי רוֹטְבָּהּ.
human_translation: Say that you heard Rabbi Yehuda his where it is absorbed in dough; where it is in its pure, unadulterated did you hear him Now, in a pot Rabbi Yehuda said is not nullified, nullified when it is in its pure, unadulterated as it was taught Rabbi Yehuda says: Water and salt are nullified in dough, they are not nullified in a pot because its gravy.
llm_translation: Statement: If you heard it to Rabbi Yehuda, where there is swallowing in a dough, where there are those who are in their eyes, did you hear it to him? Now in a pot, Rabbi Yehuda said it is not nullified, in their eyes it is nullified?! As it was taught, Rabbi Yehuda says: Water and salt are nullified in a dough. And they are not nullified in a pot, because of its moisture.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא, הָכָא בְּחָבִית שֶׁקָּנְתָה שְׁבִיתָה, וּמַיִם שֶׁלֹּא קָנוּ שְׁבִיתָה עָסְקִינַן. דְּבָטְלָה חָבִית לְגַבֵּי מַיִם.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: Here, we are dealing with a barrel acquired residence and water that did not acquired residence. the barrel is nullified relative to the water,
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: Here, we are dealing with a barrel that was acquired as a vessel, and water that was not acquired as a vessel. We are discussing a case where the barrel is nullified in relation to the water.

hebrew_text: כְּדִתְנַן: הַמּוֹצִיא הַחַי בְּמִטָּה — פָּטוּר אַף עַל הַמִּטָּה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַמִּטָּה טְפֵילָה לוֹ.
human_translation: As we learned One who carries out a living person on a bed is exempt even for the bed, due to that the bed is secondary to
llm_translation: As we have learned: One who removes a living creature on a bed - is exempt even on the bed, because the bed is considered secondary to him.

hebrew_text: הַמּוֹצִיא אוֹכָלִין פָּחוֹת מִכַּשִּׁיעוּר — בִּכְלִי פָּטוּר אַף עַל הַכְּלִי, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַכְּלִי טָפֵל לוֹ.
human_translation: one who carries out food, less than the measure in a vessel is exempt, even for the vessel, due to that the vessel is secondary to
llm_translation: One who takes out food less than the prescribed measure - in a vessel is exempt even on the vessel, because the vessel is secondary to it.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב יוֹסֵף, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בִּשְׁיָירָא, נוֹתֵן אָדָם חָבִית לַחֲבֵירוֹ וַחֲבֵירוֹ לַחֲבֵירוֹ. בִּשְׁיָירָא אִין, שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁיָירָא לָא? אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: כִּי תְּנַן נָמֵי בְּמַתְנִיתִין — בִּשְׁיָירָא תְּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Yosef raised an objection Rabbi Yehuda says: a caravan person gives a barrel to another, and the other to another. In a caravan, yes, that not a caravan, no, Rather, Rav Yosef said: When we learned in the mishna as well, we learned to a caravan.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Yosef raised an objection: Rabbi Yehuda says: In a case of "bishyaira," a person gives a barrel to his friend, and his friend to his friend. If there is no "bishyaira," is it not the case that there is no "bishyaira"? Rather, Rav Yosef said: For we learned in a Mishnah: We learned "bishyaira."

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: בִּשְׁיָירָא — אֲפִילּוּ חָבִית שֶׁקָּנְתָה שְׁבִיתָה וּמַיִם שֶׁקָּנוּ שְׁבִיתָה. שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁיָירָא — חָבִית שֶׁקָּנְתָה שְׁבִיתָה וּמַיִם שֶׁלֹּא קָנוּ שְׁבִיתָה.
human_translation: Abaye said In a caravan, even the barrel acquired residence and the water acquired residence, not in a caravan, the barrel acquired residence and the water did not acquire residence,
llm_translation: Abbaye said: With a remnant - even if she acquired a pit and water acquired a pit. Without a remnant - she acquired a pit and water did not acquire a pit.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: הָכָא בְּחָבִית דְּהֶפְקֵר עָסְקִינַן וּמַיִם דְּהֶפְקֵר עָסְקִינַן. וּמַאן אָמְרוּ לוֹ — רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי הִיא, דְּאָמַר: חֶפְצֵי הֶפְקֵר קוֹנִין שְׁבִיתָה. וּמַאי ״לֹא תְּהַלֵּךְ זוֹ יוֹתֵר מֵרַגְלֵי הַבְּעָלִים״? לֹא יְהַלְּכוּ אֵלּוּ יוֹתֵר מִכֵּלִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶם בְּעָלִים.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Here, we are dealing with an ownerless barrel and ownerless water, And who they said to It is Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri, said ownerless objects acquire residence And what This not go farther than the feet of its owners not go farther than vessels that have owners,
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: Here we are dealing with a barrel that is ownerless, and with water that is ownerless. And who said this? - Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri, who said: Items that are ownerless acquire a status of possession. And what is meant by "Do not walk more than the feet of the owners"? - These should not walk more than utensils that have owners.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָיָה קוֹרֵא בְּסֵפֶר עַל הָאִיסְקוּפָּה וְנִתְגַּלְגֵּל הַסֵּפֶר מִיָּדוֹ — גּוֹלְלוֹ אֶצְלוֹ.
human_translation: was reading book on threshold, and the book rolled from his hand he roll it to himself,
llm_translation: He taught: If one was reading from a book on the roof and the book rolled out of his hand - he should roll it back to him.

hebrew_text: הָיָה קוֹרֵא בְּרֹאשׁ הַגָּג וְנִתְגַּלְגֵּל הַסֵּפֶר מִיָּדוֹ, עַד שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ לַעֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים — גּוֹלְלוֹ אֶצְלוֹ. מִשֶּׁהִגִּיעַ לַעֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים — הוֹפְכוֹ עַל הַכְּתָב.
human_translation: he was reading on top the roof, and the book rolled from his hand, as long as did not reach ten handbreadths roll it to himself. once the book has reached ten handbreadths he turn it onto the writing,
llm_translation: He was reading on the roof and the scroll rolled out of his hand, until it did not reach ten handbreadths - he rolls it towards him. Once it reaches ten handbreadths - he turns it over on the writing.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ אֵין מְסוּלָּק מִן הָאָרֶץ אֶלָּא כִּמְלֹא מַחַט — גּוֹלְלוֹ אֶצְלוֹ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ בָּאָרֶץ עַצְמוֹ — גּוֹלְלוֹ אֶצְלוֹ, שֶׁאֵין לְךָ דָּבָר מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת עוֹמֵד בִּפְנֵי כִּתְבֵי הַקּוֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even is removed only a needle breadth from the ground, he rolls it to himself. Rabbi Shimon says: Even if on the ground itself, he rolls it to himself, as you have nothing as a rabbinic decree rest stands before sacred writings.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: Even if it is not removed from the land except as much as a grain of wheat - roll it to him. Rabbi Shimon says: Even if it is in the land itself - roll it to him, for you have nothing because of a prohibition standing before the Scriptures.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הַאי אִיסְקוּפָּה הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא אִיסְקוּפָּה רְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד וְקָמָה רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, וְלָא גָּזְרִינַן דִּילְמָא נָפֵיל וְאָתֵי לְאֵתוֹיֵי.
human_translation: What are the circumstances of this threshold? If you say a threshold a private domain, and a public domain before it, and we do not issue a decree lest fall and he come to bring it
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Gema: How is the case of an iskufah comparable? If you say that an iskufah is a private domain and a kamah is a public domain, we do not decree lest one fall and come to carry."

hebrew_text: מַנִּי? רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּאָמַר: כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁהוּא מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת אֵינוֹ עוֹמֵד בִּפְנֵי כִּתְבֵי הַקּוֹדֶשׁ. אֵימָא סֵיפָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ אֵין מְסוּלָּק מִן הָאָרֶץ אֶלָּא מְלֹא הַחוּט גּוֹלְלוֹ אֶצְלוֹ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ בָּאָרֶץ עַצְמָהּ גּוֹלְלוֹ אֶצְלוֹ —
