human_translation: who is It is Rabbi Shimon, who said: Anything that is due to rabbinic decree stands before sacred writings. say the latter clause Rabbi Yehuda says: Even if is removed only a needle breadth from the ground, he rolls it to himself; Rabbi Shimon says: Even if on the ground itself, he rolls it to himself.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who is the Tanna? It is Rabbi Shimon, for he said: Anything that is due to a Rabbinic decree does not stand in the presence of the Holy Scriptures. Let us say the latter part: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even if it is not removed from the ground except for the size of the thread, he rolls it up. Rabbi Shimon says: Even if it is in the very earth, he rolls it up.

hebrew_text: רֵישָׁא וְסֵיפָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, מְצִיעֲתָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה! אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: אִין, רֵישָׁא וְסֵיפָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, מְצִיעֲתָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: the first clause the last clause Rabbi Shimon, middle clause Rabbi Yehuda? Rav Yehuda said: Yes, The first and last clauses Rabbi Shimon, the middle clause Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Beginning and end, Rabbi Shimon, middle Rabbi Yehuda! Said Rav Yehuda: No, beginning and end, Rabbi Shimon, middle Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה אָמַר: הָכָא בְּאִיסְקוּפָּה הַנִּדְרֶסֶת עָסְקִינַן, וּמִשּׁוּם בִּזְיוֹן כִּתְבֵי הַקֹּדֶשׁ שְׁרוֹ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rabba said Here, we are dealing with a threshold that is trodden upon and due to degradation of the sacred writings the Sages permitted
llm_translation: Rabah said: Here we are dealing with the case of a tilted (or slanted) roof, and due to the disrespect of the holy writings, the Sages permitted it.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: תּוֹךְ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — גּוֹלְלוֹ אֶצְלוֹ, חוּץ לְאַרְבַּע — הוֹפְכוֹ עַל הַכְּתָב. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ בְּאִיסְקוּפָּה נִדְרֶסֶת עָסְקִינַן, מָה לִי תּוֹךְ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת מָה לִי חוּץ לְאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת?
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to his within four cubits, he rolls it to himself; beyond four cubits, he turns it over onto writing. And if you say we are dealing with a threshold that is trodden on what to me within four cubits what to me beyond four cubits?
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Abaye: Within four cubits - he rolls it up with him, outside of four cubits - he turns it over onto the writing. And if you say we are dealing with a roofed area, what do I need within four cubits for, what do I need outside of four cubits for?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָכָא בְּאִיסְקוּפָּה כַּרְמְלִית עָסְקִינַן, וּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים עוֹבֶרֶת לְפָנֶיהָ.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said: Here, we are dealing with a threshold a karmelit , and a public domain passes before it.
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: Here we are dealing with a Carmelite rooftop, and the public domain passes before it.

hebrew_text: תּוֹךְ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, דְּאִי נָפֵיל וּמַיְיתִי לֵיהּ לָא אָתֵי לִידֵי חִיּוּב חַטָּאת — שָׁרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: within four cubits, if falls and he brings it he cannot incur liability a sin-offering, the Sages permitted him
llm_translation: Within four cubits, if one falls and causes death, and it does not lead to an obligation of a sin offering - the Rabbis permitted it.

hebrew_text: חוּץ לְאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, דְּאִי מַיְיתֵי לֵיהּ אָתֵי לִידֵי חִיּוּב חַטָּאת — לָא שָׁרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: beyond four cubits, so that if he brings it he incurs liability a sin-offering, the Sages did not permit him
llm_translation: Outside of four cubits, for if one brings it, it leads to an obligation of sin offering - the Rabbis did not permit it.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, תּוֹךְ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת נָמֵי נִגְזַר דִּילְמָא מְעַיֵּיל מֵרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים לִרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד. וְכִי תֵּימָא כֵּיוָן דְּמַפְסֶקֶת כַּרְמְלִית לֵית לַן בַּהּ, וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: הַמַּעֲבִיר חֵפֶץ מִתְּחִלַּת אַרְבַּע לְסוֹף אַרְבַּע, וְהֶעֱבִירוֹ דֶּרֶךְ עָלָיו — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: If so, let us likewise issue a decree within four cubits, lest he bring in from the public domain to the private domain, And lest you say: Since a karmelit separates we have no with it, didn’t Rava say: One who carries an object from the beginning of four to the end of four and he carried it by way of above his head, is liable, even though
llm_translation: So, within four cubits, it is decreed, lest one carry from a public domain to a private domain. And if you say, since it is interrupted like a carmelit, we do not have a concern with it. And Rava said: One who transfers an object from the beginning of four cubits to the end of four cubits, and he transferred it in the usual manner — he is liable.

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, בְּאִיסְקוּפָּה אֲרוּכָּה, אַדְּהָכִי וְהָכִי מִידְּכַר.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? with an extended threshold. in the meantime, he will remember
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what are we dealing with, with a long roof, until thus and thus it is remembered.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם בְּאִסְקוּפָּה שֶׁאֵינָהּ אֲרוּכָּה, וּסְתָם כִּתְבֵי הַקֹּדֶשׁ עַיּוֹנֵי מְעַיֵּין בְּהוּ וּמַנַּח לְהוּ. וְלֵיחוּשׁ דִּילְמָא מְעַיֵּין בְּהוּ בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים וְעָיֵיל לְהוּ בְּהֶדְיָא לִרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Actually, to a threshold that is not extended; ordinarily one peruses sacred writings and puts them let us be concerned lest he peruse in the public domain, and carry it directly into the private domain
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Always in a roof that is not properly constructed, and the Holy Scriptures' concealed matters scrutinize in it and place them. And be concerned lest perhaps one scrutinizes them in a public domain and carries them out into a private domain.

hebrew_text: הָא מַנִּי בֶּן עַזַּאי הִיא, דְּאָמַר: מְהַלֵּךְ כְּעוֹמֵד דָּמֵי. וְדִילְמָא זָרֵיק לְהוּ מִזְרָק, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מוֹדֶה בֶּן עַזַּאי בְּזוֹרֵק.
human_translation: whose this It is Ben Azzai, who said walking is considered like standing. But lest he throw as Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Ben Azzai concedes one who throws
llm_translation: The text: "Ha mani ben Azai hi, de'amar: mehalech ke'omed damei. Vedilma zareik lehu mizrak, de'amar Rabbi Yochanan: modeh ben Azai be'zorek." Translation: "This is the teaching of Ben Azai, who said: Walking is like standing still. And perhaps he throws to them a pitcher, as Rabbi Yochanan said: Ben Azai agrees with one who throws."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר אַהֲבָה: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת אֵין מְזָרְקִין כִּתְבֵי הַקּוֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ahava said: That is to say one does not throw sacred writings,
llm_translation: Rav Ahah bar Ahava said: This means, we do not sprinkle the writings of the Holy Scriptures.

hebrew_text: הָיָה קוֹרֵא בְּרֹאשׁ הַגָּג וְכוּ׳. וּמִי שְׁרֵי? וְהָתַנְיָא: כּוֹתְבֵי סְפָרִים תְּפִילִּין וּמְזוּזוֹת לֹא הִתִּירוּ לָהֶן לְהַפֵּךְ יְרִיעָה עַל פָּנֶיהָ, אֶלָּא פּוֹרֵס עָלֶיהָ אֶת הַבֶּגֶד!
human_translation: one was reading on top of the roof, And is it permitted Wasn’t it taught writers of scrolls, phylacteries, and mezuzot did not permit them to turn the sheet facedown Rather, one spreads a cloth over it
llm_translation: He would read on the top of the roof, etc. And who is the author of this teaching? And it was taught: Scribes of scrolls, phylacteries, and mezuzot were not permitted to spread a curtain over their face, but rather they should spread a garment over it!

hebrew_text: הָתָם אֶפְשָׁר, הָכָא לָא אֶפְשָׁר, וְאִי לָא אָפֵיךְ אִיכָּא בִּזְיוֹן כִּתְבֵי הַקּוֹדֶשׁ טְפֵי.
human_translation: There, it is possible here, is not possible And if he does not turn over, it will be more degrading to the sacred writings.
llm_translation: There it is possible, here it is not possible, and if not, there is a disgrace to the Holy Scriptures.

hebrew_text: הוֹפְכוֹ עַל הַכְּתָב? וְהָא לָא נָח! [אָמַר רָבָא:] בְּכוֹתֶל מְשׁוּפָּע.
human_translation: one turns it over onto the writing. But did not rest Rava said: to an inclined wall.
llm_translation: Turn it over on the writing? But isn't that not appropriate! Rava said: In a plastered wall.

hebrew_text: [אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי:] בְּמַאי אוֹקֵימְתָּא לְמַתְנִיתִין? בְּכוֹתֶל מְשׁוּפָּע, אֵימָא סֵיפָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ אֵינוֹ מְסוּלָּק מִן הָאָרֶץ אֶלָּא מְלֹא הַחוּט — גּוֹלְלוֹ אֶצְלוֹ, וְהָא נָח לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Abaye said to him: In what did you establish the mishna to an inclined wall? Say the latter clause Rabbi Yehuda says: Even is removed only a needle breadth from the ground, he rolls it to himself. But didn’t rest
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye: With what do you establish the Mishnah? With a protruding wall. Say the latter part: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even if it is not detached from the ground except for the width of a thread - roll it towards him, and that is satisfactory for him!

hebrew_text: חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּכוֹתֶל מְשׁוּפָּע, אֲבָל
human_translation: is incomplete and is teaching the following: In what is this statement said? in an inclined wall. However,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Hasorei michasra, vehachi katanei: Bameh devarim amurim - bekotel meshupa, aval."

hebrew_text: בְּכוֹתֶל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְשׁוּפָּע, לְמַעְלָה מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה — גּוֹלְלוֹ אֶצְלוֹ, לְמַטָּה מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה — הוֹפְכוֹ עַל הַכְּתָב.
human_translation: with regard to a wall that is not inclined, three above he roll it to himself; below three he must turn it onto the writing.
llm_translation: In a wall that is not sloping, above three cubits - roll it towards him, below three cubits - turn it over on the writing.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר אֲפִילּוּ אֵינוֹ מְסוּלָּק מִן הָאָרֶץ וְכוּ׳. דְּבָעֵינַן הַנָּחָה עַל גַּבֵּי מַשֶּׁהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even is removed only from the ground, that we require rest atop something.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says even if he is not removed from the land, etc. For we require rest upon something.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רָבָא: תּוֹךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה לְרַבָּנַן צָרִיךְ הַנָּחָה, לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי אַמְרַהּ לִשְׁמַעְתֵּיהּ?!
human_translation: But that Rava said within three to the Rabbis, it is necessary rest Let us say he stated his halakha in accordance with the tanna’im ,
llm_translation: And rather this that Rava said: Within three speakers, for the Rabbis, there must be a pause, should we say as the Tannaim said it for his hearing?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: כּוּלַּהּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, וְחַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּכוֹתֶל מְשׁוּפָּע, אֲבָל בְּכוֹתֶל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְשׁוּפָּע — אֲפִילּוּ פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים גּוֹלְלוֹ אֶצְלוֹ. שֶׁרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ אֵינוֹ מְסוּלָּק מִן הָאָרֶץ אֶלָּא מְלֹא הַחוּט — גּוֹלְלוֹ אֶצְלוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, is all Rabbi Yehuda, and it is incomplete and is teaching In what is this statement said? an inclined wall. But with regard to a wall that is not inclined, even less than three handbreadths one roll it to himself, as Rabbi Yehuda says: Even is removed only a needle breadth from the ground, he rolls it to himself.
llm_translation: Rather: entirely Rabbi Yehuda it is, and lacking from the lacking, and thus it was taught: In what matters are these words said — in a protruding wall, but in a non-protruding wall — even less than three handbreadths, he rolls it away. For Rabbi Yehuda says: Even if it is not detached from the ground but only the size of a thread — he rolls it away.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּבָעֵינַן הַנָּחָה עַל גַּבֵּי מַשֶּׁהוּ.
human_translation: What is the reason we require rest atop some
llm_translation: What is the reason? Because we require resting upon something.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ זִיז שֶׁלִּפְנֵי חַלּוֹן — נוֹתְנִין עָלָיו וְנוֹטְלִין מִמֶּנּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: a ledge in front of a window, one place upon it or remove from it on Shabbat
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "A bolt in front of a window - one may place it on and remove it from it on Shabbat."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הַאי זִיז דְּמַפֵּיק לְהֵיכָא? אִילֵּימָא דְּמַפֵּיק לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — לֵיחוּשׁ דִּילְמָא נָפֵיל, וְאָתֵי לְאֵיתוֹיֵי. אֶלָּא דְּמַפֵּיק לִרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד, פְּשִׁיטָא!
human_translation: This ledge, to where does it protrude? If you say protrudes into a public domain, we should be concerned lest fall and he come to bring it in Rather, that protrudes into a private domain; obvious
llm_translation: The Gemara: This bolt, from where does it protrude? If you say it protrudes into a public domain - there is concern that perhaps it will fall, and one will come to carry it. Rather, it protrudes into a private domain, it is obvious!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לְעוֹלָם דְּמַפֵּיק לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, וּמַאי ״נוֹתְנִין עָלָיו״ דְּקָתָנֵי, כֵּלִים הַנִּשְׁבָּרִים.
human_translation: Abaye said: Actually, where it protrudes into a public domain, and what that it teaches: One place upon it? fragile utensils,
llm_translation: Abaye said: Always one should take out to the public domain, and what is "placing upon it" that it teaches, utensils that are broken.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: זִיז שֶׁלִּפְנֵי הַחַלּוֹן הַיּוֹצֵא לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — נוֹתְנִין עָלָיו קְעָרוֹת וְכוֹסוֹת, קִיתוֹנִיּוֹת וּצְלוֹחִיּוֹת.
human_translation: That was also taught a ledge in front of a window that protrudes into a public domain, one place on it bowls, cups, small cups [ kitoniyot ], and saucers.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: Ziz that is in front of the window that opens to the public domain - one may place on it bowls and cups, pitchers and basins.

hebrew_text: וּמִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בְּכׇל הַכּוֹתֶל עַד עֲשָׂרָה הַתַּחְתּוֹנִים. וְאִם יֵשׁ זִיז אֶחָד לְמַטָּה מִמֶּנּוּ — מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בּוֹ, וּבָעֶלְיוֹן אֵין מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בּוֹ אֶלָּא כְּנֶגֶד חַלּוֹנוֹ.
human_translation: And one use entire the wall, until the lower ten And if there is one ledge below it one use but with regard to the upper one use it only opposite his window.
llm_translation: And he makes use of the entire wall up to ten cubits from the ground. And if there is one protrusion below it - he makes use of it, but those above do not make use of it except opposite his window.

hebrew_text: הַאי זִיז הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִי דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ אַרְבָּעָה — מְקוֹם פְּטוּר הוּא, וַאֲפִילּוּ כְּנֶגֶד חַלּוֹנוֹ נָמֵי לָא יִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ. וְאִי אִית בֵּיהּ אַרְבָּעָה — בְּכוּלֵּי הַכּוֹתֶל לִישְׁתַּמֵּשׁ.
human_translation: This ledge, what are its circumstances? If it is not four it is an exempt domain one should not use even opposite his window, And if it is four let him use entire the wall.
llm_translation: This Ziz, how is it valued? If it does not have four handbreadths - it is considered an exempt space, and even opposite its window one may not make use of it. And if it has four handbreadths - one may make use of the entire wall.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: תַּחְתּוֹן דְּאִית בֵּיהּ אַרְבָּעָה, וְעֶלְיוֹן לֵית בֵּיהּ אַרְבָּעָה וְחַלּוֹן מַשְׁלִימָתוֹ לְאַרְבָּעָה. כְּנֶגֶד חַלּוֹן — מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ, דְּחוֹרֵי חַלּוֹן הוּא. דְּהַאי גִּיסָא וּדְהַאי גִּיסָא — אָסוּר.
human_translation: Abaye said: the lower is four and the upper is not four windowsill completes it to four one use opposite the window, as it is an extension of the window, to this side or to that side prohibited,
llm_translation: Abaye said: The lower part that has four components, and the upper part that has four components, and the window completes it to four. Opposite the window - it is used, for the holes of the window are. This side and that side - are forbidden.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ עוֹמֵד אָדָם בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד וּמְטַלְטֵל בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים. בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים וּמְטַלְטֵל בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יוֹצִיא חוּץ מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: A person stand in a private domain and move in a public domain, in a public domain and move in a private domain, provided that he does not carry beyond four cubits
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A person may stand in a private domain and move objects in a public domain. In a public domain, one may move objects in a private domain, provided that one does not transfer them beyond four cubits.

hebrew_text: לֹא יַעֲמוֹד אָדָם בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד וְיַשְׁתִּין בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים וְיַשְׁתִּין בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד, וְכֵן לֹא יָרוֹק.
human_translation: a person not stand in a private domain and urinate into a public domain, in a public domain and urinate into a private domain. And likewise, one not spit
llm_translation: A person may not stand in a private domain and urinate in a public domain, nor in a public domain and urinate in a private domain, and likewise, one may not spit.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף מִשֶּׁנִּתְלַשׁ רוּקּוֹ בְּפִיו, לֹא יְהַלֵּךְ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת עַד שֶׁיָּרוֹק.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even once spittle is gathered in his mouth, he not walk four cubits until he spits
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even if saliva detached in his mouth, he may not walk four cubits until he spits.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַתְנֵי לֵיהּ רַב חִינָּנָא בַּר שֶׁלֶמְיָא לְחִיָּיא בַּר רַב קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב: לֹא יַעֲמוֹד אָדָם בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד וּמְטַלְטֵל בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שָׁבְקַתְּ רַבָּנַן וְעָבְדַתְּ כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר?!
human_translation: Rav Ḥinnana bar Shelamiya would teach to Ḥiyya bar Rav before Rav A person not stand in a private domain and move in a public domain. said to him: you abandoned the Rabbis and followed Rabbi Meir,
llm_translation: The Gemara: Rav Chinana bar Shelamya taught it to Hiyya bar Rav before Rav: A person should not stand in a private domain and move objects in a public domain. He said to him: Have you forsaken the teachings of the Sages and acted like Rabbi Meir?!

hebrew_text: הוּא סָבַר: מִדְּסֵיפָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, רֵישָׁא נָמֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וְלָא הִיא: סֵיפָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, וְרֵישָׁא רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: maintains that from the latter clause Rabbi Meir, the first clause likewise Rabbi Meir. But that is not so: The latter clause Rabbi Meir, while the first clause the Rabbis.
llm_translation: He thought: From the end Rabbi Meir, the beginning Rabbi Meir. And not so: the end Rabbi Meir, and the beginning the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יוֹצִיא חוּץ. הָא הוֹצִיא חַיָּיב חַטָּאת. לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרָבָא, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: הַמַּעֲבִיר חֵפֶץ מִתְּחִילַּת אַרְבַּע לְסוֹף אַרְבַּע, וְהֶעֱבִירוֹ דֶּרֶךְ עָלָיו — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: provided that he does not carry beyond he carried he is liable a sin-offering. Let us say this supports Rava, as Rava said: one who carries an object from the beginning of four to the end of four carried it above his head, he is liable
llm_translation: And only not he shall take out outside. This he took out liable sin-offering. Let us say assists to him to Rava, for Rava said: One who transfers an object from beginning of four to end of four, and he transferred it in a normal manner upon it — liable.

hebrew_text: מִי קָתָנֵי: אִם הוֹצִיא חַיָּיב חַטָּאת? דִּילְמָא אִם הוֹצִיא — פָּטוּר אֲבָל אָסוּר.
human_translation: Is teaching if he carried he is liable a sin-offering? Perhaps If he carried exempt but it is prohibited
llm_translation: Who is the Tanna that teaches: If one has brought out, is he liable for a sin offering? Perhaps if he has brought out, he is exempt, but it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: הָא הוֹצִיא פָּטוּר אֲבָל אָסוּר, לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: הַמַּעֲבִיר מִתְּחִילַּת אַרְבַּע לְסוֹף אַרְבַּע וְהֶעֱבִירוֹ דֶּרֶךְ עָלָיו חַיָּיב! מִי קָתָנֵי ״הוֹצִיא פָּטוּר אֲבָל אָסוּר״? דִּילְמָא: אִם הוֹצִיא — חַיָּיב חַטָּאת.
human_translation: Some say he carried exempt but it is prohibited let us say is a conclusive refutation of Rava’s as Rava said: one who carries from the beginning of four to the end of four carried it above his head, he is liable. Is teaching if he took exempt, but it is prohibited Perhaps if he carried liable a sin-offering.
llm_translation: There are those who say: If he took out, exempt, but if he carried in, forbidden. Let it be in accordance with the reasoning of Rava, for Rava said: One who transfers from the beginning of four cubits to the end of four cubits, and he transferred it in the usual manner, is liable! Who is the Tanna who teaches "if he took out, exempt, but if he carried in, forbidden"? Perhaps, if he took out, he is liable for a sin offering.

hebrew_text: לֹא יַעֲמוֹד אָדָם בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הִשְׁתִּין וְרָק — חַיָּיב חַטָּאת.
human_translation: A person not stand in a private domain Rav Yosef said: One who urinated or spat liable a sin-offering.
llm_translation: A person may not stand in the private domain, etc. Rav Yosef said: If one urinates and spits - liable for a sin offering.

hebrew_text: וְהָא בָּעִינַן עֲקִירָה וְהַנָּחָה מֵעַל גַּבֵּי מְקוֹם אַרְבָּעָה, וְלֵיכָּא!
human_translation: But we require lifting and placing from atop an area four And not
llm_translation: And this, we require uprooting and placing down from on top of a space of four, and it is not there!

hebrew_text: מַחְשַׁבְתּוֹ מְשַׁוְּיָא לֵיהּ מָקוֹם. דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, הָא דְּאָמַר רָבָא: זָרַק וְנָח בְּפִי הַכֶּלֶב אוֹ בְּפִי הַכִּבְשָׁן חַיָּיב חַטָּאת, וְהָא בָּעִינַן הַנָּחָה עַל גַּבֵּי מְקוֹם אַרְבָּעָה, וְלֵיכָּא!
human_translation: intent renders it an area As, if you do not say so, that Rava said: a person threw and it landed in the mouth of a dog or in the mouth of a furnace, liable a sin-offering. But don’t we require placed on an area of four And not
llm_translation: His intention is established for him a place. For if you do not say so, this is what Rava said: If one throws an object and it lands in the mouth of a dog or in the mouth of a furnace, he is liable for a sin offering. But we require that it come to rest in a space of four handbreadths, and it is not so!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: מַחְשַׁבְתּוֹ מְשַׁוְּיָא לֵיהּ מָקוֹם, הָכִי נָמֵי מַחְשָׁבָה מְשַׁוְּיָא לָהּ מָקוֹם.
human_translation: Rather, intent renders it an area Here too, his intent renders a area.
llm_translation: Rather: his thought is established for him a place, thus it is stated: thought is established for her a place.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָבָא: הוּא בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד וּפִי אַמָּה בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, מַהוּ? בָּתַר עֲקִירָה אָזְלִינַן, אוֹ בָּתַר יְצִיאָה אָזְלִינַן? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rava raised a dilemma: one in a private domain, and the opening of his member is in the public domain, what is we follow uprooted Or we follow the emission Let it stand
llm_translation: Ba'ei Rava: Hu birshut hayachid ufi amah birshut harabim, mahu? Batar akirah azlinan, o batar yetsi'ah azlinan? Teiku.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן לֹא יָרוֹק. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר וְכוּ׳. אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא הַפֵּיךְ בָּהּ?
human_translation: And likewise, one not spit Rabbi Yehuda says: even if he has not turned over
llm_translation: And so too one should not spit. Rabbi Yehuda says and so forth. Even though he did not turn it over in it?

hebrew_text: וְהָתְנַן: הָיָה אוֹכֵל דְּבֵילָה בְּיָדַיִם מְסוֹאָבוֹת, וְהִכְנִיס יָדוֹ לְתוֹךְ פִּיו לִיטּוֹל צְרוֹר — רַבִּי מֵאִיר מְטַמֵּא, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי מְטַהֵר.
human_translation: Didn’t we learn was eating a dried fig with unwashed hands? inserted his hand into his mouth to remove a pebble, Rabbi Meir deems impure, And Rabbi Yosei deems ritually pure,
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: If one was eating a dried fig in his hands, and he inserted his hand into his mouth to take a morsel — Rabbi Meir declares him impure, and Rabbi Yosei declares him pure.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הִיפֵּךְ בָּהּ — טָמֵא. לֹא הִיפֵּךְ בָּהּ — טָהוֹר!
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says he turned over impure. he not turned over pure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: He turned it over - impure. He did not turn it over - pure!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מוּחְלֶפֶת הַשִּׁיטָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The opinions is reversed,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: Mochlephet the acacia tree.

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם לָא תַּחְלֵיף, וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? בְּכִיחוֹ.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: Actually, do not reverse and With what we are dealing here with his phlegm
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: Always do not exchange, and here with what are we dealing? With a spit.

hebrew_text: וְהַתַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כִּיחוֹ וְנִתְלַשׁ, מַאי לָאו — רוֹק וְנִתְלַשׁ! לָא, כִּיחוֹ וְנִתְלַשׁ. וְהָא תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כִּיחוֹ שֶׁנִּתְלַשׁ, וְכֵן רוּקּוֹ שֶׁנִּתְלַשׁ, לֹא יְהַלֵּךְ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת עַד שֶׁיָּרוֹק! אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא כִדְשַׁנִּינַן מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: Wasn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda says: one’s phlegm was detached, What, is it not spittle that was detached? No, one’s phlegm that was detached. Wasn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda says: one’s phlegm was detached, and likewise, his spittle was detached, he not walk four cubits before he spits Rather, it is clear as we originally answered,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: 'If it is spat and detached, what is the reason it is not considered impure - spit and detached! No, if it is spat and detached.' And it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: 'If it is spat and detached, and likewise its saliva is detached, one should not walk four cubits until he spits! Rather, the halacha is as we initially stated."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כִּיַּח בִּפְנֵי רַבּוֹ חַיָּיב מִיתָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״כׇּל מְשַׂנְאַי אָהֲבוּ מָוֶת״ — אַל תִּקְרֵי ״לִמְשַׂנְאַי״, אֶלָּא ״לְמַשְׂנִיאַי״.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: phlegm in front of his master liable for death as it is stated: “All they who hate Me love death” Do not read it “They who hate [ mesanai ] Me”; rather, “Those who make themselves hateful [ masniai ] to Me,”
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: When one angers his master in private, he is liable to death, as it is stated, "All who hate me love death" - do not read it as "my haters," but rather "those who provoke me."

hebrew_text: וְהָא מֵינָס אֲנִיס? כִּיַּח וְרָק קָאָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: But doesn’t he involuntarily, We are speaking phlegm and spat
llm_translation: And does one who is forced count as a willing participant? Like a donkey, and only that is what we are saying.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ לֹא יַעֲמוֹד אָדָם בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד וְיִשְׁתֶּה בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים וְיִשְׁתֶּה בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הִכְנִיס רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ לִמְקוֹם שֶׁהוּא שׁוֹתֶה. וְכֵן בַּגַּת.
human_translation: A person stand in a private domain and drink in a public domain, in a public domain and drink in a private domain, only if he brings his head and most of his into the domain which he drinks. And the same in a winepress,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A person may not stand in a private domain and drink in a public domain, nor in a public domain and drink in a private domain, unless he has brought his head and the majority of his body into the place where he is drinking. The same applies in a winepress.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ רֵישָׁא רַבָּנַן, וְסֵיפָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר!
human_translation: the first clause, the Rabbis, whereas the latter clause, Rabbi Meir,
llm_translation: The beginning is according to the Rabbis, and the end is according to Rabbi Meir!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: בַּחֲפֵיצִין שֶׁצְּרִיכִין לוֹ, וְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: to objects that one needs, and all.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: "In the objects that one needs, and the words of everyone."

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: כַּרְמְלִית, מַאי? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הִיא הִיא. אָמַר רָבָא: הִיא גּוּפָא גְּזֵירָה, וַאֲנַן נֵיקוּם וְנִגְזוֹר גְּזֵירָה לִגְזֵירָה?!
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before karmelit , what is Abaye said: This is to that Rava said: itself decree. And will we proceed to issue a decree to decree?
llm_translation: The Gemara asked them: What is a "karmelit"? Abaye said: It is it. Rava said: It is a decree in and of itself, and shall we then establish and decree one decree after another?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ, מִדְּקָתָנֵי
human_translation: Abaye said From where do I say that From that it is taught
llm_translation: Abbaye said: "From where do I say to her, from the verse."

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בַּגַּת.
human_translation: And the same in a winepress.
llm_translation: And so too in Gath.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא אָמַר: לְעִנְיַן מַעֲשֵׂר. וְכֵן אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: ״וְכֵן בַּגַּת״ — לְעִנְיַן מַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: And Rava said: to the matter of tithes, And similarly, Rav Sheshet said the same in a winepress to the matter of tithes.
llm_translation: Rava said: for the matter of tithing. And so said Rav Sheshet: "and also in Gath" — for the matter of tithing.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: שׁוֹתִין עַל הַגַּת, בֵּין בְּחַמִּין וּבֵין בְּצוֹנֵן, וּפָטוּר — דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בַּר צָדוֹק מְחַיֵּיב.
human_translation: As we learned One drink on the winepress whether with hot or whether with cold and he is exempt. statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Eliezer bar Tzadok deems obligated
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: One may pour water on a winepress, whether with hot water or with cold water, and he is exempt - these are the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Eliezer son of Tzadok obligates.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: עַל הַחַמִּין חַיָּיב, וְעַל הַצּוֹנֵן פָּטוּר. מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּחֲזִיר אֶת הַמּוֹתָר.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: with hot he is obligated with cold he is exempt because he return the leftover
llm_translation: The sages say: Regarding the hot (food) one is liable, and regarding the cold (food) one is exempt. Because it returns the permissible.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ קוֹלֵט אָדָם מִן הַמַּזְחֵילָה לְמַטָּה מֵעֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, וּמִן הַצִּינּוֹר מִכׇּל מָקוֹם שׁוֹתֶה.
human_translation: A person catch from a gutter less than ten handbreadths And from a pipe one drink in any manner,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One may collect water from the roof to below up to ten handbreadths, and from the gutter one may drink from any place.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ קוֹלֵט — אִין, אֲבָל מְצָרֵף — לָא. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הָכָא בְּמַזְחֵילָה פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה סָמוּךְ לַגַּג עָסְקִינַן, דְּכׇל פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה סָמוּךְ לַגַּג, כְּגַג דָּמֵי.
human_translation: catch, yes, but press no, What is the reason Rav Naḥman said: Here, we are dealing with a gutter within three of the roof, anything within three of a roof is considered like the roof
llm_translation: Gemara: "If it collects - no, but if it merges - yes. What is the reason? Rav Nachman said: Here we are dealing with a roof that is less than three handbreadths from the edge, for any roof that is less than three handbreadths from the edge is considered as the edge."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: עוֹמֵד אָדָם בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד וּמַגְבִּיהַּ יָדוֹ לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים לְפָחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה סָמוּךְ לַגַּג, וְקוֹלֵט, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְצָרֵף.
human_translation: That was also taught A person stand in a private domain and raise his hand above ten handbreadths, within three of the roof, and catch provided that he does not press
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: If a person stands in a private domain and extends his hand upwards more than ten handbreadths but less than three handbreadths from the roof, and he collects an object, provided that he does not intentionally detach it.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: לֹא יַעֲמוֹד אָדָם בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד וְיַגְבִּיהַּ יָדוֹ לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים לְפָחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה סָמוּךְ לַגַּג וִיצָרֵף, אֲבָל קוֹלֵט הוּא וְשׁוֹתֶה.
human_translation: It was taught another A person not stand in a private domain and raise his hand above ten handbreadths, to within three of the roof, and press but he catch and drink.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Another Baraita teaches: A person may not stand in a private domain and extend his hand upwards more than ten handbreadths, less than three handbreadths from the roof, and he will be liable to bring a sin-offering. However, he may receive the object and drink.

hebrew_text: מִן הַצִּינּוֹר מִכׇּל מָקוֹם שׁוֹתֶה. תָּנָא: אִם יֵשׁ בְּצִינּוֹר אַרְבָּעָה עַל אַרְבָּעָה — אָסוּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא כְּמוֹצִיא מֵרְשׁוּת לִרְשׁוּת.
human_translation: But from a pipe one drink in any manner, taught If the pipe is four by four it is prohibited because he is like carries from one domain to domain,
llm_translation: From the pipe, one may drink from any place. It was taught: If there are four handbreadths of water in the pipe, four handbreadths by four handbreadths — it is prohibited, because it is like transferring an object from one domain to another.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בּוֹר בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים וְחוּלְיָיתוֹ גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, חַלּוֹן שֶׁעַל גַּבָּיו מְמַלְּאִין הֵימֶנּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: a cistern in a public domain, with an embankment ten handbreadths high, a window above one draw from on Shabbat
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A pit in a public domain, and its opening is ten handbreadths high, one may fill it with water on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁפָּה בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים גְּבוֹהָ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, חַלּוֹן שֶׁעַל גַּבָּיו שׁוֹפְכִין לְתוֹכָהּ מַיִם בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: a garbage dump in a public domain ten handbreadths high, a window above one throw water onto on Shabbat,
llm_translation: Garbage in a public domain, its height is ten handbreadths, a window on its back, one may pour water into it on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בִּסְמוּכָה, לְמָה לִי חוּלְיָא עֲשָׂרָה?
human_translation: With what are we dealing If you say with adjacent why do I embankment ten
llm_translation: We are dealing with what? Perhaps with a case of proximity, why do I need a space of ten?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? בְּמוּפְלֶגֶת מִן הַכּוֹתֶל אַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: With what are we dealing here? four removed from the wall
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: Here, what are we dealing with? With a mofeleset from the wall, four.

hebrew_text: וְטַעְמָא דְּאִיכָּא חוּלְיָא עֲשָׂרָה, הָא לֵיכָּא חוּלְיָא עֲשָׂרָה — קָא מְטַלְטֵל מֵרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד לִרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד דֶּרֶךְ רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים.
human_translation: And the reason that there is an embankment of ten if there is no embankment of ten moving from one private domain to another by way of the public domain.
llm_translation: The reason that there are ten cubits, is because there are ten cubits - he is transferring from a private domain to a private domain in the manner of a public domain.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא בִּסְמוּכָה — הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּבוֹר וְחוּלְיָיתוֹ מִצְטָרְפִין לַעֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Even you say with adjacent teach us that a cistern and its embankment combine to ten
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Even if you say it is a "smuchah" - here it is implied to us that a bee and its honey combine to make ten.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁפָּה בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים וְכוּ׳. וְלָא חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא תִּנָּטֵל אַשְׁפָּה?
human_translation: a garbage dump in a public domain Aren’t we concerned that the garbage dump might be removed,
llm_translation: Rubbish in public domain, etc. And we are not concerned lest the rubbish be removed?

hebrew_text: וְהָא רָבִין בַּר רַב אַדָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּמָבוֹי אֶחָד שֶׁצִּידּוֹ אֶחָד כָּלֶה לַיָּם וְצִידּוֹ אֶחָד כָּלֶה לְאַשְׁפָּה, וּבָא מַעֲשֶׂה לִפְנֵי רַבִּי, וְלֹא אָמַר בּוֹ לֹא אִיסּוּר וְלֹא הֶיתֵּר.
human_translation: But didn’t Ravin bar Rav Adda Rav Yitzḥak said: An incident involving a certain alleyway, one of whose sides terminated in the sea, and the other side terminated in a garbage dump. And the incident came before Rabbi and he did not say about it, either prohibition or permission.
llm_translation: And Ravin bar Rav Adda said Rabbi Yitzchak: There was an incident in one alleyway where one side ended at the sea and one side ended at the garbage dump, and the case came before Rabbi, and he did not say about it that it is neither forbidden nor permitted.

hebrew_text: הֶיתֵּר לֹא אָמַר בּוֹ — דְּחָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא תִּנָּטֵל אַשְׁפָּה, וְיַעֲלֶה הַיָּם שִׂירְטוֹן.
human_translation: did not say about it permitted, as we are concerned lest the garbage dump be removed and the sea will throw up sediment
llm_translation: The permission he did not say in it — we are concerned that perhaps he will remove a splinter, and the sea will rise a hairbreadth.

hebrew_text: אִיסּוּר לֹא אָמַר בּוֹ — דְּהָא קָיְימִין מְחִיצוֹת.
human_translation: he did not say about it prohibited, as partitions, exist,
llm_translation: Prohibition not said in it - for they stand partitions.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — דְּיָחִיד, הָא — דְּרַבִּים.
human_translation: not difficult. this with a private that to a public
llm_translation: Not difficult: this - of individual, this - of many.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אִילָן שֶׁהָיָה מֵיסֵךְ עַל הָאָרֶץ, אִם אֵין גּוּפוֹ גָּבוֹהַּ מִן הָאָרֶץ שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים — מְטַלְטְלִים תַּחְתָּיו.
human_translation: a tree that was hanging over the ground, if its branches are no higher than three handbreadths from the ground, one carry under it.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A tree that overhangs the ground, if its trunk is not at least three handbreadths high from the ground - one may move objects underneath it.

hebrew_text: שׇׁרָשָׁיו גְּבוֹהִים מִן הָאָרֶץ שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים — לֹא יֵשֵׁב עֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: its roots three handbreadths higher than the ground, one not sit on them,
llm_translation: Its roots are high above the ground, three handbreadths - it shall not rest upon them.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין בּוֹ יָתֵר מִבֵּית סָאתַיִם, מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: One not move under more than two beit se’a . What is the reason
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: One may not carry objects within it an enclosed area more than two sa'ahs. What is the reason?

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵי דִּירָה שֶׁתַּשְׁמִישָׁהּ לַאֲוִיר, וְכׇל דִּירָה שֶׁתַּשְׁמִישָׁהּ לַאֲוִיר — אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין בָּהּ יָתֵר מִבֵּית סָאתַיִם.
human_translation: because it is a dwelling that serves the air, And any dwelling that serves the air it is not permitted to carry in it more than two beit se’a .
llm_translation: Because it is a dwelling whose purpose is for the air, and any dwelling whose purpose is for the air — one may not move in it more than two sa'ah.

hebrew_text: שׇׁרָשָׁיו גְּבוֹהִין מִן הָאָרֶץ וְכוּ׳. אִיתְּמַר: שׇׁרְשֵׁי אִילָן הַבָּאִין מִלְּמַעְלָה מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה לְתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה, רַבָּה אָמַר: מוּתָּר לְהִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן, רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: אָסוּר לְהִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן.
human_translation: the roots above the ground, It was stated the roots of a tree that come from above, from three to within three Rabba said: It is permitted to use them, Rav Sheshet said: It is prohibited to use them.
llm_translation: The roots are high from the ground, etc. It was stated: the roots of a tree that come from above, from three to within three, Rabah said: it is permitted to make use of them, Rav Sheshet said: it is forbidden to make use of them.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה אָמַר: מוּתָּר לְהִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן, דְּכׇל פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה דְּאַרְעָא — אַרְעָא הִיא. רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: אָסוּר לְהִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן, דְּכֵיוָן דְּמִכֹּחַ אִיסּוּר קָאָתֵי — אֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: Rabba said it is permitted to use them, anything less than three from the ground is the ground. Rav Sheshet said: It is prohibited to use them; since they come from a prohibited source, they are prohibited.
llm_translation: Rabba said: It is permitted to make use of them, for any less than three is considered as nothing. Rav Sheshet said: It is forbidden to make use of them, for since there is a prohibition involved, they are forbidden.

hebrew_text: דְּדָמוּ כִּמְשׁוּנִּיתָא, דְּסָלְקִין לְעֵילָּא — אֲסוּרִין. דְּנָחֲתִין לְתַתַּאי — שְׁרוּ. לִצְדָדִין — פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבָּה וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת.
human_translation: that resemble crag, those that rise upward are prohibited fall downward are permitted to the sides dispute between Rabba and Rav Sheshet.
llm_translation: They are like a needle, when they go up - forbidden. When they go down - permitted. Sideways - a dispute between Rabba and Rav Sheshet.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אַנִּיגְרָא, וְכֵן בְּקֶרֶן זָוִית.
human_translation: And likewise, a tree that grows in a ditch And likewise, in a corner
llm_translation: And so is Anigra, and so is in the corner of the horn.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דִּיקְלָא דַּהֲוָה לְאַבָּיֵי, וַהֲוָה סָלֵיק בְּאִיפּוּמָא. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף וּשְׁרָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Abaye had a certain palm tree that projected through an opening in the roof. He came before Rav Yosef and he permitted him
llm_translation: That palm tree that was in the possession of Abbaye, and it was ascending in its quality. He came before Rav Yosef and he sang to him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר תַּחְלִיפָא: דִּשְׁרָא לָךְ, כְּרַבָּה שְׁרָא לָךְ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Taḥlifa said He who permitted to you, permitted it to you Rabba,
llm_translation: Rav Ahah bar Tahalifa said: "What is permitted to you, is permitted to Rabbah."

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא אֲפִילּוּ לְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת בֵּיתָא כְּמַאן דִּמְלֵי דָּמֵי, וְלִישְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה סָמוּךְ לַגַּג, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious. lest you say even according to Rav Sheshet, the house is considered full, and to use less than three from the roof. teaches us
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Peshita? Mahu d'teima apilu l'Rav Sheshet Beita k'man d'mlei damei, v'lishtamesh b'fachot mishlosha samuch l'gag, ka mashma lan." English translation: "Is it obvious? What is the reasoning? Even according to Rav Sheshet Beita, like someone who is full of blood, and to make use of a space less than three handbreadths near the roof, it is implied to us."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: שׇׁרָשָׁיו גְּבוֹהִין מִן הָאָרֶץ שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים — לֹא יֵשֵׁב עֲלֵיהֶם. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּלָא הָדְרִי כָּיְפִי — פְּשִׁיטָא. אֶלָּא לָאו, אַף עַל גַּב דְּהָדְרִי כָּיְפִי!
human_translation: we learned: the roots three handbreadths above the ground, one not sit on them. What are the circumstances If that do not bend over again, obvious, Rather, doesn’t even though they bend back
llm_translation: We learned: Its roots are high from the ground, three handbreadths - one should not sit on them. How so? If they did not spread out like the palm - it is obvious. Rather, even though they spread out like the palm!

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם דְּלָא הָדָרִי כָּיְפִי, וְהָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן אַף עַל גַּב דְּצִידּוֹ אֶחָד שָׁוֶה לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: No, actually where they do not bend back and teach us Although one side level with the ground,
llm_translation: Not, forever, not return like, and the here, is heard to us even though his side one equal to the land.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן שׇׁרְשֵׁי אִילָן שֶׁגְּבוֹהִין מִן הָאָרֶץ שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים אוֹ שֶׁיֵּשׁ חָלָל תַּחְתֵּיהֶן שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁצִּידּוֹ אֶחָד שָׁוֶה לָאָרֶץ — הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יֵשֵׁב עֲלֵיהֶן, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין עוֹלִין בְּאִילָן, וְאֵין נִתְלִין בְּאִילָן, וְאֵין נִשְׁעָנִין בְּאִילָן.
human_translation: The Sages taught roots of a tree that are three handbreadths above the ground, or if there is space beneath them three handbreadths, although one side are level with the ground, one not sit on them because One not climb a tree, nor one hang from a tree nor one lean against a tree
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: The roots of a tree that are higher than three handbreadths from the ground, or if there is a hollow space beneath them of three handbreadths, even though one side is equal to the ground — one may not sit on them, because one does not ascend into a tree, and one does not hang on a tree, and one does not lean on a tree.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא יַעֲלֶה בְּאִילָן מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם וְיֵשֵׁב שָׁם כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ. אֶחָד אִילָן וְאֶחָד כׇּל הַבְּהֵמָה, אֲבָל בּוֹר שִׁיחַ וּמְעָרָה וְגָדֵר — מְטַפֵּס וְעוֹלֶה מְטַפֵּס וְיוֹרֵד, וַאֲפִילּוּ הֵן מֵאָה אַמָּה.
human_translation: And one not climb a tree while it is still day and sit there the entire day both a tree and all animals; However, a cistern, ditch, cave, or a fence. One climb up climb down even if they are a hundred cubits
llm_translation: And not ascend in a tree from the middle of the day and sit there the entire day. One tree and one all the animal, but a pit, ditch, and fence - one climbs up and goes down, and even if they are one hundred cubits.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי חֲדָא: אִם עָלָה — מוּתָּר לֵירֵד, וְתָנֵי חֲדָא — אָסוּר לֵירֵד. לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם, כָּאן — מִשֶּׁחָשֵׁיכָה.
human_translation: It was taught one If one climbed up permitted to climb down; and it was taught one prohibited to climb down. not difficult. Here, while it was still day; there, after nightfall.
llm_translation: One taught: If it ascended - permitted to descend, and one taught: forbidden to descend. Not difficult: here - from midday, here - from nightfall.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, הָא וְהָא מִשֶּׁחָשֵׁיכָה, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — בְּשׁוֹגֵג, כָּאן — בְּמֵזִיד.
human_translation: And if you wish, say both after nightfall. But not difficult: Here, unwittingly; there, intentionally.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Here and here from when it became dark, and it is not difficult: Here - unintentional, here - intentional.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, הָא וְהָא בְּשׁוֹגֵג, וְהָכָא בְּקָנְסוּ שׁוֹגֵג אַטּוּ מֵזִיד קָמִיפַּלְגִי. מָר סָבַר: קָנְסִינַן. וּמָר סָבַר: לָא קָנְסִינַן.
human_translation: And if you wish, say both unwittingly, and they disagree about penalized unwitting due to an intentional Sage, maintains they penalized And Sage, maintains they did not penalize
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Here and here it is unintentional, and here it is a penalty imposed for unintentional violation, thus they differ. One Master holds: We impose a penalty. And one Master holds: We do not impose a penalty.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: כְּתַנָּאֵי. הַנִּיתָּנִין בְּמַתָּנָה אַחַת שֶׁנִּתְעָרְבוּ בְּנִיתָּנִין מַתָּנָה אַחַת — יִנָּתְנוּ בְּמַתָּנָה אַחַת, מַתַּן אַרְבַּע בְּמַתַּן אַרְבַּע — יִנָּתְנוּ בְּמַתַּן אַרְבַּע.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: parallel to the tanna’im , that require one sprinkling becomes intermingled with require one sprinkling, will be sprinkled once. four sprinklings with four sprinklings, will be sprinkled four times.
llm_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: like the Tannaim. If they were given in one gift and became mixed with another gift, they should be given in one gift. If four were given in a gift of four, they should be given in a gift of four.

hebrew_text: מַתַּן אַרְבַּע בְּמַתַּן אַחַת, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: יִנָּתְנוּ בְּמַתַּן אַרְבַּע. וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: יִנָּתְנוּ בְּמַתָּנָה אַחַת.
human_translation: four sprinklings with one sprinkling, Rabbi Eliezer says: is sprinkled four times. And Rabbi Yehoshua says: is sprinkled once,
llm_translation: Gift of four in one gift, Rabbi Eliezer says: they should be given in a gift of four. And Rabbi Yehoshua says: they should be given in one gift.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: הֲרֵי הוּא עוֹבֵר עַל ״בַּל תִּגְרַע״! אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: הֲרֵי הוּא עוֹבֵר בְּ״בַל תּוֹסִיף״.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to he transgresses “you shall not diminish,” Rabbi Yehoshua said to he transgresses Do not add
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Eliezer: Behold he transgresses "do not diminish"! He said to him Rabbi Yehoshua: Behold he transgresses with "do not add".

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא כְּשֶׁהוּא בְּעַצְמוֹ. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: לֹא נֶאֱמַר ״בַּל תִּגְרַע״ אֶלָּא כְּשֶׁהוּא בְּעַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said They said only where by itself, Rabbi Yehoshua said Do not diminish, was stated only where by itself.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Eliezer: They only said when he himself. Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: It is not stated "do not diminish" except when he himself.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: כְּשֶׁנָּתַתָּ — עָבַרְתָּ עַל ״בַּל תּוֹסִיף״ וְעָשִׂיתָ מַעֲשֶׂה בְּיָדֶךָ. כְּשֶׁלֹּא נָתַתָּ — עָבַרְתָּ עַל ״בַּל תִּגְרַע״ וְלֹא עָשִׂיתָ מַעֲשֶׂה בְּיָדֶךָ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua further said When you sprinkle you have transgressed Do not add, and you performed an action with your hand, when you do not sprinkle you have transgressed Do not diminish, you did not perform action with your hand.
llm_translation: And furthermore said Rabbi Yehoshua: When you have given - you have transgressed "do not add" and you have done a deed with your hand. When you have not given - you have transgressed "do not subtract" and you have not done a deed with your hand.

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר דְּאָמַר הָתָם ״קוּם עֲשֵׂה״ עָדִיף, הָכִי נָמֵי יֵרֵד. לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ דְּאָמַר הָתָם ״שֵׁב וְאַל תַּעֲשֶׂה״ עָדִיף, הָכִי נָמֵי לֹא יֵרֵד.
human_translation: According to Rabbi Eliezer, who said there, it is preferable to stand and take action, here too, climb down according to Rabbi Yehoshua, said it is preferable to sit and not take action, here too, not descend
llm_translation: To Rabbi Eliezer who said there, "Arise and do" is preferable, thus it is also said, "He shall come down." To Rabbi Yehoshua who said there, "Sit and do not do" is preferable, thus it is also said, "He shall not come down."

hebrew_text: דִּילְמָא לָא הִיא, עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הָתָם ״קוּם עֲשֵׂה״ עָדִיף — אֶלָּא דְּקָא עָבֵיד מִצְוָה. אֲבָל הָכָא דְּלָא עָבֵיד מִצְוָה, הָכִי נָמֵי לֹא יֵרֵד.
human_translation: Perhaps that is not Rabbi Eliezer stated it is preferable to stand and take action only there, where one performs a mitzva However, here, one performs no mitzva indeed, he not descend.
llm_translation: Perhaps it is not so, until here not said Rabbi Eliezer there "arise do" preferable - rather that he is doing a commandment. But here where he is not doing a commandment, so too will not descend.

hebrew_text: וְאִי נָמֵי, עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הָתָם ״שֵׁב וְאַל תַּעֲשֶׂה״ עָדִיף — אֶלָּא
human_translation: Alternatively, Rabbi Yehoshua stated it is preferable to sit and not take action only there,
llm_translation: And if you say, until here Rabbi Yehoshua did not say there "sit and do not do" is preferable - rather

hebrew_text: דְּלָא קָא עָבֵיד אִיסּוּרָא, אֲבָל הָכָא דְּקָא עָבֵיד אִיסּוּרָא, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּיֵרֵד.
human_translation: where one does not commit a transgression However, here, where one commits a transgression indeed, he descend
llm_translation: The text reads: "d'la ka avid isura, aval hacha d'ka avid isura, hachi namei d'yered." Translation: "Where he is not making a prohibition, but here where he is making a prohibition, so too it descends."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי חֲדָא: אֶחָד אִילָן לַח וְאֶחָד אִילָן יָבֵשׁ, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּלַח, אֲבָל בְּיָבֵשׁ — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: It was taught one both a green tree and a dry tree it was taught another In what are these matters, stated? With regard to a green But in a dry it is permitted
llm_translation: It was taught: one tree moist and one tree dry, and it was taught another: in what case are these words said - in moist, but in dry - permitted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — בְּשֶׁגִּזְעוֹ מַחְלִיף, כָּאן — בְּשֶׁאֵין גִּזְעוֹ מַחְלִיף.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: not difficult. Here, stump sends out new there, stump does not send out new
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said, it is not difficult: here — when his trunk is changing, here — when his trunk is not changing.

hebrew_text: גִּזְעוֹ מַחְלִיף יָבֵשׁ קָרֵית לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה, כָּאן — בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים.
human_translation: You call stump sends out new dry? Rather, not difficult, here, to the summer, there, to the rainy season,
llm_translation: He uprooted it, he transplanted it, it withered, he read it! Rather, it is not difficult: here — in the days of the sun, here — in the days of the rain.

hebrew_text: בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה, הָא נָתְרִי פֵּירֵי! בִּדְלִיכָּא פֵּירֵי. וְהָא קָא נָתְרִי קִינְסֵי! בְּגִדּוּדָא.
human_translation: In the summer, the fruit will fall off where there is no fruit But small branches will fall off with a tree that has been stripped
llm_translation: In the days of the sun, behold, the Natri bore fruit! In the shade, fruit. And behold, the Natri produced thorns! In a thicket.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָא רַב אִיקְּלַע לְאַפְסַטְיָא, וַאֲסַר בְּגִדּוּדָא! רַב בִּקְעָה מָצָא, וְגָדַר בָּהּ גָּדֵר.
human_translation: Is that so? But Rav arrived at Apsetaya and prohibited a tree that had been stripped of its branches. Rav found field, and fenced it in.
llm_translation: I?! But didn't Rav come to Apastiya and prohibited the use of a fence?! Rav found a breach and fenced it off.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: אָסוּר לְאָדָם שֶׁיְּהַלֵּךְ עַל גַּבֵּי עֲשָׂבִים בְּשַׁבָּת, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאָץ בְּרַגְלַיִם חוֹטֵא״.
human_translation: Rami bar Abba said Rav Asi said: It is prohibited for a person to walk on grass on Shabbat, due to that it is stated: “And he who hastens with his feet sins”
llm_translation: Ramei son of Abba said, Rav Assi said: It is forbidden for a person to walk on grass on Shabbat, because it is stated: "And he hastens with his feet, he sins."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי חֲדָא: מוּתָּר לֵילֵךְ עַל גַּבֵּי עֲשָׂבִים בְּשַׁבָּת, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: אָסוּר. לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּלַחִים, הָא — בִּיבֵשִׁים.
human_translation: It was taught one it is permitted to walk on grass on Shabbat, and it was taught another it is prohibited not difficult. This to green That to dry
llm_translation: One taught: It is permitted to walk on grass on Shabbat, and another taught: It is prohibited. There is no difficulty: here - when they are moist, here - when they are dry.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא, הָא וְהָא בְּלַחִים, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה, כָּאן — בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים.
human_translation: And if you wish, say both to green and there is no difficulty: Here, to the summer, there, to the rainy season,
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: here and here with parched grains, and it is not difficult: here - in the days of the sun, here - in the days of rain.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, הָא וְהָא בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — דְּסָיֵים מְסָאנֵיהּ, הָא — דְּלָא סָיֵים מְסָאנֵיהּ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say both to the summer, and not difficult: This where one is wearing his shoes, that where one is not wearing his shoes,
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: This one and that one refer to the days of the sun, and it is not difficult: This one - referring to when it completes its course, that one - referring to when it does not complete its course.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָא וְהָא דְּסָיֵים מְסָאנֵיהּ, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — דְּאִית לֵיהּ עוּקְצֵי, הָא — דְּלֵית לֵיהּ עוּקְצֵי.
human_translation: And if you wish, say both where one is wearing his shoes, and not difficult: This where has a spike that where does not have a spike.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: This and this, when they finish measuring it, and it is not difficult: this one - that has thorns, this one - that does not have thorns.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, הָא וְהָא דְּאִית לֵיהּ עוּקְצֵי: הָא — דְּאִית לֵיהּ שְׁרָכָא, הָא — דְּלֵית לֵיהּ שְׁרָכָא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say both where has a spike, This where long and entangled, that where is not long and entangled.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Here, and here, there are thorns: here - where there are thorns, here - where there are no thorns.

hebrew_text: וְהָאִידָּנָא דְּקַיְימָא לַן כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, כּוּלְּהוּ שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: And now, when we maintain in accordance with the opinion Rabbi Shimon, all of these are permitted,
llm_translation: And the matter that is established for us according to Rabbi Shimon, all of them are permitted.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: אָסוּר לְאָדָם שֶׁיָּכוֹף אִשְׁתּוֹ לִדְבַר מִצְוָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאָץ בְּרַגְלַיִם חוֹטֵא״.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama said Rav Asi said: It is prohibited for a man to force his wife in the mitzva, as it is stated: “And he who hastens with his feet sins”
llm_translation: And Ramai son of Hama said, Rav Assi said: It is forbidden for a man to compel his wife to do a matter of mitzvah, as it is stated: "And one who hurries with his feet sins."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כׇּל הַכּוֹפֶה אִשְׁתּוֹ לִדְבַר מִצְוָה הָוְיָין לוֹ בָּנִים שֶׁאֵינָן מְהוּגָּנִין. אָמַר רַב אִיקָא בַּר חִינָּנָא, מַאי קְרָאָה: ״גַּם בְּלֹא דַעַת נֶפֶשׁ לֹא טוֹב״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Anyone who forces his wife to the mitzva will have unworthy children Rav Ika bar Ḥinnana said: What is the verse “Also, that the soul without knowledge is not good”
llm_translation: And said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: Anyone who forces his wife to fulfill a commandment will have sons who are not esteemed. Rav Ikka bar Hinana said, What is the verse? "Even without knowledge, the soul is not good."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: ״גַּם בְּלֹא דַעַת נֶפֶשׁ לֹא טוֹב״ — זֶה הַכּוֹפֶה אִשְׁתּוֹ לִדְבַר מִצְוָה. ״וְאָץ בְּרַגְלַיִם חוֹטֵא״ — זֶה הַבּוֹעֵל וְשׁוֹנֶה.
human_translation: That was also taught “Also, without knowledge the soul is not good”; this is one who forces his wife to the mitzva. “And he who hastens with his feet sins”; this is one who has intercourse and repeats
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: "Even without knowledge, the soul is not good" — this refers to one who forces his wife to engage in a matter of mitzvah. "And hasty with his feet sins" — this refers to one who engages in sexual relations and then drinks.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: הָרוֹצֶה לַעֲשׂוֹת כׇּל בָּנָיו זְכָרִים יִבְעוֹל וְיִשְׁנֶה! לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — לְדַעַת, כָּאן — שֶׁלֹּא לְדַעַת.
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rava say: One who wants all his children to be males have intercourse and repeat not difficult: Here, with consent. There, without consent.
llm_translation: I?! And did not Rava say: One who desires to have all his children male should practice cohabitation and then sleep! It is not difficult: here — intentionally, here — unintentionally.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל אִשָּׁה שֶׁתּוֹבַעַת בַּעְלָהּ לִדְבַר מִצְוָה הוֹוִין לָהּ בָּנִים שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ בְּדוֹרוֹ שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה לֹא הָיוּ כְּמוֹתָן. דְּאִילּוּ בְּדוֹרוֹ שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה כְּתִיב: ״הָבוּ לָכֶם אֲנָשִׁים חֲכָמִים וּנְבוֹנִים וִידוּעִים לְשִׁבְטֵיכֶם״, וּכְתִיב: ״וָאֶקַּח אֶת רָאשֵׁי שִׁבְטֵיכֶם אֲנָשִׁים חֲכָמִים וִידוּעִים״, וְאִילּוּ נְבוֹנִים לָא אַשְׁכַּח.
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Any woman who demands her husband that mitzva will have sons the likes of whom did not exist even in Moses’ generation. With regard to Moses’ generation, it is written: “Get you, wise men, and understanding, and well-known from each one of your tribes, and it is written: “So I took the heads of your tribes, wise men, and well-known, However, understanding, could not find
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said Rabbi Yochanan: Any woman who demands her husband for a matter of mitzvah, they give her children who even in the generation of Moses were not like them. For in the generation of Moses it is written: "Take for yourselves wise and understanding men, known to your tribes," and it is written: "And I took the heads of your tribes, wise and understanding men," but wise men I did not find.

hebrew_text: וְאִילּוּ גַּבֵּי לֵאָה כְּתִיב: ״וַתֵּצֵא לֵאָה לִקְרָאתוֹ וַתֹּאמֶר אֵלַי תָּבוֹא כִּי שָׂכוֹר שְׂכַרְתִּיךָ״, וּכְתִיב: ״וּמִבְּנֵי יִשָּׂשכָר יוֹדְעֵי בִינָה לַעִתִּים לָדַעַת מַה יַּעֲשֶׂה יִשְׂרָאֵל רָאשֵׁיהֶם מָאתַיִם וְכׇל אֲחֵיהֶם עַל פִּיהֶם״.
human_translation: While with regard to Leah, it is written: “And Leah went out to meet him, and said, You must come in to me, for indeed I have hired you and it is written: “And of the children of Issachar, men who had understanding of the times, to know what Israel ought to do; the heads of them were two hundred, and all their brethren were at their commandment”
llm_translation: Regarding Leah, it is written: "And Leah went out to meet him and said, 'You must come to me, for I have hired you with my son's mandrakes.'" And it is written: "And of the sons of Issachar, men who had understanding of the times, to know what Israel ought to do, their chiefs were two hundred, and all their kinsmen were at their command."

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָאָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר אַבְדִּימִי: עֶשֶׂר קְלָלוֹת נִתְקַלְּלָה חַוָּה, דִּכְתִיב:
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rav Yitzḥak bar Avdimi say: Eve was cursed with ten curses, it is written:
llm_translation: I?! And did not Rav Yitzchak bar Avdimi say: Ten curses did Chavah incur, as it is written:

hebrew_text: ״אֶל הָאִשָּׁה אָמַר הַרְבָּה אַרְבֶּה״, אֵלּוּ שְׁנֵי טִפֵּי דָמִים — אַחַת דַּם נִדָּה, וְאַחַת דַּם בְּתוּלִים. ״עִצְּבוֹנֵךְ״, זֶה צַעַר גִּידּוּל בָּנִים. ״וְהֵרוֹנֵךְ״, זֶה צַעַר הָעִיבּוּר. ״בְּעֶצֶב תֵּלְדִי בָּנִים״, כְּמַשְׁמָעוֹ.
human_translation: proceeds to “To the woman He said: I will greatly multiply [ harba arbe ]”; these are two drops of blood one the blood of menstruation and one the blood of virginity. “Your pain”; this is the pain of raising children. “And your travail”; this is the pain of pregnancy. “In sorrow you shall bring forth children”; in accordance with its meaning,
llm_translation: "To the woman He said, 'I will greatly multiply,'" these are the two drops of blood - one is the blood of menstruation, and one is the blood of virginity. "In pain you shall bear children," this is the pain of childbearing. "And your desire shall be for your husband," this is the pain of conception. "In pain you shall bear children," as it is understood.

hebrew_text: ״וְאֶל אִישֵׁךְ תְּשׁוּקָתֵךְ״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה מִשְׁתּוֹקֶקֶת עַל בַּעְלָהּ בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁיּוֹצֵא לַדֶּרֶךְ. ״וְהוּא יִמְשׇׁל בָּךְ״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה תּוֹבַעַת בַּלֵּב וְהָאִישׁ תּוֹבֵעַ בַּפֶּה. זוֹ הִיא מִדָּה טוֹבָה בַּנָּשִׁים.
human_translation: “And yet your desire shall be to your husband” teaches that the woman desires her husband, when he sets out on the road; “and he shall rule over you” teaches that the woman demands in heart but the man demands verbally. This is a good trait in women,
llm_translation: "And to your husband is your desire," teaches that a woman longs for her husband when he goes on a journey. "And he will rule over you," teaches that a woman demands in her heart, while a man demands verbally. This is a good trait in women.

hebrew_text: כִּי קָאָמְרִינַן, דְּמַרְצְיָא אַרְצוֹיֵי קַמֵּיהּ.
human_translation: When we say that she make herself pleasing to him,
llm_translation: For we say, that Marzaya of Arzoyei stood before him.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי שֶׁבַע הָוְויָן! כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר: עֲטוּפָה כְּאָבֵל, וּמְנוּדָּה מִכׇּל אָדָם, וַחֲבוּשָׁה בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: They are seven. When Rav Dimi came he said wrapped like a mourner, ostracized from all people and incarcerated within a prison,
llm_translation: These are the seven woes! When Rav Dimi came, he said: "She is wrapped like a mourner, and is banished from all people, and is bound in the house of prisoners."

hebrew_text: מַאי מְנוּדָּה מִכׇּל אָדָם? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דַּאֲסִיר לַהּ יִיחוּד, אִיהוּ נָמֵי אֲסִיר לֵיהּ יִיחוּד. אֶלָּא דַּאֲסִירָא לְבֵי תְרֵי.
human_translation: What is the meaning of ostracized from all people? If you say because it is forbidden for her to seclude herself it is also forbidden to seclude himself Rather, that it is forbidden to two
llm_translation: What is the prohibition of mingling with any man? If you say it is because it is forbidden to have intimacy with her, he too is forbidden to have intimacy with her. Rather, it is forbidden for two households.

hebrew_text: בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: מְגַדֶּלֶת שֵׂעָר כְּלִילִית, וְיוֹשֶׁבֶת וּמַשְׁתֶּנֶת מַיִם כִּבְהֵמָה, וְנַעֲשֵׂית כַּר לְבַעְלָהּ.
human_translation: It was taught in a baraita She grows hair like Lilit, she sits and urinates, like an animal; and serves as a pillow for her husband
llm_translation: In the Mishnah it was taught: A woman who grows her hair long like a Kelila, and sits and urinates like an animal, and becomes like a mound for her husband.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? הָנֵי שֶׁבַח הוּא לָהּ.
human_translation: And the other these are praise for her,
llm_translation: And the other? That is praise for her.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״מַלְּפֵנוּ מִבַּהֲמוֹת אָרֶץ וּמֵעוֹף הַשָּׁמַיִם יְחַכְּמֵנוּ״. ״מַלְּפֵנוּ מִבַּהֲמוֹת״ — זוֹ פְּרֵידָה, שֶׁכּוֹרַעַת וּמַשְׁתֶּנֶת מַיִם. ״וּמֵעוֹף הַשָּׁמַיִם יְחַכְּמֵנוּ״ — זֶה תַּרְנְגוֹל, שֶׁמְּפַיֵּיס וְאַחַר כָּךְ בּוֹעֵל.
human_translation: As Rabbi Ḥiyya said: What is that which is written: “Who teaches us by the beasts of the earth, and makes us wiser by the birds of the sky” “Who teaches us by the beasts of the earth”; this is the female mule, which crouches and urinates “And makes us wiser by the birds of the sky”; this is the rooster, which cajoles and then mates
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Chiya said, what is the meaning of what is written: "From the beasts of the earth and from the birds of the sky, they will teach us"? "From the beasts" - this is the wild ox, which kneels and drinks water. "And from the birds of the sky, they will teach us" - this is the rooster, which appeases and then mates.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אִילְמָלֵא לֹא נִיתְּנָה תּוֹרָה, הָיִינוּ לְמֵידִין צְנִיעוּת מֵחָתוּל, וְגָזֵל מִנְּמָלָה, וַעֲרָיוֹת מִיּוֹנָה. דֶּרֶךְ אֶרֶץ מִתַּרְנְגוֹל — שֶׁמְּפַיֵּיס וְאַחַר כָּךְ בּוֹעֵל.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Even if the Torah had not been given, we would have learned modesty from the cat, and stealing from the ant, and forbidden relations from the dove, and proper relations from the rooster, which appeases and then mates
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: If not for the Torah, we would learn modesty from the cat, and theft from the ant, and forbidden relationships from the dove. The way of the land from the rooster - that it appeases and then mates.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי מְפַיֵּיס לַהּ? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, הָכִי קָאָמַר לַהּ: זָבֵינְנָא לִיךְ זִיגָא דְּמָטוּ לִיךְ עַד כַּרְעָיךְ, לְבָתַר הָכִי אָמַר לַהּ: לִישְׁמַטְתֵּיהּ לְכַרְבַּלְתֵּיהּ דְּהָהוּא תַּרְנְגוֹלָא אִי אִית לֵיהּ וְלָא זָבֵינְנָא לִיךְ.
human_translation: What does appease Rav Yehuda said Rav said: say this: I will buy you a coat that will reach your feet. After say this: May the crest of this rooster fall off if he has and does not buy you one.
llm_translation: "What appeases her?" Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, thus he said to her: "We have sold to you a hen that will reach your knees, and afterwards he said to her: 'To release it for its claws, for that rooster, if it has them, we have not sold to you."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַדֶּלֶת שֶׁבַּמּוּקְצֶה, וַחֲדָקִים שֶׁבַּפִּרְצָה, וּמַחְצָלוֹת — אֵין נוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן גְּבוֹהִים מִן הָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: the door to a rear court, and bundles of thorns a breach; and mats, one not close with them unless they above the ground
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "The door at the threshold, and the pegs at the breach, and the bolts - one may not lock them unless they are raised from the ground."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּרְמִינְהוּ: דֶּלֶת הַנִּגְרֶרֶת וּמַחְצֶלֶת הַנִּגְרֶרֶת, וְקַנְקַן הַנִּגְרָר, בִּזְמַן שֶׁקְּשׁוּרִין וּתְלוּיִין — נוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן בְּשַׁבָּת, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר בְּיוֹם טוֹב!
human_translation: And raises a contradiction a door, or a mat, or a lattice [ kankan ] that drag when they are tied and suspended one close with them on Shabbat; and needless to say on a Festival.
llm_translation: Gemara: And they raised a dilemma: A sliding door and a sliding bolt, and a sliding jug, when they are tied and suspended - one may close them on Shabbat, and needless to say on Yom Tov!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בְּשֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶם צִיר, רָבָא אָמַר: בְּשֶׁהָיָה לָהֶן צִיר.
human_translation: Abaye said: to that have a hinge. Rava said: to that had a hinge,
llm_translation: Abbaye said: When they have a hinge, Rava said: When they had a hinge.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: דֶּלֶת הַנִּגְרֶרֶת, וּמַחְצֶלֶת הַנִּגְרֶרֶת, וְקַנְקַן הַנִּגְרָר, בִּזְמַן שֶׁקְּשׁוּרִין וּתְלוּיִין וּגְבוֹהִים מִן הָאָרֶץ אֲפִילּוּ מְלֹא נִימָא — נוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן, וְאִם לָאו — אֵין נוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן!
human_translation: raises an objection a door, or a mat, or a lattice that drag when they are tied and suspended and above the ground even by a hairbreadth, one close with them. However, if not one not close with them.
llm_translation: Challenger: A hinged door, a hinged window, and a hinged jug, when they are tied, suspended, and elevated from the ground, even if they are full of water - one may move them, but if not - one may not move them!

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ, וְרָבָא מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ. אַבָּיֵי מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ: אוֹ שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן צִיר, אוֹ שֶׁגְּבוֹהִין מִן הָאָרֶץ. רָבָא מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ: כְּשֶׁהָיָה לָהֶן צִיר, אוֹ שֶׁגְּבוֹהִין מִן הָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: Abaye reconciles in accordance with his reasoning, and Rava reconciles in accordance with his reasoning. Abaye reconciles in accordance with his reasoning either have a hinge or above the ground. Rava reconciles in accordance with his reasoning, have had a hinge or above the ground.
llm_translation: Abaye resolves according to his reasoning, and Rava resolves according to his reasoning. Abaye resolves according to his reasoning: either they have a pit, or they are elevated from the ground. Rava resolves according to his reasoning: when they had a pit, or they were elevated from the ground.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: סוֹכֵי קוֹצִים וַחֲבִילִין שֶׁהִתְקִינָן לְפִירְצָה שֶׁבְּחָצֵר, בִּזְמַן שֶׁקְּשׁוּרִין וּתְלוּיִין — נוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן בְּשַׁבָּת, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: The Sages taught branches of thorn bushes or bundles that were arranged a breach in a courtyard, when they are tied and suspended one close with them on Shabbat; and needless to say, on a Festival.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: bundles of thorns and sheaves that were set up for a breach in the courtyard, when they are tied and hanging - one may lock them on Shabbat, and needless to say on a festival.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: דֶּלֶת אַלְמָנָה הַנִּגְרֶרֶת — אֵין נוֹעֲלִין בָּהּ. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי דֶּלֶת אַלְמָנָה? אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי דְּחַד שִׁיפָא, וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי דְּלֵית לֵיהּ גַּשְׁמָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya taught a widowed door that drags one not close with it. What are the circumstances a widowed door? Some say from a single plank, and others say a door that does not have a lower doorsill
llm_translation: It was taught by Rabbi Chiya: A door of a widow that drags - one may not lock it. What is the case of a door of a widow? There are those who say that it has one threshold, and there are those who say that it does not have a threshold.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הַאי מְדוּרְתָּא, מִמַּעְלָה לְמַטָּה — שְׁרֵי, מִמַּטָּה לְמַעְלָה — אֲסִיר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: a fire from the top down, it is permitted. the bottom up, it is prohibited,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: This dwelling, from above to below - permitted; from below to above - prohibited.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בֵּיעֲתָא, וְכֵן קִידְרָא, וְכֵן פּוּרְיָא, וְכֵן חָבִיתָא.
human_translation: And the same eggs and the same a cauldron and the same bed and the same barrels
llm_translation: And so in Be'ata, and so in Kidra, and so in Purya, and so in Havita.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מִינָא לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן חֲנַנְיָה: חִדְקָאָה! דִּכְתִיב בְּכוּ ״טוֹבָם כְּחֵדֶק״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שָׁטְיָא, שְׁפֵיל לְסֵיפֵיהּ דִּקְרָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״יָשָׁר מִמְּסוּכָה״. וְאֶלָּא מַאי ״טוֹבָם כְּחֵדֶק״? כְּשֵׁם שֶׁחֲדָקִים הַלָּלוּ מְגִינִּין עַל הַפִּירְצָה, כָּךְ טוֹבִים שֶׁבָּנוּ מְגִינִּים עָלֵינוּ. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״טוֹבָם כְּחֵדֶק״, שֶׁמְּהַדְּקִין אֶת אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם לְגֵיהִנָּם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״קוּמִי וָדוֹשִׁי בַת צִיּוֹן כִּי קַרְנֵךְ אָשִׂים בַּרְזֶל וּפַרְסוֹתַיִךְ אָשִׂים נְחוּשָׁה וַהֲדִיקּוֹת עַמִּים רַבִּים וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: A certain heretic said to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya: Man of thorns! For it says about you: “The best of them is as a brier” He said to him: Fool, go down to the end of the verse: “The most upright is worse than a thorn hedge,” Rather, what is the best of them is as a brier? just as these thorns protect a breach, so the best among us protect us. Alternatively: The best of them is as a brier [ ḥedek ] that they grind [ mehaddekin ] the nations of the world into Gehenna, as it is stated: “Arise and thresh, O daughter of Zion, for I will make your horn iron, and I will make your hoofs brass, and you shall beat in pieces [ vahadikot ] many peoples;
llm_translation: He said to him, that one from Minya to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Chananiah: "Chidka'ah! As it is written in Scripture, 'Their goodness is like the morning cloud.'" He said to him: "Fool, look at the end of the verse of Scripture, as it is written, 'Upright from among the crooked.'" But what does 'Their goodness is like the morning cloud' mean? Just as these thorns protect against the breach, so too the good among us protect us. Another explanation: 'Their goodness is like the morning cloud,' for they grind the nations of the world to Gehinnom, as it is said, "Arise and thresh, O daughter of Zion, for I will make your horn iron and your hoofs bronze; you shall beat in pieces many peoples."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ לֹא יַעֲמוֹד אָדָם בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד וְיִפְתַּח בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים וְיִפְתַּח בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן עָשָׂה מְחִיצָה גְּבוֹהָ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: A person not stand in the private domain and open in the public domain in the public domain and open in the private domain unless he erected a partition ten handbreadths high the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A person may not stand in a private domain and open an object in a public domain, nor in a public domain and open an object in a private domain, unless he made a partition ten handbreadths high. These are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּשׁוּק שֶׁל פַּטָּמִים שֶׁהָיָה בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, וְשֶׁהָיוּ נוֹעֲלִין וּמַנִּיחִין אֶת הַמַּפְתֵּחַ בַּחַלּוֹן שֶׁעַל גַּבֵּי הַפֶּתַח. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: שׁוּק שֶׁל צַמָּרִים הֲוָה.
human_translation: said to him: an incident at the poultry dealers’ market in Jerusalem, and they would lock and place the key in the window that was over the door, Rabbi Yosei says: was a market of wool dealers.
llm_translation: They said to him: There was an incident in the market of the potters in Jerusalem, and they used to lock and place the key in the window above the door. Rabbi Yosei says: It was a market of wool merchants.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְרַבָּנַן, אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — וּמַהְדְּרוּ אִינְהוּ כַּרְמְלִית! דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: יְרוּשָׁלַיִם אִלְמָלֵא דַּלְתוֹתֶיהָ נִנְעָלוֹת בַּלַּיְלָה — חַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים.
human_translation: And Rabbis, Rabbi Meir spoke in the public domain, and they responded a karmelit . As Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Jerusalem, were it not its doors are locked at night, one would be liable for it because the public domain.
llm_translation: Gemara and the Rabbis, Rabbi Meir said: Public domain - and they made it like a Carmelit! For Rabba bar bar Ḥana said that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Were it not for the fact that the gates of Jerusalem are locked at night, they would be liable for the status of a public domain.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כָּאן — קוֹדֶם שֶׁנִּפְרְצוּ בָּהּ פְּרָצוֹת, כָּאן — לְאַחַר שֶׁנִּפְרְצוּ בָּהּ פְּרָצוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Here, before breaches were made in its there, after breaches had been made in
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Here - before breaches occurred in it, here - after breaches occurred in it.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: סֵיפָא אֲתָאן לְשַׁעֲרֵי גִינָּה, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: וְכֵן לֹא יַעֲמוֹד בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד וְיִפְתַּח בְּכַרְמְלִית, בְּכַרְמְלִית וְיִפְתַּח בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד,
human_translation: Rava said: In the latter clause we came to to gates of a garden is saying as follows: And likewise, not stand in the private domain and open in a karmelit ; in a karmelit and open in the private domain,
llm_translation: Rava said: The latter clause comes to teach us about the gates of a garden, and thus it states: "And so one should not stand in a private domain and open into a public domain, in a public domain and open into a private domain."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן עָשָׂה מְחִיצָה גְּבוֹהָה עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּשׁוּק שֶׁל פַּטָּמִים שֶׁהָיָה בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, שֶׁהָיוּ נוֹעֲלִין וּמַנִּיחִין אֶת הַמַּפְתֵּחַ בַּחַלּוֹן שֶׁעַל גַּבֵּי הַפֶּתַח. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: שׁוּק שֶׁל צַמָּרִים הָיָה.
human_translation: unless he erected a partition ten handbreadths high the statement of Rabbi Meir. said to him: An incident at the poultry dealers’ market in Jerusalem, as they would lock and place the key in a window that was over the door, Rabbi Yosei says: was a market of wool dealers.
llm_translation: Rather, if so, he made a high partition of ten handbreadths, the words of Rabbi Meir. They said to him: There was an incident in the market of the potters in Jerusalem, where they would lock up and place the key in the window above the door. Rabbi Yosei says: It was a market of wool merchants.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: פִּתְחֵי שַׁעֲרֵי גִינָּה, בִּזְמַן שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן בֵּית שַׁעַר מִבִּפְנִים — פּוֹתֵחַ וְנוֹעֵל מִבִּפְנִים, מִבַּחוּץ — פּוֹתֵחַ וְנוֹעֵל מִבַּחוּץ, מִכָּאן וּמִכָּאן — פּוֹתֵחַ וְנוֹעֵל כָּאן וְכָאן. אֵין לָהֶן לֹא לְכָאן וְלֹא לְכָאן — אֲסוּרִין כָּאן וְכָאן.
human_translation: The Sages taught the entrances of garden gates when they have a gatehouse on the inside, one open and close from within. on the outside, one open and close from without, from here, and there, one open and close here and there. they do not have neither here nor there, it is prohibited here and there,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: The entrances of a garden, when they have a gatehouse from within - one opens and closes from within; from outside - one opens and closes from outside. From here and from here - one opens and closes here and here. If they do not have a gatehouse neither here nor there - they are prohibited here and here.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן חֲנוּיוֹת הַפְּתוּחוֹת לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַמַּנְעוּל לְמַטָּה מֵעֲשָׂרָה — מֵבִיא מַפְתֵּחַ מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת וּמַנִּיחוֹ בָּאִיסְקוּפָּה, לְמָחָר פּוֹתֵחַ וְנוֹעֵל וּמַחְזִירוֹ לָאִיסְקוּפָּה.
