human_translation: And likewise, stores that open into the public domain: When the lock is below ten one bring a key on Shabbat eve and place it on the threshold, the following day he open and close and return to the threshold.
llm_translation: And so, the shop stalls that are open to the public domain, when the key is locked below ten handbreadths - one brings the key from Friday evening and places it in the window, the next day he opens and locks it and returns it to the window.

hebrew_text: וּבִזְמַן שֶׁהַמַּנְעוּל לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה — מֵבִיא מַפְתֵּחַ מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת וּמַנִּיחוֹ בַּמַּנְעוּל, לְמָחָר פּוֹתֵחַ וְנוֹעֵל וּמַחְזִירוֹ לִמְקוֹמוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: And when the lock is above ten bring a key on Shabbat eve and place it in the lock. the following day he open and close and return to its place the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: And in a time when the lock is above ten - one brings a key from Friday evening and places it in the lock, the next day he opens and locks and returns it to its place, the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אַף בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַמַּנְעוּל לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים — מֵבִיא מַפְתֵּחַ מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, וּמַנִּיחוֹ בָּאִיסְקוּפָּה, לְמָחָר פּוֹתֵחַ וְנוֹעֵל וּמַחְזִירוֹ לִמְקוֹמוֹ, אוֹ בַּחַלּוֹן שֶׁעַל גַּבֵּי הַפֶּתַח.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: Even when the lock is above ten handbreadths one bring a key on Shabbat eve and place it on the threshold, the following day he open and close and return to its place or in the window that is above the door.
llm_translation: The sages say: Even when the key is locked above ten handbreadths - one brings the key from Friday evening, places it in the window, the next day opens and locks it, and returns it to its place, or in the window above the doorway.

hebrew_text: אִם יֵשׁ בַּחַלּוֹן אַרְבָּעָה עַל אַרְבָּעָה — אָסוּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא כְּמוֹצִיא מֵרְשׁוּת לִרְשׁוּת.
human_translation: if the window is four by four and it is prohibited because as though one is transferring from domain, to domain.
llm_translation: If there are four by four in the window - forbidden, because it is like transferring from one domain to another.

hebrew_text: מִדְּקָאָמַר: ״וְכֵן חֲנוּיוֹת״, מִכְּלָל דִּבְאִיסְקוּפַּת כַּרְמְלִית עָסְקִינַן. הַאי מַנְעוּל הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִי דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ אַרְבָּעָה, מְקוֹם פְּטוּר הוּא.
human_translation: From it is stated And similarly, stores, by inference that we are dealing with a threshold a karmelit , this lock, what are the circumstances? If there is not four in it, it is an exempt domain.
llm_translation: From where he said: "And similarly, the storehouses," we are dealing with the general principle of a Carmelit. How much is the value of this lock? If it does not have four walls, it is considered an exempt area.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אִית בֵּיהּ אַרְבָּעָה, בְּהָא לֵימָא רַבָּנַן: אַף בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַמַּנְעוּל לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה מֵבִיא מַפְתֵּחַ מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת וּמַנִּיחוֹ בָּאִיסְקוּפָּה, לְמָחָר פּוֹתֵחַ וְנוֹעֵל בּוֹ וּמַחְזִירוֹ לָאִיסְקוּפָּה אוֹ לַחַלּוֹן שֶׁעַל גַּבֵּי הַפֶּתַח? וְהָא קָא מְטַלְטֵל מִכַּרְמְלִית לִרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד!
human_translation: And if it is four would the Rabbis say in that Even when the lock is above ten handbreadths he bring a key on Shabbat eve and place it in the threshold, the following day he open and close and return to the threshold or to a window above the door? Isn’t he moving from a karmelit to the private domain?
llm_translation: And if there are four in it, in this case let the Rabbis say: Even when the key is locked above ten handbreadths, one brings a key from before the Sabbath and places it in the window latch. The next day, he opens and locks with it, and returns it to the window latch or to the window that is above the door? And he is carrying from the private domain to the public domain!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לְעוֹלָם דְּאֵין בּוֹ אַרְבָּעָה, וְיֵשׁ בּוֹ לָחוֹק וּלְהַשְׁלִימוֹ לְאַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: Abaye said: Actually, is not four but there is to carve out complete four
llm_translation: Abaye said: Always there are not four, and there is in it for a statute and to complete it to four.

hebrew_text: וּבְהָא פְּלִיגִי: דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר חוֹקְקִין לְהַשְׁלִים. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: אֵין חוֹקְקִין לְהַשְׁלִים.
human_translation: And this is dispute: Rabbi Meir, maintains one carves out to complete And the Rabbis maintain one does not carve out to complete
llm_translation: And in this they argue: Rabbi Meir holds that we may carve to complete, while the Rabbis hold that we may not carve to complete.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מֵהָא מַתְנִיתָא תְּלָת: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ חוֹקְקִין לְהַשְׁלִים. וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ הֲדַר בֵּיהּ רַבִּי מֵאִיר מִשַּׁעֲרֵי גִינָּה.
human_translation: Rav Beivai bar Abaye said: Learn from this baraita three Learn from it we carve out to complete And learn from it Rabbi Meir retracted garden gates.
llm_translation: Rav Bibi bar Abbaye said, hear from this Mishnah three: hear from it that they measure to complete. And hear from it that Rabbi Meir adorned it with gate locks.

hebrew_text: וְשָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ מִדְּרַבָּנַן אִיתָא לִדְרַב דִּימִי, דְּכִי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מָקוֹם שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ אַרְבָּעָה עַל אַרְבָּעָה — מוּתָּר לִבְנֵי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים וְלִבְנֵי רְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד לְכַתֵּף עָלָיו, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יַחֲלִיפוּ.
human_translation: And learn from the Rabbis Rav Dimi is accepted. As when Rav Dimi came Rabbi Yoḥanan said: A place that is less than four by four it is permitted for the people in the public domain and for the people in the private domain to adjust onto their shoulders, provided that they do not exchange
llm_translation: And you shall hear from heretics from the disciples, it was said to Rav Dimi, when Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Yochanan said: A place that does not have four by four - it is permitted for the public domain and for the private domain to carry on it, as long as they do not switch.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נֶגֶר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בְּרֹאשׁוֹ גְּלוֹסְטְרָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹסֵר וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי מַתִּיר.
human_translation: a bolt that has knob [ gelustera ] at its end, Rabbi Eliezer prohibits and Rabbi Yosei permits
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: A carpenter's saw that has a metal plate on its tip, Rabbi Eliezer prohibits its use, while Rabbi Yosei permits it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: מַעֲשֶׂה בִּכְנֶסֶת שֶׁבִּטְבֶרְיָא שֶׁהָיוּ נוֹהֲגִין בּוֹ הֶיתֵּר, עַד שֶׁבָּא רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְהַזְּקֵנִים וְאָסְרוּ לָהֶן. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אִיסּוּר נָהֲגוּ בּוֹ, וּבָא רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְהַזְּקֵנִים וְהִתִּירוּ לָהֶן.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said: An incident in a synagogue in Tiberias, where they were accustomed permitted, until Rabban Gamliel and the Elders came and prohibited them. Rabbi Yosei says they were accustomed prohibited, and Rabban Gamliel and the Elders came and permitted them.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said: There was an incident in the synagogue of Tiberias where they were lenient, until Rabban Gamliel and the elders came and prohibited it. Rabbi Yosei says: They were stringent about it, and then Rabban Gamliel and the elders permitted it to them.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּנִיטָּל בְּאִגְדּוֹ — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי. כִּי פְּלִיגִי
human_translation: If can be moved by the rope everyone agrees When disagree,
llm_translation: Gemar b'Nital b'Igdo - kulei olma la p'ligi. Ki p'ligi.

hebrew_text: בְּשֶׁאֵינוֹ נִיטָּל בְּאִיגְדּוֹ, דְּמָר סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דְּיֵשׁ בְּרֹאשׁוֹ גְּלוֹסְטְרָא — תּוֹרַת כְּלִי עָלָיו. וּמָר סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דְּאֵינוֹ נִיטָּל בְּאִיגְדּוֹ — לֹא.
human_translation: in where it cannot be picked up by its rope, As Sage, maintains: Since it has a knob at its end, it has the status of a vessel, And Sage, maintains: Since it cannot be picked up by its rope, no,
llm_translation: In that it is not removed with its band, for Mar holds: since there is a glosṭra on his head — the law of a vessel applies to it. And Mar holds: since it is not removed with its band — no.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נֶגֶר הַנִּגְרָר — נוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ בְּמִקְדָּשׁ, אֲבָל לֹא בִּמְדִינָה.
human_translation: a bolt that drags one lock with it in the Temple However, not in the country
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: A dragging beam - one may fasten it in the Temple, but not in the province.

hebrew_text: וְהַמּוּנָּח כָּאן וְכָאן — אָסוּר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הַמּוּנָּח מוּתָּר בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ, וְהַנִּגְרָר בַּמְּדִינָה.
human_translation: And one that rests is prohibited in both Rabbi Yehuda says: One that rests is permitted in the Temple, and one that drags in the country.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And the munnach here and there — prohibited. Rabbi Yehuda says: The munnach is permitted in the Temple, and the nigrar in the province."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵיזֶהוּ נֶגֶר הַנִּגְרָר שֶׁנּוֹעֲלִין בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ אֲבָל לֹא בַּמְּדִינָה — כׇּל שֶׁקָּשׁוּר וְתָלוּי, וְרֹאשׁוֹ אֶחָד מַגִּיעַ לָאָרֶץ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: זֶה אַף בַּמְּדִינָה מוּתָּר, אֶלָּא אֵיזֶהוּ נֶגֶר שֶׁנּוֹעֲלִין בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ אֲבָל לֹא בַּמְּדִינָה — כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ לֹא קָשׁוּר וְלֹא תָּלוּי, וְשׁוֹמְטוֹ וּמַנִּיחוֹ בְּקֶרֶן זָוִית.
human_translation: The Sages taught Which is the bolt that drags with which one lock in the Temple but not in the country? Any that is tied and suspended while one end reaches the ground. Rabbi Yehuda says: This is permitted even in the country. Rather, which is bolt with which one lock in the Temple but not in the country? Any that is neither tied nor suspended but which one removes and places in a corner.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: What is a bolt that is dragged that may be locked in the Temple but not in the province? Any bolt that is tied and suspended, and its head reaches the ground. Rabbi Yehuda says: This is also permitted in the province, rather what is a bolt that may be locked in the Temple but not in the province? Any bolt that is neither tied nor suspended, and one may remove it and place it in a corner.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּנִגְרָר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda with regard to that is dragged.
llm_translation: Said Rav Yehudah said Shmuel: The halakha is like Rabbi Yehudah in Niggarar.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וְהוּא שֶׁקָּשׁוּר בַּדֶּלֶת. אִינִי?! וְהָא רַבִּי טַבְלָא אִיקְּלַע לְמָחוֹזָא, וַחֲזָא לְהָהוּא דַּהֲוָה תְּלֵי בְּעִיבְרָא דְּדַשָּׁא וְלָא אֲמַר לְהוּ וְלָא מִידֵּי? הָהוּא נִיטָּל בְּאִיגְדּוֹ הֲוָה.
human_translation: Rava said: And that is if is tied to the door Is that so? But didn’t Rabbi Tavla happen to Meḥoza and he saw a certain that was suspended from the side of the door, and he did not say anything to That was one that could be picked up by its rope.
llm_translation: Rava said: And he who is tied to the door. Is it not so?! But Rabbi Tavla entered a certain district, and he saw that there was a child hanging in the sky of the village of Dashai, and he did not say anything to them immediately? That child was taken by a demon.

hebrew_text: רַב אַוְיָא אִיקְּלַע לִנְהַרְדְּעָא, חַזְיֵיהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּהֲוָה קָא קָטֵיר בְּגֶמִי. אֲמַר: דֵּין לָא נִטְרוֹק.
human_translation: Rav Avya happened to Neharde’a saw a certain person tying with a reed. He said: This not be locked
llm_translation: Rav Avya came to Nahardea, he saw a certain man who was cutting with a sickle. He said: "This is not proper judgment."

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי זֵירָא: נִקְמַז, מַהוּ? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מַאי תִּיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ? לָא שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ הָא דְּתַנְיָא: נִשְׁמַט — אָסוּר, נִקְמַז — מוּתָּר. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אָמַר: נִקְמַז, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ נִשְׁמָט — אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira raised dilemma: was pressed what is Rav Yosef said: What is dilemma? he not heard that which was taught was detached it is prohibited; if it was pressed it is permitted; and Rabbi Yehuda said: was pressed even though it was not detached it is prohibited?
llm_translation: The question of Rabbi Zeira: If it was stolen, what is the law? Rav Yosef said: What does he need it for? It is not necessary for him. This is like what is taught: If it was dropped - it is forbidden, if it was stolen - it is permitted. And Rabbi Yehuda said: If it was stolen, even though it was not dropped - it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּנִקְמַז. וְטַעְמָא מַאי? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מִשּׁוּם דְּמֶיחְזֵי כְּבוֹנֶה.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda with regard to that was pressed And what is the reason that was pressed Abaye said: because it appears like building,
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehudah in the case of Nikmaz. And what is the reason? Abaye said: Because it appears like a bribe.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב נְחוּמִי בַּר זְכַרְיָה מֵאַבָּיֵי: עָשָׂה לוֹ בֵּית יָד, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בּוּכְנָא קָאָמְרַתְּ. אִיתְּמַר, אָמַר רַב נְחוּמִי בַּר אַדָּא: עָשָׂה לוֹ בֵּית יָד — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Rav Neḥumei bar Zekharya raised a dilemma before Abaye: one produced a handle for what is said to him: A pestle, you say? was stated Rav Neḥumei bar Adda said: he produced a handle for it is permitted.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rav Nachumi bar Zecharya from Abaye asked him: he made for him a hand house, what? He said to him: a bucket he meant. It was stated, Rav Nachumi bar Adda said: he made for him a hand house - permitted.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא שָׁרִיתָא דַּהֲוָה בֵּי רַבִּי פְּדָת דַּהֲוָה מַדְלוּ לַהּ בֵּי עַשְׂרָה וְשָׁדוּ לַהּ אַדְּשָׁא, וְלָא אֲמַר לְהוּ וְלָא מִידֵּי. אֲמַר — תּוֹרַת כְּלִי עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: there was a certain beam in the house of Rabbi Pedat that ten to lift it, and they would place it against the door And did not say anything to them He said: it has the status of a utensil.
llm_translation: That certain Sharita who was in the house of Rabbi Pedat, who would measure out for her a Beit of ten and throw to her a lentil, and he did not say to her and not immediately. He said - the law of a vessel is upon it.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא אֲסִיתָא דַּהֲוָת בֵּי מָר שְׁמוּאֵל דַּהֲוָה מַחְזֶקֶת אַדְרִיבָּא, שְׁרָא מָר שְׁמוּאֵל לְמִישְׁדְּיַיהּ אַדַּשָׁא. אֲמַר — תּוֹרַת כְּלִי עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: there was a certain mortar in the house of Mar Shmuel that had a capacity of an adriva , Mar Shmuel permitted to place it against the door said: It category of a utensil,
llm_translation: That case of the woman who was in the house of Mar Samuel, who was holding a needle, Mar Samuel saw her and was afraid. He said - "The Torah of a vessel is upon her."

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח לֵיהּ רָמֵי בַּר יְחֶזְקֵאל לְרַב עַמְרָם: נֵימָא לַן מָר מֵהָלֵין מִילֵּי מְעַלְּיָיתָא דַּאֲמַרְתְּ לַן מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב אַסִּי בְּכִיפֵּי דְאַרְבָּא. שְׁלַח לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: הָנֵי כִּיפֵּי דְאַרְבָּא בִּזְמַן שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן טֶפַח, אִי נָמֵי אֵין בָּהֶן טֶפַח וְאֵין בֵּין זֶה לָזֶה שְׁלֹשָׁה — לְמָחָר מֵבִיא מַחְצֶלֶת וּפוֹרֵס עֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Rami bar Yeḥezkel sent to Rav Amram: Let the Master tell us of those outstanding matters that you told us in the name of Rav Asi the arches of a boat sent to him Rav Asi said as follows: the arches of a boat, when they are a handbreadth even if they are not a handbreadth but there is less than three between them, on the following day, one bring a mat and spread over them.
llm_translation: Send to him Ramei son of Yechzeqel to Rav Amram. Say to him, "Master, from the words of the exalted one that you told us in the name of Rav Assi in the villages of Arba." Send to him thus said Rav Assi: "Those villages of Arba, when they have a handbreadth, or if they do not have a handbreadth, and there is no space between them, three - the next day he brings a cucumber and spreads it over them."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא — מוֹסִיף עַל אֹהֶל עֲרַאי הוּא, וְשַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי.
human_translation: What is the reason this is adding to a temporary tent, well
llm_translation: What is the reason? - He adds to the temporary tent, and it is reasonable that the value increases.

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ דִּכְרֵי דַּהֲווֹ לֵיהּ לְרַב הוּנָא, דְּבִימָמָא בְּעוֹ טוּלָּא וּבְלֵילְיָא בְּעוֹ אַוֵּירָא. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב.
human_translation: Rav Huna had certain rams that required shade during the day and required air at night. He came before Rav
llm_translation: Those palm trees that were for Rav Huna, during the day they would provide shade, and during the night they would provide light. He came before Rav.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל כְּרוֹךְ בּוּדְיָיא, וְשַׁיַּיר בַּהּ טֶפַח, לִמְחַר פַּשְׁטַהּ וּמוֹסִיף עַל אֹהֶל עֲרַאי הוּא, וְשַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי.
human_translation: said to him: Go, roll up mats [ budeya ] leave handbreadth On the following day, unroll adding to a temporary tent which is permitted.
llm_translation: He said to him: Go, tie a bucket, and leave in it a handbreadth. The next day he spread it out and added to the temporary tent, and it was beautiful.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי חִיָּיא: וִילוֹן מוּתָּר לִנְטוֹתוֹ וּמוּתָּר לְפוֹרְקוֹ בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rav said in the name of Rabbi Ḥiyya: a curtain one is permitted to spread it out, and one is permitted to dismantle it on Shabbat.
llm_translation: Rav said in the name of Rabbi Chiya: "A curtain is permitted to be spread out and permitted to be taken down on Shabbat."

hebrew_text: כִּילַּת חֲתָנִים מוּתָּר לְפוֹרְקָהּ וְלִנְטוֹתָהּ בְּשַׁבָּת. אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין בְּגַגָּהּ טֶפַח, אֲבָל יֵשׁ בְּגַגָּהּ טֶפַח — אָסוּר.
human_translation: a bridal canopy, it is permitted to dismantle it and to spread it on Shabbat. Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said: We said only where the top is less than a handbreadth However, if its top is a handbreadth prohibited.
llm_translation: The wrapping of a bride is permitted to be removed and spread out on Shabbat. Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said: We only said this when there is not a handbreadth on the roof, but if there is a handbreadth on the roof, it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: וְכִי אֵין בְּגַגָּהּ טֶפַח, לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה סָמוּךְ לַגַּג טֶפַח, אֲבָל יֵשׁ בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה סָמוּךְ לַגַּג טֶפַח — אָסוּר.
human_translation: And where its top is not a handbreadth we said only if is less than a handbreadth within three from top. However, if is a handbreadth within three from top, prohibited
llm_translation: And when there is not a handbreadth in its roof, we only said that there is not less than three handbreadths adjacent to the roof, but if there is less than three handbreadths adjacent to the roof - it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: וְכִי אֵין בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה סָמוּךְ לַגַּג טֶפַח נָמֵי, לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין
human_translation: where it is less than a handbreadth within three of top, we said only where
llm_translation: And when there are not less than three handbreadths adjacent to the roof, a handbreadth deep, we only said that there is not.

hebrew_text: בְּשִׁיפּוּעָהּ טֶפַח, אֲבָל יֵשׁ בְּשִׁיפּוּעָהּ טֶפַח — שִׁיפּוּעֵי אֹהָלִים כְּאֹהָלִים דָּמוּ.
human_translation: its incline does not extend a handbreadth However, if its incline extends a handbreadth the inclines of tents are considered like tents,
llm_translation: In its projection a handbreadth, but if there is in its projection a handbreadth - the projections of the tents are like the tents themselves.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: סְיָינָא — שְׁרֵי. וְהָתַנְיָא אָסוּר! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — דְּאִית בֵּיהּ טֶפַח, הָא — דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ טֶפַח.
human_translation: And Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, said: felt hat [ sayna ], it is permitted But wasn’t it taught is prohibited? not difficult. This where a handbreadth that where it does not a handbreadth
llm_translation: And Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, said: "Siyana - permitted." And it was taught: "Asur!" It is not difficult: this one - that has a handbreadth, this one - that does not have a handbreadth.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה: שַׁרְבֵּיב בִּגְלִימֵיהּ טֶפַח, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּאָסוּר?
human_translation: But if that is so, pulled his cloak a handbreadth is it also prohibited
llm_translation: Rather, from now on: if a Sherbav (a type of garment) in its folds is a handbreadth, is it indeed considered as forbidden?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — דְּמִיהַדַּק, הָא — דְּלָא מִיהַדַּק.
human_translation: Rather, not difficult; this where fits snugly that where it does not fit snugly
llm_translation: Rather, it is not difficult: this one - that is similar, this one - that is not similar.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מַחְזִירִין צִיר הַתַּחְתּוֹן בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ, אֲבָל לֹא בַּמְּדִינָה. וְהָעֶלְיוֹן — כָּאן וְכָאן אָסוּר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הָעֶלְיוֹן — בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ, וְהַתַּחְתּוֹן — בַּמְּדִינָה.
human_translation: One restore lower hinge pin in the Temple, but not in the country. And the upper is prohibited in both Rabbi Yehuda says: the upper in the Temple, while the lower one in the country.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may return the lower limb in the Temple, but not in the province. And the upper limb - here and here it is prohibited. Rabbi Yehuda says: The upper limb in the Temple, and the lower limb in the province.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: צִיר דֶּלֶת שִׁידָּה תֵּיבָה וּמִגְדָּל, בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ — מַחֲזִירִין, בַּמְּדִינָה — דּוֹחֲקִין. וְהָעֶלְיוֹן — כָּאן וְכָאן לֹא יַחֲזִיר, גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא יִתְקַע. וְאִם תָּקַע — חַיָּיב חַטָּאת.
human_translation: The Sages taught hinge pin of the door of a carriage, box, or cupboard, one restore in the Temple; in the country one back the upper one not restore in either a preventive measure, lest bang And if he banged he is liable a sin-offering,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A door hinge, a bolt, a lock, a key, a handle, a lock, a latch, a bar, a doorpost, a threshold, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door, a doorframe, a door,

hebrew_text: שֶׁל בּוֹר וְשֶׁל דּוּת וְשֶׁל יָצִיעַ — לֹא יַחְזִיר, וְאִם הֶחְזִיר חַיָּיב חַטָּאת.
human_translation: a pit, cistern, or an extension one not restore And if restored he is liable a sin-offering.
llm_translation: Of a pit and of a cistern and of a pit — one may not return, and if one returned, liable for a sin offering.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מַחְזִירִין רְטִיָּה בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ, אֲבָל לֹא בַּמְּדִינָה. אִם בַּתְּחִילָּה — כָּאן וְכָאן אָסוּר.
human_translation: One return a bandage in the Temple. However, not in the country. If for the first time it is prohibited in both
llm_translation: It was taught: One may return a lost object in the Temple, but not in the rest of the land. If initially it was lost — here and there it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: רְטִיָּה שֶׁפֵּרְשָׁה מֵעַל גַּבֵּי מַכָּה — מַחְזִירִין בְּשַׁבָּת. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הוּחְלְקָה לְמַטָּה — דּוֹחֲקָהּ לְמַעְלָה, לְמַעְלָה — דּוֹחֲקָהּ לְמַטָּה, וּמְגַלֶּה מִקְצָת הָרְטִיָּה וּמְקַנֵּחַ פִּי הַמַּכָּה, וְחוֹזֵר וּמְגַלֶּה מִקְצָת רְטִיָּה וּמְקַנֵּחַ פִּי הַמַּכָּה.
human_translation: The Sages taught bandage that became detached from a wound, one return on Shabbat Rabbi Yehuda says: it slipped downward, one push it upward; upward, one push it One uncover part of the bandage and clean the opening of the wound and then uncover another part of the bandage and clean the opening of the wound
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A bandage that was spread over a wound - one may return it on Shabbat. Rabbi Yehuda says: If it was loosened downwards, one tightens it upwards; if it was loosened upwards, one tightens it downwards. One uncovers some of the bandage and smooths the edge of the wound, then goes back and uncovers some of the bandage and smooths the edge of the wound.

hebrew_text: וּרְטִיָּה עַצְמָהּ לֹא יְקַנֵּחַ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא מְמָרֵחַ. וְאִם מֵירַח — חַיָּיב חַטָּאת.
human_translation: one not clean the bandage itself, because spreading and if one spread he is liable a sin-offering.
llm_translation: ורטייה עצמה לא יקנח, מפני שהוא ממרח. ואם מירח — חייב חטאת. Vertiya itself not he shall anoint, because he is smearing. And if he smeared — liable sin offering.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁפֵּירְשָׁה עַל גַּבֵּי כְּלִי, אֲבָל פֵּירְשָׁה עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. Rav Ḥisda said: taught only where it became detached onto a utensil, However, it became detached onto the ground, everyone agrees it is prohibited,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yehudah. Rav Ḥisdah said: They only taught this when she spread it on the top of a vessel, but if she spread it on the ground, everyone agrees that it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי: הֲוָה קָאֵימְנָא קַמֵּיהּ אַבָּא, נְפַלָה לֵיהּ אַבֵּי סַדְיָא, וְקָא מַהְדַּר לֵיהּ. אָמֵינָא לֵיהּ: לָא סָבַר לַהּ מָר לְהָא דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מַחְלוֹקֶת שֶׁפֵּירְשָׁה עַל גַּבֵּי כְּלִי, אֲבָל פֵּירְשָׁה עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע — אָסוּר, וְאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה!
human_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi said: I was standing before Father, fell onto a pillow and he replaced it. I said to him: Doesn’t the Master hold that which Rav Ḥisda said: The dispute where became detached onto a utensil, but if it became detached onto the ground, it is prohibited; and Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: Master Bar Rav Ashei said: I was standing before Abba, when Abba's father's garment fell, and he picked it up. I said to him: Does the Master not hold like what Rav Ḥisda said: A dispute that was resolved on a vessel is permitted, but if it was resolved on the ground, it is prohibited. And Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehudah!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לִי: לָא שְׁמִיעַ לִי, כְּלוֹמַר לָא סְבִירָא לִי.
human_translation: He said to me: I did not hear this that is to say, I do not agree
llm_translation: He said to me: "It is not heard to me," meaning, "It is not logical to me."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ קוֹשְׁרִין נִימָא בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ, אֲבָל לֹא בַּמְּדִינָה. וְאִם בַּתְּחִילָּה — כָּאן וְכָאן אָסוּר.
human_translation: One tie up a string [ nima ] in the Temple, but not in the country. And the first time is prohibited here and there.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may tie the threads in the Temple, but not in the province. And if initially tied in the province, it is prohibited here and there.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּרְמִינְהוּ: נִימַת כִּנּוֹר שֶׁנִּפְסְקָה — לֹא הָיָה קוֹשְׁרָהּ אֶלָּא עוֹנְבָהּ! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — רַבָּנַן, וְהָא — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
human_translation: And raises a contradiction a harp string broke, one would not tie it up but fashion a bow. not difficult; this in accordance with the Rabbis; and that Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: Gemara: And they raised a dilemma: If the string of the lyre snapped - he would only tie it with its grapevine! It is not difficult: this one - is according to the Rabbis, and this one - is according to Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר דְּאָמַר מַכְשִׁירֵי מִצְוָה דּוֹחִין אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, קוֹשְׁרָהּ. לְרַבָּנַן דְּאָמְרִי אֵין דּוֹחִין, עוֹנְבָהּ.
human_translation: According to Rabbi Eliezer, who said the preparations of a mitzva override Shabbat, tie according to the Rabbis, who say do not override one fashion a bow.
llm_translation: To Rabbi Eliezer who says: "Items that facilitate the performance of a commandment override the Sabbath," we tie it. According to the Rabbis who say: "They do not override," we leave it.

hebrew_text: אִי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, אֲפִילּוּ לְכַתְּחִילָּה נָמֵי!
human_translation: If Rabbi Eliezer, even for the first time, too
llm_translation: If Rabbi Eliezer, even to begin with, stands!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְהָא — רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rather, not difficult. This, Rabbi Yehuda, and that, the Rabbis,
llm_translation: Rather, it is not difficult: here Rabbi Yehuda, and here the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַלִּיבָּא דְּמַאן?
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda, in accordance with whose
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda said: "Who is the authority in the matter?"

hebrew_text: אִי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר קָאָמַר, אֲפִילּוּ לְכַתְּחִילָּה נָמֵי.
human_translation: If in accordance with of Rabbi Eliezer, also even ab initio ,
llm_translation: In the matter of Rabbi Eliezer, it is said, "Even at the outset, stand."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, הָא — רַבָּנַן, דְּתַנְיָא: בֶּן לֵוִי שֶׁנִּפְסְקָה לוֹ נִימָא בְּכִנּוֹר — קוֹשְׁרָהּ, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: עוֹנְבָהּ.
human_translation: Rather, not difficult; this Rabbi Shimon, that the Rabbis. As it was taught a string of the Levite’s harp was severed he tie it Rabbi Shimon says: He form a bow.
llm_translation: Rather, it is not difficult: here - Rabbi Shimon, here - the Rabbis, as it was taught: if a string snapped for Levi on his lyre - he ties it, Rabbi Shimon says: its grapevine.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אַף הִיא אֵינָהּ מַשְׁמַעַת אֶת הַקּוֹל. אֶלָּא מְשַׁלְשֵׁל מִלְּמַטָּה וְכוֹרֵךְ מִלְּמַעְלָה, אוֹ מְשַׁלְשֵׁל מִלְּמַעְלָה וְכוֹרֵךְ מִלְּמַטָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Even will not issue the sound, Rather, he unwinds from the lower winds it around the upper or he unwinds from the upper and winds it around the lower
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Even she does not hear the voice. Rather, she unties from below and ties from above, or unties from above and ties from below.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָא וְהָא רַבָּנַן, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בָּאֶמְצַע, כָּאן מִן הַצַּד.
human_translation: And if you wish, say both the Rabbis, and not difficult; here, in the middle, there, on the side
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: here and here the Rabbis, and it is not difficult: here in the middle, here on the side.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָא וְהָא בָּאֶמְצַע, מָר סָבַר: גָּזְרִינַן, וּמָר סָבַר: לָא גָּזְרִינַן.
human_translation: And if you wish, say both in the middle, One Sage, maintains as a decree, And Sage, maintains we do not issue a decree
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: This and this are in the middle. One Master holds: We decree, and the other Master holds: We do not decree.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חוֹתְכִין יַבֶּלֶת בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ, אֲבָל לֹא בִּמְדִינָה. וְאִם בִּכְלִי — כָּאן וְכָאן אָסוּר.
human_translation: one cut off a wart in the Temple, However, not in the country. And if with an instrument, it is prohibited in both
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One may cut the navel of an animal in the Temple, but not in the province. And if it is done with a utensil - in both cases it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּרְמִינְהוּ: הֶרְכֵּיבוֹ, וַהֲבָאָתוֹ מִחוּץ לַתְּחוּם, וַחֲתִיכַת יַבַּלְתּוֹ — אֵין דּוֹחִין, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: דּוֹחִין!
human_translation: And raises a contradiction carrying bringing it from outside the boundary, and cutting off its wart do not override Rabbi Eliezer, says: They override
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: And they raised the case: If one mounted it and brought it from outside the boundary, and a piece of its yavalt was removed - we do not push it back. Rabbi Eliezer says: We push it back!"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי (בֶּן) חֲנִינָא, חַד אָמַר: הָא וְהָא בְּלַחָה, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — בַּיָּד, כָּאן — בִּכְלִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Yosei ben Ḥanina One said both a moist and not difficult. Here, by hand. there, with an instrument
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Yosei (ben) Chanina, one said: "This and this with wetness, and it is not difficult: here - by hand, here - in a vessel."

hebrew_text: וְחַד אָמַר: הָא וְהָא בַּיָּד, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּלַחָה, הָא — בִּיבֵישָׁה.
human_translation: And one said both by hand, and not difficult. There, a moist here, a dry
llm_translation: And one said: "This and this in hand, and not difficult: this - in moist, this - in dry."

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״הָא בַּיָּד הָא בִּכְלִי״, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר ״הָא בְּלַחָה הָא בִּיבֵישָׁה״? אָמַר לָךְ: יְבֵישָׁה — אֲפִילּוּ בִּכְלִי נָמֵי שְׁרֵי, מַאי טַעְמָא? אִיפָּרוֹכֵי אִיפָּרְכָא.
human_translation: And according to the one who said: This by hand, that with an instrument; what is the reason that he did not say, This to a moist that dry He say to you a dry it is permitted even with an instrument. What is the reason? it crumbles
llm_translation: "And for the one who says, 'This is prohibited in the hand, this is permitted in a vessel,' what is the reason he did not say, 'This is prohibited in moist food, this is permitted in dry food'? I will tell you: dry food—even in a vessel it is permitted, what is the reason? It is crumbled, it is crumbled."

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״הָא בְּלַחָה וְהָא בִּיבֵישָׁה״, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר ״הָא בַּיָּד הָא בִּכְלִי״? אָמַר לָךְ: בִּכְלִי — הָא תְּנַן: אִם בִּכְלִי — כָּאן וְכָאן אָסוּר.
human_translation: And according to the one who said: This to a moist that to a dry what is the reason that he did not say, This by hand that with an instrument? He say to you with regard to an instrument, we learned If with an instrument, it is prohibited in both
llm_translation: And for the one who says, "This one is in a state of wetness, and this one is in a state of dryness," what is the reason he did not say, "This one is in the hand, and this one is in a vessel"? I say to you: in a vessel - as we learned: if in a vessel - here and there it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: וְאִידָּךְ — הָא דְּקָתָנֵי הָתָם, מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא בָּעֵי אִיפְּלוֹגֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And the other teaches this there because it wants the dispute Rabbi Eliezer and the Rabbis
llm_translation: And the other one - this that it was taught there, because it requires that even Rabbi Eliezer and the Rabbis should argue.

hebrew_text: וְאִידָּךְ — דּוּמְיָא דְּהֶרְכֵּיבוֹ וַהֲבָאָתוֹ מִחוּץ לַתְּחוּם קָתָנֵי, דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And the other teaches parallel to carrying and bringing it from outside the boundary, that are by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: The other opinion is that of the Sages, who maintain that one who rides an animal and brings it from outside the boundary is liable.

hebrew_text: וְאִידָּךְ: הֶרְכֵּיבוֹ דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי נָתָן, דְּאָמַר: הַחַי נוֹשֵׂא אֶת עַצְמוֹ. הֲבָאָתוֹ מִחוּץ לַתְּחוּם כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּאָמַר: תְּחוּמִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: And the other carrying not in accordance with Rabbi Natan, who said: A living being carries itself, bringing from outside the boundary, in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, who said: boundaries by Torah law.
llm_translation: And the other opinion is: One who rides on an animal without the animal's consent, not like Rabbi Nathan who said: "A living animal carries itself." Bringing it from outside the boundary is permitted like Rabbi Akiva who said: "Boundaries are from the Torah."

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב יוֹסֵף: אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה שְׁחִיטָה שֶׁהִיא מִשּׁוּם מְלָאכָה — דּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, אֵלּוּ, שֶׁמִּשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיִּדְחוּ אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת?
human_translation: Rav Yosef raised an objection Rabbi Eliezer said an a fortiori inference: If slaughtering which is due to a prohibited labor overrides Shabbat these due to rabbinic decree, isn’t it right that they override Shabbat?
llm_translation: Challenges Rav Yosef: Rabbi Eliezer said, a fortiori: And what about ritual slaughter, which is considered labor - it overrides the Sabbath; these, which are due to rabbinic prohibitions - is it not logical that they should not override the Sabbath?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הָא וְהָא בַּיָּד, וּשְׁבוּת מִקְדָּשׁ בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ — הִתִּירוּ, שְׁבוּת דְּמִקְדָּשׁ בַּמְּדִינָה — לֹא הִתִּירוּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: Both by hand, and a rabbinic decree the Temple within the Temple they permitted a rabbinic decree to the Temple, in the country, they did not permit
llm_translation: Rather, said Rav Yosef: This and this are in hand, and the captivity of the Temple in the Temple - they permitted, the captivity of the Temple in the province - they did not permit.

hebrew_text: יְתֵיב אַבָּיֵי וְקָאָמַר לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב סָפְרָא לְאַבָּיֵי: הָיָה קוֹרֵא בַּסֵּפֶר עַל הָאִסְקוּפָּה, וְנִתְגַּלְגֵּל הַסֵּפֶר מִיָּדוֹ — גּוֹלְלוֹ אֶצְלוֹ. וְהָא הָכָא דִּשְׁבוּת דְּמִקְדָּשׁ בַּמְּדִינָה הוּא, וְלָא גָּזְרִינַן דִּילְמָא נָפֵיל וְאָתֵי לְאֵיתוֹיֵי!
human_translation: Abaye sat and recited this halakha Rav Safra raised an objection to Abaye one was reading a scroll on the threshold and the scroll rolled out of his hand, he roll to himself. And here, isn’t it a rabbinic decree to the Temple in the country. And we do not issue a decree lest fall and he will come to bring it in
llm_translation: Abbaye was sitting and saying that matter. Rav Safra raised an objection to Abbaye: If one was reading from a scroll on the roof, and the scroll rolled out of his hand - he should roll it back to him. But here, regarding the case of the Shvut of the Temple in the province, we do not decree lest it fall and come to repair!

hebrew_text: וְלָא אוֹקֵימְנָא בְּאִסְקוּפָּה כַּרְמְלִית וּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים עוֹבֶרֶת לְפָנֶיהָ, דְּכֵיוָן דְּאִיגְדּוֹ בְּיָדוֹ — אֲפִילּוּ שְׁבוּת נָמֵי לֵיכָּא?!
human_translation: Didn’t we establish to a threshold a karmelit , and before which the public domain passes? As he holds in his hand, it is not even rabbinic decree.
llm_translation: We did not establish it in a Carmelit or a public domain, for since he holds it in his hand - is there even a temporary dwelling place present?!

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: מְשַׁלְשְׁלִין אֶת הַפֶּסַח לְתַנּוּר עִם חֲשֵׁיכָה. וְהָא הָכָא דִּשְׁבוּת דְּמִקְדָּשׁ בַּמְּדִינָה, וְלָא גָּזְרִינַן שֶׁמָּא יְחַתֶּה בַּגֶּחָלִים!
human_translation: raised an objection One lower the Paschal into the oven just before nightfall, But here with a rabbinic decree to the Temple in the country, we do not issue lest rake the coals
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: They may roast the Passover offering on the oven with ashes. But here, in the case of Shabbat that is sanctified in the province, we do not decree lest one stoke the coals!

hebrew_text: אִישְׁתִּיק. כִּי אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר לִי רַב סָפְרָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא לָא תְּשַׁנֵּי לֵיהּ: בְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה זְרִיזִין הֵן.
human_translation: was silent When he came before Rav Yosef, he said to him: This is what Rav Safra said to me, said to him: What is the reason you didn’t answer him: Members of a group are vigilant
llm_translation: The man was silent. When he came before Rav Yosef, he said to him: "So did Rav Safra tell me." He said to him: "Why did you not repeat it to him?" "The members of the group are diligent," he replied.

hebrew_text: וְאַבָּיֵי: ״כֹּהֲנִים זְרִיזִין הֵן״ — אָמְרִינַן, ״בְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה זְרִיזִין הֵן״ — לָא אָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: And Abaye, we say priests are vigilant, members of a group of people are vigilant, we do not say.
llm_translation: Abaye: "Kohanim zerizin hen" - we say, "Bnei chavurah zerizin hen" - we do not say.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הִיא, דְּאָמַר מַכְשִׁירֵי מִצְוָה דּוֹחִין אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת. וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר דְּכַמָּה דְּאֶפְשָׁר לְשַׁנּוֹיֵי מְשַׁנִּינַן.
human_translation: Rava stated is Rabbi Eliezer, who said preparations of a mitzva override Shabbat, And Rabbi Eliezer concedes as much as it is possible to alter we alter
llm_translation: Rava said: Rabbi Eliezer, that is, who said that the preparations for a commandment override the Sabbath. And Rabbi Eliezer concedes that we may change the wording of the Mishnah as much as necessary.

hebrew_text: מַאי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: כֹּהֵן שֶׁעָלְתָה בּוֹ יַבֶּלֶת — חֲבֵירוֹ חוֹתְכָהּ לוֹ בְּשִׁינָּיו. בְּשִׁינָּיו — אִין, בִּכְלִי — לָא. חֲבֵירוֹ — אִין, אִיהוּ — לָא.
human_translation: What is As it was taught a priest grew a wart, his fellow cut it off for him with his teeth. With his teeth, yes, with an instrument, no, his fellow yes, he no,
llm_translation: What is it that is taught: A priest in whom a wart has arisen - his fellow cuts it for him with his teeth. With his teeth - no, with a utensil - yes. His fellow - no, he himself - yes.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי? אִילֵּימָא רַבָּנַן וּבַמִּקְדָּשׁ, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן בְּעָלְמָא מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת — הָכָא, מָה לִי הוּא מָה לִי חֲבֵירוֹ?
human_translation: whose If you say the Rabbis, and in the Temple, since the Rabbis say in general due to rabbinic decree, here, what is to me himself what is to me another
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Mani? Ileima Rabbanan uvaMikdash, keivan de'amri Rabbanan be'alma mi'shum shevut - hacha, mah li hu mah li chaveiro?" English translation: "Who is he? Perhaps the Rabbis and in the Temple, since the Rabbis say in general regarding a Rabbinic enactment - here, what is it to me, what is it to his fellow?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר דְּאָמַר בְּעָלְמָא חַיָּיב חַטָּאת, וְהָכָא אַף עַל גַּב דְּמַכְשִׁירֵי מִצְוָה דּוֹחִין אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, כַּמָּה דְּאֶפְשָׁר לְשַׁנּוֹיֵי מְשַׁנִּינַן.
human_translation: Rather, wasn’t Rabbi Eliezer, said in general is liable to a sin-offering And here, even though preparations mitzva override Shabbat, as much as it is possible to alter one alters,
llm_translation: Rather, no, Rabbi Eliezer who says in general one is liable for a sin offering, and here, even though the preparations for a mitzvah override Shabbat, as much as we can change, we change.

hebrew_text: לָא: לְעוֹלָם רַבָּנַן, וְאִי עָלְתָה בִּכְרֵיסוֹ — הָכִי נָמֵי.
human_translation: No, Actually, and if grew on his abdomen, so too,
llm_translation: Not: Always scholars, and if it went up in his crib - thus it is said.

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? כְּגוֹן שֶׁעָלְתָה לוֹ נְשִׁיכָה בְּגַבּוֹ וּבְאַצִּילֵי יָדָיו, דְּאִיהוּ לָא מָצֵי שָׁקֵיל לַהּ.
human_translation: here, we are dealing with where, received a bite on his back or on his elbow, where he cannot remove it,
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? For example, if his wife climbed on his back and on the backs of his hands, as he cannot remove her.

hebrew_text: וְאִי רַבָּנַן, נִשְׁקְלֵיהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ בְּיָד, וְתִפְשׁוֹט דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מַחֲלוֹקֶת בַּיָּד, אֲבָל בִּכְלִי — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל חַיָּיב!
human_translation: But if the Rabbis, remove from him by hand, and resolve Rabbi Elazar, as Rabbi Elazar said: The dispute by hand, but with an instrument, everyone agrees he is liable
llm_translation: If the Rabbis, he was weighed and found to be in possession, and Rabbi Eliezer will strip him, as Rabbi Eliezer said: A dispute by hand, but in a vessel - everyone agrees he is liable!

hebrew_text: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר נָמֵי לִישְׁקְלֵיהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ בְּיָד! הַאי מַאי? אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר — הַיְינוּ דְּגָזַר יָד אַטּוּ כְּלִי. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ רַבָּנַן הִיא — נִשְׁקְלֵיהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ בְּיָד, וְתוּ לָא מִידֵּי.
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, Rabbi Eliezer also that he remove it for him by hand. What is this Granted, if you say Rabbi Eliezer, this is by hand was decreed due to an instrument, However, if you say it the Rabbis, he remove it for him by hand. And nothing more
llm_translation: And to taste, to Rabbi Eliezer, indeed to drink it he held it in his hand! This what? If you say according to Rabbi Eliezer — that is, he decreed hand like a vessel. Rather, if you say it is according to the Rabbis — he held it, he held it in his hand, and it is not immediately.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כֹּהֵן שֶׁלָּקָה בְּאֶצְבָּעוֹ — כּוֹרֵךְ עָלֶיהָ גֶּמִי. בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ, אֲבָל לֹא בַּמְּדִינָה. אִם לְהוֹצִיא דָּם — כָּאן וְכָאן אָסוּר.
human_translation: a priest who was injured on his finger he wrap it with a reed in the Temple, but not in the country, If is to draw blood it is prohibited in both
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A priest who was wounded on his finger - he wraps a bandage on it. In the Temple, but not in the rest of the land. If it is to extract blood - here and there it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא גֶּמִי, אֲבָל צִלְצוֹל קָטָן — הָוֵי יִתּוּר בְּגָדִים.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, said: They taught only a reed However, a small sash is considered an extra garment,
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah, son of Rabbi Chiya, said: They only taught regarding a large bell, but a small bell - it is permitted to wear it on garments.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: לֹא אָמְרוּ יִתּוּר בְּגָדִים אֶלָּא בִּמְקוֹם בְּגָדִים, אֲבָל שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם בְּגָדִים — לָא הָוֵי יִתּוּר בְּגָדִים.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: They said extra garment only in a place garments But in a place garments not is not considered an extra garment.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: They did not say "Yitur in garments" except in a place of garments, but if not in a place of garments - it is not considered Yitur in garments.

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם חֲצִיצָה! בִּשְׂמֹאל.
human_translation: And let him derive as an interposition. on left
llm_translation: And let it emerge from the issue of a partition! On the left.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי בְּיָמִין — וְשֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם עֲבוֹדָה.
human_translation: Alternatively, on right but not in a place service,
llm_translation: If he said it on the right - and not in the place of worship.

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרָבָא, דְּאָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: בִּמְקוֹם בְּגָדִים — אֲפִילּוּ נִימָא אַחַת חוֹצֶצֶת. שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם בְּגָדִים, שָׁלֹשׁ עַל שָׁלֹשׁ — חוֹצְצוֹת, פָּחוֹת מִשָּׁלֹשׁ עַל שָׁלֹשׁ — אֵינָן חוֹצְצוֹת.
human_translation: disputes of Rava, as Rava said Rav Ḥisda said: In a place garments even one thread interposes in a place garments not three by three it interposes, less than three by three it does not interpose.
llm_translation: The dispute of Rava, for Rava said in the name of Rav Ḥisda: In a place of garments—even if there is only one thread it constitutes a separation. Not in a place of garments, three by three—constitute a separation; less than three by three—they do not constitute a separation.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וַדַּאי פְּלִיגָא. אַדְּרַב יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא מִי נֵימָא פְּלִיגָא?
human_translation: certainly disagrees with of Rabbi Yoḥanan, shall we say that it disagrees with of Rav Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan certainly disagrees. But does Rabbi Yehuda, the son of Rabbi Chiya, really disagree?

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי צִלְצוֹל קָטָן דַּחֲשִׁיב.
human_translation: a small sash is different, since it is significant,
llm_translation: The translation of the Talmudic text is as follows: "The difference of a small bell is significant."

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא, אָמְרִי לַהּ: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא גֶּמִי, אֲבָל צִלְצוֹל קָטָן — חוֹצֵץ.
human_translation: another version, they reported Rav Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, said they taught only a reed, but a small sash interposes.
llm_translation: The other sages said to her: Rav Yehudah, son of Rabbi Chiyya, said: They only taught regarding a camel, but a small bell - it is a utensil.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: לֹא אָמְרוּ חֲצִיצָה בְּפָחוֹת מִשָּׁלֹשׁ עַל שָׁלֹשׁ אֶלָּא בִּמְקוֹם בְּגָדִים, אֲבָל שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם בְּגָדִים
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: They said interposition with regard to less than three by three only in a place garments However, in a place garments not
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: They did not say a partition less than three by three handbreadths is considered a partition, except in a place of garments, but not in a place that is not a place of garments.

hebrew_text: שָׁלֹשׁ עַל שָׁלֹשׁ — חוֹצְצוֹת, פָּחוֹת מִשָּׁלֹשׁ — אֵין חוֹצְצוֹת, וְהַיְינוּ דְּרָבָא אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא.
human_translation: three by three it interposes; less than three it does not interpose. And this is Rava Rav Ḥisda said.
llm_translation: Three by three - partitions, less than three - not partitions, and that is what Rava said, Rav Ḥisda.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא פְּלִיגָא דְּרַב יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא? שָׁאנֵי צִלְצוֹל קָטָן דַּחֲשִׁיב.
human_translation: Let us say that this disagrees with Rav Yehuda, son of Rav Ḥisda, a small sash is different, since it is significant.
llm_translation: Let us say the dispute of Rav Yehudah, son of Rabbi Chiya? It is different, as the small bell is significant.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אַדְּאַשְׁמְעִינַן גֶּמִי לַישְׁמְעִינַן צִלְצוֹל קָטָן!
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Yoḥanan: Rather than teaching us a reed, let teach us a small sash,
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Yochanan: We have heard a comparison to hearing a small bell!

hebrew_text: מִילְּתָא אַגַּב אוֹרְחֵיהּ קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּגֶמִי מַסֵּי.
human_translation: teaches us matter in passing, that a reed heals.
llm_translation: The matter, due to his behavior, is being heard by us, as it is similar to what happened.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בּוֹזְקִין מֶלַח עַל גַּבֵּי כֶּבֶשׁ בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁלֹּא יַחְלִיקוּ, וּמְמַלְּאִין מִבּוֹר הַגּוֹלָה וּמִבּוֹר הַגָּדוֹל בַּגַּלְגַּל בַּשַּׁבָּת, וּמִבְּאֵר הַקַּר בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: One scatter salt on ramp so that not slip And one draw water from the Cistern of the Exiles and from the Great Cistern, by the wheel on Shabbat. And from the Heker Well on a Festival.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may sprinkle salt on the back of a lamb so that they do not slip, and they may fill from the pit of the exile and from the large pit with a wheel on Shabbat, and from the cold well on a festival day.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ רָמֵי לֵיהּ רַב אִיקָא מִפַּשְׁרוּנְיָא לְרָבָא, תְּנַן: בּוֹזְקִין מֶלַח עַל גַּבֵּי הַכֶּבֶשׁ בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁלֹּא יַחֲלִיקוּ. בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ — אִין, בַּמְּדִינָה — לָא. וּרְמִינְהִי: חָצֵר שֶׁנִּתְקַלְקְלָה בְּמֵימֵי גְשָׁמִים — מֵבִיא תֶּבֶן וּמְרַדֶּה בָּהּ!
human_translation: Rav Ika from Pashronya raised a contradiction before Rava: We learned One scatter salt on the ramp so that not slip, In the Temple, yes, in the country, no, And raised contradiction a courtyard that was damaged by rainwater, one bring straw and scatter it about
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Aikah raised a contradiction to Rava from the Mishnah: "One may spread salt on the back of a lamb so that it does not become smooth. In the Temple - no, in the provinces - yes." And they asked: "If a courtyard became muddy from rainwater, one may bring straw and spread it on it!"

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי תֶּבֶן, דְּלָא מְבַטֵּיל לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Straw is different, as one does not negate it;
llm_translation: The difference regarding straw, for it does not nullify it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: הַאי מֶלַח הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דִּמְבַטְּלֵיהּ — קָא מוֹסֵיף אַבִּנְיָן (וּכְתִיב: ״הַכֹּל בִּכְתָב מִיַּד ה׳ עָלַי הִשְׂכִּיל״).
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: This salt, what are the circumstances? If one negates it he adds to the structure and it states “All this do I give you in writing as God has made me wise by His hand upon me,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ahah son of Rava said to Rav Ashi: How is this salt comparable? If it is nullified - it adds to the building (and it is written: "All this in writing from the hand of the Lord upon me, He made me understand").

hebrew_text: וְאִי דְּלָא קָא מְבַטְּלֵיהּ, קָא הָוְיָא חֲצִיצָה.
human_translation: And if he does not negate it constitute an interposition
llm_translation: And if not he is nullifying it, he is considered a chazitzah.

hebrew_text: בְּהוֹלָכַת אֵבָרִים לַכֶּבֶשׁ, דְּלָאו עֲבוֹדָה הִיא.
human_translation: when the limbs are brought up the ramp, that is not Temple service
llm_translation: When walking limbs to the liver, as it is not considered labor.

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״וְהִקְרִיב הַכֹּהֵן אֶת הַכֹּל וְהִקְטִיר הַמִּזְבֵּחָה״, וְאָמַר מָר: זוֹ הוֹלָכַת אֵבָרִים לַכֶּבֶשׁ! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: בְּהוֹלָכַת עֵצִים לַמַּעֲרָכָה, דְּלָאו עֲבוֹדָה הִיא.
human_translation: And not But isn’t it written: “And the priest shall offer it whole and make it smoke upon the altar” and the Master said This bringing the limbs to the ramp. Rather, say when the wood is brought to the arrangement that is not a service.
llm_translation: And not? And this is written: "And the priest shall bring all of it and offer it up on the altar," and Mar said: This refers to the limbs going to the sheep! Rather say: in bringing wood to the arrangement, as it is not considered service.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא: חָצֵר שֶׁנִּתְקַלְקְלָה בְּמֵימֵי גְשָׁמִים — מֵבִיא תֶּבֶן וּמְרַדֶּה בָּהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְרָבָא, וְהָתַנְיָא: כְּשֶׁהוּא מְרַדֶּה — אֵינוֹ מְרַדֶּה לֹא בְּסַל וְלֹא בְּקוּפָּה, אֶלָּא בְּשׁוּלֵי קוּפָּה!
human_translation: Rava taught: a courtyard that was damaged by rainwater, one bring straw and scatter it about Rav Pappa said to Rava: But wasn’t it taught When one scatters he not scatter with a basket or with a large basket, but with the bottom of a basket,
llm_translation: Rava expounded: If a courtyard became muddy due to rainwater, one should bring straw and spread it there. Rav Papa said to Rava, but isn't it taught: When spreading, one should not spread it neither in a basket nor in a pitcher, but in the corners of the pitcher!

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אוֹקֵים רָבָא אָמוֹרָא עֲלֵיהּ וּדְרַשׁ: דְּבָרִים שֶׁאָמַרְתִּי לִפְנֵיכֶם טָעוּת הֵן בְּיָדִי, בְּרַם כָּךְ אָמְרוּ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: וּכְשֶׁהוּא מְרַדֶּה — אֵינוֹ מְרַדֶּה לֹא בְּסַל וְלֹא בְּקוּפָּה, אֶלָּא בְּשׁוּלֵי קוּפָּה.
human_translation: Rava then appointed an amora before him and taught: The statement I issued before you was a mistake of mine. However, they said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer as follows: And when one scatters he not scatter with a basket or with a large basket, but with the bottom of a basket.
llm_translation: The Gemara retracted and established: The words that I said before you are a mistake in my hands, but nevertheless, they said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: And when he rebels, he does not rebel neither with a basket nor with a pitcher, but with the handles of the pitcher.

hebrew_text: מְמַלְּאִין מִבּוֹר הַגּוֹלָה. עוּלָּא אִיקְּלַע לְבֵי רַב מְנַשֶּׁה, אֲתָא הָהוּא גַּבְרָא טְרַף אַבָּבָא אֲמַר: מַאן הַאי? לִיתַּחַל גּוּפֵיהּ, דְּקָא מַחֵיל לֵיהּ לְשַׁבְּתָא.
human_translation: One draw water from the Cistern of the Exiles Ulla happened to the house of Rav Menashe a certain man came and knocked at the door. said: Who is that? May his body be desecrated, as he desecrates Shabbat
llm_translation: Filling from a pit that is uncovered. Ulla happened to come to the house of Rav Menashe, that man, the son of Abba, said: Who is this? Let his body be weakened, for he is desecrating the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה: לֹא אָסְרוּ אֶלָּא קוֹל שֶׁל שִׁיר. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מַעֲלִין בִּדְיוֹפִי וּמַטִּיפִין מֵיאֶרֶק לַחוֹלֶה בַּשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rabba said to him: prohibited only a musical sound Abaye raised an objection to One draw up with a siphon [ diyofei ], and one drip miarak for an ill on Shabbat.
llm_translation: Rabba said to him: They only prohibited the sound of singing. Abaye raised an objection: We may ascend with a bandage and drip water into the mouth of a sick person on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: לַחוֹלֶה אִין, לַבָּרִיא לָא. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? לָאו דְּנָיֵם וְקָא בָּעֵי דְּלִיתְּעַר. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: אוֹלוֹדֵי קָלָא אֲסִיר!
human_translation: For an ill yes, for a healthy no, what are the circumstances? not that he is dozing off and they wish to waken him, And learn from here it is prohibited to produce a sound
llm_translation: To the sick one, yes; to the healthy one, no. How so? It is not that he is in pain and requires relief. Learn from this: Even the lightest labor is forbidden!

hebrew_text: לָא: דְּתִיר, וְקָא בָּעֵי דְּלֵינִים — דְּמִשְׁתַּמֵּעַ כִּי קָלָא דְזִמְזוּמֵי.
human_translation: No, who is awake and whom they want to have fall asleep, a sound that is heard as melodious.
llm_translation: Not permitted, and he is asking for figs - because he is weakened by the sound of the locusts.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: הַמְשַׁמֵּר פֵּירוֹתָיו מִפְּנֵי הָעוֹפוֹת, וּדְלֻעָיו מִפְּנֵי הַחַיָּה — מְשַׁמֵּר כְּדַרְכּוֹ בְּשַׁבָּת, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִסְפֹּק וְלֹא יְטַפֵּחַ וְלֹא יְרַקֵּד כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁהֵן עוֹשִׂין בַּחוֹל.
human_translation: raised objection to One who is guarding his produce from birds or his gourds from beasts guard in manner he on Shabbat, provided that he neither claps, nor slaps nor dances in the manner that is performed on weekdays
llm_translation: He raised an objection: One who guards his fruits from birds, and his gourds from animals - he may guard them in his usual manner on Shabbat, provided that he does not inspect them, clap his hands, or dance, as is done on a weekday.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא — לָאו דְּקָמוֹלֵיד קָלָא, וְכׇל אוֹלוֹדֵי קָלָא אֲסִיר? אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יִטּוֹל צְרוֹר.
human_translation: What is the reason not because he is producing a sound and any production of a sound is prohibited? Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: a decree lest he picks up a pebble
llm_translation: What is the reason? - Is it not because of the danger of a miscarriage, and all miscarriages are prohibited? Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: It is a decree lest one take a pebble.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: נָשִׁים הַמְשַׂחֲקוֹת בֶּאֱגוֹזִים — אָסוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא — לָאו דְּקָא מוֹלֵיד קָלָא, וְכׇל אוֹלוֹדֵי קָלָא אֲסִיר?
human_translation: However, that which Rav Yehuda said Rav said: Women who play with nuts prohibited what is the reason not because produces a sound, and any production of a sound is prohibited?
llm_translation: And rather this that Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Women who play with nuts - prohibited. What is the reason? - Because it may lead to a miscarriage, and all miscarriages are forbidden.

hebrew_text: לָא, דִּלְמָא אָתֵי לְאַשְׁווֹיֵי גּוּמּוֹת.
human_translation: No, perhaps they will come to level the holes.
llm_translation: Not, perhaps will come to equalize bodies.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, הָא דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: נָשִׁים מְשַׂחֲקוֹת בְּתַפּוּחִים — אָסוּר, הָתָם מַאי אוֹלוֹדֵי קָלָא אִיכָּא?! אֶלָּא: דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְאַשְׁווֹיֵי גּוּמּוֹת.
human_translation: For if you do not say this that Rav Yehuda said: Women who play with apples, prohibited, what production of a sound is involved there? Rather, they will perhaps come to level holes,
llm_translation: If you don't say so, this is what Rav Yehudah said: Women who play with apples - forbidden. What is the reason there? Is there a concern for light-headedness? Rather, perhaps it will lead to comparing shapes.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: מְמַלְּאִין מִבּוֹר הַגּוֹלָה וּמִבּוֹר הַגָּדוֹל בַּגַּלְגַּל בְּשַׁבָּת, בְּמִקְדָּשׁ — אִין, בִּמְדִינָה — לָא. מַאי טַעְמָא, לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּאוֹלוֹדֵי קָלָא — וַאֲסִיר?
human_translation: We learned One draw water from the Cistern of the Exiles and from the Great Cistern by the wheel on Shabbat. In the Temple, yes, in the country, no, What is the reason not because he is producing a sound, and is prohibited
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: One may fill from a pit of the exiled and from a large pit with a wheel on Shabbat, in the Temple - no, in the province - yes. What is the reason? Not because they are considered a vessel - and it is prohibited?

hebrew_text: לָא, גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יְמַלֵּא לְגִינָּתוֹ וּלְחוּרְבָּתוֹ.
human_translation: No, a decree lest he draw for his garden and for his ruin.
llm_translation: Not, decree lest he fill his garden and his vineyard.

hebrew_text: אַמֵּימָר שְׁרָא לְמִימְלֵא בְּגִילְגְּלָא בְּמָחוֹזָא, אָמַר: מַאי טַעְמָא גְּזַרוּ רַבָּנַן — שֶׁמָּא יְמַלֵּא לְגִינָּתוֹ וּלְחוּרְבָּתוֹ? הָכָא, לָא גִּינָּה אִיכָּא, וְלָא חוּרְבָּה אִיכָּא.
human_translation: Ameimar permitted to draw by a wheel in Meḥoza, he said: What is the reason the Sages decreed lest one draw for his garden and for his ruin. here there are neither gardens nor ruins.
llm_translation: Ammemar permitted to fill a winepress in the courtyard in the village, he said: What is the reason the Rabbis decreed - lest he fill his garden and his ruin? Here, there is no garden here, and there is no ruin here.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּקָא חָזֵא דְּקָא
human_translation: once he saw that
llm_translation: As soon as he sees that he sees.

hebrew_text: תָּרוּ בַּהּ כִּיתָּנָא — אֲסַר לְהוּ.
human_translation: they were soaking flax he prohibited them
llm_translation: They taught in it: "Kittana" - he prohibited it.

hebrew_text: וּמִבְּאֵר הַקַּר. מַאי בְּאֵר הַקַּר? אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בּוֹר שֶׁהִקְרוּ עָלֶיהָ דְּבָרִים וְהִתִּירוּהָ.
human_translation: from the Heker Well. What is the Heker Well? Shmuel said: a cistern with regard to which they advanced hikru arguments and permitted it
llm_translation: And from the pit he dug. What is the pit he dug? Shmuel said: A pit into which words were dug and they permitted it.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: לֹא כׇּל הַבּוֹרוֹת הַקָּרוֹת הִתִּירוּ, אֶלָּא זוֹ בִּלְבַד. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ ״שֶׁהִקְרוּ דְּבָרִים עָלֶיהָ״, מַאי ״זוֹ בִּלְבַד״?
human_translation: raises an objection They did not permit all Heker wells, but only this one. And if you say with regard to which they put forward arguments what is only this one
llm_translation: Challenger: Not all pits that are dug were permitted, rather this one alone. And if you say, "that things were said about it," what is "this one alone"?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: בְּאֵר מַיִם חַיִּים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כְּהָקִיר בַּיִר מֵימֶיהָ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: a well of living water, as it is stated: “As a well keeps its water fresh hakir
llm_translation: Rather, said Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak: "A well of living waters," as it is stated: "Like a spring whose waters do not fail."

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: לֹא כׇּל הַבּוֹרוֹת הַקָּרוֹת הִתִּירוּ, אֶלָּא זוֹ בִּלְבַד. וּכְשֶׁעָלוּ בְּנֵי הַגּוֹלָה חָנוּ עָלֶיהָ, וּנְבִיאִים שֶׁבֵּינֵיהֶן הִתִּירוּ לָהֶן. וְלֹא נְבִיאִים שֶׁבֵּינֵיהֶן, אֶלָּא מִנְהַג אֲבוֹתָם בִּידֵיהֶם.
human_translation: the matter itself, They did not permit all Heker wells, but only this one. And when the exiles ascended they encamped by it, and the prophets among them, permitted to them. And it was not the prophets among them but a customary practice to them from their forefathers,
llm_translation: Body: Not all the pits that were dug were permitted, only this one alone. And when the exiles came up, they camped on it, and the prophets among them permitted it. And not the prophets among them, but the custom of their fathers was in their hands.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שֶׁרֶץ שֶׁנִּמְצָא בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ — כֹּהֵן מוֹצִיאוֹ בְּהֶמְיָינוֹ, שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁהוֹת אֶת הַטּוּמְאָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בִּצְבַת שֶׁל עֵץ, שֶׁלֹּא לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַטּוּמְאָה.
human_translation: a creeping animal, that is found in the Temple, a priest carry it out in his girdle, so as not to delay the impurity the statement of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka. Rabbi Yehuda says: with wooden prongs, so as not to increase the impurity,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If a creeping creature is found in the Temple, the priest should remove it with his garment, so as not to delay the impurity, the words of Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka. Rabbi Yehuda says: With a wooden spoon, so as not to increase the impurity.

hebrew_text: מֵהֵיכָן מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתוֹ — מִן הַהֵיכָל, וּמִן הָאוּלָם, וּמִבֵּין הָאוּלָם וְלַמִּזְבֵּחַ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן נַנָּס.
human_translation: from where does one remove it From the Sanctuary, from the Entrance Hall, and from between the Entrance Hall and the altar, the statement of Rabbi Shimon ben Nannas.
llm_translation: From where do they bring it out? From the Sanctuary, and from the Hall, and from between the Hall and the Altar. These are the words of Rabbi Shimon ben Nannas.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁחַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹנוֹ כָּרֵת וְעַל שִׁגְגָתוֹ חַטָּאת — מִשָּׁם מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתוֹ. וּשְׁאָר כׇּל הַמְּקוֹמוֹת — כּוֹפִין עָלָיו פְּסַכְתֵּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Any place where one is liable to karet intentionally and sin-offering unwittingly, from there one remove it. And the rest of the places one covers with a bowl [ pesakhter ]
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Any place where one is liable for intentional transgression to receive karet and for unintentional transgression to bring a sin offering - from there they remove him. And in all other places, they impose upon him a fine.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מָקוֹם שֶׁהִתִּירוּ לְךָ חֲכָמִים, מִשֶּׁלְּךָ נָתְנוּ לָךְ — שֶׁלֹּא הִתִּירוּ לְךָ אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says Wherever the Sages permitted to you, they granted you from your own, as they permitted to you only due to rabbinic decree,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: A place where the sages permitted for you, they gave it to you from yours - they only permitted for you due to a rabbinic decree.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב טָבִי בַּר קִיסְנָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַמַּכְנִיס טְמֵא שֶׁרֶץ לַמִּקְדָּשׁ — חַיָּיב, שֶׁרֶץ עַצְמוֹ — פָּטוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר קְרָא: ״מִזָּכָר וְעַד נְקֵבָה תְּשַׁלֵּחוּ״, מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ טׇהֳרָה בְּמִקְוֶה. יָצָא שֶׁרֶץ שֶׁאֵין לוֹ טׇהֳרָה.
human_translation: Rav Tavi bar Kisna said Shmuel said: one who brings into the Temple defiled by a creeping animal he is liable, a creeping animal itself, he is exempt. What is the reason The verse said: “Both male and female shall you put out, one who has purification in a ritual bath, excludes a creeping animal, which has no purification.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Tavi bar Kisna said in the name of Shmuel: One who brings in a ritually impure creeping creature into the Temple - is liable, but the creature itself - is exempt. What is the reason? It is said in the verse: "From male to female you shall send them out," one who has purity through immersion. The creeping creature that does not have purity is exempt.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: ״מִזָּכָר עַד נְקֵבָה תְּשַׁלֵּחוּ״ — פְּרָט לִכְלִי חֶרֶשׂ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי. מַאי טַעְמָא, לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּלֵית לֵיהּ טׇהֳרָה בְּמִקְוֶה?
human_translation: Let us say supports him: “Both male and female shall you put out”; excludes an earthenware vessel. the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili. What is the reason not because does not have purification in a ritual bath,
llm_translation: Let us say it supports him: "From male to female you shall send away" - excluding earthenware vessels, the words of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean. What is the reason? Is it not because it does not have purity in a mikveh?

hebrew_text: לָא, מִי שֶׁנַּעֲשָׂה אַב הַטּוּמְאָה. יָצָא כְּלִי חֶרֶס, שֶׁאֵינוֹ נַעֲשָׂה אַב הַטּוּמְאָה.
human_translation: No, something that can become a primary source of ritual impurity, excludes an earthenware vessel, which cannot become a primary source of ritual impurity.
llm_translation: Not so, one who became a father of impurity. He is like an earthenware vessel, which does not become a father of impurity.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: שֶׁרֶץ שֶׁנִּמְצָא בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ — כֹּהֵן מוֹצִיאוֹ בְּהֶמְיָינוֹ, שֶׁלֹּא לְשַׁהוֹת אֶת הַטּוּמְאָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בִּצְבָת שֶׁל עֵץ מוֹצִיאוֹ, שֶׁלֹּא לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַטּוּמְאָה.
human_translation: Let us say parallel to tanna’im , a creeping animal that is found in the Temple, a priest carry it out in his girdle, so as not to delay the impurity. the statement of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka. Rabbi Yehuda says: He remove it with wooden prongs, so as not to increase the impurity.
llm_translation: Let us say according to the Tannaim: If a creeping thing is found in the Temple - the priest shall take it out with its dung, so as not to delay the impurity, the words of Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka. Rabbi Yehuda says: With a wooden spoon he shall take it out, so as not to increase the impurity.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי: דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר שֶׁלֹּא לְשַׁהוֹת, קָסָבַר: הַמַּכְנִיס שֶׁרֶץ לַמִּקְדָּשׁ — חַיָּיב. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר שֶׁלֹּא לְרַבּוֹת, קָסָבַר: הַמַּכְנִיס שֶׁרֶץ לַמִּקְדָּשׁ — פָּטוּר.
human_translation: What, isn’t it that this disagree: The one who said not delay maintains one who brings a creeping animal into the Temple is liable, And the one who said not increase impurity maintains one who brings a creeping animal into the Temple is exempt.
llm_translation: What is the reason that they do not argue about this? For one who says not to delay, he holds: one who brings a creeping creature into the sanctuary - is liable. And one who says not to include, he holds: one who brings a creeping creature into the sanctuary - is exempt.

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא חַיָּיב. וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, מָר סָבַר: שַׁהוֹיֵי טוּמְאָה — עֲדִיף. וּמָר סָבַר: אַפּוֹשֵׁי טוּמְאָה — עֲדִיף.
human_translation: No, everyone agrees is liable, and here, this they disagree: The Sage, holds: Delaying impurity takes precedence. Whereas the Sage, holds: Increasing impurity takes precedence,
llm_translation: Not, that all the world is obligated. And here in this case they are arguing, the Master holds: that being in a state of impurity is preferable. And the Master holds: that being in a state of purity is preferable.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כְּהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי, דִּתְנַן: מֵהֵיכָן מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתוֹ כּוּ׳.
human_translation: Rather, these tanna’im , as we learned From where does one remove
llm_translation: Rather, like the Tannaitic sages, as we learned: From where do we extract it?

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי: דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר מֵעֲזָרָה לָא, קָסָבַר: הַמַּכְנִיס שֶׁרֶץ לַמִּקְדָּשׁ — פָּטוּר, וּמַאן דְּאָמַר מִכּוּלַּהּ עֲזָרָה, קָסָבַר — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Isn’t it that disagree about the following: The one who said not from the courtyard maintains one who brings a creeping animal into the Temple is exempt, And the one who said that from the entire courtyard maintains is liable.
llm_translation: What is the reason that they do not argue about this? One who says from the Azarah, he holds: one who brings a creeping thing into the Temple is exempt. And one who says from the entire Azarah, he holds: he is liable.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וּשְׁנֵיהֶם מִקְרָא אֶחָד דָּרְשׁוּ: ״וַיָּבֹאוּ הַכֹּהֲנִים לִפְנִימָה בֵית ה׳ לְטַהֵר וַיּוֹצִיאוּ אֵת כׇּל הַטּוּמְאָה אֲשֶׁר מָצְאוּ בְּהֵיכַל ה׳ לַחֲצַר בֵּית ה׳ וַיְקַבְּלוּ הַלְוִיִּם לְהוֹצִיא לְנַחַל קִדְרוֹן חוּצָה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Both derived their opinions from the same verse: “And the priests went into the inner part of the House of God, to cleanse it, and they brought out all the impurity that they found in the Temple of God into the courtyard of the House of God. And the Levites took it, to carry it out to the brook of Kidron”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said, and both of them expounded one verse: "The priests entered the inner part of the house of the Lord to purify, and they brought out all the impurity that they found in the temple of the Lord to the courtyard of the house of the Lord. And the Levites received it to take it out to the Kidron Valley outside."

hebrew_text: מָר סָבַר: מִדְּאִשְׁתַּנִּי בַּעֲזָרָה בִּלְוִיִּם, טוּמְאָה בַּעֲזָרָה לֵיכָּא.
human_translation: Sage, maintains: As there was a change the Levites, in the courtyard, there is no impurity in the courtyard,
llm_translation: Master holds: Since it differs in the Azarah between Levites, impure in the Azarah does not exist.

hebrew_text: וּמָר סָבַר: עַד הֵיכָא דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר בִּלְוִיִּם, מַפְּקִי כֹּהֲנִים. הַשְׁתָּא דְּאֶפְשָׁר בִּלְוִיִּם, תּוּ לָא מִטַּמְּאִי כֹּהֲנִים.
human_translation: And Sage, maintains: Up to where it is impossible by the Levites, the priests took it out. now where it is possible by the Levites, the priests no longer render themselves ritually impure,
llm_translation: And Mar said: Until here where it is not possible with Levites, we bring out Kohanim. Now that it is possible with Levites, come and do not render Kohanim impure.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַכֹּל נִכְנָסִין בַּהֵיכָל לִבְנוֹת לְתַקֵּן וּלְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַטּוּמְאָה, וּמִצְוָה בְּכֹהֲנִים. אִם אֵין שָׁם כֹּהֲנִים — נִכְנָסִין לְוִיִּם, אֵין שָׁם לְוִיִּם — נִכְנָסִין יִשְׂרְאֵלִים. וְאִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי, טְהוֹרִין — אִין, טְמֵאִין — לָא.
human_translation: The Sages taught everyone enter the Sanctuary to build, to repair, or to remove impurity the mitzva is by priests. If no priests are available, Levites enter; if no Levites are available, Israelites enter. In both they are pure, yes, they are impure, no,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: All may enter the sanctuary to build, to repair, and to remove impurity, and it is a commandment for the priests. If there are no priests present, Levites may enter; if there are no Levites, Israelites may enter. And both the pure and the impure may enter, but not the impure.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: רַב כָּהֲנָא מְסַיַּיע כָּהֲנֵי, דְּתָנֵי רַב כָּהֲנָא: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״אַךְ אֶל הַפָּרוֹכֶת לֹא יָבֹא״, יָכוֹל לֹא יְהוּ כֹּהֲנִים בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין נִכְנָסִין בֵּין הָאוּלָם וְלַמִּזְבֵּחַ לַעֲשׂוֹת רִיקּוּעֵי פַחִים —
human_translation: Rav Huna said: Rav Kahana, supports priests As Rav Kahana taught Since it is stated “Only he shall not go in unto the veil, might priests with blemishes not enter between the Entrance Hall and the altar to manufacture beaten plates
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: Rav Kahana assists the priests, as Rav Kahana teaches: Because it is stated "But into the veil, he shall not come," one might think that priests with blemishes may not enter between the hall and the altar to perform the removal of the ashes —

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״אַךְ״ — חִלֵּק: מִצְוָה בִּתְמִימִים, אֵין שָׁם תְּמִימִים — נִכְנָסִין בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין. מִצְוָה בִּטְהוֹרִין, אֵין שָׁם טְהוֹרִין — נִכְנָסִין טְמֵאִין. אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי, כֹּהֲנִים — אִין, יִשְׂרְאֵלִים — לָא.
human_translation: the verse teaches “only” a distinction mitzva unblemished if no unblemished are available, blemished ones enter. pure if no pure are available, impure ones enter. In both priests, yes, Israelites, no,
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "Only" - it divides: a commandment with the perfect, there are no perfect ones - those with blemishes enter. A commandment with the pure, there are no pure ones - the impure enter. Both this and that, priests - no, Israelites - yes.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: טָמֵא וּבַעַל מוּם, אֵיזוֹ מֵהֶן נִכְנָס? רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: טָמֵא נִכְנָס, דְּהָא אִישְׁתְּרִי בַּעֲבוֹדַת צִיבּוּר. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: בַּעַל מוּם נִכְנָס, דְּהָא אִישְׁתְּרִי בַּאֲכִילַת קָדָשִׁים.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised impure and has a blemish, which of them enter Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi said Rav said: impure one enter, as he is permitted in communal service. Rabbi Elazar says: one with the blemish enter, as he is permitted to eat consecrated foods,
llm_translation: He inquired of them: A ritually impure person and one with a blemish, which of them may enter? Rav Chiya bar Ashe said in the name of Rav: A ritually impure person may enter, for he is permitted in communal service. Rabbi Elazar says: One with a blemish may enter, for he is permitted in eating holy offerings.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר וְכוּ׳. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הֵיכָא קָאֵי? הָתָם קָאֵי, דִּתְנַן: מִי שֶׁהֶחֱשִׁיךְ חוּץ לַתְּחוּם, אֲפִילּוּ אַמָּה אַחַת לֹא יִכָּנֵס. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה יִכָּנֵס, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין הַמָּשׁוֹחוֹת מְמַצְּעִין אֶת הַמִּדּוֹת מִפְּנֵי הַטּוֹעִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Rabbi Shimon, on the basis of what on the basis there, as we learned: one whom it grew dark outside the limit, even one cubit he not enter Rabbi Shimon says: Even fifteen cubits he enter because the surveyors do not measure precisely. because of those who err.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says, etc. Where is Rabbi Shimon standing? He stands there, as we learned: "One who darkened outside the boundary, even one cubit may not enter." Rabbi Shimon says: Even fifteen cubits may enter, because the measurements do not prevent the anointed ones due to the fools.

hebrew_text: דְּקָאָמַר תַּנָּא קַמָּא לֹא יִכָּנֵס, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן יִכָּנֵס.
human_translation: that which the first tanna said, he not enter, Rabbi Shimon said to He enter.
llm_translation: The text is saying: A Tanna said, "The first one should not enter," and Rabbi Shimon said to him, "He should enter."

hebrew_text: שֶׁלֹּא הִתִּירוּ לָךְ אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת. הֵיכָא קָאֵי? הָתָם קָאֵי, דְּקָאָמַר תַּנָּא קַמָּא — קוֹשְׁרָהּ. וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן — עוֹנְבָהּ.
human_translation: As they permitted to you only due to rabbinic decree, On the basis of what on the basis there, where the first tanna said one tie it and Rabbi Shimon said: He form a bow.
llm_translation: They did not permit you except due to a Rabbinic prohibition. Where is this applicable? It is applicable there, as the Tanna stated first - he ties it. And Rabbi Shimon said to him - its grapevine.

hebrew_text: עֲנִיבָה, דְּלָא אָתֵי לִידֵי חִיּוּב חַטָּאת — שָׁרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן. קְשִׁירָה, דְּאָתֵי לִידֵי חִיּוּב חַטָּאת — לָא שָׁרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: forming a bow that it cannot lead to liability for a sin-offering, the Sages permitted it. tying which can lead to liability for a sin-offering the Sages did not permit it,
llm_translation: Anivah, that does not come to the obligation of sin offering - the Rabbis permitted it. Keshirah, that comes to the obligation of sin offering - the Rabbis did not permit it.

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ הַמּוֹצֵא תְּפִילִּין וּסְלִיקָא לָהּ מַסֶּכֶת עֵירוּבִין
llm_translation: We will return to you when the one who finds phylacteries and a ladder for it from the tractate Eruvin.
